FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Maria J.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: Great place for subs/hoagie, sandwiches, etc. Many options for sides such as fries, cheese sticks, etc. Order in or take out. Order in and pay at counter, food brought to you. Service is pretty quick. Not fancy but good food!

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Ashley N.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: We hosted a luncheon in the banquet room at Frisch's. Sherry, who runs the show, is so sweet and easy to work with and get ahold of. The food is WONDERFUL. Everyone very much enjoyed the afternoon and left with full bellies, tons of compliments to the chef! I have zero complaints and will definitely plan to host future events here. Highly recommend! (broasted chicken, lillian potatoes, lasagna, green beans almondine, all perfection)

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Mark L.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description:
I came here for the broasted chicken based on recommendations in other reviews and it lived up to the billing. 

For $8.99 I got a breast, thigh, drumstick and wing all very moist and hot out of the fryer. The broasted chicken dinner also comes with a choice of potato and cole slaw. I got roasted potato wedges which were also good 

You get a big serving at a reasonable price. They also serve some beer so if you want a draft beer instead of a fountain drink with your food you can do that. 

It took a little while for the food to come out, but it was worth it because it came out hot and freshly cooked. You could tell the chicken wasn't sitting around and dried out.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Brad H.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description:
The food here for the most part is pretty average.  It is probably best described as slightly improved cafeteria food.  The place also just feels old and  outdated.  Despite this, the place has a loyal following, especially for their fried chicken.  I feel many people simply come back here because hey have been coming for so long, rather than because the food is good.

I have had a lot of different meals here, but the one that I will say is far above average is their pasta salad.  You can buy it in bulk too which is great for summer parties.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: April R.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: Haven't been here in a few years, but I can say I enjoyed the dinner we got to go last night. Staff was very friendly and the menu had a variety of options to choose from. I had a mozzarella chicken and tomato sandwich, and my boyfriend had a breaded chicken sandwich (this was a huge portion size)! We also had a side of fries and cheesy potato soup that came with it too. All of the food tasted good and it didn't take too long for our order to be ready. Prices are decently fair and they also have a nice deli and beer selection available. We will be returning in the future.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Jaime M.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: Just had my mom's 60th birthday in the banquet room.  The room is gorgeous, the staff was attentive and the food was amazing!  I received nothing but compliments on how the party and food turned out.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Sandra A.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: Ordered baked fish and bake potato.  Dry and tasteless fish and overcooked dried out burnt tasting potato.  It was take out so there was nothing I could do but write about this here.  The chicken dumpling soup was very satisfying but $9.99 for a quart.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Tina B.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description:
The Broasted Chicken is the bomb. I don't know how I never thought to come here during all those twenty-some years I lived in the South Hills. I mean, I guess I do know why and it's because the place doesn't look fancy on the outside (and neither is it on the inside). The front is a deli, so unless you want a pound of chipped ham or whatever meat and cheeses you need for your lunches, you wouldn't think to come in. Beyond the deli counter is a separate room that houses the kitchen and the dining room. It looks like a cafeteria, but I would definitely not call their food cafeteria food. Simple concept: you order at the counter, they give you a number and they bring your food to you when it's ready.

My husband and I were in the area and after reading other reviews, we both went with the Broasted Chicken Dinner. For $8.29, it comes with cole slaw and a choice of potato; I got the broasted and he got the mashed. The chicken dinner seriously is half a chicken: you get a thigh, a breast and a whole wing. Whatever magic they're doing in the kitchen, this chicken is crunchy on the outside, so incredibly moist on the inside and it's seasoned to perfection. Forget KFC, this is the place to go for breaded chicken and for an incredibly affordable price too. The cole slaw was delicious, mostly tangy and sweet, and just the slightest bit creamy. The broasted potatoes, which are just wedge potatoes, were pretty darn good. Again, crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside. Perfection. 

Although it's not very fancy, the food is just fantastic for the price. The menu is huge so I'm sure we will be back for more!

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Elaine J.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: We ordered carry out and picked up within the 15 minutes. The bread was soggy and the fries were cold and soggy. We will not be ordering there again.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Kimberly T.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: This restaurant has been here for ages.  Why we have never tried it I am not sure.  FINALLY we went in for lunch.  It was actually quite surprising!  The first part fo the place is a deli.  They don't make individual sandwiches but they sell Boar's Head deli meats and also offer fresh buns.  You walk through the deli to get to the restaurant.  They have quite a selection.  I chose the Chicken Parm sandwich.  It came with chips and a pickle.  They had soups and daily specials.  They also have a nice little salad bar.  They even have a nice selection of desserts.  The sandwich was delivered to my table and it was freshly cooked.  It wasn't a chicken patty that was pressed chicken.  It was real chicken.  100%.  It had been flattened out a bit so the pieces were thinner and not huge pieces that would be hard to bite into.  There were 2 chicken patties on the sandwich.  The roll was fresh and stood up to the contents.  It had lots of gooey melty cheese and the marinara was really good.  My husband had the Cajun chicken sandwich.  It was just as good.  It wasn't spicy like Cajun can be sometimes, but it had a great Cajun flavor.  His sandwich came with French fries.  I may or may not have helped him eat his because they were so good.  We each took half of our sandwiches home to have for dinner.  We also each grabbed a dessert.  I'm a big fan of coconut cream pie so I picked up a piece of that .  I had am sad to say that it was disappointing.  It had no actual coconut in it.  It was just flavored.  However, my hubby got the Boston Creme Cake and loved it.  You can have broasted chicken for your meal but it takes around 20-30 minutes because they make it fresh.  We passed on it this time but we are having a family dinner next weekend and we are going to order the broasted chicken for that.  They have sides you can buy in the deli.  Great food for a great price.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Cathy N.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: I ordered the scallop dinner. Big improvement from the last time I was there. Lots of scallops and everything was delicious. Service was very quick. I'll definitely be going back

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Casey K.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description:
When I was younger growing up in the south hills, I remember Frisch's being one of the most popular spots for weekend grub. Maybe it was me a wide-eyed child, but I remember it being great.

After wanting to pick something quick up for dinner one evening, we stopped into Frisch's and placed an order fro take out. After going back and forth between the deli counter and the cafeteria-style line, we finally figured out where we needed to order since the staff seemed confused themselves.

While waiting, we checked out the deli counter, which they have seriously cut back on. The food in there didn't look too fresh. I had initially wanted to get some sides, but changed my mind after seeing what was there.

We ordered chicken and the broasted potatoes. The chicken took 40+ minutes to cook and when we got home we realized that almost every piece was a wing versus a breast piece. The potatoes were generally bland. The meal also came with cole slaw, which I'm not a huge fan of, but they forgot to include it after making a big deal about it at the register.

The food itself was soggy after a less than 5 minute ride and I was pretty disappointed. After a less than exciting meal, I wouldn't go back, especially with places like Armstrong's right around the corner.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Paul D.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: Nice little deli the Rueben was passable though a little short on meat for a sandwich crom a deli. The pizza was about them it was passable. What made the pizza passable was the sauce. I enjoyed the sauce a lot.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Rich G.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: It was typical ... the Reuben was good ... service was good. The chicken looked excellent.... will try again.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Vicki F.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: I ordered a sausage pizza & there was a piece of cartilage or bone and a cross section of an artery or vein on the pizza. I will not be ordering sausage anything from here again

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Tim W.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description:
I have to agree with Darren W., Frisch's Broasted Chicken blows every other fast food chicken place out of the water.

I got the #2 which is a 14 piece bucket of the Jack's Famous Broasted Chicken which also comes with a quart cole slaw and 2 orders of broasted potatoes (pretty much roasted potato wedgies) to go. I was told that it would be a 30 minute wait which was fine with us. Who wouldn't want to wait a few minutes for fresh cooked chicken verses chicken that's been sitting for hours?

We were given our number and sat down. A few minutes later an older gentlemen walked by us with a killer looking Italian Hoagie. My wife then looked at the board and saw that it was the special of the day and immediately walked up to the counter and ordered one. 

About ten minutes later her hoagie and sausage and ravioli soap arrived at our table. I went right for her soap to taste it. It was spectacular and I immediately walked up to the counter to order my own! I went with a burger and the same sausage and ravioli soap.
Maybe ten minutes later my burger and soap came and our chicken and sides. 

Once we got home we dived in. I ate my burger, a drumstick and half of my soap and my wife ate half of her hoagie and soap and a drumstick as well. We were stuffed! My burger was so big! The beef patty itself was over an inch thick. The burger was cooked to perfection. One of the best I have ever had! 

Now to the chicken. It was still piping hot even though it took me about 30 minutes to get home. It was so juicy and perfectly seasoned. Simply delicious and well worth the drive and the wait. The broasted potatoes were equally as good too. Even the cole slaw was really good and I don't even like cole slaw so that should tell you something.

Frisch's offer a ton of other things as well including soaps, sandwiches, pizza, wedgies, calzones, wings, desserts and even a salad bar!

I WILL BE BACK!

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Miriam W.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description:
While on a recent Lowe's outing, on the hunt for a new refrigerator, we happened upon the good reviews for this informal, very Pittsburgh-y place and decided to give it a try. What we found was a restaurant and store combo that looks like it's been in this spot for a long while, in a good way. We entered into the store part, not knowing that the restaurant is in the back, and were greeted by a friendly and helpful guy who actually introduced himself to us with a handshake...this even before he knew it was our first time in. He directed us to the restaurant once he learned we intended on dining in, and we headed back to find more counter service, a salad bar and a diner like atmosphere. We helped ourselves to the salad bar and ordered some chicken, which they cook up fresh for you. The chicken takes at least 15 minutes, so we'll know to plan on this for our next visit, or perhaps call ahead. 

The salad bar is nice, with lots of choices and some tasty cole slaw and potato salad. The chicken is the star here, however. Broasting is frying under pressure, and the meat absorbs less oil then in traditional frying. Crispy outside, juicy within, and very delicious. I tried a thigh and some wings, and liked it all. The hot sauce that comes with the wings is divine, and I will ask for this on my next visit even if I don't order the wings, as it goes well with all of the chicken parts. I will also try the broasted potatoes on my next visit, as these seem to have many fans here on Yelp. On our way out we passed tables that had ordered the pizza, so chicken isn't the only draw here. Frisch's is a fun place with friendly service and very good food.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Dan M.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: This place is a South Hills classic! Great food and great value! Get the frizzle burger, the broasted chicken, and a bowl of soup and you'll be set!

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Stacey B.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description: I had not ordered food from Frisch's for a few years as their food was just not good. I had heard that the food was good again, so I gave it a try.  I am happy I did as the Italian hoagies were delicious!  It is hard to find a good hoagie and I am happy that Frisch's is back!  I am spreading the word so everyone can give them a try again.

FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.author: Lexi Z.
FsDogwXYckKUgs5VUoPbJw.description:
Mixed review really.. 

We ordered from here for family game night a week ago and had amazing food! All we ordered was 20 piece broasted chicken. It was great, fed us all, lots of meat, crispy and just how we wanted it. We picked up and it was easy. 

We came here again after loving it from game night and ate in, not such a great experience.. I had already tried their chicken so I went with a fish sandwich. The sandwich was ready in less than 5 minutes which was great on the service end but I'm guessing it was not fresh fish. Also, I was expecting batter dipped and fried fish on my sandwich, I was sadly mistaken. It was more like a giant fish stick, I'm very big on fish sandwiches too, so I was sad. My bun was slightly moist all over and I was overall unhappy with my meal. 

After my craving not being satisfied for their chicken, we returned the next day and I ordered their broasted chicken to go. I was very pleased with the pricing on individual pieces and the portion you received. The things I was unhappy about was when we ordered before I paid, we were told it would be 10-15 minutes max because they're made fresh, which is great! I didn't mind at all, even though we were in a rush and needed to be out quickly, but I like fresh food. Then, after she swiped my card she told me it would actually be longer and that there was a call ahead order in front of me now and that he would try to squeeze my order in. I was not happy, but I sat patiently and waited. Finally after about 25-30 minutes, my chicken came to my table to go. Once I was in the car, I began to eat and my chicken was well under cooked, I was so disappointed, I really wanted it to be as good as the first time I had it. The chicken was very uncrispy and the meat was very very slimy and still pink in the middle. 

Overall, the parking is easy, good location, food is hit or miss, but I will be back and will hope for the best as I try again! Will update my review next time I go.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Michael Y.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description:
Solid location.

This place has everything you'd want from a Noodles and Co. The selection is great, they have Truffle Mac :0 and there's lots of space to eat and hang out with your friends! Portion sizes for the food are big, which is great for people who are hungry and those who want some leftovers for later.

I recommend trying some of the heat spice they have next to the drink machines. It's not that spicy but adds a slight heat and smoke flavor to whatever you're having.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Kara H.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: Noodles and Company is always a good experience! Used to visit the location in Wexford, but since it closed last year we have been going to the market square and Oakland locations. Safest bet is always the Wisconsin Mac and cheese, I haven't tried anything else and definitely don't need to. The only thing that sucks is parking in both locations.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Ciera P.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: I love the zoodles option and Lucy is amazing. Everytime I come here she is so freindly and thoughtful. Zoodle Truffle Mac is my favorite

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Gary R.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description:
Me and my 14 year old son was on break from a chess tournament and decided to grab something to eat. As soon as I walked in I seen that the picture on the menu are misleading. It shows the bowl filled and the bowl they give you are huge.. However they dont even fill the bowls half way. Now mind you I am a big eater and this review will be based on that.

I ordered the Pasta Fresca with chicken and my son got the Buttered noodles. We received our order and we got exactly what I noticed. My son loved his buttered noodles and I loved the taste of the Pasta Fesca. However, I expected more for the the price I paid for it since pasta and noodles are so cheap. Me and my son was both hungry after a couple hours later.

This review is based on a big eater. So if you are use to eating with small portions, I would rate this as a 4 or 5. However I will only give a 3 on this and debating if I should give it a 2. 

It is such a shame since it is so close to the university and students are on a budget. They probably would get a lot more customers from them if they gave bigger portions or cut down on the price.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Rosie W.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: Love this place!! Under new management and this place is really turning around.... food is great and they even have a gluten free option!! Super awesome :)

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: LLific Y.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: When I ordered the Japanese pan noodles, what I got is half plate of badly burned noodles and half plate of salt. Haven't had a chance to try other foods since this will be my last time come here.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Jasmine C.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: The food was probably a 3.5/5... very standard Noodles&Company, but a tad on the salty side. However, there was plentiful seating, a clean eating space, and 5/5 service! The employee who took my order was super friendly and a manager asked me how my food was. Overall a great experience and I'd recommend it to others, but personally I'm just not a big fan of the types of pasta Noodles and Company offers.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Christopher J.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description:
The section of food is surprisingly diverse. 
Excellent noodles and pastas. The Korean meatballs were a tasty surprise.

Quick, efficient and friendly service is something I've come to expect from this location. So far they have been top notch!

Plenty of seating! Is on Pitt campus and is a favorite of the students.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Isaac M.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description:
Well, yup, the noodles here are pretty good. So, yup, if you're gluten free, they will accommodate your pasta if you pay more money. Eh, yup, they forgot to add the chicken I ordered in my Pad Thai, so I had to send it back. Um, yup, there was a HAIR in my Pad Thai when they "fixed" it. No, yup, it wasn't just in the dish, I noticed it as it was in my mouth. I flossed my teeth in Noodles & Company last night with a nasty, jet-black, protein rich 5-incher of human head hair last night.

Obviously, this is going to bring down my review, but the food here is still good. The manager made me a new dish free of charge and threw in a rice krispie treat on the house. I'll still eat here.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Cayla T.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: I've been going to this place for quite awhile. If you love noodles, then this is the place for you! You can get noodles made in multiple global cuisines! Also, they have the virtual soda machine (I love this type of stuff)! Need I say more?

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Jen C.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: We ordered in trays for a coworker's retirement luncheon. It was a great idea, it was a massive amount of food for 15 people. I've previously eaten with the Cranberry Township location and I'm not a fan as the food tastes processed but I really enjoyed the Alfredo pasta creation. If I was craving quick pasta, I would go here for the Alfredo.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Darren M.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: Tonga one of the managers was fantastic. He worked with me to sort out a group order that would nt go through on line.  He even delivered it himself and would nt even take a tip. Great fella and very helpful

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Liting C.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: Noodles have always been my top 1 comfort food but the Japanese pan noodles at this place did not bring me comfort. Quite the contrary, I experienced nothing more than a bloated stomach and an overly sweet greasy taste lingering in my mouth. The prices are low but the serving size is also proportional to the price.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Melanie P.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: I've been going here for a while and the employees have never been overly friendly or even motivated to do their jobs well. I went there today and my friend ordered the spaghetti and marinara sauce, and specified that she did NOT want cheese or meatballs on top, she even repeated this twice. So when they brought out our food of course there were meatballs on top. She told the man that she asked for no meatballs and so he brought it back, came back three minutes later with the same bowl of spaghetti except now it had 5 meatball indents where the meatballs had been... it was almost comical the way it looked. Did they really think this was acceptable? They didn't even ATTEMPT to make it look like they gave a sh*t about their presentation. So she brought it back again and asked him if they just took the meatballs off and he said yes, and she asked if she could have a whole new one because she's vegan and can't eat anything that has touched meat. So 25 minutes pass, still no food. When she goes over to ask where her food is, they tell her that they haven't even started making it yet. Meanwhile people who had come in 25 minutes after us were getting their food already. So by the time she finally got her pasta we had been there for an hour. The worst part? The girl who had messed it up in the first place was laughing at my friend as if she was an idiot or doing something wrong. Very poor customer service. So disappointed and will not be returning.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Denise C.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description:
I like noodles and company and I enjoy their food. However, I have one major complaint. They focus too much on the noodles and not enough on the vegetables. 

Sure it's a pasta/noodle joint, but when I order "whole grain linguine with balsamic, olive oil, white wine and roasted garlic, red onions, tomato, spinach and parmesan or feta" I expect to get just that. Out of all the times I've gone, which is about 5, my meals have lacked vegetables. Maybe one or two pieces of tiny broccoli, 3 spinach leaves, or just even a few chunks of tomato. I enjoy the vegetables and they should be present in the dish, but they aren't. 

I may be expecting too much since I'm a vegan, don't worry I didn't order cheese, but they list vegan and vegetarian items on their menu so they should be more sensitive to us. This is something this location definitely needs to work on.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Nerine S.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: I don't know what happened to this location because it used to be great, but my last few orders have been a lot less flavorful than they used to be. My friends have noticed this as well. Feels like they're skimping on their sauce :( used to go all the time but probably won't be back

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Mara K.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description:
Unfortunately I'm going to judge Noodles & Company a little tougher than I normally might because the Thai/Asian market in Oakland is well represented and if you want people's business then you really need to step up your game.

Here is one thing I really appreciate at Noodles and Company - the caloric value is listed for each dish.  Talk about an eye opener - if you don't choose wisely, you better have a date with the gym later in the day because there's a dish on the menu (fettuccine) that is over 1,200 calories.  

I had the Bangkok curry on my visit today and I thought the flavor was nice, not overpowering for a curried dish, and it was a nice size portion.  The caloric count wasn't bad and I felt full.  

My colleague who dined with me did a soup and salad combo and said that the spicy Caesar chicken sandwich was indeed spicy.

This is not my go to noodle destination, but, it's not on my list of "don't ever come here again" noodle places.  I'd describe it as, "it is what it is", nothing to write home about but nothing to write a bad review about either.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Anne C.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description:
Small portions, Large price. 

I went in with low expectations and came out feeling affirmed.  
I got the Bangkok Curry and it was just..okay.  The whole experience of the food was just...okay.

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Ian R.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description: The quick pickup is sadly not very quick. I still love the food even though mine was cold after waiting for my friends food

3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.author: Larissa G.
3qrfY-XCUKVyrO5T6GskqA.description:
Yum! I really like Noodles & Company, which while not the cheapest stop for food is still pretty reasonable in my experience. 

I remember when this location first opened so I have to say, seeing the evolution of the shop has been kind of cool. The general layout hasn't changed - this location has that cozy college campus feel to it - but what has changed is the menu and displays. I remember when I first came here the only options were noodle soups and, well, noodles! Now you can find salads and sandwiches, and even better for those of us watching our waistlines, there's calorie measurements next to the entree listings.

The soups are all delicious, the veggie sandwiches are also quite simply wonderful, and the noodle dishes I've had have been tasty enough considering that what I'm ordering isn't as expensive as the pasta dishes at my favorite Italian places. For a chain store the food is much better than you might expect and it's never disappointed me when I've needed a filling, affordable and quick meal. 

Not a fan of the "make your own soda" machine, I think those things are pretty disgusting. But otherwise this is a pretty reasonable quick stop for food in Oakland - the downtown location is good, too. I'll be back!

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Brittany C.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
We only had drinks, I had the cantaloupe "soda" and my husband the chai tea. The cantaloupe soda was very good and actually am sad I haven't tasted anything like it before and won't be back anytime soon :(.

My husband said his chai was watery and I would agree as they only used one tea satchel for around 18 oz of liquid. 

For drinks I felt the prices were good.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Bri B.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description: We dined here for the first time after visiting the conservatory. We were excited since the food seemed fresh and they offer a good selection of sandwiches, salads, flatbreads, soups, etc. However, we were pretty unimpressed. The food was essentially flavorless. The flatbread was practically a tortilla with some cheese and peppers/onions on top. The sandwiches were rather small and really nothing special. The salad was flavorless, with little-no dressing. The basil parmesan soup, however, was good but the size of a cup was very small. The food did seem fresh but all in all, it was really nothing special.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Diane B.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description: Easy to see why Cafe at Phipps was named one of the best museum restaurants in the US. The food is fresh, with options for everyone in the family and the prices are reasonable. one tip - if you order the red or green juice blend, be aware it is served at room temperature. The red was good, but I think it would have been even better if served cold. Next time, I'll ask for ice.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Shana R.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
"Veggie Pizza" 
I like this cafe because they shave allergy sensitive options and everything is fresh, organic, and great tasting.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Sneha N.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
I was here a couple of times for team lunches. Both the times, I liked the food. It is such a vibrant place! Food is fresh and light, yet filling. The last time I was here I ordered roasted veggie sandwich with chick pea salad. I liked the food and I am sure I will go back again. 
Things to remember:
1) They are busy during lunch hours and you should be prepared to wait for at least 10 minutes for your food to arrive.
2) If you are planning to go in a group, make sure you are there before the rush hour to easily find a table for everyone at one place.
3) Don't hesitate to order the bbq sliders if they are offering, my colleagues were happy with the sliders they ordered.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Brenda W.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
Cafe Phipps located inside the Phipps Conservatory on the main level is offering a fixed price menu of 4 courses on Friday nights during the month of March for 65.00 per person which includes the dinner and admission to the conservatory which stays open til 10pm on Fridays.  The hostess indicated this is something they plan to continue monthly with the menu options varying.

We made reservations and arrived early with no problems getting seated.  They have cordoned off a section of the cafe with a privacy partition for the guests with reservations while keeping the rest open for normal cafe operations.  The tables have tablecloths and the table is nicely set with wine glasses and beautiful napkins.  We started our meal with glasses of wine (price additional to the fixed price meal).  The first course was a warm artichoke and roasted red pepper risotto.  This was delicious and an ample serving.  

I should interrupt here just as our diner was interrupted.  Suddenly a fire alarm went off in the building.  Everyone just looked at one another with no one moving.  Ok.... I was taught, as good measure, that one should get their butt up and head to the exit in such a case so I donned my coat and headed out.  I do think the staff should be better instructed to not only get their butts out the door but ensure their patrons do, as well.  That was irksome on a safety level.  Within 15 minutes, the all-clear was given (our server later indicated something in the basement had triggered it).  Anyway, I did my part and my husband followed suit a wee bit after me reluctantly and then we did finally return to our table.

Ok, onto the 2nd course.  The 2nd course was our choice of either a house salad or a mushroom soup.  I selected the salad while my husband opted for the soup.  Both were adequate but I should have asked for additional salad dressing (a vinaigrette)

The 3rd course was the entree -- I opted for the crab cake and asparagus, my husband selected the filet with asparagus.  Both were good.  I can't say the crab cake was like any other I've had, but it was good.

The 4th and final course was dessert -- a warn blueberry cobber with ice cream.  It was good but not as sweet as either of us would have liked.

Afterwards, we had plenty of time to visit the gift shop and the convervatory which was sponsoring orchids and bonsai.  

I like this concept of a very nice dinner and journey through the convervatory -- makes for a truly great date night.  Oh, and another plus?  When you are finished with dinner they give you your complementary conservatory ticket and it's good thru the end of the year -- not just that night.  I like that!

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Arlene M.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
My girlfriend and I just finished touring Phipps Conservatory by day and decided to eat here for lunch. Most of the food is home grown and many of them are healthy options. Pizza is available for all ages.

It is set cafeteria style where you order and you are given a number to put on whatever table you wish to sit. The food is then brought to you. Should you decide to order a beverage then you are given a cup with your purchase and proceed to the drink station to get what you want.

They also serve specialty beverages there but we decided to go with the a healthy option. We each ordered the vegetarian sandwich which came with a choice of side. We opted for the quinoa and slaw. The do have an option for $9.95 where you can order half sandwich and pair it with either a cup of soup or chili without meat or salad.

We got our food served to us in a reasonable amount of time. The food was good to say the least because we don't often get a chance to eat healthy. When we were finished they have a selection of trash and recycle bins as well as one for dishes and silverware. Your food comes with real dishes and silverware which i would call Panera style.

Little did we realize how crowded this place can get if you don't come early. We had arrived shortly after noon.  By the time we were done the place was packed with people! It brought a nice conclusion to seeing Phipps by day during the holiday season because there is so much you miss at night when the lights are on. Still this cafe is a nice place to unwind and take it easy if you don't feel like hunting for another place. Would definitely eat here again whenever we come again.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Eva R.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
A nice lunch spot in Oakland that is often forgotten about. All the ingredients are very fresh and local. I had the chicken apple panini, with a side of bruschetta salad, and coleslaw. The total came out to be about $10, which considering how expensive panera is now days is not bad. 

The panini had chicken, apple compote, arugala, and white cheddar cheese. It was fresh and satisfying. The brushetta was not bad but the red onion was very chunky and overpowering. The coleslaw was also lacking flavor. My friend's chicken meatball looked great, but she said there was a little too much bread. 

Overall, a nice lunch place if looking for healthy and fresh sandwiches, soups, and salads.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Maria J.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description: I actually thought Cafe Phipps was pretty good and would eat here again when visiting Phipps. Reminds me of a smaller version of Panera Bread with salad, soup and sandwich options. Order places at the counter and brought to the table. We were served quickly even though they were busy. Prices approximately $7-$10 a person with water to drink. Environmentally friendly. Would eat here again.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Robert U.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
This place is surprisingly good!  My family and I were captive customers, having already ponied up for pay-parking and having paid our admission to Phipps.  Then we got hungry.

They have a nice menu, with plenty of fresh items, NOT the standard frozen chicken nuggets and hot-dogs.  I had some vegetarian chili that was very good, and came with some interesting flat-bread instead of crackers.  My kids enjoyed their lunches, as did my wife.

Overall, this is a solid choice, so do not hesitate to give it a try and let us all know what you think.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Byron Y.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description: The setting is nice, and the food is fresh.  As much as I would like to give this place more stars, I haven't been impressed by the taste of the food (it's on the bland side) or the serving sizes (sometimes I leave thinking I could have had two portions).

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Elle W.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description: The mushroom bruschetta and vegan chili was very very tasty.  The soup tasted so fresh and had the perfect seasoning.  The mushroom bruschetta was almost 5 stars.  But the bread was burnt on the one side which made it really tough to eat.  But the flavors of the mushrooms with the onions and balsamic had a great flavor and consistency of the ingredients.  I wasn't expecting such a tasty meal while going to look at plants lol.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: B G.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description: A great place to ear, sip wine & unwind after spending a day at the Phipps Conservatory. Had their Quiche & Cuban Sandwich which came with Faroe salad. Both outstanding. They did also have vegan choices. Vegan chili was delicious.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: David B.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
When the Phipps made great strides on becoming more green and sustainable, they also made a commitment to making the Cafe more healthy and environmentally friendly.  The foods are locally sourced, the menu items are organic and thoughtfully prepared.   For example, it's hard to find healthy options for children, however the Phipps has gotten rid of their high sugar drinks in favor of healthier options.  

The soups are quite wonderful, and so are the salads. 

The Cafe is careful about recycling, too, which I find to be a thoughtful touch. 

The sunshine streams into the glass walls, this cafe is a good place to change your mood to positive.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Frank M.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description: I came here to eat for years with my wife who loved the quiche and I loved the salmon salad. They just changed the menu for some reason, probable money issues.  The salmon salad was removed for some Asian noddle dish that is a cheap joke.  My wife spoke to the boss, who was eating a salmon salad and she said people requested a change.  I still think it was a money issue, I wish they would just of raised the price and keep it on the menu. Very sad, we are eating somewhere else. If people didn't want it why was it sometimes sold out and why was the boss eating it? Very sad!

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Mallory R.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
It is reviewed as one of the best museum cafes in the nation, but I was not impressed. I can't comment on the food since I didn't try any, however I tried their iced coffee and the green juice. 

As the lady making my green juice was preparing the fruits and vegetables, she did not wash any of the items she was putting into the juicer and did not take the time to remove any stickers, therefore those pesky little stickers went straight into the juicer and made it into my drink! Definitely a turn-off. 

The iced coffee was nothing to write home about and looking around at the selection of food from other customers, the portions were small and not very appetizing. 

A gorgeous conservatory, but eat and drink before you spend your afternoon in the beautiful Phipps!

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Kristy A.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
I was really excited about this menu...   Everything looked fresh and delicious and I was pumped to have some healthy options.  The execution of this menu, though, fell a little short.   

I ordered a salad and a sandwich and a glass of wine.  The salad was quinoa, apples, lettuce, cheese, etc.  It was under-dressed and under-seasoned, but otherwise a good concept.   The sandwich was really where I had the problem.  The menu description didn't really say either way, but I sort of expected it to be hot since it was a grilled chicken variety.   It was served cold, though, which was fine.  What wasn't fine was the ratio of fixins to bread.  Way off.  I could barely taste the meat, sauce, etc. - there just wasn't enough of it and there was entirely too much bread.  And I am a bread lover, so that is saying something.  All of my companions who ordered sandwiches had the same problem.   Those who ordered soup fared better - the soups all got good reviews.  The quiche also looked really good.  I just can't get past that skimpy sandwich though.  

As far as seating, it was definitely limited.  I snagged a table in the back next to some really LOUD families.   It's a café, so I didn't mind it.   There were a lot of people waiting for seats though.  

Overall, a decent lunch place (skip the sandwiches though).  Not really a dinner vibe for me.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Mary R.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
We decided to eat here based on previous Yelp reviews. I have to say I was a little disappointed. There is an awkward cafeteria-type bar set up with a separate coffee/drink bar to the right. A fair beverage warning: they do not serve regular soda, lemonade, or sweet tea at the Cafe Phipps. On the plus side you can get a beer. :-)

I had a bowl of tomato basil soup that was fresh and delicious. It came withe some homemade breadsticks, also yummy. I also had a really decent cappuccino. So, while I though the cafe was fine, I just wish that it also catered to more plebian tastes like...Diet Coke.

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Jennifer J.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
This place is a hidden gem and you should eat here even if you aren't touring the conservatory. We ended up here accidentally because the restaurant across the street where we intended to go was closed for a private party. 

All of the menu items are perfect for lunch - filling, but not huge and healthful without being annoying. 

I had a salad and sandwich combo. The salad was supposed to have chicken, but they forgot to put it on. When I asked one of the staff, she cheerfully apologized and very quickly brought me the chicken. 

I had my 10-year-old niece with me and she was able to find something on the menu (an almond butter and berry sandwich) that she enjoyed and I could feel good about giving to her. 

Right across the street (behind the other restaurant) is an access point to the Schenley Park trail where we went for a hike after lunch. It was perfect!

EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.author: Larissa G.
EWswCV97BBb0ezXRZhCoOQ.description:
I absolutely love Café Phipps, and eating here is always a treat. Combined with an actual trip into Phipps, and a meal here can easily be part of a perfect afternoon or evening.

The cafe itself is a lovely, bright, colorful part of Phipps' main lobby and floor. In my experience it's always been well maintained, i.e kept very clean with plants and candles put out on the tables. The framed photos of fields and fresh produce hanging on the walls just complete the cafe's fresh and vibrant look and feel.

While the menu itself (and the ingredients of what's sold here) often changes with the season and availability of produce, the general idea of the menu is always the same - you can order or mix-and-match soups, salads, sandwiches, a couple entree-items at times, and a quiche of the day. There are also usually smaller bites and side dishes like fruit cups, as well as dessert options like cupcakes. And as far as I know, all of the items are made from fresh, organic, and local ingredients, or brought in from local vendors.

And I have to say, nothing here has let me down. The soups in particular always impress me - you can tell that their tomato soup is freshly made and it's always very think and pulpy; I feel healthier and happier just looking at it! Their salads are always a lovely blend of veggies and dressing (and meat if you opt for it, although Phipps is very vegetarian friendly), and the sandwiches have been perfectly toasted and to die for in my experience. Honestly it's impossible for me to leave without a smile on my face after eating here, the ingredients used are just so wonderful and perfect together.

Oh, and since Phipps is one of the green leaders in town, it should come as no surprise that they aim to recycle and compost the few dishes and silverware items that can't be washed and reused.

I seriously have no complaints about this little eatery. The best part about the cafe is that a visit to Phipps, while recommended, is not required. So if you want a healthy and/or tasty meal, this is definitely the place to go!

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Mike M.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: I still haven't found my go-to pizza shop in the North Hills but Large Plain is in the running.  I came here recently and ordered the buffalo chicken pizza along with some wings(mango habanero and louisiana purchase).  I really enjoyed how the pizza had fries on it, I feel like that's the x-factor in buffalo chicken pizzas.  The mango habanero wing sauce was also really good and I'd order it again.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Crystal V.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: I placed an order and 2 hours later, still no food. I called and it seems my order was delivered..... to someone else. I guess I'm going to bed hungry. On the upside- they gave me a refund

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Brad S.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: Very OK pizza. I've had it multiple times before reviewing. There is nothing special about the crust. It almost seems like a store bought crust. It's better than that but a fitting comparison for appearance, taste, feel. I found the pizza under-sauced which is a shame because when I did get a little pocket of sauce it was tasty. Toppings were good. There are better options in the area.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Jess R.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: I love large plain for a quick Pittsburgh pizza.  We always order the cheesy bread and a deluxe pizza.  I know it is ironic to get the deluxe at a place called large plain, but it is my jam.  This pizza has fresh mushrooms (none of that canned junk), fresh veggies, enough meat to be flavorful but not overwhelming.  The cheesy bread also comes with fresh ranch dressing.  We order about every other week and will continue.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Samir R.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description:
Never order over the phone. We ordered super deluxe and we were very specific that we do not want any meat on half of it. We get there and they make it all meat and do not put veggies on half. I understand that this can happen. So I'm not upset about it. But the part that upset me was the lady who took the order blamed it on us and even while the pizza was being redone, she was making sarcastic jokes as to how she doesn't eat pork. 
They give us a large pizza when we asked for X large. 
They remade the pizza for us after tantrums, but if you at the picture, they forget to put sausage on it and the pizza was undercooked for us to rebake it and the only thing I could taste was salt. I'm not going there again.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Nicklas V.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: There name says it all. Plain. I have to just add this into my category of another average Pittsburgh pizza shop. Nothing special. Wouldn't order again unless it was the only option.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Julia S.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description:
I ordered delivery since I'm from Cali and have absolutely no idea how to drive in this snow...
Yum. Very good. The best part is the thick cut ham. It's crisp and chewy. Very delightful.
Dough: was not too pleased. I like my dough slightly crunchy. New York style. This was more chewy... Sad.
Then I reheated in a frypan for 3 mins or so. Phenomenal. Not greasy. Just the right amount of crisp and crunch. Now I am hooked. Just wish it came that way...

Delivery was spot on.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: diann v.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: We came home from a long day and Large Plain was open, we were staying close by so we thought we would try it.  It doesn't look like much but the pizza is good!  We ordered 1/2 combo and cheese.  Everybody was pleased.  It was recommended by a friend as well. I recommend it too!

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Brendan G.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: Love little pizza places like this.  Was able to put a order there through yelp and got large cheese.  Pizza there is big and pretty tasty.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: LaMar W.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description:
This tiny little gem is tucked off of Babcock Blvd in a very tight, nondescript building, but the pizza is goood.  

The star of Large Plain pizza is definitely the cheese - hence the name.  They almost force you into buying their large, plain pizza, which is great for the price (and tasty), but if you're like me and like a few meaty toppings on your pie, be careful as the cost really skyrockets.  They want about $2 per topping (and bacon counts as a *double* topping) so I feel like I'm being gouged for being a T-Rex, in a way.  

Still, it's phenomenal pizza.  Just expect to part with about $20 if you want more than one topping on it.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Jason F.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description:
I stopped by here a couple of Saturday's ago by myself for pizza.  I knew that I was going to be in the area ahead of time and so I placed an order for a single large cheese pizza.  After taking my order I was told that it would be about 15-20 minutes before it was ready.  I arrived at the restaurant just over 25 minutes later and the pizza was ready.  The inside of Large Plain wasn't much to look at as there was a counter and a few picnic tables inside with a few more picnic tables outside.  The whole process of picking up the pizza took maybe 2 minutes which was impressive especially since the employee was friendly to me.  

Large Plain's pizza is a medium thickness crust pizza although it is on the thinner side of that thickness.  That allowed for the crust to be somewhat crispy which is something that I love in pizza.  It had a good ratio of cheese to sauce which made eating it easy but I didn't think that there was anything special about either ingredient.  In the end it was a solid pizza that was A-OK.

The bottom line for me is that I might stop by here again in the future.  Yes the service was nice and the pizza was ok but there are plenty of better pizza places in the area that I would be more likely to head to first.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Dave H.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: Amazing pizza but I honestly order less frequently because I have to give my address every time I call for delivery. GET A POS SYSTEM!

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Peter S.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description:
A little positive first, I love that I am able to order online. But... My email was time stamped 7:15pm and the extra large pizza with pepperoni and 13 hot wings I ordered showed up at 8:17pm.  I can almost hit a golf ball to the restaurant.  Wings are okay and I thought this pizza is identical to every other pizza in Pittsburgh.  My wife thought it had no flavor; she had three bites and gave up.

I understand that it's Friday night, they were probably busy; so I should expect the delivery delay.  I called to check and was put on hold and then hung up on.  Waiting for an hour and getting below average food leaves a bad taste. Won't be ordering again.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Abby W.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: Pizza is awful... Sweet sauce and generic dough. It reminds me of a pizza pronto. Not good at all! I got a ranch steak hoagie. Again, like a pizza pronto hoagie. Gross steak, maybe 5 fries, and no toppings. I will not be returning!

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Dave T.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: Excellent pizza if you haven't tried it it's a must! If you don't believe me.......they won best pizza in Pittsburgh from star 100.7.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Joseph L.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description:
decent pizza place, but they are kind of the worst with up charges if you order online? They have a $2.00 delivery fee online and double up charged me for asking for an extra Italian dressing packet. 

food though! buffalo chicken hoagie is really good. mozzarella sticks are not. chicken ranchero was average, but i've never had one that's above average?

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Abbot Place T.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description:
Pizza is good but I would say toppings are pretty skimpy. I had scarce black olives and tomatoes on my pizza. The crust is a bit thick too.

Overall it's good and we enjoyed it

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Alicia S.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description:
A great find and they deliver to our new house! 

The phone call in to order was painless and quick and the pizza arrived promptly. The price is great for the quality of the pizza. 

The pizza was exactly what we were hoping for. A nice crust that was doughy without being undercooked. The part that makes or breaks a pizza for me is where the crust meets the cheese line. Large Plain puts cheese all the way up to crust without the gross sauce-only portion. 

We will definitely make this a go to pizza shop!

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Catherine C.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: Best pizza around!! Always so good and such great service. Their breadsticks are very good too! The prices are awesome here, and everything we have tried has been great. The pizza, if ordered with sausage, comes with the small crumbled sausage which is hard to find and so good! I have to stop myself from ordering here so much.. Definitely worth every penny.

kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.author: Jordan H.
kmq0Y15icHK36kpJyho_Zw.description: This by far is my favorite pizza in Pittsburgh. By chance I found it while in McKnight rd and wanted to try a new pizza place. Its awesome. It seems like it's fairly new but that doesn't make it taste any less amazing. I think I've met the owner or at least the main cook she was so nice!! My second time there she Gave me coupons and extra 6 wings. I mean how nice was that!! She was so nice and friendly. We talked while I was paying and she seemed very down to earth and just a nice person. They definitely have a great thing going on there. Its clean! Easy to get too. The prices are really good. I got a xl for less than 15$. I tried their wings and they were really good too. If you like hot wings their definitely worth getting. Their pizza is not overly greasy, just enough sauce and cheese. I've only had pepperoni pizza but thats definitely good enough. Its not like you HAVE TO have a bunch of toppings. I would like to try some other toppings though just to see what it's like. If your in the area definitely try it!! It says  limited delivery so im I'm not sure where they go to. I've always picked up.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Jenna W.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
Been here multiple times and it is by far my favorite fast service Mexican restaurant. There are so many topping choices for your burrito, bowl, salad, quesadilla, etc. They don't limit you  either, so you can put as many ingredients as you like on your meal. Each meal you get free chips, which is a huge plus in my opinion. The salsa bar within the restaurant has a nice variety of different temperature salsa. Their queso is delicious! Keep an eye out for Free Queso Day, where they give out free cups of queso and bag of chips. This location ran this year's event very organized. As I walked in, I was asked if I was ordering food or only there for queso. I was directed to a separate line, away from the lunch rush, and given my queso within 2 minutes. 

I recommend signing up for their rewards program. You receive points with every purchase and discounts throughout the year. Plus a free entree on your birthday!

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Jennifer J.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
First time ordering , assumed this would be on the same order as a Chipotle or Quodoba.. ordered chicken burrito bowl with rice cheese sour cream lettuce tomatoes and corn salsa maybe ?? Also ordered two soft ground beef tacos . 
In the chicken burrito bowl I had 60% tomatoes . Then a few specks of rice . Chicken , and other items . Food was stone cold ! 
The ground beef soft tacos were cold and the shell was slimy and mushy . Delivery driver was supposed to meet me at rear door of the apartment complex . Instead he called me from front door . I had to run outside up the hill in the rain to collect my food .. I'll never be back here . Sorry moes.. terrible first impression

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Tiffany Y.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: I ate at Moe's for lunch on a weekday. The business was busy as expected. I ordered a chicken quesadilla, which tasted good, and a fountain lemonade. The employees smiled and said polite things. The restaurant was full of other customers, but I was lucky to find a table and seat to eat at. The price was comparable to what other restaurants charge.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Rachel C.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
The customer service was extra friendly here and it was kept very clean however I have yet to feel super impressed with the food. 

Although I do think the queso cheese dip is better than Chipotle's queso cheese dip since it actually tasted like they use real cheese and it has a nice creamy texture the flavor is still pretty mild and it could use a little bit more of a kick, however,  it was still overall more delicious than Chipotle's queso dip and it would mix nicely with other parts of the menu.

The chips were just overly salty to the point where I found it difficult to eat them however I tend to always feel this way about chips at fast food restaurants. They did have a nice crunch however and you could tell that they were freshly made even when it was late that we got them. Because they tasted fresher and more crispy than Chipotle's chips I would say they are better than Chipotle's however both of these places need to use less salt!

Although I haven't tried much on their menu yet I will say that I like this places chips and queso dip more than Chipotle's. If I was really craving queso dip in the middle of Market Square I would choose this place! My concern is that it will be difficult for them to compete with Chipotle which is directly across from them in market square being that Chipotle is already pretty popular and this place is so similar. 

I would consider trying something more substantial on their menu sometime to leave a more detailed review and will update this review as soon as I do.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Krista M.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: I feel bad saying this but Moe's just isn't good to me. Chipotle, which is right across the street from this location, tastes so much more authentic and has much better flavor (in my opinion). Moe's to me is very Tex-mex, and honestly everything seems to taste like microwave frozen dinners. The queso is delicious, but honestly their only redeeming item to me. If the service was good I would up the stars since I know a lot of people so like Moe's, but to be honest they're pretty short and snark at this location. Just not my place.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Denny V.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
If I could afford to put a Moe's franchise in my house- I would...!

Love Moes, the food, the friendly workers, the friendly managers (lunch was free today because the manager used my order as a 'time study' to see how long it took me to get through the line).  

I love me some Moe's...!

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Bryon M.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
This is the best Moe's I've ever been to! I haven't been to one in a while because I haven't liked them in the past, but I figured I'd try this one out since it just went through a renovation downtown near my work. The line was super long, and all the inside tables were bustling. This can be typical of downtown lunch time, but I decided to wait and give it a shot. I'm glad I did because the line moved quickly, and the food was really good. It's like a chipotle, but with way more options. They also have a ton of sauces and sides to put in little containers for when you eat your meal.

I'd go back here for sure. I'd also recommend using the app to order to cut the line. Moe's definitely knew what they were doing with this remodel, and the counter is so long that they're able to take so many orders at once. It's very lively inside with so much capacity and people eating, so next time I'll eat there instead of bringing the food back in a doggie bag.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Ajay H.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: Came here during the 2018 Holiday season, and we were greeted with the standard "Welcome to Moeeeee's" greeting as we walked in. All the members of the staff were pleasant, friendly and attentive. Well, all except our friendly cashier, who seemed like she didn't want to exist. Anyway, we ordered our burritos and bowls (the chicken and tofu was incredibly seasoned and delicious), and the salsa bar didn't disappoint, as usual, to go with the side of chips that came with the burrito. Would definitely return here and wish they had more locations on the West coast!

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Nena U.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
This location IS slammed at lunchtime!   This was my friend "Danny B's" pick on this month's lunch time adventure.   We arrived promptly at 11:30 AM and there was only two people in line!  But listen up people by 11:40 the line swelled twice the size!!    After getting our food we chose a high table by the window - overlooking Market Square - in order to people watch.  There's plenty of outdoor patio seating available - in the event the indoor dining would fill up.   I had the "Wrong Doug" steak packed with black beans, cheese, quac, salsa, lettuce.   I usually get the salad or taco .. wanted to try something different.  The Wrong Doug is packed with goodness and grilled on both sides and served warm..  it was delicious but too big for me..I couldn't finish it.   

By the time we left the garbage cans were overflowing and they ran out of ice at the beverage station. . this location does well at lunch time.   It was a great lunch!! 


Thanks Moes !

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Sarah B.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: After having a bad experience at another Moe's earlier in the week we were reluctant to give Moe's another try. But, we were hungry and we went inside. We are so glad we did! Not only was the food great but the staff was super friendly. They were all very welcoming and made a connection with us as soon as we came in. The restaurant is in a great location overlooking Market Square. It is spacious with plenty of seating. The restaurant was kept very clean and organized.  The manager was very positive with his staff and even told them to have fun because it was Cinco de Mayo! We had a great time and will definitely be back!!! :)

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Robert U.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
This is a decent Moe's - "A-OK," just as Yelp describes a 3-star rating.  If you've been to Moe's, you know the menu.  I'm a fan.  The food here is fresh, everything is made-to-order, and I like it.

Beyond that, this location is a bit tight inside, tighter than your typical Moe's.  They do have some out-door seating here, which is a nice option.

Beyond that, it's not that special, so again, nothing wrong here at all, a solid 3-star location.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Angela C.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: Moe's beats national chains Chipotle, which has a location directly across from this one, and Qdoba, in my opinion. I think it's the combo of that friendly, "Welcome to Moe's!" along with fair prices and free chips that make your meal feel like a meal and, thus, a better value. I'm a vegetarian and every entree has a veggie or tofu option, and the tofu is well-seasoned and delicious. They also have the best queso of any of the fast Mexican places and it's not even close. This location spent a very long time remodeling but it's worth it thanks to the less crowded conditions while standing in line -- always long at lunch but moves quickly -- and the secret to-go nook next door. I say secret because it's separate from the restaurant and could be easy to miss, but what a great help to downtown workers in a hurry. Order on the app, give them 15 minutes and there's your order waiting, like magic, along with a salsa bar and drink fountain where you don't have to jockey for position during busy times like the main restaurant next door. Also worth downloading the app for -- you earn points that can be redeemed for free food in relatively short order, and a free entree for your birthday. Great rewards program.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Jon F.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
We visited Pittsburgh for the first time last weekend and found Market Square, which is the obvious downtown destination spot.  We looked around for an authentic mexican joint but couldn't find what was online (closed, perhaps?) so we ended up going to Moe's.  Moe's is like Chipotle is like Baja Fresh is like QDoba...you get the idea.  These are all counter service establishments that serve cafeteria style - pick your type of food, your meats, your fillings and customize your order.

I'm not generally a fan of this type of food and some of the things they get wrong like the rest of the chains do.  For example, they skimp on the meat - you get one spoon ladle full and the rest is fillings (I did not ask for double meat - you might try to!).  The meat itself is decent, but not what you're going to get with the places that do 'real mexican' - for example, I had carnitas but it wasn't anything like normal carnitas.  It felt like cafeteria food.

What they do get right is the same as the chains too - the ingredients are all fresh, the quality is decent and you can get a variety.  We ate in so it came with chips and I dug a number of the salsas they had.  My Carnita taco was passable and my girflriend had what amounted to a crunchwrap that was pretty tasty.

So, if you know what to expect and aren't too demanding, you can get some good food here.  And I don't know about the other reviews, but we found the service to be fine -friendly, warm and attentive.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Amanda J.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
Trying to find a cheap place for dinner in downtown Pittsburgh is near impossible.  So many places are closed by 4:00.  I know Moe's is a national chain, but we don't seem to have too many in Pittsburgh?  This might be the only one?  Who knows.

I ordered the Julia Guilia stack ($7.22 w tax), which was essentially a vegetarian burrito panini with a hard taco inside.  The vegetarian version comes with free queso and free guacamole which is cool by me.  The wrap isn't overly flavorful, but being as it comes with chips and salsa, it is super cheap.  Speaking of salsa, the salsa bar has some nice options, and you can actually see tomatoes in the red salsa.  Move aside Chipotle and Qdoba, I think Moe's is way better.  The food is cheaper, there are more options, and it tastes better.

One issue: Why do they feel the need to do the "Welcome to Moe's!" thing?  The last thing I need is to be screamed at by strangers when I enter an establishment.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Sophia S.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: I love this Moe's. I do online ordering about once a week from this location, they are always on time and always make my order exactly how I want it! One problem though was when we went into the store to get salsa, they were all out of the green salsa for the day (it was 11:30!!)

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Josh N.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
I came in today at noon (Monday, 8/7/17) at the mad lunch rush hour: twelve bells.

The associates I dealt with were friendly and efficient. I walked in at 12:08 and walked out, with food, at 12:20 which I thought was good since the line was out the door.

The food was standard Moe's fare; I had a bowl with ground beef, seasoned rice, and pinto beans. I could have easily made two meals out of it.

Four stars instead of five due to being very stingy on the chips.

I'd like to pop in at "not rush hour" but I was impressed by the performance at Moe's on Forbes today.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Rick B.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: So my last review got deleted because the location is closed. My Yelp app will not allow me to choose a new city. Maybe it needs an update Im not sure. So I head to Pittsburgh alot. Anyway I finally brought my laptop home from work and was able to get some places done I had been. Sorry Yelp does not specify a date, project a date, or even require one. Yes I was at a Tom Petty concert if that gives you an idea. That does not change the details. I have my Moes App to prove my dates for rude judgmental owners who apparently go out of their way to only garnish the positive. Clearing showing the interest to get better. I was going to the state college Moes for much better service and quality. Obviously that owner has no worries. So do what you have to do. I personally give my real life experience and you solidify why it is now closed. Touche!

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Kay S.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: Poor customer service.   Ordered takeout and was treated poorly.   And asked for directions back to the hotel and they couldn't help me either.   Don't bother.   I won't be back.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Hannah H.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description:
First time I visited a Moe's and had some expectations due to others raving about their food (better than their other tex mex counterparts, etc) 

I went for the grilled chicken salad, which was not too bad, not anything spectacular.

But the staff working when I went were hating their jobs there and not hiding it at all, not showcasing customer service, getting frustrated at everything.

pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.author: Carson D.
pJxbs4qsbd9lVYiLLc6Eig.description: Free chips?  I literally counted 10 chips while they skimped on the burrito itself. Save yourself the money and time!

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Christy B.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description:
After a night out at the casino which ended up with me passing the pho joint on my way to my uber, I could not shake the deep craving for the pho I didn't get before catching my ride. When I explained this to my husband who could not for the life of me figure out how I could eat pho for breakfast (ok ok, brunch) he suggested federal galley since he could get anything besides my weird breakfast hangover craving.

It is everything I dreamed it would be. I got the kalua pork which worked perfectly in the rich broth. All of the flavors blended more and more throughout the meal creating this great balance of savory and spicy. I'll say that it might even have been better the next day. I'm looking forward to trying many more options at Shaka, as their entire menu has my interest piqued.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Brogan M.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description:
This spot is yummy, but I was just a little confused. 

The food pairings are a unique fusion that definitely satisfies a much needed void for mouths that like sweet, sour, spicy, and fresh all in one bite. 

I'm sharing three stars because I always start at 5, and go down. This spots spicy range is a little unpredictable, as in you might get WAY spicy even if you don't think something is going to be spicy. 

The second star  missing would have been the price, it was about $21 a head for a rice bowl and some fried spring rolls.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Renee J T.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description:
It was a weds night the gallery was about full
The concept here is 5 different eateries with a common dining area I've been here before 
Let me sidetrack 
If you are a group or just 2 people want to eat together be warned it might not happen each kitchen is its own
So I've been seeing Shaka on social media
A poke bowl could make a great dinner
I ordered the pick your own because I am picky 
Tuna brown rice seaweed salad and edamame  sounds like my perfect combo and they have bubble tea I'm a huge bubble tea fan
Son ordered taco from a different kitchen and I ordered a hot brownie sundae from Provision 
Both arrived before Shaka food 
Bubble tea arrives I'm sad because these bubbles have a hard center I like my bubbles squishy but the tea has a nice flavor
So bowl arrives it's covered with requested items but oh no there is lots of green onions scallions 
And maybe you like but I don't and that's why I ordered the pick your own
They were very friendly about taking it back to remake. Sadly it took another 20 min for bowl arrival ( I went back to their counter asked for it to go)
I did eat it the next day it was good but alas the whole experience was not good

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Kristen E.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: Had a poke bowl with salmon, brown rice, pineapple, Lima beans, etc. It was good, though the sauce had a slight acidity that wasn't my favorite. At least there are large portions, which is good, because the average entree costs $15, which was more than I was expecting to pay at a glorified food court. I did appreciate that it was warm, had free WiFi, and had several flat screen TVs playing the football game. So I guess you're paying for the ambiance as well as the food. I did think the music was too loud to have comfortable conversation, especially as there is nothing to soak up the sound (all concrete, wood, and metal). There are gender-segregated bathrooms.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Karolyn A.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description:
Shaka is the restaurant I didn't know I needed in Federal Galley. 
When I saw Michigan & Trumble was bowing out, I was bummed... But then I saw the space had posted a menu for a Hawaiian cuisine place, and Poke was on the slate. There wasn't a poke place in North Side (to my knowledge, at least!) and I became intrigued.
I work right accross the way from Federal Galley, so I find myself there a lot. After eating off Shaka's menu the last few nights, it's safe to say it's my new go-to!
The Truffle Tuna is fantastic, so decadent! And the Spicy Smoked Salmon is an intoxicating  dream of loxy goodness, spicy mayo, edamame, and seaweed strips.
I love Shaka already, and can't wait to try more!

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Anqi H.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: This is probably the best Hawaiian fusion place in Pittsburgh. I love their truffle tuna poke bowl. Poke bowls are only as good as the quality of the fish, and their tuna was pretty good. I would get that anytime. I came here again on a Sunday and got the spam musubi brunch, and was pleasantly surprised. Musubi with hash browns! Can't wait to come back and try something else.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Ellen K.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: I'm super excited to have a lunch time option of a poke bowl. Shaka is a nice addition to the variety of cuisines at Federal Galley. Today was my first visit and as I came after the lunchtime rush, my order was ready in no time.  I tried the spicy ahi tuna bowl. It had delicious flavors. While not my favorite poke joint in Pittsburgh, I will definitely be a repeat customer and I hope it does well!

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Toni J.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: I like the food, but they always try to upsell you on adding avocados to your bowl, but they neglect to inform you there's an extra charge in adding avocado. That's pretty lame. Do you really need to try to rip me off a dollar every time I order? So be warned.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Lyndsay A.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description:
Shaka is the newest concept at Federal Galley. I visited just a few days after their opening and the whole experience was honestly underwhelming. 

We arrived around lunch time, so I expected to wait. However, we waited over 30 minutes in a line of only about 10 people. The woman taking orders was spending time chatting with customers instead of keeping her long line moving. She was also working the counter AND the only food runner, so she would disappear for several minutes at a time leaving the whole line at a standstill. 

When we finally ordered, I tried the spicy ahi tuna poke bowl. When adding avocado to that, it was $18. I expect to pay a little more at places like Federal, but come on! I was starving and I just kept hoping it would be worth it. 

When we finally got our food, probably another 15 minutes later, it was absolutely delicious. No question about that. HOWEVER, the portions were immensely small for the price and I let not feeling full. 

I was extremely disappointed in the overall experience but I hope maybe in a few weeks they can work out some of these issues and I'll give them another shot because the flavor of the bowl was great.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Sahil N.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: Although the price may stir people away, this place is delicious! I spent just under $22 for a poke bowl with smoked Salmon and Spicy Ahi Tuna! It was very high quality and had a unique flavor profile! I definitely recommend this as a nice healthy and tasty treat! Oh I also added Avocado of course! I'm hoping to see this place at a stand alone restaurant one day soon!

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Tim K.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: Love love love it! 3rd time and it's not the charm u just love it  the menu is amazing. The people are great and the food is AWESOME. I live across the street. I WILL be back!

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Kimberly S.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: Having recently been to Hawaii, the food here is not entirely authentic and is way overpriced BUT the truffle tuna poke bowl is my EVERYTHING right now! It's so damn good. Plus, I don't mind supporting a female chef.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Nicole K.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description:
Love the poke bowl! A little spice was delicious can't wait to go back. We had a the salmon and tuna.  Both were worth getting. 

Just read an article from the Sacramento Bee out of California. They recommend your poke bowels. Completely agree!

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Rugger W.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: Enjoyed a terrific bowl of pork pho.  It was one of the most flavorful broths I've had and the pork far exceeded expectations.  It's a little on the pricey side for fancy soup - but that's true of most regional pho or ramen dishes.  With that in mind, it was a nice splurge while on that side of town

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: William P.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: Nice job here.  Great new concepts on good.  Love everything I have tried so far.  Very interesting take on fusion foods. I.love everything and really will come here regularly for awhile.  Walking distance for us and nice to have awesome food options so close.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Kevin C.
