QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: I had the Citrus Ponzu Poke with Salmon, though I had asked for Tuna...The food was very good, even though it was not exactly what I ordered. It is a tasty dish with quite a lot going for it in terms of flavors and presentation. The two snags for me were the price and size of the dish. At $16 this is quite steep for lunch. Plus, for the money, the portion size was less than desirable (I still was hungry afterward). I will probably try a different restaurant the next time I'm at Federal Galley.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Steve L.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description:
Wasn't sure about the Federal Galley at first, but this place is an awesome addition!  Love the concept of Vietnamese-Hawaiian fusion cuisine...I had the Kalua Pork and Cabbage Rice bowl and it was amazing!  Loved the combination of flavors here....sweet from the pineapple, salty from the pork, and the cabbage was just the right amount of crunch!  My wife had the Truffle Tuna Poke Bowl and she was super impressed.   Wanted to order the Hawaiian Egg Rolls, but they were sold out!  Works for us though....just another reason to come back for more another day!  Had a chance to talk a bit to Summer and Nick and they truly care for their customers and want them to enjoy their experience!

Give this place a try...Super good/healthy food at affordable prices!

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Jonathan B.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description:
Shaka is fantastic. I ate there on opening weekend. Although the line was long, it went very fast. The counter employee was polite and helpful- moving the line along while making sure to explain the menu and to provide insightful suggestions. I ordered the Truffle Tuna poke bowl and the Hawaiian Egg Rolls. Both dishes arrived quickly. The employee delivering the dishes was very polite. He made sure that the dishes looked to my satisfaction, asked if I had any questions about the dishes, and informed me to let them know if anything was not to my standards. 

Shaka knocked both dishes out of the park! The egg rolls were a perfect blend of sweet and savory, and the right choice as a snack/starter. And the Truffle Tuna bowl - out of this world! At the outset, the presentation was perfect, and looked worthy of a menu picture. The taste rivaled the presentation. It is certainly obvious that Shaka uses fresh ingredients, and each item was carefully selected to work well together. If you want quality food, make your way to Shaka! I was thoroughly impressed, and will return soon.

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Emily H.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: Shaka is THE place! The food is absolutely delicious, and STUNNING. Today I ordered the pork pho and it did was extremely flavorful. The meat was very tender, and the combination of ingredients in the broth came together so beautifully. The quality of the food is AMAZING, they really care about the food they are putting on the table. The owner, Summer, is willing to answer any questions about the menu and has created an incredible menu. I would recommend Shaka to any of my friends!

QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.author: Diana T.
QXKN5MYb5O1sg6-G2pwTzg.description: A great new addition Federal Galley. The staff is very friendly, the food is amazing love the flavors.  I've asked for items to be on the side (as I wasn't sure if I would like them) and they were very accommodating.  I eat there once a week.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Alan W.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Went for diner the other night with wife and daughter.
The place was pretty empty.
I have been too several other Eat'n Park's before But my daughter choose this one as it was near her house.
We where seated immediately and server came over within a minute or two.
She immediately took drink and menu orders.
What I like about Eat'n Park is the salad bar as you can never go wrong at all and there is really enough food for a meal.
I had the turkey diner which came with mashed potatoes and stuffing and gravy.
The server was excellent friendly and service was fast.
The turkey meal was good and as I said I love the salad bar.
I would go back to Eat'n Park this location and any other.
If you are looking for an inexpensive meal that is also very good then Eat'n    park is for you.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Renee J T.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Well ...Thursday night at 8:30 we arrive 
We wait we wait about 15 min
No one comes to seat us talk to us nothing 
There are about 6 people dining ...Salad bar looks good 
Apparently no one works here ?
After seeing no one we left

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Barrett O.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Have had good breakfasts at several Eat'n Parks, this one is nicely modern and spacious with good service and good food. Great for breakfast and cool specials both for breakfast and lunch. The parking is on the street which can be an issue but you're inSquirrel Hill so that's the deal almost everywhere.

First thing noticed was the cleanliness of the restaurant. We were quickly seated. Our beverages were ordered and quickly brought over. Our waitress was friendly , pleasant and knowledgeable when we asked questions.

Our food was very good and they have some really cool items on the menu and the food is exactly what it says it's going to be. We usually make this our "go to" breakfast place every time we are visiting our daughter on Pittsburgh but getting a really decent burger and terrific shake is also happening on occasion. The prices are great, especially for Pittsburgh, and you always know what to expect.

I know the Yelp reviews are kinda all over the place but we have been doing Eat'n Parks for years and it's good for us every time so far.

Also giving a 10% veteran discount for the month of November and that gets kudos from my wife & I who are both veterans and lifetime members of Amvets

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Ashley S.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Not quite sure why i have never reviewed this location but here we go.....

So EnP is mediocre at best at any location. The service is pretty meh, the food is pretty meh and the portions are worse than meh. It's just a meh experience and sort of expensive if you think about it. 

So with this location, everything has gone down hill since my first visit. The service is absolutely terrible, the food again is mediocre and it's just not a great experience. 

Last time i ordered take out, I sat for 45 minutes before I even received my food. Now anyone that knows me, that I am pretty much non-confrontational. But I was hangry and it was late. No apologies, nothing from them other than here is your food. Yeah, I could have gone somewhere else, eaten and been home in the time I waited for my burger. Blah 

Don't think i'm going to ever come back to this location.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Chai A.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description: Meh.... Food has always been good but the service can use some work. I order from here twice a week at work and almost every time something from my order is missing.  Seams like they are always short staffed which could be the problem.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Richard Z.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Place is OK -- I think some of their main entrees are a little bit expensive compared to the actual amount of food you get but as far as the taste goes, it's decent. The mushroom burger tasted pretty good, though I didn't like their choice in bun and the actual burger was pretty small. The pies they have are amazing though. In fact, I think their desserts in general are really really good. 

Don't think you'd expect top of the line quality and hygiene at a super late night diner, so there's that, but it's nothing too extreme.

Service was a little slow (waited 45+ minutes for food, but it was also like 2 AM), but everyone was extremely nice. 

All in all, it's ok. There's definitely better, but it gets the job done.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Damon N.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description: The server was rude when we were nice. She was terrible at remembering our order. Food was good once it finally came out but the service sucked and so did the server, salad bar wasn't filled once since we've been here and it's been 45 minutes so we had to ask for them to give us stuff that should already be on the salad bar. Do not come here. It sucks very badly

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Shawn C.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description: "I got a nut roll, and I didn't even order one. My stomach is kind of hurting from the binge of yesteryear. " - Tyler

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Andrew C.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
After growing up going to this location, we have had a few terrible experiences, when it takes 30+ mins to get a meal only to be told we didn't get the order in the kitchen, then the manager does not know how to do a refund?
Oh and did I mention the SOB male server who said he was the only 1 here, but then I see 5 other employees.
Yep!

Bottom line don't do take out late on a Sunday night!

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Fox E.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Park n Eat then go into the restaurant. That's how I like to do it.

Eat n Park is probably one of the worst diner chains you may ever have the misfortune of visiting. Their food may even be worse than Denny's. If that is possible. The service here is nice but I always seem to get food poisoning from this chain, and it only seems to be teenage girls or old people that ever want to take me to one. Next time it is suggested, I will insist on choosing somewhere else.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Alejandro E.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description: Garbage service. Ordered drinks. Never got a refill. Waited an hour for food only to learn they hadn't even started the order. Cancelled the order. Server had the audacity to charge us for the drinks. Foods good, but not worth the wait or garbage service

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Mike R.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description: DONT COME HERE FOR TAKEOUT they won't take your order for about 20 minutes while they watch you wait. Probably have a better chance of getting service by sitting down and eating. But who am I kidding even then there motto at this eat n park is to say "be right back" and then to disappear for an hour.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Sneha N.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
I was here a few times just for the molten lava cake. It requires no description! They have the best molten lava cake and please do not hesitate to ask for more chocolate sauce. 
For some reason, the second time I visited, they added whipped cream on the side which was totally unnecessary. I am still not sure if that is part of the order since they never gave whipped cream when I got this previously.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Rich M.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Elevator Review: Food is meh. This place is powered by nostalgia. The staff is nice, but service is often unbearably slow. 

My son loves this restaurant. He loves the salad bar. He loves the Smiley Cookie. He loves the kids menu. This is why I think that EnP gets as many 4 and 5 star reviews as it gets: people ate there as children and nostalgia drives them to rate highly. 

The food is fine. EnP is a diner. You can go in and get good breakfast food (but there are better options). You can go in and get a good burger or sandwich (but again there are better options). And they have some great desserts (but, wait for it, there are better options). 

I have had numerous friends (all non-native Pittsburghers) act surprised when EnP's non-diner food is lackluster. (Is anyone really surprised that EnP doesn't make a great quesadilla?) If you're going, stick to the basics. 

My issue with the Murray Ave restaurant is the service. While there are servers that we absolutely love, it takes unreasonable amounts of time for food to arrive. My son and I waited 30+ minutes for a chicken sandwich and pancakes at a time when the restaurant was less than half-full. When we first started patronizing the Murray Ave location (2016) service was quick, but since mid-2017 the pace seems painfully slow. Did management change? Is the kitchen that understaffed?

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Sirena W.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Limited Time $2 pies, pies, pies!

My friends and I got 5 different pies:

- Peachberry: 10/10, the combo is amazing and that perfectly baked crust, mmm.
- Apple: 8/10, better than average apple pie
- Oreo Creme: 6/10, your standard oreo creme pie
- Blackberry: 3/10, oddly sweet... not in a good way
- Strawberry creme: 1/10, under-baked pie crust, uncut strawberries, strawberry jelly/syrup, whipped cream, no thanks.

We also got the hand-breaded zucchini. The first few zucchinis were good. As we got toward the bottom of the basket, they were drenched in oil. Yuck.

Waitress was friendly, but wasn't very attentive. This might've been because we got say away from the rest of the crowd. Still no excuse though on a slow Sunday night.

+ side: THEY ACCEPT DINEX yay.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Amit D.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
I've been here several times, and only once it was when other nearby places were open - my first time. All other times, I've come here during odd hours - after 2am or before 7am. The only reason I come here is because it's really close to my home and is the only place open late. (I think they recently moved away from being open 24 hours and shut down 3am-6am). 

It's not the best eatery around. Their fish sandwich is pretty unsavory, so I wouldn't recommend that. Somehow, they've managed to mess up the molten Lava cake as well. Their breakfast items are decent - the banana french toast is the only item that I somewhat like. I would also avoid the key lime pie. 

The servers are nice. Ambience is like a regular diner.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Rachel R.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Ol' Reliable. Something for everyone, and the food isn't half-bad. It's definitely not the best food you've ever eaten, and sometimes the service+hygiene leaves a little to be desired, but it gets the job done, and this location is open till the wee hours (used to be open 24 hours when I was in high school--whatever happened to that?) so it does well for a meal after a late movie at the Manor or a late night drinking at the Cage. I like the fish sandwich (a GIANT amount of food, and the bun is tasty), the onion rings, the Smiley cookies (duh), and the potato soup. Plus really good milkshakes! 

This location is rarely crowded even on the weekends, has been recently remodeled, and my parents got engaged here as poor college students in the early 80s (!) so I really can't complain too much about it!

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Bobby W.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
People are crazy with these bad reviews! Eat'n'Park is a Pittsburgh staple and a BREAKFAST/LUNCH spot. Don't come to eat'n'park expecting a fine dining experience: it's a beefed up diner. 

The pies and breads are fantastic. They bake a lot of things in house. The breakfasts are delicious and their smiley Belgian waffle is the best waffle money can buy. The service is good at this location and it's open super late on weekends if that's your thing. 

The salad bar is always fresh, the soups hot, and the sandwiches on the menu are good. Super clean and well maintained and a great location for a big crowd of people regardless of what time of day.

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Lindsay B.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description: We visited Pittsburgh for the 4th of July and this was our first stop given we landed so late that nothing else was open. I can't say that the food was amazing--just so so. However, our server was Troy (who was apparently the manager of the restaurant) and he was amazing. Our appetizer got left off and our food took a while to come out. Troy took it upon himself to give us both dessert on the house and some free coffee mugs. He also knew alot about the surrounding areas and gave us tourists some great information for our trip. Food=not so great. Management=great!

JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.author: Danielle L.
JBrwWVhNm8PFhTOVkuXk4Q.description:
Well, I love Eat'n Park.  I can't get enough of it!  There's just something about that ranch!

Anyways, I have a few go to's.  Salad bar with chicken finger entre, salad bar with cheese sticks, or buffalo chicken salad.  Most of the time I get something with the salad bar because I can eat that ranch for days.  Their apple pie and Oreo pie are both good classic desserts.

Overall, the enp quality is meh, service is all over the place, but there's just something about bleh diner food that keeps us sucked in!

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: David G.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description:
My colleagues and I had the immense privilege of visiting a hot local spot tonight: Forbes Gyro.
Upon entering, I already knew we were in for a special treat. The décor inside was simple, but it was clear the restaurant was kept clean. The seating arrangements were aged like fine wine, and it was evident that they had been used often, indicating the location's popularity. 
We were greeted with a beaming smile from the location's proud owner, Jacob. He gleefully took our orders, and was quick to offer his pen when mine ran out of ink. That's just the kind of guy Jacob is. You know when you eat at Forbes Gyro that you're getting that famous Oakland hospitality that attracts students from all over the world. 
One issue that arose amongst my associates was the notable absence of individual slices of pizza on the menu, but you know what they say: never order pizza in a gyro place. Either way, the menu was somewhat unclear, and even lead to some confusion amongst the group as to what was offered.
I ended up opting for the classic lamb gyro, which arrived in a timely manner. My gyro was wrapped in a soft warm pita, and was filled with the delectable combination of juicy lamb, fresh lettuce, sliced tomatoes, and just a pinch of onions. Drizzled throughout the gyro was what one can only assume to be homemade tzatziki sauce. The lamb was tender and well-seasoned. 
I was enjoying my experience until I opted to sample my colleague's fries. Much to my chagrin, the fries were rather bland as initially served. When paired with the authentic Greek salt offered at each table, the quality of the side dish improved significantly. 
All-in-all, Forbes Gyro was an unforgettable experience. My 45-minute expedition to the land of the Mediterranean ended abruptly when I stepped back out onto the mean streets of Oakland. Whether you are study the trends of the DOW, or spend your days examining the works of da Vinci, Forbes Gyro has just a little something for everyone.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Salina P.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: One of the best gyro around south o people!! I was hesitant going into bc of some reviews, but the quality of this place proved them all wrong. The people who work there first of all are so kind. And the gyros are to die!! No meat overload to the point where it's too much, but they don't skimp either and the lamb is crisp and juicy. Pita is top quality, they also make them super quick and have to put in no time. Just the right amount of sauce too, and you just can't beat the price either. I was never a big Mediterranean/Greek eater before, but Forbes Gyro confirmed my love for the gyro scene!!

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Justin H.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: Good place to grab a gyro if your in the mood for a decent gyro, has a full menu that offers pizza and Turkish dishes. The place is right on Forbes so parking will be terrible but if your in the area and want a gyro in Oakland this place is a viable option.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Chai A.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description:
HORRIBLE I repeat HORRIBLE!

Never felt to slighted in my life involving takeout food.  I stopped and ordered a gyro and falafel a hour ago.  I got home and started to dig into the scrumptious smelling falafel and my tongue was immediately hit with the God aweful taste of either rubbing alcohol, fermented mouse droppings or some other taste that should not be on anyone's food.  Whatever they fried my falafel in was obviously not supposed to be in there because I broke it apart and the inside tasted fine.

My gyro was as basic as it gets from the place that claims to have the betb gyro in the city.

You have no idea how bad I wanted to go back to the shop and curse out the owown in front all the customers he is scamming.  I kind of felt someone was odd about him when I went in and could 5ell he didn't want to serve me anything but I shrugged it off.

DO NOT ODER FROM HERE TRUST ME

Update: just called the owner and he implied I did something to the food on my way home LMAO what a joke...then he says we'll the grease we use is old ...
Well obviously it is along with something else your not admitting ‍

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Karla D.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description:
This is definitely an Oakland institution.

I really like the chicken wraps and my boyfriend is a fan of the gyros.

Been coming here for years and here's the thing I don't get, the fries are never good. Never. Always greasy, limp and soggy.

So, don't order the French fries and you'll have a great meal.

Sometimes the service sucks. Every now and again you'll get an order taker with a real annoyed attitude. Blah.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Carlyy B.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: The meat is soooo dry and hardly tastes like gyro meat. Also if you like cucumber perfume flavored sauce on your gyro than I guess this is the place for you.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Mahum H.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: My always go-to pizza place. Oh wait, I mostly get it ordered at home whenever I put on a nice movie. Must must must try all their pizzas on the menu

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Vicky Y.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description:
Good gyros at a good price.

After passing by this place everyday, I finally decided to go in and try it with a friend. We were surprised to find that the food tasted much better than the restaurant's decor suggested. I had the chicken gyro with pita. The meat was tasty, lettuce crunchy, and sauce was dripping on the table (sorry). The portions are also quite large (especially for the price) and I was VERY full by the time we finished.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Orlando R.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: The worst ever I don't know what they call gyro but for sure they don't know what gyro is. To begin that's not lamb meat , second the meat was half cooked it was red. Then you call and no manager to take the complaint.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Kaki M.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description:
We have been there a lot of time ... very nice nd friendly, the best Lahmacun in Pittsburgh!!!! 
Also love their lentil soup

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Pink H.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: The food is terrible, the gyro meat was dry with no flavor, the sauce was like water, the cheese fries were flavorless as well especially because the cheese was slices melted on the fries not to mention the combo meal with 2 gyros and one order of fries came to 20bucks no drinks included like really... Terrible food way over priced and raggedy interior...Smh. Nice ppl tho -_-

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Frank S.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: I ate here about 2 years ago..it was horrible..I tried the gyro combo today for lunch and it was worst..the gyro had little meat and had no flavor..the fries were good. but not worth eight dollars. bad service girl at register the girl had no emotion and snatched money...I wont be back

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Sarvar I.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: I always order food from there when i have chance. I love their wrap combo, that comes with wrap fries and can of soda. Gyro wrap is probably best meal in pitt.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Liz E.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: I like their food...and we order alot for the VA in Oakland...hungry nurses...we called for delivery...they no longer deliver??? In a college town??? Ordering on the Grub Hub/Eat24 app costs $2.99...which was 20% of a 15.00 order...they are literally 3 blocks away.  Sorry, we won't be paying that...R&B's pizza got our business tonite...and we'll spread the wealth unless Forbes Gyro starts delivering again. It's a shame because the food IS good.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Limbin P.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description:
To be honest I think this is my favorite restaurant in all of Pittsburgh. The service is incredible, the food is always delicious, they're open way more hours than anybody else in Pittsburgh, and some of the things are really good deal like the calzones. I'd recommend the gyro or Adana Kebab though because that's what's really special here.  Also they have Hershey's ice cream which is pretty good. They're not over friendly but they have really good service. 

Don't expect somewhere nice and fancy. Expect a delicious, affordable, hidden gem.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Brandon L.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: I've had food delivered from here using Grubhub and thought that the food was pretty decent! Just based on the food - I would give it a 3-star. However, the most recent time I stopped by the store in-person, I tried their raspberry ice cream in a sugar cone and it was DELICIOUS! It was only $2.13 and they are pretty generous with the portion! I am a big fan of Dave and Andy's across the street but in terms of affordability and flavor, I will probably find myself coming here more often for ice cream. They also accept credit/debit cards here which makes it more convenient. Kind of weird to be supporting this place mostly because of their ice cream but if you want some good dessert, then definitely give this place a try!

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Tony C.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: We loved the food we got while visiting the city.  Ordered takeout, which my wife went to pick up.  She told me I had to write a review about how awesome the service was when she went to pick it up.  Fast, friendly, and everything in our order was perfect.  The Forbes gyro special pie was a great change of pace from the normal pizza.  I loved it.  The vegan in our group loved the falafel pita.  Everything was really fantastic.  We will definitely order from here again.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Edward C.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: Found this place on Yelp, was Christmas Day and starving, only place open in all of Pittsburgh (well, not really but it seemed like it). I had the Gyro special #1, came with fries and a pop. The Gyro had plenty of meat, tzatziki sauce, lettuce and tomato, delicious. I shall drop by again next time I'm in the area.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Joseph T.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description:
The food at Forbes Gyro has drastically improved since opening a few months ago. I ordered a doner plate with a spinach pinwheel pastry. The doner was more flavorful and had a nice crisp texture. The rice had bits of a small brown ingredient which made the rice very tasteful too. I was unable to identify it, but my friend suspected it was a type of nut. The pastry was good too! I liked how flakey it was, but it was a tad too greasy.

Also, they have now expanded their menu to include American and Turkish pizza.

jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.author: Nerine S.
jTlcLfsSDGnHcbjL1aD9Zw.description: So underrated! I get a lamb gyro here pretty often. They're fast, delicious, and open late -- so it's a great late night food option when you don't feel like eating pizza or American food when you get hungry on the late night. They have a wide variety of items and the prices are reasonable. I go about once a month and I'll definitely be going more often.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Taylor D.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description:
I LOVE this place. Cheap chicken wings, great seasoning, and wonderful fries. I can't get enough of their seasoning, if anyone knows what it is, please let me know. Everyone has always been friendly at this location. But beware, they are cash only and they don't have an ATM. They are also available on a couple food delivery apps, so if you don't have cash and don't want to leave your house, you're in luck! 

Definitely give this place a try! Bang for your buck! 

(And did I mention that seasoning though?)

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Mackenzie B.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description:
I ordered the large catfish. It was okay? And they are weaaaaaakkk when it comes to the seasoning. Ask for some on the side - and they will give you shit for that.

You don't come here for the service, we pretty much watched the staff argue with each other for about 10 mins.

And the sweet potato pie was bad - I've had decent sweet potato pie, and this was garbage.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: shana n.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: I have been going to this place for years before I moved away. I went last night and the place hasn't changed. Great prices, cash only, great food. Only one thing the chicken wings have gotten a lot smaller. Like when you order chicken wings you expect there to be at least three full bites on that wing not 1- 1 1/2 because of the lack of meat. Do better y'all and get another plug for chicken wings. Because the chicken wings from the other night would be embarrassed to be called wings.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Theron G.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: My roommate ordered delivery from Hook Fish and Chicken almost two hours ago via DoorDash, and it has been "1 minute away" for the past hour! We tried calling Hook, but no one answers and the answering machine is full. We live in the same neighborhood, so it's not even a long drive!

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Jessica H.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: All the Uber eats selection suck so i figure i go with them. I got the catfish nuggets and shrimp. It was so freaking good. I gave them 4 stars not 5 cause my cheese sauce was cold. Who wants cold cheese fries. I recommend this place worth the prices.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Chai A.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: The best seafood place in town besides red lobster..... I don't know what the season their fish in but whatever it is should be illegal cause it calls my name in my sleeo

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Lori C.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: Tried this place today for the first time.  The place nothing impressive could use some sprucing up.  The catfish was amazing though and I loved the fries. I did think it was a bit pricey though. I would probably get take out again if I was in the area.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Addiel G.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description:
"Not even freshly squeezed", LEMONADE $2.99 for an average sized cup is a bit much and 80 cents for every refill is ridiculous !! 
Chicken wings Amazing , no sauces necessary !! Cole slaw is sweet & tasty , corn nuggets & Catfish  delish... 
Building certainly needs some TLC and a deep cleaning so that's why I can only give them 3 stars... 
The help was polite, patient and courteous

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Ike F.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: This place is below average.  Food was not that good. I got the wings and they were small and fried to a crisp.  Not in a good way.  They were super dry. My friend got the gizzards.  He said they were just ok.  Average fries and so-so coleslaw.  I also got a piece of cake and it was super dry and fairly tasteless. Plus the worst part is that it's cash only.  Not worth having to spend an extra 15 minutes to find an atm which won't charge me a fee.  I will probably never come back.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Markus L.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: Yes the pricing is weird. Yes there is no seating. Yes they only except cash. I'll just stick to reviewing the food. The "powder" is a nice touch. It's delicious. Fries are great! I ordered the perch and it was amazing as well. Considering there is no dine in, the food is packaged well and holds up (mine didn't get soggy at all) while I took it back home. Service was fine.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Emily W.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: I  Hook Fish & Chicken!! That seasoning is to die for!! I Love the wings, shrimp & fish!!! It's close to me & I like that!! I'll definitely be back!!

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Heather G.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description:
As long as you don't expect service with a smile, then this will be a good spot for you!

I sampled the fried chicken wings, fried scallops, fried whiting filet, fried jumbo shrimps, and French fries. As I review this, I realize how calorically wrong this plate sounds but if you are going to indulge in seafood, this is where you want to be. 

And everything for me was a sample because the portions were so large that I wasn't able to finish any one thing. It made for great leftovers the next day, though.

They sprinkle some dust on the fried seafood after it comes out the fryer but I wouldn't be able to tell you what it is. It looks like sawdust but has no taste and the "friendly" cashier ignored me when I asked him what he was sprinkling on my food. 

Even with his attitude, I still give this a 4 star experience. That says a lot...

There is a take out only restaurant so unless you live in the area, be prepared to eat in your car...like I did.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Ellen A.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: Fantastic as always. Order was prepared correctly and delivered on time right to our door!

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Courtney H.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description:
You can never go wrong with hooks ! The chicken is great and so are the catfish bites . Extra "dust" please! 

 The workers are very rude if you don't know exactly what you want. They are not very patient. Also it seems like They do not like answering questions. This place is CASH ONLY. So come prepared. Overall it's a really good place cuz the food is delish!

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Erica S.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: Ordered the shrimp and chicken tender meal. Their chicken and shrimp are seasoned just right. Whenever I get a taste for fried food we always frequent this company. There chicken wings are delicious too.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Stacie C.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description:
I don't know what kind of magic unicorn pixie dust they sprinkle on their food, but whatever it is, I can't get enough!

After years of hearing a friend ask me if I've tried Hook Fish and Chicken yet, I could finally answer yes.  And then I finally understood why she kept asking.  I tried the combo featuring 6 whole wings, fries, slaw and bread.  It was all just. So. Good.  The bread (your basic white sliced) is placed on the bottom, like a cloud that any grease from the wings can soak in to.  The wings and fries are packed into a styrofoam container and sprinkled with their infamous seasoning and then closed tightly with a rubber band placed around to keep all that goodness from spilling out.  

The menu is basic, just pick your fried food of choice (wings, tenders, fish, shrimp) and sides (even fried okra).  My meal was $8.  It is cash only and take out only with an ATM on site.  You can call ahead but most orders are ready in ten minutes.  

Be warned, you will become an addict.  "Why did I only get 6 wings?" I kept asking myself as I have been dreaming of those wings ever since.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Veronica B.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: Really good! I ordered the Tilapia and Fries...and got a whole lot with big huge fish filets. I've also had their fried chicken in the past and that was good as well. I just wish they accepted cards. Yes they do have an ATM but that charges you. It is definitely a great place to check out, but make sure you bring cash.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Robert P.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: Not cheap but good quality ... they have numerous locations throughout the city... Most are real good and I actually prefer the fish over the chicken but both are good

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Amara R.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: Good place for fried fish. Carry out only with a number of options from which to choose. I would've liked a little more seasoning on my whiting, but nothing some hot sauce couldn't fix. Also, very good french fries.

YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.author: Harold W.
YKOKwx7RgJ9SwDC5MdI2gw.description: They have great chicken wings fried in fresh  oil consistently. If you love shrimp then look no further.Their food is made to order and may take a little longer if you're expecting fast food .  When I have a craving for fish or shrimp they are at the top of my list. I don't like  long reviews, I just want to convey places  were I had good food. Bon appétit.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Joshua C.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
This is a special Jimmy Johns and is the go-to lunch spot in Oakland. I could literally eat here every day. Why - because it's great. Has to be some of the freshest bread in the city. No matter what I get off the menu I still feel great afterwards. Kick-ass staff too. I'm in and out in less than three minutes just about every time. These kids hustle to make things right and are led by great management. I would recommend this Jimmy Johns to anyone who's in the Oakland area who wants a fresh, healthy lunch that's lightening fast. 

My go to is the #4 Turkey Tom with sprouts and Jimmy peppers. I've been trying some of the new items on the menu and walk away happy every time.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Bob P.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
Waiting for over one hour, tracking order says eat which i assume means it is here- it is not. Called store and they said they were very busy and sorry- no ETA given.
Dont like the idea they misrepresented the order tracker- maybe it makes them look good for corporate. Not using them again

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Shannon N.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: Quick service. Went in at noon but didn't wait long in line. This was my first time dining at a Jimmy Johns and I was surprised to enjoy it. I got a veggie wrap. They have an option to have a lettuce wrap instead of bread! I would have liked more vegan options...hummus for instance.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Heather D.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: Freaky fast my ass. Took over 30 mins to be delivered. Probably won't order from here again which sucks because this little Frenchie sandwich is actually pretty good.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Michael L.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
From the moment you enter this Jimmy John's off of Forbes, you are immediately greeted by the employees. This is a great place for a quick bite to eat in the Oakland area. You can't go wrong with a Beach Club any day of the week. I highly recommend having them cut your sub in half and taking advantage of the freebies to add to your sub. Also, the Vito and Italian Night Club are classic staples to get here! If you enjoy Salt and Vinegar chips these are the by far, the best that I've ever had. 

 I am sad to say the cleanliness of this franchise location is subpar, as 75 percent of the tables and floors weren't clean with only 3 people eating in-shop. This is the only reason for sub 5 star review. 

Street parking is available next to the CVS, within walking distance to this Jimmy John's.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Jj N.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: Received a delivery from a employee on a bike at 3401 forbes was real short with me and nasty gave me improper change asked his name he took his sunglasses off and stared at me kind of oddly won't be ordering again

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Bridget W.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
Love this place! The sandwiches are always delicious and I've never had a problem with their delivery service. 

I've tried the roast beef here, the Vito and the beach club. So far, the beach club is my favorite. I love the taste of the turkey with the avocado! It's so yummy! Their bread is to die for as well! 

I love ordering from them because they're super fast and so inexpensive! 

I might love this place more than subway... and that's saying a lot.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Grace C.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: I was just in and placed a to go order for a turkey breast unwich, extra turkey, hold the mayo, add Dijon mustard. Seems pretty simple to me, but it seemed to cause great confusion amongst the staff. I thought we finally had things straightened out, but when I opened my sandwich, I had no condiments at all, and maybe 1 oz of turkey. So I basically paid over $4 for lettuce and 2 small slices of tomato. I would have complained and asked for a new sandwich but by this time I was a couple miles away in my car driving to my next meeting. So now I'm hangry. This is not the first time this location has messed up an order. You guys really need to get your act together.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Marc C.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
I loved Jimmy Johns while in college. Personally i enjoyed it more than subway. The ingredients tasted better and the chip selection was always on point. It was never too crowded at this location probably because it was on the edge of campus.

My favorite sandwich was the California beach club. Turkey cheese, lettuce, tomatoes & avocado. They had some damn good guac there for sure. always a good choice to recharge after a long day of lectures or studying. 

I miss this place wish we had one on Long Island. #JJonLI

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Cay W.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
This place is awesome!! 

Staff was super helpful and very nice!!

Service was unexpectedly fast even on dollar sub night!!

Definitely recommend going here if you need a quick lunch or a bite after work 

Service is fast and super affordable prices. 
No offense to subway but JimmyJohn's is the Best!! 

Great job guys keep up the goodwork!

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Derry R.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
Jimmy John's is a great go to when you need a quick bite or just can't decide what to eat. They specialize in cold cuts which pairs great with a Coke on a hot summer day. Typically, I don't indulge in Jimmy John's too often in the winter time. 

"Freaky fast", the motto they live by, does have it's problems. They have a surprising number of employees every single time I'm in the shop, no matter what time of day. But with such an assembly line, specifications particular to my sandwich are often missed and ignored. I have learned at this location, after they have made your sandwich, it's imperative to check to make sure that it has been created correctly. I've gotten numerous free sandwiches because of their errors. 

However, when they make my sandwich correctly and to my liking, I'm highly satisfied and would definitely recommend Jimmy John's to anyone who has never tried before. 

4 stars.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Nicole R.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: I have been to many an event catered by Jimmy John's, and it is always a bummer. This is because for their catering menu, the only vegetarian option they have is a sandwich that basically has provolone and flavorless "guacamole" paste. It's a shame.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: mark t.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
I've eaten here many times before. In my opinion it's a great place if your in a hurry. I love how fast they work. there's always  3 or 4 people doing the work of 1 or 2. I've often sat and wondered about this and I think it's a gimmick that shifts the focus away from the actual taste. 
 The taste of the hoagie is fair. I've had better but it's done so fast that it's worth it...? If it weren't for the speed of preperation and the cookies I would go 3 stars. As it sits,  I LIKE not love this place.
 great college food.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: M M.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: Jimmy Johns is a good sandwich shop but I'm gonna tell you the truth about them. They're fucking cheap as hell. Portions are small as a dogs weiner. Three slices of turkey, cheese, and vegetables that are so paper thin that you can almost see right through it. They even changed the lettuce from delicious leaf lettuce to cheap ass, rabbit food iceburg because it cost less yet they want $6 for a sandwich? Like give me a break. Seriously.....all bread and paper thin condiments. I feel as though I'm at Panda Express when they give you all rice and very minimal meat. Cheap cheap cheap! Go to Jersey Mikes instead. They cut the turkey fresh for you in front of you and they load it up really good. The taste is amazing as well. The only thing good about JJ is the bread. Big deal. When I go out to eat I want my monies worth. Not some cheap as owner that skimps on portions.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Alexa T.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
Would be coming back only if JIMMY JOHN'S head is mounted on the wall!
Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Mike H.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: Yes.  Quality and Clean.  JJ's trumps Subway for sure.  This location is perfect if you're at work, at school or a hospital near by.  Good prices and from what I understand they have delivery that's freakishly fast.  Good food in a pinch.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Lauren P.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: You can't go wrong with a sub from Jimmy Johns-perfect place for lunch. They deliver or a quick place to stop in and get your order.  One of the best secrets is the nine grain bread you can choose to get your sub on instead of the white roll. It is so tasty!  I always go for the beach club-turkery, provolone cheese, tomatoe, lettuce, and guacamole.  One of my favorite things about this place is the option to get guacamole on the sub.  I also highly recommend the vegggie sub-sprouts, cheese, tomatoe, cucumber and more gucamole! Their cookies which are huge (especially the chocolate chip) are delicious!

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Sarah B.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description:
I found my first experience with the unwich to be a delightful treat.  I must eat gluten free so I am always wary of the ability of sandwich shops to meet my needs.  They did a wonderful job of keeping my unwich from cross-contamination and I loved every bite of the all veggie choice (sans avocado spread which couldn't be verified gluten free).  I did find it a bit odd that all of there deli meats had gluten but better safe than sorry.

If I had written this review yesterday I would have given 5 stars.  However, today I ordered the same unwich for dinner and was pretty disappointed by how wilted and even brown pieces of the lettuce holding the unwich together were.  I would expect crisp and fresh lettuce since the lettuce is a key player here.

All in all, I'd go back and keep my fingers crossed for fresher lettuce.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Tony D.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: The few locations I've been to have been pretty consistent, and this one is no different. Their sandwiches are fast, cheap, and to the point. They have a ton of employees, so the food is passed down the assembly line in an efficient fashion. The menu, with all its creative monikers and such, really just comes down to choosing your vegetables and meat and finding the combination that you want (or customize it). No matter what you get, the subs are some of the best that you'll find in the area.

kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.author: Jenny B.
kYXnTyi3ucyxoswK9bvzCQ.description: I love Jimmy John's sandwiches, and this is the fastest one I have ever been to.  I stopped by for lunch today and ordered a veggie sub, and my sandwich was ready before I walked to the end of the counter to get it!  And this was at 12 noon; they were pretty busy.  I am definitely a fan!

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Savi N.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description:
We stumbled upon Sahara whilst looking for a park to take our dog. We decided to try them out as they allowed us and our pup to sit on their patio and eat. 
To start off the waitress was amazing. So friendly and brought across water for our dog. She was very present without hovering.
We started off with the Hummus which was by far the best I've had. I told my husband at that point - if the hummus is this good the food must be fantastic. 
Which it was. 
We had the lamb platter and the Chicken platter. Both were amazing and the portions were huge. 
My dog who rarely eats when he is out polished off a generous amount of lamb and rice.
The veggies are outstanding and the red cabbage took me straight back the the UK at our favorite kebab truck! 
We had tons of left overs and have finally found our go to place.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Ed N.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description:
This was my first time at Sahara and we came in for lunch.  

Staff - super friendly and inviting.  They went out of their way to make the meal and great experience.  He even got us the dinner menu so we could order different appetizers.

Food - we dined on lamb and chicken kabobs and a sampler appetizer.  They were all delish.  The food was flavorful and tasty.  The warm pita was a nice touch as well.

Location- beautifully decorated.  The lights in the facility are lovely.

I will definitely be back for more!

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Kristy A.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description:
I used to love Istanbul Sofra and was sad when it closed (I get it though - hard to support a place where the owner is in the news for bad stuff).  This place is essentially the same and I was excited when it came back under a new banner.  Space, menu, etc.  are not notably different.   The chef, I am told, is the same.  They just got rid of the owner problem.   

So why the one star?   A few things.  First, value.   I ordered a small mixed appetizer and a lamb kebab meal via Grubhub.   The total with tip came to almost $50 - for lunch.  This is way excessive, but I ordered anyway because I was in the mood for it.   For the price, you'd think the portions would be huge.   They are and they aren't.  The meat portion of my lamb kebab was scant - very little meat and cooked beyond well done.   The vegetable (zucchini) was a mere garnish, with two tiny spears.  Lots of rice though - go figure.  The pita portion was also scant for the amount of dips ordered in appetizer.   Guess you gotta pay for extra.   I would usually stretch this order into 2 meals and a snack, but with barely any meat and pita, it was more like one and then a bunch of waste.  

The packaging was also haphazard.  Two bags, one with warm pita on top of cold salad.  And the other with cold dips on top of the warm meal.   I didn't even know the salad was in there because it was buried under the pita (I assumed the pita bag contained a reasonable portion of pita and didn't think to look under it.  

The piece de resistance though.  After eating half of the mixed eggplant, I discover a bug mixed in.  Looked like a little beetle or something - possibly a baby roach.  Just gross.  After thinking that I'd already had one unexpectedly crunchy bite in the part that I ate, I tossed the rest of my $50 meal in the trash and ate a cookie for lunch.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Etta M.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: Excellent food and service. According to my dad, best lamb chops he's had in many years.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Khadija D.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: I just went here with a friend from out of town and I was very impressed. The food is delicious, authentic, and reasonably priced. The staff was wonderful too. I highly recommend it if you want a nice night out to treat yourself.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Paul H.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: They have a second, small dining room which is great if you have a large group and want a quieter or more private space.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Diane B.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: Pleasantly surprised. Many restaurants have come and gone at this location. Hopefully this one is here to stay. I was skeptical because there are so many places around town for middle eastern food, and many are so-so. Here, the food was beautifully plated and delicious. Only negative - the staff seemed very disorganized (but pleasant).

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Riccardo F.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description:
This is my first time at Sahara, but second time  if I consider Istanbul Sofra. Although the ownership has changed, the menu is still the same...luckily! Their middle eastern cuisine consists of rice, meat, falafels, yogurt sauces is going to make you fall in love with the culture.

Waiters have kindly cut and served the cake that we brought, and the service was really fast although the restaurant was crowded.

Going back as soon as possible!

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Kristen E.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: Since the head chef of the former Istanbul Sofra bought the restaurant, you can be sure the same (slightly shorter?) menu is being prepared with the same care and attention to detail. We recently enjoyed average dolma with nice warm pita before tucking in to huge platters of three different kebabs. One entree is two servings, so you can share with a dining partner, or take it home for leftovers. The value for your money can't be beaten. The servers are attentive, and if I'm not mistaken, the interior is brighter with a new coat of paint.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Yusuf K.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: Turkish manti was the most delicious one I have ever eaten! I also suggest shish kebab!

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Sercan Ö.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description:
I don't give many 5 star reviews, but this place is fantastic. We loved everything about it from decor to the food.

The Hünkar Beğendi was so delicious, I had the kebabs and they were tender and delicious.

The staff is really nice and accommodating. Come check it out! We'll definitely be back!

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: john p.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: This place is the successor to another Turkish restaurant.  The food is not quite as good but is still very tasty.  The predecessor was generally packed but this place seems to unfairly bear the burden of the previous management.  Enjoyed the food and staff were very pleasant and accommodating.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Heather M.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: The food was excellent and service was remarkable I really liked the restaurant I recommend trying it the chef from the old restaurant bought it I had the grape leaves they were amazing I also had the shrimp kebab dinner it came with rice and vegetables

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Sarah J.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: We were looking for a fun meal after visiting the Frick and were so very pleased. This place has an awesome atmosphere inside and out and the food was so fresh and tasty. We ordered the Karniyarik based on our waitresses recommendation that it is an ancient recipe and it was delicious. We were the only non-Mediterranean people there which is always a good sign.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Lucinda R.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description:
So fresh so delicious so fast! I ordered delivery via yelp and grub hub- awesome potions for the price- perfect seasonings and the lamb was tender. I plan to visit the restaurant in the near future!

My driver was friendly and courteous- 
Really worth a try!

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Sercan A.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: we just had our best meal there, service was great, food tasted excellent! Too many delicious choices on their menu, fresh greens and yummy appetizers. Best Mediterranean restaurant I've tried in a while, will definitely come back!

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Deborah B.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: Delicious, good value.  We were just interested in take-out, and the manager made suggestions which were perfect for the 2 of us-did not try to sell us on too much food.  The lamb kebabs were delicious and a sizeable portion for the price.  Baba Ghanouj was the best I've ever had- had a smoky flavor that was memorable (and addictive- wish we had ordered more).  The meal was prepared in 10 minutes and the manager had thrown in a complementary dessert sampler- revani (sponge cake) and Kazandibi (milk pudding)- both were heavenly.  They offer delivery within a certain distance- we will definitely be ordering from them again.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Olga D.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: Great meals and desserts. Absolute favorites: whole bronzino and shrimps. Love pickled red cabbage. As for desserts, baklava and revani win. Make sure to pair it with some Turkish coffee served in a cute tiny cup.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Arkın A.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description:
Best food and Best service!
Such great food and great people here. They always have something delicious to sample and their speicals are amazing.

jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.author: Richard C.
jpbnJhXkq2mFsWoSX2eCeg.description: When you come from a background that regularly eats Mediterranean and Middle Eastern food, you become spoiled on homemade food, that captures the essence of the culture and land. Sahara meets those standards. Everything is always excellent and fresh. The rice is still perfectly cooked and melts in your mouth. I'm grateful head chef has taken charge, it's apparent that he cares about the menu and quality of food.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Danielle K.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
My first visit to the Bagel Factory was a little overwhelming. It's a large space with different stations spread out around the perimeter. There's an ice cream and milkshake station to the left with the sandwich counter, cold deli case, and coffee bar around the right side and back. The menu is expansive, which is both great and a lot to consider. I got a garlic bagel lox sandwich with cream cheese, lox, tomato, onions and capers. It was big, delicious, and filling. My breath will be intense for hours, but worth it. 

The staff are eager to help and take your order, but this may seem a little brusque if you're trying to decide on one of their many options. The staff were eager to make sure we were comfortable and got everything we needed though. We'll definitely be back, but I think I'm going to look at the menu online beforehand to get some ideas.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Justice H.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: The order was originally disastrous. But the owner of the establishment fixed the order himself and threw in muffins for the trouble... Amazing customer service from the owner...

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Anjalie F.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
The ex-New-Yorker in me woke one morning craving a bagel, so I decided to try this place out. I got a multi-grain bagel toasted with cream cheese

The good: the bagel itself was good! It had a nice soft texture with a crispy exterior. All the staff were friendly, and my order was ready within a few minutes


The bad: This place is huge and dimly lit, making it feel very empty and unwelcoming. Also, the bagel was a little on the pricey side: at $3.20 I would have expected it to be pretty filling, but I could definitely have eaten a second one.

This is a good spot to pick up some bagels, but until they improve the lighting and break out some squishy chairs, I will always get my food to-go. I would also skip their toasting/cream cheese, and do it yourself at home

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Sherri K.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
Best bagels, morning sandwiches and lunch sandwiches ever. And not hungry for dinner these sandwiches hit the spot. Oh yes I loved the challah French toast. Worth the drive.
Yes they do get busy so review writers should have more patience when enjoying time out. It should not be a rush.. rushy people should go to the grocery store.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Frank S.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Great Hot lean Corn beef. My wife had the pastrami. Large sandwich and great taste. 9.99 for sandwiches I would have Payed $20 it was that good. We will be back soon.  Love it and great service.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Oizumi T.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Raining day, ordered a "Pitt burger " at the bagel factory, not many customers there, I waited for about 17 mins for my burgers, it was an opened beef burger wirh beckons and tomato and lectures, pretty standard taste

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: A L.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Good bagels, expansive menu, reasonably priced! Great location. Enjoyed the stop here when visiting Pittsburgh.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Allyson H.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
I really wanted to like this place. I liked it when I first walked in. I ordered and went to pay. A nice lady ring me up, took my cash and when right back to packing cookies with her hands. It bothered me that she didn't wash her hands or wear a glove. I was the only person in here and while I waited over 10 mins for a toasted bagel with cream cheese. I was looking in the case where they have all the tuna salads, cream cheese, etc. I noticed that it was very, disgustingly dirty. I'm in food service and I was highly grossed out. 

That being said the everything bagel was delicious but I will probably not be back until they actually clean a bit. It just makes me wonder if this is what the front of the store looks like, how does the back of the store look?

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Jen C.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
I truly enjoy their bagels.  My boyfriend and I stop in here super early on the weekends - before the parking meters start! - so parking isn't too much of an issue then.  We like the ability to sit inside or take with us to go.  I bring a lot of my family and friends who aren't from Pittsburgh here, I think the bagels are that good.

Sometimes the service is slow, but for the taste, I'll take it! :)

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Eric M.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
Everything people have said is true: kinda dingy, waited forever with only six other customers and not too motivated workers. It's not cheap, so you expect really good. It's not. (Well at least the experience.)
My sandwich was not right, so I asked to talk to manager. After 11 minutes, a man came out. He never introduced himself but in conversation said he was the owner. By now I was frustrated and accepted the offer to get my money back. It was funny how he grabbed the sandwich, chip bag and drink and ran to discard them all. 
The owner apologized, but no one else did. When I pointed that out, he had a worker insincerely yell "I'm sorry. Have a nice day," as I walked out. Crossing this place off my list.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Brian V.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Bagels very good. Had the veggie and cinnamon bagel. Would def order again. Coffee was hot and fresh squeezed orange juice delicious. Delivery right on time.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Emily Y.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: On Sunday morning, I got a takeout order of a bakers dozen of bagels. There were lots of options to choose from and relatively quick service.  Also got a container of cream cheese.  Bagels were decent quality and the store seemed cute in a down-to-earth sort of way.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Lauren L.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Don't bother ordering via GRUBHUB here on yelp. Waited two hours for my food before having my order cancelled. Won't be ordering again.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Chaymaa F.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: I do not recommend this place at all. I bought an egg and cheese bagel and it was horrible. I believe the egg was 2 or 3 days old and they heated it in the microwave before serving it, when I opened up the bagel it looked and felt like silicone. Not mentioning the cheese. Disgusting.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Brandon J.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: I tried Bagel Factory for the first time via UberEats. I ordered a half dozen bagels and was immediately called by a woman named Karen alerting me that every Tuesday(that day was a Tuesday) is buy a bagel get a bagel free day.  She didn't have to do that because I would have never known anyway. Now I'll be a frequent customer! Also, the bagels are delicious!!

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Mark G.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Ate there a few weeks ago. Service was poor. Everybody seemed annoyed to be working there. There were four people working and two customers, and they really struggled to do basic things like relay the coffee offer to the coffee person and the short-order request to the kitchen. The bagels were fine but nothing special. It was 11 am on a Friday and they were out of smoked salmon, which is a level of bagel-incompetence that I've never before witnessed. The interior is dingy; seating is disorganized and arranged weirdly, with divisions and fences in random places. If a person came in, got six bagels to go, and left, it might rank 3 stars. But for *literally* anything else, including a simple sit-down order like coffee, two eggs, and a bagel, it's poor. Skip it.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Amanda J.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
I'm very torn about Bagel Factory, as living in New York made me a bagel snob.  It's not fair to compare Bagel Factory to a NYC bagel so I won't.  But if that is what you are craving, this will not fill that void.  I think the best bagel in Pittsburgh is a fair claim to fame, but Pittsburgh has some really bad bagels.  Just a thought.

I ordered a rye bagel with bacon, egg, and cheese ($3.99).  There was a ton of good, thick bacon on the sandwich, and that was AMAZING.  Plenty of cheese and the perfect amount of egg as well.  But the bagel was pretty much flavorless.  Rye bagels should have flavor.  If this place wasn't called the bagel factory, it would be different.  But the bagel was so whatever.  The bagels are also really small for a fresh bagel.

I would definitely come back to the Bagel Factory, but I think they really should work on creating a more memorable bagel.

They accept credit cards.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Eliana B.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
This place is almost always closed and there's no hours posted so i genuinely don't know when they're open. They happened to be today, and i was craving a tuna melt, so i took a chance (even though I'm disappointed about 80% of the time i go there or to the Oakland location). I ordered a tuna melt ("do you want that toasted?") and potato latkes to go, and then waited for 15 minutes for my food even though the place was completely empty and i think there were 3 staff members there. When they brought my food out the staff member asked me if I'd wanted latkes, and told me he hadn't made them or charged me for them. I said no and left, noticing how small the bag was. When i checked out my food i saw this $9 tuna melt was the size of a standard sandwich you'd make with grocery store sliced bread, and was literally just cheddar on tuna salad. I didn't specify that i wanted stuff on it (lettuce, tomatoes, mayo) so okay I guess that's on me. I hopped on the bus to go eat my lunch in a nice shady spot in Oakland, and quickly noticed that the bag was leaking some mysterious green juice that got onto my clothes and backpack.

In the end i have only myself to blame-- i know better than to mess with this place.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Chris H.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
The thing I love most about the Bagel Factory isn't even their bagels: it's their breakfast entrees. I love their smoked salmon scramble with a side of potatoes, but they have a pretty good selection of other wonderful choices as well. The only thing I've ordered that I didn't like were the pancakes. 

Their French toast bagel is one of the best sweet bagels I've had. Sometimes I eat the French toast bagels cold and plain, but they are wonderful just toasted with butter.

The shop is also really cute and has a nice vibe. The people who work there are quick and also very friendly. This places feels weirdly unique and homey and should be visited when in Squirrel Hill.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Nick G.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Weird place. OK breakfast sandwiches and OK coffee. Friendly staff. Expected a little more.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Stefanie W.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
If I could give this no stars, I would give it no stars. The multi grain bagel tasted like a stale white plain bagel. The eggs were pre-made fried eggs, and the sandwich was absolutely gross. The other sandwich we had which was hummus and arugula on wheat bread had la scant teaspoon of hummus on wheat bread that didn't look like wheat bread. Also when I ordered iced coffee I had to wait for them to get me the milk because they don't have regular milk on the counter with the skim and the half-and-half.  Last but not least there was no air conditioning. I was told by the staff that the air conditioning broke and then another customer came in and told me that there was no air conditioning here all summer last summer.
Terrible place.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Dave M.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: These bagels are terrible. Do not go there.  They are supposed to be made fresh every day.  That's a stretch!   They shorted me on my order initially too.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: katie b.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: First, my bagel and lox sandwich was decent. Not the most amazing I've ever had, but definitely hit the spot. Cup of coffee was fine. What is very disappointing about this place is its interior. I want so badly for them to read this so they can make improvements! It could be something special, with way more business than I currently observe. Its empty, large, dusty, unkempt, out of date (less important). I wanted to enjoy my breakfast while I did school work, but I couldn't because their internet was broken. The customer service was meh. The bagel sandwich with lox and a cup of coffee was over 10 dollars. What disturbed me most was how incredibly dim the place was. The workers were literally in the dark! Also, above them was a terribly dusty ceiling tile frame. Right above where I assume some of the food was made. Yuck! This place has been around for a LONG time. I hope they eventually decide to invest in some updates and bring it up to snuff. It would definitely attract more business that way. This place is a Gordon Ramsey level fixer-upper. And I truly wonder if their front-of-house looks the way it does is it up to code where they do the majority of their food prep? Probably not.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Rob C.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
Bagels are good, pretty standard in flavor, comparable to a Einstein etc. 

Coffee is normal restaurant blend type coffee not a reason to come here. 

Staff super friendly. 

Price for what you get? Got a toasted bagel with egg and cheese. Should have taken photo, but didn't think of it till after leaving. Bottom line: Very disappointing. Barely any cheese and egg was super thin, wasn't all of an egg but probably half of an egg. $3.50. Is been far better to have just a bagel for .99 cents. Person with me had a bagel with cream cheese, 2.99. $2 for cream cheese to be spread on it for you. 

I won't be back, suffice to say.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Bobby W.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
It's irksome that anywhere from 50-75% of their light bulbs are burned out and not replaced. Feels unkempt and like a cave. The staff out front is always nice and smiling. 

I like their breakfast and their bagel chips. They do a nice job of a greasy diner style breakfast and the bagels are ok. They also have a nice outdoor seating set up on Forbes- which is not typical on the street. 

The layout seems weird because they have not converted what used to be the Ben and Jerry's ice cream on the left side of the store front. It's now just a storage corral for bagel racks and supplies.

So much potential for the location, space, and neighborhood- I would love it if that decided to capitalize on what could be a really cute breakfast eatery!

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Rami N.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Meeeeh, ordered a salami bagel took 30 minutes to prepare, no line and not many people. Should have taken the bagel and prepared it at home, would have taken 3-5 minutes!

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Shaena U.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: We come here most Tuesdays to get the buy-6 get-6 free bagels deal. The bagels are good, and the price is great! They also sell salmon and meats by the half-pound for a pretty good deal. Seating outside is nice in good weather, but otherwise inside is pretty dim and the sandwich prices aren't great.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Harsh G.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
The staff sucks! They were out of almost everything we wanted to order.

The lady at the billing counter is rude. Appears like she needs to learn some manners.

The AC was not turned on and it was hot inside.

The only good thing was the smoked turkey bagel.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Vickie B.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
Bagels are much better than Columbus Ohio and they are generous with groupons so I can load up with 4 dozen bagels. The person that waited on us was a little edgy when stating that she had to ring up our order as two separate order. It did not matter to us and hubby apologized for the extra work.  But my sense is that perhaps she was edgy because groupon users gave her a hard time.  When she saw that we were pleasant, she quickly became friendly as well.  So to those who complain about staff, remember that a smile and a thank you nearly always helps get you what you want.  I like their bagels, especially the marble rye ones.  We help them out by calling in our order the day ahead.  Even frozen for months, they are a zillion times better that what is available in Columbus.

Oh and in the past we have got their ruben's which are very good.  Just not appealing at 8AM.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Jenn T.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
Back in September, we tried a week of 'Buy Fresh/Buy Local,' with a goal of having 75% of our meals for the week locally-sourced. I can't say it was easy or cheap, but it was a great experience that left me with a lot of lasting decisions.

One of those decisions? Buying my bagels freshly-made from the Bagel Factory instead of in a plastic bag from the grocery store.

I like the Squirrel Hill location because it's convenient to my house, and although there is metered street parking in the front, there is also a (pay) parking lot behind the building if you have to go during a busy time of day. 

They have a ton of different house-made cream cheeses (the lox and chive ones are my favorites, although they have a variety of plain and sweet-flavored cream cheeses as well). The bagels are stored behind a glass partition so you can see which of their dozen-plus flavors are available when you go in. I'm partial to the cracked wheat and grain bagels, but there are blueberry, garlic, honey oat, plain, and everything bagels (to name just a few). All of them are super-fresh and filling but light.

And best of all - at the Squirrel Hill location, if you go on a Tuesday to pick up your bagels, buy six bagels and get six bagels for free!! Free bagels! You can't argue with that! 

The staff is always really friendly and helpful. They helped me learn how to freeze bagels without sacrificing quality (so that I could take advantage of that six-free-bagels deal). And any time there's a sale or a special, they will tell you right away when you go in.

The only negative part of my whole Bagel Factory experience is that the stairs leading from the shop to the parking lot out back are metal, and no matter what shoes I am wearing, I sound like an elephant entering and exiting the building. Sorry, Bagel Factory employees! I wish I didn't sound like a stompasaurus every time I go in!

This shop also has a huge chalkboard menu of sandwiches (although I have  only gone for bagels, so I can't comment on the sandwiches), and they sell fresh bread loaves, cookies, and other baked goods as well.

So, be ready to say goodbye to Thomas' bagels at Giant Eagle. Once you get your fresh breakfast bagels from the Bagel Factory, you won't be able to go back!

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Isaac D.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: The bagels are good. That's all you need to know. It's all about the bagels, even if the interior is just eh the food is well priced and the location is very convenient

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Aire B.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: I don't know why I do it, but every time I'm in the area I decide to come back here. And sadly I'm usually disappointed :( you can tell the food is good quality which is why I am not giving a 2 star review. But $11 for a breakfast sandwich and iced coffee is insane to me and I used to live in NYC, so my thoughts on food pricing tends to me fair!! On my last visit I was told they did not have the breakfast meat I wanted even though it's on the menu. The man making my sandwich was not wearing gloves which really just grossed me out. My $8 sandwich was ok, but not enough to fool me into going here again, at least for a long time. :(

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Karina S.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: They never have any ingredients for any of their menu items.  I got a cob and had no bacon no blue cheese. They had no ingredients to make a Reuben. And gave me a nova lox sandwich with Vidalia onions! I come hear relatively often because it's the only breakfast place without a line and this happens constantly

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Kayo Y.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Ridiculously slow service, inefficiently run and very unprofessional staff. Took me about ten minutes of being first in line to have my order taken and another 10 minutes to get a single hummus and spinach sandwich. The hummus was all over the paper and barely on the bagel itself, the spinach was also not getting "sandwiched" by the bagels at all. Add insult to injury the paper wasn't nearly cut enough so the whole "sandwich" fell apart trying to tear the wrapping. I would have been so much better off at Dunkin' Donuts down the street.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Jaime C.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: definitely would not come back. There were more people working than there were customers and it still took at least 30 minutes to make 4 bagels and they lost half of our order in the process. The people working there seem to lack any sense of urgency or decent customer service skills. On top of that, my bagel with cream cheese had almost no cream cheese? Very odd vibe.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Elizabeth B.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Three of us had run to Commonplace Coffee a few weekends ago for one of their delicious beverages, and my sister-in-law was feeling a bit peckish. We ran into Bagel Factory for a quick breakfast. I have never been in a restaurant that was so dismal and dingy. Even with the morning light, it was very dark inside, and I was shocked to see the condition of the tables and chairs and walls.
