I was hoping that the food would compensate for the interior's shortcomings, but I personally think that Panera or Bruegger's serve much better bagels. My sister-in-law's bagel was very small and thin, and I could tell her face fell a bit when it was handed to her. Thankfully, I ordered an egg and cheese bagel, which was a little more satisfying but still nothing special.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Ali Y.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: While the bagels are fairly good, the restaurant itself is fairly dirty and unorganized. I didn't see a clean table in the building and they don't appear to have air conditioning, so don't go on a hot day. Unless I was picking up bagels, I wouldn't return.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Jay H.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description:
First time to this location, although I've been to the Oakland location many times out of convenience. I am not a fan of that one, and this one wasn't my first choice on this day. However, my wife sent me on a bacon egg and cheese errand at 630 AM so I figured I'd give the squirrel hill location a shot. I was pleased.

This is first off a totally different experience than the Oakland spot. Feels way less chainy. More attention to detail.  I came in with a mildly persnickety order and it was perfectly executed, by a lady that looked like she knew the deal in this business. She even cut our breakfast sandwiches in half and individually wrapped the halves.  Food was tasty. Coffee was good. Space is surprisingly big with a lot of food options. I'll definitely go back. 

One criticism, upgrade those bathrooms pronto.

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Jonathan C.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Ordered my food to a very unfriendly employee. I got two bagels with butter and I was one of four customers in the entire store. I'm now typing this as I've waited almost 15 minutes and my bagel still has yet to be prepared. Not impressed

yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.author: Keyva C.
yo6Ewp9hobvoHbIPXlpRzg.description: Didn't expect for a bagel shop to be cooking great comfort food. This was probably the best french toast I had in a long time. It had a great fluffy texture while not compromising the integrity of the bread. I would most def come back just for this again.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: A R.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description:
This is a GREAT little place for breakfast!

Breakfast at Shelly's has great food and at a great price.  When i was there the music was great and Shelly was awesome!  This is my new favorite breakfast spot!
The only downside, if this is one, is that it is cash only but they have an ATM on the premises.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Taylor W.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: Wonderful place! The staff were very friendly and the food came out quickly. I ordered the spinach, feta, and tomato omelette it was delicious!

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Gina W.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description:
Another hidden treasures on the Hilltop! Every meal feels like it's made with love. You can sit at the classic dinner counter and watch an early Steelers game on Sundays or just enjoy quiet company in a booth. I've never had a bad meal at Shelly's. The French toast roll-ups are to die for and if you add a side of cheesy grits, your taste buds won't regret it. The breakfast burrito is an easy favorite of mine.

Street parking is pretty easy and the staff makes you feel like family. 

Just remember to bring cash, this place is cash only but they do have an ATM on site. 

Extra trip: always ask about the daily specials and don't forget it's BYOB!

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Joe L.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: Ridiculously long wait times for delivery app orders. I recommend customers don't order from here if they want their food in a timely manner. I've informed with Uber Eats that this is a consistent problem with this restaurant. Zero sense of urgency.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Clara D.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: Absolutely loved Shelly's! Waitresses were very nice and our food came out quickly. The restaurant itself is relatively with less than 10 tables but lots of space at the counter - they even have a small rug with toys to keep kids entertained while waiting for their food! I got the hot sausage sandwich (my to go) which was amazing, the hot sausage was clearly made in-house and was delicious on the Dutch Crunch bread! It is cash only but they have an ATM inside. Will definitely be returning!

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Anqi H.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: The food was good. We got the French toast roll ups, steak sandwich, peanut butter and chocolate chip pancakes, and breakfast burritos. The portion was generous and prices really reasonable. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The only thing is it took really long before we got our food. They're definitely understaffed. We went sat morning and it wasn't super crowded. There is also a greasy smell at the place. I would consider coming back if I lived closer. The food was good but it wasn't good enough to make the trek up the slopes.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Jilena N.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description:
My fiancé and I stopped at Breakfast at Shelly's Sunday morning around 10am. Much to our surprise, the place was empty! It quickly became clear that they do a lot of business through grubhub.
I ordered the breakfast sandwich with hot sausage and home fries (my go to) and my fiancé ordered the standard #2 (2 eggs over easy, sausage, home fries, and toast). The sandwich came on a Dutch crunch bun which was delish. The sausage wasn't your standard patty or link, it was hand formed and grilled to perfection. Neither the fried egg nor the sausage was overly greasy which made the sandwich that much better. 
The home fries were cooked nicely with a seasoning blend that sets them apart from all the other diners.
Overall, the only thing lacking was that diner "feel." We will likely return!

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Joe G.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: The hot breath omelet lives up to its name. The hot sausage is made in house and you can definitely tell. The toast options were a little disappointing (no Italian and all bagged bread), but I'd recommend it to anyone in the area looking for a greasy diner option for breakfast.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Brittany R.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description:
I came here with a few friends for breakfast on a Friday and though it's not in the most "tourist-y" area, it was a pleasant experience! We seated ourselves and were greeted immediately. Our drinks were brought to us in a timely manner and shortly after ordering, our delicious breakfast arrived! 

I personally think you can never go wrong with breakfast because it's the most important and BEST meal of the day.. Anyway, the food was delicious. Tasted fresh and we were served pretty big portions! You definitely get bang for your buck here. There was parking along the street outside. They accept cash only though! There's an ATM inside but make sure you bring some cash so you don't get charged the service fee.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Maureen M.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: The food was so good! The pancakes are light and pair perfectly with the combo breakfasts. Today's special was cheesy grits with bacon and they were awesome. Not much seating, though. Definitely not suited for parties bigger than 4. There's one table that looks like it would fit 8 but it's tight. And don't forget cash only!

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Harry S.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: Breakfast was phenomenal. Service was great. The omelet was made to perfection with the peppers being fresh. The home fries were something to write home about!

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Grace K.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description:
The atmosphere is retro-darling, clean and attentive.  The food is great and they keep your coffee filled.
Definitely worth a visit.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Michael D.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description:
Great place for breakfast as long as you aren't picky about how your eggs are cooked. Asked for sunny side up and got over hard, then asked for a replacement of sunny side up eggs and got over easy. Wasn't even busy in there.

But the food itself was good. I've tried multiple sandwiches there, all great. Try anything on a Dutch crunch roll and you won't be disappointed.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Peter G.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: Food was excellent. Service was exceptional. The decor and feel of the restaurant. Reflected a  charming 50's diner. The location was not the best, but overall it was a pleasant experience. Would definitely visit again, but probably won't.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Janice I.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: Ordered breakfast.....cream cheese was expired and smelled terrible. The grits were very bland and tasted more like cornmeal. They also were not hot or even warm. The French toast - said was Texas toast - but was very thin and floppy. The breakfast burrito's ends were hard and crumbly like the burrito was old and not fresh. Spent almost $50 and was disappointed. I would not recommend this place.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Bob L.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description:
Don't let the location discourage you, during the daytime anyways. :)

Does very well for all of your standard diner fare, not anything as far as especially appetizing ingredients at least on the breakfast items.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Renee K.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: I tried this place today and wasn't sure how it was gonna be but glad I did,  this place isn't anything fancy or even true to be its a nice little diner with a nice full deli,  nice to see small businesses in the area and seems to do very well.  I had the breakfast burrito with a choice of meat inside it was huge,  very good. Nice service and I will definitely return to try other items so hard to choose the first time there.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Nathan K.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: Moved to Allentown recently and so glad we found Breakfast at Shelly's. Every time we come here the food and service is always excellent. And such low prices. Only takes cash. But with such low prices it's not an issue at all. Have tried many different items off the menu and everything is delicious.

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Narayanan V.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description:
I had breakfast with Shelly's on my visit to Pittsburgh this time around. Am sure Pamela will be upset when she reads this, but you gotta do what makes you happy. This is a new business at a location that previously housed a dinner for decades. The interiors are unassuming and call out Steelers only, but the owner and servers are really very friendly. There are tables for large groups and comfy bar stools. I ordered spinach feta tomato omelette, they delivered exactly what it says, nothin more nothin less. The portion sizes are right and the food is not as greasy as the other more popular spots. The home fries are probably how I would make them at my home. Do bring cash as they do not accept cards here.
Touchdown for me...definitely would come singing for the potato and omelette ...brown and yellow, brown and yellow, brown and yellow

kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.author: Emily B.
kWcAfYg-60hpIUEUSzWjHQ.description: I ordered off of Grub Hub and the food was just ok.  I had the sausage wrapped in French toast.  What i was hoping for and what I got were two different things.  The sausages were tiny and the toast was tasteless.  I had to drown it in syrup to tolerate it.  I also had a side of home fries, which were pretty good.  I wouldn't recommend my order, but i might give it another shot...just a different meal.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Douglas H.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
Got a couple of apps before heading out to a meeting. 

Pork Belly taco's - really good. Served with pickled onions and radish. Pork belly was perfectly cooked and the onion radish combo really worked. Balsamic reduction sauce was perfect compliment.

Pork Pot Stickers - Average, however, the accompanying sauce was really nice with a serious bite. 

Only complaint was the wait time on the food. Took almost 20 min. for two apps in a largely empty restaurant.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Michael S.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
A Tuesday night. 5 other tables in the house. Waited 10 min to see a wholly uninterested but friendly server who took my order.

I was given a watered down iced tea and a lemon in a cup. 

After ordering a Caesar salad and an appetizer I waited another 15 min. 

What I got was actually delicious! Despite the blah service, the food was stellar. I had the crispy pork belly tacos and a Caesar salad. Both were really tasty (though there wasn't much crisp in the tacos).

I then had a patty melt. A bit undercooked but also delicious.

I left feeling full and pleasantly surprised.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Anthony V.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
This review is in regard to their brunch. I had some friends in town and we went here around 12:30 on a Sunday. There was only us and another table. We were greeted right away and were told we could sit anywhere. Our waitress was pleasant, but we were confused if she was our waitress or this other gentleman who started to take care of us as soon as things started to fall apart was our waiter... Anyway...

For only having a total of 6 people in the whole restaurant, it took the kitchen almost (or maybe it was...?) 30 minutes to make 4 breakfast sandwiches. Also, we ordered cinnamon-swirl bread and didn't initially receive it because the waitress "completely forgot about it." (Not sure how this happens with only two tables in the whole restaurant...) In addition, I thought the bread (which was technically french toast and I wouldn't have ordered it if I knew it was french toast) was lacking cinnamon and the "vanilla icing" on top was clear with virtually no taste. Vanilla icing should be white, not clear. That was odd and not good. Thankfully our ...waiter?...manager?... comped it. 

The breakfast sandwiches were not very good. The toast for my sandwich was like toasted and then maybe fried...? Or maybe it was extremely stale bread...either way, it was an extremely odd and hard texture for simple white toast. The home fries were not very good. I typically don't put ketchup on my homefries, but I had to with these ones because they lacked flavor and not all the homefries were consistently cooked properly. We also had to ask for salt and pepper as it was not at the table or brought out with our food.

When we got our split checks, the guy waiter (or manager) flip flopped 2 of our checks and he had to go back and void the original transaction. (Once again, I could forgive this, but not with only 6 people in the whole place.)

It worries me when this many things can go wrong when a restaurant is virtually empty. I will not return and would advise others to cross the Hot Metal Bridge and find somewhere else in the south side.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Alisa W.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description: Food was mediocre. Roasted Brussel sprouts lived up to the reviews & were good. Salmon dish not worth the price. Very disappointing. Wine was reasonably priced for happy hour & the brand offered. Bartender wasn't the friendliest or the most attentive. Not sure I'd return

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Kristy A.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
Some good and some bad.   Overall, I'd go back, but I wouldn't pick it.   

The good...
- The rooftop area is good on a nice day.  They have a shade sail and it's a relaxing space.  One walk up window for drinks and a limited food menu up there.   
- The service overall was good.  The rooftop lost my tab, but when I asked if I could just take care of it downstairs with my dinner tab, she said yes.  Nice and easy.  I reminded the downstairs service at the beginning and end of the meal, but it never appeared on my bill.  She finally came around and just said it was on the house.  No problem there!   
- The decor.  The industrial theme is well done and the place has a nice feel to it.   

The eh...
- The food.  This was the main reason that it got downgraded.   The Korean wings were syrupy sweet - way too sweet.  Nice spice level, but so sweet.  Same with the salad I ordered.  It was huge and had a ton of toppings, which I loved; but again, it was very sweet.  
- The menu.  I had looked on Eliza's website and picked out what I wanted to order, but the new menu didn't have either of those things.  If you are gonna put it out there, make sure it's right.   
- Signage.  Am I allowed to park in the lot?  No idea.  Is this unmarked side door what I'm supposed to use for the restaurant?  No idea.  Rooftop bar?  Total guess.   Improvement needed there for sure.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Arlene M.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
Today is the official opening day of Eliza's Bistro's and I was glad to visit it. The bistro is under different management than the Hotel Indigo which houses it but it carries the same industrial motif and color scheme as the hotel itself. Since this place was built on the former site of a J and L Steel mill the bistro decided to also recreate the authenticity of what once stood here. I was literally blown away by the paintings and the designer who I had met over at the hotel told me that they were planning on putting in a large full wall painting over in the corner. Even the ceiling made you feel like you were in a blast furnace. They also have free WiFi here. I also learned that in the near future they will be having weekend brunch.

I had a very friendly and helpful waitress. I sat in a booth away from the bar and high top area so I could take in the surroundings. Outdoor seating is available if you choose. I learned the place was named for a granddaughter of the J and L Steel Mill whose name was Eliza. I also learned that Steel mills used to carry names associated with their blast furnaces.

Most everything with the except the salmon is local sourced. The salmon comes from Ohio. I wanted to try the Brussels Sprouts so my waitress substituted that with my fried chicken sandwich as my side. Normally you get a side of French Fries or small salad with dressing.

I got my food fairly quickly. The sandwich was topped with coleslaw and had cheese on the bottom. The sandwich was moist and tender. I found the Brussels Sprouts a little on the dry side but my waitress explained to me that they are fire grilled. That made me happy because I love Brussels sprouts and was able to enjoy them better.

I'm glad they made that substitution because I wanted to try one of their desserts. Today they were offering standard flavors of Millie's ice cream or homemade cheesecake topped with cherries. I opted for the latter since I'm well acquainted with Millie's and can attest that they have good ice cream.

My cheesecake was not overly large which I was glad about but moist and delicious! I can see this place becoming very popular with the locals once word is out. There is a free lot outside the complex before you enter. Next to it stands a pay parking garage. There is no public transportation and I'm not sure if the shuttle I learned about in the hotel would cater to restaurant patrons. Since they are in a hotel they are open every day of the year which makes it a bonus if you would rather eat out during the holidays.

Eliza's bistro sits in the Hotel Indigo which is in the middle of Technology Dr that runs parallel to 2nd Ave. The only real drawback I can see is having to deal with rush hour traffic. Other than that it is well worth a visit. Good food at reasonable prices. You can't ask for more.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Deborah L.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
*this review is of the cafe/bar, not the seated dining & food

As a student at bridgeside point, there aren't many options for food/coffee in this area so I was hoping this would be a good option for those days I need an extra boost of caffeine between classes. However, I went with 3 of my classmates one afternoon and we were greatly disappointed. We all ordered vanilla lattes but there was no consistency between our drinks. The espresso tasted burnt, some drinks had extra milk and that's all you could taste, but one was only filled 1/2 as much as the rest of ours. The worst part about all of this was we ended up paying ~$6 + tip for a 12oz cup of coffee? I'm not sure what the actual size was, but I do know for sure that it was not worth it. I don't think I've ever paid so much money for a mediocre cup of burnt coffee.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Brendan T.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
This wasn't my first rodeo at Eliza and it won't be the last.  Warmly greater by the owner Kristen when I walked in and then served by the sweetest little blond girl.  Service was fast and efficient. I had the Gouda mushroom burger which was wonderful.  So hot when it came out I had to wait to chow down, just how it like it. The side salad was fresh and crisp.  Even with a large wedding party having drinks and food the staff still maintained positive control over the restaurant and customers. 
Living close by and having a nice addition the local cuisine is great! Will come again soon!

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Mara K.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
I'm on the fence with Eliza after having brunch on a Sunday afternoon.  The first level of annoyance was the lack of clear signage for parking.  It appeared that you needed to be a guest of the hotel to park in their lot so I went to the garage and ended up paying $5 to park there.  Then I learn later that half of my party parked in the hotel lot - for free.  

There was only one other party seated other than our group of five so the service was rather quick.  None of ordered a brunch cocktail so it was just coffees and teas, but I did see that someone from the other group had a nice looking Bloody Mary.

I ordered the smoked salmon on a bagel with a side salad.  The salad was fine but the entree was impossible to eat without looking like a mad Viking.  First, you couldn't even cut through the bagel and it was just as hard to bite into.  My friend and I both had this option and we each had to deconstruct and pick apart to eat.  So that was messy and not fun.  But the salmon was good and the egg was seasoned nicely.  

The prices were reasonable.  It just isn't quite a happening place on a Sunday morning/afternoon.  This is an odd spot for a hotel but I think as the area around it builds up it will bring in more traffic.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Jamie H.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description: Great food! We got the mushroom gravy biscuits and sausage gravy biscuits and shared the brioche. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. Parking was the only negative point. Paid parking.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Jocelyn G.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
Very cool happy hour location. The parking for the area was kind of confusing, so I deducted one star. 

They spent a lot of time salvaging cool mementos from when the area had steel mills so there is a very artsy industrial vibe without being depressing. Because it is a hotel as well, it's good to know their restaurant is also open at 6:30 am if I should want something decent to eat. 

I went for happy hour on a beautiful afternoon and was able to enjoy the view of the river and the South Side across the way from their awesome rooftop lounge over a few glasses of wine. 

Highly recommend a hangout on their rooftop on beautiful sunset days.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Ronald F.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description: This is a nice place to eat. Clean and nice staff. I usually order lunch as I work next door. Had an awesome Salmon Cesar Salad. Turkey and Swiss was surprisingly a really solid lunch. Eating in takes a little longer than you would like for lunch, seems a little under staffed because of the wait between ordering and paying the bill. But you can order pickup if your in rush for lunch. The prices are ok, but they have a 9$ lunch special, that is worth it. However, one time I received undercooked salmon filet but I ate it as I felt bad if I were to return it.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Hans E.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description: Holy hell... just brutally bad. I'm actually still here. We have been done with our meal for a good 15 minutes and are one of 3 tables here and haven't seen the waitress. Just walked in on the cook taking dick-pics in the bathroom... seriously... this is brutally bad

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Meghan B.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
Made a reservation for 5 people for this past Sunday for 11:00 am. We had family in from out of town and I thought it would be nice to check out Eliza- as I've been meaning to check it out for a while. We arrived on time for our reservation and were quickly informed that the service would probably take a while, as a large wedding party had arrived and would also be getting served brunch. I am a patient person and we decided to hang out for a bit. 20 minutes went by and no server had come over to see us, we weren't all given menus, and no one had offered us drinks. We watched other tables receive service during this time. I understand they were short-staffed, but it really felt like we just weren't valued at all. I decided to make the decision to leave before we ordered anything, as I figured this would have been a disastrous experience had we stayed. I suggest that the management pay a little more attention in the staffing- it was a holiday weekend, and they should have expected the customer volume to be higher than normal. It was embarrassing to take out-of-towners to a new cool restaurant, just to have to rush to find another place that's not on an insane brunch wait. Luckily, I was able to find a spot in Southside to accommodate us. I hate to give a place a bad review when I haven't even tried their food, but I just was really disappointed that management didn't plan ahead here. 

Also, you can apparently park in the hotel lot to dine here. I had no idea, as there is no signage that states this. We parked in the garage nearby, meaning I paid $5 to be ignored at brunch and leave without being served. Hmm. So don't make the mistake I did, just go in the hotel lot to park.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Brett C.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description: DO NOT GO HERE! The restaurant was barely busy, I had to seat myself and was given a dinner menu for breakfast. I assume the guy was in training, so I can let the menu slide, however his trainer looked MISERABLE. Complete RBF, like she was in pure agony with every word she spoke. This is now the 2nd bad experience I have had here, I work in the park and it's convenient for me, I decided to give it a second chance but I shouldn't have. Food was mediocre at best, service was terrible, probably because there was no actual staff. I will go out of my way to never go here again.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Marcy J.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
First impression was the hostess telling us that we were the last reservation of the night (7PM on Saturday) so feel free to sit wherever we liked. The restaurant was about 15% full so lots of places to choose from. We chose one of the unfortunately awkward booths (long table so if you want to face each other you are far away) because the chairs at the tables looked more trendy than comfy.

Nice and quiet. Perused the drinks menu and almost choked at the wine prices - they are literally charging $19 for a glass of a Sauv Blanc that doesn't even cost that much PER BOTTLE at the PLCB store. Server came for our drink orders and then vanished for 20 minutes. Given how empty and quiet the place was, it was a mystery as to why it took so long. Drinks were ridiculous. My gin cocktail was almost certainly a virgin drink (tasted of nothing but citrus and simple syrup) and my husband's bourbon cocktail was one inch of drink (before you removed the giant ice cube). He then ordered a martini figuring that would at least be a real drunk and that arrived as one-third full of a small coupe. All three drinks totaled $50. COME ON.

The food was fine, not enough to make up for the rest of the oddness: the lamb meatballs were actually pretty good but they were oddly shaped, some were round and others were just pieces of meatballs: so much for presentation. My husband got the cavatelli and the pesto had broken which led to the pasta sitting in a pool of green oil. I got the Po Boy, which was impossible to eat as served because the clams were chewy and large and would just pull out of the sandwich when bitten into.

My husband's plate was cleared, I was about halfway through deconstructing my sandwich so I could eat the clams, and our server came over and asked if we were ready for our check. Um, what? Not asking if we wanted coffee or dessert was really odd to us, but by that point we were one of only three parties remaining in the restaurant (it was 8:30) and we thought maybe she really just wanted to leave. We went somewhere else for drinks after. We will not be back.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Danielle C.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
Popped into Eliza on a Saturday mid afternoon just for a snack and beverage. I ordered the Cranberry Cider and pork belly tacos. My boyfriend ordered an iced tea and pretzels. As we were sitting at the bar, we chatted with one of the owners and bartender, who were both very friendly. Our food came out very quickly and was oh so delicious!  We will be back and would definitely refer a friend...or several.

Side note: although it says this is only breakfast and brunch, they also serve dinner!

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Ty W.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
I came in on Saturday morning before my trip home.  The dining room was about 40% full with tables of 3+. There was one visible server and a host. As the steady flow of guest came in, the server looked to be stretched thin. That's when the host sprung into action. He was seating people, taking orders, running food, making coffee drinks for people walking up and all with a smile! His name was Jay and he took care of me while also directing traffic and even giving instruction to the bartender who arrived a little after 10am. He is a star employee and was a pleasure to dine with. 

  As for food, I had the corned beef hash. Poached eggs, corned beef, baked Brussels sprouts and potatoes. The meal was delicious and I would go back!

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: karen h.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description:
Just ate here for lunch last week and had the Pittsburgh Salad. It was really good but for $10 I feel like it should include some sort of protein and paying $7-$8 to add it, is just way too much for lunch. 
I will say the staff was excellent! Please think about having a few lunch specials.

QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.author: Azia P.
QQ4763IteaX73s6-1d68dw.description: We stayed at Hotel Indigo which is a amazing interesting hotel. It's not plush but I love the raw material and industrial concept. Eliza is such a amazing addition! I had the Pittsburg Salad with French Fries on it. So good! My husband had the fish sandwich and it was also good (I took a bite as well - yeah I'm that girl) - Atmosphere was great and Service was great. Love it!

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Jamie L.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description:
I've been there a couple of times. The food is good. Last night had their veal parmigiana, large portions and very tasty. It comes with soup or salad, and bread. I had the wedding soup also very good. The service was very good. They have a wine menu and a small drink menu. 
The crowd seems to lean towards the older side. Prices are reasonable.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Michael F.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description:
Here is my actual rating:

5 stars for the food
1 star for service. 

We had 6:30 reservations. Finally got sat at 7:15. Finally received water and drinks at 7:40.  Please keep in mind we had a 3 year old with us. We had to beg a waitress to get us bread and a side of pasta for the 3 year old. The service was very disappointing. Our waiter finally wanted to talk to us when we were leaving. Didn't say 3 words to us the whole time. The owner was there and never came over to see how things was or to apologize. 

Now the food, was GREAT. We had chicken Milanese, veal piccata, veal Parm, 2 prime ribs and scrod. The desserts were awesome as well. Had all four to share with the table and they did comp those.  Would go back due to how good the food was.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Carmen R.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: This is another older "red sauce" place that does a good job but will eventually fade away. Their crowd is old and the place was almost empty at 9pm. Service was good and you can tell the wait staff has been there a while. I believe these places will all be gone on the next five to ten years as newer more up to date Italian places take over.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Kevin B.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: Food is very good! The owner needs to rethink about whether he should retire. Had a party of 10 and a few were late because they were from North Hills and unfamiliar with the area. He hovered over our table like a vulture wanting to pull a table away and squeeze us in like sardines. Wasn't even nice about it. Our bill was $450 and he just lost a lot of future business because he wanted to make maybe $45-$50 off a two top? After tonight I'll NEVER go back. The food might be good but you can find much better somewhere that they VALUE your business!!

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Elizabeth S.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: I've been here for dinner a few times. The service is always great. This time was no different. We didn't have a reservation and they were very busy but we were seated in the bar right away. My husband had the ravioli, half cheese and half beef, he loved it. I've always had the crab cakes, and they're great, but this time I decided to try the stuffed scrod and had a side of pasta with a meatball. The pasta was delicious and perfectly cooked. The sauce is delicious and the meatballs are perfect here. I don't recommend the fish it was terrible, it was over cooked and dry and the stuffing was mediocre at best. It tasted like the deviled crab stuffing at the grocery store. The wedding soup is really good but the side salad is nothing special although the ranch dressing is really good!

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Ed M.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description:
Nice neighborhood place. A little dated. Older crowd. Food is excellent. Bartender was nice.
Had the salad named for owner. Very tasty. Good

Stopped in for a third time, bar was half full, nobody behind the bar. Older crowd gossiping. Waited 5 minutes, then left. Poor, actually no service. Not going back.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Melissa M.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: DELICIOUS!  I loved this place from head to toe- such a great atmosphere- a little dated/ with older decor/ clientele but just feels so special.... homey!  The food was outstanding!!!! The linguine w/ red clam was out of this world- the chicken parm delicious!!! They had a white bean chicken chili which was amazing and we finished w choc/ peanut butter cake....  SO GOOD!  Excellent service- I would highly recommend this place and can't wait to come back'

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Glenn Z.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: THEIVES! Multiple times our lunch group has been here. The food is good HOWEVER, when we compare our credit card invoice with the restaurant receipt, someone sneaks on another $10! We always tip at least 20% too! Not sure who keeps doing this.....the server or the management! STAY AWAY OR PAY CASH!

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Wesley H.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: I was denied service, as my fiancé had an out of state license that they weren't familiar with. Prices seemed steep looking at the menu, but I never got to try anything. Waitress seemed to be trying to embarrass us, as she voiced her doubt very loudly. I did not feel welcome, so we left. So close to my house and new to the city, I wanted to like this place. Shame

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Renee K.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: I really enjoyed myself here,  tried it for the first time.  The whole staff is so friendly and work together and help each other out. I had a steak very good. I will definitely be returning.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Celeste K.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: This is a great example of good quality Italian cuisine.  The service was very kind, the location was nice and family-oriented, and the food was dynamite! Everything was delicious, there are large portions though, so be sure to save room so you can enjoy everything. Other than that, this place is delightful, with delicious food!

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Jillian M.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: I was in Pittsburg for work. This restaurant was suggested by a coworker.  The food was really good and my favorite was their sauce, it was right on. I would come back if I am ever in the area again.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Angelo D.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: What a joke. Foods absolutely abysmal. Just look at the picture of the chicken DeBlasio and that should tell you everything you need to know about the place. Ordered the crab cake and they didn't even bother to fry the f*cking thing. How anyone can post a positive review of this place baffles my mind.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Kirk H.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: Food and service was great. Love the stuffed breadsticks! Jiacomo is an awesome server! Highly recommend this place for Italian dining.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Paula W.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description:
My coworker and I have frequented since we moved our office near DeBlasio's around two years ago.  We have had mostly great experiences, especially when sitting down to eat.  

Takeout, however is always a disaster.  About a year ago we ordered a Caeser Salad with shrimp to-go, and it was served with the dressing. When we called to let them know, we received a lot of attitude and were told "it's always served dressed."  To-Go salads should always have the dressing served on the side.  You don't know if someone is planning on eating it right away.  

Today, we ordered the same salad and were charged $7.95 for the shrimp on top of the $8.50 for the salad.  Again I called and explained that the online to-go menu showed $11.95 TOTAL for the Shrimp Caesar Salad and was told (with attitude again) that they have new menus.  I suggested that they make sure that the online menus are updated, because they are obviously wrong.  Again, with attitude I was told "they are in the process of updating them."  This is the age of the internet, that should be put up simultaneously with the roll out of in-house menus.  

Additionally, I did not receive a side of fries with my sandwich, which the online menu clearly stated.  When I noted this on the phone, I didn't receive an apology, just an "ok."

We will NOT be making to-go orders in the future, but I will commend the ladies in the bar area for their excellent service whenever we do eat-in.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Tara K.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: I ordered from here through Grubhub only to be called 10 minutes after ordering on a Tuesday evening that they cancelled my order because they were too busy.  Absolutely terrible customer service and the restaurant didn't even call to apologize, a customer service rep from Grubhub called to tell me.  I understand things happen and places get busy but at least apologize to your customer.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: John S.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: I will say other than Pizza and Hoagies we've not yet tried too many Italian places, but without a doubt DeBlasio's is some of the best Italian I have had since moving to Western PA about 18 months ago. Stopped in for lunch the other day, it was not busy till we left, service was good, not at all rushed which I liked that actually/ You may not want to go here when your in a hurry. I got a calzone and wife got a sandwich, we liked both. The calzone was large and pretty fully stuffed, not just bread. The sauce however was excellent! I loved the flavor. I'll be back to try some full on more traditional Italian dinner items - soon.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Steve F.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: Long unknown wait time, angry staff and mediocre food.  If you want spaghetti and meatballs, stay home and make it yourself.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Jessica P.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description: Simply okay.  We had a group of 8 and were stuffed into a back room that was very crowded and very little room in between tables.  I had the chicken Deblasio, which tasted like chicken with a gravy that I could have had anywhere let alone an Italian restaurant.  I will say we had really good service, just wish the food was better.

96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.author: Danielle D.
96puuUqlMC8INO36uLi0ag.description:
This is an aged Italian place in a strip mall that has its dedicated regulars, but leaves new customers baffled as to the loyalty. The place was packed on a Friday night but we were able to get a table for four. Note: there is no printed kids menu but they have the usual fair.
After we were seated we sat. And sat. About 10-15 minutes goes by without a server stopping by. The hostess who seated us noticed that we hadn't had a server yet and said she's get someone to is ASAP but we still sat. Finally our waitress comes. She didn't give her name but was friendly to our two kids. 
Note about the seating- hope for a booth because the tables are THISCLOSE to one another. My husband got bumped by servers all night (none of whom apologizes) and I could hear every word of the tables conversation next to us as I was practically in their laps. 
The bread was fair- kind of dried out. The wedding soup was a disappointment - which is a travesty for an old school red sauce joint. Funky taste and bland. My husband's salad was a decent size.
For our entrees, the kids both had spaghetti and meatballs. They ran out of milk, which isn't realize excusable when there is a Giant Eagle in the same plaza. The kids portions were generous but expensive. My husband had chicken Parmesan, a huge serving. He had roasted potatoes as a side (other sides were pasta or veggies), which were served in a small applesauce sized dish and were not very good. I had the homemade ravioli. The dough was heavy and gummy, and slightly undercooked. The sauce was typical red sauce.
Took forever to get our check, of course. There was a manager walking around but not stopping at any tables.
I would go here again if someone really wanted to go here, but I won't be hurrying back. The price point is too high for fair food, sitting in the lap of our neighbor, and this price point.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Christy B.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: I've been to the bar/restaurant a few times. It's in a beautiful location at the waterfront and very close to the Improv. The perfect place to grab a bite to eat or drink if you are waiting for a show or after. They have a lot of drink choices and a big menu of food, all of which had been very good every time. It's a pretty busy establishment so you may need to call ahead for a table if you have a large group. The drinks are a bit pricey, but it is in a nice area with a lot of other things to do around them. The last time I went the bartender was really friendly and talkative, great perk. When I get the chance to travel to the area I definitely like to stop in here.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Chris S.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Sooo I've never had a horribly bad experience here not have I had a wonderful one, so I feel that three stars is pretty fitting here. 

Upon walking in, the left half is the bar area which is cool because they showcase the brewery part. There's a traditional bar with TVs etc and several pub tables behind it. Full menu. Great option when we don't have the kiddo. Once or twice got iffy service over here though. 

Right side is more traditional dining room. I like that the kitchen is open air and most of the seating if not all is booths. Kid friendly group friendly. 

My biggest gripe here is that I find the food here inconsistent at best. It's pretty average to begin with, but I've ordered the same things twice and gotten two totally different things. This is not due to a menu change (which they have implemented). This has happened within a very small time span under the same menu and I have been very disappointed. 

All in all, an okay choice - but when in he waterfront especially with so much competition, I'd probably head elsewhere tbh.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Pris P.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
We went during peak hours (Friday at 7pm). Our entrees took about an hour to come out. I believe the norm for a restaurant is max 40 minutes and even then, that's a long time and there are some apologies that come along when the food comes out.

Waitress was just ok. I don't think I saw her smile once...which is fine, some people done smile. However,  she wasn't very friendly. 

Uppity jagoff IPA was delicious. 

For aesthetic reasons, they could use a smaller plate for the pork flautas. They took up less than half the plate. 

Guacamole appetizer is $10. Steep for the amount you receive. 

Food was ok. Added with the food time-delay, I'd probably stop by elsewhere before my Dave and Buster's trips.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Darian K.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Stopped in for food before a movie at 6 on a Tuesday and the place wasn't super busy, the parking lot looked full but there was plenty of bar seating. We sat at a high top at the bar and service was pretty prompt. I wasn't super hungry so I ordered a side salad and dessert right away, and my boyfriend ordered a burger. It was also happy hour so we each got a 16oz glass of their kolsch beer. It was a good kolsch and 2$ off. My salad was big for a side and the dressing was good but the lemon garnish was not necessary, they were slimy and did not look fresh at all, I've waitressed and would have been POed if kitchen put those on something I had to serve. The brownie was ok, hot in the center cold on the edges, obviously microwaved but I expected it, probably won't get it again. The burger was pretty good, I doubt it was a fresh patty but it wasn't bad. I'd order that again. Overall everything was ok and I'd go back before a movie again but I wouldn't go out of my way to specifically eat here, it's a chain and tastes like one so you know what to expect.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Julia N.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: While visiting Rock Bottom I had a beer and the street tacos - both were pretty average. Nothing too special about either of these items but I enjoyed them. I'd like to come back to this location again and try out some more drinks, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come here for the food. The service was good and the food was served quickly though!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jessica S.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Went here last weekend for my moms birthday dinner where I brought some of her friends so it was a small surprise. Everything food wise and drink wise was perfect. The only reason I gave it a 4/5 was because the waitress wasn't the best. Took her forever to come refill drinks at time, and she wasn't the nicest when we had to ask for refills. I get it that waitressing isn't the easiest job and I applaud anyone that could be a waiter or waitress because I know I wouldn't do it lol, but you still shouldn't cop a low key attitude. but overall love this place !

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Harold W.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: I had the lemon salmon which was pretty good. I didn't have any drinks of alcoholic beverages so I can't comment on them. The other dishes my guess head we're played it well and they seem to enjoy them. Not the best of service.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Bill S.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Food, Beer and SERVICE was fantastic--our server--Stephane couldn't have been any nicer and att

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Paul H.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
This place is a great time for quick beers and food. The location is perfect in the Waterfront because it is close to everything and within walking distance to all of the great attractions in the development (shopping, entertainment etc). Even if you don't want quick bar food, the menu has a lot more to offer with entrees and they are all great. 

I definitely recommend the tacos and the flight of beers. Great beer selection!  You definitely need to check this place out and it is also connected to the dueling piano bar Sing Sing. Also a great time and they offer free admission sometimes with your receipt from Rock Bottom that shows you have dined there.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Chris H.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Upon arriving we were seated quickly and that's good but after 15 minutes of waiting for ANY server to approach us or acknowledge us, we left. 15 minutes is a long time in a place that was not crowded.  It was obvious we were being ignored because a couple that came in and were seated at a booth (right next to our table),they were approached IMMEDIATELY and their order was taken. Are you kidding me? Why? After 15 minutes of waiting we left but not without stopping at the hostess booth to inform her why we were leaving. She said the booths are "reserved". This is Rock Bottom brewery not a 5 star restaurant, and for BOOTH SEATING?! Well we ended up going to Burgatory. Same amount of people in the place and we were seated quickly and served. I guess because they actually value their customers. We're not unreasonable because there are usually reasons for lousy service, but just not good ones at Rock Bottom.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Noelle T.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: This place was alright. I wasn't in a good mood when I went so some of my judgement may be too harsh so here we go. They did not dry our appetizer plates so we had to go out of our way & do it ourselves. The lighting was making me tired af. OH. & this lady had the AUDACITY to interrupt my fried pickle eating to ask if "it was good"?? Like this women wasn't even working. She was there eating & deadass came to our table to ask. They were good btw just too filling. I'm pretty sure our waitress was on crack & it took her about 4 hours to give us some goddamn water. Their water be tasting quite odd. There was not one busser in sight. There was a table that was left dirty for a good 20mins after the people eating at it left. Lastly, the veggie burger. Too mushy & looked like it came right out of a Spongebob episode.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Lauren B.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Rock Bottom is solid...like a rock, one might say. The menu has changed a few times since I started eating there (and being a hostess there for a very short amount of time a few years ago), and some of my favorite items are no longer on the menu. However, the old standby is still there: jalapeño pretzel sticks. And boy, they are phenomenal. Not only are they JALAPEÑO PRETZEL STICKS, but the dip they come with is delicious, creamy spinach dip. It's almost too much. 

On this particular visit I ordered the chicken tostadas, and they were very good! Flavorful, a good ratio of toppings, and the tortillas underneath were just the right amount of crispy. Overall, if you want easy, approachable, American bar food, Rock Bottom is a good choice.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: M M.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Went last Saturday night. There was about a 45 minute wait for us to be seated, which was fine considering we didn't make reservations. It took another 10-15 minutes for our server to even acknowledge we were there and take our drink order. It also took FOREVER for her to take our food order and to serve us our food. The food was also cold. She didn't apologize. I had the mango habanaro chicken with rice and broccoli. Chicken was good but cold. My friend and I shared a huge piece of cheesecake for dessert. It was probably the best part of the meal. I feel the service was horrible. Safe to say I won't be going back.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Candy W.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Excellent staff! I love going to dinner at Rock Bottom. I also love their cocktails. The wait staff is always great and takes care of us. They have my favorite sirloin steak!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Laurie H.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Super!  Early lunch at the bar was great. Bartender very attentive and smiley. Bacon wrapped poppers with jalapeño jelly all made in house and perfect. Nice in house beer selection with a built in chiller down the bar.  Definitely worth a stop!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Angela T.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Great food and service. Our server Vinny was very knowledgeable and friendly.  Didn't have any beer but the nachos are killer!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jeff M.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Eventually your bartender needs to acknowledge people.  I am going to start walking out without paying.  Call the cops.  20 minutes waiting to pay my bill.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Angela K.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Paul is the best bartendar in the burgh, period . If it wasn't for him I'm not sure if I would come back . Great food , great drinks, great spot .

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: susan n.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
What a fun place! 
Great food, lively space, great service. 

The Waterfront is such a nice area to stroll around before dinner. 

I had the 3/4 pound bourbon burger & it was terrific.  I ordered medium rare & unfortunately it came out well done - I hate wasting food by sending food back, so it was on me that I didn't love it. The list of beers on tap is very long. I had a Belgian type beer and enjoyed it. The burger comes with a side, so I ordered mac & cheese and it was a little watery, but great. 

Our waiter was so young, but he was terrific. He was doing his very best to take care of our large group, running all around. 

I would recommend & I would return.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Kashiff M.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
The perfect pick-me-up for when you've hit rock bottom! Great brews, fabulous food and terrific service. The atmosphere was amazing. Lively and upbeat, but still relaxed enough to enjoy your meal. 

The flat bread was full of flavorful, rich and melty cheese and the crust was light, crispy and perfectly prepared. I can't forget about the sweet and spicy dynamite shrimp which lasted a total of 5 minutes. Everything was better than great. Truly a 5 start experience in my eyes. 

I'm already looking forward to planning the next visit. Lucky for me it's just a short drive away :) Get there now, what are you waiting for?

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Courtney B.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Pretty nice bar. 
Their drinks are overpriced, but they're located in the heart of the Waterfront.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Katie S.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
We haven't been to Rock Bottom in a long time. We received a gift card so decided to stop for a late lunch today. 

Our server was amazing. She was friendly, attentive and we never waited, but weren't hovered over either. Our glasses were constantly refilled as well. 

We ordered the nachos, the veggie tacos and the 2 AM burger with the mashed potatoes. Everything was fresh, flavorful and really good. 

As a vegetarian, I always appreciate having more than one option to select from. 

We were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our visits.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Scott K.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Excellent menu of food and drinks! Bob the bartender is the best! Remembered us from a prior visit. Very friendly and knowledgeable. Highly recommended. A taste for everyone's pallet. From the staff to the guests a very pleasant experience. Looking forward to the next lunch with friends. A++

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Taylor D.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Every time i've gone here, the foods been wonderful. The service has also always been great and I love the atmosphere . Have never had a beer here, hoping to soon. Always love going to Rock Bottom before catching a movie.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Kirstin P.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
I hate giving bad reviews, but Rock Bottom needs to seriously step up their allergy training. 

I am allergic to capsicum, aka: any kind of peppers. Thank goodness I am not anaphylactic, but it makes me very sick the next day, similar to food poisoning with chills, vomiting, and severe fatigue. 

Of course, I informed my server right away at the beginning of our meal, "I am allergic to capsicum, which means I can't have any kind of peppers" and asked him to make sure none was included with our guacamole dish. 

The guacamole came out and after eating some I commented to my boyfriend, "Does this taste spicy to you?" He thought it didn't so we continued eating since we couldn't see any peppers in the guacamole. I was also starving. 

My burger came out cooked perfectly, but there was red flakes all over my fries. I asked my server, "Excuse me, what seasoning is on these fries?" "Oh it's a combination of things, like paprika and some other stuff" "Paprika is made from peppers," I explained, and asked him to bring me new fries without any seasoning. His response was "oh, I assumed seasoning would be fine." That's when I looked closer at the chips that came with the guacamole and saw they also had this seasoning all over them.

They brought me new fries and everything tasted delicious, which is why I gave them 2 stars. But thanks to poor training and assumptions that I could eat things I explained I was allergic to, I spent all of the next day extremely sick. Allergies need to be taken seriously!!!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Kellie U.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: I got the nachos as my entree and my husband got the mango chicken. My husband loved his meal. I had a taste and it was pretty good. Very spicy, but if you're into that, you'll love it. Unfortunately, I was not very happy with my nachos. It seemed like they were probably done a good 10 minutes before my husbands food. By the time they got to the table the cheese was cold and hard. I didn't complain, because you never know what people might do to your food when you send it back. If you do order the nachos, just ask them to bring it out as soon as it's done.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: David B.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
There are so many other places with great beer and food. I suppose Rock Bottom might do in a pinch. 

We didn't get served right away, I guess we fell through the cracks. But by the time someone got to us, they explained the happy hour specials were only good until 6:30 pm. That stung, because if we had been served when we arrived, we would have qualifed.   They missed one great opportunity to make things right, but they blew it. 

We decided on the Guacamole Made-To-Order. It wasn't made table side, and it wasn't all that good, just rather disappointing. The pizza, was pretty tasty, especially the crust. 

I ordered the Oatmeal Stout, but it was only so-so. At least the prices were reasonable.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Rosa A.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: My boyfriend and I were both craving a burger one Sunday afternoon and this is where we ended up! I had the Bacon Cheddar burger, which had this bbq/ranch sauce on it and it was sooo good. Mike got the 2 AM burger which was topped with an egg (this is Mike's favorite type of burger!). They both came with fries. I'm not sure what the seasoning is on the fries, but those were excellent! I've had other things off their menu but I definitely recommend a burger!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Merlyn R.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: I ordered the greenhouse salad, grilled beer-glazed chicken, and the triple chocolate brownie (all not pictured). The food itself was good with perfect portions! The brownie was still warm and very gooey inside. Overall, I had a nice experience with great wait staff! The only complaint is that the lemonade was rather tart, but I'm sure that it is due to people adding sugar to taste.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jenna W.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Great food, beer, and atmosphere! I've been here a few times and have always gotten a burger, which are always juicy and fill you up, but if you're looking for something a little nicer, their Cajun Pasta is very good. It has sausage, ground chicken and shrimp, as well as linguine, so you will leave full and satisfied. The pasta was cooked well and the cream sauce had just a little kick to give the dish extra flavor. The service here is excellent, very pleasant and attentive. As soon as we sat down we had someone taking our drink order and our food came out quickly once we ordered it, despite our group being large. The atmosphere is casual and comfortable, great for a group of friends or family.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Bee M.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: This was my first time in years here and honestly I must say overall I'm impressed. We ordered the flights and let the bartender pick our choices. They were all very different and delicious in different ways! The Porter is an interesting one!! The firecracker shrimp is AMAZING. The only hiccups through our service was the fries were over cooked (the server was more than happy to get us fresh ones) and he didn't like to refill our waters lol. Definitely a great place for food and good time!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Shawn T.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: We got the jalapeño pretzel sticks as an appetizer and they were amazing. I would go back just to get these. Also got beer flights. Beer was good. I would definitely recommend going for appetizers and beer. My main meal was just ok. They have several appetizers that sounded great and I would go back to try.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Kyler W.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
This place has gone down hill since the last time I was here. . . 

We showed up on a Saturday around 3:00 PM. The section of the bar that is meant to have ice that you can set your pint on to chill it, was not turned on and was just water. Not a big deal right? However there was old food just sloshing around in the water and the bartender kept placing our drinks in the gross water. 

We got the buffalo shrimp appetizer and the deep fried cuban sandwhich. Both were just ok and nothing spectacular or worth going back for. Not sure what is going on here but this place has tons of potential and should strive a little harder on all fronts. With the competition in this area they shouldn't be slacking at all.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jessica P.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: The one star is earned for the food here alone.  We love to eat here when we make a trip to the waterfront, but our service today makes us not want to visit again.  Our server was not pleasant from the get go.  He barely greeted us, any time we needed something we needed to wave him down because he didn't check in on us at all.  My sandwich was wrong, with an ingredient I literally cannot eat.  Instead of apologizing or anything he just grabbed the sandwich away from me.  When he brought the new one all he said was "ta da", so with that we asked for our check.  Didn't get an apology for the mess up, didn't get a thank you for dining at the restaurant.  It doesn't take much to just be pleasant when you're a server, but for this guy apparently it was asking too much.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Katie W.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: I cannot say enough good things about Rock Bottom!! I absolutely love this place. The food is consistently good, but the staff is what really highlights this place. The bartenders are extremely friendly, especially if you tend to come around a lot. Uppity Jagoff is consistently a fantastic beer. There is a bar area on the left upon entry, with smaller tables and more of a 'sports bar' kind of vibe. And then on the right is more of a dining room feel, with booths and larger tables. Both are great depending on the kind of party that you are catering to. Also, try the chicken fried chicken if you can, it is the best!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Sammi A.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Waitress was pleasant and there was no wait. Our food arrived to the table quickly. I ordered the steak and portobello salad. It was fantastic. The steak was superb. I'm pretty picky when it comes to ordering a good steak. The meat was tender and cooked to perfection with no gristle or fat. It was definitely quality. It's a really nice atmosphere and located in the hub of the waterfront just a hop and skip to live entertainment at sing sing. I would highly recommend it!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Valerie V.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Rock Bottom is a decent larger sports/brew pub seating is at a premium on weekend evenings, prepare to wait an hour to be seated at a table or try your luck scurrying against others as a high-top becomes available in the bar.

The food is average, nothing extraordinary...we did get the sausage filled pretzels bites, they had little or no  sausage in half of them (should have gotten the ball park pretzel)

They do offer a drink and wine selection but beer is limited to house brew only.

Update 1/2017 Be prepared to wait close to an hour for food...
And make sure you order to doneness, mine came pink with a bloody bun may be because the waitress said they are behind due to a large party

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jeane C.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: We followed our hostess through the near empty restaurant of the famed Pittsburgh waterfront, when she stopped at a four top next to the kitchen and walkway. Despite all the server traffic moving back and forth behind our seats, no one stopped or noticed our position for 20 minutes. And they didn't really notice as we left. So, I say "don't eat there" but even if you do go you won't eat there.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Marlynn L.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: We waited for over 30 minutes for our simple food orders... 2 kids' meals, an avocado chicken sandwich, and a chicken salad.  When the avocado chicken sandwich came out, there was no avocado on it.  After asking our waitress, she took back my plate to simply bring it right back out to report that they are out of avocado.  She also didn't offer any compensation on the bill.  Overall, the food was very mediocre.  And, most importantly, customer service is poor.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jake H.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Was visiting Pittsburg and decided to try Rock Bottom. We arrived during their happy hour and my date and I split a flight of beers which were all different yet good! We also got the happy hour chicken nachos which were HUGE and very affordable. Our meals came out hot and delicious. Seemed very reasonably priced for how much food and drink we got. Would definitely come back if we ever find ourselves in Pittsburg again.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Daniel G.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Food was good and the restaurant has a nice atmosphere. The main issue I had was the high chairs don't fit the table heights. My son had the choice of having the table at his chin or below the high chair. I will admit they had normal height tables but they were all reserved. Nice place if you are looking for a payed back bar atmosphere.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Lynne T.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: OMG!! Stale tortilla chips with my bland guacamole and sour salsa!! You need to eat here if you have no tastebuds and you're drunk

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jason B.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Not the best place to eat down at the Waterfront, it's far from the worst either. Sometimes it's overly crowded and their waitresses seem to be on a never-ending carrousel of changing over. I've literally never even seen the same person working there twice. Perhaps it's just me, but I like to build a report with those in which I choose to dine with. 

Worth checking out, but don't regret it too hard if you don't, I wouldn't say it's a "must try"

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Katy K.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
I would like to start off for saying that the service at Rock Bottom has always been very good. The staff is always friendly and attentive. However, the food has gone greatly downhill over the years. I used to really enjoy my meals here, but i have been let down time and time again in the last few months. I come semi regularly to the trivia night they host and am usually disappointed with my food. The chicken they use is often dry, rubbery, and flavorless. It honestly looks like the scraps that have been left out for days. Our food also comes out luke warm. 

Update: my friend found pieces of plastic wrapper in her carrot cake. Pictured below.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Michael E.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
I went to Rock Bottom with a handful of friends to celebrate a birthday. There is so much potential for this restaurant to look cool, but I could not help but wonder if the inside used to be a Perkins or a nursing home they took over. Very bizarre. The bar area looks well designed but the restaurant seating is very Eat and Parkish. Yikes. 

Once ordered. The. Food. Took. For. Ev. Er. The restaurant is big, it was not full, and I'm still wondering what happened and why it took so long. I ordered a burger with an upgraded side of mac and cheese. I just wasn't impressed. I was starving and still didn't think it tasted that great. The whole meal didn't have a lot of flavor. 

Sorry to be a negative Nancy. Here's a plus! Plenty of parking. 

I won't be back. Sadly, after leaving, I wasn't doubting I truly just visited Rock Bottom. 

*I actually emailed the restaurant via the comment and never received a response. #ouch

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jay D.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
It's been a few years since I've eaten here since moving out of the area.  Went here the other day with my colleagues from work for lunch, and I was beyond less than impressed with our meal.  

Our service was great, a gentleman who truly hustled the whole time and kept our drinks filled (one of my biggest pet peeves when it doesn't happen!).  Because of how great he was, and the fact we were on a true time crunch, I didn't say anything about how unpleased I was with my meal.

I ordered a cup of their chicken tortilla soup, and their Chicken Waldorf salad.  Neither would I ever order again.  The soup was, in my opinion, terrible.  I don't know if it is just because I have had better, or had different expectations, but to me it was just bland, watered down and terrible.  

The Waldorf salad was whole other ballgame.  It was supposed to have all these wonderful toppings on it, and these "toppings" were scarce and hard to find.  There were barely any grapes on it (maybe two or three halves?), two or three large clumps of the walnuts, a small scattering of sand grain sized blue cheese, and two little apple chips on top which were old, stale and soft.  All of this on a very large and plentiful mound of (fresh, at least) salad mix.  The chicken...... ugh... the chicken.  Maybe a couple very thin slices thrown on top...which did not taste very fresh.  

This salad that I received was most certainly NOT the salad that I see other Yelpers posting.  If it had been, I'm sure I would have loved it.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jamie L.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: I was at rock bottom twice. The food has been good each time but I had the pretzel crusted chicken and it was excellent! The service is always excellent and quick!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Sherry M.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
I am not a beer drinker. As a former Restaurant Manager, of a restaurant in Pittsburgh that used to brew its own beer, I did once help the Brew Master make an ale, as part of the training. Craft beer is an inquired taste. I can drink it on occasion under the right circumstance.
 
Rock Bottom has never been our go-to craft beer place. I like going to Rock Bottom after the movies, because it is the only place open late, other than Eat-n-Park, which I do not like. 

I love the Mac-Cheese with Bacon & Chicken. It is the dish I order every time. I am not much on the spices that they cook with for the other dishes. The rest of my family loves the spices dishes. The Mac-Cheese is a dish that I  highly recommend. 

My  three stars is because of the service. The one thing I really dislike about this place,  is at night dinning, the side work and the cleaning the servers do when people are eating really bothers me. The service gets so slow because, the servers are doing their side work to complete their shift. I really dislike having the sweeper run under my feet or around the table when I am eating. I understand it totally, I get the concept BUT, I wouldn't sit any one in a section that the server is closing out. With the huge dining room area that they have, they had plenty of tables to leave until closing. This is the one pet peeve of mine when dining. When the servers are cleaning and taking care of the rest of their work, they tend to forget about the tables and customers they still have. It takes forever to get the bill or refills. I always ask for two glasses of water and the check when they drop of the food.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Brenda C.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Going to breweries and getting flights is a favorite thing to do for us. It was a hot day and we were excited to find this place. We weren't looking for it, we just ran into it in the shopping center.
We were jazzed. But, sadly the beers and the food were only ok. The service was a little crappy too. Not mean, mostly just blah, uninterested, no smiles.
I won't go back.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Lyndsay A.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Rock Bottom is a unique choice at the Homestead Waterfront where there are predominately chains. I've eaten here twice, and both times I really enjoyed the beer (which is all brewed there!) but my food was average. Boneless wings are a yummy app and the beer changes seasonally, so they always have something you're in the mood for. Service is generally friendly and quick.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Kelly M.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Grabbed an early dinner with a girlfriend tonight at Rock Bottom. 
When we got there, we chose to eat outside as it was a beautiful day. The patio was nice with elevated (stool) seating, which may be a deal breaker for some, but the patio is not near the main road so not a ton of cars going by, a plus. 

The waitress came to our table quickly to get our drink orders and I asked for the happy hour menu [I could not find it ANYWHERE prior to my visit so I added a pic to the Yelp posting, you're welcome :)]. Though the menu is quite small, especially with foods, the foods really are a great deal. An especially good value are the pizzas (choice of margherita or pepperoni), because they are a nice size (8 cut!) and very delicious, you will probably have leftovers as I did. My friend said that the seafood tacos were very good, and they did look very nice on the plate. Their greenhouse salad is also delicious and a good portion, and they have their own spin on it- there's raisins and salted sunflower seeds sprinkled on top. Normally I would be reluctant for these in a salad, but it just works! Their salad dressings are all homemade but the dressing cups are extremely small so I had to ask for another.

All in all, decent food, our service was great, food came within a reasonable period of time. Happy hour is the only time I can see myself coming here in the future because the food is worth the price you pay during happy hour. (I am giving 4 stars because I had a great meal at a great price with great service, but I can completely get why others would rate lower if they paid regular prices for the same food)

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Aiyana L.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: I have been to this restaurant twice during my work travels to Pittsburgh. It's great. Service has been fantastic. Never have to wait for a table. You can see the brewery while at the bar and one side of the restaurant though giant glass windows. You can take home growlers of beer. Food was very good. I am picky and they accommodated anything I wanted to edit on the menu. It's very clean and continently located

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Lucas P.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: This is one of my worst experiences at Rock Bottom. I'm pretty sure the waiter was high. Hi Dan you did a terrible job. If the guy with a buzz cut is your waiter just leave. The best thing he did was leave the water pitcher on a table. I went over and grabbed it and filled me and my friends cup 3 times before he came back. Food was cold. Don't recommend this place. The manager didn't seem to care either. Terrible performance all around!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: David D.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: Good food but service was beyond terrible! The waiter told me don't get upset sir you food will be here shortly and I reminded I hadn't ordered yet! Then went to eat and we were short our silverware and that took another 5 minutes. Never again.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Camellia B.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
We went in on a Steelers home game Sunday. It was pretty quiet inside. The staff seemed sleepy but were polite.
We ordered firecracker shrimp which came out over cooked and Luke warm. The sauce was only put on one shrimp. One. So basically we got breaded shrimp.  My spouse ordered a Rock Bottom classic burger well done. She was served a burger so well done it looked like charcoal. The cheese on top was even burned. Yuck! I got shrimp and lobster enchiladas. One enchilada had maybe a drop of enchilada sauce, the rest were dry and crusty. Yet again, overlooked. Don't eat here. Just drink.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Jake L.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Solid beer options with a frozen bar to keep em cool on. Also, they offer what is maybe the most generous beer flight I've ever seen.
Service is great. The bartenders are helpful and attentive, and can guide you in the right direction with said flight.

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Gina F.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description: We've been going to Rock Bottom for several years.  If you go during the day, Bob will take care of you at the bar...during the evening, Paul and/or Eian will definitely keep your glass full.  It's one of those places where you go that you know the food will be good and the service great.  Probably my favorite place at the waterfront.  Thanks guys for making me want to come back!

ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.author: Amanda S.
ESzO3Av0b1_TzKOiqzbQYQ.description:
Average is the word to describe Rock Bottom brewery. Service is good, staff is friendly, but the food is mediocre at best.
