mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: Great breakfast joint, beat corned beef hash I've ever had. Friendly staff, loved it.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Katie W.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: The cutest little breakfast place around! The inside is surprisingly spacious for the area. There is a cute little outdoor patio as well. Not only was the restaurant nice, but the food... oh my god. It was a little pricey for a breakfast, but you got more than your money's worth. I had the banana pecan French toast, and wow, I have never had anything like it. If you can get the pecan praline syrup on a meal, absolutely do it. It is incredible. Love this place!

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Danielle H.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description:
Super cute breakfast spot. Love her choice of decor. One of our favorites when staying close to the south hills 
Friendly staff!

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Kristy A.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description:
Overall, a solid breakfast choice and we will be back.   We stopped by on a Saturday morning and were told to sit anywhere.  I chose a table in the front near the open garage door - very comfy with a nice cafe feel.   

Both of our breakfasts were plentiful and tasty (skip the biscuit and gray though - the gravy was sub-par).   Staff members were friendly even with the chaos that a table on the patio was creating with their two dogs.   The chaos was actually quite entertaining and the people creating it were really good-natured, so it wasn't unwelcome or annoying.   You can BYOB to make bloody marys and Irish coffee and such.   

Prices were reasonable, but don't forget to pay the meter....one $15 ticket later.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Ted C.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: When to the cracked egg and really felt like I was hit over he head with so much msg! Omg - people can we please find a breakfast joint that at least used real eggs????

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Marshellena C.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: Excellent food ,service ,and atmosphere as usual i have never experienced anything less than that when i go to this intimate yet roomy diner i had my usual Popeye omelet its an omelet with chorizo spinach and feta it's sooooooooooooooooo good it comes with your choice of toast and potatoes i suggest cheesy potatoes but they are all good i also got a banana  pancake  on the side and every single bite had a fresh piece of banana in it this place is worth the drive no matter what part of Pittsburgh your coming from!!!

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Molly H.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description:
There's nothing more that I love than breakfast. Replacing an older breakfast joint, the Crack's Egg really cracked the code to a great spot. Totally renovated and open space. The coffee is strong, hot and bottomless. 

I've visited twice and can't wait to go back for more. Omelettes are fluffy and full. Selections of breads to accompany and choices of potatoes makes me very happy on a Saturday AM drop-in. 

While I haven't (yet) tried the waffles or pancakes, from a distance they look amazing! One of these options will definitely be my next morning fill up though it will be hard to veer from my love of omelettes. 

Stop in and check this place out!

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Jessica R.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: The food was good and reasonably priced but the portions were small in my opinion. I had the caprese benedict and it was just poached eggs on top of tomato slices. Still could have used an English muffin or something with it because there was nothing to soak up the egg and hollandaise with. My fiancé had the biscuits and gravy and he liked it but again the portion was pretty small. It was not busy in there and the service was fast. Another plus is they are BYOB with whatever you want to bring for mimosas or bloodies..but unfortunately I didn't know this til we were already there. Didn't see it advertised on their website unless I missed it.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Ashley L.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: Ordered from DoorDash and it did take awhile to get the food, but it was SO good. I hadn't heard of this place before that but I'm so glad we found it! I had a breakfast sandwich that was also a burger!!! I thought it was fantastic and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone that's a breakfast or brunch lover like myself.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Jamie R.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: We went here on a recommendation.  The food was awesome.  The place is bigger than it looks too.  You can sit outside or inside.  Service was wonderful and quick.  We will be visiting again, again, and again.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Johnny T.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: This is a great place for a nice breakfast. The food is always perfect. The prices are always reasonable. The service is always friendly. The atmosphere is always... well I suppose it depends on your beliefs. While at first I found the decorations very welcoming and comforting, after a few visits I realised that the walls were riddled with religious beliefs. To each their own I suppose, but the once "welcoming" decor became very unwelcoming.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Phil G.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: It's Sunday so free street parking! I wanted more than I could eat but ordered it anyway.  Everything tasted great and the waitress remembered my name and how I like my eggs. Impressive since I wouldn't call myself a regular.  Our table was too small to hold all the plates so that was a bit annoying, but we made do and enjoyed ourselves and the food nonetheless.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Brittaney M.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: Amazing! Food and service is awesome! The decor and atmosphere is adorable! One of my favorite breakfast /brunch places.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Rini P.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: Amazing breakfast food! You get so much food for the amount you pay for. This was my first visit and I will definitely be coming back. The menu had a lot of variety so theres something on there for everyone. The only downside was that they didn't have a parking lot so we had to park at the meters and that in itself was a hassle.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Robyn H.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: The reviews were good and the menu sounded delicious. Unfortunately we were duped. The breakfast burrito was unremarkable and the avocado toast Benny was very odd. One small piece of bread spread very thinly with unseasoned avocado & two poached eggs. I asked for Hollandaise sauce and had the privilege of paying extra for it! The grilled cinnamon roll was really dry so we asked for extra icing to moisten it and again had the privilege of paying extra for it! Extremely disappointing. Seems like a lot of those reviews were planted by employees or family members.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: April R.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: I went here for the second time this morning with my father for brunch. We had an enjoyable experience again. We had a hard time deciding what to get because the menu had such a nice variety. I decided on the Belgium waffle and turkey sausage. The waffle was really great but I wasn't crazy about the turkey sausage. It was way too spicy for me. Our waitress was very nice too. The place is small, but adorable and well kept.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Jesse T.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description:
Holy Moly Breakfast Nirvana!!! The Crack'd Egg, just Crack'd into my top 3 favorite morning eateries in Pittsburgh! I plan on becoming a regular here before the rest of the Burgh finds out about this place. It's literally perfect. 

The food, the service, the upscale diner setting, I wouldn't change a thing. And on top of it all, the prices are very reasonable! Oh yeah, and it's BYOB!! Oh yeah, and it's never too busy!!!

The only reason that I'm writing this review and not trying to keep this place as my own personal secret is because I don't want to run the risk of them not succeeding. 

I HATE driving down Sawmill Run Blvd from Green Tree, but for this breakfast insanity, I'm just gonna have to suck it up.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Caitlyn B.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description:
The Crack'd Egg is a cozy and friendly neighborhood breakfast spot! As a new resident to PA I so appreciate the love for breakfast foods and all of the options Pittsburgh has to offer. I was looking for a spot where I could eat alone and would have the charm of a neighborhood spot but still accept credit cards (what can I say.. I'm a millennial and rarely have cash). 

I visited on a Friday morning. It was busy but not too busy to be seated immediately. The service was quick and friendly. Surprisingly quick!! I ordered pumpkin coffee off their seasonal menu and that was great. Then I ordered chocolate chip pancakes and bacon. 

This isn't your greasy diner type of place so that's why I'm excited to give it 5 stars. I'm happy to support a neighborhood gem that serves delicious breakfast food in a clean, upscale environment with friendly service and good prices. 

I can't wait to go back to try the cinnamon bun!

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Blake S.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: The Eastwood omelette was amazing! Great service and the breakfast was so filling and savory. My daughter really enjoyed the berry oatmeal as well.

mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.author: Emma H.
mIVfDS47YwXjDjXVxAoZVg.description: The service was very good and it was a great place to eat. The decorations were adorable and the staff was very welcoming and our order came out quickly. The portion sizes are large and the food is great. Prices were amazing and I felt like I was at home eating there. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great breakfast or lunch anytime.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Carolina V.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
We had a magnificent meal last night at Seasons Restaurant. The space, service, and food were fabulous. What an amazing treasure in Etna! A chef who trained at the French Laundry who is sourcing local ingredients to make inventive and creative food? Who could ask for anything more!

This restaurant is a gem. I would run, not walk, here. We got the chance to speak to Chef David after our meal and we're blown away by his story and hustle. We cannot wait to return with family and friends!

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Peter M.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
Ive lived in Pittsburgh for the last few years and been to all of the 'top restaurants' in the area from Poulet Bleu to Altius to Twisted Frenchman and I've never had anything like this...if I could give 6 stars I would. I celebrated my birthday and an anniversary here and both meals blew me away. 

The decor is unassuming and unpretentious and the food is absolutely divine. Yes, expensive, but a must visit if you have the chance. Chef David has a masterful grasp of fine dining using ingredients, garden grown parts of plants I'd never heard of to create visually striking dishes that taste just as good as they look. If you want to experience food in a way you haven't before, Seasons has my highest praise. I'll be coming back any chance I get.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Alex F.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
I had an absolutely amazing experience here. The food was to die for. The chef made this asparagus appetizer that blew me away. Never had I experienced asparagus this good. The chef also made milk fed chicken which was some of the vest damn chicken I've ever had as well.  

This restaurant is definitely meant to showcase unique foods and tastes. It exceeded my expectations through and through. It broke regular ass asparagus for me. 

I would highly recommend this place for a social evening with friends and family who are interested in food.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Megan M.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description: We returned to Seasons for our anniversary and had the same wonderful experience as before. Unique, local, incredibly fresh ingredients. I highly recommend this place for an elegant, elevated dining experience in Pittsburgh.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Sue T.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
I want to give this place another chance. The exterior is absolutely stunning. The interior is equally impressive. 

The restaurant is hyper-local and doesn't even provide lemons with water. Something I was a little appalled by but later after some thought, admired. 

I could tell that the restaurant was still trying to find its groove though. There was only one server in the restaurant who catered to all the guests. Service was a little slow because of this. For a 6 course meal, my two friends and I were at the restaurant for 3.5 hours and left.. still hungry. 

I appreciate all the small touches the chef included in the meal such as a welcoming cocktail which was a very tasty, delicate cider. The first dish was roasted sunchokes, topped with fancy salt and black truffle. The sunchokes were cooked to perfection with a very buttery taste and texture. The salt complimented the dish wonderfully. This dish was very unique with exquisite taste however, simple. 

Next was a fancy clam chowder. It was great! The clams were very plump and juicy. The soup itself was very buttery. The dish was delicious but nothing out of the ordinary. The third course was a soup with gooseberries, chives, grains and carrots from the chef's garden. This might have been the best dish I had. The dish had different textures that were great and delicious. I was super happy eating this because I also felt healthy. Every bite was a treat. The gooseberries' sweetness mixed with the buttery salty goodness of the broth and oats. This was the best dish; this was the only exceptional dish to me.. all the others were good. 

The last savory dish was venison loin with honey poached cranberries. This dish was tasty and the meat was cooked perfectly, it was super juicy and blended well with the sauce. The meat was salty but blended well with the sweet tartness of the sauce. 

The dessert was apples with cultured cream and blueberry jam. This was super tasty, but just a fancy yogurt. 
The last course was a little taste of honey. I was a little shocked that a spoonful of honey would be considered a course. The meal concluded with a cute little take home gift of camomile tea and a stick of the featured honey. 

Would I come here again? Absolutely after some time. I'd like to give this restaurant a little more time to operate and find its bearings before I return. The food was delicious and executed beautifully. However, the service and portions were slightly off for me. My friends and I decided to go to another restaurant afterwards to order a few appetizers and desserts to feel satisfied.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Carol W.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description: My husband and I enjoyed a multi course meal here. You get a number of small courses, each presented in an artistic way. We love to forage and try different spices so we had a lot of questions for the staff. They were knowledgeable. They even gave us a foraging location for our favorite mushroom. We got some ideas for our own cooking. Each course had a different look, texture and spicing. They will accommodate different dietary issues if given advance notice. We are not vegetarians but some in our family are. I noticed that the vegetarian dinners are less expensive. I liked the emphasis on local foods.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Robin R.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description: My wife and I came for our 3 year anniversary dinner. Chef David was very accommodating and made our evening one for the books! His passion for food shows in his cooking. Each dish tells a beautiful story and wows the palate. From the local to the seasonal ingredients, I couldn't wait to taste the next course. This isn't your typical establishment and I'm glad! If you have a passion for food, I highly suggest coming here. Salute!

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Alex A.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
One of the best restaurants Pittsburgh's ever going to see. They've got some amazing dishes and the chef uses techniques which are most definitely fine dining certified, pretty sure you're not going to get any better as far as ingredients. We were lucky enough to get a spot at the chef's table and got the VIP chefs grand tasting experience. Of course it's the expensive thing on the menu at $139 (keep in mind there are other options with 4 courses starting at $65, 8 courses at $95, do the math). For the finesse that you're getting on the plate. You won't find it anywhere else in Pittsburgh. Probably closer to a $250-a-plate meal in Manhattan. 


All the ingredients are locally sourced as much as possible, vegetarian options are there. Staff is friendly and the decor puts you in a vibe which definitely elevates your meal. Don't sleep on it, the ingredients and dishes obviously change with the SEASONS, we had some incredible dishes for December! Think truffles (white and black), lobster, mushrooms, winter vegetables, venison... can't think of the rest. The complexity and variety of ingredients will definitely send your culinary prowess into overdrive. Pittsburgh's restaurant scene is transforming, and Seasons on the wave. Chef David will bring you places.

DONT F*CKIN SLEEP. If you've got a hankering to bring your loved one and enjoy some really fine food, Take their asses here and put a stop to just swallowing generic midwestern fare. 

These photos are some, not all, but you'll get the picture. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation already.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Arlene M.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
I finally had the opportunity to dine at this New American upscale restaurant and learn about the concept behind it. The place is very small and reservations are required. Dress is casual and it is BYOB for wine pairings.

Chef David B, whom I had the pleasure of speaking with explained to me that everything is local sourced, there are seasonal adjustments to the menu and they go even to get their salt from mines in WV as well as use special olive oil. The decor is unique ranging from a metal moose head to a wall "cork board" where they will nail your wine cork into the board as each patron opens their bottle.

The menu changes on a daily basis but you are not given a physical menu to look at. Instead your waitress will ask you a series of questions related to any food allergies you have and how you prefer your food. This is primarily a tasting menu so you can choose anywhere for 4-8 courses, They have a regular chef's menu as well as a vegetarian menu in which to choose from. Gluten free and vegan can be made upon request.

I decided to go with the 4 course tasting menu. (quick note-the 4 course tasting menu is only available on Thurs, other days you would have to choose between the 6 or 8 course.)  As a prelude I was given something called a one bite potato pierogie with chives and sour cream. This tiny dish was outstanding!  Everything is prepared slowly and your utensils are constantly changed so you can savor the taste. For my 1st course I had a beet tart with sour cream. The shell was made at Buckwheat farms (may not have spelled it right). Needless to say this was one of the best beet dishes I ever had! My 2nd course was a wild mushroom bisque that consisted of roasted mushrooms, with roasted potatoes, chicken, and greens from their garden. This too was exceptional. My 3rd course was butternut squash risotto made with duck herbs and local Parmesan. Instead of rice Chef David grinds the squash into a texture that resembles risotto. This item too was one of the best squash risottos I ever tasted.

As I was waiting for my next course I learned that the Chef was preparing a 5th plate for everyone in house this evening. Meantime upon request they made me from scratch a glass of ice tea which comes from Tupelo honey tea over in Milvale. This special plate turned out to be roasted sirloin from grass fed beef, red peppers, and roasted eggplant. Believe me this plate was a meal in itself. The final course was dessert. The uniquely created dessert was a poached apple covered by cookie crumbles from Winterberry Farms along with goat cheese and honey in an apple cider base. Needless to say this is a rather different approach to dessert since the goat cheese takes away some of the sweetness of the apple and gives it a somewhat sour taste.

Considering the great effort used in not only acquiring the best local sourced ingredients (shown on their website) and the amount of work taken into preparing each individual plate the meal is expected to be expensive. However, I never have an issue with that when it comes to quality and hard work. The staff was very attentive to my needs and made sure I had everything I needed to enjoy this wonderful tasting menu.

Seasons is open for dinner only on Thurs-Sat from 6:00-9:30 pm. Metered street parking is available in Etna but there is no charge due to the lateness of the day. Seasons is not just a restaurant but a dining room  experience. This restaurant is a welcome addition to the Etna community.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: K K.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description: Incredible tastes, textures, and service!  Superb fois gras.  The housemade wheat bread was delicious - toasted to perfection. House grown and locally sourced fresh veggies and herbs beautifully and tastefully prepared. Our prix-fixe menu was varied with creative twists. A memorable meal.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Daniel P.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
My wife and I tried Seasons last night and ordered the 8 course. We really enjoyed the experience and highly recommend...it's only a few minute drive drom popular destinations like Lawrenceville or Aspinwall. The chef is thoughtful and consistent with delivery. We particularly enjoyed a mushroom, black truffle and house made cottage cheese dish, a pork belly and honey dish, and the clam "chowder." All were prepared uniquely and focused on locally sourced ingredients, which was very cool. 

Don't plan on eating and leaving, its a night long experience (a good thing) and you're never rushed. Service is great.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Drew M.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
If you told me a year ago I was going to have one of the best meals of my life in an upscale restaurant in f-ing Etna, PA, I would have said you were crazy. 
If you can only check out one restaurant this year, make it Seasons. You will not be disappointed. 
My wife and I have eaten at Michelin star restaurants and this almost at that level. I love that all of the ingredients are locally sourced and that gratuity is included in the price, which makes me believe the staff are earning a living wage. Yes, at $114 to $165 per person, this is going to be one of the more expensive restaurants in Pittsburgh - but it's worth it because of the quality of food, the innovative menu that always changes and the intimate experience of having a quiet restaurant that only takes reservations and holds no more than 14 people . Plus, the chef would personally come out and explain the meals to us and where the ingredients came from. Where can you get that in Pittsburgh? 
I should mention that the front door sticks a bit, so you have to really pull it to get it open. 
I can't wait to go back. I highly recommend this place.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Kevin C.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description: Great experience! Meal, service, atmosphere leave nothing to be desired.  Chef David and his team are doing things, and doing them well

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Matt B.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
Yelp is about food, so let's cut to the chase: The food here is top-tier. It's creative, elegant, perfectly prepared and just so incredibly, astoundingly delicious.

That said, I think what makes this place really special is how unassuming and welcoming it is. Fine dining of this caliber is usually paired with a little pretense. Be honest, even if you're into the scene, you know this is true. It's just part of the gig.

That, for me, is where Seasons really shined. There was no pretense. The night I was there, service was provided by a single person, and she was super nice, conversational and had a great sense of humor. 

The Chef stopped by, said hello and introduced himself. He then returned to our table all night long to talk about each dish, where he got the ingredients, what he was thinking about when he was putting it together, etc. 

This felt personal, informal and actually kind of humble. Chef came across as guy that is just genuinely super jazzed about sharing food with people, whoever they may be...never mind the fact that the food he's cooking is luxurious, refined and about as close to perfection as you're going to find.

I don't think Pittsburgh has anything else quite like this right now.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Marco V.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
I have been at Seasons in February and the dining experience was excellent. Zero complaints. David Bulman is a very talented and accomplished chef.

We had a reservation March 29 at 7 pm and received a call at 6:30pm to cancel the reservation. We suspected the excuses about "health issues" were not genuine. Especially since we never received a follow-up call or an apology from Mr. Bulman.

Since then I realized others experienced similar cancellations.

It is a shame that Mr. Bulman does not have the same business acumen as his culinary skills. When (not if) his restaurant will fail, it will be a loss for all us who enjoy fine dining.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Arlene C.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
This is probably one of the worst experiences I've ever had dining in an upscale restaurant. We made the reservation for Thursday January 3, 2019 at 7:00 about a month in advance. The price was about $54 per person for a 4 course tasting. They were supposed to call us in advance so we could pair the wine which they did not. When we arrived we learned the price had increased to either $88. for a 5 course meal or$114. for 8 course and we all had to order the same.  We chose the 8 course.

The meal took approximately 3 and 1/2 hours as we were told because new people were working there. The first course was a slice of bread with butter. Because the service was so slow we asked for more bread but they had none. The soup was good. The main course was deer and duck of which I normally would not eat either. In all fairness when we arrived we were asked if there was anything we would not eat...but who would have thought they would serve deer.

I rely very heavily on yelp reviews to choose new restaurants and this was the first I've ever been to that had good reviews and was so bad and felt the need to warn others about.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Alexander H.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description:
Worst experience I've had dining in Pittsburgh.....
They clearly have no idea how to run the restaurant.....
It's unfortunate......

We showed up to our reservation two minutes late and was greeted at the front door by the server, the only server. And was told our table isn't ready and we can walk in the rain to a bar and have a beer. Mind you this BYOB so we brought an expensive bottle of wine to pair with our $300 meal for 2. No courtesy call nothing, just left standing in the rain. So we went and sat in our car for 20 minutes. Once we finally dined I quickly realized the place had no idea how to run a restaurant, steps of service were non existent, food was cold, steak was very tough. And it was a $300 meal.....

Save your money and your time...

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Stephanie S.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description: My favorite Pittsburgh restaurant! Chef David Bulman's expertise regularly wows me. All of the dishes are so balanced and thought out!  He uses locally sourced fresh ingredients.  I have always walked away from my meal feeling happy and satiated.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Wes N.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description: This place definitely gives you a different kind of dining experience but I will say it is not for everyone. The menu changes daily and we had no idea what was on the menu tonight, might be a problem for picky eaters. I went here with a large group (of 13) and there was only one other party. They apparently were a little understaffed as someone had called off. The restaurant space itself is nice. It is a BYOB so plan accordingly. Each member of my party had the standard tasting at $88 a person (hospitality included). Some of the courses left a bit to be desired. I cannot recall what was in the soup but it was served in a cup the size of a large shot glass. One of the courses was an egg and truffle dish, eating eggs for dinner seemed a little odd but they were very good. This was followed by duck (served two ways) and then a venison dish. Not a huge venison fan but I really loved it tonight. The portions on both of these varied significantly between different folks at our table. Some of the proteins were not warm enough, not sure if that was intentional. There was an apple and cream dessert and also a taste of honeycomb. I love the idea of this place, serving locally-sourced products but something in the execution seemed a little off. As above, I know they were understaffed but I wasn't really impressed with the service, we were there for 3.5 hours. Perhaps as a product of being there for a few hours and having small portions, I left still a little hungry which wasn't really something I was expecting with all the courses. Overall, glad I tried it out but I probably won't be back.

vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.author: Jonathan B.
vZSgu1k5gWkTmoMwmmKc9Q.description: Went to Seasons in Etna last night.  Was really looking forward to trying, especially with the Chef's background.  Unfortunately, we were totally disappointed.  First of all, Chef didn't serve a number of items on his published Restaurant Week menu. Why do you publish a menu and not deliver what you promise? Took over 2 1/2 hours of mostly sitting and eating very little.  Nothing was special in any way. A few very very small courses of fruit and veggies. Tomatoes, Cucumbers, Melon.  One course was a single slice of outsourced bread with a tiny radish and butter.  Really??  Another course was about a quarter cup of corn. Tasted nice, but nothing special. The one protein, Amish chicken, was 3 small slices of breast with no flavor, atop faro which was well prepared and good with the diced veggies.  The best dish, by far, was the really small dessert of panna cotta (about 3 spoons).  Left hungry.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Lynn E.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
We've been back a few times since my original review.

The margarita is so yummy and the chips are fresh and hot.
The queso cheese has definitely changed to actual queso and not "government cheese". I actually liked both and wish they would offer both on the menu.

Salsa varieties are good too. Hubby liked the Diablo because it wasn't too hot.

The beef brisket taco is delish, but a little runny.  So make sure you have the proper napkins.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Nancy S.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
Go here to drink and grab chips and salsa. It's really a bar that also serves mexican-style food. It's not a your go-to for good tacos.

Anxious to try the restaurant when I heard it was owned by the same who runs Io Cafe only to be sadly disappointed that it doesn't measure up to its sister cafe across the street. In one sentence, the entire experience was flat and bland. 

First sign of trouble...food came out in two minutes. Usually we all feel like we hit the lottery when we are lucky to receive fast service but if I want food kept it steam tables I'll go to chipotle.

Ordered chips and guacamole; chips are fresh fried to they're hot but the guacamole was basic smashed avocado and I think I saw a glimpse of one piece of chopped red onion. 

Carnitas taco... terribly soggy, zero flavor. 
Crispy Cod taco was a piece of fish most likely pre-frozen pre-breaded... and they do a good job of hiding it under some mango salsa which was the only item with flavor. 

Each taco is about $3-$6 dollars, rice and beans are $3 chips and salsa... extra. Two meals with chips and guacamole no drinks.. $34. Go to chipotle

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Michael H.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
This place is magnificent. I wish I could give it 10 stars. Actually, I just did...10 Stars. 

The tacos are interesting and fresh. 
The queso is out of this world. 
The service is awesome. 
The ambiance, highlighted my the amazing murals, are perfect. 

You need to go to this place. 10 stars.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Gi G.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
I have been a regular at Taco  Diablo since they were in a small space across the street. When they opened in their larger space and began bar service, it was even better.  Not only was the food good, so were the margaritas.

In the last month or so things have changed, and not for the better. The margaritas are awful, bitter tasting due to too much lime or other changes in their mix. It seems the wait staff have become the bartenders.

The food is hit or miss.  The guacamole is bland.  Some of the sauces are less vibrant than before. And, what is up with all the mismatched paper containers for the food. It feels like we're at the food court in the mall, instead of a neighborhood restaurant.

I can appreciate that restaurants need to make changes at times. But, it seems as if they tossed out a number of things that were good only for the sake of change.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Christy C.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
I live close to Taco Diablo and it frequently comes up in the many "where should we eat?" discussions I find myself a part of.  While it finally won the battle, I wouldn't say it won the war.

My partner in dining crime and I started off with an order of nachos.  The chips were crisp and generously topped with black beans, guacamole, queso - which was delicious - and our protein of choice: brisket.  Now, it takes a LOT for me or my SO to comment that something is salty... but this brisket was borderline inedible. I picked around a good bit of it to find the chips that were slathered in the cheese/bean/guacamole goodness.  I'd definitely order these again, but perhaps with the chicken or taco beef instead.  I appreciated that the protein was included and not a separate upcharge.

Next up were a shared order of four tacos:

Grilled Chicken - this is your basic grilled chicken taco, folks.  No frills, it's topped with a smooth crema, diced tomatoes, cheese, and lettuce.  They definitely skimped on the toppings, as the lettuce, cheese, and tomato almost felt like a garnish rather than a part of the dish.  However, I did quite like the cheddar cheese they use.

Chicken Al Pastor - this was probably the most disappointing of the lot.  I remarked during our meal that it looked like it was missing something and that I thought there were more toppings listed on the menu.  Sure enough, we missed out entirely on the avocado and cilantro... and the "al pastor" was nothing more than diced pineapple on top of some grilled chicken.  Definitely not worth the $5 price tag.

Crispy Cod - sadly, this crispy cod was not crispy at all and was missing the napa cabbage listed on the menu.  The mango salsa was a nice touch... but if you're going to bill something as being "crispy," it damn well better be crispy. 

Loaded Crispy Potato - this taco also contained the aforementioned brisket.  Aside from the salt quotient, this taco was decent and the most plentiful of the bunch.  The iO sauce packed a punch.

I'm sad that this experience wasn't better... I will say the nachos were good minus the brisket, my margarita was tasty, and the company was superior. It could've been an off night, but my first visit here left a good bit to be desired for the $55 price tag.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Maria J.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
Located at the Beverly Shops on Beverly Rd. It is small inside and therefore, was busy on Saturday night at 7pm. However, we were seated right away at the last remaining booth. I'm not sure when they opened but it seemed like they weren't finished decorating as one large wall literally had nothing on it and it just made it seem unfinished. 

Our server was polite and helpful. Food came out pretty quick. The queso was good and not too runny which I hate! The diablo salsa was also good, not too spicy so it's still good for someone who doesn't like much spice. Tortilla chips were good and my only compliant was that they were a little greasy. Would still get both again. Tacos can be ordered in 2'a or 3's, or you can  pick as many individual that you want. Several good vegetarian and pescatarian options available which was great. I would definitely get the cauliflower and shrimp tacos again.

I would definitely come again and would prefer this place over other chain Mexican restaurants.
I think you get a good meal here and while I've had better and worse tacos elsewhere, I will definitely come back!

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Michele W.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description: Overall Taco Diablo was okay. Service was good, staff was friendly. Happy hour was a bonus and a good deal with $2 off drinks. Ordered a burrito bowl. It was average with taste. Mine had chicken, which was a bit on the dry side.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Don R.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
This was a great neighborhood place.  We have been regulars since they opened.  The food was always good.  I feel the quality of food is not what it used to be.

They have made a few menu changes recently I hope they reconsider.  The taco's are no longer a la carte.  Taco's come as two per order.  You cannot mix up.  Like one fish and one beef.  This was disappointing.  I always looked forward to trying multiple selections.  Would usually order three.  Also, they now serve everything in disposable containers.  This doesn't fit the ambiance.  It's a sit down restaurant, not a taco truck.  The wait staff were put in the awkward position of trying to explain the changes as "being good things" - they are not.

I hope they reconsider the menu and go back to what made them special.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Christy B.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
I will say that I am going into this review slightly bitter, as our 15ish minute wait time turned into 45 minutes. I understand fully that things happen and you can't control other tables, so I give them a pass on this. But I'll still keep in mind to get here before I'm starving. 

As for the food, the chips and salsa were very good and seemed fresh. The tacos were good... but weren't $70 good for two adults and one toddler. We had better tacos, drinks, and pricing going downtown to Bakersfield. Also, no kids menu here but they were more than willing to accommodate! 

The drinks were...eh. My husband got the el camino and had me try it. I'm not sure how else to describe it other than the taste you get in your mouth after smelling a burning tire. Once it was iced down, it was more bearable but he said he definitely wouldn't get it again. The spicy mojito was pretty good. I'd prefer to dial the jalapenos back just a bit. It wasn't unbearably spicy, but against the spicy tacos it didn't quench very much. 

All in all, I think we'd go here again, but only if totopo was too long of a wait and we were desperate for tacos in Mt Lebanon.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Robin L.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description: We love this place. Super cute and comfortable. Friendly staff. Tasty tacos! We will keep coming back.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Denise M.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
First time here & will return.  It has a good vibe and the service was really good.  Nice mix of age groups too!   I had the nachos with beef brisket.  They didn't skimp on any toppings.   I really liked the cheese they used... it's not a nacho cheese but more like a queso. Hubs had tacos which he said were good.  I didn't taste them.  It was served w black beans & rice.  I put the beans (because you can never have enough black beans ) on my nachos &  tried the rice.  It was ok.  A little dry.  
He also got a steak burrito.  He devoured it.  I tried the steak & it was very good.   We will return to try other items on the menu.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Rebecca M.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description: Impressive taste, I just wish the tacos were a bit larger for the price.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Ali C.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
We went for lunch one day last week, and were very pleased!  Nice and clean, vibrant mural on the back wall, good service, good food.  

It was pretty full when we got there, so it was a bit loud in there.  Anyone who has read my reviews in the past knows that this is a point of contention for me while dining.  I'm a little hard of hearing, and I don't want to scream and struggle to hear while I'm eating.  I wish people would just put something up on the ceiling to absorb sound.  I get the openness factor that everyone is going for right now, but come on.  

Also, with it being in close proximity to the elementary school, be prepared for Mommy & Me at lunchtime.  I'm sure it's not as kiddy for dinner. 

The food: Awesome!  I got two different tacos, and was mostly thrilled.  One was chicken al pastor.  I LOVED the topping -- pineapple, onions, cilantro.  All fresh.  But the chicken was so BLAND.  And because it was pulled chicken, it was almost like just gnawing wet on a sock.  The other taco was carnitas.  THAT WAS AMAZING.  The whole thing was like a party.  The rice and beans were also good.  I have to stress the freshness.  You can tell that literally everything was made to order, and all the ingredients were definitely not frozen or canned.  FRESH!!  This is like finding gold.  

Next time, I think I'll definitely try a cocktail or two.  The bartender definitely looked like she was making some good stuff.  

Good little spot in my old neighborhood.  Yay!

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Carolyn G.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description: I'm not sure what happened. This used to be a 5  in my book.  Everything has changed. Dsappointing margaritas, food in paper/food court bowls, balsa wood flat soup spoons that don't taste good when eating soup. What's happening? I hope this is a glitch?

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Adam G.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description: I've been meaning to stop here for awhile as I pass it nearly everyday. Headed to one of my favorite places across the street only to find they are closed on Tuesdays so Taco Diablo it is! My excitement to try this place didn't wear off right away. The decor is fun, the place is nice and clean which is a must for any restaurant. The staff all seemed friendly and helpful but then I got my food.... I'm not saying the food is bad because it's not but it's also nothing to tell anyone about either. They need to improve their recipes if they want to make it in Mt Lebanon! The meats they use are dry and bland as well as the rest of their ingredients. Maybe I caught them on a bad day? The entire experience wasn't bad at all but the food was well below expectations for a Mexican food joint with plenty of competition around to require the food to stand out in order to survive. Good luck Taco Diablo :-/

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: James B.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
Decent tacos, but there's little to write home about. I was looking for a taco place on my way home and stopped in on a Friday afternoon. Other than one other guy having a beer, I was the only patron in the establishment. Service was good and the food came out quickly.   
I would definitely stop back if I was in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Allison B.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description: Surprised by this place having less than 4 star reviews, although it seems like those reviews were prior to their new location. The place had great beers on tap and mixed drinks. Happy hour even on a Friday!! The chips and guac we're downright some of the best I've ever had...and I'm a serious critic of chips and guac. The place is super cute. I loved the variety of basic tacos and fancy "gourmet" ones to mix and match. Kinda expensive but I felt the quality was worth the price!

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Wes N.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description: Another decent taco place in Pittsburgh. I actually think their starters are better than the tacos. Their chips and queso are fantastic, the chips especially are very good. The sauce that comes with the patatas bravas is excellent. They have a good selection of tacos. You can buy tacos individually or can buy platters (with rice and beans) of either two or three of the same tacos. One thing I did not like is that when you mix and match tacos, which I'd imagine is what most people do, you have to pay extra for the rice and beans. I did this and wish I hadn't, the rice was fine but the beans tasted like they came out of a can. The carnitas taco was great, the chicken al pastor had no flavor at all. The tacos were pretty small. They ran out of Diet Coke. Would definitely give it another shot though.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Alistair C.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description: Definitely a fun vibe and I love the intimacy of the space. This has been a few restaurants over the years and I'm hopeful this one sticks. Who doesn't love tacos? There are so many variations that there is a taco for everyone. So, I am hoping that there will be more options at Taco Diablo. I'd love to see some more seafood apps/starters and vegetarian options for the tacos. I'd love to have a bean taco, but finding one in Pittsburgh is harder than it should be. I bring this up just in case the owners read the reviews. All in all this is a great place to meet friends for a few drinks and grab some tacos. Great space, great location and really good food. I will keep coming back to see how the business grows.

Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.author: Troy B.
Z5LyFZUazPQ1x_i6HsS3vw.description:
Today I stopped into the new location (they were formerly a popup across the street, and they recently moved into the space that used to be Sushi 3), for lunch, and I was teetering on giving them three stars, but I gave them the benefit of the doubt, and kept them at four.  The lunch menu today seemed so much more limited than what was available in the past, and the prices are higher also.  In the past I remembered getting four tacos for $10, but that deal was not advertised today, and each taco was $5.  Also, of the four kinds offered on the menu, they were out of the brisket, and were substituting ground beef.  I was surprised there was no guacamole at all on the lunch menu, and the many choices of hot sauces they used to have were nowhere in sight.  They also no longer offered glass bottles of Mexican Coke, which was disappointing, but at the same time, it also gave me a chance to try a cocktail, and I had the "El Diablo," which was very tasty, but I felt that the alcohol content was pretty weak.  I had the Carnitas taco, and it was fine, but it wasn't as good as the one I had previously.  I feel like it could've used some pickled onions, or jalapeños, or something.  After I ate my taco, I was still hungry, so I had the "Cheesy Tostada," and it was good, but nothing too exciting (It was more like a salad than an entree).  Overall my lunch was somewhere between A-O.K. & Yay, I'm a fan, so I rounded up, because the service was fast and friendly.  Would I rush back for lunch?   Hmmmm? . . . probably not, but I might come back again for dinner, as it seems they have a larger menu with a lot more choices in the evening.  Anyways, I still give them a . . . 
. . . Cheers!

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Pretty T.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: One of my Favorite places! No Pork! No Pork sold! It's the best place for those who don't eat pork and want pepperoni, ham, bacon great place! Love it! Again no pork sold here!

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Sherry M.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description:
This is the second time ordering from Joe & Pie - ordered online this time. The chicken pizza and hoagie was very tasty, I really enjoyed every bite.  

** Note to self : ask for dressing in the side. Hoagie was hot and dressing got a little drippy - but I enjoyed it !! 

The delivery person was so friendly! It arrived in no time, fresh and hot. 
I have no issues ordering online, and will do so again. 

I do have my favorite pizza place Mario's in Greentree, but for a fast quick lunch and great service I am going to order from Joe & Pie !! 

Highly recommend!!

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Lauren B.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: I ordered delivery and it came exactly when they said it would. The delivery man was friendly and it was well packaged with a generous portion. I ordered the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo. The sauce was very good but the shrimp were extremely over cooked so that they were dry and chewy. Disappointing since shrimp cost extra. I'll try chicken next time.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Anthony T.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: Pizza is very good but extremely expensive. 2 pizzas were $41.  1 medium and 1 large pizza. 2 toppings. The taste doesn't justify the price.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Christine L.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: I ordered from door dash pizza came late and was cold. I would of like to try if hot but I guess that's the gamble you take ordering from DoorDash

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Brittany P.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: This is our favorite delivery pizza in Swissvale. They're always quick and the pizza is the cheesiest pizza I've ever had! They always have great specials  and their ranch dressing is fire.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Dontae' W.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: This is definitely a great place to eat! I love their pizza and wings. I've yet to have anything else on the menu but I actually do plan on trying something new soon. It's a little pricey but it's worth it!

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Jvon P.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: I order from here maybe once every other week. I usually order the same medium pepperoni pizza (pepperoni on half) and not once have they ever forgot. Delivery time is always quick and reasonable as well. I've never had a bad pizza from here. I've never had a bad anything to be honest .Great place for pizza wings subs and salads!

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Emily O.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: I've ordered from here fairly often now and they are usually pretty good, but I just had the worst pizza I've experienced in awhile. Their white sauce is good, specialty pizzas are great. However their red sauce is too sweet and their basic pizzas are not good. Don't order the Sicilian, taste and texture resembled cardboard. Not good.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Lisa P.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: Joe and Pie Cafe is the best pizza and food delivery spot in Pittsburgh!!!  They are always prompt and friendly, their pizza sauce and dough is amazing.  They will toss the pizza thin like NY style if you ask them!!  Pasta and meatballs are very good as well and their calzones mmmm!!  I have had their salads and pretty much everything on the menu.  I am only home once a month and in the week I order once or twice from them!!!

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Chris S.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description:
Ordered the chicken bacon ranch pizza last night - very good! Delivery was on time and food was hot. The pens game had just started so I could understand if they were busy. The guy went to our neighbor's by accident but he is cool so no problem...however, we paid online ahead of time so it technically could've been stolen if delivered to someone not as nice lol. We also got fried zucchini which was the good flat, thin plank style that we like. 

This is our first time, and we only got delivery, so I can't really speak for anything else...but their menu is pretty extensive and they do breakfast/brunch (delivery!!) so I definitely want to try that. Pizza was even good reheated for the next day. 

Mineo's is still my favorite, but they don't deliver...so this so far has been the best if you don't feel like going out or leaving the house! I might not have even found these guys, but having just moved to the area...they mailed us a menu and it worked! Excited to try something else from these guys. Thanks for offering another good option in the area.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Tom J.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description:
First Time ordering from here. I pre-ordered at 1 PM for delivery at 5:30 PM. It came exactly at 5:30 PM I ordered the steak salad. It was excellent, the best I have ever had. Thanks
We ordered again on Sunday. Chicken Parmesan and spaghetti and meatballs with salad and garlic bread. Fantastic!

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Cory J.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: Absolute worst experience as a customer. Do not order online, the process is horrible. I ordered online and apparently I accidentally tapped the tap to remove button on cheese when trying to order a a half cheese half pepperoni pizza. The driver walked up to deliver the pizza and asked if i  wanted a pizza with no cheese right.  When I said no, he said well thats what's on the ticket. He then showed me a ticket that said no cheese and told me he would call his manager. Then he came back and said his manager wasn't in but the assistant said there is nothing they can do. The next minute I got a call from someone at the store just blaming me. Not offering a solution not willing to listen to me. Just told me i was wrong and not them.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Timothy H.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: Joe and Pie has some of the best pizza I have ever had. Reasonably priced and offer specials and deals frequently. They are accurate with carry out times and the food is always hot and fresh. I would recommend their garlic knots and their ranch dressing is perfect. The workers are very friendly. Once for a carry out order, they had forgotten my side of ranch so I walked back in and they gave me extra and were very apologetic. They have a very wide selection and I can't wait to try more from their menu.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Stacey B.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description:
Tried the chicken shawarma. It was decent. Don't think the young man at the counter asked me what sauce I wanted so no sauce at all. Would have been better with cucumber sauce so a little bummed. Very clean dining area. Phone was ringing pretty often with orders around 2:30pm so that's promising for them. Give it a try. I also know they deliver (including breakfast!!!) within 5 miles of Edgewood Towne Centre. 

Update: the owner contacted me directly to let me know he was going to use the feedback to train staff which is great. Also offered another shawarma on him. Very good service on his part. If I'm ever in the area, might take him up on that offer.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Kiera Y.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: Had breakfast here this morning. It was very good. I'll definitely be ordering delivery at least once a week.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Luc P.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: I order from this particular Joe & Pie quite frequently. I absolutely love how sweet the sauce is and how rich the crust is... the only issue I have is that the quality of pizza isn't always consistent. I've had amazing volcanic cheese plain pizzas, and sour minimal cheese plain pizzas too. I still am pleased at least 85% of the time.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Julia E.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: Grabbed a slice here yesterday. The place was empty but it was clean! The pizza was just okay but certainly wasn't terrible. I was desperate for a quick slice of pizza and this place met those needs.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Beth B.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description:
You know the saying about pizza...Even when it's bad its still pretty good.  This is the one pizza that defies that logic.
 It's bad. It's really, really bad. 
The only good thing is that is that it was also so unbelievably small we didn't have to eat much of it. 
Save yourself the trouble and go to Vincent's pizza park instead.

0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.author: Jill C.
0PtNw7RgF4JFcPyP-LqZ_Q.description: Just moved to the area and needed a quick dinner. I ordered the gyro pizza and it was delicious. Crust was crispy and the toppings were generous. Delivery was quick and service was great. This is definitely my new pizza place.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Abby K.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
I have walked by this dingy looking restaurant every day on my way to work and finally decided to give it a try and boy am I glad!

While this place Is far from fancy it's incredibly affordable and has a pretty straight forward menu with daily specials.

You order at the counter and then wait for your order to be called. I came during lunch so their was hug line but I surprised at how quickly orders were being called.  Service was great. The woman behind knew half the customers by name which is an awesome sign.

I love an unhealthy salad so that's exactly what I got. I ordered the steak salad which came on a bed of greens with tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, French fries-yes French fries-, cheese and a giant slab of gyro meat. It was delicious! 

If you are looking for an affordable lunch spot downtown look no further!

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Karla D.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
I have a handful of downtown places that I would say are my regular places to visit for lunch. Zorba's is on the list. They get super busy and lines out the door some days at lunch and that forces me to pick another restaurant. But there's something to be said about a line out the door, right?
That's because the food is consistent, fresh and tasty. Each and every time.
I like the salads here so much that I wish I could just eat them everyday.
The gyros are flavorful and filling as well.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Rachel S.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
Came here for the first time for lunch.  Ordered their gyro salad with lamb/gyro meat.  Came with a side of a warm pita.  Salad dressing is the Greek tzatziki sauce.  Salad was around $9.

What's hot
- Quality.  Came with a side of a warm cut up pita bread, warm gyro meat, tomatoes, sliced onions, and cucumber.  The tzatziki sauce was yummy and gave the salad a nice flavor.  I was able to wrap a few pieces of gyro meat and onions in the pita bread.  Friend ordered their Greek chicken salad, which came with freshly grilled chicken breasts and French fries (Pittsburgh salad!).  It's good that their meats are freshly made and not just sitting there.
- Takeout containers.  We ordered in, but weren't able to finish.  We asked for takeout containers and plastic bags for our food, which they obliged.  Nice that we can still get that.
- Layout.  This place is well laid out and a good space.  There are booths and small tables. 
- Location.  It's in the heart of downtown, which is convenient and walkable. 
- Price.  Most of their dishes are under $10, which is a reasonable price for the amount of food you get.
- Portions.  Decent size portions for the price you pay.


What's not
- They use iceberg lettuce.  You may like iceberg lettuce, but I like dark green lettuce better.  Different strokes for different folks.  Haha... but the salad is still good.
- Service.  This place is a family owned restaurant.  The day we went was slow, but I was told they're normally quick when the whole family works behind the counter.  My point is to be prepared when they're short staffed, because it really effects their speed.  This place looks popular with the locals, which means you need to be prepared for decent wait times during "rush hour".  
- Layout.  I don't recommend eating in if your group is more than 4 people, because there aren't tables that can accommodate a group larger than 4. It's more convenient to walk to this location rather than drive. Additionally, parking around this area sucks, so I don't recommend driving here to eat.

Final Answer
Willing to come back.  I've had better, so may not be a first choice, but it's good and dependable.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Brad H.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
Stopped in here for a gyro recently after having heard some good things.  Maybe the other food options are good here, but I was not a fan of the gyro.

They do give you a ton of gyro meat which I appreciate to an extent.  However, it overwhelmed the rest of the ingredients.  The meat had an ok flavor to it, as did the pita.  What really made this gyro bad for me was the sauce.  The tzatziki sauce can either make or break a gyro and it definitely broke it for me here.  It tasted like straight dull, without any other flavors usually in tzatziki.  The taste did not ruin the gyro, but it made me feel like I was eating something other than a gyro, if that makes sense.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Terri G.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
I was downtown and in the mood for a salad.  Where to go, where to go?  Suddenly, I remembered a place on Smithfield Street that had gi-normous "salads" that I used to eat with my co-workers when I was in my early 20s.  Could it still be there?!  The answer is Yes!  It is still there and it looks almost exactly like I remembered it.

I will say if you like any type of frills, extra friendly service, or salads with less calories than a double cheeseburger, this may not be the place for you.  But, if you like large portions, quick service & prep at a reasonable price, you may want to give Zorbas a shot!

I got the "Famous Chicken Salad" although I am not sure that it really qualifies as a salad.  I will attach a pic and let you be the judge...

It was delicious!  The chicken had a nice flavor and was tender and not overcooked.  There are other items on the menu - other salads, sandwiches, gyros, etc and there is a different lunch special every day.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Soleil M.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: Best buffalo chicken salads in the city- upgrade it with spring mix and grilled onions (thank me later)

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Keyva C.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: Great place to grab lunch downtown. Great selection of food items, my go-to is Wednesday's special the Buffalo chicken salad with the in house made ranch. You also can't go wrong with a sandwich from here as well. They have hand cut fries which is always a bonus to any establishment I feel. I would recommend either coming before 12 or after one because the 12-1 hour can be crazy, but it is totally worth it either way. They have specials just about everyday, and they are all great.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Fox E.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
I'm a little Zor right now so I'm just gonna relax on the couch and write this review.

It's been a long time since I had the Gyro (Pittsburghese: Jeye-row) here but I remember it being pretty good which is why I give it four stars. The chicken gyro on the other hand is not a real chicken gyro so that would score 2. And the last few times I've tried to come here it's been closed when it was supposed to be open and I don't appreciate that. So if that happens again it will be going down to three stars.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Chelsea M.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
What happened? :( this used to be my favorite spot before. Hadn't eaten here in over a year & stopped in for lunch today. Ordered a gyro special and while the portion size and the deliciousness of the gyro is the same, everything else isnt. 

1. Drinks used to be $1. The cooler is full of basic apple juice, orange juice & CANS of pop that are sold at gas stations for 50 cents. Zorbas now sells them for like $1.40.

2. Their ranch used to be delicious. Now it is completely watered down & lacks any flavor at all.

3. No more wings!!!! There's a sign that says "wings are off the menu to to quality & price" Wings cant be that much to buy in bulk, right? Half the restaurants in the city offer them for 50 cents one day a week. -_-

Change isn't always good. While the giant portions & courteous staff are still great, things mentioned above makes Zorbas seem like they are trying way to save a dollar.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: J D.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: We went on a Friday and there was a consistent line the entire time we were there. They ran out of fish around 1230. I didn't order it but it looked crispy. The buffalo chicken salad was large and definitely enough to fill you up. It seemed like there were a lot of regulars so I'd put this on your list to try.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Eff E.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: Went in for the first time today because I kept hearing about how good the salads were (steak & buffalo chicken) and they did not disappoint the portion size was great well worth the money paid happy customer will be back again!!

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Nek S.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: I love Zorba's!! It's my go to place to eat whenever I'm in the downtown area of Pittsburgh! They are fast pace and the food is made to order which is amazing. My absolute favorite item on their menu is their steak salad it always leaves my mouth watering for more not to mention it's so fulfilling, you will definitely be stuff. If you haven't I highly recommend you try out Zorbas you won't regret it!

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Dowdy G.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
Cheap prices, the portions are big (& should fill you up), plus there's specials!
Fries are so decent enough... one time I ate em out of the trash. True story

(But hear me out.... they were still in the container. My coworkers' eyes are bigger than his stomach, and he tossed them without even offering them to me! Like, he really barely ate any. So yeah... I pretended like I was in the bathroom shitting, waited for him to clockout, and picked those b*tches out the trash, first picked-off the little bits of lettuce & tomato leftover from his beef gyro... and hid the fries in an empty container I had in my lunchbox. I regret nothing)

EDIT:
After eating here three times (thus far), their food isn't all that great. I should have taken pictures, but I don't exactly want to "ruin" them over my bad experience. The portions are still huge and prices are nice. But they just slop together To-Go orders, and I assume you have to get to the fries quick, because every time I eat em they're soggy.

However, are terrible as the Steak hoagie looked... it was actually good! But be prepared to be disappointed in presentation

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Betsy C.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
Zorba's is a pretty decent lunch spot in Pittsburgh. I haven't been there in years and ran in today feeling like I wanted fries and ranch. I ordered the Buffalo chicken salad and although I do wish there was more Buffalo sauce on the chicken, it was pretty tasty. They have a fish special on Fridays that looks really good but it must sell out pretty quickly because they were out of it. Zorbas wasn't too busy but I know from past experience that it's crazy during the lunch rush. Some people say the service is rude but I've never found the people who work there to be rude; they're just trying to get you in and out! I think I'll come back again soon and try that fish on a Friday! 
*update* I've tried the fish sandwich and it is amazing! Definitely shareable.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: LaTrenda L.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
Great place to go downtown if you are looking for something hearty and decently portioned. I caught up with a friend during the week here. Stopped in and ordered a chicken salad. It gets pretty packed around lunch, so plan ahead. 

Ordered the food and went to sit down to wait. It took about 10 minutes to get my sandwich. It was huge. If I wasn't so greedy, I would have saved some for dinner. But I am greedy, so I ate. And ate. And ate until I cleared my plate. It was really fresh, and well seasoned. 

The inside of it reminds me of a school cafeteria. If it was up to me, I would do take out, and enjoy my lunch in another location. 

But overall, you can't beat fresh, affordable, fast food.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Elizabeth M.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: Zorba's is traditional Pittsburgh. Tons of fries on salads. Portions are huge. The people who work here are friendly. Specials are a great deal.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Jeff D.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description:
At the daily special rates price point, the quality/tastiness of food, and friendly service, I am rating Zorba's 5 out of 5.  Gyro's and fries here are delicious, however my favorite special is the buffalo chicken salad with ranch, so good.  In general they have juicy tasty chicken, I think its grilled or baked, but never disappoints.  

The restaurant is very clean and the open kitchen design is a appealing to me, because I see the cooks using gloves and demonstrating safe food handling.

I would knock a half star off for the drink selections, but there is usually something i like.  Also the line can get long during rushes and the staff works hard to take orders quickly and get the food out.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Samantha L.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: Pass on this place they're terrible! Ordered takeout- I called to let them know my order was made incorrectly and that I didn't receive what I paid for. The phone was passed around because no one really wanted to handle it. The "alleged" manager got on the phone and said that it was made properly (go figure) which to me is ultimately disrespectful by discrediting me because I wouldn't for a second waste my time calling to complain about something if I had no reason to. All in all this place doesn't treat their customers right & I wouldn't take the gamble if I were you in ordering from them. Take your money elsewhere as I plan to.

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Jayme B.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: I've been to Zorba's numerous times and I've never once been disappointed by their food. I can never decide what I want to get. The tuna melt pita and buffalo chicken salad are amazing!! Their ranch is delicious also. FYI, it's cash only. The prices are reasonable for lunch!

N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.author: Dan M.
N9n4bj5nnuvVgt8iyT5YVg.description: I've only eaten here once before. Walking through town I saw it & thought I would see what they had. I decided to go with the Steak Hoagie, & some cheese sauce on the side. I waited about 20 minutes to get it (on my lunch break), & normally I wouldn't be upset, but when other people who ordered after me started getting their numbers called before mine I started getting pissed off. Especially when the cooks kept making salads instead of my lunch. I've included this very depressing looking "Steak Hoagie". I know it's a lunch rush but this thing was sloppily put together. In addition, the use steakum like meat. I was expecting a steak hoagie like you'd get in Philly, & not these slabs of reprocessed steak. I paid $5.75 for the sandwich, $0.80 for cheese sauce that tasted worse than 7-11 cheese sauce, & $1.25 for a can of soda. The food was terrible & the cooks need to get it together.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Akshay S.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
It wont be a shocker if I was to find Indian restaurants FIRST having moved to a new place! And that's exactly what I did :)

Décor : Ive never dined here as the place in itself is rather minuscule esp for a family. The overall ambience is below average to be honest and at the forefront kinda dampens your spirits!

Service : No comments here as all of my trips to this place were take outs only (See reason above)

Food : You must be wondering, hmm why the 4 stars if Service and Ambience was questionable. Here's the reason... their food, whatever I DID try, was very very good!

We typically order Butter Chicken, Chicken 65 and Chicken Biryani. The Butter Chicken was one of the BEST versions of itself that Ive had here in US, almost competing with some great establishments in India as well. The creaminess of the curry, the tartness of the char on the chicken and the moistness of the chicken itself, was simply romance for the taste buds!! The Chicken 65 was perfectly seasoned, not too Spicy, and again cooked just right. The Chicken Biryani had its rice almost harkening back to older times where they imbued the rice with these all spices that made the fragrance elements go off the rails! 

We also tried their Goat, which in itself was Good, but no match for their Chicken dishes. I highly recommend trying those dishes from this place!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Lauren R.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
I personally have not eaten here but the food smelled wonderful when I first arrived to pick up an order. Although the restaurant doesn't look too bad, I went to use the restroom and noticed something pretty gross. Near the restrooms, there is a patch of ceiling that has fallen apart. It appears that there may be some type of mold or mildew. 

This is not directly near the food, but I don't feel that it is safe in a restaurant considering mold spores can drift through the air. 

There was also a lot of dirt and some bugs in the restroom. As well as a lot of bug catchers near the back of the restaurant - next to the dirty dishes in the hall... 

I'm afraid this place needs a very deep clean as well as some ceiling repairs...

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Tina B.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
I've ordered takeout on numerous occasions and have been holding off on reviewing until I've experienced dining in the restaurant. I recently dined-in and I must say, Cafe Delhi is absolutely the best Indian restaurant I've tried in the South Hills, and maybe even all of Pittsburgh!! The food is consistently amazing. I can honestly say I crave Cafe Delhi immediately after I finish eating it. After trying quite a few items on the menu, you can't really go wrong with anything. My favorite, though, is the butter chicken. Pair that with garlic naan and it's heaven. My husband's favorite is the paneer tikka masala. 

Cafe Delhi is a fast casual setting, which I like. Order at the counter and they'll bring it out to you. It's usually quite busy here, but the service is always relatively fast. I love the food here and as you can guess, I'm craving it now!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Danny N.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: I was impressed with Cafe Delhi.  It stopped by on a Thursday for lunch.  The restaurant was busy, but not packed.  You order up front and get a number.  I asked for suggestions and ended with the lamb chettinad.  It was a perfect portion, large, but not too large.  The naan was great.  The spice, which I ordered a 5/10, was on the mark.  The lamb and the gravy or whatever the sauce is called was very tasty.  I'll definitely return.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Maria J.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Great place to grab Indian food in Carnegie. Location a little hard to find but just off of the Main Street in Carnegie. Friendly and fast service. Take out or dine in setting. Order taken and paid for at the counter, orders are then brought out to you. 
I had the Aloo Gobi Masala, Somosa Chaat and Naan, all of which was perfect and I would order again. Dishes seam to come with rice or Naan but you can order a side of extra Naan. 
It does look a little divey inside. When I was here when it was cold and as other reviewers said, there are space heaters around the perimeter which was interesting, but the temperature was fine in the dining area so it didn't bother me. Prices reasonable. Can't wait to come back for more especially for take out!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Wendy C.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Best biryani that I've had around Pittsburgh! We came here for lunch during a weekday. It was a bit hard to find the parking lot since it's not paved but it's right behind the store. Once you go in, you stand in line, order, pay and get a number for your order. There is some outside seating which was enjoyable since the weather was nice.

I got the lamb biryani, sweet and sour mushrooms and mango smoothie! Everything was amazing and reasonably priced. The biryani was full of flavor and was amazing! You must try this place if you like Indian cuisine!!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Megan M.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: When Apis meadery opened next door, the owner suggested we try cafe Delhi. It turned out to be great advice. We live about ten minutes away and one of our favorite things to do is order cafe Delhi and sit outside sipping a flight of mead while we wait for our food. Everything we have ordered has been great! And it's closer than Mintt! Tonight, we ordered goat biryani, chicken kurma, samosa chaat, naan, and some nine vegetable dish in sauce. Everything was buttery and delicious, as always. If you're looking for delicious Indian food, this is the place.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Linda R.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: Looooove love love. So happy that I discovered this place and blessed that it's so close to my house.  Everything I've ordered has tasted amazing and is super authentic. The staff are friendly, but even if they weren't, I'd still go as often as I do because their food just keeps me coming back! I highly recommend if you're looking for delicious Indian food!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Aditi G.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: Just OK. I'm Indian myself and was really looking forward to eating here but the flavors tasted a bit off to me. I ordered multiple chaats, idli and dosa and it was lacking something. Really nice people who work here though. Don't think I'll be back. They also forgot one of my items in a to go order I had so wasn't too happy about that.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Alyona Z.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
I came here with my coworker on a Sunday for dinner and we ordered some delicious food. 
The service was quick and the staff was friendly. 
I ordered the lamb spiced level 2 which was plenty for me, and my coworker ordered goat curry level 6, and it was hotter than hell for her lol. 
She was sweating with the heat but she loved it. What a sight to see, I must say! The garlic naan is spectacular and is highly recommend trying it with your food. I also ordered chicken tikki masala to go level 2 and it was so good! I will definitely return again!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Dan B.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: So good. I ordered the samosas and the chicken tikka masala. The place gets busy so plan accordingly.  I think this might be my favorite Indian food in the city.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Kara B.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Very authentic Indian place right in Carnegie. You order at the counter, and someone will deliver your food to you table. The place was packed, so I figured it must be good! 
I really don't eat Indian food, so I asked the girl at the counter what's good and she told me she doesn't eat there so she didn't know lol. I thought that was a strange response! 
We ordered the Mirchi as an appetizer and it was so delicious!!! My fiend ordered some kind of potato pancake with vegetables in it and she loved it.
