I had a bite and wished I would have ordered that too! I got the lamb wrap and wasn't a fan. The lamb was red. Not red as in bloody and rare, just red. It freaked me out a little bit. I've never seen bright red lamb before. 
I should also note that Cafe Delhi is BYOB and they don't charge a corking fee! 
If you like Indian food, you should check this place out.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Amy M.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Best Indian food in the city, IMHO. I've yet to find better naan or better butter chicken in the burgh. 
As a side note, there's a lot of cream in Cafe Delhi's butter chicken, so that may not be your thing but it's definitely MY thing. It's so good, you guys. I crave it on the regular. I want some right now. 

They also do a really great biryani and their dopiaza is fantastic. 

I'm a fan!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Jenny H.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
One of my favorite Indian places in the Burgh! It's a hidden gem in Carnegie that's worth stopping by.

The restaurant itself can get busy during expected hours of service (lunch and dinner) so if you want it fast, order ahead and carry out. They do have a period of time that they are closed during the day, I believe from about 4:30-5:30pm, so that is something to be mindful of when planning a visit. 

My favorite dish is the Malai Kofta with rice AND naan. You can't go wrong with their naan. It's so soft and buttery and everything I need. This dish is a nice balance of savory and sweet and is exceptionally filling. The Palak Paneer and Paneer Tikka Masala are also exceptional plates as well. As a vegetarian, I enjoy the robust options to select from. As others have noted, if you don't enjoy super spicy foods, stick with a 3 or 4 level. I've never braved anything more than this just because I am a creature of habit and stick with what I know.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Ana A.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: I've been here several times, and the food is always great. The menu gives you authentic options, and more common dishes too. It's a small place, so sometimes it can get a little busy, but it's worth it. There's also a nice little outdoor seating area that's perfect for nice weather. It can be a little bit hard to spot your first time, but it's right off of the main road in Carnegie!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Varun S.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Nice spot. I think this one has better north indian food than any other place in pittburg.
Enjoyed my dinner here. Probably will go next week again:) try chole bhature here also try some deserts.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Diane B.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
I came here for the first time this evening. You order at the counter and they bring your food out to you. I picked up a mango lassi at the counter. 

I ordered the samosa chat as an appetizer. It's a brken up samosa in a bowl with chickpeas and all kinds of good stuff on it. 

Next came my entree - the palak paneer. This is a homemade soft cheese in a liquid green spinach sauce. Delicious!!!

The service was excellent and the room was cool. Very pleasant. 

It's so nice to have good Indian food so close by

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Pri P.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Pleasantly surprised by this place! One of my friend suggested me to visit this restaurant and I did! Omg, food if finger licking good. I got to go and do not dine in but the person at the register was extremely sweet, asked me where I was coming for and to enjoy my food. 
I had garlic naan, chicken tikka and rice - everything excellent!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Rebecca M.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: Wow. This place by far exceeded my expectations! the parking was super convenient. Had a small wait because the place was not only packed Inside, but also with to go orders as well. Cafe style, order at counter. The food runners, cashier, and waitress were all very attentive and kind. My food was AMAZING! Hot and fresh, just the right amount of spice! I can't wait to come back here! Loved it.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Sonia A.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: This place was excellent. The food had so much flavor and is truly authentic Indian food. The service is great. I will definitely be ordering from here again!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Em K.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: Deliciousssssss Indian food! We've ordered a few times from here and we love it. The chicken korma is phenomenal. We've also had the chicken tikka masala and it is super flavorful and delicious. If you like Indian food, you'll like this place!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Andrew P.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
This one is tough: the food was really good, but everything else was really rough. You order at the counter and they bring it to the table of your choice. But there was no one at the counter for about 5 minutes as 4 of us patrons waited to place orders. Eventually an attendant came by, but apparently the patrons that call in their orders are given preference to those at the counter. If I hadn't been craving Indian food as badly as I was, I would have walked out.
The cafe was very loud with children screaming and running around. The floors were slick and greasy.
But in the end, the food was delicious.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Preetha G.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
This cafe is pretty easy to find, with ample parking. However, given its popularity during the peak hours the parking lot is pretty full and the place is buzzing. You would want to plan and come a little early if you would like to be seated immediately.
We discovered this treasure of a place very recently and have been a regular since! 
The ambiance is that of a cafe as the name suggests, it isn't as big as a restaurant. They operate like a cafe, you have to place your order at the counter and seat yourself, pretty much self-service. 
The staff is pretty friendly. 
The food however is the highlight, as should be! They have the most authentic Indian food of all the Indian restaurants we have tried in Pittsburgh. They have a variety of snack options too which is another thing that sets them apart from the other Indian restaurants in the area. 
It will take a few visits to gauge your comfort with the spice level of the food here though. We are a couple that has a pretty decent spice tolerance, however an 8/10 was too Spicy for us, a 5 or 6 is what I would suggest if you are into spicy food and way lesser if you aren't. 
We are now a regular and will be unless we find something better which we doubt!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: CC R.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: I ordered their Butter Chicken (spice 2) and garlic nann I am new to this type of food - and a light-weight on spice BUT this dish is yummy.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Eric T.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: Exceeded my expectations. Really great quality food! Highly recommend the corn chowder and chili chicken.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Katie R.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: Small establishment. Food is great. However, not your typical restaurant set-up. You order at the front desk and pay up front and then they serve you when it's ready. You can sit anywhere, seat yourself atmosphere. We had the mixed grill with rice. We also ordered some chicken noodles and garlic naan.  We will be back!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Hemant K.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: I headed to this place after going through a bunch of Indian restaurants I was yet to try. They are located away from the crowd and have a really comfy and cozy interior. Their food is pretty good and the prices are reasonable too. A must try if you are in that area.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Laura W.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: Best Indian food in the city. Best Indian food I've ever had. Malai kofta and bhindi masala are my favorites. The people working here are so nice!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Divya P.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
With over 50 items on an extensive menu ranging from noodles, wraps, dosas, pav bhaji, soup, parathas, Naan, biriyani and several types of curries, Café Delhi is trying to be a typical Indian fast food bistro. Sadly, I can't say it succeeds. What these types of joints back in India get right, is consistency. Also, the cook making dosas would focus just on that and the cook handling the Indo-Chinese preparations wouldn't also be in charge of biriyani. That's how they turn around high quality despite the breadth of menu offerings. Without that kind do staffing, it's unsurprising that Café Delhi doesn't get much right. Not even their masala chai. My spring dosa was missing the 'assortment of veggies', per their menu and was instead just overstuffed with a ton of potato. The paneer is chewy and the chilly paneer arrived sitting in a pool of oil. The naan is just about as good as frozen store bought naan. (Choolaah in Shadyside for me is the gold standard of paneer and naan.) The gobi manchurian is the only item remotely well prepared. Servers are way too busy to make recommendations or even eye contact for that matter. The dishes are simply plonked on the table randomly wherever they find empty space and one's left to figure out which one is whose. I wasn't too happy with cleanliness levels either. 
I've given this place a few tries and I get that Café Delhi satisfies a certain type of patron. If I needed my Indian-food-fix on a regular, almost daily basis, needed variety and if I didn't know how to cook, then maybe I'd've lowered my standards. But none of that applies to me and hence the rating. I wouldn't go to or recommend Café Delhi unless someone in the group really NEEDS  chaat or a dosa that night.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: sherpes s.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
The place is very clean.  Staff is attentive.  Decor and setup is modern.  The menu is clearly presented on an electronic screen, and on plastified paper menus.

The quality of the food is good, and executed with care and attention.  My only minus is that it is a bit on the expensive side.  For $8.99 + tax, all I got was two dosas of the side of pancakes.

Food portion was too small. Not going back.  Looking for other outlets of quality indian food.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Jedda P.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Had my doubts about this place because it looks like a slightly sketchy neighborhood but boy, was I wrong! Got here around lunch time on a Saturday (~noon) and it was very slow... Not sure if this place is usually slow or if it's bc it's a holiday weekend. 

Customer service up to par, which is very important to me. The person who took my order was very pleasant. He told me to order my entree with naan, and hooked me up with a bowl of rice. 

Ordered: 
-Chicken tikka masala: it came in a smaller bowl than I anticipated but it was actually just the right amount with my sides of naan and rice. I felt like there was a lot more sauce than chicken... And probably could've been better with more... But no complaints. 
-Mango Lissa: came in a tiny cup. Was hoping it'd be made to order / fresh but he pulled it out pre made from the display. It was still good but wish it was colder. 
-Tandoori chicken: got 4 pieces of chicken and should be more than enough for 1 person. It was flavorful and overall, no complaints. 

They have spice levels 1-10 (mild to hot). The 8 had a kick but I didn't think it was as spicy as an 8 should be. It was actually pretty close to the level 5 spice. 

They have indoor and outdoor seating. Outdoor seating can be under a roof, or completely out in the open.

ourfoodieventures.com

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Rachel M.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: Great!  Tasted very fresh and full of flavor.  Love all of the options.  Super fast service.  Very nice and helpful staff.  Will definitely be a regular here!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Keri N.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Often times I find myself here before they open, waiting in my car to be the first person to order. The staff has always been kind and generous; a few times when I place a take out order, they offer a complimentary pop or chai tea...what a nice touch!

There are so many good things to try, I don't know where to start. I once found myself ordering 6 items for just my husband and myself...oops!! The samosa is always a good choice. Their pakoras are even better. I like to have the bhel puri as an afternoon snack. The masala dosa is a family favorite too. Their Pav Bhaji is second only to my mother-in-laws. Okay, one more...the Chana bhatura is always fun, but definitely order it if you're dining in. Now you know all of the dishes I order all the time, try them for yourself!

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Abhishek P.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
4 stars overall.

In my opinion, the best indian food in town (second best if you include Chez Moi or Chez anybody who's indian mom cooks up a storm).

Anyhow, when I move to a new town, my staples are where is the nearest Taco Bell (oh look...what's that falling straight to hell...well the validity of all my reviews of course - it's a Indian thing, you won't get it), where is the nearest Zara (fail), where is the nearest coffee shop, and what's the best indian restaurant in town.

Well, I tried them all in Pittsburgh except for this one given it's location out in the boondocks of Carnegie. A colleague recommended it and he said it's the closest thing to "restaurant style" indian food you're going to get that is reminiscent of India and back east(er) in Queens, NY.

So I went.

I ate.

I was conquered.

If it is anything I know, it's Indian food.

This is great food. My go to's are the Chicken Malai Kabab (very well cooked, juicy pieces of tender chicken breast marinated in yogurt, cheese, cilantro, ginger among other spices), the spinach chicken and the Chicken Pepper Fry.

One of the reasons why Indian Food in general can be unhealthy is the extraordinary amount of oil or cream. I love their butter chicken and tikka masala but their butter chicken is loaded with cream (I can see the fat separate sometimes) as well as the Spinach chicken (but not much because spinach can be creamed by cooking it well). The tikka masala is great but it seems like they forgot  a key ingredient in theirs which would be black cardamoms and Javentri (Mace) which gives it that flavor. The butter chicken is on point, and the spinach chicken is too die for. Perfectly cooked pieces of dark meat in a spinach curry laced with cloves. It's like eating crack.

I love that it comes with naan or rice so I usually get one of each. The naan is your typical naan, nothing extraordinary.

My review for this place is overall quality and taste of food which I think they nailed.

My only thing is, for take out, I think they can give a little bit more meat in their dishes...JUST saying, sometimes there is way more gravy than protein and well, that is no Bueno considering other restaurants really don't do this.

Saved by the bell in that their food surpasses others in the area so Kudos.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Rahul T.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
Very disappointed with the paneer roll . It could definitely use more spice and chutneys . It would be much better if they used paneer tikka instead of the barely flavorful paneer . 
Rest of the food including the chicken biryani , chicken lollipop and idli were good

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Jenn P.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
I've wanted to try this little spot for a very long time and finally made it. We arrived as they were reopening for dinner, at 430p. It was uncomfortably cold in the restaurant, so we sat near the space heaters they had around some of the tables.

So you sit and look at the menu, then you have to order at the counter and your food is delivered. No a problem, except you have to pay and leave tip on your card before you eat, which would also be fine if the food and service are good. 

At the counter, there are 4 bowls of various after-dinner fennel seeds, with plastic spoons for scooping.  While we were waiting for our food, I observed an employee standing at the counter sticking her naked, uncleaned hand in, grabbing fennel seeds, eating them, then repeating...multiple times. I did not try them upon leaving...

The samosa was average, consisting of just seasoned potato, and you receive 2 in an order. I find it odd that they use plastic takeout containers for the mint and tamarind chutneys, and only give you about a Tablespoon of each for 2 larger samosa. 

The gobi manchuruan was quite tasty, but for $6, I expected more than a small side plate.

The butter chicken was terrible. It was $10.99 can consisted of a small bowl filled with an insanely thick, pasty tomato sauce with a few very small chunks of chicken. It was like eating undiluted condensed tomato basil soup. I asked about it and was told it's glue-like cause of the cashews. They took it back and brought it back out with a liquid sauce. 

There also appears to be a lot of unnecessary plastic and styrofoam use/waste.

I was just totally disappointed in this highly overpriced place and I will not return. I'm also thoroughly baffled by the 4 star rating they have. I am guessing the banquets have a higher quality food, as seen in the staged photos.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Sneha N.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
I was here for dinner with my friends. We placed order for papadi chat, chicken drumsticks, dahi puri( not sure if the name is completey correct, it is panipuri with dahi in it) and salt lassi. 

Both papdi chat and panipuri are good. My friends enjoyed it. However, I was disappointed both with the lassi and chicken drumsticks taste. Lassi had too much of masala flavor. I wish I had gone for mango lassi instead. Chicken drumsticks which is my favorite item on the menu was a disappointment for the first time. It was over fried, oily (I could see oil dripping off the piece) and bland.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: J D.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: I decided to come back and give the place a try. Food was much tastier this time. We ordered a vegetarian dish as well as chicken vindaloo. They had space heaters in the restaurant to keep the place toasty in the winter.

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Brittany G.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description: The food definitely tastes authentic. The restaurant is always a very clean and comfortable environment. I love to check out the deli case and see what is available as they always have many desserts. The dishes and water glasses are always Crystal Clean. Great portions at reasonable prices. I have been in their Ballroom one time. It was also a very nice place. So grateful that we have something like this in Carnegie, love the culture ! keep up the good work Cafe Deli

rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.author: Pinak L.
rqLksDzegxNXMWwZk3eZnQ.description:
1) Order ahead on the phone or on Yelp/Eat24 if you want to do a pick up. The place gets busy in the evenings and not the most coordinated service you'll find. 

2) The food is like any other average Indian restaurant you'll find in town. Nothing special but nothing to bash it for either. 

3) It can be a hit or miss with the level of spice. 

Note to the new comers to Indian Food - If you cannot tolerate that burning heat in your Indian food, stress that when ordering food. Remember, "spicy" is not always indicative of the "heat" in your food. Many people make this mistake, as these terms are used interchangeably, confusing things further. Remember, the heat in Indian food is mainly due to addition of fresh green chili, red chili powder or flakes, ground black pepper, and sometimes ginger. Asking the chef to skip only the first two items won't make the food less delicious. Your food will instead be mild, still tasty, and won't burn your insides or give you acidity/heartburn if you are prone to it. 

4) Samosa chat (a bit on the hot side), dosas, butter chicken, breads, and "biryani" rice are my favorites from this place. EDIT: Butter chicken is EXCELLENT. 

5) The place is kind of expensive for the amount of food you get.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Bob L.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
Excellent gastropub tucked away behind Trader Joe's in East Liberty.

Kudos to Justin Severino for the eatery operation in this space! Delicious, creative informal menu with of course some great meats including 3 types of wings. 

Always loved the beers from East End Brewery too. Must try it all! Doing a Sunday brunch 12-5 now.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Lisa K.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
I'm updating my thoughts on the basis of a return trip and the selection of different items from the menu. 

We returned to Larder over thanksgiving weekend, having grown sick of turkey. We chose our beers first and then reviewed the menu. These transactions take place at two different counters. I ordered the Butter Bean Bread and the roasted cauliflower. Both were excellent, and either could have served as a full meal for me, though admittedly I am a light eater, especially with a filling beer. My husband ordered the smoked meatball hoagie and was similarly pleased. Re beer - well East End has a great selection, and helpful staff. Definitely glad we chose to return, and Larder will join our list of regular places for a casual meal. 

(Initial review)  
Maybe this is unfair because they just opened. We like East End and were excited to try Larder, both because it makes the brewery more of a destination than a stop, and also because Justin Severino is a great chef. I expect some hiccups in the first few days. My husband ordered a Gem Salad and loved it, but at $10 seemed a little pricey for the size and contents of the bowl. I ordered the mussels steamed in Monkey Boy (which I was also drinking) and was disappointed. The dish comes with fries, but the fries were floating along in the bowl of mussels. In other words, soggy. This can be easily fixed by sending the fries in a separate bowl. Or maybe scrap this dish in favor of something more easily assembled. After all, the fries didn't appear to be frites soaked in duck fa offered by Point Brugge, etc (but who can tell when they are part of a "soup"?). I expect better execution from Larder in the future, and I'm sure that an update of this review will reflect that. 

The space is nice - definitely and upgrade, and buzzing with people. Worth trying again.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Rachel W.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
I am so glad I finally made it here. Being a big fan of Cure, I was disappointed it closed but so excited that the chef/owners opened up a new place. This is such a great place to kick back and relax. Two separate counters to order your food from and then your beers. We tried the mussels, the pulled pork and of course, the chocolate cake. Everything was so flavor-packed but balanced so well. 

This isn't your bar food type experience. But rather some of the best quality food that happens to be with a bar and really classed up an already great brewery. 

I think this is the perfect addition to East End because their beers are fantastic and the food paired so well. 

Excited to come back!

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Pete J.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description: My first time at a Severino joint. Tried to hit Cure before it closed and missed it. So this is great, combine beer and food and all is good. The concept inside is interesting, one counter for food and one for beer. I was the first one in the restaurant today. I ordered the pulled pork with collard greens and pimento cheese sandwich. Sandwich was a decent size, tasty and the fries were decent. The fries could have been a little less greasy. I think the place is more like a 4.25 but Yelp won't let you rate that. The menu is a bit limited but everything looked and smelled good. I would most definitely go back.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Megan M.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
Despite morcilla and cure being two of my favorite restaurants, for some reason I was expecting ordinary pub fare from Larder. We were there for lunch on a Sunday afternoon (cause we needed the last of the pickle beer) and found a transformed taproom and outside area had been added to East End. The place has a fresh, cool, vibe and the menu is accommodating towards meat eaters, vegetarians, and even children.  
We ordered the cucumber-watermelon salad, falafel, and brisket sandwich. All three items were perfectly seasoned and delicious. The watermelon salad came with olives and feta and was refreshing and summery. The falafel came in a great mayo-y based sauce with fresh dill flavors and pickled radishes. The brisket was juicy and melty and I loved the cheese that was on it, ( like a crystally cheddar). I think it could have used a pickled something, but maybe they didn't want to detract from the meat flavor. The beans on the side were AMAAAAZZINNN. Overall, it exceeded my expectations and I can't wait to try next season's menu.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Simone H.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
After returning to Pittsburgh after 3 years, I've watched the East Ending Brewing Tap Room grow up. First, it was a brewery watering hole; then they added beer garden; then renovated to become a brewpub with its latest Food installment of Larder. 

I was super excited for the brewpub, after moving into the Larimer neighborhood. But Larder was just an all round disappointment. There was a lot of sighing on my end, so it ends up with a two-star review, despite the East End part of this establishment being a 3.5 to 4 star. 

Space: Remodeled and awesome. It has truly grown up. There are tables and booths that are welcoming and comfortable. I do miss the old-school chalkboards that were replaced by the electronic tablet-style board to the right side of the bar -- but so is the future; they added the beer garden a little bit ago and it's truly nice to sit out and enjoy this hot sweltering Pittsburgh heat.

Sips: East End continues to represent its hard-earned reputation and produces quality beers -- right on. However, I do feel that prices have increased a dollar or two since 2016 with my last visit there, a strange phenomenon as it outpaces the increase in income in this city.

Snacks: Now here is where I start to get critical. It's a Severino - it's supposed to be good (I would be a disaster if It couldnt produce great food with all the credit Severino has garnered in the past few years). It is in line with his other early establishments mostly reminding me of Tako, just for 'American' street food. So everybody please sit down. I was by myself and ordered two items. The chorizo hotdog with the queso fresca, and Joe's potatoes with the blue cheese and horseradish honey. 

First the hotdog - yes it tasted good - obviously - when you get a piece of spicy meat that is practically fat and salt on a bun of carbs, OF COURSE your mouth gets Umami feelings. However, no Hotdog should cost $14; I don't care if it's loaded with truffle oil or edible gold (in which case I'd yell at you for using truffle oil and edible gold inappropriately) - a Hot Dog SHOULD stay a street food. Simple, happy, good memory-invoking American Street food -- at $14, Its simply just not worth it. 

Joe's potatoes: I want to spit. First: it's four fat potato wedges for $8 - just let that sink in right there. A potato wedge costs $2. It's an item that is ordered in the kitchen for $0.30 a potato. Second: It is roasted with the skin (seasoned) - fine; however, when you cut into the potato, it literally falls apart exposing a very unseasoned potato. The potato itself tastes like one took a raw potato and shoved it in the microwave without dressing it up. Oh - and get this - I picked up the potato bits that stayed on my fork - they GLITTERED -- like wtf? Why is my potato glittery? Is this a twilight potato? Is that why it has no flavor? Next, the horseradish honey -- no horseradish. I kept waiting for the wasabi feeling to hit and be smoothed over with sweetness, but no. None of that. And the blue cheese? Just no. All in all this entire dish was bland beyond compare. 

Service: ah the service. I feel like they knew this review was coming. 

East end side. To the woman who glided into the bar to get my order - awesome. Thank you for your service. 

Larder side - Okay, lets preface that I got to Larder at 4:23 pm (23 minutes after opening time) - they were ready to rock n roll and serve. 

The menus were just being put out (but the little menu stands on the booth tables are too big and couldn't hold the drink special notification), and people were super excited. The Larder employees were crawling around like ants there were so many of them :) (this is not a bad thing - they were very much anticipating a crowd). What I object to is that NOBODY checked on me after they set down my food. But, it didn't stop them from staring me down from behind the bar because I gawked at my glittery potatoes and then pushed them away and didn't touch them. I waited; just waited to see what they would do. Three times the manager on duty went around and gently glided past my table. I had a busboy pick up the empty hotdog carton, wordlessly, but that was it. ... maybe they anticipated a rant? Dunno. When I grabbed my purse and left (as all is prepaid of course at the counter as they make you tip before you see how service is instead of an evaluative event, which it should be; Honestly, counter work such as for food trucks and food stands and carts and pop-ups should just have a no tipping policy because there is no aspect of actual tippable service here; they are just food runners/ food handlers if at a truck, but I digress). I found all the managers socializing and getting their pat on the backs on the ramp of the beer garden - I guess that's where they disappeared to. 

Anyways, I will POSSIBLY set foot here again in 3 months after they get their heads screwed on correctly. But until then - nope.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Brant H.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
Dined at Larder on their opening night (Friday, July 5) and was impressed how smooth everything went, with none of the hiccups we expected.  There was a tiny bit of confusion when trying to order at the Larder counter, but that was only because they had so many folks staffing the counter.  Despite a sizable crowd, both ordering and service were very quick.  All the staff were super-friendly and attentive.

Along with solid beers from East End (particularly enjoyed the Allentown, an Imperial Shandy that the server aptly described as Arnold Palmer-esque), we initially ordered the smoked wings with harissa and za'atar, as well as the smoked salmon dip. The six wings were on the small side, but perfectly cooked (crispy and succulent) and the sauce was delicious with just a touch of heat.  The salmon dip was generously portioned, with a nice stack of buttered toast (for once, enough bread!) and some tangy pickled onions and cornichons alongside.  We then ordered the beefsteak tomatoes. The tomatoes themselves were just okay--ripe but less flavorful than I'd hope--but the accompaniments made all the difference:  a sweet tangy chow chow, crunchy sunflower seeds, and smooth, rich avocado spread.  

We didn't try any of the entrees, but looking forward to coming back to try the brisket!

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Liz D.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
I went here with my boyfriend the other day to see how it was. The food was pretty good, we ordered the falafel, Gem Salad, and the strawberry cobbler. The falafel was delicious and we really enjoyed the pickled radishes that came with it. The salad was also very good, but for $10 I expected it to be a little bigger. 

For accessibility, parking is tough. It's only street parking and cars tend to park up on the sidewalk too. Because there wasn't enough room for my wheelchair on the sidewalk I had to push down the middle of the road. The ramp to the entrance is good, but seating isn't the best. Outdoor tables are on gravel, and inside there are a lot of booths and the only tables available are large 6 person ones. The tables also have large round bases. It was pretty empty when I was there so we got a big table for the two of us no problem. I could see it being an issue when it's busy.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Splash L.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
My wife and I went today, the food and service were fantastic!!! Monkey Mussels were fresh & clean, falafel was absolutely delicious, and smoked buffalo wings were juicy flavorful and just spicy enough.
May I be bold enough to suggest a pickled vegetable dish as an appetizer because the radishes with the falafel were really good!!! Maybe carrots, cauliflower, cucumbers, and peppers? Just a thought... 

As far a service, we were greeted promptly and kindly. Service was quick, and all food was piping hot and superb! Staff came over to check on us a few times and clear our plates & pints.

We can not wait to come back and try a few new selections from Chef Justin & his staff!

Thank you EEB & and Larder staff for making our day, we enjoyed it very much.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Daniel P.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description: A bit disappointed. We came here and had some beers to start at East End which isn't my favorite brewery but had a few options which really surprised me. The imperial IPA was standout and the kolsch is quite nice too. Back to the food. Given this is Severino we had really high expectations and we're kind of hoping to see some reflection of Cure there. And there was, in a sense. We got the tomato starters which were superb. Then, we split wings (got the harissa rub) and brisket sandwich. The wings were good, but not $8 for six TINY wings good. Frankly I was surprised they source the wings they do. While the harissa resembled the shared chicken dish cure had, I missed out on the smoke flavor and the apricot flavor was MIA. You could have fooled me that the yogurt dip had cumin in it. Maybe the zaatar was too bold, idk. Again, they were good, but nothing id go back for. The brisket sandwich was down right bad. Served on a barely toasted rye, with one slice of brisket. It was $16. So... Yeah. Disappointed to say the least, but I suppose if it in the east end, need something easy and don't want to go to the 4 or 5 breweries in Pittsburgh with better food, this will do...meh. I'm so mad I had to write this.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: DJ J.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description: We were at East End Brewing enjoying the great beer and ordered a couple of items to munch on.  So glad that Larder is here.  We had the smoked wings with Harissa and the smoked pickled beet salad with goat cheese.  The wings were very good with a nice flavor and juicy - came with a cumin yogurt dipping sauce.  The beet salad was great.  Nice pieces of beets with a sweet maple-dijon dressing, some sesame seeds and some goat cheese.  One person who doesn't like beets said we should get more.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Stephanie S.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
The atmosphere is great - plenty of outside moveable tables, dog friendly, cornhole available, plenty of waiters coming around offering to get refills.
The food is not what I expected. It's not bar food. It's much higher end. The pulled pork BBQ platter was delicious. I'm kind of a picky eater, only ate the pork and cornbread, but far better than any I've had anywhere. But the prices are really high. The platter was $20.
Son got the brisket sandwich, which he loved.
We got the blueberry cobbler for dessert, which was really delicious, but also a really small portion for $8.
There weren't any appetizers we were interested in. Drinking good beer, sitting outside, would be awesome to have little something to snack on.
I'd go back for sure.
Atmosphere at East End is positive, pure, full of a super nice people.
(parking...drive together with a crowd for sure)

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Sirsha C.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description: There is nothing that this place does badly. Nothing. I don't need to go on and on. Get everything. Get twice of it. And then get the bread pudding.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Dylan S.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description: The second I got in, I passed someone with a brisket sandwich. Looked so tasty I knew I had to get one. I got a sammie & fries while my partner opted for the butternut squash soup. The brisket was really tender & well-marinated, with the rest of the sandwich a good balance of sauce & bread. Drippy, crunchy, and hit the spot. Butternut squash soup was perfect for a chilly day & good to dip fries into. As always, well-made beers & super friendly people. Would definitely go back to try other Severino dishes.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: Jay F.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description:
It's as good as everyone says, and then some.

I had the North Carolina BBQ sandwich with collard greens and bread & butter pickles, and I don't think I've ever had a better one. The pork was tender and succulent and the complements were, well, the perfect complements. 

But what must be mentioned is the utter deliciousness and textural perfection of the roll on which the sandwich was served. So often, BBQ or pulled pork sandwiches are served on the most ordinary rolls or bread, but not here at Larder. Really Good Rolls.

And while the beefsteak tomato dish was a perfect side to accompany the BBQ pork, my friend had just the tomatoes with a side of fries, and he also could not stop raving about the fries.

Everything was perfect. I can't wait to go back, both for something seasonal like the tomatoes, and to see what they'll do in fall and winter.

4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.author: allison m.
4FyNb9zmHWf57oy24l3Lzg.description: Larder does not disappoint.  We tried a good portion of the menu and we enjoyed everything.  I can definitely recommend the wings, bbq platter, and the falafel.  Sounds like there are more tasty things to come and we are excited to head back and try more.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Grace K.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
I went here today with a friend for lunch, we both had beans and greens at my friend's suggestion.

They we're excellent!  I will return and urge you to do the same.  This place is a sleeper.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Savannah R.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description: I was drawn to this place because every time I drive by, I notice the outdoor patio area. It looked so cute with all the lights and it's perfect for rainy days because there's a roof! The outdoor bar is amazing. The bartender and head chef is so friendly. He even served us our food himself. The menu isn't huge but the prices make it worth it. They don't have a parking lot but there are usually tons of spot on the nearby streets to park. No matter what day or time you go, you can be seated immediately and your food/drinks come out super quick. Definitely go in the summer to take advantage of the outdoor patio! Reason for 3 stars? Although I loved the outdoor area, the inside didn't really seem like it had been kept up to date. You can also smoke there so I wasn't a huge fan of that. The food isn't the best quality but it's good. Not a place I would recommend for a nice night out but great if you're stopping by for a drink.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Derek R.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
The had a full page in the entertainment book and the Enjoy fundraiser book.
  They have a policy of NOT accepting these coupons.
Service was only fair. Food was ok, not outstanding by any means.
Bathrooms are down a steep set of stairs that are in disrepair.
Men's room was filthy, loose toilet, broken door.
Doors to the outside were open to allow the fresh air in, unfortunately cigarette smoke from outside the door was blowing back into our dining area.

Menu is quite limited, marinara sauce was tasty, salad had lots of nice greens.
   Many other choices to eat  with a better menu, cleaner bathrooms and are honest enough to accept coupons.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Judy E.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
We made reservations for dinner before the theater. They were aware of that and we allowed an hour and a half for dinner. It took over an hour for our food to arrive which included three salads and a fried fish sandwich. We had to track the waitress down to find out where our food was, when she finally brought it out it was cold.
When we told another server about it, her answer was well we're very busy. People at tables around us left because their food was taking too long to eat and get to the theater. We passed another couple sitting in a pizza restaurant and two other tables took their food to go.
The only reason we went was because they were near the theater. I would recommend that people not go

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Rebecca S.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description: I love this restaurant! I always enjoy  my meals. The chef, Matt always exceeds our expectations and makes our evening special.  I can't wait to go again. I highly recommend it.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Regina P.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
I loved it here we came today on a Sunday and at 3 jazz music on the deck.   As if that wasn't a plus the food was excellent.   We ordered a lot we got the beans and greens and stuffed hot peppers, salad pasta and the pizza looks amazing.   The service was the best.  Great music and awesome food you really need to try out the place!!!!

Jam session on jazz every sunday

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: GM O.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description: Great joint.  Very unassuming place and some of best wings in town!  They had me at 'wings'--the garlic parm wings!  Tuesday nights are their wings nights--go for the garlic wings.  Savory, crunchy, garlicky, buttery goodness! I am salivating as I write this! They also have great pizza! But their must try dish--greens and beans!  So good!

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Leslie J.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
Staff is unfriendly. Very unorganized. 

Just went there for lunch and ordered a chicken wrap. 15 minutes after we order the waitress comes back to let us know they did not prepare chicken for the day so everything on the menu with checkin was unavailable. 

Running out of food is understandable, but not PREPARING it is just lazy. Why did we sit there and wait for 15 minutes after ordering to find out they didn't have what we ordered? 

This is not my first bad experience at this place, I will not be going back and do not encourage anyone else to either.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Nena U.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
Great food - must be one of the best kept secrets in the burg!!  
Wings: Tasty and done just right.  I got the dried Cajun.. tasty. I also tried hot  buffalo with parm on them (not on the menu) and they were pretty good too.
Stuffed banana pepper pizza (Village tavern pizza): this concept is genius!! ! It was the best pizza I have ever had.  They make their own dough - everything is so fresh.  

Fresh cut French fries folks!!! They were really delicious! 

Great service, it was clean and there is street parking or a parking lot practically across the street ... 

Bravo Village Tavern. .... Bravo !

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Anne B.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
Delicious fresh spinach & tomato pie served by coolest sweetest bartender out under the roof at the patio bar. Nice n cool even with the crazy heat of late! A couple fun locals watch the game on the tube while two pairs of couples enjoy the ambiance separately. Ice cold beers help bring happy to the hours! 
Minus a star because when I initially walked inside it smelled of puke. Ha

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Rachel Q.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description: Stopped here for lunch after going up to the West End Overlook simply because of the fact that they allow dogs. It ended up being the best meal we'd eaten so far on our multi-day cross country road trip. The service was friendly but not over bearing and the food was well-priced. 10/10 would come back if I'm ever in Pittsburgh again

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Amy M.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
Oh Village Tavern, you used to be one of my favorite Italian places in the burgh. But the last few times I visited, I've been less than impressed. 

My visit today was so disappointing. There were a group of 6 of us there for my mother's birthday. I think our server was recovering from a major night out or this was her first day ever with a job. I get it- being a server is hard. I stuck it out for 2 years and eventually gave up, because I wasn't a very good server. But NEITHER WAS THIS PERSON. 

We had to flag her to come take our orders. She seemed surprised like "Oh, I've only given you 20 minutes to read through our one page menu. Are you sure you're ready?" We had to ask for silverware after our food was delivered. We had to ask for coffee refills eleventy-billion times. We had to ask for red pepper flakes twice. We had to ask for our bill twice. I never got my water refilled once. I ordered a beer that never showed. We waited and waited and waited for everything. There was one other group of four in the entire dining room, so it's not like it was slammed. We still tipped her well, because- life is hard, yo. 

The food wasn't all that great this time around. I usually go for dinner and today, it was lunch. So maybe that makes a difference? My husband's Reuben was the most pathetic Reuben I've ever seen! If I'm going to pay $10 for a sandwich that meat better be at least an inch thick. My dad said his burger was "meh". 

I love their red sauce and their meat sauce, their stuffed peppers, and their fried provolone. The salads are good too! 

I'm not going to give up on this place because I'm an Italian girl who needs her sauce on Sundays, but I'll probably be getting take out from now on.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Kristy A.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
I'm really not sure how this place ended up with 4 stars, because I was struggling to give it two.   Service at the bar dragged it up, but that's about all that I have positive to say about the place.   

I went there for a wine and coloring book event, but had dinner at the bar first.  It was warm in the bar, but even warmer (sweltering really) in the restaurant section.  The food was freezer fare that they made an attempt to dress up a little.  The buffalo chicken wrap had potential, but the thin buffalo sauce leaked all out of it and it ended up a big soggy, greasy mess.  The lettuce on it was questionable as well.  The sweet potato fries were passable and were served with apple butter, which was a nice touch.  It's still freezer food though.  I also found it really odd that they were filling their ice wells with 20 lb bags and were serving soda from 2 liter bottles. 

Once I moved to the dining area, I wasn't sure which was worse - the sweltering heat or the "entertainment".  At first, we thought "what is with this music selection?"  The bar was playing contemporary country and this was stuff my grandparents would have listened to.  Then, we thought "hmmm...this version of the song really sounds like bad karaoke".   After looking around, we see a guy out on the patio with a karaoke machine.   Oh...that explains it.  It IS bad karaoke.   30 minutes later, though, we thought "why is this same terrible guy still up there?"  And then he pulled out a trumpet and clearly, it wasn't just karaoke night - this was the intended entertainment.  Yikes!

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Nicole T.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
I was so looking forward to good food as the menu sounded delicous.

I got the Greens and Beans with hot sausage appetizer and fried cheese appetizer.

Greens and beans were terrible.  The hot sausage (not hot at all) was ground up....could have been groundmeat.  There were carrots and lettuce in it.  Enough said

Marinara sauce for cheese had zero flavor and tasted like tomatoes straight out of a can

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Anthony B.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
Bought a groupon and decided to try the place out.

Parking:
 First there is no parking lot, it is all on street parking, which was fine because it was after 7 and we didn't have to put money into the meters.

Ambience:
Great design and layout of the location, brick walls, wooden booths, old wine bottles on wall.

Service:
Absolutely terrible. We never got refills on our water or soda. We received the food and never asked if we needed anything. Had to go to the waitress to ask her for red pepper flakes. The other waitress was kissing some guy a few times, and she never came over either. I didn't even try to get management as the lady who looked to be the manager was texting on her phone the entire time and looked uninterested in helping tables.

Food:
We ordered the pizza and it was absolutely awful. Think $5 antoons pizza in oakland. The middle completely fell apart. And the pizza was over topped. I never thought you could put too many toppings on a pizza. But it must have been close to a pound of hot peppers on it, and this pizza crust couldn't manage to hold it all together. 


Overall:
I will never come back to here.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Kitty K.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description: Awesome service and food. The Rich Cole Jazz band was great too. Italian food, cool music. Laudback. Relaxed ambiance.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Sara P.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
Any local restaurant that serves a healthy side salad (aka. not iceberg lettuce) in Pittsburgh gets at least 4 stars from me! The Village T & T is a cozy little place, with hard wood booths and tables.  The menu serves traditional Italian fare.  I ordered the Zucchini Parm special and my Mom ordered the Chicken Romano.  The zucchini was good, but the chicken was out of this world!  And, as stated before, the side salads had no iceberg lettuce at all! Score.

The only advice I'd give is to have one waitress per table.  Even though the waitresses were very nice, we had two - two came to the table to take our order, and they seemed to switch off duties throughout the meal.  It just felt a bit crowded and I felt more pressure to order quickly because there were two people waiting to take our order.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Steve D.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description:
This is the best of the best.  Good food, good service, owner on site

Italian food is perfect.  Bar food is a cut above

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Ed S.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description: OK place. Service is iffy at times. Food is hit or miss but it is solid for the money. It's not a place I would go put of my way to travel to go there. I keep trying it hoping that I will find something that knocks my socks off. Still looking . The owners seem super nice and always go out of their way to say hello.

_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.author: Tom F.
_7nELtYw3n2DzMN8252lhQ.description: Our family was in town for a night while traveling through the area.  The recommendation for Village Tavern came from hotel staff for a "local" place.  I was impressed with the vibe of the place (felt like a Pittsburgh neighborhood joint) and most impressive was the staff.  Food was great, atmosphere was even better and our waitress, Josi, was the best.  Simply put, I could not have imagined a better place to visit!  If you are in town, check this place out!  You will not be disappointed.

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Renee J T.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description:
Hands down the best chicken sandwich in the burgh...
Yup go there
It's not in a trendy neighborhood so this perfect sandwich does not come with that trendy price 
Big soft roll big chicken cutlet Mayo 
It's just so good 
Menu also has other chicken offerings including buckets of pieces 
Burgers 
It's a little place but they do have a counter you can sit at will accommodate 2-3 hungry folks 
Friendly service 
This place can't be beat

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Daniel S.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description:
I wanted to love this place.  I'm in the area a lot and it would be great to have a go to, affordable, take out place for lunch.  It had great reviews so I grabbed lunch hoping for above average.  The fries were great.  Plentiful, seasoned, and crisp enough that I devoured them.  But then there was the burger.  It was a frozen patty with no seasoning added.  It was cooked OK and the toppings were fine, but the bun was a bit stale.  Was it better than McDonalds or Burger King?  Absolutely!  But that's a pretty low bar.  For the price I wasn't expecting a fresh ground burger, but how about tossing just a tad of seasoning on it as its cooking so it doesn't taste like a plain old burger.  It was especially surprising given how well the fries were seasoned.

I will likely try it again and maybe get the Beefsteak or other sandwich.  But if I get a stale bun the second time, I'll know its a pattern and not an anomaly

If you just need something to eat and want it reasonably fast and inexpensive, this is one of the better options in the area.  Just don't expect it to live up to the glowing reviews.

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Matthew U.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description:
This place is not hard to miss.  One obvious reason is the bright coloring of the building.  That definitely catches the eye when you drive by.  The other not so obvious reason is the food.  It is outstanding, satisfying, and worth it.

I looked up the menu prior to arriving and had my decision in mind to hopefully make for a quick stop.  I had gotten the Bacon Burger Combo and my better half decided on the Italian Beef Combo.  With a combo it is basically whatever item on the menu you want with fries and a drink.  Pepsi products are available.  When I placed my order I had a little bit of a wait for it to be ready.  There were already several people inside when I arrived.  Pro-tip here, call ahead to place your order if you are nearby (delivery is available through GrubHub).  

Having a little time I putzed around a bit.  If you want to dine in, best to come alone, there are only about three seats available at the bar type seating near the windows.  Menu and pictures of menu items are all over the one wall, so if you are not sure what to get this may help.  Staff are extremely friendly, when I first walked in I was greeted happily by one said employee.  Made me feel very welcomed.

Food was finally ready and I head home.  My Bacon Burger was amazing.  Prepared just how I had asked for it.  I had made mine a double which, as an afterthought, was maybe just a little too much for me.  That burger was huge.  Like "could be the whole meal" huge.  The burger patty was very flavorful and cooked perfectly.  The fries are hand cut and lightly seasoned.  My better half said that his Italian Beef was pretty close to the real deal.  Being from Chicago originally he was impressed.

Definitely a place to frequent for me when I get the chance to.  It's nice to have a variety of places to eat in just about every neighborhood in the city.

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Don L.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description: Good food with friendly service.   Italian beef was delicious.    Will be back to try the wings!

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: DJ J.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description: Stopped by this little local take out place that recently opened.  The menu has gyros, burgers, sausage, chicken wings and more.  The staff was very friendly and helped to explain the menu.  There is s $5.99 lunch special.  My Mexi-Jerk chicken taco was very good.  The taco was actually pita bread and came with fries.  Will definitely stop back if in the neighborhood.

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Scott S.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description:
Stopped in for lunch on Tuesday and had the best Italian style beef I've ever had in Pittsburgh. Truly authentic Chicago style (giardineira peppers and everything) they really know what they're doing here.

They have an extensive almost daunting menu but I look forward to trying some of the other items! I recommend you do the same

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Nick W.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description: Finally found a decent place to get some Italian beef without going into the city.  Great price too.  You guys rock!

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Matt E.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description: Stopped by today for a beef sandwich. Very friendly and the beef was delicious. Highly recommend.

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Karyn K.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description:
Stopped in and the place was clean and inviting.

At so many places now the staff treat you like you're inconveniencing them by coming in-not here. It was clean and inviting and the window-seat view is nice from the inside.

My husband loved the Old Bay wings. There were so many choices! I got the taco. Tex-Mex style on a soft warm pita. I was pleasantly surprised by the portion and quality. I want to stop back ASAP for the fish. 

Come on Northside! Go on in. It's more that just Mexican War Street gastropubs.  Tacos, and chicken and wings, oh my.

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Genesis W.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description: True Chicago style food prepared by a Chicago Native! One thing I love to do when I move to a different state is look for the best place that will give me a taste of home and this place NAILED IT! The Italian Beef was delicious and flavorful! I will definitely be back and I suggest you all go and try some Chicago Style food- I suggest the Italian beef!

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Taylor F.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description: Super friendly people serving up tasty and affordable food. Not healthy by any means (would love to see some veggie options!) But very solid and tasty! Best chicken fingers I've had. Lunch specials rock.

Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.author: Gina R.
Km8UIy8hjWNU80IZjhQ_yQ.description: This was such a great stop to try! I have never been here before and they were so welcoming! The food was amazing and was definitely worth it. Prices were very reasonable! I highly recommend making time to eat here!

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Gin K.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
Happy to find a healthy option in Pittsburgh during our trip. Navigating the gluten-free, vegan leaning thing is hard enough (egg and dairy allergies the main reason to seek vegan fare as shortcut) but didn't think finding a good salad would be challenging. Thank goodness for Earth! We ate here two times in two days, me building my own salad both times, hubby did the Thai menu option day one then built his own day 2. 

Took our salads to the Pirates game day 2 after finding no healthy options in park that I could eat (or were too pricey or not my taste). Very good. Appreciated the diverse options like brussel sprouts, blue cheese, garbanzo beans, carrots, sliced almonds, sunflower seeds, meats, different lettuce mix bases, many dressings, etc. Service is fast.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Natalie H.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
I really want to like this place, but every time I've eaten here it's been a negative experience and I'm tired of giving Earth Inspired the benefit of the doubt. From giant kale leaves and stems that are impossible to chew, to a 'grain bowl' with completely uncooked, hard-as-a-rock rice, the food quality is totally inconsistent. I've always gotten takeout and discovered these quality issues when I'm back at my office, unfortunately. A general problem with this place is that after the salads are assembled, they are not chopped up or mixed very well, so the dressings aren't blended and there are often really large pieces of veggies. The employees here are also not very friendly.

Earth Inspired is one of the only lunch places downtown that has a such wide salad selection and some of their toppings and dressings are quite good, especially the seasoned tofu and cheeses. The also include a slice of delicious, seedy bread. The price can add up very quickly if you add more than the basic toppings, but the price is fair for a large salad portion.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Michele W.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: Love building my own salad .... the several times I have been here, ingredients have always been fresh. They have posted a new menu will be coming August 19th.  Looking forward to some different options !

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Jen E.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: I went here because I wanted a nice light and healthy lunch. I chose the make your own salad. I chose my salad base, for add ins I ordered garbanzo beans, beets, been mix, and edamame and goat cheese.  You also get a nice slice of bread with it. To drink, lime LaCroix for $1.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Kristina W.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
Life is all about balance right?! I'm always on the hunt for a healthy, quick lunch spot downtown during the work week. I recently was treated to lunch at Earth Inspired Salads in the Alcoa building, across from Hotel Monaco, Kimpton. Love a place where I can build a healthy salad with all the fun tasty fixin's  Plus it's a great spot to support local as Earth works with local communities, farmers and sustainable partners! All around a lunch spot to feel good about.  

I enjoyed the Bovine Bleu salad all the ingredients were fresh & tasty, the steak was cooked well.  Also tried the Southwest Turkey Wrap which was interestingly made with ground turkey versus sliced deli-style meat. Also tried the Wok This Way Pad Thai rice bowl with shrimp. The flavor was nice and light, almost refreshing - not the in your face kind of curry which is actually great for lunchtime in my opinion.

Definitely would recommend for lunch time healthy eats, not a long wait like similar spots are downtown.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Michelle C.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
Tasty, quick salads and wraps to go. And I do mean quick. I ran out of my hotel across the street at ten-of-one hoping to somehow make it back for my 1pm call. The employees were a little brusque, but I don't mind skipping idle chit chat if it means I can grab a made-to-order salad in minutes and be back at my room with time to spare. 

I loved the many protein options including spiced ground turkey, which I can't say I've ever seen as a salad topping outside of my own kitchen. I wasn't sure if I'd like the dressing that came standard with the taco salad, so I asked for another extra dressing on the side and ended up combining the two. My salad was delicious and hit the spot! I'd definitely hit this place up again while staying at the Monaco or if I just happened to be in the area.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Chuck P.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: Ate here several times on a work trip and it was great. Wonderful selection of salad choices as well as a make your own option. I tried nearly all of the menu salads and personally loved the shrimp caesar salad, which I also had as a traditional chicken caesar. The salads are a bit pricey (between $8-12) but the portions are huge and it is downtown near many large office/bank buildings so who can blame them when they are the healthiest food for blocks and they have a line nearly out the door at lunch. I highly recommend coming here for lunch if working/staying downtown. They also are open until 6pm in case you want to grab a quick take back to your hotel dinner.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Nelson B.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: I found this place wondering around downtown and I'm glad I stopped in. Their salad bowls are really good. I had a build your own kale salad and really liked the curried cauliflower and Adobo chicken (which isn't spicy) I got with it. The bread was tasty too since it had poppy seeds in it with oats and sunflowers on the top. I also really liked the atmosphere since they had potted plants and herbs near the tables at the window. I'm definitely going to come back next time I bike in the city for a nice light and healthy meal.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Gina M.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: I was thinking this place would be good, with a solid food philosophy and unique salads based on the cool looking decor and well, the name.  it looks a bit hipster but the service, grumpy guy who we seemed to be bothering, & the food were far from inspired. I had a chicken mozzarella wrap because the salads looked pretty bad. My mozzarella wrap seemed to have no mozzarella, although my husband assured me the guy had put "some" on.... ok My husband had a rice bowl which looked like just a bowl of rice, not much more in there. Hubs said the rice was not salted....  no music, tired looking table & chairs. Dunno, just seemed like the food that would come out of some mom and pop deli and the place itself was annoying because the logo and decor are totally misleading. I would never eat here again

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Brad H.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
This is one of my favorite lunch places downtown.  I am not a huge salad person, but the ingredients they use here are so fresh and delicious that I can't imagine anyone not enjoying them here.

They allow you to either make your own custom salad from scratch or have one of their creations.  You can also choose if you want light, regular or heavy dressing.  My go to is the Et tu Brute salad.  It is a kale based salad with an amazing caesar like dressing.  The piece of bread they give you with it pairs great with the salad.  Even though it is one of their healthier salads, it keeps you full.  

There are so many great options here, can't wait to go back.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Amy C.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: I got the Bovine bleu salad. Big portion. It was a very good salad and came with good fresh bread. I got the avocado ranch dressing and it was perfect with my salad. Kind of expensive for a salad, but I'll still be back.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Rachel C.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
I will say this over and over again. Salads are usually boring. But there are certain places that can make a stellar salad, and I can confirm it is here! I almost wish I worked downtown so I can grab a salad from here daily. 

I ordered the Cobb Salad with Salmon and it seriously was delicious. There was ample parts toppings to lettuce to dressing. That might be the key to a good salad, along with good quality ingredients. While it's not a cheap salad, at $12, it still was worth it to me because of how good it was. 

The staff was really nice and was able to answer all my questions (I always have too many!). I'm very interested to try out more salads when I'm downtown again. Who knows, maybe I'll have to make a special trip... Or they'll just have to be more successful that they open up more locations around town!

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Beth B.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: Wow, is that an expensive salad.  Went into Earth for the first (and probably last) time today.  The cost for a basic salad with lettuce, chicken, cheese and a couple of veggies was $12!  I was floored.  There was nothing special about it, and you have to repeat what you want multiple times to the employees on the assembly line because it is so hard to hear in there.  Quality looks fine, but way over priced.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Lewis R.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: What a rip-off! They charge $6.42 for less than 2 cups of plain Greek yogurt that was generic GE brand (they opened the container in front of me) and put strawberries on top. That's not right. Will never buy at this chain again.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Kurt A.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
Well, I REALLY wanted to love this place.  The website was neat and informative, and the store itself is amazing.

When you walk in, you can smell the fresh vegetables.  Clean as a whistle, and the glass-doored fridges were bursting with colorful veg.  The space has enormous ceiling and is decorated as you would think a trendy vegetarian place should be. 

The worker was very friendly and laid back (again, think hippie-chic), and was amazingly helpful.  I ordered the 'Crouching Tiger, Hidden Chicken, and they were quickly receptive to the request for a substitution.

The salad was made in a giant bowl right in front of you, and I was amazed at the amount each of fixings added.  I asked for heavy dressing, the tomato-dijon jalapeno, and went back to work, excited for my feast.  What a let-down.  The flavors just weren't there.  The dressing seemed to have spice, but not a "kick," and almost no flavor whatsoever.  I tried adding salt and pepper (more than once), but with no luck.

I understand that it is supposed to be a health-food place, and I will try it again with a stronger dressing or added cheese, but this place just didn't "do it" for me.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Ryan H.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
This is Earth Inspired Salads 2nd location to downtown (other store is located on 5th Ave near Market Square). Located directly across the street from Hotel Monaco. The restaurant was super clean and very well designed with plenty of seating to eat in. This was actually my first time eating at EIS and I have to say that I will definitely be back! I've always been a huge fan of Hello Bistro for an alternative, healthy lunch. 

However, EIS is on a whole other level when it comes to healthy and fresh. Their concept is the same as Hello Bistro but the quality of produce seems well cared for as their brochure talks about having a commitment towards sourcing local farmers to provide healthy, fresh ingredients. I also like the idea of being able to see the calorie intake for their "Inspired salads". If by chance you're feeling creative, you can also build your own. However that seems like it could turn out to be a little pricey (add-ons). This location also offers grain bowls which is a mix of brown, wild and barley rice. Daily soup solutions and my favorite feature of all - gluten free dressings! Eat in, pick up or order out!

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Alicia J.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: This is probably my favorite lunch spot.  I like the vegetarian options and how I can mix it up and get different toppings/lettuces/dressings all the time.  I recently came for their new breakfast and found it to be just as great as lunch.  My breakfast wrap took longer to make but was worth rolling into work a little late for some fresh eggs and veggies.  The space is inviting and clean too!

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Karthick E.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description:
I went in for a rice bowl but apparently they ran out of rice. They asked me to get rice bowl with wild rice and I agreed to it. The bowl seemed to cost 11 bucks but Just had rice, chicken, Guacamole and salsa. I felt that the bowl was a little overpriced for very little ingredients. The staff are very friendly though.

Not satisfied with my bowl and that's why the 3 stars!

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Matt K.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: Two stars since I haven't tried other items on the menu. The Fiesta Bowl, however, is something I wouldn't order again. Lots of brown rice (some even crunch), cold chicken, some beans, and a dollop or guacamole.

wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.author: Martine S.
wbKGU8Epr2jKX74jWpd4Aw.description: Great salads! A little expensive but convenient. The girl at the counter explained the options really well and the salad was great. Goat cheese was amazing! Good portions too.

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Ramona D.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: This is the place to stop by when going to a Pittsburgh Penguin Hockey Game! Apps are good and beers are great!

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Sherri K.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description:
adventure with the night so beautiful and the drive was great, worth the trip. Took our date night to this place with having the steak made a perfect medium rare and I the adventurous one got a hamburger donut(as the bun). Removing the top donut to take home for the next morning. perfect with just the bottom donut, right amount of meat and sweet., don't get w/ sweet potato fries they are w/sugar and cinnamon get the regular fries. I was up in eyeballs with all the sweet.
Great outdoor eating

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Ted P.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: This place is sad. I've gone here a whole bunch since all my hockey friends want to stay close before events. The building is pretty but it's been consistently shitty since it first opened as blue line grill. The only reason they stay afloat is because they get unsuspecting hockey and event fans in.  The waits are terrible. The food is generic and bland without any remote resemblance to the theme they are going for.  Food is rarely cooked properly and you're more than likely going to be hovering over a toilet for the majority of the next day. Owners have zero care in the world.   Save yourself and go to cafe fifth, Milano's, or red ring before the game instead.

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Roberto S.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: Awesome location directly across the street from the PPG arena.  Very convenient if you are going to a Pens game or a concert.  The hostess seemed a little overwhelmed and was kinda cold to us but not mean. However when we sat down our waiter was on point.  We decided to do apps only before went to a concert.  They were all pretty bad.  Everything tasted like is was from a microwave.  I am willing to go back only if we have something going on at the arena.

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Brad H.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: Really happy they have changed their menu to include more traditional bar style food.  They kept some of the old parts of the menu, but have added some great options such as different buffalo chicken options, pizzas, more burgers, and different sandwiches to choose from.  On my last trip we had the pretzel app and the buffalo chicken wrap.  Both were very good.  Probably the best food I have had since this place opened.  Really happy to see they listened to customers who wanted to see the menu expanded.

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Renee M.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: I don't even know where to begin. Came before an event so we expected it to be busy, not a problem. A friend in our group asked the hostess how much longer it would be and she proceeded to do all but curse at her. She went into extensive detail about her personal life and then told my friend she was rude for asking when the table would be ready. We were finally seated and another hostess came over to "apologize" which was really just her way of saying "you need to understand what she's going through" and then called me rude for glancing down at my phone and stormed away. The rest of the evening she kept giving our table dirty looks. I've worked in the restaurant business and understand how stressful event days can be, but to be greeted and continually talked to in such a manner is not acceptable. I won't be coming back and I will be telling everyone not to go either.

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Steph H.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description:
This is a good place to come before a game or concert, but I would never come just for the food. The atmosphere is lively and fun. They have a lot of TVs and service is always pretty decent. The best part is the upstairs where they have a deck looking at the arena. There are heat lamps for when it gets chilly!

The food is where things get a little odd. Overall it is good food. Not great but not bad. Last night we had the chicken nachos, pretzels, and chicken fingers. The pretzels and cheese had zero flavor and tasted frozen. The BBQ chicken nachos were tasty with a good spice from the jalapeños! The chicken tenders are southern style with a nice kick also. They were a little under cooked for me, but my husband liked them. The menu is just strange. Before a game and at a bar, I want bar food. Like mozzarella sticks, wings, dips. However their food here is more entree style and they have speciality milkshakes. Just not really what you think of on game day.

This is definitely the best spot right by the stadium in terms of atmosphere, but if you are looking for bar food try elsewhere.

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Kelly W.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: We went to Buford's prior to an event and the place was very busy but we were seated promptly and drink orders were taken. That's where it went downhill....it took us almost 30 minutes to get the waitress to come back to the table and take our food order. Then another 30 minutes went by and no sign of the waitress, and food that was ordered from customers that came in much later than us was coming out. After another 10 minutes I flagged down the runner and asked if she could please check on our food. We had been there over an hour and a half and the show was starting in 45 minutes. She was very helpful and came back and said there was a mix up in the kitchen and they would start our meals immediately. Another woman stopped by and apologized and said they would discount the bill - which I asked for since I also saw many tables waiting to pay. The runner finally brought our food (30 minutes before the show) and 1 of the 4 dishes was entirely wrong. My friend had ordered a shrimp appetizer and a burger was delivered, so they had to start her meal over. The waitress appeared and said she wasn't sure what the mix up was but would get our bill together. At that point I asked to speak to a manager. He apologized and said our order was never submitted to the kitchen and that the waitress was filling in for someone that had called off. He did the right thing (which I appreciate) and took care of the bill but we spent over 2 hours chasing down staff to try to get a meal that we ate in less than 10 minutes so that we could try to make the show on time. We did with 2 minutes to spare:)  I'd like to say this was a fluke but I was there once for lunch as well and the service was obviously better than the pre-show mess but not much better. Sadly the food was good but we had no time to enjoy it. They have a great location for before events but the service issues need to be improved.

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Kevin P.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: Awesome bar right across the street from PPG Paints Arena ("Paint Can" as I would like to call it). It has a sports bar type setting with a hipster feel. We went for lunch time and it was not busy at all which was nice. We were seated promptly and our orders were taken quickly. I ordered the chicken po boy with fries and a water. The chicken po boy was on a hoagie bun that was about 6-7" in length (who said size doesn't matter haha jk). The fried chicken was not greasy or heavy at all and was easy to stomach, ate the whole dang thing. I would definitely recommend trying this place out!

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Jeff R.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: Went up stairs asked  manager who was standing talking to 3 waitresses if we could get service outside, the said sure.  Two waitresses came served outher customers,  one came out twice,  totally ignored us

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Chadd M.
P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.description: Went for a pre-college tour lunch. Service was a little slow but food came out hot. Fries were great. Reuben was tasty. Be nice to come back during a game/concert for drinks.

P1a2WApEoMb65s14RmqV2g.author: Jamie L.
