U5R81BLqytl1phE-E9Mt0g.author: Cody H.
U5R81BLqytl1phE-E9Mt0g.description: Delicious food always. Friendly staff. Recommended if you are looking for authentic Honduran.

U5R81BLqytl1phE-E9Mt0g.author: Jay H.
U5R81BLqytl1phE-E9Mt0g.description: Papusas and tortas were both the best. Waitress didnt speak english, but we managed. Was relatively inexpensive and took about 25 minutes for our food. We have been back twice and will continue to go!

U5R81BLqytl1phE-E9Mt0g.author: Annie O.
U5R81BLqytl1phE-E9Mt0g.description: I can't say enough good things! My boyfriend had been craving horchata and due to a previous review mentioning how good their horchata was off we went and it definitely delivered. We started off with tamales and then had enchiladas and fajitas. Everything was so good and spiced to perfection. It was a lot of food for a good price too! Definitely will be returning.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Sarah W.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: I like coming here for Steelers games and just when I want a place to chill and enjoy a beer with their delicious loaded fries!  They always have a decent beer selection.  I love their wings and loaded fries!  Service has always been good here.  Nice relaxed bar atmosphere.  I've never been here late at night so I'm sure the atmosphere changes then.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Christopher B.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
Came to Carson City Saloon a plethora of times while living in Pittsburgh. Mostly recently I came to watch the NFL Championship games. We had a group of about 30 people, and Carson City was able to accommodate us all. 

We sat a very long table with all of us sitting comfortably. The wait staff was great. Being able to take all our orders, get food/drink out quickly. Everything that you could ask for out of a bar on a heavy football day.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Jacqueline C.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: I guess this may be as good as it gets(bar itself).  The bartender, Bri was EXCELLENT, cheerful and on it!!!! Nothing bad to say about the help!   Great TV's but they do allow smoking in this bar and it is disgusting.  I was starving so I ate some sweet potatoe fries which were good.  I guess smoking is the norm at any Carson Street bar or maybe that is acceptable for Pittsburgh.  Bar was "OK".

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Jeffrey S.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
First experience here. This is a place for young 20 year olds. It's been years since I did this type of scene. We went out for our daughters 21st Birthday.

Bottom floor is nice a cool and cozy until it gets packed. That's when it's difficult to move around.

The roof bar you have to get their early else it's a line to get upstairs. When you arrive it's hot and packed. It could be more like Sienna Mercatto.

Nice experience.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Mariah M.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: This is my favorite bar in Pittsburgh! It usually sports a lot of college students and young adults, but it's a great 3-Story bar with a rooftop. I haven't visited earlier in the day, but I know they have tables and serve food earlier. Their drinks are pretty affordable for Pittsburgh and I'd definitely recommend coming one night!

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Brad H.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
This review is based on both the atmosphere and the food.  I have been going to this bar for the last ten years and have a lot of great memories here.  With the addition of the rooftop, it is spacious enough that it usually is not too jam packed.  However, some nights it being crowded is what makes it so fun.  It is the best place in the city to watch a penguins game.  Playoff games here are amazing.  

In terms of the food, it is better than you would expect for s place like this that is more of a bar than place to eat.  My usual go to is the buffalo chicken hoagie or the wings.  They also have some great house made ranch.  If my review were based only on food it would probably be a 3, but everything else this place offers bumps it up.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Ryan B.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
Unfavorable experience, from staff, food, management, drinks, and ambiance. 

Beer = warm
Food = would feed to my Goldendoodle at best 
Management = should take a class in customer service

Bring in John Taffer

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Cassie M.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: Always have a good time here. We usually come here to pregame because it gets crazy hot and crowded after midnight. Ordered a mystery shot for $5 and it landed on "bartender's choice." Our girl hooked us up and mixed like 5 different liquors in a shot glass with some other random stuff. Thought it was going to taste nasty and I was going to die but it actually tasted delicious and gave us a nice buzz. Only con is there's only 2 bathroom stalls upstairs (drunk women + crowded bars, this is a recipe for disaster)

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Michael C.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: If I could give this 0stars I would... every time I drink the dollar yingers I feel like I have to shit myself. It's so frustrating because I just want to have fun with the boys. Can someone please tell me why???

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Stephanie G.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: Wow where do I begin?! This bar has created so many new friendships, no, relationships. If you're single in pgh GO (or work) HERE!! I'm personally going on 6 years with a previous bartender. Not to mention several other employees who have married their favorite regular (or employee) ;-)

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Nicholas W.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: After traveling and having been to a variety of clubs/bars/pubs/dive bars across the country, last night we made our way to this for one of our several times here. Service was not on top of things though, especially with the bartenders. Aside from cheap drinks throughout the week, service isn't up to standard with the bartenders off-the-clock using profanity when I was trying to order a drink after and the bartender off-the-clock whom was drinking telling me to "Wait my turn, Cu##"? I've never experienced such vulgar language from a lady and been so offended on my nights out to drink, and this time was from a bartender from the bar we were at. Unacceptable. Highly recommend Carson City Saloon for quick cheap drinks, specifically the $1 Blue Moons or $1 Yuengling drafts on Wednesday and Thursday, but better off making your way to Mario's down the street or any other direction along East Carson. So, for anyone traveling in Pittsburgh, pop your head in for a drink but do not get comfy.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Frank G.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
Carson City Saloon is a spacious, divey sports bar with multiple levels and televisions, as well as a large projection screen for sporting events and a rooftop bar that is great during nice weather.

The food here is not good and should only be eaten in emergencies such as starvation and extreme intoxication.  Despite the very reasonable prices, the execution of the menu items aren't worth what you pay for them.  Like I said, it's only good for keeping you from getting sick while you're pounding drinks.

On the other hand, the service is excellent and attentive.  I was there during a Stanley Cup Finals game, and although there were only a few servers on the floor, they were doing an excellent job keeping up with the crowd's demands, maintaining tabs and remaining upbeat the entire time.  As for the ambiance, the music gets a little loud when they aren't piping in the game's audio, the smoking gets heavy, the crowds get thick and the nightclub vibe is in full effect as the evening draws on.

My opinion is that this is a divey club disguised as a sports bar that has plenty of floor space for watching games, but ultimately caters to a younger crowd.  If you decide to watch the game there, do yourself a favor and eat somewhere beforehand, then get ready to get rowdy!

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Vi L.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
I'm writing this review based on my dining experience here. The service was great and our waitress was very attentive. The menu was straightforward and the food came out in a timely manner. Overall, the food was just average though. Portion size was a bit too small for the price. I got the Parmesan crusted chicken wrap with a side of Parmesan fries. The wrap was smaller than my hand, and I have small hands. The wrap was just a typical chicken wrap smothered in mayo. The fries claimed to be tossed in some garlic parm mix, but tasted like it was tossed in plain salt to me. The fries were crispy though, which I like. My meal came out to be over $10 and it was just meh. 

Considering the fact that I was in Southside and there are plenty of better dinning options around for the same price, I probably will not go out of my way to get food here. There's Fatheads and the Library a few blocks down.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Simone H.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
I have experienced Carson City throughout the years as they continue to be a staple Carson Street destination throughout the year for all kinds of occasions. Steeler and Penguins games, summer day time bar crawls, Friday night shenanigans, and New Years Eve parties. I've seen them reinvent themselves with the opening of their rooftop level making it a continued enjoyable experience to come.

The first floor is your basic Southside location, half way between a sports bar, a restaurant and a push-fest crowding yourself to get to the inconveniently small bar. The space on the general floor is large enough to hold a group drinking party whether fundraising post-gaming or as part of the Santa Clause crawl. This is also the only level you the full menu, make sure to try the dips, the buffalo chicken is constantly good. Even with the craft beer explosion here in the city, this is primarily a liquor bar, at least on level 1.

the second level has a small balcony veranda and minimal floor space, usually there will be shot girls tasked to get you to participate in a liquor promotion, some free versions, some not. There's not much to see at this level.

The roof-top bar has been there for a few years now and by far an awesome addition to the Bar. This level is mainly a Beer level and gives you a vibe of a never ending college Spring Break no matter at what age. Grab a few snacks and appetizers while you grab a can of miller lite or an alcoholic slushy [those are fantastic - 2 flavors, 2 liquors types] and during some Saturday afternoon engage in a game of cornhole flashing oversized designer sunglasses over your abercrombie and fitch fashion tanks. I was there this Saturday during the Mustache March and the Kentucky derby. The slushies were the highlight of the night and the Bartender were fantastic [even if I almost scared her to death as a penny jumped out at me from my purse and i mistook it for a large bug]

Always chill always great for getting your first neck-sunburn of the year. Do come often.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Michelle M.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: I wish I could give it 0 stars. I liked this bar at first but then I left my purse at the rooftop and the bar would not let me back in to go get it because I didn't have my ID. Which is totally reasonable, but I asked them for an escort to bring me up to go find it with me. The employee was so incredibly rude I couldn't believe it. He called me names, he said I "didn't belong", he asked me to walk in traffic. The manager was all about backing up his employee and did not apologize once. The manager said there is no way the employee said those things and that he is too "calm" to act that way. It was the most ridiculous experience ive have to deal with since being in Pittsburgh. I regret ever going here and giving them my business. If you go here make sure you don't make any errors because they will treat you like complete shit. We will never be going here again.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Emily S.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: Love their fried pickles, Parmesan fries and pierogie stack sandwich! Staff is friendly and a great bar to watch sports.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Anne C.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
Someone named Marissa was outside giving away $3 off $5 which was a great incentive for buying something here, especially when coupled with happy hour. 

I got their smothered fries and was surprised that their portion sizes were so small! However, it not was not a huge deal since I was mostly focused on their drinks. I was really excited to try their jello shots and it was delicious but didn't phase me at all, despite me being a lightweight. I wouldn't get a jello shot here if your goal here is to get sloppy.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Alex L.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description: A great atmosphere and location. The bar itself is fine for a bar in the South Side. The food is just ok. Nothing amazing, nothing terrible. The wings are the standout. A great hangout, but not your best option for food in the South Side.

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Angela H.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
Hmmmmm were we here on an off night? Or is Carson City a completely different bar now?!

I was in town for the weekend, and I wanted to do a mini crawl with some college friends, and this was our first stop. When I was in college, 2008-2010, this was my favorite bar to come, watch sports, and drink on the weekends. It would always be PACKED. This was before the rooftop bar opened.

We came in, and it was so empty. The tables on the left side were all empty (I'm sure the kitchen was closed by then anyway). They had taken down the half wall that separated the restaurant side from the bar side, so it was all one room downstairs now. So downstairs was almost empty, with just a handful of people at the bar. The 2nd floor was completely empty, and we made our way to the new rooftop bar, where most of the crowd was, but it still wasn't crowded! I was so upset to see it so empty. This place used to seriously be the best. I had to use the bathroom once, and I don't think I've ever seen the women's room without a line, let alone me being the only person in there. It was so strange! There also used to be a beer pong room in the basement that would fill up with people, but all the rooms were closed, so I dunno if it even still exists...

Anyway, my friends and I all got one drink and decided to move on to the next place. I hope this was just an off night, or we were there a little too early, cause if Carson City is this lame now, I'll be sad!

scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.author: Kimberly T.
scIbMKZIigMz4w5Q2SltTg.description:
My favorite oldest son and I had a date night last night and decided to try the Saloon. When we walked in we were the only diners but there were a few people at the bar. The menu was appetizers, sandwiches, salads, and burgers. We ordered loaded fries to start.  They came to our table hot and cheesy. They did not disappoint. They came with a ranch dressing that tasted homemade. 
I ordered a chicken wrap switch homemade chips. The chips were very thin and crispy. I was not thrilled with my wrap. The chicken had a weird texture and there was about a half an onion on my wrap. It was overwhelming. Even after I pulled out all of the onion you could still taste it. I only are half. 
My son had a burger. It wasn't what he thought it was going to be but said it was "ok". He ordered a side salad with his burger which was a typical side salad. 
It was all typical bar food. Nothing stood out or was memorable. You won't leave hungry but you won't rush back.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Dan L.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: Ok ok ok listen...you all know what you're getting into when you're coming to a bar called the Thirsty Scholar. CHEAP BEER and CHEAP FOOD, however what you didn't know is that the place is HUGE! Great for a group hangout and even better for Saturday/Sunday football! I came here with low expectations and left pleasantly surprised. The scholar is a great place to get away for a few hours to throw back some cold ones and give your brain a break. The bartenders, especially Maggie, were super friendly and recommended the Spicy Parmesan wings for Wednesday's wing night! ($0.70/wing). Oh and did I mention they let you bring your well behaved pup inside the bar!!! Will DEFINITELY be back!

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Pauline C.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
Found this little bar last year after I turned 21. The food is okay, we really go for the great well drink prices! It's never too crowded, so it's easy to find a seat most of the time. What really makes them stand out is the option to request games for the table. I've had so many good memories of playing UNO with my friends. 
The only thing that bugs me is that there are often times events so the back room is closed until 10 pm. I wish there was a feed online that told you when those events were! The front room is okay while waiting for the event to be over, but if they converted the store into tables/chairs I think it would be better. 
Overall, I love Thirsty Scholar and it's been one of my favorite memories at Pitt. I look forward to the fun times I have there each visit!

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Katherine L.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
Thirsty Scholar is awesome! The food does not taste overly greasy or fattening like bar food often does. The pretzel bites come out hot, and they are perfectly soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. The spinach dip with chips is delicious and filling, and it had more spinach in it than comparable dishes at other restaurants, which I liked. 

Thirsty Scholar has an awesome selection of beers, and the $5 buckets after 10 PM are the way to go. The Whiskey Ginger bucket is made with the right ratio of whiskey to ginger beer, and it is not overly sweet. 

The bottle shop inside Thirsty Scholar is also very well-stocked. I have only had great experiences with servers/bartenders at Thirsty Scholar. Servers are helpful and attentive. 

If you are looking for a slightly quieter bar to grab snacks and hang out at on a weekend, this is the perfect place.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Natalie B.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
I really enjoy this place. I finish work around 4 and tend to head over right after. It's quiet and spacious so I don't feel like I'm hitting the "I hate my job, let's drink" crowd. 

Drink prices are more than reasonable and strong. I love their moonshine, super yummy and served in a really cute jar. Bartenders are friendly without being overwhelming. 

I haven't tried the food yet but it's on my to-do list for sure!

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Cayla T.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
This place had opened awhile back, and I've wanted to try it because the menu looked really good. I had been to the store side a couple times. It's expensive but convenient and for the size, good variety. 

There was a private event happening so only the front of the restaurant was available. Glasses of wine are $4 all day so I ordered a moscato. The glass is really small, I wish I would've taken a picture. Whatever, I didn't come here for the wine; I came for the food. I ordered garlic Parmesan wings and the spinach dip. The wings were more like 'wing dings' and not worth the $7 simply for their size. I will say that they were flavorful and crispy. The spinach dip on the other hand was just not good at all. It was super thin and I continually added salt to help the flavor. I'm curious to see the back of the restaurant so I may venture back and try something different on the menu. Also, the speciality drink menu looked amazing.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: RC M.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: Nicer, and a bit upscale bar in Oakland. Love the name! Great beer & drink selection and the food is really good. A level up from typical bar food. Try the wings, at least a dozen flavors to choose from and there's a Wednesday special.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Luci H.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
I can see it now.. I'm a first-year med student, need to take a break from the books and diseases, and find this bar - The Thirsty Scholar. 

I can see myself posted up at the bar, with some notes and a draft beer. The friendly bartender makes just enough conversation to keep me feeling welcome, without interrupting my studying. This is the kind of bar I would be at if I went to UPitt. 

I unfortunately just stopped by while waiting on a plane to fly back to Texas. I had the Philly and some buffalo chicken dip (which was awesome). The Philly wasn't great, but why get a Philly in Pitt? Idk, I just did.. ok?!

The only thing I could offer this spot as advice, would be to get some local beer on draft. I'm always looking local when visiting new cities and the bartender mentioned that there weren't many in their rotation. Oh well, it's a great stop if you're in town!

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Lizzie K.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: Honestly this place isn't bad. They have these like bucket drink things that are huge and also taste super good. It's never been super crowded when I go there so it's a nice bar to go to when you want to get together with a group of like 3-6 friends because you'll all get timely service. I would go here more if I still lived there.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Christopher M.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: After work wings for dinner are always a great option. I also had a ginger beer to wash it down. In the summer time it's sort of quiet and empty so it's the perfect place to go for relatively fast service. The bartender was friendly and chatty which is generally nice and the place was clean. The tv was on ESPN which is great for the guys trying to keep up with sports. As far as the wings go, you can order 6 of a kind with different flavors. I like to keep mine spicy with some citrus flavor. Dry rubs are the best! My coworkers love this place so I'll probably be back with them at some point.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Christine M.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: Great Oakland location, and extensive menu so that everyone in your group can find something they like to eat. Perfect for parents, college students, they're roommates and younger siblings. Nice ambience especially for book or board game lovers.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Emily T.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: Thirsty Scholar is the most underrated Oakland bar, in my opinion. Joanne, the owner, is so friendly and accommodating. They have lots of fun and creative drinks with academic themed names. Only Gene's Place can really beat their prices, both are the cheapest in Oakland. The smaller front bar tends to be professors and the "older" crowd, and the large back bar is where students gather. For being right in a dense neighborhood, the space is HUGE! A lot of frats and sororities host mixers there for that reason. There is a ton of seating for groups and it almost never gets too crowded because of all the seating. The food is solid and they have late night specials on some of the appetizers.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Erika R.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
So i had the chance to go back to Thirsty Scholar and well... not much better. 
The service was subpar and the food didnt taste good at all.
I ordered a quesadilla. The meat was disgusting and the tortilla may as well hqve been cardboard. (Ever hear of flavor?)
So ordered it to come with sour cream and salsa, but also a side of chips/salsa. 
They gave me 1 side of salsa in the smallest condiment cup possible.
So i had to ask for more.
The iced tea &cup had a wierd taste and film on the cup. I swear there was a little alcohol in it if not left on the cup. 
My friend ordered a burger with lettuce and pickles. She got tomato no pickle.
The service sucked. We saw our food sit for pick up for quite sometime. 
Should have gotten up and left but our lunch break was almost done.
Will not be returning.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Mariah M.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: Thirsty scholar is one of my favorite bars in Oakland! It's a great break on a weekend from the other Oakland bars, which are very busy. Here, you can find great drinks and food. Unfortunately, the service is a little slow there, and I wish the kitchen was open later on the weekends.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Aj S.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
Free delivery from Postmates and quick delivery brought us to Thirsty Scholar. After decorating the tree, bar food was exactly what we needed and TS delivered. 

We both ordered burgers and were pleased with the taste. Mine was a little bit smaller than my boyfriend's, but I did order mine well done while his was medium well. The most impressive part of the meal were the sides. I ordered cole slaw and my BF ordered onions rings. They both were HUGE portions. The slaw came in what was close to a soup cup and the onion rings could have passed as an appetizer. Both meals were around $10. 

There are a million other places like this in the city, so nothing quite stands out. However, everything was good and I really have no complaints.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Louise B.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
This is the place to be. The drinks and food are good, obscenely well priced and the atmosphere is perfect for a fun time with friends. The staff treats you like family and you will want to come here every night!!

I personally recommend any of the bucket drinks, the Scholarita (to be shared!) And the pretzel bites. 

They just added board games too!! What more could you want out of a night with your buds?

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Joe S.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: Great spot, close to the hospitals. Very good drink prices, awesome staff and great food.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Michael U.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: It feels really fake. The staff is wayyy too overly friendly so it comes off as condescending or feels like a kid's restaurant. The decor has no personality. It's like the creator of the McMansion opened a bar. They have a good beer selection, but the atmosphere is just not fun. I hope they can fix this.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Orlando R.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description: The best bar and grill good price, great service and great food too bad it close on Sunday

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Jack S.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
I's named the "Thirsty Scholar" for a very good reason, lots of good beer and large drinks. Come for the alcohol and stay for the alcohol... The food is very unimpressive and not worth the money unless you're really drunk and need something to soak up the booze so you don't puke. I mean this in the best possible way since it is a collage bar.

I could go down the path of a culinary critique of a hugely disappointing meal but why... it suffices to say the Scholar could greatly benefit from someone in the kitchen with some, any actually, cooking experience.

w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.author: Gary D.
w-qFEyBuVKyQ_b81jRig2w.description:
I ate a dozen wings here and wasn't impressed at all. I had 6 honey habanero and 6 spicy parm. Spicy parm flavor was good but the wings were very gummy. The honey habanero was bad, it was rubber wings with a bottle of honey poured on top. I never waste food but I only finished 3 of them. 

I am not a fan of the fact that they give UPMC and College student discount but REFUSE to give Veterans Affairs employees and Disabled Veterans the same discount even though it's basically connected to UPMC. Just another restaurant in the area that doesn't like to support its Veterans. 

Needless to say, I will not return here.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Alan W.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description:
Wife and I had dinner her the other night.
I had the cod with mashed potatoes and gravy and they have a huge salad bar.
The cod was delicious and the salad/soup/fruit bar was really great.
I could of come for just the salad bar and would of been completely happy.
The service was great and it was fast and friendly.
The place is pretty big and was very clean.
If in the area I do recommend Eat'n Park as the food and service are both really good.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Amanda R.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: Great friendly staff and quick service. Like all locations a great menu any time of the day. Very helpful with substitutions for allergies.  The salad bar is always clean and well stocked with items and plates. Clean restrooms and just very clean in general. Ample parking spaces.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Chris M.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: A staple in Dormont. Great atmosphere  and love the new menu. Service with a smile from the great staff. Ahhhhhh,  steak salad!

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Julia E.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description:
Peoples reviews make me laugh. Its eat n park...its not fine dining. You have to know what you are getting yourself into. 
Went to this location for dinner last Tuesday around 6pm for dinner. We were seated right away. Both my husband and I ordered the superburger with the salad bar as our sides. Love doing that because my daughter can then eat for free off the salad bar. 
My superburger was delicious. Don't expect a big juicy burger. They are very thin patties, but as I mentioned, delicious. Salad bar was okay but I know going into it that its not amazing. 
Our waitress was friendly but didn't come around that often. She never even refilled our water. 
Kids get a free cookie at the end of the meal. My daughter who is 2 would give it 5 stars. 
There is a parking lot alongside and around back. Its great that you do not have to park on the busy street.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: John V.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description:
Best food and service 24 hours.
The oldest still standing Eatn Park that exists. Awesome !
Thank You Eatn Park Dormont Pa for all your years of outstanding service.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Gregg G.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: Went here for lunch today to grab a quick meal. My mother in law ordered chicken noodle soup, which appeared to be all noodles. She ate maybe a  1/3rd. I ordered a tuna salad sandwich on a croissant. The sandwich was all mayonnaise and egg whites with a hint of tuna. It had no flavor and was extremely oily. I do not eat eggs and had the menu indicated that there were eggs, I never would have ordered it. My wife had the hot turkey sandwich which was so salty it was inedible.(We think it was the gravy ) The one redeeming factor were the french fries. Lukewarm but okay. Why anyone would go here is beyond me. The place needs a thorough cleaning and the parking lot and exit are awful.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Lina B.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: This is a standard Eat'n Park. Friendly staff, have never had any complaints, and always great service!

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: J L.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: Fool me once... well other than pizza, this is only place that I can walk to so I keep trying and it gets worse and worse.  Take out or eat in, food is smaller and either cold or burnt. The restaurant is very dirty all the time! Service can be good, sometimes.  The joke is there is ALWAYS something wrong! Today's take out, I ordered 4 items. 1 was right. 1 was missing and 2 were completely wrong. Server did not apologize, Manager did not apologize and did not listen to corrections so messed up the redo! I posting her as my pledge not to return. I will pay uber to go the one on Banksville Rd.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Carmella C.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: Don't do online ordering here! I placed and paid for my order online one salad at 9:00pm. Said it was ready for pick up at 9:18. Got to the restaurant a few minutes before and the online ordering instructions says that whenever your order was ready they will drop it off to the designated online ordering counter. Ended up waiting until 10 pm. The whole time 2-3 different waitresses saw me waiting never asked if I needed help or for anything. Finally at ten I decided to say is my order ready it's supposed to be done at 918 and they said oh yeah here you go and they didn't give me utensils or a dressing like I requested. Not to mention all I ordered was ONE salad. It shouldn't take a whole hour from 9-10pm for a salad.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Billy L.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: I truly do not know where to begin. This Eat'n Park is absolutely horrific. The staff is terrible from the high school girls who work at night to the older women who work in the day time. I haven't had a good experience here in the longest time. The dinning room is always a mess, the staff has no urgency to wait on you, the food takes forever no matter if there is 5 people or 50 in the restaurant. The staff is incredibly rude. I never met a more miserable group of waitresses in my life. I live very close to the Dormont location but I highly recommend driving the extra mile to go to the one on Banksville Rd. or go up the street to Tom's Diner.  The restaurant was recently remodeled but they should of just demolished it because it's a disaster.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Kelly M.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description:
Two words - salad bar!!!!!!

If you are a sucker for a good salad you need to come here and build your own heaping plate complete with delicious homemade dressings.

Their soups are excellent - my fave is the chili (it's a soupier version) and the stuffed pepper soup.

Their fried zucchini and provolone sticks are hand-battered and always fresh; both go amazing with their famous ranch dressing. 

As for entrees- I honestly have never found one that is absolutely to die for- most are just homemade classics and modern American eats. They add in a special dish here and there (like a summer salad or spicy pasta dish or fish dish during lent) as well. I personally enjoy their rosemary chicken breast with mashed potatoes (ask for rosemary sauce on the potatoes instead of gravy - yummy), their shredded pot roast sandwich with the salad bar, and also the Santa Fe turkey sandwich which sadly was taken off of the menu when I was last there- I think they may bring it back as a limited item in the future as it was reasonably popular.

Their cinnamon rolls ("stickies") are delicious as well, and if you aren't already stuffed, try the "stickies a la mode" for dessert. Or one of their many homemade pies, one of which is at a discounted price every month. 

Don't ignore this hometown staple! It's as dear to Pittsburghers as Primanti Bros.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Joe C.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: Worst breakfast ever . Don't order breakfast off the menu what you 'll get is left overs from the buffet Eat m Park was a good restaurant at one time .  This happens twice now ,once in Monroeville and now I'm Penn Hills .The last time it happens Corporate said they would correct this practice but that was to just humor me. Last time for our family at Eat m Park!!!

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Dean G.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: My late night go-to place when I get a hunger attack in Pittsburgh! I loved it.  Have one of the Smile Breakfasts, they are very tasty and satisfy the munchies without overstuffing your belly.  Plus ,  Excellent service!  Denny's doesnt hold a candle to this eatery!

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Meg F.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: I LOVE Eat n Park. I know so many Pittsburghers who bust on this wonderful establishment, and I don't get it, bc E & P is amazing. The salad bar, the milkshakes, the chicken noodle soup.... the grilled stickies a la mode!!! Those are a few of my favorites. They're open 24 hours which is the coolest, and it's super reliable. A hometown chain with fast service and low prices, can't beat that. I've also been told recently that they're pretty into supporting the Pittsburgh economy, sourcing much of their produce and food supplies locally. And can I say that in an era of so much ageism in the workplace, I love that Eat n Park employs many senior employees. A true champion born here in our own fair city.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Cipriano M.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description:
My new friends I met in Pittsburgh took me here for a late after bar breakfast. I've never heard or dined at this chain-restaurant. It is 24-7 place. I ordered the Grilled Stickies since that is their trade-mark food. It is like a French-Toast stick, but with other flavors and fillings. It was delicious. The meal came with eggs and bacon. It cost about $6. Not bad at all for a great amount of food. 

The interior was cute, clean, different, causal, and I loved the smiles all around. This place will make you smile. The restroom was clean as well. My friends enjoyed their meal and everyone was pleased.

The only downfall I had, was only waitress was not very attentive to us. I don't know if she was better with her other tasks or on a smoke break. She was nice and friendly, but not around when you needed her. 

Overall, I was very impressed with this place. The menu offers a large variety of tasteful treats and meals. I wish I could go back to Pittsburgh for this chain-restaurant to try more of their food options. Worth trying out in my opinion.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Michelle A.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description:
I just have to say, Regina is the best. She was attentive and efficient, two of my favorite qualities! Seriously though, she was fantastic. This is a 24 hour location, so you know the staff deals with jerks, but you would never know based on the smiles and warm greetings...even at 3 am. 

Eat, visit, tip. Regina is great!

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Zanya F.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: Request Macie!! She's the best server. We love her and request her everytime. The food is here is whatever but we always have a great time with the great company. Macie is the only reason my boyfriend and I come everytime.

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Julieanna L.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description: Newly renovated the restaurant has a diner feel with an updated touch. The menu hasn't changed but the quality is even better. Opt for the salad bar or one of many items on their menu and you won't be disappointed! Don't leave until you have a slice of their homemade pies or shakes, they'll leave you dying for more!

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Joe D.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description:
Okay Eat N' Park, come clean, you DID change the recipe for the smiley cookie, fess up! Something is missing, skimping on the bourbon vanilla? Lemon extract from the icing? They just don't taste like they used to! My advice, find the original recipe and go back to it! 

Good coffee, great breakfasts, love the salad bar, that potato soup is still creamy and satisfying as I remember. Love the whole grain & blueberry pancakes too. 

Eat n Park has been a great place to go after a night of imbibing much alcohol. Getting a big stack to soak up the old fashioneds and martinies, extra butter and syrup! And, that amazing corned beef hash on English muffins with two sunny side up eggs, or just a huge class of whole milk and a buttery bear claw. These all helped me lessen pain of morning hangovers on many occasion. 

It's a Pittsburgh classic, but dang, you did mess with the cookies, I know ya did!

nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.author: Victoria S.
nzaEIvPWOL9UQhpGWy2fqA.description:
Every eat n park is different, referring to the service and food quality. I like this establishment because of the salad bar (the Dormont and Banksville ones are my top choices), and the fact that this place is all about the kiddos. It is not too over priced, but to each their own. I particularly like the chicken Romano. It has a tasty white wine sauce to it. The other go to's for dinner is the baked floridian(in orange juice), and the Rosemary chicken. For breakfast: I would just go for the buffet. There is plenty to choose from and they have a decent breakfast/sausage gravy. Lunch: the buffalo chx wrap, turkey club, and the pot roast sandwich. 
They have very good pies. The strawberry pie is our favorite. Pretty soon, they should be having their pie special (a slice for $2).

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Chuck H.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
I wanted to try this place for lunch for awhile now and was not disappointed. The chicken wings where very good and the fries were perfect. Thanks for a great lunch

Chuck

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Pat D.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
Sooo let me tell you how we ended up here. We are on a quest to try Pittsburgh's best through the alphabet. We started with places that start with "A", and go to "Z." The only rule is, neither I nor my girlfriend could have eaten there before. Let's just say that there are not a lot of "Q" restaurants around. 

Arrive at Quik-It-Chicken. A gas station/ hair salon/ chicken shack hybrid, it actually smells really good inside and even on the car ride home, our take out smelled amazing. The taste was close. 

I got the Quik Meal- a wing and a leg, with collard greens and a corn muffin.

Chicken (on bone)- 3.3/5 
The chicken was sitting out a while so I put it in my air fryer for a little bit when I got home which made it better. It tasted fine but could have been seasoned a bit more. I want to try a fresh piece of chicken right out of the fryer. 

Collard greens- 3.7/5
The collard greens are exactly what I expected, cooked right with a kick!

Cornbread muffin- 4.6/5
But the corn muffin... let me tell you about this fluffy, moist, decadent, corn bread muffin... MMMMMMM! I'd be back just for one of these God's gifts to earth.

Chicken tenders- 1.8/5
My girlfriend got the chicken fingers which sadly, were poorly breaded and very, very dry. Avoid at all costs. 

If you're in the area and want some fried chicken, stop in. You'll get your fix. Definitely get a muffin!

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Alycia W.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
I walked in, staff looked at me and didn't greet or acknowledged me. I waited as one of the staff stood near the cash register and did not make eye contact. Finally someone who was preparing food asked what I needed. I think people forget what customer service is and it shows in the lack of care in how they treat customers, especially first timers. Maybe it was just me...

Positive is that the food was done in advance.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Joshua B.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: This was a pretty tight spot. I got a ribs dinner and it was pretty solid. The counter woman, who was lovely, picked me out solid ribs.  For my sides I got a mashed potatoes which was good. I also got a mac & cheese which was pretty average in my opinion. The last side that I got was the cornbread stuffing and I thought that that was really good. My wife thought that cornbread was ridiculously good. I gave her my piece because I was full and I'm just an overall nice guy.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Cass B.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
Love Quik-It and have since i was a little girl and they were on federal street.   My parents would ask Pizza or Chicken on a friday night and my vote was always Quik-It.   Revisited after realizing I was in the area and I had to stop.  Best decision ever!  Chicken - outstanding,  Sides - great,  corn muffin - come to mama! 

This review is totally a selfish ambition though since I see that the owner is very responsive on yelp.  :-) 

Whatever happened to those really long and thick french fries? (I told you I've been a fan a long time!)  I mean they were the best!  I've searched high and low for them in the world but have never found another.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Salvatore A.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
Their bbq is absolutely fantastic. The right amount of smoke flavor, falling off the bone meat, no gristle or fat. The fries were tasty and crispy. 

This was my wife and my first time trying here. We ordered through UberEATS. 

Uber screwed our order up the first time by not sending it through. After calling the restaurant, they were extremely helpful and got right on our order. 

The cons, for me, come down to my preference. I personally like a thicker red beans and rice, and a little more bbq sauce on my ribs. But that's me. Everything else was perfect. 

I hope one day they have brisket. It's been a very long time since I had a good BBQ brisket, and I feel like they would knock it out of the park. 

We will be ordering from them again. Amazing!

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Jake R.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: I was told this was the best chicken in town. I was told the truth. The chicken is so tender and juicy on the inside with the perfect amount of crunch on the outside. Very friendly and fast. I'll be back for sure.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Vee B.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
I had the chicken wings with fries, REALLY great food. I loved it- I was half way through the wings before I got home ! Food tastes fresh and is slammin. Ohh and the cornbread I could eat cornbread until I slip into a food coma! 
The owner is super nice and you can tell he puts his heart and soul into the food he makes. There are a lot of sides too, I didn't get to try them but I will next time I stop in.
Great food good prices, thank you  Quik-It!

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Josh C.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
The wife and daughter wanted fried chicken on a Sunday afternoon and with a little checking around we landed on Quik-It Chicken.  
I placed the order over the phone and went to pick it up.  Do not be frightened by the area/building.  The interior is clean enough and the people are friendly.  
We ended up getting one of the meals with chicken, corn muffins, and sides.  The prices are very reasonable and if I'm being honest down right cheap.  
My daughter was tortured with the 12 minute drive back home having to smell the glorious fried chicken.
First, the sides.  Corn muffins were definitely tasty, moist and full of flavor. All too often corn bread is bone dry, but these were delicious.  The green beans were squeaky and not overcooked, just how we like them.  A ton of water in the cup along with some diced onions.  Cole slaw was finely diced mayo based slaw and good.  Last side were the fries, they were the large pillowy steak fries that our family isn't a fan of.  They tossed them in hot into the Styrofoam container rendering them soggy, oh well.  
The chicken though is why you'd come here.  Crispy, crunchy as my daughter put it.  I cannot stand when fried chicken is greasy and this wasn't, perfectly moist while having that crunchy exterior.  Not much seasoning so I was happy I had some hot sauce at home.  
For the money you cannot beat Quik-It-Chicken.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Veronica S.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: Chicken here is always hot and delicious as are all the sides! I've never been disappointed. Been a repeat customer for years and years

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Brandy S.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
Shoulda done my research.

I had very little time between meetings to order and then eat my lunch. I found this place  through Uber Eats. Since I'd never heard of it, I thought "cool, a small business with homemade food and the menu looks amazing". I ordered quickly and then moved on to my next task. 

When it was delivered, I was really excited to try everything. Ribs, greens, baked beans, cornbread muffin, and, I was the lucky recipient of mashed potatoes that I didn't order, even better! (or so I thought) 

When it came time to eat, it was a much different story. The bbq sauce wasn't great, although the ribs were pretty tender. The mashed potatoes were a strange consistency, definitely not homemade. What really got to me was that everything had a strange after taste. And it was the same flavor across everything. I can't figure out what it might have been, it was more "chemical" than herb or spice. At first it didn't seem too bad, but a few minutes into my meal, it became overwhelming to me and I just couldn't do it anymore. Ended up throwing the rest out. Although the food is gone, the taste is still lingering.

Just had a quick moment to stop and check out Yelp to see if maybe this was a one-off issue? From reading other reviews, I didn't see anyone reporting the same thing so maybe it's usually different or it's just my personal preference (I'm by no means a picky eater though and rarely give less than stellar reviews). However, it made sense to see that it came out of a gas station because it tasted like it came out of a gas station. 

Sorry, I really wanted to like it.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Veronica B.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: I wasn't too satisfied just recently. Which I'm sad to report. Everything tasted so seasonless, especially the sides. The greens tasted like it was just boiled in water. And the stuffing was extremely runny. The chicken was, eh ok. I was very disappointed. :(

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Eve A.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: I was so disappointed by my first order from Quik-it! I'd been dying try them since I'd moved to the North Side and had heard friends rave about their chicken. My sister and brother-in-law were coming over, so I placed an order on Grubhub around 3pm, to be delivered at 6. At 5:40 I got a call from Grubhub saying that Quik-it was out of ribs, so they'd canceled by order altogether. I called the restaurant directly to try to get something else in place of the ribs (we had about $80 worth of food ordered). There was no manager available, though the nice woman said I could place a new order on Grubhub, just without ribs (and a few other things they were out of). I went back to Grubhub and was told the restaurant is not taking orders at this time. I really tried, but I guess it wasn't meant to be. I won't order from Quik-it again.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Tyoko B.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
Quik It has been around for a long time and I remember my mom stopping by after church to pick up chicken for dinner or just to munch on. I was in the neighborhood and had a hankering for something soulful, so I stopped.

I MUST say something about the appearance of the "joint". This is a gas station, restaurant and hair place rolled into one but separated by 2 doors. Talk about convenience...if you're into weaves n stuff. Lol The restaurant looks like a fast food establishment but nothing was inviting about it. There are signs advertising specials everywhere but they are very confusing because a few of them had different prices for the same combos. You're better off just paying attention to the board behind the counter. To the left of the counter are a few old greasy fryers and based on the looks of them, I doubt they work. No big deal but they're dirty and I just wonder why someone would put them there...of all places. Did I say they are dirty?

The sides are set up in plain view, just like the picture on here shows.  I'm addition to the items I selected, the case held stewed tomatoes, red beans n rice, stuffing, mashed potatoes, gravy, corn, green beans and I may be missing something. There were sweets advertised on one of the posters but I don't remember seeing a list of what was available. The chicken is supposed to be the star of the show but, when I visited tonight, it was sitting off to the side with no warmer on and I didn't smell that just fried chicken smell. You know the smell I'm talking about. (Unless you've never fried chicken--- tell me it ain't so!) Anyway, I didn't feel like being inquisitive so I just went with the Quik It bowl which consisted of 2 sides and cornbread for $3.99. I chose greens and Mac n cheese to go. The lady who waited on us was very nice and offered up smiles which I truly appreciate. 

When I got home and tasted everything, it wasn't bad. I will even venture to say it was tasty. The greens were seasoned well. The Mac n cheese was the Stouffer type but a tad bit cheesier if that makes sense. It was the comfort food I needed on this chilly night. Now, the cornbread muffin may need its own review because it was HEAVENLY! OMG...it was like a sweet pillow of moist ground corn. Sorry, I can't even put it into words. Let me put it to you like this, when I saw my daughter almost throw away her untouched muffin, I was ready to dive across the kitchen to stop her from committing that sin! Lol It really was yummy!

I plan to go back and visit to try the chicken from my past and then update this review.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: chaos w.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: Fantastic Chicken!! I'm not much of a Fried Chicken guy, but when you tag it as "Party Fried" Ill try it.. Breast was big and juicy, the wings were huge, the fried part was a party! Ate every piece!.. If you want wings, not like one of those Kids meal .35cent ones, this is the place.. Delicious!!

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Ross G.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: Ordered from here for the first time tonight. They didn't have everything we ordered initially, which should have been our first warning that we should have just cancelled and ordered from somewhere else. When the food arrived, items were not included that were supposed to be. The macaroni and cheese was poorly textured, the chicken was average at best, and since we didn't receive the cornbread it's probably safe to assume that was average as well. The chicken that arrived was not as described on the menu, meaning the pieces were completely different than what was anticipated. We would not recommend ordering from here, and will not be trying this again.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Keon W.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: Arrived around 2:45 PM in the place was empty. I ordered a three-piece, the meat was dry and was not hot. The best thing about the meal was the cornbread which was hot. The restrooms are disgusting. I will not be back

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Lacey A.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
Extremely rude staff. I called at 9 pm to order takeout. The lady said that the kitchen was closed. I told her, "I thought you guys were open until 9." She replied with "Yes but tonight we're closing early." No explanation, no sorry, NOTHING! I then began to say that they should really display those changes on Yelp or their website. She hung up on me. 

The previous time I called for takeout and they were out of four of my six items. No apology from the staff member. Completely rude and acted like I was an inconvenience. 

I will not be coming back here, which is a shame because I enjoyed the food.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Theron G.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description:
I have been here three times.

1) The first time, I arrived at 9:45 p.m. on a Sunday night. Despite Yelp (and website hours) saying that they were open until midnight, the woman told me that she had shut down the kitchen and wasn't cooking anything new, so I left. [Update: I submitted to Yelp to update the hours, so now it says that they are open until 10 p.m.]

2)The second time I ordered a chicken strips meal (as I hate meat on the bone) with French fries and a cornbread muffin. The chicken strips were OK; the seasoning was weak, the meat was slightly dry, but there was A LOT of meat! I felt like each one was at least half the size of a full chicken breast. And the cornbread muffin was absolutely phenomenal!!!

3) The third time I stopped by at, like, 6:45 p.m. with the intent of trying the highly-recommended sweet potatoes and apples with a chicken strips meal,
--with a cornbread muffin, of course!--but this time the woman told me that they weren't serving chicken strips as they hadn't thawed any that day. What?! They just decided that no one was gonna get an advertised food that entire day? To me, that's a bit messed up.

The service seemed curt and somewhat unapologetic the first and third times I was there. The second time, it was decent--the bare minimum that you should expect--but it's not like the woman was super friendly or anything. I'm confused by the reviews where people say they had fantastic service. I'm not creepy or rude or anything.

If there was a KFC or Popeyes close-by, I'd probably not give them another chance, but as it is, it is one of the only food places open within walking later in the evening . . . I don't know. When winter is over, I'd probably instead just walk the mile to the fast food places near the Allegheny T station instead. That's sad, because I'd really prefer to patronize local small establishments like Quik-It Chicken instead. But even if customer service at Taco Bell sucks, at least they'll be open when they say they will, and they'll have the food available that's on the menu.

RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.author: Louann M.
RcpBuH5LHNj1v9MT1JK22w.description: Best chicken in the burgh!!! I work on the northside myself & a co-worker order about once a week. The owner is also super friendly!

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Joe M.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: Went on a run and stopped by this place after the run on a Monday night. Had the chicken adana and lamb gyro - phenomenal. It's really a beautiful interior and was shocked how empty it was. The waitress said they just made the adana fresh and you could tell. The rice was perfect kinda buttery and delicious with the side sauces too. 100% going back again

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Alfonsina S.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description:
We ventured out to have lunch as a treat. And we chose this place since it was on our list of places that we wanted to try. Hubby had a combo plate with the lamb Gyro and another item, and I had the moussaka.
We split lebneh as an appetizer.  The server kept checking on us produce containers when we needed to put leftovers in them because we couldn't finish the absolutely fabulous food. Definitely gonna come back

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Jennifer J.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: I asked for extra tziki sauce, they give you one tiny cup that's completely watered down and does not adhere to your pita bread when you try to dip your bread, I ordered chicken kabab  and aidan kebab, proteins did not taste fresh , i would only order here again if these guys were the only place open at the time that im craving turkish food. Go elsewhere! Salad they give u with ur food sucks too! Just a handfull of bagged lettuce!

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Bulent T.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description:
My wife and I love this place. Great quick service. 
Food is always fresh and tasty, servers are friendly and always helpful
We will be back soon

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Abbie S.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: It's nice that the menu has pictures for each dishes. The Shish Kebabs (lamb/chicken) are very tasty. Price is reasonable and the food's size portion is pretty good for guys. The waitress is very friendly. She also gives good recommendations for us the first-time-visit. It'd be nice if our foods could come sooner, but the wait is worthwhile as the foods are really good. I'd be interested on trying other plates next time.

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Olivia G.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: This place was absolutely amazing! My roommate and I were itching to try it because it just opened up down the street, and it did not disappoint. We got the falafel, the mixed grill option to share, and the baklava for dessert. They even gave us complimentary tea with our meal. The meal was MORE THAN enough for two people, we even had some leftover. The baklava was incredible and I would come back for that alone. The falafel came with pita (or it may have been complimentary) but it was excellent regardless. The meat was all perfectly spiced and flavored and tender, super moist and delicious. Definitely come here if you are looking for authentic Turkish food and an awesome friendly staff!

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Olivera T.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: Best food in Pittsburgh! I had Lamb Adana, with the special homemade hot sauce and Sheppard salad and it was delicious! You have to try the Turkish tea And baklava or the Brown Top Pudding! Service is great also!

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Fran M.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: My son attends university of Pittsburgh and we decided to try a new place. It was a pleasant surprise to find such a warm friendly staff and delicious food! My sons and I highly recommend trying the kebabs and gyro platter.

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Audra W.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: Aside from being one of the only places to eat late in Pittsburgh (past 9pm) it is also excellent. We ordered hummus, a chicken kebab plate to split, and our waitress highly recommended the baklava so we tried that. Everything was fabulous - hummus was rich, the kebab was cooked perfectly, tender and flavorful, but this baklava was incredible. She did not lead us astray! I haven't had baklava like this anywhere. Nutty, delicious and not like the normal overly saccharine stuff you usually get. It's homemade. She also brought us some tea. We found our new late night joint. I will definitely be returning and ordering take out in the future.

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Amer M.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: I went to this restaurant couple of times. The food was delicious. The waiter was friendly and welcoming.

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Erin F.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: Apparently this place recently moved to its current location from Squirrell Hill. I am really happy about that! The food is really good. I had the chicken Adana entree and my husband had the Special Village beef.  The portions were generous and the service was attentive, but not overbearing. We will definitely be back soon!

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Jenna B.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: Same great ownership and menu as the Turkish Kabob House in Squirrel Hill. Love both restaurants. Very casual, good for eat in or take out. The Baba Ganoush and Falafel (by itself, in a plate, or in a wrap) are absolutely excellent. Many other good dishes, but I always go back to these two.

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Shara S.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: This is an ok place. Service was slow and distracted, the lamb kebab was good but it was not what I had ordered. the server got my order wrong and no one was interested in fixing it. The chicken was over cooked and lacked flavor. Portion sizes are on the smaller side and the pita looks and tastes store bought.

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Rieko M.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: Quiet corner restaurant with comfortable tables. Tasty kabobs over rice. The server was very charming and helpful to identify their specialty dishes and describing how they are served. Must try if you enjoy Mediterranean food.

7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.author: Leslie T.
7rO0ET3aQLT_NtFutyZC1w.description: I went because I was curious to see what the folks who took over Avenue B's place were offering.  Meh!  My lamb dish was over-priced and underwhelming.  What little meat there was on the platter was tough, chewy, and buried in a thick, gooey sauce. This tomato sauce was supposed to have some spice--instead, I had a charred hot pepper and a burned tomato at each end of the platter.  The sauce itself was bland and overly thick with yogurt and soggy pita bread, making it genuinely unappetizing.  I had a Mediterranean salad that had exactly 1 black olive in it.  The salad was tasty enough, but again, for the size of the salad and the price tag attached, you'd think there'd be something more interesting going on on the plate (and in the mouth in terms of flavor).  My server was quite polite, but not particularly efficient or attentive.  Maybe the cook was having a bad day, but based on this experience, I am not ever likely to dine here again.  There's no way this lunch was worth $26 dollars--I can get a lot more bang for my buck elsewhere.

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Keri S.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description:
I shrieked when I found out Pittsburgh was getting a halal cart. I'm from NY and lived off of $7 halal food through college. 

I went on opening day and I was impressed. There were a bunch of guys working the cart. One took orders/payment while another guy cooked. It was very organized and all the people who worked there were super friendly and helpful. I'm not sure how they're gonna roll out delivery because they were in high demand!

I ordered chicken over rice and a falafel on a pita. The chicken over rice is definitely on par with NY halal carts. It's spiced nicely and I love the fresh veggies. My husband and I housed it in 2 minutes. Not a joke. The falafel was made with love and the chef seemed so proud of the final product...it was really cute how proud he was when wrapping it up! It was alfresh and delicious. The white sauce was everything I hoped for. The hot sauce wasn't as spicy as expected (but they warned me so I just got extra!) 

I will be back. A lot. 

Update: everyone that works here is amazing! They went above and beyond to accommodate my requests for extra hot sauce. I don't know many restaurants that will take advice from customers to better customer experience but they are rocking it! Also they're open late late late!

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Laura L.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description:
Truly a taste of New York in Pittsburgh! Granted it's not the same but it's a refreshing look for our campus! 
My friends and I shared two COMBO PLATTERS. The combo platter included chicken, lamb, and salad. It was a good amount of food, filling and tasty. I especially liked the lamb and white sauce!! The price is also aMAzInG!!! The platter is only $6.99. 
Sadly, it was just one man running the whole truck so the line became pretty backed up. Because of how busy it was he forgot to give us hot sauce, but he was super efficient and friendly!! 
Will definitely return in the future when I'm craving halal food and low in funds!

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Karen L.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description:
So so glad there is the NY-feeling if a halal cart serving chicken over rice. The people there were excited to be in Pittsburgh and excited to share their food. 

Got my chicken over rice and it was absolutely delicious! For those who are interested, it is meat cooked served with rice, pita, and a side of salad. The white sauce and the hot sauce is a must! The price is very reasonable and comes with a drink. I would say this is a new gem in the Oakland area. I cannot wait to go back again. They also have a variety of other options too. Must try!!

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Eva R.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: Was very excited to try this food cart as Pittsburgh does not have any halal food carts. I had the chicken and lamb combo, which was about $7. I also had the spicy and white sauce put on. The guy was nice and gave us each a falafel while we waited for our food. The chicken and lamb combo was good, but nothing out of this world. I was hoping for more flavor from either the meat, sauces, or rice, but it tasted pretty lackluster. I also thought the portion could have been more. The box was not really stuffed and I easily finished it in one sitting. I was thinking how a chipotle bowl is around the same price yet much more filling. Overall, nice and quick food option in the Oakland area if looking for Halal food.

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Maher K.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: Best Falafel over Rice I had in Pitt. Price is cheaper than chipotle. The guy is super nice and I had a great conversation with him while he was preparing my food.

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Ginny G.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: I had The Halal Guys in New York City so I was excited to find out that Pittsburgh has one now! The food is priced fairly, with tasty flavor and good quality of meat, fresh veggie, and decent portion. I'll definitely come back. It is a great to-go food. Love it!!!!!

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Shorif R.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description:
As soon as my friends and I heard about this food cart we were filled with excitement. This has been our longest dream filling up on NYC style Halal Food in Pittsburgh. I am from NYC and grew up with these carts all over the city. The best meal deal for a college student like myself!! 
Exceptional Quality, Great Service.. Most of my friends agreed that the Platters & Gyros tasted better than the ones we have had in NYC. Honestly I'm craving a platter as I write this review. I will definitely be a repeat customer.

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Ideal E.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: OMG real Halal Food in Pittsburgh. Ever since I moved from New York, this is the one thing I missed the most. There's nothing like it in Pittsburgh, it reminds of my college days. Seven dollars buys you a full meal and a free drink. Same price as it is in New York. I will be a repeat customer. Expect to see me more often.

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Sahil N.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: My prayers have been answered! I'm from NJ/NYC, so this is just as big a staple for us as Pizza! I'm so happy this place opened! This is a family owned business and they are all very friendly! I had the chicken and lamb combo platter as well as the falafel platter. They packed it nicely for me, definitely enough portion. This is Bangladeshi Owned, which is actually awesome! Here's a secret, the best halal carts in NYC are Bangladeshi Owned...they flavor their rice better and add Tandoori spice to their chicken! It's NEXT LEVEL! The falafel was super fresh, chicken and lamb was as well. The highlight is the sauce, it's different than halal guys, a little creamier and heavier but it also has a hint of Dil, like a traditional Tzatziki Sauce! The hot sauce was spicy but not crazy like Halal Guys. BUT still don't get too carried away if you wanna keep your stomach lining in tact haha! Thank you for bringing a bit of home to Pittsburgh! Also this should teach other food establishments, especially local food trucks (not going to name names) that good food doesn't haven't to be $14 for a platter! If you find a place selling you a platter for more than $7, RUN AWAY and put your fist up in protest!

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Nik S.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: 5 stars. Food truck smelled so good I finally had to give it a try and it did not disappoint. so glad to have this food in oakland. combo platter is a must try and the guys working there make it a great experience. would recommend and will definitely be back!

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Sabrina C.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: I was excited to try this place and went on a Saturday evening. The line was pretty long but the 3 guys working were very apologetic about the wait and were all very friendly. I ordered the combo platter ($7) and made it deluxe (+$2) and the guys working made sure my box was packed with meat. The meats were very tasty and I got a lot of food for the price. I was a bit disappointed by the "deluxe" part of the meal, however, as the extra $2 went towards about 3 fries, a few bites of pita, and 1 piece of falafel. Next time I will probably skip the deluxe, as you get a lot of food already without it. I also recommend asking for a lot of white sauce. The meats are well marinated, but you can also ask for the red sauce if you want a bit more of a kick. Overall, I had a good experience and will likely be back for more halal food!

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Aidan B.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: Delicious food, all freshly made and affordable, no more than $9 a person even if you splurge, only $5 for a gyro and drink with anything you want in it.

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Aqib M.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: AMAZING NEW YORK STYLE GYRO!!! I've been waiting so long to find halal food of this caliber in the Pittsburgh area. I'm so thrilled to have halal pitt and with its prices matching the ones I get back home it's unbeatable. For $7 You'll get more than enough food and a very big change in taste that you'll receive in most of the places around here!

SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.author: Anthony S.
SKEG2ym9YgM9F9EQ_pPuIw.description: Sizable portions for $8 and comes with a drink, jot as huge as the ones in NY. Definitely will be my go-to from now on.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Casey N.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description:
Cute little deli that has yummy fresh food! Stopped in here to use a gift card I recieved and was not disappointed!

I order the buffalo chicken salad with grilled chicken and my friend ordered the crispy chicken bagel. Both came out super quick, after we selected our seats and both looked amazing! Every ingredient was super fresh and good quality! Staff was friendly and raved about different items on the menu.

Perfect little place to stop for a quick, fresh meal if you are in the area! I will be back to here again as well as to try Cafe Io!

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Deb D.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description:
bare bones deli.  great cooks, rude help.
french fries were outstanding.  salad,
nothing to write home about.
try io cafe a few doors down instead.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Russell D.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: I grew up just outside of New York City and know a good deli this place is very good They make their own corned beef and it's excellent . I've only had a corned beef sandwich and a Reuben there which we delicious so I can't tell you anything about the rest of the menu however my wife and her friends go there often and they always say the food is excellent . The deli has no atmosphere so if you're looking to take someone out for a  business lunch I would go elsewhere  but if you want  a quick sandwich and great food I recommend it

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Lynn E.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description:
We stopped in for lunch over the weekend.  One of my favorite places is Cafe IO.  The IO Deli didn't disappoint!

My husband had the chicken and waffles sandwich that smelled so yummy.  I honestly can't remember what I had, but I do remember it was one of their daily specials and it was good. Homemade chips weren't bad either.  I've been here before and just like at Cafe IO, their tomato bisque soup is really yummy.

The place is small, so mostly take out orders, but we sat in the window checking out the sites of Beverly Road as we ate. 

The staff is always friendly and our food came out fast.

Its a good place to stop in for a quick lunch.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Nick H.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: From their soups to their sandwiches, this wonderful little spot does food right. From homemade chili to hand brined corned beef, they go the extra mile to make sure their customers are happy and well stuffed. The specials and daily recommendations are consistently on point, and their traditional menu items will keep you returning every week!

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Michael H.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: If anyone grew up going to Dante Polices in Mt Lebo, you need to get to io Deli. Order the chicken bagel and cheese fries. You will think it's 1989 again! Everything here is fresh and cool. Great service too. Go and check this place out. It's both a throw back and a fresh new surprise all wrapped up in one place.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Sean Q.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description:
Average at best. Agree with prior review that staff seemed annoyed I was there. Order a buffalo chicken panini, but no buffalo favor. Bread was soggy and blue cheese that came with it was in a packet with it was not homemade.

Very disappointed compare to café I/O

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Joe H.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: I grew up in Philadelphia and ate corned beef in the best delis in Philadelphia and NYC. I saw the sign for homemade corned beef and took a chance. Damn, am I glad I did. Hot corned beef on marble rye with swiss and carmelized onions. Go try one now!

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Amy R.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: This place was a staple before it moved and now that it's moved, it's even better!  They used to do mostly just deli-style sandwiches, but upon expanding they've added some more complex options, such as wings and hotter foods.  Consistently tasty food with friendly and fast service. Plus, now a place to sit and enjoy the food right away instead of taking it back to the office.  I'm happy that the Iovino restaurants are doing well.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Michael S.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: The atmosphere is cozy, the service was ok, but the food was on point! I got the Crispy Chicken Bagel and my wife got the Meatloaf Sandwich.  Both were cooked perfectly and had amazing flavor. They were both served with sides of the Best Homemade Chips I've Ever Had.  They were so light and crisp and were reason alone to come back!  We really enjoyed our meals. Perfect comfort food! We will definitely be back.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Joana B.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: I've stopped in for lunch a couple of times now and I loved my orders. Their seafood salad is perfect and my favorite that I've had from anywhere. It's not overly dressed, or over seasoned. It's prepared just right and very fresh. I really enjoyed their salmon and prosciutto sandwich too. Looking forward to trying out their restaurant next door for dinner with our two sons. They even have kid friendly options.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Darren W.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description:
IO Deli is a pocket dimension of gourmet delicacies located a couple of doors down from Cafe IO, its parent restaurant. On two occasions last week, Kay and I found ourselves exploring it, Challengers of the Unknown that we are. 

Located within a narrow corridor of a storefront, the proprietors own a panini press and a meat slicer and are not above using both to full effect. 

Take for instance the masterful Corned Beef panino. A Reuben in sheep's clothing, the meat was ample as was Swiss cheese, the tart sauerkraut, the creamy Thousand Island dressing,  all of contained expertly within toasted rye bread and halved bisected. Salty, creamy, sweet strings were plucked, making for beautiful gastronomic music. Complimented by a large, halved dill pickle, Kay and I longed for a patch of green grass and a blanket. 

Mama Rea's "Famous" Potato Salad came next, quite frankly sending Grandma's to the nursing home for the rest of her days. I couldn't detect much else in the potato salad other than a sugary mayonnaise dressing and some mild herbs (perhaps parsley). There were no eggs, crunchy veggies, or paprika involved. No, this potato salad, featuring thinly sliced discs of spud excelled with an elegance of economy that I'd never encountered before. 

Dessert was a successfully chewy bake-sale level M&M chocolate chip cookie that put my candy canines to bed happily. 

My second visit centered around the Pizza Dog and the Squid Salad. Grilled in the panin press like the corned beef sandwich, the Smith's weiner was topped with mozzarella, tomato sauce, pepperoni, peppers, and a relish of tomato and red onion, taking it to Chi-Town in a deep pan pleasantly. 

The Squid Salad included chilled, al dente calamari (tentacles and all) and parsley in a simple olive oil/vinegar dressing. Gourmet as all get-out, this could have been served on a fancy plate in more opulent environs for much more than I was charged.
