It was as if it had been swiped from a table at Il Pizzaiolo via teleportation. Some fafcat musta got my tuna melt instead. 

IO Silverrrrr! Get on your horses and do some takeout here, pronto!

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Brooklyn S.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: This is the only deli in the neighborhood and thankfully it is amazing! You can get great lunch or dinner sandwiches. The deli meat is great - very high quality and very fresh. And I love that you can get it by the pound. The pre-made sides are also a great option. It's so refreshing to have a little deli near by.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: Mickey T.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: Not sure how this place still exists.  Staff seem annoyed every time a customer comes in to place an order.

pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.author: L S.
pZLOwjgfDmoOcZJAta7aFA.description: not open!! this place has excellent soups and a good variety of sandwich options. just make sure you have a backup plan if you want to stop in because theyre often randomly closed. hours on the website say open till 6 in one place and open till 8 in another but today when i got there at 4:30 they were closed. this is the third time in a month this has happened. yesterday i called to confirm they would be open till 8 but at 7:35 the door was already locked. panera definitely isnt better but at least they are open when they are supposed to be.  unfortunately i am done trying to patronize a shop that keeps disappointing.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Kashiff M.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
Happy hour Monday thru Sunday? Count me in! We were pleased to find not only the last two seats at the bar on a Saturday evening during a pens game, but that there was also happy hour going on. $3 drafts, $4 long islands, $5 house wine and a variety of apps on special. Easily the best news all week!

I ordered a brand new menu item, a harvest bowl with flavorful sauteed garlic mushrooms, asparagus, Roma tomatoes, carrots, almonds and full grain rice. Everything tasted like it was picked minutes before and prepared naturally. This review doesn't do the meal justice. I'm thinking about going back as I'm writing this now!

Service was quick and friendly and everything came exactly as we requested. I can't say enough about my experience. Head in and find out for yourself.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Jen A.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: This place used to be one of my favorite to go for good food and a nice happy hour. Not entirely sure what happened but the food has consistently gone down hill and the happy hour is simply not that happy of an hour or two. With many other options in the surrounding area, go somewhere else.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Lexi N.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
I truly did want to like Walnut Grill. With all the delicious options that make it so hard to decide it really disappoints me that their food isn't as good as it sounds. I've tried both this location and the Robinson location now and I have to say it just isn't worth your money.

At this particular location I got the french onion soup and the California eggs benedict. The soup was the only good thing I've ever eaten at either location. The eggs benedict was absolutely terrible. Tasted nothing like hollandaise sauce and it was just so bland.

The only reason I feel like I can give it a 2 star is because our waitress was extremely nice. She was the absolute sweetest. Otherwise I would not recommend Walnut Grill to anyone.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Krissy G.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Staff was pleasant and easy to work with our large group. Food was nicely cooked as well.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Charles R.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
Instead of going to a favorite breakfast spot, we gave their new breakfast hours a try. The food and coffee were fine. Sadly, from the entry foyer to our seats, the place looked dirty. A layer of grimy dust covered the shelf and lamps above our booth. Our server stepped away and returned later smelling of tobacco smoke.
TV noise from the bar rattled the breakfast atmosphere.
The staff took our complaint seriously. Perhaps they'll show some pride and clean up for their guests.
We'll stick with our favorites.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Debbie I.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: I gave it a two because the sauce on my chicken was good however I spent $17 on a piece of chicken that was 1/3 about half a breast there was also a tiny Caesar salad with croutons that only tasted of burnt garlic. The dressing why is watery. What a waste of money and I would never buy anything here again

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Kaitlin S.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: The wait wasn't very long at all. Although the food wasn't really amazing. There wasn't anything wrong with our meals, they were just lacking in some flavor and creativity. What I'm trying to get at here is that the food here was honestly just ok. Also, at the time most of the requests we made were declined because the things we asked for- like fruit as a side- were not delivered yet. The Walnut Grill isn't horrible but it's not amazing either. I don't think we will be coming again.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Shane T.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: I came with my in-laws to enjoy the happy hour specials. We got a variety of appetizers and some drinks before a few of us ordered dinners. The deals were good for a happy hour special. It was very loud in the bar area though and maybe conversation very difficult. Over we had an enjoyable experience.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Jimmy P.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Went for brunch, by far not a great experience. disappointed in selection, service was questionable at best. Went up twice no omelette guy at station. Will not be back .

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Nelson B.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: The ambiance is really casual and a nice place for dinner or happy hour. Their entrees are decent sized for a meal and their sweet potato fries are really good.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Greg P.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
Ugh. How is this place still in business?? Came here for food and drinks. First off - food is normal. It's not amazing, it's not outstanding... it doesn't suck, it's just normal, nothing special. I could probably tolerate the food better if it was priced accordingly, but let's be real, they think they're a fine dining establishment with those prices. I could probably justify paying that much if the food was amazing, but it's not. 

Secondly, and this is really what drives the 1 star, this place has the worst service of any restaurant in the area. I'm talking about waiting for 10 min to even get approached by a waitress who then gives you attitude, takes your drinks, disappears for another 5 min, drops off drinks and leaves again and doesn't come back for another 10 min. I was dumbfounded on how poor the service was. Food dropped at the table and no check in from the waitress until about 30 min later, at which point were already done. Then she comes by and says "desert?". Not "how was everything, can I get you anything, etc". Just "desert?". We decline, she drops the check on the table and walks away. As in, she already had it printed and ready to go, didn't say a word, just dropped it and walked away. 

Overall, staff is rude. That's not the first time I've came across this here. Food is ok. I wouldn't waste another dollar here. Plenty of other places to go to in Fox Chapel and surrounding areas. Honestly surprised they're still in business.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Kathleen A.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: I love this place for a cheap after work happy hour. Granted it's out in the suburbs but their prices are unbeatable and happy hour goes from 5-7 which is later than most. I usually go for the $3/4 glass of wine and occasionally some bar food. There is a lot of seating and a nice atmosphere. There's typically an older crowd (late 30s-50s) but not necessarily a bad thing. On occasion service can be a little slow. I'll keep returning as long as the prices and hours continue!

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Roxann G.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Took a picture of my fork that fell in a PUDDLE on the cold, damp floor by my seat. We ate in our coats. 2 of the 3 gas heaters were "out of gas" at 5 pm on New Year's Eve. (?) Empty tables in the bar the entire time we were there, but we couldn't eat inside because we were told that they "just got 100 reservations" this very day. Amazing!!! Funny thing is that 2 days ago we called for a reservation and were told that they couldn't take reservations for the bar on New Year's Eve. All of a available management were on board with this treatment. Wonder what the truth was??? Sure felt like discrimination to me. We were long time customers, and that is why we stayed and paid our bill, but we will never go back. Ethics training for management is recommended!

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Matt N.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
We went here for lunch on my wife's birthday.  When we first parked outside of the restaurant we saw that they had outdoor sitting and an outdoor bar.  It looked nice.  Luckily it was sunny out and a nice day so we decided to sit outside.    The inside looked nice and it was big but you can't beat sitting outside in the warm weather for lunch.


     They let us sit wherever we wanted outside.  You could either sit at the outside bar, you could sit on their high table tops, or they had regular sized tables to sit at as well.  At first we sat on a high top but the table was a little too small for us so we settled for a regular sized table.  The outside area that we were in was covered but they had an uncovered area too in the back.  It was really nice and relaxing outside.  The Sam Adams Oktoberfest was out early so we both ordered the Oktoberfest.  


     They gave us a lunch menu and a dinner menu.  We were hungry but it was lunch time so we decided to go for the lunch menu.  The lunch menu is basically the dinner menu just with smaller portions.  I ordered the Salmon Balsamico with a side of sweet potatoes fries and my wife got the same thing but she got a side of vegetables and a side salad.  I really liked my salmon.  It had marinated roma tomatoes, goat cheese, basil, balsamic reduction in it.  The sweet potatoes fries look great and some of the fries tasted really good.  The problem was most of them weren't cooked long enough so they were a little hard in the middle.  The fires that were done were excellent.  I decided to take them home and I warmed them up to make them softer and that worked!  


     My wife had a coupon for her birthday so it was a buy one meal get one free.  You really have to sign up for things like this for your birthday if you don't already.  It really saved us a lot of money for her birthday weekend.  Since she had this coupon they knew it was her birthday so the waitress asked if she would like a free Caramelized Walnut Ball.  My eyes got really big because I knew my wife doesn't eat dessert so this would really be for me!  It was a nice gesture from them to give us a free dessert for her birthday.  I did give my wife a bite or two of the walnut ball but I inhaled the rest of that dessert!


     Overall we had a really nice lunch date for my wife's birthday.  We sat around after lunch and had a few more beers to enjoy the weather and each other.  It was great.  If I could go back I would have probably just ordered from the dinner menu to get more food but I was still happy with the portion of my salmon.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Carrie N.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
For all who are unaware, if you go to Walnut Grill's website and sign up for their mailing list you will receive a coupon for a free dinner or lunch entrée for your birthday.  It's a pretty sweet deal so of course I wanted to take advantage of this offer on my birthday.  We went here for a late lunch after seeing a matinee movie at the nearby cinema.

The restaurant has a lovely outdoor seating area, and it was a nice afternoon to eat and drink outside.  For lunch I opted for the Salmon Balsamico.  It came with marinated roma tomatoes, goat cheese, basil, balsamic reduction.  I kind of think goat cheese, or any cheese on a piece of fish is let's say fishy to me so I scraped it off.  My husband got the same thing adding some sweet potato fries and myself a side salad.  

Service was pretty good, our waitress was attentive, and we didn't wait long for refills.  Our food came out with a normal wait.  I think my husband liked his salmon more than I liked it.  It was cooked well, just thought it could have been seasoned a little better, and the goat cheese, though scraped off lingered on the fish.  I love goat cheese, just not on expensive fish.  If it has cheese on it, it should only be served at a fast food restaurant where you may make claims that it's not real fish.  Speaking of expensive, I thought their prices were a little high verses their portions.  I hate to kick a gift horse in the mouth, but kind of true.


Nevertheless, we had a very nice afternoon at Walnut Grill and was even given free desert a walnut ice cream ball.  This was much more of a treat for my husband than myself since I believe I had a bite or two and he gobbled the rest of it down.  Very nice touch to end my epic birthday weekend.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Angela K.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: I have been coming here for a few years now and I have never once experienced a bad meal or bad service. I usually sit at the bar if I pop in alone on a lunch break, but the staff is always friendly and I could honestly eat their food everyday if I had the chance (especially their ahi tacos and tater tot appetizer)! My husband enjoys this place as well and as many others have mentioned, GREAT for happy hours! Even off happy hour time, the drinks are not super expensive and they always have some kind of promotion going on (1/2 wine bottles, $4 titos, etc). I cant speak for all locations, but the Waterworks exceeds my expectations each visit.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Wes N.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: I think this place is good. The space itself is nice, they have outdoor seating, both covered and uncovered. Went here recently with a large group and our service was really good and our food was also brought out very fast. The food I've had here has ranged from average to good. They have a pretty good happy hour and I believe they do an all-day daily drink special. Overall a solid choice for lunch or dinner.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Crystel P.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
This was my second time here. First time I cane here is when it opened and had the cheese plate which was good as expected for a new restaurant.

We decided to give this place a try and went for the spinach and artichoke appetizer which was delicious but there were huge chunks of artichoke which were yummy but I like then chopped a little finer.
Now what impressed me was the tuna tacos. It actually had slices of raw seared tuna with an Asian slaw and a sweet soy sauce to compliment the tacos nicely. You get three to an order for 12 bucks which was an awesome price. They were just yummy.
My boyfriend got the beef tacos which I did not taste but he said they were perfect and topped with a heaping amount of cheese and mixed veggies. 
I would recommend giving this place a try and can't wait to go again.

As for the staff everyone was friendly it did take a while to get a cocktail but it wasn't absurdly long. They do take reservations which is nice

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Danielle M.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: I have been going here for a number of years but had not been there for about a year and went today for my sons birthday brunch... the place has just gone DOWN. The booth that we sat in seriously smelled like pee. I'm not sure if there was something on the floor or coming from the bar area.. I don't know but.. PEE. It then took 50 minutes for us to get our food (we literally all got breakfast food, no-one got anything complicated and there were 4 of us) then when we got it, there was a busser who kept walking by and singing quite loudly... This place used to be SLIGHTLY elegant, I'm not sure if its the area, or the management, or whatever it is but.. NO. Just NO

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Steve G.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
The bartender at Walnut Grill in Fox Chapel tonight was one of the worst I've ever had anywhere. She definitely didn't want to be working there. Very unfriendly, could care less if we were sitting there. Never asked my wife if she needed anything. I asked her for another drink. 10 minutes later she asked me if I wanted another drink. I said " I asked you ten minutes ago for one" I asked for the check and she pointed to it sitting  behind the 
bar. Not even handing it to me. Also, I know a server there. She advised me to never return any food . It could fall on the kitchen floor and end up back on

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Nick V.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
Went here to meet a client for lunch.  Due to renovations had to wait 15-20 minutes, no biggie.  I'll start by saying the hostess and waitress were very nice.  I did have to wait 20 minutes for my soup and spent 1 1/2 hours there (food took forever!). Now onto the food.

The French onion soup was eh, the onions a little more undercooked than I cared for and it was typical onion soup, nothing special.  I ordered the horseradish/ potato crusted cod with loaded baked potato.  They brought me a baked potato that seemed to have been sitting for 3 days, the cheese was glued to it and it wasn't that great. They also brought me a fried cod sandwich (wrong) and I had to convince the server that's not what I ordered.  So I sat there and ate the potato.  They did bring my fish and it was again just eh.  The crab "relish" was ice cold and the fish had no flavor.  But hey, they did bring me another potato!

All in all disappointing especially with what they charge.  I probably won't be back.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Holly G.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: The brunch menu looked really good and we were excited to try it, but unfortunately we couldn't even get our server to greet our table. After waiting for 10 minutes and her passing us several times without even saying hi, we decided to just drive down to eat n park. The table next to us was considering dining and dashing after eating half their plates and not even bothering with boxes. Sorry to say I probably won't bother to try for brunch again and wouldn't recommend that anyone else do so if service doesn't change.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Joyce C.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Had the Sunday brunch buffet.  It was delicious with plenty of choices and food was flavorful and hot.  Prime rib was outstanding. Can't wait to go back.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Jay D.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Stopped at the Walnut Grill to give their breakfast a try.  I should have taken a few photos to prove that there is truly a place that serves worse food than Applebee's. I have never had lunch or dinner here, and based on my breakfast, I won't be anytime soon.  If you're into snotty eggs, cold fatty bacon, and burnt toast, come on down.  If you're looking for something good, give Eat N Park a go. I do not recommend this place. God, I'm still gagging just writing this review.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Bob G.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: The WORST Restaurant Experience EVER!  We tried to make reservations for the bar area for Happy Hour two days ago and were told that they wouldn't take reservations for the bar and that it was first come first serve but to be there early.  We arrived around 5:15 with many empty tables in the bar Jeff told us all of the tables were reserved. He talked us into the "heated" outdoor patio.  We found that only one of three heaters had gas and we froze while empty tables in the bar NEVER had anyone sitting around these during our entire miserable cold, wet dining experience!  We were lied to and no one wanted to give us Jeff's name! to protect him! Horrible Experience! We were told that the General Manager was Mark, but he would not come out to talk to us.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Al B.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Service is good, waitstaff is friendly and professional.  However, the food is surprisingly bad.  The prices lead you to expect better quality food than what you receive.  Our last two experiences have been quite unpleasant, with the portions extremely small and little to no flavor. I would not recommend dining here. There are many good restaurants in the area, and any one of them would be a better choice than Walnut Grill.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Tyoko B.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
I like Walnut Grille. The service is good and the food is equally good. 

This location is in the Waterworks complex competing with Chili's and Eat N Park. Honestly, that's no real competition because this place is a notch above that with some of their food creeping over into the very fine dining category. 

My only wish is that they offered more seafood options on the menu. Salads here are pretty solid and lunches are quick if you let them know you need to get in and out. 

Happy hour here with friends is a bunch of fun regardless of whether you want to drink or not. TVs are well placed in the bar area and you can opt to dine at tables around the bar, in the dining room or outside when the weather is nice.  Definitely worth a visit.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Mary M.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Went for brunch and didn't like the selection (it was mostly breakfast food which I didn't want) so I ordered off the regular menu and got the potstickers which were delicious. I also got the spinach and artichoke dip which was pretty standard. It was a little expensive for what you get, it wasn't amazing, just good. Our waitress was attentive and friendly.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Thaddeus C.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: In a word, DON'T. The dying plants at the front entrance were an unheeded sign. The entire space is in a state of neglect. Leaf strewn patio, wicker chairs unraveling, a warning about a swarm of bees buzzing around and employees who made no effort to make their exchanges with one another discreet. Did I mention the strings of decorative lighting with all of the burned out bulbs? The food was better than the setting but so what?  The place needs some diligent management who knows how to keep things looking crisp.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Brad F.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
I went here with some friends of mine last night and had a great time. Our server was attentive and friendly. I had their classic burger with sweet potato fries and the burger was cooked the way I like it and tasted great. 
They also have a great craft beer selection!

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Rochelle H.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
Here's the thing that peeves me a little about this restaurant chain.  Why can't they open a restaurant closer to me?  I know that I only have to cross one river to get to the nearest Walnut Grill, but can't they open one up the street from me? :-)!

Me, my family and friends have been to this restaurant many, many times and I can't believe that I have never written a review since it's one of my favorite go-to places.  I think that I have had every single appetizer on the menu, with the exception of the stuffed banana peppers or Seared Tuna Tacos(I just don't like stuffed banana peppers or seared tuna) .  My favorite appetizers are the Pork Dumplings, Fried Pickles and Cheese and Fruit Plate.  You can't go wrong with any of these choices and if you go during their "Happier Hour", the prices are reduced to $5 or half.  What's not to like about that?

 My favorite go-to dish is the Wild Mushroom Chicken.  Is it a cutting edge dish?  No, but I still love it and I usually add one of their delicious scrumptious crabcakes to go with it. (I hate crabcakes with a lot of fillers and vegegies.  Theirs has neither and "I die" for both dishes.  Also not to be missed, if they have any kind of meat shank in season, just order it , eat it, pay for it and go home to recover from a meat coma.  They're just that good.

My daughter usually orders the Buffalo Chicken Wrap or Shaved Prime Rib Sandwich.  Both are delcious and very filling with your choice of a side dish.

For the desserts, you can't go wrong with the Brownie Works or Walnut Turtle Meltaway.  The devil is a liar if you don't think either of these desserts are yummy!

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Ed S.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Finally stopped by and sampled some of the appetizers. BBQ chicken pizza was large and was very tasty. The charcuterie plate was very well put together with ample amounts to taste. Smoked blue cheese was the best . Chicken lettuce wraps were nice sized and really tasty as well. Last sample was the Brussel sprouts and they were pretty good. Lots of balsamic glaze on them and it covered up a lot of the dish. Service was very nice, everyone was helpful and cordial.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Erica S.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Came to walnut grill for dinner and ordered to start two appetizers and a martini. For our appetizers we had the Brussels sprouts and the calamari. Both were good. The Brussels sprouts were perfectly cooked and drizzled with balsamic and cheese crumbles. The dipping sauce is a good match as well that comes with it. I highly recommend them. The calamari was good, not the best I have had but good. They could have been a little more crispy and seasoned, but I would order them again. The Bellini strawtini drink was so good. It was made with champagne and came with a fresh strawberry on the side. Not too sweet which made it perfect. For my main meal I ordered a Caesar salad with salmon. I like food with a little kick to it so I requested the salmon to be cooked blackened which they did with no problem. It was definitely a good Caesar. I would next time get the dressing on the side. Was a little too much dressing for me. Overall it was a great food experience.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Andrew L.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
This is a decent place for brunch on the weekend. I went here expecting to order off the menu, but was informed they have a brunch buffet. After looking at the menu, there was nothing that I appealed to me. Most of the items did not sound appetizing or were too expensive, so that left me with brunch.The service was good. The waiter came and and cleaned the plates and refilled our drinks throughout the meal. 

The brunch was better than I expected, but not great. They had a carving station with prime rib. The prime rib was very fatty and cooked to a medium rare. Their Greek salad was very fresh. The rice pilaf was hit or miss. One batch was great, very flavorful while another batch was tasteless. Finally the cookies were great while I did not care for the apple cobbler or the brownies. Other items for brunch included - fresh fruit, bacon, sausage, home fries, Eggs Benedict, bass in a curry sauce and chicken parmesan.

Overall it was an okay place for brunch. The items for brunch were either good or okay, nothing was amazing. I feel for $18.00 I could have gone elsewhere for a better meal. I don't think I will come back here.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Emmanuel V.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: I ordered 2 steak salads and when I arrived the order was not ready. Upon arrival I saw that there was only one steak salad. When I told the waitress she said I would have to wait 20-30 minutes to get the second one. When I made it clear that I wouldn't do that she did everything to speed up the process but let me wait anyway for 15 minutes which is not her fault. The food was ok, she was amazing and the ordering service was horrible.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Hope B.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Went in for happy hour yesterday, surprised by their great specials. The strawberry mojito was so refreshing and the turkey burger was absolutely amazing the simple toppings complimented it so well. Rebecca was our server and she was so friendly and knowledgeable about the menu and specials. If you go to the Fox Chapel location, request her! We had such a wonderful experience.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Melissa Z.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Walnut Grill is consistently good in both food and service. Brunch is my favorite. I love the outdoor seating in the summer. I definitely recommend.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Mike P.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description: Went to the breakfast buffet on 9/16/2018, large group, seems like the place has really gone down.  Used to be a great spot for brunch.  Showed up , no one at front station, then hostess came by, made a big deal out of the fact we went from 14 to 15 people, yet the place was empty.  the buffet was sub standard, often empty dishes and pans, fish was dried out, chicken dry, no pancakes and no french toast, both empty.  Noticed alot of workers talking and the hostess texting like mad on her phone.  No one in charge really, just a bunch of kids running the place.  I bet in year or two they will be gone, cannot run a restaurant this way.   Next time we will just do Eat N Park for half the price.

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Rachel C.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
I attended the Walnut Grill, Fox Chapel location for the first time today for a special event. The event was hosted in a private room that was large enough to hold about 30 guests. We had our own wait staff and a menu that was catered to the event. 

We were greeted by friendly waiters who took drink orders from us immediately. When it was time to select from our lunch menu, I decided to choose the Parmesan Crusted Chicken & Gnocchi (see photo attached) with a Caesar Salad - both of which are on the restaurants regular menu. The meal was brought out promptly by our servers and was delicious!

I will definitely be back to try the full menu at some point, but for now-I can recommend this restaurant to anyone looking to host a small-medium sized private event as we had a great experience! The worst part about it was having to get in & out of the Waterworks parking lot :)!

jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.author: Victoria D.
jFs8pmCWB6n0LWzddOwI1g.description:
I love Walnut Grill! I have been here (and the location in Wexford) many of times with both my boyfriend, girlfriends and my family for brunch, lunch, dinner or just wine after work during their Wine Wednesdays (1/2 price bottles HELLO) and have had great service and food every single time!

My first time was for my birthday when I was a freshman in college and their half-baked-gooey-hot-brownie dessert (not sure if they still have it) has left an everlasting imprint in my brain.

This particular location has never been overly packed when I've been here and  that makes it a great place to stop in and grab a bite at any time.  My service has always been excellent and my food has always been great.  Some of my favorites are:

ahi tuna app, spinach and artichoke app, chopped cobb salad, fish tacos, buffalo chicken wrap, and the Sunday buffet (not every item on the buffet is amazing but they do have some pretty good options, IMO)

It's a good place for date night, dinner with a friend or group of friends, brunch with your family or even to stop in and have a drink and dinner alone at the bar!  Interior is modern and always clean.  I really like this place

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Eric B.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: In terms of cheap and easy pizza, this is one of the places to go. The pizza is delicious and it's actually got some of the tastier wings that I have had in Shadyside. It also being next to a bus stop is a blessing and a curse. It's really easy to get to, but sometimes it will attract some less than favorable clientele. I really enjoy it though and I will keep going back!

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Kristen E.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: I didn't expect to find large, delicious salads at the corner pizza joint. Servings are quite generous, even by American standards. I could only eat half of my seafood salad and had more than enough toppings to make another large serving the next day. Nice manager. Give 'em a try!

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Mike M.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
We got delivery from here the day after St. Paddy's as recovery food.  We ended up getting a large meat lover's pizza, wings, and breadsticks.  The food was just average.  The pizza was actually soggy on the bottom, which is kind of a pet peeve of mine.  The wings ended up being the best part of the meal so I may come back for those.

Meat Lover's pizza: 5/10
Wings(garlic and hot): 7.5/10

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Jerome P.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
After seeing the whole "living insect" thing....
Yup. They get Z E R O S just for GP!

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Julia M.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: The pizza is pretty good; we used to order from here. The service is awful. Last time we ordered our pizza arrived over an hour late after estimated delivery time, was cold and the staff on the phone was not knowledgeable about the timing (we were trying to feed visitors so called a few time re ETA) They offered us 50% off next order. Today we tried to order to take advantage of that offer and give them another chance. Our complaints last time yielded a note in our account to not deliver! This is such poor customer service and a failed promise to rectify that service.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: 宸熹
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: This probably one of the best street pizza resturaunt I have ever had. I like the pasta a lot and get really addicted to the ranch pizza sauce which I was told to be pitts special.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Alyssa S.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: A neighborhood gem. The pizza is good (especially with ranch) and the breadsticks are amazing.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Eric D.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: Buffalo chicken pizza is good but keeps getting slimmer on the toppings. Calamari is always overcooked and unseasoned but I still order it ‍, throw parm or something on it? Learn when to pull it from the fryer? This last time I ordered 6 4oz ranches and receive 7 half filled 2 Oz ranches. Delivery driver told me all my sauces were there and tipped him $10 like a dumb a$$ without checking. Either change it to 2 ozs or learn to count, morons. Ripped me off over $3 and happens everytime I order. If I count the number of times I was ripped off I'd have multiple orders free. Not worth calling to complain because they don't care and won't fix it.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Donna H.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
I would always order from them but here lately the food is not up to par and the customer service is rude, unknowable, and just an airhead.

I'm done. Second time my hoagie was bland, no seasoning, forgot mayonnaise....and they are unapologetic. Wow!!!

Some months ago I didn't have this problem with them. Maybe with the attitude of some of the people who answer the phones (mostly) but other than that I don't know what happened?

Food was really good until lately. (Hoagies aren't good anymore)

What's up?

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Hunter V.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
Pizza Palermo is a terrible pizza establishment. I can't even comment on how there pizza tastes because I never received my order since the customer service was so awful! I called and ordered a delivery medium pizza one Saturday night and gave my card info to the person over the phone at about 1:30 am (they are open until 3 am). I was starving and had barely eaten that day. I got home and waited. They never gave me a time to expect the pizza because they hung up on me when I was trying to as by the way. So basically I waited until 2:30 am and the pizza still hadn't arrived so I decided to call to see what happened. When I called I reached an employee who was very short, rude and unhelpful, she told me that my phone number was not in their database and there were no orders for me on there screens and that there was nothing she could do about it. I hung up and looked on my card statement and there was already a charge from pizza palermo. So I decided to call back and I got the same rude person I talked to the first time. I explained there was already a charge on my card from them and asked if there was any information I could give to help them find my order, the employee said there was nothing she could
Do. I asked if I could give my address and if that would help, she said no. I asked if she could
Talk to someone else who could help, she said no. She ultimately ended up telling me that all I could do was dispute the charge on my card and she could not help me food wise at all. This is just one instance but if this is any reflection on their business as a whole then I'm sure their pizza is awful too. Don't eat here.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Lyndsay A.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: Pizza Palermo is a very basic pizza shop in Shadyside. Although I do think their pizza is delicious and fresh, I have eaten there twice now and service is very slow. For two hoagies, we waited over a half an hour and it was about 8pm during the week, and only two other people were in the restaurant. In addition to pizza, I'd recommend their cheese fries! However, the buffalo chicken wrap and the barbecue wings both left a lot to be desired. With so many pizza shops in the area, it's hard to find what stands out about this one.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Chris C.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
When you have that 2am food craving after a long time of drinking, this place won't let you know. We came in here at 2:30am and they were still open, with plenty of people inside. Other places were closed, but Pizza Palermo was not. Plenty of workers churning out delicious pies.

3 of us got the XL Meat Pie and oh my lord was it amazing. I thought it was going to be one of those sad cheese pizzas but wow it was delicious. Super satisfying

Recommend:
- Call ahead of time. We felt like newbies waiting while others called in their orders ahead of us.
- They have sandwiches too. Pizza was delicious though. 
- Limited Parking so park on the street.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Hope Y.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
1st: Pizza was cold. I called and was told, "it's because it's cold outside." Huh? Okay, so note to self: never order pizza in the winter from here (for delivery) because there's no guarantee your pizza will be REMOTELY warm. 

2nd: the pizza was burnt and they act as if they couldn't understand what I was stating. Soooo, I took the pizza back; although they did advise it would take 40-45mins, to get the new one. Why wait 40-45 mins to run the risk of cold pizza, again. 

3rd: all of that for it to be subpar. It's been real!

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Brent C.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
This place is terrible !
I ordered food from them and driver calls my phone I don't have it on me and by the time I see the missed call he's gone !
Never came to the door ! 
I called to ask what's up and they wanted to bring back cold food with no discount!

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Al C.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: Good food even better customer service.  The manager Cynthia goes above and beyond to make sure customers are 100% happy with the service.  I've been in management for 10+ years.  I have a very high standard for great customer service.  Cynthia and her staff exceeded my expectation.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Ostap L.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: Ordered large pepperoni pizza and wings. When I got home I noticed that there was no pepperoni. Wasn't too happy about but after calling the pizza. They said that they wouldn't deliver correct order since I live 20 min away. Manager Ali said that he can offer me double pepperoni next time. Lol what a joke. There will be no next time. Pizza was meh, wings were dry. But even worse that Customer service was bad. ;) Save yourself some time and buy your pizza from Slice on Broadway

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Jim V.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
We needed a quick place to grab dinner and Pizza Palermo was nearby.   The employees were very helpful in identifying what we should try as out-of-towners.  Pizzas were great, fried zucchini was good, calzone was the size of a football.  

Thumbs up!  Highly recommend Pizza Palermo.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Matthew U.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
This is one of the better pizza spots in Pittsburgh to order from.  Their menu is so extensive that I am fairly sure that any one person in the city would be able to find something that will put their hunger at bay.

I opted once for their fries with cheese and bacon on them.  This falls under their appetizers portion of the menu, but honestly it could be a menu item all on its own.  It is a healthy portion (that may sound oxymoronic) of fries.  You get to pick the cheese you want those fries to be smothered in and then crumbled bacon tops that off.  I almost always opt for the cheese sauce, that way I am guaranteed that the cheese makes its way to the bottom of the fries as well.  When I first ordered this item, I made the mistake of ordering another item on the menu and I should have just stuck with the fries.  They are more than enough.

I have had an array of items from the menu, but the fries are what stuck with me.  This may end up being my go to place when I can't decide what I want to snack on.

Staff are polite when you order, if you get delivery they are quite speedy.  One thing to know for delivery: $1 delivery fee.

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Ken C.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description: Been eating their pizza for about 10 years because close to work. Last two times making me look elsewhere. Pie today tasted like cheap spaghetti sauce on dough with very little cheese. Supposed to be16 cut pepperoni pizza with two sides of their ranch dressing. Got no ranch and only 21 pieces of pepperoni on whole pie. Tasted like school cafeteria pizza. Too many shops in area to pay hood money gor bad food, paid 18.00 for bad pizza

SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.author: Ali L.
SV8y4bp5HmgURzvUC2Rs9w.description:
In my mind,  this place is pretty solid. The sandwiches are tasty,  the pizza hits the spot, service is adequate, and they have $8 lunch specials. They have a fairly extensive menu as well.

Id recommend the Italian hoagie, I think they do it quite well here. The half is plenty for one person. 

It's a great spot just a 10 minute walk from Walnut, and seems to literally always be open. I'm pleased.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Nathan B.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description:
I love this place. The food is great. Sometimes it takes a minute for the order to be served but it's well worth the wait. The staff is pleasant and always friendly.

The ice cream is cool, the variety and what not. The kids love going there. It has a nice view of our front yard. They could benefit from labels for the flavors of ice cream and an occasional switch of the channel on the television that incessantly plays booty short shorts video of the bling and blinged.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: F. L.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description:
Not having had good Mexican food in ages, I really wanted to like this place, but was disappointed.

I ordered a chorizo gordita and a chivo (goat) taco. The gordita arrived lukewarm, and the filling wasn't especially flavorful, although the exterior did have a very rich masa flavor. The chivo was just ok, plenty tender but underseasoned, not in the soupy birria style I'd been hoping for. Also tried a popsicle, of arroz con leche flavor, which was pleasant and had a rich enough flavor, but wasn't mind-blowing. Definitely what I perceive (as a white person) as authentic style of food, though, and plenty of Latino clientele.

Someone at the next table ordered what I think was menudo, and it came out steaming hot, so that might be worth a try.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Rebecca M.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: As authentic as you can get. Menu is on the wall, be prepared to have the best Mexican food around. The language barrier is a little difficult, and please be prepared to wait for your food. Everything is made to order. If you order right; you won't leave hungry!

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Sarah M.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: Amazing popsicles. The hardest part is choosing a flavor because they are all so good.  Some of my favorites are tamarind, watermelon, coffee, strawberry, and spicy mango. They are only $2.50 each so we usually stock up when we come here. Highly recommend giving this place a try.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Arlene M.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description:
My husband and I stopped over here after reading about their homemade Popsicle. They have outdoor seating here and inside is a small cafe with seating area. The  entire menu is in Spanish so you have to ask the counter lady to interpret everything for you.

They do serve lunch items here including tacos all for a reasonable price. BTW some of the prices aren't listed on the board I was looking at so you have to ask. The is a listing of prices for food items.  Their specialty is both their homemade popsicles and homemade Mexican ice cream.

I did ask about vegan options. Some of the popsicles are made using water instead of milk and I was told they would be in the first row of the freezer I was looking at. They carry standard flavors but also unusual ones such as chili with mango Popsicle or strawberry and creme Popsicle. I decided to go with the latter. Popsicles sell for $2.50 each. My husband got a lime one.

We sat down to eat them and man they were nearly frozen solid! But I must admit they were delicious!! These are real strawberries in there so that would be my recommendation if you like them. My husband was also pleased with his lime Popsicle.

I had learned from talking with her that the ice cream is made differently than the Popsicle so wanting to further taste out their products I ordered 2 scoops of peaches and cream-real peaches to boot. Again, she does serve one vegan ice cream but did not exactly find out which one it was.

My husband did the same and when we went to eat them nearly broke our plastic spoons! Nevertheless we were able to work through that and had one of the most enjoyable homemade ice cream we ever tasted. Ice cream for 2 scoops also sells for $2.50.

In addition to a refrigerator with drinks she has homemade pineapple drink, another fruit based and the third I couldn't recall.

Needless to say shortly after we started eating our ice cream this place was packed! I saw a waitress bring out some tacos to a family and they did look good.

I like the authentic Mexican feel to this place but having English definitions on the menu board as well as pricing on all boards would help a great deal since I expect this newly opened small business will be a big draw. For the sake of the food we enjoyed I bumped up this rating because we were so pleased with our treats. 

Located on Broadway Ave next to a couple of other small eateries one hour free street parking is available during off peak times.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: DJ J.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description:
Stopped in to check out this new pace for some Mexican Ice cream, ice pops, fruit drinks and to see what was on the menu.  This is in the same location that was Casa Rasta but the wall and bar have been removed.  There are tables to seat at inside or outside.  
Everything is homemade.  Homemade ice cream and ice cream pops.  Some good Mexican food as well.  Some very interesting flavors of ice cream including mango, eggnog, strawberries and cream, Oreo cookies red currant, guava, pineapple, watermelon.  
I had a strawberries and cream pop and it was delicious.  Also had chicken quesadilla that had a homemade tortilla and came with some rice and avocado slice.  Very good and a great little place for a quick meal or for some delicious ice cream.

If you are in the area, it is definitely worth checking out.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Janner P.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: The food is great but THEY TAKE SOOOOOO LONG I waited like 3 hours for a corn on the cob and I had to cancel my order cause they where about to close so I just give it a 2 and the grils at the cashier are always in a bad mood I asked if my order was about done and they said you have to understand that it will take a nother hour so this place gets a 2

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Thy V.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description:
The popsicles are amazing, over 20 different flavors, so it was hard to choose. 

All made from real fruit and fresh juices. A flavor for everyone! 

My boyfriend is from California and misses authentic Mexican food and treats, so it was great to take him here.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Joyce C.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: I love this little place! Delicious home made I've cream and sweet treats. They have expanded thier menu a bit, so now you can have dinner and desert! Lovely family owned small business.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Cydney K.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: This place is so good!! It's so authentic and the popsicles are to die for. They have so many flavors!

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Jonathan G.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: We ordered from Alquisiras for a large event. The paletas were very tasty and liked by all of our guests. We wish we would have ordered more. The popsicles are absolutely delicious and reasonably priced. I would recommend them to anyone for both personal and large orders.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Diana O. C.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: This is exactly what Pittsburgh needed! A great place to stop by and have delicious snacks like homemade popsicles, elotes, or if you are a little bit hungry they have enchiladas, tortas, tostadas and some other great traditional Mexican dishes!! I highly recommend it!

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: R J.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: The homemade ice cream bars, ice cream and horchata are fantastic. The hardest part is picking a flavor. I haven't tried the food, but it's worth coming here for the ice cream alone.

fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.author: Devin B.
fOiEnLJk4qnp8j7onjvm4A.description: Delicious Mexican food on a warm summer night, sitting outside, watching families stopping by to pick up homemade popsicles or Horchata. I had the enchiladas, which were delicious. The freshly made guacamole was excellent. The service was friendly and relaxed, happy to explain what each and every homemade (must try!) popsicle was. I went with the watermelon with absolutely no regrets, but there were so many more to try that we'll have to head back to Beechview soon on a hot July or August afternoon.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Paul H.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Great food, great service, but it's a shame the place is acoustically so loud.

I had the 5 course meal: squash soup with cranberries (excellent), salad (substitution for wagyu beef, excellent), duck with radicchio (excellent), scallop mousse with eggplant and kimchee (I loved the kimchee but not the scallop mousse texture), chocolate ganache (very good).

It was a Thursday, we were there from 6:30 to 9:00. For music, they played a lot of Annie Lennox, who I like, but the loud acoustics plus the music made it difficult to carry on conversations among all 5 of us. I think I caught about 80% of what was said. Between songs, it was easier to talk. Shortly before we left, the music seemed to be shut off, and by then there were half as many diners, and the noise level was ok. Cost for 5 people was $274 before tip.

Some of my friends said they would never go again, because it was so noisy, but my conclusion is that I would go again, but I would go at 5pm or 9pm, or I'd insist on a quiet room (I saw a side room, unused, as we left. I wonder if that could have been an option for our group?)

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Katie R.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Came here for our anniversary. 
Wonderful service. 
There cocktails were top notch!! 
Portions are small so it is best to get a few to share. 
I am a transitioning vegan and they had vegetarian and vegan options. 
The gnocchi was the best we have ever had. Also, highly recommend the green salad. The dressing was simply outstanding. 

Trendy atmosphere. Check them out!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Spike T.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Crowded.
Sat down 35 minutes after our reserved time.
10 minutes later, water was served.
Spent 2 hours at the table... 1 hour of it waiting for stuff.
ALL courses of food were not hot when delivered to the table.
Too famished to send it back.
It's amazing to think that we sat there WAITING for course after course only to be served it after it had undoubtedly sat in the kitchen for too long.
Skipped dessert, just wanted to get out of there.

Too bad... as what we did taste was complex, unique, flavorful.  The menu is varied, enticing... including many vegetarian options.

The setting is industrial cool done well... the location in the middle of nowhere in Braddock across from a working U.S. Steel plant makes the trip there seem like an adventure. 

Too bad everything about the Restaurant is run poorly... at least on this past Saturday night when they seemed frantic and overwhelmed.  Maybe it was just an anomaly, just one bad night... but sometimes Restaurants just become too popular for their own good.

Not sure if I'd return.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Maria I.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I really wanted to be wowed here and my expectations were high. I was somewhat disappointed by the food and I'll explain why. Initially, I was going to give this place three stars, but the entire dining experience made it a four for me.

What I love about this place is its commitment to the community and locally sourced ingredients. I absolutely love the way the building has been transformed into this restaurant. I love the decor, the tables, the way the silverware sat, and the tall water glasses. The music was a little loud, but I enjoyed the jams. I also was into the bar and partly open kitchen. An interesting thing I noticed in the bathroom were the smaller mirrors in the stalls versus a giant mirror above the sink. I thought that was neat.

The staff was fabulous. I loved how we were greeted and sat. Our waitress A'ary was wonderful. Her personality was incredible and she helped us pick some dishes when we couldn't decide. We were shown the menu and explained how we could order from the first, second, and third sections. I asked for a cocktail recommendation and was told that I'd love Tepache, which is exactly what I ordered. It was delicious! The cocktail included green chartreuse, pineapple, bitters, and lime.

Now on to the food. First, I ordered the crab which consisted of Maryland crab, farm egg, grits, spigariello, and bottarga. I think this dish was a play on a southern version. I felt like my egg was a little too runny and there was too much extra greens on my plate. I thought the crab could have been seasoned a bit, but that was my personal taste.

Next, my friend ordered smoked tofu and I got the duck dish. Her tofu had a lot of greens on top along with my dish did too, which we felt was unnecessary as it didn't do anything for the dish. I thought her tofu was bland though she loved her dish minus all of the extra greens. My duck was pretty good. Some pieces had crispy skin and other pieces had fairly chewy skin. I had a few pieces of brussel sprouts in my dish along with cauliflower and I again thought both could have been seasoned more. I didn't love the sauce the duck was sitting on. I think it was blended squash, but it didn't do anything for me.

Then, I ordered a blondie for dessert and it was interesting. I loved the crunch of almonds mixed in along with the blondie itself. I thought the cherry cream was good, but the apples and the foam on top didn't excite me. I personally didn't get the point of it.

Come check out the place as the menu changes. I recommend making reservations ahead of time. They do have a parking lot to the right of the restaurant and there is also street parking. Dress code is labeled as smart casual, but that's up to interpretation. Dress up a little and you'll be fine.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Molly R.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Hit the gas and drive on over here for dinner! Make a reservation first since it's not too big, and it certainly gets crowded. It's well worth the drive to a up and coming part of town for the food and ambiance. As you can guess, this building was an old car "dealership" - I say "dealership" lightly since it's a small building compared to modern car dealerships. They use a lot of locally grown produce when possible curate new dishes to match the season. Come hungry and get an item from each of the courses! We loved everything they we tried, and they were really helpful with finding or updating items to be gluten free. Check their menu before you go since I think it changes pretty often.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Jessica D.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Superior Motors can do no wrong in my book right now.  I visited on Saturday with a couple friends for Restaurant week!  

We were seated at the bar. At first I was disappointed to be seated at the bar...but as the meal continued - i was glad. We made friends with the wait staff/bartenders behind the bar.  It was great!  They recommended drinks, food, etc.

Now...regarding the food.  All the yum was happening during restaurant week. (And all the time!)  It was suggested that we add one more side - which we did.

If you are visiting Superior Motors I highly suggest getting the smoked potatoes.  I believe they change them with the seasons - but they (as they have been in the past) are my absolute favorite.  I will order them every single time i visit - restaurant week or not.  

All the additional food for restaurant week was amazing (it always is!) Superior motors never disappoints.  You should be there, Now.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Steve G.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
A revitalization is going on in Braddock and this very trendy restaurant is in the forefront. The atmosphere is industrial warehouse beautifully designed, looking out across the street at an old US Steel plant. So I guess it fits in the vibe. 

It features a tapas focused menu. The problem with tapas for us is that we never really leave full without dropping plenty of coin. And with 4 people having 2 rounds of $12 cocktails it pumps up the bill quickly. That said the quality, taste and and presentation was very good. 

While I might recommend it For the experience, I doubt that we would return.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Lisa K.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I am biased for sure, because I am a huge ) Sousa fan. We've watched the progress of construction over the past couple of years. The beer selection is well-curated. The food is fabulous. I would put the space, the vibe and the food up against any restaurant in any other city - NYC, Chicago, etc. Because it's pricey, I probably won't take the whole family there as often as I'd like, but hope to go back soon with my husband. 

August 2019 Restaurant Week Update: We try to visit Superior Motors for every Restaurant Week. I have no complaints about the quality of the food or the service (or the cocktails). But the portion sizes were small by comparison to past Restaurant week offerings. This is not a problem for me, because I tend to prefer smaller plates, but overall this was not so much of a "deal" like we have experienced in the past at  Superior Motors or at other fine restaurants this year. If I were rating the meal I had tonight, overall I would give it four and one-half stars for the small portions.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Ruby K.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Pros: good service, interesting menu items, convenient parking, nice ambience

It was hard to enjoy my meal because there were around 3 fruit flies just hanging around our table the whole time. The cheese with bread and dried fruits was good, but not anything special or worth trying here. I thought the shrimp appetizer was interesting - it came with corn salad and "compressed" watermelon, and seemed very well thought out in terms of flavor combination and plating. However, it didn't taste as good as the concept seemed and the whole idea of compressed watermelon was just kind of funny to me.

I had the salmon dish as my entree, and I really enjoyed it. The salmon was very crispy on the outside, and soft and tender on the inside. The dish included salad, pickled foods, and grains, and had a really nice balance of salty, savory, and sweet. A lot of the menu seemed to have influences from Asian cuisines, and I thought the food was very unique.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Aaron S.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
The hype is real. Had a complexingly refreshing kiwi berry and habanato chilled soup to start. Gnocchi and a crab dish to follow, then mains of scallop and duck. Every dish had unique and interesting flavors, and was plated like a work of art.

Cocktails were equally worthy of hype. Highly recommend the strange fermented pineapple drink they ferment and make in house as well as the fermented cherry / kiwi berry / spicy non-alcoholic drink made from scratch in house. 

Bartenders serving us were nice dudes, up for some conversation, and quick with solid recommendations, especially guiding us to some solid drinks. 

Highly recommend!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Nicole S.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I think after this meal, my thoughts on small plates have changed. I usually just think they're pointless and an easy way to over charge people. 
But this meal was amazing. 
There were 3 of us and we had a total of 8 dishes (including 1 side dish and 2 desserts) and our total was $160. We were all completely full after also. 
To start we got the soup, the beef tartar and the gnocchi. All were Incredible. I was really wanting the tuna tartar but they were out of tuna so that was a bummer. But still it was amazing. The gnocchi was out of this world. I wanted 6 plates of it. For entrees we had the pork belly, salmon, chicken, and a side of potatoes. The salmon was the only dish we didn't like. None of us liked it really. The flavors were a bit odd and very very bitter. 

Dessert we had a chocolate fudge type thing with popcorn crumbles on it(my fave) and the yogurt cake. 

Honestly I'll go back without a question. I do wish the place was a little more inviting. The host was kinda eh, and the servers were nice but kinda felt a bit cold.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Frank Y.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
We enjoyed Pittsburgh's restaurant week at Superior Motors. Kevin Sousa and the restaurant were featured on Anthony Bordain's Parts Unknown. It's great food. A local garden in Braddock, where the restaurant is located, provides the produce. The dishes are simple but bold in flavor. The preparations allow the flavors of the fresh ingredients to come through. He trains and hires many local young people from Braddock, an economically challenged area. It's a great concept and dining experience.

We had the restaurant week prix fixe. Everything was cooked to perfection. I had the NY Koji strip steak, my wife had the scallops. Both were great (see the photos for the descriptions of the food).

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Steve K.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
If gentrification had a visual dictionary entry it should be this establishment. Trendy, eclectic restaurant in an otherwise poor and lifeless area--the road is rather bumpy and there is basically absolutely nothing else around (but I bet their rent is cheap!).

I didn't come particularly hungry, so I had a small dish with some apricot, cheese, and some more goodness. It was light and fruity, basically exactly what I was looking for. And the entree was a beef dish with some asparagus and some other veggies around it, with two different sauces including a mole sauce. Both dishes were tasty, and the beef in particular was cooked very nicely. For the quality the price is reasonable.

The place is so far out of the way of anything else that I'd say you should go when you're in the mood for a ride--and have confidence in your tires.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Laura T.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
A very nice place, but not the best option for vegetarians. We got, in order of favorite to least, the kimchi rice cakes, potatoes, carrots with cheese and hazelnuts, and seitan with beets and lentils. The seitan was pretty un-special, but you can get a meat option ("sweetbreads") which is maybe worth the money. These were the only 4 vegetarian options on the menu that day.

We also got a mushroom-infused chocolate cake, which I again found not as exciting as I expected. I did love a lot of things!! The staff was exceptional, and service was so speedy. They have a special pairing where they pair two wines made with the same grape from different vineyards- this time one was from South Africa and one from Texas! That was great and delicious. I also loved the atmosphere inside and that they labeled the vegan options.

Overall, I wouldn't make the drive out from Pittsburgh again when there are tons of vegetarian options close to home.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Jenny H.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
A beautiful restaurant! what a great job they did designing this space, in such an unsuspecting area. We sat at the bar and had a view into the open kitchen where we loved watching the delicious and creative food being made. The bartender was very nice and answered all our questions. I had a cocktail that was so delicious, I will definitely be driving all the way back to have another sometime soon. It was some concoction of Maggie's farm rum in the best way possible. 

We shared 4 plates including the pork chop, cauliflower, and potatoes. Everything was beautifully plated and tasty. You do have to order quite a few plates to end the meal feeling full. The portions are small and food is very unique!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Grace V.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: The food was good until dessert. I ordered " coconut" on the menu and it tasted so weird to me. It does looks good though. Not recommended it for dessert.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Lindsay V.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Food is amazing. The staff here is excellent especially Erin our waitress. She was knowledgeable and wonderful

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Sue T.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I went to Superior Motors tonight for their collaboration dinner with OddFellows ice cream. Each of the six dishes had ice cream integrated somehow. 

There were four savory dishes that progressively got better. The first dish was green apple bonito sorbet with tuna and uni. I have to say, it was not enjoyable at all. The food tasted really fresh and the presentation was beautiful. However, the flavors did not blend and it just tasted like ice cream and fish. The second dish, was burnt toast ice cream and celeriac. This dish was tasty however, the ice cream just seemed like it was thrown into to dish. The edamame ice cream dish was next and included venison tartare. This dish was good however, the venison was a little too spicy for my liking. The final dish was the foie gras ice cream with squab. The squab was cooked a little too rare however, the foie gras ice cream was very rich and full of flavor. 

The two desserts were the best part of the meal. The flavor blended very well. There were really good flavors and textures.  

Atmosphere: the dining room has an industrial feel inside. Looking outside the window, there is a steel factory across the street. This was really beautiful aesthetically but concerning once you I outside the restaurant. The air smelled funny and a little nauseating. 

I will review this place again, once I dine and enjoy their regular menu. For being best restaurant according Pittsburgh magazine, along with other accolades, I was expecting more.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Amanda A.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
No. Just no. Again, here I am with an unpopular opinion, but this place is overrated to the max. We came during restaurant week because I've been dying to make it out that way- and what better time?

I'll start by saying that the staff is incredible. The host, our server, everyone was warm and welcoming. 

The restaurant week menu consisted of a potato appetizer, a steak, and a chocolate dessert. There was also a "specialty" drink for restaurant week. 

To start, the rule was if one of us ordered the restaurant week menu, everyone at the table had to order it as well. Like, what? How is that even a thing- and if it is, why is that not mentioned in their restaurant week advertising? What if I just drove my vegetarian friend 35 mins, and now no one can order any restaurant week foods because there is only one option and it's meat?

The steak was chewy and gross - even my husband wouldn't finish mine. The potato appetizer ended up being the highlight. Such a disappointment.

Then, they are out of their specialty drink- okay, there is a replacement and it sounds decent. End of the story is that I paid $11 for a substitute drink that was basically water with a slice of pineapple.

Only cool part was the friendly staff and the fact that they display the record of the music that is playing at the time.

I was so angry that I got fancied up, drove all the way across Pittsburgh, only to be disappointed.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Dušica V.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
This restaurant has been on my list for some time to try, and maybe I was over expectant, but in the end the experience was nothing more than mediocre at best (at a fairly hefty price).

The wait (even though we had a reservation) was annoying, the waiter asked us 15 times if our mediocre dishes were okay, and in the end after ordering an app, an entree and a dessert, I was still hungry (and I generally don't eat a lot).

Also I'm not sure why our dessert for a toddler came on a giant plate?

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: R W.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I applaud the owners for making a bold decision having a restaurant next to a steel mill. Ride to the restaurant is adventurous: Welcome to Pittsburgh, Authentic Steel City Feel!

I choose to give them 5 stars for food, service, ambiance and creativity.

Will be back. We enjoyed their food tremendously. I had to have 2 of their Beet-Martinis...best I've ever had.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: James G.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Having been a huge fan of this chef's previous restaurants as well as being a frequent customer at Brew Gentlemen right down the street, I'm surprised it took me as long as it did to finally make my way to the ambitious Superior Motors.  

It should be mentioned that the venue itself is aesthetically stunning. The bar area has a much warmer and relaxing vibe to it compared to the smaller and somewhat cramped side dining room where we were seated though, but that's a minor complaint.  

Food wise, my friends and I ordered pretty much everything on the menu and enjoyed every one of the dishes that came out.  The standouts for me were the duck and venison.  

Side note:  It seems like the question regarding how much to order comes up a lot here.  The protein dishes were surprisingly larger than what I was expecting, and I would think that one could get by ordering a protein and appetizer per person. Of course I would recommend ordering whatever interests you, drinking a bunch of their amazing cocktails (bourbon one was fire), and worrying about how much money you spent another day.  Superior Motors is such a unique and interesting  place that you should take as much of it in as you can during your visit.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Kristy A.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I have a love/hate relationship with fine dining.   On one hand, I love the creative and bold flavors, the multiple courses, and the superior service.  On the other, everything is so delicious that I want more of it, and fine dining always has such small portions.  Superior Motors sort of bridges the gap for me on this.  All of the dishes I tried were delightful and expertly put together.  And while I did want more of some of the most tasty of items (just because I'm a glutton), I wasn't hungry at the end of my meal.   

First, the service.  I was really pleasantly surprised by this.  They definitely have a fine dining feel with lots of servers and a lot of attention to detail, but without all the stuffy pretentiousness that usually comes with it.   Coat check was available and easy.  The servers knew their stuff and were very attentive without being intrusive.  I never wanted for a refill and they helped with selections on wine.  They even got the little stuff, like pulling out my chair when I went to the restroom.  Everyone looked happy to be there and it showed in the service.    

In addition to the menu, they offered a 3 and 5 course option. Several of the dishes in this option were not on the regular menu.   I selected the 3 course option and added the salmon crudo and the smoked banana dessert from the regular menu.  This essentially gave me the 5 course meal with a different dessert and for a few bucks less than the 5 course option.  The meal came to around $65 and I had several glasses of wine on top of that.   I spent more at Lautrec and was far less satisfied there.   

Each course was beautiful and absolutely delicious.  The chestnut soup was creamy and warm - I wanted more of that.   The truffle risotto was a very nice second course.   The salmon crudo perhaps could have used a little acid or something, but we are splitting hairs there.   The braised beef was tender and covered with a mole that packed in the flavor.  This also came with some parsnips and a sweet potato puree - both were delicious and I wanted more of those.   I ended with the smoked banana dessert, which was a strange combination of flavors and textures that really worked.   The ganache and sweet potato desserts were also outstanding.  

So why four stars instead of five?  Two things.  First, I generally object to having to pony up a credit card to make a reservation.  I absolutely get why they do it, BUT it does make me think twice about making a reservation for 6 people.   While I would love to think my friends are as responsible as I am, the reality is that stuff happens and I don't really want to be on the hook for all of them.  

Second (this is really where they lost the star) is the requirement that the entire table do the special multi-course menu or no one can.  I went with a group of 6 ladies - that's 5 other people I had to get on board if I wanted that menu.  One vegetarian or picky eater or cheapskate in the group would have spoiled it for everyone.  The server said it was something to do with the timing of the courses, but I'm just not sure how that's a thing.  Each of us could have made completely random 3-4-5 course meals from the regular menu, so I'm not sure why those particular dishes were harder somehow.  

In the end, while I was annoyed that my companions were a little pressured into their food choices, the meal was delicious and the service was great.   I'd go back.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Kim G.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Eh, Overrated. Over priced. For the trendy crowd not me. Pressed food is weird. My daughter loved it.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Roseanne S.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Celebrated my birthday at Superior Motors. Creative dishes. Good flavor. Well balanced. I had the watermelon non-spirit drink, chilled yogurt berry soup, salad, walleye, and meringue dessert. I would definitely return. The food was amazing. The only thing that could have made it better was the an accommodation for my walleye dish as I am allergic to gluten. It would have been nice to have been offered a GF starch substitute for the farro (e.g. rice).

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Arlene M.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Chef Kevin Sousa's  2018 award winning restaurant sits in the middle of an old neighborhood in Braddock, PA in what was once a Chevy dealership. The eclectic farm to table menu is laid out differently than most restaurants that we've been to.

Parking is free either on the street or in what was once known as the dealership's parking lot. When we arrived we were seated promptly and a very friendly and helpful waiter guided us through the menu and answered any questions we had. He explained to us that in creating the menu they deviated from the traditional style of appetizers, salads, mains, etc to more of a four course selection where you can pick and choose whatever you wanted. The first page is the entire food menu. The pages that follow it consists of your wine or alcoholic beverages. They have a full bar here.

Anything marked with a "v" on the menu meant the item was vegetarian but could be made vegan upon request. I began with the carrot tartare that came with seaweed wraps. My husband had the smoked potato with radish. I was literally blown away with how good that carrot tartare was! Even wrapping portions of it in the seaweed made it more delectable. I tasted my husband's smoked potato and wasn't overly impressed with it. 

After completing these items I had discussed with the waiter about the main courses. Everything is cooked to perfection however, be aware of the fact that the inside of most of the dishes can be under cooked.  I say this only to point out the fact that they give that warning about consuming raw or undercooked foods at the bottom of the menu.

I originally wanted the salmon but learning that they could not prepare it well done I then settled for the veal with ricotta, asparagus, and fiddleheads. My husband went with the chicken where he was given two thighs along with morels, endive, and hickory. We waited a bit for our food but it had a nice presentation. I found the veal tender but wasn't used to the preparation. On the other hand I was literally blown away by the fiddleheads. They look like round asparagus and are seasonal to this time of year. My husband told me he enjoyed his chicken meal.

Needless to say the two items we ordered literally were filling enough so we had to pass on dessert. The menu is online and does change weekly. It is located across the street from the Edgar Thompson works. It makes a great place to go for a special occasion. Dress is casual.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Audrey W.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I hate to say it but the presentation of the food is much better than the food itself. The taste doesn't live up to the looks. I ubered 30 minutes with my friend to try this place out. However, the food was really just mediocre...... 

The appetizers taste kinda weird. The shrimp was not as fresh as I'd expect it to be. The entree (duck confit) was better. Service was great, though.
