G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Robert B.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Superior Motors is a must try for any Pittsburgh foodie.  The menu is dynamic and always fantastic as is the service.  The location can provide some intrigue as you bring your guest, but don't let that bother you as the food and ambiance will not disappoint.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: John R.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
We went on Thursday night for the five course tasting menu.  FYI - If one person at your table gets the tasting menu, the whole table (or in our case the two of us at the bar) has to do the tasting menu.  Kind of a weird requirement, but ok.  

I think the biggest problem this place has is that expectations have been set EXTREMELY high.  "Food and wine magazine!"  "Anthony Bourdain!"  You go in expecting some of the best, most innovative food you've ever had in your LIFE.   Were any of the dishes we had "AMAZING"?  No.  They were fine.  Everything was "fine."  Fancy presentation, but at the end of the day course four was still half a chicken breast with a dollop of greens.  The first course was some arugala with half a strawberry and 2 cubes of rhubarb.  It was fine.

The staff never asked if we were enjoying a course - but did seem to notice that I didn't like the fish course because at the end he mentioned it and took a drink off the tab to make up for it (which was nice!).  But at the end of the day, after drinks and tip, a $200 dinner for 2 that took 2 hours?  "It was fine."

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Marsha T.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Odd menu, fair service, awful desserts and very expensive for tapas. Food was decent, except for the three desserts, which were inedible.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Kelsey L.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
First of all, the atmosphere at Superior Motors is amazing. The space is unique and the bar/lounge area is very cozy. The wait staff was super friendly and attentive and our waiter even gave us a tour of the kitchen after our meal. Also, the drinks are AMAZING. Definitely order the "punch" because it's a truly beautiful drink. 

Now the food...

...everything was beautiful. I can't say enough about the presentation. However our table of 4 ordered upwards of 12 dishes and my husband and I didn't love any of them. I ordered the duck as my entree and couldn't finish it. I basically choked down a few bites because it was so expensive and I didn't want to waste it. It would have helped had the preparation method for each item been described briefly on the menu as this would have better guided my ordering decision. This food just wasn't for us...maybe that's because my taste isn't sophisticated enough for this stuff. What's worse is that this dinner was NOT cheap. So we spent a small fortune on a bunch of dishes, left unsatisfied, and drove through Wendy's on the way home. 

We'd go back for drinks but not for dinner.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Bill M.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I was underwhelmed to say the least.  Mushroom App lacked a flavor... oh wait what was it...  It will come to me....  Oh Yeah!  Mushrooms.  Tasted more like a pile of nut oatmeal.  Friend also got it.  I didn't eat mine - we both said we should have sent it back.  Tile fish was cooked properly, but lacked any real direction. Carrots were an interesting pairing - but didn't come off well.  My wife seemed to enjoy the beef - but later admitted she was just being nice (she's awesome).  I passed on dessert and opted for a cup of coffee - I think the coffee was a hold over from the old car dealership...  because that's what it tasted like.  @ $250 a couple I would have hoped for a more impressive culinary experience.

Service was good - dude was a little dry, but that's cool...  He knew the menu and handled the table well.  One of our friends happened to have a couple of $$$ cocktails and he delicately asked how we'd like him to split the bill (twice) - we confirmed splitting it 3 ways was just fine (which it totally was)...  But it was considerate to all how he executed it.   

Displaying the vinyl playing is a cool idea.  Hadn't listed to a Radiohead Kid A all the way through for a while - so that worked.  But in general... Superior Motors just feels like it's trying too hard.  A little less "scene" and a little more execution please...  Next.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Moussia K.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: I came here a month or 2 ago and I keep forgetting to leave a review. My husband and I really enjoy eating out and love to try the new places in the Pittsburgh food scene and Superior Motors is such a great addition! I love the interior how open it is and the seating was so comfortable. I really think they captured the Pittsburgh vibe of eating out. People don't want to necessarily get fancy to eat unique tasty fancy food. There weren't tons of options to try as pescatarians we really enjoyed what we ordered and look forward to coming back as they update their seasonal menu!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Kat V.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Some people laughed when I mentioned going to an expensive restaurant in Braddock, but the minute you step inside, you won't remember the neighborhood at all. The restaurant is really well designed - I love the vibe.

Almost EVERYTHING on the menu looked great and everything we got was delicious. If you want amazingly good food and are willing to pay for it, this is a must try. Our service was amazing. Though we drank a lot of water (and some alcoholic beverages), our glasses were never empty. The waitress was able to explain everything on the menu (we had some questions) perfectly and offered tips we might not have thought about. If you're looking for a nice meal at a fancy restaurant with great service, give this a try!

(One minor warning for those with nut allergies - almost everything on the menu seemed to have peanuts or tree nuts.)

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Eileen N.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I was so excited to try this place out. Superior Motors is in a very edgy neighborhood and the contrast (a pretentious restaurant in a neighborhood peppered with shootings/stabbings just blocks away) felt very off-putting and voyeuristic to me.  

I will say that I love the decor and was really impressed by all the artwork. I wish the creativity was translated into the food. We had the duck, pork, and beef. I thought the composition of the pork dish was very focused, but did not understand why they plated the entire dish in one corner of a plate. It helps sometimes to spread the ingredients out and allow them to breathe a little. I also wasn't too excited about the marmalade that accompanied the duck. 

To finish, I had the tart, which was an interpretation of key lime pie. I thought the dessert had really good balance. I love it when a dessert is rich and satisfying but doesn't taste sweet. 

Overall I'd say I have mixed feelings about this place. It is a very unique experience, but could be so much more.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Tina B.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I know what you're thinking. "Braddock?? It's sketchy over there and it's too far. Not worth it." Oh but that is so not the case. Trust me, you wont regret it one bit. Superior Motors is such a gem nestled in the rough. Truly, I was absolutely blown away after my first bite. Wow. Everything we had here was just outstanding. 

I came here during restaurant week so I think my portions were a little smaller than usual (so don't be discouraged by my pictures of such small plates). Because of this, I was able to sample three absolutely phenomenal dishes as well as the full plates my husband ordered. Ocean trout tartare, fried squid, sage cavatelli, beef, and veal. Of these, my favorite was the fried squid and if I had to pick my least favorite, it'd be the veal. Overall, though, each dish was so inventive, intricate, and absolutely stunning. 

Overall, Superior Motors is a very well-thought-out restaurant. The whole experience here is definitely worth the trek to Braddock!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Derek D.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I had a lot of fun with this dinner. My experience with the staff wasn't the best. I've read that they hire folks from the local depressed area of Braddock. They were nice enough, but may need time to perfect their new trade. Our waitress was not the most attentive and frequently forgot to refill water. 

I thought the food so good. We had for starters the octopus. Which was nothing less than amazing. The preparation just fit so perfectly with the taste of the meat. The raw scallops were so tasty and last was the foie gras. It was sweeter, almost like a foie gras pie; but delicious.

For our mains my wife had the beef and I had the lamb. Both meats were cooked to perfection. I think the beef was better, it has a nice smoked flavor. The lamb was good, but the preparation was so delicious. 

They had a nice wine selection, maybe a few to many roses. The cocktails were great. The beer selection left a little to be desired. I always wonder why beer is so plain at these places. Where are the DIPA's and imperial stouts?

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Jason F.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I stopped by here a couple of Thursdays ago with my wife and my parents for my birthday dinner.  Superior Motors is one of those restaurants that I have been looking forward to trying ever since it was introduced maybe 3 years ago.  The slow progress of building it and its location in Braddock meant that it wasn't a place to head to for just any meal.  That's why I waited until my birthday to give it a try.  We had reservations for 7:15 and arrived to the restaurant right around that time.  It was busy inside and we waited about 15 minutes for our table to open up. Whoever it was that was working the front of the house on this day, you could tell he was really busting his butt doing anything he could to help the servers and hostess.  I loved seeing that!  In any case, the inside of the restaurant is certainly interesting.  The walls are brick which gives it an industrial feel and then there are paintings on the wall which my mom thought elementary school students could do. Haha.  They were better than that but certainly more of the abstract variety.

For dinner on this evening I decided to start off with the crispy pig face appetizer while the rest of the table decided to split the smoked seitan.  The menu described my crispy pig face as coming with vegetarian boudin noir (not sure how that works), black truffle and mustard while the seitan came with popcorn, mango and spruce.  Both were beautiful whenever they came to our table.  My crispy pig face ended up being quite good as it was fried into a rectangular object which ended up having a really intense pork flavor to it.  I especially enjoyed dipping it into the mustard.  Last but certainly not least was the boudin noir which sort of had the consistency and flavor profile of stove top stuffing although not exactly the same. I was also able to try some of the smoked seitan and loved both the smokiness of it and the mango on top of it.  Then for my entree I went with the duck while my wife ordered the salmon.  My duck came with Swiss chard, cashew and rhubarb while my wife's salmon came with white asparagus, sorrel, hazelnut and hollandaise.  I was especially excited about mine as duck and rhubarb are too of my favorite flavors and you so rarely see them together.  Thankfully it didn't disappoint as my meal was delicious.  The duck ended up coming two ways with probably a half of a breast as well as some confit and both parts were cooked perfectly.  Meanwhile the cashew added some texture to the dish while the rhubarb added that sweetness and sourness that it is known for.  My only complaint about the dish was that there wasn't more of it, haha.  My wife and parents also really enjoyed all of their dishes.

The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  Superior Motors really lives up to its wait for me as all of the food was beautifully plated and delicious.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Hillary C.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Just one of those eternally-memorable meals.
Mezcal cocktail - dragonfruit and salt and pepper - was toe-turling.  Rye punch with the luxardo cherry and orange peel was light and herbacious and oh-so satisfying.

Absolute bests:
* Braised lamb with hidden crisped sweetbreads and an orange sauce that, I swear, originated from an angel
* Fried pig's head with blood pudding was an umami explosion, like a tiny bite of the entirety of your mom's Christmas dinner, rolled into one.
* Peekytoe Crab with fresh, sweet corn was the most gentle, sweet, cool, palate-cleansing dish I have ever had
* Veal with rhubarb was such an innovative flavor pairing, meant to be, more compatible than Kristen Bell and Dax Shepherd; has reignited my interest in both ingredients.
* Pretzel Salad was both comforting and elevated and completely blew my mind
* THE YUZU GANACHE OMG OMG OMG OMG uh, normally, the dessert isn't supposed to be the best part of the meal, but the ganache was impossibly silky and the yuzu ice cream was utterly sublime.

Complaining for no reason, other than it's expected on Yelp:
The only ones that I could have taken or left were the korean rice cakes, black cod and the cobia, which would have been both objectively outstanding anywhere else, but the bar was raised too damn high.
(and in the case of korean rice cakes, I just think that I like them cheap and dumb.  Like at all-you-can-eat KBBQ-style.  It felt so wrong eating fancy ones).

Server was charming and so knowledgeable - we asked for a white wine recommendation that would work with our entire meal, and he smartly advised us to the Viogner, which was meaty and present and golden and worked with literally everything.  We regretted not getting the duck because the wine had a hint of game in it that would have sent us through the roof.

I would honestly take a special trip back to Pittsburgh, just to enjoy this establishment once again.  Hard success, great business - I'd give it more than five stars if I could.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Erin G.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Food was amazing. The salmon (first) is the best salmon I've ever had. Our server was great too. Personable and knowledgeable. Can't wait to go back!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Jonah K.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Firstly the venue was amazing, right next to a working steel mill. I thought we were lost when we were driving to the middle of nowhere for a nice dinner. The building itself is very industrial and fit the area well. The service was excellent, and the menu was highly creative. The food was all really well done and worth the adventure for dinner. Would go back for sure.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Chelsea C.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
My husband and I visited Superior Motors for an epic date night that we will long remember. I prefaced the visit by calling and speaking with Chris Clark, the GM, who asked a few questions about our preferences and then spoke to Chef Sousa. My request was that we didn't want to make any decisions - that we wanted to be surprised and eat until we busted open.

We went a bit early, which I highly recommend, so we could walk around a bit. SM is located directly across the street from the USS Mon Valley Works Edgar Thomson Plant. I loved that the restaurant really fits into its surroundings and does not overwhelm the neighborhood. Arriving early will also give you a chance to check out the interior and grab a drink.

Chris met us when we arrived; and, knowing how busy the reservation book was, recommended that we just sit at the bar. This couldn't have been a more spot on recommendation for us, as we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The bartenders were not just friendly but awesome wait staff themselves. They paired all of our dishes with the perfect choices of IPA, prosecco, saki, and a Greek red wine.

The food...oh, the food...

We started with what turned out to be the only challenging dishes for the both of us. My husband had the diver scallop with buckwheat noodles and cuddlefish ink. I had the cobia, with freeze dried avocado noodles (YUM! I could eat a whole bowl!), and a tomatillo/jalapeno/cilantro broth. What was challenging for the both of us was just that we hadn't ever had such unique raw seafood preparations before - so it was just an overwhelming starter - but delicious nevertheless.

For the next course, I had black cod with sunchokes, kale, and leek. I'll mention here that Chef Sousa's dishes are always loaded with fresh veg - and the veg are always prepared with multiple cooking techniques to keep the flavors and textures constantly evolving based on what's on your fork next. My husband had the salmon, with white asparagus, sorrel, hazelnut, and a hollandaise. Again, the textures and flavors here were morphed with every bite.

For the next course, I had a chicken dish that was so reminiscent of my Nana's funsei (a South American dish) that I got all choked up with nostalgia - but I still managed to gobble down what was an outstanding chicken dish. My husband had the veal with ricotta, asparagus, and fiddleheads. What an incredible combination of meat, cheese, and veg! I could have eaten a whole platter of this.

Overall, Chris and Chef Sousa picked the ideal combination of dishes for us: challenging, comforting, and downright delicious all around. At this point, we were pretty full from cruising through the menu; however, the pasta was calling to me...

We ordered one last savory course to share - the house made pappardelle with egg, watercress, and cauliflower. As a carnivore myself, I couldn't have loved this veg dish more. It was like the great red wine we were sipping: delicate and still packing a bold flavor punch.

Any regular diner would have thrown in the napkin - but not us! We finished our journey with the ganache, yuzu, lime dessert. Chocolate with citrus is probably one of my favorite combos so I was a happy camper. 

I will warn the frugal spender: Superior Motors is quite pricey; however, you 100% get what you pay for, which, in this case, is superior service, libations, and food. And if that's not enough, remember what Chef Sousa is doing for the neighborhood and Braddock Youth Project kids; about how he both reclaimed and re-visioned the history of the building itself; and, the fact that products are sourced from area vendors.

It is easy to see why 'Food & Wine' considers Superior Motors to be the Restaurant of the Year. I look forward to seeing Chef Sousa continue to grow. Cheers!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Kelly A.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
This is one of the most over rated restaurants in Pittsburgh. We were so excited to try - seeing there is a $100 cancelation fee for canceling after Thursday for a Saturday reservation- but the whole experience turned out to be horrible. The main problem was the cold chicken THIGH...as well as the microscopic soft shell crab served over ramen.  We were told we had to order all 3 courses at once so the food was timed properly, but the joke was on us! The food came out cold and like it was a food dish double in "Honey I Shrunk the Kids". We could get more fish off a baby goldfish!! No flavor in any of the dishes except the steak tartar which was actually very good.  The cocktails were below average, super short pours and nothing special. 
The service is inexperienced and not attentive which appear to be culinary students with no oversight. Over 20 mins between courses with nobody to be found. 
The manager was very nice when we expeessed our concerns. He's great and a good restaurant should pick him up. 13/10 do not recommend this restaurant. For the cost, expect I expected amazing but this restaurant did not deliver it, not even close.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: John K.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Have no idea what the food or service is like. All I know is that my reservation was cancelled with no explanation. My phone call was not returned. Clearly, SM has a larger clientele than they need or can handle. They don't need my business or yours--they certainly don't deserve it.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Steve S.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Superior Motors...Superior Food....Superior Experience

From the moment we entered the door for our Anniversary Dinner, the staff was ready and made us feel like special customers.The host (I didn't get his name) welcomed us with a "happy Anniversary" and a smile. Our server, Erin, was warm, cheerful and informative, answering all our questions with aplomb. 

We were first served a free celebratory glass of champagne and settled down to one of the best meals of our lives.

The Bourbon Cocktail, flavored with coffee rum, was a delicious starter. 

We started with the Beef Tartare, served on a perfect cracker-like bread, and the Crispy Pig Face (no it's not shaped like a face or a pig), savory pork with a beautiful berry and mustard sauce.

For our main, I had the Duck entree, perfectly flavored and cooked to a sublime medium rare, while my wife had the Grass Fed Beef, so tender it melted.

I don't recall the details of our dessert, but let's just say it was a perfect topper to the meal.

We were treated at the end to an "anniversary" tour of the kitchen. Fascinating!

It was a great experience all around. The staff was awesome, the food sublime.We will definitely return!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: David B.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Simply the best restaurant in Pittsburgh. Kevin Sousa is an amazing chef who has continued to expand his repertoire. He and his staff have thought through a million details and have come up with a restaurant experience that is deeply satisfying. 

I would invite you to leave your preconceptions aside. Superior Motors is challenging, flavorful, thrilling and thoughtfully conceived. If you are not interested in being challenged by new flavors and provocative food expressions...save your money and go elsewhere. But if you would like to try bold flavor combinations and an adventure in dining, by all means, don't miss eating here. 

The dining room is carefully laid out, and it does not feel crowded. Our server was attentive and passionate. She was obviously well trained and loves her job. We gave her a ridiculous 40% tip and she earned every penny. 

Each dish led to some new discovery. Not just, novelty, however, but, gratifying, refreshing and delicious. 

So I really miss Salt of the Earth, it was my favorite restaurant. However Superior Motors is...well, superior!

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Irene L.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
We had been waiting YEARS for superior motors to open, and by the time it had, we had already moved away! Fortunately, we we able to make time to come out here on our last trip to Pittsburgh. 


The food was delicious. I loved Salt of the Earth, and was really looking forward to Kevin Sousa's next venture. In our group we had the octopus, hamachi, almost all the entrees and the pavlova and bread pudding desserts, and saw him working in the open concept kitchen while we were enjoying our meal.

A couple things:

I had issues with our main waitress throughout the night. We were in a group of 6 and we ask a lot of questions when it comes to food and satisfying everyone's palette. She came off and very condescending and more like we were intruding on her restaurant, rather than welcoming us to share this experience with her. We did not feel like sentiment with other waiters and waitresses who came by to collect plates. This was very off-putting and there was really nothing we could do about it. 

Cocktails were not good. My watermelon gin drink tasted like watered down gin. I had one sip and didn't touch it for the rest of the night. I had hoped that our waitress would notice and offer a new one but  it just sat there full until our check came. Our general experience with her for the entire night was really bizarre. 

The interior decor is really nice but the elevated tables around the perimeter of the restaurant have HUUUUGE tables. Really nice and spacious but hard to reach certain plates. Also when our waitress handed us new plates in between I went to grab mine but she wouldn't let go and stared at me during this power play until I let go so SHE could put my plate down. So weird. 

I want to say that the food was worth the money but this particular experience, having to deal with our waitress, was not. I hope to give SM another chance, but don't feel particularly inclined to.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Andre S.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Food: Good - Flavors are present and presentations are great. Excellent unique options though the menu are limited and very little proportions at time.

Service: Excellent - Very professional and courteous. Even have alcohol and menu samples at times.

Overall: Recommend - Definitely worth the drive, you won't be disappointed. Prices are a little steep.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Ben F.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I want this review to be better, but as I sit here typing, I can't in good faith give them more than 2 stars. The fact is that a restaurant can serve the most innovative, flawlessly prepared food, but it won't matter if the experience is tainted. 

We decided to celebrate my grandmother's 93rd birthday here, and brought a cake to celebrate. Well, I guess a write up in the New York Times means you don't have the time or the willingness to cut the cake for your guests. Instead we were met with a "we don't serve outside food. The manager should have told you." This was after the manager took the cake himself and refrigerated it for us! I get it, you're riding high from your review, but lest you forget, this is a customer service industry and continuing to promote an attitude of "we can't be bothered because we're so amazing" will not work forever. 

People want to be treated like you care even a little bit about them, not to be treated like the next person in line needs to be sat at our table. The food almost becomes an accessory to the experience when you foster a culture of pretentious and cold treatment. Unfortunately it's not the quality of the food that I'm taking with me from the experience; rather, the almost nonexistent customer service.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Stephanie S.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: I have been wanting to go to Superior Motors since it opened. I was so excited that I was able to a table during restaurant week.  My husband and I were both rather underwhelmed!  My entree came with 2 scallops, just 2 and they were cold in the middle.  My husband opted for the steak which also was cold and a small portion.  We found the food just average and do not understand all the hype.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Jacob B.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: The buzz surrounding Superior Motors ultimately worked against it. Driving 40 minutes to dine at an expensive restaurant as hyped as this one primed me for the best meal of my life when in reality it wasn't even the best meal of my week. The food was all properly prepared but none of it was exciting. The flavors were fairly bland and nothing left me with a lasting impression. They also crammed our party into an awkward table that made conversation difficult. Given the price and distance, I would not recommend Superior Motors.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Matthieu K.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I am a big Kevin Sousa fan. I very much miss Union Pig & Chicken and miss Salt of the Earth. Union Pig was much more my style of eatery...  

This place is probably one of the 5 best restaurants in PIT. That it sits in the shadow of the Edgar Thompson Works, in Braddock, is amazing actually if you know the area. This real estate, just a decade ago, was entirely derelict and quite dangerous. Braddocc Mayor John Fetterman, through the will and force of his personality, has made this entire ZIP code habitable again. I believe he owns the building Superior Motors is in ... 

Sousa and his staff create and serve food that is flavorful, challenging, and ... if you enjoy the gourmet experience ... thrilling. I have to admit, that's not my thing at all. This is just not my kind of place. I had a steak dish when it first opened (wish I'd taken better notes, believe it was Argentenian steak of some variety - was excellent) and it was not on the menu when I returned in 12/2017. 

Appetizers are all works of art. The only one that I was interested in eating was the beef tartare ... and it was excellent, 5 star.   I have had the pork dish (I don't like caviar with my pig, sorry), and it was good. Very good. I think the presentation and arrangement was superior to the dish itself. Have also had the short rib which was equally stunning. Like wow, this is astounding to behold. 
 
You can BYOB, with a cork fee, which I always appreciate. 

I have never had service matching the price of dining here. Never. I don't show up in camp pants and a Penguins jersey either(I know what you were thinking!) I know "how to eat" and "how to order" at a 5 star restaurant ... the staff here treated me like a rube. Several times, when asking questions about the menu, the server deferred and said "I'll just let you have more time to review the menu." NO, I don't need more time... I need you to answer my question. Good lord. Never encountered that sort of treatment at any of Sousa's other eateries. 

Anyway, if you enjoy food as art? You will LOVE this place. If not, you won't. This is a very unique gourmet restaurant that offers truly unique and superior dishes.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Missa G.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: We did not have a reservation and actually went with the idea to listen to the "live music" that was advertised and if possible have a drink / small plate.  The music on this particular night consisted of a man moaning into a microphone with a back up moaner behind him.  It was bad.  However we were able to snag a table and dine and the food was fantastic.  We sampled the chicken thigh, gnocchi, and crab as well as the yogurt cake for dessert and coffee.  Everything was so different and the tastes equally interesting.  It would have been nice to have bread to dip into the remaining sauce but the waitress said that their restaurant "tends to cater to those that want to avoid carbs."   I like SM for a restaurant experience where I can have just enough and it's interesting.  Seemed to us to be somewhat romantic with the decor, lighting and way the servers deliver the food and vamoose ..however there were groups of families and college students.  Great place.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Sarah F.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: This place is fantastic. Unpretentious, high-end, modern, new gastropub. Bartenders are cool as heck. Modern cocktails, new world wines, local beer. Plates are small, so get 5 to share.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Lindsey C.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
Finally got out to Superior Motors - man did it live up to the hype and then some!! Was blown away by how friendly and accommodating the staff was. Before arriving I called to inquire about what entrees could be adjusted for a vegan. The woman on the phone was so happy to walk me through the menu and discuss which items could be adjusted and made vegan (several of them!--basically just omitting the cheese). All the pictures looked so good, so I knew I was in for a treat. 

The restaurant itself is so clean, simple and elegant. From big half circle booths, tons of tables, to the bar, and even a back dining area, the restaurant was definitely very large. So nice that my party of four was seated at a large booth and not crammed at a four person table. Our table was ready the second we walked through the doors and our waiter arrived within moments of us sitting down. Definitely would recommend a reservation as it was quite crowded at 5 PM on a Sunday. 

Our waiter walked us through the menu and was happy to describe all dishes in further detail. My table ended up ordering the beef entrée, sturgeon, and mushroom risotto. Holy heck was the mushroom risotto perfection. The rye and pearl barley was a perfect al dente and really made the meal feel super hearty and filling. It was topped with just two tiny tiny slices of mushroom. My only complaint is compared to both the beef & fish entrée which were quite large, the portion size of the risotto was teeny tiny--almost appetizer size. Felt that as being an entrée it definitely should have been a bigger portion. Although aside from the size, the taste was absolutely exquisite. It was made vegan by omitting the goat cheese and WOW was it amazing. For dessert they had four options and our waiter advised us the further down the list you go, the less traditional the desserts became. Fortunately the coconut dessert was vegan and also last on the list, it was super unique and so very delicious. We also ordered the pear tart and my party absolutely loved it. So sweet they even put a candle on the dessert for my boyfriend's birthday. Loved everything about our meal here, and I can't wait to get back again in the near future.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Danielle F.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: First time at Superior Motors with a group of 4 and it was great. Tried almost everything on the menu by sharing and loved it all. Top hits were Beef Tartare, Brassica and Greens and Gnocci. Main entree favs were Lamb, Beef and Halibut. Great drink selection. We did not have dessert. Shout out to our server Vondre who we loved. He brought us a complimentary Salmon and took us into the kitchen at the end of our meal. Got to see Kevin taking command of the kitchen and it made our night. Highly recommend even if the portions aren't huge as others have mentioned. Great atmosphere, would happily return. Well worth the out of the way trip for this fine dining experience.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Mike C.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
We brought out-of-town friends to the restaurant this past weekend.  I have been rooting for this restaurant because of what it could mean to Braddock. I had a good experience but given the price point I am not rushing back. 
The food was uneven -- some very good dishes, some good and many just OK.  There are many better restaurants in Pgh at this price point. And the one glaringly bad moment of the evening was when we asked for some more bread for an appetizer (chicken liver pate) that didn't have a sufficient amount. They replied No, but we could order another appetizer. Not the right answer ever, especially given it would cost them very little and our party spent $700 that evening.
Next time I want to splurge, I will choose one of my favorites in Pgh -- Cure, Poulet Bleu, Legume, Butcher in the Rye, or Morcilla.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Maria P.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: The restaurant is in Braddock 7 miles from Pittsburgh.  I live In town and to reserve a table you have to give a credit card. I found that a little odd but they were accommodating on changing the time for me. I visited the area late so I do not have a clear opinion  about the area. It seems nice but across this place there is a factory. There is  available parking on both sides of the restaurant and on the street. The ambience  is really nice. To open kitchen concept is very attractive . The staff is nice and our server was a little hyperactive!!! . She was informative though. We had a company of five and I tried the beer which is aged and  my husband tried a cocktail. The drinks were good. The food was a four out of five stars. We had  the steak,   the scallops and the Venison. I tried them all. The presentation was excellent. The pork and the duck were not well prepared. Again the presentation was great and the plate looked fine but the duck had the characteristic smell of an unwell prepared meat. Maybe the chef should remove these plates from the menu. The desserts were very good. Good try chef but not a five star. Sorry. I will not be back.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Michael S.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description:
I like this place a lot.  Contributing food innovation to an old neighborhood offering memories both good and bad. Small plates are perfect solution for wanting to order 5 items on the menu. A few of the highlights from the eight dishes we shared. 

Chicken livers were like liver lovers ice cream. Really good. The halibut offered taste beyond this great fish. Veal and steak tartare were tasty as well. All washed down with a great Italian bottle of wine.

G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.author: Doc R.
G2hXfdIKdhI6TVQrXpTnFA.description: Wanted to like this place so much. But it is Overrated. Poorly executed menu. Terrible service. Incredibly expensive. Disappointed is an understatement.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Kaylie M.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: Exactly what you expect in a quick and fairly cheap pizza place- Thick cheese, good pepperoni. Good service and perfect timing estimate. Overall, perfect neighborhood place for takeout pizza

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Ian C.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: Pizza was delicious. Fast and friendly service. Good pricing, online ordering. No indoor seating.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Karla D.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description:
Eh. Every now and again I'll grab a slice here for lunch at work. I try not to because it's rally not that great. Sometimes it's super greasy, other times it's overcooked and/or burnt. I've even had slices not cooked all of the way through.

Consistency definitely isn't something you should expect if you come here.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Candice M.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: Every time I order a Sicilian the cheese is stuck to the top of the box. When I order a regular pie they screw up the order.. half pepperoni isn't rocket science :((

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Jerome P.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description:
Not my favorite. They were kind of expensive for what you get. Nothing wrong with "thin pizza".... Unless you're chewing more of your own teeth then the pizza itself. The crust is too light. I swear they bought it at Aldi.
Taste OK, though... ish
.... Nope! Not pleased

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Mike M.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: The golden standard and only control group for all pizza comparisons is the plain cheese pizza . The plain cheese pizza here is good. Classic football pizza. Pizza.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Bob P.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description:
OK.  So when your favorite pizza place starts changing their ingredients after 15 years of being a loyal customer, it's time to go exploring.  We are on our fifth restaurant and may possibly have a winner, although I feel further trials may be in order.  Went to Than's Amore Pizza on Butler Street in Lawrenceville for the first time last night.  The shop looks great, the people were professional, but the girl behind the counter needs to get off her cell phone and come up for air every once and awhile.  The Chef was precise, fast and more than qualified to put together a pizza.  The pizza was very good.  Ordered mushroom and sausage.  The mushrooms were plentiful and very good.  It was, however, a bit difficult to see any sausage on board.  Good cheese and a nice crust.
Doesn't anyone toss dough  anymore?  My favorite part of a pizza is when the erratic edges of a tossed pizza bubble and burn a bit.  That's the best for me.  This is what keeps my quest on-going.  If you are in the area and would like a very good pizza, I would recommend That's Amore.
Now go figure out how to put bubbles in your pizza perimeters!!!

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Ran L.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description:
It turns out that trying to find eats on Butler street after 10pm on a Tuesday is a major challenge. We went up and down Butler street trying to find some grub, but all the kitchens of our usual spots were closed.  It was either beer for dinner or venture into unexplored late-night food territory.  We noticed Pizza Amore as we drove by but wrote it off as another "probably only good while drunk" pizza joint, until I decided to Yelp it.  4.5 stars?!  We had to give it a shot.

While we had beers next door at Remedy while waiting for the pizza to be made, we overheard some other beer drinkers raving about how amazing the homemade meatballs at Pizza Amore were.  A totally out-of-the-blue coincidence. Good thing we had ordered meatballs on half of our pizza!

When we finally got the pizza, we were so pleasantly surprised at how much better it was than what we had expected based on the shop front.  The crust was very tasty, just the right mixture of chewiness and crispiness, and just the right tinge of sweetness.  The meatballs were indeed delicious, and they are in fact homemade (next time I'm trying the meatball hoagie).  The pizza did not make it home.  We ate the whole thing standing on the street and have returned for takeout several times since.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Lauren B.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: My husband and I got some slices to go from here and were really unimpressed for the price. Having recently moved here from NYC, this seemed not even as good as a dollar slice. Bland, nothing special with the crust or the cheese or toppings. Maybe the whole pizzas are better, but the slice to go seemed like not a great move. Was happy they had cracked red pepper and cheese to top the pizza with at least. Since we tried this place we also tried Spirit, and I liked Spirit's pizza a lot more.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Jane F.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: While waiting for my order I witnessed one of the cooks walk in through the back door, stop to put out his cigarette, and start making a pizza without washing his hands. I will never return to this establishment and hope the health inspector is thorough when checking this restaurant.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: T W.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: My first time stopping in I only bought some tea on a hot summer today, but noted that it smelled great if I ever stopped by if I was hungry. My second time nearby I had a pepperoni pizza and it was quite good! Greasy, but tasty! On food alone, I'd give it 4 stars, But, based on how accommodating the staff was I have to give it 5 stars! Other notes: small interior with a few outdoor tables

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Buttet F.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: Let's get this out of the way: you're not going to go here for the atmosphere (there is no seating), or the service (they're gruff), so the food better be good. Well, I'm sorry to report that it's just mediocre. In a city full pizza places (hell or even just on Butler Street), there are way better options. I won't go back and I can't offer a recommendation.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Matt H.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: I work close to here so we get pizza from here pretty often. It's always pretty tasty and comes at a good price. Never a complaint.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: John M.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: I was turned on to this place by my buddy who said it was the best pizza in Lawrenceville. He was right. I was very impressed. That perfect level of grease, lots of cheese, and the sauce wasn't that awful sugary crap at most Pittsburgh pizza shops. I will be back again many times.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Darren P.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: Ordered a large cheese pizza and it was great. Good quality cheese and sauce. The crust was good. I would order again.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Dave R.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: Not great pizza.  But not bad, either.  In all likelihood, I would not eat here except it's the closest pizzeria to my house.  I've had nothing but the pizza so I can't judge the sandwiches or calzones etc.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Jordan H.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: We order from here often. Their calzones and white pizza are delicious! Delivery is always very prompt.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Taylor S.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: Me and my boyfriend live right down the street and have ordered pizza from every pizza place on butler street. This place has the best!!!!! Yummyyyy I'm hungry.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Dave R.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description: Average pizza and sandwiches.  Nothing great but nothing horrible either.  Overall, their pizza just lacks any defining flavor.  With that said, it's probably the best pizza place within walking distance of my home but there are several better places that are a short drive away.

-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.author: Julia J.
-ZaQKvtRGQA-4FoUE_1s4w.description:
By Pittsburgh pizzaria standards, this place is pretty great. The crust is thin and crispy (as pizza should be!), there is no sugary sweet taste to the sauce, and they do not automatically give you a side of ranch under the assumption that that is an acceptable way to eat pizza. It's also super cheap. Also, PIZZA BY THE SLICE! WIN!

They do tend to be inconsistent, as the single slices are never the same size from one visit to the next. One time, my slice was literally wet and soggy and inedible at the bottom.

When you want to spend under $5 on a (decent) meal, go here.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Hallie T.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: So happy to have finally crossed paths with Pita My Shawarma for lunch the other day. The loaded shawarma fries blew my mind with a generous serving of amazingly seasoned fries topped with savory beef shawarma and mouth watering garlic sauce. Should have gone with my instinct and ordered more to save for dinner time.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Brant H.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description:
The Pita My Shawarma truck's off-duty parking spot is near where I live in Dormont, so have been curious about it for months. Finally had a chance to try it yesterday when it set up in Oakland, and it was well worth the wait.

The chicken shawarma was generously-sized, and everything from the chicken to the pita was clearly fresh.  Chicken was tender, juicy, and well-seasoned.  I loved all the veggies--crisp and flavorful, especially the pickles. Garlic sauce was tasty--but wow, still tasting the garlic today.  Only minor nitpick is that I felt like the wrap could have used a little more tanginess---I'd put some of their chili sauce on the top (which did have some tang) and that half the wrap was amazing. Second half was still very tasty, but less memorable.  

Zero nitpicks about the fries, though.  They were easily the best fries I've gotten from a food truck in recent memory, maybe ever.  Crisp on the outside, tender on the inside, not too greasy, and definitely enhanced by the za'atar seasoning.   Highly recommended!

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: David B.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description:
I tried the Beef Shawarma and it was good. The fries were amazing, served piping hot and extremely flavorful. My dining mates all pitched in to help me finish them. The truck was fairly busy but served up my order very quickly.

They offer a vegetarian option in the Hummus Wrap. 

Friendly professional service.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Arlene M.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description:
Made my way to Southpointe to find this new food truck. The menu sits off to the side on a wooden board with cards telling you what's on today's menu. In addition to shawarma you can also order a hummus wrap or for an upcharge of either $1.00-$2.00 depending upon the meat you choose, you can have it as a salad.

The falafel shawarma which I was hoping on getting was unavailable for purchase. The chicken shawarma uses chicken thigh as its base. The beef shawarma uses the prime of the meat. I learned that if you order a shawarma and a side of French fries then you can get a free bottled water or canned soda.

I decided to go with the beef shawarma and as I was waiting it to be prepared I learned that it is hand staked as I was watching them cut my meat. It comes with pickled turnips-an unusual but very tasty addition along with the typical lettuce, tomatoes, and onions that normally accompany it.

I would advise to stock up on napkins because this thing gets messy. They have plenty of them at the truck. The beef shawarma was a bit tough in some places and outside of the fact it seemed cold (I'm attributing the cold weather to that one) it was otherwise very tasty. The size is very generous for the price and makes a satisfying meal otherwise.

Pita My Shawarma has its own website with a partial listing of their menu items. The website also tells you when and where you can find them. I expect to see them a lot more around the Burgh once spring arrives and the temperatures improve. I am hoping next time I run into them they will have the falafel shawarma.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Stacey V.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: Pita My Shawarma was in Harmony today so happy to be able to try there Shawarma. Very very good had a Beef and Chicken Shawarma, they are huge was`t able to finish them both but wanted to try both, I can not say which one was better both of them so very good. If you get a chance to try there Shawarma`s you won`t be sorry, they are so yummy!!

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Troy B.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: Second time here at Pita My Shawarma today for lunch, and this food truck is so delicious, I have to add one more star!  This is by far, the best Shawarma in Pittsburgh.  Last time I had the beef, and today I tried the chicken ... Mmmmm!!!   Also got the yummy Za'aatar covered French fries again, and they were excellent!!!   The house-brined pickled turnips on the sandwich were really good.  I can't wait to try some Falafel, coming soon.  Jason, the owner and his assistant are very nice, kind, generous, and very cool ... Cheers!

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Karla D.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description:
Went to a meet and greet with State Rep Sara Innamorato last night at Hitchhiker in Sharpsburg. Pita My Shawarma was the food truck of the evening. I'm so delighted about this because the food was some of the best food truck gourmet we've had in awhile.

My boyfriend and I shared the beef shawarma. It was so good and big! The tastes and flavors burst in my mouth. The meat was juicy and the pita perfectly warm and soft. Everything melted in my mouth. Tarator sauce was spectacular and the pickled turnips were the perfect added touch.

Great people, professional, talented and all around awesome.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Julia E.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: I really wanted to love this food truck. It has awesome reviews. I went Friday night for dinner outside of Biddles. There wasn't much of a line but once you ordered it was a 10 minute wait for your food. It may have actually ended up being longer than that. Anyways, I found that odd for a food truck. The guys that were working were super friendly. I ordered the chicken shawarma and my hubby got the beef. Both seemed like they were lacking something. It just wasn't as flavorful as I wanted it to be. I will note that my daughter who is 2 was devouring the chicken. She loved it. Truck was very reasonably priced. If I come back I would like to try their hummus.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Sarah T.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: We visited this food truck at our local brewery, Leaning Cask.  Despite freezing temperatures they were waiting, eager to serve us out in the cold.  I ordered the fries which was a giant portion size and were fantastic.  My husband ordered the Chicken Shawarma which was also large and he said was delicious.  Very pleased with the service and the food quality!

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Will S.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: Just had this for the first time at the Holy Cross Farmers Market in Mt Lebanon. I got the beef shawarma with sesame sauce and pickles ($10). I really liked it. I thought the pita it came on and all the other ingredients were quality and the beef was heavily seasoned but not overwhelming -- so it was flavorful without drying you out (you know, like when somethings just got too much seasoning on it).   I would recommend it, and I'll be back.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Ostap L.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description:
Looking for something different? Look no further.
Best Shawarma in the Burg. Fresh made daily. I tried Chicken, Beef and also some fresh-cut fries. Everything was amazing. Friendly service.
Their schedule is available on their website on Find Us page.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Rachael S.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: The garlic sauce is delicious. The bowl left both of us hungry (had one beer and one chicken). The fries topped with beef were pretty good. All in, ok but I won't chase the truck.

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Taylor S.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: Had this the other night can't go wrong the beef on the pita was seasoned and you can taste the spices the lettuce and everything else that was on it I could have ate another one it was that good

C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.author: Brad S.
C9kxpolRlQcqwtx7DYggmA.description: Probably the best Shawarma in the city customer service was amazing the food was amazing and I love the color of his truck

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Rachel C.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
Three words. Birthday Cake Pudding. OMG. Salad bar. Get at it, yinz guyz! I love EnP and we go way back to my teenage days working as a hostess for my first job and then server through college. So I'm a fan for life. 

Now my experience is a little different because I have a toddler and I'm gluten free. Of course, it's perfect for kids and their choices are great with many options of fried mac and cheese, grilled cheese, corndogs and so much more. 

Now that I'm gluten free, the options are definitely slimmer for me, but I appreciate they have gluten free buns so I can still enjoy a delicious superburger. I also love any of their salads, with fries on top of course. Warning, fries are fried in the same as gluten items, but I just eat them anyway (sorry to my stomach). There's a handful of items that aren't marked gluten free that you can alter to be that way. I often get the bruschetta chicken, but grilled rather than fried. I do wish there were a handful more items to get that are GF, but I'm appreciative there are a few out there to choose from! 

I do hope one day they start making gluten free smiley cookies!

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Derek R.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
Very poor service tonight, over 1 hour to get our food which was cold.
No bread, ice cold vegetable.
Kitchen seemed to be backed up or understaffed. Waitress was nice.
No apology from the manager.
I would think they would offer a dessert for the problems, but no.
   This place was so good when it first opened in the new building, but has gone downhill. It's sad, they don't seem to listen to customers.
  The newest menus are physically a joke, cheaply made.
They discontinued some of their best items ( snow top buns, crumb buns, Pittsburgh sandwich etc).
The cream pies have an artificial whipped cream topping that's pretty disgusting, very greasy.
The chicken noodle soup is still great.
It's a shame that one of our only 24 hour places to eat is lacking in customer service.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Wayne S.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
Microwaved bacon and sausage for breakfast 
combined with greasy eggs and potatoes.
A 100% chance of an upset stomach.
This restaurant is overrated, based on some sort of Pittsburgh nostalgia.
So many better choices for family meals.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Julieanna L.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: Quick and easy. Hometown fave. Nothing like stopping in to get a milkshake and slice of pie. Waitress' are always friendly and chatty. Simple place to dine yet full of history!!

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Sara M.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: I come here at least twice a month, always good service. Rarely have issues, salad Bar is always fresh! One of my favorite eat n parks.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Ashley W.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: My go-to eat'n park! This is a newer location right on Banksville road. I've been to this location many times and I've never had a problem. The employees are great and the restaurant is super clean. Ask for Joan, she is THE BEST!  Always remembers our us and never forgets our usual order. The drive through is always a breeze as well. Call ahead to place your order & it will be ready within 20 minutes. They always give us a free cookie for to-go orders as well, which is nice. No complaints from me, I'd recommend.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Elizabeth S.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: I like this eat n park because they have the midnight buffet on Friday and Saturday nights! It's always fun and interesting to stop in and eat with the late night crowd. The late night buffet has breakfast items and soups and some salad ingredients. You can order the buffet until three am, you can also order from the regular menu as well.  The food is ok, it's eat n park so it's better than fast food but not five star restaurant food. The service is spotty depending on the server but it is open 24 hours so  that's always a plus.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Christopher B.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
This location could quite possibly be the best Eat'n Park I have been to in my 3 years of living in Pittsburgh. From the time we walked through the door the service was A1. I especially want to take a second to talk about how great Amber (The server) is. She was attentive, easy to talk to, and generally amazing. (She got a good tip from everyone). 

As far as food goes... This seems like a top tier Eat'n Park. The bacon was perfectly crispy )how I asked for it), Buffalo chicken fingers were completely coated in buffalo sauce (some location have spotty with the sauce). Those were the highlights. 

I have a meeting in the area once a month so I will be back for a good meal and great service from Amber.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Vanessa C.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: I heard really good things about the smiley face cookies so I had to go here. The cookies were really good and I mailed some to my husband in Korea and he said they were still soft when he got them. The burger I had I was really good and I ate mine with a gluten free bun. The gluten free bun was absolutely the best I've ever had and tasted like normal bread. The service was a bit slow but the food made up for the time I waited.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Steven M.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
Yesterday was my first time ever stepping foot inside of an Eat'n Park and it's probably not a chain I will be returning too. I was staying at the hotel next door so it was super convenient to just walk order, so that's exactly what I did. The staff was friendly when I walked in and discussed the menu with me before I made up my mind and ordered from the takeout area. I ordered the chicken fillets with French fries and mashed potatoes with gravy (I like potatoes, sue me). The food took about 20 minutes to come out and before you know it I was back at my hotel opening up a container of disappointment. I was not expecting a top notch food experience but I was also not expecting 4 chicken fingers that look like they were served at a baseball game with 12 French fries......why would you call it chicken fillets when they are just a few mediocre chicken tenders? On top of that, the French fries lacked pretty much any flavour making them pretty unenjoyable. The mashed potatoes were alright but since they also didn't give me any plastic silver-wear or anything to eat with I was forced to use one of the chicken strips as a spoon, which was great, really great. They throw in a small Cinnabon, a cookie, and roll for free and the roll was alright. The cookie was terrible and I didn't bother trying the Cinnabon.

Overall, I'm going to try and avoid ever returning to a Eat'n Park when I return to Pennsylvania. The food wasn't very good and I'm not going to recommend coming here unless you too stay at the hotel next door.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Arlene M.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
We recently had an event here so I was glad for the opportunity to return to have dinner with family and friends. The fall menu is now out so the offerings I had at the event are no longer available. They are now serving turkey with all the trimmings.

Service is always fast and the staff are the nicest ones to work with. This one has also been remodeled to include a take out window. The usual menu items are available as well as their renown soup and salad bar. My turkey dinner came with stuffing, gravy, and a side of my choice. It was very good. Pumpkin pie and cake is now in season so make the most of it while you have the opportunity. A person in our group had the rosemary chicken which is another one of my favorites and it did not disappoint. 

This Eat n Park has the new check service. You don't have to take your check to the pay area. Prices are very reasonable and you can get a good meal or sandwich or whatever you are interested in. They do change the daily soup menu but they always have chili and chicken noodle soup on the salad bar. It's right off an exit at Banksville Road headed away from the city.

Definitely the place for smiles!

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Henry W.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: I had been fasting for blood work this morning and reallly needed food. Had a good breakfast that hit my spot.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Stephanie S.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: Eat'n Park is way different from when I was growing up. The food is OKAY. The staff was just there, nothing special, no smiles. The service was slow. This just wasn't a great experience and it's sad because I was looking forward to it as there are no eat'n parks around my residence. I could go the rest of my life without going back although the cookies are still delicious and soft.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Ralph H.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
You kind of get what you pay for here. It's your basic food at a basic price. I particularly like the salad bar over everything. The burgers are good as are the chicken dishes. Superburger combo for 7.99 or the Angusburger special for 10.99. 
Grab a piece of pie for 2.99 as of this review.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Marie M.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: Ordered takeout this morning : got my food and the chicken sandwich was raw . I tried to put it in the oven to cook it the rest of the way, but it was just such a turn off. I ordered food to not be hungry anymore and I get the food and it's not even edible . I called the restaurant and they offered me a gift card:said transaction Can not be reversed and refunded money. I know that is not true because I worked at eat n park before. Let me remind you I paid for something I didn't eat . Sad

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Blue S.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: This place is great! We ordered takeout for the bourbon salmon, the superburger, and the zucchini lasagna. The salmon was delicious, and the lasagna was amazing. I've never had a vegetarian entree that tasted this good. Also, with the three entrees we got three free cookies and some sides. The cole slaw was just ok, but the garden rice and garden salads were phenomenal. I wish we stayed at the restaurant to eat because the diner vibe was really chill and warm. Definitely recommend this place to anyone staying at Days Inn or Comfort Inn because it's just a short walk away!

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Stephany M.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: Friendly service. Clean. Seated quickly. Great buffet and breakfast. Attentive waitress. Highly recommend.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Mary-Michael M.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
The place for Smile. Oh is it ever! Eat & Park really knows how to make dining a streamlined experienced. They are the classic Pittsburgh family establishment. After starting with one restaurant, they've grown into a chain that has been perfected! 

My families kids LOVE this place & I love Eat N Park for providing us with such a stress free dining option. The menu options are extensive. They have something for everyone's dining needs- diabetic, allergies, celiac, small portions for kids & seniors, picky eaters... it's amazing just what they've thought of! I can't think of any other restaurant in the country that offers what Eat N Park does! 

Our family has many favorites- just to name a few, the chicken soup is heavenly. As is the fish sandwich w mac & cheese during Lent. There are just so many choices- it really is almost impossible to review just one meal. The thing about Eat N Park is that the menu is straightforward & the calories, ingredients, and all details are readily available upon request. This makes finding a dish that suits ones individual tastes easy and exceptional. Personally, I think you can't go wrong with the hot turkey sandwich & French fries - all covered in gravy. Delicious!  So very delicious!  

And we can't forget to mention the Smiley Cookies. They are iconic! Do not leave without having one if you're dining for the first time! The Smiley Cookies are absolutely the best part. Or maybe the stickies are. Or the the pies. No. The Smiley Cookies are the best... or maybe the stickies.  They are all so amazing! You might have to try them all and decide for yourself!

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Christian S.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description: We came here after a concert because we were really hungry. It took a pretty long time to get sat and then it took awhile for are server to get to us. The power went out twice which I though was kinda creepy. The server was nice but kinda clueless. The food we ordered was not described in the menu will so when it came out it was not what we expected. I was not asked if we want a refill and are app came out after are meal and it was covered in spilled sauces. I wanted to get some cookies to take home because I use to get them as a kid but I had to wait about 10 min in an empty line because there was nobody at the register. I probably would try this place one more time but If it is still bad I will not be returning.

575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.author: Dana R.
575BoZY8tDPcfSRcdsUNLw.description:
Honestly, never been here, but I want to give a shout out to this particular Eat N Park. My friend recently visited and here is his quote:

"We had a fantastic hostess at enp who happened to have his pronouns on his name tag to allow for his identity while in transition! Glad enp is open and allowing its staff to be who they are!!!!"

Thank you Banksville ENP for rolling with the times!

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Joe K.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description: This is a down home chill laid back place, but don't let it fool you their food is really good. Wing night and happy hour specials well worth it. The stuff is also sweet and very nice. VAL N MAL R THE best

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Tom S.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
First time here getting use to Pittsburgh area were it seems half the places are bar and grill local spots. Couple of TVs, fair sized bar and booths opposite the bar, little spot in the back with five tables. Two small and the rest for six and up.  The place was almost packed on a Wednesday at 5:30. There is smoking out on the covered patio and not inside. One server and one bartender both really moving to keep everyone waited. Doing a great job!

We ate here twice, got Wings and they are a little on the hot side, but they were fair size, no small ones, wife got a sandwich. Second time I got small pizza and wife got a BLT sandwich. The pizza was good and very cheesy. The BLT was on huge bread which is OK, but the bacon was way over cooked.  Onion rings were good.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Evan F.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
Not sure if we caught them on a bad night or what, but we had a less-than-stellar meal at this low-key neighborhood bar.  After a ,ong day of moving our daughter in to her new college apartment, we needed a quick and casual dinner someplace near our hotel. I scoured Yelp for recommendations and this spot popped to the top of the list.

We sat at a booth table in the bar area and settled in with our beer and cider orders. Server was a nice kid and he took good care of us along with others from the staff who chipped in as needed. The vibe there is very "local" where the servers seemed to know everyone who came through the door (except us! ha!) and folks appeared to be having a good time.

On to the meal review, however. We ordered a house salad, a burger to share and an order of wings. The salad was chopped lettuce, carrots and cabbage and was clearly from a bag. Nothing special to say the least. Our standard cheeseburger was most likely frozen and thrown on a grill given its shape and how it was cooked, but it was served atop a terrible, chewy bun straight out of a bag. The saving grace to the meal were the buffalo garlic parmesan wings, which we found pretty decent with a mild tangy flavor from the sauce and parm cheese combined.

Wish there was more to say about this place...although the atmosphere was chill, the food left a lot to be desired.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Rachel W.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
We randomly stumbled across this place and it doesn't look like much on the outside but the reviews I read seemed promising so we decided to just see what happened. 

They were super busy but only had one person working the bar/tables. However, she was very on top of things and worked quickly so no complaints here.  

The atmosphere has a very "local bar" feel which I love. I ended up getting their 'wedgie' which is a sandwich made with pizza dough. It was super good. I had more of a chicken sandwich and I think opting for something with more flavor such as salami would have paired nicer with the dough. So, I am going to opt for that next time! 

Great food, beer on tap, service, and price. We plan on going back soon when we just need a place to kick up and enjoy some solid food.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Christy B.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description: Alexion's is a great little place with really good food. I love their chicken salad sandwich, which is saying alot since I don't really love chicken salad period. My coworkers always get their Italian wedgie and their Reuben is great too. I do wish they could make changes a little easier but they've always been accommodating... it just shows up a little weird on billing but ends up working out. The place does have a smoking section out on the patio so I'd recommend inside if you don't like the smoke. There's also an upstairs which I had no idea about until recently! What really matters is that the food is always consistently good and the service is almost always good. We've only had bad service once which is saying alot considering the amount of times we've been there.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Andy C.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
Food was ok. Had the Rueben Calzone.

Large portion, tasted great but the Corned Beef was very tough. May have gotten overcooked as the Pizza Dough for the calzone was baked.

Local place with friendly service and reasonable prices.

Had side salad. Fresh and nice portion size.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Lindsay K.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description: Ordered a personal white pizza with their hot sausage and green peppers! Soooo tasty and the crust was PERFECT! The bartender was super nice and on top of everything (especially since she was the only one on the floor!) kudos to her!

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Karla D.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
My office was down the street and often I would walk over and grab lunch. 
Sometimes would grab drinks with coworkers at the end of our day as well.
They really have a pretty phenomenal bar/restaurant style menu.
It's basic bar fare but the way it's prepared takes it to another level.
Fries with nacho cheese sauce-yes, please.
Chicken parm sandwich-yes, please.
Pizza-yes, please.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Rebecca M.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description: Nice hometown spot! Great sandwiches, nice beer selection as well.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Antonio T.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description: A real laid back place with a lot of cool servers and great service. I would recommend you build your own sandwich and enjoy the vibe.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Senora F.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description: First time visiting Alexion's. Our server Blaze was awesome. Prompt, non-hovering, friendly demeanor and yoooo!! Our food came out in like literally 6 minutes. I ordered a jalapeño cheddar burger and my bae ordered a veggie burger. The veg burger isn't a bean type, but more of a patty, but tasty nonetheless. I asked for tomato slices for my burg and added the side pickles and this jam is LIT. Finished it off with a session IPA on the patio. Mmm mmm gerrdd!

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Meghan B.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description: Came here for a birthday party, which was held in the upstairs room. It was a bit crowded up there, but our group made the space work. The service was excellent. The servers had to run up and down steps carrying drinks, food, and taking orders. They were incredibly friendly and did a wonderful job. The pizza was delicious and the wings smelled SO good, although I did not have any. We were a little sad to see there is no dart board here, but other than that we had a great time.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Julian S.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
Where do I even begin:

At the moment of arrival, the outside of the establishment looked like a building in foreclosure, as it was dim and insipid.

As I entered the building, the restaurant was pumping loud rock music from every corner of the building, which obviously made it hard to communicate with the waiters(but I'll get there in a moment).

A group of close friends and I sat on the couch seats, which seemed old fashioned and a little outdated. To my surprise, the place was PACKED with people.

Our waitress(who seemed to be the only one as she was running around the whole building checking on the customers), finally approached our table and asked what we would like to order. One of my partners asked for a salad and the other asked for the chicken tenders, while I ordered the smokehouse burger.

I knew there should have been suspicion about the food, since the waitress had a difficult time describing the salad to my partner, having only said "it's like what's in a regular salad" and recited a list of what is suppose to be in a salad, such as lettuce, dressing, and to my partners surprise, pickles.

A solid 30-45 minutes had passed and the food had finally came, well, to everybody accept my order. As my partners were experiencing in on the salad and the chicken, I waited another 3 minutes for my smokehouse burger to arrive. And I was SHOCKED.

What my eyes detected first was the use of white toast bread( uncooked and not even toasted), When I expected the traditional brown buns to appear. The smokehouse burger consisted of onion rings, teriyaki sauce, bacon, and cheese, which luckily it had all the components. 

The burger was too big to put in a human-sized mouth. I have made a couple of attempts to eat the sand which like a burger, however the size of the burger was overpowering. I asked my waitress for a fork and knife to help dissect this behemoth. 

As fast as I had put the food in my mouth was the same speed I wanted to spit out the bite. First. The teriyaki sauce was inconsistent with the burger, as there were large patches of the sauce in some areas of the burger while the others were scarce. The onion ring was probably made with poorly made batter and the crust couldn't hold on to the onion itself. The bacon, however, was crisp and it is what you would expect from bacon, light, tasty, crunchy. 

Now here's the real disappointment. The party itself was BLAND. Absolutely no seasoning in it, not even salt and pepper. The cook of the burger was well done and I couldn't take another bite from that sandwich. 

Aside from my plate, my partner had tasted the table ketchup and she found a weird taste in it. I took a sample of the ketchup in the bottle and it tasted old and warm, which should not be a characteristic of ketchup.

And to top it all of, one of the customers sitting at the bar was arguing over the loud music to another customer and at a server. We stopped paying attention, grabbed our things and left. Never coming back.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Charlie H.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
Soooooo good!! Tried going here last week around 600 and due to a party on the 2nd floor, it was packed with a 3 couples ahead of us so we left to try again today. We snagged a booth when you first walk in right across from the bar. Per the reviews on Yelp, we ordered Toms wedgie, and some fries and wings. 
Toms Wedgie: Seriously the BEST thing I have ate at a restaurant in a long time! The wedgie is half a pizza crust folded over packed with toppings depending on what you choose. It's a PIZZA CRUST!! 5/5
Wings: We ordered the Buffalo Parm, they were ok, but dry. 3/5
Fries w cheese: Not really expecting something miraculous here, average 3/5
I will definitely go here again, and more than likely order Toms Wedgie again. I wish I caught the Servers name, but had to point out that she was extremely friendly and attentive the entire time we were there. Soooooo....
Server who I can't remember her name: 5/5

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Marissa M.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
I never would have found this place if it weren't for Yelp, and I'm so glad I did! After seeing everyone's picture of the wedgie's I HAD to get one.  Luckily my boyfriend and I split one, cause they are HUGE! I didn't quite know what I was getting myself into when I ordered it, but this thing is like a giant sandwich, but the bread is PIZZA CRUST! I was so pleasantly surprised when I figured that out! We tried the steak wedgie and it was soooo good! It also happened to be wing night which is Tuesdays and Thursdays.  Wings are 40 cents...super cheap and super yummy! 

This place is definitely a sporty, divey, casual place to come for a drink or bite to eat, but I think that's part of its charm.  The staff was very friendly but I did have a bit of trouble getting prompt service which is the only reason I didn't give 5 stars, but hey, it could have just been an off night, and the food was worth the wait! Definitely give this place a try, you'll be happy you did!!!

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Justin C.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description: Great neighborhood bar/restaurant. Great food though additionals like extra sauce etc are very overpriced.

uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.author: Megan S.
uNzg9P7p-7QBNp47U4koEg.description:
Love love love. Perfect hometown bar atmosphere, super friendly service and yummy eats. Having two of those talked about Wedgies (though you could easily share one), side of coleslaw and 4 microbrew drafts, set us back only $44, which felt just right. We saw many baskets of wings go by, which do look baller and they have like 8-10 different sauces.
