z4GLHQ2-o0p6Ia4q_4j4HA.description:
Nothing great, nothing awful either.

Service is OK, but they were slow when we were there. 

Food was descent, eggs were good, but the bacon was over cooked til it was dark and crumbly.  

They do take credit cards, but you'll have to get up and go behind the counter to enter your PIN as debit, and still leave a cash tip.

The building and the interior could use a bit of work.  Our booth had a huge patch of duct tape and was lumpy.

What you would expect from a diner in the Saaathills.

z4GLHQ2-o0p6Ia4q_4j4HA.author: Derek R.
z4GLHQ2-o0p6Ia4q_4j4HA.description:
One of my weekly lunch or breakfast place.
Good home cooked food and reasonable prices. I would avoid busy times. An Sunday mornings. The staff is limited and cannot handle the full crowd. I never have a problem usually, except today my glass of milk was chunky( turned sour ).
Sadly Shirley has passed on and will be missed.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Lina B.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: This is my favorite pizza place in Dormont! My fiancé and I order here once every week or so and we love it. On tuesday's they have a pick up special for a large one topping pizza for 8 dollars! Our delivery orders always come on time or earlier and we've never had an issue with pick up either. If you've never had their wings I definitely recommend them!

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: April T.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description:
They are good...Sometimes 
Over the years the prices have gone up but the quality tends to go down. It really depends on who's working and time of day. I've noticed when they have a influx of younger people on staff that's when your going to get super dry or half burned hoagies. Missing items and warm salads.

I would say it's a toss up 50/50 if your going to get a good meal or be disappointed. Delivery is super slow even if your a few blocks away. I do like they offer online ordering but the fees are way too much. Dormont is saturated with pizza shops and Molly's ranks up there on the list but it's no longer #1. I found lil Caesars to have better consistently so that's saying something.
I'll still order from time to time but I'll never expect to be impressed like once was.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Jessica S.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description:
I am so confused as to why Molly's has such a poor rating on here. I lived in Dormont for two years about a year ago right down the street from Molly's on Glenmore and Potomac, this was before Molly's was on grubHub. Living so close by we ordered often, a quick call to place the order and we would walk up in 15 mins to hot delicious food to take home. We have gotten the various steak hoagies, Emily's garlic bites, the pizza with all kinds of toppings, and the steak salad, my key go-to. All items listed were exceptionally good and I never had an issue with the customer service, the owner being one of the nicest people I have met in Dormont. The only small issue I had was with a younger girl in her early 20's maybe, that just hated working it seemed. She could get a bit rude when I walked in to pick up the food. But other than that I have never had a complaint. 

The folks in there are always pleasant and they make a killer pizza. So killer in fact we still order from there now that we've moved to Beechview. And now that they have the broaster we order even more often, more recently we got boneless wings what were perfectly cooked, sauced and seasoned. With all of the pizza places in Dormont this is by far the best and it's awesome that it's family owned. Go support this local business and get some pizza in your belly!

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Bob C.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description:
Top notch lifesaving! I'm from Buffalo and am here with my family on vacation on a Tuesday and where Vocelli's let us down with closing 2 hours earlier than their advertised time and saying they were only doing pickup (Vocelli's also lists delivery 7 days a week, a lie apparently), MOLLY'S not only delivered, the food was delivered/arrived at 10:10, they close at 10:00! The guy even said he'd apply a coupon. Mind you, we called at 9:20, what wonderful service!

I know we're in Pittsburgh but their authentic Philly was certainly authentic and hit high marks with me. Good cheese sauce and steak (and juicy sub steak flavor along with onions. In Buffalo we take our pizza serious and we ordered a personal for the kids. The best in PA I've had yet. My wife also enjoyed her turkey sub but could only finish half. The bread is quite big and heavy. Maybe our only complaint and it's not much of one. Whole family of 4 fed for $25 too. 

Sorry the photos aren't so appealing, we were starving after the other local establishment let us down and scrambling. I'll remember Molly's for coming through for us.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Derl H.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: We pulled off the interstate looking for a hotel. Once we got a room we looked at the in room information for something to order for dinner. We ordered a pizza from Molly's and were very impressed. Really good flavor, arrived hot. One of the better pizzas we have ever had.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Zack F.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: Got a random  unaddressed  menu in my mailbox today and if I know anything its if a place pays someone to go door to door with menus. Then the food is probably worth a shot. In this case we got 12pc. broasted chicken  and Greek salad delivered  easily  will feed 3 adults or 2 adults and 2 kids. Now I cant wait to try the pizza

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Hans Z.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: Overpriced and pretty basic and for the most part, tasteless. Why anyone would get Pizza from here when you have Campiti's, Beto' s and Fiori's all within a stones throw is beyond me. I was appalled at the price of this stuff when you consider how inauthentic it is. Not a place I would recommend if u want a proper slice. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Evan K.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: As seen on receipt ordered rigatoni pasta received spaghetti. Second issue order steak hoagie did not receive in order. Ordered at 830 didn't receive til 945 pm looked in bag found out didn't receive called store directly no customer service gentleman was very rude trying to give me credit not wanted. I will let everybody know about my horrible experience.note this is the 3rd and last time.?

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Heidi W.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: I used to love this place. They had decent food and my husband loved the Authentic Philly Cheesesteak. The last 2 times that I ordered salad, there was no salad dressing include, which is required to even place a salad order. The first time, I didn't complain because it could have been a fluke. But on Monday September 3rd, I place and order for a steak salad. Now mind you, the steak salad in Pittsburgh includes french fries on it. Not only was the order 30 minutes late, with no communication, but again there was no salad dressing, 2 cherry tomatoes cut in half, a couple of rings of raw onion, and no french fries. Granted the order was placed on a holiday night and they wanted to get out work, but please don't short change the customer and please respond to customer complaints. They have lost a customer and it's sad because I really liked the food there.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: James H.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: Best pizza and wings on this side of town (dormont) haha seriously though if you're looking for a nice hot cheesy pizza and the best wings ever! Look no further!

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Kelly M.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description:
A nice local spot. This pizza shop is family owned and operated on the corner by the Potomac station! The man who runs it is always very friendly and conversational- and the employees seem to be a lot of younger kids of high-school age. I can get behind that- a guy giving them a chance to earn some extra money while learning about cooking, customer service, etc. 
The pizza is always very good, and with their specials you just can't beat the price on most weekdays! Also their salads are always large, fresh, and full of veggies.

Support your local businesses! It's what makes Dormont a great place to visit and live!

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Stacy N.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: Today my friend and I ordered lunch.  She got a turkey hoagie and onion rings.  The hoagie was cold and onion rings burnt so bad that the container melted.  She called the place and asked them to replace her order, the man replied 45 min at least.  This was at 1 pm which meant she would now have to wait until almost 2 for lunch so she asked to be reimbursed instead and was told no but you can have a store credit because we don't do that here.  Umm what hold up you want me to pay for burnt food with melted styfoam and a cold hoagie? That was it the conclusion was the manager would not refund her the money so she is forced to eat there again if she wants any compensation for her sad lunch.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Jennifer B.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: Solid, delicious pizza. Get the deep dish it's sooooo good.  Tip - check for coupons - they usually have a ton floating around online or in mailers or magazines.  They had a $3 off any deep dish - soooo good. I've also had the margarita pizza and their hoagies (the meatball and the turkey) too which are pretty tasty. The Molly's cheese sticks is actually like a small pizza - really tasty if you order it as an app you might be too full for your actual pizza.  Molly's never disappoints.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Raul A.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: I ordered from here twice. The first time the pizza wasn't bad. The second time the pizza was awful, I could barely get through a couple slices. There was hardly any sauce and it was barely edible. From what I can tell there is no consistency from pizza to pizza. The first pizza was thin, cooked well and pretty decent, the second time as mentioned above, there was hardly any sauce which made the pizza very dry as well as the bread being very thick and it just didn't taste the same. It tasted as if I ordered it from another place altogether. I wish I could get refunded but I guess it is what it is.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Meg F.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: Love Molly's! This is my neighborhood go-to pizza place. I prefer their regular style pizza to the deep dish, but know lots of people who swear by it. It's a solid, reliable, pizza shop. Delivery is fast, everyone is nice, prices are reasonable. Good salads & hoagies too. Definitely recommend.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Liv F.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description:
Ordered from Molly's a few times now and all the food I've had has been pretty good so far.  They have a nice menu - wings, hoagies, pasta, salads - I'm a fan of their chicken salad!  I feel like it's a bit on the pricey side, but considering the food and service has been good, it's worth it to me. 

Update: tried their Stromboli and I liked it - my picky eating 6 yr old even ate some of it.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Lindsay B.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: Great food and fast delivery!! The phone girl Zia? was friendly and helped me decided on my order! Will be back

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Amy M.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description: Fantastic food! Great service! Tyler is the BEST- always gives great customer service and is consistent on taste with the orders. Chicken is incredible and hoagies and pizza are out of this world. Definitely recommend this place!  5 stars isn't enough!!

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Judy G.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description:
I stopped in on a whim and wish I hadn't. I ordered 1 slice of pepperoni pizza. I waited so long for it that I thought they were out growing the wheat, milking the cow, and killing the pig. Okay, that bit was an exaggeration but my paid parking ended at 3:45. I got back to the car at 3:55. The only other thing I did was stop in a shop for tea so I'm guesstimating it took them 20 minutes to warm up one slice. I honestly did wonder if they were cooking a whole pie just to get me that slice. The young woman who brought it to me did apologize so I'm guessing that's not a normal wait time.

I wasn't impressed with the pizza. I like a thinner crust although that's a matter of taste but the taste wasn't all that. There wasn't enough cheese or sauce which, really, is the whole point of pizza. Also, given the wait, while the edge of the crust was hot, the middle of the slice was lukewarm. 

A ridiculously long wait for almost reheated, bland pizza? I don't think so.

NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.author: Jaynie C.
NrokuoWJAy_VbMprivfAIA.description:
I wish I could choose 0 stars. Molly's lost a customer in us on Saturday night. There is too much competition in the area to settle for horrible customer service, receiving the wrong orders twice and being over charged. We ordered 1 Cajun steak hoagie which was on special for $2 off the whole hoagie...we also ordered a Philly steak...and a pizza with pepperoni mushrooms and onions..not that difficult. We received 2 Cajun steak hoagies at full price...And a sausage and mushroom pizza. When we called to let them know about the mistakes, we were put on hold 3 separate times and then they had to speak with a manager to see if it was ok to rectify their mistake. I asked to speak to the manager and was told that I couldn't. They did replace the pizza...they did not fix the overcharge or the fact that they sent the wrong hoagie. I called twice asking to speak with a manager and both times I was denied. 
We will not order from Molly's again. How they were voted best is beyond me. The food was mediocre at best. The Cajun hoagie had so much seasoning that I found it inedible and Dominos pizza is better than what we received. Too many good pizza delivery places in the area to waste 40.00 on food that was basically inedible, the staff desperately needs to learn customer service because not one person apologized for their mistake and acted like we did something wrong. Next time we'll spend our money at one of the other delivery places in the area. Molly's, I hope the 4.00 overcharge, poorly trained staff, and miserable delivery driver don't cost you more customers.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Madeline V.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
The Map Room is where my boyfriend and I went on our first date, and we've gone back every year since then. I've also come here on two or three occasions other than our annual dates when living in the neighborhood, and this darling Regent Square mainstay has definitely grown on me! The atmosphere is cozy and old-timey with plenty of friendly locals, wood trim, framed maps on the walls, and cool map etchings on glass partitions. (Hence the name!) The service is always friendly, albeit a bit slow on a couple of understaffed occasions, but it's a small place and I'm more than willing to wait a bit so long as the service is pleasant.

The beer and liquor prices are really good, which is why it's nice to come for drinks. They have a draft list with about twelve options and twice as many bottled beers to choose from. Things like Flying Dog seem to be $1.50-$2.00 cheaper than pretty much anywhere else even if the selection is smaller. For those who don't want beer they have a menu of throwback cocktails (think Gin Rickey and Tom Collins) for reasonable prices similar to that of Kelly's in East Liberty. On top of all this whenever I've ordered their food it's been really delicious and definitely a cut above dive bar fare in terms of greasiness and taste. I've never been here and not seen multiple tables full of people eating and looking very satisfied with their meals, so I know it's not just me. I'm glad The Map Room is still open after seeing Dunning's close (the area needs another late-night food spot besides D's) and I hope it stays that way for a while yet! I'll be coming back (at least once a year) so long as it does.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Savannah R.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description: This place is so fun! Your neighborhood dive bar. We got there at 8pm and it wasn't too busy. Ive also never seen such convenient street parking in my life. I got a front row spot! The bartender Kiki helped us right away and she is the sweetest person ever. She made sure to remember our names and called us by name all night. I've never had a bartender think to do that. We had a blast here. Everyone was singing and dancing. The music was great and there was a long line to play darts. My favorite part was the stack of board games and cards they have in the corner of the bar. We played trivial pursuit all night while we were drinking and it was so fun. As the night went on more people started to show up. It seems like more of a post-midnight bar. They don't serve food anymore though. Even though it is very small inside, you definitely feel right at home when you're there. The drink prices are amazing too. For as big as the glasses are and as strong as she makes them, this place is definitely worth returning to.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Lana L.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
Cute, easygoing restaurant. The whole restaurant is map themed (surprise surprise) and there are Trivial Pursuit cards in the booth tables (great way to entertain yourself as you wait for your food). Ordered the calamari and the Hangover burger for a really late dinner on a Thursday night. Both were pretty tasty and came out in a reasonable amount of time. It's open late every day of the week and prices are good, so I'd recommend The Map Room for any meal of the day, especially when you're hungry late at night because most other places probably won't be open.

Taste | 4
Atmosphere | 3.5
Presentation | 3
Service | 3
OVERALL | 3.5

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Mike G.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
Dont know what the other reviews are talking about with the food, thought it was incredible. 

Started with the field salad with Gorgonzola dressing, very fresh and flavorful. I had the pub fish and chips which was good, the fries have that perfect combination of soft and crisp texture. My wife had the black strap seitan sandwich and loved it. It's difficult to find a vegetarian option that is unique but they nailed it. The BBQ sauce on it was tangy and went with the cheese perfectly. 

Also nice that their cocktails are very reasonably priced and they have Pimms cups which are quite hard to find. 

Will definitely be back.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Anne C.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
Yes, Map room Yesssssss. 

Love their happy hours. Calamari Tacos with fries on the side for only 3 dollars? Ya jokin'?! Best deal ever and the tacos were superb. I will definitely go here always and so should everyone else in regent square.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: HN S.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
I like the Map Room.  I've been here a number of times and have always been satisfied.  The service is good and the food quality has never disappointed. If you're looking for beer, the place next door, D's Six Pack and Dogs, is where you want to be.  But it doesn't hurt that the Map Room has a full bar and a few quality beers on tap as well.

This Irish inspired pub sports a limited menu of regular items and an ever changing variety of daily specials. This evening I had a choice of either chicken parm on angel hair pasta or marsala creamed pork chops.  Since I had chicken for lunch I went with the pork chops.  It came with a tasty bowl of Irish stew and the chops didn't take very long at all to follow. 

My dish had two chops coated with marsala cream, a baked potato with sour cream and real bacon bits on top and a grilled veggie meddly of tomatoe, zucchini and Brussels sprouts. Everything was delicious!

Dinner and a beer set me back $23.80 plus tip...  not bad at all for a relaxing Monday .evening.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Karla D.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description: When I still lived in RS this map themed neighborhood pub was a nice place for brunch or dinner. Some Sundays during football season regulars would bring in potluck that was available for all to share. Trivial Pursuit cards at the bar are a fun feature. Decent menu and the food is never a disappointment. Bartenders are sweet and on their A Game.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Krissy G.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description: Good food, good service. Impressed with the whiskey offerings!

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Andrea S.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description: This place is great. I ordered a quinoa black bean burger that was cooked to perfection. The onion rings were huge and delicious. The menh was small but the waitress was lovely and even said that if there wasn't anything appealing on the menu that her cook could whip something up for me. I don't live close, but I'll definitely be going back.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Darae C.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
This is more of a 3.5 star review, as I thought this place was solid and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't an absolute dump. 

I'd driven by here a few times while visiting a friend and last night stopped in for a bite to eat after discovering everything else on the block was closed. We walked in and looked for a hostess stand or something to dictate if we should seat ourselves, when a bartender yelled that we can just sit anywhere. The dining room side of the room was almost full with two large tables and duos of people, but we got a seat and waited.

And waited. And waited. After awhile a clearly overwhelmed server came over and read us the specials, which was our main draw to the restaurant in the first place. From the outside this just looks like another neighborhood bar and grille joint that doesn't take its food too seriously, but the menu is a bit more upscale barfood inspired. Though I'm not sure they hit all the marks on everything they wanted to accomplish, it was better than most comparable establishments I've been to.

After hearing the specials, we ordered the loaded cheese fries appetizer and waited a good bit for menus to be brought over. I'm not complaining about the service--when our server could get to us amidst her 10 or so other tables, she was great. The problem is that she was the only one on a busy Sunday night and clearly wasn't used to that sort of pressure.

I ordered the Regent Square with steak on a baguette and my friend ordered be A1 black strap burger with bacon. We also tried the crab and corn chowder and the cream of mushroom.

The scratch made cheese sauce was great, and you could tell the fries were handmade. The crab soup left a lot to be desired. My sandwich was just alright--the bread was great, but the steak was in large chunks and not sliced which made some bites a bit more difficult to chew than others. The flavors were all there, but again it missed the mark for me. It would have done well with a sauce of some sort.

I heard a table complain behind us about how long their food was taking and the server said she explained before that it is scratch made kitchen and the food takes a lot of time. I can assure you that my table wasn't informed about the scratch made kitchen, but we excused the long wait times because it was clear the place was overwhelmed. There was nary a sign on the menu or posted anywhere that mentioned how long the cooking times would be. I don't mind waiting if that means good food is on the way, but I feel as if that is something that absolutely should be mentioned up front so the diner can adjust their expectation.

All in all, my experience here was fairly good and I wouldn't mind trying it again. I'll just remember to allow myself extra time :)

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Janice K.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description: This place has some good beer but it's really kind of gross inside and is essentially a dive. I can't understand how it's so packed all the time. The service is average and after seeing some of the people I'd be nervous to order food here.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Roger A.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
The good: the service, decor, location, beer list, perogi, & Cesar salad. 

The bad: the shrimp linguini

The ugly: The seitan was inedible, and one of the worst things I've ever tasted. I am pesceterian (former vegetarian), and it made me nauseas. It had the texture of pure pig fat, but without the yummy taste. Our server was kind enough to comp both of our entrees 

Summary: seems like a good place for a beer and appetizer a bad place to try something new for dinner.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Chuck K.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
The Map Room, Regent Square

I met a friend out for dinner last night. Initially I was in the mood for deep-fried goodness, so we ventured to D's Six Pax and Dogz.  Unfortunately, D's doesn't serve food after 10pm on the weekends.  Luckily, The Map Room was open, and the kitchen was still making food.

We sat down and were greeted by our friendly waiter. While we continued to search for an entrée we ordered fried zucchini and crab cakes.  We were also served some tasty local beers- delicious!

Our appetizers came in 10 minutes, and we quickly dug in.  The zucchini was perfectly fresh, and hand breaded.  A tasty dipping sauce was a nice accompaniment for the crispy veggies.  Homemade crab cakes were equally as good.  Large chunks of sweet crab, breadcrumbs, and egg bound the sautéed cakes together.  A mild tartar sauce complimented the pronounced flavor of the dish.

House salads came before our entrees.  Fresh greens, ripe cherry tomatoes, large slices of red onion, fresh (homemade) croutons, and herbs made for a flavorsome mixture.  The homemade blue cheese dressing was sweet, and creamy.

Entrée were next.  I chose the fish and chips.  Large portions of fresh fish were served with hand-cut fries.  Rich beer batter coated the perfectly cooked, golden brown fish.  The fries were crispy, and well seasoned.  My dinner mates chose risotto, and pasta with mushrooms with veggies- both dishes were delicious.

The food at the Map Room is sophisticated, and enjoyable.  The prices are moderate for the area.  If you're looking for a new spot to enjoy some well-prepared food, give the Map Room a try.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Faith A.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description: My spot. Great food and extensive whiskey list. The owner is always around and incredibly friendly! Recommend it over d's if you want to be able to talk to the people you go with. maps are super cool. Recommend the loaded fries. Taco's are fresh and a great deal.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Dana S.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
I've never had the food here so I can only comment on my drinking experiences, but I've always had a good time here. I like the decor and it's comfortable to hang out in, plus you often meet friendly people there (or talkative at least, whn you're at the bar!).

I've always thought the prices looked a bit funny on the menu, as they're listed like 4.27 and 5.29 and stuff, but maybe I'm the only one who thinks that. Also, they sell Magner's cider, yay!

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Meg T.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
Based on the other reviews, I'm thinking maybe I went on an off day--I don't know! 

Based on my experience, I would say DEFINITELY don't go for the food. I got the shrimp scampi which was truly horrible. I thought, okay it's a bar maybe their bar food is good I should have known not to order something like shrimp scampi, however, my boyfriend ordered the fish and chips and those were awful too! The fries were soggy and the fish was way over fried and tasteless.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: The B.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description: The Map Room is one of our favorite, low-key Regent Square go-tos. My wife, a vegetarian, regularly orders the black strap seitan and loves it. (They changed chefs and for a short bout had a rough time getting the recipe down. But it's back to its good ole self.) The decor is a bit dated, but cozy. It has a charming pub feel with good East End brews on tap. Don't come here if you are in a hurry. But if you have the time to enjoy a beer and then some great food over a friendly conversation, then this is your place. The service is always friendly and accommodating.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Justin D.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
As other reviewers have said, this is a nice place to get a beer and chat with friends.  It's relatively quiet compared to other places, and they do keep trivial pursuit cards around at the bar, which can add a little fun into the mix if you're the trivia type.

I struggle a little bit with the "gastropub" classification on this one, unless you call any bar & grille establishment a gastropub.  I've never had food here that I was particularly fond of, nor would I consider it one of their selling points.  It's merely ok.  

Overall, The Map Room serves a different clientele and provides a niche atmosphere unlike the other establishments in the Square, which is why is still exists.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Sarah S.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
The next time someone suggests to eat at the map room, I'm walking to giant eagle and buying a can of soup.

We ordered two appetizers.  An hour later they brought them out with my boyfriend's food.  After he had finished eating a really small portion of fish for 13$, they brought out my burger.  She had asked me how I wanted the burger, I said medium, she brought me out a super dry well done burger.  I ordered the BBQ bacon burger and there wasn't even enough sauce on there to taste it.  Maybe a quarter sized amount.


She also went on about how they make food from scratch - then the "pub pretzels" were very obviously from a frozen package. 

I spent forty dollars to be miserable and hungry.  I'm giving one star for the cheese sauce with the pretzels, the only positive of the night.

-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.author: Amanda L.
-FcuxZqsQ0FO35GEXExwjw.description:
Living in Regent Square, this is where I go if I want to have a nice, quiet, relaxing beer. I have never been there on celtic music nights, Every time I have gone I have been able to enjoy my food in peace, and this is something that is SO important to me. Its on the dark side, with not much natural light, but this really seems to vibe with the environment. The vegetarian selections are slim, but they are yummy.

If your looking for a louder environment, try D's.
If you're looking for a louder and rowdier environment, try Murphys.

Thanks Map Room for giving me a place to relax!

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Lynwood H.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description:
I ordered the Chorizo sausage bowl today and it was *SO* good!  The portion was large too - good value for the money.  I will be going back whenever this truck is nearby.

All food trucks have slow service.  It's not because they are trying to be slow, but because of limited resources within the truck.  There's very little space for food prep, which by necessity serializes most of the prep.  It's not fair to compare full-service restaurant service to a food truck.

It took close to 10 minutes to get my food.  When I placed my order they gave me a beeper so I could go do other things and be alerted when my food is ready, which is more than most other trucks do.  By food truck standards their service is excellent.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Marcy J.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: The food was really tasty, the wait was realistic. HUGE portion. Fries hot and crispy. Nice people.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Julia E.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description:
This was my first time trying Tango Food Truck. We ordered several items...the steak bowl, choripan sandwich, spinach empanada, and fries. The steak in the steak bowl was seasoned so well. The best meat I have had outside of Gaucho in Pittsburgh. It came with spinach and grilled vegetables which were also delicious. I had a bite of my husbands choripan sandwich. It had a very different but good taste to it. 
The food took longer than I expected to be ready being a food truck, but once I took my first bite of that steak I realized it was well worth the wait. 
There is no doubt I will be returning to this truck.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Dan W.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description:
Tried the Tango Sandwich.  It had some nice flavor but was a bit pricey for what it was.   Also, the bun fell apart before I finished eating the sandwich.  
The sweet potato fries were very good.   You get a nice portion size for just $4.   
I would eat here again, though I would probably try something different from the menu next time.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Elle W.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: The fries were good.  After speaking with the chefs here.  I have decided to update my first review.   A big fan.   However there were about 10 of us at the truck but it took 20 minutes for fries.  Everyone was waiting and getting really irritated.   If you get the wait time under 10 minutes.  I would def give it a 5 star

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Troy B.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: I caught the Tango Food Truck parked up on Route 60 in Robinson Township today, and ordered a few empanadas.  I tried the Spinach, Corn, and Beef (one of each).  They came with a little portion cup of dipping sauce, and they were all very delicious.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: DJ J.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description:
Tango has Authentic Argentinian food.  The menu includes Steak Sandwich, Milanesa, empanadas Beef Kabob, Chorizo & salad.  
Had the Choripan sausage sandwich with chimichurri, onions and peppers.  It came with a side of rice.  Great sandwich.  
Check them out on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/tangofoodtruck/

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Ashley L.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: Today I realized I never write about food trucks! What kind of jerk am I that I constantly praise the amazing restaurants in Pittsburgh but fail to acknowledge the deliciously talented trucks we have! Tango is amazing and unique in Pittsburgh. Their empanadas are flavorful and the sauce that comes with them is also exceptional. They have an amazing steak sandwich that if also delicious and fresh! I have also seen theses fries that have chicken and cheese on them... I only let myself drool at them for a second or two before I head to the bathroom to stare in the mirror and talk myself out of it.  Excellent food!

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Jerry S.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: One of the best food trucks in Pittsburgh. Their chimichurri sauce is great. I always settle on the Choripan sandwich. Ask for an extra chimichurri for your rice. You won't be disappointed.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Jamie D.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: I had 2 empanadas today for lunch for $6. The chicken one was pretty good, but the beef one was amazing! Tons of flavor and the dipping sauce was delicious! Will definitely get Tango again the next time the truck heads my way.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Ryann J.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: Tried the Steak Bowl.  A healthy food truck option.  What?What?

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Eric D.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: Just got the empanadas but they were great! Would defiantly return to have a full meal.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Ben S.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description:
Rude and waste of time!

This truck came to my office complex for lunch. I walked out to order and was the only person waiting to order while 4-5 other people were getting their orders filled. I stood waiting at least 5 minutes while they prepared the other orders. I wasn't acknowledged at all until all of the orders were completed.

When I finally went to order, I asked for Pulled Chicken Empanadas. "We're out of those". 
I asked for Beef "We're out of beef, only have cheese and ricotta left."

Okay... nothing was erased off the menu.

I settle on ordering the chicken bowl, which comes with lettuce, peppers and onions, chicken, and RICE.

I was given the chicken bowl, opened it up - NO RICE!

I asked if she forgot the rice, she said they were out of that too...

I wouldn't have wasted my time to leave my office and come out if I knew I was going to wait so long before putting an order in, settling for something I didn't even want to begin with, and then having it not even be complete yet paying full price ($10!!!!)

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Lindsay M.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: Food was excellent and well seasoned. I ordered the steak bowl and loved every bite! Steak was tender and had an amazing sauce on top. Will definitely order again.

LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.author: Liam F.
LrEjsBYlqXdig7x5DFz0ow.description: Best food truck in Pittsburgh, all the food is authentic and tastes great. The empanadas and sausage are my personal favorite but the other foods are good too

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Tom J.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
It may look like your average neighborhood joint, but Dad's is anything but! 

We were first-time visitors and went on Tuesday night, Nov. 25, 2019, and we were immediately greeted by the friendly staff. 

Ordered food and took about 10 minutes. Cuban Sandwich and Burger were fantastic. Very fresh. 

I suggest a visit anytime to enjoy this gem in the rough.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Nathan T.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
This place is cool. They have a nice selection of beer and their bartenders are always friendly and accommodating. Pizza is good. Wings are good. The only thing I got and didn't love was the buffalo chicken dip sandwich. Sounds great on paper but it's too much, like another review said. I wouldn't dock a star though because the service and other food is great. 

Thanks for coming to the neighborhood!

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Julia E.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
Been to Dad's twice now. Easy to get to and they have a parking lot- huge plus near the Regent Square area. Both times we went we were seated immediately with friendly staff. Short wait time for food but enough time for my daughter to enjoy the music and dance around the floor. They have a bar area that is separate from the restaurant side. I like it that way as it makes the restaurant side not as noisy. 
The first time I went I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich. It was like eating buffalo chicken dip on bread. It was delicious but TOO much. My stomach hated me. The next time I ordered the mild wings (I do not learn with hot sauce) and the mushroom swiss burger. Both were delicious. Would definitely order the burger again. The fries are just okay- I would recommend a different side if possible. They have a kids menu that includes corn dog bites! 
Will be back again I'm sure.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Lauren B.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: I was really excited to see this place open within walking distance of my house!  The neighborhood definitely needed a new local pub like this after Foli's closed (it's in the same location as the old Foli's).  They have a great beer selection with some local craft brews featured and a nice variety on their menu so I could even take my vegan friend. The first time I went the Mac n cheese was really disappointing and bland but it improved by the second time. The dad's chili was much more spicy than I was expecting but it was tasty.  I appreciate that side salads are offered as an option instead of fries as a side for the entrees.  The menu includes pizza, burgers, hot dogs, other sandwiches and salads.  The service has also been friendly and prompt.  The seating area is bigger than it looks from the outside, with an initial bar area in front and a larger spacious and well lit dining room behind it. Prices are also very reasonable.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Yanai L.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
I have been to Dads a few times now and am pleased with what I have found. There is a second location in Monroeville that I have also been to. This location took over for Folis that closed a few years ago and has had a complete remodel. It is now quite nice with plenty of televisions and a new bar. The best part about this restaurant is the beer list as well as the ability to buy a six pack to go. The draft list has a strong mix of different types of beers and ones that are high quality (not just yuengling). 

You can sit in the main dining area (where you are seated) or you can seat yourself in the bar area. It has been quite busy a few times making it's simpler to sit near the bar. The food at Dad's is good, but I'm not blown away by what I have had so far. The pizza is not much better than what it was when Folis was there, though likely made with higher quality ingredients.  

I am glad that Dad's moved in and I will be back frequently to this local watering hole.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Vanessa W.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
I've been to their other location once and was so thrilled to see they were coming to Forest Hills. We desperately need more options. 

I've been there twice since opening and to be honest, thought I already reviewed lol. First visit was on a Saturday night. Service and beers were excellent. I was hoping for our new local establishment to be a place to perhaps, ahem, meet some single men buuuuuut, the clientele seemed to trend a bit on the older side. Sigh. 

My second visit was a Sunday early evening. Service on this visit was again excellent. We enjoyed some delicious beers and a friend ordered an appetizer. I only had a bite but it was pretty good. Would love to see some more vegetarian/vegan friendly options. 

Looking forward to visiting more often this summer ! A couple outside seats would be awesome, also!

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: DJ J.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
Dad's Pub has opened a second location that is a little more handy for me.  Stopped in for lunch on a cold snow flurry day and had a really good lunch.  Started with Dad's Award Winning Spicy Chili.  My cup was full of meat and few small pieces of pepper and was the perfect spiciness.  Followed that with an E Burger that is cajun seasoned and sauced with peppers, onion and hot pepper cheese.  My burger was cooked to the correct temperature and very tasty and sloppy good.  The fresh homemade fries were crispy and good.
There were 17 beers on tap.  
The staff was very friendly and there seemed to be many who the staff know.  
A nice addition the the neighborhood.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Kim J.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
Went around 4 on a Saturday. Nice decor and well lit. 

We were seated right away. The service was very good. We ordered the pretzel sticks and fireball cheese bites as appetizers. Both were good, but extremely greasy. The cheese sauce that came with the pretzel sticks was very good. It wasn't your standard canned processed cheese sauce. Tasted like real cheese. 

We ordered a large pizza with banana peepers, mushroom, and onions as our entree. It was good, but not memorable. If you get a lot of toppings make sure to ask for the pizza well done. If you don't, the pizza crust will be a soggy wet mess. 

Overall not bad. I've been to the Monroeville location as well and have had some of their sandwiches. I like their sandwiches better than the pizza. It's good bar food.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Kristen A.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: First time here, since I live out of town now... Everything was amazing! Peirogis had a good kick from the jalapenos but so soft. Buffalo Chicken salad was grilled perfectly and the ranch was perfect with it. The wedding soup has just the right proportion of chicken, meatballs and veggies with a great taste!

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Paige L.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: Met a friend for dinner here. Shared a delicious pub fries appetizer. White pizza was excellent. Service was terrific. Menu includes a Yinzer Burger and some cool drink specials, like the Wreck it Ralph. Good stuff!

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Alexis R.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
Finally a good place to eat near forest Hills!! 
It's brand new, only opened a few weeks ago, so had that "new place"smell to it. We sat in the bar area. Nice wooden high top tables, with a couple of tvs for sports. 
Fast service, the appetizer( so good- pretzels and cheese/ mustard) came quickly, as with our main dishes. 
I had the chicken quesadillas- was huge, but just filled with chicken and cheese. No veggies. Im fine with that, bc it was hot and fresh chicken. 
I also got the mac n cheese which was really tasty and just enough at the small size. 
My mom got the fish sandwich it looked good and she said it was great. 
Do yourself a favor and check this place out. Also large parking lot, which is nice. 
Non smoking throughout. 
Bar looked good choice- wise.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Cody M.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: Came in from out of town and needed a place to eat close to where we were staying.  However, I would drive miles for the food, atmosphere, and service Dad's provided. Would have been five stars, but sadly the T-shirt's they had displayed for sale (very cute ones) were no longer available to purchase. Overall a wonderful meal.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Angie T.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description:
Great service .. Management , Sean went out of his way to make my son's going away party memorable ! 
Salads are luscious and taste homemade ... Just really perfect .. It is a comfortable local place .. the servers are very kind and patient .. Just a great place ... period

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Kate S.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: First time here at the Braddock Hills  location. When I heard they were opening this location near where I live, I was hopeful it would be as good as the bar and restaurant that used to be in that spot. Folis bar and grill was amazing.  Today I ordered take out. A large pepperoni and mushroom pizza and a large chicken Caesar salad. Honestly, the pizza was terrible. The mushrooms were badly burnt. The pizza was extremely greasy. It was soggy on the bottom when I got home which was three minutes from their location. All I could taste was garlic. Not sure where it was coming from. The garlic taste over powered any pizza taste. It was not edible. The Caesar salad was a joke. The dressing was in a container. I opened it to add it to the salad and it was very thin and watery. It was not classic Caesar dressing. It had a very strong vinegar taste. I did not taste any parmesan cheese. The lettuce was brown on the edges. I only had four and a half pieces of chicken. It was burnt and mostly black. The croutons weren't good either. I threw it out. The pizza was a large but only 12 inches in diameter. This meal cost me $32. I won't be going back. I'm noticing that the crowd on the weekends is considerably less than it was when they opened. I think the word is spreading that this place isn't that great.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Tara L.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: Everything was GREAT !! wings are awesome !! So glad to have something new in the forest hills area that is actually good for once !!! Service was really good too ! We def will be back !! The siracha wings are amazing !

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Amanda M.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: Amazing! My husband and I were in town for a golf convention and we ate here.  Amazing food! Pretty good prices.  If we are ever in the area again.... we WILL be returning!!

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Trent M.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: The food was not bad. It wasn't knock my socks off great, but it wasn't inedible. I had the roast beef sandwich, which was a bit bland. I wish the rocket sauce and au ju had more flavor and I wish the roast beef was more rare. My husband got the Grueben with lamb, which was really delicious. Another member of our party got the hot balls or something. They were mostly gooey cheese with minimal spice. Service was very friendly and accommodating. I think with an elevation to the food quality, this place could be great, but it's not QUITE there yet.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Raffaella G.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: I love this place.  I love that it is an easy walk from my house, but I love the food and service even more.  I have been there with 2, 3, and 11 people and the service and quality was exactly the same.  Everyone in my pucky family was happy.  I love the hand cut fries and homemade potato chips.  Every burger looks fantastic

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Barbara M.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: I am so happy this restaurant opened.  Good food and service!  Friendly bartender and great atmosphere.

dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.author: Christine A.
dQwH07r6eSfY5cU4McyLFA.description: Great food and atmosphere. Service was fadt.no complaints and can't wait til next time.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Courtney W.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description:
We stopped here for Halloween decorations and had a couple drinks. We were not there during karaoke so we were able to get a seat at the bar. The bartender is super friendly and entertaining and quick to refill drinks. 

This is a dive but one worth visiting. Christmas time gets so crowded that you can barely move so if crowds aren't your thing, I'd suggest going during the week or when karaoke isn't happening. The place is small and not for the claustrophobic. 

The decorations are what to come for. So many lights! There's a lot to look up at and see, and it looks like it takes a long time to do. It's one of the most unique bars I've ever been to. 

I've never had the food so it's hard to comment there and I haven't seen many people eating but I imagine it's typical bar food selection. If you're in the area, this place is a must see!

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Brianna L.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: This should be 5stars across the board.  Fun, lively, friendly, karaoke, hefty pours, what more can you ask for?!? But for real such a good crowd on Saturday night in a local town. Love coming home to hometown Pittsburgh and having a great time.  Bartenders and servers friendly.  Come for good times and drinks.  With the glowing Christmas lights and indoor changing decor you can't miss it.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Noah B.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: Definitely my favorite spot up near the waterworks. I love the atmosphere and the price. I have no complaints for this restaurant since the sever and the food are 5/5. I will definitely be back in the future.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Paige C.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: I've been wanting to go to this bar for a while but I haven't gotten around to it until recently I went for my birthday. I loved it! It was so busy but we managed to get a table on the patio and we all ordered food and it came out really fast for how busy it was. The waitresses were great especially dealing with carrying trays and drinks through the crowd of drunk people. I just ordered the pretzels and cheese they were good and I had some of the spinach dip with the homemade chips it was also delicious. We didn't stay long since it was far from my apartment and we couldn't drink too much but I definitely want to come back it was really fun and definitely felt like you were in some cheesy Christmas movie.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Bethany F.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: Horrible.  The last time we went there the bartender was high and stumbling behind the bar. it was a Monday and we couldnt get waited on even though there were a half dozen people in the entire place. One of the patrons was behind the bar as well waiting on himself. It made us uncomfortable and we left. This place stinks. It literally stinks. The smoking is so thick you can't breath. For that alone, I would never order food. So with the staff, service and smell, this is a no for us.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Tannér B.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description:
One star review for the bartender that is tonight (5/25/2019) that is closing the bar at 1:30am when the hours are listed online as 2am. We asked why it was 1:30 and the bartender was just blatantly rude and said "I'm done for tonight." Also the karaoke DJ tonight had very weird versions of songs and showed favoritism to a strange couple that weren't awesome singers.

I'm a long time patron here and I've never been so rudely treated by a bartender here. I feel bad giving this 1 star, but wow that was rude. 

--my point being that the typical Bob's garage staff would NEVER

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Chrissy F.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: Sentimental favorite. Will always love this place and all of the details that make it unique.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Aaron Z.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description:
I came here recently with some friends for dinner and some drinks. The place is decorated outlandishly with lights and whatever else you would find in your grandmother's attic. Needless to say, this makes for a very unique dining/drinking experience! The inside is quite small with just the bar area, a tiny corner for the bathrooms next to the kitchen, and a back room that is a little smaller than the bar. 

The menu sounds better than the food actually is. I ordered the hot turkey and french fry sandwich and it was very underwhelming. Mostly bread, fries, and gravy with almost no turkey. I would probably try to avoid ordering food here again.

What makes this average out to a 3 star is the atmosphere. Such a different dive bar, and the night we visited was karaoke night. Such a fun atmosphere with drink prices that were OK for a weekend night out. The group of us had a blast with karaoke and would definitely be up for coming back. Our waitress was very attentive and took care of us all night even though we were migrating around the room for karaoke. 

If you like karaoke definitely try this place out. Would not recommend eating here. Would recommend drinking here.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Karla D.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description:
I've been here a few times with a friend who keeps a boat at the Fox Chapel Yacht Club. This Christmas year-round themed bar is popular with the boating crowd as well as locals. Usually hit it up so my friend's 70 year old mom can perform karaoke. She'll show up in something of the gold lame' variety; fitting in perfectly with the decor as she belts out the tunes.
The fact that it's super tacky in decor only adds to the charm...too bad the same can't be said for the staff. Seriously sometimes the bartenders are just complete jerks. Of course it gets busy there, people love the junk, but a little kindness goes a long way.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Anina P.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description:
This place is a must-see in the Pittsburgh Area. You see the outside and think THAT has a lot of lights... then you walk inside and it's like an explosion of Christmas. 

My friends and I went on a monday, purposely hoping to skip the weekend crowd. 10/10 would recommend.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Bill S.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: Great Place!! But Service Sucks--needs to Fire the guy and girl behind the bar--Terrible!!!

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Ben J.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: What a gem this place is! Obviously the decor can only speak for itself if you see it for yourself, and believe me you won't be disappointed! It's s bit tricky to find it even though it's on the Main Street so put it in your gps. Food is exceptional considering the tiny galley style kitchen. And service has been great the few times I visited this year;)

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Ryan C.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: A group of us came here for the first time for a  friends birthday for the karaoke and the decorations.  I'll start by saying we did have a pretty good time over all but the reason for the 2 star rating is that the one bartender, an older bald headed man was completely rude and homophobic.  During karaoke he would yell from behind the bar to shut the F* up.  ummm its karaoke night.. .you're going to have drunk people up there singing... it wasn't just us... everyone was having a great time!   He had 2 friends that I think were co workers (one was the bouncer) sitting at the corner of the bar that he would go whisper to and they would all look over at us and laugh.  It made us very uncomfortable but we chose to stay because we were having fun singing and we made friends with a lot of people in the bar.   He also would not serve us... When we went up to the bar he would look at us and walk away and we would have to wait on the friendly blonde bartender to come serve us.  When Karaoke ended at 1:30 he just went over and flipped the power off and said Time to get out, go home, no more singing.  The DJ explained to us that hes an ass and not normally there on Wednesdays and that we should come back again because we are fun.  He was also doing so many shots behind the bar i'm not sure if he is really that rude or if he was just drunk but I feel like if he is like this all the time time then his time in the service industry should come to an end. There are gay people every where and the bar was filled with them.. not just us and You should never be made to feel uncomfortable in an establishment that you are paying money at so get over it.  The blonde bartender, the woman in the leopard shirt, the young bus boy, the guy in the black polo that was running everywhere and the DJ were all great and like I said we had a fun time even facing the homophobic bouncer and bartender and we could have left at any point but we shouldn't be made to feel we have to leave.  We were paying money just like everyone else!!!   Everyone should go and check out the place but if you see an old bald headed man behind the bar don't be too gay or sing karaoke and you'll be fine !!!!!!!

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Taiece B.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: The gaudiest decor. The friendliest people. The weirdest pricing? My 16 oz MILLER LITE was like $4.75. That is way too much. Otherwise, I stumbled in here after having recently moved to the area. I asked a bunch of people where I should go hang out, and everyone recommended this place (they know I love karaoke). I actually went here alone! And I didn't have to feel that way because literally EVERYONE was so nice! It felt like a was a regular. If it weren't for ridiculous domestic beer prices, I'd probably become a regular.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Eric S.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: This waitress could not be more miserable or rude!  Working for tips with an attitude like that has got to be tough...

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Emma Z.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: Atmosphere is absolutely great. However, the service is some of THE WORST I have ever seen. We waited for 30 minutes for each drink and over an HOUR for our check - even after we asked the servers multiple times. This place would be great if they actually put an effort into their service

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Meghan B.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: AWESOME bar for happy hour. Karaoke and lots of beer and liquors to choose from. The bar itself is so fun and it feels like an instant party when you arrive. I have only come here for drinks but had a blast! Looking forward to returning!

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Tim F.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: Okay so here's the thing it's an absolutely awesome Christmas karaoke bar with reasonable prices and decent food and great atmosphere. The Waitresses were all friendly and helpful even when they were very busy. The night before Thanksgiving is always a crazy bar night and I'm sure most bartenders and waitresses hate it but nonetheless the female bartender and waitresses were wonderful. The older bald gentlemen bartender although is a different story. Through the night watching him take shots behind the bar is all fine and cool but clearly he forgot where he works ....ya know ....at a karaoke bar. His constant shouting of obscenities after every song sung by patrons at the bar started to get really old halfway through the night. Hearing him shout shut the f*** up, sit down, oh my God shut the f*** up to me was at least disconcerting considering the fact that although he may be a 150 years old he does work at a KAROKEE bar. I know many other people heard his repetitive offensive remarks and it continued until the end of the night where he shut off the power to the DJ's karaoke computer mid song when a couple were singing. I spoke to the DJ about this bartender and his comments, and he assured me he's not usually there Wednesdays, and he also told me that with him shutting off the power at his booth it messed up his programming and hard drive on his computer for the karaoke. And for clarification purposes no, I'm not some bitter tone-deaf person who is just upset at some idiot bartenders remarks. I'm simply someone who was there having fun with a bunch of my friends and couldn't help but notice his derogatory comments towards everyone. So in conclusion I guess I would say to that indeed HE should be the one that should shut the f*** up, because other than him this place is an absolute blast!

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Renee S.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: First time at Bobs garage!  Wow how beautiful all decked out in Christmas charm and lights and well ......everything Christmas!! The staff super friendly.  Food was real good and comforting.  We will be back! Seen weekly specials too.

TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.author: Bernie F.
TeaOjHwZmKYlD9ce1l-8Ug.description: The beers were high for the atmosphere, karaoke was really loud and count your change.  Ours was $20 short on a $20 bill.  Blue Moon $6 and yeungling $4 for draft.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Tationna S.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: This food truck is much different than most. For the most part, during the warmer months, you can find them on Penn Ave which is cool because you don't have to worry about missing them. They also have a few tables set up in front of the truck so you can enjoy your food when you get it. There's a window where you place your order which is separate from the window where you pick up your food. They accept credit cards which is awesome and the menu is pretty extensive for a food truck in my opinion. Staff was super pleasant and patient considering I never know what I want. I was able to pick 3 different tacos which came out to a little over 10 dollars with tax. Not bad. When I got my tacos at the pick up window, I realized they were a bit on the smaller side from what I'm used to (and I'm a taco fanatic). But I silenced the chubby girl at heart and ate the tacos. They all tasted amazing and each had their own unique flavor. Surprisingly, I was pretty full off of these tacos. My favorite was the barbacoa taco and I definitely want to go back and try a quesadilla.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Karla D.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description:
This truck is in my neighborhood so we swing by usually once a week in the summer as a treat.
The tacos are authentic~completely. Everything is made on the spot so you know what you're eating is fresh and hasn't been sitting around like it might if you were to go to a chain restaurant. Service is quick and accurate.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Heather S.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: Maybe the worst burrito I have ever had.  Missing most of the toppings and they were out of beans for the burritos.  Not worth $10.00 or waiting 20 minutes in the feeding cold for.  So disappointed.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Meghan B.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: I ordered a chicken loaded taco with salsa verde and it was incredible. So fresh, so tasty, authentic, and well worth the $3 I spent on it! I wanted to try more items as their taco salads, burritos, nachos, etc. all looked incredible as well. The only reason I deducted a star is because the wait here was pretty long. We waited around 45-50 minutes in line before ordering. The food only took about 10 minutes after that.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: DJ J.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description:
Have noticed Taquitos in the parking area beside Spak many times.  Had a chance to stop for a quick lunch.  Nice friendly staff with some good tacos and other items on the menu.  On the day I stopped, they told me they were out of a couple of the meat options and the chips were not there yet after I ordered those items.  Not a big deal because of all the options.  Check out the menu.  It is a 4 step menu where you pick an  item, then select a meat or veggie, then select a topping and then select a salsa.  Food came out very quickly.  There was a short line for a little bit that move quickly and they seemed to get a lot of walk up traffic from local businesses. I ordered two tacos a Chorizo and a Carnitas.  Both were good but was expecting a little more flavor in the Chorizo.  
A good quick inexpensive lunch.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Dylan M.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: I usually prefer beef tacos but the beef weren't that good the chicken was great. MAKE SURE YOU GET LIME ON IT WHOLE NEW EXPERIENCE. Also get a Jarritos had my first one at Disney loved it and was so happy when I saw it here. Good place if you want some tacos

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Madeline V.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: Delicious tacos from a family-run business! There are tons of meat and vegetarian options as well as a variety of salsas and toppings, and the tacos come in two sizes so you can try different kinds for a reasonable price. Service is super friendly and the food comes out quickly, exactly as it should be. I'm from California, so Taquitos is a much-appreciated taste of home for me. Well done!

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Paul F.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: I posted a review a few months ago and at that time I was into soft tacos because that is what u get when eating street tacos in Mexico but I heard that Tasty Taquitos makes their own crisp shells - so good and always fresh made and now my goto taco is crispy. Although Pastor is a favorite, I also like the Rajas ( potato onion and pepper) so good  but also I am a fan of lamb. They have cactus and tongue and I tried a hibicus flower. I never met a taco at Taquitos I did not like. Warning for the cautious, the hot salsa is very hot. I could not handle the heat. I still swear Mbuqe the mango habinaro They are now selling frozen Margarita's at the Evergreen so try one to counter the punch if you order extra spicy food. Enjoy.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Taliya A.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: Good tacos but does not honor the hours they have posted, does not have a working phone number. I arrived at 4:10 and their hours say they close at 5. The woman who takes orders explained that "now that it's winter they're all done." So maybe check them out in the summer.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Ed S.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: Great food truck!!!!! Ordered from Spak and they were in the lot next to them. Walked over while waiting and had some vegetarian cactus yes cactus tacos and they were so very tasty! Loved the choices they had with all the regular choices as well as lengua (tongue) . Super amount of choices . Must try !

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Anthony R.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: Delicious and affordable soft taquitos, crunchy tacos, and burritos in traditional or local style -- this truck serves up some great meals fresh to order. When the weather gets too severe or rainy there's a tent set up so you can still order and enjoy, and the staff is always super friendly. They also make a super spicy sauce that is ah-making!

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Michael H.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: The food was fresh and delicious! They were at Refucilo Winery when I first tried them. Their chorizo was very good and not too greasy.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Fernando Q.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: Tasty and Fresh lots of vegetarian options along with authentic tacos. BEST TACOS IN TOWN.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Sara R.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: Best tacos in Pittsburgh. Food is authentic, fresh, and it's the real deal. Lots of menu options and also serve  vegetarian options. Definitely recommend it. A must if your in town!

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Nick D.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description:
Good food, clean truck, family owned and operated. What else do you need?

They do have Sidral Mundet, an apple soda that is common in other cities at Mexican spots but rare in Pittsburgh. 

Be aware that the truck usually sits on the corner of Penn by Spak, sometimes it's other places for events.

kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.author: Molly K.
kgHs-woMf_rHH4fBZx6JXg.description: PHENOMENAL FOOD! This is up there with some of my favorite Mexican of all time. Everything was fresh and made from scratch. The tacos al pastor we're my favorite!

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Denny V.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description:
7/15/19
Didn't feel like cooking so we decided to try their steak hoagie.  DAMN....!  Yes, the reviews are right.  That steak hoagie was delicious...!  $11 and worth every penny.  Get both dressings, you'll thank me later.  

And you know- this is the THIRD time getting food from here (amateurs, I know...!) but our order has been 100% correct all 3 times.  I like tomatoes, Kim doesn't.  All 3 times they have been on the side as requested.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Ken D.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: My steak wedgie was so bomb i got two in one week  Their steak hoagies are fire too!!!

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Bob M.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: I got a pizza from Paisanos yesterday first time in about 4 or 5 years. It was a 16 cut it looked like a little kid sliced it. It tasted like a grocery store pizza. If I wasn't hungry and if it didn't cost so much i probably would have thrown it away. I do not recommend this place

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Skylynn L.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: Ever since Mark left nothing has been the same. the delivery has been trash. There's only one driver that can get you food to you while it's still hot. Not worth it unless you go in to get your food yourself. Not to mention on the steak wedgie it was about half the usual amount of meat. Not even enough to spread a crossed the bread. The food is still great depending on who's there. You can tell who cares about what they're presenting to people and those who do not.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Erin D.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: I ordered a large steak hoagie with everything on it & white cheese fries . The food was great

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Joshua S.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: My brother and I ordered the curly fries, the Italian calzone, and a small half cheese/half pepperoni pizza. The calzone was the size of Pennsylvania, and had plenty of meat fillings, sauce, and ricotta inside. I would have enjoyed a nice cup of marinara sauce to go with it, but that wasn't a deal breaker, for me. The curly fries were nicely salted, and freshly cut, on site. All-in-all a good experience, although I would suggest doing take-away over eating in. The back room is full of 'stuff', and not very inviting.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Dan K.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description:
The Allentown/Mt. Oliver area is lacking an outstanding pizza place that will deliver, so usually I'll hop in the car and just go pick up Fiori's pizza in Brookline because it's worth the drive.  On this occasion, delivery was necessary so I decided to give Paisano's a try after not having their pizza since the late 90's.  Tonight's experience convinced me to either just make the drive to Fiori's every time, or just try elsewhere next time.

When I placed the call to order, the woman who answered was abrasive and impolite.  The order wasn't complicated; a large pizza with 2 toppings was all I ordered.  The price, I thought, was a bit high, but I wasn't angry about. Was not given an estimated wait time, which I'm wasn't too mad about, but that usually is helpful.

When the pizza arrived, the delivery driver was polite.  However, one of the toppings I ordered was completely omitted.  So I paid for a topping that I didn't receive.  The pizza, as far as taste was concerned, was average at best.

I'm not usually the one to give negative reviews, but the unpleasant phone order, plus the order error, plus the overall averageness of the pizza taste has driven me to decide to explore other options in the future rather than give Paisano's another shot.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Michelle L.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: Still one of our favorite pizza places even though we live a good 30 minutes away! My 8 year old requested this pizza for his birthday dinner! Italian hoagies are so good here and the fries are delicious, too. We'll never tire of the pizza though-very generous toppings!

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: David K.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: I eat here often and would recommend the food. There is an area to sit down, but I like to get my food to go. The people who work here are friendly. Try the pizza combo sub or breadsticks

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Cassandra R.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description:
I've ordered delivery from Paisano's a handful of times. The pizza is good, not my top favorite place for it, but the curly fries are so good that I usually order from here anyway. The curly fries are simple and look like whole potatoes that were just spiral cut (sometimes you get the end pieces) and briefly deep fried, but they're ridiculously good. 

The guy that has always picked up the phone is extremely curt on the phone, with a lot of one word questions/replies. When I call and ask to place an order for delivery, the answer is just "address" then "phone" then "order" or "what can I get you". Not a huge deal, but don't have high expectations for niceties and politeness. 

The pricing for delivery orders is a little confusing and also seems high. There seem to be separate prices for each item based on whether they're for delivery or eat in/pick up, rather than an additional flat delivery fee. My order total always seems well above the menu prices, but maybe I'm misunderstanding something. They also charge an extra fee for paying with a credit card, which I have never seen a restaurant do before, and feels at least questionable when I'm making a $30+ order. 

The customer service attitude and strange pricing policies definitely detract from my impression of Paisano's, but I enjoy the food so they won't stop me from continuing to order here in the future.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Julia C.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: I ate here for the first time tonight. I was waiting for the bus so only had a few minutes before it arrived. The gentleman working was so accommodating and hurried my pizza and i still made the bus. However, in the case that i would have missed the bus, it would've been sooo worth it! This pizza was amazing and I'm thrilled that i discovered this little gem! You've got a customer for life! Thank you!

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Morgan D.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description:
We have ordered from here several times and the food is consistently decent and fairly priced. The delivery has always been nicely timed, too. 
I live close by and was out for a walk one day and decided to try dining in there. That was a mistake. The place is filthy, really, just gross. I wish I hadn't gone in there. It's the best tasting pizza delivered to Mount Washington. If I can forget about how dirty the shop is, I will order from there again.... Delivered

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Daniel E.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: This will be the third time I have ordered from them. The food is good however, every time I have called I have felt like I am bothering them (in all situations I have spoken to both a male and a female). They need to slow down and engage the customer at hand, not the call they may have on hold or the customers they may have in store. This is enough to keep me from ordering again.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Colleen F.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: They have a to die for seafood supreme pie. Italian n steak hoagies, Pizza, fries all wonderful. We Order often. Mark can be unpleasant on days, but he has good food and he knows it. The public can be difficult to deal with and I'm sure he had his share in the neighborhood. He gets buisness. 30 years ago I used to hate calling n would make my husband because I love the pie so much. Now I don't care we've come to expect it.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Joshua S.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description:
I have been eating here for 30 years. I have NEVER had a bad order from here. You will never find a hoagie better than Mark"s famous Italian or Steak hoagies.
The pizza is amazing and is always perfect!! All of Marks toppings are 100% fresh every time. Everything is priced very low and under competitive for the quality of the food that they sell which a lot of it is homemade.
Mark has his recipes and he has never changed them to my knowledge. I will continue to eat there for hopefully the next 30 years
Mark, keep up the good work!!!!
Parking is also tight.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Corey D.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: Just moved to the area and really wanted to try this place. I called and the woman that answered the phone gave me an immediate attitude. I hung up because I refuse to service a place with poor customer service skills.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Keanna C.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: Been going here my entire life. I love it especially the swigs he pizza. Perfect for any occasion.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Darren W.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description:
Kay wasn't feeling much like Julia Childs or Danica Patrick this evening, so to the internet we looked for (a) A pizza parlor that would deliver to Beechview. (b) A pizza parlor we hadn't tried yet.

Alas! There was Paisano's! The middling first review almost deterred us, but in trying Paisano's, we found that a "tough skin" was not required. In actuality, Paisano's is a bit of a softie, from the lady that answered the phone to take down my order to the pie itself. 

Doughy and malleable, the cushy crust was the clear high point to our sausage-only pizza (Kay surprisingly detoured from the Kay Kombo this evening). "Greasy" this pizza was not. The cheese itself was dairy divinity incarnate, and the sausage approached the correct balance of crispness and succulence. I would have liked to have been able to detect more of the pasty sauce, however. 

Conversely, the dozen garlic wings we also ordered were brittle, fatty, and thus almost foolproof.

The delivery time took less that 20 minutes. Top. That. 

No one heckled us, either. 

Us paisanos eat pretty well, don't we? 

I just learned that "paisano" is Italian for "peasant."

I aimz ta educate yinz when possible. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-gvsgwmAfdU

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Mike H.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description:
