This place is insanely hit or miss so don't blame me if you dislike your order.  I will say they make a hell of a bacon cheeseburger, hand pressed and broccoli cheddar poppers I could eat all day.  They don't hold a candle to Pizza Company but in a pinch it works.  They have been here 45 years so they gotta be doing something right.

Eat at your own risk, good or bad.

45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.author: Tony A.
45wDLpgW2BFrCRqlf19Efg.description: Unfortunately terrible service. Would be one star if the pizza was worse but the product isn't bad.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Tito K.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: This seems to be the place to go before going to a Pittsburgh Riverhounds game.  We did just that.  Lots of seating options inside and we had really good service.  With our drinks we had pizza rolls, which tasted like a pepperoni roll met an egg roll.  We also had a plate of nachos.  Everything was pretty good.  If we start going to more Riverhounds games, we will probably be back.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Tabitha C.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
I have been to this place several times --- a few for friends' birthdays and once for my own birthday. The greeter has you sign in with your email, name and birthday - because of this they send you promotions and offer VIP tables for your birthday and with a certain number of guests - you qualify for a free pizza, discounted drinks, etc at your own table area that evening. Therefore we took that offer a few different times.

I have to say that this place is just okay - its nothing special and therefore not my favorite. I have only tried their pizza which I couldn't really rate as it was just used to soak up alcohol to drink more. When you get the VIP package - you get $3 well drinks and draft beers --- the selection of these is pretty lacking but with the deal it doesn't seem as bad, however they are very off tasting. I couldn't put my finger on it but it wasn't good and I've tried the same IPAs and other beers before and they didn't taste the same. 

Our waitress that served our table was very attentive and nice. I think she took a couple drinks back for us and got new ones as they were that bad. With the VIP package we did get a bottle of liquor towards the later part of the night with mixers (cranberry juice and orange juice) and glasses for our whole party. It wasn't bad but I think the retail value they suggest for the bottle is very inflated ($110) which I guess is the bar price but I would never pay that for some subpar vodka. When you are the birthday guest ---- your drinks are one penny but if I recall correctly that is very limited in choice. Understandable.

I guess the reasons this place isn't great are the drinks are just ehhh, the music is very random and has no flow - it will be bumping for a few songs then just some off the wall song that changes the whole vibe, the guests trying to dance have very pitiful space --- granted its not a club, the way the environment is on weekend evenings it is really no different.

I think this place is better for maybe happy hour but isn't awesome for a night out with friends in the evening despite the little deals here and there.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Jeff T.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: It is a nice place to visit for drink and get some fat food. The water and waitress are nice and friendly. The food and drink are pretty average. For drink, we had Royal Apple, Margarita, Apple Pie, and Whiskey short. They were pretty good, except my Royal Apple seem like non alcohol in it. For food, we had burgers and they were pretty good. The coolest part was they bar partnered with a local artist, who does her paintings class there. You can actually enjoy food and drink and paining at the same time. Will I come back, maybe for drink.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Jeffrey C.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
I created a Yelp account just to write this review and to warn anyone who thinks it may be a good idea to visit Buckhead Saloon. I visited Buckhead Saloon on July 5th with a group of friends to celebrate the marriage of two amazing people.

The wedding was fantastic - wish I could say the same about this disgrace of a bar. Both the owner and bouncer were terrifyingly hostile to my group of friends who were predominately female. All the while there was a police officer who stood there and refused to help. I could see the hatred in their eyes and felt real fear for my well being. If you value your dignity and safety, please stay away

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Marissa A.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
Let me preface this by saying that I rarely if ever review places unless they are egregious, however this establishment meets that criteria. The most stressful aspect of my wedding night was the way my friends and family were treated at Buckhead Saloon. The blatant abuse of power denying people who had legitimate IDs and were approaching 30 years old was unfair and handled in the most unprofessional way. The "security guard" policeman at the front door refused to verify that an ID was real and when challenged stated he could arrest anyone who challenged him...I would strongly recommend you stay away from this establishment and instead head down the street to Homerun Harry's where they have plenty of space, courteous staff, and do not haphazardly deny IDs and just generally treat people decently which is the minimum standard you should be able to expect on your wedding night.

If you need any more proof of unprofessionalism, all you have to do is see how the owner responds to other negative reviews below with no apologies and only excuses and rebuttals. Before you say that my review was "erroneous" and our guests enjoyed your place: 1. Steve actually didn't and left your establishment following this event. 2. There was legitimately no one at the 300 person wedding named Bruno... better check IDs better next time ;)

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Philip R.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Quick lunch while staying in Station Square.   Really enjoyed the chili lime dry rub wings!  Service was good.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Liz R.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: We walked in to the saloon and were greeted with "have a seat anywhere". We sat at a tall table by the bar seats. We waited and no one came over to wait on us. The guys at the table next to us left and their table was bussed immediately, but still no acknowledgement that we were waiting. After 10 minutes we got up and left, and on our way we passed a waitstaff talking on her phone, and just outside the front door two other staff members talking. Very disappointing, they were not busy so no excuse. We won't be back.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Janet M.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: I was there with a group for a small party. The margaritas were good and only $5 and there didn't seem to be any issues getting waited on as there has been in the past. The tables seemed to be sticky and not very clean. The ladies restroom was not clean at all and it was very early in the evening. A large roll of toilet paper was lying on the floor instead of the holder. This could be a decent bar to hang out but somewhat of a turn off with the lack of cleanliness.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Jake S.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: This place was a horrible experience for my groomsmen party and I. All of us were over 24 and were refused service and the bartenders broke the IDs of some members of our party while acting in a demeaning manner towards us. We will not be bringing our wedding party back this way anytime soon and I hope that parties staying at the Sheraton read this review before coming here.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Kaitlyn A.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Let me preface this by saying I have never written a review for any business as I have never felt compelled to do so. UNTIL my experience this past weekend at Buckhead Saloon. If zero stars were an option I would pick that. I have never in my life been somewhere more dysfunctional or rude. We were in town for a wedding and the bouncers refused to let members of our party in because we lived out of town. Even going as far to break some IDs of some members of our party who were 30 years old by bending them and stating they were fake. Once inside for those of who were allowed in, the service sucked and the drinks weren't any better. Unless you want a giant headache and a trip to your local DMV after visiting Pittsburgh, I strongly encourage you to go ANYWHERE else.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Joe B.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
In town for a wedding and took a walk over here from our hotel for happy hour. We were excited to learn that happy hour was to 8:00 pm with $4 beer and drinks and $2 Peronis. 
Our sever Sam was very helpful and was also training Annie. Both were very attentive and we never had to wait for the next round. Snacked on some $5 small plates of cauliflower bites, pierogis and cheesy bread. All were good. We also were there for trivia and were fortunate enough to win a set of Yuengling glass. 
Had a great time! Thanks Sam And Annie!!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Joe L.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Nice place to sit at the bar and watch a game. The bartenders are attentive, and the liquor selection is massive. The wings are an added bonus, as well! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to stop in for a drink and a quick bite to eat.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Clint M.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: A huge shoutout to Marcus! Great bartender, awesome personality and made our time here very enjoyable.  Thank you, Marcus!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Mike S.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: The people who work here are awesome. The food is not bad either. They have great happy hour specials and the food during happy hour is awesome. Buckhead is a great location for anything downtown or right in Station Square. The place is convenient to Gateway Clipper and all other activities down here! If your at the Sheraton stop here the bar is 1000 time better! If you're hosting a Fantasy Draft this is the spot, or just watching the game they have Tv's everywhere and the "view" isn't bad at all!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Jenna W.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Fun place to watch Steelers and Penguins games. Plenty of Tvs and places to sit to enjoy your time with friends. Drinks are a good price, food is typical bar food but good. Staff is friendly and attentive. Fun place to go out and dance on weekends without the overcrowding

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Abby G.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: This place was the absolute worst experience I've ever had in a Pittsburgh establishment. The bar tenders were so rude, disrespectful, and arrogant. They LOST my friends I.D. and card for over 40 minutes, charged me and several members of our group incorrectly, and physically shoved one of my friends and it was her 21st birthday. The manager was degrading to the girl who's card was lost and tried to blame her for it. Absolutely ridiculous and we will never return here. If I could give this place a 0 I would, please do not give this place your business and avoid everything my friends and I went through.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Maria M.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Went here on a Friday night and was really surprised at how empty it was.  There was a $5 cover because they had a DJ. Drink prices were about what you would expect. Crowd was late 20's to mid 30's which was nice.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Robert H.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
Let me tell you about the WORST experience I've ever had at a restaurant in my life, and it just so happens to be at the "wonderful" Buckead Saloon.

As a college student who is part of a club on campus, it's very important to us to find a place for formal events that will be able to accommodate our needs and guest list, all while giving us great customer service. Buckhead Saloon is CERTAINLY NOT THAT PLACE.

Recently, we had a formal event at Buckhead, and since our club is for all ages and majors, we have some members that are 18, 19, and 20, which is obviously under the legal drinking age. At EVERY OTHER PLACE that we have ever booked, the underagers have been treated fairly and kindly even though they were not served drinks. At this poor excuse for a proper bar and restaurant, the underage membersof our club (even though no laws or rules were broken by them or any other member in attendance) were treated as second-class citizens. We are still not sure if this is because the management/bartenders knew that they couldn't get extra drink money from them or what, but regardless, the underage members of our club who were trying to enjoy their last event of the semester were treated very poorly by bouncers and management alike.

I find it soooo interesting how Buckhead Saloon RARELY replies to college student complaints on Yelp, even though there are exclusively bad complaints about similar formal experiences...just goes to show you that they do not care about their young customers whatsoever. Good to know!!

As a club, we regret booking any sort of event with Buckhead Saloon. After many rude and (FALSE) accusatory comments made by bouncers and management to underage members of our club, we are HAPPY to announce that we will never, ever be back, and we will certainly spread the word to other clubs on campus about the awful experience that we had at this place. Thank you kindly for ruining our last event of the semester!!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Mara M.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
Idk what is worse,  their food,  their lack there of customer service or the dirty mop water smell this entire place has. I called and placed a to go order on Friday Sept 7th. I should of gone with my gut instinct & not picked up my food based on how rude the guy was on the phone. Working in station square, food places are nearly extinct so i went to pick it up anyway.  
So i go to the bar, one waitress/ bartender was really nice,  then comes over this blonde anorexic bimbo who not only kinda throws my receipt at me,  she snatches my money out of my hand when i was ready to pay. I wasnt going to fight fire with fire,  not while i'm on the clock at least!
She places my food down and walks away...i tried calling her back bc they didnt give me any utensils.. after being ignored i left.  
I go outside and open the container of chicken nachos and im like WHAT IN THE ENTIRE FUCCCK is this?! Nachos are burnt,  minimal dried out chicken and some type of beer sauce that smelled old.
I ended up throwing the entire container away.  I wanted to go back in there but i know they were going to be rude and i wasn't in the mood to deal with their shit twice in 1 day..   
To say the least,  i will never go here,  if 0 starts were an option that's what they would get. I don't recommend this place.  There's definitely a type of crowd they prefer to serve, i wasnt 1of the preferred.  Lesson learned.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Dave S.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
I was at the hotel across the street for a conference, a huge conference with at least 500 people if not more attending. 

But the hotel didn't give this restaurant a heads up that there would be likely a lot of people there for lunch, and there were only 2 guys serving.

Yet those two guys, one of them was named Kelby, came in clutch. They hauled it to try and get service to everyone in the joint. They went above and beyond, as did the third guy who rushed in to help. 

What a fantastic staff who did their best to adapt and succeed under pressure. I had the fried pierogies by the way, and they were absolutely delicious.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Kristin M.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Visiting Pittsburgh attending a work conference, my assistant and I ventured out the night we got there (April 30, 2019) for dinner.  There was evidentially more business than expected this Tuesday evening as the restaurant was understaffed with only one employee in the kitchen.  We were very patient for quite a while and tried to be understanding, the food wasn't all that great but we were hungry and had to get going so we ate.  By the time we got our bill, we quickly paid it (leaving extra cash tip since we're only allowed 10% on the card) without question and took off to get where we needed to be.  Fast forward to a month later when my county of employment gets their Visa statement and it shows 2 beers on this dinner bill.   I have been employed with this county for 22 1/2 years and certainly know you don't charge any alcoholic beverages to the county credit card; but regardless, I absolutely HATE beer as does my assistant, so I know we didn't get beer that night.  When I called Buckhead Saloon to inquire about a refund, I was told they would check into it and call me back.  Three phone calls and two weeks later I finally spoke with someone who rudely tells me they can't refund everyone that calls and says they didn't get something on their bill.  WHAT?  How often does that really happen?  This wasn't a personal credit card, it was a government credit card, it's not like I'm trying to scam someone.  This is a piss-poor way to do business; I too am in the hospitality business part-time and this charge would have definitely been reversed or refunded.  I had to pay the county back for the faulty charge.  I hope whoever did order the Blue Moon and Redhead beers enjoyed their free beer; you're welcome!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Noelle G.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: My fiancé and I were wandering around Pittsburgh. Not really knowing where we're going. Just exploring. Looking for a fun place to drink. Marcus, who was a newer employee at the time, totally made our night! They had this fun plinko type game for shots for st Patty's day. He made us drinks we've never had before and they were DELICIOUS! I have never met a better bartender! Definitely coming back if Marcus is there!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Ben H.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: They intentionally overcharged my friend.  We had to call the manager to get this issue resolved.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Jimmy B.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
PRO: Nice location, plenty of seating available, Steelers/Falcons game on TV, Pretzel was great!
Con: Service was not good. We sat at the bar and several employees looked past us for several minutes before we got a bartender to come take our drink order. He got us drinks and took our food order, then we didn't see him again. Another employee brought our food out, and we never saw anyone again. Our drinks were gone, our food was gone and we waited while several employees were huddled around someone with a cute little dog, ignoring customers. We literally stood up as if to leave and walked across the restaurant to find someone to get our check. He said "usually people come up to us to ask for the check". VERY LAME. There were only 6 patrons at the bar and you can't see if we want another drink or want our check? I think we figured out why there were so many empty seats on game day! Will not return!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Dana P.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: We were in Pittsburg this weekend for my nephews wedding. As a business owner, of a 5 star food truck, I am probably a hard sell when it comes to service. But Buckheads blew even ME away............ rudest management, servers and bartenders Ive ever come across. They refused to let my nephews friends, all who range in age from 26-30, into the bar. One of them is in med school at Johns Hopkins. They claimed it was because they had "out of state " IDs. Wtf? So did I! At the end of the day? We went there because it was across the street from the hotel ( Sheraton) that we all stayed in. There were 200 of us, and we were ALL of age. The bar manager apologized for their confusion the first night and promised to make sure we were all okay after the wedding to return. THEN? The OWNER cAme in and refused to serve us. Apparently in Pittsburg, you need tattoos and a GED to enter Buckheads. And it helps to be a redneck. My experience literally the worst I've ever had. And being from Houston, that's quite a statement. Don't give them your money. They won't return the gesture.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Kaylee K.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: So I've been to buckheads many times over the years, and each trip is different. Yesterday I went for happy hour. From 5 til 7 they have a pretty decent drink menu consisting of $3 beers, $4 wells, and $5 wines! I stuck with summer shandy, which is a treat this time of year. My friends ordered from the appetizer happy hour flat bread menu. Decent I suppose. I just had the chicken fingers and fries. Nothing wrong with that sometimes! the bar was so empty tho! The bartender assured that they were having a party of 400 come in at 9. Keep in mind this is a Thursday night! We didnt believe it! We ended up going to another bar, and on our walk back... there was a giant line to get in!! I couldn't believe it! Buckheads, you never fail to surprise me.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Joyce R.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Just stopped for a drink before going to Hard Rock to hear our friend's band. Great Happy hour prices. I ordered off of the happy hour menu. Then, I got the bill. I was charged regular prices, and worse yet, the bartender argued with me, stating "yes, I know you ordered the Southern Tier, but you didn't specify which one, so I gave you the more expensive one." Thanks so much Buckhead's! I will not be back.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Mairin S.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
It is truly impressive how awful our experience with Buckheads was. We had a wedding across the street at the Sheraton hotel, and the night before the reception, we booked a private party and tab at Buckheads where we spent about a $650 tab plus tips. The next night, after the reception, we told our 150 guests to head to Buckheads again for an after party. 
The bride did not have her ID (as most brides don't walk around carrying a purse or their ID as they are most likely over 21, have been drinking already at their wedding, and generally don't get asked for their ID because they are a bride). Also she is 25. So, when the bride arrived at Buckheads (wearing her wedding gown) without her ID she was denied entry because she did not have an ID. However, the night before when she had booked the party and paid the tab, she was not asked for her ID. The staff obviously already knew her, knew she had booked a party the night before, and half the wedding guests were already at the bar. I won't go in to how rudely they treated the bride on her wedding night but it was honestly as surprising as it was terrible. For anyone having a wedding at the Sheraton or thinking about having a party there, I would highly recommend against asking your guests to go to Buckheads.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Zach P.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: This was just mediocre I don't know why but was expecting more. I came here with my wife before the Riverhounds game should have listened to the reviews looked cool and that was it. Wife got a walnut gorgonzola salad that was ok. I got pork carnitas sandwich yeah nope not close. And when we got there we walked in there where 2 women standing there looking at a menu asked if they where waiting for a table replied yes so we waited behind them. And about 5-10 minutes after standing there and having many people look at us that work there a bar tender asked if we are waiting for a table and we all replied yes and they said oh well you can just sit anywhere but they had a sign up that said please wait to be seated. Agh I hate that stuff if you want people sit throw away your sign. And as we started walking to a table the bartender says you can't sit there it's reserved for a private party. Should have left then. Drinks are prices food is mediocre for the price you pay. Won't be back here again.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Heather T.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: We were in town for a wedding at the hotel across the street. Wanted to find a nice place to hang out after the reception and continue our celebrating. Our first clue should have been the tool that worked at the door. He was incredibly rude and unwelcoming. Awful smell when you enter the place, bathrooms were dirty and gross. Drinks watered down. So we took our group down the street and had a great time.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Lexi J.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Buckhead has always been one of my favorites. The managers and bartenders make it special because they are so personal.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Al O.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
I have enjoyed hamburgers from across the country but this was the worst hamburger I ever had. They only make well-done hamburgers.  The burger was dry and hard like a hockey puck. Ordered sautéed onions.  You couldn't bite into the onion, they were hard and cold.  The top of the roll was flaking off and dry also. Way too expensive for the quality. 

The big screen TV's were projector TV and hard to see because they were too lite.  service was marginal, nothing good at this place

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Sarah K.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Buckhead's has great service and good vibes. Martin and Louis were amazing to work with at our company's fundraiser. Drinks are all reasonably priced with a wide variety of small plates to order as well. Would recommend to anyone!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Erin K.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Very slow service and mediocre food. I would not recommend coming here if you are at all in a hurry. Our group was fairly large, but our food came out over a span of at least a half an hour with no real explanation on the wait. When it did come, the food was bland and some was actually overcooked despite the wait.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Josh J.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Started our Saturday Night there this past Labor Day weekend had a blast good tunes and great service from our bartender Jordan. We will be back

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Kevin M.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
Went there on a recent weeknight while visiting from out of town and the place was dead.

My Pepperoni rolls were burnt.  I was too tired and lazy to complain.  I don't think anyone would have cared anyway.

This whole area was depressing frankly.  Station Square needs a multi-million dollar facelift and renovation.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Josh R.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Cool specials on beer. Food good. Staff nice. Little on pricey side but fun nights like Friday 13th horror movie trivia make this place worth it.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Matthew M.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: Cool bar and atmosphere but the liquor is watered down at the source (the bottle) then further watered down by the pour system (slow pour on the liquor but fast pour from the mixer). Be careful of this!!

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Robert W.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description: We had our fantasy football draft here today. They were great! Very accommodating. They gave us a private area for the afternoon with a bartender.   We had a great time. We had plenty of food and alcohol. Special thanks to Marty and Morgan who took good care of us. NB: one large order of nachos was plenty for the group.

oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.author: Eric S.
oxig-TT9V2QttAvRqa5WNA.description:
So we went to a great wedding on the Gateway Clipper and tried to go for a night cap with friends at the Buckhead Saloon. We are the 13 and 14th person in our group, I have my ID and my wife doesn't, so they won't let us in. 

Combined between us we are 108 years old!  And no, I'm not 90, we're close in age. Are you kidding me?  The muscle head at the door was a TOTAL tool bag!  Once again the death of common sense in America...

So sad....

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Kayla L.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Amazing. Never a bad experience. It is always popping off at this location. Friendly staff. When Susan brought my food over to me she offered to bring over some napkins and a water cup for me. It felt like I was getting full restaurant service. As I ate Nancy was cleaning tables and offering to take peoples empty trays for them. A great sight to see. I was here a little before 4pm and ever employee that came in was welcomed in by a manager. Shows that it is a healthy environment to work in. The food is always amazing. Can't go wrong at this Chick Fil A

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Deah B.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description:
Stopped by for dinner on a Wednesday night. The place was very busy. How busy? Cars around the building and a long line inside. We ordered through their app. 
It did take a little longer than expected. Considering how many people they were serving it was understandable. 
We received all the things we ordered and all the extras that come separate. 
The place was clean. An attendant was cleaning tables as people left.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Bob S.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Easily the best fast food chicken sandwich hands down. Great flavor and always great service. The line at dinner time can look long, but it always moves fast AND you never have to wait that long to get your order.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Makayla K.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: 3rd times a charm coming here disappointed once again this time for breakfast. December I got food poisoning from this specific chick fil a from the southwest salad. Came back again a few months later and stomach upset after. Decided to come again this morning for breakfast at 8am waited 15 mins in line ordering 2 egg white grills and 2 teas. Received both drinks with 0 ice in it. Both sandwiches had cold pieces of cheese on it. Really 8am it's not like it just opened. Won't be coming back, i'll stick to the pleasant hills location.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Margaret R.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: The greatest costumer service in the entire food industry. One time I tried to throw away my own trash and an employee rushed over to take care of it for me. The food is cheap yet always delicious and the place is always incredibly clean. I've never been there when it wasn't busy but the employees take every step to get your food out as quickly as possible, it's really impressive. The devil works hard but chick fil a employees work harder.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Alex L.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Worst chick-fil-a experience I have ever had. It's took about 5 minutes, and 3 workers running around looking for the manager to determine if they could put milk in the coffee instead of creamer. That was after we had to describe that there is a difference between the 2, and seemingly what milk was, to everyone. The manager came out just handed us 2 creamers. We ended up just buying a kids milk. On top of that frustrating event, the food was brought out to us missing items.... I have always had a great experience at chic filet restaurants until I visited this location. This place would benefit greatly from electronic kiosks. A layer of separation between the customers and the people that work there would have made the whole experience better.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: John S.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Excellent chicken sandwich for fast food. There's always a line wrapping around the building at the drive thru, but service is excellent. They wouldn't be this busy if the food was mediocre. The employees are extremely polite and efficient. I'll stop here every time I'm in the area if I feel like a good chicken sandwich.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Amber S.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Plain and simple, we love Chick-Fil-A! Yes the drive thru is long but we are always happy with hot food.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Brittany G.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: I have show this place Grace so many times. I really don't want to leave a bad for you, but I think that this is necessary. I cannot count how many times they have messed up my order. They rarely get the order complete.When I have substituted my fries for fruit they have given me fries. I order a tea half cut with no ice they give me ice. Today when I ordered my tea half cut with no ice they gave me tea that is obviously old. Am I picky, Maybe? Or maybe I just like to receive fresh food and drink. I mean that's why I don't go to McDonald's. I'm highly disappointed in this Chick-fil-A, but at least the playground is nice????

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Nancy W.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description:
Make sure you go through the drive through "the right way".  I was refused service at the drive through after accidentally pulling in the parking lot then going to the drive through. I got to the window and they said they wouldn't serve me and if I had a problem to see Tom inside because I "didn't drive around the building the right way."  Is this a real policy to refuse paying customer's money?  

Before they try to say I cut someone off or something else, there was no one behind me.  There were two cars in front of me and none behind me when I got to the speaker.  

I left and went to another nearby business and won't return here.  Even with their prior bad press, paying customers clearly mean nothing and they don't need our money that badly.   Fine by me. :).

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Eva R.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Chick fil a is my guilty pleasure. If I am craving some fast food, chick fil a is my go to. I love their chicken strips and chicken nuggets especially with their chick fil a sauce. Their strips and nuggets are always tender, juicy, and crispy and when dunked in their tangy, honey mustardy, bbq sauce--it's just heaven. Their sandwiches are also delicious with a generous chicken breast in between buttery bread. It is not a patty full of processed meat but actual chicken. Basically, they know how to fry chicken. Also, make sure to get some waffle fries. You cannot go wrong with waffle fries. Chick fil a is always a pleasure to have once in a while.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Noelle H.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Used to love this place, but last Friday after getting their wraps, my son found hair in his....I looked through his wrap and sure enough there was hair...omg...so gross....I tried calling them but they never answer their phone...obviously we will never go back.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Tonya W.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description:
Always great customer service and very clean restroom, dining area, and play area.  My sons and I go here occasionally as a treat and have never had a bad experience.  

Yesterday, my oldest and I went here for lunch.  While walking in, he told me a mosquito bite on his ankle itched.  The manager overheard and offered some some anti-itch ointment from the store's first-aid box.  The ointment was not necessary and we politely declined, but I was impressed that he offered.

I wish more places and people operated like Chick- Fil-A. The world would be a better place!

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Jeff S.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Slow!!! Just have time if you try to go thru the drive thru here. Just spent the last 20 minutes waiting for my meal. Not even a thank you for waiting when I finally got my food. The food was hot when I got it so that was good. I have been here a bunch a times and the are never the fastest chick-fil-a but this time was bad enough I decided to leave a review.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Eric R.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description:
Rustic. Original. Decedent. Chick-Fil-A

"I'm way to drunk to taste this chicken."
-Colonol Sanders

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Lexi Z.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: Hate coming to this location. Can't ever park, always way too crowded, drive thru is never fast, I've been overcharged and had them fix it the last 3 visits, and they're always running out of trays when you eat in, so you have to get a to go bag which is so inconvenient!!! The reality of it is, there's a huge stack of trays and no one cleaning them! Just poorly managed. The chicken is always cooked inconsistently as well. Sometimes it's cooked well and thoroughly and other times it is barely cooked and slimy. Just not impressed overall.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Denny V.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: This place is a ZOO... but is run like a finely oiled machine.  Does the business here ever slow down?  But I still walked in and within about 4 minutes- my order was taken & paid for by one of the managers that were 'lending a hand' and taking orders.  Manager Rick took my order and right next to him was Manager Dennis who was just as friendly.  Keep kicking ass guys and the 5's will keep coming in.  By the way- it was about 80 degrees out so I ordered the grilled chicken wrap with the Avocado Lime Ranch Dressing and it was the BOMB...!  So cool, refreshing and PERFECT on my wrap.  Thanks for the suggestion Mgr Rick.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Mary Y.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description:
I LOVE anything chicken!! I've been a big fan of Chick-Fil-A since i was in high school. I LOVE their waffle fries with Polynesian sauce. This location has a speedy drive-thru with also a play area for little kids. Great place to take the family. Plus there's a Trader Joe's right next door, so moms can make a quick market stop. 

They offer grilled chicken options for those looking to keep lunch on the ''light'' side. 

I'm not from the south, but my guilty pleasure here is the SWEET TEA!!

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Kylie O.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: This staff is so friendly!!! I have never had a problem with the service. The people that work here are the sweetest.

qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.author: Nicole C.
qpa8Y4VAMQKh8P5zqC5Y4g.description: I love Chik Fil A and usually this location is amazing. I usually hit the drive thru but this morning decided to go in and have breakfast inside. I placed my order at 10AM and didn't receive my food until 10:17AM.... oh and all we ordered was a cup of fruit and a bacon bagel sandwich. Probably wouldn't dine in if you have anything you want to do the rest of the day.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Dustin Y.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
So my wife and I just bought a house in the area 6 months ago and wish I would have tried this place earlier! Like others have said, not many places deliver to the North side. We like to go for walks, and often walk past Riveria, and their staff is always friendly and busy. I sometimes go in there to grab something to drink and figured I would give them a shot. 

I called the night of the stadium series game, right at game time, so they were busy, really busy. While I was on the phone I heard him ask 2 other customers if they could please hold while he took other orders (my order). He was polite, understood everything and I was off the phone in less than a minute. Very easy and streamlined conversation, done! He said it would be 45 minutes. My chicken ranchero pizza was here in 35, it was actually 10 minutes early!!! The delivery driver was very friendly and even said sorry about the wait, even though he was early! 

The pizza was delicious! It had lots of chicken, bacon, and fresh tomatoes. Some places like to skimp on the chicken, but they don't!! Everything was very tasty, and they even included a side of ranch to dip the crust in! (I posted some pictures of the pie) 

I will continue to order from them as they've really impressed me, I can't wait to try the calzones, strombolis and hoagies!

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Savannah K.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: My boyfriend and I ordered Riviera Pizza and Pasta through Grubhub today. We ordered some fettuccine Alfredo, a cheese Sicilian pizza and an order of their mozzarella sticks. Let me tell you, I am not impressed. The pasta was okay, but tasted artificial. It definitely wasn't homemade. It could have used a lot more salt. The pizza was god awful too. It tasted like the pizza crust was a frozen crust ordered in that they through sauce and cheese on top. There was barely enough sauce and cheese on it as well, it was just a bite of bread with little toppings on it. The mozzarella bites were okay, but pricey for only getting 4. They weren't homemade either, definitely frozen and fried up. I'm so disappointed in the food I received. Nothing I had tasted homemade, and it was pricey too. For the 3 things I ordered it was about 45$ I don't think I'll be ordering from here again.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Crystal M.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: I am visiting from out of town and was looking for someplace to deliver. This place is a gem. Reasonably priced, fast delivery, and the delivery guy was super friendly. Also, the food was great! I would definitely recommend giving this place a try!

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Holly P.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: Want to call to place an order the guy on the phone said they were too busy to explain what they had that came with the chicken strips now however I'm from Vegas and I didn't even know what the fuck they sold just pizza some other shit I don't know but as I explained I'm new to the area he proceeded to hang up in my face never will I call them the fuck again  ......my name is HollyWood Pendavis look me up if your mad

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Jodi Z.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: Easy to order online.  Our delivery arrived early.  Pizza was hot and had the perfect amount of toppings.  Crust is SO GOOD.  The little ranch dip is perfect for dipping that crust into.  Really enjoyed the pizza as well as the chicken sub.  Price was good for the amount of food we got. We will definitely order from here again.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Dana L.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: This is easily the best pizza in town. Have ordered multiple different items from this place and all were excellent! Always delivery within a timely fashion

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Amanda H.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
Not a big fan. I just moved to town and my husband has been ordering for years. He said they used to be better but the prices have gone up and the quality has stayed the same. 

He ordered a chicken teriyaki hoagie and I got the chicken Parmesan. His sandwich was poorly assembled and messy. The sauce made the bottom of the bread too soggy to support the sandwich. The chicken Parmesan was only okay for the price. The chicken breast came chopped up and mixed in with the noodles which made the chicken breading on the pieces a little soggy. 

My experience wasn't terrible, but definitely not the best. Not sure if I will order here again.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Jake H.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
Well, I have been ordering from Riviera for a while -- since the glory days of Riviera. 

This last order was probably the last for a while: 

Riviera used to be a solid 4, almost 5 star pizza joint to me -- quality pizza, and all the other items on their menu would be on point -- plus they came piping hot, in a short amount of time. 

However, within the last year or so prices have been JACKED up and the quality has remained the same, if not gone down hill. 

This recent order included a teriyaki chicken hoagie, chicken parmesan, and a small white pizza with tomato. The small white pizza was delicious and a great price actually. The chicken parm was expensive for what you got, and mediocre at best. The teriyaki chicken hoagie was the real problem -- it came in a complete mess, teriyaki sauce all over the top AND bottom bum, leaving it nearly impossible to eat without leaving your hands a sticky mess. Now I am not one to give a bad review simply on a messy display (please see my review of Pgh. PoBoy) - but this was just unacceptable, the teriyaki was super sticky and was an annoyance to get off while trying to grab a drink. 

This place used to be a real winner and my go-to when I got home late and needed some quick food -- sadly they are down on the list now. 

Hopefully Riviera can get their act back together and make up for those higher prices they are now charging.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Trish I.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
We've been ordering from here since we bought our house in November. Always good food delivered quickly with nice drivers. Tonight, however, sealed the deal that we'll forever order from them. 

We accidenly overpaid the driver by $20 ... We're good tippers, but not that good (it was stuck to another bill and we didn't notice)! He came back to our house and returned the money to us. 

So now in addition to their great food, we know they also hire honest people!

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Marcia K.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
I have NEVER been more insulted than this evening by not only the driver of this business but also the so called "manager" who apparently was hatched and doesn't have a name.

We ordered a combo consisting of a large cheese pizza, wings and an Italian hoagie for pickup, but then changed it to delivery. 

Upon delivery, the driver was given a $100.00 for an order of $28.00.  HE chose the tip he wanted by TAKING it out of the $100.00 and gave the change back to my daughter.

The pizza was good and so were the wings, HOWEVER, the hoagie was COMPLETELY soaked and the bread was soggy to the point that it was falling apart.  I had my daughter call the store and a man that answered the phone was screaming at my daughter telling her that it was her fault for changing from pickup to delivery.

I was sitting across the room and could hear him insulting my daughter, so I took the phone from her.  He was ranting and raving and would not stop long enough to hear that I was not the person he was originally speaking to.  He then started telling me that it's plain physics that the bread would be soggy.  Yes, he knows so much about physics which is why he is making pizzas?

Both my daughter and I asked to be credited for the hoagie and next time we ordered we would use the credit.  He continued to scream at me then hung up.

I WILL NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER order or recommend this place.  They have no idea how to treat customers - at least the women anyway.  Perhaps that is how he is used to treating women, but I will NOT put up with that.

Although the customer isn't always right, this guy has no idea that without customers at all he would not have a business.

gross hoagie 3

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Melissa M.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: Best pizza and ranch!! Incredibly quick delivery time! Always accurate order and have never been late.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Gina C.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
We have ordered and enjoyed: buffalo chicken salad, steak salad, Caesar salad, tossed salad with cheese, spinach rolls, eggplant parmesan hoagie, the Napoleon pizza, and pizza with and without toppings. As others have mentioned, the cheesey breadsticks are great. I'm vegetarian and I love their eggplant parm, especially on the Napoleon pizza. 

We get delivery in Fineview in 45 minutes or less. I've ordered online, through Eat24 and GrubHub. I prefer Eat24 and their weekly $2 coupon, as well as their Pizza & Sticks deal for $16.99 (large cheese pizza, breadsticks & mozzarella sticks [toppings extra].)

I believe the horrible driver people have mentioned no longer works there. We've been ordering delivery on monthly basis from Riviera Pizza for over two years and have had a problem only once.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Carrie K.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: I love this place - we order from there 2-3 times a week.  The food is consistently good - not fancy,  but it always tastes good. Delivery is quick, the employees are polite and friendly.... I love their stromboli. Totally recommend!

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: D F.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: Outstanding hot wing sauce. Not the typical sauce, different and delicious. Wings were meaty and fresh. Steak Pizza was very good as well.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Killian R.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: Called in to order delivery. God forbid you try to remove an item from a hoagie like onions because they absolutely won't do it. They were very rude when I asked them to as well. So the customer isn't always right. So anyone who is looking for something slightly customized your way (allergies) or good customer service, do not order from here because you are basically SOL.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Scott S.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
Ordered take out a few days ago. 

Had the taco pizza.   Wasn't too great.   The pizza was real heavy on lettuce and crust and short on all the good stuff that makes a great taco pizza (beef,  jalapeños,  tomatoes,  cheese)

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Johnny F.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
I think the other reviewers' taste buds may be clouded by their desires for a viable local pizzeria.  

My food was absolutely gross and an insult to Italian food.  After ordering thru grubhub and waiting an hour and a half for delivery, which was about 40 minutes past their estimated delivery time, I received my "meal."  

I ordered a Stromboli, cheesy sticks, and fried dough balls. The total came to $32.00.  The cheesy sticks were edible. But the almost $20 Stromboli had little meat, no veggies, and was simultaneously soggy and burnt.  The burnt parts flaked off, revealing a slimy, spongy, salty yet tasteless mess. It was terrible. I was refused any kind of refund.

Finally, the fried dough balls basically resembled little pieces of fried chicken and had the consistency of stale fortune cookies, but without any flavor or sugar. Very strange; not edible.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Amy R.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
I am so bummed that we moved to Spring Hill 2 year ago and only discovered this place 3 months ago.  It's really in a strange place in Spring Garden - no other businesses are around and it's just this neon green building with just enough room for a counter and some pizza ovens.  But, its the closest pizza place to us and we decided to give it a try after the positive reviews it had already received.  Holy cow, jackpot!  I'm pretty picky with my pizza and this is great pizza!  I haven't had a single thing I haven't liked yet - I've had white pizza, buffalo chicken pizza, cheese pizza, strombolis (these are great!), fried mushrooms, and cheesy bread sticks (OMG, I can't wait to eat the leftovers for dinner tonight!). My hubbie has also had the steak sandwich and really liked it.  This is now our go-to for takeout when we feel lazy.  What a great little place.  

Oh, and you can order online.  So easy.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Otabek U.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description: Great Pizza and fast delivery. Especially Salads and wings are all delicious!!!I already ordered 4 times in couple weeks.

oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.author: Jenny B.
oRKyGtUsN5IcRReN7ScUwQ.description:
We have ordered pizza from here a few times--they are one of the FEW places that does North Side deliveries.  We usually get black olive + mushroom + hot pepper pizza, and it's just okay.  Better than Pizza Hut but not life-changing or anything.

Their cheesy breadsticks are AWESOME, though.  I could just eat those for dinner.  They are doughy, cheesy, and perfect.  

The service has always been speedy and the delivery guys are nice.  

If you're ordering online, make double sure you have your order right:  I ordered a small pizza one time on accident and called to make it a medium, and they couldn't change it for me over the phone--told me to go online and change it, which online ordering sites don't let you do.

**Updating my review to add a star because we have ended up ordering from them quite often.  The pizza has gotten better, they are consistently faster than their time estimates say they will be, and the delivery guys are always friendly.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Ria F.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
I'd give this place only one star for customer service but their food is so delicious that I'm bumping them to a 3. We went on Wednesday night and literally stood at the hostess stand for 7-8 minutes waiting for someone to acknowledge us. Then there was a 40 minute wait even though we could see empty tables. 

We ordered the Pineapple Express and it was sooooo good. Our waitress was busy but attentive. She did forget our son's dough ball that came with his kids meal. We didn't end up mentioning it because she seemed busy. Then, at the end of the night, there was a mix up with the bill & we were presented with one to sign that was a different amount than our receipt. Luckily, I caught the mistake. Hopefully it will show up correctly in my bank account too. 

We chatted with other patrons as well as the friends we had with us and the consensus was that they know how good their food is so they don't feel the need to try hard when it comes to service.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Carly M.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try Caliente for quite some time being that they are voted 3x World Pizza Champions and Best Pizza in America. We ordered the medium buffalo chicken pizza and a pepperoni pizza, along with a side of their award winning honey siracha wings. The pizza was amazing, and they definitely make a perfect pizza crust to! The wing flavor also did not disappoint. We are also ranch connoisseurs and will dip our pizza in it. They have homemade ranch and it was really good! 

We came earlier in the night so there was plenty of seating, but as we were leaving it was starting to fill up. There was also a great drink and craft beer list to choose from. There is a small parking lot out back, we were able to get a spot, but I am unsure where you'd park if the lot was full- street parking perhaps! 

Overall, we are really looking forward to coming back!

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Jaclyn K.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
My fiancé has been dying to try the pizza that was voted #1 pan pizza in the world, so Caliente has been on our list for awhile. 

The decor inside is your no frills pizza joint, with plenty of seating and an extensive menu (with more than just pizza), as well as many beer options. They were out of a few of the draft beers when we were there but had plenty of others to choose from. 

We ordered the Quack Attack and a small Betty White's Garden Pizza. While I don't think any pizza is really worth over $30, my fiancé enjoyed it. I really liked the white pizza I had, and their ranch dressing is amazing, too. 

I'd say the Quack Attack pizza was a one-time thing - cool to say we tried the best pizza in the world but not worth spending that much on a small pizza again. We would definitely come back, though, for some of the other options on the menu as the service was great and we enjoyed the variety of pizzas offered.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Katelyn K.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Great pizza! The pizza is a thicker pizza and tastes great. Have never ate in so we can't comment on service. I do wish the pizza had a little more cheese on it. The bbq chicken pizza is our go to and doesn't disappoint.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Rachel C.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
Because I do not like overly greasy pizza I have to say that I like this pizza more than most pizza places because of the light and fluffy crust. Other than the extra fluffy crust, this pizza is really not that out of the ordinary - which is why I find it surprising that they pride themselves on being the "best pizza in the world" since it isn't exactly gourmet pizza, at least not the pizza we ordered.

The prices are reasonable but not an especially good deal. I was told by multiple people to not order anything other than their pizza so I am just commenting on their pizza here. Would definetly come here again for pizza but am sincerely questioning the claim that they have the best pizza in the world - that would be a bit of a stretch to say that. Perhaps next time I will select a specialty pizza to see if that could change my mind. :)

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Blaise P.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: I've been here twice now and I have to say this place is just kinda "meh" the first time I had got two different flavors of wings and I have to say there sauces are ok. And as well as a buffalo chicken pizza that was good but pretty hard to mess up. Decided to come here again to give it another go and this time got there big New York style pizza. The pizza it's self was HUGE but the first thing that comes to mind was how soggy and soft the crust was. I got the hot honey and that was definitely pretty good tasting on the pizza but other than that it just tasted so bland. I also got a order of the stuffed rolls with the bacon cheese and jalapeños. I have to say being they where half priced made it a good deal. They where good by there self but the dipping sauce tasted like 1000 island dressing and all you could taste was relish in it. For a place that won awards for the best pizza it sure does lack in a lot of areas and the dough seems to be nothing fantastic. On a positive note the server both times was very nice but overall I highly doubt I'll be returning here in the future.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Jenee S.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: We finally decided to come back after the hype went down. We were extremely happy this time around. We placed an order for pickup. I arrived on time and the food was actually ready with no mistakes! One of the workers made sure the order was correct before leaving as well. This is still one of our favorite pizza places and glad they are back on track

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Kelly M.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
My boyfriend and I missed a friend's birthday dinner here a few months ago and they raved about the food so we decided to give it a try last week.

It's definitely a bar inside, and dimly lit. We snagged a table by the old Coca Cola machine which was a nice spot! 

We ordered both the mozzarella sticks appetizer (for me) and the chicken wings (for him). The mozzarella sticks were certainly just frozen-to-fryer and the sauce was just blah.

He asked for a sauce recommendation for his chicken wings, and our waitress offered the honey sriracha since it was award winning. It was very spicy, and he had a mixed review- it was interesting and tasty, just not something he'd order again. Not knocking the sauce at all, it just wasn't his taste.  If you like sriracha-type spicy mixed with super sweet, it may be for you! He did however say the wings were cooked perfectly and he can see why they're popular here - he could see himself coming here with some guy friends to watch a game and eat a bunch of chicken wings and beer! 

I got a side salad with ranch & it was quite small but the vegetables were fresh and the dressing was yummy.

We got the white pizza with sliced tomatoes on top as our entree. After hearing rave reviews and seeing them in the newspaper for great pizza, I have to say I was a bit disappointed. The pizza was good, just not that flavorful at all. We couldn't taste any real garlic or salt in the oil or on top. The crust itself was DELICIOUS though!

I also did not like that we kept getting new paper plates and plastic condiment cups for every single thing. It just seems super wasteful to me! 

I could see us coming back to Caliente for another birthday meal or something like that. 

However, it definitely is not our vibe for a date night or takeout option, and we just weren't super impressed with the food.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Derek P.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
One of my favorite places to go for a beer and pizza. The only caveat about Calientes is that there is no parking. A small back lot and a lot across the street that is shared by other local businesses is it.

From the start the wait isn't long no matter the day and the servers are enjoyable.

They were voted to have the best pizza 3 years running from 2016-2018 and it is definitely correct. I normally go for the Cry For Mommy wings but if spicy isn't your flavor then you can't go wrong with the Honey Garlic. One of my favorite wing flavors around Pittsburgh
 
Come back frequently so feel free to ask any questions.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Abigail F.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: This place has ONE highchair.  There were four babies walking in the door at the same time we were and the ONLY highchair in the restaurant was taken.  Absurd for a restaurant in suburban south hills.  Owners would be wise to have at least five high chairs.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Bethany B.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
We will be loyal Bado's patron from now on...

There was confusion with an order I placed at 4:29pm this evening via GrubHub. The confusion was not brought to my attention until the 5:29-5:39 window for pickup I was given by the app. When asked why the staff did not call the clear the confusion prior to me arriving, I was given the answer 'we would of but you showed up' I finally received my incorrect order at ~6:20pm, 40 minutes after my pickup window. I would assume the '5 minutes' estimate I was given at my initial arrival was incorrect and the order could have been corrected in that case. Very poor communication among staff! Unapologetic staff! We're definitely done with this establishment.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Louie A.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Ordered pizza last night and they said it would be an hour wait. Ok no big deal. Pizza arrives after an hour and twenty minutes and is ice cold. Ordered wings also and they were warm at least, but then first one I bite into still has a feather attached to it. Overall between the cold pizza and feathered wing it was terrible not to mention late.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Malarie J.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
I am obsessed with pizza..... Like I could eat it every single day of my life and be fat & happy. 

With that being said, when my husband suggested that we eat here tonight, I was incredibly excited. I've been wanting to go for quite a while. 

We decided to sit at the bar and since I'm not a big beer drinker, I asked if they gave samples of drafts. The bartender was happy to give me a shot glass of the Arsenal Isabelles Rose. I opted for it, while my husband got a Corona. We looked over the menu and decided on the Late Night Yinzer and the pepperoni sticks. 

The sticks came out first and my first thought was "holy s**t,  that is huge!".....these things could have been my meal!  The red sauce served on the side was absolutely delicious!!! 

Then our pie came out. I love tater tots as much as I love pizza and the Late Night Yinzer combines both!  It's steak, white american cheese, tots and a ranch sauce. How the heck can you go wrong with any of that?!  Let me tell you..... This was hands down the BEST pizza I have ever tasted anywhere ever. I seriously cannot wait for leftovers tomorrow. 

I will most definitely be back to try more of the pizza and I'd love to try a hoagie (they sounded wonderful!). The service was great, the food was top notch and the prices were fantastic. 

There's definitely a reason they have been named the best pizza in America!!!

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Jim H.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: My first visit to caliente. Had to go since the publicity about the chef winning a pizza competition in Italy. First, a nice draft beer list and not a crowd in the early afternoon. Of course we ordered the Mee maw, which is the winning pizza. Lots of toppings bacon, broccoli rabe, two cheeses, etc., but they work together hot and cold (saved some for breakfast). The dough was my favorite part. Following the trend for square thicker pizza,the dough which is proofed for 5 days was the winner for me. With just enough lusciousness from Olive oil it was a terrific delivery vehicle for the topping, and was just not the texture and flavor of cardboard like some pizza crust. Was it my favorite pizza ever? No, but I'm a traditional grandma pizza guy. I think it is worth the visit to do your own comparison.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: TP J.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Despite the horrible experience detailed in my previous review below, my wife really wanted the Grandma's Backyard pizza for my daughter's birthday party so we broke down and ordered again.  My wife called at around 2:30 and asked that the order be delivered at 5.  The food arrived shortly before 5 and everything was delicious so I'm bumping the review to 3 stars.  Hopefully they are getting their act together because as I mentioned, we really do like this place!

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Chase H.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Embarrassing establishment. I was one of the dummies who waited 2+ hours for food. What did I get? Cold fries. Uninspired heated up, rubber "boneless buffalo wings" tossed in sauced unevenly. Also, the "best pizza in the world" was severely undercooked. $30 for doughy breadsticks. Not sure what was worse: the food or the service. It doesn't take talent to give good service.  It does take talent to wheel a good pie and have hot food. Would rate a .5 out of 10 if Yelp would let me.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Will S.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
Caliente makes a pretty good pizza, but it's not exactly an exceptional pie despite them continually winning awards with specialty pizzas. Their other items -- sides, wings, apps, etc -- are all fine as far as bar food goes. 

Service has been shaky at their Mt Lebanon location. Several times I've gone there there the order has been wrong in some way (wrong wing flavors, wrong pizza toppings), but to their credit they have been responsive to the complaint and offered the corrected item at no charge.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Rachel C.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Ordered from this Caliente's Saturday afternoon. (First time ordering from them) Got the steak hoagie and an order of the hot garlic wings! Let me just say ... AWESOME! The food was excellent, (especially the wings- cooked to perfection) and it showed up super fast. I called back just to let them know what a great job they are doing and they will be hearing from me again!

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Jimmy S.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
I'd normally give this restaurant a 4 stars but last night (Friday) was a complete and utter failure on the entire ownership and management of Caliente.

We waited a solid 2 hours for our food, this was after we were told it could not be fulfilled, then it could and then again that they couldn't fulfill the order.

Finally, right around the 2 hour mark, and I mean, 2 hours after it was supposed to be done, our food was finished.

The pizza was undercook and the wings had to of been under the heat lamp since the original time the food was supposed to be done. The wings were not made to our order as well. So, in the end, not one thing was done right.

Like some people have said, the people who worked the front handled it well. The owners should have a sit down with the managers who worked this location last night because they didn't manage one single thing. If they're in the kitchen helping out, no problem but when a disaster like this is happening, that's when a manager should come out and talk to the customers.

This is not the first time we've waited for our food well beyond the promised but it seems to be happening more than it should for an establishment like this. 

Typically the food is always done correct and it is generally really good. I'll give them that.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Peter T.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: The only positive part of this rating was the food taste & quality which was above average. The service however, was a joke. first two drinks, a Pino Grigio & a "craft cocktail" on the menu weren't available & no alternatives offered. not offered a food menu. Not told the specials. Bartender on cell phone when we were ready to order forget details of our order. Made us ask to correct details our order.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Holly R.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
If I could give zero stars, than I would. Sent a message on Monday, but did not get a response. I see that responses are given here, so maybe I'll get lucky, and they will finally respond. Funny that website only shows the "rave reviews."
-only two in restaurant= 30 min wait for 2 steak salads
-fatty steak, a few fries, and little cheese
-no napkins were given
-asked for silverware and was told that the plastic silverware was behind the dirty condiment/menu container
-waitress not attentive to anything but bottled beer
-$40 for 2 steak salads and 4 Miller Lites? I could have gone to Dukes on Cochran Rd and would have had the great food, and service that they consistently provide
#lessonedlearned
#saveyourself
#neveragain
#THIRDtimewasnotacharm

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Bob K.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
If I could NO stars I would. The waitress was very nice but have been waiting for 2.5 hours for a 3 pizzas. The place was very crowded but not for that long. Had drinks and no apps.   Late to go anywhere else. If you have a choice do not go here. 
I can only imagine that they forgot about our order. 
They offered no comps at al which is pretty unacceptable at this point. 
Very poor management at this point. No good manager would let a party of 8 EIGHT PEOPLE. 
That alone should be a course of of action 
UPDATE:  it's been three days since I was at Caliente and STILL NO RESPONSE. PATHETIC!!

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Brian F.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Came here for the famous "worlds best pizza" and wasn't disappointed.   The "quack attack" was a pan pizza with duck, mushroom and a bunch of other stuff I don't remember but loved.  It's pricey but worth it.  My girlfriend and her kids had a traditional pizza that was also quite good.  Many draft beers and a fun environment.  Will come again.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Marissa M.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Beer and pizza, a match made in Heaven! Thankfully Caliente has a good variety of both! Caliente is both an eat in and take out restaurant, and they also provide delivery which is a plus.  I typically stick with the pizza options when I come, but they do have a variety of other food options as well.  My favorite pizza here is the Chicken Ranchero, which is basically a chicken bacon ranch style pizza.  I definitely recommend giving it a try.  While I have had positive dining experiences in the past, I am only giving Caliente 3 stars at this time due to the poor service I received on my most recent visit.  I am hoping it was just a bad day and that it will not happen again in the future, because I do enjoy dining at Caliente.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: April R.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Came here on a Friday night around 7-8pm. Originally it was pretty crowded and then there weren't many people around at all for some reason. The place was so dark there was barely any lighting to read the menu. Our waiter was friendly, but as we were seated, our waiter was frustrated and complaining about how many tables he had and other occurrences throughout his night that we didn't really need to hear about. I ordered their $5 sangria special which was pink lemonade and it was just okay. We both had a beer each and I did enjoy their variety of beer selections available. We ordered a steak rancher hoagie and a buffalo chicken pizza. The pizza was very good and the steak hoagie was alright. It has a lot of thick bread on it which was very filling. Rather have more meat than bread. Once we finished we were given the check without asking if we wanted anymore drinks or dessert and felt kind of rushed. Unfortunately not craving to go back but would just for the pizza.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Steve C.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Not sure why this place is rated so low. I've had some really good wings here. Pizza and cheesy breadsticks have been really good as well. The bar is usually empty when I go which is nice as well. Quality place in my book.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Brittany M.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: While the pizza and the food is good, the customer service is not. We live a mile away and order for pickup, as the delivery can take over an hour. We have ordered from them once and paid the bill, only to open the box and found that we were given the wrong pizza even though the receipt on the box said it was correct and so we overpaid. We just tried to order pick up, first call we were hung up on. Called back and said "hi we'd like to place an order for pickup" and the response was "yea we can't make pizzas and all that right now". As much as we like the pizza, we won't be ordering again.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Max C.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
** FOOD POISONING **

I was looking for a new spot to eat lunch around Mt. Lebanon when I stumbled upon Caliente and figured I'd give it a shot.  All I had was a half dozen wings and some fries.  The food was alright, your typical pub food.  The service was s.l.o.w. - I was the ONLY ONE at the bar, and there was only one other table in the entire restaurant when I went in - and I still had to flag down the waitress for things like napkins, glasses of water, refills, my check, literally-any-time-I-needed-her, etc.

Now the good part.  About 1-2 hours after ingesting their sub-par food, I start burning up and feeling nauseous.  About 30 minutes after that, I run to the bathroom to throw up.  10 minutes later, I'm throwing up again, and again.  I leave work early to go home and rest... I throw up the entire rest of the evening. I throw up the entire next day afterwards. After 24 hours of constant nausea, I am able to keep water down, and eventually some ginger ale.  Considering it's not flu season, I sought answers elsewhere.

I come to Yelp and see that a few other reviews mention getting sick or contaminated food. I then go on to Allegheny Dept. of Health to see what their most-recent inspection was .. I'm surprised they haven't been shut down! There were almost 10 health violations, some of them being major infractions! 

This inspection has been included in this review. I will never, ever, be returning here - there are SOOOO many better options in the Mt. Lebanon and Castle Shannon area that have delicious food, good service, and won't make you deathly ill.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Greg K.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
You ever heard of bait and switch?   I am in the food business.. have had customers come to me after a showcase and say that other guy's stuff is great.  I want to try them only to come back a few weeks later and what they actually got was less than desired.  Here we go... I would rather have a little Cesar deep dish than a mee-maw reward winning pizza from here.  What a joke.  

Recommended... eat in and get a regular pizza.  Slow but if you're not in a hurry good time.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Herb G.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: This place is bonkers. Really great food and good atmosphere. I love their wings always crisp on the outside and warm on the inside; I recommend the Jamaican jerk. Great seasoning with just enough kick. Their pizza is also very good I love the crust. And if you saved enough room the s'mores desert pizza even satisfied my sweet tooth!

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Daryl R.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Heard about this pizza and decided to try it after a Steeler loss to Baltimore. We sat down and Pizza looked good around us. Ordered a 5 Cheese Calzone. After about 20 minutes a waiter said the Calzone was made too thin and was falling apart. He asked us if we wanted to pick at it while a new one was being made. I agreed and it was really falling apart...not much dough to hold together. Waited about another 30 minutes in the most uncomfortable chairs I have ever sat on in any restaurant. We decided we waited enough...got up and told the waitress to just box the new Calzone they cooked. After another 5 minutes she returned with the newly made item. The restaurant looked very busy and under staffed. Take out orders seemed like a priority to them because the restaurant side was a captive crowd. Maybe I will try them again for take out some time but I am never sitting again in those chairs or at the bar on the stools. I actually noticed most patrons shifting in their seats trying to get comfortable. $25 and an hour without edible dinner was enough for me.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Ashlee S.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: The duck pizza is BOMB! I only ate in there once at the bar, great service. The Italian hoagie is really good too. I get delivery mostly. Food is always prompt, everything is pretty good!

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Bruce Y.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
Solid pizza.  World's best? - they have a few things to straighten out before I would go that far. 
Ordered takeout last evening (Friday).  Web based order process is fantastic - works great with one exception.  The email notification I received stated that the order would be ready in about 30 minutes. 2 hours later my food was ready.  Caliente: YOU NEED TO FIX THIS! Don't lie to people with false promises.  I felt absolutely terrible for the poor ladies working your takeout counter. They were swamped and customers were upset.  Not a single manager appeared to be around to assist.  
The result for me: a couple of ok pizzas, a wilted salad that sat under a heat lamp for an hour or so, and a couple of upset people that had to wait way too long for dinner.
Lots of potential- just need to work out a few bugs.
Oh and that nasty exhaust fan you have blowing out on to the sidewalk....  and your voicemail/on-hold messages should be reconsidered. Again, lots of potential.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: John R.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Food is ok.  Service is terrible!  On multiple delivery orders I've received the wrong food (wrong amount of something, wrong flavor wings, etc.).  I'm not one to complain so I usually just get what I get.  This last time I spent $75 on an order for a party and it showed up wrong again.  I reached out to Caliente via their "contact us" page on their website, but got no response.  I'm not ordering from here again and I do not recommend anyone else does either.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Apryl Z.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
While the food was good, and our service was good, we did not have a good experience. 

Mid meal, a large party of 15 walked in, and a hostess asked us to move our seats. It was then that the people asking us to move for them started laughing and point at us. 

We never should've been asked to move, and our meal should've been comped due to both the inconvenience, and the rudeness of the other table.

This experience was unacceptable and we will not be returning.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Richard D.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: I'd leave no stars if I could. Ordered this through Uber eats and could be my worst meal. Never ordered from here and never will again.
