Watery ranch dressing, lousy celery, rubbery wings a soggy hoagie and an undercooked pizza... caliente means hot this was Luke warm at best

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Amanda W.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description:
The waitresses and food (in general) were fantastic when we came for dinner Tuesday night around 6pm! The two women waiting on us did everything that they could to offset the crappy management and sloth-like kitchen staff.

We had a party of 6 with 3 young children. The first kids meal came out 45 minutes after ordering, the second came 13 minutes after that (yes, we timed it.), the third came 14 minutes later.

Almost 10 minutes after that, we finally received one of the adult meals, 5 minutes to the next, and finally 5 minutes to the last. it took over 30 minutes to receive all of our food. Oh, and 2 meals were made incorrectly!!!! At that point, the waitresses were furious along with us, and we were ready to walk out. 

The waitresses asked the manager, Max, to discount our check, and he did nothing. My sister ended up speaking with him, and not to our surprise, he seemed to lack any personal skills. She politely explained to him that this is unacceptable and that she knows how this situation should be handled (she works in a restaurant). He also reeked of smoke. We got the discount, but that's not the point.

He claimed to have no idea of the situation, which was a flat out lie. Especially since I had just watched our waitresses speak with him about our situation, as well as another table that was having an issue. he also claimed that they were slammed with orders... meanwhile, there were THREE tables with people at them. THREE. This manager needs to be fired!! He obviously cannot figure out how to efficiently run a restaurant and I could tell that his lack of leadership was causing a real problem for the rest of the staff, Employees dont quit jobs, they quit bad managers.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Samuel S.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: I ordered to go and drove 30 mins to go and pick it up. When I got there I waiting about 25mins before I was attended to because the guy working at the register was very slow and was with one customer for a while. After almost an hour later for them to tell me they don't have what I ordered for.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Paul M.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Update - just ordered take out. Very disappointing, read some other reviews but decided to try it anyway as we have had decent food here before (pizza) my wife ordered a grilled chicken salad, which was a giant box of lettuce with minimal toppings, let me re-phrase that, the toppings were sparse, my buffalo chicken hoagie was the same, a giant bun with seven small pieces of chicken and a small amount of melted cheese. We ordered a hamburger for my son which he described as edible but nothing special. The fries were overdone.  With so many other options, we won't be coming back.

_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.author: Tango S.
_laY6Ba-VWXCR6xg7LVtuQ.description: Great people, awesome food, best party room in town. The bar has a selection of craft beers for everyone!

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Yakov H.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
This is a hidden gem in the Cultural District! We brought a bottle of wine from the Market Square Grocery. This restaurant is BYOB with no corkage fee! We ordered the Malai Kofta and the Palak Paneer. The Kofta in particular was a deliciously balanced blend of spice, cheese, and veggies.

Subtract one star for: The a/c is fairly weak, and there were a few little flies. Both of which perhaps are part of the authentic Indian atmosphere :-P

After walking past the crowded, noisy venues of Market Square and Sixth Street it was nice to find an affordable, tasty venue for a quiet dinner date after enjoying comedy at Arcade. Methinks this place could stand to be a little bit LESS quiet though. Check it out next time you are downtown!

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Matt M.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
I ordered delivery via the Yelp app as I was in Pittsburgh for work and didn't feel like going out. The delivery came quickly, but there were a few small concerns. The container that they put the shrimp curry in wasn't sealed so it leaked all over the bag and was actually about the fall straight through the bag. They also didn't include any napkins or plastic silverware. I put down that it was delivering to a hotel, so I had hoped that they would include that stuff.

The shrimp curry was pretty good. I ordered a spice level of 7 out of 10, and they spiced it just right.  There was a pretty decent amount of shrimp in the meal (probably 12 shrimp), and the basmati rice was good as well. 

I would have ranked them a bit higher if they would have included utensils and had some better packaging. I had to go down to the hotel lobby so they could open the dining room to get some plastic silverware for me.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Wendy C.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: This place is okay for Indian buffet. This was the first time that I've been here since I usually go to the other one that is also downtown. The thing that I like about this restaurant compared to the other one is the variety of food that they have compared to the other one that usually go to. The highlight of my meal was the noodles which were flavorful. Everything else was pretty bland which Indian cuisine is usually filled of flavors.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: C G.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
NEW OWNER, NEW MANAGEMENT, NEW CHEF:  IT'S *HORRIBLE* NOW   :(

they seem like nice people, however, this place changed management/ownership about 9 months ago (around January 2019)...the reviews in chronological order show the decline after transition:

the previous chef no longer works there.  the current service is fine, but i really only care about FOOD - & other than good chai tea - this place now HORRIBLE because the food tastes bad.  even the *rice* is bad (it's like Uncle Ben's, not like authentic Indian rice).

it's ridiculous how that with new ownership/chef, this place went from one of the best Indian restaurants in the Pittsburgh area to one of the WORST.  it's unfortunate & i'm disappointed because I was looking forward to giving them a chance since i used to go to the old place often when it was under the prior ownership/chef....therefore, i'm sorry for this poor review (the new people do seem very nice), but their chef & food is just *NOT* good.  I've been to all of the Indian restaurants in the south western Pennsylvania area (there are about 8 or 9 restaurants in total) & this is now unfortunately one of the worst with regards to food taste.  however, they have do very good chai tea.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Samrat B.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: This was one of the worst experiences I have ever had in an Indian restaurant. Everywhere online (google, yelp) the timing showed 10pm closing, and we made it to the restaurant at 9:10pm and we were told only take out orders as they were closing. When we said there is still time to close the lady was like it will take at least 20 mins to make your food and then it will be time to close. Never experienced such rudeness and lack of interest in an Indian restaurant before.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Adam G.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: These people are extremely rude and the restaurant is dirty! With all the decent competition around I have no idea how they remain in business. I understand these are new owners but they do not deserve to serve the public with the attitude they have. Save yourself the hassle, go a few doors down where they appreciate their customers!

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Alessandra C.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
CHANGE IN OWNERSHIP, CHANGE IN QUALITY

It is with great sadness that I write this review... I work downtown and used to hit up the lunch buffet when I felt like eating out. This place used to always have amazing food, variance in the buffet options, friendly staff who knew their regulars, and all offered at a great price. 

However, I went back today for the first time in a few months and was severely disappointed. Caught of guard as the food tasted different (worse) and the ambiance had changed, I learned that ownership changed hands this month. It's clear that they've changed the recipes and completely turned the staff over. Mushy rice, curry that tastes off, and a lack of clean table service will make this a no-go for me moving forward. While they've kept the lunch buffet price the same, they seem to only care about getting people in and out. Sad to see the quality and care change. My advice: try a different Indian restaurant before settling on this one. There are plenty of others with better quality food than this!

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Shrikant K.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: Took them almost an hour for 4 parathas - which were tasteless and pathetic. There's nothing else to add about the restaurant. At this point I'm just rambling because yelp thinks my review is too short. Pathetic food. Avoid.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Kevin G.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
Problems with the restaurant service .  

Stayed at a neighboring hotel and decided to eat here on a Saturday evening.  Apparently there was a new owner the day I arrived.  Normally when someone takes over a restaurant they train their staff, develop systems, hire staff. Not here.   It would have been smart of the owner to stay closed upon taking ownership until they could develop some proper restaurant procedures and train staff or just do deliver service only that day.  It was apparent that these folks had no idea how to run a restaurant; service and operation of the business was sloppy.   

Dinner Service Issues: 
  
1.  Three customers in restaurant on a Saturday evening, with a seating capacity of 30 or more tables,  yet it took over an hour or more to receive food.  

2.  A group of six or so GrubHub delivery people mingled loudly by the entry door.  It appeared GrubHub delivery and take out was getting priority over the patrons in the restaurant.  It would have been wise to just order through Grubhub versus eat here as my food would have arrived faster. 

3.  Waiter was brand new and could not pronounce or was familiar with any of the Indian menu dishes.  Also was bringing out one dish at a time to patrons every 15 minutes or so .  Waiter was also likely serving as the bus boy, sous chef, and food runner and not focusing on customers. He tried .. I don't blame him; I blame whomever was in charge of training or managing him. 
 
4.  The head cook also moonlighted as a food runner and online order taker; constantly running in/out of the restaurant or chasing after GrubHub delivery people who took the wrong bags. 

5.  The owner was just standing behind the cash machine/counter the entire time not assisting employees or the operation of the business.  He was more focused on organizing take out orders for the grubhub delivery people (which any lower level employee could do).   Perhaps he should have been back in the kitchen assisting his staff and hire someone else in charge of host/check out/Grubhub order taking duties.   

6.  Decor, tables and environment of restaurant seemed rather drab/beat up.  Upon closer look tables were not properly cleaned off as the waiter was too busy doing five or six other job titles . 


On a positive the food was OK  without viewing what in the heck was going on back in the kitchen.  The presentation of it could have been a little better.   People familiar with this restaurant  mentioned the lunch buffet is a little more organized as it is a buffet/requires no waiting service.   The waiter and owner did apologize for the sloppy service and appeared they were well aware that there were some problems they need to address at this location.  A discount at checkout would have been a nice gesture.  My advice regarding dinner service if eating here- maybe wait a month or so to eat dinner here on site after my review posts  until they develop some restaurant systems/procedures/know how to run a restaurant or just order for takeout only as your order will come faster.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Paul P.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
Came here in the evening prior to a symphony performance - it's just down the street from Heinz Hall.
It was...okay. Buffet for me, and the food was passable, although it had obviously been out for a while. My young son ordered off the menu, and his food was okay, in his regard. The restaurant seemed clean enough, although for some reason two pairs of tennis shoes were on the floor at the end of our aisle - wonder who owned those?
Good enough...my son wanted to try Indian cuisine, and so now he has. Might stop in again, might not.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Tina R.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
$11 lunch buffet, bland food
I didn't know there was a change in ownership until my most recent visit when it became apparent very quickly due to how much the quality of food and service has gone downhill. I used to eat at the lunch buffet frequently under prior ownership. However, I was completely underwhelmed at my last visit. I never expect much spice in an Indian lunch buffet given the need to cater to all tastes, but the food just lacks flavor. The chana masala tasted like plain boiled chick peas, the dal makhani nearly had no flavor, the chicken tikka masala didn't have a rich flavor, etc. I could go on but you get the point. Prior owner had a very kind, courteous woman at the front desk who would greet you with a friendly smile and was always very helpful. When I got takeout, she would give me plenty of naan and a side of tamarind sauce each time. At my last visit, I was given two tiny squares of naan and I was told they can't give a side of tamarind because it's for appetizers (??). Not worth the money, especially with another Indian restaurant two doors away.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Sunil V.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: This place continues to be my favorite Northern Indian lunch destination in the heart of this great City. The atmosphere is awesome from the decor to the the welcoming hosts and the authentic food. The garlic tandoori naan is great and is made in a real clay oven and has the great taste. The curries, appetizers and desserts in the lunch buffet are all so good. You cannot beat the atmosphere, price and location. You have to try this very well run established Indian restaurant.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Sakshi A.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: This place is a good option for having lunch buffet on weekdays but I will not recommend it for ala carte. Being a vegetarian, I ordered "shahi paneer" today and the veg they served was some other common paneer dish made in pure tomato based gravy but it was not shahi paneer. It was not my first time in the restaurant but definitely the last time as it am really disappointed with such service. If they do not have or wish to serve the dish ordered by customers then they should have conveyed the same with suitable reasons.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: A. G.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
India Palace had recently changed ownership. Now the food is barely edible.
The chicken makhani is barely cooked and very hard, there was a chickpeas dish mixed with kidney beans and the chickpeas was very hard - not soaked enough - the, chanamasala (which was one of my favorites under the old ownership) was soupy and had a weird color, there was not enough daal... I'm sorry to say but i go from being a frequent customer   for so many years to never coming back.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Adelina M.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
Meh. It was ok. I do not know what else to say about the food or even the decor. Meh kinda is the feeling I had after eating here today. I went with a fellow Yelp friend who works down town. It was the lunch buffet so I did not know what I was in store for, but for the price of $8.99 I thought, why not. The place is really big inside. There is enough seating in there for large groups of people and even an area that looks like it could be sectioned off for a party that would be separate from the rest of the restaurant. 

The service was ok. Nothing out of the ordinary happened. They sat us, they were friendly, but they weren't really checking often to see if we needed anything. I could have just went up to get another drink but decided against it and just had one. They did clear the tables rather quickly but checking to see if we needed anything else wasn't something that happened. So meh...

The food was also meh. Nothing out of this world spectacular but nothing that was terrible. The chicken was good and so was the veggie options. I will say that the tikka masala chicken was a little dry, which is hard to do, I think, for something that is marinated in a heavy sauce. But the sauce was also a bit watered down. So meh...

I won't say that I will come here again, but then again I do not head downtown very often. It was not terrible but it wasn't stellar. So meh. Try it out, and maybe dinner is better than the buffet!

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Oren S.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: It should be noted that the restaurant changed hands in early 2019 and my visit today made that clear.  Everyone was welcoming and friendly and I received excellent service, not hallmarks of the old India Palace Cuisine. The food was delicious as always but there were not serving spoons for everything that was offered even after the lunch buffet was well underway. I wish the new owners much success.  You can expect to see me regularly!  I would dine with you more often if you regularly offered the staple dish of Indian buffets, aloo gobi (cauliflower and potato).

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Chipu C.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: India Palace was a classic Indian buffet restaurant. They offer the traditional dishes and the environment is very standard if you've had Indian food before. The lunch buffet price is $8.99 plus tax, which is very reasonable. The service is minimal, but not terrible. I enjoyed their food and all the tastes were standardized. If you want a quick bite that will meet your expectations, no more and no less, then give this place a try. Blessings!

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Leena F.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: I have had the opportunity to dine at many of the Indian restaurants in the Pittsburgh area. India Palace happens to be one of my favorites. They have a large dining room, which is great for meetings and family functions. Their food has flavor and spices, that are unique to the taste bud. There's flare in everything you order. Great atmosphere. They are Byob which is easier as well.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Samson L.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description:
Average Indian buffet you can expect at an inexpensive price. The food is generally fine and I particularly like the naan which is not burnt or too moist.
However there is no one to serve you when you enter the restaurant. They just show you a buffet area near the kitchen. So I ended up choosing a table to have a seat and grabbed a glass of water. The owner immediately told me it was not 'self-service" and should wait for an assignment of table (but there was no one to help and there were plenty of vacant tables!). I quickly removed my stuff from my seat, only to be "assigned" to the same table again. Also, they did not refill water or remove the plates. No greetings or thank you throughout the encounter. They left even before I took the receipt.

SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.author: Muffy C.
SGapZBbSgSYY3fziaskULQ.description: The food is good. The staff is cold and unfriendly. I have been here twice and both times I was made to feel a bother. Didn't want to answer questions. Food is good. The restaurant is messy with boxes, miscellaneous stuff like two dried dead plants in the front window ....Food is really good so I will go back again. I will bring others to just don't expect "Palace" treatment.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Cailyn B.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: Amazing pizza! And super fast delivery on a Sunday night. We got half meatball and half pepperoni. The meatballs were delicious.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Tom B.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: It's not in the middle of anything but I liked the old school feel and they had a good pizza special. The pizza was really good I would probably stop there again if I'm in the area. It actually feels like your in NY with the decor

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Yerzhan N.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: Very good pizza, excellent customer service, delivery is very fast. Will recommend this place for everyone!

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Amber R.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: I was staying at a hotel in downtown Pittsburg and the restaurant was closed, so I was handed a pamphlet to Genoa. I ordered the spinach chicken pizza in medium. They said I would have to come downstairs to get it but they ended up delivering to my room which was awesome. Delivery guy was very nice asked several times if i needed anything else. I had looked this place up on yelp after ordering and was a little weary after seeing reviews. However! I was pleasantly surprised. I judge a pizza by if i want to eat the crust or not. Let's just say I ate it all (not in one sitting ) but the toppings were packed on and the flavor was great. The side of ranch it came with was really tasty as well. I just re-heated some pieces for lunch today and it was still just as good. The portion to price ratio was very reasonable. I would totally order from here again.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Nathan C.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description:
Ordered delivery to the hotel I was staying at for a conference. The cheese on the pizza stole the show and it made for a perfect late night meal. 

You can definitely taste the blend of cheese they use when making the pizza so I appreciate the taste.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Bianka F.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: Ordered 2 large pepperoni pizzas and they still managed to mess that up. Gave me 2 plain pizzas instead. Then when my boyfriend tried to call and inform them of the mistake, they denied sending us the wrong pizza and hung up on him. He called back and once again they said sorry we can't help you. Excuse me? How about you give us the right pizza or a refund. The pizza isn't even great to begin with, so after this experience I would never recommend this place. Quite honestly I'd rather eat anything else.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Chris F.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: I order from Genoa's at least twice a month. Buffalo garlic wings are absolutely great! The delivery is always fast and the food is always hot! I've had one bad experience but normally they hit it right on the nose. I highly recommend Genoa's!

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Jeremy L.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description:
I've never been to the actually location but the delivery is great!! They are so fast from the placing of the order to my door. 

There pepperoni rolls are one of the best things one the menu and their cheese pizza is so simple yet amazing!!

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Catherine N.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: The buffalo chicken pizza is amazing!! Only reason I wouldn't give 5 stars is because I haven't tried anything else on the menu - I love this pizza that much

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Merlyn R.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: The pizzas are affordable and customizable. There's definitely competition when it comes to pizza in downtown / uptown Pittsburgh, but Genoa holds its own. They even serviced me by creating a pizza with custom toppings and no cheese! That was delicious.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Savannah K.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: My boyfriend and I wanted to try somewhere new today, so we found Genoa Pizza on Uber Eats. We ordered a larger extra cheese pizza, some bacon cheese fries, and I ordered some fettuccine Alfredo. Delivery was pretty speedy, but the food was just okay. The pizza was very good, my boyfriend even agrees. But the cheese fries could have been cheesier, and my alfredo was lacking a lot of elements. The Alfredo sauce wasn't cheesy, could have used garlic and a few other spices. The piece of garlic bread it came with became soggy from sitting in aluminum foil. Overall I enjoyed it, but there's room for improvement.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Megan O.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: This is for sure my go-to pizza place every time I'm downtown! I've been getting pizza from here for 3 years now and it's the best college pizza you could ask for. The place itself is very cute, decently roomy in size and has a nice bar. The staff is nice and we always get our orders correct! Whether you're dining in or getting it delivered, Genoa is the way to GO!

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Janet H.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description:
I ordered a deluxe steak hoagie but somehow ended up with a club deluxe which I didn't notice until I bit into it. 
They made me a new steak deluxe and it was so good! Great tasting steak, cheese and mushrooms, onions, hot pepper. I would happily buy again.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Keirstin C.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: Extremely underwhelmed. I ordered the steak and ranch hoagie to be delivered at my overnight job nearby. The person who delivered it seemed nice enough and the food was still hot even after I let it sit before I started eating it for a few minutes which is a plus but after that it goes down hill.  The sandwich comes with fries on it Provolone, cheddar and ranch. I swear I've never seen a sandwich have less meat!!! It looked like they put 2 frozen steak ums that you get from the market on the roll added fries and cheese and called it a day, they didn't even chop it up which might just be a personal preference but I've  never seen it like this before. The flavor of the meat was just ok however I do think they put a good amount of cheese on it and the ranch was good it tasted homemade which I love. I may go back again if my co workers decide to get it but I will definitely order something else and pay for extra meat.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Olivia L.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: If you like seafood and you like pizza you will LOVE this seafood pizza. Soooo delish

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Wei G.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description:
Got here after a 6 hour bus ride and was starving so I call Genoa's what ended up being a total of 4 times to be passed around the phone and hung up on.... also 4 times. Never got my order placed over the phone. Saw the same place on here and placed an order only to receive less than what I ordered! :)

Asked for a calzone w ricotta, mozzarella, pineapple & sauce on the side (literally wrote this in the comments in caps since we don't have any.....). What we got was a calzone w a dollop of ricotta in a ball in the middle with no sauce!! :))

Connection sucks where I am and the driver texts me but it doesn't come through and pulls up a few houses down then gets offended that we didn't tell him there was a dog when he sees my dog on the porch where I pretty much just spat back "yup." Guy gets in his car and angrily holds his horn down while he's driving by the house after making a u-e lmao

Easily one of the most karmically hilarious situations I've been in in a while. Sufficed to say I will never be ordering from here again on my trips to Pittsburgh and I don't generally recommend others do either. :////

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Kate P.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description:
I love Genoa's. I've been eating here for the last couple years and every time I introduce a new friend to this place, they are excited to share it with someone they know! 

Let me just say, Genoa's dose cheese fries better than anyone. Also, they have great pizza (obviously) and their hoagies are awesome. I've tried a lot of different items on the menu but my most recent love is the eggplant parm. So good. 

The service is really good, everyone is friendly. I appreciate the atmosphere. It's really comfortable. They get a good crowd.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Amy Jo R.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: I have eaten here a handful of times and the food is good and the staff always makes me smile and have me laughing so hard. I appreciate their energy!!

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Carol K.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: The food at Genoa is good but the service is much better.  The blue haired princess named Nichole was very attentive, prompt and professional.  While working the register, making drinks, taking orders and delivering food she was on her game. I would definitely return to this place to see her again.

ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.author: Matt P.
ijNQXC2cBhbkf6iB6D8OJw.description: The reviews were so mixed which always makes you wonder if they're paying to have reviews written.  The answer is "probably".  I ordered on seamless and they came up as a place that delivers (after one am).  I ordered a hoagie, boneless wings and a quesadilla.  The hoagie was actually decent and edible.  The boneless wings were just slightly undercooked and rubbery. The quesadilla - not sure  what they did here but they either don't own a fry pan or a flat top because it was just a soggy shell full of yellow cheese.  It had potential.  Hey - I am one guy and ordered 3 things and one of the items was edible.  Small win for me, but I'd say this place needs to spend some time and hire an experienced cook.

L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.author: Melanie E.
L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.description: Damn, I didn't know a simple sandwich could taste so damned good!  The turkey sandwich was absolutely devine- it hit the spot and was served fast.  I'd post a picture but I ate it already....

L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.author: Pamdora T.
L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.description: what can i say....the best fresh sandwiches for me in pittsburgh  and the owners are like there produces fresh n nice thanks for keeping it fresh

L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.author: Elaine H.
L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.description: If you grew up in black neighborhoods you always had a corner store who makes food and this is what that is but their sandwiches are hands down the best in the city I always come here for a corned beef sandwich and it is so good only place I will go now for corned beef sandwiches if you don't know about this place or never been please go it is well worth it

L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.author: Matt H.
L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.description: Really cool hidden sandwich shop in the Hill District. The owner is super nice and his ability to take 5 sandwich orders at once without messing any of them up is ridiculous.

L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.author: Charles L.
L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.description:
If you're looking for a basic no nonsense sandwich, this is the place.  Their selections are limited but everything I've had is very good.  Their menu is about a simple as you can get.   Your choices are corn beef, turkey, or ham.  I've had the first two and both are excellent.  The deli meats are delicious and the accompaniments are fresh.  I've only had their white bread and it tastes like it came straight from a bakery. 
 It is a small neighborhood market so there are no places to sit so it's togo only.  I also highly recommend their potato salad.  For my taste, the best I've had in Pittsburgh.  Going forward, I will stop by at every opportunity.

L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.author: Erica S.
L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.description: Sams market has great sandwiches. There is not a lot of fluff to this place. Simple and sweet...but very tasty satisfying sandwiches. I always get the turkey sandwich which is so fresh. It's a great place to grab a quick sandwich on your lunch break or grab a sandwich on the way home from work.

L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.author: Scrappy F.
L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.description: Thee Best Sandwich Shop in the burgh.. especially the corned beef. Really fulfilling. Really fast services.. about 40 second's to make..the fastest I've seen yet.

L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.author: Celeta S.
L1KkmY4vTgCrS1J5aUFMtA.description: This is one of the best corned beef sandwiches in the city. The meat is not fatty like some others. The portion is generous and everything is fresh. I love the sandwich from Sam's with chips and a beverage. The cost os reasonable and the location is convenient!

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Troy L.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description:
For $12, you can't afford to go anywhere else in Lawrenceville. And why would you want to?

For very little money you can get an extra large pizza from Pesaro's. Its not a flatbread, not some gourmet truffle-oil mushroom B.S. -- nothing artisanal about it. Just good pizza without any pretensions.

This isn't just the best pizza I've ever had at this price point. This is one of the best pizzas I've had period. It comes with plenty of cheese, a great sauce, wonderful dough, enough toppings to satisfy.

And it's $12.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Tom B.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: We were working in the area they have a special large pep for $9.99 and it was large plus really good. They also have delivery there's no seating inside but they've been around a long time so lots of people like the pizza

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Purvi S.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: Came here after a night on the town in Pittsburgh as well as after some bars in Lawrenceville. Excellent small pizza joint with pizza by the slice as well as medium large multiple specialty pizzas. We got one of the cheese slices and it was huge and excellent in terms of the cheese to crust ratio. Will definitely be coming back for more different pizzas As this slice was excellent!

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Taylor A.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description:
Got some pizza from here after a night of drinking and it hit the spot! I appreciate this place staying open late to accommodate the late-night dining crowd. 

You can buy cheese and pepperoni by the slice which was thin crust and exactly what I needed. 

The people working here are also very friendly!

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Dolores S.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: We got pizza there last night and it was dry.  The whole pizza was dry.  The cheese and sauce.   Sometimes we get good pizza and sometimes it is bad.  Last night which was a Saturday it was bad.  You expect it to be good on a busy day.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Jonathan H.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description:
Very greasy, lots of cheese, lots of toppings.

If you're the kind of person who takes a paper towel and tries to remove the grease from pizza; this place is not for you.  If you're the kind of person who loves great tasting pizza, you will love this place.

Perfectly cooked, and delivered fast.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Lindsey P.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: Pretty average pizza for a really cheap price. I'm not a huge fan of their fried foods.  The breading they use is not what I prefer for fried foods. Their pizza is consistent and good. My partner always gets their buffalo chicken sandwich. Good quick pick that doesn't break the bank.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Miranda W.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: Worst pizza place in Pittsburgh. And I've had pizza all over the city. By far the worst! Service was also terrible.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Priya T.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: We called around 1:45 am, and the guy picked up the phone to tell us, "hang up, we are closed"

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Funtime P.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description:
I ate a slice here. It was fresh and cheesy and made well but was basic.

The store was clean and they had other food to choose from.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Jesse J.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description:
I've never felt the need to write a review after years of using Yelp. But I feel I need to warn you. Unfortunately, this is the worst pizza place I've been to in Pittsburgh, and I've been to most. It also competes for the worst food I've had in Pittsburgh. Let me start off by telling you about the experience. 

First, online ordering is completely useless. I wasted about 20 minutes trying to enter my order into both Yelp and GrubHub and neither worked properly. I would try to clip the "free breadsticks when spending $25" coupon after adding $25 worth of food to my cart and instead of working it would just delete my pizza from my cart and say "Oops! Looks like you haven't spent $25 yet!" So I tried GrubHub. We decided to get the 'Family Feast' - Pizza, breadsticks, a sub, a drink for $25ish.  When choosing the 1 topping pizza we noticed there's no option to make it only half pepperoni. Fine. We'll just make the whole thing pepperoni. But when you go to add 1 topping to your 1 topping pizza it charges you $1.75 for an 'extra topping'! I guess the one topping they give you for free is just the cheese. Fine. I'll pay $1.75 for pepperoni. Now to choose a sub - my wife wanted buffalo chicken. As you might expect, you can customize it a bit, but there is one section in particular where you can add extra toppings, like gyro meat or crab meat. We thought about it, then decided not to add crab meat...but it doesn't let you. It's a required field! You have to pay extra to add some extra topping or you can't add it. When I went back to check the pizza section I noticed it's the same thing - you are forced to pay extra for a topping - even the one that's included! And there is no way to just choose cheese pizza with no extra topping. 

So I called instead. That experience was great! I decided to add $5 cheese fries to our Family Feast. Food was done pretty quick and they gave us everything we ordered. Unfortunately. The most damning thing about Pesaro's is the taste of the food. 

The breadsticks are bland, the sub might have been edible but did they didn't put any buffalo sauce on the buffalo sub. The ranch is just packets. The pizza tastes like what I remember next-day Chuck E Cheese pizza tasting like. And that wasn't even the worst. Literally, what are those cheese fries? Why are they charging $5 for those? The fries are uncooked. The cheese is just a giant glob of some bland cheese that cements the raw fries to the foil. It was impossible to eat and if there is one thing I'm thankful for it's that. I threw them right away. To be fair, it wasn't all bad - the highlight of our meal was the 2 liter of Pepsi. 

It's often true that you can spend a small amount of money to get a lot of trash (Dominos), or spend more money to get a little gold (Spak). Pesaro's is like spending a lot of money on a little bit of trash.
How does this place exist on Butler street?

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Anonymous W.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: Worst fries I have ever had from a pizza place.... chicken tenders were skimpy af..... overall place was total garb

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Terence G.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: We're Quasi-Regulars delivery is timely, food is average.  Pizza okay, Sandwiches,  ingredients not so good.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Tammy B.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description:
This is our go to place for pizza , always fresh and yummy?!!-"

Not fond of the fried mushrooms and cheese sticks it seems like the grease isn't hot enough.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Mary-Michael M.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description:
$12.84 is an amazing price for the EXTRA large one topping pizza made with real cheese, fresh toppings, perfectly seasoned sauce, and dough that's done right, pick up/walk in special. Plentiful and full of toppings. Real cheese that's doesn't make ordering extra cheese necessary. (Ahhhh yeah, mmmmmmm, but we do, because we love their xtra cheese pizza w the thick fresh cheese layer, oh. my. yum. ) Fresh toppings. 

I am going to be honest- Personally, Pesaro's Pizza is tied w Caliente's as my favorite local places to get pizza.  There are many similarities. Quality. Both use fresh, quality cheese and toppings. Both serve dough that's handled properly before it's even cooked and it can be tasted in the product when eaten. 


However there are some huge differences. To start, price. Pisaro's is about 12 and some change for the xl. About ten less than my other favorite place. Pesaro's pizza size is also noticeably much, much bigger. We can order one xl and feed the entire family w a few slices leftover. Our other favorite place requires us to buy at least two of their xl size pizzas to equal one of Pesaro's.

Pesaro's Pizza pick up xl one topping pizza special is amazing. $12.84 is a fantastic deal!

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Karla D.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: When it's Sunday morning at 1030 am and you want pizza badly...call these guys! Called at 1038 am for delivery to Bloomfield, was told 45 minutes  (average) and food arrived in under 30. Fresh, hot and good. Sicilian with extra cheese and a side of fried mushrooms were just what the junk food doctor ordered!

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Amanda C.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description:
The calzone & stromboli were good. However, our appetizers were not! I ordered fried mushrooms & my husband got the onion rings. The onion rings were burnt. When I called to complain, I wast old that they don't have a deep fryer. They cook them in the oven & if they cook them less, they get soggy. So, I guess the serve burnt appetizers. My "fried" mushrooms were the worst I've ever had. They were soggy & flavorless. I called & was given a credit for the onion rings (I didn't realize that my mushrooms were not good either & wasn't about to call them again.)
Stick with anything other than the appetizers. Why even sell "fried" items if you have no way to fry things? 
We won't be ordering from this place again, even with the credit.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Lillian T.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: Yummy! Ordered a take out personal size pizza for lunch, and was not disappointed. I added 3 toppings (pepperoni, bacon and green peppers) so it was about $7 for a 7 inch pizza. Big props for how much toppings they loaded onto my pizza! It was piled high and there were no bare spots, which I appreciate. The crust was yummy, more of a pan style thicker crust. Not overly cheesy or saucy, pretty much perfect. I felt like it was a quality pizza for the price, and was fresh and quick. Will definitely order again!

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Sarah C.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: I get the Hawaiian usually- very tasty simple pizza! I have done delivery and pick up. Both experiences were there quick.

wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.author: Charlene N.
wpJcD0Qv-q4ShVJYH0hMLw.description: Delivery time was great. Food had great flavor. Food tasted good. I would recommend. Quality for the right price. I would order from here again. Portions were terrific.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Larissa G.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description:
I normally love Pizza Parma. I don't love THIS Pizza Parma, unfortunately. 

I work very close to their location, so it's easier for me to pick up orders here rather than have things delivered. But it's really not a pleasant shop to walk into. The staff are always disorganized; often they're bickering or complaining about their day. I've noticed that it takes them a while to locate my order as well, especially if I place it through GrubHub. And it typically feels like there aren't enough people to make the orders, answer the phone, and interact with customers at the front counter. Just a high stress, grouchy environment all around.

Meanwhile, the food varies in quality. Their pizza is good, as are their french fries. The main appeal of the hoagies is more that you get a lot of food for a fairly low price; otherwise, they're pretty "meh". It's also a bummer that when ordering through GrubHub, you're limited to ordering regular or diet Coke. They have other drinks available in-store! They're just...not available to app users. Sigh.

My final vote for this place is 3.5 stars; they're a cheap lunch option, the affordability is a plus, and some food items are better than others. If you stick to their pizza, fries, and other cheat day staples, you'll probably be a happy camper.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Megan M.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: Pizza was ok, not the usual buffalo chicken pizza because it had mushrooms and green peppers and lacked blue cheese, but they said that came on it so that's fine. But the mozzarella sticks came with barbecue sauce and ketchup. Odd.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Jazmine S.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description:
Great quick service.  Friendly staff. 

For Valentine's Day, many lovers will spend tons on food and gifts. This pizza is my favorite so far not because of their special heart shaped design but because of the basil flavoring in their sauce that gives to a more authentic delicious pizza. 

I ordered sausage and pepperoni heart shaped pizza that was outstanding. We ate the whole thing (2ppl).

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Julie D.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: I had a coupon for a free medium cheese pizza. Honestly, can't complain! They put a ton of cheese on their pizza which I enjoyed but you might want to ask for less, especially if you're sensitive to dairy! I liked the sauce a lot, I could taste the fresh basil in it. I would've preferred a little more sauce considering how much cheese there was though. The crust was pretty good too, not soggy. The prices on their menu seem fair. I'll probably be back here to try some of their specialty pizzas!

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Shahad A.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: Their red sauce pizza is the kind of pizza you rely on on gloomy days. I find them to be the best pizza place around here. Their staff are not very friendly but that doesn't bother me honestly. The prices are okay.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: B R.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: Over an hour late, cold. No refund, no excuse. Service just keeps getting worse and worse. Guessing it will be Vocelli Pizza next time.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Carly C.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: HORRIBLE SERVICE. not only did delivery take forever but the general manager was completely RUDE, unhelpful and unprofessional. A manager should be able to help and solve issues. Just terrible service, subpar pizza, DO NOT ORDER FROM HERE!!

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Sameh A.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: Ordered wings from here, they were not good at all, it looked like they cooked the wings and just threw some sauce on top (BBQ, hot, etc) so it didn't taste good at all. Pretty average experience, I had food to go but I would not come back for food. I don't expect the pizza being any different , this seems like a late night  bar with below average food that is only tolerable when you are too drunk to comprehend what you are eating.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Melissa P.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: Not bad! We had them deliver lunch to the office, and it was pretty good. It's certainly not one of the Pittsburgh classics-- the Sorrento's/Fiori's/Mineo's pizzas of the world-- but it works. We got cheese bread and cheese pizza. They definitely don't skimp on the cheese, which is awesome, but the flavor wasn't quite there for me. Especially with the cheese bread, you definitely need the marinara dipping sauce or garlic butter sauce to give it that little bit of kick. But overall, I'd order it again.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Kevin J.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description:
$24 for a large pizza made of rubbery cheese, about 10 lbs of grease, limited toppings, but it was complete with employees yelling "fuck! Shit!" In the background.

First and last time customer. Would love a refund but if the owner is anything like the employee at the counter, I wouldn't want to even hassle with speaking with them.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Ashley R.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: For $2.50 you can get a slice of pepperoni bigger than your head. It's like a slice from teenage mutant ninja turtles in real life. So delicious. I'm often nearby for work and this is my go to. Best pizza in town.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Sophia S.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: I was pleasantly surprised with pizza Parma. Not going to lie, after reading all of the reviews I was scared to order. My boyfriend and I split the gyro special and got it delivered. Delivery came in the designated time and the food was warm when we received it. The gyros were tasty, the tzatziki was the best part. I will definitely be ordering from them again!

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Ken C.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: Ordered two items Smoked turkey hoagie and mozzarella sticks. Never eat their food again. Four cheese sticks and they were inedible, cheese was old and sour threw them in garbage $699 in garbage then hoagie, stop of bun was burnt and hard as rock. Mayo was stacked thicker  than turkey so I scraped turkey, lettuce, tomato and onion off  bun and ate it as a salad. Spent $21 for absolute garbage. Did not call to complain because if they send that quality of food out they would not care about complaint.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Charna K.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: Pizza crust and sauce taste really tasty but the cheese was way too cheesy . Maybe it was a very busy time that I ordered it and that's why it was messy pizza ... my niece says "I don't like this pizza"

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Kiera Y.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: Never lets me down for lunch. The manger Norman is a god send. He knows customer service.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Joseph T.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description: I Went there last Night for a couple of Slices after Cubs Pirates Game...I'm From Chicago so a Pizza snob,But I Gotta say this was amazing Loads of Pepperoni Well done Nice crust,Girl behind the counter was super nice...Very nice surprise..I will be back next year when I return and If they shipped Pizza to Chicago I would order...Went to Downtown Location

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Macey S.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description:
I was here a few weeks ago after my friend and I left this bar. The closing time for this spot was 2am. We came in at about 1:30 maybe 1:40. We were immediately ignored and told that they aren't serving pizza anymore because they are closing. (We actually left the bar earlier to get here so we could get something to eat before bed) on yelp the closing time was 2am. 

Long story short - we practically had to beg them to make us the smallest pizza that would take maybe 10 minutes, which would still have them done by 2am. They were rude and annoyed and probably spit in our pizza. The pizza sucks, everything about it. The cheese, the sauce, everything. Definitely not homemade or using fresh ingredients. It's really not that difficult to notice or taste those kind of things.

Although I don't want to completely rip into their business, I have some advice.
1. Update your account on your website or yelp if you want to close at a certain time and stick to that
2. Fire you're staff and hire new people to work for you
3. Maybe reconsider the menu and ingredients because you have a lot of other competitors in this part of town

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: William K.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description:
I've lived in Shadyside for about ten months now. This place had become my go-to. 
The pizza is still good, no question.

But, I'm still struggling with simple things here. 
I order the same salad, EVERYTIME! Mediterranean, add chicken, no cruton. NO CRUTON! I'm guessing out of twenty (at least), I've not had cruton 3 times. The menu says the salad comes with cruton, but their computer screen doesn't show cruton as an option to subtract. They've showed it to me. But the food prep area has cruton on the guide. Again, I've been shown.  I just don't like crunchy then soggy bread chunks on salad. Sorry...

This last time I kinda lost it and called them out on fb. I was immediately called to remedy the issue with free everything. That's not how I roll, though. I don't want free food for their constant mistake. I usually eat half the salad with dinner and take the other half for lunch. Hence the now gross af soggy bread all through my salad. 

Also, I ask for an extra side of sauce to dunk my crust in. Every time I order pizza. I have received the extra sauce 4 times in 22. Yes, at this point I'm counting.

To their credit, after multiple text exchanges with the "manager". Which in itself was weird that they would think it ok to randomly send me a message just because they have my phone number on file. I have a credit of my purchase cost under my phone number. But am wary to use due to possible retribution.

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Amanda J.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description:
My friend is about to have a baby, and we have been ordering a ton of pizza for pick-up in Shadyside lately.  Since I have ironed through most of the places in Squirrel Hill, it's fun to try the other pizza places.  Maybe my friends and I hit Pizza Parma on an extra good night, but we thought the pizza was better than Pizza Perfecta just down the street.  Even better, Pizza Parma has a parking lot!

We ordered an extra large cheese pizza ($13.99 special) and an order of breadsticks ($4.99), and we were told the pizza would be ready in fifteen minutes.  They totaled $17.10 (lower than we expected from menu prices), and I threw a couple dollars in as a tip because the people working at Pizza Parma were so nice!  The man behind the counter was so friendly and everyone working here seemed to be happy.  Plus, our pizza was ready in ten minutes so score.

This was a pretty standard cheese pizza.  There was lots of cheese, which was great.  It wasn't overly spiced sauce nor was the crust special, but we enjoyed the pizza.  The breadsticks were good, but I wouldn't order them again.  They were the circular pizza crust kind, and I prefer the fluffy kind of breadsticks.  All in all, we will probably keep ordering takeout from here.

Other reviewers seem to have other stories about here, but I suspect they have similiar issues to Pizza Bellino in Squirrel Hill.  Some pizza does not survive the delivery process very well.  This pizza wasn't so good once it sat, but it was yummy fresh out of the oven!

A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.author: Karin U.
A-IqLvBfU5Gr_b9HVLETTw.description:
Wow really tasty pizza! We did a 2 topping large pizza deal from a coupon I got on a takeout menu. I asked for less cheese on the pizza and it turned out incredible ! The cheese was really tasty and rich so it was good to ask for less cheese (especially if you're a pizza sauce fan like I am). The crust was also really good. Not too thick. I'm a N.Y. pizza fan so I don't like that type of crust you're going to get from sorrentos or whatever that is thick undercooked and falling apart. 
Great take out pizza. It's a little pricey for the pizza - that's why I took off a star. It was ~$20 with tax for a large pizza.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Bobbi N.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: Amazing food with such a family atmosphere. Food is beyond delicious.  Mike and Antoinette treat you as if you were a guest in their own home. The limoncello is the absolute best that I ever had.  Great wine selection and amazing food.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Laura C.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: Atmosphere and service: 5 stars . The food is amazing, can taste the fresh & top shelf ingredients. Baked gnocchi is my favorite. I tried the pumpkin and leek soup too (seasonal), it was delicious! I always look forward to eating here and can not wait till the next time.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Savannah R.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: This is such a cute little restaurant. My friend and I went here for dinner last minute and I was expecting them not to take reservations on such short notice, but they did! Our waitress was so nice and served us right away. The bread served first good. It didn't seem like it was cooked in the restaurant but it was alright. I ordered the sundried tomatoes and gulf shrimp and my friend had the Mediterranean Sea scallops. Each entree comes with a salad. The waitress made it seem like the salad came with cheese because she asked what kind of cheese I'd like but when we got the bill, we had been charged for cheese. The food was good besides that and the atmosphere there is nice. Definitely get the chocolate truffle cake. Amazing!! After we finished eating, the owner came up to us and said how much she appreciated our business which was so sweet!

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: John R.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: It may not look like much from the outside, but Gran Canal is the place to go for top-notch authentic Italian food!  Gran Canal is a lovely, family-owned business with some of the best service around. The courses of the meal were paced well, and the house specialty Italian Vinaigrette was superb. The Pappardelle Con Salsiccia was served in a delicious red sauce and phenomenal sweet Italian sausage - highly recommended! Great food and great service; I will be back!

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Deborah O.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: If you haven't eaten at the Gran Canal in Sharpsburg, you are missing some of the best food in Pittsburgh. It's an absolutely lovely place and the owners are the nicest, but the star of the show is the food. Every pasta dish is exceptional, as is every appetizer, salad, etc. I can't name a favorite pasta because every time I try another one, it's my favorite. But it's literally everything on the menu and right now, run, do not walk, for the pumpkin, leek and potato soup before it goes out of season. There aren't that many Italian restaurants that get it this right and especially not in Pittsburgh

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Emily G.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: This is the best Italian food in city. I highly recommend the gnocchi, the pappardelle, and the mushroom ravioli, but I've never had anything here I haven't liked.  Even the limoncello dressing on the salad is memorable. Beyond the food, Gran Canal offers such a welcoming environment; Michael and Antoinette go out of their way to greet customers and make them feel at home.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Cheryl G.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: Had the most delicious Italian meal at the Gran Canal.  The food was amazing and the service top notch. The staff was so welcoming and attentive, but the food....oh my, the food was superb! What a hidden gem in Sharpsburg.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Paul R.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: Absolutely a wonderful experience! Authentic Italian cuisine and excellent service. As soon as you walk in you are treated like family. Will definitely be back again and again!

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Ruth H.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description:
I'm so grateful to have finally dined here !!!Wonderful service ! And the homemade PASTA YUM !
We had it with the Bolognese & the sausage & spinach. Enjoying my leftovers for lunch today 

Save room for Dessert! The flourless Chocolate torte was not too sweet and scrumptious!!!

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Gina F.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: I heard about this restaurant from friends that dock at Silky's Marina and can't believe I didn't find it sooner.  The food was wonderful.  Had their gnocchi, which melted in my mouth.  Service was excellent and felt like I was being served in their home.  Thanks for a great experience, will be back again and again.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Shanna C.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description:
I love Gran Canal so much. This family owned restaurant is often my pick for a date night or taking out of town guests to dinner. Make a reservation if possible, because they're only open 3 nights a week! The owners are wonderful, charming people who really care about their customers.

Every meal comes with a great salad and warm bread. The pasta is fresh and the portions are large. If you don't have room for dessert they have a great selection of after dinner drinks (or digestifs) at the bar.

Also, I think I have had the best wine of my life here, which the State Store employee told me that they special order. So if you see a Dipinti Chardonnay - get it! Get the whole bottle!

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Sal G.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description:
we have been there 3 times.....first two were ok

four of us went ........

first of all ..an appetizer for $14.......that has 10 slices of meat and some cheese on a plate..........that's not a good deal

veal Cannelloni was ok........sauce was burned ....too bitter

my wife's chicken was overcooked

my friend chicken was the same

only person happy was our friend who got shrimp

soup was very good

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Chirley R.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: Enjoyed the cozy atmosphere and meal very much. The tomato soup was to die for!!! Tiramisu was a bit of a let down.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Joey M.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: Where do I begin? I've moved to Pittsburgh three years ago and I just made it to this tremendous restaurant. I've missed out for those three years. From start to finish, the atmosphere, the service, dinner, and drinks were perfect.  Truly the finest family Italian restaurant in the Burg. Michael brings the authentic Italian experience with food and conversation while Antoinette's genuine and kind-hearted personality made for a truly wonderful experience. The hidden gem in Pittsburgh is in Sharpsburg. Looking forward to our next visit.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Daddio 4.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: This place is fantastic! Family owned and run and they treat you like family. The wife is the hostess/bartender, the husband is the chef and their daughter is the waitress. But besides the impeccable service, the food is delicious! We love this place. It's very unassuming from the outside but we're so happy we found it!

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Suzan H.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description:
We have never had a bad meal here. We have gone with small groups, large groups, and just 2. We feel welcomed and very special when we see the owners, Michael and Antoinette, smiling at us as we walk in. The food choices are excellent. The wine list is perfect. The prices are terrific.
Why you ask?  Well...there are homemade pastas, veal, veggie dishes, and fabulous specials. 
The wine list is small and really characterizes the restaurant. Michael has really chosen well with regard to the wines. 
Desserts....wonderful and again, a good size. Not crazy big...just enough.
The pasta sauces are so delicious and vary by dish. Recommend it highly....tell them I sent you!

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Lisa F.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: Actually 3.5 for food and 4+ for service and setting. We tried shrimp app which was delicious. For entrees, baked gnocchi was superb. Light dough and savory traditional sauce. Chicken Marsala had a thin Demi-glacé type sauce...wish there had been more sauce. It's your typical family-run old school Italian restaurant. They make you feel at home, like you're part of the family. On a narrow street in Sharpsburg, great place when you need a dose of cozy, Italian comfort.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Lisa K.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: I had looked forward to eating here because over the years I had heard good things. The wait staff was professional and the ambiance was nice, but the pasta was so-so - not house made as I had been told when I asked, but out of the box pasta, fine if you are cooking at home, but substandard for restaurant fare. Disappointed.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Natasha H.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description:
After reading a few stellar 5-star yelp reviews, I decided to make Friday night dinner reservations at Gran Canal Caffe. (I suggest making reservations a few days in advance.) I'm glad that I did and will certainly be returning in the future.

Upon our arrival, we were warmly greeted by the bartender and waited just a few minutes to be seated.  The wine list is pretty extensive and surprisingly affordable for such a small restaurant. We ordered the pear and baked Brie for an appetizer and it was oh-my-god yummy. The Brie was gooey and runny and warm, which is just how it should be! Our meals included starter salads, which were pleasant. (Note: Try the limoncello dressing if you have a chance. It's light, yet flavorful.) The main dishes were really good, as well. Hubby had the pasta aioli and I had the shrimp San Marco. 

The reason that I rate my experience at the Caffe as 4 stars, instead of 5, is two-fold: first, our server was overwhelmed by a large party and several others tables. We waited a pretty long time to ask for refills, etc.  Second, the menu, while delicious, is pretty limited to pastas and a few meat dishes.  There are only a couple fish and poultry options and most of them are pasta based.

Overall, a nice dinner and charming restaurant that I'll recommend to friends and family.

5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.author: Robin R.
5nMvlKW5n2-O0tT44DYnDQ.description: Gran Canal is a true hidden gem. Located in Sharpsburg, Michele and Antoinette provide such a genuine dining experience. I highly recommend the homemade veal cannelloni. The combination of marinara and béchamel sauces over top finish this dish nicely. I've also enjoyed their meatballs, chicken marsala and most importantly Michele's risotto. For this you must call ahead but totally worth it.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Michael S.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description:
I enjoyed my meal here.  I've liked Nepalese food for years, but don't see many around. So I was pleasantly surprised to find this gem.  I had a mutton thaali, with a mango lasso. All of it was great. The thaali came with pulse soup, mutton, vegetable curry, basmati rice, papadon, yogurt, and gulab jomun for dessert. 

All of this with a friendly atmosphere, and good service.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: F P.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description:
I came in here twice over a one week period. Tried a few different things because I'm somewhat unfamiliar with the food.

Both times the service was the same. Not anything spectacular but the waiter dude was nice and both times the cook came out and asked us if the food was good. They were pleasant and there is a slight language barrier but not a big deal (I'm the one that doesn't speak their language, after all). The only real complaint here is the water they give you doesn't have ice cubes in it. But besides that, no real complaints about the service.

First time I came in and got the Samosa Chat and Chicken Chau Chau. Samosas are what I would say the Himalayan version of an Egg Roll. Potatoes, carrots, peas mashed up inside an egg roll wrapper with curry spices and deep fried. Samosa Chat means they put plain yogurt and some veggies and chickpeas on it. Its surprisingly filling and delicious. The yogurt has a sour cream-esque thing going on. Quite nice. The Chau Chau is basically not much more than a pack of Ramen Noodles all doctored up with a few veggies and some pieces of Chicken. I was disappointed with this and wouldn't get it again.

Second time I came in with my SO. We got the Veggie Appetizer Plattter, Veggie Chow Mein and Chicken Pikora. The Appetizer Platter was good. You get a variety of yummy deep fried things. A samosa, some momos (veggie wontons), onion pakora (their version of onion rings/bloomin' onion), aloo pakora (deep fried curry potato patty). Everything was hot, flavorful, fresh and crispy. I asked for everything to be made "Spicy AF" and, sadly, the heat was not amped up. They did give me a little dish of mashed up red chilis. It added some warmth but not as much as I'd like.

Veggie Chow Mein was great. My SO liked this the most. Sort of like what you would get at a Chinese spot just with South Asian spices (Curry). The serving size was a bit small but this was a great, tasty dish.

Chicken Pikora was basically their version of Chicken Nuggets. The batter was quite delicious. The dipping sauce was tasty though not spicy-hot. But I liked this one most of all the stuff we got.

Second time I went, we got some bottled Coke and didn't touch our water. Can't wait to go another time and check a few more things out on the menu.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Kathleen W.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description:
This was fabulous. We got the chicken momos steamed. They were tasty, but we will try them fried next time. We got the c (chili) momos. OMG. These we soooo good. Mind blowingly tasty. I want to go TODAY and get more. They dialed down the heat a little for us (medium). I think I might be willing to give authentic a go :). We also got the chicken Thali. It was very tasty and a nice showcase. We shared it. 

The food put me in mind of a cross between Chinese and Indian food (if you're not familiar with the style)

So good.  The location is a little bit of a dive, but the food is awesome and that's what I'm going for.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Nick H.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description:
Been wanting to try this place.  I am glad I finally got the chance to.

Ordered pork momo, mutton thukpa, lamb curry, pork soup, the cheese balls in honey dessert and a milkshake.

The flavors were glorious and one of the most authentic I have been able to find. Probably one of the best tasting meals I've had in a long time. I was impressed that the milkshake wasn't overly sweet to fit a more American palate.

We had take out and everything was fresh and quickly prepared. Staff was friendly.

Why only 4 stars for such amazing food? There simply wasn't enough. The curry portion size was tiny for the price. Not even enough to cover the rice given. The thukpa was slightly lacking in mutton. That said the pork soup and curry were loaded with meat so they may have just been low on mutton. The momo portion was fine. Legit though please give more curry (at least more sauce) for the price. It's too good to skimp on.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Sameer A.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: Delicious Momos and very authentic Nepalese dishes. The dried chicken (Sadeko Sukuti) was outstanding. Service is good and they always have a smile on their face.. I'll definitely come back again.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Kyle J.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: Be ready for a flavor adventure. Curries, cilantro and noodles, oh my!  We shared several dishes and loved each one.  Every dish was fresh, we could hear them chopping vegetables in the kitchen.  Chicken Tika Masala, Pork Thukpa soup, Mutton Chau Chau, Samosa.  Will def be back when we come back to this side of town.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Sherese S.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: Authentic, flavorful, quality ingredients. This is a well deserved 5 stars. The chicken tikka masala was the winner, but everything we tried was delicious. I hope people will go out of their way to support this unique spot.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Alistair C.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: Stopped in for lunch today and I am so glad that I did. The space itself is less than inspiring and the location is not great. It's not a 'charming' area; however, it's all about authentic Nepalese food served by some of the friendliest staff I have had in quite some time. I ordered the Mo Mo's which are dumplings. I had the veg mo mo = freaking awesome. The dipping sauce is a spicy tomato based affair and is awesome. I also ordered a vegetarian Nepalese soup called thukpa. It was a delightful noodle bowl w/ mixed veggies in a spicy veggie broth. It was the perfect meal for a snowy day in January. I cannot wait to go back and try more items on the menu. I should say that the two friends I was with had meat based dishes and they were equally blown away. One had pork mo mo and a mutton soup. The other had some chicken rice dish that he loved. All out win.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Sherri S.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: The food was so amazing!!! Just don't expect to get it all at the same time.  Get the pork mo mos!!

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Beth D.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: We had no idea of the thriving Himalayan culture here in the South Hills.  We had steamed chicken mo-mos and both had the Thaali Set (chicken and mutton).  Simply gorgeous food, service, and experience.  Definitely feels like you have left southwestern PA.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Judy S.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: Great food. Lovely people. We had chicken momos (steamed) and pork momos (fried) and they were tasty and savory. A little disappointed that the beef momos on the menu are no longer available since they were our go-to dumplings when we lived around the corner from a Tibetan place in Manhattan. The lo mein was just lo mein, but it was really good lo mein. Same goes for the fried rice. The crowing glory was the mutton chow chow - drenched in a delicious sauce. Will certainly go back (hungry) and try many more dishes. It appeared that waiting tables is a family affair and everyone was friendly and genuinely interested in pleasing us.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Ron D.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: So I have had a recent interest in Nepalese food, and have been going to many many new restaurants because of this. Let me start by saying the food isn't terrible.   I always order a lot so I can compare the taste of other places I have been. Maybe I didn't go at the right time, but all of our main courses were cold and the rice was over cooked. I actually coughed when I ate my first spoonful of chicken curry, it was the saltiest curry I have ever had.. The chicken was cooked well, I liked it but it was destroyed with salt. I also had a Chili Mo Mo, I took this at a very high heat, an 8. However, the dumplings in the Chili Mo Mo are fried, so I expected them to have a tougher outer shell. However, we also ordered a Steamed Pork Mo Mo and the dumplings were clearly not fresh. They were cool and the pastry was very hard, its like what I would expect when they were frozen or refrigerated for a long time or not cooked properly.. The Vegetable platter appetizer I enjoyed. I had worked up a 40 dollar tab but wished I didn't have to pay it because I wasn't satisfied with the food quality at all. I will stick with the other Nepalese restaurant just down the road. Unfortunately they aren't open on Wednesday, and found my self here. I may give this place a second change but won't spend nearly as much I case I do not like it.

Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.author: Swikrity B.
Pj0nNvgiNkJkJ3-2_w6Urw.description: This is probably the best Nepali restaurant i have ever been to. Their service was impressive. The mutton sekuwa and the chicken thaali was outstanding. I am gonna go visit them again.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Brittany S.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Wow. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I'm not huge on italian deli but wanted to try this based on reviews...glad I did! Looking forward to trying their other stuff soon.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Christine M.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description:
Excellent sandwiches. We tried one of each: the Italian beef with a mixture of sweet and spicy peppers. (Wonderful) The Pig Latin which is sweet and savory ham. (Delicious) and the meatball with sauce. All were tasty and fit well with the soft Italian buns they were stuffed with.

The chocolate and vanilla cake was super moist and delicious! 

Service was fast, friendly and efficient. Everything in our order was packaged well and correct!! We will definitely put this one on our list of "go to" places!

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Chelsea M.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description:
Still delicious but I wish the sandwiches were bigger or the option to buy a bigger sandwich was offered. 

Went in today and unfortunately it just seemed small. Polpette only had 2 meatballs. I honestly thought 3 came on the sandwich the last few times that i was here but maybe I'm  wrong.

Either way, it's too good of a sandwich to be so small. I need moreeeeee hahah

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Chris M.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Such a wonderful place, the food was delicious and I actually like that their sandwiches are a bit on the smaller side, they're affordable enough that you can't go wrong with two. The owner is also incredibly friendly and welcoming, we will definitely be going back.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Jeff S.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: My new favorite place! It's not just sandwiches, which are great! They have Italian food like lasagna on a regular, specials rotations. The owner, Gina, is warm, welcoming, and exactly what you'd think of when you were a kid and visiting your Italian friend's house for lunch. She chatted with me for a long time. Just a good soul who wants to feed people good food. We need more places like this. Doesn't feel corporate or like a chain. Everything is top notch. I can't wait to meet her Nana maybe it's Nanna. (No clue, I'm German.) Yes, an Italian grandma comes in to make some of the food! Something about that just screams Old World - and Pittsburgh. Their meatballs and sauce is fantastic.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: DJ J.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description:
Check out the website and the music!  Love it!
The staff is very nice and helpful.  Went with a few others that had questions and the staff was very good at answering.  
There are only a few high tables and the stools are a little low for the tables but we were not planning on staying long.  There is a side room that you can eat in that has a couch and table but we just used the high tables.  

If you like Italian beef sandwiches, Go to OSI.
Nicely season meat, nice and moist, topped with peppers.
Nice and sloppy!  
Just what the doctor ordered!
As good as Chicago!

Good bread/bun.  A little smaller than 6 inches.
There are 2 other sandwiches, and some electives/sides of salad, pasta and desserts.
Only 4 small stainless steel tables.

If you are in the Waterfront area and looking for a good sandwich!  Here u go!

Address is on 9th Ave. but it is really in the alley behind the church/school.  
In the basement of the old school.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Tara L.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Best meatball sandwich in Pittsburgh! Staff was helpful and friendly.  We will be going back soon.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Dave D.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: What a great spot in Homestead!  It's tucked away and a bit hard to find at first, but well worth the effort.  It's a simple places, clean on the inside with friendly staff.  They have great homemade Italian style sandwiches.  The meatball sandwich or Italian beef are can't miss.  Highly recommended it!

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Jason O.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: The sandwiches are perfect. We tried 3 different ones today and we will be going back again to try the rest real soon. Really nice space and great service! It's a little hard to get to but believe me it's worth the effort.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Neil S.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: We popped in while driving through town and found this place from Yelp! Glad we did! Excellent sandwiches in a very cool building. Everything is made from scratch and super delicious.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Liz M.
