eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Just had a Polpette and an Italian hoagie. Both really delicious and filling. It took a bit of maneuvering around to find this gem but it was worth the search.  The smells of Italian sauce cooking with meatballs is reminiscent of an Italian Kitchen. The owners are so friendly and we even got to sample the beef and the meatballs in sauce while we waited. Both were delicious. The sandwiches are on Breadworks buns and are the perfect compliment to the fillings.  I am looking forward to my return visit to try some of their other offerings.  The chocolate cake looked pretty amazing too.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Kate D.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Very nice quality sandwiches with a very friendly staff. I got the Italian sandwich as I was not going to be able to eat it for about an hour, and I was afraid the Italian beef would get too soggy in that time. They clearly don't cut corners on their ingredients and the homemade dressing is delicious. I can't wait to try a messier sandwich when I can eat it right away! The portions are smaller than your average place, but I am not a big eater so I'm happy with the size...I'd say a 6 inch bun probably. Definitely worth a try, tricky little place to find and cash only, but well worth it. Make sure you look around for signs once you turn off of 8th ave...they will lead you more correctly than maps!

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Antwon R.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: One of the best sandwiches i ever had. Tender beef and the meatballs, wow. Very down to earth owners.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Maurice M.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description:
Wooooow what an explosion of yumminess for my taste buds. I'm a native "munhallian" but haven't had the pleasure of eating at this magnificent jewel hidden in an alley of homestead. The lady who helped us said it was her family who makes the food and man you can absolutely tell this is home made eating! 

They let me sample almost everything and I was soooooo pleased I couldn't choose and got one of each. No joking, the best meatball sandwich Ive ever had! If you're in town and need a quick bite to eat with some homemade loving and great customer service this old school Italian shop is where to go! 

I don't know how red robin got its slogan Bc these sandwiches are "Yummmmmmmmmmmm!!""

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Kathleen P.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Best sandwiches, pasta, meatballs I ever had.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Daniel C.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Omg! You gotta try the sauce and meatballs! This is the real deal ! I'm Italian and always looking for good homemade Italian food, to bad I'm not from the area If not I'll have Nona cook everyday for me, a must place to go and fall in love with their food ! Definitely a 10!!  Grazie!

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Drew R.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Food and employees are great! Only reason keeping it from 5 stars is the limited high style only seating and it was uncomfortably hot inside. They should put a few standard height tables/chairs and a better air conditioner system. Even a window box or portable air conditioner would make it much more comfortable.

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Daniel B.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Family owned Authentic Italian sandwiches in a cool brick building that used to be a school. Italian Beef Sandwich with hot and sweet peppers and chocolate cake were excellent. Gina was super nice and accommodating! Very reasonable prices!

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Alec B.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description: Absolutely amazing. I highly recommend stopping by. A little bit hard to find (be sure to drive around to the rear of the building) but WOW the food was amazing!!!

eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.author: Jon C.
eLp6aAgRL-tWM2wjRdPQMw.description:
Positives - food is very good, atmosphere is great, people are kind.
Negative - the sandwich is too darn small.  I ate there at noon and it is 2:30 and I'm starving. They are bigger than a slider, but smaller than a real sandwich.  Maybe offer a "pick 2" lunch special?  Idk.  

But again, the food is good, just have to figure out the awkward portions.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Briana B.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description:
I was really impressed with this place! I found out about it through the Ritual app and I ordered 2 slices. I am PICKY when it comes to pizza having come from the eastern side of the state where we're spoiled with NY style. So when I say this pizza is good, it says something. 

The slices were HUGE and everything was perfect. The sauce was delicious and they weren't shy about the amount they put on. The cheese was also the perfect amount. Too much cheese on a pizza (I might be alone with this statement) is overwhelming.

Their fries were iffy. Tasted like they haven't changed the oil in a while or something. However, I don't expect top notch fries from a pizza place. 

I'll def be back!

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Erin H.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: Pretty quiet night except for a group of women screaming in the back.  Waitress was very nice.  Just grabbing a quick meal before a show.  They made zucchini parmigiana for us - came with a nice tossed salad.  Used to go there all the time when I worked downtown.   Hasn't changed.  Still delicious.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Robert R.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: great little place to eat.  we came in from out of town and just took a chance on this place and we hit the jackpot.  all of the food, pizza, sandwiches, garlic bread. tiramisu and zeppoles were great.  but the best was our waitress, miss karen.  what a hard worker and fantastic server.  she made our visit to feel right at home.  thanks miss karen.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Lori H.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: Well I read some of the previous reviews about having to wait in line. What that told me is this place must be good. It did not disappoint,  my husband and I split an antipasto salad which was large and delicious. We both had a slice of pizza and it was delicious- very large slices and very delicious. We both would recommend this little spot! Service was excellent too.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Pete L.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: The food is good, especially the pizza slices. Too bad, cuz they only serve you if you sit in a certain area, which fills up at lunch time. So if you go there from 11:30-2:00 for slices and the 6-8 seats at the bar are taken and you sit at a table, they won't serve you slices. It's completely ridiculous. They're always packed at lunch so don't expect to get slices unless it's to go or you show up at 11.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Nancy Y.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description:
This is a long overdue review. I stopped by here with some friends while at Anthrocon! I think there were a ton of people in the back room area however the dining room was pretty empty and quiet. No one greeted us, despite making eye contact with us, and we had to awkwardly seat ourselves before a woman came to our table with silverware and menus. She was nice and polite but the service was rather slow even though we were practically the only customers there. It was nice because it was quiet and had pretty lighting, but the dining area definitely wasn't very clean.

I ordered an Italian hoagie, which was good, but not anything spectacular or out of the ordinary. Prices weren't bad for the hoagies but the pizza slices were kinda pricey. So overall, the food was good but the service and cleanliness definitely could use some improvement.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Jerry J.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description:
My co-worker and I went to get lunch here, and I got fried foods, but she got a salad.  Her salad was old & the lettuce was discolored. When receiving the bill at the table, we said something about how the salad looked bad. The waitress said 'Ok, I'll let them know,' and that was it. No offer for a new one. No offer to remove/discount it. NOTHING.

When going to pay at the counter, we once again said something - and she completely overlooked it. Many other places around here to eat - ones that have the basics of Hospitality down.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Raymond D.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: If you would enjoy waiting 45 minutes for 1 slice of plain pizza at lunchtime then yeah this is your place.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Leah R.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: Good quality pizza with fantastic cheese. The atmosphere is home-ish. The service is fast and the food affordable. Pizza was definitely better than the spaghetti.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Kendel C.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: Family owned and operated and you feel like a close cousin as soon as you sit down! The pizza is authentic and delicious with toppings covering every inch. Even the salads and sides are exactly what you want out of this mom and pop shop! The waitresses and bartenders are funny and hardworking as well as genuinely nice people. I have no idea what all these stuck up, overworked business class curmudgeons in Pittsburgh are expecting! But, being away from home for an extended time found me back at the table everyday! Love this place!

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Katie W.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: I really believe that Villa is a hidden gem in downtown Pittsburgh. Without a doubt, some of the best pizza I've had in the area. Consistently good food, and great service. The sandwiches are enormous and always very good. I love Villa, very decently priced, and a great place to stop for lunch.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Theresa H.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: Delicious pizza. When we first walked in we had to ask if we should seat ourselves.  Two employees that were there never acknowledged us or initiated conversation. However, after being seated the server was very nice and the pizza was delicious. We are from Chicago and it's hard to find good pizza in any other city but this was definitely worth the stop in here.  Definitely recommend

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Karla D.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description:
Swung by for a quick lunch. I think this was only my second or third time here. 
Got an Italian hoagie that was ok. Just what you'd expect to get from any pizza/hoagie style shop.
I doubt I'll go back anytime soon only because there are so many other options downtown for this sort of fare.
Also for what I got I found it to be a bit expensive.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Jeremiah S.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: Best pizza downtown, arguably the entire city. Some menu items on the more expensive side but quality and quantity are king here.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Denis T.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: After many years of going to,and enjoying the pizza there ,that will never happen again. I ordered a pizza tonight and it was horrible. I called it in ,half sausage half plain. Easy right? Nope, got home to find all sausage and it was very obvious that the pizza had been sitting around for a while. Cold and dry. It was a leftover , I was the last customer of the night.Like I said I have been going there for years and know the product. I called to voice my displeasure and the woman that answered could have not cared less. Well another one bites the dust.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Dayton B.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: Traveling through town and looking for a descent restaurant to dine at. Welcomed to Villa with a rude server who was angry when our group of 12 came in 4 hours from closing. Was spoken to in a rude tone all night by the one server who was working. Food was ordered and sat in the cooking window for several minutes before having to ask if we could have our food. All vegetables on pizza were canned and watered down the pizza. Garlic bread was very burnt and when asked to remake was told "it was not that bad". Several issues with etiquette as we were constantly wondering if she was being serious. Personally enjoyed my salad and ravioli as portions are moderately large here. Calzone was huge and would feed 2 people well, although asked for a box and was never give one. Sounds like an average place for lunch, just be ready for a wait.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Lucretiz C.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description:
Still hating this place. Due to Villa Reale's proximity to my work locale I find myself dining here more often then I would like to admit. The latest disaster lunch was an Italian sausage. The sausage was flavorless and dry to the point of being mummified. 
I have little else to add about how worthless this location is and I do wish that it would cease to exist.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Margie M.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description: Traveling, not local. Stopped in due to recommendation from local. Food is decent, service horrible. Dominick the manager was a complete pompous jerk when I tried to speak with him about my concerns. Will not be back.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Joseph L.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description:
This is my favorite happy hour spot. The drinks and food are cheap and there's nothing trendy about this place which is awesome. 

You can always grab a table with colleagues and they sell pizza by the slice and it's so good. It has that New York pizza taste. 

The two women that work the bar are also great. They are quick and I honestly don't know how they manage to keep the place moving when it's busy.

cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.author: Emmin M.
cWsgD-u_TvTohsx6LSi9aQ.description:
This little pizza dive defines three stars. Pizza, hoagies, pop, some beer. Nothing to write home about but it gets the job done if you're hungry. 

Stopped here after pirate fest at the David L. Lawrence Convention Center for a quick bite and it did its job. 

Downside: The credit card machine was down so it was cash only and they just mopped the floor so it smelled like bleach.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Ted K.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Service excellent. Gumbo to start. Awesome!!
Wife had plank Salmon. Super.  I ha the chef specialty Salmon also great.  We will be back!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Christine T.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Glorified Long John Silver's. Sadly this once stand up dining experience  has hit the proverbial iceberg. I won't write poorly about the wait staff only because they know how bad this place is and they're just doing their job. The food is old and not fresh. I had the cup of clam chowder and it was fair, as was the sourdough bread, but honestly these items I'm sure were premade elsewhere. I had fresh oysters 3 of which I regret eating, thinking well the next one will be better. They ran the brine from them and were not cut properly from the shell. I had the beer battered (Sam Adam's) shrimp, same thing, the next one will be better, I ate 2. (This was the Long John Silver's I was referring to) and if anybody knows that experience it comes back around on you. So gross, wasn't even remotely sea worthy tasting. Such regret.

My husband had french fries and although those managed to be tasty, his stir fried vegetables were edible however tasteless. He is a vegetarian and there were not many options and he got burned and I feel bad I dragged my family there. My poor son just ordered a caesar salad, how can they screw up a salad? well they managed it. Sadly strewn about a dinner plate looking more like a garnish for a Christmas Ham, sliding off the plate with every fork stabbing attempt, mushy crouton mixed with hard over toasted ones. 

Just a sad day at Mitchell's, years ago it was a favorite.  Despite the manager comping the check, I let him know that we will never come back to this establishment again. Its simply overpriced delivering less than fast food quality. Honestly I'd rather eat at McDonald's. Close the doors you are not worthy of people's hard earned money.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Lauren G.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Came here because the menu had a lot of promise. I decided to eat at the bar. I ordered the Cabernet and ahi tuna from the happy hour special. While delicious, I thought the ahi tuna was small (super thin slices), even for a reduced price of $10. The Cabernet was a very excellent choice at $6. My biggest complaint (besides the price/portion) was the service. I felt like there was no attention made to me after I ordered my food. A prime example was that I had to ask for a water refill, after having it be empty for several minutes. And when I asked for the check, the bartender was a little snotty telling me it was already folded up in a glass near where I sat. I don't think I'll come back, even though the menu did seem to have good variety.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Rochelle H.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
So, my sister Luch and I received gift cards to this restaurant for Christmas.  We decided that we would go on a quiet Sunday afternoon and wrap ourselves up in a seafood cocoon.  The décor of the place is your basic upscale "seafood shanty" style.  Brass accents and hardwood floors, you know this type of place.

Since we had reservations, we were seated quickly.  My sister had never been to the restaurant before and I haven't been there in quite some time.  Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and very helpful in assisting us with making our selections.  When it comes to seafood, I'll eat almost anything and I wanted something yummy.  My sister, on the other hand is extremely picky.  Since we were starving, we both decided to order appetizers.  My sister ordered the "Spicy Crispy Shrimp" (Shrimp with creamy chili glaze, sticky rice and pickled cucumbers) and I ordered the "Maryland Style Crab Cake" served with roasted corn, tabasco mash remoulade and traditional tartar".  We also received a warm loaf of sourdough bread and butter.  Ahhhh, I love warm bread and butter. (I hate the fact that a lot of restaurants charge extra for this accompaniment, but I'm still a sucker for warm bread.)  The Spicy Crispy Shrimp were a gentler version of another restaurant's "Bang-Bang Shrimp" dish.  The sauce leaned more creamy than spicy and the tempura batter was a little thicker that I like, but it was a decent dish.  The Maryland Style Crab Cake on the other hand was entirely too salty.  I like crab cakes that are composed mainly of crab meat with just enough of a binder to hold the thing together.  The crab cake passed that test but failed on the seasoning test.  It was so salty that it actually distracted from the rest of my meal. Bleh!

For our entrees, my sister ordered Chili Glazed Salmon with asparagus and I ordered the dinner Prix Fixe meal with Lobster Bisque, Triple Shrimp and Banana Bread Pudding as my dessert. (I know that I ordered a lot of food, but didn't I say from the start that we were starving?)  My sister's salmon was perfectly cooked as well as the asparagus.  The tempura shrimp that were a part of my Triple Shrimp entrée, were light and not greasy. (That's why I don't usually order tempura shrimp)  Additionally, the bacon wrapped shrimp portion was also tasty.  My Triple Shrimp was served with a side of jambalaya rice and veggies.  Both were okay. (I'm a little spoiled when it comes to rice.  I like to see individual grains, but the dish had a good flavor.)

Overall, we were pleased with our meals (except the crabcake).  And if you order one of the Prix Fixe meals, you definitely can't go wrong.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Carrie C.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Mediocre food .  The atmosphere is nice and it is situated right on the river . Service was good .
Best thing we had were salads . The Calamari was tasty but portions were small for the price and it being a shareable item .

I have had better food at the Milwaukee location .

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Stacy M.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: We went to Mitchell's to try out their happy hour. The hostess that greeted us was amazing. She engaged in conversation and offered up recommendations. I work in customer service and would love to have an employee like her. Their menu seemed promising with great options and prices. When ordering, some of the happy hour food options were no longer offered. The food was sub par when we finally received it (we ordered several items). Our initial bartender Tay was obviously new (it took him a very long time to make drinks off the menu) but had a great personality and a great attitude. When our initial bartender left we had Kaley. She seemed to lack the social skills most bartenders have. Kaley was not engaging to the bar patrons without being engaged. We probably won't be returning to Mitchell's anytime soon

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Paul H.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Went here with a group of 6. Service was great and very fast. The menu has a little of everything and if you like seafood you will find something you want here. The atmosphere is great and the location is convenient to the Waterfront shops and entertainment either before or after dinner. The King Crab Legs were excellent and I also tried the crab dip and calamari appetizers. Both were excellent. Even the Chilean Sea Bass was great. I highly recommend this place.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: T G.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: No good. Unfortunately the food was not very good.  We should have realized since it was 6:00 pm and dead there was a reason.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Susan J.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: My husband and I just had a great meal here. The Chilean sea bass is extraordinary! Also, the vegetables were perfectly cooked and delicious. Our waiter was attentive. All in all, we had a wonderful experience dining here and we highly recommend this restaurant!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Brittanney S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
My boyfriend and I stopped in yesterday for an early dinner.
Our server Kaelee was very sweet and accommodating! We ordered cocktails, an appetizer, and the Prixe Fixe Menu out on the patio. The server poured my cocktail table side and it definitely added to the fresh appeal that Mitchell's has always aimed for! The service was quick and the staff was very friendly and inviting!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Krista M.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: My boyfriend and I went here for a nice dinner last night...I wanted to take him somewhere nice but not somewhere overly expensive. We both tried to crispy shrimp appetizer....delicious! Good portion too. For dinner we each got a steak, me the filet, him a ribeye. They were both cooked to perfection and reasonably priced for a good piece of meat! We got the lobster Mac n cheese as a side but I was too full and Brought it to my mom instead. She said it was delicious! I ordered banana bread pudding for dessert because I can't resist banana and it was a cute little single serving dessert that was yummy. I wish I had gotten our waitresses name because she wa great as well. Very nice and prompt and checked back often. Would love to go back soon!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Heather Z.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: First of all yelp still marks this place as McCormick and Schmidt. It is not and I'm glad. This place was amazing. I came here from out of town by myself. They made me feel very welcome and the service was fabulous, the drinks are great the food is amazing. The view of the water outside is so nice and relaxing. I can't recommend this place enough!!!!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Sirvasha E.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Wish I could give this meal zero stars. $200 for garbage. We were celebrating a special occasion. So we ordered multiple courses. The cocktails were literally the best thing we had. Started out with a half dozen raw oysters. They were disgusting and flavorless. Bacon wrapped bbq shrimp was a little better not much. The entrees were terrible as well my son had salmon. He said it was flavorless. But the kicker was $44 for the smallest portion ever of Alaskan King Crab Legs. They can't even serve with proper drawn butter. I ordered hollandaise for the asparagus and it was cold. Despite this we ordered dessert. We had the Sharkfin pie. It would have been good except it was freezer burned and the bottom layer was hard as a rock. This place is so awful. 
Service was ok. I guess there were guests at the booth in front of us that the staff knew so they were constantly hovering around that table with the hostess even sitting down with the guests during her shift. Even the manager was hovering around the table. That was pretty annoying. Red Lobster is better and cheaper. And when you have top notch options in the city like like Luke Wholeys, Merchant Oyster Co, and Muddy Waters no reason to waste money on this garbage.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Sherry M.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Mitchell's Fish Market in Homestead is my favorite fish restaurant in the area. At one time I knew the head chef, but he has since moved on.  I really like the food here, which keeps us coming back again and again.  I think that management needs improved in some areas, but that doesn't keep me from enjoying the food. 

On several occasions we have had new servers that really needed to have the senior server follow them until they are comfortable with service. The new servers get distracted or confused and it is not a good dining experience when you have to explain or worry about what the server has forgotten or will not deliver. Okay that's the negative, on to the good stuff.

We return because we love seafood, and the quality here is good. We belong to the resultant group and rewards program. I also receive points by making the reservation on Open Table. The gift cards and points from the restaurant group help absorb some of the cost. 
Mitchell's is a wonderful restaurant for special occasions as well as date night with a movie.We have come as a family or as a couple. 

Despite what some have commented on, the price is comparable to other seafood restaurants of this quality. Walking through the door of a restaurant like this, you should expect the higher price for the quality of what you receive. 

I like dining here and Highly Recommend.  I love the Salmon !

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Nate C.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Get your seafood fix after a long day of shopping. The food was delicious, highly recommend the cedar plank salmon.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Jessica D.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
I gave my mother options for restaurants for dinner - and she chose the chain.  I was bummed.

However!  I was pleasantly surprised with Mitchells!  I have been to a few seafood chains recently - and Mitchell's has by far been the best.  

I got the Ahi Tuna bowl and was so pleasantly surprised!  It was phenomenal - phenomenal enough that I would go back for it!  My mother loved her scallops and we both enjoyed our cups of Lobster Bisque.

Thank you Mitchell's for the pleasant surprise!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Phil G.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: My wife and I came for lunch . We were looking for a new restaurant we haven't tried. The atmosphere was quiet which we liked . Our server Kaelee recommended the cedar plank, which was great. The glaze really made the dish . Service , prices , and location were a plus for us today.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Roger W.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Went with the wife the other night for dinner. I was not impressed
I had fish and chips while the cod was very good the coating was greasy leaving my fingers looking like they needed an oil change.
Wife's shrimp was kind of bland with no  sauce at all on it. She needs to eat gluten-free. Any good chef worth his salt can make a sauce using arrowroot instead  of flour. But nothing was put on it.
Lobster bisque was a bit salty for my taste. And all fairness to server was
 good he offered to take it off the bill but I politely declined.
I don't think I would return

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: John P.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
I am in Pittsburgh for business.  I ordered the tilapia blackened style.  The fish was very good but was cooked in a lot of butter.  I don't mind butter because I am on a low carb diet.  However, if you are watching your fat intake you should be careful.  The fish was cooked well though and was quite tasty.

The issue that I had was the side of asparagus.  It was totally uncooked.  I like my asparagus to be firm but it was plain crunchy.  I should have sent it back but I was eating by myself and did not feel like making the meal take longer.

The service was good.  I ate at the bar and everyone was very friendly.  

The bottom line is the restaurant is pricy and the food should reflect that.  In this case, they came up short.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Bernadette U.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Came here for a family dinner and couldn't have had a better experience. Our waitress was very accommodating and attentive. My in-laws like to share entrees between them, so she had the kitchen split their order on their individual plates. She did the same for shared desserts. I had the shrimp and bay scallop pasta, which I feared would be a huge portion, but surprisingly it was totally Goldie Locks--just right! Several people raved about the crab cakes and holy f**ck the "sharkfin" pie was the BEST dessert I've had in years! 
Would definitely come back for another group dinner.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Jennifer C.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: The grilled scallops were moist and delicious. The sides were not over salted and tasty. The Mitchell salad was fresh and flavorful. I would dine at this restaurant again.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Colin H.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: We had such a pleasant experience for dinner on a Sunday evening. Our server, Brynn, was amazingly sweet and wonderfully interactive. She had a great understanding of the menu, answered all our questions and offered delicious suggestions. The Shanghai shrimp, salmon and scallops in a super tasty ginger soy sauce was a great choice and the homemade sharkfin pie was so yummy! A delightful atmosphere and a must visit.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Salvatore C.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: The food here is impeccable.  The seafood is always fresh and cooked perfectly. I eat here often and have always been impressed with the presentation, flavor and professional friendliness of the service. I highly recommend Mitchel's to anyone who enjoys top quality food in a comfortable, friendly environment

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Kimberly W.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Many years back, this restaurant was top-notch, but it has since gone way down hill! My husband and I went here recently and had TERRIBLE service - it took NEARLY AN HOUR to get our food! The table beside us was having a similar experience, too. When the food FINALLY arrived, it was mediocre, at best. The Mt. Lebanon location is MUCH better!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Nancy S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: I really liked the calamari and green bean appetizer. The house salad was decent, too. I had the lobster and tilapia dish for the main course. The tomato sauce on the fish was a little too salty. The mashed potato side was very delicious. The creme brûlée was no longer warm when served although the taste was okay.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Carrie N.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
We went to Mitchell's last weekend to celebrate my BFF's birthday.  She has been to Mitchells several times and speaks highly about it.  I have been there before but is has been several years and really didn't recall much.  But like my friend I love seafood so there was no objections there.

The menu isn't too big, which is good, and they allow you to choose sides vs giving you what they deem you should have with your meal.  Our waitress was very nice. We arrived a little after my friend, but waited about 15 minutes for her other friend and date to show.  Once settled in we all placed our orders.

I decided on a yellowfin tuna, prepared medium rare, and for the sides I requested a double order of asparagus.  We didn't wait too long for our 6 meals to arrive.  However, 3 out of 6 of those contained mistakes.  My BFF asked for coleslaw.  Not there.  Easy fix they brought it out.  My husband wanted fries, he got potatoes.  Ok so now he gets both for same price, so I guess another easy fix.  And then there was me.  They just straight up brought me someone else's food.  The waitress quickly grabbed it up after I said to the guy this isn't what I ordered.  There was rice on the plate, and I don't know what fish since it only sat in front of me for a few seconds before being snatched away.  I only waited a few minutes and she brought me my correct meal.

The yellowfin looked amazing.  Nice thick portion, and once I cut into it, it was beautifully cooked and seasoned well.  However, my "double" order of asparagus was FIVE spears.  Before the waitress left after bringing the correct order I said something to her about it.  That to which she said, "That is a double".  Hmmm.  So a single order is 2 and  1/2 pieces of asparagus right?  That's bunk.  My fellow diners felt sorry for me and offered up some of their veggies, very sweet of them.  Weird thing was, my friend's other friends date ordered asparagus as one of his sides and got 4 pieces.  So was it just me or maybe they need some help executing in the kitchen and in service.  Not to mention the meal was $32.00, and I just bought a bundle of asparagus for 1.88 at the Giant Eagle!  

So other than the mix-ups and the asparagus situation of 2016, I really enjoyed my meal and time at Mitchells.  The fish was as noted very tasty, but the price is reflective of a special occasion dinner option.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Janice L.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Will not return.  Our dinner took way too long to get and my Tuna was over cooked.  Had to send it back and wait a long time to get it.  They did take my dinner off the bill after I suggested it.  Very noisy.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Natalie M.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Going to make this quick. 2 stars only because the waitress was the only good part. Waited 45+ min to get our table we had reservations for, waited over an hour to get our food which then was missing a dinner because they ran out of "steak".  In that time, no one came to us to tell us they ran out of something and that someone wouldn't have a dinner when everyone was finally presented their dinners. (Mother's Day by the way) The people that got the filets were presented with a pitty poor excuse for a steak that should have cost $15 max. However, Our waitress was very polite and professional and luckily the manager decided to comp the bill. But whoever is running the kitchen an is in charge of orders, needs fired. This place has gone down hill SO much it's not even funny. Way too many major errors an I think it's time for an evaluation of staff. Used to love this place, but we won't be back. I'd go into the quality of the food, but at this point it's not even necessary. Get it together

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Ray K.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Excellence service and great food. Definitely will come back to try other seafood. Cook to perfection and great portion too

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Melissa A.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: We went before a concert, and the place was pretty empty--- which we found nice. Our server was new (commented it was his first day), but he seemed very well trained since he was so friendly and very attentive. I got oysters and lobster. My husband got the ribeye. Everything was perfect. We loved the quiet setting. We'll definitely be back.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Kim D.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
This is the place you should go if you like:

Management and wait staff who are rude to people with disabilities.

Managers who take no responsibility for their rude bartenders, poor service, and mediocre food quality.

Bar staff who are vocal about their disdain for large parties.

25 minute waits for drinks; 45 minute waits for salads; and 90 minute waits for mediocre, bland, and cold food.

Poorly staffed events.

Poor customer service. 

General incompetence.

Save your hard earned money and go to one of the many decent, moderately priced establishments in the area.  You'll get better service and food, and you'll still have some money in your pocket.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Lana L.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
After doing some chores at The Waterfront, we were hungry and decided to try Mitchell's for dinner. We were seated at a comfortable red booth. The clam chowder was perfect; definitely get it. The mussels were delicious--not as firm as mussels usually are (but in a good way) and bigger than normal. The spicy crispy shrimp surprised me; I didn't think it would be good, but it was. Boyfriend said his lobster bisque was "funky" and I agreed that it tasted weird, but it was still edible. 

The calamari, however, was unseasoned. Maybe they forgot to season it that night? I feel like the way it was served to us is not the way they usually serve it. Also, I was disappointed with the small portion of the calamari. For $12, we should be getting way more than we did. 

Our server was attentive and noticed that we liked a lot of their appetizers, so she informed us about their happy hour (Monday through Friday 4:30-6:30pm) where their appetizers are at most $7 each! Tempting, especially after our pleasant dinner experience.

Taste | 4
Atmosphere | 4
Presentation | 3.5
Service | 4
OVERALL | 4

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Rachel S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: I wasn't sure what to expect because of mixed reviews but their food was amazing! The service was on point! I will be making this my go to seafood restaurant. I am full and happy!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Eric T.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Save your money and eat better at Red Lobster. This was one my favorite seafood restaurant, although because of the price it has been 3 years since my previous visit. Our visit started with the hostess arguing with another member of the staff, they tried to keep it down but unsuccessfully. The food  menu is a one sided piece of paper with the drink menu on the back. My wife and I both wanted surf and turf, but that did not exist on their menu. We found something that sounded good and hoped for the best. The salmon lacked any flavor at all, the crab cakes had too much of whatever spice was in it and the asparagus was either undercooked or  old. The mashed potatoes were the only good food we ate of appetizers, salad, and main course. The only other pluyI can think of was our server. Next time I will spend way less and get more food that tastes good.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Hobbs M.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Horrible service and food. Host playing on phone and ignoring guest. restroom was out of soap. let the host know, no action. 

better seafood at Red Lobster

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Richard T.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
went on Wednesday for lobster and steak special.
Food and service very good as usual however restrooms while clean were very dated.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Stephen L.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
The food was overpriced and miserable. We paid $14 for five pieces of overcooked shrimp in the cocktail, and $11 for a musty tasting mussel Provencal with quite a few dead and utterly inedible mussels.  The fisherman's platter entree was at least edible, though the fries were generic (Think Ore Ida's).  The King Crab legs were cold, old, and skimpy for a $33 entree.  They were also bizarrely cut down the middle, perhaps as part of a nefarious ploy to fill the plate with more mediocrity.  All in all the seafood was consistently disappointing and only a few shades away from being actually poisonous.  The only saving grace is the excellent service and gorgeous patio which at least meant we could enjoy our loathsome meal in a pleasant atmosphere.  Maybe there's a reason millennials are letting places like this die.  

Side note: the hush puppies and smashed potatoes were actually quite nice which only makes the rest of the meal all the more pathetic in contrast.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Sammy B.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Great food The staff is super nice... Nice to meet up for a quick dinner/meetings with coworkers .. Great for happy hour Nice mature laid-back crowd... And date night is a must here... 
So check this place out my yelpers

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Elis H.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: 4 stars and a half! I ordered fried Calamari, lobster soup and a grilled salmon with mushrooms and bok choy in the side. Everything was very delicious. I recommend the lobster soup for those who like strong flavor (wine), there are some small pieces of lobsters inside, it's better eat with the bread they serve as courtesy. The server was very kind and attentive, I really like the service. The window view was wonderful and the price is fair for the quality of the food.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Randy F.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
I really had a taste for the Shanghai Trio......everything was meh, the sauce wasn't reduced so the rice was floating, the shrimp & scallops totally flavorless (yes, steamed or poached seafood can still have some flavor).....Such a disappointment

***Note:  Ask Landry's Select Club members how they wish to pay, never assume.....This will prevent any issues later

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Sharon L.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
I had a work dinner while
visiting Pittsburgh. We shared some apps- the calamari. Crab cakes and bacon wrapped shrimp and all were fantastic. I had the fresh Salmon entree prepared on a Cesar plank. Yum! Great service to.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Sandi K.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Had a 6pm reservation - no crowd - waited till 624 with no waitress/server to even take our drink order.. Left..... a shame since we love the food. Our Anniversary.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Thomas S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Came here to celebrate a family members birthday dinner. We had reserved the private party room which was a $300 order minimum, which with 10 people we easily met that. 

    The room was a tad chilly upon arrival but the waiter had the temp adjusted to correct it quickly. We had a guest arrive a little late, their was no one at the front to escort them back and they kind of walked around lost for a little.

    After some internal debate, I settled on the millionaire margarita to drink, didn't love it, but didn't hate it. I ordered the Sam Adams Battered Fish and Chips which came with coleslaw, hush puppies, and french fries. Everything came out really well and on time. 

    My girlfriends water glass never got refilled. 

    Overall though, I just wasn't impressed with the atmosphere, for a restaurant that is more pricey than elsewhere, I shouldn't have any gripes. I personally would not come back here if it was my choice.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Colin M.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Mitchell's is one of those restaurants that I never find to be disappointing but never have a pressing need to come back. Meals are hit or miss, albeit reasonably priced. Waitstaff is typically pretty good. But they just don't have the wow factor.

It's seafood that's better than Red Lobster, but it doesn't have much character. Like most seafood establishments in Pittsburgh, they do have a good Happy Hour but I'm never in the area that time of day.

The cod with lobster Oscar topping is a prime example. The bernaise sauce is not very good, and neither is the potato hash, but he fish itself is cooked well. Decent appetizers and a good wedge salad, so at a future visit I might stick to finger food.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Susan F.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Very expensive considering the food quality. Great view from the patio, but not enough to justify the price considering the mediocrity of the food. The selection seemed nice, but when the food came, it was only okay. I had the lobster and shrimp stuffed cod. The only spice that I could discern was salt. Hubby also  was not happy given he'd overpaid for fish and chips. Decent bottled beer selection, though. Service was minimal, so it bothered me to have to pay 20% on a $65 bill. The service was fine, nothing exceptional or bad, but because the bill was so high, it just annoyed my I had to pay $13 in tip.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Michelle K.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Met for lunch with high school friends
We enjoyed Mitchell's Fish Market.
Four of us arrived around 1:00 pm on a Tuesday and we were seated immediately.
Our server was really nice as she kept checking on when we were ready to order. We were excited and had not checked the menu due to the chatter. A couple of ordered the crab cakes with corn and broccoli. The crab cake was hot and delicious with not much filler. The corn tasted as if it was fire roasted. Yum.  One had the salmon and the other had a lobster. Everyone enjoyed their meals. The checks were out promptly and a manager out front actually spent time to take several pictures of our group. Great job.. We will return.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Jenna S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: It took forever to get a waitress but once she was assigned she was great.  The lobster bisque and bread were fantastic.  The bacon on the bacon wrapped shrimp was very undercooked but the shrimp were good

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Marcia F.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
wow .... what happened to this place????
yuk!
clean next to the booths near the window ... disgusting!

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Kristy A.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Mitchell's...what have you done?!  I have been to this location several times and always loved it (just never got around to writing a review).  The patio area is great when the weather is nice and I've historically loved the fish preparations.   This last trip, though, was a pretty steep slide downhill.  

First, I went to the bar and ordered a glass of the house pinot grigio...a generous poor from a bottle that was definitely a couple days past its prime.   You should know better.   

Then onto the table.  I'm pretty sure the hostess double sat the server who was supposed to take care of me, because she expressed her frustration right in the middle of the patio area.  I waiting a few minutes and then someone else ended up taking care of me.   The service was fine, but I was a little put off by the start.  What really got me though was the menu.  Mitchell's used to have a great menu and I've always been thrilled with my selections.  I don't know what changed, but it was something.  I ordered the crispy ginger salmon with stir fried vegetables.   The portion was ample, but the fish was sort of mushy and the crispy ginger topping wasn't crispy at all.  The veges were half overcooked and half undercooked.  

If I didn't include this last visit, I'd have given it 4.5 stars.  This last visit brought it down.   Here's hoping that whatever changed, changes back.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Chrissy B.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: I have been going to this restaurant for years. We never had a problem until recently. I do not know if they are under new ownership or what but their menu changed significantly. Their menu downsized and heir prices rose. The food was good but expensive

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Phil S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Was here with a few friends on 12-21 for an annual dinner tradition we've been keeping up with. 

If the kitchen had a manager, it was certainly not evident as the place was not even half full and we waited well over an hour for our food. Part of the wait was due them running out of entrees and the server coming out suggesting substitutions. 

I ordered the chicken which wasn't even made yet when the rest of the party was nearly done eating. The server offered to box it up but at that point I was no longer interested. 

While kitchen screw ups on such a light night is difficult to explain, how it was handled by the restaurant manager was even more inexplicable. 

It was good that my wife's meal was comped and I didn't need to pay for my coffee and the gumbo That came with the food I didn't get, but it is the  managers responsibility to come out to address issues like this with the customer. Doing so would have motivated me to come back another time , but instead the server was thrown under the bus to address and apologize for issues that were not her fault but that of  the kitchen. The manager never showed his or her face. 

Making this very point was that on the receipt under refund was "server error" when it was the kitchen screwing everything up. I brought this up to the server and assured her none that of what happened was her fault and gave her a ten for her troubles. 

The manager taking 5 minutes to come out and explain things and at least shaking our hands would have redeemed this evening but instead he or she hid in the back. It's a pity because now they lost customers over being discourteous.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Ken F.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Had another (yes I know we shouldn't have gone back) terrible experience.  Place looked like it was closed .... maybe because it should be (next controlled burn in the Waterfront) - service was painfully slow.  The oysters were below average.  The charbroiled oysters were terrible.  Took 30 minutes for our entree to come out after oysters and the filet was well done (ordered medium rare). When I asked to get my Landry points the waiter informed me Landry's sold this location a month ago and they are no longer part of their company ....... NO KIDDING - because this location is horrific.  Time to close this ship wreck.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Aaron K.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Once a month spot for me ,and it never fails. I recommend sitting in the bar for lunch. Raylee is awesome and is always on point.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Naomi B.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: I appreciate your apology, but haven't heard anything from your district manager. This was a business trip and we were really looking forward to an enjoyable meal.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Stacey K.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: Awful. I have gift cards and it's not worth the terrible experience that occurs every time I have eaten here. Food is subpar and the service is slow. It took an hour to get our lunch at 2pm. It was a simple fried fish sandwich & ahi tuna bowl. Extremely disappointed and do not recommend.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: NaTasha E.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Tried the cedar plank salmon which came with grilled zucchini and asparagus.  It was also topped with diced tomatoes and feta.  It was cooked to perfection and proved to be a very filling healthy meal.  I also really enjoyed their bread pudding.   Not too sweet and the perfect portion.  

This would have been a five star rating but the atmosphere of the restaurant was a bit lackluster. It was a Monday during football season but I was the only guest in the restaurant.  Generally this would make me think twice about staying at an establishment but I'm glad I stayed. I will try this place again.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Douglas W.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
This was my first time at this location.  I've frequented the Upper St Clair Galleria restaurant.  There's a lot to like about this Columbus OH based chain.  I don't usually eat at chain restaurants nor will I review them because they're typically big food corporate run places that don't care what they feed you they just care about their stockholders.  This place seems different to me.  The food quality and care seems to be very high.  

The staff is always well trained.  I like the decor and ambiance.  The menu offers many options.  I don't really like the fish preparation options very much and the portions can be small in some of the dishes but overall I am a fan.  I do really appreciate being able to buy fresh fish here.  I like to buy the trout and prepare it at home.  

We were here for a Thanksgiving meet-up event with 69 other people.  The room was a little small and it ended up being too loud too but the staff really pulled it off overall.  It's a tough thing to do.  It wasn't perfect for sure but the food was surprisingly good and came out hot and fresh.  Nicely done.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Whitley S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
A OK!

Really loved the bacon wrapped shrimp! So amazing with the sauce on the side. This was probably the the best part of the meal.  

I also had blacken salmon with a double order of spinach instead of a starch. The spinach was just steamed without any flavoring... Which is better in the long run,  but I wish they had options for sauteed with garlic. 

The service was great as well!  We were always taken care of.  

Will definitely bring my bf here in the future.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Jocee S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description:
Awful,

Gave it 2 stars cause the wait staff was nice.   Was there on a Saturday night.  It was warm in there (too uncomfortable to enjoy a meal) and was told by management that air conditioning unit was broken.  Can't you afford to pay extra on a weekend to have someone repair or replace the unit?  Not even a ceiling fan in sight.  

Same old menu with few options.  Ordered the tuna medium and came out rare.  They redid it but this time was way overcooked.  Ate it anyway.  Are the chefs so inexperienced that they can't tell when something is rare, medium, or well done?  

Anyway, haven't been there in years until now and I remember why I avoided this place.

3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.author: Barbara S.
3nR6JE3hD-D-Fhzr10_k7g.description: One of the worst dining experiences ever. - I ordered a Bloody Mary ($10) - the picture showed it with lots of yummy garnish - I got NONE - sent it back to be fixed meanwhile the waiter forgot my water so I'm thirsty.... they screwed up our salads (YES ... SALAD!!). I didn't even order one and all my husband wanted was his without the dates & pine nuts - waiter tells us the kitchen messed up - salads come FREEZING COLD and no dressing!  Meanwhile I had to remind him that I ordered lobster bisque - then he came back and said - you wanted the chowder, right !!!   NOOOOO Then steak is undercooked - the had to bring my 4th shrimp out separately because the forgot to make enough!!!  I ask for the manager ... tell him I typically don't complain but every part of the meal was messed up - he apologized and said "I'm going to take care of your bill" - they deducted $40 !?!?  We paid and YES I tipped the waiter a little cause I realize nobody's perfect - but unfortunately we will NEVER go back

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Anne B.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description:
Just what I've been looking for!
My favorite thing is the roasted veggie wrap.
Will write more when i try more!
I've tasted a few zoups. All very good. Just haven't branched out...

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Phil A.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: An outstanding selection of rotating soups with good sandwiches to match.  The salads are also worth a try and they have a lot of selection there.  I appreciate the clean crisp storefront and dining area.  Definitely worth a try over your normal lunch spot.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Tobias M.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: Yum, The food is amazing and the staff is friendly. Go here. Soups are the best, and they nail the sandwiches.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Denis T.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: Unfortunately it appears that Zoup has gone the way of so many fast food restaurants. That being the problem finding counter help that cares about customer service. I am a loyal customer actually on my fourth customer loyalty punch card to give an idea as to how often I go and get soup. Recently the experience with the counter help has deteriorated to the point where I'm probably not going back. The product is great obviously I think that given how many times I go there for lunch. But the people working at the counter are  simply rude and don't even attempt at trying to create a nice customer experience. One example being me asking for some extra chips the girl at the register didn't even lift her head to acknowledge my request nor did she even pass the request on to the other person assembling the order. Yes she heard me there's no question she just simply didn't care this is the third time in a row .I feel bad because I know the owners are very conscious of trying to create a nice lunch experience

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Arlene M.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description:
Zoup is a nice Panera style chain soup cafe. Unfortunately there are not enough around the city. This one is laid out differently but still follows the same pattern. Each day they have a menu of different soups. Some are on a daily basis. The staff is very friendly and willing to explain everything to you.

You can sample whatever soups they are offering that day before you make your purchase. You can pair it with either half a sandwich or half a salad and you get a roll to go with it. Drinks are machine style with free refills. What they neglected to tell me but I knew from a previous visit is that they have a rewards card where you get a stamp with each soup you buy.

Today's soup for me was clearly French onion. It lacked the cheese but made up for it in the flavor. It was very hearty. I paired it with an Asian chicken salad. Nothing out of the ordinary but descent. Free WiFi is available here. Keep in mind that this is not a bakery cafe so their desserts are extremely limited. They open at 11 am.

Zoup makes a nice alternative to a sit down or take out style lunch. This location is in the Fox Chapel strip mall. The one I visited in the summer was in Canonsburg, PA. I also learned today that their 3rd location is now open in Washington, PA.

I wish they were closer since they have a nice variety of soups. You can purchase it in different sizes. Prices vary accordingly. Expect to pay in the same vicinity of Panera Bread. It's definitely my go to place when I want soup and with the weather getting colder nothing beats a good hot bowl of it.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Ron K.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description:
I should have written this long ago as we order here regularly for work functions and honestly the experience is A+++ every time. It is a family run affair and the owner (Richard) is the nicest and most customer service driven person I have ever come across. He bends over backward for the customers and his team must also do the same based on the quality of food and service of the establishment as a whole. Richard seems to remember all of his customers as he can talk to them as if he knows them and remembers even small details shared from past conversations.

We order multiple sandwiches for each event and in all cases, the sandwiches are scrumptious and as fresh as can be. All of the sandwiches I have experienced have been tasty and mouthwatering and I wish would never end.

The "side" salads are bigger than any restaurant salad and honestly, are much fresher. It seems as if they must grow their own ingredients as they are so fresh and tasty.

Order the Lobster Bisque as well as it is out of this world as are the chocolate cookies!

If you are dining for one, doing take out or catering for a large group you can do no better than Zoup in Fox Chapel and your employees will love you for it. From management to the food and everything in between it is A+++

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: George M.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description:
The best soup I've had in the Burgh. Seriously awesome soup, soup options change every day.  Try mix of Fiery Enchilada and  chicken pot pie jalapeno peppers add spice to this awesome concoction!  

Lobster bisque, New England clam chowder, roadhouse sirloin awesome too.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Cydney P.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description:
*Visiting Pittsburgh*

Wanted some quick lunch with a friend one day, found this place. The picture of the mac and cheese soup got me in the door, but the lobster bisque made us stay. 

Not bad portion sizes for what you pay and you get a nice little hunk of bread. The soup had a good amount of meat in it, which is often lost in a lobster bisque. I just wish the bread was warm because, spreading the little square of butter on it was hard. 

Sampled the potato soup, yum and the spicy crab which I thought was just okay. 

Ultimately I'd come back again for the bisque and maybe a chance to get that mac and cheese soup. You can check what soup they have that day by going onto their website and typing in the location. They also have a stampcard for frequent visits. I live in Atlanta so I won't be able to use that, but it's a great spot for a filling, quick lunch!

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Don A.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description:
Soup was pretty decent. Had the lemon chicken basil. That said, I'd normally give 4 stars for delivering a decent product - 5 for wowing me. But I'm taking it down a peg for the bafflingly slow delivery. 

So you walk in this place and the line seems like a buffet line full of soups. Great just what I wanted for winter, a bowl of hotness and get me out of here. You'd think they'd pour you a bowl right there, pass it down to the cashier, ring you up, Bob's your uncle and you're on your merry way. Two man operation, three tops with the sandwich guy on the backboard. If you ordered a sandwich, wait a sec while the guy makes it. You'd already have your soup if you want to suck that down while you wait. 


Do they do that? Nope. The buffet style line isn't used at all, it's just like a display I guess.  For some reason there's like 8 people milling around and apparently getting in each other's way. Myself and probably 5 customers standing around waiting, probably annoying already seated folks with our forced hovering, as we stare at clearly done and ready to go orders that are sitting there on the backboard. 

What are they waiting for? A harried looking girl who is puzzling over putting the items together into orders, then bagging and tagging them. 

The temptation to reach in the well area to grab the rapidly cooling soups you know belong to you is really frustrating and as a Lean process analyst absolutely maddening. 

How you can complicate pouring a bowl of soup I'll never know, but honestly I was entertained by the floor show.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Nancy L. W.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: I've been here once, so this review is for one meal and an interaction with one employee. I loved it. I was greeted immediately upon entering the store. The employee then described the selections of soups and sandwiches. You can taste soups before buying, which is great. There were at least 8 to choose from. I had chicken pot pie soup, and a turkey sandwich. Delicious, however, I'm giving the place 4 stars, because it seems a bit pricey. My dinner was $12...a few bucks more than I feel it was worth, considering the portion sizes. Overall, tasty and worth returning to some time.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Hope B.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: Food was ok. We bought two cups of soup, two salads, and two drinks - came to $40 -_- very pricey for a soup place.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Jim S.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description:
I admit I wasn't all that excited about going to a soup and sandwich place and when we got there it was packed. Naturally I thought even less of being there. 
I chose to endure and I was very surprised how quickly the line moved. The staff was very friendly and offered to give us a test of anything thing we wanted. My daughter tried the tomato soup, I took a small taste. It was very good. I chose the Try two combo, a safe choice of turkey club and a cup of the chicken pot pie soup. Wow! Both items were fantastic! This place has moved on to my preferred list. The food and service is great even if you don't care much for soup. I'm sure you'll be happy with whatever you get.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Tyoko B.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: Honestly, you can't go wrong here. They let you sample as many soups as you want so you're sure to find something you like. Add your choice of roll and you've got a yummy lunch or dinner. In addition to soups, they have salads and sandwiches as well. One sandwich worthy of a shout out is their ham and cheese with maple. Sounds a bit odd to put maple mayo on anything but trust, it works.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Lizzy M.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: Yummy soup and sandwich. I went for lunch and got the combo. My only complaint is the price. It's a little expensive for basic meals.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: A B.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: Better value than Panera at the next plaza. I know it's a soup place, but I think the salads are just as good, if not better. My son asked for the Zoup chicken noodle soup as a birthday present! Now that is saying something. My husband at a close second, talked about the lobster bisque for three days after having a cup for lunch. Lucky to have the only one of this franchise in Pittsburgh so close to where we live.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Jen K.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: I finally tried this place because I work in the area and it's conveniently located. Hands down, it's waaaayyyy better than Panera (who has increased their prices and decreased their portions). There are no words for the lobster bisque. It's that good. The curried chicken salad sandwich was also phenomenal. I can't wait to try a salad the next time. Get the punch card, esp. if you intend to come here often. The employees were all incredibly friendly and I love that you can sample the soups. This is my new place for lunch. No question!

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Jon P.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: The food is delicious and the manager could not be more gracious.  I needed to transport soup in hot weather and the manager went out of his way to package it in ice!  The staff is pleasant, the restaurant is spotless and the food certainly fills a niche!

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Earl M.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: Delicious soups!  Innovative and unique flavorings that easily surpass other eateries of similar types.  Sandwiches and salads are also better than offerings at other places.  Friendly and efficient staff.

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Misty S.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: I love the food as much as the servise best place ever. Just wish i would remember to bring my punch card ugh

2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.author: Rachel H.
2KrRu2odf_53L90UQLKVvA.description: For a quick, convenient, healthy option, this is definitely 5 stars. The owner is fully engaged and excited to offer so many great soups!

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Girishma R.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: Good food. Ordered pizza, french fries and wings which are hot and good as for the first time order. We are enjoying hot food in bad rains and thunder special thanks to the delivery person and the restaurant.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Savannah K.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description:
A neighbor of mine recommended that I try out La Felice Pizza and Pasta, since it's so close to where we live. He said anytime he orders from here, they deliver it so fast, they always tell him it'll be at least 45 minutes but it usually arrives in 20-25 minutes. We had the same case scenario today, we ordered at 11:10 in the morning, they told us about 45 minutes, and the food arrived at 11:30. Very impressive and speedy service. 

Anytime I try a new pizza joint, I keep it simple and order things I know I already like before exploring the menu. I got my boyfriend an Italian sub, which he absolutely loved. He said is was toasted to perfection, and dripping in some oh-so-delicious Italian dressing. I also got a plain medium cheese pizza. My boyfriend loved it, I wasn't so sure how I liked it however, it wasn't bad, but the sauce wasn't wowing me, it was still enjoyable however. What really disappointed me was the last item I ordered, which was the fettuccine Alfredo. Anyone who knows me knows I LOVE pasta, especially a simple cheesy Alfredo. Don't get me wrong, I wanted to try all their pasta dishes, but I always stick with simple when trying somewhere new, because if the simple things aren't good, chances are the other menu items aren't. The Fettuccine Alfredo from La Felice was quite disappointing. The sauce was definitely artificial tasting, and not homemade. The fettuccine was very over cooked and was not al dentè whatsoever. The meal came with a side salad and a piece of garlic bread. The garlic bread was quite good, but the salad was kind of boring. The lettuce was definitely fresh, but it was cut so unevenly. I know I sound like a huge complainer, but the side salad was just odd to me, there was huge pieces of lettuce, and big slices of green pepper, onion, and two little cherry tomatoes. 
If I order from here again I'll try some other menu items, maybe they'll be decent, I just didn't care for what I ordered. Maybe next time I'll order a gyro, which my neighbor highly recommends.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Sabera R.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: It has become our favorite weeknight pizza place like seriously! I didn't know they served such amazing sandwiches as well I was skeptical and avoided ordering them for a long time only until recently, I was in a weird mood as ordered there chilling chicken sandwich and I absolutely love it!

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Cody K.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: I rarely give small businesses bad reviews even if I'm dissatisfied but In this case HERE I AM! If I could give a negative star I would. Most people  would've done more. I simply ordered food from a pizza shop and to my surprise my personal information was given away. I tried reaching out to them and was ignored. Therefore they're just grimey all around. Unless you like compromised personal info included in your delivery I'd say make a Tostino's before ordering from them.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Habibulloh A.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: I love the way they provide prices. And meals taste really good as well. Always friendly service and fast delivery time. One of the best places to eat at north hills.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Abbot Place T.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description:
I gave it to my dogs    See photos 

Worst pizza in my life.  Thin burnt pepperoni , smelly dark sausage 

Nobody at home liked this crap 

Spongy crust was nothing like Sicilian is supposed to be

I should have gone to Luciano's! Or Italian oven. Or even Pizza Hut

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Nicklas V.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: Someone recommended to try this place out because It was the best.  I think they need there taste buds checked, or to each there own I guess. I have to just add this into my category of another average Pittsburgh pizza shop. Nothing special. Wouldn't order again unless it was the only option.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Wade B.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: Close your eyes, and think of a pizza that isn't bad; but, isn't good. This is la Felice navidad Pizza. Don't get Boggs wrong the pizza wasn't bad but the more I thought about my night and how inebriated I was, the more I reconsidered what my taste buds were telling me. I wish I could give this place more stars, as they were extremely fast with the order. I don't know where they were getting their ingredients, but my guess is out of a box from the biggest chain store in the world (no free ads) instead of Italy. If it is almost midnight after some hippie concert or after a Stiller game where Big Ben and Jeff Reed plan to flirt with some women afterwards; then, get this pizza. If that isn't the case with how your night is going, don't.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Mike M.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: Got an XL pizza from here: half hawaiian and half pepperoni.  It was pretty big for the price and fed 3 people easily.  It's nothing crazy but it satisfied the cravings.  The best part was probably the pepperoni, it was those smaller ones that curl up when you cook them.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Kelly K.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: Always quick delivery and food is awesome! Go to order is the family deal, has a little bit of everything for a great price.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Ryan V.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: This restaurant uses unlawful, deceptive sales practices. They offer $10 off $20 on the cover of Clipper Magazine if you guy a gift certificate through an outside company. At no point during the purchase of the certificate is it disclosed that the offer is dine-in only. Then they refuse to offer delivery. I don't know who is running this place but they aren't Italian-American.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Katie G.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: My favorite pizza place. Love the pizza. Quick service and very friendly delivery drivers.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: John D.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: Placed pick up order on a Friday night. We had the cheese lovers pizza which includes five or so different cheeses as well as the chicken salad. The pizza was delicious, still piping hot once I had made it back home. The chicken salad was top notch as well. All the vegetables were fresh and crispy. Being from NY, I have high expectations when it comes to pizza and I am always skeptical when trying a new place. So glad we did.  The service was great too. Upon my arrival, a delivery driver who had just got back from a delivery greeted me in the parking lot and held the door open for me. These folks understand good customer service and quality food. We are truly excited to have discovered them and will definitely be back again soon. A big thanks to the other yelpers for their reviews as this is why we chose them to try out.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Waxdiva W.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description:
Here's a good rule to follow:  Buy pizza from a pizza establishment owned and run by Italians, not by middle easterns.  

Threw away 99% of what was purchased at LaFelice... a large pizza and calzone, neither of the overpriced items were representative of the usual pizza fare.  So, if you're expecting great pizza, please purchase from those who KNOW what pizza/calzones are!!

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Gina D.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: I don't feel like there's any heart in this place. Every time I order it amazes me how low quality the ingredients are. The steak hoagie is very bland. The gyros are also terrible unfortunately. I ordered a bacon pizza and there was barely any cheese or bacon. For $17.00 for a large bacon at-least make it decent. I got cheese fries and the fries were cold and stuck together and unsalted, the cheese was cold, as if it was in the fridge. Never ordering here again.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Kerry M.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: The 2 seafood pasta dishes aren't anything like the pics on the website. They show muscles, clams, big shrimp, scallops and linguini. All they come with are salad shrimp and imitation crab meat with penne pasta. No Thanks. Don't use images off the internet to advertise your food!! Especially if its not even in the same ballpark. If your proud of that crap then use images of YOUR food.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Shirley A.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description:
This is best Italian dinner delivery in North Hills. The food is delicious without a high price tag. I ordered Tuscany chicken pasta, just the right combination of chicken, artichoke hearts, my favorite, roast red peppers and spinach, another favorite, served over pasta with garlic butter!! 
Wow, Yes,  I ate the whole dinner and carved for more, check this out if your tired of pizza and wings for dinner, Oh they have that too on a hugh menu, the Tuscany chicken salad was awesome!

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Jim S.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: False Advertising!  Be warned that what you see on their website isn't necessary what you are going to get.  I ordered the Hot Sausage Sub.  On their website, they had an image of a big juicy sausage link.  When the sub came, it contained a handful of pizza topping crumbled sausage, and it was simply awful.

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Elizabeth L.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: Food is absolutely delicious!  Order here once/week..quality food, fast delivery, and delicious!  Prices are great for the quantity/quality of meals!!!  Will definitely continue to order!

2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.author: Brendan C.
2wU2cdWiKegJujTliMJx0w.description: Ordered a steak hoagie and hot wings. The hoagie was ok, but nothing you couldn't get at any other pizza place. The hot wings would have been really good as the hot sauce was great, but there was next to no sauce on the wings (see my pic). It looks like they took the wings out of the fryer, put them right into the to go container, and just used a squeeze bottle to drizzle tje sauce on. One wing was compmety sauceless. It isn't that hard to put the wings in a bowl and actually toss them in the sauce.  I won't be ordering from this place again.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Brady H.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: Not only is this the original Thai restaurant in PGH, it is by far the most consistent in terms of quality Thai food.  My wife and I have visited this place a number of times now and we love it!  The portions are what they should be, the atmosphere is quiet and very comfortable and the service is timely, friendly and professional.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Crystalann T.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
Mediocre.

I went for lunch and had the green curry with tofu. It was around $9 and included a spring roll and wonton soup. The soup portion was small but flavorful. It was served luke warm which gave me the impression that it wasn't fresh. The spring roll was bland but edible.

For spicy dishes you have your choice of spice level from 1 - 10. I chose a 6 for the green curry and it was spicier than I expected but not inedible. 

I've had better green curry at other places but this one was okay. 

The portion size is acceptable for lunch but I imagine that it's not enough food for someone with a big appetite. 

Decor isn't anything special. A quarter of the restaurant has big mirrors filling the walls. 

The table didn't look clean and it was sticky in some areas. 

Parking outside of the restaurant is free. 

It's a convenient location if you are shopping at the Waterworks Mall. 

The staff was courteous.

They accept major credit cards.

I wouldn't return here but I'm glad I finally got to check it out after passing by it so many times.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Jayme B.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
Stopped here with some friends before a movie. The place is pretty small and it's easy to miss when you're driving. I was greeted and seated right when I walked in.
