I had a Thai iced tea- it was pretty good.. a little sweeter than I normally like it, but it still was tasty. One of the things I liked about Thai Place is that their menu is extensive. They have ALOT of items on their menu, so there should be something for everyone. I tried the sweet and sour shrimp (steamed shrimp). They put their own Thai spin on the sweet and sour sauce. It was good and the portions were a good size. The service was good too; our waiter was very friendly.

I definitely would stop back because there were a few other things on the menu that I wanted to try.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Rachel W.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
3-4 star place based upon what you order. I had the Pad Thai and it was good. It was very different and more unique than what I am used to when ordering pad thai. It reminded me more of a sweet and spicy chili sauce as the base versus a peanut sauce. That being said it was still really good and I'd go back if I were craving that flavor combo again. However, my plus one had the panang curry and said it was some of the best they ever had. I have tried out quite a few Pittsburgh Thai restaurant where they would order the Panang curry and this one is their favorite. So I tried it as well. The vegetables were cooked perfectly, the chicken was very tender and the curry sauce was fully developed so I think a curry is your best bet here, or at least the panang for sure! 

The service was great as well. So overall it was a great first experience!

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Matt N.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
We were in the area and found this Thai restaurant near the Waterworks.  It was a Friday night around 830pm.  It wasn't busy at all.  We walked in and were greeted by the hostess which turned out to be our waiter.  He said we could choose any table that we liked and we did.  We both ordered water and looked over the menu.  We have been in a wide noodle type of mood so that's what we looked for.  I got the Pad Se Ew and my wife got the Spicy Rice Noodles.  We also ordered their Fresh Spring Rolls for an appetizer.

     The restaurant is nothing fancy just average decorations and furniture.  Our waiter was nice.  The menu wasn't too big either but it had what we were looking for.  It says they have a full bar and they do have a couple shelves of liquor but again nothing to fancy.
Our Rolls came within 5 minutes and I liked them.  My wife thought they needed to have more mint and green things in the rolls (LOL) but it's actually just how I like it.  Their peanut sauce was a little sweet and we heard another customer complain about it.  The hot Thai sauce that we asked for was really good and went well with our rolls.  

     Our food came out and there was a lot of food on the plate.  I asked for chicken and it was good.  The flavor was tasty and I asked for a spice level of 7 and I thought it was spicy.  My wife and I usually agree on spice levels and she didn't think it was spicy.  My dish had a lot of vegetables in it which was good but they put water chestnuts in there and I'm not a big fan of that.  There were a lot too which made me not enjoy my food as much.  Also the noodles were skinny and not as good as some other Thai places we have been too.  I think it was average not bad but not great.  For the price of the food and the amount that we got I was still happy.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Nena U.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
Recommended by my boyfriend.. we often drive past.  It's not a very big restaurant but cozy and clean.   The menu has a lot to offer - all of your thai favorite dishes can be found.  I enjoyed the corn fritters for an appetizer.  I got the chicken pad thai as my main dish. It wasn't spicy enough.. I ordered it as a 6 just to play it safe (1-10 spicy) but wished I went higher because I could have probably handled a 9.   The service was excellent.  The dish was good but definitely not my favorite.  
Thank you

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Jason F.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
I stopped by here a couple of Saturdays ago with my wife for lunch.  We were at the Waterworks Mall whenever we became hungry and so thought that the Thai Place would be the perfect lunch spot for us.  We arrived to the restaurant at around 11:30 to find the place completely empty.  That certainly didn't seem good but we reasoned that it was still early.  During the entirety of our meal only a single other table ended up walking in.  Anyways the inside of the Thai Place consists of an almost comically small bar where the cash register is and then a rather large dining room.  We were given our choice of seats and my wife chose a booth near the back of the restaurant.

For my lunch entree on this day I wasn't able to find anything interesting which I was familiar with on the lunch menu and so I ended up trying something different.  So I ordered the Khao Man Gai while my wife went with the pad Thai from the regular menu.  The menu described my Khao Man Gai as tender juicy chicken, fragrant ginger and garlic flavored rice, served with a light chili dipping sauce.  However my request for a spice level 10 meant that the dipping sauce would be quite spicy.   I have to admit that whenever my dish came to the table that I was quite disappointed with how it looked.  The chicken was cooked plain and was sitting next to a white looking rice and a chili dipping sauce.  My first bite of the chicken plain didn't really help the matter as I found it was somewhat boring.  However the next bite I dipped in the sauce and man was that spicy and flavorful!  I proceeded to dip the rest of the chicken into the sauce and enjoy every bite of it.  Once I had finished the chicken I planned on eating maybe a 1/4 to 1/2 of the rice like I usually do.  However that garlic and ginger flavor that was in it was nice and I ended up eating all of it.

The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  While I didn't really expect much from this restaurant and food, especially after I first saw it, the food ended up being sneaky good and I really enjoyed my lunch here.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Lindsay B.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
Delightful family style Thai food within walking distance of the Waterworks Mall. It's a little difficult to get to on foot-- although there are crosswalks close to the restaurant, there is no easy sidewalk path so you'll be wandering a bit through grass and rocks. Despite the slight inconvenience, however, the breadth of the menu and flavoring is an absolute delight. 

I ordered Mongolian beef (spice level 8 on a 0-10 scale) for around $14. As someone who enjoys spicy food a lot, a spice level of 8 was very mild. Next time I'll definitely order a spice level 10 to get a bit more kick. The dish was quite hefty-- I came home with leftovers for dinner the next night, so it's well worth the price! Despite being a beef dish, however, there was a large portion of mixed vegetables and a generous portion of sauce. It was a very well balanced dish, and I was super happy to give this restaurant a try!

The host was also the waiter, and seemed to be the main staff for the restaurant, which wasn't too busy at 7pm on a Saturday. He was very attentive and helpful. 

Will definitely go back!

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Heidi G.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: Not too bad. I had the chicken and broccoli as well as the Tom Yum Gai which I can never pass down at a Thai place the soup was pretty good. The Chicken and Broccoli could have been from any average "Chinese" place; nothing special; way too much undercooked broccoli for my own liking. The people however were fantastic!  I would go back just for the people!  I think the think with Thai restaurants is spice level. I got my meal to go. I asked for my spice level to be medium spicy..... I was expecting much more than I got and was disappointed. Each place is different and that is my fault; not theirs. The food was good; just not my favorite.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Travis H.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
I was at the hospital and decided on Thai for lunch.  I was not impressed and a little let down. 
I ordered the green Curry with chicken.  I asked the waiter what vegetables where in it and he really did not know and was reluctant to ask.  He said three times, "it's a good mix".  But I wanted to know what was in it.  I then asked if I could had Egg Plant added into it like many other Thai Restaurants have done and he told me that if I want egg plant I would have to order an egg plant dish. 

Half way through my meal my drink still had not arrived, he was apologetic but he walked past me a million times since my table was next to the kitchen door and water station. 

I order a spicy 5 out of 10 like normally but it seems to be about an 8 when trying to eat the curry.  At the end my bill never came although my CC was on the table waiting.  So I walked up to the register. 

The food was mediocre and the service left much to be desired.  Th from receptionist seemed friendly but never offered me a fortune cookie like all other guest. 

At the end I'm glad that their are other Thai restaurants in Pittsburgh like Nikki's Thai on the north side, Bangkok Balcony in Squirrel Hill and Thai Cottage in Regent Square.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Vivian S.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: The food was delicious- my family and I ordered Thai teas, Pad Thai, Pad Se Ew, and a curry I can't recall and it was really good however the service was weird and rude. The man who I believe is the owner or manager was very sweet however the two waitresses there were inattentive and rude which was odd considering we were the only people there.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Colin M.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
I've been coming here for years for lunch since I work up the road. They're quick, friendly and reasonably priced - which makes for a perfect workday lunch in my opinion. 

They recently added some new items to their menu including their version of Pho. Different than most versions I've had but it was absolutely fantastic. Nice spicy broth, thick rice noodles and large chunks of chicken. No jalapeños but it was plenty spicy and had a large portion size.

They also have one of the better Thai iced teas that I've tried in Pittsburgh.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Meghan B.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: Ordered take out a few times when I was visiting my friend who lives out this way. Most recently, we both ordered the lunch special with pad thai - one with chicken and one with tofu. The lunch deal came with a small portion of soup and a small veggie egg roll as well, which was awesome! I tried their wonton soup, which was super tasty and my friend loved her hot & sour soup. The egg roll was quite tasty as well! The pad thai was also really tasty and we were both given generous portions. I should also mention that pick up was a breeze- the staff was very friendly and it came out right on time AND they are open on Mondays, which is unlikely for a thai place, but also super convenient! Overall, I really enjoy this place & will most likely return again the next time I am out this way!

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Tiffany Y.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: 3.5 stars overall. This restaurant does not have many parking spaces outside. It does have adequate indoor seating, although the booths are not designed for overweight or obese customers. The staff are friendly. The Thai vegetable spring rolls came with a very mild dipping sauce. The green curry with chicken was not my favorite of all time but tasted good.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Iris D.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: This is a great Thai place to go to. My family and I love it. We recently went there and we all loved the food. They are very quick and nice. I will definitely be going back for more delicious food!

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Carrie C.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
Best Pad Tai with shrimp anywhere in Pittsburgh. The wonton soup is light and not too salty with the lightest wonton wrappers that melt in your mouth.
Delicious! The steamed dumplings are also a favorite!

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Adam M.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: This place is open on Monday on a regular basis... Yelp has it wrong. Lunches are priced in around $9 and the food is excellent. Probably the best hot and sour soup I've ever had and the Gang dong red curry that I ordered with tofu was very delicious the portions are adequate so that you feel satisfied and not overly stuffed which is perfect for lunch since I need to get back to work. I would recommend this place absolutely and will stop back again

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Michelle D.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: This was my first pho experience and I wasn't sure what to expect. The staff (family owned) was super nice and accommodating. I loved what I ordered - although I could have went spicier probably for my tastes. The bowl was so huge that I had leftovers to take home! Recommended for sure. I will be back.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Joshua L.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description:
I love trying new Thai places. The server was pleasant but the food was not impressive or exciting. It was pretty expensive for food that I could've prepared or even store bought. Got the sweet and sour tofu. No exciting flavor. Just bland. Corn fritters were good but that's about all.

$43 for an appetizer and two plates. I'll pass.

Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.author: Lindsey S.
Bj8SZok_fBDxzHYE4Z_0kA.description: Service was good, nice and friendly. Iced coffee was delicious and good price. I got pad see ew but the sauce was not anywhere as good as most places I go to. Good portion though, large amount.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Jay F.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: This place is great! Appears to be family owned and operated. They work really hard making good Chinese food really fast. I've read a few negative reviews and having ordered it for a year now I can say it's always been good. I keep coming back.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Lindsay W.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: This place is terrible. I ordered fried rice with chicken and sweet and sour shrimp. I received yellow rice, definitely not fried, and the only other ingredient in the rice was chunks of raw white onion. The sweet and sour shrimp came as overly battered and barely any shrimp compared to amount of breading. They served it with a side of duck sauce. It wasn't a composed dish and actually looked more like donuts when it arrived and I was super confused. Definitely will not make the mistake of ordering from here again.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Jonathan H.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description:
The place is freezing cold, like the same temperature inside as outside.  People working there were wearing a coat inside because I guess they just don't turn the heat on to lower their gas bill.

The glass on the front door is cracked.  The floor is dirty.  The "open" sign is being held up by packing tape.  The chairs are ripped.  Lots of shady people in neighborhood.

The eggroll and the General Tsos were fine, just your typical Chinese place food.  But something was off about the fried rice, the taste and the color were both just off a little.  Prices are low, but you get what you pay for.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Alicia M.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: The food was pretty flavorless if you ask me. Also who puts cabbage in low mein? Fast service but don't know if I will be returning.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Taylor D.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: I love this little hole in the wall! I was cautious as first due to their appearance, but when I tried their food I immediately loved it. It's high quality chinese food for a low price. Their service is quick and they cook the food to order. I highly recommend!

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Gage R.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: Never will order here again . Customer service awful. Food was cold. Chicken chow mein was about 90% onions/cabbage. Very disappointed. FYI: does not come with noodles.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Cherith C.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: The Vegetable lo mein and the dumplings are delicious and this place is a quick and easy pick up for anyone who's hankering for some good Chinese food to-go on the Northside! Orders are ready usually within 10-15 minutes and service is quick and efficient with some delicious dishes for a quick bite!

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Clayton H.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description:
Great place for reasonable take out.  Lovely family who own the business. We have been dining here for several years. Get the shrimp dishes. My wife loves the shrimp and Chinese vegetables. 

The north side gets a bad rap and the area around this place can be scary to out of towners.  Don't worry.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Adam P.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: Piping hot food and delicious.  Excellent price points.  This place greatly exceeds expectations.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Igancio H.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: This place is always great and the best American-Chinese in Pittsburgh.    However, although there is a small seating area, it's best for take out.   The people that work there are very nice and it seems to be a family owned business.   Also, as customers can see into the kitchen, it is very clean.   Love this place.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Jonathan D.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description:
Although I'm not a huge fan of Chinese food, I'll admit that China Taste is serving up some very yummy Chinese food on the North Side. Although the storefront is a bit drab, don't let that deter you from stopping in and picking up some food. On a recent rainy Saturday afternoon, my boyfriend and I made our way over to grab some food. We placed our order., paid and returned about 10 minutes later to pick up the grub.

I was in the mood for wonton soup and wasn't disappointed. Delicious, hot broth with a plentiful amount of wontons was promptly devoured. My boyfriend ordered two different beef and vegetable entrees, which were accompanied by white rice. I tasted some of his meal and agreed with him that it was very, very tasty.

China Taste was so good that we ended up stopping back later in the evening after we hit up the casino. I again ordered the wonton soup (although this time a whole quart). He ordered a quart of the chicken and broccoli. Again, super yummy.

Yep - the place is a whole in the wall, but the employees (the same were there both times) seemed pleasant. Plus, you cannot beat the price for what you get. It's redic cheap.

Stop in the next time you're in or near the North Side area.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Lucretiz C.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description:
I am taking away a star because they don't deliver. If China Taste delivered I could easily see myself eating from here weekly.  This is a hole in the wall in a seedy neighborhood but I just can't get enough.

The Chinese food is some of the best I've had.  Typically get the Hunan Shrimp or Schezwan shrimp with a side of pork fried rice. The shrimp are big and taste fresh not frozen . large and cooked perfectly and the veggies are always crisp and not soggy and over done. Also we've had the sweet and sour chicken and General Tso's chicken.  
Although the restaurant is tiny and a little run down the food is very good.
All the entrees I've ever had were served pipping hot. 

The restaurant is really nothing pretty and there are a total of 3 tables. The restaurant is tiny.  If you're passing through the Northside check this place out.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: A R.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: Followed the advice of my fellow yelpers, gave this place a shot, and I was not disappointed. My fiancé and I moved to the area a little less then two years ago and up until now, we have been unsuccessful in finding our neighborhood go-to spot when it comes to Chinese. This is it! It's inexpensive and tasty. Its not overly salty like some Chinese take out tends to be.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Heather A.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: I really enjoy China Taste, and if they delivered I'd give them 5 stars. They're quick, and a perfect spot for when you're craving American Chinese food. It's nothing fancy, and I wouldn't eat in store but it makes for a great take-out place.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Jack L.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description:
I work on the North Side and went for a walk to find something new for lunch.  I am quickly growing tired of Eco Bistro directly downstairs from my office at Allegheny Center.

At any rate, came across this place at the corner of Ohio and the onramp to 279.  The lunch special was inexpensive and grabbed a soda for about $6 in all.  I had the Kung Pao Chicken and it was prepared to order.  Tasty, cheap, fast.  I ate inside - there are only a handful of tables in this place and it's decently clean.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Amy S.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: I think the food was really, really, really good for the price. The appetizer we got, boiled dumplings, were especially yummy. The General Tso's chicken wasn't the best I've ever had but certainly wasn't bad at all. The egg roll was really good too. My mom picked up the food and she said it was kind of divey inside but that doesn't really matter to me. The food was great and it was quick, and cheap.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Will K.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: It's hard to find a GOOD Chinese place. This is a GOOD Chinese place! The prices are awesome and the food is spectacular! The crab rangoon are under $5 and will leave you completely full! This place is great for satisfying that late night Chinese food craving!

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Brian K.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description: Great Chinese food for a cheap price. Just checked this place out tonight as I live nearby, def will be going back again. As noted in other comments, no delivery is a bummer.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Serena T.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description:
Got take out from this place on the weekend.  Ordered kung pao chicken, steamed dumplings, and pork egg rolls.  I was really hungry so it hit the spot, but there wasn't that many chicken pieces in my kung pao chicken - a lot of peanuts (as expected) and a whole lot of celery and carrots (aka filler).  So I was a bit disappointed in that.  

The steam dumplings were good, especially when fresh and hot.  The egg roll was tasty as well - I didn't find it too oily.  Very affordable and a generous portion - I had the leftovers the next day.

O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.author: Ma T.
O5MzWfMWDeEwkzNVeKdCfg.description:
This place has the best beef lo mien I have tasted in Pittsburgh.  They cook to order so your food is fresh and isn't sitting out under a heat lamp.  My friend says the hot and sour soup here is the best she's tasted as well.  I like their pork egg roll but it is pretty different from others.  It is mainly vegetable (Cabbage I believe) and pork.  Their egg drop soup is pretty decent.

I can't say I am impressed with their other dishes.  I've had curry chicken, shrimp fried rice, chicken soup, shrimp egg roll.  They were definitely edible just no where near as flavorful as the beef lo mien.  The chicken soup was horrible.  It was bland and the noodles were lo mien noodles.  Fried rice were ok but I've had much much better at other places.  They have a huge menu though so it'll take some time to go through them.

The obvious bad thing about this place is it is in a ghetto neighborhood.    It is probably not worth making a trip out there but if you're in the neighborhood, I'd say give it a try.  They're cheap and they give you tons of food.  It is cook to order so wait time might be a little long.  You can call in and order as well.  Not everything on the menu is the best but they have a huge menu to choose from.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Michaela C.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
Chicken Grille is my go to spot when I want fried chicken in Oakland -- not the newer chicken spot down the street. 

Even with the name change (the restaurant used to be called Tenders), the food and prices have stayed consistent. 

My favorite thing to get here is 4 tenders, a side, and a sauce for ~$7. It's a generous portion, but for an extra dollar or two you can get 6 tenders and 2 sides. They also sell popcorn chicken by the pound which is great when you need something quick and cheap.

The best thing about this place is probably the fact that they also serve Colombian food. Their platanos are always cooked perfectly and they serve a variety of grilled chicken dishes as well. I hope they never close!

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Joseph J.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
Way better value than chikn and many of the other fried chicken places in the area. They have a decent selection, but I prefer the tender meal over the other options.

All of their food is very filling and reasonably priced.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Avi G.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: Extremely underrated spot, in the heart of campus. Try their home-style soy braised pork bowl. These set this place apart from the surrounding ones.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Ciera P.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: Good chicken spot at an affordable price. My boyfriend eats from here everyday. The breading is good, but the chicken is not well seasoned. Luckily all chicken comes with sauce on the side.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Zheng W.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: Fried pork and the free chili sauce are my favorite!

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Lily W.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
I came back here after having not the greatest experience with my first asian bento. I decided to come back and give it another try. I ordered the marinated beef, this time the bento was so much better! The portion of rice and sides was just right. Unlike last time, I finished the food so quickly and had a food coma. :p The sides were very average, but the marinated beef was delicious. 
The customer service was great, they were very friendly. Tenders take customers feedback seriously I can definitely tell from last time I came, my experience this time is much improved. I will have to come back and give it another try. They just started selling the asian bentos and I already heard their curry is phenomenal. That's what I'll try next time. I'm excited to see what they offer in the future.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Amanda G.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: This place is great.  They have kind of a weird variety of food (Cuban, Southeast Asian, and fried chicken), but all of it is delicious!  I bring my little brothers here and it is their favorite popcorn chicken spot.  I used to get the teriyaki, but then I tried their tepanyaki, and both are incredible.  Tepanyaki has more vegetables than teriyaki.  I've got a Cuban sandwich here, and it did need a little more mustard but was still very tasty.  If you get a curry or soup dish, I highly recommend you eat it there, otherwise you won't get very much broth in the to-go version.  Great food at even better prices.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Frank S.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: Still the Best Fried Chicken, Popcorn chicken. fast and Friendly staff. Please try this place you wont be disappointed.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Hiroyuki G.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: Fried wings are good. They fry twice so it is vey crispy Ann hot. I would like to try Japanese curry with katsu next time.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Adelina M.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
The four piece chicken meal was awesome. Yes the tenders are on the smaller size but they are fresh and lightly fried. The breading was on the spicy side but was really, really, really, good. The meal only came with one sauce but you can purchase more for a little extra. I got to try the fried pickles and an empanada, too. Yum. The empanada is spicy!! So be prepared for that. The pickles are good, not outstanding but still good. 

The meal came with a side, I picked the salad, which had lettuce, croutons, and cheese. Can't wait to go back.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Amanda J.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
While looking to try somewhere new for dinner in Oakland, I came across Tenders on Yelp.  A place that basically sells chicken tenders made a thousand ways?  Sure!

I ordered the Tenders Sub ($6.49).  It was fried chicken, iceberg lettuce, cheese, and their special sauce.  The chicken tenders were awesome with a lightly-fried breading.  Unfortunately, the lettuce was really yellow, which was a big turn off.  The other downside was that a tiny bottled juice was $2.50.  Considering that only the quality of the chicken was above that of a McDonalds, I was a little underwhelmed by the meal.

I would come back and order the tenders meal, but I am not rushing to get back.  They do accept credit.

*There does not appear to be air conditioning!  Be careful coming here on a hot day.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Lisa G.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
I had quite the lunch adventure today and this was where it ended. I was going to get tacos but that didn't work out. So decided I would try for a gyro. When I showed up to said gyro place I found Tender instead. There is a menu posted in the window so I took a look and thought I would try a sandwich. There is kind of 2 menues to this place. One is the chicken side and the other is the Cuban sandwich side. It almost feels like ordering off of a secret menu but it's not. 

Upon entering I found a few small tables set up and an ordering counter. I asked the girl what was good. She responded with what are you in the mood for and gave a bit of a list. I said a sandwich. Her response was the Cuban or the Bay Of Pigs if you like spicy. I said I like spicy let's go with the Bay Of Pigs and got a side of fries as well. 

It took ten min for my food to come out. While waiting I found out they are about a month old and have no pics tips or reviews on here so of course I was going to remedy that. The girl behind the counter brought me out my food and I have to say my sandwich was much larger then I had expected. I enjoyed the sandwich. The meats were flavorful and the cheese added a much needed contrast to the spice of the meats and the sauce.  I also enjoyed the fries. They were the generic store bought kind but they were fresh and crispy and not overly salted. 

I had also heard the girl at the counter say there was additional seating up stairs. So once I was done with my food I went up to check it out. Now I must say the stairs are a bit iffy so watch your step and be careful when you come down. That first step is larger then it looks. The upstairs space is nice. It even has a water dispenser and cups set up. Along with a table of condiments. Basically I wish I would have headed up stairs to eat but no big deal. I would love to come back and try something else. Maybe some tenders.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Jacob V.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: I've been a few times now and I've never been disappointed. The entrees come with a decent amount of food and the sauces aren't bad either. Keep it up!

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Matthew U.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
This place is surprisingly filling.  After much debate with coworkers where we should get food from, a yelp search and some stomach grumbling, we decided on this place.  None of use had heard of this place before, but sometimes that is a good thing such is the case for here.

After looking over the menu we each decided on our choices, I opted for the six piece meal that came with two sides and two sauces for no other reason than I was being greedy that day.  These are not your typical tenders, they are actually better if I may say so myself.  Longer than most tenders you come across when you go elsewhere.  I really think they should have called this place Strips...wait, that would sound bad and make this place sound like a whole different type of establishment than it is.  Breaded and seasoned perfectly and the right size to be able to dip all the way to the end, no need to tear them apart.  The sides were equally satisfying.  I decided, since I was being greedy, to get a double side of tater tots.  I am not sure what it is about tater tots, but I am obsessed with them.  That's why this place was surprisingly filling.  I only opted for the barbeque sauce for my dipping.  Each order also comes with you generic piece of Texas garlic toast.

Now, asides from parking, here is the downside.  If you are choosing to eat in, make sure you are only dining with one other person or alone.  The inside of this place is rather small, with only about three or four two seater tables for dining in.  Unless you plan on eating quickly, I suggest taking your food to go.**

**I just found out that there is an upstairs seating area, I was not aware of this, so if you want to dine in, head upstairs.  My bad.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Makenna M.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: An interesting mix of menu options but some of the best chicken tenders I've had! You can get a huge meal enough for two people for around $10 which is hard to beat!

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Laura M.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
I stopped by Tenders on Thurs. evening with CM for a quick dinner.  Having tried and enjoyed the Cuban sandwich at Black Bean, I was eager to try one of the Cuban dinners from this new establishment run by the same owners.

Seeing an unfamiliar dish listed as picadillo on the menu, I asked the woman working what it was, and she told me it was seasoned pork.  It sounded interesting to me, so I decided to order the meal version of it ($9.99), and CM went with the fried fish dinner ($9.99).  However, when the dish was brought to me, the meat turned out to be ground beef, which is the epitome of meats that I won't touch with a ten foot pole.  I told the woman who had taken my order, who brought our meals to us, that I don't eat beef, and she looked mortified.  I asked her if she could bring me some of the roast pork instead, and she eagerly did so free of charge.  I just wish she would have checked with me about picadillo being beef-based instead of pork-based, which would have prevented it from being wasted (CM tried it, but wasn't a fan, so that's unfortunately what happened).

Each of the meals came with rice and beans, fried plantains, and some kind of buttered toast, plus the entree that we'd ordered--a decent amount of food for the money.  The pork was of the pulled variety, and was okay, but parts of it were too fatty and dried out to eat, and I found it underseasoned.  (Not sure if the version I received is how it's typically served on a platter, since it was a last-minute substitution.)  The addition of some hot sauce helped to add some flavor.  I tried a bite of CM's fish, and thought it was better than the pork.  As for the sides, we both really enjoyed the toast. Incidentally, neither of us are huge fans of plantains (we don't like sweet foods as part of a meal--as opposed to for dessert), but we tried them, and they were good.  The rice and beans was nothing special--just a scoop of white rice with some black beans on top--and were also underseasoned, such that I added salt and pepper to them, which helped.

My favorite part of the meal, by far, was the fried cookie dough that we ordered for dessert ($3.99).  Having checked out the photos prior to coming, I saw photos of it and decided that I wanted to try it, and CM obliged, sharing it with me.  It consisted of three large balls about 4" in diameter, ideal for splitting between 2-3 people.  If you've never tried fried cookie dough before, like me, it's amazing!  It was fried long enough to produce a crispy exterior and a cooked rind, while the interior stayed delightfully warm and gooey.  Fried Oreos and candy bars are also available for dessert as well.

Overall, we were pleased with our quick dinner at Tenders.  While I found my meal somewhat inconsistent in quality, I suspect that if I ordered something else, such as the chicken or fish, or a sandwich, it would have been more consistent.  I'll have to visit another time for lunch to see if they can earn a fourth star--though I'm tempted to up the rating based on the fried cookie dough alone, which I may also be back for soon!  3.5 stars.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Erin B.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: Pretty terrible. I ordered the six piece tenders with hush puppies, fries, honey mustard and buffalo sauce. I received five tenders, no fries, and no sauce except mayonnaise. Because I ordered pickup, I did not realize the mistake until I was already home. I was charged $8 for a completely incorrect meal. Food was ok, I really wanted to like this place but unfortunately I will not be coming back.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: David R.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: Favorite cheap lunch place in Oakland.  Teryaki chicken and Havana wrap all the way home!

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Sharon W.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description:
I stopped by here a few days ago and tried their breaded wings and again tonight for their naked wings.

The hot buffalo sauce is pretty darn good, and it's about the closest thing to my hometown's version of hot wings, which I had missed a lot. It's a small little restaurant and easy to miss, but a must see if you want some good wings. Also, love the tator tots and garlic bread.

zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.author: Roger A.
zi6cB_bkswWPLD2k3IVtyg.description: Don't get a Cuban veggie wrap. It falls apart and is not very good. Probably would be difficult to do well, but this did not come close. Maduros were pretty good.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: William C.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description:
Great food amazing sandwich.  Super friendly staff
Number seven is number 1.  I drove here from Westmoreland county to get this sandwich.  Number 7 did not let me down

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Ryan F.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: My 2nd favorite steak sandwich in Pittsburgh. The two locations I went to were deliberately placed in populated areas that service many who work downtown. Nothing in terms of details, but I have always enjoyed their steak sandwiches. If you work downtown you won't go wrong! However; I wouldn't go too far out of your way as it isn't that unique of an experience. 7.2/10

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Nicole F.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: I love Peppi's, but the location in Point Breeze on Penn Ave needs some help. We went in for two mushroom cheese steaks last night. The cook made the sandwiches super fast, but the guy taking the orders and finishing the sandwiches disappeared for over 10 minutes. Sandwiches we're lined up for him to finish and when he came back, we had to ask if he was going to finish our sandwiches. He didn't wash his hands or put gloves on. We took the sandwiches, but won't go back to this location again.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Brayden A.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: I absolutely love peppi's, but this location is slowly letting me down. Found a humongous black hair in my cheese from the large man working the subs without a hair net. Extremely disgusted and disappointed I wasted  $10. Hope this changes immediately.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Mark M.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: Felt bad wanted to give them 1 star. This is only Peppi's by name! The quality of this location is more comparable to lunch lady food at elementary school! I'm most impressed on how they can make a steak sandwich taste like Yuk!!! .......YUK!!!!

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Theresa G.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description:
Hit The Strip today and Peppi's was a must! Lou and crew had things under control and turned out some great food!!
Our choice: steak n cheese and the cap and cheese. 
No matter the choice, can not go wrong!

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Drew M.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: Terrible. Drove 20 mins to check out this place. Walked in and cook started cussing and throwing things on the grill. Cashier got disgusted and didn't speak as he was taking someone else's order. Obviously they were both not happy about people coming Into eat. Pretty sad considering we where starving and from out or town. Don't recommended for anyone wasting their time. Too bad as I have heard the food is good.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Justin C.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: Worst subs I've ever eaten. No toppings, the very little bit of cheap lunch meat is a nice touch. Don't waste your time here. Had to add mayo for some flavor.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Kendra J.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: My parents and I needed a quick bite to eat for dinner. My father was convinced it was sketchy cause of the look, but I had a good feeling.  I was so glad I pushed to eat here.  Their food is so good.  The rolls they used for our cheesesteaks were soft and fresh tasting.  They made the cheesesteaks quick and the guys cooking gave great service. A couple's  order ahead of us had a slight switch up with who had mushrooms; they just made them new subs without any attitude. I asked to add pepper relish to mine which was not too spicy and had a great taste.  Since we got the meal deal, they all came with a fountain drink and fresh cut fries that were also delicious and at a great price.  They even had vinegar for on the fries. The building is an old fashioned diner, so it's a little cold in this frigid weather, but just expect to wear an extra layer while you're there and it's fine.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Tam L.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: I love this place the sandwiches there are out of this world!!! Prices are good great service always friendly I would recommend this place to everyone

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Soeren B.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: Was there 15 minutes before they close and did not get anything despite making a huge detour just to try. Just don't tell people you're open until 8 when you're not.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Danae N.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: I've been going here for years and the food has never disappointed. This is tasty hot sandwich shop. My husband and I usually go here when we don't feel like cooking but don't want go out to eat. The wings are good too, but my favorite is the fries.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Jen C.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: Lived near here for years and never stopped in. Having it for the first time tonight and it's delicious. I got the cheese steak with extra cheese only. Same for my daughter. My boyfriend got the #7/Roethlisberger, which he's had before, and it didn't disappoint yet again. We also got the Cajun fries; SO GOOD. This place looks like your good ol' old-school silver diner, and it is, but it's hoagies, sandwiches and salads. I'm so mad at myself for not trying this before. It's cheaper, but no less delicious, than my local pizza shop and it's no further of a drive. Give em a try!!

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: M. I.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description:
I went in yesterday and it was a disaster. Something has changed. they were playing VERY loud rap music, I walked in and there were a bunch of frozen meats on the grill, a couple people were waiting and no one looked at me let alone smiled. I waited at the cash resgister while very unwelcoming people acted busy. Then I overheard the grill guy go to a customer and say "We can't do this." What he was refering to was to put lettucce on her sandwich. He explained that the Health Department was there yesterday and until they get another tong, they cannot use their hands or the meat tong to put the lettuce on the sandwich. So while there was lettuce there in a little bin, they were not putting it on sandwiches. He grumbled more about the health inspection. I looked around and noticed it was filthy, the cutting board looked unclean and had traces of a bunch of sandwiches, the floors are dirty. 

Finally the cashier looked up at me and I ordered a coke and left. Never to return.

I am NOT talking about the Strip location. The one near Wilkinsburg in the old diner.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Meredith S.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: Highly recommend stopping into this local jaunt. Diner style, friendly and great authentic atmosphere. Go with an open mind and enjoy all the 'character'. We ordered 2 of the hot subs - best we have had in awhile. Giant loafs of delicious flavor. If you're looking for something 'local' this is the spot.  Maybe pricey for subs but for the size and taste well worth it.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Tim W.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description:
You know that old saying? "Opinions are like butt holes, everyone has one." Well it's defiantly true of Peppi's. Some people hate it. Some people love it. I am a part of the later group. Peppi's is a Pittsburgh institution that unlike Primanti's hasn't sold out yet. 

This location is in a old diner and is rather divey but, who cares? Their food is as great as ever. F.Y.I. There is a small parking lot in the back. On this particular visit we all got cheese steaks to go. My wife and I both got New Yorker's. (steak hoagie with provolone and American cheeses, grilled onions and bacon and we added mushrooms). Our daughter got a regular cheese steak. Ten minutes later we were on our way. After smelling our hoagies during the whole torturous ride home we destroyed them as soon as we hit the door!

They were just as good as ever! We all tried to eat just half but, the other half keep calling us so we put them out of their misery and eat the whole thing.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Barbara Y.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description:
My husband and I have eaten here twice when we were in a mood for a quick sandwich. We ordered cheese steak hoagies with fries on both visits.The fries are delicious, fried just right and not greasy. Today's fries contained a lot of little pieces which I just happen to love so that worked for me. Another diner might not like those little bits though. The sandwiches have great flavor with the fried onion crammed into an excellent bun. While we were eating a man came in to order an Italian hoagie. He said he had one from a fundraiser where they sold 2,000. It says something if a fundraiser hoagie garners a new customer. 

I would recommend this place only if you are not choosy about decor. This is a diner that may be an original from the 50's. The cooks are very friendly and welcoming, but the cash register clerk is not. Today I asked my husband if he was as friendly as the last time we were here. He laughed and said maybe even more. I can overlook that though. The food is worth a visit.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Katie M.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: The subs were wonderful, full of flavor and just fantastic.  Don't let this little "dive" fool you.  Go in!  The food is great!

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Lin X.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description:
I was at the east end co-op and this was the closet spot to get food. It's a small diner which looks exactly like those in movies. 

The fries we got was terrible. Probably because they were closing and we got what left. We were in the mood of fries, so we finished them anyway. I ordered their famous Roethlisburger and I really loved it. The minced spicy sausage made it so tasty (and greasy too)! To make myself less guilty for eating so much fat,  I made two meals out of one  sandwich.

I'll drop by again if I'm in the area.

5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.author: Daniel M.
5RVbdMA1oVz7GCOIwn1Z3Q.description: Just stopped in for my first time, and really enjoyed the food. I had a New Yorker which is basically a cheesesteak with bacon. Between that and my cajun fries, I couldn't finish my meal and I'm a big guy so you know the portions are decent-sized. The employees were friendly and it's a cool old-school diner.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Margaret R.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: My family are frequents to Bravo and they always go above and beyond our expectations. Our favorite dishes are the caprese salad, pecorino cheese dip, Bolognese, the warm berry cake, and their house made balsamic glaze is to die for! Wait staff is amazing and we always get refills before we even ask. I highly recommend this location, we have never had a bad experience!

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Rachel C.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
I definitely appreciate that they have gluten free pasta, but I was underwhelmed with my spaghetti bolognese and I don't think it was the GF pastas fault. Bravo used to be my JAM back in college. I actually preferred it over Olive Garden. I thought their dishes had more flavor and I liked the environment more. 

Now that I've frequented so many awesome local businesses over the years doing killer dishes, the place just feels different now. But when you're in the Galleria and have a screaming toddler in tow, this just works. 

So I just wish the bolognese would have had more flavor. It definitely lacked much of anything and I was definitely hungry shortly after I ate it because the meat portion wasn't very big either. Plus, no carrots in the bolognese? I thought that was part of the authentic dish? 

Service was also spotty. Our server didn't come back with our first drink order for a while. We had to ask for them actually. Then my husband needed a fork after we were served our main dishes, and the server said okay, then immediately went to the computer to put in an order. Maybe five minutes later I saw him out of the corner of my eye walk over to get a fork, but my husband had already gone to another table and grabbed his own fork at that point. Like I said, not great. 

I'd pick BRGR over this place at the Galleria any day.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Jenna W.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
The food itself is good, not anything very special, however it's the reason for 3 stars. I ordered the chicken parm. You get 2 large chicken pieces and a healthy helping of pasta. The chicken and noodles were cooked nicely, there was plenty of cheese covering the dish, and a good amount of flavor on the breading. The sauce was a bit too sweet for my taste, but it didn't ruin the dish. Caesar salad was also good and refreshing. 

The service on the other hand was disappointing. While our servers were very nice, and probably overwhelmed on a Friday night, there were a several things that hindered my experience. We had a private room for our party of 14, so I expected more attentive behavior. It took a while for our drinks to come, my friend's was the wrong one and we had to ask about my friend's beer 2 times before she told us they were out and another would have to be ordered. We also had to ask for bread to be brought to our table. The food took what felt like forever too. The manager did come in to give an update of our meals and apologize. Then came us trying to pay our check. I would estimate it look 15min for her to come back and swipe the card. Overall a good place for food with many menu options, but could use more employees to cover the Friday rush so it wasn't a 3hr process.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Eva R.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: Bravo's has been a staple in the Galleria as long as I can remember! They have an ample amount of seating and a menu offering classic italian dishes. They start you off with some delicious bread and dipping oil. That dipping oil is one of my favorite reasons for always coming back to Bravo's. I could eat gallons of that stuff. Their insalata della casa is their house salad and is my go to. It has a yummy parmesean dressing. I am a fan of their grilled salmon. Their pastas are good as well. Overall, a nice place to grab dinner in the Galleria!

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Bernie L.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: We usually go here on Sunday nights and sit at the bar.  Amanda is usually bar tending on Sunday, and she's the best.  She remembers our usual drinks, and is very knowledgeable about the menu.  If we have an issue she is right on it.  We love their new hot cheese dip.  The Mediterranean vegetable salad is really good.  Hubby had the shrimp scampi and ate every bite.  Warning: Never, ever, order the vegetable "meatballs."  They're gross and disgusting.  They should have asked a vegan chef to give them a recipe.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Robert M.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: Service was just ok . Had the fish and chips FYI only a Friday lent special, it was very good . I think something is wrong with there soda machine the last 3 trips the drinks have  tasted awful . I now will only order wine .Prices are a few dollar to high in my opinion and parking is a nightmare at certain times .

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Walt L.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
My friend and I have eaten four times recently at Bravo in the Galleria.
The food is very good, but the bar.... The bartenders are usually out of ginger beer, so no Italian Mules, which we both like. Then we ordered a rusty nail, but no drambuie! Who is in charge of the bar? Is this a systemic problem?

Walt Lemke, Ph.D.

Still no message or phone call following up the above.  Hmmmmmm

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Nikhil M.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
Wow! The place looks gorgeous from outside and it is quite pretty from the inside as well. Crowded on Father's Day - a 30 min wait to get a table . They have a lot of seating but the occasion called for a full house! Just amazing to see people enjoying with the parents! 
The drinks - the good old 'old fashioned' was nice and so was the lobster bisque soup . It just paired up really well with the hot bread . Like a lot of yelpers have mentioned - the bread with the dipping oil is good ! 
The food was a disappointment- just assumed that the Bravo Pasta( with mushrooms and chicken) would hit it out of the park- but it was only average but thank god for atleast average since the chicken Parmesan just did not make the cut :( little flavor to it - and I could get the same at any cheap Italian joint .
Desert- the seasonal which was a berry cake with vanilla ice cream. Well presented but just an average desert
One more thing - a fellow yelper mentioned to be careful with the cutlery - so we made sure that we checked everything before using it and ALAS - a dirty spoon came with the soup .
I'll still go again but only for the ambience and the nice restaurant decor

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Mike W.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
Just took my family to this horrible restaurant, 

Wow from the employees to the manager needs to be furloughed like the federal employees because they do not deserve to have their jobs!  

FOOD WAS HORRENDOUS!!!!!
Did you see my shine

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Brendan M.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: I just watched the expo grab a giant rubber band ball one of the salad prep staff was playing with, bounce it off the ground multiple times, roll it around on the counter, then walk over and pick up fresh basil, tear it, and place it into someone's food.... all without gloves or washing his hands.. hello you're on display in front of the entire restaurant

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Sam B.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
A simple dish of oil. A perforated loaf of herb crusted bread. An old-world style dish of spaghettini and Italian meatballs. The smells of amour and fresh linen. This is Bravo! This... this was my lunch.

My tastebuds were watering from the moment my eyes met the building exterior.

As my family entered the establishment, we were greeted by two lovely young ladies. One had a small zodiac tattoo behind her ear. We were seated by the windows overlooking the walkway terrace. 

My cousin ordered the shrimp scampi, my brother had the chicken parmesan, and I opted for the classic spaghettini and meatballs.

Regrettably, the scampi was served in a butter sauce that "lacked a distinct flavor". I also received reports from my sister that her portion was "not big".

Now, the spaghettini and meatballs. Apparently spaghettini is a shorter noodle with smaller diameter. The flavor of the tomato sauce was indulgent but not overpowering. The meatballs were certainly the star of the plate. A wonderful crust on the outside with a tender and flavorful interior. Had the portion been a bit bigger or the price a bit smaller, Bravo! would have a perfect plate on their hands.

The chicken parm was "good".

I feel strong in my evaluation of three stars. Main factors were portion consistency, overall taste, servers, aesthetic, and pricing. I would happily return to Bravo! with appropriate expectations.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Bruce T.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: This used to be one of the best Italian chain restaurants around.  However, it reportedly is under new ownership and the quality has suffered greatly. Portion size has decreased dramatically and overall quality is not up to prior standards. I will expand this review in the near future.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Mark W.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
Wonderful experience.

Our home kitchen has been under construction for three weeks.  I have ordered a plethora of carryout and delivery from all over the area.  I've had a lot of bad experiences.  Besides pizza, this was the first restaurant that got everything right.

Ordering carryout on their website was terrific.  Everything was easy and self explanatory.  I didn't have to change anything, however, if I wanted to add an extra something-something, or remove an ingredient, there were boxes to check to accomplish that task.

The food was fine.  It was well boxed and, most importantly, everything was there.

Everyone that I spoke with, inside of Bravo, was also very courteous.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Doranne C.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
My husband and I enjoyed an Easter lunch here on Sunday 16 April 2017. There were specials for Easter as well as the regular menu items. 
I had the special Easter frittata which was stuffed with Boursin cheese and served with a chopped salad. My hubby had a glazed pork chop, that was fall off the bone tender, with whipped potatoes and French green beans. This was accompanied by their herbed bread and dipping oil. Every bite was delicious. 
We love their Bellinis with peach nectar that are served  slightly frozen.
It was busy, but we had an attentive server.
We like the ambience, open kitchen, brick pizza oven, and outdoor seating. It's never too loud here. Some restaurants are so loud that you can't enjoy a conversation at your table. Not a problem here. 
I definitely recommend Bravo's. Bravo!

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Rose P.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: Friendly waitress, great food, they actually gave our grand daughter dough to play with while waiting, she made a horse out of the dough and they baked it too!!

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Robert U.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
A disappointment. 

I've been to many Bravo locations over the years and have liked them and their food. This location is let down by the service and the food. 

The wait staff is generally distracted, and more interested in interacting with each other than with the customers. 

The open-kitchen concept is fine with me, but it's way too loud. Sounds like they are dropping cookie sheets on the floor every 30 seconds.  I wet my pants every time they crash something.

Finally, the food is too inconsistent. Cheese is barely melted on the chicken parm, not golden at all. The entree salads are sometimes huge, and sometimes tiny. The greens are the cheap part, so don't skimp on the easy stuff in a $15 salad. It's just lack of attention to detail.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Gabriella H.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: I normally love eating at Bravo's, but tonight was awful. The night started with our waitress asking what we wanted to drink, she brought back regular water instead of sparkling. She then proceeded to place oil for bread on the table. About 15 minutes pass and we see other tables getting bread, but we have not received any and no one has asked for our order. After telling her we would like bread and SPARKLING water, she says 'yeah'. Like we just inconvenienced her greatly. Finally she takes our order and then brings our food. As soon as she places it and walks away, I comment that there is a hair in my moms food and for her not to eat it. We then tell the waitress and all she does is pick up the food and take it away. No apologies, no nothing. We then decide to just leave, so we go up to our waitress and she asks if we want another salmon dish. She clearly had NOT placed another order in  with the kitchen and just seemed to expect us to sit there and not have another meal. We then left and on our way out, we spoke to a manager. The manager was never informed that our food had a hair in it and gave us coupons. The best part is, the coupon is 10 dollars off when you spend 40 dollars. Utterly useless and terrible service.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Simone H.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
So given the waitstaff was short this day I will let slide the long wait.

However, the waitress didn't put my order in completely correctly when I asked to sub the type of pasta [I will live] and the spinach tasted unwashed that left a taste of iron in my mouth.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Daryl R.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description: Went to Bravo on New Year's Eve. We were seated at a nice table by the window up front so we thought. There was a party in a private room next to us and a very large party in a partitioned part of the dining room. Well Bravo limited their access to the dining room by blocking an entrance with tables. The only access for this party of 60 was through the private room and squeezing past our table. At first I was very cordial and cooperative. After we had to ask for several condiments and forgetting our soups it became a hassle. I was paying for my dinner just like the large party. Waitresses and busboys were squeezing around us by the tens. No less than 40 people crossed our paths. I was surprised the Fire Marshall would  approve the limited exit paths. The final straw was a hostess with extremely long hair down past her butt flinging past through the narrow access and her hair wishing though my pasta. We told her she needed to put her hair up...she replied that since she was a hostess and not a server...she wasn't required to comply with the same requirements as the servers. She then informed me " you will have to stand and move so another large party could get to their table". Not a please will you stand so we may seat? More of a move your ass. Food was just edible...I know it's a chain so I didn't expect much. The Shrimp Alfredo was lacking all flavor. Again I realize they were busy that night but you need to service people to keep up with standards. Do yourself a favor...drive past Bravo and try Armstrong's, Pasta Too or Dellalos when you have a hankering for Italian Food. I guarantee a much better quality of dinner and much friendlier, attentive service.

P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.author: Alice D.
P034NqfS_1sf-pC51170Kg.description:
Dirty dishes. Dirty glasses. 
Bread plates had food encrusted on them. I showed it to the waitress and she brought clean ones. But then gave us 2 wine glasses that were so grimey that the bottoms stuck to the tablecloth. I could actually see someone's lipstick on my glass. They were filthy. GROSS!  When we pointed out how dirty our wine glasses were to our waitress she said, " I will have to talk to the kitchen about changing the water in the dishwasher."  WHAT? !  Does that mean they reuse the water in the dishwasher?! That's disgusting. She brought new wine glasses that were pristine clean. But..... having to inspect all my dishes and glasses before I touch them is not what I consider to be a pleasant dining experience. This place obviously has poor cleanliness standards. I do not recommend going there. There was no apology for the filth. In fact,  the waitress didn't seem one bit surprised that our dishes and our glasses were filthy.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Frank S.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: I've been getting slices from here for years. You can't beat the value of $3 slices. The staff is friendly too and they're usually pretty quick

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Jessica D.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: Solid pizza- good cheese to sauce ratio. Pretty standard, although I will say I tend to prefer Dominos because I love a white sauce however this will probably become a staple as it will deliver and Dominos will not.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Matt E.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: New York style I've never seen before. Doughy, undercooked, tiny pieces. 2 stars for delivering quickly but the pizza is way below par. Don't put New York pizza on your menu and deliver domino quality. Wings aren't cooked. Beware.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Sarah M.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description:
I first ate here in January. Ordered two single slices, which were mediocre at best. Sauce tasted a little off and the crust was bland. 
Then, just last month, i was craving pizza, and decided to give them another chance. I ordered delivery, and it took a decent amount of time (for living so close to their store.) The food itself was nothing special. Once again, the pizza, a mini traditional with weird-tasting sauce and bland crust, was subpar. I also ordered mozzarella sticks, which were very hard and not worth the struggle to chew, as well as the blandest frozen french fries. Just not worth the money imo

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Nicklas V.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: Ordered a couple slices of pizza and a half of an Italian hoagie. The pizza was ready momentarily because it was lunch time and it was wasn't bad. I sat and waited for the hoagie for over 20 minutes and I only had 30 for lunch. Went to ask the girl about my hoagie and she went to check on it and everyone kinda looked around clueless. She then came over and said they'll put it in the oven now they forgot. There was only about 4 people in the store. I asked for a refund on the hoagie and she gave it and I left. Another side note they had menus there with another companies name on them and she said that the company messed up so they got them for free. I wasn't impressed at all and won't return. Luckily this place is not related whatsoever to the Milanos pizza I grew up with.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: DJ J.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description:
Have stopped by a couple of times for a couple of slices.  The place is usually busy especially around the lunch hour.  The people are friendly, especially the poor cook that has so many pies in the oven.  Noticed his shirt had two Milano's locations, one in Allison Park so I guess there is at least one other location. The sign on front says Milano's pizzeria.  
Have always been happy with my slices of pizza.  A medium crust with a decent sauce.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Gökhan A.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: They have a really good NY style thin crust pizza. The place is clean and has a nice atmosphere

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Sarah A.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: This place has an amazing pizza , they call it new york style thin crust . i stopped by at lunch time huge selection of pizza by the slice you can pick whatever you want buffalo chicken , spinach feta , white pizza slices bbq slices its amazing for that price its not bad also pizza was above average I really like it. Thanks guys I will go back there again.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Eric C.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: Pizza was excellent my father has been in the hospital for 4 months now and he was craving pizza we ordered and they delivered a good product quickly

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Haley R.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE. I ordered a Medium pizza with 2 sides of ranch which were $1 for each cup. I was told 35-40 minutes and I did not receive my order until an hour later. The pizza was ice cold and I did not get the two ranch cups that I ordered and was charged for. The delivery driver told me to call the store, when I spoke to management they said they could not give just a partial refund for the ranch cups. So when I asked for the full refund I was told I was have to come and bring the pizza back. I never once got an apology for my order being wrong or being late and cold. Although the pizza was decent I will not be a returning customer.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Joe M.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: I would like first start this off saying that If I could rate this awful establishment below 0, I would. I have never had such an awful experience with any type of restaurant as I had with this one. We ordered a pizza, 2 dozen wings, cheesy bread, and 2 drinks and it took an hour longer they said to get here. When it finally got here the pizza was cold, the wings were not cooked at all, and our drinks were nowhere to be found. I then proceeded to call and complain and they said they would refund me for the wings which I said I was fine with. An hour later I received a call from a driver saying he was outside waiting for the wings. I had no idea what he was talking about. He said he had come to pick up the wings that were not cooked and that they had told me to return the wings. I then called the manager of this disgusting pizza place and he proceeded to yell at saying I was wrong and should have kept the wings to return them if I wanted my refund. Aaron, the manager, was extremely rude and obnoxious, yelling at me the whole time saying that I should have kept the wings when I had thrown them out because they were inedible and downright disgusting. He proceeded to yell at me on the phone saying I would not get my refund and then hung up on me. I understand that mistakes are sometimes made in the kitchen, but the extremely rude attitude of the driver and the manager was out of this world and I still cannot believe what happened. Never order from this place unless you want awful service and food that makes you want to vomit.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Cayla T.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: They do pizza by the slice here! I've tried their pepperoni pizza, white pizza and cheese pizza and it's all good pizza for a good price. The location is a small restaurant with enough seating for a good number of people, but I usually have it delivered. If you're just looking for good pizza, then try this place.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Mara K.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description:
I've been getting pizza from here for many, many years.  My office at Pitt has been a long supporter of Milano's by purchasing 100s of pizzas for student events for some time.  

I went in with two colleagues on this occasion and a GroupOn towards our order.  We had the Hawaiian Pizza, pepperoni roll, an order of bread sticks, and drinks all for $27 ($2 cash with the $25 GroupOn).  It was very busy with many folks buying slices for take out but we got our large order in less than 15 minutes.  The pizza was absolutely delicious.  Actually, everything was delicious.  

Milano's is a fantastic college campus pizza place that is frequented also by the many people who work in Oakland.  There is not a lot of seating but there is a spot in the back that would likely fit a group of 10.  So come in to eat or grab takeout, this is a solid pizza place.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Sheena M.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description:
Excellent food and customer service! The reviews stating that the owners here were involved in an altercation with a customer are wrong - that is Pizza Milano downtown, a totally different shop. 

Original Milanos in Oakland is amazing!! Hands down the best pizza on the Pitt campus and has been for 15 years!!

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Emilio S.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: Was in Pittsburgh for some personal reasons, and we were starving and had been eating some pretty bad food and was craving pizza. Being from New York we wasn't expecting much but this place was amazing. Tasted like New York pizza and Michael and Juan were super inviting and make a killer pie. The calzones look legit too! We will def be back during our stay for sure!

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Aaron M.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: Pizza came way late, which seems to happen every time I've ever ordered from them - this time, it took 2+ hours for delivery. Seems to be a recurring theme each time I order from these guys. Pizza is quite good, but terrible service and delivery times.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: James A.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description:
OVER AN HOUR AND A HALF FOR A PIZZA AND SALAD TO BE DELIVERED ON A MONDAY NIGHT and then to have the delivery guy never show up. Requested a refund and thankfully the EatStreet app has amazing customer service, unlike these bums.

Ordered at 640, finally decided enough was enough and cancelled at 820. I love supporting local businesses versus chains but for the love of God pizza hut has a 30 minute order to door wait time right now!


no pens games, no apologies, just "he's on his way".




It's my own fault for being lazy and ordering pizza and expecting a restaurant to provide decent food within the provided timeframe. I mean, the delivery guy did have to drive all the way to children's hospital from the hill district. That's a tough one and a half mile stretch of road.



Never again.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Kelly S.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: I ordered my pizza at 6:32 PM on a Tuesday night. I understand that traffic in Pittsburgh can suck, but it is 8:25pm. My driver literally just pulled up. 2 HOURS for cold pizza. At least he was nice and appologetic. I can't comment on the taste because it is in the oven now, unfortunately.

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Ryan T.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: Dont get all the good reviews. Must be drunk college kids. The cheese on the pizza was super greesy and kept sliding off, and the hoagies were soggy. My girlfriend said she would give it 0 stars if she could. Had a Groupon and still wasnt worth it

0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.author: Jason S.
0fkjHTNaMCT4FjZqaa4euA.description: I love the food here. Hands down my favorite pizza place in Oakland. There sandwiches are also really good. The prices are right around what you expect in the area. Only downside, place can get crazy busy during lunch time and creates a delay getting your food.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Frank S.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: Ive never eaten at the restaurant. Ive only had takeout. this place is the best. Food is ALWAYS early and always Hot and fresh. I will go in to dine and express how awesome they are. Eat here asap.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Sherry M.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description:
Fast order online ! Fast delivery as well ! Hot and ready to eat ! I can't say enough about how pleased I was to get this order with no issues what so ever and a very friendly delivery person also ! 
I asked for the white sauce and revived it. Very tasty 
Hot white rice and chicken fried rice ! 
Shrimp egg roll and spring rolls !!! 
Highly recommend!! 
Will defiantly order again

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Chris S.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: Not saying this is fancy or authentic by any means...but it's solid, reliable, delicious "Americanized" Chinese food. Portions are very generous. I've only gotten takeout / never eaten inside...but food has always been ready on time and very fresh & hot. They once screwed up my soup and and offered me the correct one (which I still haven't picked up yet) so that's pretty decent. I recommend.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Tyra J.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: I ordered the General Tso's lunch special and the meal was good until I tried the wonton soup! Absolutely disgusting and the actual wontons were extremely gummy! Might order the chicken again but never a meal.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Elizabeth J.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description:
I figured that this is important to know, so if you read any review let it be this one: according to GrubHub I've ordered from here 6 times. This was my go to chinese restaurant. 

My most recent order I found bone chips/gristle or something white and unchewable in my dumplings. I dissected the remaining dumplings and found it in 3 of them. I want to point out that this is the SECOND TIME I've had this happen. The first time it was in my very last dumpling and I thought it was a one time thing. 

Overall the food tastes average with an above average amount of grease. I've had a few different things and saucy dishes like sesame chicken are sticky, and their beef has a very soft chewy texture. I no longer trust this restaurant and question what kind of shortcuts they must be taking to "consistently" (for lack of a better word) end up with crud in their dumplings.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Ned S.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description:
Somehow I ended there by mistake 
Best mistake this year 
Clean fresh veggie, great hot mn sour soup. Egg roll made with care
    I am a fan

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Katy S.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: I've lost count how many times we have ordered from here. They are fast, friendly, and provide good takeout food. Our go to is the sweet & sour chicken and veggie lo mein.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Eduardo C.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: I placed a pick up order for chicken and broccoli dinner special over the phone. The lady was very polite and pleasant. The food was prepared fast and it was tasty. Would recommend for fast food.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Matt L.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: This is my go-to Chinese retaurant.  I love it  My typical dish is the Sesame Chicken.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Keeka K.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: The food is mediocre but the prices are cheap and delivery isn't the worst (it was under an hour for 3 miles away and friendly service). I had the Szechuan and Kung Pao, and both dishes were identical (battered fried chicken in a sesame-like sauce, the sesame had sesame seeds on top). The egg rolls are huge and you get soup with every entree, and the food was on par with Panda Express with more generous portion sizes, so I'm a fan.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: molly r.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: I am surprised that China Star only has three stars for its rating! It's our favorite inexpensive Chinese food place near Central Pittsburgh. I do mainly judge a Chinese place by their hot and sour soup, and theirs is terrific. But their chicken and eggplant is also great and we generally find that we enjoy other things we get. Plus, delivery is always friendly and convenient.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Jack C.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description: This place is actual gutter trash. Bone chips in my chicken lo mein, and the steamed dumplings are just an uncooked jimmy dean breakfast sausage jammed into an inch-thick, gummy dumpling wrap.

gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.author: Carla P.
gDQlaDRAjsCx2p_p6oJLjw.description:
