2To5KDQepjSUpdA5oPPRog.description: Pizza is whatever, girl proceeded to use her bare hands without washing them to prepare the slice, crust was soggy on bottom, looked around for the restaurant grade and it was nowhere to be found  Improve the pizza quality and have employees wear food preparation gloves and I'll be back!

2To5KDQepjSUpdA5oPPRog.author: Todd M.
2To5KDQepjSUpdA5oPPRog.description: I watched the pizza shop zip through a rush without breaking a sweat. They were courteous and attentive. The pizza was deliciouse and exactly what i was craving. I will return frequently.

2To5KDQepjSUpdA5oPPRog.author: Sarah K.
2To5KDQepjSUpdA5oPPRog.description:
This place is quality!

... in that it has an indistinguishable quality that, I think, is what makes it bad. It wasn't horrible, just mediocre, but had some sort of ingredient or something that made us stop and think, "hm, no."

Also, I think that mysterious quality was what gave me the overwhelming urge to wear stretchy pants and try not to vom. 

I'm sorry Cestone's! I wanted to like you, you sell pizza by the slice and you're close to my house, but it's just not going to work out.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Nakia C.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: Interesting menu. I got the pulled pork quesadilla. Was blown away by the portion size (I only ate 1.5 of the quartered slices). Didn't love that it was BBQ pork since I was in the mood for Mexican taco flavors but think I would've been up for if I had had a better understanding. My friend got the vegetarian falafel tacos and loved them!

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Sue T.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description:
I would only eat here for their taco flight. This was my third time visiting Ba-Co and I have to be honest, I still don't understand why people rate it so high. 

The taco flight was beautifully presented and a decent value. For $14, I got five generously portioned tacos which was a much better deal than $6 for a normal sized taco. I wish there was more flavor with each taco. Everything looked great but there was not much exciting flavors to me. I also wish the server would have told me what tacos I was receiving. Me and my friend were confused and had to try to guess what each taco had for meat. Would I recommend ba-co? No, not for a great taco place however, I would recommend it to an adventurous eater that is out of restaurants to try in the city. I would love to compare notes with them and see why they like or dislike it.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Arlene M.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description:
Ba-Co is one of the 4 concept chefs in training at Smallman Galley. Please note that next month two of the chefs in the Galley will be moving on but Ba-Co is not one of them.

I met Tim the chef and inquired about their burrito special as well as their tacos. I learned that the burrito is a do it yourself choice of meat or falafel and they include the necessary fillings that go with it. He did tell me it was not vegan however, the falafel taco was. I never tried a vegan taco before so I opted for that and the Texas short rib as my other one.

I took my number and sat down to wait. Shortly afterwards I was served my two tacos. For $6.00 a piece they were a descent size and pretty filling. The Texas short rib was flavorful and tasty. The falafel one was huge but I must admit it wasn't dry. Maybe a little more sauce would have added to the flavor but it was very filling.  Course both of them were messy as one would expect.

Afterwards I spoke to him and asked if he was doing anything special for Cinco de Mayo this weekend. Tim told me he was but it will be part of the brunch menu.

Ba-Co occupies the space formerly held by Joey's snack shop and is the latest addition to the team of aspiring chefs in training. Parking in the Strip district  remains problematic since most of Smallman St is still torn up but if you are lucky you can find metered street parking or pay lots nearby. Bike lanes are on Penn Ave as well as public transportation.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Abby K.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description:
I'm a fan of Smallman Galley so I was excited to try their new concept- BA-CO. I love barbecue tacos so I was looking forward to trying this new selection.

First off the man taking our orders was not friendly and seemed bothered by us just being there. That definitely put me off especially since all the other concepts that I've been to at Smallman's have always had great service.

I ordered the Texan and the Trail Blazer tacos. I was so excited for the Trail Blazer taco because pork belly is probably one of my favorite meats. Man was I let down. The meat was dry and flavorless. The meat on the Texan was also disappointing; it was very chewy and I had to give up eating it like normal taco and had to use a fork and knife.

When I'm ordering a six dollar taco I'm expecting something amazing not something so underwhelming. 

I'm going to give ba-co the benefit of the doubt since it just recently opened and eventually give it a second chance.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Elizabeth F.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description:
Solid choice at Smallman's Galley. I was intrigued by the burrito description and asked the cashier for his favorite protein pick--pork belly. Okay, let's do it. 

We head over to grab a seat and he finds me to let me know they're out of pork belly. I opt for the short rib instead. When it arrives, you can tell it's a fork and knife situation. The tortilla is nicely grilled. The filling is sweet and rice more a sticky style. The beef was overdone and tougher to chew. There's not much more flavor than sweetness as the BBQ sauce overpowers it.

Overall, it's alright. A bit pricey for what you get.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Rachel C.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description:
You know when you get a dish you'll dream about? You'll want to go back every day for? I had a dish like that here. Ugh. It was so good! The Texan lime cilantro rice bowl will be dancing around in my head for weeks. And hopefully in my belly again stat!

This is the newest kid on the Smallman Galley block. It's got to be hard coming into an already established place and making your own way. I think they have a strong start! The house smoked brisket was juicy and tender, the BBQ sauce tangy and the slaw was a perfect crisp topping. 

Can't wait to go back and work my way down what I'm sure will be a delicious menu!

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Kristy A.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description:
Delicious!    These tacos definitely delivered and I'll absolutely be back.    I had the two: 

The Trailblazer - House Smoked Pork Belly, street corn, chili lime aioli, pickled red onion, cilantro, mojo, queso fresco and crème fraiche.   May have been a touch corn heavy, but I loved it all the same.   

Not your Grandma's - Southern Hot Chicken, slaw with honey and confit garlic aioli, pimento cheese and pickled red onions.  This one was a winner for sure.   Great texture and flavor - will order again and again.   

I also finished with the tres leches cake - this was a little drier than I would have imagined and didn't have much caramel sauce, but I did like the flavor and it was a nice end to the meal.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Steve K.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: I had two tacos, the veggie one (falafel) and the smoked pork one. Both were tasty, but the former popped a little more than the latter, I'd say. I got the corn tortillas as the wheat ones have enriched flour; luckily they also checked the flour used for the fried chicken taco, so I avoided getting sick. Cool concept, good execution, reasonable price point. Definitely worth checking out.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Sophia C.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description:
It's been a minute since I've written a yelp review (whoops), but I'm so excited that Ba-Co is a part of Smallman Galley! I love the Smallman Galley concept: restaurant incubators, and you get to order and try different places.

Ba-Co is one of their newest spots! It's barbecue tacos, which I never knew I was missing from my life until I ate here. My favorite taco would be the Texan--house smoked brisket, housemade bbq sauce, slaw + yellow mustard. LIFE CHANGING YALL. The prices are pretty fair as well: $6.50/taco, and $12/two. They have some other great tacos, like pork belly (Trail Blazer), hot chicken (Not Your Grandma's) and veggie options.

If you have dietary restrictions, let the chef know as they're really careful about that! It can be hard to get a seat at Smallman, so would suggest going at not standard dinner hours.

I will be back for sure!!!

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: DJ J.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: While we enjoyed our tacos, $12 for two seemed a bit pricey to us.  You do get a good sized taco with plenty of filling but....  The Texan is a BBQ short rib with jalapeños ranch and slaw and a mustard was very good and the Not Your Grandma's is a spicy chicken with honey, a garlic aioli and pimento cheese was good and definitely had a sweetness with a tad of spiciness.  Actually wished both had a little more spiciness.   This is a nice addition to the Smallman Galley.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Julia E.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: I was disappointed in my order at Baco. I really wanted vegetables so I ordered the veggie taco plate. First off it comes out and the taco plate was 2 tacos. No sides. I'm fine with no sides but don't refer to the dish as a plate that is $12. Just call it two tacos. The veggie tacos were definitely falafel. Second mistake- just call it falafel please. It really didn't have much flavor at all and I have had really good falafel before. I also ordered the street corn. It was good but tasted like bagged corn not your typical corn on the cob. If I go back to this stand I will be sure to try something else as it does look like Baco has fairly good reviews on other dishes.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Meghan B.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: Visited a couple months ago with my family, as it was their first time experiencing Smallman Galley! We tried items from 3/4 of the featured restaurants, including Ba-Co. We went with the chicken taco with creamy garlic sauce, as my mom isn't a fan of spicy things. We also tried the street corn. The street corn was disappointing- it was just frozen (and flavorless) corn sprinkled with some cheese and seasonings. It wasn't even on the cob. I wouldn't buy that again. However, the chicken taco was divine. Fresh, and full of flavor. I liked it so much that I ordered a couple to-go so I could enjoy them again later on. I am excited to go back soon and check out their other menu items- maybe the corn will be better once corn is in season again?

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Bo N.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: Woa, so glad I found this place, I'm very impressed. Eastern US is lacking greatly in quality Mexican food and you guys are nailing it! Thank you! Can't wait to try the Tamales next time!

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Emily G.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: I was super excited to try Ba-Co but was very let down. I got the bowl with chicken and it had no flavor. The cilantro lime rice was just white rice, I couldn't taste anything different when I tried it on its own. The chicken had less spice and flavor than crockpot salsa chicken. Unfortunately will not be giving this one another try as there wasn't a redeeming factor to the meal.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Joshua W.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: Had a fantastic lunch with my girlfriend. The tacos are amazing and the tres leches was phenomenal.  The atmosphere of the building is very artsy and has a bit of nostalgia being in an old factory building. Service was great and cost was on point for the quality of the food. Would recommend to anyone.

ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.author: Jackie J.
ssYUkuMC5VuJ4PDTXhNi1w.description: Literally so fantastic.  I've had gluten free here quite a few times and enjoyed it every time!!

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Shannon N.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description:
Wonderful food. Can't wait to go back!

When you walk in your eye catches the counter...and below the dessert case! Tempting to the diner but also I observed many a patron picking up boxes of desserts. 
We say at a table for four. The room is loud and open. Heavy chairs on a hard floor.
I recommend getting the hummus. The table ordered hummus to share and it was delicious. Comes with pita bread. 
I ordered a falafel salad for entree. The falafel was still hot and was very tasty. The yogurt dressing that came with it was served on the side. I used the hummus as a dressing instead. 
The rest of the table enjoyed what they ordered.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Stacey B.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description:
We are Aladdin's fans, for sure.  We eat here several times a year and usually order the same things all the time because they are so good.  I love their lamb shish kabob salad, their falafels, their baba ganouj, and their hummus.  Their desserts are fabulous if you still have room.  They offer nice selections of herbal teas and recently added wine and beer.  

I tried their grilled tuna steak grilled pita roll and it was so amazing!  I got it with the pickles and turnips which gave it a super nice kick.  We ordered one other their sampler platters and nearly ate the entire thing.  The grape leaves and falafels were incredibly delicious.  

As always, the wait staff was terrific.  They are always so good about refills and making sure we have everything we need.  The prices are super reasonable too.  They are open until 10PM during the week so it's a nice option if you are out late shopping or running errands.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: D M.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description:
So disappointing. Went for my birthday and took the kids. We were all excited about new food. Waitress seemed irritated by questions as we aren't that familiar with the fare. She couldn't give recommendations, didn't bring sweetener for our tea or refill the pita until we asked 3 times. Food was meh. We love trying new places and two of us are vegetarians. Was expecting a lot from the reviews. Order baklava as a birthday treat. It was dried out, not warmed, with wrapping on it. Left it largely uneaten. Never did check on how we liked it, even though most of our food was not eaten. Never got refills. 

Service abysmal for a party of five. I was a server in college and give people breaks, but she was terrible. Someone else ran our food and just walked away. 

Waste of my birthday dinner & wasn't cheap. We all agreed we will never go back. I'm not willing to risk that maybe it was just an off night because others who came in after got their food before us and saw them get refills.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: R J.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: These people hustle. I'm here watching every single employee working the entire time. It's gotten very busy since I came in and even when it was fairly quiet, every person was doing something. They are friendly, the service is good, the place feels clean and the food is perfect.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Chai A.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: Very good. I usually go to the squirrel hill location because it's closer to my job but the mcknight location is closer to my home so I gave it a try.  I got the curry Chicken pitza, Kafta and falafel. All were perfectly cooked and fresh. The pitza is much better at this location. The decor was also warm and welcoming as was my hostest!

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Joyce B.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: We live out of town but we stay at a friend's house close to here and always stop here to eat.  The food is always so fresh, the menu is very expansive and the service is great.   The decor is clean and fresh and inviting.   Love the place.  It definitely deserves more then 4 stars!!

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Jody A.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: Met a friend for dinner. Got there at 5:00pm and there were plenty of tables.  It was a little chilly in the place. Our server was attentive and very nice. Ordered the Greek Pitza. Our order came out in like 5 minutes. My friend got the hot grapes leaves and Fallarfal. My pizza was covered in feta and was supposed to be a veggie pizza on a pita. If you call one piece of pepper, tomato and one olive per quarter a veggie pizza you won't be disappointed. I was. Drank like a fish the rest of the night. Will go back but maybe try a salad this time.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: David B.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description:
Delicious and healthy Middle Eastern food.  I've always experienced attentive service here and everything tastes as if it is made fresh.

They serve great smoothies that feature fresh fruit flavor without being too sweet. 

The dessert case displays the daily offerings, not listed on the menu because they change frequently. 

The reasonable prices, vegetarian options and fresh ingredients keep me coming back.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Jessica M.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: One of my favorite places to stop for lunch, and that includes almost all locations! I typically get the beef shwarma plate with hummus. Their hummus is amazing, and one of my toddler's favorite things to eat. Their salads and smoothies are also great.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Christopher W.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description:
If you have read my other reviews, you know that Middle Eastern food has a special place in my heart. This place has an incredible menu with lots of non-meat options, and also clearly denotes the vegan AND vegetarian dishes. I had several small plates, and the flavors were spot-on. Their hummus was good, the grape leaves were well-flavored and had a nice texture, and the prices were reasonable for the area.

To be honest, the only thing I didn't really enjoy was the dessert. Perhaps the next time I will choose something different or go somewhere else for dessert. Other than that, this was a good choice. For those of us in the vegetarian/vegan tribe, this is a great place to eat out!

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Tricia B.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description:
There are so many good things about the concept of Aladdin's. I love Mediterranean food. I love that they have a lot of choices for vegetarians. I love that they are sensitive to food restrictions and clearly label things to that end on their menu. I love that they have healthier options if you want to go out to eat but not kill your waistline. 

But unfortunately, the thing I need to love the most about Aladdin's -- the actual food -- was just not all that impressive during my visit. I ordered the Jasmine Favorite dinner with chicken. The medley of beans, veggies, and rice that sounded tantalizing from the menu description was bland and devoid of the promised seasoning. The bits of veggies looked and tasted as though they came straight from a freezer bag. And the chicken tawook adorning the top of the dish was tough, flavorless, and had an oily coating of what tasted like Sysco-type industrial cooking spray. The dish just didn't taste all that fresh (or all that Mediterranean, frankly). 

They have a huge menu, so perhaps I just ordered the wrong thing or went on an off night. I do like the concept, so I may go back again and try something else. But for now, I can't give my very average meal any more than 3 very average stars.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Mike M.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: One of the best spots in the north hills for lunch.  I always get the wraps here because they're delicious and very cheap.  This time, I got the beef pita wrap and the falafel pita wrap.  I got both of these for under $14 and it filled me up.  I will continue to go here when I need a quick bite to eat.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Shyneika D.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: I loved how they have so many vegan options. The food was fresh and satisfying. I brought my daughter with me and she enjoyed her food too. The waiter was very nice and accommodating. It was a nice and relaxed lunch. It wasn't crowded at all and our food came out in very good timing. I would definitely return again.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Kari S.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: After eyeing this place for a while, I decided to stop in for take out. I got beef shawarma plate with hummus. It came with bread. The whole ride home, it smelled so good that I wanted to pull over and have a taste (ok I was also starving).  The hummus and beef was excellent - i wish there was more meat as it was delicious. The people who took my order were the nicest and friendliest that I have met for a while! I would go back just to be surrounded by these kind people and amazing food!

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Ruma B.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: Worst food ever!! Took the lamb plate as a pick up. Dog food would have been better. The little bits of lamb were cooked to death & chewy as hell. Never going back again! What a waste of money!!

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Elizabeth B.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description:
Aladdin's is an amazing local restaurant chain, and I was excited to finally introduce the restaurant to my husband! We've been here twice recently, and unfortunately, I must admit that our experiences were pretty different.

Food: Aladdin's food is excellent, particularly for the price. Getting an appetizer is a must, and I usually order the hummus. I'm not a hot sauce fan, but trust me, order some of their hot sauce and add a bit (to taste) to the hummus. It will blow your mind! I've also had the tabouli here before and would highly recommend it, too. In addition to the appetizers, I have enjoyed the rolled pitas (particularly the Aladdin's kabob and the chicken shawarma). The rolled pitas come packed full of meat and veggies, and I believe are a great value for the price. I also tried Farrouk's falafel pitza and was a bit disappointed. I didn't love the flavors or the thin, toasted pita crust and wish I had ordered one of the rolled pitas instead.

Service: The first time that my husband and I came here, service was phenomenal. Our food was delivered promptly, and our female waitress (not sure of her name, but she has a very sweet, high voice) was amazing! However, the second time we've been here, we were very disappointed in our service. It was extremely slow and seemed to be because of our male college-student aged waiter. The table next to us arrived and ordered after we did but finished eating when we had just received our food. Our waiter was MIA for long periods of time during our meal, including not refilling drinks promptly and taking a very long time to deliver our tabouli appetizer (which I can't imagine took the kitchen more than 3 minutes to make and plate).

Overall, Aladdin's is a great restaurant. However, I am definitely going to pause before coming here again to make sure that I have plenty of time available for a meal that could potentially take a very long time to be served...

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Misha R.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description:
good place to eat nice music.
good selection of food

I've been here 2 times and ordered dishes with  meet 
and this 2 times meet was dry.
in my vision meet should be juicy and melt in  mouth.
Everything else was good.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Andrea S.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: My favorite thing about this place is that they're open til 9 on Sundays. It's nice to not have to get fast food after work in the evening. The service is always quick & I've never had to ask for refills on anything. Their cakes are SOOO good. My favorite thing to order is the falafel hummus wrap. It's simple, filling & only $7. My boyfriend always gets the lamb platter & it costs $14 so it's pretty reasonably priced all around.

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Melsa W.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: Amazing food! Love the chicken Dijon rolled with pickles and turnips. Hummus is a must have! :-)

kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.author: Roya G.
kPwYdRKp1-W1-tUR8iylxw.description: Literally the most amazing Mediterranean food in the area. I come here every time I'm home from school and it's absolutely scrumptious. The hummus is a MUST and get it with their hot sauce. That sounds weird but trust me on this..... best combo to hit the 412. Anyways my gf and I decided to share the lamb platter and it was cooked to absolute perfection. Also I got the tabbouli salad which was so perfect, i love the amount of lemon/lime juice. Makes for a great complement to any meal there.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Erica V.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
Stopped by with friends/kids fleeing a nearby event- awesome spot and easy to order. Bubble tea did not disappoint. Bourbon chicken was okay- a little over cooked and could use more sauce or seasoning. The spring rolls that come as a side option are rather tiny. Kung pao chicken was great! And the rolls were surprisingly good 

Bonus- you can purchase tokens for carousel when picking up food!

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Andy V.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
I stopped by Asia tea house on a recent visit to Pittsburgh, mainly to kill some time before an event. I wasn't sure if I was hungry, thirsty or both and fortunately it was still open so I was in luck regardless.

It's a walk up counter with outdoor seating available. A friendly girl opened the sliding door for me to order. They had a decent selection of dishes. I ended up opting for a tea drink which they had about six or seven options. I chose their strawberry bubble drink.

Within a few minutes it was ready and I pretty much devoured it. Tons of bubbles inside to chew on and the strawberry drink was not really what I was expecting but I ended up really liking it. It wasn't tea and milky and it wasn't necessary a smoothie it was some sort of hybrid which I really liked overall. And it was only $4 or so for a large which I enjoyed even more. 

It's a good place for a quick bite or drink in the middle of the college town.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Rachel C.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: All I ordered was a Honeydew Bubble Tea ... we waited 1-2 minutes and the price was 4.23 (including tax) which I felt was OK considering how convenient it was and the location. It had a nice honey dew flavor (which is my go to flavor for boba teas), the perfect amount of coldness to make it extra refreshing on a hot summers day and a good amount of chewy boba pearls. It seemed a tad bit sweet but I felt that was more of a reflection of the fact that the flavor itself was more concentrated than other bubble teas which for all intensive purposes attested to the fact that it was good quality. The slushy/foamy texture at the end made it a bit hard to drink the remainder of the boba so I would suggest adding a little milk at the end to savor the rest of the flavor.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Pauline C.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
Great choices and good prices. I love that it's in the center of Pitt's campus. When it's warm out, it's really fun to sit in Schenley to eat and people watch. 
I used to grab this for lunch when I studied at Hillman, but due to their "no hot food policy" I've been visiting less. However, Asia Tea House has tasty food for a college budget!

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Nancy Z.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: For a reasonable priced meal, this place is great!  I ordered an avocado bubble tea and although I felt that the shake was a little more watery to my liking, it was OK.  The bubbles were chewy and fresh.  I also ordered tofu with vegetables lunch special - the taste was mediocre.  I was a little disappointed that the actual meal was not that big.  It appears that they focus on more rice than the actual meal. The sushi was made to order and you can never go wrong with an avocado roll or cucumber roll.  This place is located next to the carousel and had outdoor seating for your enjoyment.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Joley B.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
I stopped by here recently on a trip to Pittsburgh.  We were exploring the Cathedral of Learning and other spots around the Pitt Campus.  The day was chilly but the sun was out, and as we strolled through Schenley Plaza, I noticed "bubble tea" on the sign, so I figured I'd get one. 
I was a little disappointed that they didn't have a mango-green bubble tea, and so I settled on the mango bubble drink.  It was basically a mango smoothie/puree with tapioca pears thrown in for good measure.  It didn't taste bad, but it wasn't exactly what I was expecting.  

Asia Tea House offers a variety of other options, and they were open when few of the other vendors in the plaza were open.  The girl at the counter was very friendly.  I would probably not make this my top destination, but it was an Ok stop for my in-the-moment-passing-by-a-bubble-tea-sign craving.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Joy J.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: Bubble tea tasted horrible. Tasted like watered syrup.  Had 1/5th of it and dumped it. Don't waste your money there.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Lucy C.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
Convenient and affordable but mediocre taste. 

* Food: I've tried their General Tso's Chicken, Sesame Chicken, Vegetarian Tofu and Bourbon Chicken. Overall, they taste decent if you're craving some Chinese-American food. My favorite would be the Bourbon Chicken.  

* Price vs Worth: Their prices are around $6 - $8. There are definitely better places to eat nearby for the same price. The only times I come here is when I'm studying next door at Hillman Library. 

Will I come here again? - The service is actually really fast and the cashiers are always very nice. I will probably come here again just because of the convenience.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Joe S.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
Asia Tea House was pretty good because of the amazing set of atmosphere. I had a mango bubble tea and it was dull with flavor in comparison to the pineapple bubble
Tea. I would probably come back to try their Asian Food (which looks amazing). But for now I will stick with a 3 of 5...

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Monica S.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
Freshman year, I tried someone's bubble tea from here and swore I was never going to eat at this place (their tapioca pearls were atrocious), however..

I've seen maaaany people get food from here and a part of me always thought.. have I been missing out? Me and a friend walk past it several times a week, and this time, their daily special caught our eyes. 1 entree 2 sides for $7? Or 2 entrees 1 side for $8? If you're craving some American-Chinese food that's: fast, under $10, and weather's nice, I won't judge. 

VEGGIE TOFU + ORANGE CHICKEN + LO MEIN ($8): Lowkey good and they give a lot. You can say it's not real Chinese food and I'll agree with you on that. But you can't say that it's still not tasty. I do have to say that I wished the lo mein had more vegetables, as it was literally all noodles and was actually quite bland. Veggie tofu I thought lacked flavor too, but the zucchini and carrots were yummy and nicely cooked. Orange chicken is my guilty pleasure and in my meal I actually saw a cooked orange peel that I thought was funny. Well I know that they use actually oranges now..

SERVICE: Quite fast! Well. Me and the friend came here around 11 after class when they literally just opened for the day so I'd hope that they wouldn't be slow LOL. They also offer condiments like soy sauce and duck sauce. It's not laying out but I specifically asked for hot oil and they gave it to me. Yum yum yummmmm. 

Asia Tea House, cheap, very 'American-Chinese', just "meh" for me. If you're looking for authentic and not as cheap, try Hunan Bar or Sichuan Gourmet.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Nancy Y.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
I was never really a huge fan of Asia tea house, but in the past couple of months I've gone a couple of times and they've met my expectations for a cheap American-Chinese food restaurant. I usually get the general tso's chicken with lo mein and the green beans.

General tso's chicken is sometimes over cooked and super hard, but the flavor is good, just wish it was easier to chew. (Other friends recommend the orange chicken). Lo mein doesn't have any veggies or anything in it, it's just noodles. But the green beans are freaking delicious and fresh every single time, so I recommend getting that as a side. (They're also pretty veggie friendly - my friend asked them if they could do a general tso's tofu and they happily obliged). 

I've had their bubble tea before and I'm not really a fan. I have friends who really enjoy their taro and matcha bubble tea, but I've never enjoyed any of the ones I've gotten from here.

It's cheap and in a convenient location. Quality is probably higher than Szechuan in Oakland, but you don't get as much food.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Kyle J.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
I was walking around the park and chose to stop at Asia Tea House. They looked like they had a really great menu. There were a lot of people that had food from their restaurant. I was only looking for a snack, so I got a chicken egg roll and an iced green tea (I think the green tea was a special for the day). The egg roll was the perfect snack I needed. The tea was mellow and refreshing. 

The staff I interacted with was super friendly. And service was very quick. Next time I am in Schenley Park I will get a real meal here!

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Chris C.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: I got the chicken lo mein and it was WAY too salty. There was too much soy sauce cooked into the noodles and I could literally feel my arteries clogging. I also found a piece of raw chicken! How quaint... I wouldn't come back here again.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Dakota D.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: Paid for extra meat and got a portion that's not big enough to be a standard portion. And the meat was tasteless.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Keanna C.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
Reasons to eat here: 
1. Good food and perf ft portions. 
2. The mango mango berry smoothie (you can add tapioca pearls for $0.50) is delicious. It's sweet without the overkill, and the consistency is always perfect; never watery or chunky. 
3. Fast friendly service
4. The prices are very agreeable

Basically if you enjoy being satisfied you'll enjoy dining here.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Amulia N.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description:
Went here for dinner, got the Tofu in Curry sauce, vegetable spring roll, and fried rice. The curry sauce was not as spicy as I would have liked, but was fine after I added Sriracha. The fried rice was nice, nothing extraordinary, but the vegetable spring rolls are delicious. You get a large amount of food for an amazing price, excellent for college students. The food itself is average nothing special, but a great value for the price. In terms of spice I had to add Sriracha to everything to add some spicy flavor to the food. 

Overall great place and you definitely get your money's worth.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Jordan D.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: I've had good experiences every time I visit Asia Tea House. The food is always good, and he service is fast and friendly.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Meghan B.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: If you're really craving Chinese or Sushi and don't have time to visit another place, then sure, come here. The food is just okay- it won't blow you away and everything I've ever tried here and is just missing something. Their chicken lo mein is meh- even with taking it home to doctor it up, it still just didn't impress me. Their sweet potato tempura sushi is ok, but it sure isn't memorable. There are a few things to like about this place: 1) it's affordable, 2) it's convenient for college students to get to, 3) there's always outside seating available. Overall though, if you are looking for delicious Sushi or Chinese, I would recommend not coming here.

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Brittany R.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: Kind of bland for Chinese food.. I will go here if I have to when I am visiting Pittsburgh but only if I'm in a rush!

K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.author: Jasmine C.
K6AKMjAdCSe8xllsbyeL9Q.description: This place has pretty quick service (order at one window and pick up at the next window). The food is definitely not very authentic, but in my opinion it's pretty good Americanized Chinese food. The fried rice was nicely flavored, the steamed vegetables were not too raw or overcooked, and the garlic sauce chicken was tender. The size of the meal was a good deal for the price you pay. There's no indoor seating, but there's plenty of outdoor seats. Also, on the warmer days it's very nice to bring a blanket and eat on the lawn.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Ed J.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description:
Very tasty pork green chile stew and delicious tortilla.   The homemade salsa was fantastic, but their homemade tortilla chips were a little thick and could have used some salt.

But the price was VERY reasonable, and on a beautiful day, eating on Schenley Plaza is better then any indoor restaurant.  Great spot for a quick and delicious lunch!

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Frank S.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: Mesa never fails to impress me every time I get food from there. My favorites are the enchiladas and the breakfast burrito

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Katherine L.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: Mesa's breakfast burritos are the reason I keep coming back. They are huge and only cost $5. There are also some really good hot sauces by the window that go perfectly with the breakfast burrito. Not sure about other lunch options, but the sopapillas with honey are also good! Food comes out pretty quickly, and they accept cash, debit, or credit. Service is good. This place is absolutely unbeatable when it comes to counter-serve breakfast in Oakland.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Dashawn B.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description:
I visited Mesa for breakfast and was pretty satisfied with my experience. The location is directly in the middle of Pitts campus. The scenery was very pleasant and there was a descent amount of seating around the shop. The customer service was not anything special. The wait was not very long. 
I ordered the breakfast burrito but removed the green Chile sauce and added bacon. The bacon was in chewy chunks which I appreciated. The potato's were cut in a home fire style. The burrito at first glance looked pretty small but as I finished it I realized the my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach. I obviously finished it because I know my mom didn't raise a chump. All jokes aside when ordering from here you definitely get your dollars worth. My burrito totaled at $5.50 +tax.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Tessa S.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: This is one of the worst places that I have ever eaten. The chicken is bland and the pork was hard in the tacos, the tortillas were COLD (clearly not warmed up), and there was a puddle of liquid that my tacos were submerged in when I open the container that made them gross and impossible to eat. I was hoping that the rice and beans were at least going to be something I could gut down at that point but that was not the case. The rice and beans were clearly old (gross crust on both of them). Ended up have to dump the entire meal. Worst $8 I have ever spent.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Elim Z.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: Great values and portion! First Time here and I'll def come back. The beans and rice ($3) was also larger in quantity than expected, very flavorful too

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Nancy Y.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description:
Stopped by here this morning for a breakfast burrito that my friends always seem to get since it's conveniently right next to Hillman library.

$5 for a huge burrito filled with a ton of stuff!! I thought it would come with some sort of meat in it but I didn't specify when I ordered so I ended up not getting any. But apparently you can get like chorizo or bacon in it for no extra added cost! I don't know everything that was in mine but there were onions, peppers, egg, potatoes and cheese all in a grilled tortilla and it's so delicious! I think this is a pretty good deal for the portion size and it's convenient location. The other food I've had here was good, but this breakfast burrito is great! I'd definitely recommend it.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Nicky E.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description:
After wandering around the Cathedral of Learning, I was famished, and I stopped at Mesa for a breakfast burrito. 

It was hearty and filling - potatoes, eggs, bacon, other food things that I can't remember...in a wrap, with their hot sauce. My mouth was having a party. Not sure why this place doesn't have more stars, but I really enjoyed the noms, and the atmosphere. 

I also got their Pinon coffee, and it was light and nutty, and utterly delightful. 

I left satiated and ready to take on some more touristy activities! Thanks, Mesa!

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: David B.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description:
Very authentic Mexican food, served up quickly. When I'm in a hurry to eat, it's great to have an option that features quality food.

The prices are very reasonable, a bit lower than Conflict Kitchen.

The Schenley Plaza is always a great place to relax and hang out.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Lizzie K.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: Omg this place is so good. Get their breakfast burrito and get it with beans. You will not be sorry. Also I got some chocolate dessert there once that was super good. But seriously the breakfast burrito tho. You gotta.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Noelle E.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: love this place!!!!! best breakfast burrito in town. literally $5, can't beat it. also try the fritters!!

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Achyuth M.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: This is my favorite go to breakfast place in Oakland. I can always count on quality food for a reasonable price. Its an absolute must if you're in the Oakland area and looking for breakfast or lunch.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Robyn C.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: As a New Mexico transplant, I've been so happy to find a place to grab some authentic breakfast burritos and piñon coffee

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Leila I.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description:
This is the little shack in schenley plaza that used to house Conflict Kitchen. Although I was super sad about their closing, I have no complaints about this new place! New Mexico themed. As a group of friends, we ended up ordering just about one of everything on the menu. Everyone liked their food! I was expecting just a single tamale or enchilada, etc but they also came with rice and beans so it was more food than we expected, considering we just wanted a little snack. 

The dessert was like something brought down to me from heaven. Lavender-infused panna cotta with blackberries and a piñon (pine nut) brittle. OMGGG. I will be going back again and again just to get that! It paired perfectly with the piñon coffee, which is just regular coffee roasted with pine nuts so it has a smooth, nutty taste. 

The worker happily described some of the different menu items to us and even checked on us after words to see if we liked it. Really sweet of him!

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Olivia B.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description:
Super disappointed. I was really excited to try this place. 

The enchiladas were super small, and bland. Yes, you can add hot sauce but shouldn't there still be flavor? It literally looks like it came out of a microwaveable meal. I feel bad giving it a review like this but this is my honest opinion. Maybe after some time they'll improve the food and this was just because they're getting use to things but for the quality of food and having to pay ~$8-9 for two small enchiladas with a small portion of rice and beans, this is not worth it. 

The rice looks like it would be seasoned but it was extremely bland. Not enough additional hot sauce can hide this. 

I've shown this picture to several people who all agree that it looks like it could be a frozen meal.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: bayar N.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: I stopped by right before they closed on a Sunday. Ordered the breakfast burrito and I thought it was a nice size burrito. It was pretty good but way too greasy. Still have a heartburn from it.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Kelly V.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: One of the more economical food choices in the area. Their $5 breakfast burrito (available all day) is a substantial amount of food for the price. And tasty! All menu items are gluten free. The coffee is outstanding as well.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: K K.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: Delicious and consistent. This is just a great breakfast burrito! And just a great enchilada! Great place to grab a quick and pretty healthy veggie-friendly bite near the cathedral of learning. Good value.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: David L.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description:
I like how they have changed up the menu. Been here several times now. When Mesa opened, the food was about 3 stars and could be bland at times.

Really happy with how they have continued to tinker with and update the menu - for the better! Now the food is in the 4-5 star range and of similar quality to Conflict Kitchen which was formerly in this spot.

The breakfast burritos (served all day) are amazing. Particularly when they have chorizo on the menu. The chopped salad and carne enchiladas are also a good choice. 

Also recommend the Mexican coffee / hot cocoa when they have it to spice up the cold day as well.

7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.author: Michelle N.
7LkgfuhLVeQZ4qHHq86JKQ.description: Food was decent. But damn they have rude employees! My husband asked for the burrito to be cut in half and the man working sad " no, I would rather not" them turned to his coworker and bragged about it!  We won't be returning

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Bebe B.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description:
This is literally out my back door! Having a bowl of cauliflower and cheese soup and a GIANT fish sandwich! Stop in and try it out!
 Reasonable prices, good food, and friendly staff! GREAT Sunday breakfast!!

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Morgan B.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: Just a perfect little Diner nothing fancy but  clean, warm and  inviting with friendly staff good food and great pricing. This is the kind of place I would go with my grandmother and grandfather when I was a kid. No matter what people say don't ever change folks... you nailed it... the warm coziness of visiting your grandparents. Not to many places like this exist much anymore in America, but luckily around Pittsburgh we have a few.

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Kimberly T.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: Gary's has been around for over 20 years. It's a small place that's only open for breakfast and lunch. We go for breakfast there so I've never seen their lunch menu. The breakfast menu is straightforward. I typically get the same thing-1 egg, 3 strips of bacon, home fries, and toast. They use Mancini bread for the toast. YUM!!!!  They have other menu items like pancakes and waffles. I keep thinking I will order something different but I always order the usual. Bacon and eggs is a comfort food for me. Eating at Gary's is like eating home cooking. Who doesn't want that???

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Meghan B.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description:
Gary's is a hidden gem in Carrick that I missed out on for years! I have lived in Carrick my whole life and only within the last two years decided to give them a try. I am so glad I finally did! 

From the outside, you don't know what to expect- there aren't many windows on the outside. When you walk in, you will be surprised with how many tables the place has. It's definitely outdated in terms of the decor and furniture- but I kind of love the old school feel of the place. 

Their food isn't going to knock your socks off- but it's very good and VERY reasonably priced. My boyfriend and I have never had a $20 bill , it has always been under and we have always left full and happy. 

Fluffy pancakes, crispy bacon, thick toast, crispy home fries and omelettes that are packed to capacity-- their food never disappoints! Service is always awesome. And it has never been crowded when my boyfriend and I have come on the weekends (we are late comers though- eating breakfast around 12-1 usually). 

Anytime I want an awesome breakfast but don't feel like driving far to get it- Gary's is my first choice!

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Ike F.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: This is just like stepping back into time.  Definitely old school interior and exterior.  It's very dark inside, no windows except for the ones in the front door.  That definitely gives it a lot of character. We went on a Sunday morning for breakfast.  It was packed inside.  We had to wait a  few minutes for a table, but not long.  Most customers were senior citizen regulars who ate and left pretty quickly.  I got the Pittsburgh omelet which had sausage, peppers and onions.  It was pretty good and tasty.  It was served with Mancini's bread (could have been toasted a little longer), and home fries (pretty average, but still tasty).  My partner got the hungry man which had a little bit of everything.  He said everything was cooked well and tasty.  Pancakes were nice and fluffy.   Definitely come here if you want the basics done right.  Nothing fancy or crazy creations.  Just the classics and a cool atmosphere you can't replicate.

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: F P.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description:
Good little greasy spoon, where the spoons aren't greasy. I got the Hot Turkey Sandwich with Fries. She got the pancake with strawberries and whipped cream with a side of bacon.

My sandwich was pretty good. Big thick pieces of toast. Crispy golden fries. The gravy was pretty bland but was still good (and plenty of it). The turkey was good lunch meat turkey. I'm picky about my turkey. Only complaints was the turkey was still cold before they put it all together.

We were going to get two pancakes but the waitress recommended just one because they were huge. We took her word for it. The pancake pretty much took up the whole plate. She loved it and I snuck a bite here and there. She couldn't even finish it. The bacon was thick, crispy and tasty.

All in all, cool little hole in the wall diner spot. One of the better places in the neighborhood. Too bad they close to early (2pm).

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Megan G.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: This place is such a gem! My boyfriend lives in the Southside and if we're not in a rush on the weekends we'll drive up to Carrick for breakfast at Gary's. The decor is reminiscent of a 90's small-town Italian restaurant (think plastic plants, brick arches, etc.) but the food is actually REALLY great diner breakfast. We've never waited for a table and never paid more than $15 for breakfast and coffee for the two of us. I would definitely recommend checking it out if you're in the area!

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Chris L.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: If you're looking fancy decor, fagghetabatit. If you want a great breakfast for a reasonable price, go here. You will not be disappointed.

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Laura B.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: Great little place for breakfast and lunch. I had the Greek omelette, potatoes & toast, everything was really good. I will definitely go back!

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Jennifer J.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: I didn't even know it existed and I lived not too far away. It is a wonderful place for breakfast -- delicious pancakes and even better french toast. My husband and I usually get 1 of each then split them so we get a little of both. Very reasonably priced as well!

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Karen K.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: My husband and I go here every Sunday.  They have specials only on Sundays which are always so delicious.  There are about 8 different specials to choose from, varying from different omelets to sweet embellished waffles or French toast.  Their basic menu is also widely expansive.  Besides the awesome food selections are the amazing people that work there.  They are always so friendly and accommodating, I cannot recommend this place enough

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Lorie R.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: Consistently good..love the Mancini raisin toast. Friendly, prompt service! Best breakfast in town!

nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.author: Lanie H.
nbKdzlGl5Rl6lB8F5g97ag.description: I love this joint! From the outside one would assume it's probably just got a lunch counter inside, but there's a whole cozy sit-down area. The food is delicious and reasonably priced, the people who work there are warm and personable and will remember you (and what you like to eat). The portions are generous, when I eat in I almost always need a box for leftovers. They offer carry-out which I love. The only beef I have with this place is that I wish they were open later. Other than that, it's all aces!

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Dom D.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: Staff was hard-working and nice, restaurant is super clean and aesthetically pleasing. Pizza was cheap and fantastic, and anytime I'm in garfield, I would definitely eat here again!!

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Lauren J.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: I hate to give a review after ordering one thing and having it delivered, however; I've had so many bad experiences with pizza shops around me, that I'm excited to finally find a place close to my apartment that delivers a good quality pizza. The pizza had a great flavor, the cheese tasted fresh and the ranch dipping sauce was great. The prices are so affordable and the pizza is high quality. I've now found the ONLY place I will be ordering pizza from in the future.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Derrell G.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description:
This is definitely my new favorite pizza shop! It was sooo easy to order & because i did order online it came with free breadsticks! No other pizza shop has a special like this. The food was exceptional also. Will definitely be ordering again. 

I ordered a 16" pizza , Italian Hoagie , 12pc Wings & got breadsticks free from ordering online. Here's

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Karla D.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description:
I'm really surprised how great this place is. It's like a hidden gem I'd never paid attention to. They have an extensive menu but it's not too much. Some places have crazy menus that read like novels.
It's nice to have a decent variety at a pizza shop. We had an Italian hoagie, gyro and fries. Really tasty with fresh ingredients.
Specials are cheap and lots of food. 
There's a small dining area that's decorated with black and white framed prints, modern tables and chairs and nice flooring.
Staff are super friendly.
Will be back soon.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Maryanne S.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: Lifelong city resident. We've had pizza from "everywhere." Pizza Fiesta is our favorite. My kids won't let me order from anywhere else. Their favorite is the buffalo chicken pizza. Perfect every-time. The ranch dressing is fabulous.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Gabrielle C.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description:
I would really like this review to go VIRAL because they delivered something that was so much more than a pizza, it was a gift to my soul sister from afar. I live in NYC and wanted to do something special for my friend's birthday and asked (pleaded) that they help me do something creative with the pie. 

They DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!! Pizza Fiesta not only wrote "Happy Birthday" beautifully in the box, but they made the pizza into the shape of a heart, and lined the edges with pepperoni. IT WAS A GOSH DARN WORK OF ART!!!

My friend was thrilled to say the least, not to mention she said it was delicious. 

It's people like the workers at Pizza Fiesta who are the unsung heroes of the food industry. They do things out of the kindness of their hearts while also delivering quality. 

A million thanks to Pizza Fiesta for saving the day!!!!

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Andres A.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: Their  cheeseburger is the best in the world. Specially if it comes with the French fries and cheese-bacon on the top.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Nathan H.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: The best 2 AM pizza I've ever had. And it's dirt cheap. And it's good leftovers too. Will definitely come back next time!

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Alex A.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: It pains me to say that I can no longer recommend Pizza Fiesta. Living a block from this shop, I ordered nearly every week the past few months for their reasonable prices, unique buffalo sauce, and complimentary breadsticks with every order 10 bucks and up. And up until now, it had been pretty great. Recently though, this place has taken a nosedive. Smaller portions, no more complimentary breadsticks, and horribly rude staff. I will say that their buffalo chicken hoagie was one of my favorite in the area but I just can't bring myself to frequent this pizza shop any longer until they reevaluate their attitude towards customers.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Marisa S.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: We were staying at the Sheraton in Station Square. This pizza was the one that delivered to us. We got two large pepperoni pizzas. They were delicious  they came with ranch inside the box and I was confused but once I tried it with the pizza it was delicious. A great drunk food for the end of our night. Will definitely be ordering again when we come back

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: J P.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: Foods wack and over expensive compared to what you can get from other places. It was like eating bad bar food. It's extra-basic.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Wesley H.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: A little slow on the cook but it has a nice location , and conveniently stays open later than other restaurants in the area. My fiancé and I really enjoyed the seafood pizza.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Jia J.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: New pizza, burgers, gyros, and other comfort good spot opened about a year and a half about by a nice family from Kyrgyzstan. They have lunch specials and are one of the latest places still open of you're on Penn after a show, gallery opening during Unblurred, or other event. If you become a regular, they'll even occasionally share Boortsog and other Kyrgyzstan dishes that the staff each together with you :)

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Hailey H.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: This pizza reminds me of school pizza. The dough was chewy and very unappetizing. The delivery also took 15 minutes longer than the latest expected time of delivery. I would not come back to get pizza here.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Eric G.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: These wagz are everything !! We had the wings and fries are everything !! We stopped here after the Pe rally.

qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.author: Rebecca P.
qV193bfO-X4ysTviA2iUAA.description: This place is really good and delivers to me! Yay! Their pizza is good and their gyros are GREAT. And they deliver really fast. Definitely recommend

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Kenna P.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: The food was amazing and the delivery was so fast! I absolutely love their good. Its always good, delivery is on time and they are very professional. I would definitely recommend them to anyone and plan on ordering from then again very soon!!

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Rachel C.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: This type of pizza is thin, chewy, oily and has very little tomato sauce in it which is pretty typical for a pizza place. What I enjoyed the most was the flavorful oil in the pizza - not the healthiest pizza but pretty flavorful nonetheless. Although I enjoyed the pizza overall and the customer service was quick, I strongly feel that the pizza should be accurately depicted on their menu and that the price is not the best value. To be fair, the picture of the pizza that they advertise on their menu looks nothing like the pizza that they give you and I find that disingenuous. Although the slice they gave me was pretty good, I still found the price of 3.50 per slice without toppings to be a bit much. It was a rather large slice vertically however the thickness was thin, which again, was not how the picture on the menu was depicted at all.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Matt M.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: Ordered a bacon pizza which came over fifteen minutes earlier than projected. Food was hot and fresh, great dough and taste. Awesome pizza spot with quality ingredients, fresh taste and quick delivery.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: J T.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: Bottom of the cooker fries, the sauce on the wings is so hot that it's not edible.  The gyro didn't even come with cucumber sauce (they put ranch sauce instead). The steak that they use is steak-ums.  Will NEVER order from here again!!!

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Jocelyn G.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description:
Gennaro's is one of my go to pizza delivery places. I tried someplace different last time just to see what's out there and regretted not ordering from Gennaro's. I usually get the "Create your own Pizza" option which I usually special request crispy and it is! I like a place that gives you what you want.

I also ordered their popular deep dish pizza and it was delicious. It was just a little much for me(too much crust, too much cheese), not my usual thin crust style, but I'm glad I tried it. 

I have never had bad pizza from there, the cheese taste good, so I'll keep it in my "go to" file under pizza delivery.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Anissa P.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description:
Last night my boyfriend was really craving an Italian Hoagie, so we decided to order in. We picked a random menu from the many we get in our mailbox. Unluckily, we chose this place. Called in and an hour later we received our order.

As we opened it up, he noticed that his Italian Hoagie was just a thin layer of meat on bread. Now, we all know what comes on an Italian Hoagie. He called back and informed them of their mistake and requested a new Hoagie be delivered, they said to him that he would have to return the first Hoagie which he had no problem with seeing as he wasn't going to eat it. 

About 10 mins later, they called back saying the driver was only going to deliver the vegetables that were supposed to be on it. Unhappily, he accepted it because he was hungry and just wanted to eat. Now 15 minutes after that phone call, my boyfriend called back wondering if he was on his way. They replied that the driver only left 3 minutes ago which was unnerving to say the least.

As another 5-10 minutes passed, becoming aggravated as the Hoagie was soggy and cold, we called back to ask for a refund because we had become very unhappy at this point, 1hr and 40mins after we initially placed the order from this location. Their response to the refund request was so completely ridiculous, saying they would only refund the vegetables. Now, if you ordered a pizza and it was delivered without cheese, wouldn't it be absolutely ridiculous if not only the shop didn't provide you with a replacement, seeing as it's completely their fault, but told you that they were only going to refund you for the cheese. 

I was completely disgruntled, being a manager myself. This place did not provide good customer service. This is not how you correct a mistake, this is how you lose your customers. My boyfriend did not get what he ordered and he did not get what he PAID for. Gennaro's was absolutely unprofessional and as I work downtown as well, I will definitely be passing this on to as many people I can. Ordering from Gennaro's is a BIG MISTAKE and I will never, ever do it again.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Emily S.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: With my one experience through ubereats delivery, the sauce was really good but the rest (texture, cheese taste, and crust) was below average. Not the worst pizza i've ever had but i will not be ordering again.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Cameron D.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: I placed an order thru Uber eats for a buffalo chicken pizza. Upon receiving it I noticed all the fries were burnt ( black and charred even). I called to express this and all the manager cared about was if I had ordered there prior. He didn't offer and redeliver or anything but simply just contacting Uber eats to get a refund

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Tyler S.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description:
Service 0/10
Pizza 4/10

First 1 star given on yelp. 

If you're going to be open on Carson Street Saturday night after 2 A.M. - you gotta have slices rolling and ready to go. Waited over 10 minutes for a few cheese slices. Most customer friendly pizza places have pre-mades ready at the front counter . No such thing here. Everything done in the back, they were doing who knows what in the back while I saw employees eating pizza themselves before getting served. 

Below average pizza, undercooked and floppy. 

After 10 minutes I asked for my slices and was given a rude "be patient". No, be FASTER. 
 
Will never return. 

Just go to benny's.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Bebe B.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description:
This is the first time my friend and I ordered from this restaurant!
It was DELICIOUS!
We both had the seafood salad!
OMG! Fresh greens, cherry tomatoes, crab, shrimp,and mozzarella cheese! YUMMY!
Choice of garlic bread or croutons!
We also had the cannoli for dessert! Double YUMMY!!!
We will be ordering from them again!!!

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: ferrous o.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description:
The food at this joint is delicious.  They do most things right.  

However, this is the second time that I have ordered delivery and they have screwed up my order.  The last time, they put the wrong toppings on the pizza and it took about 1.5 hours for it to arrive and then I had to wait while they re-made it from scratch.  At least they were willing to make it right.

This time, the order was *totally* incorrect and still took over an hour when they are mere blocks from my house.  When I called to get the delivery driver to return, I was told that the driver made a mistake and delivered my food to the wrong location.  Their answer was...seriously...that they were going to send someone out to swap out the food they delivered to me with the food I actually ordered.  This is not only completely unsanitary (I opened the incorrect order and as far as I'm concerned contaminated it even if I didn't actually touch any of it) but at this stage I ordered pretty close to 1.25 hours ago, and  spending further time transporting the food from point A to B and then C is going to mean it's cold and/or soggy.  

15 minutes later, the manager called to ask if I wanted them to re-make the food after I'd already asked for a refund.  This was the proper thing to do the first time, but it was already honestly still too late.  When expecting food in no later than 45 minutes, no one wants to spend close to two hours waiting for a resolution and then wait what could really be another 45 minutes to eat at this hour.

Sorry, guys.  Your food is great, but I can't handle it twice in a row.  I might still stop in, but I'm not using you for delivery in the future.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Kathy R.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: Ordered and paid on Yelp. Very convenient. Good pizza. Ordered original crust/thin. Not the best or the worst I've ever had. Would eat it again if in the area.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Domenic D.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: Eaten here a couple times before and overall was nothing special.  From my previous experience I would rate Gennaro's a 3. However, my recent order I decided to try the buffalo chicken pizza and I would not recommend it. The pizza is loaded with fries, seems like it has no cheese and is doused with buffalo sauce.  I was only able to eat one slice of the pie before I was done with it.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Mike S.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: The deep dish is the best you'll find in the burg. It rivals any authentic Chicago deep dish you want to compare it to. Don't wait just order it. It will change your life! The crust has a salty sweet pretzel like taste that you will crave in your sleep. They are always 100% on point never had an issue with food or service.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Kevin S.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description:
This is a vlog review for Gennaros. Follow the link below to see the review/ratings from the #OneBitePittsburgh team. 
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=GvL1WPrHBu0

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Erin P.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: Genarros is the worst. The act like they care but they don't. I ordered a simple cheese pizza and had to wait an hour and a half and watch others getting served way before me. They don't respect their customers. Never coming here again

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Jessica D.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: Not missing anything here!  The pizza has zero taste and was rather disappointing!  The dough tasted like cardboard with a very bland sauce.   Might be a good place for drunk college students but certainly not for a quick lunch while enjoying events down on the south side.  Over rated, over priced for poor quality.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Chelsea M.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description:
My sister-in-law and i stopped in late night for some pizza and wings. I had never been here before but knew it would be open so we the 5 minute drive here. 

The menu offers a large list of things.. including deep dish pizza.

We ordered a regular pizza and plain wings. The wings were delicious.. crispy and by no means a wing ding. Pizza was average but eh whatever. We were all starving.

The guy taking our order was a total sweetie. We enjoyed a beer while waiting for the food. 

A cool thing about Gennaro's is that they sell (& DELIVER!) beer. You can mix & match six packs or buy them individually (not sure if that option is avail for delivery) 

Next time i will pass on the pizza and try some thing else

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Keeka K.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description: A wide variety of selections on the menu, with pretty efficient service (about 15 minutes). I had the seafood pizza, which toppings wise, was incredible, but the crust and cheese were average. Also had the cheesy bread which was overpriced as it was mostly bread with a minimal amount of cheese, but it was slightly healthier in that it was less greasy than pizza chains like Domino's.

w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.author: Matthew U.
w67o_AhcSU_fjVOTlbquXg.description:
Mediocre at best.  See that delicious looking picture up there that shows you how great the chicken tenders are?  Well that's exactly what I ordered, except for mine, they came fried a little extra.  I might be being kind with that.  The were fried extra to the point where each bite tasted of burnt coating.  No matter what I dipped them in I still tasted the burnt-ness.

Next time I order from here, I'll make sure to order something that doesn't come from the fryer.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Matthew U.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description:
Seriously you guys, you need to try Nana's.  I am a fiend for a good hot dog and always on the look out for my next hot dog adventure.  I was told about Nana's from a few coworkers and finally had a chance to stop in.

This place reminds you of a busy department store lunch counter.  It's a pretty narrow spot, but the counter top stretches all the way back.  You have a few choices on how to enjoy your food from here.  The first being that you order and eat in.  The second, show up and order your food to go.  The third, and probably the smartest of them all, call ahead to place your order and show up to pick it up.  I chose the second, probably will do the third on my next venture here.

I don't want to say that I was disappointed by going about my experience the second way because it can be time consuming if you are in a hurry.  But that did allow me to see how they work, and let me tell you, they work swiftly here.  Orders continually roll in and they do not miss a beat.  I cannot say that they have a set station that each of them man because they are all over the place and work so well together.

I came in and looked at the menu, deciding fairly quickly and placed my order.  I then sat back and watched the show unfold in front of me.  Order in, orders on the grill/in the fryer, going on break/coming back, answering the phone, bagging up the orders and doing it all over again.  It was exhausting to watch, but enjoyable.

I went with the two beef dog combo deal.  You can have them topped however you please with a ton of combinations.  This comes with fries and for a little extra you can get them topped with cheese.  For the beef dogs they slice them down the middle and grill them face down.  Great technique as they get this bit of charred taste to them and give it a bit of a crunch.  They are then placed in fresh steamed buns and topped to your liking.  Also comes with a drink and does not break the bank at all.  An aside, cash only.  Make sure to have cash on you or stop before getting here.

The dogs tasted amazing and fresh.  I devoured them in seconds and enjoyed the fries.  A very satisfying meal to be had.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Blaise P.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: Can someone say BEST HOT DOGS IN PITTSBURGH!!!! There I said it this place is a hidden gem that sits right outside the heart of the city. They don't promote there self it's just kinda a word of mouth thing so you gotta be on a lookout cause it's easy to miss and parking is terrible. On walking in this shop it's always packed when I go in but there's a small eating area to sit down at the counter and it's a small little flattop, fryer and some countertop space as a prep area so there's not a lot of room in this place but they work best with what they got. The old saying goes don't fix what's not broke and this place has been pounding out orders since the beginning of time on this equipment and it's still pushing strong. It's not fast food and it's not fine dining you think about it as your gram gram is making you a meal. The staff are always so friendly and so attentive and helping and sweet it's always. The prices are right and the food is even better. I love this place and I tell everyone about it I'll definitely be returning in the near future.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Tom L.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: This is the best hotdog on the north side of Pittsburgh. It's right across the street from Allegheny Commons Park in a short walk to PNC Park. If you're planning on getting a hotdog for the Pirates game and it's a daytime game because Nana's closes at 3:30 this is the place. Simple but delicious menu they have a couple of sandwiches but the real mainstay of this place is the hotdogs. Very affordable compared to all the other food options in the area. Particularly on Federal Street. It's also only cash so pretend it is the 1980s And bring some bills with you. Highly recommend it if you are in the area. It's also in the Mexican war Street area close to the mattress factory argues him.A very affordable lunch after if you are Visiting the area.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: David B.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description:
A nostalgic treat. You especially should try their chilli dog, the best in the city. 

This place is definitely old school, and the prices are reasonable. 

Featured in Rick Sebak's 2013 Documentary, North Side Sandwiches (under the name of Steve's New York Hot Dog Shop) the restaurant has a new owner and name, but still delivers a classic hot dog.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Sunil V.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: What a great find ! The service is very friendly with hard working and caring folks. They checked on me twice for a drink refill and if I needed anything else for my hot dogs. The Food quality, portion size and price is great. Ordered 2 pork dogs, fries and a drink for $5. Love watching the skills of the cooks making food in front of you. I will definitely be back, Try this place for step back in time, with great Pittsburgh City style and service.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Britton B.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: If I can only eat in one place in Pitts, it's here! Upon walking in I got a very local and homey feel which I find to be more of a good thing. Then looking at the menu I noticed plenty of good options for breakfast and lunch. Even if I wasn't hungry I feel like the menu would have made me  hungry. The prices, were even better! I was impressed with those prices but still skeptical until I ordered. Once I did I was amazed at the quality of this food! Then thinking back to the price I was blown away at what a steal this was. I ordered a few things with one of them being the regular pork dog with everything on it. Thinking back to all my trips and places I have visited, this was easily one of the dogs dogs I've ever had especially with this one of a kind chili. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Even the local customers seemed friendly and laid back. Definitely will be back here next time I'm in town.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Roberta J.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: Very good chili cheese dogs and fries. Very friendly people. Lovely owner. Gives little hugs to the kids and chocolate kissrs

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Christian H.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: It's hot dogs, french fries and soda. They do one thing and they do it well. Hot dogs come in two kinds: pork and beef.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Colin W.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: Cheap, convenient, local. I don't mean local in terms of locally sourced - if you're of the Chemex-and-tofu set you'll hate this place. But this is an old-school Pittsburgh establishment, and the prices feel straight out of 1990. I come here for lunch about once a week. The hot dogs and kielbasa are amazing and a meal won't set you back more than $5. As long as you don't mind reminding the cashiers that you got a drink or that you ordered kraut on your dog, this is a wonderful place to grab a bite, and a really great way to experience the North Side.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Mallory L.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: We play softball up at Fineview and stumbled upon this place needing a snack between games. $2.75 gets you a giant, amazing, greasy bacon egg and cheese sandwhich. We came back between games a few weeks later, after talking it up to the team, and planning on ordering for them, but we missed breakfast! They graciously offered to still make the sandwiches for us! Thanks Nana's :) We'll be back!

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Corey K.
