AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: This place is great, I didn't know a hot dog could be so good. The beef hot dog was bangin', the chili sauce was bangin', the fries were bangin', the prices were bangin'. Their only flaw is they get a little flustered when busy. 4/5, would eat there again.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: guest g.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: Steve's Hot Dog Shop just reopened as Nana's Hot Dog Shop and it's amazing!  If you haven't been there yet then you need to try it out!

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: M K.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: Great place for a quick lunch. Had a pork and beef hot dog with everything. Had some fries as well. Pork hot dog was great. I preferred it over the beef one. Friendly service from the guys behind the counter. I'll be back

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Cathy F.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: Hot dogs are ok if made right.  Was in there today and service and dogs sucked.  This place can't compare to Steves Hot Dogs......those two Greek sisters who owned it before had the best service and dogs.   Too bad Nana's couldn't take after them.  I've been to Nana's several times always to find the same slow service.   I'm done...no more going to this place.

AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.author: Joe G.
AnXCOnAFU69mQ6xzdgBleQ.description: the food is awesome.  its just way faster to slaughter your own pig, rise your own yeast and wait for your own potatoes to grow.  i would love to eat here again, its just faster to eat somewhere else.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Mark R.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description:
The best Chinese food you can find in all of Pittsburgh. Staff is also friendly.

General Tso's and the Beef Lo Mein noodles are our favorite.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Larissa G.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description:
I ordered from Red Dragon a couple times earlier this year due to it being close to my place of work. I haven't ordered from them in a long time though, since I quickly decided their food isn't really for me. 

The taste of my orders was always kind of "meh" - not terrible but not memorable either. I didn't even finish my last order of General Tso, since the lackluster flavoring hardly seemed worth the calories. And speaking of calories: the orders themselves always seemed extra greasy, to the point that I suspect that eating here after modifying my eating habits over the spring might overwhelm my poor stomach. 

My final star rating is based on the fact that I expect Chinese food to be an affordable and appetizing "cheat meal" when I do order it. Red Dragon unfortunately falls short, especially compared to the quality of other local eateries (Chinese and otherwise) - hence the 2 stars.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Abbie S.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: This place has a new owner and they have more Taiwanese cuisine options. I think the foods are overall pretty tasty with reasonable prices. Spareribs pork with salty egg, steak ribs with black pepper sauce, and eggplant stuffed with porks are delicious. I think other dishes should be good to try for next time.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Tony W.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description:
Their menu is separated between Chinese-American food and authentic Taiwanese food.  

I can't speak to the former but the latter( Taiwanese food) is extremely good!  I really encourage everyone to try the Taiwanese food!  This place has the most authentic Taiwanese food in Pittsburgh... and I've tried quite a few!

Do yourselves a favor and try it out!

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Jonathan H.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description:
It's pretty typical Chinese food.  The taste, flavor, texture is all equivalent to other Chinese places in the area.  And by that i mean i enjoy it.

The tables and chairs are good quality.  A lot of Chinese places in Pittsburgh have cheap tables that are falling apart and not level.  But Red Dragon has good quality.  Red Dragon also uses real plates, silver-wear, and glasses; which again not all Chinese places in the area do.  So thumbs up for the tables and plates.

I was a little confused for a second though, because this place was called "Tasty Chinese Restaurant" in the past, and now they're called "Red Dragon".  It's the same address, phone number, it just has a new name now.  Other yelp reviewer Joel A, says in his review that the old lady who Ran Tasty is not at Red Dragon; that's unfortunate, she was really nice.

A small problem I have though, is that "Sherry F" on Yelp is clearly a fake review.  And on top of that Sherry F stole my picture.  I took this picture of their General Tso and put it on Google Maps https://tinyurl.com/yadtd6o4 over a year ago.  And now Sherry F stole my picture and uploaded it to Yelp https://tinyurl.com/y8pyffw3

My photo was for "Tasty Chinese Restaurant" not for "Red Dragon".  In Sherry F's review she mentions a new chef from Taiwan.  That's fine, but if it's a whole new restaurant now, why are you using photos from the old restaurant???  Not only are you stealing people's photos, but those photos don't even represent the food at Red Dragon, because they were taken at Tasty Chinese.

As I'm writing this Red Dragon's Yelp has two 1 star reviews, and one 5 star review.  The one 5 star is from Sherry F.  Sherry seems to be copying many photos from many other people online.  And the only review she ever wrote on Yelp is for Red Dragon.  Yelp's Content Guidelines have a general guideline that says not to review your own business, and doing so is a conflict of interest.  And Sherry F doesn't disclose her connection to Red Dragon in the review.

I came to Yelp planning on giving them a 5 star, but am lowering it to a 4 after seeing them try to deceive customers with a fake review.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: 凡
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: Their beef noodle （牛肉面）is sooo good! My friends and I would all say they have the best beef noodle in pittsburgh. The noodle seems to be handmade; beef is great tasted and soft; soup is great. Adding chilies is recommended, it will taste even better.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Pam N.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: The general tso was terrible. The breading didn't stick to the chicken and was very mushy. The only good thing was the steamed rice! I won't be ordering from this place again.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Diane A.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: I had ordered yesterday a egg rolls vegetable eggrolls they weren't even cooked they were dipped in grease and The bag that  the Eggroll was put in had oil in it it was disgusting I would never recommend it to anyone I feel giving it a one star would be too much

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: 庭倫
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description:
You can get authentic Taiwanese food here.
I tried the majority of dishes on the menu, and I love most of them. My top three favorites are braised pork over rice, Shredded Beef with pepper sauce, fried rice cake.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Lerrel P.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description:
This place is great. Large quantity, delicious flavors and kind staff.

I asked for a chicken noodle soup, and they made a great one even though it was not on their menu. 

I'll definitely visit this place again.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Gregory K.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: The food is pretty good. It is a bit pricey so I'm still debating if it's worth it but it's definitely some of the better Chinese food that I've had from an establishment like this. It's a typical neighborhood Chinese restaurant, minimal seating inside, large delivery business. I will say that they have a good amount of "non-traditional American Chinese" dishes, which could be nice but I haven't gotten the chance to try many of them yet!

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Alex B.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: Our goto very casual dinner place. We have eaten at the three previous incarnations and enjoy this one too.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Joel A.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description:
If I could give this place a Zero Star Review I would. This is NOT Tasty China which used to be in the same location. Having read the reviews of others, we cautiously tried Red Dragon, placing our same order as we did at Tasty. First, this place is NOT cheap. The prices for Red Dragon are much higher than Tasty's and the food is of such a lower quality. 

We ordered General Tso Chicken, Beef Chow Fun and egg rolls. I honestly don't n ow how you mess up egg rolls but these were inedible. The taste was of something rotten. The General Yao's was full of fatty pieces with a sauce that didn't taste like any General Tso's that I've ever had before. Red Dragon's tasted more like I was chewing on a dirty dishrag. The Beef Chow Fun was soggy and mushy and lacked any flavor. 

We couldn't eat the food that was given to us because of how bad it was. The worst part is that the friendly older woman who manned the front desk is no longer there. 

Unless things drastically change - we'll never go back to Red Dragon. 

Losing Tasty China is like losing a friend- I've been going there for nearly a decade.

Edit: They  Don't Give  Out  Fortune  Cookies

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Yi Sen L.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: I am a Taiwanese and I approve this restaurant. Their beef noodle is the most authentic Taiwanese beef noodle you can get in Pittsburgh. Stinky tofu is good too.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Frank S.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: I ordered some orange chicken, lo mein, and a few appetizers to go. The food was all ready on time and tasted great. I'm interested in trying the more authentic dishes next time.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Nicole G.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: Great food and wonderful service. It's clear that the cooks know what they're doing. Every time i've eaten here I leave satisfied. Hands down the best chinese restaurant in the area, my go-to.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Gary G.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description:
First of all despite a prior controversy about someone's posted review I assure you I have no ties to the Red Dragon Restaurant other than as a consumer of their comestibles. And a happy consumer I am. Their food is of the Guangdong/Hong Kong/Taiwanese school of Chinese regional specialties and are exemplary versions of them. I've had their eggplant stuffed with pork and the texture of the eggplant was silky and the pork filling crispy (how they do it I'm not sure but has to involve several cooking steps). This dish is often included in dim sum offerings but here there is enough for two people to share over rice as long as they order another dish.They have an unusual beef roll appetizer that even folks who only eat American Chinese food can enjoy. But  really order from or eat in the restaurant their more authentic Chinese offerings; don't waste your time there ordering only American Chinese.I'm sure their chef can do it but let him cook what he himself eats and everyone wins, Another dish I love are the Chinese rice cakes with pork and very tasty greens, all the food groups in one dish! Of course their dumplings are fine as well.
I know many of us who were patrons of the former restaurant Tasty  miss the kind lady who was almost always there but please try this place on its own terms. It is not the same as Tasty and isn't even trying to be. But there is a lot of really good food to be had there.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Nadia L.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: We go to Red Dragon all the time and the food is much better than the other Chinese restaurants in the area. They have all the usual American Chinese dishes like General Tsos but they also have some more authentic dishes as well, like steamed sea bass with ginger and scallions and the salt and pepper shrimp. The food isn't super oily and over salted either.  Family owned with friendly service.  We will be back!

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Joshua C.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: This place is not as good as Tasty Chinese, which it replaced. The food is good, but doesn't stand out. The sautéed string beans were bland, the steamed dumplings tasted like they had come from prepackaged frozen dumplings, and as another reviewer already mentioned the General Tso's Chicken was all fatty meat. I did like the fried rice, but that didn't make up for everything else.

IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.author: Sherry F.
IcrFc5IwCcKyGbVmgWjVjg.description: My favorite Chinese restaurant in Pittsburgh. It opens recently but I would say the food is fresh and delicious! The chief is from Taiwan and he is good at various kinds of Chinese food. They offer American style Chinese food, wonderful Taiwanese food and other popular Chinese spicy food. I like them most because they can really provide you healthy, tiny oil, not salty food. I tried fresh fish and Eel and I think the eel is amazing

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Gina R.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description:
Pizza Bellino is a place I dedicate to when I feel like I simply cannot have enough carbs. I am not going to say the food is incredible, although it is good. The best thing about Bellino is they have amazing crust and breads. A personal pan pizza is cheap and very filling. They don't do anything particular with their sauce or cheese, so it stays mild and consistent. But their crust is always amazing! Their breadsticks are always amazing!! They make their own dough, and it shows. The breadsticks are puffed perfectly, and chewy, covered with parm and garlic sauce. People usually get really excited about olive garden breadsticks, but I am here to say that these are 10 times better. 

They have a vast menu, and the owner is always there. I do sometimes wish they would switch out their flourescent bulbs in the dining area. But definitely give Pizza Bellino a try, I think it will happily surprise you!

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Robert B.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: This pizza was probably one of the worst pizzas I've ever had, no flavor in dough, pizza sauce, even the pepperoni!! Would not recommend to pizza lovers. hope this helps someone

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Miranda E.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description:
The customer service is horrible. We were charged over $23 for a deal that was listed online as $17.99. I showed him my phone to show that the price listed online was $17.99. He said the online prices were not updated and proceeded to pull out a menu and show me the new price. He was unapologetic and did not offer to honor the price that he had failed to update online. 

Pizza really is great but customer service is bad enough that I won't go back.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Michael Z.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: This place is the worst, I went in there to get a pizza and the cashier yelled "bancode" at me because I told him my pizza was burnt.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Shannon A.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: This may have been the worst chicken parm I've ever had. The chicken was cut up in small pieces and tasted like Perdue chicken nuggets that were chewy and soggy. The cheese was burnt. Terrible. Two stars because I ordered their pizza before and liked it. Figured their other dishes would be good but I was very wrong!

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Cassie M.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: Delivery was FAST. White pizza was delicious - great crust. Eggplant Parm hoagie was meh they put like one piece of eggplant on it and some generic red sauce. Fries were good, they just needed salt. Basically the food is average and if you're hungover/need a quick bite this is a good place to stop by

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Shayne F.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description:
Back when I lived in Pittsburgh I would come in here once a week for their lunch special. The pizza has always been good but the service not so much. So this weekend I am visiting Pittsburgh and decided to stop back in and nothing has changed. The pizza is still decent enough to put up with the lack of customer service. To start, when approaching the cash register the employee did not say hello or even what would you like. It was literally a staring session for a few seconds with no dialogue when he approached the register. 

  I broke the ice and this is how the convo went.

Me: I would like two Pepperoni slices please
Him: With drink?
Me: No thank you
Him: *Sticks hand out for my credit card*
Me: Well what's the total?
Him: with no drink, $5. Turns walks away and tells them the order.
Me: Okayyyyy


Like I said, not the worst but just not very inviting.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Jayla P.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: This was one of my favorite places to eat but the delivery driver ruined everything he was very rude and demanded a tip I've also instructed all staff in my building not to order from here any more

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Will R.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: This is my first time ordering from Pizza Bellino. I ordered a white pizza and garlic wings. The delivery was timely, slightly earlier than expected. The food was basically average. It may be because I grew up on Mineo's and Caruso's and now called A'Pizza Badamo. The pizza wasn't cold but it wasn't hot either. The wings were a similar temperature. They were crispy, juicy, and well cooked. The garlic sauce was rather bland and left a lot to be desired.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Bobby W.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description:
Their delivery white pizza with ricotta and spinach is my go-to. The crust is so delicious, crispy and buttery. Lunch specials and sandwiches are great for eating in. The supreme buffalo chicken sub is very good. They also have super good slices and you can get nice toppings too. Very fresh! The slices get topped with toppings and then into the oven so they come out really crispy and delish!

The staff is always nice and very welcoming and the location is great. There are very few good delivery options in squirrel hill besides Chinese/Asian so I call Pizza Bellino when I don't want to go out.

The delivery is super super quick and always shows up piping hot. The sandwiches are not the best delivered but what hot sandwich is good if it's not as fresh as possible.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Jerome P.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: Food is always good. They could probably stand to make the crust a little lighter with less sauce but overall their salads and pizza is pretty good.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Alice W.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: Just delicious！Amazing pizza. Hawaii pizza is really good！The delivery was fast and pizza was still hot.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Leah G.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: I was looking forward to trying the white pizza with spinach and ricotta as recommended in another review i saw, but the menu was a little misleading.  I placed my order online and, while browsing the menu, I saw an option for a white pizza with spinach, ricotta, tomato, and mushrooms OR a traditional white pizza (with no ingredients or description listed.)  I thought perhaps the traditional white pizza came with spinach and ricotta (as some white pizzas at other restaurants do) but I was disappointed to find that it was just a regular cheese pizza sans sauce.  I expressed my disappointment to the man working and he was unhelpful- he merely informed me that i had ordered incorrectly and didn't offer any solutions, so i left with my pizza.  It was pretty bland and greasy but it was ok.. I mean, even bad pizza is still good.. right??

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Paige S.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description:
If I could, I would give this restaurant zero stars. My friend ordered food from them through grubhub wile we were hanging out - popcorn chicken and buffalo fries- but upon arrival,  my friend received chicken tenders instead. No big deal, but the hot food came in Styrofoam containers, and because they were stacked, the packed heat melted the containers into/onto the food. They tried a bite of the chicken and it tasted distinctly like Styrofoam. They proceeded to be violently ill for the rest of the evening. When i came back after class, we tried calling,  but the man who answered was HORRENDOUS. We politely asked for a full refund of the food we didn't eat,and were told that we had not ordered from them at all. We had to repeat ourselves several times to establish the fact that yes, we did order this food, we had the order in front of us.  He then said that the containers don't melt. Well, this picture of the container I have says otherwise.  He continously interrupted us over the phone, berated us for yelling at him (which we didn't do, we simply asked for a refund and stated why), and when he was fed up told us that it was grubhub's problem instead and refused to accept any responsibility. Honestly, if he would have just been polite and directed us to grub hub in the first place,  this wouldn't be an issue,  but because of his behavior,  we will no longer be ordering from this establishment again. On top of that, it would probably even be cheaper and more environmentally friendly if they'd just  switched to cardboard containers. Not to mention, no one would get sick.

Tldr; melted Styrofoam made my friend sick, worst customer service we've had in years.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Jam I.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: Needed to order lunch and didn't have time to pick up pizza. Found them via Grubhub with over 1,000 reviews and highly rated. I order a pepperoni pizza, it was your average run of the mill pizza. Not bad but there's many other better pizza places.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Ginger P.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: Absolutely terrible.  Cold, not marked and the owner was the rudest person I have ever spent my money with...STAY AWAY

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Bretton M.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: I ordered Bellino's through Eat Street. They sent the wrong soup, so I called Bellino's to get the correct soup sent. The man answered the phone and I nicely told him I recieved the wrong soup. Not even a second later he is screaming at me how I'm a "stupid idiot" for not calling to see what the soup was. I told him that I ordered through Eat Street and the soup I ordered was an option on the menu. He then said that both Eat Street and I are "stupid idiots" and me getting the wrong soup is my and Eat Streets fault and I got what I'm getting that's it. I asked him why he was treating a customer so rudely and he cussed at me. I then asked him if I couldn't have the potato soup then why was it on the receipt and why would they just automatically send me wedding soup? And why is it my job to call them if they don't have the soup I ordered, why wouldn't they call me and ask? He screamed at me that am a spoiled, worthless American and should ___ __! He then hung up on me. I called Eat Street and told them what happened and they were so appalled that they refunded my money and sent me a coupon for my next order through Eat Street. Thank goodness Eat Street knows how to treat their customers. I only called this man to get the correct soup, if he just said "We're sorry, we don't have it." this would have all been over and I would've been fine but he was so terribly ignorant and rude to me, that they lost a very good cutomer today and possibly lost their membership to Eat Street. Do yourself a favor and don't ever order from here, it turned my great day into a headache.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Joseph M.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: A very big menu and quick service. I stop here for my later lunch hour on weekdays. Really good if you want something for in and out eating. If you get more complex than a pie or couple slices, you might want to order ahead of time so you don't have to wait too long.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: William M.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description: I absolutely love Bellino's pizza and subs. The variety of pizzas is incredible and as a fan of their veggie it is huge and packed with flavor. The subs are large and filled with your favorites. Highly recommend Bellino's, very highly.

2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.author: Amanda J.
2UCXCbv7qaO3d8FfQd4Ing.description:
I am slightly confused by the reviews for Pizza Bellino, as they range from thrilled to enraged.  Pizza Bellino is one of the closer pizza places to my apartment, but I just made it here recently.  I stopped in because I was starving, and they sell single slices for $2.  I got a great slice of cheese pizza!  One slice was enough for a small meal, and the sauce is very nicely spiced.  The cheese quality is good too.

The service is pretty fast when you eat in, unlike Aiello's and Mineo's.  I have always had good customer service here as well.  There are crazy good lunch specials, and they always have deals in the Squirrel Hill Pennysaver.

As one of the only places that delivers in Squirrel Hill, I can imagine it can be pretty slow and tense.  I would stick to eat-in.

Good for a quick slice of pizza!

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Maria J.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
If you've been to one Olive Garden, you've been to them all in my opinion. If you haven't been there, this is a chain restaurant which serves up many classic Italian dishes and more. 

Each meal is served with soup or endless bowl of salad. I highly recommend the salad which has their signature Olive Garden dressing topped with onions, tomatoes, black olives, croutons and pepperoncini. I've enjoyed many dishes and haven't had one I hate, however, the eggplant Parmesan is greasy in my opinion and I've had better elsewhere. They have great lunch options too which are lighter making overeating less likely! While I typically prefer a mom and pop non-chain restaurant. Olive Garden is a reliable choice which you can find in many cities and get a decent meal.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Candace S.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
It saddens me to have to write this experience,  but this was one of the most horrible experiences I've had a Olive Garden.  We were celebrating my cousin's birthday, and he was so disappointed by the time we left.  We had a server, Tiffany, and she was not very attentive.  We had a party of 8, in which I didn't think it should have been as difficult as she made it.  The restaurant was not busy at all, and there were so many empty seats all around us.

When we were seated, our drink orders were taken and we decided to put in a few appetizers.  She wrote them down and came back 20 minutes later with only one drink!  Then she proceeded to take our dinner orders, and stated the drinks will be right up. 10 more minutes later she finally brought the other seven drinks.

We are sitting there hungry, waiting for soup/salad, apps or something, and then 20 minutes later she decided to bring our soups and salad.  It took almost an hour for soup and salad?!?  She never asked us for refills on the drinks, instead she brought a pitcher of pink lemonade, yet nobody ordered pink lemonade.  We just chalked it up and kept waiting.  So here we are, 1 hour 15 min later and finally the appetizers come out (only 3 lasagna frittas).  They were disappointing because they were not hot and the sauce started to settle and harden, which tells me they were done for a while sitting under a lamp, and then she finally decided to bring them to us.

So here we are 1 hour 40 minutes later and the entrees come out.  The mashed potatoes were cold, but the chicken was hot.  She brought another pitcher of pink lemonade, hence no drink refill order taken.  It was such a disappointing experience.

Finally, my family get their take home orders and they were were incorrect and overcharged, so she had to adjust the bill.  Finally  I think the worst is over and I'll avoid this place going forward, but I was wrong.

We split the check 3 ways among our party, and my card was charged twice.  I'm thinking my it just a hold and once it settles, it will fall off. -wrong.  First it was charged in the wrong amount (higher than what I signed for) and then it posted twice.  So now I'm out of almost $100 until the manager resolves this.  I called on Monday and it's now Friday and my money still has not returned.

Never again

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Lynn E.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
I went solo for lunch yesterday.  Right off the bat, I got a creepy vibe from my waitress.  She kept staring into my eyes without blinking as she talked.  It was weird, like she was waiting for me to answer some unasked question.  Of course, there were a few questions she did forget to ask when she stopped over to check on me.  
"Would you like some more iced tea?" once or twice, would have been nice.

On to the food...
Salad was absolutely drenched in dressing.  Wilted lettuce swimming at the bottom of the bowl...so sad.
I ordered spaghetti and meatballs because I had a craving for Italian after checking out Alla Famiglia's menu.  Which I hope to get to next week.

The food Olive Garden was very disappointing.  The meatballs has some sort of crunch on the inside when I bit into them.  Not sure what that could be...maybe I don't want to know.  Also they were flavorless.  Spaghetti was just ok, but the marinara sauce was very watery and there wasn't enough of it.

Overall pretty disappointing experience at the OG.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Bonnie C.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description: Worst server ever. Never smiled, drinks took 40 minutes.  Very haphazard service.  Waited a long time for refills.  Food was good.  It was a family gathering of 7 but the restaurant wasn't busy, she just didn't seem to care.  Her nametag indicated Mich as her name.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Jackie M.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
Terrible food, just don't go. Bar ok, service ok, food terrible! 
Previously pretty good, managers are 12 year old lost in spaces

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Jason S.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
I frickin love HERBY, the FOOD, the people!!

Yet, it is time after 20 years to upgrade your bathrooms. Every time I go in I slip on the floor of grossness (and No it was not just mopped). I almost want to report to ACHD. It is only a matter of days (hint) before I fall and....well you know

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Karla D.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
I have to say The Greentree Olive Garden is one of the nicer versions of the chain in our area. Back in the day the one at Village Square was it for me.
Menu is the same as all locations but service is miles better here.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Larry J.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description: Typical Olive Garden good food Great service great location right off of 376  however we haven't been here in a while I feel like the prices are getting a little expensive for a chain restaurant.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Emily W.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
Just an overall GREAT experience at the Greentree Olive Garden! Wonderful service! Excellent food!! Just out on a evening date with my sons!! We kept talking about how great everything was! Also a manager stopped by to check on us!! Superb!!
Dayla G was our outstanding waitress!!!

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Wayne O.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description: Had a great experience on fathers day. We had 6 adults and 9 grandkids. Olive garden is not one of my favorite places but my daughter's wanted to go there.We had seating for 15 . Our waittess was fantastic some of the best service I've had and I eat out a lot. Took drink orders arrived within 5 min . Very attentive refills extra bread sticks . Interactive with kids she was great.food ok.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Larissa G.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
I love me some Olive Garden - always have. Yes, I'm very aware the food here is as American as apple pie and not authentic Italian in the least. It's not a secret, and I've always enjoyed Olive Garden for what it is and nothing more. I'm particularly fond of this location since it's usually a little less crowded than the one by the South Hills Village Mall. I say usually because the last time I was here the place was paaaaaaaaacked. Apparently Tuesday nights are the night for pasta in Pittsburgh now?

In case you didn't know, Olive Garden recently(ish) overhauled their menu and cooking styles, and I've really enjoyed eating at Olive Garden since then. The best addition for me has been the creation of lighter fare dishes, which are what I usually order now. The chicken and tilapia piccata dishes have become my go-to items - both are served with parmesan-crusted zucchini, and both are prepared in zesty sauces that compliment the protein and don't ruin your calorie counting efforts for a month.

But of course, the salad bowl and breadsticks are still a staple here, and they admittedly kind of ruin all my healthy eating efforts after I order those healthier main dishes. But I could never skip them - not when they're such a key part of a meal here! Once I add in those, it's more like I'm ruining my calorie count for the week at worst. And...that's admittedly not a terrible price to pay for those beloved breadsticks!

Consistently good service and tasty cocktails are the cherries on top of a place that I've always been fond of. One day, I'll be back ready to splurge on one of those pasta dishes - but until then, piccata dishes it is for this girl!

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Valarie J.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
I honestly come to Olive Garden because I know I am going to get pretty good meal here. 

We ordered the create your own pasta ( angel hair, shrimp, alfredo)  and the chicken and shrimp carbonara. Both means we're very hot and pretty good. There was plenty of meat and lots of sauce. The Alfredo was a little bland but with some extra cheese was better.

We also had the unlimited salad and chicken gnocchi soup and they were both great.

The best part of the experience was our server Edwin. He was super nice and attentive. He was already there when we were looking for him. He did an exceptional job.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Portia H.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
4/30/18  I ordered yesterday.  I ordered an eggplant sandwich and a salad.  I was kinda disappointed that it came with fries:-(  An order taker who listens to your ordering a vegetable sandwich and salad should warn of the fries, but it didn't.  I was at least happy that they put ketchup on the side.  It came in a nice big compostable paper bag.  The salad was not the best.  I trashed the soggy tomatoes.  The black olives were good. What really messed up the salad were the rancid croutons.

5/1/18

The eggplant sandwich was good so I ordered it again today.  I asked for them not to put the garlic and salt on the top.  They did, BUT they also did NOT give a side of ketchup:-(  I am a ketchup lover so I came home and opened a new bottle of ketchup.  I had the sense not to order the salad.  I informed the ladies at the counters that the croutons were rancid.  Hopefully this will prevent you from getting the rancid croutons.  I got the Pasta Fagioli soup and it was WAY better than the salad.  The price of this light lunch is good. $7.48 all in.  You also get (2) breadsticks.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Brittany H.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description: The food was good; however the seat was dirty and the service was terrible. The order never went in and we had to wait so long for our food. They left dirty dishes in the table way too long even though we had them stacked where they could easily get them out of the way. The server barely apologized for our almost two hour dinner or made it up to us in anyway. We were told the manager would be over and he/she never came. Disappointed with this location.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Debi P.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
*Dirty seats
*Smelly Water
*No silverware 
*Pay money for a plate?! For real!

This is probably the worst branch of Olive Garden I have ever been to. The person who took us to seating arrangement did not even clean the seating area before inviting us. There were food pieces on the seat and a crayon! I had to call that girl back from front-desk to get it cleaned.
I took two of my friends for a farewell dinner. We ordered Chicken pasta and Shrimp Scampi each with a side of salad. The server lady arrived with 2 plates and a bowl of salad. When I asked for a 3rd plate, she said sorry maam, you have to add another salad if you want another plate. Are you kidding me?!
We decided to ignore her stupidity and managed with plates provided for bread. Then came the smelly glasses of water. It was so smelly that we had to ask the sever to return it and replace with new water. A basic glass of water should not be that complicated. Second set of water arrived, still smelly. I guess they need to take a look at dish cleaning department. 
Little annoyed with this event, when we decided to start on salad, there were no silverware served. My friend walked up to front desk to ask for silverware. Such poor service!
These kind of blunder can be avoided by just placing silverware before placing the guests. Common sense!!!
I still ended up paying a tip as she had to change those smelly glasses of water so many times, which the cleaning department should be blamed for.
Never coming back to this place again! 
Smelly water, no silverware and you have to pay money to get an extra plate. This place/staff needs training!

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Heather R.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description:
I'm writing my review as I sit here, having this train wreck of a meal. My server has absolutely no idea how to do her job. I don't say this lightly as I've worked in restaurants for the past 25 years. I wouldn't normally eat here, but my kiddo got to choose dinner tonight, so here we are. 
1. Sat here staring at my food because I wasn't given silverware to eat it with. 
2. Unable to wash the food down because our drinks were also forgotten (not refilled, didn't get them until after my entree arrived). 
3. Forgot my child's entree. I was already finished with my plate (I took my time), before the server realized that she never brought my daughter her food. 
4. Has no idea how the "endless pasta" thing works. Told me she didn't think that I could order something different than my first plate. Wrong again. 
5. Forgot drink refills and soup. 
6. Wears so much perfume I can literally taste it. 
7. I was overcharged on my bill. 

I'm sure I'll remember more after I leave, but I won't be back again. I would have expected a manager to have shown up by now either explaining this was her first day of her first serving job ever, or for Ashton Kusher to pop out telling me I've been Punked. 
I'm still going to tip 20%, as this isn't really her fault. The blame falls on the manager for this one. He or she has put someone out on the floor that is obviously not ready, and isn't doing service audits to make sure they know their job.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: J D.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description: I would avoid coming here during the week around lunch. This place gets very crowded and the service has been slow on multiple occassions. Food is your typical OG food.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Derek Z.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description: I get that it is a chain restaurant but they really need to make something in house. You can tell that everything is frozen from the soup to the dessert, the sodium wow. I gave them three stars because the service was good. If you like sodium then you like chain restaurants then this one won't disappoint.

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Gianna L.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description: in the middle of eating my meal and there were just plates piling up next to me. multiple people walked around swerving in between the tables and the dirty plates and didn't do anything about it. a host sat 3 tables and two servers walked by without even acknowledging dirty meals next to my face. it was absolutely so disgusting and I was planning on giving this two stars because the food is always good, but there was a hair in it. on top of everything... the service was really bad and all of our soups were cold for something that was "fresh out of the oven"

Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.author: Berni D.
Ky0X7OLqSeBpvNNf0NjVcg.description: Haven't been here in a while and boy things have gone downhill food wise...  First why does this place smell so bad? Especially when you first walk in the door? You expect to smell Italian food smells, but it smells more like dirty mop water.  The service was not bad, but the food was horrible.  I don't remember ever having to beg and wait for a few olives on my salad. The soup was very salty and flavorless, and my sandwich was sad... barely anything between the bread.  I'd ordered the same lunch item in the past, but it was actually very good before...  It is very hard for them to make any changes or adjustments to items because, as I was told, everything is pre-made and frozen.  The sauces are flavorless and not even as good as what you get from a jar at the grocery store.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Ken L.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
It takes me 45 minutes to get here.  I barely make it in before closing time.  I have tried 7 different dishes in 2 visits.  Bottom line verdict up front:  best Thai in town hands down.

Crab rangoons:  golden crunch outside, a hardier crab cream cheese inside.  

Papaya Salad: fresh, crisp and refreshing however I wish they would shred it more finely. Careful on spice as this one is more susceptible to spice levels!

Fried Tilapia - this is normally topped with their house special curry type sauce but I prefer it on the side to prevent sogginess. Dip when necessary.  Very good sauce and decent fish portions.

Drunken noodles with Beef!  Hot steaming plate made to order!  Flat Rice noodles are soft, chewy and silky in your mouth.

Thai Tea - finally a place that puts less emphasis on type II diabetes sweet!  Just enough sweet and smoothness here.

Crab Fried Rice.  Nice portions of crab and actually moist and delicious.  

Highly recommended when GOOD Thai is warranted.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: David B.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
Rick Sebak has recommended this place many times, but I finally got here, and it even exceeded all expectations.  Everything was prepared fresh and the spices were perfect.

Our server was very helpful and attentive. We appreciated the excellent service.  It's a small dining room, but rather cute.

Everything was deliciously prepared, and our final bill was especially reasonable.

We enjoyed meeting the owner/chef, and we have been back several times.  They are continually adding new dishes.  They recently added Monday dining, which works great, because other places are usually closed.

But last Monday, they served the absolute best Mango and Sticky Rice that I have ever tasted.  The Mango was perfectly ripe and flavorful, and the toasted seed topping completed this very traditional presentation.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Darren M.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
Amazingly nice people and fantastic food. Be aware, the place is tiny. There are only 3 tables.

This is probably the best Thai in Pittsburgh, hands down, and I've tried them all.

Save room for the Thai tea ice cream. A real treat!

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Daniel M.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
It's been a while since I had a really good Panang curry as the one here, and the pad see ew is delicious as well!
Really good find.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Laura C.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description: Kao soy with shrimp, 7 has the perfect amount of heat. Cross between a soup and curry topped with fried onions and a good amount of veggies. I have never tried this before but now it's all I can order. Friendly, quick service to boot. (Disclaimer: small dining area, photo taken at home)

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: South U.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
Sweet charming little family owned spot. Super delicious and fresh!!! They don't have many vegan options and didn't seem that familiar w it but were happy to guide me to what works. None of the curries can be made vegan/real vegetarian (fish oil). 
I ordered the avocado spring roles w peanut sauce and the basil eggplant w steamed tofu instead of fried. 
Sooo good. Sat at little cafe table in the window and watched a giant rain storm roll in while the aroma of Thai spices, basil, garlic- filled the room. Seemed like sisters were running it. Magic.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Nicole W.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
This place is amazing. I am so excited that we have a great Thai place in my area. The staff and owner is wonderful - they are friendly and polite and will help you out with anything. 

My favorites are the avocado spring rolls and the spicy eggplant. I've never been disappointed by anything on the menu. 

Note: It is a very small place - I typically order takeout. If you decide to eat in, just know that you might need to wait. 

Whatever you do, make sure you try it!

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Wes N.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description: Loved this place, a great spot in Blawnox. The restaurant space is pretty small, I think they only have three tables. It is a BYOB so plan accordingly. Our waitress was super sweet and very friendly, service was quick too. We started with the Avocado Fresh Rolls, they were very good. Their peanut sauce is delicious. I had the Pad Thai which was also very good, they are happy to make it extremely spicy if that's your thing. Prices are very reasonable. Would definitely come back here, would recommend checking it out!

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Andrea M.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description: Our favorite for Thai takeout. It's a fun, intimate dine in experience as well, but be aware that they do not have much air conditioning. Any of the noodle dishes are a favorite, and I think we're spoiled for life on crab rangoon after trying theirs. Good service- our orders are almost always waiting for us when we get there, and they have comfortable places to wait on the rare occasion they're not. Don't be afraid to order your food a little on the spicy side, but they'll adjust the level of heat for your taste.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Greg T.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
Came in based on the very good reviews and we were not disappointed. Due to the very small seating area there was about a 10 minute wait for a table for lunch but it was well worth the time.

We started off with a few appetizers; the chive dumplings, chicken satay and avocado spring rolls. All were excellent with the chive pancakes and the rolls being our favorites.  

For my entrée I went with the Pad Cha Special which was shredded rhizome root, lime leaves, red pepper and green bean in spicy brown sauce which I asked for, and came out, spicy. It was large enough that I could have probably taken leftovers but it was so good I couldn't stop eating it. We washed this down with a few Thai iced teas that made the meal even more enjoyable.

Service and prices were very good.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Leah K.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description: We love this place. Fresh, authentic thai great for takeout. We love the chive dumplings, pad peanut noodles and any of the curries, especially the pumpkin. Great friendly local place but very limited seating.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Terrence Michael L.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
Pretty small place, seating maybe a party of 6, 4, and 2 at one time. Couldn't tell if there's a bathroom in here either but the parking was easy on the street!

I got medium spice Pad Kee Mao and it wasn't that spicy but it wasn't that flavorful overall either. Probably will have to try going back and getting something else! 

Their lunch specials are a pretty good price for an egg roll, small sample, and lunch entrée which is what attracted me in the first place. Didn't get to try any of the drinks either but the thai tea is made in-house and sounded pretty good!

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Glenn S.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
Easily my favorite Thai restaurant in Pittsburgh!
Close to home & work, very reasonable prices,
and the best Pad Kee Mao this side of Thailand!

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: R J.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
Super nice people, but average food. No American style iced tea, so it's water or super sweet Thai Iced Tea. 
Ordered Tom Kha soup with tofu, broth was good but so much tofu and mushrooms that there was hardly any broth. 
Had Pad Thai, disappointing- really greasy. They use quality ingredients, that's appreciated. 
Maybe just a bad day.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Yue L.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description: So tasty! Good price! Easy to find parking! The owner is nice and friendly~ The only issue is limited seats~ anyway,really really recommend :)

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Keith C.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
I always worry about trying a new Thai place. Most popular Thai restaurants sweeten their curries so much they should be on the dessert menu. Maenam Thai is one of the best exceptions in Pittsburgh. I ordered the Maenam Pork Soup and Chicken Basil with Fried Egg. These were both new dishes to me, and they are my new Thai favorites. The medium spice level had just the right kick for me.

The seating is quite limited, with just two indoor tables and one outdoor. But we were able to sit right down at 2pm on a Saturday for a late lunch. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. I will definitely go back again.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: A B.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description:
Best authentic Thai in the... well, not quite in the city. But definitely worth the quick drive outside of the city.

I've had a few of the dishes. My favorite is the Pad Thai. My friends were all excited about their meals, as well. The owner is sweet and helpful and wants nothing more than for you to be happy and fulfilled. 

Sure, there is not much seating, but I've never had to wait long during lunch time. I recommend stopping in.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Edith D.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description: This is a sweet little family owned restaurant with fresh homemade recipes using high quality ingredients. Delightful, modest and affordable and always a plus to see small, single, privately owned restaurant rather than the mushrooming of these chains. Had the papaya salad which was perfectly seasoned and delicious for a summer evening enjoyed on the sidewalk table they have set up in the front right before heading to Moondog's for authentic live blues

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Scott K.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description: So great to have an excellent spot like this in Blawnox.  We order takeout weekly.  The curries are our favorite, particularly the Green, Mango, and Pumpkin.

mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.author: Glenda M.
mHvPsn0FMc_lg7rH4wvTfA.description: Fabulous!  Had fresh avocado roll served with warm peanut sauce. Delicious!  Then green curry with chicken. This dish was packed with eggplant, broccoli, green beans, red peppers, thai basil and chicken. The best I have had in the Pittsburgh area. Had to try the Thai tea ice cream (even though I was very full) it was light and delightful perfect ending!  Only a few tables inside and one table outside. We were lucky and got to sit outside. Will definitely be back to try some other dishes.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Ralph W.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: Good authentic Italian food there are not to many places like this these day that have this only issue tacky decor old carpeting ceiling with leak stains. And chairs still there from when I was A child. But I recommend the food. It is very good especially the meatballs and potatoe balls. As well.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Jason H.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: This "restaurant" is absolutely hideous. This was my first time ever at this place and it was a disgrace. The food was awful and overpriced, my 1 y/o daughter had wood chips coming from her hi-chair. (The hi-chair is probably 40 years old...) The carpets were disgusting and looked like they hadn't been cleaned in years. I will never go here again, please don't waste your time. After tonight I realized this establishment is an embarrassment to Pittsburgh's Little Italy. If you want good Italian cuisine, go to Alexander's or The Pleasure Bar. You couldn't pay me enough to go back.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Jen C.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: So, I did read the reviews while sitting in the restaurant and I don't 100% understand where they were coming from.  I went in with a table of 6 and immediately fell in love with the nostalgic authentic vibe.  This restaurant feels like it's owned by a family or hardworking individual who has run it for years and years.  It didn't feel like a chain or like they were trying to trip up their customers with the promise of a great atmosphere.  The food spoke for itself.  I ordered the angel hair pasta with meatballs and my only regret is that I didn't ask for an order with two sides of meatballs - I though they were that good.  I would definitely come by again.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Joe B.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: My family has been coming to Lombardozzi's for over thirty years for graduations and celebrations of every type. We just did a family event (the first in several years) and I was reminded why they've been around for so long. The food was excellent for 50 people. The Chicken Marsala, Roast Beef, Rigatoni and more was perfectly cooked. The attention to details and service was great.  The staff were super friendly and Tony Lombardozzi was a true true professional working through the (sometimes picky) needs of our group. It doesn't hurt that they have 2 great private party spaces (we were upstairs this time) with no room fees. I've been there at least 20 times over the years. Our 85 year old mother, at least 100 times. And the next generation continues to run a great restaurant. Thank you, Lombardozzi's!

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Guglielmo I.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description:
Stop here after visiting a relative at the hospital. The waitress was very accommodating.  My bf has fried calamari , he enjoyed it very much.  I had the bruschetta..very flavorful. 
We both had the manicotti with meat sauce..also very good. I wasn't thrilled with the meatballs. L..small and not much flavor for $4.95.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Amy B.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: One of the worst restaurant experiences ever.  Service was extremely slow.  There were two tables including us when we got there.  It took 10 minutes to take drink orders.  Food arrived more than 40 minutes after we ordered.  I got the wrong meal.  The waitress offered to get me the right one, but I didn't want to wait another 40 minutes.  The crab imperial was rubbery and very overpriced.  Another person ordered eggplant parmesan.  It was sliced so thick that it was still crunchy when it was served.  She couldn't even eat it.  I won't even consider giving this place a second chance.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Ron A.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: I love this place. The food is always flavorful. I've never had a bad experience there in my numerous visits. Do yourself a favor and check this place out. The lunch buffet is the best bargain. It's W-F 11-2. Great food!

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Donna H.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: Sadly, this Bloomfield icon has seen better days. We recently had a dinner for 60 people at Lombardozzi's. We appreciated having a separate room downstairs for our event. The dinner was buffet-style with two servers dishing up the food. The restaurant ran out of every dish, even bread, so people were standing in line waiting for more food to materialize. When the pasta marinara ran out, someone dumped a pot of newly cooked plain pasta in the pan, but no additional sauce. The two young servers were wonderful, so the problems weren't their fault. However, since the servers were determining portions, it's not like our group members piled their plates with a pound of pasta and three chicken breasts each! Someone seriously underestimated the food needed for 60 people. I do agree that the fried zucchini was tasty. Take note: wine choices are very limited here.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Karla D.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: I live just about a five minute walk from here and had never been. I wanted to go because it always reminded me of the places I'd go with my Nana when she wasn't busy cooking up her own homemade Italian delights. The food here was really good though the marinara sauce was a tad watery. Wedding soup was full of flavor. Unlimited bread that always is a winner with me. The service is really good too. Clearly their business is now parties, banquets, etc but you still get the feeling of how it once was there: Crowded, white glove, high end Italian dining in the days of old. I liked it and I will return.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Amanda J.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description:
No idea how this place is still in business.  Dad and I came in on a Thursday night.  Our waiter was the cook, bartender, and host.  For two hours, this place was deserted except for us.  A touch suspicious.

I ordered a gnocchi dinner with lobster and crab in Alfredo sauce ($22.95).  There was a plethora of seafood in this dish, although it was not the best gnocchi I have ever eaten.  The Alfredo sauce was also a bit too garlicy because it lacked any other flavoring.  The entree was not bad, but it wasn't the greatest Italian food either.  The fresh bread was good.  However, I was really unimpressed with the salad.  The dressing was overly strong, and there was far too much of it.  Just an ok meal.

In the future, I will definitely go to the Pleasure Bar over Lombardozzi's.  The food is cheaper and the quality of the Italian food is better.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Christie W.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: I had the chicken Alfredo very delicious a little pricey but worth it service could be way better the waiter kept whispering stuff under his breath couldn't hear him though

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Kylie R.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: We were pretty much the only ones in the restaurant (there were two other 2-tops and a small party in the back) and the service was horrible. I was hoping to show my family a good time as they were visiting from out of town and our waitress spent more time by the bar on her phone than she did attending to us. Our wine glasses were dirty so we had to send them back and ask for new glasses. It took 15 minutes to get waters and they came without lemons, even when we had asked for some lemon.  The waitress wasn't knowledgeable on the food items and my parents weren't able to ask for another glass of wine because by the time she came back to the table they were done their meals. We were very disappointed and I wish I had taken them somewhere else.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Tina B.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description:
This review is for their banquet room and not for their regular menu. I came here for a communion party and what a place to hold such an occasion. There is definitely a family feel here. 

Food was served buffet style, but there were servers to place the food on our plates, which I thought was very nice. Taste-wise, the food was delicious. On the menu was baked chicken, penne pasta, meatballs, fried zucchini, potato balls, salad and bread. Chicken was moist and well-seasoned. Meatballs were also moist and flavorful. My favorites were the fried zucchini and potato balls. The potato balls were pieces of potato, breaded and fried. They were soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. I'm definitely curious as to how the regular menu is and definitely plan on coming back!

Service was also great. The servers served our food from the buffet trays and they also cleared our empty plates out of our way quickly. The reason for my docking of one star is that it was so dark in there! The restaurant's outdated brown decor didn't brighten anything up either. I suppose it makes the place feel like you're over nana's house or something, but the darkness made it feel a little depressing.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Mike P.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: Honestly the owner should close the doors.  Had a couple that wanted to eat there and would not change their mind so I agreed to go.  Where does one start? The decor is 1978 and they haven't put a dime into it.  Very dark inside so use your phone for a flashlight to read menu, I think this is done on purpose because carpet is so old and dirty.  They have a fella trying to be the bartender and waiter at same time, it just does not work, for crying out loud, hire a waitress or waiter !!  The prices are expensive , in $27-30 range for dinner, the food is in $9.99 cafeteria range, and the taste is not even as good as decent cafeteria.  My steak was freezer burnt , salad soaked in dressing, and everything ala carte. Bread stale, had to ask for menu, drinks and water , again the OWNER needs to hire staff if you wish to charge $29.50 for a simple dish. And maybe hire a chef while you are at it.   Maybe paint the place and put in a few light bulbs and new carpet, booths and chairs.... Any restaurant on Liberty is by far a better choice.  Shame  on owner.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Victoria S.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description:
I have been coming here for almost 3 decades (my entire being). This restaurant has a place in my heart and many members of my family. Being that I was raised in an Italian culture, I have much appreciation for the taste and quality of their food. 
  Today we had a small banquet, of about 30 people, for lunch to celebrate a mile stone. We arrived early, but were very much welcomed and the back room was all set up for us already. The server was very friendly, welcoming and ready for our group. 
   The room set up was put together very nicely. The tables were set up in a long/3 sided way so that we were all together at "one" table. I liked that very much. 
   We picked a buffet style lunch. The chicken was a fried chicken that was not dry and had a good amount of meat. The penne with marinara was so good. I love their sauce! The meatballs are home made and seasoned very well, smothered in their marinara sauce. We also had their fried zucchini and these amazing fried potato balls! I'm telling you, these potato things are awesome! I didn't know they were going to be served, but I'm so happy they were! 
   The cost of the banquet, service, and setting were very much affordable! I am very happy with everything and am looking forward to another visit. 
    P.S. This is a perfect place for a nice Italian dinner for two. They are family owned and have been around since the 70's. They know what they are doing here.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Patrick P.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description:
I pulled into this unassuming restaurant for lunch.    The place is old school.   I feel as if I am in a Good Fella's movie.     There aer 2 standup gambling syle video game machines (think space invaders but they are are called "Magical Odds and the other one is not named but has is a memory game.

The place is very friendly.    

I ordered the wedding soup and the Spinach Gnocchi with a Crown and Diet Coke- I needed a drink after driving the hot wheels track known as Downtown Pittsburgh - I think my GPS needed a drink too ;-)...

My wedding soup arrived and I felt it was a littel under seasoned but that is something I can definitely add - no dings here.

The Gnocchi arrived and it was quite tasty.     The pasta was done right - I had felt like I was eating spinach dumplings.    I orignally was going to request a meat but this meal needed none of that nonsense.

They have a lunchtime buffet that looked good but I wanted to try something made fresh for my first stop.

Overall - I like this place

Service - Great - super friendly
Food - Very good - The Gnocch and their other homade pastas deserve a try
Price - My meal (dinner menu) was $17.

Check this place out - it will definitely take you back to the 70's :-)

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Darren W.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description:
Kay and I took a friend and Bloomfield native to Lombardozzi for dinner Friday evening. I specifically came to Lombardozzi since it was one of those restaurants that had been nagging me; I hadn't been to Lombardozzi since I joined Yelp 3.5 years ago, my last visit occurring sometime in 2002, I believe. 

Now, I found nothing "unappealing" about the interiors as another reviewer put it. It is classy and old-fashioned like many a neighborhood restaurant, which puts it in the same realm as nearby Del's. Traditional, modest, and eternal are words that come to mind regarding Lombardozzi. A jolly family banquet was afoot in the room next to us, and we didn't mind in the least as we caught up with one another, carrying on with our lively conversation as the clan behind us did. Thus, we found that the atmosphere was highly welcoming. 

Overall, Lombardozzi swayed wildly between a 3 and a 4 and stopped somewhere in between for me. 

For starters, service was somewhat spotty. We had 3 different servers ask us for our orders. Even the third and final server admitted that he was mildly annoyed with the lack of communication. 

Why I ordered Crabmeat Imperial, I can't tell you. I really didn't know what else I wanted and figured its high price ($25!) would lead me towards seafood euphoria, and it mostly did. Crabmeat and stuffing filled a trio of oyster shells with thick, sweet, meaty succulence, but damn it if the portion was stingy! It was so miserly, I was jealous of what my dining companions ordered for their entrees were not only cheaper, their rations were far more generous!

The opening salad suffered from being overdressed with a vinaigrette that I would have liked had my greens not been swimming in it. 

My last course, on the other hand, was a winning chalice of Bananas Foster, which I only ordered since the restaurant was out of most of their other desserts for the evening. A rite of cinnamon, caramel, vanilla ice cream, whipped topping, and of course, bananas, I was reminded of why BF is the most ornate of all sundaes. Warmth dandled with cold. Salt and spice embraced sugar and cream. Chunks of hot, pappy starch mingled with everything. Elegance, simple, elegance. 

Did I merely order poorly? You tell me. I REALLY wanted to like Lombardozzi more than I did. Something's telling me that a return visit and a plate of meatball-studded gnocchi will yield better results.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Jo P.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: The restaurant was dead.  Couldn't serve their breaded clams cause they didn't make the stuffing that day.  Service was very slow.  Food was ok.  Pasta was mushy.  Bread was not fresh.  Used to have a crispy Italian bread from Sancholis.  Not the same Italian restaurant we used to love.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Brandon F.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description: Lombardozzi's is an average Italian restaurant. The food is OK and the service isn't great. This restaurant is not one that I will frequently revisit.

WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.author: Maria Q.
WLixYfXWO1Q0b_L4PsQ-5w.description:
Don't waste your time!
Oh, where should I start..?
My family and friends came here for a Sunday lunch. The prices are crazy high (for -cheap- pasta). The menu outside the building and website doesn't match what they show you at the table. One of our guest was the last one to receive his perfectly square cheese ravioli and the filling was still frozen! (You'd think that for a $16 ravioli plate you'd get home made). After they microwaved it it was barely fit to eat. Some had flavorless Chicken Piccata, Fish and Eggplant Parmigiana. The atmosphere didn't help. The only thing with an aroma in this place was the tomato sauce. 
I don't understand the big fuzz some make about this restaurant. What a joke!

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Charlie D.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description:
Great tasting pizza for an unbeatable price ($10 large). The subs are better than the pizza even. If you're in the area or live nearby this is your best option. Any time I call it's always 19-20 minutes and it's ready in exactly that time frame.

Edit: THE HOAGIES ARE SO GOOD

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Wes N.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: Eddie's is great. The place itself definitely isn't going for high marks on aesthetics, it's a pretty small and simple. But what they do get high marks on is their food. They have a big menu and the prices are super low (like $9 for a large pizza). It is cash only. Everything from the cheese to the crust on the pizza is just right. The folks working there always seem pretty friendly too.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Patrick G.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: My first time at this place.     Everyone in there very friendly.    I'll be taking this trip across town again for this pizza n wings.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Jay D.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: After many years, I finally had a chance to try Eddie's Pizza Haus. We got two large pizzas (1 sausage & 1 cheese). I really wish I would have tried this place sooner as the pizza is really good.  I will definitely be a returning customer here.  I recommend a visit if you happen to be in the area.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Erin W.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description:
I feel absolutely horrible for giving a 2-star review of this place. 
As a Morningside resident, I was really hoping to love and support the Pizza Haus. I ordered pizza from here for the first time a few days ago. I was probably the worst pizza I've ever had in Pittsburgh. 
The price was great, but that was the only thing that was a plus. The crust was very tough. The sauce was so incredibly bland. And there was just an insane amount of cheese.
Never in my household has a pizza been left unfinished (left over cold pizza is the best breakfast of course!), but we threw away probably 1/3 of the large pie. 
I'll give it another shot and try the hoagies, but I'm going to permanently pass on the pizza.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Chelsea W.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: I've been eating this since I was a kid its never changed and the prices haven't really either. It's a great place if you want local neighborhood  pizza or pizza shop food. I tell alotta people not from around here to check it out!

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Michelle S.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: Great pizza but their hoagies are amazing! The chicken fingers are really good too (we get them for our 5-yr-old daughter who loves them). The pizza is a bit on the greasy side, but it's that good game night/ have a beer kind of grease. The dough is fluffy & flavorful. Only downfall is they're cash only which is kinda tricky when the pizza urge hits & no one has cash. Rite-aid down the street has an ATM though.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Michael M.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: This is a small takeout and delivery pizza shop in Morningside.  It has good pizza and salads and I presume the hoagies are also good but I have not tried them.  They doe a very good business and customers appear satisfied with a lot of repeat business.  It appears to be a local favorite.  I had avery good slice of pizza, good cheese, nice sauce and well prepared.  You can get served as a walk-in in 10 minutes or less.  Not the best pizza in Pittsburgh but adequate.  The owners, cooks and staff are all friendly and engaging.  Definitely has a neighborhood feel. I'll definitely be back when I am close by.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Neil N.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: Great pizza. Dough always fresh, sauce has a nice tang, cheese blend is just right. Delivery has been prompt each time. Definitely our fav neighborhood pizza delivery place.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Abigail W.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: Really great local pizza. Probably the best crust I've had in a while. Very inexpensive for Pittsburgh but you can taste quality ingredients. They don't have many specialty pizzas. So, don't call in an ask for the works. They don't have it. But if you want a delicious shredded Italian sausage pizza, or a white pizza with tomatoes, they got you.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Sharon O.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: I've lived less than a mile from Eddie's for the last twenty years.  I often drove past the store but up until two years ago I never stopped.  I mean how good could a pizza shop in the middle of Morningside be?  The answer is darn good.  I gave Eddie's a try on the recommendation of a friend.  My first order was for a pepperoni pizza.  It was at least as good as any pizza that I'd gotten from one of those places in Squirrel Hill.  The pie was cooked to perfection with a crispy outside crust. The red sauce has a kick to it and is not too spicy or sweet.  There was a generous portion of pepperoni and enough cheese that you'd never never have to order it as an extra.  From that day on Eddie's became my go-to pizza shop.  Their subs are reported to be even better than their pizza but I really can't speak to that.  I'm a pizza girl all the way.  I don't mean to give the impression that Eddie's doesn't have s few hiccups.  It's a family business and they shut their doors promptly at 10pm, and they're closed on Sunday.  At times the quality can be inconsistent.  Not the food itself, but occasionally there will be too much or too little sauce on the pie or the crust is less than crispy.  A lot depends on which member of the staff makes your pizza.  I always try to order between 4:00 and 9:00.  Eddie is almost always there at that time.  Eddie oversees all of the food preparation and nothing inferior leaves the shop when he's around.  Another minus is their delivery charge.  I'm sure somewhere tucked away in Pittsburgh there's a shop with better pizza than Eddie's but I sure haven't found it!

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Aaron F.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: According to Urbanspoon (blasphemy I know) their are like 1,100 pizza places in pittsburgh. So what is the best pizza in Pittsburgh. Everyone has an opinion and so here is mine: The best pizza in Pittsburgh is the pie comes from the place in you neighborhood that has quality ingredients, fair prices, and friendly service. Eddie's Pizza Place  is all of these things and since I live in this neighborhood this is my favorite.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Andrew D.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: Decent neighborhood pizza can be found in morningside at eddies pizza haus. The sauce and cheese are perfect, but the crust falls short.  It has a nice texture and overall the pizza isn't greasy, but the crust lacks much flavor. Maybe a little more salt is needed in the dough to compensate? The pizza is decent enough though and merits a try, perhaps it was an off day for Eddies.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Dave H.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: Eaten here twicebut only pizza. I do have to say its up there with Napolis or Ailleos as for the pizza. Tonight me and my neighbors were up for some more. Was disappointed when ordering a meatball hoagie to find out they had no meatballs! Pizza places should never run out of certain things. Had gotten a cheese hoagie. Didnt get get why someone would order this, but was told it was good. didnt like. Luckily the pep pizza was great, but.. when u get toward the crust, its all dough. Still kick butt pizza but get rid of the cheese hoagie.

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Tiffani M.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: First, I just have to mention that this place--bless 'em--was the only thing open in Morningside during "Snowmageddon" (aside from Rite Aid which was picked clean anyway), and we were all kind of stranded up here. I had the Italian hoagie and thought it was the most delicious thing I had ever eaten (considering we had been living on canned soup and Chef Boyardee for days). Months later, after the snow had melted and sanity had been restored, we decided to try them again to see if they were as good as we remembered. I got the same hoagie and was surprised that it really was quite tasty! I wouldn't make a special trip for them if I didn't live here, but they're good for what they are! As a side note, we've tried the pizza, and it's rather mediocre. I suggest they change their name to "Eddie's Hoagie Haus."

Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.author: Liz S.
Nf9s7ULgb0Shnc5Mr7JweQ.description: I will admit I am completely biased towards this place. I grew up eating their pizza. Crust is soft and fluffy, not chewy. The cheese is a little thicker than the average new york style pizza place. The sauce has spice but not too much. At some places you need a little milk or water to cool your tongue. Their one downside is that they're not always consistent. Some days its just started to turn golden brown others its over done.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Chris P.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description:
Nancetta's is the best Italian food I've had in Pittsburgh! Everything is made in house from scratch, and the ownership and staff make you feel like part of the family. 

I had pasta with rabbit. This was a large portion of food. The past was cooked al dente and was perfect, and I couldn't believe how much rabbit meat there was on the plate. I had to take some home. This was my first time eating rabbit. It's tender and has a similar taste to chicken but a little more "gamey." I also got a side of gnocchi and wow! It's so light and melts in your mouth. The best gnocchi I've ever had. 

This will go down as one of my favorites, and I will go back frequently!

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Scott O.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: Unapologetically slow. Overcooked pasta. Dried out eggplant parmigiana. Really expensive.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Amara O.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: Service is painfully slow and downright rude. Took and hour and a half to get our food after we ordered. The portions were small and the food was mediocre at best. Way too salty- like all you could taste was salt. The noodles were overcooked. Everything was crazy expensive, especially for what you get. The restaurant is really small so there's no excuse for the wait. It is really dark, has bad music, and every time they open the fridge it is blindingly bright. Don't be fooled by the other reviews. Will not be coming back.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Martha A.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description:
I have been to Nancettas Ristorante in Fox Chapel 2 times before this evening. Very few cars in the lot at about 7:30pm.
At least 6 tables with 2to 4people seated. One server.
I was seated immediately. I asked only for a glass of water and the server stated she would come back to tell me the specials.She was very busy bring checks to several customers. Then seated another couple 
20 mins later still no waitress to come to my table.
I left. I shared my discontent on their FB page in a private message.
The waitress this evening responded as if it was my fault.
Why am I now on Yelp?
I just want you to know this is recurrent. The customers were turning their heads as if to express disappointment with failed service...1 waitress running all over the restaurant.
I would say reevaluate I you system.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Barb W.
