gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: Has anyone ever gone back?  Awful, slow. Got scolded by waitress. Bartender was nice. Calamari looked like it came off of the freezer floor. Not surprised the parking lot was empty.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Julie M.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: The absolute worst dining experience ever. My son and I went on a Saturday night at 7:00 and did not receive entrees until 9:00. Owner tried to argue how long we waited. I should have left after another customer complained about his undercooked pork chop and sent it back 3x. Few customers were there so hard to explain excessive wait for mediocre food. Salad was not fresh and the  waiter said the bread was home made fresh from oven but it was not warm. Pasta chewy. Large menu but son ordered meat lasagne and waiter came back and said they only have vegetable lasagne. Very disturbing place.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Shannon B.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description:
What a delightful surprise within 20 minutes of our home! We found this restaurant on Yelp because we were looking for a new place to try. 

When we pulled in, there were only 2 cars in the lot and it made me think they weren't open. I asked my fiancé if maybe that was a bad sign, and then we decided that we wanted to have the experience no matter what. We are so glad we went in!

We were one of two couples in the place, so we were seated immediately. The hostess was our server because they didn't have a server that night. We ordered drinks which came out timely, and then we put in an order for a Caesar salad to share and our dinner orders of chicken Romano and the veal medallions. The Caesar salad was a little over priced for what you get, so I wouldn't recommend tacking on $10 to your tab for a salad. Save it for your entree and dessert. The Caesar dressing was authentic though, so if you're in the mood to splurge, then splurge away! We also had bread with butter and pesto oil that was very good!

Our dinners came out around an hour after we were seated, so considering everything is made in house and to order, an hour was the perfect wait. We had plenty of time to have a wonderful conversation and let our salad digest. My veal medallions was delicious, although for $26, I thought the pieces of veal would have been more substantial. Overall it was a very good meal. My fiancé has the chicken Romano. He raved about it! I took a bite, and it was delicious! 

We decided to make a whole night of it and ordered the chocolate explosion with berries. It was worth the 15 minute wait for it to be warmed up. 

The decor was lovely, and I really loved the look of the bar area. We are excited to go back to try more things from the menu. We spent more than we had planned, but I think one of the best parts of this restaurant is that it can fit a less expensive budget if you don't add on the salad, drinks and dessert. Even without all of those extras, our dinner would have been excellent. Can't wait to return!

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Cheryl S.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: Creating delicious authentic Italian food is what Nancetta's is all about! Nothing like the pre-cooked meals served at OG. Pre-cooking saves time but sacrifices the blend of flavors and texture in the dish.  Make it an enjoyable evening at Nancetta's in their beautiful dining room with a glass of wine as your crafted dish is prepared to order. I recommend their homemade pasta and the homemade gnocchi melts in your mouth! Also try the grilled Spanish octopus and fresh fish dishes. Outstanding chicken Romano too;-)

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Diane S.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description:
Had an excellent dish of spaghetti bolognese.  My friends loved their dinners of chicken piccata and gnocchi w pesto.   
We sat outside and enjoyed the beautiful patio.  Service was excellent.  I would definitely come back to try another dish.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Toni M.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description:
Nancettas is amazing!! I can't believe this place only has 3 1/2 stars! If you love authentic Italian food like I do, this is the closest to Italy that you'll get in Pittsburgh! 

I had dinner reservations on a Saturday night for my boyfriend, my parents, and I.  When we arrived, we sat at the bar for a drink before we sat at our table. We ended up making great conversation with the owners, a fabulous couple who are both so sweet! They even brought us out a plate of his homemade Soppressata. My father has had a lot of soppressata in his life (including his own family's homemade in Italy) and he said this was the best he's ever had! The rest of us agreed with him as well. They also had homemade bread with an amazing olive oil dipping sauce. They kept bringing it out, and we continued to eat it! 

For dinner, it was a beautiful June night, so we decided to eat outside. All of the other customers were also eating outside ( I don't think anyone was inside eating). Their patio is so cute, covered with trees and umbrellas! We continued to have amazing service during our meal by both the owners and our waitress. For my dinner, I ordered chicken piccata and shared a side of the gnocchi with Chris. Both were amazing! Everyone else said how amazing their meals were too- eggplant parm, veal parm, and Chris tried rabbit (which was actually great!) 

Since we were there to celebrate, we also decided to get dessert! Even though we were all full, we saw the table next to us order dessert and we were basically drooling looking at it. The 4 of us shared the lemon tart & the raspberry chocolate chip gelato. I am not much of dessert person but these were both amazing & the perfect ending to a great meal! Even if you don't live close to Nancettas (like us) it was worth the drive! I cannot wait to come back!!

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Frances H.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: Outstanding.  Truly. Be prepared for a leisurely pace since everything is homemade, from the amazing bread to pasta, veal and boar dishes.  We will return for the many seafood specials.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Steve S.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description:
TL;DR - waited 60 min for mediocre app, 90 minutes for mediocre soup and salad, 120 min for decent mains. Beautiful decor, flawed concept. 

The good: the restaurant is absolutely beautifully decorated inside. The waitress knew the menu very well, was polite, made good suggestions, and never let our water glasses get even half empty. The veal Romano and seafood pasta dishes were tasty. 

The bad: I wanted to take my mom out somewhere nice for an early mother's day dinner. She had been wanting to try this place out for a long time. The restaurant is very small and it was hard to make a reservation. When we got there, it was practically empty of people but full of tables. The two of us were seated at a table for 6. Why...I don't know. Because there were too many tables, we were practically sitting with the two women next to us. 

It took over 10 minutes for the manager to tell us the specials. Another few minutes the one and only waitress came and took our drink order. Once our drinks are delivered, we ordered an appetizer (risotto balls), the veal and leek soup, and the best salad. The risotto balls came....45 minutes later. They were OK (nothing to write home about). Another 30 minutes later my soup arrives but my mom's salad wasn't ready. At 8:30 (90 minutes into dinner), my mom's salad finally arrived. Again, the food was OK. At this point we're beginning to get upset at how long we've waited to have our appetizer, soup, and salad served. There were only 8 people in the dining room and everyone has been waiting far too long and starts asking the waitress where the food was. We can all tell she's getting upset that a nearly empty dining room is full of hungry customers. 

The ugly: At this point, it's almost 9 pm and everyone has been there since between 7 and 7:30. The waitress starts apologizing to everyone about the delay. She says this is typical and whenever she puts pressure on the kitchen, she states the chef just yells at her. Several couples just ask for their food to go. At 9:00, the food starts coming out. Everyone has been served except us. We hear our waitress tell the chef she still needs a veal Romano. Does that mean they didn't ever start cooking our food? Our food arrives at 9:15...2 hours and 5 minutes after we were seated. We ate some of our meals but we were just too tired to eat any more. We get the rest of our meals wrapped up to go. 

Nancettas prides itself on its meals being "scratch made in house." They state that their meals take a little longer than most restaurants. Making your customers wait 2 hours is bad for business. 

How can a restaurant be successful if it alienates its customers by making them wait an ungodly amount of time before serving them? How can a restaurant be profitable if it can only turn a table once in a dinner session? The issue here is management turning a blind eye to a major issue and a failed concept. We will not be back and we certainly will not be recommending this place to anyone.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Thomas A.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: We waited an hour for our apps. They were delicious. Very good in fact. Then waited another half hour for entrees. When my wife's entree was not brought with mine, after the waitress said they ran out of feta. Not sure how that causes the meal to be delayed. It arrived 15 minutes later very hot, while my plate was mildly warm. Especially after sitting while I waited for her plate. The food is fantastic, but the service and is terrible. Good is brought to you in piecemeal and slowly. We watched another large group leave after waiting too long. Hiring additional help would go a long way. Need another server and kitchen help. Food is great, but you can only forgive so much terrible service when there are great restaurants in our city to compete with. Needs significant improvement, but something tells me this owner doesn't care and is satisfied with his product.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Walki P.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: The food was delicious!  We ordered the antipasto for 2, beans and greens, chicken parm, Alfredo pasta with chicken and pesto gnocchi with chicken. The servings were a bit small for the price. We did wait quite awhile for our entrees so I'm glad we ordered appetizers. The restaurant was empty, we were the only ones there. Service was very good! Our sever, who was also the hostess was very attentive and friendly.  We sat outside in the patio.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Mary O.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description:
What a delightful and delicious evening! We sat outside on an early summer evening and you would never have known you were on the back side of a parking lot.

The food, the service, the wine...everything was wonderful. Yes you may need to wait a bit, but isn't that what an evening out should be - delightful and not rushed? You are in for a treat with the food so relax and enjoy.

All 4 people in our party were thrilled with our food and the whole evening!

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: John D.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: Arrived on a Saturday and few cars, place is beautiful, I looked up reviews and previous reviews mentioned few cars. We went in and loved it. Almost don't want it to get out how good the food was. The owner and the server were truly amazing. I really enjoyed the whole experience. Everything is made in house or local sourced. Wine list is personally selected and I wasn't disappointed whit the suggested Pinot noir. The food was perfect, full of flavor and light. If you want good food and drinks and new modern indoor and outside seating you cannot wrong

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Spencer D.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: Excellent in every way.  Beautiful atmosphere.  Super wine list. Attentive and helpful staff. The owner made frequent visits to the table. Wild boar was tender and flavorful, gnocchi melts in your mouth, veal medallions sumptuous.  Don't forget the desert

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Maria H.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description:
FANTASTIC!  My family went here last minute one night and we were so happy that we did!   The food was incredible!  Great food is not fast food!  We had a very relaxing dinner with the chef, his wife and the server who were all very attentive to us.  The pear asiago ravioli was so unique and delicious.  My husband special ordered linguini with clam sauce (which was not on the menu) and the chef made it without hesitation!  Very impressed with the wine list too.
We will definitely be back to this little hole in the wall gem!  So glad we found it!  
Thank you chef/owner for a wonderful meal and evening!!

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Suzy M.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: I made a reservation for 7:15pm, we arrived early and were sat immediately. Great start to the night. It took awhile to get drink orders but the server really tried hard to find me the right wine. That's the last good thing that happened. It took forever to give our dinner orders. There was 1 server and 1 bartender but they had 2 tables each. Then we got our salads about an hour into it and dinner 2 hours after walking into the building. I had to ask where the food was and she was shocked. When I went to ask her I found her making the salads without gloves and eating while she made them. There are other things that left a bad taste in my mouth but all I need to say is that if you want a 4 hour leisurely dinner then this is the place but don't expect to be serviced or have food in front of you.

gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.author: Lauren H.
gvmhnxxuS6BrPoIuBYd6dw.description: This place is fabulous. The food was amazing but the service itself is enough for me to come back. Such a mom and pop place and everyone was so nice. By the time I left, I didn't want to! I wanted to stay and hang out with the owners and server because by the end of my meal I felt like I was part of the family! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this restaurant!!!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Ed N.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
OMG this is the bomb diggity bomb of Italian food in Carnegie.  Since Papa J'a burned down I have been looking for a nice place to eat Italian food in Carnegie.  I read some tiger reviews about complaints of small portions and let me say IMO the portion sizes are appropriate and perfect.  The food preparation was spectacular!  

Food - wow.  Taste bud heaven.  The burrata was so warm and tasty it melted in your mouth. I've never has anything like that before in my life.  The table had gnocci, cavatelli with sausage, manicotti.  Each meal was tasty and delicious.  The manicotti was almost as good as my deceased Aunt's recipe.  And hers were always the best.  The meatball was one of the best I've had.  

Portions - appropriate for a normal diet. I mean if your expecting The Olive Garden 10 pounds of pasta then this isn't your place.  This food is meant to be TASTED and ENJOYED not inhaled.

Ambiance - it's very loud and it makes conversation difficult.  They are expanding and that will decrease the noise levels.

Staff - they are fun, friendly, and helpful.  They added to the experience.  The highlight was when the owner came over to chat. And he really chatted and was interested in our experience.

This is a repeater for sure!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Tina B.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
When something is done right, you don't need all the bells and whistles for it to be good. I'm a fan of simple food and Leogreta is just that. With a relatively small menu, it's easy to figure out what you want. However, knowing that everything is made in house, I had a hard time deciding. I ultimately went with the greens and beans as an appetizer, the gnocchi as my entree and the husband went with chicken parmesan. They were nothing fancy, but were delicious. As simple as they were, they were done right. My only gripe is I wish I got just a little more. However, the highlight of the meal was the buttermilk panna cotta for dessert. Again, it was so simple, yet so perfect. 

I think Leogreta is a good place when you're looking for small portions of Italian. Don't expect to leave with leftovers, but you can definitely expect to leave with an appreciation for simple scratch-made food.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Lisa K.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
I've been to Leogreta several times now, beginning when they just opened. This week's visit was a pleasure just like all of the other times. It's just so dependably wonderful! This visit I tried the capellini with sausage, and my husband had a featured beet and goat cheese salad and the combo, consisting of a meatball, slow roasted pork and house sweet sausage. We were both very happy with our selections. He had a Peroni, and I had the house red wine. For dessert, he loved the coconut cream tart, and I had buttermilk panna cotta. Both were excellent. 

Prior visits have included gnocchi and meatballs, among other regular menu offerings. There hasn't been a less than happy bite in anything. 

It IS hard to get in on a whim. Make reservations!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Rebecca G.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Had a great dinner with my husband this past Sunday evening at Leogreta. We made a reservation and were so glad we did-we called the day before and there was no availability. Greeted warmly by attentive staff. Drink orders were immediately taken-we both enjoyed the house red that was reasonably priced-and the specials were described. Small menu, but still hard to decide since everything sounded good! We started with the Roman Pizza bread-amazing! We both got Caesar salads-that would be the only mediocre item we had-heavy on dressing and lettuce was very wilted. I had the gnocchi-outstanding-with a meatball that was very good. My husband enjoyed his pork ragu special. We shared the coconut tart for dessert. We can't wait to return and try another one of their Italian specialities!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: maryanne r.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: We lucked into this excellent little restaurant on our way to the Pittsburgh airport.  It's easy to get to from Route 79 and well worth a stop for dinner. The fare is old fashioned Italian with a new twist here and there. The pasta is homemade and the ingredients are fresh.  It's family run and very friendly. A find!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Nick H.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Totally delicious entrees, sides, and soups. They have really injected new life into the Carnegie neighborhood. The service is top notch and it looks like with their expansion, things are only going to get better. More seating, more space... not as noisy.  All wonderful

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Julie F.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
I've been a long time fan of Chef Aluzen. But LeoGreta is his own and it is incredible. Simple but outstanding. 
Gnocchi was recommended and it didn't disappoint. Really., don't pass it up. Greens and beans, cavatelli and sausage. I love them all. I'm determined to try everything at least once.

Tip: make a reservation early in the week for the weekend. This place is no longer a secret.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Kayla F.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Delicious, fresh Italian food at a ridiculously affordable price. 

If you're willing to travel outside of the city to Carnegie, I highly recommend Leogreta. The food was delicious and the house wine was smooth, all at a great price. We would re-order everything (burrata bread, arugula salad, gnocchi) except for the chicken parmasean which was good, but not great. Note that they also take reservations, which we recommend making.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Caitie Z.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
My husband and I met another couple one evening for dinner. We had reservations for 5pm on a Saturday evening which is a must if you want prime time on a weekend.We called a week ahead of time and they only had two time slots remaining, 5pm and 8pm. The restaurant was very small inside, about 10 tables, all that could be pushed together if there was a larger crowd. We were seated right away and the waitress had water waiting for us on the table. She gave us a run down of the menu and the specials for the evening and gave us time to decide.
 
The menu offered a few starter options that were more unique than your average Italian restaurant. We ordered the White Bean Dip served with bread made by Mediterra and our friends tried the Burrata, warmed tomatoes and peppers in oil with fresh basil and mozzarella. I thought both appetizers were pretty good! The dip had a nice garlic kick and the Burrata was basil forward which was to my liking. We were also served bread with dipping oil to begin our dining experience. 

The menu offered a variety of salads to choose from. My friend ordered the special - an apple and kale salad. It had nice flavor but had a little too much dressing for my liking. The entree section (or Pasta section) of the menu was not very big. Most items contained some form of pork ingredient, whether it was hot sausage, meatball, or pancetta. I debated between Linguini Carbonara and Spaghetti and Meatballs and finally settled on good ole' Spaghetti. It came with one giant meatball that was fairly tender with a decent amount of flavor. The pasta itself, while I could tell it was homemade, was a bit tough for my liking. The sauce was slightly watery but there was enough to cover the pasta and meatball entirely when mixed together. Overall, I thought the dish was good but next time I would try the Carbonara. 

Three additional sections of the menu include sandwiches (if you aren't feeling pasta), others and extras such as greens and beans, house meatball, chicken parm, and desserts. Despite each section being on the smaller side, this restaurant does offer a variety of options that are made with fresh ingredients in a "scratch" kitchen style.

Despite a few minor hiccups with my dish, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here. The staff were very nice and quick to attend to our needs, the price was reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food, and the atmosphere was quaint, cozy, and clean. I hope to be back while Carbonara remains on the menu!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Aaron Z.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
My wife and I came here with another couple on a Saturday for dinner. We were able to beat the dinner rush and get situated. Inside, the restaurant is rather small and narrow, and the inside was very clean and had a nice amount of natural sunlight from the front windows. 

My wife and I ended up splitting the white bean dip with bread and I ordered a beer. I liked that the beer selection had a decent amount of local breweries on it. The white bean dip was excellent with a decent amount of garlic. We ended up asking for more bread as the dip was actually quite a filling appetizer. For dinner, my wife was boring and ordered spaghetti and meatballs while I had the pork ragu special. I was impressed with how well the pork worked with the pasta. Typically I find pork harder to make work in a pasta dish, but this was pretty decent. 

Overall a very good Italian restaurant in Carnegie. It was easy to find parking and is very close to some other shops. Prices are very reasonable compared to other nice Italian restaurants.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Rachel C.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
I was excited to come here because I saw that they offered gluten free pasta, which is always a treat to hear at Italian places. The lunch menu is pretty tiny. A bunch of sandwiches I obviously can't eat and four pasta choices, that I could only have one of.

I will say the sausage was delicious. It's house made. But the plate was teeny tiny and I was hungry shortly after I ate. I also ordered the burrata to split with friend. In retrospect, I could have totally ordered that for myself and a salad and maybe been satisfied.

I would hit this place up again if someone wanted to go. Would love to see more GF options, even naturally GF like risotto would be nice to see. I've also been to some Italian spots that offer gluten free bread, which is so awesome to have for those appetizer dishes and oils. Special note to owners: Just freeze the bread so it doesn't go bad. We (GF peeps) just get excited to enjoy it with a regular meal!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Catherine C.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
So after passing by this place many times, seeing it packed every time, i've decided to go give it a try. I didn't have a reservation but they had a table available as long as i leave by 6pm which was perfect! 

Service: not bad at all. The waitress was attentive to my needs, water was filled and refilled. Great explanation of the menu and the dishes. Super friendly and patient. I loved that she said it was a scratch kitchen!!

Food: I did do research on what other yelpers said about the place and it looked like the cavatelli was most popular. So that's what i ordered. The pasta is fantastic, however, there was not too much taste to the hot sausage. In fact it was mostly salty and no taste. The dish was nice to have the greens added to it, however, compared to the gnocci and the sampler with the red sauce, it was not my dish of choice. The sampler with the meatball, sausage and roast was exceptional. In fact i would want pasta added to that. The meatball was average, nothing unique, however the sausage and the roast was exceptional. The meat shredded easily and tender. The sausage compared to the hot sausage had 100% more taste. The gnocci was soft, light, and best I've ever tasted.

Overall, I would revisit and try something else because they are providing great food. Price is pretty fair, you don't get a large portion, but it is filling for the amount they give, which is what i like at a restaurant. 

These are reason why i would pay more to eat local rather than going to a chain like olive garden!

I would recommend calling for reservation and giving your full name. I sat by the entry and overheard a customer only leaving a first name and she was not found on the list. She was still seated but i would hate to be there and not have a table! It's a small, quaint place, that just makes you feel hip, comfy, and satisfied.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Lindsey H.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Loved everything about this place and can't wait to go back! The restaurant is small, but welcoming. We were greeted and seated pretty much as soon as we walked in- we had a reservation- and I would definitely recommend having one. We shared the white bean dip as an appetizer and the coconut cream pie for desert-both were really good. For my meal I had the gnocchi and a meatball- amazing! It is a scratch kitchen, and everything tasted so fresh.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Brooke V.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: We made reservations on Friday for 5 at 5:30. Friendly staff! Everyone loved their meal, the home made pasta is amazing! I loved the carbonara and buratta appetizer! The seasonal walnut tart was great! Nice atmosphere and friendly staff!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Derek P.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Even though I've heard good things about this restaurant and read the great reviews I probably will never eat here due to the way I was treated over the phone about 90 minutes ago. I called asking if they take reservations which the gentleman who answered the phone said "yes!" I asked if they had anything tonight  and he said "no." I further asked if they accepted walk-ins and he responded with a very arrogant "full means full!" response.  As a potential patron I do not appreciate being treated in this arrogant manor. There are plenty of other great restaurants nearby which we happily gave our money to. 
Service is everything.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Denise G.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Authentic Italian cooking in the revitalized area of Carnegie.  Just off of the I-79 exit of Carnegie Leogreta makes a good first impression.  Lots of on street parking and a few lots a short distance away from the restaurant.  

The decor is clean and simple, not many tables so I'd suggest a reservation.  Some of the table tops are fastened to antique sewing machine bases. I could tell from the moment  I sat down Leogreta's goal is to provide excellent food in a relaxed and welcoming environment. Linen table clothes, napkins and better than most cutlery shout out quality and attention details.

Our server was prompt to offer drinks and specials as we looked over the compact menu. Currently wine and beer are offered.  The server said the next door building is being remodeled and when expanded a full bar will be available. Here are some classic Italian dishes of gnocchi, beans and greens with sausage.  The arugula and radicchio salad was good sized (ample for sharing) with a balanced dressing.  On this visit we enjoyed the linguini carbonara.  Creamy with chunks of pancetta.  A gluten free option used penne pasta.   Didn't have room for dessert but will be back to Leogreta and will save room for dessert next time.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Jenna T.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Leogreta offers a classic Italian dinner experience, and it's a gem in Carnegie for sure. 

It's quaint with only a few tables, so make sure to call ahead for reservations. 

I've enjoyed the greens and beans as well as the homemade gnocchi. You can't go wrong with any of their salads either-most recently I had their salad on special-mixed greens with apple, walnuts and crumbled feta. They also have gluten free options and are very accommodating. 

The prices are very reasonable, the food is consistently good and the service is top notch.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Katie R.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Loved this place! 
Everything is homemade.
Salads were very fresh. 
BYOB that comes with a nominal charge. 
Fresh brewed iced tea and hand squeezed lemonade. 
I had the sausage and cavatelli. Delicious! Although, a little watery. 
My other half had gnocchi and meatball. The meatball was the best we have had! Ever! 
Red sauce is delicious. 
We will be back! 
Place is small would suggest making reservations.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Marty B.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Wow. What. A. Gem. to have in the South Hills. We are always looking for a good Italian place in PGH and Leogreta has exceeded expectations again and again. Each time we have gone the menu features new items which are always creative and delicious. 

The restaurant itself has a great warm Italian vibe with a brick wall and good music. It is small enough to feel intimate but large enough to feel comfortable. Each time we have gone, the service has been great and knowledgeable. 

We get the house red wine when we go which is great. All prices are very reasonable for such good quality food. The bread is homemade (I believe) and as someone who's body is composed of 50% bread, it more than receives my stamp of approval. The gnocchi is made from potatoes and is such a great texture. To top it off, we had a DELICIOUS vanilla cheesecake with an almond crust bottom (the other 50% of my body is composed of dessert, if you were wondering). Such different dishes and great flavors all around are what keep us coming back to Leogreta. 

See you again soon!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Dan B.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
I don't often give five stars, but this place is very good. First it's a scratch kitchen. Absolutely everything is made in house.  The food was done perfectly, service was spot on, and I have zero complaints.  The atmosphere was kinda like a SOHO restaurant. Small interior, with brick accents, and a tasteful decor. 

I highly recommend this place!!!!!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Ron W.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: We were recommended to try this place. The Butternut squash soup was a hit. The greens and beans was watery. My wife's Carbonaras was undercooked in the pasta department and the sauce was sparse and uninspired.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Arlene M.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
LeoGreta is officially open and is serving both lunch and dinner. Takeout is available and I noticed upon entry a reservation book thus concluding they take reservations as well. The theme is Italian/French. The business was opened by chef Greg Alauzen formerly known in some of Pittsburgh's better restaurants.

The place is very clean and the staff warm and friendly. The restaurant is average size and sits about a mile west from the center of Carnegie business district. I decided to order for lunch the veggie sandwich that consisted of roasted portabella mushrooms, peppers, white bean spread, and frisee. They use bread from Mediterra bakery located in Robinson.  All sandwiches come with a side of pickled vegetables. This is probably one of the few vegetarian choices on the menu. There are none for vegans.

I noticed that portion sizes are fairly huge so come hungry. I got my food fairly quickly since the place wasn't overcrowded. My mushrooms were huge in my sandwich. Although I loved the sandwich I had some trouble biting the bread. I later learned after I completed my sandwich that they had given me "end" pieces of the loaf and I could have had a choice of a different softer bread. The menu does not list the bread choices so I would have not known this option existed.

When I ordered my ice tea I learned they only serve it sweetened. Unsweetened ice tea is not available so do not be mislead by the menu. My tea was filled completely with an orange wedge attached. I asked for a straw and was told they had none. Later on I learned that they were ordering straws and would have them next time I visit. Right now the place is BYOB, however, they have applied for a liquor license so this will change in the near future.

My waitress asked me if I wanted dessert. I skipped over that in favor of one of those delicious meatballs. They sell for $3.00 but judging by the size one is good enough for me. My waitress brought me a few "center" cuts of the same bread I had with my sandwich and it was a lot easier for me to chew. I must say the meatball was worth every penny and I enjoyed that over my sandwich.  The meatball is also available as a combo with pork and house sausage. Prices are reasonable.

I feel this place is a work in progress seeing that it has just opened and still has to get what I call some of the " bugs" worked out of it. Menu corrections should be made so that the consumer would know about the two types of bread they serve as well as correction for the ice tea (should be labeled "sweet tea"). Also since I didn't order a dessert I have no idea of pricing since desserts are not on their online menu. Still it makes a welcome addition to an up and coming community in Carnegie. There is metered parking along W. Main St but you can obtain free parking if you park along one of the side streets. It sits about a block down from Applelicious where you can also get a sweet treat.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Kara B.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Leogreta gets a solid 5 stars for sure! 

I called on a Saturday for a 5:30 reservation before a Pens game. This place is super small and quaint. There are only 10 tables, so I definitely recommend making a reservation- especially on a weekend. It was even busy at 5:30. 
My husband ordered the spaghetti and meatball. He basically licked the plate clean and could not stop raving about it! The meatball was huge and tasty, and the sauce was plentiful and on the sweeter side (which we love). 
I ordered the cavatelli with sausage because judging from yelp, it looked like a fan favorite. It was incredible! The homemade cavatelli was delicious and so was the sauce it was served in. The sausage is also made in house. Actually, I think everything is. The desserts are served with Millie's ice cream which is always a plus!!
The service also gets a solid 5 stars. Even though every table was full, our water glasses were never empty and we were checked on multiple times by multiple staff members! 
One small complaint, but I'm not going to hold this against them.... the $20 corking fee! They do serve alcohol so I don't see the point of being byob. Charging a fee that high is only going to piss people off, so I would just do away with it. 
Anyways- I cannot wait to go back!!!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Julie E.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: This is such a cute spot in Carnegie. As a local, I am so glad to see great new businesses opening up. I LOVE the food here. Great beans and greens and meatballs too. I had their gnocchi which was super filling and tasty. The Sunday special meatbside is so good. Reminds me of eating at my grandmas house. I'm happy to see hey are expanding the place.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Kristin D.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
I'm so glad I finally found time to visit this quaint restaurant in my hood! (And an even bigger plus that they do take out!) Our waitress was very friendly and moved the courses along nicely. I just wish she would've told us about the specials that my friends and I noticed as we were leaving. 
The bread and oil they offer is very good; you can taste the quality of the olive oil. Very rich and smooth. They have alcoholic beverages on the menu (as well as BYOB) and the Malbec I had was quite tasty. 
I started off with a arugula/radicchio salad. Very fresh and crisp. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan with a side of cavatelli as my main dish. Very good. Organic chicken breast with the perfect amount of breading. The cavatelli were cooked perfectly. I really liked their red sauce and wish there was just a bit more of it as well as a bit bigger side of cavatelli, but at least I didn't leave feeling like "Thanksgiving" dinner kind of stuffed. For dessert I picked their homemade apple crisp with Millie's vanilla ice cream. Yummy! 
It's a great addition to Carnegie. I look forward to my next visit! Well done, Leogreta!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Spencer H.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Food was phenomenal...... so much flavor in every bite. I was equally impressed with their wine selection. We had two different bottles and both were fantastic. This has to be one of the best dining experiences if the THE best I've had since moving to Pittsburgh last November. 5 stars.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Troy B.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Finally . . . made it here for lunch.  Brought my mom, and we had the gnocchi, beans & greens, and a meatball, and split it all family style.  The food was incredibly delicious, and the service was very good too.  We topped off the meal with a coconut creme pie, and that in itself was a different experience, because it was served, not as a piece of pie, but as it's own little small, round, pie, and it was also delicious.  Looking forward to coming back again some time . . . Cheers!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Rose N.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
I dunno. Was so excited for my first visit here but left disappointed. BTW their lunch menu and dinner menu are the same. Same offerings, portions, and prices. We came for lunch. My friend had the manicotti stuffed with ricotta special which she said was good. I had a meatball sandwich with a side of the risotto. Meatballs were very good but the bun was lackluster. This was the first risotto I didn't care for. The regiano cheese had too strong, bitter flavor. I left half of it. Other notes: crusty artisan chunks of bread with dipping oil seemed stale. The pickled vegetables that come with meals was nearly non-existent - one mini carrot, a little piece of cauliflower, and a sliver of pepper. 

I would like to see the menu expanded, maybe add seafood options and more pasta/sauce options. The only non-pasta "dinner" was chicken parm under "extras/others". 

I may return (don't live that close), but probably not for a long while. I'm not tempted. Plenty of other fantastic Italian restaurants in the 'Burgh. Sorry.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Amanda A.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
**LADIES** Note my pics- they have hooks along the wall to hang purses! YES.

It's been a long time since I've been to a restaurant with such friendly, attentive service as LeoGreta. From the minute we walked in until the server chased us out because we forgot our card- oops- everything was top-notch.
We started with the white bean dip just to try something new. I knew I would probably like it, assuming it would be like hummus- but my hugely carnivorous husband also liked it, and that's impressive! He also had a big, juicy meatball- and he said he would order them everyday for lunch if he worked nearby.
We each had a different salad- both were fresh and delish. The server told us all about the place, the chef, how everything is from scratch-just an all around nice experience.
I had the gnocchis, husband had the linguini. Both were served piping hot, and were just the right amount of food after a couple of appetizers. I was impressed by the light, fluffy gnocchi. They weren't as "chewy" as your run of the mill boxed pasta. Very nice.
The chef stopped by to chat and was super friendly. The other wait staff chatted with us as they were clearing tables nearby. Just really great food and people. I hope this place does well for years to come!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Laura A.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
We went here for an early dinner on a Tuesday. The restaurant is very small (maybe 10 or so tables) so I recommend making a reservation. Our server, Roberta, was absolutely amazing!! She was warm and welcoming, quick to make a suggestion and very attentive. The first thing I noticed was after ordering my drink, it was brought to the table with a straw. Typically I try to not use straws but I had left mine at home and to my extreme surprise and delight it was a paper straw! 

We started with the buratta which did not dissapoint! It was warm with the right amount of salt and paired perfectly with included bread. I started my meal with a Caesar salad and it was very good, the croutons were exceptional. For dinner I had the Carbonara which was made in the correct Italian fashion of adding raw eggs to the dish as opposed to cream. You can certainly tell the difference and this was very good. One of my friends got the cavatelli and sausage and it was to die for. There is no red sauce as you may expect, instead it is coated in the oils from the sausage with some added spice. Lastly my other friend got the gnocchi, it is clearly home made and melts in your mouth. The consistency of it was better than any other gnocchi I have had at a restaurant. We also ordered a side of hot sausage and a meatball. The hot sausage has an absolutely amazing flavor! The meatball was good but it tasted as if it was only made with beef and was a little dense for my liking. 

To end our meal, my friend ordered the Panna Cotta, her favorite dessert. It came in the most adorable pot with a lid. The Panna Cotta was slightly more dense than others she has had but the pure raw honey, from the chefs personal farm, added a wonderful sweetness that really took the dish up a notch. 

All in all we will be back again to sample other dishes and possibly have a few of the ones we tried this time. I highly recommend giving LeoGreta a change, but I do suggest calling to grab a reservation.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Kristy A.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Overall, an excellent meal.  We went with a group of 6 on a weeknight.  The reservation process was friendly, as was the greeting when we arrived, and the service throughout.   I definitely felt welcome and comfortable there.  

The food was really good.  I did the buratta and the gnocchi with a meatball.  The buratta was delicious and luscious.  And not huge - you can definitely eat the whole thing alone.  The gnocchi were some of the best I have had in a long while.  The meatball was middling for me, but I'm not a huge meatball person.  In the end, the burratta and the gnocchi were enough and I really didn't need it.   I also sampled a white bean dip and the carrot cake - both were really good.   

The only two complaints I had...   One, the corkage fee is just ridiculous at $5 per glass delivered to the table.  I am not a huge fan of corkage fees in general, but can agree that wine glasses and corkscrews aren't free.  $5 total for the table is really about all I'm willing to suck up though - the per bottle and/or per glass nonsense is really for the birds.  As a result of this fee, none of us bothered to bring wine - which is really the opposite of what you are going for in having a corkage fee.  Second, the place is excessively loud.  We had to shout for most of the meal and I couldn't hear a lot of the conversation.  They need some panels or something to knock down the noise level.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Ali C.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
I want to give 3.5 on this one.  

I was there a couple weeks ago with a friend for lunch.  It was extremely loud.  While the small restaurant has a nice open feel, you sacrifice the ability to hear the person sitting across from you.  This is a peeve of mine everywhere.  I don't have great hearing in my right ear, so why would I want to spend a full meal struggling to hear?  This instantly takes away from any experience for me.  

Our server was very nice, and came over to me immediately to get my drink order while I waited on my friend.  (The sweet tea is extremely sweet.)  She -- the server -- convinced me to try the spaghetti and meatball on recommendation.  After having read previous reviews on the sauce being EXCELLENT, I broke my standard rule, and ordered a dish with red sauce in a restaurant. 

*I unfortunately should have gotten a sandwich.*

It wasn't bad, but it was VERY, very tart.  After I got past the initial shock of it, I got used to the tartness and it was alright.  The meatball was meh.  It was large, and clearly had been over-handled during prep.  It was tough, and the flavor was just ok.  The pasta itself was good.  I want to say it was homemade, but don't hold me to that.  It was very delicate and nicely al dente.  

I'm sorry, LeoGreta!  I really wanted it to work out differently for us.  I'm just spoiled by my own mother's sauce and meatballs.  I grew up being fed a sauce that rivals ambrosia, and meatballs that just melt in your mouth releasing this flavor unmatched by any other.  It's a super tough act to follow, and so far, only one restaurant has satisfied my long distance cravings.  

I plan on returning and giving it another shot.  My friend's salad looked delicious, and she said it definitely was.  And the people at the table next to us all had lots of different things that looked and smelled fab.  I'll just have to try other items.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: DJ J.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
So nice to have a good Italian restaurant in the area.  Staff is friendly and the Chef was helping out in the restaurant to make sure things were going well and helping to serve and clear tables at times when he left the kitchen.  We were able to talk with him for a few seconds and he really wants to know what you think.  We found out the everything but the bread is made in house.  Coming soon, Bar LeoGreat in the space next door after renovations that will be connected to the restaurant.
We started with the Greens and Beans which were very tasty and cooked perfectly.  Really enjoyed the sausage.  My Linguini Carbonara was very good and a good sized portion.  We split a couple of the homemade deserts, a flourless chocolate cake was superb and the coconut pie was good but the crust was probably a bit to thick for the delicate pie.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Daniel S.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Went with a large group on a Saturday night and they were very accommodating.  The appetizers were good.  The barrata was better than Altius.  The wine selection was limited but very good and reasonably priced.  

I'd love to comment on several of the entrees but I can't.  You see I don't eat pork, and pork is in almost everything this restaurant serves. I understand that sausage is usually made with pork.  But the beans and greens - pork.  Meatballs - pork. Every pasta dish - pork. There are exactly two entrees not made with pork.  There's the chicken parmesan - good but not exciting, and there's the gnocchi.  The gnocchi were excellent.  Even the carbonaro made without the sausage was good.

Bottom line is this is a great new restaurant, well worth a visit.  But if you don't eat pork, you will be extremely limited with the current menu.  

I want to go back and try new items, but I won't because there is literally nothing else on the menu I can eat.  It is so disappointing.  This restaurant easily would have garnished 5 stars except for the excessive pork on the menu.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Alicia V.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Love this local place!! Friendly staff and delicious chicken parm; among other things! Try it out!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Tatum C.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Great gnocchi, even better desserts! Very nice people & service. The staff is so kind and helpful. Feels like you're joining their family for a meal. Well done!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Jeffery B.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Not really into Italian, but my other half really enjoyed it. Probably need reservations, we got lucky. They seem to make everything fresh, so I enjoyed that. Friendly staff.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Glenn W.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: Meh for the price, the food is just okay honestly it's about the same quality as a home cooked meal with the price tag of a 5 star perfect restaurant. It's just not worth it. You expect amazingly fresh Italian food but that's not what you get.

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Xochitl R.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description:
Wow! 

My boyfriend and I walked in hoping for a table. The gentleman at the front was kind enough to seat us. Wait staff was amazing and food was absolutely perfect. 

Thank you Leogreta!!

dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.author: Brianne H.
dP8_X1zpSo3rGarHMyzQ1A.description: We had the most amazing dinner tonight. Portions are European size so just enough. On par with meals I have had in Italy. Amazing spot.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Dara D.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: I order from them all the time.  Gotten lots of different items and it's always great.  They are so sweet as well.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Tine W.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: Waited an hour for food. Staff not sincerely apologetic. Food was not good and not worth the hour wait. Staff is not respectful of customers coming in on their lunch hour and needing to get back to work on time.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Jenna W.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: A good lunch spot for soups, salads, and sandwhiches downtown. I ordered the Bacon Chicken Panini and it was pretty good. I would have liked the bread to be crispier and the sandwhich to have some more flavor to the chicken, but I still enjoyed it as a lunch option. Sandwhiches come with a side salad, so you leave feeling full. Our waitress was friendly and attentive to make sure our food came out quickly so we could return to work. Conveniently located on Smithfield street, for those who work downtown or in Station Square. The restaurant was not overly crowded and they were able to seat 5 of us immediately, which is very refreshing especially during lunch hour downtown.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Puneet G.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: I was in Pittsburgh in Feb 2019. I was looking for a local breakfast place instead of the pricey buffet in the hotel and tried this place. The sandwich was made to order and excellent. The cappuccino was satisfying. All in all a great decision. The owner is new and recently acquired this business and is making great efforts to deliver great service.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: J D.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: Not sure if their name changed but I went when it was Buon Giorno. My coworker raved about it but I wasn't blown away. Nice place to add to your list of lunch stops but not someplace that I would go out of my way for.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Karla D.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description:
The food is always fresh and tasty. I've had several things from the menu and I quite often order the pasta with grilled chicken. It's s nicely sized portion. Not too much food but also always tends to leave me leftovers for the next day.
The wedding soup is so delicious I highly recommend it.
I don't always have time to eat in but it's very pleasant when I'm able to.
Cute little restaurant just before the Smithfield Street Bridge makes for some fun sights to take in while having an enjoyable lunch.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: HN S.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description:
Discovered this wonderful Italian restaurant while I was wondering around town trying to figure out what I would have for lunch today. I walked in and was greeted and seated almost immediately. A few moments later a basket of very fresh, thickly sliced bread was placed at my table. I was surprised at first that there was no butter (although I'm sure I could have gotten some if I would have asked), but then I noticed that there was oil, vinegar and pepper flakes available at the table to make a dipping sauce. 


While I was looking over the menu I was impressed by the selection. There's a wide variety of pasta dishes, sandwiches, salads and specials to choose from. I decided on the Pasta de la Sandra. My order was taken quickly and my dish was served up in about ten minutes; perfect for a working person like me on a lunch break. 

The penne pasta was cooked perfectly with a vinegar and oil based dressing and all of the other ingredients (hot sausage, bell peppers, portabella mushroom, tomato, basil and Romano cheese) bursted with fresh flavor. My check came to a little over $10 which I thought was a bargain for the quality of meal that I had.   

How I've worked in this town for this long and never heard about this place before is beyond me. I will, with out a doubt, come back to Buon Giorno again and again.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Alan J.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: You ruined my Christmas lunch! I ordered Italian Specialty Sandwich and got turkey. No where in the description did it say turkey! I don't have time to wait for another sandwich. You have lost my business!

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Jason W.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: This is definitely a unique little hidden gem near the Smithfield Bridge. The "cafe" gave me the impression that it was just a little coffee spot but after going in its like a full restaurant. I stopped in here for the first time for lunch after checking out their menu online. Upon walking in I received a friendly greeting and got a table near the front. The atmosphere was warm and inviting with an Italian vibe. The room has distinct areas for seating that don't feel crammed or thrown together. There is an upstairs seating area with stringed lights, a bar area in the middle for quick lunch eats and a cafe area on the other side of the bar for lunch, coffee or meeting someone. As for food I got the Turkey Pesto Avocado Panini. Very good! Overall nice experience and looking forward to stopping back in and trying more from the menu. I hope that my inside photos bring more people in for the atmosphere as well as for the food!

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Marie Z.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: I believe the BG café by Smithfield bridge sold to new owners.  Things have gone down hill from that.  However, the other BG café down the street is always awesome and consistent.  I am disappointed because Smithfield is closer for me, but the food is not good anymore.  Risotto yuck, even the salads are not good anymore, why they changed I have no idea.  To save money maybe?

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Devin W.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description:
I ordered lunch for delivery from Buon Giorno, not expecting too much from it but I was hungry and really wanted a salad and soup. 

I got the italian soup and a greek salad with an iced tea.

The food came fast as lightning. 
They gave me a couple slices of fresh italian bread and butter. The soup was steaming hot when I got it (which is a BONUS). The salad was still cold and crisp, and i put it in my fridge while I devoured the home made italian soup. This soup tasted just like I remember getting from friends grandmas (mine never made it, we're irish). The pasta was still tender and not al mushy like you find a lot of the time. The bread was soft and very fresh. I ate my soup like a greedy little troll and moved on to the salad.
It was a HUGE salad. Such a large portion. I should have known to get a small/side salad. It included fresh home made dressing, kalamata olives, roasted red peppers, fresh feta, cucumbers, onions, twist of lemon, and assortment of lettuce. First of all... that dressing... please bottle it! It's SO good and flavorful. Perfect balance of oil and vinegar and spices. Everything tasted very very fresh in the salad and shamefully I did not finish it and ended up throwing half of it away as it was friday and it would not sit all weekend.

The tea was great! Unsweetened, the way I like it. Served with a lemon slice. 

I will make it my goal to order from here while working downtown at least a few times a month. Can't wait to try more!

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Doug B.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description:
This rather non-descript frontage in an office building just on the downtown side of Smithfield St Bridge in Downtown Pittsburgh is a gem. Fast friendly service with outstanding Italian soups, sandwiches, salads, risotto coming from a small kitchen.  All very reasonably priced for the downtown market.  A good stop for a light or business 'working' lunch. 

Location is central to anywhere in the golden triangle, definitely worth the walk - no matter where you're coming from.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Mr. M.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: Stopped in for breakfast & I was pleased by the customer service & the food. The cookies were great (not sure if baked on site, don't think so) and the breakfast sandwich was good. A little pricey but I plan on stopping again.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Lindsey C.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: Delicious, fast and affordable lunch spot in downtown Pittsburgh. This place is ALWAYS so so consistent. Not once have I had a bad meal here. Their salads are my go-to. Huge menu and everything is made with the freshest ingredients possible. They have really great lunch combos and specials every day. Other than a few occasions where our checks took longer than usual, service is typically very quick. I absolutely adore this place; my favorite lunch spot in Pittsburgh hands down!

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Ryan O.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: Delicious food, I'm from New England tho so no offense but in my opinion there is no good coffee in Pittsburgh. But there's is decent. Deff My go to café for the steel city

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Fatema A.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: This is a nice little cafe with great food and service. My colleague and I came here for breakfast everyday. Their chai latte is amazing and so are there breakfast bagels and croissants. We also had lunch here one day. The salad was flavorful and wasn't just jam packed with lettuce. There was a good variety of different veggies.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: S D.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: Cute little restaurant on Smithfield Street in Downtown Pittsburgh. Buon Giorno has a great European cafe feeling to it and I could probably spend a few hours here people watching. All of the staff is very helpful and friendly. I enjoy their Italian wedding soup and they serve it with two generous slices of bread. I'll definitely be back to try more menu items and it looks like they have many daily specials and the prices are very reasonable.

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Debbie H.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: Excellent food and great service!  A quick and delicious place to eat.  Chicken Buon Giorno- excellent dish!  Comes with a side of risotto, bread and oil.  Chicken was tender, juicy and delicious.  Risotto was perfection.  I will definitely be back!

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Rachel B.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: Love the portobello mushroom sandwich! They have free delivery and very friendly employees. They also have very fast service... Every time I have ordered, they have been early than expected bringing the food which is also a plus!

oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.author: Elisa L.
oJ2ubid01aI4n1cdIwteYw.description: This was my favorite lunch-time spot in college. Great, inexpensive options. They have an awesome half-and-half option, where you can do half pasta, half salad for cheap, which was my go-to. The food is super flavorful; I still dream about their marinaded tomatoes. Oh, and their bread! Seating here can be impossible, so mind the time. My favorite was to sit outside.The staff can sometimes lack personality, but the food more then compensated.

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Jim H.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description: Found this place by accident. It is at the end of Murray Ave across the street from Natalia's European Market. So this is a two for one trip to the Hazelwood end of Murray, both places being pretty good and interesting. Not much atmosphere in Babylon, but it is clean and the food appeared to be made to order. We had the beef kabob sandwich and the chicken shawarma sandwich. Each comes with fries and were reasonably priced considering they were on fresh bread and had identifiable meat in them. And, the meat was really good and the sandwiches were well filled and tasty. What's not to love. If you're looking for exotic middle eastern atmosphere you might want to consider another location,but if your looking for good fresh food you should give them a try.

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Troy B.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description: Stopped back again for lunch, and tried a few different things to include the Iraqi Lamb Kebab plate, Shishtawook (Chicken Tikka) sandwich, and a platter with Falafel, Tabbouleh, Babaghanouj, Iraqi bread, salad, and fries.  Everything was good, and I even enjoyed the Babaghanouj this time, with bread for dipping (it was better than the one I tasted on my last visit).  For dessert, I tried a piece of Baklava, and it was sweet and yummy!   Cheers!

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Ally L.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description:
Babylon Cuisine just opened fairly recently, I just happened to see their sign driving past one day and there is nothing much about them online yet. 

Anyway, we got takeout which was a very painless experience. Parking was easy enough (we parked on Hazelwood between Greenfield Ave and Murray), plus there are always street spots by the Giant Eagle. They have a counter that you order at and it is a casual restaurant so you don't feel like you are intruding on anyone's dining experience by picking up food. A really nice teenage girl took our order and prepared it. 

I believe the food is Iranian. They have things like shawarma, falafel, tabbouleh, bread pockets with fillings, etc. Prices are very inexpensive, probably a few dollars less than what Aladdin's charges. My favorite was the beef shawarma which had tender beer slices (instead of the tougher chunks that I've gotten at other places).  The falafel was so-so and could of used some better toppings (pickle was odd)  but the yogurt sauce that came with one of the sandwiches was excellent and they gave you a big cup of it.  

Their bread was perfect, with middle eastern food the bread needs to be on point or the whole meal just ends up being mediocre.  Their bread is delicious, soft and pillowy but still toothy enough to be used in a sandwich without it falling apart. 

Each of the sandwiches came with some average fries. We also liked the pockets (I can't remember the menu name)...the tabbouleh was incredibly fresh but I felt it needed a bit more of a zip...more citrus or something. 

Overall I the price/quality ratio of the food is excellent and I will definitely be back. It is nice to have a quick dinner option in the area that isn't pizza.

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Mark D.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description: GreAt falafel.  Tasty, flavorful, delicious homemade pita.  Spinach pie also good.  Cheap eats.  No atmosphere. Good addition to Greenfield. We will return.

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Ed F.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description:
We have been several times to Babylon. 
The service is friendly, and the restaurant is convenient and clean.
We loved the food, especially the homemade bread. The spinach pie, falafel, tabouleh, hummus, and baba ganoush were all wonderful. We also liked the Baklava.  The prices are very reasonable.  The falafel sandwich comes with an order of delicious seasoned fries, and is only $5!
We have never had anything there that was not good, and we plan to be regulars.

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Nathan H.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description: Wow! Babylon Cuisine was some of the most authentic middle eastern cuisine I have ever had! It is made to order and it was so fresh. I come from a Lebanese family and this was as close as I have ever come to home cooked Lebanese food. The falafel was the best I've ever had at a restaurant. The woman working yesterday was so sweet and so kind and I just wanted to keep tipping her! If you're in Pittsburgh, you have to check this place out!

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Greg H.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description: New family run business. The beef schwarma and falafel are both great and come with fries.

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Eric L.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description: I've been to Babylon twice now for the Chicken Shawarma sandwich, and it is delicious. Friendly service, the price is right, and the fries on the side are good, too. Don't forget to pick up a Fatayer and some baklava! I am definitely making this place a regular spot.

Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.author: Rachel M.
Gl1jrbGS941SJ-UOxKYg6A.description: I live a few blocks from here and didn't even know it existed until one day I went for a stroll with my son and we stopped in for a snack. It looks like a hole in the wall from the outside and it doesn't offer a lot in ambience but it's immaculately clean and there's a good deal of seating. The food we had was very tasty and prices are very reasonable. My 1.5 yo loved the koobat hallab. We'll definitely be back for a full meal!

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Linda N.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description:
I ride by here on the T by this bar all the time. I kept seeing the sign advertise wings and some craft beers. One night on the way home, I suggested to my husband that we stop for a beer and check it out. 

What a find!  It's a great bar. Good bar food. We came back the next week to watch college football and they had all the games on. Small selection of craft beers and nice patrons. 

We will adding this place to our local rotation.

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Dave K.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: This place is an absolute dumpster fire. Food is terrible and pours are light.  Much better choices in the neighborhood

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Mallaurie V.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description:
We are visiting from California to spend my son's Christmas vacation with my husband that works here. Staying in a charming little AirBnb across the street from The Huddle, and decided to try it on our second night. We liked it so much, we ordered take out for a late lunch today (the kitchen doesn't open until 4).  It is going to be really hard to not eat here everyday. It was game night so it was packed to the brim, always a good sign. I could imagine coming here with friends for a few beers and a bite. Dark, very Pittsburgh vibe going on. I loved it. Those that said their service was horrible are too critical. You can tell the servers have probably worked there for YEARS and give two shits what you think about them. Our server warmed up to us a lot more at the end. It didn't bother us, they were busy as hell. The drunk woman next to us started up a conversation immediately with us. We felt like family! 

Started with loaded fries which were what you would expect from east coast cheese fries. Covered in gooey, sticky cheese sauce and bacon. Husband had pork chops, which he loved. I had the 10 ounce new york cooked medium. It was cooked perfectly, and not overly seasoned. As one of my sides I ordered the pasta for baby O, who is a spaghetti connoisseur (kidding mostly). Of course I had to take a bite of the carbey goodness, and holy smokes- that was some of the best red sauce I have ever had. Who knows, maybe I am crazy and it is some kind of Pennsylvania jarred sauce; either way it was freakin delicious. R's meatball sandwich made me super jelly I didn't order it myself. The meatballs were super tender, and there was that sauce again.

Onto today's lunch. Last night we forgot to order the ever so famous wings so of course that was first choice. Also, I NEEDED some of that spaghetti;  yes, needed. In addition I have been craving a Ruban. I don't know much about Ruban's, but this one was more then excellent. It had the perfect amount of cheese, dressing, crout, meat, and the bread was toasted to perfection. The wings were everything everyone raves about. We did them tanned as suggested. The spaghetti, well that is hiding in the back of the fridge for later tonight when the kids go to sleep and I am left to my insomnia. I can almost guarantee we will be back again.

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Je'Amour M.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description:
"Okay" first server showed us are seats and took the drink order, was a bitter "Betty" and I was thankful she was not to be the server we had, the next server at our table was more courteous,  in sorts, maybe that is a stretch, okay not much of improvement from the first, tired hungry, ( I am vegetarian so menu very limited ) so I order eggplant parmigiana, well I thought this can't be so bad well when the side salad came I knew I was in danger, they had one wedge of tomato on the salad, trust it has been in refrigeration a tad to long, I was curious cause it was how to say, it looked like a kids play food, you know the plastic stuff, tasted like it too, was not good trust, here comes the eggplant parmigiana,
let's start with the portobello mushrooms on top, they are marinated in some kind of grease & vinegar, if it was olive oil it came from the dollar tree, marinara is hard to mess up, trust they achieved that, and then pairing it with mushroom soaked in vinegar is just gross, trust the side pasta made me literally gag, as for the eggplant, it was frozen trust and not a good brand, Aldi's sold a vegetarian eggplant parmigiana that more stellar than this slop could be, "PS" the cheese was so salty my ankles swelled, no lie, I took my left overs, figure this snack was good for the neighbors dog, she will eat anything, but not this lol she looked, sniffed, and looked at me as if I was trying to poison her. I don't believe I will ever grace the door of this place, not on a dare or, if I won a gift certificate, I say run fast don't look twice at this place...

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Amy M.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description:
Making your way in the world today takes everything you've got.
Taking a break from all your worries, sure would help a lot.
Wouldn't you like to get away?

Yea yea- it's nice to go where everybody knows your name, but you know what's even better? A server who knows your drink order and weekly wing order.

Their wings are the best in the city. Now I like a 20 flavor wing sauce list as much as the next guy, but trust that you don't need all of those options. At The Huddle you get 2 sauce choices and you can have those choices wet or tanned. BBQ tanned in my go-to. They slather on that sweet BBQ and then bake it into the wings. The result are wings with crispy, sticky skin and tender, juicy meat. 

The Huddle isn't trying to be fancy or unique. They are serving straight up bar food, but it's pretty good bar food. Also, don't expect 5 star service (but the wings make up for it).

Aside from the wings, I'm a huge fan of their Reuben and their monstrous grilled cheese. Pizza is surprisingly good as well! We usually have a party of 6 on wing night and their pizza is the perfect appetizer to split among the table.

Cash only!

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Kaye P.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: This place is so relaxing. The drinks are stiff , beers are cold, and the food reminds me of home. I'm giving it five stars because of the comfort food, steak is amazing, the price is so affordable, and if I'm having a rough week the jack n cokes are strong enough to smooth out the edges. Sometimes it can take a lil while for your check so just ask for it in advance. Never really had anything bad here.

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Steve C.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: If you're looking for some A+++ wings. This is your place. The wings are on the smaller side but PHENOMENAL. Possibly the best wings I've ever had. Anywhere. Juicy. Tender. Fall off the bone. Good flavor. I haven't had a bad thing at this place yet. Seriously. Stop reading. Go get some buffalo or tanned wings.

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Jen C.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: Two year have passed and my initial impression has changed. Definitely like how close The Huddle is but after many meals here I won't return. Being so close is why we've continued to revisit and the quality was fair enough and sometimes mostly good. The fried fish used to be good but now appears to be frozen freezer bag fare along with their appetizer platter. And the rest of the sandwiches are fair at best. What is most concerning is one occasion when we ordered rare steak instead of medium...they took steak back to the kitchen and put it back on grill. Another meal they took the undercooked salmon back to the kitchen grill and our latest meal undercooked scrod taken back to kitchen as well. Health safety standards...once food makes it to the table it can't be taken back to kitchen and placed back on the grill or honestly even reenter the kitchen. I'm ok enough with that if there was an improvement when you receive the food again. The latest meal no improvement in the undercooked scrod...the fish was not flaky and still had opaque undercooked color. When I told the server she told me...well he cooked it for 7 more minutes. The fish wasn't hot but she was saying it was fine.  No apology no offer for something different. I just said ok...we weren't rude and I didn't want to ask for manager and have more drama...the server would just label us as complainers.  In addition the baked potato was lukewarm at best and my dining companion ordered the eggplant parmigiana which comes with Portobello mushrooms...she let her know the mushrooms had a strong vinegar taste. The server told us those weren't Portobello mushrooms that it was eggplant...hmm ok. Regardless the point was too much vinegar/bad taste no matter what she thinks it is called.  As an aside the menus says there are mushrooms on the dish too. Clearly the server didn't want to hear it or fix it and we just said ok. Aside from this dining experience we've had consistently old lettuce in salads...fried mushrooms still frozen in middle. They took my order of mushrooms back to kitchen and refried them after I had been eating from them. So that's another example of a food safety issue. After many meals and many tries and eating there two to three times a month for a couple years we're done. That's a few thousand dollars lost in future business for them but I'm willing to drive a little farther for a consistently good meal

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Gabriel B.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: Had the ribs, so much amazing tender meat that I didn't know if I'd make to the car. Drinks were reasonably priced, the appetizers were hearty in size, and the service was good.

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Bethany L.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description:
People are not joking about the tanned wings. They are EPIC. They fry them up, cover them in sauce, and then put them in the oven for a bit so the sauce bakes in. They look dry and almost overcooked when they get to your table, but they are incredibly tender and delicious. And they give you tons of good ranch to go with them, too.

This being a divey local place, the service isn't impeccable - my waitress was very nice, but spent a lot of time loudly chatting with the table next to mine. And it really bums me out that they're cash only. They have an ATM, but it of course charges a ridiculous fee.

Overall, though: amazing wings, cheap cold beer, and decor that looks like your grandparents' basement. Good stuff.

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Jeff P.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: Good food here, especially for the price. It tastes very much like something your mother would whip up at home. I've yet to find a place in the burgh that can best their price on a nicely cooked piece of steak. 8 bucks for a new York strip that tasted that good is impressive. Their chicken tenders and jalapeño poppers are a solid choice. Their steak salad is off the chain, not to mention the most famous item there, the Black and Tan wings. Semi-burnt chicken wings coated in a vinegary buffalo sauce that reminds me a little of the beechview community. If you don't know what I mean, you don't live here!

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Anthony R.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: One of my favorite places in the area. The food is always great and the waitresses are friendly. I would recommend the chicken wedgie!

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Lauren S.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: Today must be our servers worst day. It is 8:12 pm and we arrived at 6:00 for dinner only. (In & out) The waitress is super mean & agitated we are afraid to even get her attention for the check...and our entrees are STILL not out. At this point we want to go home & go to bed...but the girls nowhere in site & the table busser doesn't speak English. Ugh...

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Sophia A.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: This delicious dive has become our standing a Wednesday night dinner. We love the wings and occasionally have the specials. Check out the board, order any of the soups, and request Amy as your server. They're all good but shes our favorite because she's super friendly and always knows our order. It's fun when your server "knows your name" at your favorite place.

9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.author: Hannah K.
9-lFwrePtcGd6tnRSPI9bA.description: I've only been to the huddle once. I just moved into the area and live only a few blocks away. I heard the wings were good. By boyfriend is a wing snob so I figured we should should check it out. He said they were alright, cooked well but lacking flavor (tanned wings). I got a turkey burger which was probably not the best choice but I try to eat healthy. It was obviously a frozen turkey burger, something I could have made much better at home.
