It is not my problem that you are so busy worrying about checking out others, running back and forth to the kitchen to get take out orders and answering calls that you didn't hear me. That is not my fault.  Save your sanity and just go to a chain restaurant you will get better service.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: John P.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description:
So normally I order from here and we are never disappointed. Last night we got beef & broccoli & I get that dinner prices are higher, but for starters, you could have laid off the broccoli and added some additional beef. That howevee isn't my issue and why I'm giving a 1-star.

My son ordered chicken chow main and towards the bottom of the order we ran into a staple in his meal. A used staple. Not acceptable. Not sure how this happened. Can't begin to fathom how either. Again, the food we get from here is always hot, fresh and worth the money. Last night...not so much.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: T. P.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: Had the shrimp with snow peas. It was served with a typical white sauce which I really like.  Shrimp were nice size and plentiful.  My biggest complaint is when I went to the restroom, it was stocked with all kinds of boxes.  The seating area where they would have the buffet was the same.  Stuff just stores all over.   Clean up please. No one wants to see all this junk

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Elizabeth J.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: This is probably one of the best Chinese places I've ordered from. They are very fast on deliveries and the food is always so good! My order is always correct and they give you plenty of sauce and fortune cookies too! I would definitely recommend trying it out if you haven't yet.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Sherry M.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description:
Hunan's Palace offers a great lunch buffet at certain hours during weekdays for business and homebody's in the area. It's a great price and the buffet is very good, wish there were more of a food section offered, but what is there is really good. There is never a crowd and for the most part your able to pick where you would like to sit. Hunan's Palace is located at the end of a strip mall in Forest Hills, with plenty of free parking. They offer take out and will deliver just to the surrounding area. They offer coupon discounts when your able to find them. The restaurant is reasonable priced for American Chinese food. It is convenient being only two Chinese restaurants in the area. We have been going for years now and it has kind of lost its charm for me. I do like the buffet when I am home during the week day and able to go. We do not order out as often as we used to. The owners have always been friendly, not as talkative as they used to be, but very polite. I see mostly the husband these days, the wife is mostly in the kitchen now if at all. If you can over look the outdated decor, it is not a bad place for dinner or lunch. I would recommend take out, it's quick and packaged very well.  The chicken dishes are well prepared, I like the freshness of the vegetables and the good hot sauces that they make. I also have been ordering from the healthier menu with the white sauce and more vegetables, and less of the meats or poultry. The fried rice's have all been consistently good.  I love the spring rolls, but I am not fond of the egg rolls. The Won Ton Soup is too salty for me and I like the pork shredded on top of the soup and not in the wrapper. 
As for a comment made by someone about an extra gratuity added to the bill, I can't speck to that, I have never had that happen to me. I am sure if you speck to the owner he will explain.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Paul P.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description:
Good place for the American traditional version of oriental food. I've ordered from here a number of times over the 30 some years I've lived in Forest Hills. Hunan has been consistent every time, whether I've eaten in or just ordered take out. Never had one issue here. Decent fare. 
The restaurant could use a good cleanup and going over...the fishtank is old, there are cleaning supplies sitting out by the entranceway along with fish food...presentation isn't just about the meal, it's also part of the facility. They are trodding along though, and have a steady customer base.
Good enough...but they could do a bit to improve, and it'd serve their business and customers well to consider sprucing/cleaning up.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Taylor D.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: I order from here all the time. They are friendly. The food is good. And the delivery is relatively quick! Can't go wrong.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Terri G.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description:
This is our go-to Chinese restaurant in the area.  We always get take-out, we have never eaten in the restaurant.  My kids enjoy the lo mein - the noodles are round like spaghetti and the quantity is large, so we get several meals out of 1 order.  

They are very quick and the price is right.  

I agree that the inside of the restaurant could use an update!

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Joe H.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description:
I eat at/order from Hunan's Palace at least twice a month and have been doing so since 2013. The owners are nice and the food is definitely above average for your standard strip mall, American Chinese. The quality is good, the flavor is there, and the portions are huge. The price is high but on point considering the quality and portions are larger than some places. The decor is extremely dated and the restaurant facility it self feels a little run down but the other restaurants in the area are even worse. I can overlook it given their food is consistently good.

The reason I think that Hunan's deserves a 5-star is because they are consistent. Every dish I've had, from Chicken w. Broccoli to Lo Mein to Szechuan Beef, has been very good and has been a pleasant meal. As far as the Forest Hills area goes, this is by far the best you'll find! Give them a try, you won't be disappointed!

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Ashley B.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: Today was the first time I had anything from here, though, I did have it delivered. The delivery driver was very kind, thanking me for the tip, the food was piping hot, generous servings, the price was on point. I was surprised when it took less than 30 minutes for it to be delivered. Usually, when I order delivery, I receive a call asking for directions, this time I didn't. I'd definitely order again.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Mike Q.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: We decided to take Chinese food to mom and dad's for Mother's Day.  Hunan Palace was on the way.  While we were regulars here almost 20 years ago when we lived in the neighborhood, we wondered if things had changed.  Surprisingly, the food was still excellent, and was a great value too!  We asked for special heat levels for my parents, and they were spot on.  Great job!!  We'll have to stop by more often!!

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Teresa R.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: I've never had a bad experience here. They are attentive, polite, and eager to please. I've been here now five times and have ordered something different each time. They have received my dietary restrictions with no anger or problems. Food is fresh and very good!

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Elizabeth B.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description:
I moved several minutes from Hunan's Palace in March and have been tempted to try this restaurant ever since then. A Chinese food craving hit me on Thursday afternoon, and I just had to stop by.

I ordered Chicken Egg Rolls, Cheese Wontons, Fried Rice, and Sweet and Sour Chicken. I was told that the wait would be ten minutes and decided to pick up a couple things at Giant Eagle during that time. I dashed over there and back -- I would be surprised if it was actually ten minutes -- and the man that I ordered from had all my food packed up and ready to go when I returned. I'm definitely impressed by the speed of their service!

Though not cheap -- I believe that I paid $26 for the four items -- the Fried Rice and Sweet and Sour Chicken were very large portions. Though my husband and I finished off most of the food within one meal, we had Fried Rice around for several days. I personally enjoyed all the food, particularly the Cheese Wontons and Sweet and Sour Chicken.

I was a little uncertain about trying this restaurant but thought that the food and service were surprisingly good. I definitely plan on coming back sometime soon!

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Rich A.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description:
I couldn't be more dissatisfied in the quality and the quantity of our most recent order.  We have purchased meals numerous times from this establishment and have watched the quality deteriorate.  Our most recent order of two cashew chicken meals and three egg rolls consisted of significantly smaller portion sizes with one order having only ONE cashew!
Additionally, the egg rolls were not completely cooked and we're raw on the inside.  We feel cheated and we are done paying more and getting less all the way around at Hunan Palace.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Paula S.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: Came here after finding a nearby restaurant stopped serving food at 9:00 pm  Found the menu reasonable and the portions generous.  Did not get charged for steamed rice which is unheard of in CA.  Very pleased with the meal

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Molly G.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: Delicious, quick, and lovely service. We love this place and the staff. They are friendly and polite and our food is consistently great.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Dave H.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description:
This is a typical family owned Chinese restaurant just you will find in most any strip mall anywhere - not fancy and a little dated. 

What isn't typical are the food and the owners. They've been at this location for a long time, they are fixtures in the community and their food is great. 

Standard Chinese fare, good prices, excellent quality. When you order something spicy, it's spicy. I highly recommend this place.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Justin M.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: I eat here at least once a month. I get general tsos and white rice everytime. The chicken is always good. Rice always taste like its been sitting for hours so basically like most Chinese places. It doesn't stand out in taste from other Chinese places but its closest to me and consistent so 4 stars.

BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.author: Alisha A.
BY1_pf7FHUycHOwYEenDlQ.description: Pretty good Chinese overall. It's my go to spot near my house for take out. The staff is always friendly and food is always decent.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Brieanna G.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description:
I love this little whole in the wall place. It has that retro diner feel with the tile floors and bright orange/ teal wall paint. 
The food is the definition of a mom and pop restaurant. The food is tasty. If you're watching calories or fat this isn't the place for you. If you're in the mood for some hardy and good/greasy breakfast food (they serve lunch too- I've just never had it) THIS IS A GREAT PLACE. 
Their pancakes/ waffles are great. Their platters/meal combos are a good option for a filling breakfast. They are priced fairly and now accept both cash and card. 
I would go here if you get the chance. 

*last time I was here their parking meters are only 10cents per 30 min. There is only street parking available and it normally isn't too bad to find a spot. 

I got asked to prom here with whipped cream on pancakes and have taken several people here for little breakfast treats.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Megan W.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: This brunch spot is a little gem that more folks should know about. They have the best and most inexpensive chicken and waffles the city has to offer. They use local products - like Jenny Lee Swirl Bread, Ricci's sausage, Mancini's bread (all made in Mckees Rocks, too!). All that paired with the diner ambiance and kind waiters make it a delightful experience.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Alan W.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description:
Went for breakfast with wife and daughter the other day.
I had two eggs over easy with bacon well done and home fries and white toast.
The food was cooked perfectly and was totally delicious.
The waitress was super friendly and provided great service.
The prices where reasonable and again the food was great.
I would definitely go there again.
If you are in the area and want great service and food you won't be disapointed.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Nicole W.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: Nothing fancy, full of locals, and a perfect little diner. I go here a lot with my family. It's the definition of greasy spoon in a very good way. My favorite is the breakfast sandwich on a bagel. My husband swears by the breakfast special.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Lynn D.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: Why do you close so early ? Im looking to buy a diner soon but all 24 hours ! I love your diner but you guys close to early ! Very. Good service and great food here ty  love the food and staff id rate 5. .ty brodaway brunch

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Ron A.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: Stopped in by chance, and was pleasantly surprised. It's a very welcoming place. The wait staff was attentive, and very friendly. The food was good, and I didn't have to wait long for my food. I'll definitely be going back.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Renee J T.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description:
Need a great breakfast? With amazing bread?
This great place is a diner
With its simple design of old photos on the wall 
Plus a old fashion counter to sit at
I came for breakfast 
Friendly waitress was there instantly with a hot cup of really good coffee
The menu has the usual egg offerings omelets n such 
What stands out is you can get Mancini bread toasted or French toast 
Yes the bread is that good 
Easy parking on the street 
Great diner

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Nena U.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description:
I declare Broadway Brunch is now... one of my favorite spots for breakfast!! Ample off street parking nearby, welcoming décor inside ( I love the hometown "rocks" prints on the wall), seat yourself and not a moment later greeted with a friendly smile.  I decided on the "extra" special, which is 2 eggs, bacon or sausage, home fries or hash browns and 1 pancake which was huge!  The pancake was really delicious and so fresh but too big for me. I couldn't finish it.  Everything was great but the bacon could have been more crispy as requested.  

I love that mancinis bread is offered on the menu... being from the rocks.. that's always a bonus to me. I dont feel the quality of the food was similar to a "greasy spoon" type place .. I thought it was better than that.

What a good vibe at this restaurant. The food and service was excellent I will no doubt be visiting again very soon!  Thanks Broadway Brunch!

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Jennifer S.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: Best brunch or lunch breakfast place to eat and they're very fast and accurate with their food and their food is absolutely good I got the chicken salad today and going was a good it's nice and healthy and absolutely I would come here everyday if I could

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Candise A.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: This diner is AMAZING! Everything is fresh and cooked from scratch! The staff is so friendly too! I had the Viking breakfast and I've never had fluffier pancakes in my life. We are from Erie but we will definitely be back!!!

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Colleen O.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: So we heard about it we went and LOVED IT!   The service was wonderful the food was great. I had chicken and waffles yummmm      she had the the Little Marge that was really good yummmm . We will be going again soon.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Joe G.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: The staff is very friendly and fast (our waitress practically ran to the coffee pot when she saw our mugs were empty). We ordered breakfast: a ham and cheese omelet for me and poached eggs for my wife. The omelet was a nice size and actually had the ham and cheese mixed within the egg which is always a plus. My only complaint would be he Mancini Italian was the home style, and not the wide, full-sized Italian. It's a shame because they are only a couple blocks from the Mancini bakery.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Elle W.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: Last 3 times I have been here haven't been good.  Raisin toast was dry and stale.  Potatoes were cold. Service was good. I gave it a 5 star before.   But I won't be back.  Too much inconsistencies.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Sarah C.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description:
This is our favorite place to go for breakfast and lunch!!! It's a small diner with 50s-esque decor, and the best servers in town.
The food is awesome...no matter what you get. We usually do breakfast-great omelettes, sauage gravy, home fries (amazing,) pancakes...even the toast is delicious. The burgers and wraps are fantastic too.
What we love the most is the service. If "We Treat You Like Family" wasn't already trademarked by Olive Garden, these guys would own it. The servers are so damn friendly! Even if you're not seated in their section, they will still come over and top off your coffee, and give you a cold refill. My husband and I walk in and they already have our drink orders on the way (maybe we go here too often...)
Definitely recommend this place. Eat here!!

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Tee H.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: Is the best restaurant in McKees Rocks and maybe in Pittsburgh so if you're looking for a good restaurant okay prices and good food then Broadway brunch is your place to be

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Dustin S.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: I loved this little place! You can't go wrong with anything you order. I love the family feel and the look. This is a true spot that you can be treated like a local and be joked around with as if they know you even if it's your first time. You might be asking well it's a breakfast place why would I give it five stars? Because they do it right!

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Timothy C.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description:
I've been coming here for years but the new owner makes a world of difference.  Great bargain and better breakfast. You can't go wrong with straightforward good food made well. In an area known for great basics these guys get it right.

Take a trip to Stowe hunry.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Mikey R.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description: It seems every time I eat here the food is even more disgusting than the previous visit. The product quality is terrible. You can taste how cheap everything is. First they switch their sausage supplier, which is a fellow small business within the community for garbage crumble. Now they've changed their already declining home fries to these cheap mini potatoes. Which were served to me practically raw. It's an absolute shame that the owner lives with himself knowing what a scam that place has become since he purchased it. They need to work with some soul in there

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Derek R.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description:
Always a favorite. New name (Broadway brunch), but the same great food. Good coffee.quick service, friendly waitstaff. Good home cooked foots at reasonable prices. The neighborhood is a bit sketchy, so lock your car doors. 
  Local foods ( Mancinis toast, Riccis sausage). Atmosphere is loud, smokey and a bit greasy, but the delicious food is worth it. 
You can't beat Marges place for a great deal. 2 eggs cooked to order, the best home fries I know of, crisp hickory bacon, Rocco's sausage, hot buttered Mancinis toast and vanilla French toast...$6.99

I hope it never changes by going upscale or healthy ( organic, vegan etc). 
 Parking meters are 10 cents an hour.

NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.author: Stacie C.
NvHGOIIukJ4y3iFswY-k8g.description:
On a random Sunday morning I went in search of a good breakfast spot.  I decided to explore the McKees Rocks neighborhood and came upon Marge's Place.  I hadn't heard much about this place, but after reading the few reviews I could find, I decided to give it a try.  

Inside, it's bigger than I expected but still has that down home diner feel.  My guess is that most of the people there were regulars.  The wait staff was friendly to those they knew but also welcoming to me, someone they had never seen before.  I picked a table in the corner so I could observe what I imagine was a typical Sunday morning.  I ordered the breakfast special: 2 scrambled eggs with bacon, potatoes and toast.  Any place that has Mancini's Italian toast already gets thumbs up in my book.  Being in McKees Rocks, though, they really don't have a choice.  The potatoes were thin sliced with onions and very flavorful.  The only way I can think of to describe the bacon is...porkier.  Is that even a word?  I just don't know how else to descibe it.  The combination of foods was served in generous portions at a great price (under $5).  

One random note: I liked the tables and chairs.  They were comfortable not just for sitting and enjoying a cup of coffee with my morning paper but also very comfortable for sitting and eating.  Good distance between the table and chairs.  That may sound silly, and I thought so, too, at first.  But when I go to a place and the booth is too wide or too narrow, it can hinder my enjoyment.  

Not only will I return, but I will also recommend Marge's Place to anyone in the area.  It was a surprisingly good find.  I like places like neighborhood businesses like this where they make everyone feel like they belong.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Jayme B.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: My coworker brought me here for lunch this week. It's nestled right on Smithfield Street, but it wasn't super busy during the lunch hour. The menu is typically deli foods: sandwiches, salads, a little case of prepared salads (pasta, tuna, chicken salad, etc). But one really cool thing was that they have a salad bar, so you can make your own salad. In the prepared food section, they also have little containers of grilled chicken that you can purchase to top your salad with some protein. I decided on that option. My coworker went with a half sandwich and soup. All of the vegetables and chicken were very fresh. The service was really good too- they offered to heat up my chicken, which I appreciated. The prices are pretty on-par for downtown. I'm very surprised this place wasn't busier than it was, but I'm glad it wasn't. I will definitely be coming back here for a nice quick, reasonable lunch option!

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Ibrahim B.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description:
This place is alright. I'm only giving 3 stars because of the sweet old lady who works here. I came during an average time - there were 4 people in line - and it took a really long time. They're under staffed 

It's a bit overpriced for what the sandwiches are. Just deli meet and lettuce and tomato. No real sauce or flavor. Had to add my own concoction of thousand island salt and pepper. Don't think I'll come back for lunch.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Kimberly S.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description:
Tried them for lunch on Friday.

The service is great. Very friendly staff and quick.

I ordered a Mt. Washington sandwich. It was tasty but it had quite a bit of slaw on it. I felt like it could have had more meat for the price.

I also ordered a macaroni salad. It was also tasty but was a bit on the wet side for me. 

All in all, I'd visit again in a pinch, but I think there are other places that provide a better value for lunch downtown.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Shawn N.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description:
Very good local deli. The menu is accessible and a tad creative. 

The best part is the people followed by the prices. I like to get a cup of their chili (regular or hot sausage) with just about any sandwich. 

They have a selection of salads and a small salad bar too.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: C E.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description:
This place is straightforward and no frills.  They have sandwiches and salads.  It is quick and not a chain, so that seems to hit a lot of points just there.  Very good sides as well.

Not many straight up delis downtown, this is the best option

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Joe H.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: Very tasty turkey with Cole slaw and thousand island. Chicken noodle soup was pretty good too. I think this is the best deli I have found in downtown Pittsburgh. Very interesting sandwich choices. I will be back.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: HN S.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: This place is everything you would expect from a deli and they do it very well. Quick friendly service, fresh and generous ingredients all at a reasonable price.  I had the Oakland Sandwich (all of the sandwiches are named after sections of Pittsburgh) which was essentially a triple decker BLT with turkey and American cheese on French bread. Just what I was in the mood for today only it was piled so high with ingredients that I couldn't finish the whole sandwich. If you come to the Boulevard Deli bring your appetite.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Claudia F.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: great sandwich and service. good price for the sandwich size too. half way through and i'm already full lol

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Celeta S.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: Fresh sandwiches, salads and homemade soups make this deli a winner. They are very friendly and the food is good. I love the variety and they have daily specials. I've been eating here a while and I've never been disappointed.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Susan D.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description:
I was in the mood to try someplace different on my lunch hour, even if it meant trekking a few blocks out of my way.  And after having tried Boulevard Deli, I can safely say it was well worth the hike.  

Nearly all of the items on the menu here have Pittsburgh-centric names and it was hard for me to decide.  The Pittsburgher?  Hmm, I'm not exactly fond of chipped ham, so no.The South Side?  Well a good cappicola is always tempting.  The Squirrel Hill?  Hey, that's my neighborhood, so why not!  The Squirrel Hill is corned beef, 1000 Island dressing, and 'kraut.

In other words, a Ruben!

Oh, but my sandwich was excellent and I was so glad I was able to walk a little bit of it off on the way back!

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Anthony M.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: Not that great of a place to eat.  The salad wasn't too bad.  Chipped ham sandwich was nothing special and barely had any taste. Overall wouldn't recommend this place.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Michael B.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: First time stopping in and was greatly pleased by the sandwich choices as well as the prices. I had the North Shore sandwich and really enjoyed the combination of flavors and left satisfied with my choice.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Angelo R.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: Such a nice little spot. Welcoming staff and delicious sandwiches at very affordable prices.

OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.author: Jim B.
OvDy9zJLGmfPgiKRUsIb4Q.description: The is a great little place. The staff is friendly. The food is always fresh. The chili is awesome. There is a wide variety of sandwiches, salads, a soup of the day and two types of chili. Quiet with some background music make it a good place to have one-on-one conversation or to calm a hectic day.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Kristie B.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: This place is amazing! Ordered pizza from here for the first time and it was delicious. It's for sure my favorite pizza in the area.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Su F.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Amazing food! Love the hoagies and Strombolies! And the pizza is great! The wings were delicious and meaty. Fun place to come with the family. We always bring our family here when they visit from abroad!

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Ralph H.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: I ordered their pizza to a hospital room and the delivery and pizza was fast and tasty. I highly recommend their pizza and their online menu is easy to navigate.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Arlene M.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description:
Haven't been in this area in sometime so I thought I would give this place a try. Set right in the middle of a construction zone-yes those orange barrels are out again, you have just enough space to "squeeze through" two of those cone heads if you are heading away from St Clair hospital towards Scott Twp.

Situated in the former "Life is sweet" bakery cafe, the parking hasn't changed so it is easy for people to "double park" behind one another as was my case.

Take out is available and you can order ahead of time online if you prefer. Once inside the setup is similar to the "Life is sweet" cafe. There are tables in front and some in the back along with reading material. Free WiFi is available. Passcode given upon request. I thought I would take advantage of the lunch pizza special since you get two slices of cheese pizza for just under $5.00 which includes a canned beverage or water.

I asked about toppings and learned that any topping from the board can be ordered for an additional $.50 each. I asked about the choice of crusts. I was told that with the special all I was entitled to was the traditional crust. If you want the whole wheat or multigrain then you would have to purchase a whole pie. The smallest size has 6 cuts which is way too much for me. So I thought I would try the special and go from there.

Yes, there are gluten free options available as well as vegetarian. No vegan here. I placed my order and got it fairly quickly even though the place was packed with kids and young adults.

I ordered the two slices with mushrooms and green peppers. The portion sizes were very generous but I could tell by tasting it that it may have been microwaved. The pizza was okay but not anything special that I would go out of my way for. It just reminded me of those take out chains (which I had previously noted you can do here) and is probably good for just that.

The two slices were more than enough for me. Didn't need a salad nor did I want to try a hoagie. Staff was friendly and pleasant but I didn't see how to dispose of my leftovers so I took it back to the counter and the clerk took it off my hands.

It is convenient to St Clair Hospital but dealing with both construction and parking can be a nightmare. If you are happy with those big box pizza places and delivery service then I'm sure you won't be disappointed here.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Troy B.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Stopped back for a second try, and this time I tried a Cheese Steak Hoagie on regular bread (the wife got a veggie hoagie on gluten-free bread again), and I thought the hoagie was O.K., but not that great.  I was pretty disappointed that the tomatoes they used were very unripe.  Also, the hoagie itself didn't have a ton of flavor (I added mayo (which they do have available in packets) plus a lot of salt and pepper to try and give it a little more taste).  I still may give this place another try again in the future, but as of now, I am giving it an "A-OK" rating.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: DJ J.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description:
New pizza place next to Rite Aid in a location that once was a Bakery/Coffee shop (Life is Sweet).
Grabbed a Italian Hoagie that had the usual ham, salami, pepperoni with provolone, lettuce tomato onion and Italian dressing.  A pretty good hoagie.  The menu has wraps, salads, wings, stromboli and a couple of desserts.  KC has traditionally, multigrain, whole wheat and Gluten Free crust.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Igles S.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: The best pizza I ever ate in my life no pork hogies fire prices is right if like pizza get out there it's worth da ride

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Jeanne H.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Closest pizza to my house! How lucky can I be...crispy crust with a little chew. Perfect! Had the White Queen this time...ripe tomatoes, fresh baby spinach and creamy ricotta.  Yum. I picked up but they have a nice area to eat in. My new go to pizza place. Can't wait to try more

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Jim M.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Assume experience with take out. Website is easy to order and customize what you need.  Food is always on point with taste and selection.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Jamie L.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Not my favorite place to get pizza. The best I could say is it was ok. Nothing very special about it. Picked it up once at home and got their pizza at work. Both times it was just ok. Not a lot of flavor. Not a lot of toppings. I probably won't try again.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Bud L.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Great place to eat tasty pizza. Very clean inside and good service. I would highly recommend their chicken wings.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Joana B.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: My new favorite pizza place in the Mt. Lebanon area. The crust is perfect, with many options like wheat, gluten free, or regular even. The pizza sauces are great and the toppings are fresh. Their wings are also really good, crispy, but not dried out. My son doesn't want delivery from anywhere else now.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Nicolette L.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Order simple pepperoni. It was still raw. We didn't enjoy it. Bland sauce. In the land of Mineos, campitis, Badamo, you hope this one would be on par.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Collin K.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Really delicious pizza with great crust options. We get the Tuscan Chicken on either whole wheat or multigrain thin crust and it is fantastic. Tastes fresh and the crust is healthier than most other pizza joints. Would definitely recommend.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Safiyyah S.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Great pizza, fresh ingredients. Fast and friendly service. Modern dining area. Healthy options. We enjoyed our visit.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Katie S.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: I was waiting for a quick/reliable food shop to go in across the street from the Bower Hill condominiums.  This place is reasonably priced and offers a wide variety of hoagies, pizzas, apps, etc.  I have tried some of their specialty pizzas including the buffalo chicken and hoagies including the cheese steak.  Always ready in the time frame they provide which is typically 20 minutes when I order.  The staff are friendly and the shop is kept clean. I wouldn't say it is anything unique but the service keeps me coming back!

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Sam S.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: I would like to give it more.  I was thinking 2.5 would be good for about average.  It's frustrating when you receive a pizza and there is such little pizza dough you can practically see through it.  At 13.99 for a large I'm sure they can afford to add a little more substance.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Heather H.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: Thank you, thank you, thank you! I was just recently diagnosed with celiac disease and was devastated to think I couldn't have pizza again, and if I did I was convinced it would be terrible. I stumbled upon your shop and all I can say is AMAZING! Thank you for producing such a delicious option for those of us who would otherwise be left out.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Rachel K.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: We stopped in last night to give it a try, We got a basic half cheese half pepperoni and a salad and ate in. It was just Meh, Ive had better. The pizza seemed like it need more seasonings and salad was ok. For eat in, there could be some sort of service, bring out the salad first while the pizza cooked, but they like to bring everything together. Next time we will stick to our favorite, Crust! Café and Pizzeria on Painters Run Rd.

UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.author: Kristina K.
UTtXuA_bPa0w24G89SKM6g.description: I have been here at least 5 times in the last 2 weeks. From the pizza, the veggie wrap to the Greek salad. Everything has been excellent every time. The pizza was hot on pickup and delicious. Read a couple of the negative reviews and definitely not the experience I've had or my friends I've sent there.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Gabrielle W.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: The food was pretty good, but the beer was warm and tasted kind of dirty. It took a while to get our food and drinks, but there was only one waitress to do everything. The waitress was super sweet, and was doing her best despite being the only waitress helping and her second day as a waitress.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Andrew M.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: I just moved to the area and put in an order for pick up. It was supposed to be ready at 6:25, I got there at 6:20 and even though I am 6'3" and I was standing right at the bar no one working there would even look at me for 15 minutes. I eventually just sat and patiently waited and finally around 6:50 someone threw a bag of food at me. Wish I would have read reviews prior to ordering...I thought about just walking out, figuring losing $25 dollars was not worth the aggravation and smell associated with the place.  Needlessly to say, I was super disappointed, it looked like such a cool place...

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Nicole W.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description:
I used to go here often when smoking was standard in all bars/restaurants around Pittsburgh. I stopped going when they refused to become non-smoking about 10 years ago. The place is honestly disgusting inside - it's so hard to breathe. 

Last evening, a friend suggested we go there and sit on the patio. I agreed because I wouldn't have to go inside. We called ahead and let them know that about 11 of us would be there. What a mistake. It was literally the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Jess W. was also a part of my party and she sums the evening up much better than I can in her review. 

I only want to say that you should run very very far away from this place. My friends and I were calm and understanding with our incompetent waiter and lack of correct food and drinks for the first 2.5 hours we were there. When our waiter went off the deep end there should have been a manager there to sort everything out. I am appalled by the way we were treated and more appalled that this restaurant somehow manages to stay open. 

They will never have my business again. Nor any of my friends. 

And finally, once again,  it's smoking. So even if you think I'm just a disgruntled person ranting, and even if the food and service were fair/good (they were both so so so so bad) -  I would tell any nonsmoker to avoid.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Karla D.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description:
This was an after work go-to with coworkers whenever there was something to celebrate (promotions, etc) or if someone was moving on to another company.

The main reason it was a gathering place for us is because it was so close to our office. Another positive factor is the size. It's a large facility.

However, service is less than average. When it gets busy the workers really seem to get confused and unable to do more than one thing at a time. I've witnessed outright rude treatment of customers.

Pretty sure the food is frozen, packaged stuff from a big processed food provider. That's what it tastes like. 

Can't see myself ever going back.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Michael M.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: Don't eat here or drink here unless you're ok being sick.  The bartender was nice but in the time I sat there I saw several MAJOR health code violations. No one in the kitchen is wearing gloves or washing hands. The kitchen staff is talking on their cell phones while making your food while eating over the food they are making for you.  The beer lines are not cold enough and they cleanly have not been cleaned.  My beer was warm had a ton of head and tastes like the last beer that was in the line, something with lime.  Hop House please pull it together! I really want to like you! It's a cool bar with a nice deck, the saff is normally pretty good, and their food is dam good I could just do without the side of ecoli or salmonella.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Jason H.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: Came in tonight for drinks and dinner with friends.  Ordered 2 drinks and then food and all was good.  Ordered the 3rd drink.  Waited 40 minutes and still never got the drink.  Waitress came over and told me the lettuce for my salad was not available.  I told her any lettuce will do.   She came back with everyone else's food and then mine last.  She asked if anything else was needed.  I told her that I had been waiting for drinks for over 40 minutes and she told me she did not care and that she could only do what she had time for.  I then went to speak to a manager.  There was not one available as I was told by someone passing by.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: J D.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description:
Update - went and sat at the bar. Bartender acted as though we weren't there. We got our own menus and she walked by us about 5 times. Within 10 minutes we were not addressed and ended up walking out. Won't go back 

You have to be 18 to enter. I ordered food to go. The calzone was recommended over the sandwiches. It was okay, nothing special but large enough for two meals and a good price. Word to the wise, this place is a smoking establishment and you notice right away. When I walked in, no one was smoking but you could smell it everywhere. They ahave a back patio.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Jess W.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: I actually can't believe the horrible experience I just had at this place. It was my first time going and most definitely my last. I was with a group of 11 people - when we arrived there were only two other people in the restaurant, so they were clearly not busy.  The waiter - JEFF - seemed to have some extreme difficulty writing down our orders. He came back a couple times saying they were out of things and asking to clarify a couple of our orders. It took a very long time to get our drinks. After putting down a draught beer for one of my friends Jeff said "that might taste weird, we get a lot of complaints that the taps are flat and warm. I meant to tell you when you ordered but didn't." Lo & behold, the beer definitely had a weird taste. So...thanks for that, Jeff. Drinks trickled in throughout our stay, but we often had to ask for things at least twice. Jeff came back at some point and said "i wrote down that someone ordered chicken fries but we don't sell that" so we had to go around AGAIN to give him our orders. OBVIOUSLY NO ONE ORDERED CHICKEN FRIES. It took over an hour for food to start trickling in. Two people in my party never even received their meals.  Others had sides missing. Whole thing was a mess. I should note that the entire night Jeff Kent's saying "I'm doing my best." You clearly weren't, Jeff. We finally ask for our checks and a ridiculous amount of time passed before a couple people went in asking what's going on. A girl appeared to be handling the checks and said they'd be out in a couple of minutes. More & more time passes so I finally went in asking what was going on. This girl was also clearly having difficulty because it appears Jeff didn't write anything down properly. I said that we were all going to leave soon and Jeff said "you are NOT leaving without paying, that is stealing!" And I said "you didn't even bring half our food out." Jeff literally went from 0 to 100 and pointed at me yelling "You are a fucking piece of trash! You're the most disgusting person I've ever met! You are trash!" Jeff, not sure if you could hear or see yourself, but I certainly wasn't the piece of trash in this scenario. The manager on duty (bartender) was called over. She said she told Jeff to leave for the night. I said that I would hope he'd be fired for talking to me like that but she said she doesn't have that power because she's not actually a manager. So that was helpful. No one offered to comp us for anything, the "manager"/bartender did not apologize. The girl helping with the checks wasn't even working apparently, she just happened to stop in. She did not offer to comp us so I told her I would not be paying for anything I got. I've never been treated like this anywhere ever. Based on most other reviews, this place is a disaster and shouldn't be in operation. At the very least I hope they fire Jeff and he considers another occupation because he clearly is not a waiter. P.S. the food I did get was horrible. A "medium" hamburger should not be hard as a hockey puck.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Sarah G.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: Awesome food + any and all drinks available but half of the staff seems to be on drugs and the inside smells like one giant ashtray

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Jalyn Y.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: Came for wing night. Lots of space for our fairly large group. Everyone was impressed with the wings, are server was very nice and constantly checked up on everyone. I had the shrimp quesadilla, very good, came with homemade salsa. My only complaint is it's a smoking bar, being a non smoker it's soo annoying going into a place to eat and coming out smelling like cigarettes. It's such a hard smell to get out. For that reason we will not be going back for wing night.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Kate E.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: Every time my husband and I come here we leave pleased! Always have great staff, great drinks, the food is awesome (try the spinach artichoke dip with the flatbread! YUMMM!) This place does a casual night out right!

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Brandon K.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: Beautiful place if ur a smoker. It not do a to go order for the pizza! It's amazing! Great place for a beer and pizza. And for a to go order. I'll b back!

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Daniel T.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: If you are black dude don't come to the restaurant... literally there is 6 people in the restaurant and they are talking about we can't place your order its to busy really....Ugh really i can't keep going to business that is racist.... Just put up a sign that say no black wanted.... PERIOD

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: David B.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: I used to really enjoy the hop house for what it was... "bar food". my last experience, even if my wife and myself don't end up sick, will absolutely be our last. No seasoning on my burger at all, not even a pinch of salt. The macaroni and cheese had almost as much flavor as the napkin I spit it into. The Buffalo chicken dip, the reason I ate there, had no sign of Buffalo, at first glance I confused it with the macaroni and cheese. It was as bland as the rest of the order. As if that wasn't enough the order of pierogis were way past date. I'd guess they were boiled about a week ago, then cooled improperly, then rotated improperly, and even still served to my wife. After we each ate 1. I inspected the pierogis under better lite not only were they hard in spots and not fried only boiled. They had a sweet flavor to them and under better light were gray. This is the worst of the worst.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: T M.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: Wings have gone down hill .ordered well done it came chewy. They have a new cook at wing happy hour and they use a different type of wing now. Both not good !

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Sue Z.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: There's a waitress who works there that threw my family out of the restaurant last night!!!! She needs to be FIRED! I have had enough of rude waitresses & this was over the top! We will NEVER SET FOOT in there again. You know who YOU ARE!!!!!!!

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Stephanie F.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: I don't know what everyone's talking about because my experience here was amazing. The food is insane good for a bar. We had garlic Parmesan wings which were so crispy and cooked to protection. Then we had the shrimp and scallop pasta which had ginormous scallops and it was to die for. The bartender Cindi is super sweet and took great care of us. Everyone in here seems super nice. This is my type of atmosphere for sure. If I'm back in town I'll be coming here to throw a couple back, eat some delicious food and play some darts. Love this place!

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: R W.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description:
EDIT... I would give it 0 stars if I could. The manager/waitress m started yelling at the whole deck after we all complained how horrible the service was. Absolutely ridiculous. Although they made sure everyone paid FULL PRICE for everything. Seriously... stay away !!!!!

Poor service... had to go into bar from deck 3 times to get my drinks and food that was sitting at the bar. Complained to managers and nothing... no comp. stay away.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Mary G.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description: I could do without the smoke, but this is a great bar so close to home. The food is solid, a little better than average bar food. They have over 30 taps and a good craft beer selection.

O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.author: Vanessa W.
O4eH0Hlu7lr_uuE2-Ymydw.description:
First visit here doing lunch with my new coworkers. Smoker friendly but they do have a decent ventilation system at least. They had a decent Lenten menu featuring peirogies and lobster mac and cheese. 

My coworker said their salsa was really good so I went with the vegetable quesadillas. Very generous salsa and sour cream portions, and that is always a plus! But that's as good as it got... the quesadilla itself wasn't very good... carrots? I realize it was veggies, just never had carrots on it before. 

I'm sure this is a great place for drinks, they appeared to have great drink specials as well but I wouldn't recommend it for a dining experience. Our bartender/server kept coming over with super cheesy lines, it was very awkward. Probably wouldn't be as awkward at night while drinking.. or if you're a yinzer.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Amanda B.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description:
This restaurant is a family dinner staple for the rare occasion we all go out to eat together. I've never had a bad meal here. I've also had my college and graduate school graduation parties here. They were very accommodating during those times. 

You have to try their fish sandwich. If you show up during Lent though, prepare to wait. It's worth it! My dad and I often split one of their fish sandwiches and it is plenty of food for the two of us. 

Kretzler's isn't a place you'll find trendy new food, but it is a dependable place that you can trust to be a good meal and a good place to bring others.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Jessica M.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: A forgettable experience overall. For advertising as a German restaurant, there are very few German options on the menu. Without having that distinguishing feature, this is just your average neighborhood restaurant with average food.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Jo J.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: Well, no more chances. I don't know how many times I try to give Kretzlers another chance at good food.  We order the same thing.  Wings- extra crispy.  All that means is that I do not want cold bloody insides, slimy skin translucent skin on the outside.  So, when I request "extra crispy". How does that translate to "underdone".  House salad.... old slimy dark lettuce mixed with brown iceberg. I don't know that they could water down the ranch anymore. Then no dipping sauce with the stuffed pretzel.  This is my local restaurant and I so want to give them my patronage.  Over the past year, my wings have been prepared properly once for every five times. Sad. I don't know what happened, but I can only assume new management/ownership.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Krissy G.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description:
Restaurant full of regulars, but welcoming of new customers! We stopped in for a Friday lunch and surprised by how busy it was! On this day, it seemed everyone was enjoying a meatless Friday with plenty of fish and seafood options. We were seated quickly, and warmly welcomed. 

I came for the sole purpose of trying the legendary fish sandwich - which did not disappoint. It was good to know we could sub out bun/bread options (if food allergies are a concern ie: sesame seed buns aplenty on the menu.) My husband had the chicken breast sandwich (batter dipped) and added buffalo hot sauce for $1. I liked chicken, however, it did get a bit lost on the hoagie bun so try for the suggested sesame bun or perhaps the white, wheat, or tortilla wrap. Potato pancakes were a hit!

They had a nice selection of over twenty beers on draft, but the list was written on a white board with a few letters missing.

Definitely look forward to coming back with the kids!

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: India S.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: Visiting from NYC.. can't say enough about this place! As someone who has been to Germany and live in a city where food is on every corner I felt like I walked into heaven! The beers are priced very reasonably and the food is phenomenal! Ordered a stuffed pretzel and almost immediately ordered a second one. The staff was so friendly, the owner greeted us which made it feel very cozy. Will be back for sure on my next visit!

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Jack T.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: Placed an order over the phone and went to pick up my food.  When I returned home I did not get the potato pancakes that I ordered, the french dip I ordered did not include the Au Jus, and the french dip sandwich was mostly bread.  Called them after I got home and they offered to replace the Au Jus I never got, and get me the missing potato pancakes.  Didn't want to  to make the drive there again so I ended up eating a very dry sandwich.  The fish I ordered was very good.  I would think twice before ordering take out from there again!  Very disappointing!!  BEWARE

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Jill M.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description:
Very very disappointed ... We went there several months ago and they were out of everything that we ordered...that being said once we got our food everything was fine so we decided to give it another shot.

Went there tonight and my husband and daughter got tavern salads and I ordered the shrimp BLT salad ... Which was literally supposed to be lettuce, tomato, bacon, Bleu cheese crumble and shrimp.  When the waitress brought it out it was a tavern salad with shrimp (fries and a bunch of veggies I didn't want) ... When I pointed out that it was wrong her excuse was she was new do she didn't know and asked if I wanted it remade.  I said yes cause I wanted it to be what I ordered ... When she brought it back it was the same salad minus the fries and added the Bleu cheese and bacon ... So I still had to pick out the veggies I didn't want ... After pointing out again that the kitchen needs to make sure they know what's on the menu - no offer to have manager speak to me

So that being said and 2 ODD experiences - I will probably never go back!

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Elaine F.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: My friend and I had heard about this place that has been here for many years.. it was a halfway point between our houses. I got a coupon in my coupon clipper so we said why not?! We came for a fairly early dinner on a Thursday night. Place was busy parking lot crowded.. good sign. I was seated promptly. My friend arrived shortly. I ordered. Really nice mild Belgian weisbeer. We got pretzel sticks with dips. Soft warm delicious. I got the Rueben .. one of the best I've had with a side of yummy cole slaw. My friend got the fish sandwich on a pretzel roll. Generous portions and delicious!! Potato pancake like my hone made ones. Definitely plan on frequent long this place.  Oh and btw totally forgot about my coupon so I HAVE to come back soon!!

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Gregory S.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description:
My friend and I ate here on a Saturday night during Oktoberfest and we both enjoyed our meals very much.  I got the jagerschnitzel with potato pancakes, spaetzle, and red cabbage.  My friend got the stuffed shrimp from the regular menu.  Food temperature, appearance, taste, and portion size was all very good.  Also the turtle cheesecake for dessert was delicious.

Our waitress was very attentive and friendly.  The decor of the furniture in the dining room is rustic and interesting.  There is also a big screen TV so you can catch a football game even from the main dining room.

The dining room area was busy but not packed, and there was plenty of space in the large parking lot.  This was my first time here and there was really nothing not to like.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Stacey B.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description:
Kretzler's Tavern has been part of the North Hills dining and drinking scene for as long as I can remember (40+ years).  The place has continued to evolve over time but maintained their German slant on beer and food.  I enjoyed a nice cold Hacker Pschorr Munich Gold draft on tap tonight with my fish sandwich and perfectly seasoned potato cake with applesauce.  They feature more than 27 beers on tap which is nice and have a full bar area with high top tables and some games. 

Their fish batter is a tad bland but the fish was white, fresh, and meaty so that sort of made up for the batter.  The potato pancakes were exactly like my dear Mother used to make: shredded potatoes with minced onion and egg that is formed into a cake and pan fried on high heat to give the outside that crispy texture and keep the inside moist.  My partner loved the coleslaw too. 

The chairs and tables are beautiful rustic wood with a dark stain that must have recently been refinished.  Business was brisk with many casual diners still streaming in as we finished up around 8:45PM.  We love to find places that will accommodate some later dining so this one goes onto the short list of North Hills restaurants with later dinner bells. 

Our waitress was very attentive and courteous which created a nice dining experience. The rest of the menu is staple diner/home cooked food like steaks/chops, sandwiches, burgers, and appetizers.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Spencer S.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: My boyfriend and I visited this restaurant because we were looking for a chill place to drink beer and watch football games and we were blown away by the hospitality, great food, cheap drinks, and relaxing atmosphere. You could tell this place was the hang out spot for locals, but the workers treated us "out of towners" great and we felt at home. I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant if you're looking for bar food and great drinks. I started off by ordering the stuffed pretzel as an appetizer: AMAZING. Then I ordered the tavern style salad with buffalo chicken tenders and my boyfriend ordered the Philly cheesesteak sandwich. Both great options. We thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant and if we're ever back in Pittsburgh, we will make sure to eat here again!!

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Bob N.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: The service is awful. The co owner, Jason, fired a millvale flood victim because she had to call off to salvage family belongings. I must admit their fish is darn good though.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Renee L.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description:
I often drive past this place and always thought that it looks more like a bar then a restaurant from the outside. However, during my first visit here last night I found out that this is not the case.  You do , however, enter the bar area to go into the rather large sized dining room. The first thing that caught my attention  was the unique looking  dining room chairs.  They appear to be custom made and tree branches were used to form the backs of the chairs. Further beyond the main dining room is another separate, more private dining room for parties etc.. I also noticed a door in the rear of the building allowing access to both the main dining room and the private one.

The menu looked very inviting with plenty of good options.  I finally decided to try their fish sandwich since this is one of their known specialties  and my friend decided on the Reuben.  We ended up splitting our sandwiches and both were of good quality and very filling.
The server mentioned that they offer homemade soups on a regular basis but it is hard to know which soup will be featured on any given day.  Last night featured a hearty navy bean soup.
The prices are very reasonable and we look forward to another visit.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Ruth H.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: Terrible, Had the senior fish sandwich , the bun was plane, dry and unappetizing the fish greasy and equally unappetizing.   Also the waitress would not accept the coupon we had because it was Ash Wednesday. ?  The coupon was supposed to be good Monday through Friday.  Not to mention the extremely long wait!

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Christine T.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description:
Came here for dinner and a drink with my husband. Nice place, large selection of beer on tap, good food including traditional German food (braunschweiger sandwich!!!) and a large shuffleboard table. Bartender was friendly enough and the place wasn't too crowded.

Update: came here again for dinner on a Sunday evening and got the prime rib special and a glass of red wine. It was very good! Lots of options for sides and a large amount of food for the price. The waitress was attentive and the prime was cooked to the right temp.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Oussama E.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: A half hearted apology and keeping the status quo under the guise of giving back to the community a paltry $500 via a go fund me page won't cut it bub. You ought to hire that waitress back and give her a raise for all the BS you put her through.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Ken P.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: I'm done with this place.  No wonder it's only half full on Friday at 8:00pm.  I just left because I wanted for 15 minutes for a waitress that never showed up, while a gaggle of them sat at a corner table gabbing.  I waived at them a few times and was ignored.  TJE FOOD IS GOOD HERE, but the service is usually slow and bad.  Mr. Kretzler, fire the dead wait, you'd be better off.  Especially since you're in an area where there's TONS OF competition.  I went to Montecellos a block away, got greeted, got drinks and an appetizer in the same amount of time it took me not to get service at Kretzlers.

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Ali D.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description:
Worst. Food. Ever. I can't explain how awful this place is - however let me begin:
-dirty: seriously? You can't wipe your menus? 
-staff: forgot EVERYTHING 
-food: was cold, greasy, and literally looked like a frozen meal
- expensive - for the food their serving, they should charge WAY less

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Kips C.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: Absolutely love the atmosphere and food here! Potato pancakes are life here  definitely going back asap!

MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.author: Ed S.
MfgewgMdqCx_JWk--6PgfA.description: It was a steelers gameday, not packed at all. Ordered the meatball hoagie with fries and the chicken parm sandwich. The fries were crispy and tasty. The meatball hoagie was really nicely made, enough meatballs and cheese and sauce as well. I would recommend it. The chicken parm sandwich comes open faced on toasted garlic bread which was different but tasted awesome that way. Good draft choices and service at the bar was quick and cordial.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Linda N.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description:
I went for the first time and it was delicious. I got a rice bowl and my husband got the soup. We both enjoyed our delicious dishes. 

I got the pork with my noodle bowl and it was great.  We also got a few sides before the meal. My fav was the Korean potato salad ... yum.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Ana A.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description:
Wow wow wow! I'm so happy there's a Korean place in Carnegie, and an awesome one at that! I have ordered from DonDon a lot in the past, and they've always offered pretty average Chinese food (the 2 restaurants have merged now), so I didn't really know what to expect with the Korean bbq options from Kasai. It is a family owned business, the service is very kind, and the food is clearly made with love.

I was shocked at how delicious everything was. I ordered the regular chicken bulgogi meal with rice, kimchi, and a salad w/ yum yum sauce dressing. My friends ordered shrimp bulgogi and some different sides, and everything was incredible. 

I'm really particular about the Asian food I eat, and my standards are prettttttty high, so when I say Kasai is a 5 star place, I mean it. I hope more people realize their food is totally different from don don (with better quality and flavors in my opinion). Great addition to Carnegie, and I am so excited to order it for delivery on Uber eats next time around.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Briar B.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: Being raised by a Korean woman gives me high standards for Korean cooking and this is the best I've had outside of mom's house.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Chang K.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: The food was so good!! It tastes very authentic. We had Bibimbap, spring roll and kimchi Jjigae, they were all spot on! Their spring roll was out of this world absolutely amazing, forgot to mention the kimchi soup was sizzling hot the whole time.  They participate in Uber eats, grab hub and door dash, too. We'll definitely be back.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Christy C.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description:
I'm always looking for new sushi spots, and Kasai has been on my radar for some time now.  The Yelp reviews seemed favorable, so my SO and I ventured here on a weekend date night.  When we walked in to a completely empty restaurant at 7:00 PM on a Friday, neither of us had to really say anything to the other - our eyes locked with a puzzled "should we stay or should we go?"  

Before we could telepathically discuss things further, we were seated at a table and provided with menus.  My only gripe at this point would be that the tablecloths could've use a refresher between guests, ours had a few food stains/marks on it that looked to be from a prior meal - a bit unappetizing.  

Finally verbalizing our thoughts, we agreed to try one or two rolls and see how they were before deciding if we would order more or mosey around Carnegie to find more to graze on.  We ordered the Chili Thai and Carnegie rolls - both were tasty, fresh, and rather different from any other roll I've tried in my sushi escapades.  The Chili Thai roll was definitely not shy on spice, but it was fresh and I was a fan of the red snapper on top.  The Carnegie roll didn't appear to have any rice inside, but the cuts of fish were generous and it was lightly fried.  This roll struggled to stay together when picked up, perhaps it wasn't rolled tightly or breaded enough, so a few pieces required a fork to pick up; however, the flavors were good and I liked how much fish was packed inside.

Our total for the two rolls was about $27, which is on par with just about any other sushi place I've frequented.  We were still the only customers when we left, save for two or three people that came in to pick up takeout orders during our meal.  I'm not sure if it was just a quiet night in Carnegie or if we hit that sweet spot between the post-work and dinner crowds.  Though our initial reaction was wary due to it being so empty on a Friday, I was pleased with what we ordered and thought that it was fresh and the service was quick.  Kasai may not be my first choice when it comes to sushi south of the city, but it's a decent option for anyone in the neighborhood looking for a sushi fix.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Angie C.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description:
This is my favorite restaurant (sushi bar),,
Always chef he's mane is terry take care of customer a lot n lot Service too there food so testy I high recommend here!..

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Katie P.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: Amazing food and service!!! Try the Korean menu.  Restaurant is very neat and is located on a very pretty street, with good parking.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Alyse J.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: Kasai wasn't the best sushi I've ever had, but it was still really really good and the service was great. The waitress was welcoming and I loved how attentive she was. I loved how the menu had such a variety of unique sushi. The food was delicious and the sushi was pretty fresh. The portions were also large and the price was very reasonable. The hot tea was really good and the teapot it came in was beautiful. I loved how the sushi chef personally walked over to our table and gave us a little dessert box of Pocky at the end of the night. Overall great food and great experience!

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Larissa G.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description:
I had a chance to eat at Kasai for the first time recently, and I'm so pleased with Carnegie's little sushi bar! Cozy, quiet, and cute, Kasai offers the best balance of affordable and quality sushi that I've come across recently.

My boyfriend and I sampled and shared the Crunch Munch Roll (Spicy crab, topped with tempura crunch, shrimp, and eel sauce), the Spider roll (soft shell crab), and one of the spicier rolls (this was mostly eaten by my boyfriend). Yum! The Crunch Munch was just delectable, and the Spider roll was the best I've come across since one of my favorite places closed a couple of years ago. Everything was fresh and the meal was nothing short of delightful.

The excellent and quick service was the cherry on top of a delicious meal - we were checked on often and were never left wanting during the night. I'm definitely look forward to visiting again!

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Mimi S.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: ...I'm so happy I ran across this place on Grub Hub.  I have been searching for a substitute for BaeBaes kitchen, The Golden Pig, and my Mama's cooking. I got the kimpbap and beef bulgogi bowl. I didn't order anything else Because it was my first taste of their food. Now I'm wishing I had ordered the cucumber kimchi and the Napa kimchi.  My only wish is the food were spicier.  I selected extra spicy but that varies person to person. Not a deal breaker. I just added some gochujang to my liking. I'll definitely be ordering from here again. It's worth the delivery and service fee

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Alistair C.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: We were heading to the Indian restaurant around the corner when we remembered it is not open on Mondays. I suggested we try Kasai. We pass it going for Indian and I thought this might be a new joint to check out when in Carnegie. We each (three of us) had lunch specials. Orange chicken, General Tso's and I had spicy shrimp. Of the three mine appeared to the be best. It was standard American Chinese. I asked for it to be spicy, and it was not. Each of us asked for spicy and nothing was... The General Tso's was all breading which really upset my friend. The Orange Chicken was meh too. I suppose if this is close to your house or work than it can satisfy a craving for Chinese. Otherwise, I have no plans to return. It appears that their sushi is liked by a number of folks. We couldn't order because they were not serving sushi on our visit:(

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Andrew E.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: Kasai changes frequently - I remember it having hibachi lunch/dinner, sushi, etc.  Now - Kasai offers Korean food and wow, was that a great idea! It's SO good.  You need to try the rice bowls.  I have yet to try anything outside of those but it's fantastic.  Open for dinner only, it's worth checking out.  Plus, it's family owned/operated.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Dan B.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: Kasai is a tiny little sushi place on the main street in downtown Carnegie.  I have driven past the place a thousand times but never stopped.  So I decided to give the place a try.  They only serve sushi, the menu had a note explaining that hibachi was not available.  We ordered some gyoza, a variety of nigiri and 4 rolls.  The service was quick and there were no issues.  The fish was fresh and on par with most sushi places in the city.  After the meal they gave us some red bean pancakes and a handful of delicious hello kitty chocolate filled marshmallow treats.  Overall I would say this place is a definite try.  Parking is free and right across the street, the food is good and the place is clean.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Abby L.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description:
After ordering from Kasai yesterday and reading other reviews, I've decided to update mine from last year to be a little more accurately descriptive of my recent experiences here. It's always disappointing to see a restaurant you've enjoyed trip up a bit with quality and service, but I think it's important to know as a paying customer.

A few weeks ago, I called to order some sushi and was told the sushi chef was ill and was off work to recover, which of course is no big deal. Yesterday, my boyfriend and I left work early and I figured I'd order some sushi on my way home. When I first called to place my pickup order, the woman that answered seemed extremely frazzled. I ordered at 1:16PM after being on hold twice and was told it would be about 20 minutes, which is relatively standard for a takeout sushi order (usually anywhere from 10-20 minutes depending on business). We arrived right around 1:30 and my boyfriend went in to grab my sushi. I grew tired of waiting, and walked into the restaurant at about 1:45 to see what was going on. You'd think it was extremely busy if your takeout order is 10 minutes late and you're still waiting, but there were only a couple people in the restaurant including my boyfriend who was also patiently waiting for my sushi and sipping a glass of water.

As I waited at the bar trying to see what the issue was, the server appeared way more flustered than she should be with less than 5 customers including the two of us in the restaurant. My boyfriend told me that prior to me walking in, the woman was speaking audibly about the man at the bar (I guess he was friends with the owner) and how attractive she found him even though she had a boyfriend and that he made her very nervous. I stood at the bar area slightly confused and she had told me she was a few minutes late passing along my order to the sushi chef and also that he had cut himself and was working a bit more slowly. That's a hair unprofessional if you ask me. Even if the restaurant was packed to the max, the sushi chef is literally a few steps away in the kitchen and there is no excuse for as poor of service that she provided.

I finally got my sushi and wasn't expecting compensation for the 45 minutes it took to get 3 rolls, but a sincere apology for the inconvenience would be nice. Other reviews mention a flustered, slow-servicing server and I'd be willing to bet it was the same woman that was there yesterday. Today's order included a Philly roll (always a Philly roll), a tuna roll, and a rock n' roll. I'm not so sure my order was right, but I ate it anyways. The tuna roll was drenched in 2 sauces and a mound of spicy tuna (good thing I'm ok with spicy foods), the Philly roll was ok, and I'm not 100% sure the third roll was a rock n' roll. It was fried as the menu described, but it was so loosely rolled and sloppy that only a few pieces stayed together as I was eating them. It also seemed like there was cream cheese inside, which the rock n' roll doesn't have. There were 2 sauces on this roll as well and they were heavy so it was a bit hard to tell what I was eating.

To put it kindly, I'm let down about what I've seen from Kasai in comparison to the good experiences I've had here before. There's no excuse for treating your customers like they aren't a priority and it has clearly been an issue other customers have experienced, too. Hopefully something changes, because I feel like this place has great potential if they get it together.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Maria J.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description:
I was unfortunately disappointed with my recent lunch visit to Kasai. I had high hopes after reading reviews. 

While I actually did enjoy the sushi (rainbow roll, avocado roll and spicy tuna) that I tried, the service was not very good and ruined the experience and the atmosphere. It is true that our waitress was the only server there at the time we were there from 13-115pm, however, there were only 3 tables to wait on during that time. The server was slow to take our order, did not get the quantity of our salads/soups right and openly complained to us about being busy and about not getting enough tips. She and the sushi chef also proceeded to have a minor disagreement in front of us and the other customers. I thought this service was unprofessional. 

The restaurant was clean but the AC was so low where we were sitting that it was uncomfortable. Approx 7 tables inside with what appeared to be a larger room in the back perhaps utilized for dinner. I would be willing to give Kasai another chance but might try dinner instead with the hope that they would be better staffed to handle the customers.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: J D.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: They have a very large menu and offer Chinese and Japanese cuisine. Their Chinese food is cheap and the food comes out very quickly. I wasn't thrilled with the Chinese but for a quick, cheap meal, it's not terrible. The sushi on the other hand was very good. The weird part about this place is that if you order Chinese and Japanese dishes, they will come on separate checks because they bill the restaurants separately.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Stacey W.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: Such a disappointment.  I'm sorry but this place does not even use real sushi. They use surimi. If you eat sushi regularly this is not quality. I shall not return.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Leslie Ann P.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: Went here and we were seated right away. Food was good, although the restaurant was kinda not well lit. Kinda romantic setting with the lighting. I went there with family so kinda awkward with the romantic ambience. But other than that the food was high quality and we will be back! I'm eating  no fish sushi these days and even with that it was so good! Mostly ordered crab roll, California roll, avocado  roll, lobster roll and cucumber  avocado roll and a miso soup! The green tea was good too! Great quick bite to eat, I recommend coming here for lunch and at night time on a romantic date, bc of the lighting!
