25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Arlene M.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description:
Stopped over here for lunch to try something new. Practically the whole front page of their menu is sushi but you are not limited to that. The left side shows the raw version and the right side shows the cooked version and will indicate whether or not it is spicy.

On the back of the menu are other offerings including entrees. I was delighted to find that I could have these same entrees for lunch. I opted for the vegetable hibatchi grill which includes fried rice, miso soup, and a side salad with ginger dressing. In addition I got a small plate of noodles with various dumplings on top among which were beef and shrimp.

The place is small and if you sit at the counter you can talk with the chef and see the various sushis in the counter. I sat at a table and was served the miso soup first. It was very good and then came the dumplings with noodles. These were especially good. The salad came next which is nothing out of the ordinary except it has a nice ginger dressing on top.

When I got my main course I was pleased with the fact that they give you a good share of vegetables to equal the amount of rice. Most Asian places load you up on rice and don't give you enough of your entree. Not here. Portion size was just right and very good. Please note that this entree can be ordered with beef or chicken for a slight upcharge.

Needless to say it was a hearty and delicious lunch and was amazed that I got all that food for under $10.00. My waitress was very attentive to my needs and helped explained things to me. Next visit I will most definitely try the sushi. Kasai is located in the central business district of Carnegie and pay meter parking is available on the street or in a private central lot. It is best to come during the week if possible during the day since it was not too busy and easy to get seated.

So whether or not you order sushi I'm sure you will be pleased with Kasai. Take out is available and if you have the Eat 24 app you can use that to order out from this place.

25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.author: Diane B.
25CzbDgm1MsT31NhA6KYog.description: I went for sushi. I got the chirashi dinner. It came with a salad. The fish was a gigantic portion of tuna salmon yellowtail and also came with omelette daikon and avocado. The dinner was $20. So cheap for so much sushi!  The rice had furikake on it. I couldn't eat it all. I had to get a doggie bag and take a lot of it home. The service was good.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Joshua S.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description:
Alex's is by FAR the best pizza place in Bloomfield. Has awesome thin crust and thick crust pizzas. His sizes are awesome, too. The large is bigger than the extra larges you get at places on Liberty. He's also not massively overpriced like they are. (I suppose that's the trade-off to having your shop on a busier street. Higher​ rent that you've gotta pass along to the customers.

It's hard to say which is better, the food or Alex himself. The shop is run by Alex himself and his wife. So it's literally mom and pop. They're both very nice people and Alex has a great sense of humor. Come in a couple of times and he'll know you by name and how you like your food. He remembers if you like your pizza a little extra crispy or whether you like onions on your hoagie, etc.

He also carries some grocery essentials for the people in the neighborhood such as milk, eggs, butter, etc. Sometimes he has home made cookies which are ridiculously good. There is honestly nothing on the menu that isn't delicious. He talked me into trying the falafel and hummus on pita bread and I was blown away that I've never had it before.

You can't say enough good things about Alex's. Great food by a great guy!

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Ken C.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: Great hoagies at a great price. Alex and his wife are super friendly and really appreciate your business.  A few blocks off of the main street but worth the  search. Give them a try.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Sommer A.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: Delicious fresh food, kind owners, large drink selection. high quality meat, good serving size, great prices, super cute place!! stop by!!

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: MT T.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: I'm not sure how this place is reviewed 4 stars. The pizza was like cardboard. I ordered mushrooms on top and it was raw, she sprinkled it with some cheese and toasted this. The pizza was a big slice, but terrible. such awful food. I think I'm sick eating this pizza. raw mushrooms with quasi melted cheese. gross .

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Edgar P.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: This is the third pizza shop we've tried in pgh and it's by far our favorite. Super sweet courtesy staff, public television on at just the right volume, and super fresh ingredients. Great job!

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Karla D.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: Just around the corner from my apartment and I love it. Alex's reminds me of the Mom and Pop shops from back in the day as a kid. The pizza is so good and it's made with love. Whenever we go to pick up the food, Alex will come round from the kitchen with the pizza and open it up with pride to show you his work of art. Always wanting to make sure you're satisfied before you take it home. The gyros are equally delicious. If you've not been here you're missing out.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Shannon B.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: Having lived next to Alex's pizza for the past two years, I can confidently claim that he has the best and most reasonably priced pizza in Bloomfield, yes even better than Caliente. Alex is also the nicest guy you've ever met.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Jackie H.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: The steak hoagie was great, as was the meatball. Got the meatball hoagie with no sauce as per Alex's suggestion and it was absolutely delicious. The pizza was great too. Also Alex. Alex is great. 10/10 will be back

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Joseph T.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description:
This place is the epitome of a mom and pop's corner pizzeria. There is only one table with four chairs (it's designed to be a takeout shop - not quite a dine in), you can see the entire kitchen, and they sell some convenience items such as milk, eggs, and cereal.

I decided to order two of the $1.50 slices which were advertised in front of the shop. I would describe these slices as eighths of a circular sicilian pie. Thie slices were reheated and not as fresh as I had hoped. If you come here, then I highly recommend ordering something that is made on to order such as a whole pie or a hoagie.

The prices seemed reasonable though I wasn't exactly sure of the portions. I small pie is $5.99, a medium pie is $7.99, and a large pie is $9.99 though I have no clue what the diameter of any of those pies are. There are also about a dozen hoagies on the menu (including a gyro) for about $6. They also have burgers for $2.49!

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: DJ J.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description:
Stopped by at lunch on a recommendation.  Was told it is good thinner crust pizza.  When I walked in a large thicker crust square pizza was coming out of the oven.  Upon ordering, Alex said I'll just give you this since it just come out of the oven, so you don't have to wait.   The crust was thicker with a nice chewy taste.  The sauce had some Italian spices.   A good pizza.  Not sure if they make thinner crust of not but the pictures on the hand out menu had pictures of both a round and square pizza.

The menu has hummus with pita bread, hoagies, burgers, gyros, and salads.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Steve C.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: Best pizza in the city and the guy who makes them, homemade, is very friendly.  I highly recommend trying them out!  Great pizza for a great price.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Timothy S.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: My favorite pizza in the city. I drive 20 minutes to get it with zero hesitation. Soups are great too.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Que K.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: Amazing Pizza for a Great Price! Plus I would recommend trying the steak hoagie Awesome!! I'll definitely be back.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Jeff W.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: Well crafted pizza with spiced sauce, oaty crust and plentiful portions of cheese and toppings.

JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.author: Sam C.
JZEw18_OhSzFj0IfXF6v6Q.description: The place looks so cute from the outside and the people seem nice. The pizza however is pretty bad. Maybe it was an off day? Will try once more. Seriously looked and tasted like the box kits you'd make at home as a kid. Zero flavor.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Nicole S.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description:
I don't really even know what to review here other than GET THE REUBEN. 
It's your standard neighborhood bar, which I love. And they dish out great meals. 

Honestly though the Reuben will blow you away. One thing I'd say is ask for your pickles in a cup or something, the pickle juice kinda soaked my bread on the bottom so next time I'll definitely know to avoid that. But that's just me being picket to ensure that this Reuben gets the amazing credit it deserves.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Erin H.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: Friday night after V-Day.  Very busy but still only waited 10 minutes for a table.  Great selections. We had fried shrimp, stuffed shrimp, and chicken parmigiana.  All came with salads (or soup or coleslaw) and a potato or mac & cheese.  Had a few beers and the total was still only $75. Huge portions we took half of the fried shrimp and chicken home with us.  Service is always great - love Tara!!!  Gotta go back on a Thursday sometime - when they have an Italian selection.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Jim H.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: Emil's is a Pittsburgh bar. If you are a bit older and have lived in Pittsburgh or its surrounding communities you will remember when bars and restaurants like this were in every neighborhood on almost every corner. Most of them had a great Pittsburgh fish sandwich and reasonable drinks. Some had other specialties depending on the nationality of the neighborhood, and more reasonable drinks like an icy Iron City or Duke beer . Many of these places have disappeared along with the jobs in the mill towns. Emil's has kept great bar food alive in the Mon Valley. Some of the beers are more exotic, but a great big fish sandwich and a variety of other meals and sandwiches are available (killer Reuben) for prices that aren't from the 70's but are still very reasonable. All are served by a pleasant and seemingly happy staff.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Brenda Howard N.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: Totally amazing food!!!  Killer Ruebens!!!!  Great bartenders and wait staff!!!  I'm dying to go back!!!!

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Bob S.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description:
Not my favorite neighborhood bar restaurant; it's my favorite restaurant period, and the perfect example of comfort food. Situated in Rankin beside the police station, don't be put off by the outside appearance. The inside is smallish but comfortable and the rest rooms are clean. A review of the fish sandwich brought me in the first time. It's as good as Nieds on Butler St. but 30-40% larger, crisp outer crust and flaky inside. Be careful during Lent, there can be lines. My other go to meals include the Chicken Parm (Thurs. only), Chopped Sirloin Steak, Stuffed Cabbage, Rueben Sandwich, and the burgers; all are tops. I haven't tried the other sandwiches but they sure look great. The soups stand out as well. Portions can be on the large side and for me meals are priced on the low end.

The staff is very friendly and efficient; Tara usually is my server, and with Krissy, the second generation owner, they make the whole experience even better.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Michelle N.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: Just had an amazing dinner at Emils. They accommodated our very large group with a moments notice and the food was fast and fresh and service was friendly ( as usual) thank you so much! See you again soon xo

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Lashanda G.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: Food was really tasty I love hot and fresh.I must admit it was I moved out of the are but in my passing I will  love to stop and have a bite to eat. Portion sizes are good

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Melvin T.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description:
Long story short...chicken parm Thursday, fish on Fridays. Chrissy club any other day. Huge grilled chicken or steak salads. And a burger you can eat for lunch and save half for dinner. Great comfort food on the menu as well. 

I come here during my lunch break and need a nap when I get back to work cause the portions are so big. Very hospitable staff and relaxing atmosphere. You should see this place during lent. Line is out the door. 

If you live in West Mifflin, Duquesne, Whitaker, Munhall, Homestead and haven't eaten here you're missing out. Rankin, Braddock, Swissvale you already know.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Kat V.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: This was a pleasant surprise. The restaurant we wanted to try in the area doesn't open for lunch and I found Emil's on Yelp. The portion sizes were huge, the prices were good, and the service was wonderful. I'd definitely go back.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Aaron G.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: Order over the phone, was told on the phone 20 mins for there famous Ruben and got there on time and waited another 30 mins

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Celeta S.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: My mom and I could have shared a Reuben sandwich. It was huge. It was delicious and affordable but its certainly a two part meal or perfect to share. The bar could use updated but its not in disrepair just a bit old school. The restaurant is close to the Rankin Police so they frequently come through. Parking is plentiful and seating is too. They have a full service bar so you can have a drink with lunch or dinner. They close at 7 so ordering take out is probably in my near future. The staff is friendly and made us feel welcomed. I have to force myself to try other menu items because that sandwich was a winner for me.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Soo N.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description:
Stuffed Cabbage w/ lots of subtly flavored meat & a large side of homemade mashed potatoes, so satisfyingly good!  5 stars! If I could eat it once a week, I would be happy. We should have ordered some to take home. If it was closer to CMU, the students would be there everyday for the stuffed cabbage. 

Waitstaff: 5 stars- super warm & friendly, real family and neighborhood feel.

Italian food is only on Thursdays! 
Meatball hoagie: 2 big meatballs, in big hoagie bread, good sauce, only $5.99! Same for the Sausage Hoagie. 

Fish Sandwich- super big & crispy. The table next to us had the Reuben sandwich on big slices of rye bread. Only the cup of soup was tiny, maybe it was included, not sure? 

We visited bc we saw this place on Andrew Zimmern's travel channel show. It's a little out of the way, but we used google maps. Can of Soda was only $1.00. The bathrooms are sparkling new. 

The interior & exterior of the restaurant doesn't reflect the good experience we had (normally I wouldn't go in, but hubby is adventurous & loves to support local businesses). We went after the lunch rush.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Bob C.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description:
I had a hankering for some fried fish tonight and the fish fry at Maximilian Kolbe was going to close before I got home on the bus, and I suggested to my wife and 12 year-old daughter that we try Emil's lounge as WQED's Rick Seback loved the place as did Andrew Zimmern when he visited for the Bizarre Foods America episode featuring Pittsburgh.  

The place is in Rankin - a rough around the edges town in the Mon Valley between Swissvale and Braddock.  Don't be put off at first - the outside doesn't have much decoration to speak of and looks like the sort of place that you might think twice about it.  A TGI Fridays it isn't... And thank god for that.

The place is well-kept but a little dated -  no fripperies here.  But we're not here for the Decor - we're here for some dinner.  

The menu is basic with reasonable prices.  The meats and seafood are high quality and everything is made to order.  Their stuffed cabbage is regarded as the best in  Pittsburgh.  I love stuffed cabbage but I just made a batch a couple of weeks ago and I'm cabbaged out.  Their Ruebens are   also killer (our waitress raved about them).  My wife and I both settled on fish sandwiches.  These are true Pittsburgh fish Sammiches - fresh fried fish in crispy breading, crammed between enormous pillows of soft, yet chewy and crispy Mancini's Italian bread.  No adornments - just a boatload of hot crispy fish.  Emil's uses thick cod fillets piled high rather than a thin fillet that needs to be broken up to fit in the bun.  Truly a great sandwich.  My daughter had the BLT - looked good and on good bread and they weren't skimpy with the bacon.

The service was very pleasant and friendly and the crowd was a great group of folks.  We all had fun with 4 other tables when my wife pulled up a Trivial Pursuit game on her iPhone and pretty much everyone joined in and had a good laugh.

Overall, if you consider yourself a true Pittsburgher - you must visit this place.  It's one of the few places (Big Jim's in the Run is another) where the spirit of Pittsburgh is alive and hungry.  Please go.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Kathy R.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: Still good.  But amazingly they changed the fish they use in their fish sandwiches.   Please go back to the flat pieces !!!

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Susan T.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description:
We finally got here on the third try. 

Everything we heard about the fish was true, fantastic and thick with perfect batter. 

Fries, onion rings and cole slaw are the perfect companions and the bun is soft and fresh.

The catfish is very good also very good, give the cajun a try.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Susan M.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: This is not the best fish sandwich in Pittsburgh. It;s a fat piece of cod in overbreaded oil.  I had a side of their mac and cheese which was pretty much mac and no cheese., Definately not homemade. Don;t leave reviews often but i had high hopes for this place. If you want good fish go to St; Elias in Munhall. They have the BEST  fish..  This place was a total dissppointment.  Service was ok for the type of establishment.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Teresa R.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: safe being it's across from the police station. Clean bathrooms! Great fish sandwich; but AWESOME Reuben! No way you can find better.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Kylene W.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description:
Emil's was featured on 25 things I love about Pittsburgh last year and have been meaning to come through and check it out. One year later I finally made it and boy was I glad!!

The surrounding area is a little sketch... but once you arrive at Emil's all your worries melt away. My husband and I were greeted with a friendly hello and welcoming service. The owner is so friendly and down to earth and so are the other staff.  It felt like we were visiting friends.

Anyway, the food. OMG the food is pure comfort!! I had the fried fish sandwich. It was seriously 1 pound! Perfectly fried and nestled in a warm soft flaky bun, actually, it's more like half a loaf of bread. The burgers are juicy and scrumptous. Soup of the day was cream of mushroom soup. Have you ever had homemade c.o.m.s.? I am not talking about the gelatinous stuff out of the can! Ya'll this soup was the bomb diggity! I've also had their wedding soup and it was super delicious!! The featured beer on tap was pumpkin beer. (I don't think it was a feature, or at least it wasn't presented that way. But for me it was their featured beer) It honestly tasted like Thanksgiving in a cup, it was great! Oh and I really like the root beer on tap too. Lastly, they have different specials throughout the week.

I can't wait to come back. Next I want to try the Ruben sammies! For me, I believe Emil's Lounge is as close to southern comfort food (if not better) I can get here in Pittsburgh. I absolutely love it!

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: C L.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description: This restaurant used to have amazing food and my experience with the catering has been good but the last 2 times I've ate there I've been extremely disappointed. Last time I got the steak which was flavorless and extremely tough. The prices are high as well. I would not go back here.

PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.author: Ron W.
PMMp2rBcs58y5kLP96HUaw.description:
Seen this restaurant on 25 best places in Pittsburgh with Rick Seback
ack. Went there with my girlfriend she grew up with the owner. She's very nice all employees are super nice service was excellent i had the fish sandwich my girlfriend had the Ruben more than you could possibly eat very reasonable prices. Going back to try the burgers  i heard there enormous and very tasty.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Teresa H.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
I've been wanting to try this place since it opened!!
Stopped in today during lunch since I was in the area. They had just opened, so it was pretty empty, but the server was great and sat us immediately.
I had the empanada lunch special and my husband ordered the Cuban sandwich.
Everything was steaming and delicious when it came out.
I didn't try his sandwich ('cause PICKLES), but it smelled awesome. The fries were salted nicely, the empanadas were seasoned perfectly, and it was so nice to enjoy a quiet lunch together.
Stop in. Try the empanadas, try the Cuban, try EVERYTHING and then comment and tell me what to get next time!

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Josh H.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
I really hate to be a person to give a less than stellar review but here I am. Overall it was OK, some things good some not. Absolutely do not get the Pollo Guisado. Honestly they should be embarrassed to serve it, let alone charge $14.  The portion was tiny and the chicken tasted like somebody poured canned tomato sauce on it and threw it in the microwave. Very bland. The rice was bland too but it's rice. 

The service was not good either. Our waitress was nice but new and the food took a really long time. It's a new spot though. I think what bothered me the most was nobody really checked on us, including the owner/manager who spent 15 minutes talking to a nearby table but didn't ever say anything to us. If you have a brand new restaurant with a brand new waitress who forgot the salt, ketchup, and to check on us this was needed even more than usual.

My sons kids grilled cheese was great. The empanadas were too. My wife got the cuban with a salad and that was also excellent. I'm sure we'll be back. I'll never get an entree again though and neither should you. They have some stuff to work on but it has potential. I think I'm just bothered I feel so ripped off though, and was never given the opportunity to give feedback or was asked about my meal.  If you live in the South Hills check it out but absolutely do not get the chicken.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Arlene M.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
I'm truly in love with this new concept restaurant that recently opened in Dormont. The place is small but they have both indoor and outdoor seating. Arriving for lunch I had my pick of where to sit since the place was fairly empty. A nice waitress explained today's specials but I definitely had my mind made up to try to fried plantains. After learning that one of the owners Samantha was born in the US but raised on her family's Dominican Republic cooking, everything here is made from scratch. She learned to cook her family's native recipes and brought them here.

They have a bar area that sits to the left when you enter and are welcome to order drinks off that menu. In addition, they do have take out. I decided to order two shredded chicken empanadas to go with my fried plantains. After a reasonable wait my lunch came with a side of pickled onions. My plantain order was small but I liked the fact that it wasn't greasy. Likewise the empanadas were flaky and tender which made for a filling lunch. Service is spot on and my needs were entirely met. 

The menu is clearly marked with gluten free options, vegetarian, and vegan so there is something for everyone if you come.  The restaurant has been updated from the former Jose and Tony's that used to sit here. it is very clean and nicely laid out. I was also very pleased with my meal but I was told it does get crowded later in the day and into the evening.  The fox symbol throughout the restaurant is a nod to the surname of the owners-Samantha and Jesse. Check out their website for more information as well as an online menu.

Definitely a must try if you are looking for a new cuisine. Located on McFarland Road near the juncture of Beverly Road limited street parking is available during the day.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Rebecca M.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
Zorros is a nice addition to the neighborhood. It's another unique restaurant that adds some interesting dining in the area.

I love that there is indoor and outdoor seating. Also, if you have been to the former Jose's and Tony's you will realize this is a major space upgrade.

Happy hour is 4-6 and features $5 sangria and $4 house wines. I ordered one of each. The sangria seemed very watered down and I wasn't a huge fan (white sangria) my friend had red and it seemed a little more flavorful. 

I ordered the avocado salad and was very happy with the portion size and the flavor of the dressing. I also ordered the shrimp appetizer, and was not happy with it at all. For $9 I got four tiny shrimp, on a bed of rice. The shrimp was totally over cooked, almost to a point where I couldn't chew it. I mentioned it to the server with hope she would bring me another order that was cooked properly but did not.

My friend ordered the pork sliders and they were very over cooked and dry as well. It just seems like our food maybe got stuck on the grill a bit too long. 

She did have the yucca and cheese empanadas and loved them. Said she would come back just for those.

I would come back for happy hour but would be apprehensive to order more food until some of the kinks are worked out in the kitchen.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Rachel C.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
Welcome addition to the neighborhood! While I only sampled a small amount of food, it was impressive and I will certainly be back often. This was admittedly my "second dinner" so I wanted a "snack." I put those all in quotations because I'm pregnant and snacking happens often.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE that their menu clearly states is gluten free and vegan. So many bonus points for that. And if I've learned anything about being GF, it's that this type of food is mostly GF anyway. Win, win!

So I opted for the avocado salad and shoestring fries. The salad had a fantastic dressing, not sure what it was, but it made the salad. It was a hearty portion as well. I will also note that there is a block of fried cheese that is the best part of the dish. I'm not sure what kind of cheese it is, but man, I could have had multiple portions of that. Then, of course in true Pittsburgh fashion, I added my fries to my salad. The fries were good. I think I could have had them a little crispier and hotter, but still good. 

Can't wait to come back and eat my way through their menu. Service was great and the place is beautiful inside. I will note, drinks looked great too, so another thing to look forward to!

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Jennifer G.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
What a fantastic addition to the neighborhood. We stopped in during the soft opening and will be back for sure!

Let's start with the Sangria! It is amazing and made the right way- wine, brandy, a little sugar and fruit. It is delicious and even better when it's only $5 a glass for happy hour! The beer selection is also pretty good, there is something for everyone from Yingling to Hazy IPAs.

The stand out had to be the Tostones! They were perfectly fried and the garlic sauce that accompanied them was delicious. We also tried a couple of empanadas - beef and yuka. Both were great, but the yuka was the winner with our group.

We also had the Cuban sandwich and chimi burger, both good. I will warn you that the cuban is made with bread & butter pickles, not dill- which knocked it down just a bit for me. 

My daughter had a side of rice and beans and said it was the best she had ever had. She is 8, so take that for what it is worth.

We sat on the patio, which was lovely but could be a challenge for some guests because of the slope. We will certainly be back often.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Michelle D.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: Place is super cozy , Sam in amazing  she was so nice all nice . Make sure everything was ok with out order and even give us free sangria! Empanadas the bomb! White rice  real Dominican style love it

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: DJ J.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
Foxy good food and service.   
Rum Flights available with about 2 dozen rums on the list.  
Tried the red Sangria that is made with fresh fruit and sugar cane, very good and refreshing.  The beef & cheese  empanada on homemade dough was very tasty and good.  Was told by my dinning associate that the Pico Pollo chicken sandwich is also very very good.  Sam and her assistant were very helpful and friendly.  Looking forward to returning and trying a main course.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Juan G.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
Relax ambience with good cocktails and great food. 
What l liked:
Mojito, refreshing and strong.
Cuban sandwich, what a Cuban should taste like.
Black Beans, out of this world.
What could be better:
Kitchen, I wish it was open also between 2-4p
Music, better sound system to spread the Dominican flavor every where even outside in the patio.
I give five starts because I was licking the plates, that tells you how well seasoned their food is.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Catie D.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: Came in for lunch, stayed for conversation. Our bartender was delightful and super friendly.  She helped us decide on starting with the Tostones which were crispy and served with an amazing garlic sauce.  I tried the Cuban sandwich, I seriously can't stop thinking about it.  The ham and pork was perfectly moist, the bread dressed and grilled to perfection.  We tried the Moro, and empanadas which did not disappoint.  I also had a glass of the home made sangria and I enjoyed every last drop! Zorros is a great new gem in Mt. Lebanon; cute, and so welcoming. The owner seems so passionate, and the staff enthusiastic.  I can't wait to try the rest of the menu!

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Mark H.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: Honestly this was the most bland food I have ever tasted, this coming from someone married to a Dominican and has been to the Dominican, the best way to describe this food would be to say someone explained what Dominican food to someone one and said now go cook it. Kind of a disappointment after hoping for a Dominican place to finally show up in the city. The only real positive I can come up with was two of us are for less than 40 before tip, but then again you get what you pay for. Will try again since they are brand new maybe there are testing the market first?

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Vanessa H.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: Love this place!! The food is very good and well seasoned. Sam is absolutely a great host. I am looking forward to trying all items on the menu. The empanadas were sooo good, they taste exactly like the empanadas that you would have back on the island. My husband had the Chimi burger and he also loved it. Will go back for sure!

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Amanda S.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: Went for a quick bite. I had the chicken sandwich (Pico pollo) the breading and sauce were amazing. My husband had the Cuban sandwich and it was a great fix for a Cuban craving. I had the sangria and it was great! Not too sweet which I like. We also had the rice pudding which we were told was the owners grandmothers recipe which was also tasty. Only downfall was my husbands dark and stormy it didn't taste like a dark rum and ginger beer but a Captain and ginger ale. We will define back to try the empanadas

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: David A.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: Had dinner here the other night.  Place was busy but the owner made time to visit each table and make you feel at home.   The Cuban platter was excellent and the service was outstanding.  Prices were reasonable.   I will definitely be back!

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Lisa M.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
I really wanted to like this place, but I wasn't impressed at all.   I went with 2 of my friends and each of us had something different, yet nothing stood out enough for any of us to try it again.  
We had a cuban sandwich with moro, the Bacalao (cod) and the Pollo Guisado which was the tastiest of all 3 items.  We all agreed that the rice and beans were very good, but the portion was much larger than the main item ordered.  I believe they give you such a large portion so you fill up on that instead of the meat.
The biggest disappointment were the empanadas.  We had one of each flavor, but they were dry.   Like I said, I really wanted to like this place, especially since it very close to my house but its nothing special.  Its highly doubtful I'll be back.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Carolyn K.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: Zorros delivered. I took a client for lunch, and needless to say, we both were very impressed. We sat down and someone was over within 1 minute to give us water and get our drink order. Ordered the cheese appetizer and beef/cheese empanada. O.M.G. It was a flavor explosion in your mouth. NEEDED MORE. Prices were spot on (in fact, I would have paid double for the same dishes). Then the main course came. We ordered the shredded chicken plate. I mean the SEASONINGS!!!!! I think this place can be defined by FLAVOR. You can tell everything is hand curated and crafted. Can't wait to come back again. Definitely need to try!

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Rebecca W.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description:
I went during the soft opening and I have to say that the food and service was great. The empanadas were my favorite. 

The drinks were not. They were extremely watered down and had basically no alcohol in them. The sangria was average at best. The margarita needs a new name because it was not a margarita. It had no lime and had clearly not been shaken because all the simple syrup was at the bottom. It also tasted like the staff watered it down with seltzer. I was extremely disappointed. Next time I would order something in a bottle.

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Francisco C.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: highly recommended dishes very well served with a very authentic taste the calm and familiar atmosphere the hosts very attentive to what you need

MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.author: Solangel G.
MTz7gJAMcN1lzsD-SQJQPw.description: As a born and raised Dominican, I was really excited to hear that finally there's a Dominican restaurant close to Pittsburgh. From my visit, I concluded that at this point, the food I got doesn't taste Dominican but more like a general Latin flavor. Anyways, this is what I think from all the food that I got: the rum cake was really moist and it tasted like rum, so bonus points. The empanadas were really good and I recommend them to anyone. They tasted homemade and freshly made. The chimi burger was great and I would recommend it to anyone. However, it would have been good if they ask me what temperature I would like my meat at because what I got was way too pink and burgers are not supposed to be eaten pink because of food born illness risks. The fried cheese was ok, but too spread out and consequently too greasy. I would recommend the chef/ owner to find a new cheese brand that fries better. The slaw was ok, but not anything I would call Dominican. The tostones were nothing to a toston. They were more like plantain chips, so that's a definitely no for me. Lastly, the sancocho is not Dominican by any far of the imagination. It was way not thick at all and it only had one meat. That sancocho was closer to a chicken soup  or Colombian sancocho than a Dominican sancocho. I didn't like it and would not get it again. Anyways, I'll be back there's more food to eat. Thank you for opening your doors, I'm really happy there's finally a Dominican restaurant in Pittsburgh.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Troy L.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description:
Really fresh bagels, good service, and an excellent Smoked Salmon bagel.

I order this bagel almost every time I come here, and it's the only "sandwich" I'll order. You can't go wrong with just a bagel and cream cheese, but when you want something more the Smoked Salmon Bagel is definitely a hit.

My only criticism is that they've ran out of the coffee I wanted almost every time I've been to this location.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Kelly C.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description:
I LOVE Bruegger's Bagels and this place had delicious bagel sandwiches but was the slowest Bruegger's I've ever been too. Pretty standard otherwise. 

Would not recommend if you are on a tight time schedule.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Emily L.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description:
Bruegger's is my reliable breakfast spot in the South Side. Always great choices for the carb lovers, dependable and friendly wait staff and a clean environment. My favorite order is a cinnamon sugar bagel toasted with cream cheese and either an iced coffee or a chai. The chai is from a bag (premade), which is a little disappointing - but if I want house made there are other coffee shops along the street.
The staff here is always accommodating and friendly - and you can't beat their delicious breakfast sandwiches!

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Jeff Z.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: If it wasn't for the tasty bagels I would never go to this location. Look at my sandwich....how do you expect me to pay almost $4 for something like this? What a joke

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Steph H.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description:
For some reason this is the only brueggers in Pittsburgh that does not toast their bagels. They may "warm" them up, but they are never toasted. This has been for over a year so it was just not a mistake once or twice. Completely ruins the bagel. If this wasn't the brueggers on the way to
Work, I would never stop at this one.

When I called to complain the man who answered was less than helpful and thought it was a joke. He asked me if I "watch how long they toast it for".. Sorry I did not babysit my bagel was it was being made. That should not be necessary.

The only reason I give 2 stars is because the employee was nice today and the cooler was cold. Which it typically is not.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: B T.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: Had the cinnamon sugar bagel with strawberry jam. Bagel was a little too chewy for me. The chocolate chip cookie was good.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Rob K.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: solid spot, good fresh coffee, plenty of choices and the staff is happy to make any modifications you like. No complaints.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: DJ H.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description:
My fave place for a quick "fast food" lunch that doesn't taste like fast food!

My only complaint(s):
- Manager needs to make sure orders are made so they don't  run out of ingredients. I don't know how many times I've gone in and they've been outta coleslaw. I don't even order, I just leave. 
- The menu needs more consistency. Just as I get used to something, they pull it from the line-up. 
- Quality control. There are times that I don't think anyone cares what the food looks like.  

Despite it all, the majority of the time my order is perfect.  When items are unavailable I'm often offered free products. I've rarely had a run in with an employee at this facility that was not pleasant.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Anne B.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: Is it just me? Seems every time I come here some local who doesn't own an inside voice comes to chat up a seated guest. . . Shhh it's morning time

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: H H.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: Clean, parking close by (on street and cross the street there's a municipal parking lot).  The staff was very friendly, the bagels were very fresh, and even though it was a busy Sunday morning, I got speedy service and my order correct.  Lots of room to sit and eat (even though we took ours to go).  You can even see them making the bagels right in front of you behind glass where you're waiting to place your order.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Kayla N.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: I love Brueggers but this location is the absolute worst. If you want your sandwich/bagel to be correct, you literally have to stalk it as moves down the counter. Most of their staff are incredibly pleasant but unfortunately there is one who acts absolutely miserable and is the reason why I will no longer be visiting this spot.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Hailey H.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: By far the hardest bagel to eat- had a great taste but definitely gave my jaw a workout. Also the staff was unpleasant and seemed unamused to be there.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Christy C.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: I've been to this location multiple times, but I had an exceptional experience this weekend that I just had to share.  I was across the street at the Southside Food, Art & Sidewalk Fest when I decided the (finally) hot weather called for a nice iced tea.  I went inside and asked if they had iced tea, preferably green.  The one gal behind the counter said they have regular iced tea, which I was fine with, until the other employee chimed in and said "if you want green tea, I can make it for you!"  She actually went out of her way and took the time to steep some hot green tea for me and then put it over ice.  She said it's not on their menu, but she also loves green tea and has perfected the art of iced green tea while working there.  I know it's not an experience that everyone will have there, but I was so grateful and impressed with her offer!  Both employees were super pleasant and receiving this kind of service will definitely inspire me to frequent Bruegger's more often!

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Ally D.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: My family and I went at brunch to check out South Side and try this bagel shop that we've been seeing all over Pittsburgh. Apparently all of the bagels are vegan (shout out to the baker's knowledge!) except the Asiago Parmesan; this made me (the only vegan in the family) happy. I got a plain sesame, which was normal, filling. The rest of the fam got egg sandwiches and had similar comments - normal breakfast flavors. Nothing spectacular, but convenient. The staff was friendly. 3 stars.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Kaylee Z.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: Every time I come here, I am greeted with smiles and such a kind manager. Awesome experience every time! The bagels are definitely baked to perfection. Worth every penny!

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Emma H.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: This was my first time being here so I don't know a lot about the menu, however, one bagel sold me.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: K L.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: Great place! Get breakfast here almost every weekend, asiago is my favorite. Staff is very polite and helpful. The managers are great too, always on top of things supporting their staff. Continue to go back as much as I can. Highly recommend them for breakfast or light lunch.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Afroza H.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: Rude service and gross coffee, as for the bagels... I'm a New Yorker, so these bagel-shaped bread things being called "bagels" are laughable to me. Also, why are they charging an arm and a leg for basic bagels + eggs, things that are supposed to be cheap?? No, thanks.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: MaryAlice R.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description: Love coming here for morning bagels. The manager is always funny and nice. Just a walk away from my place so might as well enjoy it. I've never gotten a wrong order in the past 2 years.

ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.author: Dave P.
ZpymIplQK7xrgb9VTa6O2w.description:
Pricey, but the salads are good.

It's not that the bagels cost a lot or anything they're just priced more like a movie theater.  You just don't expect a salad and a large lemonade to run $10 but it does at brueggers.

That said the food is generally on the better end of quality for fast food and the staff here are polite and attentive.  

If you're watching calories and work on the southside there aren't many options that work.  This is one of them.

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Brad H.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description:
One of the most unique and best places to get lunch downtown.  I was initially disappointed when the prior restaurant, Easy Street, left, but this place has definitely exceeded what I expected it to be.

The ordering concept is similar to a Sheetz or GetGo.  You go to any one of the computer screens and pick which of the different stations you want to order from.  After ordering you pick up your food at that station.  It can be intimidating on a busy day if it is your first time, but it is a very simple process.
The food can take a little time, so don't expect to be in and out in five minutes.  However, this is because they cook each individual meal to order.  Every pizza, sandwich, fry order, etc. is made fresh.  Nothing is ever sitting around.  

I have now tried every station.  My favorite is Piccolo Italia.  The Bee Sting pizza is one of the best pizzas I have ever had.  It has spicy chili oil, fresh basil, and is drizzled with honey.  The flavors are incredible.  I have also had friends tell me the margarita pizza is good as well.  The pizza is cooked perfectly in their wood stone oven.  Always crispy.  They also have some other dishes like the chicken parm that I would like to try.  

The other stations which I also love are Flame, Pittsburgh Barbecue Company, and Spices.  Flame has a ton of different sandwich and side options.  I really enjoy the turkey burger and onion rings.  At the Pittsburgh Barbecue Company I had the pulled pork sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese.  They loaded up the meat and the bbq sauce had a great flavor.  The Mac and cheese was also very good.  At Spices I have only had the tacos, but they are very good and have a lot of toppings to choose from.

Another great thing about here is you get free dressings and sauce sides.  Almost nowhere does this anymore, with some places charging 50 cents to a dollar for a side of ranch or bbq sauce.  It is definitely a nice touch.

On top of the great food, the workers here are very friendly and helpful.  Several times I have asked for an extra side or for something added and they always help me out even when they are super busy.  

Could not be happier this place is in downtown!

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Karla D.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description:
My office is super close by and this is a place that my coworkers and I enjoy coming to on a regular basis. The reason is because we all have different likes and dislikes and ordering here allows everyone to eat what they want while enjoying a lunch break together.
When this concept first came to Oxford Centre last year I was excited and intrigued, I mean why not have this kind of convenience in a downtown setting? Sure this is something that is seen at places like Getgo or Sheetz but those places aren't readily available to the downtown office worker during lunch M-F.
I try to eat healthy (most of the time) and light during the day so it's usually salads for me.
I absolutely love the pizza here though. So when I get that it's a real treat.
Who remembers Easy Street? I sure do, it was here before the new dining conception we now have. Easy Street was fine but this is different and just better if you ask me.

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Arlene M.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description:
In the dust of the formerly located Easy Street rose this array of made to order and take out fast foods that can easily be overwhelming. Please note that this place opens at 11 for lunch on weekdays.

Since there weren't a lot of people around when I arrived I walked though the market to get an idea of their different cuisines as well as grab and go items and snacks. As others have mentioned, there is an Italian station, a taco station, and a sandwich station called "Flame"(Just look at their buns with their name branded on them) which specializes in burgers, fish, and yes they serve a bean/quinoa style burger. The station I decided to try is actually a duel concept. One is Mediterranean called Zatar, and the other is Revolution where you can "build" your own noodle bowls. In the middle towards the back is the salad bar which I understood is pay what it weighs. I have yet to figure the cost. No one seemed to know who was sitting around me. Everything is customizable.

I knew to purchase the beverages separately but as I made my way around I didn't see any prices to go with them. The same was true with the grab and go candy or grab and go refrigerated items (similar to what you would find at an airport.) I did purchase a bottle of water for $1.89.

I asked for help and was told to order off one of the kiosks and if I wasn't pleased with the price of the item, then just take it off my order. Beverages you buy also had to be scanned. I wanted to pay cash but was told there was no cashier. I pointed to one of the employees what was written on the sign in the entry way but he said if I wanted to pay cash then I would have to pay in the bar.

Zatar and Revolution have quick change light menus on the same board so it becomes a bit difficult when ordering. I was able to ask one of cooks to assist me. The shrimp looked delicious and he helped me with the kiosk in ordering a bowl made with rice noodles, shrimp, my choice of broth, and 4 add ons of my choice. Once you pay your receipt is given a number that appears on a lit board. When your number turns from red to green then your order is ready. If you don't want to fool with the board then they can text you if you provide your cell number. 

Since most of the people were going for sandwiches I got my broth bowl fairly quickly. I must stress that although some things here may say "vegan" I was told "vegetarian" instead because things could be compromised. There's inside seating in the foyer outside market. All your plastic utensils and napkins are situated inside near the center of the market.

I felt my rice noodles were under cooked and not very tender. The shrimp however, made up for that error. They were nice size and still had their tails on them. You get 5 of them in your bowl. The broth bowl was filled to the brim and did have a bit of a "kick" to it with the Thai chili sauce he put in it. The other vegetables were in there but they seemed to be mostly shavings.

This place does catering and they have a phone number you can call them for that service. I went to the bar area when I was finished to search out a restroom and began to chat with the bar lady. She told me that I could have eaten my meal in here since they have both tables set up parallel to the bar. She also told me the Oxford Bar starts their own meal service at 3 pm and is open until 10 pm. Since they had opened two weeks ago she told me there were becoming more popular at night. 

There is no restroom in the bar area nor is there one in the market. If you need to use the facilities then you have to completely walk out of the market and what's left of the old food court down a long hall and you will find them. Expect to pay prices similar to the old Easy Street here but the nice thing is you don't have to tip here. My pho bowl came to $9.50 plus tax. Prices seem reasonable but I feel this place is going to be experimental. Once I get an opportunity to try some of the other concepts then I'll be able to advise my own recommendations. My meal was average to say the least and afterwards I was unable to locate my cook to let him know that noodles weren't to my liking.

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Nancy R.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description: This first review is for Bar Oxford inside the Oxford Market. I was looking for dinner that didn't cost a day's wage and discovered this hidden gem on the lower level of One Oxford Center. There is a lovely patio space and an open garage door-type wall on one side of the bar. They serve food until 7:00 pm. I had the Oxford Salad with grilled salmon that was extremely good. The food court of the Oxford Market is only open until 2:00 pm, but I believe many of the items available in the food court are also available in the bar. The bartender, Kristen was very friendly. She highly recommended both the wood-fired oven pizza and the chicken tenders. The tenders are freshly made in house. Happy Hour is from 4-6. I look forward to trying out more of the menu in the future!

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Larissa G.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description:
If you work downtown, this new lunch spot is worth checking out! Oxford Market is the latest eatery to open in the lower level of One Oxford Centre. It may have taken longer than expected to open, but it was worth the wait. My coworkers love it and given the crowds I've seen, so do our neighbors.

Oxford Market is a made-to-order, customizable food court featuring a total of five food stations. Each station specializes in something different, giving you a good range of lunch options to order from! Guests must place their order at a kiosk rather than ordering from the stations themselves. Most kiosks are at the entrance of the Market but a few are scattered inside it as well. Feel free to order from more than one station at a time, too! Just remember to grab a drink and snacks before ordering - these are located in coolers and stands throughout the market and need to be scanned as part of your whole order.

So what do the stations themselves have to offer? Piccola Italia offers pasta and pizza; Market Fresh offers a salad bar (note that you make and weigh your salads, versus the ordering process for the other eateries); Flame seems to strike the American comfort food vein with protein-based sandwiches and fries; and the other two stations (who I sadly cannot name off the top of my head - I'll have to add their names later) offer Thai-inspired cuisine and tacos. All made fresh, all made to order, all made based on what you want! Yum!

In the future Oxford Market hopes to host food trucks as "travel chefs" or chefs of the week. This is definitely something I'm looking forward to - although even without the featured cooks, this place has PLENTY of tasty goodness to offer. Do check them out and consider them as a lunch option!

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Matthew P.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description:
Finally something near my work location that is good and fresh. I haven't tried everything, I mainly go to the salad bar and the Taco place. This place you order on a kiosk and pay at it. Also does not take cash, which is perfect. I dont like talking to people and never carry cash so purfect for me. 


The salad bar is nice, fresh ingredients and a good variety. I go here instead of Hello Bistro, cheaper and less of a wait time. There is always something different on the salad bar and nice selection of items. 

The taco place is a fav, different toppings to choose from and the best thing is Kiosks through out the place to order food. Its 2 tacos for 5$ which is one of the better deals downtown. 

Give it a shot, good for a nice lunch and cheap.

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Jeffrey S.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description: This place is small and quaint. They have a nice location to capture something for lunch. Then for dinner they have a small bar with drinks. The only thing is the prices are high, and they only have 2 beers on tap. It's as good as a hotel bar. if that's what you're aiming for.

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Keyva C.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description:
Tried a new station this today at the Oxford Market, TACOS!!! Oh how you know I love tacos.

I had two pork tacos with guacamole, switched it up, had one with the cabbage slaw and other with kale and pineapple. Yummy!! 

The tacos are served on flour shells not homemade but delicious nonetheless. There is roughly 9 or so toppings to choose from, keeping it simple. Outside of pork you can get, chicken, veggies, or shrimp ($1 more). 

The one down I have is, I ordered a side of queso and chips to go with. The size of the queso was a joke. I definitely am not looking for a huge side but they should think of at least giving you a "chipotle" size side cup of sauce or less chips because my ratio was clearly off.

All in all once again Oxford Market has impressed

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: J D.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description: I had the bee sting pizza from Piccolo Italia and it was delicious. It's a little pricey but not too bad. Lots of flavor. I tried the brisket from the Pittsburgh bbq company. The bbq sauce was sweet and the brisket was a little fatty but I'll be back for a sandwich and some Mac n cheese. They also serve ribs on Fridays.

UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.author: Jason W.
UPjwhZ3ywrkkhcZH1gbwHA.description: Grabbed the All Cheese white pizza. Consists of fresh mozzarella, grated parmesan, crumbled smoked blue cheese and roasted garlic ricotta. The dough was light and soft with a slight crunch on the outside edges. Overall delicious and perfect size for lunch, to-go or at the bar side with drinks! Ordering at the kiosk wasn't bad. If you've ever ordered at GetGo or Sheetz it's the same concept. Expect to wait a little longer during lunch time. The overhead screen of your station will have your number and will turn green when ready!

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Janine H.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: Food was fantastic! Margherita pizza, lobster ravioli, salmon salad and moscow mules were all delicious! Love the fresh, warm bread and dipping sauce. Our waiter was very nice and we were seated quickly on a Saturday night with a party of 6. We'll be back!

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Tim S.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: First of all I have never written a review before    This was the worse experience of my life.   First of all we were there for twenty minutes before the server ask us if we needed a drink.  Our food was cold and the spaghetti was all stuck together and I was unable to eat it.   We were there on Saturday at 6:00 for four.  I had reservations but will never be there again.  A typical chain restaurant and nothing more except the price.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Judy G.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: Very accommodating staff, delicious brunch menu, service was fabulous and our delightful waitress even joined in on the laughter at our table.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: David J.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: We used to eat dinner at Bravo frequently after it opened, but we hadn't been there for several years. It's largely unchanged over that span, with the same decor, menu, and wine list. The menu is Italian and limited, with a few simple meat and pasta choices, a couple of soup and salad offerings, and a limited but adequate wine list. Prices are kind of mid-level and service is usually prompt. The food is unremarkable, but up to the unchallenging standards of a corporate restaurant. Overall it's a safe choice if you're looking for basic, but not quite authentic, Italian food. With no authentic Italian competition in the suburbs, Bravo fills the void. I guess you could call that faint praise, but so what, at Bravo there is also little to criticize.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Mary J M.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: We went early at @5pm.  We did not get our entre for almost 1/2 hour after appetizer​ was served. It was cold. I had Eggplant Parm. One of us had Fettichini - cold as well. They had huge parties of high school kids for Homecoming and the restaurant was understaffed.  Two tables of 10 were served before we were and they came in long after we did.  We left after7pm.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Jay B.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: Let me start off by stating that this is the best food experience I have had from Bravo!!! This food was excellent today. We ordered the egg plant parmigiana, shrimp diavola, spaghetti with marinara, fried ravioli, and salad. Everything was flavorful, fresh and cooked to perfection. Our waiter Tom (at the bar) Gave us excellent customer service. We will be returning soon. Bravo's is back!!!!

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: James S.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description:
Pretty much what you would expect from a large chain "Italian" restaurant.  Mostly "americanized" takes on Italian dishes (remember there is no alfredo sauce in Italy).

Started out with an order of the fried calamari.  Not very tender, and most likely frozen and not fresh/chef prepared.  Ordered the house salad to go along with the entree.  It was a chopped salad with tomato, bacon, cucumber in a house dressing of creamy Parmesan.  If you are looking for any health benefits in a salad, don't order this one.  You could barely see any lettuce through the heavy cream dressing.  And any lettuce that was there was iceberg, which was mostly white in color and covered up by the dressing.  I should have snapped a picture to better describe it.  Not very good at all.  Maybe it would be better with just oil & vinegar instead of the heavy house dressing.

Main course was from the new Imbriolo family recipe menu.  These consist of 4 spaghetti dishes.  They are all reasonably priced although once again not very authentic (Cacio e pepe would never have butter in it in Italy).  I ordered the spaghetti pomodoro and it was fairly tasty and as I said previously it was reasonably priced.

Drinks were also pretty reasonable.    House wine and cocktails both $7 and under.  Service was very good and attentive.

So overall, I would give it a 4 star for service & pricing and a 2 star for food quality & menu selections/choices, thus averaging into a 3 star overall.

I haven't been to Bravo in years.  It used to always be packed.  I realize this was a weeknight but it wasn't very crowded at all.  Seems like chains in this mode might be experiencing problems (Chil's, TGIF, Applebees, etc).  The menu has been slimmed down since the last time I visited and the new Imbriolo dishes are kind of underwhelming.  Still a decent value but probably not someplace I would seek out again as a destination for a special event or anything like that.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Alan W.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description:
Went here about a week ago.
I decided to get take out and ordered a chicken parm with a side salad and spaghetti.
When I called in the order they told me about 40 minutes minimum.
I went around and did some errands and then came back about 20-25 minutes after ordering.
I went in and the lady behind the counter was nice and was friendly.
The system for take out is not good at all.
I walked in and the lady behind the counter had to get another person then that person came out and took my credit card.
They took credit card and disappeared into back and then came out with food and receipt.
The process from the time I walked in to the time I walked out was at least 10 minutes.
The food was already ready when I came in so it sat there getting cold while they where getting the payment thru.
They told me at least 40 minutes it was less than 25 if I would of come at the 40 minute mark it would of sat for 15 minutes getting ice cold and then the 10 minute ride home as well.
Now for the food, I have too say the only good part of the meal was the salad.
The chicken part was not good and I did not like the taste of it also it was ice cold besides.
The spaghetti was cold and the sauce was not that good as well.
I do not think I would ever go there for take out again as the system for take out needs a lot to be desired as well as they do not know how to estimate food prep time.
I also noticed many negative reviews so I probably would not go back ever again.
I do not recommend Bravo for take out at all.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Nicole G.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: Don't skip this place!   The menu and recipes are updated and the shrimp appetizer is over the top good!   Want another order

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Nick S.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: I do enjoy a nice visit to Bravo! (Although I sometimes refer to it as Bravos) Unlike many upper-end restaurants that have fallen out of my favor over the years, Bravo! Has held strong. The simple pleasures of dining there are beyond great. I was always a fan of the simple and delectable oil and bread appetizer (which is complimentary) I recommend the salmon and vegetable entree' The salmon is obviously freshly made because it never had any sort of fishy taste (like some other salmon offerings at other restaurants) At Bravo!, It really is a great menu option. The prices are a bit high, so I wouldn't expect a bill under thirty dollars for one person. It's definitely worth it though for special occasions. For dessert, if you aren't full, they have Crem bru le! and cheesecake that outcompetes the Cheesecake Factory. The wait staff is also friendly.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Drew V.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description:
Had a private birthday party Saturday March 2, 2019. 
Lizzie was our waitress. 
The food was excellent. 
The service was exceptional. Lizzie was friendly, courteous, attentive and went out of her way to make our party enjoyable.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Caitlin E.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: I'm pretty disappointed! I used to come to bravo all the time when I live in Pittsburgh but I feel compelled to share my less than thrilled experience. For starters, don't serve burnt, hard to chew bread. I'd rather wait five more minutes for a fresh loaf than be served ends of the unwanted bread. Next, the food was so underwhelming. I'm a novice foodie at best, but I honestly felt I couldn't have made a worse presentation. Lastly, why are chefs so loud? A constant "WHOOP" kept coming from the kitchen. If you're in a five star establishment and that's your signature - fine. But it's McKnight, and it's Bravo. Silence yourself. Diners, don't expect much!

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Rachel K.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description:
Meh. I wasn't the one paying for my full course meal, but if I was, not the place I would choose. 

I ordered a pasta with shrimp and lots of garlic, and it was very greasy. I also shared a New York steak. I asked for medium rare, but it was cooked more like medium well.

Furthermore, I was unsatisfied with the service. I came with a group of 6 people. We clearly saw large, empty tables, but the hostess at the front said that we would have to wait for about 30-40 minutes. I pulled out my OpenTable app and saw a table for 6 in ten minutes. I made my reservation and we were seated ten minutes later at my reservation time.

I do not plan on returning.

-- 
taste / 3
aesthetics / 3
vibe / 3
service / 1
price for quality / 2
OVERALL / 2.4

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Shannon N.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description:
I enjoyed dinner with family on a Tuesday night. The wait staff was attentive and professional. The food was decent Italian fare.

The dining room is a large open area with high ceilings. Very large light fixtures hang from ceiling beams. There is a bar area in one corner opposite the entrance...the kitchen is on one side and a private room on an adjacent side

The table shared the calamari appetizer... nothing special but not aweful. I ordered the Spicy bay scallop marinara entrée. The scallops were tender and delicious, the sauce was a nice spicy tomato sauce but definitely not too spicy. Someone at the table let the staff know it was my birthday so they brought me a vanilla creme brule. They must have just taken it out of the cooler because it was cold in the center. As creme brule goes, I've had better. I'm glad I didn't pay for it.

Overall we had a pleasant dining experience and look forward to returning.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Courtney K.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: Normally the experience is amazing with great food, we made a reservation and got seated immediately, took awhile for drinks but busy night Valentine's Day no big deal, I've been a server for 8 years so when our salads came out wrong, no big deal but the right dressing came when they had already been eaten and we waited over 15 minutes for bread which was hard and taken away with one left (we had a starving 3 year old at the table) when my sons food came out I knew the server just forgot to ring in our order but to not even refill drinks, blame it on business, be honest about forgetting to ringing it in he avoided us. We hAd to leave without paying couldn't even wait for our bagged food because my nephew was waiting in a parking lot to be picked up from Boy Scouts. ReAlly hope this place gives sever Tim less tables when he's so inexperienced.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Andrea S.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: I've eaten at Bravo before, and it was always just an average meal. This time that I went, I had possibly one of the worst dining experiences in my life. First off, when I went to use the restroom before eating, it smelled like a carnival outhouse. Completely disgusting. There was urine on the floor. If I hadn't been so starving at the time, I would have walked out. We asked for bread (during previous visits, it was brought out after beverages) and the waitress said, "oh you want it now?" Which rubbed me the wrong way. I ordered the Chicken Scallopini and asked for her to leave the Chicken off of it because i don't eat meat. She made a confused face and asked me if I wanted something instead, but I didn't know what options I had, so I just asked her to add extra mushrooms to it. When I got my dish, it looked... sad. There were two whole portobellas laying beside some twirled pasta. The portion seemed small compared to my friend's spaghetti. As I cut into the mushrooms, I saw that they were scalloped horizontally, almost paper thin. I have never in my life seem a mushroom cut that way. I had many bites that were just stem. The mushrooms were also extremely undercooked. It was hard enough to find something to eat because they don't have vegetarian options other than salad and eggplant parm. (I don't like eggplant). I didn't return the dish because I couldn't bare to be there anymore. I will never go here again. This place has awful service, dated recipes, high prices, and paper on their tables, on top of the table cloth. (Thought that seemed trashy).

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Sarah T.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: My husband and I had planned to go for dinner but then discovered their great happy hour specials. $5 apps and drinks! So we sat at the bar and each ordered a drink and a few apps. The stuffed peppers were delicious and had a good bite to them. The burger was very juicy and came cut in half perfect to share. We'll definitely come back for happy hour again for a cheap date night.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Alexis K.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description: Bravo has definitely gone down hill. I've been to Both this location and the Cranberry location in the last month or so. My experience at the Cranberry location was excellent. At this location, I had to ask for a new napkin as the napkin I was given was dirty along with the silverware in the napkin (had stuck on food on the fork). Also, when the waitress brought the small plates with the bread, she set a plate down on our table and said "oops that one is dirty" and removed it from the table. Food was still very good, I just noticed that this particular location seems to be going down hill in other (pretty gross) aspects.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: Michael S.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description:
My friend and I stopped at this establishment for the first time tonight after a shopping trip to Ross. 

The first thing I saw was the bathroom. No paper towels. Urinal was clogged and there was toilet paper all over the floor. Not a particularly enticing first impression. 

Moving on to dinner. I ordered a glass of Chardonnay, received my glass and there was something stuck on the glass that I had to wipe off (it was on the inside and gross). 

Now the food. The food was actually very good. Better than I expected. I had their signature pasta bowl with mushrooms. 

The only thing that deserved five stars was our waiter Lucas A. He was attentive, kind, knowledgeable, and fun. He made dining here a delight. Keep up the good work, buddy.

hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.author: David A.
hODnmsq1kK6eA0VLbFQOVw.description:
Great food,, took our son and his soul mate to dinner, his choice, his favorite place,, first the reservation were nice and easy to make. They also let us bring our home made wine,, the service is one of the best,
The food is awesome, we have been here many times. This is truly a  restaurant.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Mark C.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: I lived in the North Boros for a long time and worked in Bellevue for 2 years and Rusty Nail was a must eat place for me and my wife. We haven't eaten here in about 10 years and we were so happy to see, nothing has changed. Large qualities of absolutely delicious food with an affordable price on top of that. The Creamy Pierogie soup was exquisite and something we had not eaten anywhere previously. Very rich, perfect temperature, and just plain awesome. I had the meatloaf and fries with gravy which was very filling. The meatloaf was actually a mini meatloaf for one. The fries were crispy and tasty. My wife had the seafood sampler and she loved it. Each sample was cooked just right and she brought some home with her. The service was perfect, friendly, drinks filled just in time, and overall, no complaints at all. It was like visiting an old friend and picking up right where we left off. Great job Joe & staff. It won't be 10 years before our next visit.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Matthew U.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description:
I'm gonna be honest with you here.  I thought this place was a bar and passed it by on multiple occasions.  I mean with a name that has 'rusty nail' in it, you kind of get a bar image.  Was I ever delighted when it turned out that I was wrong.

Looking for food after an exhausting day I was basically tired and found myself in front of here.  When I looked in the window I found a dining room with tables rather than a bar filled with people standing.  While looking in the window I also noticed daily specials.  These change from day to day.  So if you don't want something on the menu, you can choose one of the daily specials.  

On this particular night we went with the specials.  I went in and asked for a menu.  I was offered a seat, but I declined since I knew I was taking it with me.  After looking of the menu quickly I went with the specials.  I ordered the stuffed pork chops for my better half and then for myself I got the stuffed chicken breast.  While it was being prepared I was once again offered a seat and a drink.  I again declined.  Once the food was prepared I was surprised by the amount that came out, it was definitely a dinner.  Just so everyone knows, cash only.  If you don't have enough cash on you, there is an ATM inside to help you.

Once I got the food home I was floored.  The amount is overwhelming and will fill you up for sure.  You get a salad with your meal as well, and bread.  Two big slices of fresh Italian bread which accompanies your meal quite nicely.  I can't speak to the pork chops, but that chicken breast was huge and filled to the brim with some amazing stuffing.  Covered in gravy which gives you a nice blend of flavors.  The mashed potatoes were equally amazing and that gravy continued there.  The broccoli was great as well.  

I can tell you that I cleaned my plate that night and had a happy belly.  Definitely a place I will stop back at once again.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Kerry M.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description:
I've been coming to Joe's Rusty Nail since I was a little girl - it's one of my favorite spots in Bellevue. Their breakfast is delicious, but so their dinner menu. They are a cash only restaurant, but they have an ATM on site. 

I was meeting my parents for dinner around 6pm - I got to the restaurant first, so I went in to get a table. Maryann (our waitress) told me to pick a table, so I picked one against the wall. Unfortunately, there's not a lot of room in between the tables - but I was able to find one where our whole party was comfortable. 

Each day, they have different dinner specials. They also offer a variety of foods for those young and old. 

I ordered the Cream of Chicken & Wild Rice soup go start - it was so tasty! I definitely order it again. 

I ordered the Chicken Stuffed Breast for dinner - it was similar to a Thanksgiving dinner. Chicken stuffed with stuffing, mashed potatoes, gravy, corn, and cranberry sauce. It was delicious!!! 

For dessert, I ordered a piece of the Lemon Meringue pie - it hit the spot! 

I will be back again soon!

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Chad B.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description:
What a great little hometown eatery! I'm not over this way often so put out the call to some locals and they all said "You have got to try Rusty Nail!"  Now I am telling you the same.

This is a small charming little place in Bellevue with table seating and a full menu from Salads, to Burgers to full Meals and it looks like they have some amazing Breakfast I'll be back for.  I tried one of the specials which was a Jambalaya Sandwich that should be on the main menu. Yes it was that good. A Sandwich and Potato Salad for $6.99 is a heck of a deal these days.  The service was great and I get the feeling the ladies have all been there for ages. They seemed to have great rapport with the regulars of which there were many.  This one should not be missed!

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Vickie B.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: Can't wait to come back and sample more of this diner food. Very reasonably priced and huge portions.  You definitely will have leftovers.  The locals swear by the breakfast menu.  It did look good but I started off my day with a danish from the bakery across the streert.  Since we were here just a couple of days, I wanted to try the evening meal. We ended up ordering "take out" and got just one of the day's specials. Hard to chose among them but we got beef tips over noodles with a dark mushroom type gravy.  It was filled with meat.
