A salad came with it, huge salad with tomatos that tasted like they were fresh picked.  Blue cheese dressing on the side.  Again, a huge serving where both of us had two big bowls of salad.  And then two slices of Italian bread with butter on the side.  All nicely shrink wrapped so that none of the goodness would spill.  It is a cash only place.  Another find with good, diner style cooking.  I plan to return on our next visit.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Sirsha C.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: Wow this place was a deal find. Walking in here is like walking into time from the 90s. An old Pitt neighborhood where street parking is still $.25 for one hour, and the neighborhood gathers in old times places like this and there are thankfully no fries inside sandwiches. The husband was hungry and while they don't have veggie items on the menu they made him a Texas Turkey minus the Turkey which was wholesome grilled cheese with tomatoes reminded me of moms grilled cheeses. Lovely service. Let's keep places like this going among the up and coming farm to table spots also.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Damon D.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description:
Just had lunch here today with a friend. We were going to go to The Pitt Stop but it was closed.

Got the Stuffed Cabbage special. Stuffed cabbage was really good. Mashed potatoes were also really good as was the buttered corn.

Whole meal was only $9 and was a nice portion. Filled me up.

Friend had the 2 Cheeseburger special. It looked pretty good and was also a nice amount of food for the price.

Older crowd in there for sure. Waitress was nice. Food came out fast and warm.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Savannah K.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: I came here recently for breakfast/lunch with my boyfriend and his mother. I gotta say, I'm not too impressed. If it's one thing I absolutely despise when dining out, it's when tables are so close to each other that you have no privacy to talk to the people you're with. I just felt like I was sitting on top of everyone to the table next to me, the waitresses had to stand very close to the table so they didn't knock things over. I ordered a tuna sandwich with some fries and coleslaw. Fries were great, coleslaw was great, the tuna sandwich was absolute garbage. It was seriously awful. Wayyy to much tuna on the actual sandwich, it kept pouring out of my sandwich because it was a runny consistency, and it made the bread soggy pretty quick. The tuna itself had no flavor whatsoever, and had huge chunks of celery and onion in it. I can't believe I made it almost halfway through the sandwich without vomiting. My mother in law got a steak sub I believe, and she thought it was good. She also got a cup of their soup on special that day, which was cheeseburger pasta soup. I took a bite of her soup and it was oddly good. My boyfriend got a burger, and thought it was okay. Overall I'm not sure I'd want to dine in here again. The whole place can make anyone feel claustrophobic, and after that disaster of a tuna sandwich, I'm completely turned off.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Gary D.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description:
Whoa! Yelp has this place listed as a Dive Bar (when I was searching for one).

It's not ANY kind of bar. Bellevue has been a dry town until recently.

If you're hungry for real food though, you'll like this place.

On street metered parking.

Down home, small town atmosphere that is pleasant most always.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Michael T.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: Best place for breakfast. Cash only but well worth it.  Great home town place with a loca vibe.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Ken H.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: Congratulations to Joe and  his staff for 40 years of  great breakfasts  , lunches and dinners I have been going there for years the food has always been great also the service Always enjoyed The omelettes the big salads stuffed chicken breast and  the daily specials . Very nice place to go when you're in Bellevue stop in this month to wish  them all the best on 40 years of business

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Athena P.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description:
Perfect place for breakfast on a Sunday!!

Home cooked meals. Joe is awesome. Always good service. Inexpensive. 

The omelettes are always a good choice. Same with the Country egg meal. Really can't go wrong with anything here!

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Katie O.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: Great little joint in Bellevue.  The waitresses have regulars, which is always fun to see.  They have a solid selection of breakfast choices and give you lots and lots of food.  They have free coffee for you outside, if you have to wait for a table.  It's cash only, but they have an ATM in the back.  Overall, a great place to grab some breakfast/brunch.  Parking was easy to do on the street and the food comes out quickly.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Mark P.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: Great home made food! I have eaten the western omelette for breakfast and the meatloaf dinner for lunch both so delicious. Service was so wonderful.I will definitely be coming back!

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Nick S.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: Joe's Rusty Nail is a nice, family owned breakfast/lunch place that really impressed me. They have genuinely friendly service. I would definitely recommend grabbing a bite to eat there. They have a great breakfast menu with excellent tastes and good portions. I recommend their omelettes. Great restaurants like this are difficult to find these days, so it's definitely worth visiting. It is pretty easy to miss, but can be found on Lincoln Avenue in Bellevue if you're looking for a great dining experience.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Gail B.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: We had the Sunday special of pot roast. They gave me so much food it was enough for the next day. It included salad, roast beef, potatoes, gravy, vegetable. Also basket of bread. I also tried dessert. We got lemon meringue pie and coconut cream pie. I would recommend the lemon meringue pie more. Very tart flavor, loved it. The waitress Nona was the beat I have ever had. Fast, friendly, gave recommendations of what to eat. She was great.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Eryn P.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description:
I love a good gem. A gem close to home is even better. Joe's is just that. I had no idea it was there till I moved to Avalon a few years ago. I will now share my gem with you. 

Mom drove down one night to have dinner with me. I was feeling healthy (hahah, short lived) so I decided to get a steak salad. But since were here in the good old 412, salads mean croutons, fries and boiled eggs. Sooo, borderline healthy. I tried. 

I can't even describe to you how big this salad was. I can almost compare it to the salad they bring a family of four at the Olive Garden. Tons of fresh veggies, a good amount of steak, eggs, and a plentiful topping of fries. I got the ranch dressing and Mom got Italian. They didn't specify that their dressings are made in house, but they seemed it, even if they weren't. 

Mom and I could have split one of these! But I'm glad we didn't. It was such a good salad. I love cucumbers, and fortunately, Mom doesn't, so I got to steal hers. Win! 

The service was great. The server knew her menu, and made suggestions when Mom was undecided between the salad and the special. 

Mental note to self: they are cash or check (what?) only. 

Happy Eating.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Jeremy M.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: One of my favorite restaurants. It's very affordable, and the atmosphere is very old fashioned. You do feel very welcome when you enter the rusty nail

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Andrea S.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description: This is a wholesome restaurant with GIANT PORTIONS. I only come here for breakfast & my favorite meal is the French Toast Combo. It comes with an egg & choice of bacon or sausage, but I don't eat meat so I always substitute another egg in place of meat.  Service is usually pretty quick but if you go on a weekend there's a wait outside of the door. The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because there isn't much for me to eat on the lunch menu, being a vegetarian. I did order Alfredo once without chicken & it was full of small pieces of uncooked garlic. I couldn't even eat much of it. Other than pasta, there weren't really any meatless options. However, they serve breakfast all day & their coffee is pretty good for being a diner. I will always come back here because the food is always consistent and the service is always good.

BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.author: Renee L.
BY6sk5uACmes9rU7vpdzWw.description:
The place to go to if you are hungry for a home cooked meal yet lack the time and energy to prepare it yourself.  Traditional meals feature meatloaf, roast beef and are served with all the trimmings.
The dining room is small with plenty of staff on hand.
I noticed a good bit of warm conversations taking place among the staff and the regular customers.
Probably not the place to go if you prefer having a private conversation during your meal.
Cash only but there is an ATM available.

5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.author: Chandra C.
5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.description:
This is my absolute new favorite place in Downtown Pittsburgh. I'm a big fan of crepes and coffee, and you cannot beat the atmosphere, taste, and service of this place, especially at the price! My boyfriend and I stopped in for coffee and a sweet crepe, and both were amazing. We plan on going back this week with friends! 

The coffee is my boyfriend's new favorite (a little bitter for people who look very sugary coffee) and the crepes were great. The fruit served with the crepe was out of this world! 

We were in the restaurant for about an hour and no one else was in the restaurant for our entire visit, which is a shame for how amazing it is. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone in the area.

5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.author: Lulu B.
5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.description:
A new favorite hidden gem! I think they opened up recently (unless I was late to the party and just found out about them). I'm happy there's now a cute crepe place Downtown. I usually go out to Oakland for my crepes, but this will now be my more convenient go-to spot.

A friend and I went on a freezing day so it wasn't busy, but surprisingly a few people were still coming in, which goes to show it's worth it!

You order at the counter and choose your seat, but they bring the food to your seat! There are lots of comfy seating options and even a back corner type of space which would be so fun if you came with a lot of friends. It'd be fun to hear someone play that piano!

On to the important part. The crepes!!! I got the "chicken and mozzarella cheese" crepe which was quite yummy and pretty filling, and my friend got the "house of crepes" which was DELISH. Both came with a cute side salad of mixed greens and that was a nice touch to fill the plate. We both also got cappuccinos and those were well made too. 

I can't wait to come back and try their sweet crepes and other options! If you're Downtown and need a crepe fox definitely stop by!

5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.author: Tina R.
5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.description: Great new downtown option. My friend and I went here on a Friday for lunch when the weather was agreeable (by Pittsburgh in February standards) yet it was still half empty. Once people hear about this place, it's going to be packed because it's delicious and reasonably priced. Agree with other reviews, the only downside is the food is a bit slow to arrive. However I'd add that the fruit in the sweet crepe was so fresh that it was definitely prepped for our specific order so this helps explain the wait. We had the Bonjour and Super Veg savory crepes, and the de Paris sweet crepe with lattes. Everything was fantastic. Laidback and quiet atmosphere. The server brought tiny chocolate chip muffins with our bill. We'll definitely return soon and often.

5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.author: J D.
5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.description:
Cute new restaurant in Smithfield next to the pizza shop. I would suggest ordering ahead if you can. There is limited seating - three tables for 4, one table for 2, two low chairs and tables and 4 individual seats against the wall. I ordered the chicken and mozzarella crepe and was told that it would take 20 minutes to make. I'm not sure why it takes so long, but there were 3 crepes before me. The waitress said that the paninis are much faster, but I couldn't pass up on a crepe. The table next me ordered at the same time and despite them getting a panini and a salad, our food came at the same time. So I think their food all just comes out a little slow, which is fine if you're coming for a leisurely lunch. 

Now onto the food. The crepe is wonderful, nice and thin. You can't beat the price, $7.99. The spicy sauce on top has a nice little kick, but since I'm a spice lover I will ask for extra next time. There isn't a ton in the Crepe but if you eat it with the salad, it's wonderful. Portion size is also good. 

Someone posted that you order at the counter and pick your seat. The waitress told me to sit and then took my order but when another customer came in, he ordered at the counter and then sat. So I'm guessing they are still working out the kinks.

5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.author: Tally P.
5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.description: We came in the morning for coffee and crepes. I got the chicken mozzarella crepe that came with a delectable spicy sauce. My friends got the veg crepe and we all enjoyed our meal. Affordable and delicious!

5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.author: Amy B.
5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.description:
This little hole in the wall is surprisingly posh! The food is reasonably priced (portions looks small but they are quite filling, trust me!) and after our lunch we had to have some sweet crepes. The Nutella crepes with strawberries and bananas were served with a small boat of warmed Nutella sauce! 

Everything is made as you order and incredibly fresh. Absolutely recommend! 

Lunch and desert for 2 cost about $25.

5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.author: Melissa W.
5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.description: This is a charming place and the crepes were quite tasty! Table service was a nice touch even though the place is small. The staff were attentive and friendly and even gave us cute little croissants as we left. There's a  comfy looking seating area in the back where it would be fun to sit with friends & have coffee.  Next time we go I'll get my husband to play the piano!

5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.author: sherpes s.
5-JryW5OHljR0LPJhhv7jA.description: New place in the downtown area closest to the Smithfield Bridge.  Kind of low on pedestrian traffic so even if it has been open for a month, hardly noticed it.  The place is a creperie, that also offers waffles, french toast, and sandwiches "panini".  There is a capuccino machine (of course).  The  place is rather small, but it beautifully furnished with wood-and-metal tables and chairs that seem almost custom designed.  A vintage-looking upright piano sits on the back, and a sign invites customer to play.  Leather-like chairs and sofas make it a relaxing place to spend some time.  If they could also offer some "soup of the day" offering, that would be great.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Sean W.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
Just made a new family tradition! The Gobblerito!
A fantastic tearing Thanksgiving dinner in a burrito!
Some others got different burritos and fish tacos and none of them went away disappointed!
And no matter which places I've been to they all got a great vibe to them!

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Anthony F.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
This was the worst Mexican food ever. The Enchiladas were nothing but slop on a plate, and tasted that way too. 

Most Mexican restaurants I have eaten at provide you with homemade chips and salsa. Here you pay $4.50 for bag chips from Giant Eagle and diced tomatoes with absolutely no flavor. 

First and last time I will eat at a Big Burrito restaurant.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Courtney W.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: This is one of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh to get Mexican food. They are always accommodating with menu adjustments and have swaps for gluten and dairy allergies. The cocktails are always made just right and the food is fresh. Wait staff is always attentive. There are lots of Mad Mex locations scattered around Pittsburgh and I've had positive experiences in most of them consistently. The burritos are my favorite thing and they will put all of the good stuff in a bowl rather than the tortilla for those of us who have wheat issues. The decor is fun to look at as well. Great place!

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Tricia B.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
I don't get it. This place has been jam-packed ever since it opened late last year, so you would think it's gotta be pretty spectacular, right? Well, you would be wrong. I know Mad Mex is a Pittsburgh staple, so I was excited to see what all of the fuss is about. We decided to brave the crowds and try it out on a Wednesday evening (it was a 20 minute wait even during the weekday).

My key takeaway: this place seems to be all style and no substance. Sure, they have the funky decor and the sassy menu, but when it comes to the food, it's surprisingly disappointing. We started out with a trio of dips (cheese dip, black bean dip, and the fire-roasted chipotle salsa). Two of the dips were the highlight of our meal. The black bean dip and the fire-roasted salsa were awesome and very flavorful. The cheese dip, however, was an abomination to dips...it was very reminiscent of ballpark nacho cheese with some spices in it. Now, there's nothing wrong with ballpark cheese dip (well, actually, there are lots of things wrong with it, but that's besides the point), but Mad Mex charges close to $8 for their cheese dip, so I expect higher quality than that. 

And with the cheese dip, we began our disappointing descent into dinner mediocrity. My husband and I each got a burrito, which I thought they were supposedly known for. As far as I can tell, the biggest draw to their burritos seems to be that they're crazy big....but taste-wise? No bueno. The only word I can use to describe my burrito is "bland." Bland rice, bland beans, bland chicken...oh, and add "overcooked" and "dry" for the chicken. The burrito was served with salsa on the side, but it was also pretty bland (the fire-roasted salsa we got in our appetizer dips was MUCH better than their original salsa that comes with their burritos). I gave it a valiant effort, but I made it about a third of the way through the burrito before I gave up and decided it just wasn't worth finishing. 

Given how packed this place constantly is, maybe I'm missing something. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing? But all I know is that we spent about $40 on chips and dip and two burritos at Mad Mex, when we could've gone three doors down to Chipotle and gotten more flavorful food for half the price. Back to Chipotle it is!

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: David B.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
Dependably good. You know what to expect from this Mad Mex if you have been to any of their other restaurants. The artsy decor keeps it from feeling like a chain.

But we had uneven service, something I'm hoping they will eventually iron out. The first worked in our favor, they accidentally brought us 2 sets of drinks. But I ordered a salad that took way too long to arrive.

In general, good California-Mexican food. A good draft list. This is Mad Mex number 12, so you know that Big Burrito Brothers brings some experience.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Anne B.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: This is a preliminary review based on takeout that i didn't personally place the order or pick it up... Three of us got Gobbleritos. Was delicious. Just tricky to eat. Reasons: No utensils. Also, unlike the video we watched, our burritos each had one huge portion of delicious juicy turkey, instead of sliced. I did urge my lunch mates to try Mad Mex in person, it's even better!!!

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Marcia F.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
Been watching this place since the transformation from LaCappela's.
It is always busy.
We have been anxious to try it figuring it must be really good.
We had the Burrito (chicken?) 
and the Portobello fajita.
The Portobello fajita was very good, nice vegetarian option.
The Burrito was about 95% rice (see photo) and when we asked about it they said everything is proportioned.
Well, I guess I'm happy that no one else will get more chicken than me :p
We traded the "Rice Burrito" in for the chicken fajitas.
The chicken fajitas were definitely a better option.
The atmosphere is a little loud.
If you're looking for a nice quiet dinner this is not the spot.

All in all I guess for Pittsburgh it's pretty good

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Evan R.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: This mad mex is not my preferred mad mex, I don't know what it is but this location is always kind of messed up. I don't know if it's management, staff, or clientele but it's always a little jacked up. I've experienced waves of quality at Oakland, shadyside has been rock solid for some years, but this might be the weakest suburban mad mex. the vibe is bad, clientele is usually pissed and other than a couple of all stars most of the staff looks lethargic and bummed out. I LOVE mad mex but something is up

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Kaitlin S.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: Mad Mex has a unique cultural scene that you can't get anywhere else, not to mention the endless options of Mexican food! The chips are super yummy - always fresh and crispy. I can't say that the food is the best I've had, but it definitely isn't something to complain about! We will be coming again - and soon!

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Wes N.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: Another solid Mad Mex location. I've been here a few times now and it always seems to be pretty busy. They have decent happy hour specials that run till 6:30 which is primarily great deals on their margaritas. I really do think their margaritas are the best, I'll stand by that! I generally get the burritos at Mad Mex (which are huge) but tonight I went with the "Wing-O Tacos" which were very good. You get a choice of sauce for the boneless wings in the tacos and also a choice of the dipping sauce. Prices are reasonable. Would be nice if Mad Mex offered some complementary chips and salsa. Overall though, a great spot.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Chrissy F.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
I'm not big into chain restaurants but who doesn't love a little Mad Mex once in a while? I like this location because it's new so the furniture and fixtures aren't as lived in as some other locations. 

Staff are attentive and even when they're busy (they're always packed) they seem on the ball and generally happy with their jobs (which always insinuates to me that management is treating folks relatively well). 

Parking can be a bit tough which is fine if I'm dining somewhere cool in the city but adds a tiny layer of frustration when I'm at my local suburban mall.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Sam K.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: This location is really struggling with the staffing model.  I have been here at least 5 times in the last two months and every time the bar is so under staffed   Tonight is a Monday and the place is hopping. One bartender trying to take care of a full bar and fill the requests for the table.  Finished plates are abound- see photo and folks at the bar are trying to get bartenders attention.  Food is good once it shows up.  Come on Mad Mex! Get off the wallet and hire and staff appropriately.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Kathi S.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
We have eaten at other Mad Mex restaurants .... unfortunately this was just not very good- not fresh ingredients.
My husband and I both got the naked burrito chicken -the meat was very dry
Maybe because we arrived for late dinner at 8:30 we got the bottom of the pot ? Of course our timing should not effect quality.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Sarah T.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: I had another great experience here. The wait was about half an hour which was more than typical for a weeknight. We did the happy hour special- half off wings and a $7 Big Azz margarita. We also ordered the black bean dip, which is fantastic if you haven't tried it yet. The service was kind, funny and respectful as usual and the food was fantastic! Unlike the Shadyside location this one has better lighting and I think a better flow to the restaurant set up. We will be back for sure!

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Alex D.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
Great night out with the family on their first Friday they were open! As expected, the wait was around 45-60 minutes, but no worries, we had things we could do at the Waterworks, and were able to get them done. When it was our turn to be seated, we were taken to the table, and our waiter was great. 

Drink orders and apps came quickly, which was a bit of a surprise since the place was PACKED. Guac was on point - fresh, tasty, and paired well with their delicious, thin crispy tortilla chips. Of course, we were there to try a bunch of stuff out, so we ordered the steak fajitas (these were FAR better than the other steak fajitas I have had elsewhere, and were the table's favorite), chicken soft tacos (tasty tacos with corn salsa and radishes), carnitas quesadilla (this was MY favorite dish of the night, and I will say - the carnitas were superb), and their "Nacho Momma's" taco platter (these were somewhat bland, but we mistakenly ordered chicken instead of the beef).

Beers - they have a nice draft list, and even have a Founder's KBS (!!!) draft option, which is incredible. My only gripe was that the margarita that my wife ordered was 80% ice, and the tequila was barely noticeable. She ended up asking for a Coke after she drank the thimbleful of liquid in that drink - we learned our lesson there, and the next time we go, we will spring for one of the "signature" margaritas and hope for a better pour.

We finished with the downright tasty hazelnut chocolate churros. These were stellar, as we expected.

Food portions are pretty good. Most people with only one stomach can probably eat the whole entree, but will leave the piles of black beans and rice on the plate. Splitting plates was a winner for our group.

Overall, a great night, and we are thrilled to have a MadMex around the corner - I have a feeling that we will be back time and time again.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Susan A.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
Excellent food.. great service.
The waitress was on top of things
The deco is amazing
The manager walks around asking how things are.
I had the chicken parmesan tacos and they were excellent.
Will definitely be coming back

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Ada T.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: Recently learned of this new location making it a perfect spot to hit before a movie. Their parking lot was packed! They have pretty awesome happy hour specials. You can't go wrong with their wings and margaritas! We alerted our waitress of our upcoming movie and she got our food to us within a reasonable time for us to make the movie. She only missed one drink which came alongside the dinner so my friend had to chug his beer pretty quickly. Other than that, good service and great food as usual from the Big Burrito Group.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Beth W.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description:
So far not impressed. They couldn't seat a big party but had 4 people seating at a table that could hold 10. With multiple tables open that could seat 4. Owner might want to review the management tonight.
Bad food, bad service, bad Margherita's and manager with a bad attitude. This was my first visit. I will not be back and I'm embarrassed for the owner.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Jeffrey C.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: Like Mexican but tired of the same dishes? Then this is the place for you. New Age Mexican or Fusion Mexican? Also new age prices. But the food was delicious. The Pennsyltucky Fried Tofu and Shrimp Tacos make it tough to try other things. Maybe go with a group and everybody order something different? Keep in mind it can be busy at times.

X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.author: Jessica D.
X53hPZbw2_HmpcM_KHLddQ.description: I was invited her for the grand opening back in the beginning of December and I was very impressed. It's by far the most beautifully decorated Mad Mex I've been to and I've visited ones locally in Pittsburgh all the way to Philly. I brought my husband as my guest and we started out with margaritas and the tofu appetizer. I dare any tofu haters to try this app and not be converted- it is my favorite tofu dish ever. For my order I decided to change it up from the my usual chicken enchiladas and try a salad, the cilantro vinaigrette was awesome the the salad didn't quite hit the spot (will go back to my enchiladas next time!). For dessert we shared the churros which were AMAZING. Such a simple and delicious dessert- highly recommend trying these! Can't wait to go back again and again- so excited to have a Mad Mex so close to home!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Mario S.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: The service wasn't bad. The food was good. The staff also serves you with a smile. This might be the best Italian Restaurant in the Waterfront.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Jonathan A.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: My wife and I frequent Bravo on a semi regular basis. We got the fried Ravioli appetizer this time and it was delicious. Note that it's not on the menu, but it's sooo good. I would've eaten it for my entree. Make sure you ask for it if you go. Just don't eat it with the lasagne, because it is a huge portion and you don't need an appetizer to get full if you order it.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Valerie V.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
House salad is always consistent.
Portion size of the Parmesan crusted steak medallions was small for the $23 price tag-they served 3 small medallions potatoes and a veggie.
The Bravo pasta was alright-pasta was good, chicken was ok.
Limited menu, check it out before you go.
We were there on a Wednesday evening, many open tables yet had a 15 minuet wait which tells me they didn't have enough help.
Our culinary experience was ok...with so many great places to eat at the waterfront it will be a while before I stop back.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Noam G.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: I guess there was something wrong with the Alfredo sauce the day we went, because it was inedible. Even the wine and the iced tea we ordered were not good. They were nice enough to not charge us for the pastas, but we'll definitely won't be coming back..

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Eric R.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
Had dinner there on Tuesday evening...paid the bill of $30.06 with my credit card and today there is a $50.06 charge PLUS a $20 hold on my account.  I left the tip
In CASH so I have no clue where the additional $20 came from!  I am calling this morning to see what they have to say and will leave an additional review with the answer when I get one.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Ted C.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Hi - I along with two other amazing ladies came here on Sunday. The restaurant was busy; not packed - the waiting time was 20 minutes - we put our name in and walked around for 15 - came back and our name was off the list. Upon talking to the manager Ted, he quickly sat us down at a most enjoyable table. Yes, the manager was an amazing individual and great at his career. I am so very excited that people like Ted, not only enjoy the career - he is actually dedicated to his career. I love the food and the staff.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Rick W.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Excellent Long Island Ice Tea, service was nice however a little stuffy/snobby.  The decor had a nice feel and vibe. The food was mediocre. I ordered egg plant parmigiana with wedding soup as a start. The soup was more oily and salty than I prefer. The parmigiana lacked flavor. The restaurant has limited close by parking however it does offer a convenient drop off spot near the main entrance. Next trip will be limited to drinks, appetizers and outdoor seating during the summer.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Robert B.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Courteous, fast service.  Sorry but I have no doubt each dish I ordered came out of a microwave.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Kristina K.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: I recommend Bravo if you're eating in the restaurant.  Don't do take out.  Yes, it's convenient but they give you much less and charge you the same price.  Here's the chicken salad that cost $14!!!!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Levi p.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Bravo hosted a family birthday party for about 20. It couldn't have easier or nicer. It took 15 to schedule the date. The nice manager explained the process. I called in the menu (it was plated with guests picking one of three entrees). I got many compliments!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Erin H.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Got takeout and it was ok.  A little pricy though. Ordered two chopped salads and the lobster ravioli. The salads are great but I thought they would come mixed with the dressing like they do when you eat in. They did not. The ravioli were just ok. Nothing special and to be honest the sauce was just too garlicky.  Portion was ok. Enough to split between two of us. I'll probably order put again.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Aiyana L.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Ordered food for delivery so I didn't have to leave the hotel. Food got to me still hot. Got a pasta dish with chicken and red pepper cream sauce. It was really good they completely followed my order instructions online. No mushrooms. Add in a fork and knife and napkins and a cup of ice water. Which they did all of that for me. They also put in bread and the oil for dipping in. WAs very happy with their food

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Sujal M.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: I went to BRAVO! with my parents the other day. We had done a lot of organizing the apartment as I had just moved into it. The service was quick and friendly. I loved the bread as they had rosemary. The dipping olive oil with roasted red peppers was amazing. We ate so much that by the time dinner came, we weren't as hungry. We split a mediterranean salad as an appetizer. Must get this salad. Very filling. I had the eggplant parmigiana. The eggplant was nicely breaded and cooked. Spaghetti was filling. Mom had the margherita pizza, which she really liked. This is a good option if you want comfort Italian food.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Elis H.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
I would say 3.7 stars for the food and 4.5 for the service. 
They provide a very good customer service eating there but for take out or delivery they usually change the order according to my husband who order few times and always had wrong order. 
They always serve a delicious herbs breads to start which is a plus. About the food I would recommend Filet Mignon medium well. Tender, well made, they prepared as I requested. 
I also like their atmosphere especially in the day light. They also have table
outside during warmers seasons.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Mike S.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Great service great food, overall great atmosphere. It does cost a little more than most places. But the food and service are worth the cost. If you're down this way and looking for a good place to grab some Italian then this is a great place to stop.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: darren l.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
2.5 stars. This restaurant has gone downhill and it is evident as you can now walk-in just about any time compared to 5 years ago when this eatery was always busy and super busy on weekends. 

After tinkering with what was a nice menu and jacking up the prices while providing deteriorating service and multiple preparation errors, the Waterfront Bravo appears to be in a downward spiral which is very unfortunate as this was a great place for dinner before a movie at the AMC.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Chris S.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
They got my husband's order wrong but made up for it, giving him what he actually ordered and letting him keep what they gave him.

I found the food to be underwhelming and overpriced. Maybe I'm comparing it too much to the Olive Garden, but that's what it reminded me of - just more expensive and no salad (boo!) - also not as good. Pretty bland. 

I guess if you're a suburbanite who wants a "fancy night out", and you don't like complex flavor, go for it! 

The atmosphere is really nice. Underwhelmed by the staff and service. The server we had was training someone that night - awkward. 

Overall, would I go back? Probably not, especially given all of the other options in the area. 

Try out some other options in the area!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Sherry M.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
This was my first visit ever to a BRAVO and loved the whole experience from the moment I walked in the door with a girlfriend for a girls night out. 

My friend suggested the restaurant for dinner and wine. I made a reservation with open table to gain more points and use my $20 gift card from open table. 

It was such a good night! The restaurant was mostly empty, many dinners choice to eat outside, it was a nice warm evening for it. 

We started with bread and oil. I ordered the Chicken - Bacon  Flatbread, I also ordered a Caesar Salad and Wedding Soup EXCELLENT! The soup reminded  me of the Wedding Soup we used to order at Johnny Carinos, I so miss that restaurant in Monroeville. 

The Moscato Wine was very tasty ! I had Two glasses. 

My girlfriend ordered, The Bravo Pasta dish, she offered a taste, it was delicious  !! 

The atmosphere and service I enjoyed. 

I whole heartedly recommend this restaurant and I know we will return. I will return with family as well.

UPDATE:   Second dinner - Birthday celebration bring us back 
Excellent service and dinner as first time. 
Highly Recommend!!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Jeff B.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Arrived at 5:30.  It was busy with a wait.  Was told it would be 20 min.  Went shopping got back still no text.  Got a drink finally got a text.  It would be another 20.  I think they gave our table to someone who was complaining.  Not much on the menu for someone who does not eat cow cheese.  I ordered the veal parm and my wife settled on chicken.  My wife's salad came out with cheese on it.  Waiter noticed It and went to get another.  Food was good not great.  It was hard not to notice the many people waiting to be seated and those who had reservations that were upset at the delay.  We had $50 in gift cards given to us and we still paid 40 more.  A real Italian restaurant would have given us a great meal for $90.00

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: S K.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: I received a review on here, that informed me that my symptoms wouldn't have shown within hours of eating if it was related to water contamination, so perhaps we had food poisoning instead.  We both got sick at almost the exact same time, after eating dinner at the restaurant.  I have to believe it was "something" at the restaurant.  Thank you for providing the review so I could provide this update.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Kelly M.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
My friend has heard great things about Bravo's brunch on Saturdays and Sundays and asked if we should give it a shot. I was reluctant because I regularly avoid Bravo at all costs due to previous visits taking hours out of my day for an 'okay' meal, but I was getting bored with the variety at the Waterfront, which my friend and I frequent regularly for our catch-up lunches every few weeks. I gave a half-hearted yes and decided to give them another try- we decided on 11AM as soon as they opened (that's a little late for brunch, no?) and were promptly seated. We had a movie across the street at Loews at 12:35 so of course this was more than enough time to eat brunch - not! We didn't get out of there until 12:15 and not because we were sitting and chatting after the meal, but the long wait for the food! More on that later...

The brunch menu has a decent selection of breakfast foods, a couple sandwiches, a couple types of pizza, a few entree salads, and quite a few pasta options. I decided on the Romano chicken salad but asked for grilled chicken instead of the breaded/fried chicken. It was delicious with chopped lettuce, chopped eggs, small pieces of bacon, Parmesan cheese (quite odd- you'd think they'd have Parmesan shavings or shredded Parmesan, but no, it's like the finely-ground Kraft Parmesan cheese from the shaker bottle); the Parmesan dressing was excellent, though I wish they tossed the dressing with the salad instead of giving cups of the dressing as it was quite thick. My friend decided on the egg white omelette that comes with a side of fruit salad. She really enjoyed hers as well. 

Back to the wait time-  I haven't dined at Bravo for years even though I live in close proximity to two locations (Galleria and Waterfront). IT IS SOOOO SLOW HERE. I just don't get it! As I mentioned, we got there at 11:00 on the dot, so there weren't many other people dining around us, and our food took 45 minutes, for an omelette and an entree salad! I think that is just crazy. To be fair,  I would expect that for hearty pasta dinners if the place is completely packed and it's dinner time, but not a mostly-empty restaurant at 11:00 in the morning! It is extremely annoying. I see that nothing has changed in the service department so I am still reluctant to go again. 

Maybe we'll meet again in a few more years, Bravo. And mostly for the bread and oil :)

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Lina B.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: I ordered a salad with an addition of salmon and instead the waiter brought the salad with a dinner that included salmon. We were short on time which is why I couldn't wait for they to prepare my original order and I was still charged for the dish I received that was $13 more expensive. Not happy.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Phil G.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Great service , came over to enjoy a nice cocktail after work . Rebecca was amazing per usual . She's very kind and genuine , a non scripted server who cares. Rob was also helpful to me when needed, great personable skills ! Bravo is a great place to hang when you're just getting off work and need somewhere to relax and enjoy conversation . Highly recommended!!!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Courtney S.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Sorry this review is 2 years late, but our experience at Bravo was so excellent that we reminisce on it all the time. My son has severe food allergies and traveling and eating out is always difficult. Our waitress, Jenna, recognized and understood our concerns. She was so sweet and helpful. She immediately brought her manager, Curtis, over to speak with us. Curtis was also helpful and considerate. He kept a watchful eye over my son's meal while being prepared and had great ideas on how to accommodate him. My son said it was the best meal he ever had!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Jason W.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: This is one of my favorite places to eat my live in Pittsburgh I started with the 1 on mcknight road... Boy have they gone downhill.... On a slow Thursday afternoon around 3 o'clock we sit for about 10 minutes before ever being greeted... For our server to tell us she was in the bathroom which is why nobody greeted us? I understand everybody does this but it's not what I want to hear when someone's about to be waiting on me... At that point I had no expectation for anything to be halfway good so we left...

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: S B.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
Mike K was one of the best waiters I've ever had. From customizing our order for stuff that was removed from the menu to our continual demands, nothing phased him. Truly an example of outstanding customer service!!  Certainly we will ask for him on future visits!

I hope Bravo adds the chicken / spinach flatbread back onto the menu along with the Romano encrusted chicken salad.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Shana M.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
My husband and I dropped by for lunch while were shopping in the waterfront. We were greeted promptly but were sat near the door to the outside patio even though there were a bunch of empty tables. Every time someone went in or out, it was terribly loud.

Our waiter greeted us quickly and grabbed our drinks. It seems he was also the bartender as he was behind the bar most of the time even though there were no customers nearby. 

I ordered the chicken woozie, essentially fettuccine chicken Alfredo with spinach.. the chicken was cooked well, Alfredo was tasty, but the spinach just seemed like an afterthought. My husband ordered the chicken diavlo, zero complaints!

I'm not sure that Bravo is going to be a place we go out of our way to get to but overall, not a terrible experience.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: David S.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: The food here is not the worst Italian-American I've had, but it's not even as good as the old red sauce places in Bloomfield. The dishes I had were strange. The fried calamari looked more like fried rice noodles than squid, and was clearly highly processed and frozen. The lasagna tasted sweet rather than savory. The usual flavors of herbs, garlic, and onions were missing. Instead of the ground meat being integrated into the sauce, it just sat there in a layer.  The whole thing had an odd consistency.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Kalyn G.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: I got the spaghetti and meatballs. It was pretty good. Also, I went with the seasonal dessert they have now which is the Berry cake and comes with ice cream. I'm happy I did & recommend it!! I enjoyed my first time there and my waitress was nice.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Sarah B.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: I went here with my friend for lunch. The service was decent but the best thjng there was the ice tea! The food tasted like a Tyson TV dinner and it was way overpriced. You don't even get a salad included with your meal and the portions are small. I paid $20 for something i could have made much better at home with more flavor. Definitely not impressed and I will not be going back....if you want good Italian food go to Olive Garden.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Paul P.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Lobster bisque was good, I had the shrimp scampi. A little too soupy the taste was ok. Waitress was ok, took a long time to pick up the check.  She was good though, checked in often and had a pleasant personality. If I'm in the area I give it another try. Bravo is the sister company of Brio in AZ.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Chase F.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
Came in yesterday for a Christmas party and we were waited on by a nice young gentleman named Chris. He was very professional, genuine and hilarious which made our whole party a huge success. Will definitely be coming back to see him. And also, LOVE the new menu changes!! 

Thank you once again Chris!!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Anne D.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Met for a late lunch w/friends. Was greeted by a delightful waiter named Adam. While waiting for my friends to arrive, Adam engaged in thoughtful conversation. He served me coffee & water, remaining attentive as my friends began to arrive. We all enjoyed a delicious variety of lunch entrees, some wine, lots of laughs and conversation. Adam graciously took a photo of our group for us; never frustrated that we tied up a table in his section for far too long. It has been a while since I've been to Bravo. After today's experience, it will become a regular occurrence. Delicious food, lovely atmosphere & impeccable service by Adam. Well done!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Dan P.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
Took my sister to lunch here about a week ago. We were served by a woman name Summer. She had a trainee in tow. Sorry, I missed her name. We got the complete story on the new menu items. I allowed Summer to recommend The Spaghetti Pomodoro. It did not disappoint. Nor did the salad and bread. Since it was my sister's birthday she had a free dessert coming. She had their chocolate cake. It looked great.

Walked across the street to the theater to see Robert Redford in Old Man with a Gun to finish a great day.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Shelby S.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: I came here for lunch and it was good, but nothing special. While you wait, they give you bread and dipping sauce which are tasty. I like that they offer lunch combos for about $14 which I got a their chopped salad and pasta woozie. I liked their bravo salad but the pasta was only ok. Our waitress also didn't offer to add cheese on top like they have in the past which was disappointing. Overall it was an okay experience.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Michael W.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: My wife and I tried to eat here tonight and the receptionist told us it would be 25 to 30 minutes so we took a pager and waited. After a few minutes I noticed that there were at least 6 to 8 empty tables. In the next 15 minutes I watched 6 to 8 parties come in and she told them all the same thing, 25 to 30 minute wait time. About half the groups left and the rest took pagers and waited with us in a tiny lobby with only 3 chairs. I see more people leave and more clear tables and still we all wait. I finally asked why are we all waiting with so many empty tables. She told me that they were giving their wait staff a break since they were very busy.  I asked, You would rather turn customers away at the door and piss off more by having them stand around in a crowded lobby all while looking at empty tables, So your employees can have a bit of a break? She said you will have to ask the manager. Ok bring him over. Same response from him. We are just giving out wait staff a little break. I asked couldn't you just seat the customers and explain that you are busy. He said I didn't want them to get seated and then ignored. So you would rather let them leave or feel like they are being ignored in the lobby staring at empty tables. That's just bad management! Seat them, give them water and a menu and work harder. Sending customers and money out the door is never the right answer! We ate next door!

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Melanie Z.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description: Love the balsamic glazed chicken with feta. My husband enjoyed every bit of his shrimp scampi.  Exciting spinach ďip

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Kalina W.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
This Bravo location is next to stellar. We went for dinner yesterday and walked in a few minutes before my husband, since he was coming from work, and decided to grab a drink at the bar. I ordered a dirty martini and it was probably the best that's ever been made. The olives were "real" olives... Not polluted with salt. I ordered my drink "extra dirty" and it was made just that. $5 was not bad for happy hour. I have to give a shout out to the bartender, who was absolutely on her A-game and sweet as pie. A 5 star experience for sure.

Once my husband came, we were seated at a table. At first though, we were told we had to wait about 20 minutes, so I grabbed another drink. Then suddenly they seated us.. I was a little confused about what was going on and felt bad for the bartender who was unsure whether we were staying or going. 

We ordered a calamari appetizer and we got it steamed, not fried. I love that they were able to steam it for us. And the sauce that went with it was outrageously tasty. The marinara was good too. I wasn't a fan of the bread, though. That dipping oil didn't really do it for me. Our dishes came out in a timely manner and were literally steaming hot. I asked for extra garlic in mine and boy, they did not disappoint! Not to compare, but when I go to Olive Garden and request extra garlic in my dishes, they look at me like I have 3 heads. 

The booth we were seated in was super spacious and comfortable, as well. Our server was kind and attentive. Although we didn't save room for dessert, I wish we would have because I would have loved to try one of their options. If nothing else, it is definitely worth it to come back for happy hour. I also enjoyed how there were plenty of healthy options on the menu. My husband said he walked by a salad that was enormous and looked delicious. 

I noticed the managers walking around, meeting the tables and doing their best to patrol the dining room. I love waking into a place and just sensing that the reason everything runs so smoothly is because of the teamwork and leadership. We originally came here because we had a gift card, but I know we will be back soon, for the reasons listed above.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Mike H.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
My name is Hitt, I'm from Pittsburgh PA.  I do many things but one of the things I like to do is experience everything I humanly can from foods to places plus people and things.  Rather than write a long review and clutter the reviews with anymore long reviews (no knock, you guys are great) I'm just gonna get right to the point...

This place? 

Go if...

You want a fancier Olive Garden.

juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.author: Paul R.
juu7S1nP5eirbeJ8-rfguw.description:
This was the first time here and I ordered the Linguini Carbonara & had them add chicken to it. Wow, it was fantastic if I must say.
I'll be bringing my wife with me the next time for sure to savor the moment.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Erica C.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
We have been here twice now. The fish here is amazing. No question that this is the best fish in Pittsburgh. The pieces may be small, but they are amazing. They are buttery and there is absolutely no fishy flavor - quality over quantity, guys. The roles are okay, but there is no point when the nigiri and sashimi are this good. I'm terrified they are going to close and take my fish away!

Some of the appetizers are good (fried sweet potato,  tako taki (best I've had), egg rolls) but with fish like this who cares?

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Joshua B.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
Overall I would say you are better off somewhere else for sushi or ramen.

I ordered the duck ramen, a spicy tuna, and a philly roll (the two rolls I judge all sushi restaurants on - for better or for worse).

The philly and spicy tuna rolls were ok.  Nothing particularly great about them, but also not bad.  I think you can get better sushi at Sakura (or my favorite squirrel hill sushi joint - Te cafe).

The ramen was underwhelming.  The duck was more bone than meat and not nearly enough of it to justify all the bones.  The broth was bland and the vegetables seemed all over the place, and didn't fully belong.

All of this would be a 3 star rating if the services were not incredibly sub par.  We were each pre portioned an amount of soy sauce (that was not enough for either) and never saw our server to get more.  Finally upon finishing, we were mostly ignored until we got frustrated and walked up to pay our bill.

The decor was dark (we went at lunch time) and you could see sunbeams through the curtains and made evident from the smoke from frying food.  

My recommendation... save time, save money, go somewhere else.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Jenn G.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
This was my first time here after seeing that this place replaced Curry On Murray.  We came on a Saturday afternoon, around 2:45 pm.

FIRST IMPRESSION:  The decor was really boring, just a bunch of Studio G.'s My Neighbor Totoro banners sloppily strung up everywhere.   The music sounded like it drifted between spirited away soundtrack and classical. 

We ordered the dragon roll and the spicy roll combo platter.  My partner also ordered an avocado peanut roll, but the server apparently didn't hear the peanut part and so only gave us an avocado roll.
   
MENU?!: The menu was overly complicated.  It was hard to have to decipher what they considered a regular roll from a "special roll" from a "raw roll" from a "vegetable roll" from a "sushi roll".  All the quoted material were categories on the menu.  It seemed fine but gets complicated when the lunch specials let you pick from different rolls-- but it felt like too much to have to decipher because there were too many different categories of sushi rolls.  
Having them listed by pieces and ingredients would be so much easier.

FLAVOR: The fish was very fresh, not fishy at all.  All around, it was tasty.  The dragon roll at 2+1 Diner up the road was WAY better though.    They gave us complimentary miso soup in the beginning and a mango mochi ice cream at the end of the meal.

PRICES:  their prices were all right in the restaurant.  Online it seemed way more expensive.  Online, the Dragon Roll was like $15, where in the restaurant, it was more like $11.45 or something.

 The service was okay.  The speed of everything was okay, but the place was pretty empty.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: N D.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
Every dish was very very good!
Duck ramen, sweet purple potato, eel sushi, and beautifully  presented by a one chef operation. Lovely complimentary  mochi for after

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Jessica L.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
3.5 STARS

Yukiyama popped up on my Yelp a few days ago with 0 reviews, and since we were in Squirrel Hill and my boyfriend loves ramen, we decided to take the adventure and stop by for a bowl.

the waiter suggested the purple sweet potato fries which were AMAZING. served with aioli, hot and crispy and in a generous portion, we couldn't stop eating them! the mango mochi ice cream was also a delightful dessert, perhaps a smidge more frozen than we'd like but still delicious and beautifully presented.

honestly, we're wondering if we tunnel visioned into the ramen and this is perhaps a place that focuses on the sashimi/sushi. when we asked the waiter what the most popular items were, he quickly said sashimi, but I'm sometimes hesitant at newer sushi places, so I went for the duck ramen. it was too salty for my taste, the broth lacked the depth of flavor I wanted, and the noodles weren't limp, but they weren't springy either. the duck tasted like your standard Chinatown takeout duck. on the plus side, the portion was filling and the egg was cooked well!

the waiter gave us space, but was attentive - our waters were always full and our empty plates were out of the way. the interior is cute and Totoro themed. we went early on a weekday for dinner so it was quiet enough to have good conversation. 

overall, a nice new addition to the squirrel hill scene, but probably not my place for ramen.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Kristy A.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
We ordered delivery on a Friday night and were really pleased overall.  I had a combo of sashimi, sushi roll, gyoa, and sushi.   The amount of food was plenty for the price and I thought the quality was good.   I judge a sushi place by the availability and quality of ikura (salmon roe).  A lot of places don't have it at all, and it doesn't taste right at some that do.   This place was a winner.   

The packaging was a little wonky, I guess; but other than that, we really enjoyed our meals and would definitely order again.   

Notes about the packaging.  The sushi comes on small trays - maybe 1-3 items per tray depending on what you order - no issue there.  The soy sauce is in a plastic cup with a lid, that is then put in a tiny individual bag (for leakage).  It did leak and there wasn't quite enough of it.  We also didn't have quite enough wasabi.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Jess N.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: The sushi here is one of the best I've had in Pittsburgh. The fish was so fresh, buttery and oh so delicious. I got the spicy sampler and it was well proportioned, with fun crunchies in the roll and perfectly thin rice layer. We also ordered the takoyaki appetizer and it was wonderfully flavored with a nice amount of octopus in each bite. We were very satisfied with the meal and friendly service. This place is simple but the food more than makes up for it so give it a chance.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Neha C.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: The food is delicious but what makes this restaurant such a delight to go to is the hospitality of the owner. I have been there twice and each time, we were even offered small treats for dessert. Besides that, they also let me charge my phone while I ate and also charged my friend's phone. The portion size is good for the price. Improving the aesthetics of the interior would improve the overall experience of dining there but other than that, 5 stars.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Isabelle T.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: This restaurant is amazing! I would recommend to anyone if they're looking for a relatively cheap meal that is high quality. Their fish is very fresh, and their sushi is very good. I also had the duck ramen and that was amazing! The service was very nice and polite as well, and their happy hour is such a good deal. Overall, a great experience, and I will definitely go back.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Timothy C.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
Dropped in for a quick bite of dinner. It took about 15-20 minutes for my order of Chirashi to come out. The place has dim lighting and not many seats available for dining. Soft music selections from Ghibli film was playing at the time.

Onto the food. I was a little disappointed by the portion size for the cost but my Chirashi was pretty fun to eat. Crunchy, diced, pickled vegetables and shredded icrab were mixed into the bowl which is not typical fare to my limited experience and there was some scallops included in the bowl.

Still taking out 1 star for the portion size as I had to get take out elsewhere but the food was good.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Guo Y.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: The duck ramen is great  the price is right ,I just must lunch must to try it , the staff is friendly

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Dmitri A.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
Tiny sushi size. Barely any fish. This is $26 for the box and $10 for the "toro". I cannot recomendable them.

Do not order to go. Smallest portions I've ever received. Low quality too.

"toro" isn't quality toro.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Kirk A.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description:
Yukiyama has a good thing going, and I think I'd come again if I'm hungry in the area. 

They've got these really amazing purple potato fries, which were recommended by the waiter. We were going to get the gyoza until he mentioned them. They came with a great mayo sauce, which added a lot of depth to the fries. The waiter really did seem to know the menu well, or at least what to highlight to customers. We should have listened to him about the main courses though. 

Not to say that the main courses we got were horrible. In fact, I actually enjoyed my pork ramen -- I thought it was tasty. But he suggested that we get the sashimi, and I think that we probably should have, in retrospect. The ramen was more salty than I'm used to (maybe that was what they were going for, but I think I'm used to a richer, more porky broth). The chashu, which I was expecting to be the highlight of the soup, was really thin. I'm used to thicker cuts of meat in my ramen, and I think that it really did detract from the quality of the meal. The noodles were nothing to write home about. There were some green veggies in the ramen that I don't think were traditional Japanese veggies for ramen. 

Then we had mochi ice cream for dessert (he recommended again -- mango) and it was decent. Above average presentation, too.

Some final thoughts -- the restaurant was very empty, but I won't hold that against them, seeing that they're very new. I think the awning over the restaurant was from an old restaurant that used to be there, so that might have hurt them. Everything was reasonably priced. 

So, I'll probably come again if I'm in the area, but this time, I'll try their sashimi.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Jared L.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: Cute atmosphere with Japanese art on the walls and quiet music that reminded me of playing Final Fantasy. We ordered the gyoza and sweet potato fries (purple fries). The gyoza was delicious. Crispy pan friend on the outside and juicy and chewy on the inside. The fries were surprisingly really good! Freshly fried with a unique batter. My wife ordered a California roll and a shrimp tempura roll. I ordered the Rainbow roll. The sushi was perfect. The fish was fresh, the cucumber was crispy, and the rice held together very well. Well constructed. Prices are typical and the portions are good sized. I definitely recommend Yukiyama! Support this little restaurant!

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Mark D.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: Great sushi. I lived in Tokyo for a year and am discerning in my sushi taste. I'm not an expert, but I know high quality fish when I taste it. I stopped in to try the sushi appetizer and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the fish. The texture, taste, and freshness were right in line with what I had come to expect at high end restaurants in Japan. I was also delighted to find subtle herbal and savory highlights in a couple of the pieces. Unexpected but appreciated. Service was quick and very personal. I look forward to returning and trying more from their menu.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Joseph W.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: Stumbled onto this place and add to my favorites in Pittsburgh. The service and food are excellent with a very clean envirionment. We'll return for sure.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Caedyn B.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: I was so sad to find out that Curry on Murray closed, but decided to try this new place in its absence. Unfortunately, I won't be back. The interior decoration is really pretty (with some cute Totoro wall hangings mixed in), but that's about where the greatness stops. The food was mediocre, and was made worse by the fact that there were maybe 4 other tables in the whole place that customers were at, and it took 45 minutes to get a sushi platter and two bowls of ramen. I really hope this place has the chance to improve, but it's going to take a lot of convincing for me to spend the time going back.

IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.author: Mark M.
IGxQTkbFxs25yDz3gHG8bA.description: I enjoyed the each course! They had very complex flavors clear across the board! Yellowtail jalapeño,tuna tataki ,a speciality roll, salmon pizza!! Yum

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Amanda H.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: I'm updating my review... just to say that I love DeMore's. Every time I order for delivery it's always hot, fresh, fast, and the delivery driver comes to the door with a smile. The pizzas always come LOADED with toppings and every wing flavor I have tried has been superb. The hoagies are always toasted to perfection and they never skimp on the ingredients. Plus you can't beat the price! The calzones are also really good, and huge as well as the salads. DeMore's if you see this.... Thank you for great food and consistency!

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Frank L.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: When it's good, it's good. But when it's bad, it's terrible. This is now the most unreliable pizza joint in the area. I'm sick of crossing my fingers and hoping that the pizza won't be a complete disaster. Now more often than not they put wayyyy too much cheese on the pizza to the point that it slides around and goops up on one side (see all of the customer images). I've given this place too many chances. From now on I'll just order from Frank's or Alioto's instead.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Karley K.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description:
Disappointed. Usually love ordering from here and make the drive to come here since I don't live right up the road anymore. Ordered online (which I've done multiple times, with no issues) to get my food, to have it wrong, why say a pizza has tomatoes on it, then you get it and it doesn't? Why order loaded fries to get plain fries, and there was so much cheese on the pizza only the very top layer was melted all the cheese underneath was still in solid shredded mozzarella form that the entire thing just tasted uncooked. Our hoagie was smashed and soggy When called they said they would credit us loaded fries to my account.. needless to say, we spent $51 and change on pizza that we ended up not getting to eat because it was awful. 
It hurts to say it but we probably won't be ordering again unfortunately .

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Jason F.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description:
I stopped by here earlier today with my wife for lunch.  We decided to come to Demores pizza because I had always wondered how it tasted since I drove by it a lot.  The cincher was whenever they put up a sign saying that one of the radio shows had voted it best pizza in Pittsburgh.  So we called up Demores Pizza at around 11:30 AM and ordered a 12 cut cheese pizza.  They let us know it would be about 20 minutes and it was ready for us whenever we got there about 30 minutes later.  Since we did takeout I didn't really pay too much attention to the restaurant and could only tell you there was a window into the kitchen where you could place and pick up orders and then a dining room.  The pizza itself ended up looking good with some nicely browned cheese and bubbled crust in places.  Like all pizzas this one can be broken down into its three major components: cheese, sauce and crust.  Starting off with the cheese, I think that there was an ample amount of it and it had a somewhat good taste to it.  Could it have been better?  Sure.  Was it bad though, nope.  Next up was the sauce which I honestly had a tough time trying to find.  I mean I know that it was there and I was trying to taste any spice or sweetness from it but got neither.  Last but certainly not least was the crust which was easily the best part of this pizza.  It was cooked well and had a nice bite to it with the outside being crispy and the inside warm and soft.

The bottom line for me is that I might stop by here again in the future.  While Demores pizza didn't exactly blow me away, it wasn't bad either and I did enjoy their crust.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Jackie G.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: The best pizza hands down! The sauce is wonderful especially with the bread sticks. Delivery is quick and our usual delivery guy is super great  We order almost every weekend and are very happy with everything!

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Gabriel K.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: I thought the food is gone down hill it's not the same as it once was. When it was owned by the Demores. New owner kept old name. Pizza was like raw not cooked. Dough was gummy. On two different occasions. Decent pepper jack cheese balls.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Marylou M.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: We ordered a cheese pizza and a white pizza plus a greek salad.  They were all good!  The service was fine and my order was ready when I picked it up!  I would recommend this place.  It was not my most favorite tasting pizza, but it was good.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Doug W.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: As many of you already know, my wife and I are in a life-long quest to find the perfect pizza. No, this isn't it but it sure was good. Our benchmark is a pepperoni pizza. The crust was very good. Thin with a crisp crunch. It had a good flavor as well. The sauce was spread a tad too thin but was nicely balanced with spice and had a little acidic finish.  And the pizza was huge. The only things we didn't like was that they could've added more cheese (Make sure you ask for extra) and the pepperoni was thin and cheap. I would've paid more for thicker better grade meat. On the whole it was a very good pie well worth the visit. If you live in the area find and try this place. By the way, the subs looked great.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Diane A.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: Went to the pizza shop tonight for dinner ordered a medium pizza with mushrooms and black olives the pizza  was cooked on the bottom but not on the top and the fries were horrible and limp as if they oil wasn't changed in a long time never againe was and change the oil wasn't changed in a while never again

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Anthony P.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: At one point this place made a decent Sicilian pizza. But lately they've gone downhill at such a fast pace. I ordered a Sicilian last week and asked for it well done. When it arrived it was way under cooked. I called to complain and was told to go pound salt. I gave them another chance today and this time it was raw. It was barely cooked. Unbelievable. They did this out of spite. I'll never order from them again and I'll make sure I'll everyone I know.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Nikki J.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description:
We usually like Demore's but nothing was good. Everything was COLD and we had to reheat before eating. We were quoted 75 min and waited just under 2 hours. We should have been given a courtesy call to say they were behind. When I called them she laughed at her quote time and seemed to have cared less. 
A $50 order and we were left very disappointed and still hungry!

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Jason G.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: This place "used" to be good. Made a recent order which came to $59 buckaroos. Ordered a pizza, hoagie, wings and cheese balls. NEVER received the cheese balls, pizza and wings were barely warm and it took over 2 hours to deliver when it should've been delivered in 45 minutes to an hour. Driver never once apologized. Called the store, twice. First time, someone answered and hung up on me without saying a word. Ok, maybe an accident. Second call, no one answered. I drove there to get my money back and no one was in the building. This was at 11:20pm. They close at 11. Makes me wonder about the cleanliness of the kitchen now. Horrible food, horrible service will never have my business again. Before that, I made an order and stood there in the lobby. The cook was gross, constantly complaining, getting upset when another order came in. This is very bad business.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Kimberly S.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: Burnt Stromboli with little to no ricotta.  Not impressed.  I try to like this place but the food is really inconsistent.  One time its really good.  Next time this.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Danielle B.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: Nasty I even told them n they made no good no free maybe decent pizza nothing who the fuck wants to eat this shit seriously

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Aaron F.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: Overall bad experience. I used to order from demores all the time about a year ago. I stopped ordering because the food starting changing. Very greasy which I hate. I usually would pick up my food, last time picking up a few of the cooks were arguing in the kitchen. Saying very nasty harsh words. I had my son with me, he never heard words like that before. There was a rather large lady (maybe the manager) sitting at the table doing some work. She got up and was screaming at the employees. If I were them I would of walked out. The woman was nasty.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Nicklas V.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: It's an ok pizza shop. But nothing special. It just fits into my idea of an average Pittsburgh pizza shop. I'd eat it again if someone ordered it but I wouldn't go searching for it.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Heleos C.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: Terrible food worse management. If u want a greasy pizza with shitty service this is the place for you.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Kathryn F.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description:
First, I really like multi-generational family businesses.

I have been eating pizza and steak hoagies here since high school (many moons ago).

It is on the main drag of Millvale with ample parking.  This generation has repainted the building and remodeled the interior.

When I am visiting my family ... I always order a steak hoagie.

The remodeled site is family friendly and affordable. 

They also deliver.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Jay D.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: Decided to stop by Demore's Pizza and grab a quick bite to go.  I got an Italian Hoagie Pittsburgh Style (fries & slaw on sandwich) and an order of their Hot Cheese Balls. The place seemed clean, the staff was very pleasant, and the food was really good.  I recommend a visit if you happen to be in the area.

VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.author: Erin S.
VXKIx4WUGw3jNad0BOcFYQ.description: My husband and I used to be regular here.  We knew the guys behind the counter and they usually recognized us when we came to pick up our food.  Our last three orders weren't good at all and my husband said he hasn't seem any of the usual guys behind the counter any time he went to pick up food so I wonder if it's under new management.  I had a grilled chicken salad that I couldn't palate because the chicken was dry, it seemed like it was from a can.  My husband had similar chicken on his parmesan chicken sub.  We couldn't finish our food.  The last time we ordered from them the pizza we got smelled like spaghetti, I have super smell from pregnancy nose, I promise it did.  It tasted strange along with the smell.  The cheese was a little, tangy for lack of a better term and I'm pretty sure the sauce was spaghetti sauce not pizza sauce.  I think the only thing I would order currently would be friend appetizers.  I'd have to be convinced otherwise to order food again in future.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Maryna L.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: Fresh food and clean place! Big choice of seafood . My favorite buffet so far in Pittsburgh! Come check it out ;)

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Jermaine A.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
Stopped by this place for a quick lunch and this place was HORRIBLE. The restaurant is so outdated and when my boyfriend and myself walked in.. the guy at the front just stared at us until I asked if we pay first or be seated first. His response was just "yeah" picked a table and a woman came over asked for drinks. We got up to eat and man.. the food looked nasty. NOTHING looked good.. everything just looked like it was sitting there for hours and I have NO IDEA WHAT THE HECK WAS INSIDE THE EGG ROLLS! The orange chicken and bourbon chicken was the best tasting thing and that was even that good. 

To top everything off.. after being there for all of 15 minutes knowing we werent going to eat anymore.. we asked for the check and the woman kept saying something and pointing to check.
