We couldnt pick up on what she was saying for like 2-3 minutes.. here she was telling us "tip at table".. then continue to stand there after leaving one when it was unnecessary. 

If your the type to eat any kind of Chinese.. then you probably will enjoy this. But if you are anything like me, who eat from one maybe two Chinese places, then this is not worth it. There is an hibachi style option and maybe thats good.. but the giy was just standing there sooooo we were  like no! I would NOT recommend this to any one. The are lucky that I was able to give them a star at all!

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Malarie J.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
If I was able to leave negative stars, or even zero stars, I would. This place is absolutely DISGUSTING. 

EVERYTHING that any of us had from the hot food buffet tables was COLD. The ONLY thing that was actually hot was the hibachi and that's because he made it fresh right there. My son wanted fries, so he took a few and put them on his plate. When he bit into the first one, he spit it out and said it wasn't hot at all. My husband grabbed one and tried it..... And they WERE NOT EVEN COOKED!! 

The server was incredibly rude everytime she came to the table. She never asked if any of us wanted refills. She dropped our check about half way through us eating and stood against the wall hawk eyeing us. She finally came over and asked if we were ready to pay. We decided to split it between cash and card. When she brought my card & slip back, she literally stood 5 feet behind my husband waiting for me to fill it out. Once we got up, I heard her say something about us in her native tongue that sounded really rude. 

I'm hoping that none of us get sick!!!  Please do yourself a favor and just keep driving by. THIS PLACE SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN BY THE HEALTH DEPARTMENT!!!

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Bee M.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
The service was very good, and what a little lesser than what you would expect from a Chinese buffet lunch for 9.95. It sucked lol. The Sushi was decent but everything else wasn't good. All of the buffet items were cold and the hibachi sauce was AWFUL. I couldn't even eat it and I felt bad for wasting it. Then I moved on to desert- cream puffs were hard. The ice cream selection was super basic (prior to being under this new mgmt there was red bean and green tea ice cream, and that's why it was one of my favorite cheap spots before it changed over. Food was way better too). 

The weirdest thing I saw there was there waiting area for when they got busy........ I don't know why, but I feel as though vehicle seats in a restaurant should be against some kind of code or policy somewhere

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Eileen N.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
This place deserves all the stars. Admittedly, I did not expect much because this restaurant is tucked away in a shopping complex that has a bunch of big box stores, but I'm so glad I made the journey to try it. When we first walked it, my fiancé and I were immediately impressed by how clean the buffet was. The counters were immaculate, the sushi neatly arranged, and the trays fresh and colorful. 

The cleanliness was one of the biggest things that stood out to me. I've been to dozens of asian buffets and this is one of the cleanest. The wait staff was also exceptional; whenever I went to get another plate, the mess of the previous plate was also cleared before I got back. I had the chance to talk to Joy, who was so kind and amazing at her job. 

At $16 per person for dinner, I think the quality and diversity of the food here is truly discounted. What I loved was that all the trays were small -- indicating that they make small, high quality batches at a time for each dish. Also, having smaller trays meant there were so many things to try! While we were there, I was particularly enamored with the blistered yet crispy green beans and they replenished that particular tray faster than I could eat them!

The other thing I really enjoyed was the crab. They literally serve half-crabs here and they are enormous, juicy, and addicting. I was amazed they served crab for only $16/person. They are the only good Asian buffet in the area and I really appreciate the offerings here. They have high quality food, crab, sushi, and a Mongolian bar -- what more is there to say?

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Sue T.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
The food is a little dry for my liking. There is a wide variety of food offered here however, nothing out of the ordinary. I came here for the special holiday dinner on a Christmas and paid $27 for typical Chinese food and crab legs. I would not say that it was worth the money. 

I only had two plates of food and couldn't even finish the second plate fully. I think that speaks volumes since I typically eat 3-5 plates. I wasn't even tempted by their desserts. Although, the ice cream case seemed nice with a wide variety of options. 

I'm not sure if this Chinese buffet differs from any others in the area. I definitely prefer Hokkaido over this one. I'd try this place again if I was really craving Chinese food and desperate for a place that was open.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Ada T.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: Not impressed. My family and I came here for dinner. They need to work on the quality of the food and improve their sauces. I'm not looking for a 5 star meal at a buffet but I've definitely had better quality food at other buffets. The sushi was just mediocre, some of the shrimp dishes were overcooked and mushy, and the beef was just okay. Their desserts were good and I liked their variety of ice cream. If they worked on their sauces a bit, I think they would get more patrons.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Carly C.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: Warning you about the price for Saturday and Sunday is $14.95 for lunch and dinner! The food was good!

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Savannah K.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: This is a great place to have Chinese buffet. They have so many different options to choose from, a lot more than typical Chinese restaurants. This place even has sushi! The spicy tuna roll is spectacular, and they have a wide variety of sushi to choose from. A hibachi grill, sushi, many seafood options, a dessert bar, and so many soups. It's so cheap to eat out here to lunch too. Two people is about 25$ I believe. The staff is really nice, and the food is pretty good. I haven't eaten anything from here that I haven't liked. Everything is so fresh too. Nice and hot and you can definitely tell that it's not food that's been sitting out a while. I highly recommend Happy Home Buffet to anyone that's looking to get some Chinese and Japanese cuisine.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Jan S.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
Food quality has been dropping here. It's not just the ingredients but the cooking quality and serving temperatures. I started off with some raw oysters which were pretty good last time I had them here, but this time they were part frozen and had a weird chemical smell. Maybe just a bad supplier? I set those aside and tried some other things, but they were off too. The sauces were all excessively sweet and heavy. The fish for the sushi looked pale and dry suggesting it had been frozen then soaked in water. There were only a couple dishes such as the steamed fish with ginger and scallions that were properly cooked and as good as they've previously been. The bathrooms were also filthy and obviously hadn't been attended to in quite a while.

Sad to say I'm crossing this off my list and not coming back until I hear it's improved and/or under new management.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Tamara G.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: This is my first time back since this buffet opened under a new name. I went at 12:45 on a Monday & I was surprised there were quite a few filled tables. The sushi was fresh & tasted great. They don't have as much sushi selection as the last place, but definitely adequate. They will make a stir fry fresh. They have lots of Chinese dishes & dumplings, and several soup options. They have some kids items and American items too like Mac & cheese and chicken nuggets. There is a salad bar & dessert bar with hand dipped ice cream. I was seated immediately & my water was refilled promptly & plates were also cleared promptly. The food was hot. Really, who can argue with a $10.95 All you eat Asian buffet lunch?

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Kai Y.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
Great place, great food and great services!

The experiences here is kinda mixing many individual merits of buffet restaurants.

Strongly recommend!

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Mike D.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
Yikes. Should have turned away when there were only three other cars in the parking lot at a Friday at 6 PM. Walk in and it is a ghost town inside. More workers than customers. There are also mini van seats in the waiting area for some reason. Will say that the staff were very friendly and attentive.  The lack of music gave it a creepy feel.  However, the food simply was not good. Lack of flavor and you can tell the food has been sitting under a lamp all day.  Did not try the sushi because the freshness was questionable. The hibachi inside was a nice touch and better than anything else sitting out there. They also have ramen that you can pick your own ingredients. 

TLDR: you're in a major city. There are better places to eat.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Ding S.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: I had dinner with my friends last night. Service was awesome and the room was comfortable. Food was absolutely wonderful, having fish, shrimp, roasted duck, crab and all kinds of snacks This is definitely the best Chinese buffet in Pittsburgh! Will be back!

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Zeina S.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: Awful food, dining room looks like empty plain boring classroom.. what a wast of time and money! Big disappointment

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Michelena W.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
We tried Happy Home Buffet tonight for their Sunday buffet. It was adequate, but nothing special. It's fairly similar to the last two buffet restaurants that have existed in this location. I was glad for the hibachi option, because there were very few vegetables on any of the steam tables besides one dish of green beans with almonds. They were very good, but I wished for more options and variety. Like bok choy!

We tried a variety of the other entrees and they were fine. A little heavy on sauces for my taste, and mostly very well done, which isn't ideal when it comes to beef, or fresh vegetables. Pretty standard buffet fare.

The staff working tonight were very friendly and helpful. Our server was ever present, and was happy to refill our drinks, answer questions and generally be helpful. The same could be said of the kitchen staff who were busy bringing out fresh food throughout our visit. 

Overall, we'd probably come here again a few times per year to add some variety to our eating out options, but it's not a standout in terms of local restaurants.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: LLific Y.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description:
The sushi here is amazing! Well not as good as ur $500 sushi house of course. But the best of all buffet around the area.
Definitely putting on my to go list. Looking forward to come here again.
Try the hibachi though, u could pick ur own ingredients , u can't go wrong with that.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Angela T.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: I went right as they opened up for lunch at 11am and everything was delicious! The lunch price is only $10 which is a great deal. Not only do they have various sushi, Asian cuisine but also the option for hibachi!! I am curious to go back for dinner to see if they fresh taste was just because I was there first thing . Service was great too!

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Viola C.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: Great price! Best asian buffet in Pittsburgh!  The food was great, freshly cooked and well presented. Will definitely come again.

hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.author: Max V.
hh1ed5ZU4-6NupSvORCccw.description: Mediocre lunch buffet for a reasonable price. The food wasn't super fresh or hot for that matter. Everything tasted okay, but this is not a place I will be visiting again. I love Chinese buffets, but this is one you can skip.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Damon S.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: Off the frickin hook. No nonsense joint with prima coffee that's a stand out (that's rare), breakfasts that fill you to the brim and dynamite cannolis. Lunch specials were intriguing and look forward to sampling whenever I'm even remotely close.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Erin L.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
Bella Ria's is a cute and small restaurant with the staple foods that everyone knows and loves. The staff is friendly, and their prices are very reasonable. 

Their breakfast is pretty good, too. I love their pancakes!

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Chad B.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
I have been here twice now and have been very impressed on both visits. The first was for lunch and I ordered what ended up being the massive Royale with Cheese and fries. Guys, this thing was huge!  And the taste was equally gargantuan!  Everything is made to order so it was extremely hot and fresh though that quality may take a few minutes longer than the chains. Trust me, it is worth it!  Next up was a visit for breakfast.  They offer an nice menu of standard breakfast items with specialty omelets and hashes. I went for the Corned Beef Hash and it was one of the best dishes I have had in the area hands down.  The real star here are the potatoes. I don't know what they do but it is best described as culinary wizardry.  Amazing.  I may never order anything else here again. I can't wait to bring some people to Bella Ria's for breakfast after this experience.

Again, this is a made to order type of family operated restaurant. You are getting high quality for the offset of time. Don't let that keep you away. The one drawback I do see is the small parking lot and limited seating inside. It can get cramped and there may be wait times to be seated. There isn't much room for waiting either.  I'd like to see them expand somehow to accommodate those rush times but at the same time, I don't want it to lose what sets it apart from other restaurants in the area. I'd rather make those sacrifices and retain the essence of what makes Bella Ria's great!

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Ciara M.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: Bella Rita's was really good for a long while, but I know the last time we were there I was so disappointed and haven't been there since. Probably never will be again.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Daniel L.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: Bella Ria's is one of my favorite local spots when I am in town. Having grown up 15 minutes away, I had the pleasure of eating here often. The two best aspects of Bella Ria's are the homey feel - fostered by friendly staff and familiar faces - as well as the home cooking. A high portion of the food here is made from scratch. I've eaten here for breakfast, lunch and dinner and can highly recommend each corresponding parts of the menu. The French toast and pancakes are awesome, I always love the buffalo chicken wrap, and the pastas, salads and pizzas are top notch. The icing on the cake is the delicious desserts offered. The Oreo pie is one of the best things that I've ever eaten. It's a must try. Visit Bella Ria's! One try and you'll be hooked, and will become a regular I am sure!

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Victoria D.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: This place has one of the best steak salads I've ever had. It's quality steak, fresh greens, lots of veggys, blue cheese, onion petals and so on. Super tasty. This is a hole in the wall joint and gets busy fast but it's yummy!

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Joe T.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: Not the prettiest on the out side and the inside is very mom and pop. The food is bomb as hell tho! Soo good! The guys are nice! Compliments to the chef

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Stacey B.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
I have been here for breakfast many years ago and tried the Royale Burger a few years ago. For some reason, every time we think to come here, it's a Sunday and they're closed. In fact, the one Sunday, we ran into the owner and he said that his wife told him if he ever opens on Sunday's, she's divorcing him. Ahhhhh the lives of small business owners. 

Tonight I tried the Veal Parmesan with penne pasta and a side salad with homemade Italian dressing. The veal was crisp, the marinara light and the cheese gooey. Very delicious! 

We loved the warm garlic bread with fresh Parmesan in top. It was so delicious and warm with a very light crisp. 

The desserts were very good too - a berry crisp and a coconut cream pie! The coconut cream pie had toasted coconut all over the top. Super good! 

I like that it's a casual place with lots of returning customers. They close early - 9pm on Friday and Saturday.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Alan W.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
Wife and I ate hear the other night.
We had heard good things about Bella Ria's and decided to give it a shot.
At first glance the outside of the building is a bit dumpy and the inside looks like a retro diner.
*****just remember looks have nothing to do with the food and I am glad I did not get scarred off by the looks of the place***.
The waitress was super friendly and brought menus over immediately.
Waitress took drink orders and brought over some delicious bread.
I had the chicken parmesan which came with ziti.
I have to say the chicken parm was among the best I have ever had.
I would definitely highly recommend Bella Ria's for your Italian food needs.
You can be sure I will be going again and again.
Be sure to never judge a book by its cover as you will definitely miss out on some top notch eats.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Katie H.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: This place is a hidden gem in West View!! Whether breakfast, lunch or dinner the food and service have been amazing!  Home cooked meals at affordable prices!!   Great specials!  Keep up the great work!!

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Ellen B.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: We initially drove past this unassuming building, thinking it was just a beer distributor. But we turned around and realized there was a restaurant next door! We entered and were greeted by a friendly waitress and were seated. It looks like they do a swift takeout business in addition to a sit down restaurant. The place is casual and friendly, no need to dress up- just be yourself. The food was delicious! Home made Italian wedding soup, side salads with fresh field greens, tomatoes and cucumbers... not a piece of iceberg in sight! We each got specials for the evening- linguine and clam sauce with a savory white wine sauce and plenty of fresh clams on top. The filet with port wine reduction and mushrooms came perfectly cooked with homemade mashed potatoes and roasted carrots. Everything was clearly fresh and homemade- we really enjoyed our meal and appreciated the friendly service!

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Colin M.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
We've been trying to get here for some time now and finally made time on a Friday afternoon. Absolutely zero frills inside the restaurant, which is what I expected really.

One server which caused us to wait a little bit for him to bus the table, but he was running around and answering the phone so we couldn't blame him.

I went with the "Royale with Cheese" which isn't really like a Big Mac, but better. Fried onions and crispy bacon set it off.

My wife had a side salad and the wedding soup, both of which she enjoyed.

I like the fact they had about 5 daily specials, even though I didn't try them. Will definitely be back to try some of the dinner specials I've read about from other Yelpers.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Evan B.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
Place: It was our first time here in general; my wife and I went on a Thursday night for dinner. My first impression of the joint was mediocre (diner-like, radio blaring, unimpressive) but not surprising based on other reviews. The place was bumping. Only one waitress was working so she was busy serving all the tables and manning the register. She was friendly and helpful when available.

Food: I got the chipotle pork loin special with red skin mashed potatoes, vegetables, and a salad for $18. It was excellent. My wife got spaghetti (angel hair) and meatballs which was also very good. Everything tasted homemade and had great flavor. The waitress gave us two rounds of garlic bread which tasted awesome (better than most fancy italian restaurants)! Also, we got conolli to go and haven't tried it yet, but it looks delectable.

Overall: The service and size of the salad that came with our meal was mediocre. However, the cost, quality, quantity, and flavor of the food overall was great! I recommend this restaurant and look forward to trying other meals here.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Joan F.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
I've eaten at Bella ria's about a dozen times.  Hundred% of the time the staff Is very friendly and very helpful, and they never make me feel like I'm in a rush. I love that they have the Italian sodas, San Pellegrino. They have four flavors last time I was there.
Everything I've eaten there has been fantastic. I've had hamburgers, Italian food, steak, salads, the blue cheese dressing has big chunks of blue cheese, good bread, desserts are awesome. Everything there is very good. One odd thing was that a crabcake I ordered came with honey mustard dressing on top of it. I'm from the Chesapeake Bay area originally, and I have never in my life seen anyone put honey mustard dressing on a crabcake. If I had known they were going to do that, I would've told him to leave it off. I still ate it, it was just a little bit odd.
I love this place!!  Also, sometimes you have to wait for a table, but not very often. Parking is pretty easy right outside the restaurant. The restrooms are very clean. It's a family run restaurant, I like that too.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Bill J.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: Only open for dinner on Saturdays now but food is really good. Make reservations. Open for breakfast and lunch. Have new Expresso and cappuccino machine for coffee drinks. Great desserts all made in house. Good specials. Byob with nice wine glasses. Recommended.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Joe G.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: Small, but very clean. Not what you would expect from a local diner to be honest. It wasn't very busy, and was kind of awkwardly quiet inside. But the food was fantastic. The vegetable omelet couldn't have been fresher and not greasy at all. The only compliant would be they don't have any kind of fruit as a side. Oh well. We may or may not have brought our own.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Sume D.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
I met up with a couple friends for dinner while visiting Pittsburgh and we chose this place because of the great reviews. The place is not quite what you expect as it looks more like a diner, but the food is delicious and the service is with a smile. 
I was seated immediately after walking in and the place was almost full of people enjoying their meals. They have a variety of items to choose from, not just pastas, all reasonably priced. I ended up selecting one of their specials - house made baby back ribs with seasonal veggies and red skin mash potatoes - how could I say no to that?! It also came with a side salad with a housemade balsamic, and all for $16.50. The ribs were meaty and fall off the bone with an excellent rub. 
I didn't get a chance to try some of their desserts because I was stuffed so will have to stop by again.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Debbie D.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: This restaurant is a family owned business. Homemade meals. Great breakfasts and lunches. Right now hours have changed. Monday through Friday opens 7:30 am to 2:30 pm. Saturday open 7:am to 9:pm. Dinner is at 4:00 to 9:00. Reservation recommend this day. Closed Sunday. Homemade soups , salad dressings, and other good meals. Great desserts. Has take out.

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: Laura A.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description: Had their breakfast. Great place to go. Very personable, homey and just all around great food and atmosphere. Will definitely go again and looking forward to trying lunch options!

dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.author: CJ V.
dLAxjXghBijV6krvKt1RHQ.description:
Small and quaint. Great service. The chef even made me a special off the menu Cuban sandwich, which was surprisingly awesome. 
I'd definitely give this joint another shot.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Piro A.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: My first habachi, and I fear it might have ruined any future ones. The food was stellar, everyone in our group was beyond pleased, and we got a fantastic chef. Also found my new favorite cut of steak (Chateaubriand) thanks to this place. When managed to make shrimp edible, and I'm very much not a seafood person. My only complaint is it being so far away from home for me, as we were simply visiting the area

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Marcus B.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description:
This truly is a hidden gem in Pittsburgh.  I won't disagree with the service issues that are mentioned in the other reviews.  Service here is laid back (perhaps too much so), but in the end, everyone is super friendly and really very helpful.  Just come here ready to spend a little time having a nice dinner with your family/friends.

The food is really top notch.  For what you get with a dinner, the pricing is right on par with any other hibachi style place I've been to.  Everything is super fresh and the chefs know what they are doing with it.

Check this place out!  I know I'll be coming back around soon.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Bonnie J.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Excellent hibachi!  Don't let the outside sway you away.  Family owned and run, inexpensive and great food.  Everything was fresh, steak, filet mignon was excellent!  Tons of food, you will definitely take home!  Super nice family, it's a true hidden gem!

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Kaitlin R.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Great service and great food. Both the chefs and the staff are very welcoming! However, the wait was unbelievable. We had a reservation at 7 and didn't eat until 9p!

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Bruce M.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: AMAZING FOOD!!!! I like their fired rice is the bomb dot com . Who ever disown them then fuck them because I like it

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: LaKiesha D.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Came to Sapporo at 8p on a Friday night. Parking lot has abt 3 cars, bar is empty, 2 families eating and after standing directly in front of the hostess/bartender for almost 3 min without acknowledgement, we were told it would be a 40-50 min wait!! Turned around. Walked out. Went somewhere else!

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Rich S.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Awesome place. I took my 6 year old and family out for his birthday and had a great time. Food was fantastic and fresh. Chef was extremely personal and kind. Made for a special day on my sons birthday

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Jules L.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Sapporo is by far the best hibachi around!! This is a family-owned & ran restaurant & it shows in every way. They are extremely friendly & remember you. The soup is the perfect start -- not too salty. The salad has a great dressing. Then comes the feast! The fried rice is the best I've ever had, it's cooked to have the perfect crisp to it. I've never been able to finish my meal, and am extra thankful for leftovers the next day!

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Megan Z.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: What a disappointment. First and last time coming to Sapporo. We thought this would be a fun experience for celebrating our son's birthday dinner. After and hour and 15 minutes we had only beverages, soup and salad. Then they apologized saying it would be at least another half hour for a chef to begin our meal. We said that was unacceptable and could not wait any longer. Giving 2 stars for the free edamame appetizer and the fact they did not charge us for the beverages/soup/salad. Too bad this wasn't what we expected.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Lauren R.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description:
My boyfriend and I are practically Hibachi connoisseurs so when we visited Pittsburgh for the weekend the first thing we Yelp searched was.. you guessed it, Hibachi! Sapporo was highly rated so we went for dinner on a Saturday night.

The restaurant is located in front of a dimly lit motel but don't be discouraged by the facade because once you step inside the door the atmosphere is warm and inviting. 

We were greeted by the owner's daughter who sat us at an empty table while we waited for the other guests to join us. The owner's son brought us menus to look over and informed us that Sapporo is a family-run establishment. The table quickly filled with regulars who said that Sapporo was their favorite Hibachi restaurant in Pittsburgh, one couple even said that they come for dinner every single Saturday evening. The owner himself came over to our table and began cooking our meal!

I ordered the Hibachi chicken and broccoli in Sapporo special sauce and my boyfriend ordered the Hibachi shrimp and chicken, both with fried rice. Both meals were good but the special sauce on my chicken was absolutely delicious! Definitely one of the best Hibachi chicken variation that I have tasted and my boyfriend really enjoyed how flavorful his shrimp tasted. The chef, a Korean war veteran, was engaging in our conversation and made you feel as if you were over a friend's house for dinner.

We both agreed that we will definitely return to Sapporo the next time that we are in Pittsburgh.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Amin A.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description:
Been to many hibachis, this one is very clean, the building is a little older but the family that runs it does a wonderful job. 

I came here and got the chicken. Spot on, I loved the beef stew it came with- I always think the salad at hibachis are real alright- but the sushi was delicious and the hibachi was wonderful with delicious noodles , veggies, and rice- best I have had in a while because it ain't too salty- many times for me it's too extreme on the salt.

Free edamame with check in so that was a plus. 

Reasonably priced delicious Japanese goodness- seemed like it also had good drinks.

Will return.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Jessica K.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: My favorite Japanese Steakhouse in the Greater Pittsburgh area. Staff is great, and food is fresh - always! Larger portions than most steakhouses will give!

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Steven G.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description:
Weird to find a Hibachi style Japanese steakhouse out in the distant hills of western Pittsburgh, but here it is. It was rather empty on a Saturday night, and it's admittedly weird to have a white guy doing your hibachi cooking but he was real friendly and chatty and did a fine job preparing everything. The kitchen and servers did forget my steamed rice and had to be bugged for it, however.

The food was fresh and rich with flavor, and despite the highish hibachi prices the multi-course meal felt reasonably satisfying. They did leave me hanging an inordinately long time on paying the check, though, like they forgot I had yet to pay. The service overall was unduly lax, even though the cooking was great and they were reasonably cordial.

I gather the options in Pittsburgh are thin for hibachi, so if you're really craving it it's worth a trip, though in general it's not a destination.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Ryan B.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Yes it's expensive but it's the best Japanese steakhouse in Pittsburgh a real hidden gem fresh seafood and delicious sauces. You get what you pay for here perfection.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Amanda E.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Fantastic as Always. Portions are generous, and service is prompt. Always treated like family here. Try the scallops, they are DELICIOUS.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Carter P.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Really great hibachi! I have had hibachi all over, and this place really stands out!  Very friendly, great show and awesome food.  Shrimp was very fresh and steak was perfect!  Goes so well with an ice cold Kirin beer!  I try to come here every time I am in Pittsburgh!

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Kimberly F.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: Where do I even start. The rice was so under cooked it was hard enough to stick in my teeth. Mentioned twice we wanted our steak very rare, got it medium well to medium at best. Timing was awful, rice came out first and veg last. Chef drowned everything in butter, so much it was sickening. Waitress sucked and was MIA mostly. Everything was terrible. My stomach feels heavy with butter. We did not stay for our Desserts. Awful. Awful. Awful. I cannot even put it into words what a sorry meal this was. Don't waste your money. You'd be better off ordering pizza.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Ben D.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: This is my favorite Hibachi spot in all of Pittsburgh. It's right on 60 near Crafton/Ingram and Thornburg. It is family run and they are great. The décor is a little dated but I go here for the food, people, and prices. They are a little cheaper than nakama, saga, and ichiban. The service is outstanding. I like the fact the give you rice and noodles. They make you feel at home and I like that better than all of the chains.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Jason T.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description:
Sapporo is my favorite Japanese restaurant, period. I've found other places that come close, but for me, this is the place I like to spend my money when it comes to hibachi cuisine. 

Sapporo is an unassuming place right next to Steubenville Pike's hottest tourist attraction, the Pittsburgh Motel. But don't let the location fool you. Step inside and enjoy a cozy atmosphere. There's a bar at the front, some tables to the right, and the main dining area to the left. There's also that karaoke machine I've never seen used in all the years I've gone here.

Unlike other Japanese restaurants like Saga (great stuff) and Ichiban, the cooks at Sapporo aren't all about giving an extensive show while cooking. Each of the chefs have a few of the basic crowd pleasers, such as the knife and spatula toss and the onion volcano, etc., but really it's all about the food, which is fine by me. I do sometimes miss when the chefs toss the pieces of shrimp up in the air towards your mouth to catch, but only because no one ever likes to participate in that but me and it's fun to look like a goofball while trying, but that's neither here nor there.

The food here is excellent. They've introduced a new look to their menu recently. I don't know if they scaled it down, as I often always order from the same section. I did notice they have a couple of sushi options available. They used to have a full sushi bar, and you can still see that when you walk in, but I'm not sure if they're using it for anything other than just what's on the main menu, which would be a shame if so, as their sushi was always great and you could order it from a separate menu. Again, this may be something they still have that I'm not aware of.

At any rate, the starter soup and salad is great. I love the bits of onion in the soup. It's a very strong broth, but not overpowering. The ginger dressing on the salad is something you either like or loathe at any Japanese restaurant, and here I really love it, but I tend to like it everywhere I've had it, so I'm not a real stickler when it comes to that.

Usually I order the filet mignon and shrimp with fried rice for my main meal, though last time I got the deluxe version of the dish which also includes lobster tail and ice cream for dessert. Either way, it's a great dish. I've also had the chicken and shrimp and have enjoyed it as well.

Now, my favorite thing here is the shrimp sauce. I call it the "magic sauce." It's of the light pink variety and thin consistency. I'm always disappointed when I go to other Japanese steakhouses and they either don't have shrimp sauce altogether or they have the thicker, mayonnaise-based version, which is OK, but doesn't come close to the awesomeness that is the magic sauce. Apparently it's a secret as to just what goes into it. On one visit our chef joked that its main base was strawberry Quik, which one of the fellow diners at my table believed.

So if you get the fried rice here, dump some of the magic sauce on there. It's amazing. Use it for your steak or chicken as well. I find myself doing that and then saving the darker sauce for my grilled veggies, which are also top notch here. Terrific grilled onions and ripe zucchini as well as mushrooms and broccoli. I don't care for broccoli personally, but the rest is excellent.

Sapporo has also started throwing in noodles to the mix. According to the owner this is because other restaurants started doing it, so patrons who came in started asking why Sapporo didn't have them as well. I think they were doing fine without them, as it just adds even more to an already large amount of food, but they are good, if unnecessary.

The steak here is great. I've had the sirloin as well as the filet. I always get mine cooked rare, and it is of the melt in your mouth caliber. The shrimp never taste fishy, and the lobster tail is similarly excellent. All around, you get a great meal here for the price.

I'm not sure which nights are more crowded than not anymore. Sapporo's a funny place in that some weeknights you'll drive by and it's packed and then other nights it will be quiet. I'd suppose weekends draw the biggest crowds. Yet even when it was "packed" I've never had to wait long to be seated at a table.

So if you haven't been, give Sapporo a try. It's been there forever. The owner and staff are super nice and they really do care about serving you great food when you visit. They don't do lunches anymore, so it's strictly dinner meals, so be looking at spending at least 20-30 dollars on up for adults, and around 10 or so for kids' meals. It's not some place you would go frequently if you're on a budget, but that makes it all the more a treat when you do go.

QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.author: Christy B.
QQMHSov0KBlBSfb7PXOcXg.description: I'll be honest, the food is great. We went for dinner one night this summer and they were actually cooking for the Chicago Cubs. HOWEVER, I made a reservation for last night and upon arrival was told there would be an hour wait. I said we made a reservation! Didn't matter. At least then tell people you don't take reservations. Very poor customer service! I was very disappointed with the experience!

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Jim L.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: Ordered last night great service and fast delivery. The food was amazing ordered buffalo chicken pizza and would definite recommend it and the ranch is the best I've ever had also got the pepperoni pizza and it was cooked to perfection and tasted delicious

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Matthew L.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description:
Ordered four pizzas while axe throwing. Delivery was quick and order was correct. The dough has no flavor. Dough was under salted drastically. Won't be ordering from here again. 

Received a message from someone purporting to be the owner. Paul F. Who I just saw post a review on here exclaiming how amazing their experience was ordering pizza from this business.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Tom B.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: We got pizza delivered at work I tried a piece of each and they were really good. Each piece had just enough cheese and toppings on it I liked that it wasn't to crusty and actually the crust was really good I'll order from here again.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Nicole S.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description:
Let me be quite clear. I have never in my 12 years of eating Frank's had anything but the buffalo chicken pizza. It's that good. I know there is more than one location, and yes I have had them all, but Millvale is by far the best one to order from. All the employees tend to me generally nice and always approach me as soon as I walk in the door for a pickup. 

The chicken is broasted (which I understand to be a type of pressure frying) so it's different than usual frying. I will say sometimes they don't put enough cheese on, but if I go twice a month, they'll get it perfect 85% of the time. And when it's perfect, it's heaven. Oh and the ranch? Beyond words.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Ciara M.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: My second favorite Frank's Pizza and Chicken. Very delicious, but staff is ignorant and rude. That turns people away.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: M J S.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: My husband and I love pizza, especially buffalo chicken pizza! If you go to any Franks you're guaranteed to get good buffalo chicken pizza, however we believe this is the best Franks (Millville, PA). They also provide a great special for this pizza (2 for $20). The workers are very polite and you're sure to have a quick fresh pizza. The big man makes the best pie in town!

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Ali T.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: This pizza is hands down the best pizza in Pittsburgh! Been going here for as long as I can remember. My favorite pizzas are buffalo chicken pizza (this is a MUST get if it's your first time here). Also I would highly suggest getting the white pizza and adding banana peppers and crumbled sausage. Sooo good!! When delivered, it always comes when they said it should arrive and it's still nice and hot! Can't finish the whole pie? That's ok! Still tastes amazing the next day!

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Lydia R.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: Mutahar sent me here. Was not disappointed. I'm not even that big of a fan of pizza, but it was delicious. And they have so many other things. I'll try the chicken next time

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Frank L.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: I've eaten at least 1 medium Buffalo Chicken Pizza a week for nearly 10 years now. They say you are what you eat, so at this point at least some percentage of myself is Frank. I named my cat Frank. God forbid I ever have a child, but if I do my first born will be named Frank (boy or girl). Ranch dressing on the side is the BOMB.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Chantel W.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: Franks Pizza has the BEST buffalo chicken pizza in the city, hands down. I'm from Pittsburgb and it just does not compare to the other options in the city. Try it! You will not be disappointed. The service is the worst at the North Hills location and best at the Troy Hill location but everyone is generally on time. The salads are also surprisingly good too.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Marylou M.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: This pizza is very good!! The plain cheese has a lot of cheese and the sauce and crust are also tasty.  The buffalo chicken pizza is very good too!!  The garden salad does the job to get your veggies in!  My most favorite pizza is Mineos and this is the closest I can find to it in the north!! It good!

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Marc K.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: I haven't tried most of their pizzas since the Buffalo Chicken Pizza is so good. It's expensive but the best I've ever had. Their boneless wings and hoagies are also amazing. But basically everyone's reason for coming here is the Buffalo Chicken

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Elizabeth R.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: Definitely my favorite pizza place. The pizza is always hot and the driver is always prompt and friendly. Their pepperoni is AMAZING! I love the prices of the two liters of soda they offer. They also have Gatorade! Talk about convenience!!!

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Josh N.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description:
My boss ordered some pepperoni and buffalo chicken pizzas from Frank's today at my new job. I didn't try the Sicilian-style pepperoni-topped pie, but I did indulge in the round buffalo chicken pizza. I wouldn't say I was "wowed" by this pizza, but I was pleased. It was sturdy and held together well, with enough cheese and chicken to keep me content. The pizza had just enough of a punch to take it to a 3/10 on the average person's Scoville scale for the chicken and a 2/10 for the pizza overall. I'm not sure how I feel about the sauce. If I didn't know any better (and I truthfully don't), I'd say their Ranch dressing is actually French Onion Dip; a nice contrast to the buffalo chicken pizza nevertheless. Those first few bites of that white sauce were odd, but then I looked down in search of an additional serving.

Being the stereotypical new inquisitive employee (naturally, as today was my first day), I asked how often we'd be ordering from Frank's and my boss said "once a week, guaranteed." Good, I'm going to get a lot more chances to taste their food!

Review #187.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Matt T.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description:
I am a huge pizza connoisseur,and  Frank's is definitely up there as some of the best pizza in Pittsburgh. If you're in the mood for a cheese or pepperoni pizza, I wouldn't recommend Frank's. It's fine pizza, but it's nothing like a slice from Benny Fiero's or Mineo's.

 BUT, if you like Buffalo Chicken Pizza, this is the PLACE TO BE. It's absolutely the best Buffalo Chicken Pizza in town. The homemade ranch sauce that they give you is out of this world good too. The pizza isn't very saucy and runny like some other BC pizza that I've had around the area. A must try for BC lovers.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Adrienne P.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: Been ordering for years, however today they took an hour and 35 minutes to get here. Never called to say they were running late and guy finally showed up while my husband was on the phone on the manager. Never again. It would probably be cold so we aren't ordering from them again. We are only 5 minutes away so doesn't make any sense. 35 mins on a Wednesday is ridiculous. Not a game day, nothing. Get it together Franks. Lost a 10 year customer today. Stupid.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Darren W.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description:
Note: This franchise is take-out and delivery only. 

Prior to the Kvelertak concert last week, I found myself with a good bit of spare time, and feeling adventurous, I walked and walked in search of this particular Frank's (we've been to the one in Shaler before, and there are 2 others), finally coming across its Steeler-colored building in a residential part of the cozy borough of Millvale.  

For $5, I had myself a small version (4 cuts) of their famed Buffalo Chicken Pizza and was not unimpressed by it. A blend of cheeses topped it, one of them being cheddar. I'm guessing the others were mozzarella and provolone. The chunks of chicken were tender enough, but it was that crust, which when coated with the cheese, almost tasted like Pepperidge Farm's Goldfish crackers but with a dimension of chew. A cream-dream of a housemade ranch dressing came on the side, and I slathered it on each cut while I sat on a public bench that overlooked a babbling stream. 

Children ran past me, old folks chatted me up, all of them good-natured, each of them wondering just who this bald fellow was and why he was in town. 

And of course, when I mentioned the band's name, eyes squinted, head's shook and the phrase " Who? Never 'eard of 'em" came from their mouths.

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Jeralyn B.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: Love their pizza!  Their famous Buffalo Chicken Pizza is incredible! I am a huge pizza nut & would definitely recommend them!

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Irene P.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: Always love everything. Breadsticks are the best around. I've heard great things about the buffalo chicken pizza but I'm a vegetarian so haven't tried it personally. Tip- get it delivered if you don't like to parallel park. No inside seating but they have some tables outside

nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.author: Gary P.
nqcpabHusqPmCoel5U6SPg.description: Best buffalo chicken pizza and bread bites I've ever had. Love how they put tons of butter garlic and Parmesan on the bites. I'm addicted to them!!!

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Harel S.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description:
My first time here. 
Place looks very clean and some of the employees were preparing food some were making sure the place is clean. Outdoor sitting is nice. 
I ordered chicken Ceasers salad, ingredients were super fresh and the food is really good.
Only 4 stars because the place wasn't busy but it took 24 mins to get the food. To me that's way too long. Overall food is great just slow service

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: DJ J.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: Nice little place.  You order on screen at the cash register and way you wait.  Many people waiting take out and you could not get to the pick up area due to a table being to close, forcing people to cluster in the area.  My Caesar said was OK.  Was more arugula then romaine and did not have any House-Me Croutons as the menu states.  The Caesar Dressing does not have the sharp Caesar flavor or taste of garlic that I was expecting and was just acceptable.  The menu has other options of Flatbread, Sandwiches and rice bowls.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Clarissa I.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: I really enjoyed eating here! I stopped by for a quick bite and ordered the margherita pizza and tomato basil soup. The tablet ordering system was confusing to use so it took a while to place my order. Food was received quickly and hot which I loved. Each bite was delicious. Definitely recommend trying this place out.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: LaMar W.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: Terrene is awesome for lunch!  Their Glorious Steak salad is 100% Authentic Pittsburgh food fare and nobody even talks about it.  Steak and (really good) fries on a salad with uber-strong dressing and BACON! on fresh greens and all the associated salady fixins??  Yes, please and shut the front door!  That's my kind of salad!!  Don't get me wrong, it's expensive, but totally worth it.  Oh, and they take all the non-cash ways of paying (another Pittsburgh thing).  Om nom nom!

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Jabrae W.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: I ordered the Alaskan cod sandwich. It was tasty, fresh and delicious. My only gripe is that it's not located within downtown. I was cutting it close on my lunch break.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Rita P.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: Highly recommend for breakfast! Affordable, fresh, delicious, big portions, extremely friendly staff, plenty of space. I recommend got busy people in need of a quick healthy meal or families on the weekend. If I lived in Pittsburgh I'd certainly be back. Enjoy! You won't be disappointed.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Mike S.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: This place used to be a food truck and should have probably stayed a food truck. The food here is way over priced and honestly it's not that good. For the most part the staff is nice. I do recall one time the owner losing his mind on someone who wanted additional dressing on a salad they ordered, he felt comfortable enough to complain to me about it and I was actually on the customers side, he was very rude. Since their move to a store front I have eaten there twice and both times it was not good. I'm done spending money here and you should save your dollars and head over to the Gandy Dancer where you can get a great meal, just sit at the oyster bar or you'll be there forever also! But this place not good really.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Jacqueline V.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: Delicious! Had soup, special of the day which was a turkey sandwich and fries, and margarita flat bread! Everything was so fresh. Def will be back.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Brenda W.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description:
A reincarnation of Chop Salad Shop that was in the food court of The Freight House across the street which has closed.
A super reincarnation at that. You order at the counter, picking up a drink from the refrigerated case first if you like. You can order from a counter person or do the self serve option at a terminal. And, bonus, once you swipe your debit/credit card you used here before, you can opt to reorder the same thing with a click. Sweet option to save time at lunch.
They offer salads, bowls with rice, flatbreads, and soups, plenty of fresh and healthy options including vegetarian.
I like the Chicken Tikka rice bowl in particular with sweet potato, eggplant. You may skip any ingredient if you like.
There are both indoor and outdoor seating available or you can take it to go.
Friendly staff, efficient service, fresh, healthy ingredients all make this a winner, especially in an area lacking fast grab and go options.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Geoffrey A.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: Quick and delicious bite to eat before getting on the Clippers.  We had the Souvlaki Signature Bowl, Mediterranean Grilled Chicken Salad, Kids Chicken Fingers, House Roasted Turkey Pesto Sandwich, and a few flat breads, everything was fresh and fantastic.  Good fresh lemon water, which my daughter doesn't drink and one of the fine customer service folks gave my daughter a bottle of water with no lemon.  They are great.  They also have a bathroom available only to paying customers which we were, so we won!!

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Shawn K.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: I ordered a couple things from Terrene they Grubhub, and it was the first experience I had with this establishment.  I saw it was new on GH, so looked over the menu, and picked out the meat lovers flatbread and the southwest steak bowl.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The bowl was insane...ample portion, perfectly grilled steak, and just tasted really good!  The flatbread looked great, even as take out.  Again, excellent portion and the meats were perfect...and as a guy who likes greasy pizza, this flatbread was perfect.  I dont know how long this place has been in Station Square, but next time I'm there, I'm going to actually go in to eat there.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Karen K.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: The food is meh (pre-cooked fried chicken and the Mac n cheese was soupy. Wtf?). And the ordering system is overly complicated- you have to use a computer screen to input your own order but then the Mac n cheese wasn't on there so the guy had to spend about 10 min finding it in his computer. Why??

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Stephanie K.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: I wish I could give this place 10 stars! Everything is so fresh and delicious! Staff is always kind and welcoming and so professional! I've had many of the items on the menu and I've never had a bad dish. It's been fun seeing the transition from food truck to food court location and now their brick and mortar store! Next on my list is to try one of their wine and food pairing events! I'm sure it won't disappoint!

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Steve Y.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: I love Terrene! Great selection of proteins and the freshest vegetables. And portion sizes are excellent. The staff there is always very friendly especially Kim!

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Laura M.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: Completely underwhelmed by my experience at Terrene today. I visited this location as they indicate they have Gluten Free options on Yelp. Upon visiting I was told many inaccurate things about the food by several people  - one individual indicated the flat bread was gluten free, another said it wasn't. Then I was told there are no gluten free options except the Falafel - which is not gluten free.  Do not advertise yourself as Gluten Free if there is no knowledge of what does or doesn't contain gluten.  This place had huge potential and was a complete let down.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Kai R.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description:
Finally decent food at Station Square!  The other options are pretty bad - unhealthy, slow service.

Here you can get a healthy and tasty lunch or dinner.  Prices are $12-13.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Meghan O.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: The food is overpriced, mediocre commercial food. It's the quality you would get from a cafeteria. The star of the show were the french fries. Our bowls came out room temperature despite there being no wait. There was a party going on in the middle of the space with kids running around and a dog??? Probably the worst food experience I've had in Pittsburgh.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Laura P.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: This place could be potentially good. The wait between waiting to order and getting the food was 30 minutes. Way too long for someone on a lunch break. I got the southwest bowl and my husband got the Mediterranean salad. While my bowl had good flavors for $12  it was very little chicken. There were 5 small pieces!! Same with all the other toppings. The only thing in plenty was the rice so it was almost a rice bowl with the toppings as garnishes.

xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.author: Brandon A.
xICll6c7ztmXoJwy1n6NwQ.description: Fresh food great place to eat good conversation very convenient pricing daily soups available

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Gwendolyn A N.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: The ice cream was okay, but just know you are paying for the views of the skyline not just the ice cream. It is very pricey for ice cream, no samples are provided, and service is short and to the point. Probably wasn't worth the money.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Dustin S.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description:
The service is bad from the start! The first 3 flavors of ice cream my family orders they were all out. They were on the board and when you have young ones that take forever to read all the flavors it's a bit of a let down. After I was told they were all out of the 3rd flavor I was told "why don't you try try ordering something we have" by the very rude guy taking orders. I pointed out that all 3 flavors that the girls wanted were on the board and then he stuck his head out and saw then and took them down and said "and now they are not"!

I don't know if he was trying to be funny but it came off as very rude. I would have walked away then but I promised my visiting family ice cream and unlike this store I am a man of my word. I was very frustrated but I wanted to put this all behind me. But wait there is more! I was given the wrong change back when I paid! They are cash only and I only had 20 bucks so my father gave me another 20 so I could pay for it all. I was given the change back for 30 dollars and not 40. I refused to leave the window because the man said I gave him 30 when 3 people knew I gave him 40 dollars. I was given the rest of my change and told "take it".

If you want to get treated badly, for a below average product, over priced, and get ripped off then by all means take a chance here and you might not get the trifecta like I did, but if you value your self respect and your money go somewhere els it's just not with it.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Maranda W.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description:
This place is not worth it.  The ice cream isn't amazing enough to make me want to come back here- it just happens to be the only ice cream spot in the area and they jack up the prices because they know it.  

The menu is pretty difficult to understand and somehow my waffle cone with two scoops came out to $9.  I've never paid that much for two scoops in a waffle cone.  The person ringing us up was also pretty rude for us so I don't feel the need to ever go here again.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Jim H.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description:
Ordered an ice cream cone and a soft serve.  The man at the window who served me gave me change from a $20 for what was supposed to be a $7.50 tab.  I put the money in my pocket, and moved out of line.  I went to put my change away a few minutes later and found he shorted me $3.  Went back to the window, explained the situation, and the same guy told me "I doubt it", and then "hey, I've been up since 6 am".  

Pretty awful attitude.  Pretty poor customer service.  And quite frankly, pretty ordinary ice cream and soft serve.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Kaysie F.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: Perfect spot on a nice day. Grab some ice cream and sit out back or take a walk down Grandview and overlook the city (half a block walk). Super friendly staff. I wanted to sample the blackberry frozen yogurt, but unfortunately it comes out too fast of the machine for a sample spoon. But I ordered 2 scoops of the traditional scoops and the gentleman gave me a little swirl of the frozen yogurt on top to give it a try (it was tasty, I would definitely order it on my next trip). Nice selection between food and ice cream for a small shop. I tried the pretzel nuggets and cheese- right on point, little crisp on the outside, super soft inside. Would recommend that as well!

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Charley B.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description:
This is a nice little snack shop on top of Mt. Washington.

It isn't fancy, but does well with the basics. You can choose from a list of hard and soft serve ice cream, cones and toppings. There's a small sandwich and snack menu as well. I went with a couple of scoops of cookies and cream on a waffle cone which hit the spot. The prices were probably a little higher then they should have been, but this is a tourist area and it didn't really hurt the mood.

There's a small amount of seating out front and a patio in back, but I didn't use it. I ended up walking down towards the edge of the ridge and found a shaded bench that offered up a good view of downtown Pittsburgh.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Shea D.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: I got ice cream after a stuffy ride up the incline, so something cold was exactly what I needed, but I was disappointed by everything. I ordered a small vanilla/cherry twist in a cone, paying nearly $5 for the sloppiest soft serve I've ever received, it was a TINY small and practically falling out of the cone. The cherry tasted a bit too much like cough syrup for my liking. Service at the window was SILENT, I didn't even get a "hello" or a "what would you like," just a cold stare... I wouldn't recommend except for the fact that it was cold.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Andrea R.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: Avoid at all costs! This is 100% a tourist trap. Ice cream prices make absolutely no sense, and the owner is incredibly rude. Unbelievably, actually. The quality of the ice cream was poor on top of it all. This place is not worth it at all. Spare yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Danee L.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: The Oreo churro delight might be the best sundae I've ever ate.  The chocolate churro was to die for. Yum. Yum. Yum.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Maya K.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: Delicious ice cream, but rude service! The website said they closed at 11pm so we got there around 9:50pm expecting it to be open for another hour. When we got there we saw it was cash only and asked the woman at the cashier where the closest ATM is, she gave us a very rude response and blew us off. The other man there told us where the nearest ATM is which is where we went to withdraw cash. The ice cream was very good--slightly overpriced in my opinion though.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Frances W.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: Wow DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BUSINESSSSSSS!!!!!!  We cant do anything about all the tourist but hopefully our local Pittsburgh people do not support this guy!!!! We stopped tonight. first of all pulling up to the window the owner was so RUDE! NEVER GREAT HIS CUSTOMERS WHO IS HIVING HIM BUSINESS!!!! STONE FACE!  Then looked like we were bothering him!!! Three adults 4 small children ice cream cone 38.00$$$$$$$$ are you KIDDING ME!!!!! CHARGED EXTRA FOR JIMMIES WOW 8.00$$$$$ FOR KIDS ICECREAM CONE!!! NEVER AGAIN!!!  And the icecream wasn't good. The guy behind us another customer asked to taste a flavor he said NO. OMG A LITTLE ON THE SPOON TO TRY FOR HOW MUCH YOU CHARGE YOU HAVE TO BE KIDDING ME . This place is sad and robbing people will never go back and will definitely spread the word! Hes making a killing for how many years hes been there so sad

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Arlene M.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description:
I was actually on my way home to grab some ice cream out of the freezer when I saw this place. The sign on the door said to go around to the side to order. Cash only. That's never a problem with me but they do have an ATM close by if you need it.

Since it was hot there was a line but it move fairly quickly. Most of the ice cream they serve is soft serve but they carry Dean's ice cream if you prefer the traditional. I knew there would be no way I could sample anything since people were behind me but I was blown away by the price. $3.50 for one scoop? Two would have run me over $6.00! 

Mind you, I am willing to spend if I find what I am buying worthwhile but this wasn't the case here. I ordered one scoop of mint chocolate chip in a cup. It tasted just like ice cream you would get out of a grocery store. They have covered seating in the back to help protect you from the sun.

They sell food here and your usual ice cream flair but it seems to be the only one here in Mt. Washington. Since I was in the area on other business I had already paid my metered parking but I definitely would not go out of the way for this place when there are so many others that serve better quality. Too expensive for meh ice cream.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Olivia S.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: Ice cream was very mediocre and the man working was VERY rude. He didn't tell us the price of the ice cream, he grabbed the money out of our hands and threw it back, waved the ice cream in my face, and also made the order wrong. I will never come back a place with such poor service. If you come here, watch out for the balding man who might be wearing a grey baseball hat.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Cait C.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description:
The middle-to-older age man who works the counter is a total dick.

I brought my little brother up here while I visiting family during the first week of June. We walked up to the window and gave this guy a friendly greeting, "Hi, how are you?" and he just looked at us. Uh...ok. whatever. So my brother ordered a vanilla cone with sprinkles. This guy never asked what kind of cone, just disappeared and came back with a cake cone. My  brother had wanted a waffle cone. Ok, no biggie. Instead of making a big deal, I just said I'll eat the cake cone, and he got him his waffle cone. $10.50. wtf?? I live in LA, and even I think that is ridiculous. But whatever. 
So we go to leave, and my brother (ever the polite teenager) said, "Have a nice day!" And again, this miserable fuck just looks at us. 

Get some social and customer service skills, prick. PS, your ice cream sucks.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Marissa L.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: 0/5. The $4.00 overpriced scoop of ice cream in a styrofoam cup was plain vanilla mixed with syrup for the added flavor of 'strawberry' and 'cherry'. Customers aren't allowed to see the flavors before purchasing. Any and all questions are fielded with caustic dismissal and condescension from the rudest employee I've yet to encounter. I left feeling bitter and worse off for having come.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Gary L.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: The man that runs this place or owns it is horrible  never a thank you or how can I help you.  The quality of the ice cream is sub par and the service is just plain terrible. I'll never go back.  I've never encountered such a miserable person. Maybe he needs a vacation. It's a shame that this place is one of the first places tourists go to. You're an embarrassment to our community

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Andrea H.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: Pricey icecream but  tasted  good. When my friend said  thank you to the man that handed him his ice cream, the man said "I hope your thankful!"

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Kyler W.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description:
0/5 Stars.

Other people have been letting others know to stay away from this place for a good reason. The service is garbage... I am normally not so blunt but could not help myself. 

I unfortunately have been to this location on more than one occasion due to out of town guests all wanting an ice cream cone and not listening to my warnings. Every time we leave, we talk about how rude the counter staff is. The last time one I was there, one of the people in our party (not me I will not give this establishment $.01 of my money) asked for vanilla ice cream cone. They received a dish. When they let the server know that they had asked for a cone the server refused to fix the order due to them being "too busy". The solution was an empty cone shoved at the person in our party through the window. They were told to place the cone on-top of the ice cream in the dish. 

Seriously... Lets be real. We are ordering ice cream hear not dealing with a life or death situation if they had taken the time to correct the error maybe, I would have seen that each time I had been there previously was maybe a bad day. Instead, they went on to prove that the staff/ ownership doesn't care what the experience is like as long as they are raking in your $$$. 

Stay away folks. There are more reviews below that will tell similar stories. 

To the owners, 

If you read this post. Please do something about your service.

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Will R.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: Totally awesome place!! The brownie delight changed my life!!! We added peanut butter topping which took it to the next level!!

BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.author: Śrīvāsa G.
BfIcrMq0Me0D7BBSYij7Fg.description: I wish I could put 0 stars for the service. I am not sure if the man at the window had a bad day since he didn't even look at us and lightly dismissed us with no reason. We won't come back again.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Quin C.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: I'm a Duquesne student. This is my favorite CHINESE restaurant!! Food is always fresh and tasty. Love their hot pepper chicken!

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Aaron R.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: This is a decent place the food was the ok and the cookies are great. The only problem is that 30 minutes after I started to have the worst stomach ache of my life. I'm not sure if it was something I ate previously but I'm pretty sure it was because of the weird looking beef fried rice I had. If you like Chinese food go for it but I don't think I'm going to come back.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Lexy M.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description:
Really nice staff and really fast delivery. Disgusting over cooked chewy stringy general chicken with chunks of cartilage. I ordered extra sauce and didn't get it. I ordered and paid for hot oil and didn't get it. The crab Rangoon were over cooked and really paste like bland because I had no hot oil or general sauce to dip in so I just threw them away.
My coworker loved her fried rice and shrimp so they get 3 stars even though the garbage can ate my dinner.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Francisco B.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: Don't do it, unless you are desperate. I had the vegetable chow mein. It was about 90% partly fried onion, and the rest had some molecules of corn, mushrooms, and sprouted beans, in a tasteless liquid. It is ridiculously cheap, and ridiculously bad. Bathroom was clean. I strongly suggest you keep walking!

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Renee L.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description:
Great option for a pre-concert meal.  I don't think there is much competition in the way of Chinese cuisine in the neighborhood,  so it seems to do a steady business.
The menu offers plenty of options. I noticed they also offer delivery and catering services.
Service was extremely fast.  Barely any wait at all for our food.
I tend to grade places on their spring rolls, and the salt content of their sauces, so this explains the 3 stars.  They also used way too much raw American celery in my dish.
Overall, it was a good stop before  a concert since most of the other places in the area are overcrowded and overpriced.
BYOB is always a plus!

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Pat D.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: A little pricier than some other options around the area for no real reason. The rice is bland, and the Pad Thai was pretty bad. Won't be back.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Jenee S.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: Decent Chinese restaurant. Been here a few times now. Prices are very responsible considering being right by the area, along with portion sizes.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Troy B.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description:
We had some egg rolls, Chicken Chow Mein and General Tso's dinners.  The chicken chow mein came in a small and large size option which was nice.  We were ordering late after a Pirates game.
The food was average, but good.  However, i gave them a 4th star because we didnt get to order until 1045 pm.  They close at 11... but they delivered to our hotel anyway.  We got it around 1120 pm and it was VERY hot still.  
We would get it again.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Matthew U.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description:
I just recently discovered this place thanks to coworkers.  We all were hungry and for some odd reason they were determined to get Chinese.  They recently ordered from here and spoke highly of it, so I thought what the heck, let's give it a try.

I do have to say that the bright spot of it all is the amount of time it took for us to receive our food.  It was not as long of a wait as you would have expected.  When the food arrived it smelled great.  Each combo seems to be served with pork fried rice and an egg roll.  I went with old faithful General Tso's.

The chicken itself was nicely cooked, but the sauce was heavy on the peppers used to spice it.  I'm fine with spicy food, but leaving such big chunks of those peppers in the sauce was a bit of a turn off.  As far as the rice it was not the best fried rice I have ever had.  I'm not a fan of pork to begin with and this was riddled with bits of it made me think twice about devouring it.

Just because I had a poor showing with this the first time around, doesn't mean that I will the next.  I'll just make different choices.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Jake L.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: We were here for the RHCP concert and this little place popped up. Not your average Chinese. We were impressed with the way the food was decorated on our plates and how convenient it was to the arena. They served the food quick and it was piping hot. Thanks a lot!

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Sunil V.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: Family went here before a concert at PPG Arena. The staff here are great and modified food based on our tastes. We had 6 of us and all were so happy with the taste and quantity of the yummy food. The check was less than $40 and the taste very authentic. We love Chinese food and this place is too on our list. They made my wife's dish gluten free which was nice of them.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Dong T.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: Been going here since 2007 ever since being a duquesne student. Love it. They delivered to anywhere on campus. Besides being convenient, quick, and accomodating, their food is special in a weird way. Homey, not too greasy. Imo I liked them more before their remodel. They had more seating and didn't try to food newcomers with their appearance. Regardless, their lunch specials were a great value. My professer and I always talked them up on campus.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: David H.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description:
A lot classier on the inside than the outside would lead you to believe.  Food was pretty good as far as American-Chinese food goes.


My top recommendation here would be the szechuan beef noodle soup.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Jesse T.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: This is NOT your average crappy Chinese takeout. Sure, they have all your typical crappy Chinese dishes, but this place is so much more. The Gyoza Dumplings are some of the best that I've had, the sushi isn't amazing, but it's definitely above average, and SUPER cheap. I would highly recommend dining in, just so you can see first hand how these restauranteurs actually care about the product that they are giving their clientele. However, I have had delivery and takeout, and they are the holy trinity of deliciousness. Anytime you're around PPG arena give these guys a try, I highly doubt you will be disappointed.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Jacob S.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: I wish I could give it a zero. General tsos was all breading. The chicken that was used was terrible quality.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Chad B.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: I'm going to purely rate this experience on the sushi order I placed. I'll be happy to return and update my review as I try other items.  I was brought here by co-workers who frequent often. Each of them placed their order from the menu while I opted for the Sushi Lunch Special consisting of 5 pieces of sushi and a California roll. That along with a drink was $12 and some change. Please keep in mind this was around 12:30p so the lunch hour. While each of my co-workers received their food and appetizer, I continued to wait for my lunch special. I had assumed since it was a lunch special that it was readily available. I was wrong. About 10 minutes after my friends had begun to eat ( which hey felt awkward doing in front of me with no food but I insisted) my dish finally arrived. The presentation was great and I must say the Sushi was fairly good. You could tell it was a rush job because the sticky rice wasn't holding very well and crumbled a lot. This certainly wasn't the best Sushi I've ever had but far from the worst and it is nice to know I have a place within walking distance from work. I was disappointed in the timing but over all pleased with the end result. I look forward to trying some of their specialty rolls which are buy one get one 1/2 off along with their more traditional dishes.  I'm sure this will become a regular stop as long as small improvements are made.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Keja J.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: I am in town to visit with a friend and while they were working I explored around and came up one this place.  I looked it up and it seemed to get ok ratings,  and since I wanted some sushi I thought I would check it out.
