One great thing is that when you see actual natives, (chinese), eating there then I thought.. well it has to be at least decent.  I order 2 rolls Spicy Girl and Ocean roll b/c it was buy one get one half off. And I must say they are pretty good. They didn't use a whole lot of rice and the fish taste pretty fresh. And as you can see from my half eaten plate it is presented nicely as well. The only real complaint I have is that the ginger and the Wasabi aren't that fresh. And I love ginger, so I was a lil disappointed. And also if you choose to sit down to eat don't expect a true waitress service, they bring your food and that's about it.  Now I don't know if that's only for lunch b/c you have to order from counter then seat yourself. Dinner may be different. But other than that it is a decent place.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: Chelsea M.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: I'm a fan of China Wok. Since the remodel, you can sit down and have a waitress serve you. They also have sushi at a great deal... $7 for 2 rolls, $10 for 3 (for the basic rolls.. some examples are shrimp tempura, spicy tuna, salmon. Some also have cream cheese, cucumber, avocado, ect. )  They also have another page for sushi entrees which is much larger and a more unique choice of their sushi. We've always enjoyed ourselves here.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: S F.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description: Chicken is always cooked properly. Lunch prices are unbelievably reasonable. I highly recommend this place for a fast lunch.

ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.author: L Stephanie L.
ndq4rJcFLMbMGU_gK5u79Q.description:
Cheap with nice service. 

Wonton soup was not the best I've ever had because the noodles were kind of undercooked. I'm a big salt fan--so was the Roasted pork fried rice. If you're not though, this might not be the dish for you.

Overall, it's ok. Non-complicated food for non-complicated people. It's better than TGIF (which is across the street) and their clientele.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Lauren W.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: Ordered pizza pronto from Grubhub for dinner tonight. Customized a chicken ranchero adding tomato, lettuce and bacon. They didn't charge me extra which I thought was amazing. At $11 for 16 in this has to be one of the best sub sandwich prices I've seen in Pittsburgh. Definite bang for the buck. The bread was a bit tough in some parts but overall the sandwich was very enjoyable. Added on the chocolate cake....yes! Do it. Get it. That was the best part of the meal.... it was absolutely delicious! The food didn't arrive that fast but I was compensated with a $5 coupon (which I can use to order more cake!). Overall not a bad experience. Would certainly order from them again.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Ada T.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: Went in for a salad but found out they only carry iceberg lettuce so I opted for a half steak hoagie. I expected a 6 in hoagie for under $7 but to my surprise, it was double that! Bread was toasted and perfectly crusty and the amount of cheese was on point. I probably could've used a little bit more meat but I was still plenty happy with my sammich. At that price, you can't beat it. Will return again.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Tom L.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: Best delivery wings/pizza we've had in the 3 years living here. Food arrived way hotter than expected coming from a few miles away. Friendly driver - Will be our go-to place from now on!!

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Beth H.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: Love Pizza Pronto!  The sauce is so good! Today I ordered the pepperoni rolls and they were great!

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Sean S.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: My favorite north boros pizza shop. Not the cheapest but they seem to use high quality ingredients. My kids love the pizza and they offer good specialty pies.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Valerie C.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: I ordered Delivery through the Slice app with a 15% off promo to try somewhere new. My order included a Gyro, small Greek Salad, and a small Pepperoni, Bacon, & Cheddar Pizza. The Salad description included GREEK Dressing which was not included nor offered for selection via the app. The lettuce was wet as if it was not spun dry after washing. Worst $7 I have ever purchased. The Gyro offered a lot of Lamb Meat which I enjoyed, however, the tzatziki sauce was thin and lacking flavor as if watered down to stretch the sauce. Nothing special about the Pizza. The sauce lacks flavor tastes like plain tomato sauce. Overall disappointed in the lackluster flavor and preparation. Do not recommend Pizza Pronto and will not order in the future.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Todd G.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: Get the Buffalo chicken hoagie!!  I went here during college - but - even though I live 1,000 miles away - I ALWAYS go back when I'm in town. The BCH is the greatest sandwich in Oakland. Thanks guys!!

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Srihith M.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: If you go, get the ranchero steak hoagie. Easily one of the best hoagies I've ever had.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Karla D.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description:
We use this place a lot for takeaway. My boyfriend LOVES their buffalo chicken dip!! It's priced just right too-$9.99 for a decent size tray. That's what it costs when I purchase ingredients to make it myself...only mine doesn't taste half as good. When we have parties, we like to order a tray or two to put out with other snacks and it's always a big hit. Everything on the menu is really good from hummus to pizza and hoagies. Delivery really is fast; pronto even. The drivers are super sweet too!
PS: I'd take a picture but we've inhaled the food too quickly.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Ashwin N.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: This place makes some of the best gourmet pizzas, hoagies, and calzones at affordable prices. I recommend the ranchero steak hoagie, ranch delite pizza, and seafood calzone. They are open very late, and the staff is always very friendly. WAY better than Little Nippers

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Natalie R.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: Ordered a pizza. A great deal for an x-large one topping pizza. The pick up was ready on time and the staff was friendly. The pizza was good but not the best I've had. Perfect for drunk nights. Great service though!

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Donald M.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: Best pizza joint in town. While building apartment complex nearby we would order several pizzas every Thursday for lunch. Most were fantastic. A few were still very good. Make sure you mention coupon in flyer. Both Greek and Seafood are excellent Gourmet choices. It's a shame jobsite is winding down.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Matthew U.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description:
Definitely not impressed with this place, like the rating says, "Meh."  My coworkers rave about this place and are constantly trying to convince me to try it, well one day I caved and decided to place an order.

The one good thing, and maybe the only good thing, is the speed at which you receive your food.  From the time we ordered until the delivery arrived, it was a fraction of what other places in Oakland will quote you.  This however makes you wonder just how the food is prepared.  If it will come that quick it makes you think that the food has been prepared prior to your order and has been sitting under heating lamps.  

Speaking of the food, I decided to order the chicken strips and fries.  I am not sure if this is an accurate description of the food, but the chicken strips were airy.  I am not sure how that happens, but it felt as if there was a ton of air once you bit into the strip.  Weird.  As for the fries, generic and frozen.  Lackluster can best describe my food and is one of the causes as to me not ordering from here again.  Another being the fact that the prices are a bit steep.  Compared to other pizza places that deliver in the area you would think competition would be in full effect here.  Nope.  Who charges $10 for dips?  Unless you are creating every single ingredient in house, I doubt that you spinach artichoke dip is worth $10.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Chantel W.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: The delivery driver was great and they followed instructions. However, the food was terrible. The fries are cold and soggy. The gyro tasted like it wasn't fresh. The jalapeño poppers were just not good. Nothing tasted like it should have. Nothing tasted much like anything at all, really. It was just not very good.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Darae C.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description:
This is my go-to gyro and hummus place!! The pizza in my opinion is super wack, but the gyro and hummus platter are absolutely delicious, filling, and worth every penny!! 

The delivery speed of this place consistently lives up to its name because I've never had to wait more than 35 minutes for my order to be complete. One random night, a curious me decided to go for the Buffalo chicken dip. It was easily the best random appetizer choice I've made in a very long time. It was everything you want out of BCD and then some! You only want to order this about once or twice a year because the portion size is huge and addicting, but I promise it lives up to the hype!

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Sra S.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description:
I've been ordering from this pizza shop for about 10 years now. Amazing that it's still there!! That should say something.
I live in Lawrenceville, but the pizza always gets to us quick and hot. My favorite pizza is the Ranch Delight. It's awesome!! Even if you don't like specialty pizzas (like me), you will love it. I admit they SOMETIMES put a touch too much ranch on it, but most of the time (85%) they make it perfect! I have been ordering from here so long, I would probably be more likely to notice that kind of thing. 
I also love their pasta! They make it good, no pool of grease on top like some pizza places. I always get the stuffed shells or manicotti with sausage. I actually don't order pasta from anywhere else, they just make it right. Love the garlic bread, too.
Price is right, delivery guys are nice and polite. No complaints!

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Briana D.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: Cheese is perfect sauce is great, crust is amazing. I order from here quite a bit and I have never been disappointed it's always nice and warm when it comes. Super fast service and nice people working there!

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Vanessa K.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description:
Full disclosure: we ordered a pizza and a meatball hoagie from Pizza Pronto right after a more-strenuous-than-usual gym workout, so our taste buds may or may not have been skewed by hunger.  

However.  Ermahgerd. 

They delivered to us in Point Breeze, which I really appreciated (delivery radii seem to be pretty stingy around here!), and the pizza...Lordy.  We got a large pizza with extra sauce, along with pepperoni and sausage on one half (his) and sausage and mushrooms on the other half (mine).  The crust was absolutely delicious - kind of sweet, just the right crispy-to-soft ratio.  The sauce wasn't sweet enough for the fiancé, but I thought it was just perfect, and the sausage was very flavorful and crumbly.  I only had one bite of the meatball hoagie, but I liked what I tasted, and the fiancé said it was "fantastic."

These guys are our new go-to place since Vocelli finally wised up that we technically aren't in their delivery radius anymore.  Very satisfied!

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: John G.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: I don't review much, but I've made the mistake of ordering pizza from here twice. It was the worst. Seriously, folks, you can do better that Pizza Pronto. Treat Yo' Self and order from anywhere else.

3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.author: Bethany B.
3v8vcGGeJRZXTGxpeyq0gA.description: More like Pizza not Pronto. Took an hour and 20 minutes to be delivered and it was cold.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Chelsey S.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description:
I love this place. My company orders lunch from here all the time without issue. Today we ordered taco salads which is one of may favorites. 1 of the salads was supposed to come without chips but there was some sort of mixup. They were so understanding when I called and dropped off a new order in only a few minutes. I appreciate good customer service. 

Thanks for always taking care of us.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Michal M.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: Great breakfast sandwiches and lunch. Always served with a smile.  They do a good job catering lunches and Christmas cookies too.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Jes G.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description:
Everything I've ordered from here is delicious & fresh.
The soups are homemade & just what winter calls for!

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Larissa G.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description:
Sadly in the year and a half since I first wrote my review things have changed a bit at Cafe, and not for the best. More and more my coworkers and I are experiencing regular problems with this place, that is when we're brave enough to risk ordering from Cafe now.

Firstly, there's the problems with the orders. It honestly doesn't seem to matter if we order right off the menu or if we ask for a small change to our order - something basic will always be missing (like lettuce) or done incorrectly when the food arrives. 

Then there's the fact that the order time really has slowed down, a lot - once we placed an order and nothing arrived for two hours. Sorry, but unless it's a major holiday that kind of wait for a sandwich is just too long. Most recently, it took an hour for our food to even get out the door (we know this because we called exactly an hour after ordering, and they said it was leaving then). Why couldn't they have warned us about this wait in advance? This is standard practice for other companies that deliver, is it not?

The final downgrade in service at Cafe are the problems with their phone and staff. I've been accidentally hung up on multiple times at this point; I've also heard people debating in the background about who needs to take our order when we're asked to hold, please. From the snippets of conversation we can hear, things definitely aren't running as smoothly at Cafe as they used to be. Of course this is just when I can dial through - it's not uncommon to try to dial in and be told that the call can't be connected for some reason. 

All of this adds up to a more and more disappointing Cafe delivery experience. At this point the quality of the food can't make up for the problems - it's honestly hardly even worth the hassle to order from them anymore. I keep hoping they'll bounce back to what they used to be, but we're clearly not there yet.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Tiffany B.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: I recently moved out of the Heinz Lofts and the hardest part about leaving was not being able to see the staff at the Cafe every day! Cindy, the owner, and her staff were truly like family to me.  The Cafe at the Lofts made living at the Heinz Lofts better thanks to the staff members at the cafe who made you feel loved and valued.  The Southern Comfort wrap was my fav...they'll even put it on lettuce for you if your watching your carbs!! Love this place and the people who work there!! Xo

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: KaRon S.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: Cafe at the Lofts is amazing! I had the chicken noodle soup and it was by far the best soup that I've had in a very long time! Definitely will be back to try more!

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Rob B.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: Place is kinda a joke. Went in 45min before closing and the lady gave me the whole "YOU KNOW I'M CLOSIN SOON, RIGHT?" routine. Tuna sandwich was ok. They didnt have coffee hot or iced. And their special was a ham and cheese sandwich. Based on that, prob wont be back. I'm sure they don't really need my business though.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Sepideh J.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: I stopped by for a quick grab and go breakfast and coffee, was not clean and customer service was not great. place was messy. i haven't gone back since.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Angela B.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: I just wanted to come back and say that I haven't had anymore issues with the wait or timing with my orders. They have been prompt and usually I call ahead so it's waiting for me. Food is still solid, nothing I crave per se but enjoyable and filling none the less.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Peter W.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description:
I am going to let you in on a little secret...Cafe at the Lofts has a great Saturday breakfast dish.  Order the breakfast burrito with bacon, salsa and hot sauce (there hot sauce is more flavor than heat).  Order it exactly like that and you will have a new "go to" breakfast item. 

Remember, they only offer it on Saturdays. Also, they have coffee that is on par with Voluto or Tazo Dorro.  

This is a pretty cool place also.

***UPDATE***

I am sad to say that things have changed here.  Two Saturdays in a row I have come down (20 minute drive ) to get the breakfast burrito only to find they are out.  Ok.  That happens.  Although I am disappointed I am not upset. The problem is the lady working the counter...she is very gruff. Both times when I asked if they have breakfast burritos I have been rudely told "we are out."  The first visit I did not ask a follow up question.  This time (time 11:37 AM) I ask "don't you close at 2?"  The response..."well I am not going to make burritos all day. (Rude tone)". 

Sorry, but I just won't be back for a while. I figure 3 months and this person won't be working here anymore. See you in 90!

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Ash D.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: Love this cafe! Wedding soup to die for and endless new options to try. Affordable and fast as well! Will definitely be going back.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Nick K.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: The cafe at the lofts has an ever changing menu, daily specials and weekly specials. Ive tried pretty much everything and eat here everyday for lunch. Always fresh wraps and sandwiches. They have really good soups that are homemade as well. If you have the oppertunity to stop and get a bite to eat l suggest you do!!!!!

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Ben N.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: Homemade soups are out of this world. Daily specials are unique. Some of the best lunch sandwiches in Pgh!

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Nick S.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description:
Cafe at the Lofts is my favorite Troy Hill/North Side lunch spot. Delicious homemade soups, tasty sandwiches, and friendly service. A suitable North side alternative to my beloved Eat Unique and Food for Thought in Oakland.

I've had various panini, salads and soups here, and I have only been disappointed by the Four Cheese Panini. Their soups are good to very good. The salads have always seemed fresh and crisp.

There is a decent selection of sandwiches available, and the daily specials are usually quite good. If you happen to be looking for lunch on the North Side, I recommend giving them a shot.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Marla K.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description: I only ever order one thing from here --- The Navigator Wrap --- but it's delicious. I've only ever dealt with the restaurant through delivery, but they're always very prompt. Everything on the menu is fairly priced. If you work in the North Side it's definitely a great place to order from.

0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.author: Carol S.
0IhSOm9Vm1JkvRO6XyElGg.description:
What a delight!  I love finding a place that makes you feel right at home while serving food like Mom used to make!   They seem to have just the right touch from the friendly service, the portion size (generous), and really great salads / sandwiches / deserts!

I also recommend their catering.  Since I started using them a year ago, they are my first choice for entertaining guests with good home cooked entrees like stuffed cabbage rolls, glazed apricot pecan chicken, lasagna and my favorite - Garlic Mashed Potatoes with cheddar cheese.  Cafe at the Lofts is just a good place with good people & great food!

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Erin S.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: I just wanted to comment on the take-out drive thru..its a life saver! The food isnt amazing or anything, but it's very good for a diner and it's so inexpensive. Christ, for like 10$ you get an entre, 2 sides, bread and a cookie (and they allow soups and salads as sides) NO bs, just a meal and 2 of whatever you want. They never mess up the order, very reliable and ALWAYS nice...their slogan "the place for smiles" is actually accurate. It's just such a good deal for what you get.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Sharon Z.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description:
Busy Sunday.  Wait was about 15 mins for a table of three at about 12:30.   It felt like they where not prepared for the crowds.  They could not keep up with the demands for the day.  Plates were in high demand along with the waffles and pancake.    The server were only able to bring out a stack of about 10 plates at a time.   I never saw a pancake and waffles .... Were brought out 3-5 at a time and were gone within seconds.  
Our waitress was nice and very attentive with clearing plates and refilling drinks as needed. 
  
I would probably try a different location next time.  I love Eat n Park especially for their salad bar.     And, it a Burgh thing!!!

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Krista Z.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description:
Busy day here for brunch .. we had about a 15 min wait for a table for three... usually you can get in without a long wait these days.  

Have to say it felt like they were not prepared for the crowds today.  It was busy they and they could not keep up with the demand of the people here for brunch.  Plates were in high demand at the salad bar -  had to wait for them to bring clean ones out twice.  Go for soup - no soup spoons.. 

When you got a plate  --- and when you went up for food -some of the pickings were slim -- they couldn'tkeep up with the demand of foods like the waffles and eggs.    I grabbed a waffle for my sis since I was in the right place when the guy brought 5.  But they were gone within seconds again.
Could not really tell if this is the norm for them or just shot handed. 

I tended to settle my selections to some friend chicken ( which was good) bacon, French toast sticks (not a fan sorry) and the soup ( chili and potato)... call me crazy but I do like the chili ( topped with some cheese).  

Our waitress - Jean - was a nice lady.  She was busy too - but managed to keep plates cleaned up and water in glasses.   

I would go back - it's eat n park and a burgh thing - but may try another location for brunch next time.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Lawrenc A.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: Terrible customer service gave it the benefit and   Visiting twice and it didn't work

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Jennifer W.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description:
I'm giving this restaurant 5 stars for a few reasons. I order take out often from here and every employee that has waited on me at the drive thru pick up window has always been pleasant and prompt. I have not had an issue here yet. My food is packaged neatly and my coffee is hot. 
From the times I have dined inside, the restaurant has been clean and we receive friendly service. The food is everything I would cook myself at home so nothing crazy fancy, However I don't have to cook it or clean up! Best is it's really inexpensive the times I don't want to cook and this is good food at a good price. And my kids eat it! 
So good work EatnPark 51.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Krista M.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: I love eat n Park. It's nothing fancy, but you get a lot for very little money and it's decent food. Again, nothing fancy, but it's good. You can get breakfast, burgers, soup, salads, pasta...lots of options. The salad bar always has lots of decent options other than just salad, and I love their chili. Their burgers are good, the pastas I've tied are good, and the bruschetta chicken is a new favorite of mine. The smiley Cookies are a classic.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: K S.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: I always enjoy the food and company of staff. Probably one of the best EatNParks around. I'm constantly there, mostly night time, and you can tell the kitchen isn't angry or disgruntled with life or food. Come enjoy

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Chantel K.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description:
I'm a very easy to please customer and I always try to be understanding of waiters and waitresses because it's not an easy job. But I feel like this waiter had resigned himself to the fact that he was just not going to give us good service. My food was brought out cold (and I was willing to look past that because like I said I do my best not to be difficult). My husband needed a second glass of water and was not offered one so he asked. Well, we waited and waited. The waiter finally remembered that we existed and asked if my husband needed a cup of water, to which he responded yes. We still never got that cup of water. Our bill was finally brought to us after the waiter disappeared for an extended period of time, and we had yet another wait to finally get checked out. It was just not a good experience. Please do better to be attentive to your guests. I get that it's hard to balance many things but at the least, make sure that your guests have something to drink while they eat their food.

Summary: my food was cold, but it tasted ok. The service was terrible. Without the poor service it would have gotten a better review (even with the cold food).

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Sonyta O.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: We came from New Jersey for a bodybuilding show & on our way back we stopped by here for quick bite to for the road. We got the Buffalo Chicken Wrap & the Greek Salad with Grilled Chicken & it was delicious! I was was extremely impressed with how quick the food was made & the portions were generous! They were so friendly & give us free goodies at well, a cinnamon bun & a smiley cookie! Would definitely recommend coming here!

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Beth E.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description:
It's an Eat'n Park so you know what you are going to get.      Service wasn't so hot this time and not sure why as they weren't busy.

I had a turkey club which had yellow American cheese so it looked weird.   Otherwise, it was a typical turkey club.  My husband had the chicken noodle soup, which is consistently good.    He had the sandwich special which was a tuna melt.  It was not a typical tuna melt.  It was a tuna sandwich with melted cheese.   Not what he was expecting at all.  He got the silver dollar pancakes and thought they had a good flavor.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Peyton D.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: I loved eat n park. Such a fun place to go and eat. But taking down the molten lava cake is a bad move. But making matters worse and replacing it with a brownie Sunday or whatever is so bad. You can get that at any restaurant. Very disappointed. #bringmoltenlavacakeback

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Brad H.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description:
Have been coming to this eatn park my whole life and it is always a good experience.  They remodeled the restaurant in the past couple of years to make it more modern looking.  The addition of the drive through was also a nice touch.  Whether you are here for breakfast or a late night meal, the service is usually fast and the prices reasonable.

Eatn park's food is very good for the price you will pay.  They have some great appetizers like mozzarella sticks, Mac and cheese bites, and fried pickles.  Their Buffalo sauce is some of the best I have ever had.  Both the Buffalo chicken tenders or wrap are sooo good.  They also have what I would say is the best ranch in Pittsburgh.  The super burger is also another great option that you can't go wrong with.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Phil G.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description:
I have been coming to this eat N Park recently while the one on Library road is under construction.  It is large inside and remodeled since I last frequented this location (1990's). Gone is the smoking section and they have a bar-height counter, near the waiting area, that has a large screen TV.  It also has a drive thru.

They get a lot of business during breakfast, but it moves fast so I haven't experienced long waits.

The food is on par with what you expect, which is good.

It's 11am but feels like noon since daylight savings just ended.  I'm still getting breakfast but my companion is getting lunch.  Might be an odd combination of smells!

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Jacquelyn M.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: Wonderful service, and even better food. I am visiting from out of state and am so glad I found this restaurant. I have eaten here every day since I arrived to Burbank, CA. Everything I have eaten have been delicious. The omelettes are outstanding. I definitely recommend Eat'n Park Restaurant, it is a must.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Kimberly T.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: Eat n Park is a Pittsburgh tradition. It is tried and true. It's a family tradition for a lot of families. It is a family friendly restaurant. The wait staff is usually nice. The restaurant is always clean. The food is where they waffle. One word-inconsistency. Sometimes, like yesterday, the chili is watery. Sometimes, like yesterday, my scrambled eggs were more fried than scrambled. My safe bets here are The Original Breakfast Smile and the Rosemary Chicken. Yesterday my safe bet of the Breakfast Smile wasn't consistent. I was bummed. The server was kind enough to check to see if there were biscuits left because I ordered breakfast at lunch time. I was able to get biscuits which was nice but my scrambled eggs were fried and not scrambled. Their seemed to be no seasoning on the eggs either. Scrambled eggs are not a tough dish to make. My hash browns were cooked well but again seemed to lack salt or pepper. My bacon was barely room temperature. It was the customer service we received from our waitress that got my review up to three stars. If it was solely based on food it was you have been a one star review.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Rex C.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: One of the best eat n parks I have been to. Always a pleasant experiance and is a great place for a late night meal or desert for people who work late.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Daniel B.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: My sister ordered my food to go with her order. We got a $10 appetizer platter, and it had 3 onion rings, 3 half pretzels, 3 Mac n cheese bites and some chips. I've never been so disappointed in my life. Barely any portions and bad food. Never going back here

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Heather C.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: We come here often.  We always get the same. . . My husband and I order bacon cheeseburger and salad bar.  My 11 year old daughter orders burger and fries with gravy on the side.  Which never comes out right.  We go to the salad bar with only iceburg lettuce available, no Spinach or spring mix.  Female restocking without rotating anything .  Ask for some spinach and got an attitude.  No chili on salad bar.  Decided to try potato soup.  This particular location is not consistent on soups.  This potato soup was horrible.  Pushed it aside hated it.  Daughter says can I try it?  I say go ahead.  It was just going to be garbage.  Waitress stops by and tells my daughter she shouldn't be eating that.  You are not allowed to share.  This made my daughter feel like crap and wouldn't eat and made her cry.  Proceeded to tell us we we're wrong.  Well, I told her if the salad bar was stocked properly this problem wouldn't have been there.  SHE MADE MY DAUGHTER  CRY OVER SHITTY SOUP I DIDNT WANT TO EAT!!!!   And then proceeded to tell us how wrong we we're.  Again, my daughter felt guilty and cried.  Manager had no emotion and said what do you want???  Long story short left with a sad child and a free salad bar.  How do u question an eleven year old??????  Will NEVER return to an eat n park ever!!!!! HORRIBLE PLACE.  HORRIBLE, INSENSITIVE SERVER.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Paul C.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: Good Friday was and always is good at this location their fish and Mac is always consistent and good. Service was very good the gentleman was very good at his job and the food was also very good. Keep up the good work there at the 51 location.

C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.author: Ruby L.
C5zOHpwyA-snVGppkbUpQg.description: My waitress was super nice. Food was quick and affordable. I dig the little chips that came with my appetizer.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Matthew U.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description:
Not wanting to go out for dinner isn't all bad.  Mainly because you can have whatever you want delivered to you, or call ahead and do a quick pick up on your way home.  Recently my better half and I were just not wanting to move and wanted to continue our lazy day.  We decided pizza would be a good go to.

Looking up Cerasoli we made a quick decision and called to place our order.  We were told it would take about 20 minutes and our order would be ready.  Being close by that allowed for us to continue to be lazy and leave after a few minutes to get here when our food was ready.

We showed up here and had a few more minutes to wait, but that allowed for us to pay and check out the place.  It is a small pizzeria, but it does allow for eat in if you please.  There are a few tables inside, but I think that if you want to eat in house it might be best to do so in the colder months.  It gets rather hot in here.

Our food was ready and we headed out.  We decided on the Meat Lovers Pizza and two orders of mozzarella sticks.  The mozzarella sticks were your basic item that you can get from any other pizza joint in the city.  Nice coating on the outside with a side of marinara for dipping.  The Meat Lovers Pizza was your almighty pizza.  This thing came topped with pepperoni, sausage, ham, salami, capicola, gyro meat, and bacon.  Also put some mozzarella, provolone, and Romano cheese.  This thing was massive.  Also with being massive, it was greasy to no end.  It made it a bit heavy, but in the end, filling.  I could only eat a few slices and had to stop.  Which isn't all that bad, that meant that I had some for later.  All in all, a satisfying meal for a lazy day of laying around and watching some television.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Dan M.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description:
Cerasoli's likes to make themselves at home.
Never thought I'd need to have the cops associated with a pizza delivery before, but tonight came close. 

Ordered for the first time this evening for delivery and was patiently waiting for our pizza. Upon the drivers arrival he gave two loud knocks then proceeded to open my front door and say hello, as if he is Kramer from Seinfeld or something. I proceeded to let the driver know that this is completely and utterly unacceptable. Under no circumstances do you open someone's front door as a delivery driver, whether they're waiting for you or not... we then called the establishment to explain what had just transpired only to be verbally attacked, and accused of threatening to shoot this person?! This is 100% untrue and I am completely dumbfounded that they would do react in such a manner. I wanted to inform the police but I found this to be a more suitable outlet for my concerns.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Tom L.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: And OK mom and pop pizza place. The pizza look good and I wanted one. So I ordered a veggie pizza. The guy behind the counter who has a thick accent but I said wedgy. A wedgy is a Pittsburgh specialty which is basically a calzone with a salad in it. I don't like wedgies, but I was so hungry I ate it anyway.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Alan W.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description:
This review is for delivery only.
The other night I ordered a large cheese pie from Cerasoli Pizzeria.
I also asked for a dozen garlic knots which they said they do not have??
The delivery was fast and the pizza was still hot.
The pizza itself was just ok nothing special at all.
I would have too say I would not order pizza from Cerasoli Pizzeria again.
Also When I called to order the pizza I could barely understand the gentleman that answered the phone do to his thick accent.
The delivery guy was really nice and came fast.
Too bad the pizza was nothing special.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Charisse N.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: I wish i could provide a 0 star. I placed an order and was provided the wrong item. When I called to advise of the wrong order. I was told first that they ran out of my item and then was told by someone else that I ordered what i received. I work in customer service and the way they talked to me and then disconnected the call. All I wanted was either a credit or for them to correct my order. They are rude and they will NEVER get any of my business again. They are very unprofessional and I will make sure that everyone I have sent their way won't order from them anymore either. I was told they don't have time for me so I will no longer put anymore money in their pockets.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Julie S.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: Best veggie pizza ever. Love this place. They use good ingredients and you can taste the difference. In fact, as I'm writing this and thinking of their pizza....I'm going to order one now. I like that this is a family run business, they are the nicest people ever! The guy that usually answers the phone has a heavy accent and he's always polite. I never had a problem with delivery, I think it's the son that typically delivers- but they're busy and it can take a while. If you want food more quickly get off your butt and go pick it up! Lol

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Marissa K.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: This place was recommend to me by another northsider as we were discussing lack of good pizza in our area.  I ordered a deep dish pepperoni and buffalo fries with bacon and cheese.  The pizza was heavy, because it is Chicago style, but tasty.  Not quite up there with true Chicago pizza, but good.  The fries were seasoned and covered in a fabulous amount of melted white cheese.  Based on the melt I was guess a mozz and provolone mix.  Portions are good for the price.  Online ordering is through GrubHub whether you do delivery or pick up.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Joan F.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: Just had an Italian wedgey -- The best I've ever had. It's huge, too.  Everything was spread out evenly the way it should be. I just love this place!!

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Katy R.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: Want to love this place- and have before. But ordered the gyro wedgie and it seems they forgot the gyro meat. Maybe 2-3 slices of the frozen meat- and even expecting not real gyro meat, which is fine , wanted enough of it to get my gyro fix. Mostly lettuce and tomato. The dough was delicious, but just wanted gyro when we ordered it. Disappointed.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Linda K.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: Cerasoli's pizza is the best pizza on the North side! The sauce is tasty not bland and the cheese is plentiful!  Just the right amount! Truly an authentic pizzeria!

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Kayla D.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: Normally we love the food here but the customer service is terrible. Last time I tried to order wings for pickup knowing that before that time they forgot my 2 extra toppings that were paid for ! I called when we got the pizza and they said they will credit us the next time we order for the toppings. So when I try and order the wings and explain that I should have credit for my toppings because I wanted to use it I don't believe the guy was understanding that I was trying to say I had already called because he would not let me explain what happened and was very rude and just is always grumpy on the phone. This is no way to treat your customers and if they actually say they're  going to give you credit for something that you paid for and did not get than that's what they're supposed to do. Very disappointed to say I will not be ordering there again because the food is good but will not be treated like that when I am providing you with business.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Clayton H.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: Good pizza but they messed up my order and did not make it right. I'm a two year regular customer that just decided that I won't return soon. Disappointed on the personal level where I just expected more from a place we frequent monthly.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Ryan C.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: Unbelievable bad service, I ordered delivery, which was 30 minutes late, and the chicken fettuccine alfredo I received was cold, and watery. It was actually inedible and went in the trash.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Jayme B.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: I ordered a mushroom pie for my mom one night while she was at my house. I decided to try this place out after searching Yelp and seeing how close it is to my house. My mom couldn't stop talking about how good the pizza was! Fast forward to last weekend. I ordered a pizza online and picked it up about 15 minutes later. The shop is the cutest. An elderly couple is actually in the kitchen making the food! When I saw that, I knew my pizza was going to be good! Cerasoli did not disappoint! The pizza was hot but not too greasy (just enough to make it good pizza ;) and there was a good perfect amount of cheese on it. I definitely found my "go-to" spot for pizza!

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Josh T.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description:
Cerasoli is good pizza. 
Their delivery times were slow at first, but they've gotten much better. I think that's why they have a low rating. 
I love that i can order from within the yelp app too. Helps me organize my thoughts.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Runqi W.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: I ordered the pizza delivery around 10:30 pm. However, didn't receive pizza after hours and couldn't call the restaurant to check status. STILL MISSING PIZZA. I already PAID online

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: David C.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description:
Go for the food; wait, and wait, and wait for the delivery.

Pizza is always hit or miss in Pittsburgh--mostly "miss."  I hate to sound like NY-centric pizza snob, but if that's who I have to be, that's who I'll be.  I need to look out for the East Coast transplants to the 'burgh.  

The pizza and hoagies are pretty good.  The pizza is doughy, so if that's your thing, this is your place.  The hoagies, likewise, are better than your average pizza place in Pittsburgh, and certainly better than most spots on the North Side.

My biggest complaint is that Cerasoli doesn't have their own delivery drivers, but use GrubHub instead.  I can respect that is probably a financial decision, but this is why I'm only giving it two stars.  I've ordered delivery from them twice over the past two weeks.  The first time, it took two hours to get my order delivered.  Last week, and this is the last time that I'll order from them, it took more than three hours.  Again, I blame GrubHub, but again, it makes it too inconvenient for me to want to order from them again.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Chai A.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: I was skeptical at first but I ordered the deep dish with sausage and pepperoni along with cajun wings......wings were crispy and spicy like I like them.  Pizza was very flavorful and filling. It was the first time I've had Chicago style deep dish and I'm a fan,of it now

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Timothy B.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description:
I have finally found a good pizza to order from in Brighton Heights. I stumbled upon a Chicago Deep Dish w/ pepperoni and OMG.  The pizza is not too deep or doughy and the crust is very nice.  At first I thought they forgot the pepperoni but it was in the cheese!!!  Yes in the cheese apparently where it should be was also very nice.  And finally the sauce, holy amazing gravy.  Fresh on top with a tiny spice kick to awaken the taste buds, and this was better than very nice.  
Delivery was slow, but good things come... well Yinz know the rest. 
I will be ordering this again for quite some time.

1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.author: Carly K.
1FqQ0L--8sviAKNR97K5UA.description: Pizza and house rolls are awesome! Everything else I've had there is sub-par. But the pizza is legit. Sauce is amazing and they loadddd on the toppings. Definitely recommend it!

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Ryan S.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: I have had Pizza Fiesta multiple times and I swear it gets better every time I have it! From friendly delivery drivers that are always on time to just be greeted so nicely when I walk in the door, I can't so how much I love Pizza Fiesta even beyond just their incredible pizza, wings, and gyros! If you're in Pittsburgh you need to get yourself some Pizza Fiesta!

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Ed M.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: Stopped in, got a small pie for me. Took 15 minutes. Tasty. Lot of cheese. Crust a bit doey. I'll be back to try cold sandwiches

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Sophie S.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: Tried to order food from them around 1:45 and they turned us down. Don't say you are open until 2 and rudely turn us down. I work in food service and always stay open UNTIL CLOSE. A major turn off from this place, especially because they are on a college campus.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Halee V.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: It certainly did the trick when I was stuck awake waiting for a tow truck around 1am and found myself stressfully starving. I ordered the pepperoni roll and a small white pizza. The pepperoni roll was good, no complaints but nothing out-of-this-world delicious. The best thing about the white pizza was the side of ranch dressing. The pizza was soaked in grease and had a weird unnatural flavoring. The ranch made it barely palatable but my stomach hurt soon after due to the sheer volume of grease. If it's late and you're desperate, go for it.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Emily S.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description:
I would do many things for Pizza Fiesta ranch. Honestly, the pizza itself is pretty mediocre. But it's all worth it for the ranch. Change the name to Ramch Fiesta.

I love their cheesy breadsticks as well.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Joann G.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: Banging pizza. The dough and crust are ridiculously good. Perfect amount of grease on top. Pittsburgh, you've got good pizza!

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Gabby C.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: Waited 2 hours for a pizza all they could say was sorry. Not good service at all. Took me 10 minutes to get someone on the phone.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Allen M.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: I don't normally write reviews but I couldn't resist. My family and I are in Pittsburgh for the weekend and decided to order pizza and wings. When we order pizza whether it's when we are home or out of town we always order for local non chain pizzeria's. Pizza Fiesta has some of the best pizza we have had in a long time. The hand tossed dough was amazing. The cheese and pepperoni was great. We had traditional cheese and pepperoni. I wish it was a chain so that we could order locally. Keep up the good work. The wings where good but the pizza made the meal. Keep up the good work and we will see you again when we come back.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Pierce W.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description:
It seems like staff doesn't listen to customers' directions very well. I've ordered from this place twice for my lunch break and twice they've delivered my food thirty minutes earlier than what I asked for, despite my clearly stating the time my break was. This is a problem if your lunch break is at a certain time. So I end up using valuable break minutes to go down and receive food that I have to wait another thirty minutes to eat, by which time it's lukewarm and/or soggy.

The first time, I let it go, but this time I called to register a complaint and was told that the delivery man would come back in thirty minutes (what good is that going to do?) and then was hung up on (I called her back and she denied doing it). Maybe there's a language problem (I see others have also noted this); maybe they just need to clean out their ears and actually try to to give a damn. 

Needless to say, I have no interest ordering from a place that has no interest in meeting its customers needs. These people clearly have no idea what they're doing and no interest in trying to learn.

If the food were at least interesting that would be the saving grace, but it's generic, and average at best. 

Avoid.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Veronica L.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: The pizza here is very tasty! We went twice in the two days that we stayed in Downtown Pitt. We had The Hawaiian Pizza and Mediterranean Pizza! Definitely a must if you are staying downtown. Staff was friendly and helpful! A MUST if you're staying in the area

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Bia L.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: Waited over 30min for the pizza to arrive  when it was supposed to arrive at noon, I ordered the pizza two hours in advanced. This is ridiculous, I called twice and they told me the driver was 7 min away.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Brian S.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: I ordered a veggie calzone, no broccoli, no olives. It's was enormous and very cheesy. They are not cheap on the cheese. Prices were fair, delivery was said to be an hour it was here in 40 minutes. Open late and the driver was pretty nice. You can't go wrong if your an out of towner and you want dinner this late. Great job guys

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Mitsuko V.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description:
I order a large chicken tenders with fries and the broccoli puffs. This place was awful. The food was late for delivery, cold when arrived, stale and rubbery. It was such low quality. I called for a refund and all they offered were more of their bad food. The large chicken tenders only came with 3 pieces! 
I would never order from them again.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Chelsea M.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description:
Pizza Fiesta has moved to 14 Smithfield Street (next to Peppi's) 

The pizza has seemed to have gotten better. They make a great side salad. Their lunch special is slice, salad & drink for $5.99. 

Since moving, there is no longer a dining area. There may be a chair or two inside, but that's about it. My coworker is still in love with this place and treated me to lunch again today. 

The only downside (besides no seating) is that they dont have sugar. I got an unsweetened tea and asked for sweetner. She said they dont have sugar and that they also have sweet tea. awkward

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Katt S.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description:
Pizza Fiesta isn't phenomenal, but the deals they have are great. Namely, the College Special. You get a large cheese, family breadsticks, and one liter of soda for like $16. Also, you're going to want to get the ranch. The ranch here is unreal and I actually can't find anything comparable.

The pizza is truly nothing to write home about. I have had it both dine-in and for delivery, and it always seems to be a little chewy and perhaps overdone. But when you're drunk, cheap pizza is cheap pizza. The guys on the phone are nice enough, but it gets a little creepy when they call my "sweetie" over and over again. Like, they're foreign, but every girl is not a sweetie, and I am 100% not part of that population.

All in all, Pizza Fiesta is ok. It certainly is food when I'm drunk and I need food. (PS-no one has ever asked for my college ID when I ordered over the phone. Not to be an ass, but, Just Do It, 28-year-old dudebro.)

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Tim S.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description:
Delicious and fast delivery. We were pleasantly surprised with everything: salad, jalapeño peppers, pepperoni and sausage pizza. 

We had it delivered to our hotel on the strip.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Matthew U.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description:
I love the name of this place, I love the fact that they are trying to mash it up.  With a name that kind of evokes an Italian Mexican chain, it's not what you are really getting.  One of the other things that I really appreciate of this place is that they deliver to a huge amount of neighborhoods circling around the downtown area.

Since I started out on writing my review for this place I have ordered at least twice from here.  Both times I was not disappointed.  Both times I was full.

My first order was one of their bread twists.  I had the pepperoni variety.  If you need a visual for this, just think of everything that you would put on a pizza, minus the sauce, stuffed inside some bread that is in the shape of a C.  Only minus the sauce on the inside, why, because you get a side of marinara on the side with some ranch (more on that later) on the side.  It was good, so good that I ate it all in one sitting.  

My next order here was a salad.  With a mix of iceberg and spring mix lettuce I wasn't let down by this.  Add in some cucumbers, red onions, and tomatoes I was sold.  I had opted for some of that ranch dressing I mentioned prior.  What is so good about it?  It's homemade.  So good, definitely not store bought.  I thank you for this due to my allergies, I could actually enjoy a ranch dressing again.

You've definitely earned another repeat customer in me.


Woot Woot!  Review #700

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Salim V.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description:
Let me tell you right away that I love pizza. I eat pizza more than any other food...and still stay slim somehow). We tried food from Pizza Fiesta several times now and I absolutely loved almost everything. Pizza was very tasty, hoagies are also good...they are big ...16 inch. Yep 16 inch. Steak hoagie and buffalo chicken are my favorite. Wings were fried , I usually like baked ones, but these were ok too. I tried their steak calzone ones and was good too...plenty amount of cheese and meat, very delicious...especially when you are so hungry! 
Delivery was never late ...always on time.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Jenna B.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: Food was so delicious, worth going out of your way for. The delivery process was a little bit inefficient for my order, HOWEVER, the staff here is 10/10.

MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.author: Monica R.
MYyJ9orpiRq0prjVq4ku7w.description: GO OUT OF YOUR WAY TO COME HERE - I'm from tx and this is the best pizza I've ever tasted in my 24 (almost 25 since its 2016) years of life!

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Marianne C.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description:
I work in the neighborhood of this restaurant and wanted to place a take out order 
They refuse to take orders over the phone. They must be placed in person !
How lame is that !
They just lost a customer who loves to eat and drink !

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Yanai L.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description:
We went to Frick Park Tavern on a Friday night to try out the new restaurant, formerly Ease. We were impressed with the new spot and think it will be a good addition to Regent Square. 

We started off with complimentary popcorn, that was a nice addition, especially as some of us were quite hungry. I ordered the Cajun Chicken Sandwich that came with a side of French fries. It was a nice portion size and tasted great. The wife got the hamburger and noted that the fries were a bit salty, but overall was satisfied with her meal. 

I ordered a wine as they have a large selection to choose from. One downside was that they do not have beers on draft and I love draft beer. We have a baby, so we had to make room for him with an extra chair for his car seat. Overall, the service and ambiance were great and we will definitely be back sometime soon!

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Sydney S.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description:
Pros: Burgers and Cajun chicken sandwiches were really good. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Small but good beer on tap list. 

Cons: nothing really, but hoping it opens up for lunch or earlier for happy hour sometime soon. 

Summary; Well done, We'll be back. It was super busy on Friday at 6:30, so really glad we made reservations.

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Julia E.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description:
I had been to this restaurant space when it was Dunnings, then Ease and now Frick Park Tavern. I was anxious to see the changes they had made. We went this past Friday around 5pm and were seated immediately. Right away I loved the decor---new lighting and wallpaper. 
The menu looked similar to what Ease offered- just slimmed down. The kids menu is exactly the same from what I remembered. My daughter ordered the pasta and applesauce. I ordered the FPT burger - no bacon. It was REALLY good. The onion ring was a nice touch. My husband ordered the chicken sandwich and he had no complaints. 
We ordered the seasonal fruit tart for dessert. I wasn't a huge fan. Not sure if I'm the best critic since I don't usually eat dessert. 
I'm really glad Frick Park Tavern opened finally. It is a good addition to the restaurants in the square. We will definitely be back. When we left around 6:30 the restaurant was packed! Expect to wait if you come around that time. Glad to see the restaurant doing well.

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Stephanie H.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description:
I went to Frick Park Tavern on its opening night and I was not disappointed!  I was nervous that since it was opening night the quality of service or food could be compromised and my opinion would be tainted but I'm happy to report that was not the case.  Frick Park Tavern is a great addition to Regent Square!

The decor was home-y but modern and was perfect for the space.  The atmosphere was inviting for couples, friends, and families.  They have a great selection of beer, wine and cocktails and their menu has something for everyone.  There are a lot of salads and sandwiches but a nice selection of entrees to help round out the menu and make this restaurant great for a casual dinner or a nice night out.

We started with the candied chili bacon and the fig and bleu tart.  The bacon is a must get and the tarts were good - I would have liked a little more bleu cheese but that is a personal preference.  I ordered the Nature Trail which was good but I would try something different next time.  My husband got the Pnkerton and that cocktail is a must try if you enjoy smokey cocktails.

For our main meals I ordered the double cut pork chop (after seeing a sneak peak video on their instagram) and my husband got Jimmy's Special Meatloaf.  The apple glaze was so good on the pork chop and it was cooked perfectly.  The cabbage and bacon risotto were perfect sides for the dish.  The meatloaf was really good as well.  

We will definitely be back - many, many times!

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Nandi Z.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description:
I love the concept of a neighborhood restaurant that I can bring friends or family to on any day. I think Ease was a great one at that and didn't need renovation, but here we are with FPT. So far it's been great. Below are my thoughts on the menu items.

Restaurants with huge menu are an automatic fail IMO. FPT does it right in that regard. 

Pan-Roasted Salmon: cooked and seasoned to perfection. 

Crispy Calamari: The squid pieces are small, so you taste more of the batter than squid. A little bland overall, and not really crispy. I do like the occasional fried pickle they mix in there that added some flavor.  

FPT Salad: too much vinaigrette. I was a huge fan of their salad back when FPT was Ease. It was served in a big stainless steel bowl, well mixed with perfect amount of dressing. But the FPT salad was a letdown. Way too sour. I couldn't even finish it. Served on a plate so it's hard to toss the salad without accidentally dropping bits on the table. 

FPT Burger: Burger's top-notch. Even more impressive was the fries. Among the best fries I have ever had - thick and crunchy. Rosemary sea salt was a great touch.

Buttermilk Fried Chicken Salad: Great pairing. Chicken was tender and juicy; good salad. Portion was small for an entrée but big for an appetizer, so I'd consider adding another protein option if for entrée.

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Charlotte R.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description: My first trip to FPT did not disappoint.  It was packed on a Friday night with an hour wait for a party of 4. They took our phone number, and we went to get a drink at another bar while we waited. They did say that they take reservations and are on Open Table. All the drinks and food we ordered were good. The item we enjoyed the least was the cajun chicken sandwich. The server was friendly and brought our food and drinks fairly quickly for how crowded it was. I'll definitely be back!

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: MichaelElyse W.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description: My wife and ate here last Saturday the burger and the veggie pannini were excellent.  We had a 20 minute wait but well worth the wait.  We're comming back so to savor the menu

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Ashley F.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description: It's an improvement from their previous brand and it fits nicely with the neighborhood. The food is better than it was when they were Ease, and the staff were friendly and hard working. They give kids a bendable toy and sheet which is a nice touch. I hope they can keep up the good work and stay consistent. I recommend giving them a try.

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: Andrew B.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description: Excellent new restaurant in Regent Square! Waited several months for this to open. Nicely renovated inside and the food was delicious. Less expensive than its predecessor and much better food. I think this restaurant will do extremely well in the area.

wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.author: T T.
wWiD3B6p5Dwu9jeQs6GJBA.description: This is exactly the type of place we've dying to have in the neighborhood-ish (Squirrel Hill residents of 10 years). The cozy and stylish decor make it so inviting and give such a positive feeling. We tried 3 different cocktails and they were all outstanding, super fresh tasting and very fairly priced. We tried the deviled eggs and cured vegetables which were delicious but $5 for one and a half eggs is a bit too much. The charcuterie board was definitely the low point with only 2 cheeses and a very minimal selection of salami - just one type and only a few slices and at that very overpriced but at least tasty. Entrees tried were meatloaf and pork chop - again delicious and satisfying if not a few dollars over-priced.  Our service was super friendly but definitely lagged at several points - waiting to order drinks and waiting to ask for the check (another server ended up coming by to ask us). The entrees were slow to come and did not get an update from the server. A different server who brought them out apologized for the wait and that at least was appreciated. Other than these few things it would have been 5 stars. We will absolutely be back - just won't ordered the apps we did. And trust that the service will improve after the opening week. We're just so happy to have this place!

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Faith A.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description:
I was shocked to actually enjoy myself at the Ugly Dog.  I was told to expect something completely unlike what I ended up experiencing as it was described to me as a hole in the wall dump that was filthy.  Minus the smokieness, and the fact it was totally packed, I had a great time and cannot say anything bad about it!  

I did not have food, just some beers, and got to enjoy some awesome people watching, sports on TV and good music brought to us by the DJ... some older school goodies too!

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: William M.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: The service was great as were the sides!  The sides were the best I have ever had at a bbq place.  We really enjoyed the fried pickles, coleslaw, greens and biscuits. The meat looked good but the pulled pork was dry, the ribs and link didn't have much flavor like they were cooked on a gas grill.  I didn't smell smoke when I was walking up to the building and that should have been the giveaway!

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Roxy S.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: We came here for Saturday night . September 28 at 1am a group of 5 people . It was really unpleasant to find out after we all order beers one minute later , they tell us to leave they are closing at 1am instead of 2am . We decided to come here to play pool and consume beers . They security guy a big African American guy tell us at 1:04 to finish our drinks because the bar is closing . Bartender was nice to serve us but it would of been nice to have a warning how the place is closing at 1am . I travel a lot for work it would be really nice that the business owner updates the working hours to 1am and not 2am on Saturday's .

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: TJ M.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: My boyfriend and I waited 12 minutes to get a drink at the bar while 5 other people came in after us and got served.  A customer from across the bar pointed us out to the bartender and still nothing.  We left. That is ridiculous to wait that long.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Jesse T.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: The Ugly Dog Switched owners a couple of years ago and it was closed for a while, but has been reopened for at least 18 months. I've told the current staff that yelp has them marked as Closed, but apparently they're having trouble getting them to change their status to open. Anyways, I find that since they've reopened, the staff has been much friendlier and inviting, they've made a few minor upgrades, but for the most part it's still very similar, I do wish they had a better liquor selection, but hey, it's pretty standard dive bar offerings. I'm hoping that Yelp sees this review and marks this account as open. I can't imagine how much business they've lost since being designated as closed for all this time.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Allison M.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description:
It's a hit or miss here. This time the blue cheese was like water, I've never seen so much breading on wings in my entire wing eating life, the service was slow but they only had one bartender one so it wasn't her fault. (It's a wrap around bar). The Mac and cheese bites were good. The wings were also cold. Big disappointment on the wings. Used to come here all the time and no consistency.
Update; the bartender confirmed the wings are from restaurant depot.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Jeff L.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: Been coming here since I was a kid.   I love it.  It's friendly.  Food is decent.  Drinks are good.  It's a bar serving bar food but a great place for the local bar feel.   Employees are fun. Food is good drinks are good and prices are great!

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Chelsea M.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description:
Update: We stopped in for wing night last night. You could order them 6 per flavor in the past. Last night, we found out that we had to order them by 10's. Man i loved ordering them 6 per flavor :\ Its still not a big deal though. 

Our drinks were strong and the bartender was ok. 

Our wings and fries took 35+ minutes. I understand it was wing night, but i've been there during a more crowded thursday and still got wings in less than 15 minutes. 

...Still an awesome deal and great flavors. Last night we ordered Garlic Parm, Honey Garlic BBQ (!!!!!!), Lemon Pepper & Caribbean BBQ (too sweet for me). The fries seemed beer battered and were delicious!

Can i ask though... why is smoking allowed where food is cooked and served. That's a little confusing......

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Matt B.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: Stopped in on Thursday, wing night! Huge wings, good sauces. Only rated it a 3 because it's smoking. But I would go back for wing night!

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Shannon G.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: Are specials of the week are awesome from $1 blue moon Mondays to $3 bloody Mary Saturdays..4 free tacos on Tuesday and wing night Thursday we have an amazing bar crew jukebox is always jamming stop down any day or night for a drink or something good to eat..leave a comment on our website about your experience at the ugly dog..

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Jason W.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: I had not been to this place for awhile and decided to give it a try with a group of people going to check out a band this previous Wednesday. The bar was busy and the bartender, a blonde girl named Jessica I believe was working. She seemed very irritated to have to serve people. She was very rude and would be talking to friends I'm guessing for long periods of time. I was never treated this poorly at any bar or restaurant ever. There are other bars that will be happy to take our money. Never again would I go there!

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Yep N.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description:
For my first experience at this place, a three is a fair rating since I am only able to review the service, atmosphere and prices. 

The service was pleasant and attentive considering there wasn't much of a crowd to  compete with. But, it was early in the night and it seemed to be a place to go later in the night. 

The only thing that left me scratching my head was that I had originally heard about the Ugly Dog from a friend raving about their food. And while we didn't order any food (see below as to why) I can't understand how a place known more for its food can still have patrons smoking inside? 

I generally don't mind the smell of cigarettes in an open-air setting but in a closed bar with no fan movement, it leaves the smoke lingering around my face. I considered ordering food but couldn't get past the idea of my food ending up tasting like the thick smoke of the bar. 

Maybe there needs to be a compromise of smoking inside after as certain time to allow for a dinner/food crowd to enjoy the food without being subject to secondhand smoke clouding their food. 

Overall, I will likely be returning - hopefully to  order food.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Jason D.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description:
The place is alright, it's average bar and has relatively average bar food...even at that standard.  It gets an alright happy hour crowd, or an alright place to grab a sandwich and some wings.

I have a fair amount of memories when I first moved to Pittsburgh.   They used to have free chicken wings with the purchase of a drink so you could go and have wings and a few drinks cheap.   They no longer do this because I can't imagine that they made money on it.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Sam R.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: I went here on a Monday during the day. Amanda the bartender was awesome during my visit. Very quick, good personality and really cares about the bar. I had wings, they were fantastic. I will definitely come back.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Ben D.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: I go here for lunch once a week with a few co workers. It is usually on Monday or Wednesday. Monday is $6 burger day, and Wednesday is $5 anything for lunch day. The bartenders are awesome. We always get their burgers and they are great. Very consistent. For the price, this place is great. I usually just get water, but their bar is very large with many different liquors and lots of beers on tap. They have a lunch card where you get your 10th lunch for free.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: David S.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: Great wings and pretty cheap drinks. They have 4 dart boards and 2 pool tables as well. Really good dive bar with a decent crowd.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: A B.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description:
I have never been treated so poorly by an establishment.  I was with three friends, who recieved their food an hour before I did.  When the waitress finally returned with my wings, I told her that I was upset.  She said if I refused to pay for them that she couldn't let me eat them and that I had to leave and never come back.  I asked to speak to a manager, who told me that it was busy, too bad! I have only complained at 1 other establishment in my life.  Needless to say, I will never be back- because I'm not allowed!  

Can't testify on the wings since they were taken from me before I had a chance to enjoy a meal with friends.

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Christina B.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description:
I have been to this place on more than one occasion and let me just say, each time has been great. The food & drinks are reasonably priced and if it's a game-day, there are always drink specials. I find the waitstaff are nice to you if you are nice to them. (Which is really any place you go unless they are automatic as*holes)

This past Sunday I attended a comedy show they hosted, which was hilarious and quite entertaining. Of course while I was there I ordered their hot wings with ranch/celery and a couple nice cold drafts to wash it all down. So good every time! The wings aren't super "hot" (as in spicy) but just have that perfect "kick" to keep you drooling for more. I tried my friends' wings, but I can't seem to remember all the different kinds we ordered. (Besides my hot) I'll find out & update. I do have to add one *special note* that the one bartender was running all over timbuktu getting our food/drinks, while still tending to the bar. She did a wonderful job and was really nice about us ordering more wings...some time later. Ha! 

You may be wondering after reading this review (Thanks btw) why I didn't give it 5 stars...and that is only because this establishment allows smoking. Now, I will have one every so often so I'm not trying to be a hypocrite, however, I don't care to inhale nor smell smoke while I'm trying to eat. I found the best choice is to sit in the dining area (To the right as you walk in) where not as many smoking fellas venture.

I highly recommend visiting on Sundays when it's 30 cent wings (Increments of 5 wings per your choice of wing sauce).

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Jason M.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description: I have been coming here for years with my softball team. Great place, friendly bartenders, very good food. Always treated well. Highly recommended!

HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.author: Von E.
HjCCyjPiqg_cRMdwEzODUQ.description:
Von 11/17/2013
The wings are good. Many selections. A large array of beer choices. The barmaid was very friendly and helpful. The customers were friendly as well. Prices were fair. One draw back, this is not a clean place. Terrible bathrooms and the kitchen, which you can view does not inspire an appetite. But the wings were tasty.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: J P.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
OUTSTANDING!!!!'nm

I was visiting my son in January 2019 and finally make a stop here for lunch.  So glad we did

The pierogis are fantastic 

The fish sandwich excellent

The Haluski is out of his world

Service is great. Love this place.  A stop. On every visit to Pitt

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Rachel O.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
I wish I could join in with the others and say Guy Fieri is never wrong, as we have eaten at many of the joints he has visited and loved them. However, in this case, he's wrong. Way wrong. 
They opened at 4, we arrived at 4, and upon entering we were told the kitchen wouldn't be ready to serve food for another 20 minutes. We were so excited that Guy loved this place, that we decided to wait. 
Once being seated and looking around, the building is disgusting. So much mold, the ceiling is moisture stained and bowed with holes in some places, the ceiling fan had a thick layer of dust on it, the cooks were coughing all over the food, and the covers on the tables weren't clean. I don't know how this place passes any kind of health inspection. 
The service was mediocre at best, which wasn't entirely her fault as she was the only one working both the bar and the dining room. 
The food was also mediocre at best. They were out of multiple items, some of which were the ones we wanted to try. I ended up having the polish platter (which they would not add an addition single pierogi to) and my husband had the chicken parm. Both had very generous portions for a fair price point, which is always a plus, but the food was nothing special. The pierogi are huge (the potato and cheddar was good, the spinach and feta was okay), the huluski was soggy and disgusting, the sauerkraut was pretty good. On his, the sauce was pretty good, the chicken was at least cooked thoroughly, but the pasta had clearly been made previously and was stuck together and hard and just off-putting. 
We should have followed our gut and left without eating, but we had so much love and faith in Guy that he wouldn't steer us wrong (and all the great reviews I read on here convinced us to stay) but I will never come back and I will never recommend it to anyone.
I generously gave two stars for the good pierogi, and service that was not completely her fault.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Kristen H.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
I saw this place on Diners Drive Ins and Dives.

We had to go.  I thought my fiance was going to die after eating his entire Polish Platter and the half of mine I couldnt finsih. If he had to die Id want it this way for him; doing what he loved.

The food is GOOD.  So GOOD.  And not just the pierogies, the sandwiches are great and so is the meatloaf.  Its a dive bar but its warm and friendly.  I highly recommend you check out this hidden gem.

The pierogies are HUGE and they are to die for!

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Liza L.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
I would give this 2 1/2 stars but that's not an option. 
For fun when visiting other cities we like to go to places that is"known" for something, for example we looked up where Diners, Drive Ins, and Dives is and head there. We were greeted with a lecture on calling ahead next time with a party of that size. What?! There was 4 people in this place. One being at the bar. She proceeded to tell me that when busy the kitchen can't handle a party this big. Ok. It was around 3:30 and 4 people where there. Then I asked what Guy ate because really that's what brought me there, the waitress couldn't care less that he was there or that I even asked about what was featured. The cheddar pierogi was good alongside Mott's applesauce. Fetta was just ok, and the glop my husband got was just that, mushy glop (cabbage and gnocchi I think it was) that was to peppery and just a mess. Soda was flat. There's barely any lighting and the ceiling looks like it might cave in on you any moment. Stay away. 2 1/2 stars at best and that's for the store bought applesauce and cheddar perogies and onions.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Kelsey P.
