r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: Great food! We were a little worried about the location but it's a calm quiet area and you walk through a very chill bar to a restaurant. Staff was friendly. Food portions were very large and super tasty! We had stuffed banana peppers, pierogis (all 3 flavors), fish sandwich, and haluski. All of it was great! Would definitely go back if we were visiting Pittsburgh again.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Tamara G.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: I give the Starlite 5 stars for yummy home cooked Pittsburgh-ese food! If you want hands down the BIGGEST pierogies you can get, this is the place for you. And you have choices of pierogi fillings such a spinach & feta. Mmmmm. Now, don't expect anything modern or fancy at Starlite. And service, although friendly, is dreadfully slow. I come here for dinner usually before going to a show next-door at Moondog's. I always allow an hour and a half for dinner and that's even when I'm by myself! They are pretty prompt on taking your order, however the kitchen can take up to an hour to actually prepare your food. At least you know it is hot and just cooked when it arrives. I have not had a lot of different choices here, but have eaten dinner here on a Saturday night about three different times in the past five years. The pierogies are to die for, they also have a Polish platter, but many entrée choices and burgers and cheese steaks and chicken sandwiches and the like. Their wings are full sized fried chicken wings not tiny buffalo wings and so they are huge. It seems all their appetizers are pretty large servings as are their entree meals as well. Last night I ordered a large cheese steak, but without the bun, it came in a bowl and I added lettuce and tomato so it was like having a giant steak salad with the steak grilled onions and mushrooms and peppers on the bottom and the salad on the top. It was delicious! I also had a house salad with that, and four diet Pepsi's and my total bill with the tip was only about $13. Alcoholic Drinks are not expensive. My friends had the chicken wings, zucchini appetizer which was also huge & the three pirogi platter, which looked like a veritable buffet for two. The women's restroom is clean and actually spacious and in the back room where the larger dining room is. They have bands that play in the back dining room as well. If you pass by The Starlite lounge it is definitely worth a stop. I think they were featured on one of the Food Network television shows about diners and dives several years back. The crowd in the bar is an older crowd, many of them I assume are locals & regulars , but like I said,  the servers seem to be friendly to everyone who eats there.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Tom S.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: Go here and eat. Jalapeño and cheddar pierogis, to die for. Guy Fieri is never wrong.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Heather R.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: If you love the traditional pierogies, haluski and kielbasa you'll love this place. My husband had the stuffed pepper soup which was just amazing!  We both had the polish platter which gave us each a full meal to take home. Total bill was under $30. Good dinner. Will be back!

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Dee D.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
Well do NOT discount this off the beaten track venue.
They are supposedly known for awesome pierogies and YES, YES, YES they are as good as a home made pierogi gets.  I'm actually not sure if my polish grandmother could make any better.  OH my, big, fat, stuffed pierogi sauteed in butter and onion ..... well that pretty much says it all there.
The Starlight lounge is a very old neighborhood bar and now bar/restaurant serving some pretty darn good comfort polish food and fish.  Belly up to the bar, order yourself a drink from the friendly bartender, get yourself a plate of delicious old world style pierogi and ENJOY !!!  

Friendly, affordable and delicious.  Sometimes amazing things come in unexpected places.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Paula S.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
Ridiculously good. Fish sandwich was one of the best I've had. Never eat fried fish, but gave it a try. Tarter sauce seemed homemade (hate it when you get pre-packaged). Fries - hot! Fresh! Yum! Slaw had great flavor. 

Now let's talk Pierogis - amazing! My husband got the platter. Never have I seen such large ones. Filling was terrific. Creamy and rich.

Top it off - beer came in a frosty glass. Frosty glades are way under rated. Every bar and restaurant should do this!

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Trish I.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
There are some hidden gems in the area that are still "old" Pittsburgh and this is one of them.  The atmosphere is classic, the people are great and the food is amazing. 

Things to try: 
- Fish sammy
- Pierogies (all of them are great)
- Wings
- Meatloaf
- Burgers

Basically the entire menu is fabulous ... You could try anything and probably enjoy it. 

Every Tuesday, there is a an old-school bluegrass jam in the back room.  You can bring an instrument and play along, or just find a seat and listen.  It's a true jam -- they go around the circle and ask if you want to lead a bluegrass tune ... if not, you just pass and play along to the next song that's called.  

All around good people and always a good time.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Roy R.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
Starlight lounge is associated with Moondog's Blues music venue.

Clearly the local population liked the Starlight Lounge.  Whenever I would walk up from Moondog's to get a short order of food while waiting for a music group at Moondog's, they had a decent loading of customers.  Wait staff has been excellent each time; food is but bar food.  There is no five star chef working here.  Last time I ordered, the waitress placed the order, then the cook came out and... in front of me ... chastised her for allowing a "side" that wasn't part of the options.   No points made with me there.  I've rated this a 2 but it could easily a 1....   // on edit, and a comment from my partner, we are changing this to a 1.  She will never eat from there again apparently.//.

If you are going to Moondog's, and ask for food, you will be referred to the Starlight lounge.  Think ahead, and eat ahead.  You can do better.  Any national chain fast food will be better.

f8 and be there.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Mr M.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: PIEROGI ARE GREAT!! FOOD IS GOOD, BUT This place is a dive. It was on drive ins diners and dives about 10 years ago. But the Pierogi are the bomb. I will go there again for the Pierogi they are that good. It is hard to really rate a restaurant or bar such as this.  The food is good but the place needs remodeled, or is that the CHARM that they want??? 2.5 stars

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Al M.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
The atmosphere is very old world with the emphasis on old. However, one bite of a pierogi that has been exquisitely fried will make it all worth while. I had the pierogis, haluski and kielbasa platter. It was very filling and very tasty. 

Barkeep was friendly and helpful. Patrons were all from the neighborhood. I'll return. 

I'm feeling very Polish now.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Ann C.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: Food is good when the waitress can properly charge you. I get the same meal constantly and pay different prices everytime. Owner is rude & doesn't handle customers well. My job places fairly large orders and they up-charge when there is more people so I advise to place orders separately. They also give smaller portions when you order in a group. Food can be as greasy as the bar is sometimes but i gotta say the pierogies are ok. I  will never place an order for me & my coworkers again.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Phil S.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
Don't come here for the atmosphere, come for a taste of what Slavic/Polish food is supposed to taste like. As someone who spent years in Pittsburgh but never ate here until recently, it is a revelation. 

I know this was on the Food Network and all, but it's not really a dive as places in this area go. It's a standard working class lounge with a restaurant in the back that happens to serve darn good food, if that kind of food is your cup of tea. 

If you have never had standard Slavic food, you won't find it much better anywhere outside of the old country. Go try it.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Jenni H.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description:
We're visiting from Milford, Ohio.  We picked this place because we love eating at places featured on the Food Network, especially on Diners, Dives and Drive Ins.  Dive?  Ummmm, yea.  for sure.  I know Guy Fieri says, "if its funky, we'll find it."  but I just couldn't imagine him there! 
talk about a small, tiny, bar.   Would NEVER have gone here if we weren't looking for it.  
The waitress/bar maid was VERY nice.  She recommended what was served to Guy; the fish sammy and the perogies.  i've never had perogies.  From what I understand, perogies are very small.  these were huge.  I don't know, I'm sure they were awesome........I just don't think they are for me.  It was  like fried mashed potatoes.   I'm thinking Perogies is a cultural/area food.   Just not something I'm going to crave. 
     The fish sam was good.  
Seemed the patrons are regulars.    
This is not a place I would crave; not a place I would visit again if I were back in town.  But thanks for the experience.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Brian F.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: This is the second time I have come for lunch and I have the place to myself-- which is ok for me, but too bad for you! The soups are homemade excellent- just had the chicken and dumpling. So good. Now on to the famous pierogis which are tops. Ok, Starlight isn't trendy/swank but that's just another plus in its appeal column. I consider a place like Starlight a treasure where more and more, places like it are being replaced by chain crap. Do yourself a favor - come here, get some real food done well at an awesome price, and ditch the fast food and the not-so fast food places that make the food in Omaha or somewhere, freeze it (last year) so it can be fresh-microwaved today.

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Aimee J.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: Been going here for a year now. The pierogies are the best in the business! As others have mentioned, if you need catered to and fancy surroundings, this isn't the place for you! However, if you're looking for great food and feeling like you're with family, this is your place! Every time we go, we have a great time! And it's clean. Even the bathroom! I'll continue to travel 40 min to go here!

r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.author: Dean A.
r6YlsmM53fDwbRNlNl-OUQ.description: Ok, this place is my absolute favorite place to come and play bluegrass music on a Tuesday nite.  I fly here from TN just to be part of it - when I can :)

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Alex D.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description:
Yes, yes, YES!! We loved going to the place in Shadyside, and were ecstatic when we learned that they were opening this place up in Fox Chapel. My wife and I have been enjoying their pizza for quite some time, and this was a very welcome addition to our repertoire of pizza establishments we love.

The dough is super nice - has a little stretch to it, and definitely picks up all the yumminess of the wood fired oven. You really can't go wrong with any of their options - I love their Pizza della casa with arugula and Pizza del Re the most.

It's a little chaotic on weekends, but it's nice to see a new business bustling - I want them to succeed. I haven't tried their gelato yet but it looks amazing. Give them a try - you won't be sorry!

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Bob J.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description:
Three star average?!  Are you kidding me?!  Amazing pizza with hand made yeast dough.  Fresh salads.  Great gelato.

Sure the main menu is limited to pizza and panini.  But they do it very well.

Do you leave here stuffed to the gills on dough?  No.  Maybe that's why folks give this low ratings.  But if you want flavorful ingredients on wonderful, fresh dough, this is the best pizza I have had in years and absolutely the best I have had in Pittsburgh.

Abundant parking in dedicated lot at the Blawnox/Fox Chapel location.  Clean, bright and fresh decor.  We were a bit over-chilled by the A/C.  Not a white table cloth experience but high-end pizza place with a happy and boisterous crowd that slowly thinned out during our visit late one evening.

Good service.  Spoke with the manager to offer compliments on server and everything else about the food.  Often, our dining experience is uneven.  Appetizers good but entree not so much.  That sort of thing.  Not at Mercurios.  Everything was first rate.

Do yourself a favor and give this spot a shot!

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Colin M.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description:
Really glad to have another Mercurio's, especially one close to home. We stopped in here shortly after they first opened and despite some minor new restaurant tweaks, are off to a great start.

My pizza was a little thicker than I've had at their Shadyside location, and they had some logistical issues as everyone's salads were coming out after the pizza, but it was still a great meal.

Restaurant wise, it was cooler in the back and the front section was fairly warm - probably due to the oven, but hopefully something they can remedy. We were too full for gelato this time, but they all looked delicious.

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Wes N.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: A great new spot in Fox Chapel. They specialize in pizzas and gelato. The service here was excellent. The restaurant space is pretty cool, they have a bar (alcohol), gelato and a pizza area. We had a variety of pizzas including the marinara, lasagna and prosciutto. The marinara was simple but absolutely fantastic. The lasagna pizza was great too. The prosciutto was fine but I wasn't on board with how the prosciutto was basically just placed atop the pizza and not really incorporated into it. Their crust is really great. Make sure you try the gelato, they have a ton of flavors. Definitely check this place out.

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Jen W.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: This place is great- it's classic Neoplaton - done in a wood fire oven in front of you. Wait staff was a little green - but hopefully they will learn! Overall great place and very friendly- the guys making the pizzas are nice

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Joe S.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: Love it here. The marinara pizza is the best. All the salads are great. So glad there is high quality food in this part of town

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Laura A.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: I was super excited to try this place. Unfortunately it didn't live up to the expectation. Hostess, bartenders and servers to busy with their cell phones to get our order correct. We wanted arrincini but got the caprese appetizer instead. The pizza wasnt that great. I got the lasagna pizza. It lacked flavor. For the price, i wouldn't waste your time.

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Gemma P.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: Our first time here and we weren't too impressed.  The house salad was good and the panini was decent, but the pizza was meh.   We ordered a pizza that was simply sauce and fresh mozzarella for my 5 year old. There may have been 8 pieces of melted cheese which is all she ate of the pizza.  We also ordered the lasagna pizza (pictured).  My biggest complaint is how soggy/soft/limp the pizzas were.  The lasagna pizza had a little more to it, but it wasn't worth the price.  The runny sauce tasted just like tomatoes. Not much seasoning at all.  Didn't have the gelato, went to Baskin Robbins instead.  Most likely won't go back.

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Dana C.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description:
This one is good, but the better one is in Shadyside.  The food is better, and this place is just too loud!!!  Maybe if they put some acoustics in it would be better....  
We didn't stay for desert, but the food was okay. 
Not one of my favorites....

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Sally B.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: Went to the soft opening with a few co-workers and the atmosphere was warm and welcoming, the decor was rustic and clean, the food as delicious as always, and the service fantastic. We tried both appetizers offered with the soft opening limited menu, both salads, and had to get seconds of everything! Plus we each got a pizza so that we could all share and sample a bit of something new. Everything was tasty! Definitely coming back for more after work happy hours, and considering adding them to our work meetings catering rotation. Hope they add drink specials for work happy hours!

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Anna T.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: Food and service were amazing. The food was made with fresh ingredients and tasted amazing!

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Ryen B.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: Was so excited to try this place as we were passing through from IN. Very disappointed to find out they only do gluten free Monday - Wednesday so it couldn't get pizza, but my husband said his was amazing. I heard the manager tell another customer that was leaving because of no GF pizza that nigh it's says it on the website. I cannot find anywhere on the website where GF is M- F so please update the website. Also bummed to see no substitutions on the menu as I have a dairy allergy and cannot have cheese. 3 stars because my husband liked his pizza and the bartender was great, but disappointed in the visit for myself.

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Bob P.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: Simply the best pizza around.  If you have room, the gelato is a great guilty pleasure.

yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.author: Larry H.
yT1Ad3auuw1jAJEZHr7Yqw.description: Great new location, roomy and the great pizza  & Gelatos        Is there any better combination?

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Christina B.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description:
After hearing good things about this place we decided to give it a try. Ordered delivery on a Thursday. Was given an hour delivery time and it was delivered promptly within that time-frame. 

Order included:

Famous Frankie Fries - these were ok, nothing out of this world 

4 Cut Square Pizza (just cheese on top) - Loved the sauce! However not a lot on the pizza. Crust was light and airy. We prefer a more dense Sicilian pizza. But it was good!

Saved the best for last! 
12 piece chicken - this chicken was delicious!!! I can't wait to order it again. We ate all 12 pieces. My 4 year old kept asking for more! Even my picky 1 year old kept motioning for more chicken 

Will be ordering again for sure :)

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Mike M.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: Heard a lot about the buffalo chicken pizza here so I had no choice but to see what the hype was about. I ordered a BBQ chicken and a buffalo chicken pizza.  I must say I am very impressed.  Both pizzas were some of the best I've had in Pittsburgh so far and the homemade ranch was a nice surprise.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Sandra A.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description:
Best bbq chicken pizza I've ever had! 
Quality ingredients, and paired with the ranch they provide, it's very tasty!  
They have more than one location, and if one isn't in your area, you can use a delivery service.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Junie B.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: Probably gross to hear but there were finger nails in my sons slice of pizza. 4 of them. Like someone stood over the pizza clipping their nails. And we ordered through Uber eats and they gave us a huge runaround. And franks wanted no part of it and was completely unhelpful. And the stickers were intact when we got the pizza which I didn't know was a big deal because this was our first time ordering from Uber. Anyway. Gross

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Ciara M.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: I normally love Frank's buffalo pizza with their amazing ranch dressing, but this location the chicken was cooked too long and was hard and the pizza was just not what it normally is at other Frank's pizza and chickens.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Chad B.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description:
I love a good Buffalo Chicken Pizza and Frank's is one of the best!  In fact, probably my favorite so far in Pittsburgh.  I had driven past Frank's several times and was always curious about it so one Friday night I decided to call in a delivery order. I went with the large Buffalo Chicken Pizza which also came with three of their homemade ranches for dipping.  With delivery and everything it was right around $20.

The Pizza itself was a decent size and arrived quickly and hot.  I tried a piece on its own first and it had great flavor but was a little on the dry side.  That wasn't a problem though because of the amazing ranch dipping sauce!  This stuff is great!  I'd buy it on its own just to have for chips or vegetables. Next time I order I'll have to ask if they sell it separately.  My guess would be yes otherwise they are missing a cash cow!

I can't speak for their other pizzas or chicken but if this is any indication, I'm sure it would be great. I'll be checking out more of their menu over the next few months.

***Update*** Tried a regular pepperoni and order of breadsticks. I highly approve! The pepperoni pizza with the ranch is amazing. Breadsticks were plentiful and tasty!

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Brad H.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description:
I have not had anything other than the Buffalo chicken pizza.  That is what Franks is kind of known for and this alone is enough to warrant five stars.

Franks has without a doubt the best buffalo chicken pizza I have ever had.  I am a huge Buffalo chicken fan, and some places fall short when they try to put it onto a pizza. But Franks has it down perfect.  The crust is flavorful, but not overpowering.  The Buffalo sauce is a perfect degree of heat and taste.  The cheese compliments the other flavors.  Finally, their homemade ranch is some of the best I have ever had.  Makes for the perfect topping on an already amazing pizza.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Hanna B.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: Their pizza is absolutely delightful! It's worth a drive to get and the staff is very friendly.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Nena U.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description:
Franks Pizza and Chicken is a resturant that a co-worker of mine introduced me too.  Its one of those hidden gems no doubt.  

Best Buffalo Chicken Pizza I have ever had. If you don't live close its worth the drive. The ranch that accompanies the pizza is amazing.  

The resturant carries pizza, salads, calazones, and plenty of chicken varities.. such as roasted chicken, tenders, bites etc. 

The appetizer selections:   mac and cheese bites, potato pancake bites etc. 

There are several locations.. I have only visited the North Hills location.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Michele L.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: Pizza is good, the place is busy on the weekend, 40 min for pickup on Friday @ 7:00.  The Buffalo Chicken Pizza with Ranch is awesome stuff!!!

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Tricia B.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description:
Game night with some friends and we were hungry for some pizza and chicken. Lo and behold, my friend happens to have a menu in her menu drawer that is from a place that has both pizza AND chicken in its name....sold!

Right on the front of their menu, they claim that they are famous for their "broasted" chicken and their buffalo chicken pizza, so naturally we all decided we wanted to try that. My friend who picked up the goods said that the chicken smelled so delicious that he seriously considered just pulling off to the side of the road and eating it all himself, but luckily, our food made it back to our game night unharmed.

So I don't exactly know what "broasting" is, but I'd like to eat all of my food in broasted form from now on. The chicken was AMAZING. Super juicy, crispy, well-seasoned...everything a good piece of chicken should be. I can definitely see why Franks is famous for their chicken. Now the buffalo chicken pizza? Meh. I mean, it wasn't bad. But I think expectations were high given that they claim that this is their signature pie. The crust was pretty good...nice and chewy. But the pie itself seemed kinda dry. Maybe not enough buffalo sauce? The cheese wasn't particularly gooey, and the chicken strips on the pizza were also a bit dry. Like I said, it wasn't bad, but no one thought it was really all that good either. The homemade ranch sauce that it comes was with quite tasty though. Overall, the consensus among my friends was that the pizza was a 3 and the chicken was an overwhelming 5, yielding a solid 4 overall for Frank.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Colin M.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description:
Finally got around to ordering from Frank's, considering I pass it twice a day going to/from work. I typically don't order specialty pizzas, but decided to try their buffalo chicken pizza and "broasted" wings.

The pizza was fantastic, the right amount of cheese, a crisp dough, and plump pieces of buffalo chicken. It's a little dry which is OK as dipping in their homemade ranch is a must. 

The broasted chicken is interesting as it's supposedly a healthier option. Wonderfully juicy meat with a crisp breading. Could use a little more spice or seasoning but it stands alone pretty well.

Had a lunch delivered for less than $10, which is also great considering they don't charge a delivery fee and had the food to me in about 30 minutes. Will definitely order from them again.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Rachel C.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description:
Buffalo Chicken Pizza--Two Thumbs up!! This pizza is no joke and goes PERFECT with their homemade ranch dressing. 

Franks Pizza & Chicken has four locations throughout the North Hills area and is take-out only; however, the drive is well worth it. Enjoy!!

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Ann R.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: Very overpriced for a pizza shop. When my husband and I moved into our home, we wanted to treat our friends and family that helped us to some good pizza. We called 2 different Frank's locations closest to our new place and neither would deliver to us. The location farthest from us that we called last ended up being the one that delivered our food. We ordered two large plain pizza's and two buffalo chicken pizzas and it was $65. It's not like the pizzas are very big here. I will say that their hoagies and Frankie fries are delicious and my husband is a huge fan of the buffalo chicken pizza but it is just too expensive to regularly order from here.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Brooke G.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: This is hands down my favorite pizza in Pittsburgh. The buffalo chicken pizza and barbecue pizza is amazing. Add their homemade ranch and it is to die for. The delivery takes forever, but well worth the wait. We usually just pick up, and it's cooked perfect every time!

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Jake S.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: Probably the smallest sized wings I've had in Pittsburgh. Don't bother ordering apps or wings here. Way overpriced.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Kara H.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: Best pizza in Pittsburgh!!! The buffalo chicken pizza is the best, but the steak onion ranch pizza is really good also. Their ranch is sooooo good, nothing like it anywhere else. Not a place where you can sit down and eat but they deliver!

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Dawn Z.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: We just picked up a pizza and wings from Frank's, we had a coupon for 50% off. I said I'll take the 12 cut. The girl taking the order said it's square. Okay it probably tastes the same right ?  A photo of our "square" pizza, to be fair it did have 12 cuts. It was cold, overpriced and way below average.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Lance B.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: What happened to Mount Royal location? Pizza was always good til this last time. It was over cooked CRAP! I NOTICE  a new oven or what looks like a huge silver box with a window. possibly a conveyer belt ! Anyone have an idea of whats up with this. We will no longer go here as to many young and unprofessional, inexperienced  and clue less working here.

sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.author: Katie M.
sid1Wu5Z4v6yiHacGZdUeQ.description: Food is always amazing, especially the Buffalo chicken pizza.  Their homemade ranch dressing is the best! We have had them deliver a couple of times and have never had a problem. When we pick up at the store staff is always friendly.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Perry E.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
Syn has been a good edition the neighborhood overall. While it will never be able to replace the Belgian focus of the former Sharp Edge, it does a good job of bringing reasonably priced food and a good beer list to Friendship. 

Syn features both a taco menu and a pizza menu for food, with good beer and margarita selections for drinks. The taco menu is very reminiscent of Condado, so if you've been there, you'll be familiar with much of it. I very much enjoy being able to customize the food to my liking. Between the queso and tacos, I haven't had anything bad. 

The pizza menu is another story. I think it's trying to be Detroit-style pizza, but it just tastes like someone slapped some toppings on focaccia and threw it in the oven. It was not something I'd order again

The friendly staff, convenient location and solid mex-American menu have kept me going back for more and will continue to do so.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Racheallee L.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
This one time legendary watering hole and local spot has turned into a trendy Taqueria with build-it-yourself options for both pizza and Tacos. What a great combination that are combined together for all ages. 

The interior is fun and exciting. What a great place to watch sports or hosting event. I love the pinball games and then the darts for those that enjoy nostalgia gaming.  

I definitely encourage to do the build at your own but also to try some of their standard offerings that are on the menu. Full bar and great cocktail list. I absolutely love the margaritas!

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Khrys M.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
I just scrolled on through the other 1 and 2 star reviews and largely concur. We also wanted to like this place a lot and left entirely disappointed. Service was lousy and the food was entirely mediocre.

We ordered the dip combo with chips. The corn queso was okay. The salsa verde and guac were bland. We ran out of chips and it took a long time before we were able to ask for more. 

For one of my "tacos" I ordered a bowl with a base of spinach. It arrived with whole leaves of spinach (no problem there) and they gave me a *spoon* (very much a problem). A spoon to eat spinach, rice, beans, etc.  I ate my whole other taco (which was also bland) and started doing my best with the spoon before any waitstaff got close enough for us to ask for additional silverware and napkins. The rice was slightly undercooked, everything was pretty cold, and nothing had a lot of flavor. One of my tacos was supposed to have a spicy sauce on it--I couldn't tell which one.

My dining companions who ordered pizzas were also very disappointed, one remarking that a personal pan pizza from Pizza Hut was better. Those of use with tacos agreed that Chipotle is exponentially better than anything we had this evening. 

 We were never asked if we wanted any more drinks. After sitting for some time, the server abruptly showed up with four separate checks, though she had never asked how we wanted the bill split. 

I am very sorry to say that I don't even see enough promise to warrant another trip to give them a chance to find their footing.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Karla D.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
The concept of tacos and pizza in one place is brilliant I tell you. Brilliant. 
The high scores and ratings are spot on because the food is good. 
Of course we got both on our visit. Margherita pizza and barbacoa beef tacos. I had the Syn shell which is a hard shell dusted with cayenne pepper. 
Both tasty!
Since it's located at the former Sharp Edge, they have an extensive tap system which means there are lots of delicious local craft, ipa, imported and domestic pours on hand.
It's a new place and working out the kinks and we had no issues with that. 
Definitely plan to come back again because it's walkable from our house and there are so many more things to try.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Justine P.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Delicious pizza! My friends and I checked out this place on Friday night, pretty dead for a weekend evening.  The service was slow , but the food was good.  I enjoyed the queso & Hated the pineapple salsa.  I created my own pizza which was fantastic! I didn't love the el jefe taco, but I would come back to try more in the future! The place is worth checking out , but expect great customer service or a quick bite to eat!

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Megan M.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: SYN tacos AND pizza was great! Same concept as condado where you can customize your tacos and pizza toppings, shell types, crust, etc. We tried a taco and a pizza and both were delicious. I had banana peppers, chorizo, and hot honey sauce pizza and a chicken portobello taco with all of the fixins. My friend ordered one of their cocktails and it was tasty as well. They also have a huge beer selection and we will definitely come back! The space is huge, probably a great place for a party or to watch a sporting event.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Stephanie C.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
Pizza AND tacos? I really wanted to like this place. I heard of it through Instagram, and it's close to my house, so my fiancé and I tried it for dinner this evening. I'm honestly shocked by the ratings thus far? Which were another reason why we were compelled to give it a shot. 

We experienced poor service, poor food, and poor drinks. 

Service - our waitress seemed confused. She forgot the chips & salsa we ordered, and we never saw her again until she brought our entrees. After we finished our food (well i didn't, my fiancé did rather than waste), we waited about 10 minutes just to see her again to request our check. 

Food - for such a small size, the pizza can get expensive as you add toppings. We spent $40 for a pizza, 3 tacos, and 2 half off drinks. About $5 of which was just for some pepperoni (2x and hot sauce). The outside was charred, and not the good way. Tasted like a burnt dirty pan. The taste lingered for some time. The toppings were practically raw and there was an unknown cause of moisture/liquid.  The tacos were extremely greasy. 

Drinks - Both mine and my fiancé's tasted flat ? Just not cold or refreshing whatsoever. We both had drafts. 

Atmosphere -- strange and closed off. The booths are awkward. Wide and just uncomfortable wood. I think a picnic table would be more comfortable. Also the music is so bad. Though one positive is the range of TV show selection? One sports, one amc, one syfy, one food network, etc...

I am not typically compelled to leave reviews but ugh... I felt this place had potential, especially seeming so fun and new, but this evening we had a bad enough experience that we won't give it a second try.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Suzan H.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
Service: Excellent
Mexican Foods: Really Good
Portions: Nice...no leftovers
Price: Great
Italian Food: Going to try next time
Really happy this space got a new life with SYN.
I like the way you order-paper/pencil orders you complete. The server was very nice and helpful with answering questions. 
We ordered bowls-2 lettuce and spinach bowls and one rice and beans bowl. We ordered adobo chicken and barbacoa beef. I have to say I picked the winner. The barbacoa was delicious. The secret sauce was a big winner at the table too.
I wasn't a big fan of the salsa (rojo). I'm the picky one-just thought there was a little too much chipotle or something in it.
The other thing was the use of disposable plates and utensils. Most (perhaps all) were compostable. But, still trying to figure out why reusable plates can't be used. Just confusing to me.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Tom B.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Not the nicest neighborhood and not a lot of parking but the inside makes up for it. Great decor and ultra modern plus the bar looks really nice . The food and drinks were awesome plus they have a dance floor and DJ I'm back. If your in the area stop in

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: J R.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: I would return for a beer (nice selection) but nothing else.  The taco menu is uninspiring - and who wants a taco double wrapped with bacon?!  It's the stuffed crust pizza (fail) of tacos.  I made my own taco -- the chorizo and flavor was meh.  My friends ordered pizza and yes, as other reviewers said it is basically cheese on focaccia.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Katie K.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
The concept is amazing, the execution was not. 

SO bummed. We were hoping this place would knock it out of the park. We went here for happy hour, $5 margaritas, $5 queso & guac. None of these were great... unfortunately. I also ordered a pizza and was underwhelmed, even though it was a pre-made recipe. 

I hope this place gets their act together and improves their service, flavor & overall food quality.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Autumn B.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Visited SYN about 2 weeks ago on a Tuesday around 7pm with a few friends.  The bar and restaurant were pretty empty so we had a few drinks and beers at the bar while waiting for everyone to arrive and ordered some chips, salsa and queso.  The bartender was very nice and helpful and the queso and salsa were very good.  They also had mini beer pong and roulette that we played while we were siting at the bar.  We got seated and ordered some pizzas as an appetizer.  We got the thin crust, buffalo chicken and meat lovers.  They were both excellent.  We also ordered a bunch of tacos for dinner.  The tacos were also very delicious.  We would all agree that we would definitely come back, however the service was very slow.  They also lost my order of tacos so after 30 minutes waiting for them to find the slip and make them, my friends' tacos were cold.  Other than the service, the food and bar area were great and the food was really delicious. The ambiance is very nice as well.  There is a fireplace and string lights in the back room.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Daniel J.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
After seeing this place on Instagram I put it at the top of my list. We got there in time for happy hour so we got the queso and guacamole. Both of them were very obviously mass produced and not made in house. 
We moved on to the pizzas, opting for the ones they suggested, which were both forgettable. The pepperoni pizza was doused in hot honey, way too much. The buffalo chicken pizza was bland and had too much bleu  cheese. One very common theme was the absence of salt in anything we ate. 
The service was fine and the happy hour half off drafts, which they have about 50 of, is a good deal. I'd try it again but would need to hear something drastic was changed.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Sam D.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Loved it. Pizza was delicious, beer selection was good, staff was friendly as heck. Got there for happy hour too, which was a good deal. Half off drafts, and $5 margaritas and apps. Nice little unpretentious joint.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Nicole B.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Ugh, I hate writing super bad reviews, but when they're merited, they're merited. We stumbled in, since we don't live that far away. A new taco place? With some of our favorite beers and hard ciders on tap? Sign. Me. Up. Sadly, the cider/beer selection is the only thing we loved about the place. The chips starter is NOT FREE which is pretty different than any other Latin American ish place I've been to. Fine, whatever, we got their spiciest salsa and chips, which weren't anything more special than the free stuff at most restaurants, but again, whatever. Then we ordered tacos with pulled chicken and several toppings. They initially had the shrimp tacos listed as gluten free on the menu, but our server (thank goodness for her) told my gluten free not-by-choice partner that these were definitely breaded. Fine, so more chicken tacos were ordered. They came out finally and were....so sad. The chicken tasted like canned chicken at best, not pulled chicken. The flavors were flat, and the creamy toppings had no south of the border pizazz. This place rates in the worst 2 places I'd ever been for Latin American food. And it wasn't that cheap either. Save your money and go up to Beechview or to the taco truck on Penn avenue. You'll leave much happier.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Darius B.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Great pizza, great byo tacos, and an AMAZING happy hour! I also want to mention that their staff is not only diligent and knowledgeable, but they're also super nice! Have been 3 times now since their soft opening, and our experience only gets better and better. Party for 2 -  I recommend getting a pizza to split, a taco, $1.50 chips/salsa, and one of the many local beers on draft... Perfect night!

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Rose M.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description:
I want this place to be good so badly but...it just ain't working. I've been here three times so far. The first time was truly awful. Food was cold, the menu was too involved and confusing--there were too many ways to go wrong. The second time, they had added preset options for tacos and pizza and the tacos were much better. The third time, we got a preset pizza and it was...edible. 

Something about the food is just off. I'm not a big fan of Detroit style pizza, but beyond that I just don't feel like there's anything special about it. The sauce is weak and watery. The taco meat tastes like straight up cat food, I wish it weren't so but it really does. Everything tastes like it needs more seasoning or salt. And it's mad expensive! If it were cheaper, I might come here after work with friends or something but I just can't spend that kind of money on mediocre-sometimes-bad food. You can go somewhere else and get much better food for the price point.

Also, the atmosphere needs work. The bar area is kind of depressing, all this empty space and gray paint. I really hope they work it out somehow.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Justin R.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Really good design your own tacos and pizza. You play a big role in your own experience and I've already learned some of the good and bad ingredient combos. The beer selection is great and makes use of the huge number of taps they inherited from Sharp Edge. They're still in their soft opening period so they're learning. Would like to see some preset menu options and for them to realize the music is too loud for what the place is.

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Thomas S.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Great food. Great service.  Great restaurant! The bartender was especially friendly and nice.  Ordered 3 pizzas and they tasted wonderful! Plus, the churros are amazing!

fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.author: Robin R.
fRNRfDhb3VyG_fcQ9QaNhw.description: Great pizza and great tacos! I loved the option to design which pizza and tacos I wanted. Excellent beer selections. Plan to return for sure!

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Rachel C.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
Everyone will be jealous of you if you bring this with you to lunch because this place is SERIOUSLY delicious and the food here smells just as amazing as it tastes. The Cajun fries are sooo addictive and I am not even a French fry girl. The beef is also much higher quality than any other restaurant I'd ever went to - no lie - and that's a big reason these burgers are so good. It's basically the level of deliciousness that you don't even notice that you look like a starving animal or that the sandwich completely fell apart all over your face, lap and hands when you eat it. With that said, it may not be the best place for a job interview or to take your mother in law.

Even though I love this place they are going to have to provide the public with healthier and more plant based options if they want another star out of me. They are one of the few places that specializes in burgers without any vegan or healthy option whatsoever and that limits who I can come here with, how often or what I can order (sometimes I feel like going plant based for a day or so) and who I can recommend this place to. More people are going to need and want healthier more plant based options and I would like to see them make at least some effort toward that initiative. I'm confident they would find a way to make a seriously delicious vegan burger if they tried.

I only let myself go here occasionally when I have a serious burger craving as I don't think people should be eating this way on a regular basis but I can't deny this food tastes amazing!

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Tracy B.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
Was walking in at 1:15 pm to give them my first ever order. Really wanted to give them a fair shake. But a tall young man told me I couldn't come in unless I was picking up an online order. He literally blocked my way. I was so confused. Can you not just walk in and order like any other restaurant? If they were having issues with equipment or a power outage, why not just say that? 

I will give it another try another day. I haven't had a really good burger in awhile. Maybe this time they'll let me in.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Larry J.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: Love this location - good food great service. always have fresh ingredients and toppings.  The fresh cut cajun fries are soo good love them. Always stop in for a bite to eat, at any FIVE GUYS especially this one!

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Paris G.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: Just got some hamburgers, but they were very fast and good. The best part was how nice the staff were and how happy they all seemed. Everyone was extremely polite and welcoming which was pretty cool.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Eryn P.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
So many places try to make a better burger. Different meat, weird fats, or even extra seasoning on the patty. Whatever Five Guys is doing, they've got it right. 

I ordered a "Little" Bacon Cheeseburger, with the staples, lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, BBQ sauce and mustard. It was just right in size. The burger was perfectly cooked, and all the toppings were good, except the lettuce. It was like it got too hot, but it was all wilted and weird. Not a reason to get grossed out, it was still awesome.  I was with Franny and Juilian, my love-bird friends, and fortunately, got a hold of some of the fries they were sharing.  They were amazing. Maybe just a touch too much salt, but good nonetheless.  

Any place wins my heart if you have those futuristic coke machines that plop out any weird concoction of soda with random flavors like grape, peach and vanilla. Grape sprite for the win.  Try it. Trust me. 


Happy Eating!

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Pete D.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
Allen is the man! He helped us out in ways we couldn't imagine, thanks so much for your generosity. The burgers were 5/5 and the fries were delicious as expected. The drink machine is great too with 150+ combinations. Love this place! Much love from Sheevaa! 

*S*

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Annie C.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
This was my first time at 5 Guys. It took me a long time because I once read that it had the highest calories of all fast food. But despite that I tried it with my coworkers and it was delicious. I had a tiny cheeseburger with a few toppings and it was a great size. I can't even imagine what the regular size looks like! I shared fries with a coworker and I'm glad I did because even a small was a lot of food. They didn't taste like any fast food fries I've ever had before. They were really good. My last praise might be weird but I really liked the pop machines. It was one of those high tech ones where you can choose different flavors. I made a peach Sprite! I got a kick out of that. Ooh and there are peanuts that you can take while you wait for your food. Fun! 

The space was clean and I liked the decor for a fast food place. The layout in the store was odd though. We had a couple of people try to get in through the exit and since we sat near that door we had to point them to the correct door. I wish both doors would have just opened. Maybe this is an issue at a busy lunch hour. 

I'll go back but certainly infrequently because my waistline couldn't handle that too often.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Lucretiz C.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
Okay I feel obligated to take off 2 stars because of two very recent incidents. On my last trip to Five Guys I ordered a little bacon cheese burger with jalapenos. My little bacon cheese burger had NOOOOOOOOO BACON!  That alone is enough to get you 1 star.  And I know I ordered a bacon cheese burger because I double checked the receipt. Had I not been so incredibly hungry I might have noticed this more than half way through consuming the burger.  I didn't complain to the establishment because I felt bad that I had already eaten so much of it and cuz I'm passive aggressive muhahahaha. And another time I ordered a burger and the cooks smashed my burger bun and all down so hard the burger completely lost it shape. It looked real bad you'll.

I will say that I have dined here at least once a month since first finding out about Five Guys and that this restaurant has turned me into a burger craver where before I could careless about hamburgers but guys can we TRY AND REMEMBER THE BACON next time!?!  
Plus the small fry is enough to feed at least 4 people!

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Tunya K.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: Had a small bacon cheeseburger and fries today with my friend, Nancy. I had never been to a five guys restaurant before. I was pleasantly surprised. The potatoes for the fries are fresh and they post where the potatoes came from that day. The meat is fresh. Excellent service and friendly staff. I loved the fries and the burger and I am not normally a fries and burger person.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Sabrina S.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: Usually, I love 5G, but recently this one has had falling standards. For the second time this week, their fries have been burnt and come out slow. 10 minutes? For fries? No. All I ever order is fries, and they've usually been good up until now. If I wanted to wait 10+ minutes for food, I would go to Wingharts or the Yard. But for now, I guess I won't be coming back until the girl that burns fries quits or otherwise.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Colleen S.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: How can you go wrong with a burger from Five Guys? The burgers and fries are always great! I love that they have the self-serve soda machine with every flavor combination imaginable. If you are going during the lunch rush, make sure you are ready to scope out a table where people are almost done eating or be prepared to take it to go. This place gets packed during lunch and there have been times I've struggled to find a table.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Gwen S.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: Had lunch here while in Pitt for the weekend. I enjoyed a double cheeseburger and fries, with a delicious mouth watering cherry Coca Cola. I think I may now have a new favorite fast food burger... :)

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Dee P.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: Employees could be a bit more friendly. Only my 2nd time here and didn't leave me with a great impression. First time I was here though the cashier was fantastic - very helpful and friendly - so I will give it another try.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Makelle T.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: Probably one of the best burger joints in the city. The service is very fast and everyone is extremely professional. The restaurant is clean and the atmosphere seems very chill haha. This is really one of those "you get what you pay for" places, the food is great/high quality + you get a lot for your money. I'd def recommend this place to anyone visiting the city for the first time.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Serena T.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
Perhaps the stars were aligned, perhaps it was exactly what I wanted or it was just that good!  I decided to come to Five Guys in Market Square after work because I had an insatiable craving for a burger, but not just any burger - I didn't want a froo froo ultra fancy burger that came from a cow named "Franc"...I was in the mood for your all American standard burger but higher quality then your local fast food joint.

Man did I come to the right place!  I ordered the little cheeseburger and little fries (cajun style) to go along with it and it was soooo good.  The place is clean and organized and although there wasn't a crowd since I was coming after work, they were very efficient so I can see how this place runs smoothly during the busy lunch hour.

I got lettuce, tomatoes, mushrooms, jalapenos and bbq sauce on my burger and all the veggies were fresh and the mushrooms were perfectly sauted.  It should be noted that the jalapenos are fresh not the pickled kind for thos folks that might be particular.  What can I say - everything was perfect and I couldn't imagine getting a regular sized burger.  I barely had room for the fresh and tasty fries!

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Glenn C.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: As good as others in chain but they cook burgers in advance to handle the lunch time rush. Congestion by the condiments and straws area. Great location in market square.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Justin D.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
What can I say about Five Guys that hasn't already been said?  Great burgers and fries, reasonably priced, and excellent service.  This new location is a welcome addition in Market Square, tucked just behind Primanti bros. in the walkway to PPG Plaza.  The service was excellent.  Since this is a newly opened location they are extremely well staffed and attentive.  The store is SUPER CLEAN.  

Go closer to 11AM and beat the lunch rush.  Bonus tip: you can order your burger without a bun (in a foil bowl) or in a lettuce wrap.  Awesome!  You can also order extra of everything at no charge (may not apply to cheese and bacon).  I like to get extra jalapenos and hot sauce.  I don't limit myrself to just 1 helping of pain.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Lindsay S.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: Great, friendly, fast service by the staff.  Clean restaurant.  Extremely reasonable prices.  As a vegetarian, I can vouch that the veggie sandwich with cheese is so satisfying.  It's basically just their bun, their cheese, and as many toppings as you want.  Loved it!  The Oreo milkshake was also fantastic next to the cajun fries.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Maria B.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description: As close as I'm going to get to In 'n' Out Burger on the East Coast.  They have a similar model of doing just a few things well, instead of trying to be all things to all people.  I like that. The burger meat is fantastic--really juicy and not too greasy.  The buns are a bit wimpy, though, and by the time you finish a double patty with cheese, it's flattened to the consistency of a chewy wrap.  The fries are pretty decent, and I tried a milkshake, which was a delight.  All of that set me back about what you'd pay for a sit-down restaurant meal, though.  Even before I got the milkshake, you're hard pressed to get out of there for less than a 10 for a burger and fries, though.  I suppose that also speaks to the quality, since it definitely is a step or two above your average fast food chain.  All in all, it's just fine, but not something I would seek out on any sort of a consistent basis, or treat with the reverence of the aforementioned In 'n' Out.

kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.author: Havij H.
kJQbc861Qvm_HsNofAahDA.description:
Very bad customer service
Rude employees 
Overcharged my 10 year old and did not return the money. 
Then she completely burned the hot dog.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: David B.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description:
Newly renovated in 2016, the Rivers Club is a great place for hosting events. The staff is very professional and the location is excellent.

On issue I've noticed is often difficult to find your event. The Rivers Club is on multiple floors, so giving your attendees good directions is essential. 

The Rivers Club is located Downtown, yet I rarely have issues finding street parking, although many choose to park in their garage. 

Although not a member myself, I have several friends who belong and they enjoy the convenient, central location.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Eduardo S.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: What a great time we had here on New Year's Eve! Friendly service, great buffet, and good company. Very laid back and relaxing!

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Chris C.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: I and my family was treated rudely. And the manager was really rude. I am disappointed they would do this on an important night

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Mike S.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: I love this place. The fitness center just under went a renovation, they have all new work out equipment. The full service locker room is fantastic! The steam sauna, the shower facilities everything is perfect. The dining also recently renovated is a great spot for happy hour and a nice dinner date. The food is amazing, I've never had anything bad! The staff is amazing and really takes the time to help you navigate what is available. The wine tasting, beer tasting and numerous others activities really makes this a must if you're downtown on a regular basis!

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: G P.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description:
I am a signature gold/one member of club corp.  I travel all over the United States and have been to most club corp locations. 
This club by far had the worst service and management I have ever encountered.  They got almost everything wrong.   They had a 50% off Happy hour on well drinks but not martinis.  I ordered a gin straight up and was charged full price when I was assured it was on happy hour.
I moved to a table hoping for better service.  It was worse.  The server didn't even know how to
 open a bottle of wine.  The entree was brought at just a few minutes after the salad.  I felt very rushed and there was no other customers in the restaurant.
They were trying to clear my salad when I was only half done.  They calculated the bill wrong as well.  It was a very bad experience,

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Danielle M.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description:
This review is specific to the gym facilities only. 

I come here pretty much daily for the gym. It's nice because it's well laid out with a ton of equipment and it's very rarely super busy. If I do have to wait for the squat rack or a bench it usually only take a few minutes, aka enough time to stretch. The facilities are always clean and the locker rooms are so well maintained (especially the showers, which is amazing). The front desk staff is always lovely as well.

My few issues are that there aren't rubber plates, or enough plates, in the back lifting area, the equipment is a bit outdated, AND that the hours are limited in weekends (only stays open until 3/3:30 on Sat/Sunday).

Membership is not cheap (especially for Pittsburgh standards) but it's way better than Gold's gym around the corner if you are gym junkie.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: April Y.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: My husband and I are members of Clubcorp and wanted to check this out while we were traveling.  We had dinner.  Very nice maitre'd who showed us to our table and our waitress was very sweet.  My husband said his filet was out of this world.  I had the smoked shrimp dinner (the waitress said she'd never had anyone order it before).  The shrimp were totally bland but the goat cheese grits were delicious.  It took a really long time to get our check and our dining experience took almost two hours.  It has the potential to be a really great dinner spot but the ambiance is kind of like you just stumbled into an overlit hotel lounge.  With some improvements it could be really great.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: George M.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: Check out the new dining room and JAZZ every other Wednesday with the beautiful, soulful sounds of Jessica Lee , Mark Strickland and special guests.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Tina B.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description:
I've been meaning to write a review for the Rivers Club for quite some time. It is a wonderful wedding venue, as my husband and I held our wedding reception here. An important thing to note, you don't need to be a member! The events coordinator is extremely helpful and very friendly, while the venue itself is incredibly accommodating. Our coordinator made the stresses of planning a reception so easy and enjoyable. Typically, food at weddings can be hit or miss since they prepare all the entrees at once. But the food at our reception was absolutely perfect: the filets were all a perfect medium rare! Our guests, to this day, tell us about how delicious the food was. Not only did we have our wedding reception here, we also had the rehearsal dinner at the Rivers Club. They reserved a board room in the back for our large party and it was perfectly intimate. We could socialize amongst ourselves without any distractions from other parties. Again, everyone loved the food! On top of great food, every member of the wait staff is incredibly friendly and patient. Customer service is top-notch here. 

When our one year anniversary came, we chose to dine here to celebrate. Again, nothing but praises for the chef(s) and wait staff. We reserved a table, thinking we'd just get a spot in the dining room with other club members, but they placed us in a board room with just the two of us; so romantic! On top of that, they took the time to print out "Happy Anniversary" cards and decorate the room with candles all throughout. AND! we received a complimentary chocolate cake with "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate icing. All this special treatment and we weren't even members of the Club!

I highly recommend anyone getting married to hold their reception here. In addition, the dining room is open to the public. The Rivers Club, in my opinion, is one of the most underrated dining options in Pittsburgh. The Rivers Club really goes above and beyond to make you feel special.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Don B.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: Had dinner with a large group. Food was excellent. Service also excellent. The entire experience was marred by elevators. I happen to be handicapped and have trouble navigating stairs. For some unknown reason, the elevators would not go to The parking levels. We asked, and were told that they were turned off to that level. We were one of two large groups that evening. That is what keeps me from giving a 5 star rating, as all other aspects were quite good. Drinks are VERY expensive. As are dinners. I had a craft beer, which was good. The elevator/parking experience was the one very poor aspect, of an otherwise good experience.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Mike G.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: My wife and I stopped in on Friday night as were in town visiting. Our experience could not have been better. The staff was exceptional!

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Annie C.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description:
I attended a board meeting for Point Park's Alumni Association at the Rivers Club. It was a very professional space and very accommodating. The food provided was excellent. We had a little breakfast bar and then a deli lunch. There was more than enough food to go around and for a board meeting, it couldn't have been better! 

I'd like to go back for a dinner when there are open nights for non-members.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Jason F.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description:
I ate here with my girlfriend and 2 other friends a couple of Fridays ago.  We had reservations for a Friday night and whenever we arrived there was only one other table in the club.  Since the dining room is fairly cavernous, it was almost awkward.  As you would expect at a finer dining establishment the tables were covered in white tablecloths and there was silverware on the table for a number of courses.  We were sat near the windows which overlooked the Monogahela River and I imagine that the view would have been pretty great but since we were visiting at night in winter, there was not much to be seen.

Our table decided to start off by splitting zucchini and ricotta fritters and the caprese kabobs while I also ordered the beer & 3 cheese soup since I thought that it sounded good.  The fritters were not completely what I expected but were really good and lived up to their name of fritters.  Meanwhile the caprese kabobs left a little to be desired as they were just some tomatoes and cheese on a kabob with a little balsalmic drizzle.  Finally my cheese soup was an interesting mixture.  I could taste the beer but it also tasted strongly of American cheese, you know the singles kind that you buy presliced at the supermarket?  So while I enjoyed it initially, by the end it sort of tasted like I was drinking a grilled cheese soup which wasn't the most appealing thing.  For my entree I went with the grilled lemon-basil chicken and rosemary shrimp while my girlfriend went with one of their specialties, the honey and lime swordfish.  Whenever our entrees came is when the service went from awkward to just plain weird.  I should say that all of dinner up to that point our server was very standoffish and made us feel uncomfortable.  Well she did not clean off our appetizers and plates before the entrees came even though we were finished with everything well in advance.  Since we were only at a 4 top, our table was fairly full and dishes and the first dish that she served she ended up hovering over one of my dining companions until he made room for the entree.  While I have made room for entrees on the table before, I don't know that I have ever seen anyone pressured into it by a server.  In any case I ended up thinking that all of the portion sizes for dinner were fairly small with none of them covering more than half of the plate that they were served on.  My entree still was decent as the lemon flavoring on the chicken was good even if my chicken was dry and rosemary always pairs well with shrimp.  My girlfriend ended up describing her meal as a piece of frozen fish stuffed onto a plate with none of the promised honey & lime.  Since she is not normally one to say bad things about food, boy am I glad that I did not get that. 

The bottom line for me is that I really hope that I never come back here in the future.  The service that was provided was awkward and left me feeling uncomfortable and the food was nothing to write home about either.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Robin A.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: We had our wedding reception here in September 2013. The Rivers Club was fabulous! It couldn't have been better. Amanda Rapach was wonderful to work with. She was truly dedicated to making our day great and she was very responsive throughout our planning process. Amanda is a true professional and really make the planning easy. The food was great and so was the cake. The Rivers Club is a great venue!

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Amanda M.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description:
When a friend asked me to go in with him on a travelzoo deal to the River's Club, I was excited to get to try a new place and get a great deal. The travelzoo certificate my friend purchased was for 4 people to receive an appetizer, entree and dessert each. The total was $109. We made reservations for a Friday night and made our way downtown. When I was finally able to find the Club (2 elevators and 7 floors later), I was suprised to see that the huge dinning room was almost empty. There was only one other table dining. When we sat down, the maitre d informed us that with the travelzoo certificate, we would have $129 to spend for the table. We wer quite confused and taken aback by the fact that the certificate clearly states 4 appetizer, 4 entrees and 4 desserts but instead we were told that we would have a $129 credit instead. We looked over the menu, did the math and realized that 4 apps, entrees and desserts would be well over $129. when we explaied our disappointment to the maitre d, he first stated that there was nothing he could do and later offered to buy us a round of drinks. We obliged and carried on with our meal. The waitress picked up on our dissappointed but did not apologize or try to help. Rather, she talked to us as little as possible making the entire evening very awkward. 

As for the food, we ordered the zuchini and ricotta fritters and the caprese kabobs. The fritters were excellent and kabobs were very good as well. Both appetizers were large enough to share. My dining companion also ordered the beer cheese soup as an appetizer. He really enjoyed the flavors. For my entree, I ordered one of the specials- chicken pesto. I found it odd that my enree came with a salad but the rest of my dining companions did not get a salad. The entrees were fairly small. They covered about 50% of the plate. My chicken was seasoned well but was rather dry. My husband also felt his chicken dish was slighlty over cooked. For dessert, my husband and I split the chocolate cake. Again, nothing special. Overall, the table felt that the food was good but small portions. However, we were all disappointed that we puchased a specific deal that they did not honor.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Ricardo T.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: Excellent meeting facilities.  Great staff.  Just a little difficult to find if you're a first timer.

vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.author: Philip L.
vXpB8lRDXaWwwbmT3CAQwQ.description: I got to the river club five day a week and I love it a lot. I wish more people would go.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Melissa G.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
I came here for a late lunch on a Sunday.  It wasn't very busy at all.  We came in through the dining entrance, but no one said anything to us and there was no sign saying to seat ourselves, so we ended up walking over to the bar side and sat down.

I ordered the fried hot pepper cheese bites to start.  The ranch dipping sauce was good, but the cheese bites weren't very spicy (even for me who does not like super spicy stuff).  I ordered the cheeseburger in paradise for lunch, added bacon, and had a side of fries.  Their fries are really good.  The bacon was cooked perfectly.  And to be honest this burger was delicious, definitely better than some of the designer burger places around Pittsburgh.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Ron K.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
I was not sure whether to check this place out due to the poor service at times from the reviews. We decided to go for lunch on a Wednesday. The poor waitress seemed like they may have been understaffed, but handled the full load of people sufficiently. 
I hAd the Cajun blackened chicken. It was great, with great grilled flavor and a bit of Spicey heat. The wife had the salmon and she loved it. We'll be back for lunch and probably not during the evening hours. 
I give it 5 stars because of the good food for a good price

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Je'Amour M.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: Okay when you get a veggie wrap you expect fresh veggies not frozen and thawed and horrible iceberg lettuce service meh, french fries where a good frozen variety...I will not return ...

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Joe N.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: Slowest service ever. Every time. The blonde "bar tender" is the slowest human server ever. The pyramids were built faster than she accomplished anything. Awful.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Kerry M.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
If you live in the North Hills, chances are you're been past the Rochester Inn or have been to the Inn. Here's a tip: go around 7pm on a Monday night - you'll get a table right away. 

To be honest, I haven't been there in a few years, so I went into the restaurant with an open mind. 

To start, I ordered the potato soup. It was very good. It was a cold rainy day, so this soup warmed me right up. 

For apps, we tried the pretzels and the wings. Both were good. We would definitely order them again. 

For my entree, I ordered the Reuben. It's one of the best Reubens I've had In Pittsburgh. It is literally so good. 

The service was very good considering their kitchen is tiny. It might take a little longer for your food, but it's worth it! 

Rochester Inn has a great special every day & they have great live music on the weekends. 

You gotta check it out!

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Brittany N.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: I love the Rochester Inn! The food is great and they always have something going on, whether it is a live band playing, bingo night, etc. They have great food and drink specials and also have a private room you can rent for events! Definitely get there early because the parking lot fills up fast.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Kathy B.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: Thank you to the Rochester Inn!!  Had a party there last night. The staff, food and drink were perfect

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Bill K.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
We have been here a few different times and the service has been consistent....consistently POOR!  We waited close to an hour for our food....my sweet potato fries were totally COLD so I promptly told the waitress. The waitress couldn't be found for drink refills or to find out where my hot fries were so I had just the burger for dinner.  When we asked for the check, I said "Don't forget to remove the fries!"  She simply replied Ok, and went about her hurried way.  When she brought the check she basically dropped it on the table as she flew by...and did the same thing when she picked it up and when she returned our card.  Never a word...ZERO eye contact, not a Thank You or anything, and of course no mention of the mysterious sweet potato fries....  I made sure to leave a small note about the fries along with the appropriate tip. We at least had a good laugh about the poor service. 

Apparently the owners feel the place is busy enough they don't need to worry about being properly staffed....wait staff and kitchen.  Maybe they need to add on to the kitchen instead of continuously expanding their parking lot. Or remove the window to the kitchen so the cooks can concentrate on my hot fries instead of people watching all night. Lol.  Sooner than later all of their customers WILL receive poor service at some point and all they'll have left will be the bar patrons. At least the beer will be as cold as the fries!!!

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Nancy R.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: This is a great place! They have 44 beers on tap including a lot of great craft selections. There are tons of large TVs in the bar area and the penguins were playing the night I was there. On Saturday night they have a steak special. This Saturday was an 8 ounce tenderloin with two sides. I'm not sure if the type of steak changes because the special board just says steak special. My only complaint was I ordered my steak medium rare and it came out well done. I sent it back and the second one was done perfectly. When the bill came I expected the waitress to comp one of my beers to make up for the very badly cooked steak. She didn't so I didn't tip her and left a note. Despite this, I would definitely return as everything else was excellent. The service was good also despite the place being packed. There was also a band setting up for live music!

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Donna I.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
Not worth the wait for food. How does a restaurant add on but not expand the kitchen? On a not very busy Saturday night, we quickly found seating for the 6 of us. The waitress came pretty quickly and immediately informed us that a large group had just arrived and the kitchen was backed up, so we should place our order quickly. Since we could practically see the entire dining areas, we were unable to see the large group......

In addition, we were told that it would take an hour for our food to be prepared. Grilled items would take longer, fried food might be quicker.

Hearing that, we quickly placed our beverage and appetizer order and when she returned with the drinks we ordered our entrees. We did wait an hour and some food was brought out while some appeared much later. Never got the appetizer.

Since we were forewarned and felt pressured, we mostly stuck with the fried food. The wings are good. Do not order the Three Cheese Wrap unless you really like American cheese a lot.

Unfortunately, all restaurants in the Pittsburgh area are suffering greatly from the lack of good help thus making dining out very inconsistent.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: T. P.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: Went for an early bird dinner (around 4) since we were in the area.  We both had the wedding soup.  While not bad it was weird having little dumplings in it.  Funny thing is, the dumplings kind of looked like cauliflower when I looked at it.  I had the fish on a dish with a baked potato.  Fish needed more seasoning and it was a very small portion so I was a little disappointed in that.  Husband had the Delmonico steak which he said was ok but needed steak sauce.  If you can make a fantastic steak you shouldn't need steak sauce.  Bread pudding for dessert was fantastic !

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Christine M.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: Don't waste your time we wait 15 minutes and had to ask who are waitress was. Left without eating.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Lisa K.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: The only reason this review isn't a one star is because the food wasn't bad. We waited over an hour for our food, there was no explanation. We were rarely checked on, and when our bill came I was shocked. I questioned our server hope there was no adjustments when we waited so long and was met with aggravation from our server,how nobody told us how it goes. Huh- when I asked what that meant I was given some explanation about how you just seat yourself, and the server walked away. Do NOT go here on a Friday expecting dinner... it was an awful experience!!!

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Kimberly S.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: Had a good meal. I ordered the fish dinner it came with 2 sides, I got a side salad it was a nice size salad and sweet potato fries they were good.
