The waitress was very attentive and friendly.  Wr went late in the evening and they had bar bingo so it was a little lound. But nice place will definitely go back.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Don B.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
I was part of a large group of old guys. My first visit. I am a microbrewery fan. They had better than average choices on tap. Food was very good. Better than typical bar choices. Very good menu choices. Diverse. Service was excellent. 
My fajitas were excellent. Grilled chicken. Side of fries also good. Extra crispy!  
   Not the best spot I've been, but quite good. Food was solid, I recommend for a nice micro brew and something grilled.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: M s.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description: I'm a fan of neighborhood bars but several times I've been in here I've been harassed by several of the patrons while minding my own business. The bartenders and the owner seemed okay with the drunks that hang out here harassing patrons and do nothing about it. It's pretty sad. I would highly suggest going to other local bars like Hal's.. they would never promote girls being harassed. Would give a negative rating if that was an option!

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Colin M.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
We've been meaning to get here for some time based on some personal recommendations from our friends. We stopped by on a Friday night and were taken aback on how full the parking lot was (a good sign to start). The restaurant and bar area were pretty full, and we decided on the bar area since there wasn't a wait. We later regretted this decision as it was incredibly loud and we were chased out by the band that was setting up and clustering the area around us with equipment.

I'm going to chalk up our visit as "I probably didn't order what I should have." We went with the hot cheese balls as an appetizer, which were frankly, pretty awful. Lesson learned: always go with the mozzarella sticks.

I had a side salad with balsamic which was the best part of my overall meal as the vegetables which delicious (especially the tomatoes). But now, this is where it took a turn... not only was a band filtering in and making a racket and pressuring us to leave, our food just took forever to show up. To the point where I really wasn't hungry. As such, my wings ended up not being appetizing which was probably a mix of being full and not liking the flavor. I went with hot garlic parm and while the wings were big, they were incredibly soggy and disappointing.

We'll be back to give them another try... and hopefully they do better.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Lori S.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
Went to Rochester Inn this evening.  We sat down at 5:30p and didn't receive our food until 7:10p.  During the 1hr and 40min we waited, we were only offered drink refills once.  When the food arrived, my meal was not what I ordered.  I asked them to box the incorrect meal since I didn't want it.  They offered to get me some soup or salad but didn't offer to get me the correct food.  Really?  After waiting for almost 2hrs the best they could do was offer soup and salad? 
It was extremely busy.  They were obviously working hard.  Notification of the long wait for food would have been appreciated and would have allowed us to leave to find another restaurant.  
There were many disgruntled patrons around us.  Why wasn't anyone told when they first came in about the long wait for food?  Most people would understand and appreciate the notice so they could decide whether to wait or leave.
With warning, we would have left to find food elsewhere and plans to return another time.  We eat at Rochester Inn often and would have understood.  
Being allowed to sit so long with no explanation left us frustrated and unlikely to return. Receiving the wrong meal just topped off an already frustrating visit.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Renee L.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
Great burger and fries.  They use freshly ground beef and it certainly makes a difference.  I brought half of my burger home and it still had a great taste even though it was no longer warm.   The menu is pretty extensive and they have regular daily features.                                                     
The dining area is close to the open kitchen  and there is  a  very large separate bar room with giant TV screens throughout.  It appears it might become  very loud inside the bar once it is fully packed.
The Rochester Inn is definitely on my must return list.  However, I will use caution when deciding on dessert as my slice of  carrot cake was clearly enough for  3 people and ended up costing more than my burger.

EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.author: Victoria D.
EgW-kEqxP83MlVl06Qn21g.description:
My parents have been here on a couple different occasions and have always talked about how good the food is, however last week I met with them for dinner on a Thursday evening and I can't say I will ever want to come back.

It was completely packed, but my mom was able to get a table in the middle of the dining room and my dad and I arrived shortly after.  A waitress came to take our drink orders and we asked if it was OK if we waited for my dad to arrive. Our drinks arrived and shortly after, so did my dad.  

It wasn't for another 15 minutes that we saw our waitress again to order my dads drink and all of our food.  I ordered the salmon & broccoli with Caesar salad, my mom got the reuben and my dad had BBQ wings and a cup of chili.  The food took about 20 minutes to come out, which was understandable, because it was so busy.

When it was brought out to our table, everything looked good, however it did not taste the way it looked.  My broccoli was cold and had no seasoning or salt on it.  The salmon was insanely dry and flavorless - hardly edible even doused in one of the three sauces it came with and the Caesar salad was good, but the dressing had WAY too much lemon in it - very sour. My mom said her reuben was just OK. the bread was not buttered and there was hardly dressing on it.  Dad's wings, which I tried, were basic  - tough and didn't seem that great of quality. He said his chili was overly packed with beans.

We did not see our waitress again until she brought out or checks.  Poor service and terrible food during our visit - I even commented to my mom after we left that it was probably the worst meal and experience I have ever had at a restaurant.  I can't believe this place was so packed...but maybe it's a different story when youre just coming for the bar.

The interior is nothing special - certainly not fancy.  The tables are strange wooden tables that you'd find at your grandmothers house and the bar area is enormous.  Very casual.  Our table was sticky and the floors weren't very clean - just very bizarre.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Christine C.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Thursdays are my cheat day so I indulge in their incredible (and always in demand) chicken fingers and a side of tater tots!  So good and every dessert in the case is so incredible!!  I especially like the carrot cake and chocolate peanut butter cookie bars!!

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Nena U.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
A friend recommended Eadies - for a cake for a baby shower instead of our standard bakery near where work.  I was quite impressed.  We ordered a round cake for a baby shower- ordered the kit too which was extra.   The cake was beautiful.. so much detail.  Strawberry butter crème. It was delicious and not too over the top sweet.  

The prices are slightly above average but its worth it.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Aruna K.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
I tried their cake ....Only one phrase :
Richest lightest yummiest creamy cake I have ever tasted !

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Brad H.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
Love getting lunch at this place when at work.  The workers here are super friendly and fast with getting through tons of people throughout the day.      

They open early and serve some great breakfast options like their breakfast burrito.  For lunch they have a daily menu, which usually includes 3-4 hot dishes served buffet style, as well as a daily specialty sandwich and/or soup.  They also have some items that are sold daily such as pizza, fries, tots, salads, wraps, hoagies, and more.  Thursday's are my favorite days because it is buffalo chicken wrap day.  The line can get long for this day because it is a crowd favorite so you might want to avoid peak time.  My favorite thing about this wrap is that it is simplistic, but still delicious.  There is not much that goes into it, just some delicious chicken tenders, tasty buffalo sauce, chopped celery, and your choice of blue cheese or ranch.  So easy, yet so satisfying.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: David G.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Eadie's serves breakfast, lunch, and cakes and is conveniently located in the Mellon tower and a good lunch spot for people that work in the Steel Tower. The food is always solid and there are speciality sandwiches served daily, hot lunch options that vary and soups that are served on a daily basis as well as a build your own sandwich option. The food is "homey" but a bit expensive

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Caryn C.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Handy that it is close to work, but expensive for lunch that is good but not great. The cakes however are amazing!

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Braden P.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
This place is a complete rip off at the highest level.  For breakfast, the eggs come frozen, they're not even freshly cracked and cooked eggs.  The muffin sandwiches are subpar at best, they don't even toast the english muffins at all.  Who eats untoasted english muffins?  Don't get me started on that.  Yet, they charge top dollar for the garbage they call "food."  

Lunchtime is a complete rip off as well, again, at the highest level.  $7.00 a pound for perogis that come frozen?  They're not even homemade!  For $7.00 I can buy a huge sack at the grocery store and prepare them better than what this place does.  

The one worker there, Ray, acts like he's doing you this big favor if he has to refund your money because of the garbage they serve.  One time I complained to him about their high prices and he said, "if you want high quality food, you pay more."  If this guy thinks they serve high quality food, he has no business being in the food industry.

At least McDonalds cooks freshly cracked/cooked eggs and toasts their english muffins during breakfast.  

Never, ever, ever, again will I patronize this place.  Not in a million years will I ever return.

Don't even bother going here, you'll pay top dollar for garbage food.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Markisha K.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Awesome job making a flower bouquet cake for my co worker. Cake never disappoints, but this design and attention to detail was impeccable. The cake tasted just as delicious as it looked.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Lynn R.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
Eadie's catering is absolutely fantastic. Their food is delivered fresh and hot. They also have incredibly good cakes. They are a bit on the pricey end, but they are delicious and beautifully decorated.

Eadie's also has a serve-yourself/pay by-the-pound lunch every day that varies. I'd rate that overall food as 3-stars. The crab bisque is a definite 5, but is only available on Mondays. And, their hot wings are a 5, but only come up in the rotation every few weeks.

*UPDATE* Eadie's has started having wings every Tuesday (both buffalo and Asian wings).

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Amy G.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Great food, great service! Awesome Mac and cheese on Thursdays!  Delicious cakes for any occasion! Reasonably priced for its location.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Eric Z.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
Over priced if you get anything from the self-serve hot bar. Sadly I go there ever couple years and am quickly reminded why I don't get food from there.

Food is ok. Nothing great and definitely not worth the prices.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Haley C.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Great food and usually a quick in and out! Daily specials are always a variety and everything tastes homemade! Delicious desserts!!

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Tim W.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
A couple of years ago a co worker told me about this place called Eadie's Catering & Market and about how delicious their cakes were. She started to bring me a different slice every payday. I can't remember what slices of cake they were but, I can tell you that they were absolutely delicious!

Fast forward to 2014. My birthday was getting close and I couldn't decided where to get my cake from. I'm not really a big fan of Moio's in Monroeville and I had, had Oakmont Bakery cakes every year for a while now. 

Then I remembered Eadie's Catering & Market in One BNY Mellon Center and how good their cakes were. They offer everything from basic cakes, cheese cakes, brownie or cookie cakes to specialty cakes and even specialty pies. I got my hands on a cake menu and made my order a few days before my big day. I went with the Raspberry Delight Specialty Cake (White cake with white butter cream icing and raspberry filing between the layers of cake.) 

OMG!!! Let me just tell you that, that was one of the best cakes I have ever had in my life. Everything from the moist cake to the incredible icing made this cake spectacular and my birthday even better!

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: HN S.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
What a nice little surprise to find on the first day of spring. With this morning being on the wet side, I decided to cut through One Mellon Center on my way from my truck to the office and while doing so I discovered this little market. They've got a little self-serve buffet set up along the back of the market with breakfast items such as bacon, sausage, cheesy eggs, home fries, hash browns, quiche and breakfast sandwiches and burritos.  

I helped myself to a modest helping of eggs, home fries, three strips of bacon and a cup of coffee which all came to $7.34... a bit steep I thought for a basic breakfast to go. But the eggs were delicious, the bacon was done just the way I like it (a little chewy and not too crispy) and the coffee was fresh.  My only complaint about the food was that I thought the home fries could have been cooked a little longer.  They were missing that brownish quality that I look for in home fries.  It would also be a nice touch if they offered sausage gravy. If sausage gravy was available and the home fries were a little more done, I would be there every morning and this would be a five star rating.

The cashier I dealt with was courteous yet efficient -- qualities you look for when you pick something up to eat before work.  

Although it's a bit pricy for a breakfast, I can see myself stopping in here a couple of times a month for a morning treat.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Lindsay J.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Prices are skyrocketing and quality is dropping. I feel that the owners are getting greedy here at Eadies. Because of my work location and my busy schedule I often visit Eadies twice a day once for breakfast and once for lunch. Today my over $8 breakfast for a breakfast sandwich and a juice was horrible, sausage was burnt and the croissant was stale!!! Rather go get a made to order for less money! Usually lunch is sub-par at best! Come on Eadies I am under boycott until conditions improve~!

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Maria M.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Hit or miss. Some days an awesome selection and other days they have nothing good.  They have steamed veggies every day which are really good. They are definitely overpriced.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Betsy C.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
I work right next door so Eadies is super convenient for me. Plus, in the AM if I'm hungry I can hop off the T and right in without even going outside. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal there. Everything is pretty fresh and tasty. Yummy breakfast sandwiches and pastries in the am, and lots of lunch options for the pm. Chicken tender day draws big crowds so you know those are good. Soup is what draws me in, and their selection is pretty awesome. My favorite is the Salsa Tortilla, it's just amazing and you must try it! I check their schedule our weekly to plan ahead so I don't miss it! 

Worth noting, the employees are top notch. Super friendly, and efficient staff. The lines can build up but they have you out of there in no time. 

The thing that I do not like about Eadies has less to do with food and more about money, and that is my reasoning for 4 stars. There is a $5 minimum on credit/debit card purchases and I really hate that.  (btw, for a while I swear it was $10 min, but the last time I was there it was $5, so I updated my review)  The prices are a little steep and I wish I could use my card for all purchases since I don't usually carry cash. Convenience and taste will have me coming back for sure, but I keep hoping the prices and minimums will change!

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Joseph L.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description:
I really like the food, specifically, chicken tender Thursday!!!! The baked goods are mostly a hit, the cakes are amazing, but sometimes things from the cooler are just so so. 

The one negative I will say is that the prices for things from the hot foods bar are steep.. Lunch at Eadies is always super fresh and good, but pricey. Really the only reason this place doesn't get a five. 

Also, the owner takes so much pride in her business and I think that is really important. You can tell she really cares about the experience that people have at Eadies.

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Kelsey F.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: Love the food especially the buffalo chicken wraps and cake. Great service.....but seriously get some cup holders...............

0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.author: Celeta S.
0Q0v-eDzWtaySg7cbVi0yg.description: First time I had Eadie's was at work and they ordered a cake. Delicious! Stopped in for lunch and had the peppered steak with rice and a Mancini's roll. Can u say hooked?  This is some of the best peppered steak I've ever had. Tender and seasoned to perfection. They only have it on Thursday and my waistline is happy about that.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Portia H.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: This was my second time eating this delicious food!  I got the Ricotta stuffed Eggplant.  The Italian salad and dressing was perfect.  I was able to munch on my hard rolls on the way home.  Lots of butter was provided.  I came home and later that night I fried the hard roll in an iron skillet.  It was delicious!  This restaurant KEEPS it's quality and freshness in spite of our slow Pittsburgh, PA economy.  My hat is off to them:-)

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Bethany F.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: Never again. We used to go here weekly for wings. I had my 40th birthday party here. My husband even had his department work party here. We loved it. We craved it. We got busy lives and forgot about it. We went  tonight after a two year hiatus, and I can't express enough how it pains me to give this negative review. First thing I noticed is that there was no smell. There was no wafting aroma of delicious italian food. The second thing I noticed was the lackluster wait staff and nanchalant service. Our waitress seemed clueless. The waitress for the table next to us seemed uninvolved. When our wings  came out they looked like something off a Cornish hen. They used to be plump split wings. The sauce and ranch dressing was still to die for but the wings.themselves should not have been served to anyone. We had high hopes for my my strip steak salad and my husband's chicken parmesan. What we got was a small piece of boiled grey meat on a wilted empty salad. This was not ny strip steak. This wasn't even sirloin .  He got a watery flavorless meat sauce poured over mushy angel hair pasta. The chicken parm itself was dry and flavorless. There was no aroma. There was no seasoning . It was horrible .  It should have all been sent back. I was going to have my 45th birthday there this year but thank goodness we tried it out again before committing. We will never go back. This food was not edible. I've had better meals from fast food. What a shame.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Cheryl M.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description:
we had 10 people, and through some wrong information on the part of Montecellos - we would have had an hour wait  there.  A resourceful son-in-law noticed Silvioni's across the street, called, and we had a table within minutes, we had PERFECT service (thank you, Veronica), and wonderful food.  We had brought a cake which Montecello's allows, and Veronica was gracious about cutting and serving it for us.  We will definitely be back - our gain is Montecello's loss.
Full disclosure - we did not know our server - so when i say that our service was PERFECT, i really mean it.   Even with 4 kids at the table, she was very patient, she knew the menu well, got each and every order right, delivered the food hot, she was helpful but not intrusive.  We took special care to let her know how pleased we were - she and Silvioni's kitchen staff (bar staff too) made our birthday celebration perfect.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Adrienne P.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: Will never stop here again. Apparently they don't wait on interracial couples. Sat and waited for a waitress for 10 minutes. Went to bar to see what's up and they ignored us and went to the back. We walked out. Like I said, never again. They only cater to the local yokels

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: J V.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: I had eggplant parm, it was burnt and appeared to be missing eggplant. Waitress was rude. She left it on my check after I said it was not good and sent it back. Also I believe she was talking about me as I was leaving. We will not be back.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Nicklas V.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: Not a bad experience. Had been here for drinks before but never food. Came in for happy hour and they had some great appetizer specials. The Silvioni's fries were a little different. They're like a lot of other places lounge style fries with cheese and bacon but they add tomatoes and onions under the cheese. Thought I would give it a try. It was not my style but next time I'll order it without the extras I didn't care for.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Veronica B.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description:
I recently came here for Mother's Day with my family. It was everyone's first time so it felt like such an exciting treat! The waitress we had was very vibrant and friendly. The owner was wonderful, came around to chat with everyone. The atmosphere is very nice and causal. There is a dining room on the one side and bar/lounge on the other. 

We ordered several different things and I got a chance to taste everyone's plate except for the lasagna but it looked good and very cheesy. For appetizers, we had the Fried Zucchini w/ Marinara Sauce. It was great! Everyone at the table's tastes buds were leaping up and down.

I ordered the Chicken Marsala and side pasta with meat marinara. That was ehhhh....ok. It's not anything that I would return for. And the meat sauce, you could barely tell there was any meat in there.

So here is why I really gave them 4 stars and will be back, the Shrimp Fettuccini Alfredo. I wanted to order it but was hesitant because there is nothing more infuriating than messed up Fettuccini Alfredo. I tasted my brother in laws and then I was mad that I didn't order it. HAHA! It was the right flavoring and consistency. There were only 4 shrimp but they were big. My brother in law was not satisfied with the amount of shrimp however the portion of Alfredo was huge, but he ordered more shrimp. My sister had the same as me but with Parmesan Risotto. That was a winner! I would have preferred to have that with my meal instead of the side pasta with meat marinara.  

I do recommend this place because the food is good and the portions are large. And I highly recommend the Fried Zucchini, Fettuccini Alfredo, and Parmesan Risotto.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Jamie F.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: We were recently here for dinner after a wedding reception. Save your money. I've never had such horrible food. I don't understand how people are spending money on this! How do you mess up pasta and sauce? Well just come here to find out. The next day at the wedding everyone was talking about how bad the food was here the night before. At least my in-laws had plenty of left-overs for their dogs.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Nick S.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: I went to Silvioni's for a fish n chips platter. The food was good. It wasn't amazing, but more or less above average. I was impressed with the perfect portion sizes. The cost was about average. I would suggest that someone nearby should visit this restaurant. I will most likely return to try other dishes as well. The wait staff seemed to be more depressed than happy and welcoming. The layout is a bit confusing because you need to go to the very front of the restaurant to get to the other side in order to reach the water closet, as the restaurant is split in two. I suppose it was preferably designed for smoking and nonsmoking sections at one point.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Christina K.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description:
My family has been going to Silvioni's since I was a kid, it's a nice family Italian restaurant. I usually get the eggplant parm or chicken romano, both of which are good. This last time I went I randomly decided to order the stuffed eggplant parm. It was pretty good! Just two pieces of eggplant parm with ricotta cheese baked in-between  and mozzarella cheese on top. So if you are in the mood for a nice cheesy fried dish I would definitely recommend the stuffed eggplant parm. I enjoyed it. They really know how to cook an eggplant parm too by slicing the eggplant nice and thin before frying it. Sometimes you go to a restaurant and it's a big hunk of barely cooked eggplant. Not at this restaurant though. 

We've had multiple group parties here before and there was never an issue. The service is always great and the food delicious.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: David J.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description:
Our dinner last night was reasonably good in terms of food and service. However, the Pittsburgh Italian red sauce food NEEDED a decent glass of wine to complete the experience. Unfortunately it's impossible to have a good wine with dinner here. The wine sold here is an indescribably undrinkable jug variety and they won't let you bring your own. The server and manager disingenuously claim that state liquor laws prohibit bringing wine into the restaurant, but even the severely uninformed know that isn't true. 

Apparently the owners have not noticed that all American sit-down restaurants sell or encourage table wine consumption. You can get a good glass or bottle of wine at all of the fast casual restaurants that infect the interstate highway interchanges as well as at the oxymoronic upscale burger places. In Silvioni's defense, they obviously have a number of satisfied repeat customers. However, to paraphrase Alice, there surely are a large number of un-customers who, like me, could be converted to customers if they could get a good glass of chianti to wash down that pasta. 

Arrivederci Silvioni's. We won't return.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Kristin R.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: Great specials! Delicious pasta, friendly service! French onion soup has delicious crispy onion strings on top, nice flavor! Homemade Italian dressing and bread is yummy!

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Krissy G.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description:
Silvioni's is a great little restaurant. If you're looking for a classic neighborhood italian restaurant, I think this is pretty close. No fuss, just food. The side salad served before my dinner was basic. A few leaves of lettuce with a bunch of other vegetables top, plus, tomatoes - in winter! (Tasty!) 

The fettuccine alfredo was delicious and flavorful as well as generous in portion size. Others in my party had the Chicken Romano, and the Italian Sampler (A combination of Silvionis favorites: meat and cheese ravioli, lasagna and gnocchi with our famous homemade sauce.)

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Kari K.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: Delicious Italian food!!  No frills but tasty!!  Friendly staff!!we had a party of seven.  We each ordered something different.  We were all very pleased with our meals.   I highly recommend this restaurant for anybody that love authentic Italian food.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Sarah K.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: I've tried a couple Italian places in Pittsburgh and they've all been pretty awful. I'd gotten to the point I didn't think you could find good Italian food around here. Then a friend kept telling me about Silvioni's so I finally went along reluctantly to check it out. We got the fried zucchini as an appetizer, which was really delicious and I got the Eggplant Parm, which came with a side of pasta and a salad. It was one of the cheaper entrees on the menu at $12.95 so I didn't think it would be that big, but it was HUGE! Then I tried it and it was delicious. Perfectly cooked and covered in just the right amount of sauce and cheese. If everything is as good as the Eggplant Parm, I'm going to be a very loyal customer. Overall the prices seemed very fair and I enjoyed the ambiance too. I highly recommend this place.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Maria M.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: I've gone to this place several times over the last few years. I've never had a bad meal or bad service. The stuffed eggplant parm is the best I have ever had! The lasagna and gnocchi are superb! The red sauce is fabulous!  Prices are very reasonable.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Jennifer C.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: Always great, friendly service and awesome food. The lasagna is the best I have ever had!

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Nicholas W.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description:
As a kid, I adored Silvioni's. My mother would take me there as we live very close when my father was on business trips. When I look back, I'm pretty sure we went for convenience and not for five-star food.

Don't get me wrong, it is an alright restaurant. However, this is nothing special.  I know the biggest turn-off for most people's will be that Silvioni's doesn't serve pizza. "What! How could they?" I hear half of you say. I know, i know. The other big thing that will turn you away from Silvioni's is their is a much better Italian restaurant right down the road not 100 yards away. This place is Monticello's, and yes, is does serve pizza. (I might do a review on Monticello's in the future). While the food is decent, you can always count on the service being friendly, you food being made speedy, and a good bar if you want to relax for a drink. To conclude, this place might be the substitute if the nearby Monticello's is too crowded.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Linda H.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description: Love this Pittsburgh traditional Italian restaurant. I've never had a bad meal or service. The house dressing is wonderful. Alfredo sauce and marinara sauces excellent. Love the gnocchi and eggplant parm. You can't go wrong. And reasonably priced.

wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.author: Sean R.
wymUX-o-ytt31yUo_FI4-w.description:
Went in recently with my wife, two sons and their girlfriends.  Around 8:30 or so.  Not terribly late on a Friday.  Wasn't very busy, only about two or three other tables.  Upon walking in, several staff, and a few customers, shot us looks as if to say, "Who the hell are you?"
     After standing there about five minutes, with NO ONE even acknowledging us,we turned and left.  Wound up spending a fair amount of money at a nearby competitor.
    Done with this place, and I;m not the only one.  Heard this from a few people, but decided to give it a shot.  Lesson learned.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Matthew U.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description:
Being in this end of Lawrenceville doesn't allow you the option of many places to get a quick meal.  I just happened to be in this portion of the neighborhood and in need of food.  My better half had to keep reminding me about the food and I finally got it that we should really eat something.  This was literally the closest place to us, just a couple blocks away.

I decided to walk here, but I called ahead to place the order so that it may be ready when I get there.  I'm kind of glad I did it this way instead of having it delivered.  I got to see the inside of the place which gave me some interesting views.  You can definitely see that the inside is seriously underused.  Looks like it could do some ample business inside and appears to have the ability to have a small buffet, but does not utilize that.  It definitely has the Chinese restaurant feel, but no customers inside.

As for the food it was spot on.  Ready when I got there so with the short walk back it was piping hot.  Right type of spice for the General Tso and I really enjoyed the egg roll.  I definitely had a full belly after that meal.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: David B.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description:
Reliably good Chinese, albeit Americanized. They are quick, and they do mostly take out. 

There's plenty of parking, so it's quick getting in and out.

They have several good vegetarian options.

I've tried their delivery several times and it's always been delivered sooner than expected.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Karla D.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description:
Another one of my lunch places while I'm at work.

The food is good. Just your regular Chinese food menu items with no thrills, bells or whistles.

The egg rolls are decent as is the lo-mein and a few other dishes.

Really good prices.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Bee M.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: This place is unclean. I work next door. I would NEVER eat anything from there. You shouldn't either! I've seen workers smoking with their aprons on outside cleaning or fixing their cars and going back in to cook your food. They don't clean their kitchen properly and actually our whole strip was shut down for a day due to they way they are cleaning the grease traps. It smelled like doo doo at my job for a week. Rotor rooter literally was there every day for a while. It sucks because I love chinese food and it's next door lol but NOPE NOPE NOPE!

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Kyler W.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description:
My wife and I like this place very much. When we walked in the door we were treated like family.

We tried the hot and sour soup, the fried crab wontons, and the general tsos chicken.

The general tsos chicken was delicious. We got takeout and the chicken was still crispy whenever we got at home. This is one mark of a good general tsos chicken in my opinion. The crab wontons were equally delicious. Then again I've never had a bad crab wonton.

The hot and sour soup left something to be desired but maybe we just came on an off day we're haven't picked or flavor of soup that we like the best yet.

Will be excited to go back to this restaurant and visit them more often.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Wes N.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: A great spot in Lawrenceville, located conveniently next to a beer outlet. The place itself is a little strange, it's pretty large though there never seems to be anyone actually eating there. The staff is part of what makes this place great, they are always super friendly. Their food ranges from average to above average, more often I think it's the latter. Their chicken and broccoli (my go to) is usually very good. One thing that is a little disappointing is that they're closed on Tuesdays.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Yessica S.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: I ordered vegetable chow mein and two chicken rolls. The order was repeated several times. I got home with my rolls, a side of rice, and a side of sautéed veggies. No chow mein. Not sure what happened but the rolls were really tasty.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Jennifer C.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: Great Food! Delivery service was super Fast! Best Orange Chicken around, they use real orange rind in nice big chunks...YUM!

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Will R.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description:
Let's start by saying I've only gotten delivery from here, so I can't speak to the actual "in-house" experience.

Now that that's out of the way, there is a holy trinity when it comes to delivery food, especially Chinese. Tasty, affordable and a quick arrival. China Lin comes with a hairs width of hitting all three.

The prices are fantastic. They do that thing that I love at Chinese places where they offer both a Pint option and a Quart option for most of their dishes. Solid. I was able to get a breathtaking amount of food for around $25 dollars, including Hot and Sour soup for $1.80, which seems joyfully illegal.

As for the delivery, I received my food a full 25 minutes before the estimated delivery time. The driver was friendly and professional. It was everything you could want from a delivery experience.

Now, on to the food. The food was good! It wasn't great. It had it's issues. The chicken fried rice, for instance, lacked salt. When I say that, I mean there was no salt in it, an unusual problem for fried rice in my experience. The cheese wontons were good, if a bit chewy, and the General Tsos was straight up standard.

No socks were knocked off. No taste-buds set aflame with joy, it was just an evening of good, standard, serviceable Chinese food with world class service and an incredible price.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Francine L.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: Our go to for Chinese take out. What we usually order.... Gen Tso chicken, love the burgundy red sauce, Chicken lo mein, sweet and sour chicken, egg rolls, orange chicken. They have the best General Tso. Reasonable prices, Hot fresh food and very friendly staff. This restaurant has never disappointed us.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Nara K.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description:
I ordered the fried shrimp,teriyaki chicken,chicken with broccoli,boneless spare ribs and teriyaki beef.
The fried shrimp was excellent,the teriyaki chicken was good but kind of dry. The chicken with broccoli was the worse I've ever had.It wasn't seasoned at all and the sauce was runny. Don't try it. Same goes for the teriyaki beef I will never ever order it again. It was tough & unseasoned.The boneless spare ribs were amazing,I got a small order and it was actually a lot.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Susan A.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: The food tasted ok, until I seen them smoking in the back of the restaurant when they were preparing orders, as well as them dumping chicken on baking sheets and the moving it to a back hallway and leaving it sit there.. The hallway is connected to them and the gym in the plaza..

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Jamie M.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description:
If slightly refrigerated noodles mixed with Jiffy peanut butter thrown on a bed of shredded lettuce with red pepper flakes labeled as "spicy cold noodles" is wrong, then I don't want to be right. 

Nope, it was super wrong. Also the fortune cookie was so stale I could bend it. Broccoli garlic was great though!

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Tawny T.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: I've ordered delivery a number of times now, and I have only good things to say. Delivery is quick, the food is fantastic (particularly the Mongolian Beef and Curry Chicken), it's always still piping hot on arrival, and the portions are huge for the price. I'm a tiny person, so with the $15 delivery minimum, the leftovers end up being good for three or four meals. The in-house experience was equally enjoyable when I visited with my boyfriend, and we both left very much satisfied.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Jon H.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: Had our first visit here today. Pretty good. Kind of a weird little place, but the food was good for the price. What I didn't like was no fountain drinks, you have to buy bottles of pop or water. But we had fried dumplings, and two General Tso's platters. $24 was pretty good. I'll probably try delivery soon.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Matt H.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: Our office orders takeout from here once or twice a week and every time the food has been good. It's consistent and the delivery service is fast and friendly.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Jude K.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description:
Best Chinese food in the area~Hands down.
Inexpensive and fast delivery. 
What a great find!

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Ryan K.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: When you want some classic Chinese food fast, this is the place to order from. The price is great, the foods alright, and it is seriously fast. I honestly think they cook the food in the car while delivering it. The delivery driver is even wearing an apron, which only supports my theory.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Twofatladie S.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: Ordered Egg drop soup, Crab Rangoon, General Tso's chicken, mushroom egg foo young , steamed dumplings and some other stuff to be delivered. All the food tasted good but although it was delivered 20 min. earlier than  I was told it would be, all but the soup and the egg foo young was only room temperature . The chicken in the Gen.  Tso was dry and tough like it was sitting around for a while. It may be because I ordered after 6:30pm . I will try again, but earlier.

toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.author: Erica R.
toc31C-Qy2smSq0A7Q8FgA.description: Men who deliver my food was very rude was  mad I didn't have a large enough tip said fuck me bitch very unprofessional

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Adam V.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: The food was good but the portions weren't anything great. The cheddar biscuits were amazing and that's probably the best reason to go back since I cant say their seafood wasn't something that you can get anywhere else.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Tiffany K.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description:
If I could give it no stars I would. Three people in my group got sick and my dad found larva in his rice. When he called to tell them about it (wasnt asking for anything because we are never going back) the manager made it seem like he was making it up and it was SUPPOSED TO BE LIKE THAT. Too pricey, and horrible quality food. Our server was great tho, so I guess that deserves one star. 

If you dont want to get sick, I wouldn't go here.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Kimberly S.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: So I'm not big on chain restaurants but Red Lobster is good every once in awhile.  I was laied up with a back ingery and my husband said we should try the car side pick up. The beginning was good. But had trouble with my email and was told to call the restaurant.  I had a code to save 10% on my bill that worked fine online.  When I called to place the order I explained the I had a code. Apparently the young woman did not understand how yo use a code because the price was not the same as the one online. .  Finally I asked to speak to a manager.  I was put on hold and forgotten.  I did finally get the app to work. Got my order with my code. The oder was incomplete missing the sauce for the coconut shrimp. The salmon was overcooked and unseasoned.and they put the ice cream in with the hot food so it was soup. For cost it was not worth it. Very disappointed with the whole experience.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Renee L.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description:
Stopped in for the Lobsterfest that is being promoted.   The only real sign I saw relating to Lobsterfest was the huge, live, lobster-filled tank set up in the waiting area of the lobby.  Kind of sent second thoughts on the lobster choice. Poor things were all huddled together trying not be chosen as someone's next meal.

The lobster fest menu was not as exciting as I expected.   The commercials that lured me in for a love affair with lobsters fell short.  Not sure if I had higher expectations,  but I did not see page after page of selections.  Since this was my first fest, I do not know how it compares to previous promotions.

I ordered the surf and turf and it was satisfying for the most part.  Lobster tail was a bit skimpy. Our server was pleasant and very attentive. Nice meal overall, but I was expecting more .

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Elis H.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description:
I really recommend this place in terms of cost benefit. Our server was very nice, fast and attentive. Food was delicious and the price was fair. 
I do recommend hand craft lemonade and shrimp deep in a delicious sauce made with garlic and olive oil. It's very tasty!
Overall we had a great experience!

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Han S.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: Just ordered delivery through door dash. While it was on time and still hot, they missed a whole portion of my order. We ordered extra biscuits and received none. Food is good but the excitement of knowing fresh red lobster biscuits are coming... and then they don't exist.... it's just sad.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Erica S.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: I wouldn't classify Red Lobster as a 5 star fine dining seafood restaurant, but it is a nice option when you want a good affordable seafood place to go. My friend and I stopped in here 45 minutes before closing to grab a quick late night bite to eat after shopping and it was just the thing we needed. It was slow since it was closing time. The waitress we had (Gay) was so nice and had great customer service. I'm sure it was the end of her shift and she was ready to get out of there but you couldn't tell by how helpful she was and for the end of the night the food came out very hot and fresh. I have visited this red lobster before and always thought of it as a hit or miss...but this time it was a definite hit. Hit the Spot! From the Caesar side salad to the cheesy biscuits, to my 9oz glad of Cabernet and lastly the Seaside Trio with Cajun seafood Alfredo.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Ree T.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description:
Service is always terrible. Every time I go. Went today and the waiter was bluntly ignoring us and I could clearly see him checking on other tables multiple times but not once checking on us. He had attitude from the second he took our drink order but was friendly with his other tables. The food was served cold, but I could not even say anything as he did not check back with us at all after that nor did he ask how the food was. I had to flag down another waitress just to get the check. 
This is not the first time I have had a bad experience there, but I have had enough. Probably will not return.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Eric S.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: It's been awhile since we've been here, had a really good dinner tonight.  What made it even better though was AWESOME service from Nicole!  She was attentive, engaging and very responsive   Thanks Nicole!

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Christy B.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: There was no wait time for 4 of us to be seated on a Saturday around 7:30 so that was a plus. I got crab cakes that were just ok, for a seafood restaurant I expected to be more satisfied with my meal. The potatoes and broccoli were bland. The service wasn't the greatest either and I almost had stuff dumped on me by two different waiters/waitresses while I was sitting at my table. One of them being our waitresses, the other just being a waiter walking by. Our waitress did not clear dishes off our table and we had no room to even have our check on the table. My son loved it though as he had never had lobster or snow crab legs, but he is 10. Had we not all been starving we would've kept driving to a different restaurant, next time we will know better.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Robert K.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: Both in house and take out service has been excellent! No complaints from this North Hiller from Manville drive. Bob Rob approved!

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Marie M.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: Very unfortunate this is the closest red lobster and I am a big take out person, but the last three times when I ordered I was missing something. Yeah I know you would think by now I would check before I leave , however sometimes I feel like If someone is being paid to do a job, the job needs to be done correctly, esp when the patron is paying easily $50 or more to feed a family. I did not receive my lobster pizza yesterday which was actually someone's entree, so they did not get to eat .

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Optimist O.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: Why would I bother? But I did. Sadly. Lobster tail was mush. Bisque tasted like cream with a handful of salt and some artificial flavor. Steak was so tough it was unchewable. Shrimp scampi had an okay flavor, but the shrimps were the size of finger nails and were mushy. Salad was okay and biscuits were delicious. Will never go again. Go to a real seafood place where everything isn't frozen.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Bill M.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description:
This resturant never seems to disappoint. The drinks are weak and over priced. average of $7.50 / drink. If it was not for the Lime It would have had no different taste other than the cola. 
Now I will say the muscles were excellent , except for the fact that a good 1/3 were closed and not editable.  We were seated in the bar instead of the main dinning room - which was near the front door. Needless to say with the outside temp a cold 18 deg F. We were treated to a cold blast of air every time the doors were opened being a Friday eve. This was often. 
Now for the main meal. The dehydrated mashed potatoes were cold and pasty. The green beans were also cold, limp, stringy, basically not editable. 
I ordered the lobster bisque as an appetizer ,  it came like warm, pasty. Not creamy, with no apparent lobster meat. 
Since this was Lobster Fest time. One would think that seafood would be their speciality. I ordered one of their specialties and upgraded to a Filet MR.  When served, the extremely small 3 oz tail was way over broiled and the Fillet came back raw. 
Now the waitress must have informed the Manager as a 2nd order of Muscles appeared and later the Manager appeared to apologize about the quality of the food. 
Both the Manager and Waitress were very nice and professional. The Manager did discount our check though most restaurants would have removed the whole meal from the bill. 
Because the waitress was very busy, service was slow as when I ordered my first drink from the waitress it was not delivered for some time. I could see that the bar was half empty by this time and therefore the delay must have been that the waitress did not place the drink order. 

The bottom line here is the service was average, the food was poorly prepared and served. As this is a chain resturant, one would think that the food would be of a better quality. Their is. I excuse for the poorly mixed drinks, especially at those prices. 

Maybe next time. If their is to be a next time.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Tina B.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description:
The food was okay but the restaurant stinks. Literally, it smells. Upon entering, the bathrooms are immediately to the left of the entrance and they stink up the whole front section of the restaurant. During my wait to be seated, the strong smell of cleaning chemicals and human waste almost ruined my appetite. Luckily, my husband and I were seated in the back so this wasn't much of a problem during our meal. 

Our waitress was very polite and attentive. However, I couldn't help but notice that there wasn't much of a concern for cleanliness in any of the employees. When our waitress brought out our napkins, there were crumbs all in the napkins. Instead of replacing them, she said, "that's from the biscuits." Ok, but for all I know, that could be from someone else's old biscuit basket. Another employee brought out our plates and there were items hanging off the plates, touching the trays. This was served to us without any hesitation. Other unsanitary incidents occurred that I won't go into detail. I understand that this is a little nit-picky, but my husband ended up getting sick after this dinner and we can't help but wonder the reason why. 

For food, he ordered coconut shrimp and I ordered crab legs. It all tasted alright, but you can't really go wrong with steaming crab legs and refrying frozen coconut shrimp. 

I've had better experiences at other Red Lobsters so I'm not totally against this seafood chain. This location, however, I am not a fan.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Krista B.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description:
My family and I always come to Red Lobster if we don't feel like picking anything else. It's not too far from our house plus we receive great service at this location. 
We always get a bag of the biscuits to take home with us and the food is pretty good.
I always get the shrimp or lobster Alfredo when I go there. I really should go outside the box, but every time I do I just switch right back to my comfort zone. 

The workers are very polite and friendly. The place is clean, and the drinks are good (expensive but good). We will continue to come here for many more visits ;-)

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Calvin K.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: Meal came quickly and they evalen sent the biscuits upon request.. warm and delicious

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Thomas M.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: This went from our favorite place to eat to never eating there again. We got the lobster mac and cheese which was $25 ( with barely any lobster in it) and it was so fishy tasting that I thought it was rotten. We each took a bite and threw it all in the trash ( take out order). This was second time in a month that our dinners went straight in the trash. I highly recommend that you do yourself a favor and pick someplace else to eat.

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Colleen S.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description:
Affordable seafood dishes and those cheesy biscuits are enough to always keep me coming back!

I had a crab melt sandwich last time I stopped in for lunch and I really enjoyed it. Lots of options and combos to pick from.

Best part of our visit was our wonderful server, Jada. She was not only very attentive the whole time we were there, but ran out to catch me at the car just in time to give me the credit card I had left behind! THANK YOU!

Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.author: Dan K.
Tp2jd64iH0v-vjEu2OWjyw.description: I've been a fan of Red Lobster since the early nineties when it used to be a weekly thing--lunch at Red Lobster then the movies with my mom. We always went to the location in Robinson. After an appointment out this way, we decided to lunch at this location. Big win! THIS lunch was everything as I remembered--we had the Walt's shrimp--perfectly done and so flavorful! I had the baked potato with butter--fluffy, salty outside and full of flavor. My Caesar salad was perfect--crispy romaine, croutons and SHAVED--yeah, you heard that right-SHAVED Parmesan with their delicious Caesar dressing--just like old times--quantity and quality UNCHANGED!!! The biscuits were delicious and fluffy--albeit a tad smaller but still garlicky, flavorful cheesy goodness through and through! The ice tea(always been my favorite iced tea!) tastes as refreshing and flavorful as always. Finally, our server--a very efficient young man--was perfect! This was a truly yummy lunch that is sure to lure us back to this McKnight road location. Robinson Red Lobster better step up their game because THIS spot in North Hills is well worth our trip!!!

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Sydney B.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
I have been to this Panera Bread location several times in the past. I have always enjoyed experience at this location. During my most recent visit I had a minor issues that was wonderfully resolved by the staff members. 

I am a Panera rewards member. I ordered through the app. There was a minor issue fulfilling the order with my rewards through the app. The staff members hastily mitigated the issue. The best part, is that this process did not take any longer than a normal mobile completion time.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Ashley B.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
Panera is a go to stop for me when I use my Panera rewards and have a craving for a pick 2. You have parking available around the location but can easily walk from one of the nearby hotels or hospital. The location is large and have a good amount of sitting room.

The customer service was good the food was below average at best. I went for the Turkey BLT & Chicken Apple salad pick 2. The food came after 3-4 minutes. It was obvious after the first bite the food wasn't fresh. The chicken was partially frozen along with the lettuce on both my sandwich and salad. My side of an apple was delicious though!

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Nancy Y.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
I have a 25% love and 75% hate relationship with Panera. They make you feel like you're eating healthy when you're really not. They're hella expensive for no freaking reason. I always get the "You Pick 2" and there's no way that half a salad and microwaved soup is $10. No way. I always avoid coming here for that reason but there's tons of tables, is in a convenient location, free WiFi and the environment can be nice. The service is always quick and they always get my order right. 

The 25% love is for their bakery goods. Their brownies are out of this freaking world and I know that they are baked fresh every morning. None of their other food are, even if they claim to be. Baked fresh every morning. 

I only come here when I feel like using my points from the Pocket Points app because then you can get BOGO You Pick 2; which makes it a little more affordable because then I have enough food to feed me for two meals. Otherwise, no way would I waste my money here.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Michelle C.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: I got the Madagascar vanilla cream cold brew... but it's just the regular cold brew with pumps of vanilla syrup... disappointed. Not worth it.. I even went to ask if this was correct and the girl just tells me it's suppose to be pumps of vanilla but I can add cream if I want... pictures online are deceiving

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Sarah H.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: It seems that my experience here isn't consistent with many of the other reviewers here, because I thought this location has great service and food. The employees I did interact with were very friendly, gracious, and efficient. Even better, the interior of the cafe is completely updated and clean, with plenty of tables to sit at. There are kiosks to order your food at, in case the lines for the registers are too long, which is helpful. I'm unsure if my experience was an anomaly, but I hope not!

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: D R.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: Probably the worst experience I've ever had at a Panera in my life. Cashier was not friendly, did not seem to be engaged or even want to work. My food was missing chicken ... Went back to the counter and let them know.. the Young lady working behind the counter stared at me, did not apologize, but rather threw the chicken in the microwave and put on the counter and turned back around. I will never to this location. So far treatment and terrible food service

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Jasmine C.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
The restaurant is pretty clean and the employees are friendly. Overall, the service was mediocre because I got a pager for my food because I was dining in, yet it never buzzed. After 15-20 minutes, I checked the counter and my food was there... I felt like they should've paged me another time if they saw that I didn't come to pick up my food. 

The food was average- the mac&cheese was very rich and the BBQ chicken flatbread was very drippy (sauce kept on dropping out). Overall, a decent meal, but in my eyes it's overpriced for the amount of food you get.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Eva R.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
Come here infrequently due to the high prices for mediocre food. A small cup of soup is $5.13. I find that overpriced for something that is frozen, but it satisfies the soup craving when stuck in the library. 

However, in November through my Panera rewards I had a free bagel everyday of the month. I will say their bagel quality is pretty good. They are huge and filling. I tried a variety from cinnamon crunch, pumpkin pie, asiago, blueberry, and everything, but my favorite is always sesame. Their plain cream cheese is also really creamy and delicious, but more expensive than the bagel. 

Their online ordering is great if you know when you will be popping in. Otherwise, there is usually a line.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Nicole C.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
I worked at a Panera when I was in undergrad, and the standards were much higher than this one. My food is always sloppily prepared, my orders are frequently wrong, and the wait times are excessive. I know it is a busy location, but the Panera I worked at was the busiest in its franchise and our wait times never got like that.

I used to love Panera, and I still enjoy other locations, but this one is seriously lacking.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Alyssa S.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: pretty certain my dog can slice a bagel more evenly than this. also not sure why my cinnamon crunch bagel has a hint of onion to it

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Nikki B.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
Despite the fact that it always riddled with undergrads, this is a pretty solid Panera. The food is good, the employees are pleasant, and my order has always been correct. You can expect to wait in line at all hours, but they move through the line pretty quickly. 

I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars because Panera is so overpriced, but I do find myself here more than is good for my wallet because of the soup and salad varieties.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Sally C.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: This steak arugula was more arugula than steak and they gave me a baguette with a bite out of it. However in the end it didn't matter that the food at this Panera was shit because I threw it all up an hour later

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Liana N.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
Plenty of seating area for all Panera guests! I can only imagine how many students visit this location during the school year since it's near the college! It would be nice to study in here since there are some quieter areas. 

We came to Panera for breakfast and ordered the steel cut oatmeal, power sandwich with egg whites, avocado, and spinach, and four cheese souffle. My hubby loves their souffle and is delicious. It is made out of buttery puff pastry and has cheese and egg inside of it. Yum! The steel cut oatmeal and the power sandwich are pretty decent. I also got a cinnamon roll to go for free because I had a free birthday pastry to use from being a Panera rewards member. It is huge and can easily be split between two people.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Andrew L.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: My go to place before afternoon classes at Sennott Sq. It gets really crowded during day time, sometimes noisy. Otherwise a good place to do some last minute study before your midterm or final.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Justin W.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: This has be the largest Panera Bread I've been to; seating isn't an issue here. The food was traditional Panera with the great bread and the prices were the same. Service was quick and easy.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Cayla T.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: Each time I go here, I very rarely have complaints. The service is quick, the food is good, and the employees are pleasant. This is one of my go-to places for a meeting, because I know it will be quick and provide ample space to meet. It can get pretty cramped in here, but it all depends on the day and time. There is a private room available in this Panera location.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Karin U.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description:
Salad smelled bad and was just a handful of lettuce but cost almost $10. Incredibly disappointing. Panera's has changed for the worse. It used to serve bigger salads that didn't literally smell like trash for the same price. 
Also Came here for a coffee and waited 30 min just to get a paper cup to serve myself coffee instantly.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Kiera Y.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: Just stood 2nd in line for 15-20 mins while the cashier prepared a huge order. Everyone including the manager just walked past as the line got longer. Not once did the girl call for help. This is not the first time it took close to 25 mins for me to get my food. That's my whole lunch break. Sure I can order ahead but then they place my food outside the counter where people's can just pick it up. I'll go to the one on the Blvd of the allies from now on.

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Liting C.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: Friendly staff, clean environment, yummy pastries. Definitely a good place to study (read procrastinate) when you need a break from the library. My favorites are their artisan chocolate pastry and asiago bagel (yum).

NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.author: Ava S.
NBeX33C2lB6KMqpbSueHjw.description: This is probably the worst Panera I have ever been to. My bagel arrived in three separate chunks, not nicely cut. I had asked for a cream cheese bagel and the bagel came without cream cheese spread on and instead little packets of cream cheese that were hard. I will never come back to this Panera. I highly recommend finding a different cafe.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Joshua R.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
I am not a fan of sports and usually stay away from chain restaurants especially ones that lay claim to being a "Mexican Restaurante & Cantina" but as it is my partner's cousins were in town and it somehow became my job to entertain these humans that have ignored me at every family event we have been seeing each other at for the last few years. However I solidly believe I deserve to be punished for any and all sins I have perpetrated in my unfortunate life so I took this charge with a sprinkling of penance and headed to my car to pick the phone staring twosome up. 

Neither "fashionably" dressed teen appeared to have any interest in modern sports but they somehow decided they would "enjoy" taking in a Pittsburgh Pirates game and as we were walking to the entrance mumbled that they NEEDED to eat at Steel Cactus as if it were some sort of institution or they had actually ever heard of this establishment before. I put one foot in front of the other, breathed slowly and hoped my check had cleared in my bank account. I tried to be discreet in asking our server what sort of "vegan options" they had and was met with laughter from these young adults I was now legally in charge of. The server was more than helpful and whilst I felt slightly embarrassed I reminded myself how lucky I am to not have any children of my own. I knew they would order appetizers and entrees and not really eat both but I felt no reason to tell my pseudo family humans what they could or could not do. 

I think that our server could see the subtle distress that lay haphazardly in my eyes and asked me if I wanted "something else to drink." She and I both know that our time on this Earth is both brief and forlorn but is made to be slightly less atrocious by tequila. This was a turning point for not only me but Sary, Connyr & I's relationship(Yes those are their actual names.) A few drinks and some surprisingly well refined tofu tacos later and I was ready to waste more precious resources at a professional sporting event. 

If it was up to me I would have eaten at Taco Bell and poured my own swill into a Baja Blast but this was much more enjoyable than I would have guessed it would be.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Charley B.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
This is solid corporate Tex Mex served in large portions. I wasn't overwhelmed, but I was hungry during my visit and my meal hit the spot.

Extra points for location and convenience. I dined over lunch, but the restaurant space is in a building just outside of PNC Park and is in a perfect spot for some pre game grub.

My server was on the ball and quite hip. I let him know I wasn't from the area and he gave me some good tourist suggestions as well as some nightlife tips. I'm glad he was there and his help was appreciated.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Tim A.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
My meal was so inspiring, I have committed to starting every day henceforth, writing bad reviews so that YOU, dear reader, can have a nice dinner somewhere else. Anywhere else is guaranteed to be better, so just go there. 

Here's a picture I prove I actually paid this place in exchange for something edible.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Lauren M.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: We showed up during Picklesburgh & they claimed that their kitchen was about to close, but we could still get something to eat. We ordered queso as an appetizer, which tasted like it was just made with a whole case of beer. I ordered the create your own tacos with hard shell & the shells were half hard/half soft. The waitress went on to tell me that it was how their tacos were. I would 10/10 recommend the Steel Cactus on walnut street in Shadyside, it was delicious, clean, and great service!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Hayley F.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Looooved eating here before the Ed Sheeran concert! They have several different margaritas and awesome queso. It's a great spot before a game or concert!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Courtney J.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
ZERO STARS. There is nothing good to say about this place. The service was horrible and we waited over 10 minutes for water. Even longer for alcoholic drinks. Also, they don't have any specials during Pirates games. I've been to several restaurants around sporting venues and I've never encountered one that suspended their happy hours because of a game or offered no specials whatsoever. 

They were out of guacamole and the frozen margarita machine was broken. (To be fair I'm glad I didn't get a frozen margarita because I'm sure it would have melted before it got to my table.) They didn't bother to ask us what sides we wanted and when we did finally get food it was cold and bland. When it was all said and done the tickets were not right. 

The only reason this place is open is because it's at the stadium. I understand that it can get busy at times, but why build a restaurant in a premium location if you don't have systems in place to properly serve guests?

In summary... DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY HERE!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Kevin K.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
Great place to eat on a game day! 

We decided to eat here prior to the Pirates game, and it didn't disappoint. They had excellent tacos and quesadillas. Also, our table ordered guacamole, queso and salsa. They were all very flavorful and started off our meal with a bang! Yum!!

We also had margaritas, and the price was $18 for a pitcher which had approximately three glasses each. Or you can buy one individually for around $7. So if you have enough people, I recommend the pitcher. The strawberry margaritas are AMAZING!!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Shawn L.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Decided to eat at this place on my first ever trip to a Pirates game. Enjoying tacos in all fashions I was excited to see what this place had in store. This place was crazy packed due to the game with a great patio to sit and people watch. I sat at the bar and ordered their 3 taco entree of brisket tacos. The meat was just all right and had some decent bbq sauce on it, but the tacos were overall very bland. Nothing more than some brisket that had no smoke taste with some cheese. If I was there again I would just wait to hit up some food inside the park at one of the food stands. Bartenders were way slow and not really focused on us at the bar.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Dan G.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Sunday afternoon Bucco game, so it was busy.  Service was not great, slow with some mistakes on order.  Everyone said their food was at least OK, but my steak tacos on flour tortillas were bad.  The men's bathroom was memorable, flooded floor and the door handle was missing.  I should have listened to the horrible reviews, but we rolled the dice and lost.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Angel P.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
Stay Away! Stay Very Far Away! Zero Stars!!!
Worst Dinning Experience Ever. Came for a Saturday Night Game. Waited 15 minutes for someone to acknowledge us and another 15 for Water. Even the Manager was Nasty. The Food was Garbage. I Eat Out All the Time. This was once Again The Worst Dinning Experience!!!!!!!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Sam M.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Didn't make it past the extremely rude host. The guy had a serious attitude problem and basically yelled at us about how long the wait for food would be before even asking us about our party or where we wanted to sit. Won't try again!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Sharon W.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
Had dinner with an out of town guest and was highly embarrassed.
We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and the air conditioner was broken.  Server claimed it was repaired and they had all the doors closed (this was in 90 degree weather).  We nearly passed out from the extreme heat inside.  You'd think they would have compensated for this huge inconvenience. Waited patiently for our food to arrive and it was the most HORRIBLE Mexican food we're ever eaten.  How can they continue to serve food with no taste to it.  If it wasn't for a Groupon purchase, I would have really been angry.  Positively will not be returning.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Tony D.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Terrible! Service extremely slow and food is terrible! Kitchen staff arguing with each other....just a bad place. Chipotle would have been 10x better AND cheaper!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Katie J.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Long wait to be seated, and the iced tea resembled tea flavored water in looks, but managed to taste horrible.  I had to order a taco salad but due to my current dietary restrictions, I had to avoid cheese, and instead got 3 measly slices of discolored avocado which cost us $1.50.  I can't eat beef but the cooks must have initially forgotten this detail and half-heartedly scraped it off, leaving some remaining.  Menu said salad was $8 but rang up as $10.  On the bright side, I didn't have any iceberg lettuce in my teeth afterwards.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Katie C.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
**AVOID AT ALL COST**
 
Our food came out smelling like literal dead mouse. 
The avocado was old tasting- the guacamole was bland, the salsa was bland, the rice was bland and hard. The food was not good at all. 
The only thing that was good was the margaritas. 
The waitress was kind, but the managers and cooks were not very friendly when we had to send the food back. 
One of our friends even threw up from the burrito. 
No where close to authentic Mexican. 
Please save yourself and go somewhere else.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Chad B.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Well, it was okay I guess. Not really my cup of tea when it comes to Mexican but it's not like it was awful. We went for lunch and ordered from the lunch menu which had good prices in my opinion.  I had a Chorizo Burrito with Poblano Sauce and cheese (Extra $1 charge) and an order of Guacamole for the table.  The Burrito gad good flavor, a little sweet heat but was super greasy. To the point that my stomach has been uneasy most of the day. Just a lot of grease.  The chips were mostly crumbles with no full chips and the Guacamole literally looked like green ice cream...I mean, check out the picture...are they using an ice cream scoop on this stuff? Clearly not fresh.  But I will say it tasted decent.  I'm shocked we didn't get complimentary chips and salsa which is almost a given at Mexican joints but oh well.  The service wasn't terrible either.  Our waiter was pleasant and attentive.  The food came out within five minutes of ordering which is great speed but again screams pre made dishes heated up.Props for flavor service and price but that doesn't offset greasy burritos and pre made ice cream guacamole for me. I think I'd pick somewhere else for my Mexican fix.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Rodney H.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Very poor service. Orders were wrong, twice! Food is bland at best. I highly recommend not eating here!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Kevin C.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Worst ever. Before the game I ordered Picante Guacamole and a bowl of soup. 20 mins later I asked the waitress - who hadn't been back - what was up. Suddenly she comes back with regular guacamole and my soup. She obviously forgot to order and then screwed it up. Never eating there again.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Allyson H.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Service was ok and the food was also just ok. I've been here multiple times for different things and this time was the worst. Our server blamed the kitchen that the food was wrong and then said she take off the price of the chips and queso. The queso tasted burnt. My friend was gluten free and the server acted like it was an inconvenience to tell her what she could eat with out getting sick. She suggested a few things and kept saying oh wait no you can't eat that. Go to the one in the south side they have better service.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Kody S.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Trash. Worst restaurant experience ever. I can't believe they served us the tacos. Horribly cooked meat in a taco shell that tasted like cardboard. Had a stomach ache for 3 hours after taking 3 bites of my tacos. Felt like I was living the part of Bridesmaids movie where they get food poisoning from the Brazilian restaurant.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Brittany H.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
The Steel Cactus is right by the baseball stadium and off of the Roberto Clemente Bridge. It was packed when we arrived but we managed to grab a table. The drink specials were good, even on a Saturday! 
We ordered the nachos and the chimichanga dessert. 
The nachos were "okay". They definitely needed more chips because once we finished the chips we had, we were left with a lot of a soupy mix at the bottom of our plate They tasted good, but there was room for improvment.
