The chimichanga dessert is what gave this place 4 stars. 3 mini chimichangas, filled with cheesecake, covered in cinnamon sugar, deep fried, and topped with whipped cream, AMAZING. I highly recommend ordering this when you're here and sharing with the table! They are the perfect little size to eat after dinner and satisfy your sweet tooth. 
The service we receieved was great as well. Dawn, who was our waitress, was funny and personable the entire time.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Mr And Mrs G.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: If you have all day to wait for a drink this place is for you. 40 minutes for a house margarita. I had to go up to the bar to order a tequila shot to water down the overly sweet no liquor having house margarita (or wait another 40 min.). One hour later still no Chips and queso. Tacos came but were wrong and the waitress never brought the right ones. We left after canceling our food order to move to a different spot with better service.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Julie F.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
The food is always good,  we go there on our lunch break which is limited time .. today the service was god awful. And they weren't even busy. First didn't get asked for a drink for at least 8/10 minutes. Then waited for those for a while and they came out to us warm .. which we ordered 2 bottled beers.. gross it's 84 out ! Then I ordered a burrito for my lunch and chips and salsa for an app. Our app came out maybe 30 seconds before our food did, and she said she willI be back with silverware. We sat there with our food getting cold for felt 5 minutes  with no silverware.  Finally I went and got our own from another table a few down we spotted. Couldn't find our waitress to ask for sour cream so told another waiter .. he went and told her .. waited prob another 6/7 mins .. Needless to say we were not happy ! they definitely need more staff outside especially during lunch. I would hate to see there service during a game ! We will be taking a break going there for lunch. 

Julz S

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Lexxus B.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Highly recommend avoiding this place. We were in town and came in for brunch. Eggs were cold and we found hairs in the French toast. Fortunately, the server was apologetic and admitted that the quality  of the food was unacceptable. Chips and salsa were solid. Stick with simple foods at this place if you have to eat there.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Sandie M.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: How do you mess up salsa?????? How do you mess up a standard beef taco?!?!?!? Complete waste of time. 1 Star because the jalapeño margarita wasn't terrible. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Robert P.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
The food is just OK and that is the main problem... Often bland and lacking flavor... quantities are not horrible and you do get a decent amount of food, but there is just much better Mexican options available in Pittsburgh

I'm not saying it's the worst food I ever had or it made me sick or anything it's just three stars because it's just OK

A friend of mine who is less adventurous with food did have the Buffalo chicken tacos one time and enjoyed them very much he said

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Wes N.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: I think in some ways you have to be a little lenient when visiting a place on a game day but at the same time this place is a business connected to PNC Park so you'd think they'd be used to handling a decent crowd. They do get 2 stars instead of 1 because their nachos are some of the best nachos I've had in Pittsburgh. Their queso is fantastic. What was frustrating about this place was the service. Our waitress was super swamped. Another person I was with ordered beer that we never received, I figured no big deal, we'll just have them take it off the check once they run my card. Well it was actually a bit of an ordeal, our waitress had excuses why it couldn't be taken off but later brought us the beer anyway. It just took a good amount of time and was really off-putting.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Tina B.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
I've been to other locations before and this one in the North Shore did not change my opinion of the local Steel Cactus chain. Steel Cactus, to me, is just average all around. I came to this location for a work holiday lunch and to my surprise, we were the only ones in the entire restaurant. The dining space was also surprisingly small, which I think other locations might be larger. 

Our table ordered a selection of chips and dip and the red salsa was my favorite. I thought the guacamole was bland and the queso was ok, however resembled more of a beer cheese than a queso. I ordered the shrimp tacos and thought they were pretty tasty. The sides, though, were an embarrassment. My sides of rice and beans came in little cups that you typically get condiments in, which might not even be so bad if the platter everything came on weren't so large, highlighting exactly how small everything was. For $13, I expected a bit more. 

Steel Cactus is not my first pick if I'm in the mood for Mexican, unfortunately. Will I return? Maybe, but probably not anytime soon.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Chris E.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
We came here prior to a Pirates game on a Saturday afternoon during the 2016 season and the restaurant got crowded pretty fast. We were here from 1-2pm and there was a high traffic of people throughout that hour waiting for the gates to open. The great thing though is that not only do they have seating inside of the restaurant, but they also have seating outside.

Our stop here was brief, but we ordered 2 appetizers while we were here - The Traditional Guacamole and Nachos with Beef. Unfortunately, both appetizers were very disappointing. First, the Guac. The Guac appetizer came with a lot of tortilla chips, but the amount of Guac for it was very small. We were quite surprised at how little Guac was in the bowl, if you can call it that. In addition, the Guac lacked flavor and we had to salt it on our own to give it a little kick. The Nachos with Beef wasn't that much better. Once again, there were plenty of chips on the plate, but the lack of beef was disappointing. Some of the beef and ingredients were on the bottom, but the spread of the ingredients on the tortillas was still not as much as we would have liked. If anything, we enjoyed eating the chips with the Chohula Hot Sauce on the table more than we did with the Guac or Beef!

The critiques don't stop with the food though. The service wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great either. The waitress we had seemed semi-friendly, but we felt she checked up on us way too much constantly asking if we needed something else. In our 1 hour there, she probably came back to ask the same question about 5 times. We ordered 2 appetizers because we felt 1 would not have been enough monetarily with the both of us at a table, but the waitress was a bit too aggressive coming back to our table over and over again. Sometimes waiters/waitresses don't give enough attention, this was an example of TOO MUCH. Just when we thought she came by too often, when it came time to pay, she was no where to be found. I gave her my credit card, but she ended up going to other tables to take down orders and didn't return until 10-15 minutes later.

I hate saying these things about establishments, but the truth is the truth. Not only were we served below average appetizers, but the service was right there with the food. The good thing is that this restaurant has major potential and it's not out of their realm to fix these problems because they are definitely resolvable.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Amanda M.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
Moved jobs and had to find a place to eat in Northside. Everyone told me that this place sucks but I have to give it some kudos...first tacos. I'm happy to have TACOS within walking distance of work! Also, happy hour. They have $3 glasses of wine and a bunch of other discounted drinks. I couldn't find a happy hour appetizer menu though....  Finally, no one is there at night. It's quiet. Everyone is down the street at Souther Tier and such. This place is clearly a game bar as its in PNC Park. So my service was tremendous! The staff was super attentive and the food was pretty good too.

The one thing I have to say is that they tend to run out of things fast. First time is was bacon, second the keg was kicked.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Stephanie F.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
Visited here while attending NSEA conference. A fellow conference friend and I were wandering around and decided to try.
It took a while to be served but the waitress was warm and friendly.
The nachos I had were enormous and so delicious.
I also enjoyed the margarita but wish it was presented in a better cup instead of the regular short clear plastic cup.
All in all the food was delicious .

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Deborah S.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
Food is good. Messing with this ap during dinner is no fun. Really bad marketing idea. Makes you miss out on conversation and enjoyment of the time you could have spent with family and friends.

Wow! Our waitress read this review, came to the table and was adamant that we remove it. (And not very nicely) That just added to the fun! Originally gave this s place 4 stars, but well......

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Lecia C.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Unfortunately, my friend and I decided to visit here for tacos earlier this week. When we sat down we asked what the happy hour specials were and begin to check out the menu. My friend ordered a frozen margarita and she was then told the machine was out of order. So I decided to have draft beer, again when I ordered I was then told the draft system was not working (Both of these options were on the Happy hour).  Ok so 3rd time is a charm, right? My last attempt to order was a bottled IPA, that was on the menu... Guess what? They did not have that either. So the bartender then tells us to go across the street to a different bar because they have what we are looking for and they are owned by the same company so no money lost for them... Naturally that was all we needed to know and decided to leave and seek tacos else where. Never ate at Steel Cactus and probably never will.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Rick P.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Really bad service.  Sorry but when you wait 20 minutes waiting for a server to come to your table you have to wonder did I make the right choice coming here.  Message to ownership there are so so many restaurants out that care I don't see you surviving if this is this the status quo.  I've read many reviews here and there not good.   Either change and learn how to serve the consumer who pays your bills or close and let someone else take over.  Food was not hot generally average.  My advice is walk by

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Steve B.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: I went there 5/26 for a beer & burrito before a baseball game. Brandon took my order and came back with the beer and I never saw him till I wanted the check. He never checked on me once to see how things were. When I said I thought you forgot me he actually said no- really? Another guy brought the food. Another person came back with my card for me to sign. I told the woman who took the slip he got no tip as he never checked on me. All she did was say I'm sorry and not try to fix anything. That and the bland food really disappointed me.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Emmin M.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
I actually really liked this place. Went here before a Pirates game and had a burrito the size of my head. It was super spicy and it paired well with the Coronas and Spanish rice. They had chips and queso before the meal. Delicious. 

They were super accommodating to our party of 10 and I must say this was some fire Mexican food. I'll be back for sure!

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Shannon N.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Just skip it. The food was okay (needed a squeeze of citrus at the least) but our waitress was a mess from start to finish. Didn't introduce herself just asked for our drink order. She sent our food to another table and after we ate she sent another table's food to our table. She never checked on us once or asked how the food was or asked if we wanted another drink order but had time to check her phone and chat with coworkers...they got a smile from her, we didn't see one...then she dropped off the bill and took a very long time to come back for payment. I thought the restaurant template was to increase sales by 1. bringing more drinks and 2. turning tables over. Oh well. We'll try another restaurant next time.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Clint B.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description:
Seemed like a great stop to hang out before the baseball game.  The location is great but we spent most of the time laughing at the incompetence of the entire situation.

After waiting for 10 minutes for somebody to come (which was fine, we were in no hurry), a waitress came over and apologized and greeted us.  When I asked for a drink menu she gave a look as if this was an odd request and told me "she could check".  She comes back with one as I suspected and when I looked at the menu and told her I would have a Lagunitas she gave me the same dumbfounded look as before, paused, and then says, "we might have it, I can check."

I told her it was on the menu so there's probably a pretty good chance.  We reminded her we needed some water as well and off she went.  She came back with the beer and water for the table next to us but none for us.  No big deal, just another reminder.  After 5 more minutes without water we gave another friendly reminder and got it within 2 minutes.  

While eating the queso (which wasn't bad) it was obvious this is a place that does well because of location only and not because of a quality staff.  We got our tacos (buffalo chicken and pancetta) and again laughed.  

Buffalo chicken was comprised of charred 3 day old chicken and franks hot sauce poured on top.  it wasn't even cooked with the chicken.

Pancetta must have been put together by the child or our server and the tortillas were still cold from being in the refrigerator last night.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Thomas C.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: Extremely slow service on a quiet Sunday afternoon. Food delivered but no fork to eat with.  Waitress never returned with a fork had to go inside and get it. Asked for water before food arrived. Finally had to go inside after eating to get the water. Never did get a napkin. Taco salad was below average.

d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.author: Tom B.
d0aLkD3VQ3sijckod-oSDg.description: It has a great location across the street from PNC park and next to a couple hotels. If your going to the game or staying at one of the hotels it's really convenient. If it's your main destination you have to park in one of the lots and it makes it expensive. The restaurants really nice with a big patio to sit on. The menu is big and the prices aren't really to high. It gets busy on game day but if you can get a seat the foods good.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Eileen N.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: The people working here are so nice! They have the perfect attitudes to awaken the cranky early morning Oakland crowd. The bagels are so fresh (they are usually still a little warm from the bake). I so much prefer their bagels to those at Panera and if you come on a Wednesday, a dozen is $2 off!

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Yilin Z.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: Disappointed. Ordered farmhouse with one egg. It looked nothing like the promotional pics. It was cut in half, bagel felt warm to the touch, but the inside (ham egg and cheese) were still cold. And I paid almost $6 for that. On the bright side, the cashiers were friendly.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Katherine L.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description:
Bruegger's is a decent place to grab breakfast on your way to class. I do stop by here pretty often, but that's mainly because it's located right on my way to class, it's pretty cheap, and I use their rewards app. When school gets busy and I don't have time to prepare breakfast at home, it's convenient. In the future, however, I might try to switch it up a bit and check out other cheap and easy places. 

The bagels are good and the onion and chive cream cheese is tangy and awesome! I have noticed on a couple of occasions, however, some cross-contamination of cream cheese. I have tasted undeniable hints of salmon or bacon in a few bites of a sesame bagel with onion and chive cream cheese, which is very off-putting. The quantity of cream cheese on the bagel is also extremely inconsistent. 

Some of the employees are nice, but almost everyone I have ever seen working here moves incredibly slowly and has to ask you to repeat your order multiple times. It does not seem like they have any type of system down for handling mid-morning rushes, and it can get slightly frustrating. 

I probably will be coming here again, but my opinion of this place has declined since I first started coming here. Their products are quality, and if this place was more organized and if the employees were more efficient and meticulous, this place would be awesome.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Elizabeth L.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description:
2.75 
The bagels are just alright with nothing really special to offer. The wait staff was very polite and friendly, and the atmosphere felt homey. However, what really affected this rating was the fruit cups that they arrange and sell at the front register. Much of the fruit was rotten (i.e. the strawberry slices were growing fuzz, the blueberries were squishy, the cantaloupe was discolored, etc.). I don't think that I'll be returning anytime soon, but if you're in the need of a quick bagel, this would be the place to go (just don't order the fruit

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Diane T.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description:
This rating is not for the food or service, both were fine!
I have to say I was very uncomfortable entering and leaving because of a vagrant standing in front of the door asking for money from myself and others as we entered and left the shop. Management should be on top of this issue.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Valerie M.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: The bagels and sandwiches are good. My biggest disappointment is that they charge you for butter. I've never been charged for butter on a bagel from any other bagel place. Also, the staff is slow and while I've never been spoken to in a rude manner, I have heard them openly complaining to each other when it gets busy about "all the customers" or about their own life problems. With a Panera a block away, it's a better bet for me when I only want a bagel.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Michael C.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description:
I came in around 930AM, a late morning for some, to order a baker's dozen from the leftovers of that morning's lark feast. It was very much slow for that hour, and service was incredibly quick. I was assisted within a few minutes. Server helped me select the from the remaining bagels which included Asiago, cinnamon raisin, plain, honey wheat, multigrain, pumpernickel, everything, and sesame (if you'd like a greater selection be a lark).

I was quickly rung up and out the door with a hefty bag of tasty bagels to feed to my hungry students. Overall the experience of ordering bagels was great: quick and easy! A potential improvement is that the bagels could be better, but I understand I was picking from the leftovers.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Libby F.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: The employees didn't pay attention to anything I (or the person behind me) was saying in regards to my order. Charged me for a 2 egg sandwich with bacon and cheese but only gave me one egg and cheese. I watched them throw the bacon in the garbage... I was shocked by their carelessness and petty bs due to me correcting them

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Jill H.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: Seems like this Bruegger's location has had some issues over the last year or so--we used to stop often in the AM and it seems there's been lots of staff turnover, issues with their kettle or oven, etc.  But I wanted to post this review because I had a super positive experience with this location for a catering order this morning. I had a huge order and my husband is in a cast and couldn't help me get it to my car. A helpful and friendly staff member named Bettina (I'm sorry if I'm misspelling!) offered to help me get the order to my car, helped me by putting it all in a wagon she had, and helped me load it up into my car across the street.  I was so appreciative of her extra effort and assistance. The order was accurate and ready on time, the food was fresh, and the coffee stayed nice and hot.  I'll absolutely use this location for catering again.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Danielle D.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description:
Well, this place used to be my favorite and now they are awful. There was a change in management maybe 1-1.5 years ago and you can really tell. The staff are now a little rude, and incredibly slow. You can have one person in front of you in line and you will definitely be waiting at least 5 minutes. Today I had the worse experience here and this is probably it for me. You can get much better bagels at Redhawk even if you can't get sandwiches.

When I went in today, it was busy, and I was waiting a bit. A staff member came in from outside and jumped right in to working. He didn't go in the back to wash his hands at all. Then he proceeds to stick an entire finger in his mouth and tried to grab gloves to start my order. When I asked him if he was going to wash his hands since he had his fingers in his mouth, he just responded "I know. That's why I'm putting on gloves" with such an attitude. 

I should not get a nasty attitude for asking someone who just had their fingers in their mouth right in front of me to wash their hands. This is completely unacceptable. I would definitely not recommend this location to anyone.

EDIT: The manager did call me about my feedback and was upset by the situation. She said she would deal with it immediately. I was asked if I wanted anything free, but turned that down. I am still unsure if I would return here but, I appreciated the phone call and that my feedback was taken seriously.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Jasmine C.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: My main complaints were that the price for the bagel sandwich seemed overpriced (almost $7 with tax for the herby turkey...) and my bagel didn't seem very warm seeing as to it was just toasted. Otherwise, the employees were friendly and quick to make the bagel.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Erin O.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: While I enjoy the bagels when they are what I order, this is the third time I have gotten home and been given the wrong bagel. I can't tell you how disappointing it is to unwrap your bagel and find out it's not what you wanted. Probably will not go back unless I unwrap my bagel every time before I leave- not something I want to do when in a rush.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Kerry R.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: The staff are always friendly and accommodating, but overall quality of service and location is inconsistent at best. The store is regularly a mess with food on the floors, over-filled trash cans, and tables that have not been wiped down - not a very pleasant environment for your lunch break. My order is wrong about 1 of every 5 visits. I am an avid customer of Breugger's in general but never know what to expect when I consider going to this location. It would be very useful for management to address these service issues.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Cindy D.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description:
Avoid this place like the plague. Never have I ever walked a more consistently inconsistent Brueggers than this one. 

Today when I came in, it was the cashier who initially took my order, then handed it off to one of the workers on the line. This is where my order may have gotten lost. Since everything gets rung up at the end, there is no real system keeping track of what was ordered (including any modifications and allergies), making it easy to mess things up. The toasted asiago bagel with onion and chive cream cheese I ordered then became an untoasted cinnamon bagel with onion and chive. Ultimately I had to toss my entire bagel since I was already at my destination and could not get it remade.

The real issue here is the lack of a proper ordering system and a reliance on verbal communication between workers. If I had any real allergies (like a nut or dairy allergy) I would not trust this place to handle it. 

If you like weird bagel combinations and living life on the edge, this location is for you. For me, I'll be sticking to better places nearby.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Jen C.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description:
I'm obsessed with Bruegger's. As a New Yorker, this is the best a girl in Pittsburgh is getting to a real bagel. 

I think everyone who works at this location is so friendly. Especially with the amount of students that come through and sometimes the long lines, they always have a smile on their faces and a positive attitude. It is also clean, which is surprising with the amount of people coming through. It's the best place to sit, read a book, or study!

I have an obsession for the Chai Tea, which I find to be priced pretty well. I really can't get enough!!

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Chelsea M.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description:
I headed here for a quick bite before meeting up with my sister. I had like 5 minutes before my bus was due but was seriously in and out in two (phew!!)

I ordered the cinnamon raisin bagel with honey walnut cream cheese. I'm seriously obsessed with honey walnut and brought it up to the worker for small talk. He kept the convo going by agreeing with me and saying he loves it on sweet bagels. Sometimes food workers eply with a one word phrase so it was nice customer service to chat with me.

So super fast and friendly service as well as a tasty bagel. I forgot to order it toasted but that was my fault.

Also I literally LOVE their blue apple salad.. Chicken, green apple slices, blue cheese & nuts on a bed of lettuce with champagne dressing. I have no idea what champagne dressing is, but it's fabbb!!

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Cayla T.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: I use this Bruegger's each time I'm feeding a large group. They make it really easy to order a large quantity of bagels, large containers of coffee, and tubs of cream cheese. I highly recommend using them for this especially because they open early.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Zukushikurinfu M.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: Love the change in management, Kathy is AWESOME and her happy attitude keeps me coming back.  It is slow sometimes but is understandable considering she has been the only one in there a lot of the time.  Glad to see she is finally getting in and training new staff to get things back on par.  Love this place and the people, aside from a few one offs this place is awesome, her staff is great and Christian always has a great attitude, awesome addition to the crew.  Highly recommend.

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Nicky P.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: Stopped in early this morning for breakfast, want to compliment the staff and Kathy for great customer service and excellent food as always.  Keep up the great work!!!

XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.author: Jack M.
XqNDr54eLDLRfZwo4l4dVA.description: Decent Bruegger's located near the Pitt campus on Forbes. As such, it tends to be pretty busy during most parts of the day & a little less clean than most locations. They do have your standard sets of bagels, sandwiches, cream cheese, and stuff that you can take to go or eat in, assuming you have the time to sit in & do so (most do not). A suitable option for breakfast and lunch. I would go somewhere else for dinner though since I don't think this place is open during the hours that most would eat dinner at.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Scott R.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: I get my Chinese from this restaurant, despite the fact that there are at least a dozen Chinese restaurants closer to my house (in Upper Saint Clair.) Their food is top notch. There are 5 dishes by which I judge a Chinese restaurant: Wonton-Eggdrop soup, Moo Goo Gai Pan, Curry Chicken, Pepper Steak, and Lo Mein. I have so far eaten 3 of these dishes (The soup, the lo-main, and the curry chicken) and each dish gets 5 stars. First, most chinese restaurants in the area don't even have Wonton-Eggdrop soup (they have one of the other). Not only do they have it, but they have the big wontons like I am used to (and they're very yummy). The lo mein (I had chicken lo mein) was perfect - very flavorful and not too greasy as can be typical of some lo meins (theirs was more "saucy" as opposed to greasy. Finally, what I liked best was the curry chicken. I won't name names of other restaurants in the area, but let's just say I don't like watery sauces. Their curry sauce was very NOT watery, it was thick and delicious and they made it the way I like it, not too hot. In my dotage, my stomach has come to get very angry with me when I order food too spicy, although my mouth totally is on board (Sorry if that makes me a huge p@@@y, I am what I eat, get over it.) Anyway, I highly recommend this restaurant. Just a couple of minor things - I didn't get any fortune cookies with my lunch (not sure if this is standard or they just plain forgot) and I'm used to 8 wontons in a quart of Wonton-Eggdrop soup but they give only 4 (however, the wontons ARE big and the quart of this soup is fairly inexpensive, I am sure they'd give 8 if you pay a little more.) These two things are by no means a reason to avoid this restaurant that serves up delicious Chinese food!

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Beth E.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description:
This was my first time ordering and only because my usual place is closed on Tuesdays.   I ordered the General Tso's combination platter which came with fried rice and an egg roll.  I also ordered a chicken and vegetable dish and a Mongolian beef.    The order is a substantial size meal.    The General Tso's was lousy.  The sauce was thick and goopy and tasted nothing like I have ever had before, but it tasted bad.   I ended up throwing most of it away.   The other meals were fine and lasted us for days.   

Although everything came out hot and quick, I probably won't return.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Brad H.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description:
Was not expecting much from this small joint on the side of a shopping center, but I am happy I gave it a try.

The workers were very friendly which was nice even though we were getting takeout.  My wife and I got the general tsos chicken, lo mein, and egg rolls.  The egg rolls were your standard egg rolls, hard to mess those up.  The lo mein was very good.  It was not too greasy and not too dry, perfect amount.  The general tsos chicken was some of the best I've had from a takeout Chinese place.  I hate when places make it so saucy that it soggy by the time you get home.  This place made it perfect and the chicken still had crisp to it by the time I ate it.  The sauce was a perfect blend of sweet with a little kick.

As far as takeout Chinese places go, this is one of my favorites and I will definitely be returning.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Misty C.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: We travel twenty minutes from our house to this restaurant, at least twice a month . The  food seems so much fresher then most . You can re-heat what you don't eat the next day and it still tastes fresh and not like it was soaked in a ton of grease , like some. The portions are enough for 2 people . We have tried shrimp egg foo young, Singapore mei fun ( thin noodles) little spicy, general tso's  chicken( little spicy) and orange chicken . They all were excellent.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Carol R.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: My favorite little Chinese restaurant! It's incredibly clean with friendly service, I'd suggest their fried wontons.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Kevin S.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description:
This is our go-to place for quick pickup. They know their stuff.

We always love getting the Singapore Mei Fun. Try it next time you are in--it's fantastic.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Ashley H.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description:
I don't typically complain, but I'm hangry and very un satisfied.

I ordered sesame chicken by itself, combo lo mein, and wonton soup. The gentlemen was very confused about the lo mein and kept asking me if I wanted combo lo mein... and I said yes.
He didn't understand my address, or card number. I had to spell it out 6 times.

Food arrives (quickly actually) and we have sesame chicken on top of a bed of lo mein..... and wonton soup.

I'm hungry and watching my family eat while I munch on an egg roll...

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Sarah J.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: Love the service. Love that there is always a welcoming environment. Like that there are always several others coming in for takeout orders. Fresh ingredients and vegetarian options. Small place, but a few tables if you want to stay and eat. They will deliver for orders of $20 or more. Good value.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Brad F.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description:
Finally stopped in a few weeks after the grand opening for dinner. The inside is very clean and there are several tables to sit down to eat. 

I ordered General tso's and my wife got orange chicken. (Both combo platters with fried rice and eggroll.)

The portions were huge, I couldn't even finish mine (my wife didn't either) and everything was great!  Vegetables were very fresh and the chicken was cooked perfect. The eggrolls  were very full and crispy. 

The only thing is I wish my General tsos was a little bit more spicy, but I know to ask for that next time! 

Highly recommended!

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Warren J.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description:
So we tried China Cafe yesterday, we live very close so we called our order in. My first impression was that the restaurant was very clean! The employees were friendly and our food was ready  as soon as we arrived. 

We ordered two combo platters(general tso's chicken and honey chicken). portion size was generous we could not finish our platters. The chicken could have been more crispier but still very good. The fried rice was of great quality no need for extra seasoning or sauces. Lastly eggroll was a little thick and doughy for us and left us wishing for more filling.

 Overall a great experience and we recommend that people try this place it might replace your favorite.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Heidi M.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: Tried China Cafe for the first time tonight, my husband and I just moved to the area. We stopped in and ordered food to go: 2 general tso's chicken, 2 veg lo mein, and 1 order of crab rangoons. Our order was done in about 10 minutes, super fast! The place was very clean and the workers were friendly. I like that you can see the whole kitchen where they are making your food. Everything was very good! I would definitely order from there again!

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Nickolas I.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: Its good for the price i guess.. Got the General Tso Chicken, requested it well done and it was still not even close, she rather ignored my request or it's regularly very soggy. It came with an egg roll so that was pretty cool..And they have a fridge with cold root beer.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Haz M.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: Solid Chinese restaurant. The store is clean, and the food is prepared fresh. The General Tso's and Szechuan Chicken could've had more heat though; they weren't spicy at all even to my spouse, who generally prefers mild dishes. (Is it me, or is this the common issue in this area?) But their fried rice, on the other hand, was perfect. We'll be back.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Lauren B.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: Good prices, quick delivery! I'm a big fan of cold food so I think it was better the day after I got it since it sat in the fridge my boyfriend got beef & broccoli and it was a VERY small portion, and I got general tso which was okay, but like I said, way better the next day! Nothing stood out in a great or bad way. I would recommend trying them to see for yourselves!

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Sue S.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: first time we ate there the food was excellent can hot and everything was perfect thank you for a wonderful dinner

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Henri C.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: Called for takeout. Delivery was fast and food hot. There was a bit of a language barrier but we eventually got the order right.   Shrimp egg rolls were Crispy and tasty.  Main courses were very good too. Three of us ate for about $20.  Will order from them again.

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Jackie S.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: We live near by so we went in on a Sunday for eat in and was surprised first by how clean the place was and then by how quickly our food was prepared. Personally, my expectations weren't very high because it seemed like your average, cheap food. It was better than that! It was cheap but really good. The wonton soup was seasoned well and both the general tso's and the honey chicken were crispy and delicious. The honey chicken was especially surprising because I've had it at other places and its been too sweet but this was nicely done.  Looking forward to trying more!

LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.author: Eric A.
LTF14u6dfIyJQ41P-FooiA.description: went here 4 times,the food was fine and the 5th time was our last,shrimp roll were horrible,general tso chicken should be spicy not sweet,the won ton soup was greasy i am saddened i thought i found a good chinese resturant now ill go too saga where they know how to make general tso chicken Save your Money

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Jennifer G.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
You basically can't go wrong with Chick-Fil-A and this location doesn't disappoint.
I've visited several times and have been pleased with each and every visit.
The first time I visited I was with my toddlers for a family night.  They had a table set up on the side of the restaurant with a fun craft.  In addition to the fun (and free!) craft, they also had a sundae bar and balloons for the kids.  It was nice to have an evening out with a fun activity without breaking the bank.
Chick-fil-a employees are always pleasant and accommodating.  I absolutely love the fact that they will assist you with getting high chairs to a table or with getting food to your table if your hands are full with trying to wrangle kids.  Sometimes even family friendly sit down restaurants aren't that accommodating.  
A meal might cost you more than other fast food chains (mostly because they don't have a dollar/value menu like some places have) but the quality far surpasses any other chain which makes the prices worth it.  Food is always fresh and tasty.  But if for some reason you have an issue with your order, the staff is always quick to rectify the situation.
There are almost always offers for something if you use the app, which is a huge plus.
I definitely recommend chick-fil-a and the wonderful staff at this location.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Julia E.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
I was pleasantly surprised by my visit to chick fil a. 
1) my food was amazing (not just bc I was starving). I ordered the deluxe chicken sandwich with a side salad. 
2) we ordered a kids meal for my daughter. A decent amount of food plus she got milk with it which was great. 
3) I liked how they brought the food out to you. It was super quick. 
4) It was actually clean for a fast food restaurant 
5) there is a kids play space. Its small but does the job. They have hand wipes available for when the kids are done playing. 
While I don't eat fast food on the regular, I will be back in the future.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Rui T.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: Usually fast chain restaurants don't really have good salads but the Spicy Southwestern salad isn't that bad! My favorites include the Spicy chicken sandwich ( with the chick fil a sauce of course!), the grilled chicken sandwich, and the lemonade! You can't forge the cookie which you get for FREE on your birthday! Using the mobile app has been helpful with quicker orders. You also build up points which help with more rewards!

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Courtney B.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
I've never had an issue with my food, it's always been made properly with no errors. They are always friendly and polite. Usually they are quick and efficient. There have been times I've gone here where there were a dozen cars in front of me and the wait was still less than 10 minutes. 

This last time I was there was quite different. There weren't any cars in front of me in the drive thru. I ordered quickly, then sat for almost 10 minutes outside of the cashiers window waiting for my order.

I would have understood if they were understaffed or something, but as I looked through the window I saw about 6 people standing around talking while 2 other employees did all of the work. 

I won't let one bad visit change my over all opinion of this chickfila, but 3 stars for now.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Sherry M.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
Living in the waterfront, we stopped here for breakfast this morning. A family member told us, that they really like the breakfast on the weekends. 
I have to admit I was really surprised, how much I really enjoyed it as well. 
Great service, good food and a clean restaurant. 
Highly recommend the bagel breakfast sandwich! 
The ladies room is the best I have been in, but it was clean.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Jennifer W.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: One thing I like the most about chick fil a is their food is always hot. My chicken sandwich was so juicy I don't know how they do it. I also love their waffle fries. It's not super expensive but more expensive than other fast food. However it is worth it. This particular location is always busy and their parking lot is crowded but there is more parking just need to walk a little.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: James C.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: Baby girls what's your name? Let me talk to you. So first off service with a smile awesome. Sauces on sauces. But one complaint or is it shame? 8 person nug tray.....I ate solo no problem. 5'9 165lbs..... no problem. So 3 stars. Because deriving size not service. All love

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Selçuk E.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: Even though most chikfilas are super fast and delicious, this one is definitely one of the best ive ever been to. Always prepared and always delivers.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Eryn P.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
Being a Chick Fil A Veteran, (all the way back in college..yikes) I can't get enough of this place. With the exception of a few kitchens, they all seem to be perfect. 

I am fortunate enough to work directly across the parking lot from this CFA. I frequently hit the long line for my fix on my lunch hour. (Number one, no pickles, diet lemonade...perfection.) 

One day, to my embarrassment, I forgot my debit card, and couldn't find it anywhere! Fortunately, the amazing girl behind the counter just said, I'll take care of it. WHAT?! Real life. I've never had that happen to me before! I wish she would have had a nametag on, so she could get the shout out she deserves. 

Occasionally, it can get a little busy in here, and the evening crew can slack a little more than the morning crew, but that's to be expected. 

All in all, great place. 

Happy Eating!

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Optimist O.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: Giving 4 stars because the service is excellent. The food is good - but there have been times when I had cold fries, which is the worst... The chicken sandwich is great, but not AMAZING, like I thought it would be after reading all the hype for so many years... I wish they would offer the biscuit all day, as I think that would be very good but can never try since there ins't a location near my morning commute. In any event, give it a try if you have never had it.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Kimberly L.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: With about an hour to spare before boarding time, I decided to stop by here while on my way to my gate. I'm glad I did, as this location was consistent in quality with other ones I've been to! This is a good spot for grabbing a quick meal on the way to the gates. The lines didn't take a long time, and neither did waiting for the food. The cashiers were efficient and helpful, which was great! I got a regular meal with a chicken sandwich, waffle fries, and sweet tea. The whole meal was yummy and filled me with energy for the rest of my trip! I would definitely drop by again for another meal!

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Christopher J.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
Par for the course for Chick-Fil-A. It's fast, friendly and efficient service. The food is good too.

Always packed!! Family friendly!

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Aleaf H.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
Some of my friends been talking about this place for months but I have never tried it or wanted to try because  of 2 very strong reasons. 

1. I do not like fast food really
2. Fried food gives me a heartburn

However I'm in Pittsburgh meeting up my in laws and wanted to get something before we catch a movie . Place seemed packed so I had my hopes up. But really it wasn't anything special. Their signature sauce my wife and in-laws liked it is nothing but a mix of mustard mayonnaise and bbq in other word a slightly smokey honey mustard. The meat on the other hand was spot on. Very nice flavor and well cooked. It was real chicken and you can tell from the thickness of it also was moist. Wasn't very happy with their waffle fries as when I hear about waffle fries I expect some seasoning.

So the bottom line is the chicken is great but rest is just what you expect from a chain  fast food joint.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Sneha N.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: They have quick and good service. I had been here for many times and I never had any complaints. I like the cookies and cream milk shake and the spicy deluxe. Whenever I want to get some low cost, good quality food, I go here.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Meghan B.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: Amazing customer service, clean restaurant and one of the only fast food places with a playground. My cousin loves coming here- she has a blast on the playground and we really love their food, too. The fries are wonderful and I love their nuggets. Their breakfast minis are delicious, too. Try the sriracha sauce- you will not be disappointed.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Chardae J.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: Dude it's A Chicfila.  I've never met one I didn't like. The people are so nice and the customer service is awesome sauce!! Sometimes when it's nice outside and there's a huge line in the drive thru they come out and take your order to get you in and out. If I could live here I would. The only con I can think of is the fact that these guys are closed on Sundays but I respect that and enjoy my Chicfila Chicken nugget obsession six days a week. Their lemonade also compliments the whole meal. The location is perfect to my house and it's right near the waterfront. I end up here every time I'm at the Target down the street.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Jordan N.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: I'm a A-List member and I've been eating Chick-Fil-A for over 10 years and never had to to deal with the rudeness. I understand that they are young but this is a restaurant and it's a shame I've  worked in the restaurant business for year and the food quality here is poor they will serve cold over cooked fries and cold sandwiches. Last time I was there I found hair in my fries and then got a attitude from the manager because he thought I did it just for free food. I would like the see a change since I've spent over $500 and have been getting crappy food and service.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Mike H.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
This might be a chain place, but man are they good.  I've eaten here multiple times and every time my food was fresh, the service was good and the atmosphere is perfect.  

If you need to eat quick on The Waterfront skip everything else down there and go here.

Make it before 10:30 AM for breakfast.  Best fast food breakfast in town.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Jason F.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description:
Having the ability to order through the new mobile app is definitely not only a game changer but a life changer. Ordering is a breeze and you're able to customize your order any way you want. If you want a Chick-fil-A sandwich with no pickles but bacon and cheese instead go for it, the app is your oyster. One of the best features of the app is curbside pickup. I can order my food when i'm still in a nearby store or leaving work and have it ready to be delivered to my car or pickup in store when I get there. No more waiting in long lines in store or through the drive-thru. Does it get much better than that?

It also goes without saying the their customer service at this location is hands down one of the best experiences out there today. Customer service is always consistently great and everyone is beyond friendly.  I can't give them enough compliments on that alone.

y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.author: Chelsea M.
y5v2vmVlWZS-o9q-c1Wb-g.description: Who doesnt love Chick-fil-a? (dont answer that)  We stopped in yesterday after attempting to go to the gym.. funny how that worked out. I haven't been to too many stand-alone chickfila's. This one was nice as well as the workers. The food wait was a little long even if it was fresh and made to order. Also the fries were cold and we decided to trade them in for hot ones especially after waiting so long. Other than that everything was fine. i'm like 100% sure ill be back. -_-

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Ashley S.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: This is my favorite coffee shop in the area!! Staff are very nice and make stellar drinks!! Food is tasty!!

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Nate T.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description:
Tasty little breakfast place tucked into a quite large strip mall.  Don't let the strip mall setting dismay you though. The inside is nicely decorated. 
When you're here get the crepes. They're wonderful and HUGE. Their namesake crepe was kicked up with siriacha, really spicing up my morning. It's plated quite attractively as well!
Coffee wise, I'm not sure where they source the beans or that, but the breve I got was just fine. 
Price was great, especially for the size of the crepe. I'm not a huge breakfast person, but those weekend mornings where I need something, this is top of my list.

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Maria J.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description:
Loved Cafe Americano. Seems relatively new but I'm not sure how long they've been here. Restaurant and bathrooms clean. Lots of seating inside and was not too busy at 1030am on a Saturday but started to get busier when we left. 

Delicious crepes brought out to you in about 5 minutes. The Veggie Crepe was packed with feta, eggs and vegetables so they definitely don't skimp on the filling! I'd definitely get it again. My husband loved his Signature Americano crepe which he said was packed with prosciutto. I was pleased with the London Fog. Breakfast and drinks for 2 for $25. 

Looking forward to coming back!

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Beth S.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: I don't typically get annoyed at restaurants and try to be patient and understanding since I know it's not an easy job. It's extremely rude in my opinion to sweep while someone is eating underneath someone's table or around the area they are eating...It's also a health concern. It's also super obnoxious when someone's eating as they feel rushed. In addition it's just really disgusting to watch all the food from the day be collected into one spot right next to your table. Not thrilled with this place.

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Jeremy P.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: Been here a few times. Their coffee is good - way better than that canary place. Their food is excellent, light cafe fare. It's a great alternative to greasy spoon stuff you'll find throughout the area.

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Laura J.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: Cute little cafe/coffee shop tucked away in Mt. Lebanon. Good coffee, plus they have Gluten-Free Goat Bakery & Cafe donuts!

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Rebecca G.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: Cute new coffee shop in Castle Shannon "Lebanon Shops". Nice selection of coffee choices and food. Ordered skinny iced Carmel macchiato-good flavor but  still pretty warm. Nice friendly staff. Wish they were open earlier so could stop on way to work.  Nice place to meet friends or work on computer. Will recommend!

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Thomas C.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: A great little cafe, everything I've had is delicious and well priced. The service is fast and friendly!!

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Allyson H.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: Love this coffee shop! My iced caramel latte was amazing!! Way better then Starbucks. They have gluten free pastries for my friend and delicious bagels. Can't wait to come back.

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Mickey T.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: Great little independent coffee shop in Mount Lebanon strip mall location and really good renovation of the existing space.  Looking forward to sampling their crepes

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Amy B.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: Delicious crepes. The signature crepe with prosciutto red peppers and feta is our favorite. Coffee and fresh and perfectly brewed.

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Stephen P.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: Stopped by for coffee & a breakfast crepe.  Wasn't disappointed. Coffee was fresh, tasty.  Had the Americano crepe which was delicious. Sandra enjoyed the veggie crepe and a cappuccino.  Friendly staff.  We will definitely be back

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Patricia B.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description:
I was sad to see Blue Canary Coffee close at this location, but was at least heartened when I saw the spot would be occupied by a new independent coffee shop! 
I had their signature Americano crepe, an iced latte, and a gluten-free donut. The crepe was seriously the best I've ever had! Perfectly cooked, generous size, and great flavor!! The cream sauce in this is unusual and amazing!
The iced latte was strong, which I like. For once, I didn't have to ask for an extra shot of espresso. 
The donut was just ok, but glad to see a gluten-free option. 
I had to kill several hours while waiting on other things to be done, so I ended up getting a banana strawberry smoothie also, which was very good. Not too sweet, which I liked!! 
The customer service was fine. The man working at the counter was pleasant enough, but I know what the other reviewer means by "no small talk." I'm not one for over-solicitous service, so I kind of appreciate that there's not a ton of chit chat. But it was pretty sparse even for me. I think it's just his personality, but I think the other reviewer was referring to a female employee?? Just noting it because it may become an issue if this is the general vibe. Also, it was nice to see how involved the Blue Canary was with the community, and I didn't see that here. Maybe that will come with time.
It would be great if they could open earlier for pre-work coffee. :)
Overall, would recommend!! Great food and latte! Hoping they'll engage a little more with their customers and community. Must try the crepes!!

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Jenny T.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: This place is great! The food is yummy.  They are generous with coffee.  They take care of each person individually.  And,  it's reasonable as coffee shops go.  Can be a little slow.  They are new(ish).

ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.author: Samantha S.
ks2q-AWMx_xD0FpVIBXRzQ.description: I was excited to try this coffee shop out on my calm Sunday morning but sadly I was unimpressed. The baristas were nice, but didn't talk to me at all except for taking my order. Im also a barista and I know how much better it can make a customers experience if you engage in a little small talk. I could barely taste the white mocha in my latte and the muffin I got was bordering being stale. I love to visit local coffee shops but I don't think I'll be stopping back here.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Sherry J.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: Awesome ladies and fabulous cooking. It's in the back of their house, true carribean style. Food is hot and delicious and the meat is tender. Home cooked carribean food.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Maggie J.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: If you're not used to grabbing dinner from the rear of someone's house, it may throw you off at first. But don't worry, everything is on the up and up and the food is MORE than worth it. She's super nice and always loads our plate with a ton of food! If you go later in the day (4:00 or later) you might want to call ahead to make sure she has the items you're hoping for. The jerk chicken - TO DIE. Finger-licking amazingness.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Kesha M.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: I was very disappointed being my first time at Momma Roses and eating at many different Carribean spots over the years outside of Pennsylvania. They didnt have plantains which is a traditional carribean side dish. The chicken itself was boiled separate from the curry which made the chicken unfavorable.  However,  the curry sauce was very tasty on top on the rice and beans.  The cabbage had no favor, very watered down.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Herman P.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: Mama Rose is the real deal. I've been to Jamaica 6 times and around the people and culture for many years. If you go during the warm weather, you can outside and enjoy your meal. Otherwise, you just go with take out. It's not fancy, just very authentic and delicious Jamaican food.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Chris J.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: You can't beat the quantity, and the flavor of the food is great!!! 7 p.m. is the cut off, which isn't bad for the working class. Trust me, if you like Caribbean food and you're close by, you should try Mama Rose!

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: T P.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: Super friendly, however a bit tough to find (located in the back of someone's home). The environment (kitchen, dining space, wait space) was clean and they appeared to have good hand washing hygiene....giving this info only because the restaurant is located in a home...simply put, good clean place for good food.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Jose V.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: I have been looking for a good Jamaican spot in Pittsburgh for 4 years and today I found it! They have the best oxtails I have ever had! She cooks out of her kitchen so don't expect a usual restaurant.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Celeta S.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: Mama Rose sells dinners out of her home. She's located on Mayflower Street off Larimer Avenue in the East End. The food is delicious and affordable. Her oxtail dinners are my personal favorite. The meal includes peas and rice and cabbage. If you love Jamaican food you have to try this. It's fresh, authentic and delicious.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Ayantika G.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: I was kind of disappointed with the restaurant, given the positive reviews from the other yelpers. We got a take out order for curry chicken and oxtail stew. Unfortunately, the sauteed cabbage that came with the curries had gone bad after just two hours. The odor from the cabbage was so so bad, that the chicken and oxtail stew was completely inedible. Our whole apartment was filled with the stink from the curries. Also, for a business operating out from a house the price is not cheap!!!

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Uwe C.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: I've been going there for years always good food and very polite. It's better than any Jamaican restaurant in this city  by far. I love ma ma rose.

n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.author: Lizzi B.
n6_ah26nj9V6eo7PZNUQzg.description: Love this place. try the brown stew  chicken or my favorite on Wednesdays jerk chicken. she makes goat and oxtail..with cabbage and rice and beans..no better Caribbean food in Pittsburgh!!!!

vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.author: Cody A.
vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.description: Best Coffee shop in Greentree! Staff and owner are amazing, friendly and helpful. Wide selection of drinks and healthy food options. Grounded is always very clean! No seating in the cafe but on a nice day you can sit outside or right outside of the cafe in the lobby of the building!

vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.author: Stefanie S.
vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.description: LOVE GROUNDED! The whole staff is friendly and beet efficient even when they are busy! Everything is delicious from their coffee, bagels and sandwiches! Probably come  to grounded a few times a week! I can't get away it's that's good!

vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.author: Jenna T.
vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.description: Hands down best coffee shop. This place is a gem. I'm a chai latte fanatic, and these guys make THE BEST chai. Ask them to top it with dark chocolate-WOW. They also make fantastic baked goods, especially their muffins. The chocolate chip streusel and red velvet are my current favorites, and their avocado toast is delicious. You really can't go wrong here, and the service is fantastic.

vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.author: Corrie J.
vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.description: Micro foam was perfect, and the roast had an interesting flavor to it. Not quite light roast, and not quit dark roast. Staff was very friendly as well. Priced just right. Great spot in Green Tree!

vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.author: Suzanne M.
vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.description: Small and quaint, this is the perfect place for a cup. There are many options available, but I would highly recommend the pour over. It is smooth and flavorful without being bitter. The owner is beyond friendly and happy to make whatever fits your interest. While there, several apparent regulars came in, to which the barista would remember each and make their usual drink. I will definitely head back that way and get another pour over. You won't be disappointed!

vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.author: Broustello B.
vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.description: Awesome coffee.  They always have different flavors that are unique and taste awesome.  My favorite is the vanilla nut or the apple pie flavors.  This place switched me from Starbucks!  Huge fan and highly recommend!

vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.author: Mark R.
vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.description: Awesome little spot.  I work in the area and there are not a lot of great local places to grab a quick bite unless you want fast food.  I tried this out today and loved it.  The staff was very friendly, soup & sandwich were yummy, and it was relatively cheap compared to some of the other local deli's in the area.

vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.author: Tina S.
vm4XXJtH1NPQGQEm17kvHA.description: The drinks are always perfect!! My go-to drink is a London Fog latte! Everyone is always very friendly! The baked goods are very tastey, the blueberry muffins are my favorite!

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Jason D.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: We really enjoy ourselves when we hang out at the Crafthouse.  Check their website to see what bands are on the schedule.  It's a big place which I love, so you have plenty of room to move around.  The food is usually on point also, try the nachos Mmm, and the bar seat pretzel...it's as big as a bar seat.  Drinks are reasonable and usually a decent crowd.  It's also connected to a bowling alley, so if you're not feelin' it go roll a few!  There is also an axe throwing thing and one of those escape rooms.  Parking can fill up at times, DON'T park in the plaza across the street, your car will be towed.  And just so you know we won the Halloween costume contest last night!!!!  I'll include a pic or two.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Karla D.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description:
So this was my first time here and I was pleasantly surprised.
It's a cool venue (with an attached bowling alley) that has a bar and restaurant style seating with a pretty kick ass sound system for the national acts that come through to play here.
The staff is really nice and professional. No matter how busy they got the bartenders never ignored me and even took the time to let me try a couple of pours I'd never had before.
They have quite a selection of beers too. Very impressive.
Also the prices weren't terrible at all! I expected to pay a lot more than I did. Not complaining at all about that.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Denny V.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: Come out to see Dirty Shirley and had a great time.  The place is big with a high ceiling so the volume wasn't all that loud (but we were at a front table so while they played- we couldn't talk much).  They have a huge draft/beer list and the bartenders are fast.  It's a great venue for music.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Greg S.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: A great place to see live bands in the South Hills. Tonight was Metal Church, a band still around after 30 years bringing metal to the masses. Haven't tried the food yet, but that will be soon.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Jasmine H.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: Best large preztel I've had. Made my night. Anyone looking to soak up your alcohols with food this is the right portion. 19 bucks. They also offer free valet. Sound is amazing. Can see the stage from the bar.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Sammi A.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: I've recently started coming here for shows. I like the fact that you can order some drinks and food during the concert. My advice is to get here early though because you will not get a seat otherwise and will awkwardly stand around waiting for set changes. Same goes for parking, they do offer valet services but that's not my style, I like to park my own vehicle. Early is key if you're coming on the night of a fairly popular act. The food isn't bad but the choices are limited to only a few selections, prices are higher than they should be and service is slow because I think they are understaffed. Overall a fun experience, I will be back for shows.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: C G.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: I would never go here again. Service is the absolute worst. This clown bartender provided the worst service ever and shouldn't be employed as a janitor. I would never come here again under any circumstances. Food was terrible, service was worse.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: April R.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: Came here for the first time on a Saturday night. There was six of us and four of us arrived before 7 so we were not charged cover for the band that was playing. Our other two friends arrived at 6:57 and they charged them for some odd reason. I would have questioned it but they didn't seem to mind. The band did not start playing until 9 and it seems to get pretty crowded around 8. Our waitress was very nice and attentive even on a busy night. We ordered drinks and I asked for a mojito. My mojito tasted like pure water and mint. Luckily she was nice enough to take it off the tab and get me a different drink which was very well made the next time. I ordered the chicken wrap with aioli and truffle fries. I thought everything tasted amazing! Loved the food! Our whole table loved their food as well! The food did take a long time to come out though. Staff throughout the venue was very friendly. I can say some things on the menu and drinks can be pricy. They do have weekly happy hour and weekly specials so that is nice. We had fun gathering with friends and it's nice that they have decent musical guests come here often. We would probably come back when there are more specials going on to save a few bucks.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Maria J.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description:
I've been here a couple times, once with live music and another time of Tuesday Bingo night. I didn't play bingo but there seemed to be a good crowd. 
Huge beer selection. Mixed drinks and wine available too but the beer selection is the main thing you should come food. Food is good for bar food. Not many options for vegetarians. Clean large bathrooms. Lots of parking, valet at times. Service was quick when I've been here. Attached to the bowling alley and escape room I believe. Lots of events throughout the week. Biggest draw is the beer selection and events. Check it out!

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Ted C.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: I just find it extremely difficult to rate the food here - my best advice is come here for entertaining- don't eat The loosely food - if you can even call it that. The cover charge is way too high - omg they even tie your car here

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Ed L.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description:
Sticker Shock!!!
Very Expensive!
I just visited this Pittsburgh South suburban establishment for the first time yesterday, Feb. 15th to see the Pink Floyd tribute band, Pitt Floyd.
When I received my bar bill at the end of the night I was in for a shocking unpleasant surprise. They charge me $7.50 for a pint of Guiness(U.S. Pint not Imperial) and $7 for a pint of Bluepoint Toasted Lager.
If this restaurant was in downtown New York or Boston then I would expect those prices, but it's located on a back street in a middle class neighborhood, attached to a bowling alley about 15 miles south of downtown Pittsburgh.
No where on the menu or beer list to they list the prices. Typical downtown Pittsburgh beer prices is $5 a pint.
I also ordered food.
I ordered a beef brisket sandwich and fries for $12.
Thought the brisket was very tasty they skimped on the portion. One layer of brisket which did not make it to the edges of the bun, but the crispy onion rings did. So that's what you mostly taste.
On a positive note ... I sat at the bar and the service was excellent.
Plus .... It is an excellent place to see live music.
The sound system was crystal clear and didn't blow out my eardrums. And the sightlines from any where in the bar is good.
Overall ...
Bar and Food 1 star
Music Venue 4 stars

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Leigh S.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: Best date night spot! Great bands, great beers, the roast beef nachos are ahhhmazing! Staff is so fun and friendly. We love it here!

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Lizzie D.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: My boyfriend and I went here to see his friend's band. We were going to eat elsewhere but figured we would eat here to save time. MAJOR MISTAKE. I ordered the craft house shrimp salad $16.95 for some lettuce and 5 pieces of shrimp. BEST PART: on the bill it was $18.95. My bf ordered shrimp tacos $10.95, got chicken $9.95... no big deal until we see on the bill it's $11.95 plus $5.95 for a side salad. Basically there was an up charge of $2 on everything (even our drinks) which the manager said was because they didn't print updated menus for the event. We just let it go and told each other we will never be back. We dine out a lot and NEVER were the prices on the menu higher on the bill. Whatever is printed on the menu should be what you pay or you should be warned before you order that prices will be higher. This is extremely deceptive and absolute horrible business practice. I thought this place was cute and that I wanted to come back with friends but I will never come back after how we were treated by management. The server was good until we asked for the menu after we got our bill and she sent the manager over and then took forever to give us change, etc. Apparently it's offensive when you question why EVERYTHING you ordered was $2  more. I've never experienced anything like this before.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Megan M.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description:
I came here for the Thursday night line dancing. I was visiting my parents from Southern California, where I go line dancing regularly, and was having a very difficult time finding anywhere in Pittsburgh that offered line dancing. After a difficult search, I found the Crafthouse. Given that this is the one of the only places in town that offers line dancing, I'm surprised that it isn't more heavily advertised. 

Anyways, they offer lessons the first and third Thursday of the month. There is a DJ, but no live bands the 2 nights I went. They also play mostly line dances and very few partner/couple dances. 
The Crafthouse is nice, but smaller than the country bars I'm used to. There are definitely regulars that know all the dances, and they were all very friendly! I will be returning when I come to visit my parents next time :)

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Ella B.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: Decided to check this place out for an early dinner on a Saturday around 5. The exterior could really use a paint job.  Once inside, we found no one at the hostess station, but there was a group of people there for an event, I assume. They were dressed like wedding guests and were getting drinks from the bar.  We stood around for a few minutes and no one greeted us. So we left with a terrible first impression.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Kelci R.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description:
What a diamond! We went here for a pretty late meal and their kitchen was still open at 10:00 pm. Their buffalo chicken wrap was amazing (their sauce was spicy and sweet). You have to upgrade your fries to the truffle parmesan fries. 

The service was also great! The music and line dancing was... interesting but it is definitely a place to try out!

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Theresa L.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: I had my wedding after-party at the Crafthouse and it was so much fun! We rented 10 lanes, got a bunch of pizza and everyone had a great time! Working with Amanda was awesome and helped us plan everything.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Ria F.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description:
Love this place. The only reason it gets 4 instead of 5 stars is that there isn't as much seating as I'd like. The couches are lovely but impossible if you want to eat. 

All in all, I've never had a bad time there. It's so nice to have a cool place like this so close to home.

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: Michele R.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: Had a great time.  Didnt eat dinner there.  But the band was great. Would definitely come back

5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.author: George G.
5mMcFcZGdktTF8Qfh1u02A.description: Nice place but I think the parking is a scam with the shopping center across the street. Went to see Sponge a few months ago and had my car towed away from across the street. Did not know about valet because I turned into the first parking lot on the site. Will probably go back eventually, but will Uber. Once bitten twice shy...

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Neha C.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: I got the salmon and chicken hibachi combo dinner. It was pretty good. Realllllyyy filling since the portion sizes were humongous. Although the food was good, we had to wait quite a while after we got seated before the chef arrived. Maybe that's because we went on the weekend. Would I go here again? Probably yes next time I visit the waterfront.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Kayla T.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Not looking for anything special having come here, and we certainly didn't get anything special. This is a hibachi/ sushi restaurant. We dined for sushi, so I can only attest to that. 
We came here for Saturday lunch. The restaurant is not busy at that time, which was nice- no wait for a table. Not sure how busy it gets during peak times, but it had a large dining area so I would assume it wouldn't be a long wait. 
We had never been here before, and as such, needed some time with the menu. Our server greeted us promptly, but despite our heads being in the menus, she kept asking if we were ready to order. Clearly, we were not. Eventually we agreed on our food and placed our order. 
We also ordered drinks. The drinks came out quickly, but my friend had to ask for a glass with his beer twice before we actually got it. The food did not take long to arrive. We ordered a few specialty rolls and some spicy tuna rolls to share. The food was great- sushi chef did a fantastic job. We cannot be confident in what rolls we were eating, because our server didn't seem to know what she was handing us. However, they were all good. 
When it came time for the checks, our server told us that we could not split the sushi rolls between two parties. It wasn't a big deal, but I think this was just her answer because she didn't want to learn how to split sushi rolls.. 
Maybe if we had had a different server our experience would've been different, but alas, this is not a place I will be recommending to people. While the food was decent, it wasn't exceptional, the prices were a little staggering, and the service wasn't great. Not interesting in trying again.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Bob C.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Never going back.
When I travel to Pittsburgh, this has been a weekly carry out back to my hotel.
Quality good.  Service good.
Tonight, when I get back to hotel I see they forgot a portion of of my order.
I call and they say they have it so I walk back to get it
When I walk in they say I forgot my order.
I had to explain that they forgot to pack it.
The rest of my order was sitting on the bar.
As I left I mentioned I did not receive an apology.
I was ignored by 3 people on my way out.
When I get back to hotel I find they also forgot to pack utensils, chopsticks, and soy sauce.
Not going back .. not tonight, not ever.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Rui T.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Sushi is worth it especially during the happy hour specials ( 1/2 off rolls tuesdays and Thursday's). My favorite roll is called " Japanese Mafia #2". 

The hibachi is okay, especially coming from someone who has been to many hibachis. The staff isn't that friendly or great at the hibachi side. Orders got mixed up too which happens at the sushi side too.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Eva R.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Came here for dinner on a Wednesday night around 6:30. We had to wait  about 15-20 minutes for a hibachi table despite there being empty tables. I ordered the chicken and shrimp, which is what I always order at hibachi places. We were started with a miso soup and then the house salad. Our chef came over, but our stove was not hot enough.
