Apparently the hostess who seated us forgot to turn on the stove. We had to wait for another 15-20 minutes. Then the chef was able to begin. He was very nice and prompt. Both my friend and I noticed how thick the creamy sauce was. Overall, the chicken and shrimp were cooked well. The fried rice was ok. Hibachi is a pricier meal but at least there are always leftovers. This is just a standard hibachi place, nothing extraordinary.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Denali G.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Tuesday's is 1/2 off speciality rolls-great deal. Beer i got was flat, 0 bubbles. Waitress was not attentive and never actually cleared our plates and only refilled our waters once. That being said the sushi is awesome! i love the variety and they give you a booklet with pictures of every roll so you can also see what you will get. I've been here several times and the food doesn't disappoint but the service can.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Sandra P.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: What a treat this was!!! Four adults and two kids made up our group. We were seated at a table where two others were already sitting. Got to say, I wasn't wild about that. I know it's tepenyaki (sp?) and it's like a community to watch the chef cook, but we were a large group and the others felt weird and so did we. Regardless, the chef arrived and the show began. We started off with three sushi rolls and they were fantastic!! I ordered chicken and my guy ordered beef and shrimp. Loved the meal!!! The meats were cooked at the table as was the fried rice and veggies. With juggling the eggs and making a volcano with an onion,  the kids were fascinated! Everything was so very tasty and our waitress was friendly and helpful! Definitely would return and would do this all over again!! Kudos!

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Wes N.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: This place was pretty good. Ended up here because everything at the Waterfront was packed on Friday night. We got seated right away in the bar area, I prefer to bypass the hibachi tables because it typically is much quicker. Our service was great. They have a large drink menu but didn't have any specials. I split the chicken hibachi with someone, our waitress brought us two separate salads and miso soups which I thought was pretty nice. The chicken hibachi was pretty good, especially the chicken itself. Something seemed a little off with the fried rice but the veggies were good. It was a little pricy overall.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Valerie V.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
The hibachi was pretty good at Yokoso and I'd get it again.

We had a fun chief who kept us entertained.

I'm normally not a fan of ginger dressing but I did enjoy theirs and do recommend it.

We had a side of soba noodles and a side of mushrooms both could have used more spice for my taste.

The noise level was pretty loud because the place was packed.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Mimi L.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
I was pleasantly surprised!!!  I was a bit apprehensive after reading some reviews, because I rely heavily on feedback! Lol.  We celebrated Mother's Day early (on Friday) with party of nine.

The food and the service were both great!!!  The waitress kept our drinks refilled and kept checking on us, while the chef put on a great show and prepared delicious food!  The scallops and shrimp were really good--as were the filet mignon and chicken.  However, the lobster was a bit more "chewy" than we like it.  We will definitely return!

*For some strange reason, the raspberry tea was VERY GOOD, or I was just really thirsty!

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Bee M.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: I have to give 2 stars here, and I'm sad because the food was very disappointing. Our service was fine, and quick. My friend and I sat at the bar. Our cocktails were fine, but the food was horrible. The fried rice looked gross either from frozen vegetables or old rice, the shrimp was over cooked, and the filet I got was a very small portion and hardly tender. The vegetables were not fresh, and the yum yum sauce was more mayo than anything. I wanted to try something other than my usual hibachi place, but that will not happen again lol.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Robert B.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Average sushi joint.  Service is very good, variety is interesting, but the sushi does not seem the freshest.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Jess J.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Not a place you should go if you have food allergies, they don't have an allergy menu. My server asked me if things had my allergy in them....
All in all I think she did her best so I'm not upset with my service. My food was good, I just wish I didn't have to be so careful because restaurant should really have allergy information available for customers, please consider doing this for your customers.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Ryan W.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Sushi chef Kevin ruined my experience there. He was rude and made everything difficult from the beginning. He wouldn't let me order from him so I waited for our waitress while she was running around helping everyone else. Eventually I ordered the $22.00 sushi platter. I asked if I could pay extra to add avocado to the top of the California roll. She said sure. He cut her off and said no. The idea of paying extra for a couple slices of avocado blew his mind. He refused to add avocado even for an upcharge. Most sushi places charge a couple bucks. How hard is it to add some avocado on top of the California roll? Luckily we were bar hopping so i left and found somewhere else to eat. Oh well...Maybe they should try to accommodate their guests. We were each ready to have a few drinks before the comedy show across the street.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Candice D.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
We chose this restaurant to celebrate a friend's birthday and were disappointed in the food quality and overall experience. 

Now for the food. The soup was the standard clear broth with a few mushroom slices. It was awful. The salad was actually quite tasty. We all had the steak and shrimp. In general, the flavor was just so-so. Much of the preparation was not done at the table. The fried rice was already prepared (except for the egg which was fried on the grill) and reheated on the grill. The shrimp and steaks were grilled tableside but the showmanship was lacking. I could have prepared the food with more flair.

Bottom line is that the flavor was just OK. Nothing special and not what other Japanese steakhouses offer.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Chelsea G.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: I never been here before tonight! We came for my cousins 21st birthday! Cliff was the best ever he made sure we were satisfied with our meal and kept us laughing. He deserves a raise ! We will be back just for his cooking.  I Highly recommend Cliff.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Tiffany Y.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Yokoso is my favorite Japanese restaurant in Pittsburgh. I have been a customer here dozens of times for several years. I always order sushi for an appetizer and a hibachi dinner (either the filet mignon with scallops or the salmon). The food always tastes very good. The service is also always good.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Donna D.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: I have never met a hostess crew so miserable, so rude, so apathetic.  We arrived from Kennywood with 1/2 of our group who was coming right behind us.  When we asked for a table the hostess said we can't take a reservation until your party is all here and even then the wait will be "at least an hour or more".  She had no emotion and little eye contact.  We decided to get a smaller table and spit the tables.  When we were seated there were multiple tables open.   The hostesses up front were on their cell phones with heads down.  We asked to talk to the manager.   The service is horrible.  Overpriced. Unfriendly.  Next time....it's Primantis across the street!!

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Christian C.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Tuesday is 1/2 off specialty sushi rolls. I decided to bring my wife, who is not normally a big fan of sushi, to introduce her to the different rolls and kinds of sushi. We ordered three different rolls and they all were delicious. We enjoyed the sushi and I was able to convince my wife to return for another sushi date!

In short, the sushi is good. The service: not so much. Once we were seated, we had to wait a while for our waitress to even come to our table. Our waitress took our order and refilled our drinks once, and that was all that we saw of her during our whole meal. Very disappointing.

Would I return to Yokoso, yes. Would I go out of my way to come back, no. The sushi was good and the 1/2 off special was a plus, but the service we received was a turnoff.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Nicole B.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Made a reservation for a group of
Four. We were promptly seated once we arrived, and within 15 minutes had our drinks from the bar, as well as our soup and salads. Our hibachi master was James, and he was EXCELLENT. Very friendly and entertaining. Would highly recommend, but do make a reservation, as the places can get very busy on weekends!

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Candace K.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Didn't pack a lunch so got their salad and avocado rolls.   Their ginger dressing and house salad is excellent.   The avocado  rolls were good, too. Looking forward to returning.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Justin S.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Yokoso is incredible the food and service is always on point. The salmon I had today was cooked to perfection and the same went with the steak, Marissa and sandy are great best place in the waterfront

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Jasmine H.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: I was very disappointed with this location. At the entrance I let the hostess know I was celebrating my fiance's birthday and I had made a reservation and I would wait for a good booth. She ignored and disregarded my request because she sat us immediately and when I requested a different area, she ignored me again. After a few minutes my fiance and I left and went to Benihana in Greentree. No lie, the service at that Benihana was exceptional.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Phil G.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
We dropped in for an afternoon snack after finding out the Mexican place across the road had been replaced by a Primanti's. Looking around we saw Yokosa and said "Let's have noodles!"

We got a seat right away at a booth.  My side was pretty uncomfortable like all the wires under the padding were pointing up. Yee haah!  Ha ha, gave us something to laugh about!  We didn't find much in the way of noodles on the menu except for the yakisoba so we got that and another appetizer.  Food was good although seemed pricey.

They add tip suggestions on the bill but instead of percentages they had fair, good, and excellent. I did the math and fair came to 18% of the pretax subtotal.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Paula D.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
T e r r i b l e

Took me a solid 4 minutes to chew on a piece of steak. The fried rice was gross and vegetables were not fresh. Never coming here again, don't waste your money.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Jennifer Z.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Came here for the 1/2 off sushi night on Tuesday. Although it was very crowded when we arrived, we didn't have to wait too long for a table. 

I ordered the Plummy yummy cocktail which was good but a little strong for my taste. My friend however thought it was perfect; so if you like strong drinks, go for that one! Each person in my group ordered two rolls, which ended up being plenty of food. The rolls were huge! However, they were all pretty similar in terms of the fillings and toppings. Pretty much every roll on the menu was topped with a bunch of spicy crab. Now I like spicy crab, but it was way too much. They definitely skimped on the fish in my opinion as well. Maybe it's different when you order on the non half price nights, or maybe it's the two rolls I ordered, but overall I wasn't blown away by the sushi. I would still come back just because it was such a great deal, but only if I was craving some specialty rolls rather than actual fish.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Jean J.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Wondered why it was so empty and after 10 minutes of not being acknowledged at the bar despite the hostess 5 feet away, a manager literally sitting AT the bar and multiple people behind the bar, it was pretty obvious. Failing customer service = failing business. Owner needs an entire front of house staff overhaul, currently being sabotaged by clowns

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Stephen G.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Awesome place to take the family. Wife loves the sampler player, they have sushi for everyone, and the chefs are very entertaining. It's almost feels like family. Highly recommend.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Kirstin D.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Trash establishment. Just cares about making a buck and not about their customers. Sushi is mediocre. Management is terrible. Menu is over priced and not worth it. Tried to give this restaurant a second chance after my first bad experience and wish I hadn't wasted my money.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Kelly M.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
I haven't been here in years so a friend and I decided to stop by for dinner! The inside is very nice; very clean and modern, it is a bit dark and also our booth seat was very broken in, I sunk down in my chair! Kinda weird but not a deal breaker of course..

I started off with the house salad w/ ginger dressing (so good!) and then ordered the Yum Yum roll and the Pink Lady roll for my main course. 

The Yum Yum roll was delicious and I really liked the crunchy tempura flakes on top. Normally sushi isn't too crunchy and I liked the variety of taste and texture with this roll!

I have heard good things about the Pink Lady roll so I decided to give it a go. While the shredded crab on top was delicious, and the asparagus was yummy, I was not a huge fan of the large amount of cream cheese in the roll. I have never had cream cheese in sushi (I think the Philly style rolls have them) and it just didn't mingle with the other flavors in the roll. I probably would not get again but the presentation was fabulous!

I will ABSOLUTELY be back, especially on a Tuesday when their special rolls are 1/2 off! What a deal!

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Sherry M.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
From my prior post some will read that I am a huge Chinese, Japanese, Sushi, Hibachi LOVER. 

Yokoso's in the Waterfront is my favorite Hibachi restaurant hands down. I love it. with or without a coupon for lunch or dinner I GO! 

We start off with an appetizer every visit. The Sushi here is very good, but I like the Hibachi. Our appetizer of choice is: the Sampler Platter ( 12pcs - in those 12 you receive, beef gyozas, shrimp shumais, shrimp tempura, and spring rolls. Must try !!  I love the Chicken & Salmon Hibachi lunch or dinner. I have had the Chicken with Steak. I always choose the soup over the salad, but I do like the ginger dressing. I am not a huge iceberg lettuce fan. The show that the chefs display when cooking is entertaining. I like having the food prepared in front of me. I know what I am eating and how it was prepared. 

Highly Recommend. We support on a regular restaurant rotation.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Grace A.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Maybe the steak at this place is ok, but the hibachi veggie dinner was a disaster. Had to ask about the salad and miso (which was beef stock disguised as miso, as if there were such a thing!) along with the shrimp appetizer that all should've come BEFORE my dinner. A plate of sloppily thrown together over salted rice and zucchini with one or two pieces of broccoli and onion - not to mention CORN. Sorry but Yuckoso is my new name for this place!

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Kelly S.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Best sushi in town. Hibachi is also excellent. Come in on Tuesday's (dine-in only) for half off sushi. Their fried rice is also my favorite! I believe their yum yum sauce is made in house, and it's amazing.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Travel 2 G.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: Yokoso is our favorite sushi spot EVER! Server Lauren M is the main reason why we keep coming back even after moving away from the area, and the deep fried rolls are literally the best that we have ever had anywhere. I especially recommend the Pirate Roll with the crunchy asparagus and smooth cream cheese. Their hibachi is also top notch for taste and environment. If you're in the Pittsburgh area, don't miss this gem :)

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Katie W.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: I love this place! As a sushi fan, half price Tuesdays are the sole reason I come here. The hibachi comes in huge portions and is very good. But half price special rolls cannot be bear. The rolls do not appear as fancy or decorative as some other sushi places in the area, but for how good they are and at half price, you cannot beat it.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Ameya R.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Great food here. We had the hibachi, so I'm not entirely sure of their regular menu
The chef puts up an amazing show for everyone (keep your eyebrows safe :) ). The food is also very good, cooked to perfection. Has a huge portion and some very interesting flavours. Their sauces are just too good! I would highly recommend the hot sauce they have. The ginger sauce on the salads is great too
My only complain is the lack of variety in the vegetables they serve with the rice. There are so many options, but they just serve some relatively bland ones

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Edward T.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
My girlfriend and I have come to Yokoso a total of three times over the past 6 months, and each visit has displayed a tangible decrease in quality.  The service was great the first time we went, and the sushi platter we got was fresh and delicious.  

The second time we went there we had to wait a while for our waitress to  take our order.  The restaurant wasn't busy so I have no idea where she was.  When we did make our order of the sushi/sashimi platter, the waitress asked us "y'all do know that's raw fish right?" I was absolutely dumbfounded. If your employees don't understand that raw fish is a totally normal staple of Japanese cuisine, and that this is common knowledge, they should not be your employees. Despite that, the food itself was good, if not spectacular.

Tonight we went back to give Yokoso another try. It was a busier night, so we forgave the waitress for being slow to greet us and take our order of the sashimi platter.  The server didn't say anything offensive, so that was a relief.  When we got to the salmon sashimi, we noticed that it was still frozen solid. We had saved the salmon for last since it is usually our favorite, so we didn't bother complaining.  Blatantly frozen fish is a massive no-no when it comes to sushi.  Our complaint wouldn't have changed anything if the restaurant was willing to serve frozen fish in the first place.  

After our meal we were still a little hungry and didn't know why until we realized that our server did not bring us the soup and salad that was supposed to come with our meal.  We were not vigilant and the restaurant took advantage of that.  We also tried ordering the sea urchin sushi out of curiosity, and apparently the restaurant has never had sea urchin. Why put it on the menu then? Why would the waitress think telling us that would be a good idea?

TLDR; this restaurant features frozen fish, lackadaisical quality control, and can have some pretty bad service.  It can occasionally be good, but so can most other restaurants.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Joe G.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Tried this place years ago, and it was not good, so we didn't try it again until last night. Now with kids, our dining criteria has changed. 

Called at 4:20 to ask about availability at 5:30 for 8 people (2 families). Was told reservations can't be made less than 2 hours in advance but that there wasn't a wait at the moment. I took the first reservation they would make as a backup plan (6:30-after their 2 hour requirement). Figured we'd go in and wait for a table, with worse case that we wait until 6:30 or decide to go elsewhere. Arrived at 5:40. After the hostess confirmed with other staff, we were told they had a table leaving and we'd be seated shortly. We waited 25 minutes. No big deal for the 5 adults, but rough for the hungry little kids. They had mistakenly given the table they had cleared to another walk in party. At 6:05 we were told it would be another 15 minutes. They continued to seat other parties of 8. At 6:30 we were told it would be a while longer. 

Neither the hostess nor manager were well equipped to handle a busy restaurant.  After being told we would be sat shortly when we arrived, we waited 50 minutes before giving up.  We left with a sobbing four year old and ate elsewhere. If we had been told they couldn't sit us for roughly an hour, we would have sat at the non hibachi tables that go largely empty all night.  We're going to Ichiban tonight to make it up to the disappointed kids.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Lauren M.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description:
Decent hibachi place. The worst thing I have to say is that the Waterfront area in general is always crazy packed and hard to find parking. The food is good, the server was attentive and always filled my water. The chef was personable and did an excellent job. They do just put fried rice on the grill, unlike other places I've been to that turn white rice into fried rice in front of you. On Tuesday's all the specialty sushi rolls are half price which is awesome. And they give you SO MUCH food. My friend and I split the chicken hibachi dinner and a sushi roll and it was still a ton of food. The picture I've attached is just half of a chicken hibachi dinner. The other is half a sushi roll. 
It is a bit pricey. However, most hibachi places I've been to have been similarly priced. And they do give you a lot of food.
Also, just a warning, they give tip suggestions on the bottom of the receipt. I did the math for a 20% tip and it was still lower than what they said a "fair" tip is. So do the math if you go, unless you think you had AMAZING service.

JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.author: Ali C.
JzITUte597nI4RXQK9nERQ.description: My friend and I met here for lunch today. It was absolutely delicious and Cliff, our chef, was personable and made great food!! I was not sure what to expect because each hibachi restaurant is different but I must say this experience was the best I have had! I ordered the steak and shrimp and ordered some scallops on the side. It was so good! I ate about 1/3 of my lunch and was completely stuffed! I highly recommend and can't wait to return! Our server was great too but I forgot her name!

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Richard C.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: After Luigi's closed in Bellevue, I began a search for great pizza. Tonight I found it! Doughboy's in The Rocks is the best.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: David Paul R.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description:
Ordered Pizza from here yesterday and it was Good. The only problem was it was around Dinner time and Friday Night so they were Very Busy.  

From the time I placed the order to the time of Delivery was over an HOUR. 

May order from here again but Not on a Friday Night.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Briana B.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description:
It's hard branching away from your favorite pizza spot - you never know what you're going to get! After reading the reviews for Doughboy's, I decided it was worth a shot. 

They don't call this place Doughboy's for nothin'. Dare I say too much crust? I might be alone on that one but the crust took so much effort for me to eat (kind of chewy) so I just didn't eat it. It might've been better if it was more moist or had some type of butter/oil.

Everything but the crust was good though! The sauce is sweet and different than others that I've tasted but I can't put my finger on why that is. They put a whole lot of toppings on the pizza so that is definitely a nice value! 

While I had a good experience, it still isn't enough to take me away from my go-to spot.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Preston J.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: Excellent pie. Banana peppers and cheese, you can't go wrong. Perfect and will hit that spot your craving.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Chelsea M.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: Delicious pizza and slices ready for takeout. Everyone was super friendly. We ordered the sausage pizza and loved it. Plenty of parking

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Stacy B.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description:
I'm updating my review of Doughboys because they went above and beyond to make things right after my first review. Ryan reached out and offered a free pie to try to try to get a second chance with me. I told him I'd take him up on it, but never actually did. I emailed a few months ago because I was considering it, but still didn't. Finally, almost a year later, I took him up on it. 

The sauce and crust were both great. We ordered a large pepperoni and sausage pizza, and it was much better than the last time we ordered. In my opinion, they weighed it down with too many toppings for my liking, but that's better than paying for toppings and not getting enough, or getting what you paid for. I could have done with a little less sausage, but that's just personal preference. 

I think these guys are in the top 3 options for pizza delivery to Brighton Heights, now that I've given them another shot. And it's not that two others beat them out - the other two that I like are just very different. This one is best for people who like thick crusts, heavy toppings, and a really substantial slice. If you're looking for a thin, lighter pizza, this is not your joint. Each preference has their place in the pizza wars. These guys chose to be a thick, deep crust place, and they do it well. 

Thanks for encouraging me to give you guys a second try. The customer service alone earned you another star. The only thing standing int he way of perfection for me, is how heavy the toppings were, but don't change a thing. What didn't work for me is likely what  keeps others coming back for more.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: J R.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description:
Great Pizza.  Be advised this is takeout only. 

Love the crust.  Crispy, texture & body without being douughy thick like Chicago type.  Back home in central Jersey the ultra thin  "NY Style" crust is in vogue & that stuff is just like a melba wafer with toppings. 

Doughboys has fresh ingredients, had a pepperoni & mushroom - loaded with mushrooms.  Also had a white slice with Bruschetta, garlic & parmesan cheese.  Both were very good.  

I'll come back if I'm in the area again

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Renee L.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description:
Look, it's Mckees Rocks.  I am happy to see any non-industrial business thrive in this town.

When someone mentions that a place has the best pizza around (which seems to occur more times than I can count) I'm game to try it out for myself.

Surprisingly,  for has many pizza slices I have inhaled in my lifetime, I can't recall ever labeling any particular pizza place with the best pizza around.  There was one place in New York City that came close,  but it is out of business due to the retirement of its owner.

Let's just say Doughboy's has great tasting pizza.  Very fresh due to the amount of business it generates . 

The shop is full of character, starting  with the seasoned employees, the various walks of life who stop in for their "regular " pizza by the slice order.

Take out only.  There is a small picnic table out front ,where you are bound to see a few of the locals enjoying their daily nourishment.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Melissa A.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: The pizza is not good but everything else is delicious. I've had pretty much everything on the menu here and my favorite is the buffalo chicken and the gyros. The food is always hot and fresh but the cheese cake is always frozen. I just wish they were a little bit more humble. There are plenty of good places to eat chicken and I don't have to go here so they should be more appreciative of that. They are sometimes rude when I'm picking up the food. I understand that they're in a rush sometimes but there should be balance and a little bit of patience with the customers.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Selina R.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: All I can say is YUM YUM YUM. I would recommend anyone to try this pizza. Especially the gourmet pizza.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Ryan S.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: Coming from the land of flatbthin pizzas, over the Smokey mountains to find this smokin' hot pizza joint.  I didn't expect a place like this.  The most welcoming and friendly staff. They sang and danced while I walked in. I was coming in from out of town and they made food even so close to closing no complaints.  The smell was soooo good I had to pullover on a side street and sneak a slice on the way back to the hotel.  I've eaten a lot of food in my life and a lot of pizza, let me tell you I would not hesitate sneaking an extra slice of this pie away from a friend even if it meant he wouldn't get to eat.....that delectable.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Burt G.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: Doughboy's is really the best hands down when it comes to good quality, thick crust, thick cheese, lots of toppings, extremely hardy pizza.  You really get your money's worth when it comes to toppings.  They don't skimp, which to me is a big deal.  I have never ordered from them and been disappointed.  I worked on Neville Island for a time and I ordered from them when I would go on meal break.  Now that I don't work there I have to drive from the south side of Pittsburgh to pick up the pizza, but believe me there are no places in the south side that I want to order pizza from, other than maybe Benny Fiero's if I would walk down the street for a huge slice.  I have not tried their specialty pizza because it is way out of my price range, so I do not know about those, or the hoagies.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Vanessa M.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: I ordered the meaty pie and it met my expectations. This may be my new favorite place to order pizza from. I have been craving it ever since and will be ordering from here again!

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Brad J.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: Generous toppings and an awesome crust that is firm on the outside yet doughy in the middle.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Jennifer N.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: Best pizza in Pittsburgh and friendliest staff of any pizza shop in town.  I live 35 min into the south hills from them. They r worth the drive every time

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: DJ J.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description:
OH boy, Doughboy!  Use to have the pizza on a regular basis when worked nearby but sad to say that was a few years ago.  We were in the area and took a pizza home.  Delicious with a thicker crust and a nice sauce.  If you are in the area a good stop.
Take out only.  They do have pizza by the slice.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: David C.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: First time for me there and I must say the pizza was very good and a really hardy pizza. It's called Doughboys for a reason and it is a thick crust pizza not thin.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Elizabeth J.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: If you like saucy pizza - their pizza is the best! Try it. However I honestly would recommend trying the juggernaut if you haven't yet. It is my favorite thing from here! So good and filling. You will not be hungry after eating one. I have probably recommended the juggernaut to all of my friends and some co workers. Everyone that ever took my advise and tried it, loved it. I've tried making a home made one before and it just wasn't the same. I always order take out, but any time I've picked it up, the workers were nice and took care of me fast. Never had any issues here.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Joan F.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description:
I go in and get a slice or two for lunch about once a week. It's always awesome. The guys are great there. You're always working hard, and the food is great. I love the sauce and the quality of the ingredients, the crust is awesome, the cheese is great.
I love that I can go in and get a slice and it's ready, and it's fresh, and it's hot. Yum.

s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.author: Neil O.
s_CFR6l-ecfGZ3tw16PJDQ.description: Great pizza, wings, hoagies & you gotta try the Juggernaut! Personal favorite: Chicken Fingers with Cajun seasoning dipping in BBQ & Cheese Balls dipping in BBQ! Best in the Burgh since 2004!

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Aj S.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description:
I think we finally found our new pizza place! After being a Brookliner for a year, we've yet to find a L
Pizza that completely wow'd us (not including Fiori's). Antonio's definitely made us happy! 

Pizza was delicious and extra sloppy which I love. A pizza slice should NOT be stiff when you pick it up! We also ordered a steak hoagie that was flavorful and a lot bigger than I anticipated it to be.

Service was friendly and price was good ($19 for hoagie and large cheese pizza). We will definitely be returning!

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Lela T.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: Amazing pizza. Delicious.  Went two days in a row.   Both Days yummy.   Also the woman at the counter was really friendly.   Oh and you need to try the garlic sauce

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Lori G.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description:
Pizza flavor not good.  
Meatballs waayyyyy tooo much garlic!
and sauce was bitter.  Wings good.  
Service good.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Jillian M.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: I ordered from here through Postmates and was excited to try somewhere new. I got the appetizer platter which was missing the mozzarella sticks all together and the pickle chips were random thin pickle chips in clumps with dark brown greasy batter just clumped all over. The entire thing was gross and greasy and luke warm at best. I also ordered a calzone with pepperoni and mushrooms. The dough was a light very pale color with no browning at all (I was surprised it was even cooked through) and it was a complete grease pit. Like disgustingly greasy. Puddles on my plate from one slice of the calzone. I'm sick to my stomach and am going to throw away the remainder. What a waste of $30. Definitely do NOT recommend this place unless you want clogged arteries.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Kanchan B.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description:
Came here as this was the last stop (side note - I originally wrote "lost" stop and then realized what a Freudian slip that was!!) on the Pittsburgh Food tour and frankly, I found this place to be the usual pedestrian plastic cheese pizza place with an undercooked base. 

There might be other flavors but we had the cheese pizza and it was okay - not something I would come back here again for.

Yelp Review 45/2017

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Jenee S.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: Good but nothing great. We ordered Hawaiian, meat lovers, and 6 buffalo wings. Pizza was a little soggy but you got generous toppings. Sauce was ok but too much crust. Wings were large in size and the buffalo was hot. Price for the amount you get and the service was good

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Sean K.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: I was a little hungry while walking on Brookline Blvd and was lured in by the smell of pizza and their pizza by the slice sign outside.  I got one huge slice for $2+ tax.  The slice was great, but I regretted adding the crushed red peppers.  For some reason these were the hottest red peppers Ive ever added to a pizza.  My lips were so hot that it even hurt to lick them lol.  I almost always add the crushed pepper when available at a pizzeria, but wish I had passed this time.  I quickly dashed across the street afterwards to cool off with some ice cream from Scoops on the Blvd.  I liked the pizza and will be back for more, just gotta remember to go light on the peppers next time.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Jon L.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description:
yelp 10% discount deal was refused because only manager knows how to apply it. note to manager: please train your employees in applying discounts.

The pizza's not very good, either. Nowhere near the level of Mineo's or, of course, Fiori's.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Sean B.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: Great pizza!  First time for Antonio's. Awesome dough. When reheated my mushroom pie kinda turned to a floppy mess. But, I can't deduct a star for reheated pizza. Go for it!

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Kyla M.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: This is place is just the greatest. The pizza is fantastic, one of the best I've ever had. The staff is so awesome, attentive, and personable. I've never had a an encounter less than perfect with them. Tony's garlic bread is seriously addictive.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Billy F.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: This place was good at one time.   Tonight though pissed me off enough to write this short review.  Missing an order of fries...the 2 others were cold and 2 cold gyros with big chunks of yellow lettuce and a runny white sauce mostly sponged up by the pita, making it inedible.  Sorry, won't be calling back.  It's not easy to find a good delivery place around here, with a little effort someone could really do well, but some don't get it till it's too late.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Sandy H.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: Waited over an hour for a simple order of 2 gyros and order of fries.  When the driver finally arrived he demanded I give him the money before he handed me my my food.. The food was cold and the fries were black and greasy.  I told him I did want the food and I wanted my money back...  he became rude and belligerent. I called back to talk to management and make a complaint.  They basically told me to call in the morning to talk to the owner. By the way tried to give the food tome dogs and either one would eat it either!

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Dennis K.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description:
Pizza is not the best but the staff is.  Really nice guys, fast moving and generous.  I stop mostly for slices on the way home.  I call from my car and run in and take out for eating at home.  The slices are huge.  The sauce is tasty.  Not the best Ive eaten but a great weekday pizza place.  My only regret is that they use a pizza converyor cooker and not a pizza oven, so the crust doesnt get that crispy.  
Ill be back.  Perfect neighborhood pizza parlor.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Ryan P.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: Great food and the staff is wonderful, they really go above and beyond!! They are always extremely friendly and accommodating to our family especially our kids

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Jessica D.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description:
I'm sorry, pizza, I really wanted to like you, but you were a complete let-down.  After my first love in pizza, Slice, decided to go downhill, I was on a quest for a new number 1 spot.  After reading some reviews, I decided to give Antonio's a try. 

We ordered a large pizza with garlic sauce, bacon and half tomato and half spinach.  I also ordered the chicken parm half hoagie.  While the toppings were more than adequate, the crust was a complete disappointment.  Yeasty, flavorless - it so brought down the excitement I had at seeing a pizza actually covered in toppings. 

The chicken parm sandwich was ok.  It was large which I appreciated and the tomato sauce was pretty tasty, but the chicken was lackluster and there was hardly any cheese atop it's crusty shell.  

We will likely not be back and the pizza exploration continues!

One major plus was that the guy that answered the phone might have been the most pleasant, competent and kindest pizza order taker I have ever in my life spoken to.  So props for training your people how to be considerate on the phone!

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Andrea A.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: Have been a loyal customer here. Good pizza but tonight order never showed up. Was supposed to be 30-45 minutes and nothing. Called and was told he should be on his way. Never saw them. It's a shame. Called and cancelled the order.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Darren W.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description:
Insanely enough, Kay had a craving for pizza after eating at Johnny's Diner and Scoops on Beverly. She at first craved a hot dog, but Hank's Too is closed on Sundays. She changed her mind, saying she wanted something...salty. Alas, Vinnie's Pretzels is closed on the Sabbath also. 

"Pizza. I'll settle for a slice of pizza." 

Arbitrarily, we shuffled into Antonio's for two cuts of sausage-adorned pizza, and I was thankful for it was better than I recalled. The sauce was sweet, the cheese was lardy, and the crust cracked from the dental pressure I applied to it. 

I was also thankful that pizza-hating Kay loved it. Her urge was satisfied, and thus her dark side went into remission for the rest of the day.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Erin P.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: Tonight was our second visit and we will definitely be back. The food is very good, reasonably priced and the customer service is probably the best I've had at a restaurant in years.

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: J H.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description:
Antonio's is my go-to local pizza joint. I LOVE pizza and IMO this is thee best pizza in the South Hills. A group of us had a party, where 15 different pizza shops were represented. The only one that held candle to Antonio's was the great Vincent's Ardmore location.
  Better still for me is that I can be there in 5 minutes from home. Thanks for serving up awesome pies! Keep em coming!

e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.author: Dee C.
e80gyXsUZ7__eAuW7JEj_A.description: I'd give it 3.5 it wasn't super delicious but it did the job. The cheese is super silky. Slices are extra crunchy. Cheese fries are well, cheese fries. Not extremely greasy which is always a plus! Very good customer service, however. That's important.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Shane S.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: The Mongolian beef was crispy on the edges, tender on the inside, and was probably the best Chinese style beef dish I've ever had. We ordered the family portion and it was quite generous, I think it could feed 3 people on its own. The green onions were actually a great accompaniment to the beef as they provided a fresh spicy element. The chicken lettuce wraps were very flavorful. We got two kids meals which were generous portions. Our server was quick and provided everything we needed. Great experience at PF Changs.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Eric M.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
We ordered appetizers and entrees and the whole process took forever. The restaurant was maybe 10% full at best so not sure why it took so long.

The crab wontons tasted real weird, but the kimchi fries were amazing. Now when it came to the main course, it was bad! My wife's food looked like it came from a can and my food, was supposed to be spicy but had no spice at all. Also, it was weird that our rices were brought out in one bowl,  it split in half (I got white rice and she got brown rice).

Not good at all. The fries were the best and after that, this is said, the fortune cookies were second. Don't think we would come back, especially since the meal was super expensive!

(Check out the picture I posted too. Don't think this place does a good job cleaning. Seeing broken up fortune cookies where you eat is disgusting!!!)

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Jenna W.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
The Chang Spicy Chicken is delicious! The signature spicy sauce has a sweetness to it, so it isn't overwhelmingly hot and actually has flavor. They ran out of brown rice when we were there, but they gave us white rice when our meals first came out and delivered the brown rice as soon as they made more. Both rice types were nicely steamed and went well with our meals. The serving size of the entree is large, so you'll have enough for another leftover meal. Honestly, the price for an entree is higher than most Chinese restaurants for the same quantity. However, the quality of the food is slightly better than fast service Chinese food.

I highly recommend calling ahead and making a reservation. We came around 8pm on a Saturday and the wait was 45 mins for 4 people. Luckily the location is close to small shops and Dave and Busters to look around and visit while you wait. Their text reservation system is very convenient, so you don't have to stay I'm the restaurant while you wait.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Caroline T.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: I was here tonight with my friend. We waited an hour for our food to come. The waitress was avoiding us and only told us what was happening after 50 minutes of singing there waiting. She actively avoided us and didn't apologize for the wait or anything. The restaurant wasn't that crowded and this service was inexcusably bad

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Rachel B.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: Let me just say first that i LOVE P.F. Chang's. But last night, my friends and I went for the $10 chicken pad thai special. The portion size was absolutely sad and it wasn't even good pad thai at all. Here's a pic of the entire portion, pushed to one side of the plate.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Kristina B.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: A good of p.f chang experience!  Service was fast and friendly and how can you go wrong with chicken lettuce wraps!  Location is close to the movies and shopping so an excellent quick stop for a bite!  Chang's spicy chicken is always a good stand by as well! I took 1 star off because the table wobbled way too much

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Morgan C.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
My experience here exceeded my expectations! They have a separate menu for gluten free, and I was surprised at how many good options there were! My waitress was very helpful and good about making sure my food was correct. 

I got the gluten free fried rice with chicken, and it was delicious! I wish I had asked what sauce they put on the rice (I'm assuming it wasn't the normal sauce) because it had great flavor. It almost tasted a little sweet, it was perfect for fried rice. The portion size was also huge. I felt like I ate so much and it barely looked like I made a dent in it, I made 2 more meals out of it.

This is a great place to go if you're gluten free!

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Vanessa K.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
Let's start with the good - the waiter was very nice and tried hard, and the ginger beer was nice, though could have had more bite.

But wow, this food was just a bland horrible mess. We ordered the vegetarian lettuce wraps first. Almost no discernible flavor to the filling, though the lettuce was fresh looking. The sauces were similarly bleh. My friend and I discussed that sometimes restaurants think vegetarian means "I want no flavor." Which (SPOILER ALERT) is what happened when I got my entree.

I ordered a Buddha's Feast and the waiter asked "steamed or fried" and I thought steamed sounded better, lighter. Turns out steamed means they will literally just steam some vegetables and a little tofu, put no seasoning on it at all - I couldn't even detect salt or pepper being involved here - and then call that a food. I asked the waiter about this after I tasted this ridiculousness and he said that if you get the stir fry you get a sauce at least, but with steamed it's like this. Okay. So he offered to get them to make me some sauce, which was kind. I mean, the sauce was also bland and flavorless, but I appreciate his effort.

Possibly he could have warned me "Are you sure you want that? It will have no flavoring added AT ALL."

My friend who was having carnivore dishes had a better meal, so maybe it's just a vegetarian thing. But my food was appallingly bad. In 2019 in Pittsburgh there is no excuse for not being able to make a good vegetarian meal.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Kelly V.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
My first experience at P.F. Chang's and I'm giving it five stars! 

Above all our server was spectacular. I visited with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday and he made sure we enjoyed every bit of our night. I also have a food allergy and learned they have a special menu to help me determine what I can and cannot order. Our server was very knowledgeable on each dish and made suggestions based on our preferences. 

Second the dishes are large enough to have a family style meal. I love this because being my first time I never tried anything and it all sounded so good. We started with the chicken lettuce wraps and pork potstickers. Both were fantastic! The sauces provide so much flavor. I could have eaten an entire dinner just of the lettuce wraps. 

For our dinner we ordered the Chang's chicken, Mongolian beef, and lo mein with chicken. We had two sides of rice. I usually do not order beef but I am so glad we did. It ended up being my favorite dish! 

While we did not drink or order dessert here both options looked fabulous. I will be visiting again.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Lillian F.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: Good food, great atmosphere. Ive been here many many times and I've never had a bad experience. I've had the spicy chicken, Mongolian beef, pepper chicken, fried rice, pork pot stickers and egg drop soup. Be nice to your waiters and waitresses. They work hard peeps.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Christine M.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: Food was ok at best. I haven't been here in years and now I remember why. Over priced mediocre food even at happy hour. Sushi sucks. Blah! Over salted food. Our server was the only thing above average this visit. He was friendly and attentive.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Tiffany Y.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: The seating hostess and waitress(es) (we accidentally got a second waitress because of a mix-up) were timely and polite. The appetizer of crab wontons contained much crab meat and was the best that we have ever eaten in our entire lives. The dynamite shrimp and the entrees of sesame chicken and lobster/shrimp rice also tasted good. Unfortunately, the ahi poke bowl contained little ahi and tasted very bland.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Aiyana L.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: This is a nice PF Chang's. Clean and staff is very nice. Have ate here several times before. Ginger chicken and broccoli is good. Beef with broccoli is good. Egg rolls good. Prices are reasonable and portions are decent.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Tom J.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: Food was great however we asked for ice tea to drink and  received unsweetened tea. When a new couple sat down next to us and asked for tea the Danes waitress asked them if they wanted sweetened tea, unsweetened or mango. We were never asked. Seems like a small thing to complain about but we would of loved sweet tea. Music was a little loud over the speakers.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Alyssia B.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: Went in for lunch, ordered crab cheese wontons. They were amazing! Also ordered honey chicken with fried rice. The chicken was good, very crunchy, and a big portion, the rice was a little sad (I attached a photo, sorry it's half eaten). I was expecting some vegetables in my rice.... it was lacking. The Mongolian beef has a nice flavor but very chewy. The staff was friendly. I would try it again if I'm feeling like eating your generic Chinese cuisine.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Lyndsay A.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
Considering that this is a chain which can earn a bad name, I really enjoy dining here! The interior atmosphere is really fun and has a very "zen" vibe. The food is delicious Chinese cuisine! 

The main courses are designed as family style, so it may be a fun way to try several different options! I opted for the Ahi Poke bowl and it did not disappoint. There was more poke than I could eat and the wonton chips were some of the best I've ever had. I also sampled my friends honey chicken which was crispy and delicious. Both came with big servings of rice. 

For dessert, we opted for the new mini desserts which were also delicious and a great way to satisfy your sweet craving when you're full!

Be careful, this place gets busy! It was a Saturday night around 730 and we still had about a 20 minute wait. Service was also a little slow, but I still enjoyed the experience!

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Brad H.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
Even though P.F. Chang's is a chain, it remains one of my favorite places to eat.  The atmosphere inside makes for a great dinner or place to get drinks.  I have always had great service at this location as well.

For starters you have to get the lettuce wraps.  The hot seasoned chicken, with a cool fresh piece of lettuce is a perfect contrast and tastes great.  They also have really good egg rolls.  

For my entree my favorites are the spicy chicken, honey chicken, and kung pao chicken.  The chicken is perfectly breaded and the sauces are very unique  and each taste amazing.  I have also had the sushi here.  I was skeptical at first, but was pleasantly surprised.  They are always very fresh and have great flavor.  My favorite is the lobster avocado roll.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Michael Y.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
Located in the Waterfront area, where there are nice shops and entertainment, PF Chang's is in the center of attention as a restaurant in the area. The name alone, which has established a place in serving premier American Chinese food, already brings in so many people.

My past experiences at PF Chang's have been okay, but I was really disappointed with my visit here. Not only was the service super slow, but I felt that the waiters didn't really care to check in on my group and see if everything was alright. Then, the food was also really underwhelming. Everything tasted like it came straight from the microwave, or was salty beyond edibility. The dishes with sauce were absolutely drowned in sauce, and the meat was very tough to eat and not juicy and tender as it should be. For their chicken dishes, the meat is really dry and the outer shell is not crispy.

Poor service and low quality food doesn't deserve to have the name of PF Chang's on it.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Brooke D.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: Terrible food ... chicken lettuce wraps were gummy, and the sushi rolls rice was hard.. The food had made me sick within 5 minutes of eating it. The service was good though.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Brenda W.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
What?? I've never reviewed this one?  I thought I was going to update my existing review to downgrade it and discovered that, instead, I'm going to write a review for the first time.  Sigh... I lament that I used to love P.F. Chang's as an Asian-fusion quality chain.  Hmmfph. 

It used to be quite good.  Now, I ordered Orange chicken; my husband ordered Kung Pao.  The presentations were no better than recent frozen Asian entrees I got from Giant Eagle (no slight meant to Giant Eagle).  Neither was the taste.  Perfectly cubed chicken squares covered in their appropriate sauce.  Makes me feel as if they have one huge tray of chicken and then just dump the ordered sauce over whatever was ordered.  Not high-end enough for the prices.  Sorry.  Won't be coming back.  Way too many options in the city for this nonsense.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Nek S.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: We went here for a romantic date night and we enjoyed our experience. We were able to tell the menu been updated. The food and drinks were amazing. We will definitely return to this P.F. Chang's location.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Noah R.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: This was one of the worst eating experiences I've ever had. My waitress was very nice and polite, but when I received my food my portion compared to my girlfriend's was completely different even though we ordered similar chicken entrees. My portion size was minuscule compared to what my girlfriend got. When I asked my waitress about it she got the manger to come see what the problem was and then proceeded to tell me what I got is what I got. She offered to bring me out a plate of uncooked chicken to prove the portion sizes were right when I know for a fact I was getting less than usual. The manager was very rude and not helpful at all. I will not be returning to this restaurant ever again, if I could rate this 0 stars I would!

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Jason B.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
Ehh.....average, hence my 3-Star rating. Hardly the best Chinese place in the area, but in its defense, it's not the worst either. 

Would go if it was someone else's idea, but would prefer somewhere else.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: John W.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
PF is one of my favorite Asian spots. The portions are large, quality consistent and service usually good. All of those things were true with this location, and the manager even stopped by as well. The only complaint is the tables weren't as clean as they should have been. We had to make a change even after a table had been prepared. 

We ordered pepper steak, wok-fired shrimp and filer mignon, wonton soup, and a side of green beans. All of it was very good. The pepper steak was a bit too spicy. Typically pepper steak isn't spicy at all. The peppers are just for added flavor. 

The service was spectacular. Our server brought me a second cocktail because I hinted I would want one at some point in the future. We also had the strawberry ginger margarita, which was excellent. But it's very sweet and won't suit everyone.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Robert G.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
This location has been at the waterfront,  Homestead for many years, but after this visit, I believe it has "jumped the shark".

Tables were all slightly sticky, and yes I checked a few tables.  The floors were a greasy slippery,  not water.  I could see shoe prints in the slight grear/dirt covering.  In a restaurant,  the floors need regularly stripped with a good degreaser.  This was not fun for the person I was with as he walks with two canes.

My pepper steak was very good, rice good.  My friend had crispy honey chicken, that was not crispy, but soggy.  Service was great as always, so far...

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Mark M.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: Honestly it went waaaaaaaaaay downhill.You can tell a lot about a place by the people who work there.  Pf Chang's should have stopped expanding so much and focus on the quality of all there places. Call pf McDonald's

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Chardae J.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: I've been here several times and finding words to describe this place isn't hard. It's affordable, quality food and better than takeout (but you can order pick up here). Every time I've been here I've had impeccable service. I've even met the manager who stopped by our table to check on us on one or two occasions. They care about food, flavor, and the experience and I can tell. The menu has a variety of oriental food for you to enjoy. When I first started coming here I was basic with my order of shrimp fried rice and now I venture off into other things. My new favorite is their Korean inspired Bibimbap. As someone who's tried it from an authentic Korean restaurant, I love their American style version. My only gripe is it's on the lunch menu only. I don't like eggs but the cracked egg totally makes the Bibimbap pop. My second favorite is their Kung Pao Shrimp. They know how to utilize spices and ensure that the flavors are married and not fighting. Their happy hour menu is something to smile about and their drink menu is merry. For my birthday this year I tried their egg roll dessert and it was surprisingly delicious. If you can fit room, do get an egg roll. You won't regret it. I have no complaints about this place. It's a good value. Don't go expecting five star fancy food but do do expecting to be wowed for getting so much food for a low price.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Christine H.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: This review is just for the food. Our service at this location was very good.  I had lunch with a business associate, and we sat at the bar, where the manager came over to greet us, along with the bartender.  I ordered the Ahi Poke Bowl--Never have I ever had such a horrible lunch...it was about 1 ounce of ground up tuna (just like you'd put in a spicy tuna roll)--a huge pile of ginger slices, 3 pieces of mango and 4 huge pieces of avocado, with the nastiest seaweed salad I've ever had, and some wonton chips, with dressing on the side.  I don't even know how you eat this correctly...everything was cut in disproportionate pieces, that couldn't be put on the chips.  It looked nothing like the picture on the website.  Do yourself a favor and steer clear of this lunch---clearly since this dish didn't come prepackaged frozen the kitchen has no idea how to prepare it. I didn't complain about this because I was with a person I do business with, but seriously do not go near this dish.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Antara G.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
Came to this side of town and decided to have dinner here with my family. It was peak dinner time- 6:30pm on a Tuesday evening- packed, but we didn't have more than a 5 minute wait, which was nice. 

We were seated and I'm not sure if P.F. Chang's has recently changed this, but we weren't given the selection of sauces they used to give before. It's been a few years since we came to a P.F. Chang's, so didn't know if that concept still existed, but there wasn't as much as any salt or pepper on our table. 

Our server was very friendly, but when we asked him for some hot sauce/chili oil, it took him a good 15 minutes to bring it to us, at which time we had already chowed down. 

The size of our entree- Mongolian beef- which we paid around $14 for, was definitely smaller compared to what we had gotten before. Was quite disappointed by the fact that the pieces of meat didn't even cover the entire bottom of the serving dish. We also got the Hokkein noodles, which was enough for three people. 

The restaurant is in a very nice area with other shops and restaurants in The Waterfront in West Homestead.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Emily L.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: I got veggie fried rice, crab Rangoon and egg rolls. Honestly the best part were the egg rolls, the Rangoon wasn't cheesy at all likenimnused to at every other place and the rice doesn't have much flavor for all the stuff they load onto it.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Mike S.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: So this place is never a disappointment. From the moment you walk in, get your seat,  meet your server, everything is excellent. Tonight we sat at the bar, a member of management stopped by our area, the staff was so nice! This place has to have amazing leadership. Everyone was great. Now to the food, it was unbelievably delicious. Perfect serving sizes, warm colorful. Just delicious. Again we didn't finish it all and the staff had no problem wrapping everything up for us. Now the price is a little high, but with this level of service I'll pay that every time! This place is a must!

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Paula V.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: I ordered from here twice now used the delivery method.  The food was cold, and the food was just ok guess I will not be ordering from them anymore. Driver was very polite.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Julie M.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
We stopped in on a busy Saturday night at 7pm and were told the wait was 90 minutes. They take your cell
# so we were able to do some shopping while we waited. Fortunately they called us after an hour. I had the steamed pork dumplings which were delicious and a perfect ratio of filling and dough, with a chili sauce on the plate. I also had the lobster avocado roll which was also delicious, especially the cream sauce that had a great umami flavor.
Service was good and quick and the restaurant appeared clean despite being packed. Even though this is a chain it's a good stop when you're in the mood for something different.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Justin B.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
This was my first time ever eating at this place. I'll say that I was not disappointed!! Not only was everything fast but our service by our waiter in general was amazing!! 

The food was such big portions and very fair prices. I had plenty to take home for lunch at work tomorrow! I can't wait to return here more and more. 

That was the best hour and a half trip to a place to eat I have ever had!!

Definitely give this place a try!!!

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Susan F.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: So overrated and overpriced! The wonton soup was not too bad but had way too many things other than wontons in it (including water chestnuts UGH) The service is often below par and the dishes are all either spicy or bland...with not much in between. They should have a scale like many other restaurants. I'd much rather go to a family owned Chinese restaurant like the Chinatown Inn in downtown Pittsburgh.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Mike E.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: Girlfriend and I stopped for lunch today at this location . She waited for a table , I went to men's room just in time to see an employee come out of the stall and leave without washing his hands . Got my girlfriend and left any restaurant that doesn't practice basic sanitation doesn't get my money - ever go somewhere else why take a chance ?

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Kimberly T.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description: I met some family for lunch and was excited to see that they offered bowls with rice or noodles.  Then I was bummed because the two I would have picked were spicy.  I just can't do spicy.  So I opted for the Honey Chicken Bowl with brown rice.  The chicken was a little crispy and they gave you a bit of sauce over the rice.  It had a good taste but there was some heat in that dish.  I have had their Honey Chicken here before and it's always been mild.  I'm not sure if maybe it was cooked in the same oil as a spicy dish made before the Honey Chicken but it carried spice.  The rice helped to take the bite off of the heat but I drank a lot of water trying to tame the burn in my mouth.  The others with me ordered spicy bowls and enjoyed them.  They looked amazing.  I was bummed that my non-spicy options were limited and even then I somehow got some heat.  So I will go back to my regular choices of places to eat Chinese food.

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Lisa M.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
The food and service were excellent,  and our server honored all my requests.  She also let me box my own food. Wontons and Fried Dumplings are awesome!!  Drinks are very good as is the sesame chicken.   Only downfall was the chocolate dome dessert was a bit disappointing *mushy and lack of good flavor*.   The service is very attentive.
(P.S.  Warning - fried rice costs extra $$)

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Taylor K.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
PF Chang's is a typical chain - you can expect the same menu from location to location. Really good experience at the Waterfront with our waiter - s/o David. My friend had the Pad Thai - it was good, but not the best Pad Thai I've had. I had the stir fried eggplant with brown rice...so yummy! I've never tried anything similar to this at an Asian restaurant. We shared the Cauliflower Tempura which was a hit. Tastes very similar to a Sesame Chicken, but with cauliflower instead. 

Even though PF Chang's is a chain and I have to admit, I'm not usually impressed by these big chains - I was impressed with our experience here. Good food, good service. I'll be back!

cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.author: Steph H.
cGQKUOAZm_VHcQOJWbatog.description:
This place never fails. I come here pretty often and am never disappointed.

You HAVE TO start with the lettuce wraps. Seriously, these changed my life. Also, ask for the special sauce with them if you like spicy.

The Kung pao chicken and shrimp is my favorite. It has a little spicy kick, but is not unbearable by any means. The spicy green beans on the side make the meal. 

You also need to try the Bomb Pop Martini. It is not on the menu but if you like a sweet, fruity martini, then this is for you. They make it upon request!

Our server this evening, Kristina was AWESOME. She was sooo nice and personable. She really did a great job!

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Rachel C.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description:
Came in here with my dad on short notice and came out feeling completely impressed; which is good since they are one of the very few Chinese restaurants in the area.

We ordered the Kung Pao Shrimp which is one of my favorite "go-to" dishes. The service was quick and efficient and the overall portion was enough to feed us both. In addition to the generous portion we both liked how they did not skimp on the peanuts or shrimp - the peanuts were not too salty and the shrimp was thick and tender. We both also really liked the sauce - it had the perfect amount of kick. The vegetables it came with - the celery, carrots, water chestnuts, mushroom and zucchini - were all cooked to the perfect amount of crispiness. The dish had everything you could want in Kung Pao Shrimp. 

We will definetly come back here if we end up finding ourselves in the area and craving Chinese food again!

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Alistair C.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: Pleasantly surprised by how amazing the food was! I ordered Szechuan Hot Sin and it was mind blowingly delicious! Real lobsters, huge sea scallops and ample shrimp was joined by copious amounts of broccoli, water chestnut, cabbage and zucchini. The sauce is a smoky spicy affair that complemented the ingredients. I also ordered shrimp in lobster sauce to go. Just sampled some of that and have to say it's the best I have had in years. The prices are insane too! Lunch specials are $4.85...Yes, this is not a typo. Entrees are reasonably priced and the portions are legit. The quality of the food is top notch too! Cannot wait to go back.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Bhawana B.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: This is my sister's, my sister's ex boyfriend's, my friends, my family, and my favorite Chinese restaurant. The food is delicious and the workers there is so wonderful. Nothing comes close to this restaurant. When you walk in you can smell the delightful cooking. When you sit you get treated like royalty, and their service is great. You get to order what you want and while you wait you can read the horoscopes on the back of the menu. It is clean and kid friendly environment. Ton of people are there everyday. When you get your food you and bite into it you can taste love in the food. No matter what you get. You get what you expected and so much more. I can't enough good things about it. I just love the Tong Garden.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Aja J.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: Doesn't get much worse, folks. I was "weekending" in Brookline and stopped in for takeout since my favorite spot around, Silver Palace, was closed for vacation. My General Tso's was soggy, the Crab Rangoon was missing all the crab...and rangoon, and it was just all around pretty nasty. I hate saying that, but it's true!

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Vicki K.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description:
Not a fan. First time I had sweet and sour chicken and it was completely overdone. I'm talking crispy and the chicken had dried out and shriveled away from the breading. The second meal I had was general tso's and it was soggy. I actually didn't finish that. 

Gave it 2 stars because the woman at the register is nice, the mixed egg roll is good and my dog enjoys the white rice

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Nicholas W.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: Got some take out and I really wasn't impressed. Dish smelt like smoke and taste watery and burnt. Better options nearby. Really wanted to like a business on the Blvd but I probably won't be coming back. This is my second time trying it...

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Bill W.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: This is my go-to place when I haven't gone shopping yet. The food is very good and portions large. I love the steamed tofu with vegetables and brown sauce (which is a variation of the Ma Pa Tofu (or something like that - they don't mind special orders). They are also pretty fast. The ambiance leaves something to be desired but for the price and food quality (esp. for take out), it's great to have them in our neighborhood.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Bryan B.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: Tong Garden on Brookline Blvd is my favorite Chinese food, their chicken and shrimp egg rolls are to die for and the sechuan beef is excellent. The owners are very nice people as well. I've been going there for 5 years and I've never had a bad meal.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Steve S.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description:
I saw some good reviews on here for The Tong Garden, and I've lived in Brookline my whole life, just haven't ever tried this place.  So I ordered the General Tso's lunch special and tried it out.  Came to $5.95 and was a good portion of meat and rice, I ALMOST couldn't finish!  But I did.  

One note if you order the General Tso's, wait at least 5 minutes before you eat it.  Be especially careful when dipping the chicken in the sauce, which is about the temperature of lava!  Even about 15 minutes after I got it, it was pretty damn hot, so be careful!  

Other than that, my lunch was delicious.  I'm going to have to try some more things here.  I usually order my General Tso's from China Village on Library Road next to the Castle Shannon Storage, and I'll probably continue to do so.  I think it's $4.80, you get about the same amount of chicken, more rice, but it's more flavorful.  The lady there is really nice too and is impressed every time when I ask for chopsticks.  But I will be back to Tong Garden to sample some more dishes.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Patrick M.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: Great food at good prices. Very generous portions. And FAST service. Great service. The owners/Employees are very nice and friendly people. I go there for take out and also to dine in.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Carrie M.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: Very good and reasonable prices. Nice size portions. Best shrimp I have ever had in a Chinese restaurant

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Jack B.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description:
Chose this place based on the previous review. I live in the Banksville area and have been searching for a decent place for Chinese takeout for years. Particularly, my wife and I have been searching for a restaurant with ample, fresh veggies (with rice and brown sauce or with lo mein) and crisp, tasty tofu. I called Tong's for the first time without referencing a menu and simply described what I was looking for over the phone. They said, "Yep, we can do that" and then told me it'd be ready in 20 minutes.

I got there and it's as unpretentious as the reviews say. A regular walked in behind me and asked where the kid was and apparently he was in vacation in China. While waiting for my food (I was early), I perused the menu and noticed that what I had ordered (mixed veggies w/ brown sauce and an order of General Tso's tofu) didn't exist on the menu. I was charged a reasonable amount in spite of this and it turned out pretty good. Not my favorite tofu to date (Mandarin Gourmet downtown wins that) but definitely satisfied my craving. Vegetables were also very, very good. They included zucchini, carrots, broccoli, onions and other good stuff without the typical "filler" veggies that you find at cheaper places. With that being said, this place was a buck or two cheaper than everywhere else I've tried in a 10 mile radius. 

Bottom-line: Best Chinese restaurant this side of the tunnels. Highly recommend.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Julie H.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: I loved the food here. The egg rolls were the best I've had around the area. It wasn't filled with cabbage like other places. The portions were huge. Everyone in my party had left overs for the next day. The only thing was an issue with parking.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Jan M.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description:
Happened to have Tong Garden because it was close by, and not pizza! The hot and sour soup is okay, thick and heavy on the white pepper, not my favorite. Silver Palace on Rt. 88 has a much better version. 
The steamed dumplings are tasty, but I almost want to bet they are pre fab, not made in house. 
My favorites are anything and everything spicy, although I always request extra spicy, and the Kung Pao chicken, and beef have both been tasty. The version of Ma Par Tofu was good, but heavy with oil. 
Consistency is usually there, but a few occasions, I was told a different cook was in the kitchen, and it tasted like it. Sweet and sour pork ordered for someone was a disappointment.
Tong Garden is okay for something different, reasonable prices, and always friendly service. Not a regular go to, but it'll suffice in a pinch.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Darren W.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description:
We've been getting take-out from this place for years, and I have yet to eat better Chinese food in this city. My favorites would be the appetizers, especially the Fried Dumplings, The Egg Roll, and the Crab Rangoon. The General Tso's Chicken though is tender, sweet, and rich, and the Beef Fried rice is steamy, and light, yet sticks to the ribs, the little meat bits being packed with flavor. I also crave the Sweet and Sour Chicken, and I cheat!  I just dip it in that red candy syrup. Rules are made to be broken.

Be mindful of the little ones when you stop by to pick up your food too. One of them is always doing their homework or showing you their toys.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Bobby S.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description:
good no-frills old-school chinese grub on the doudy eastern end of brookline boulevard.  some nicer lighting / interior design would do them well.  
  i love the mongolian beef and the hot n sour soup is delightful on a frigid cold winter day in pittsburgh ...
$4-5 lunch specials.  can't be beat.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Cathy S.
