I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: I have tried the chicken lo-mein, it ok.  the ginger chicken (I get it extra spicy) is super yummie!!!! the general tso's is a hit or miss.  the hot and sour soup is ok.  the Mongolian beef is super yummy!!!! the fried rice is ok. the veggie egg rolls I don't like. will add more as my family and I try new dishes.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Damon V.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description:
yummy, yummy chinese food.  thank heavens for there being one in brookline.  great food.  friendly, fast service.  decent prices.  funny kid who jumps out and tries to scare me every time i go is great in store entertainment.  very simple decore.

i always walk here when i order since it so close and they always have it ready before i get there.  usually get the general tso's.  must try the other menu items someday.

I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.author: Eric O.
I_vzg2V92U7wdD61tvGtpg.description: Tong Garden (Tong's Chinese Restaurant) is a wonderful little family run restaurant. It is located on Brookline Blvd. The dining-room is nothing to write home about. Simple tables and chairs in a somewhat tattered setting. Children's magazines and toys can often be seen in the corner as the owner's children often play, watch TV, or do their homework in the restaurant. The food, however, more than makes up for the lack of ambiance. Simply put, Tong Garden has some of the best Chinese food in Pittsburgh. The Mooshu and Kung Pau are excellent, the sweet and sour chicken is made with large strips of succulent chicken breast, and their soups and sauces are wonderful. If you have the chance, try Tong Garden. Highly recommended. Cash only.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Todd S.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: WOW is this place good!!! I wish I lived closer to it. I was working in the area and tried it out. I went back 2 more times the following week! The chicken fried rice is some of the best I have had- definitely the best in Pittsburgh.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Kacee C.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: We order all the time, the food is good, but portions are way too small for the price.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Paul V.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: We have ordered from Dragon Palace several times, and the food and service have always been fantastic. I particularly recommend their "authentic menu" items.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Linda N.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: Delicious! Food served piping hot and great service. Very enjoyable and highly recommend !

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Shannon B.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description:
We have been wanting to find a new Chinese food restaurant for a while now because our previous place (Hong Kong Taste) had been disappointing is in so many ways.

We have finally found our new place! The food was very good! I ordered orange chicken, which I didn't see listed on the menu, but they made it anyway. So good! My husband got the sesame chicken and an order of the beef lo mein. Both had a lot of flavor.

I also got an egg roll and an order of fried dumplings. Both were full of flavor, and I'll definitely get them again. We even got a couple of free doughnuts. Everything was so good! The staff were so friendly too! Great place, and we can't wait to go back and try more!

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Thomas J.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: I have ordered a $50 delivery from this place after they had opened in 2018, just to try a new place. The ONLY positive thing I can say is that the food seemed to be fresh & that is all. The portions are VERY SMALL for the prices they charge. I am a former chef for many years & most restaurant-related individuals & customers have pet peeves & here is my #1 pet peeve: HAVING HAIR IN FOOD & Nothing disgusts me more than this!!! When I start eating, 3 bites into my meal, I notice something isn't rite & YES, I find an extremely long hair in my mouth!!! I called to complain, asked to call next day to speak to manager, took a week for a response, offers a food substitution (I decline, I only request money back & denied due to credit card use) & informed they're not at fault. (I have a bald head, so SOMEONE there is responsible!!!) All I get is avoidance, lies, nobody knows anything, money cannot be returned, manager finally comes to residence to see food, I pull out a VERY LONG WHITE HAIR; she doesn't know anything & has nerve to offer me free RICE!!! I DO NOT/WILL NOT recommend this place AT ALL for a meal!!!!

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Tim B.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: I was very pleased with my meal here. It wasn't fantastic but definitely good enough for me to want to come back and try some different selections. I had the Hawaiian Chicken. Portion size wasn't huge but was quite acceptable. Service was friendly and quick and time to prepare the food was good, considering that it was prepared fresh. I liked it and look forward to coming back.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Howard T.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: Alas another ho hum chinese restaurant.Wonton soup was a clear salty dark broth with 4 wontons. Singapore noodles were dry.Mooshu pork was tastless.They do  have a good garlic sauce which was a pleasent surprise. Overall this place is not worth revisiting.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Ryan M.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: Great service! Friendly and helpful atmosphere! Food is great! My new favorite Chinese place.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Catherine C.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: My husband and I grabbed take out from here and it was really good! Great service, prices seem to be reasonable compared to others as well. The meat in the fried rice and Lo mein was all really good quality. The food wasn't greasy, and had a lot of taste compared to other Chinese restaurants that seem to have the same taste for everything. We will definitely be ordering from here again!

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Loren K.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: I was really in the mood for Chinese food yesterday, so I thought I would try Dragon Palace based off of the Yelp reviews. I ordered the Sichuan Tofu because I saw a picture of the Sichuan Beef on Yelp (submitted by the restaurant) and it looked delicious with the bamboo shoots and other veggies. When my dinner arrived, it was just a bunch of silken tofu floating in a bland, viscous sauce with no vegetables. It was so unappetizing that I couldn't eat it. The photos submitted by the restaurant are misleading, and I will not be ordering from here again.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Stacie D.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: They have great food! Much better than Tai Pei. They have a large menu including traditional and authentic ! We need to support a local family owned restaurant . This is high quality , large portions and amazing service. The food improves every visit.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Jason B.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: I tried the General Tso's Chicken lunch yesterday.  What I got was more akin to Generic Tso's Sweet & Sour Type Chicken.  The chicken was under-cooked (as in raw batter and medium rare chicken), the broccoli was cold, the sauce was from a pouch, and the waitress inattentive.  The portions, under-cooked as they were, were large.  The rice was nice.  I would skip this place and maybe try the Chinese restaurant up the road.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Alex R.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: Great Chinese food, delivered. Super friendly staff. We've ordered 3 times and it hasn't missed a beat once. Highly recommend!

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Mark Z.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: Very good food service very friendly highly recommend it  I got the crispy beef it was awesome

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Twofor F.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description:
A nice surprise, for Sharpsburg!  We gave it a try last night, take out style. They has quite a few orders ready to go, and about half the tables were filled. Big hello from the staff, very friendly and they seemed genuinely appreciate for the business. We started with steamed veggie dumplings, sort of the low point.The dough was quite thick and heavy - BUT they were large and filled with a very tasty blend of veggies. Trimmed the extra dough off and they were gobbled up!
 Moved on to the main dishes - Szechuan beef (lots of veggies, great taste, tender beef), Dragon and Phoenix (tender chicken, shrimp, lots of crisp veggies) which was a little bland but very good taste, and veggie fried rice (plenty of fresh veggies with maybe some frozen peas and carrots) - again very tasty. We were struck by the amount and freshness of the veggies, the tenderness of the chicken and beef, and the low amount of oil used. Potions were plenty large (leftovers for lunch), food sat well with everyone, and the prices were good. I wish they had brown or similar rice but only white rice is available. The decor is attractive, the restaurant was quite clean, we'll be back for sure!!

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Matt G.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: Good food compared to the other Chinese restaurants in town. Got the pork dumplings and beef lo mein. They were very good.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Kris K.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description:
Easily the best Chinese food in the area. Forget Jimmy Wans and Tai Pei. Cheesy name aside, Dragon Palace is authentic and delicious. 

Ho fun noodles are fresh, flavorful and not too greasy. The diced chicken with fried pepper has a wonderful crunch with a spicy salt and pepper kick. 

Looking forward to trying more things on the menu next time. If you're tired of the tired Americanized Chinese cuisine scattered around the greater fox chapel area, you need to check this place out.

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Tony R.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: First day open and I thought I would give Dragon a try. We ordered the General Tsos chicken, a standard staple, and it was good. The dinner was large enough for my wife and I to share and we were both satisfied. One downside, they don't have veggie egg rolls. We will be trying more off the menu to see if they are more than a one trick pony. To Erik B, the price is what we were expecting for a meal. By the way, customers from Sharpsburg don't have to settle for okay quality food. We actually like high quality food and can pay more for it. Snob much?

Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.author: Wei L.
Msq2CBPFaY7Fe7h7R20fOA.description: Love the scallion pancake and the spicy crispy chicken.  Try the special spicy dipping sauce, I now dip everything with it.  My dog Chops loves going there too, we always leave him some rice or leftover.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Andrea M.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: If I had to describe the food here in four words , it would be the phrase "Mexican American comfort food." Tacos, enchiladas, fajitas and chimichangas are among the offerings- all tasty. We come here fairly regularly, and always have good service. The decor inside is bright and colorful- it reminds me of one of the Mexican restaurants where my family went when I was a kid- but it's clean and honestly, a little nostalgia is good for you. And the prices are very reasonable. They have nightly specials during the week on a la carte items, and their lunch specials can't be beat. I'm regularly surprised that it's not more crowded there. I recommend Patrons very highly.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Bethany F.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Ok. We visit alot of Mexican places but this is our favorite local chain. You can't go wrong. The staff is fun. The margaritas are fantastic and the food is scrumptious. We have never had less than a wonderful experience . I try to get something different every time. You will love it here. Affordable and kid friendly

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Cheyenne H.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Been coming for years and never disappointed. Absolutely amazing food. I'm still even in the restaurant while typing this up. Would be 5 if not for yelp's weird rules about 5 stars!

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Olivia F.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: This place was awesome! If you want authentic Mexican food this is the place!!!! Two of us went at 5 PM (happy hour is 4-6) and got guacamole, enchilada dinner, shrimp dinner, two margaritas, one piña colada, three Coronas, and fried ice cream for dessert and it was only $57. Wilfredo was our server and he was awesome! Never had an empty drink and our food was out quickly every time. Will be back soon!

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Rebecca L.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Coming here was second choice but not regretting it at all. The food came out fresh and fast. The wait staff was writing down our requests and having a seven year old in tow made the casual atmosphere more comfortable for all of us (3 adults)  three boxes of leftovers but the salsa and chip came right after we sat down, so we were nibbling immediately. For a Sunday evening meal it is a good option. Not every restaurant is open on Sunday in Pittsburgh.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Vickie L.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description:
Just got home after waiting over 1 hour for food. When I told server we were leaving and to give us our bill for the drinks we'd had, he insisted we STILL wait for the food.  My husband finally left after the 1 hour mark.  He was starving and there's a McD's on the way home. I stayed to pay the bill. Instead of bringing the bill for our drinks, and well after an hour (!!!), they brought out the food!  -- After my husband had left. And it was the  entire bill. They didn't even comp a drink or anything.
Oh - and the Choripollo had only two VERY small chicken pieces. Smaller than chicken nuggets. More like chicken knuckles.
We will not go back to the Patron's in Fox Chapel. We used to be such fans. They have certainly gone down hill.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: B D.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: What is the deal?  Patrons has cheapened out.  I paid for a margarita and got this small sample in a PLASTIC cup.  WTF!!  I will never come back.  This from a family that has been regulars since it opened!!!

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Tiffany Y.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: 1.5 stars. I should have listened to the reviews, but I instead based my decision to eat at this location of Patron because I had a good experience many months ago at their location in Monroeville. We were seated promptly, and the waitress was polite. However, the appetizer of nachos and the entrees of chicken quesadilla and chicken fajita, in my Mexican-descent husband's opinion, contained "gross" ingredients, and I thought that the foods lacked flavor. The waitress waited a while to refill my husband's empty drink. We ate about half of the food. Because I still felt hungry, we immediately went to Eat 'n Park down the street to have our second dinner. My husband said of Patron, "This was the worst Mexican food that I've eaten in my life." The food also made my husband stay up all night with bad heartburn. He has even refused to ever go to another location of Patron. I think that their chef needs to be retrained.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Leslie T.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: I tried Patron today based on the rave reviews I found on Yelp.  I have to say that I was quite disappointed.  The salsa tasted more like something that had just been poured out of a can of tomatoes--there were a few wilted flecks of cilantro, but no discernible flavor.  The chips were fine--it's hard to mess those up.  And, I have a mixed review for my mixed platter.  The refried beans were delicious.  The taco was edible, but unremarkable. And the chile relleno had so much gooey batter that I had to peel it off to make it edible.  The guac was decent, the tomato slices that came with it were watery and flavorless.  Chile relleno is always my go-to when checking out a Mexican restaurant--and this one was definitely "meh."  I'm originally from the southwest, and have had plenty of really great Mexican/Tex-Mex cuisine.  Friendly service.  The decor is authentic.  The ambience?  Well, if you don't mind competing soundtracks--of muzak and multiple tvs, then you'll be right at home.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Hybrid C.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Patrons gets no stars. I had carnitas today but was served beef jerky. The rice and beans were hot when I returned my plate for fresher carnitas. When I got my plate back my beans and rice were cold this time and the new carnitas were the same dry pork. Still got charged for the meal that I didn't even eat. I was born and raised on Mexican food and know what good Mexican food looks and taste like. It's a shame I have to give them a star just to post...

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Wes N.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Recently went to the Patron in Fox Chapel and also the one in East Liberty. I really think that the quality of their food has improved a lot. Their menu is big. Service is quick. Portions are pretty big. And the food is very good. Definitely would recommend if you're looking for your standard Mexican fare.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Dianne K.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: It was the most awful dog food meal I've eaten. We've go here before and it's always been pretty ok, not this time!  The salsa was frozen solid, the chicken (so called) on the quesadilla was rubber and fatty. Our 3 year olds burger was NOT a burger....it was a grayish piece of something!  Bad!!!We will not return!!

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Michelle L.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description:
This was the worse food I've ever had. I had chips and salsa, no big deal.  Asked for fajita tacos (chicken) Cost me $13.  The guy brings out a plate with soggy corn tortillas, chicken that looked like it came from the nearest Chinese place and so many huge chunks of (uncooked) green pepper that I had to take them all off.  I tried a couple peices of chicken and a bite of the soggy tortillas UGH nasty gross.

I was starving so I pushed the plate away and ordered a side of rice.  I got that on a dirty plate served up with what looked like mixed frozen vegetables. 

I will NEVER go back and shouldn't have even gone in when I got there there was only two people in the entire restaurant.  GROSS food, horrible experience.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: BhaVik P.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Great authentic Mexican food and great service! Also great daily specials on food and drinks! Check out the daily specials pic I added! Enjoy!!

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Amy S.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Had lunch today with my two daughters (16&7) and was highly disappointed.  The chips we were initially given were stale.  The second basket we were given were crunchy and still warm, so I have no doubt that our first basket of chips were old.  My older daughter and I both ordered the chicken chimichanga.  The menu simply states that it was a fried shell, filled with your choice of beef, chicken, etc... topped with a cheese sauce.   No mention of green peppers.  Needless to say, they were absolutely filled with green peppers.  More peppers than chicken.  I've never had a chimi with peppers in it at all.   My little daughter wanted chicken nuggets and fries.  They were out of nuggets so we ordered a chicken and cheese quesadilla instead.  When it came out and she took a few bites, there wasn't a piece of chicken to be found.  Add to that no refills, and forgotten ketchup packets, and it was a less than stellar experience.  We'll go elsewhere next time.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Tricia B.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description:
I've been here dozens of times. It's not my favorite Mexican restaurant by any stretch. But it's solidly average, it's close to my house, and sometimes I'm wildly lazy and don't feel like trekking far to stuff my face with copious amounts of free chips. So I keep slinking back to Patron for an adequate but not outstanding meal.

The first few times I went here, I sampled several chicken dishes that had their shredded, seasoned chicken in them (e.g., chicken flautas, chicken enchiladas). I found the texture of the shredded meat to be tough, stringy and chewy -- very off putting. So I started steering clear of anything with the shredded meat, and now I usually get their "pollo amigo" entree, which consists of chicken breast strips over a bed of rice topped with their cheese sauce. It's fairly tasty (the meat in this dish doesn't have any texture issues), although they could stand to be more generous with the cheese sauce. It's not overly spiced or flavorful, but it's generally decent (and that's pretty much how I would describe everything I've ever eaten here -- decent but not amazing).

Service can be hit or miss depending on what section you're in. I've always been seated right away (it's rarely busy in there), and free chips and salsa have always been delivered to our table with haste.  But beyond that, you can't always count on your server to promptly take your order, fill your drink, or check up on you with any regularity. It just really depends on the day.

Given the food quality and service, I think that they are probably priced on the high side. But like I said, when a craving for Mexican food strikes, they'll get the job done adequately.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Shelley F.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Rainy Saturday night.  Ordered food for my family to be delivered via Postmates.  Incomplete order.  Called Patron's Fox Chapel Plaza to resolve the discrepancy and was met with rudeness by Jose.  I even offered to come pick up the missing components of the order.  Jose said he had no record of any order (as if half the delivery just dropped from the sky).  Will not order from Patron's via Postmates and will not dine in.  Here's my equation... failure to correct mistakes + rudeness=loss of a long time, frequent, and loyal customer.  Bye bye.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Kate H.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: I usually just tag along here and snack on chips and salsa but yesterday I went out on a limb and ordered bean tacos. Today it looks like I'm stuck with salmonella or e. coli type systems. Knock yourself out with margs, just not the food.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: Colin M.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description:
The decor certainly smacks you in the face when you enter the door. One of the better attributes is their ability to get you in and out during the lunch rush - even with a large group.

Their menu is comparable to Emiliano's in terms of style and variety but they pale in comparison from a quality standpoint.

Chips and salsa are OK. Overall, not a bad choice just far from my go-to in the region.

keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.author: George M.
keJOgdHUWFm2d08qFk3QsA.description: Usually exceptional customer service and awesome Mexican food in an authentic feeling environment.  Sit at the bar in the back and watch the game or whatever, the bartenders are great, pour a stiff margarita, and are friendly as can be. Tip them well.  Currently my favorite Mexican place in the city.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Emily M.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description: We have been coming here since the old location in Century 3 mall, and come by at least once a month. I am shocked by any negative reviews, as we have vacationed to Mexican and this is the most authentic drinks and food we have found. They are ALWAYS clean and the staff is amazing, attentive and friendly. We love Darwin, but honestly everybody here is great.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Karen P.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
Old Mexico has become the go-to place for my father's family dinners out - it's inexpensive, it's delicious and it works well with groups young and old. 

While this might not make the cut of finest authentic Mexican cuisine for more discriminating reviewers, it does serve good food made with love. And sometimes that is all that matters. It doesn't have fancy stylish decor, it's a bit loud with a similar menu to many of the same genre. But there is always a crowd of people having fun and enjoying their meals too - and that says a lot about a restaurant. 

The salsa is total noms. Sadly it comes in little bowls but they do refill. They have taken dishes off the menu and adapted them for me when I was following a particularly strict food reset. And they are very friendly. Overall a great place to take a family for a nice meal.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Ashley H.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
I was hopeful that Old Mexico would be decent.  I don't want to drive into the city or Monroeville for a Mexican dinner.  Unfortunately we won't be returning to Old Mexico.

We asked for margaritas and less than a minute later we received these ecto-cooler green margaritas.  They must have been premade or something because no bartender is that fast.  The taste was not pleasant... So water was ordered to wash things down.  

Dinner arrived and my enchiladas we're mush.  Overcooked chicken, tortillas, rice... and topped with a huge blob of sour cream.  My husband's fajitas we're interesting.  I've never seen summer squash, zucchini and cheese on a fajita platter before.  In his words, "it was interesting..." 

As we waited for our check, I'm just taking the place in and notice a large tile missing from the ceiling.  I was expecting some bugs or rats to come crawling out of it too be honest.  We weren't going to stay around to find out. 

Unfortunately we're still on the hunt for a Mexican restaurant outside of the city.  Old Mexico just didn't cut it.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Brad H.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
Really happy that a good Mexican place is finally in the area.  The interior really makes you feel like you are in Mexico.  The decor and overall setup of the place is very authentic and made for a great start to the meal.

We started with queso and salsa.  The queso was some of the best I have ever had.  It was a thicker queso and had a great cheesy flavor.  For my meal I went with one of the combination dinners which came with a burrito, chalupa, taco, and an enchilada.  All of the items were very good, but my favorite was the burrito.  The only complaint I have is the chicken in the dishes was a little dry and over cooked.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Erin S.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
Just no, run. It's a combo platter of Myrtle Beach, Ocean City, & Yinzer..this is one of the trashiest restaurants I've ever been to. The outside looks terrible and should have been a sign, but I wanted to give it a chance.

There are many good reviews on here, but this restaurant was full of many sweat pant/wife beater tank rocking customers..so that's where your reviews are coming from.

Transparent report of what to expect..low to average food at a cheap price, yes. If that's what you seek, you will like it. It is a super old building that was half-ass redone but looks dank (holes in ceiling tiles) outdated, and dirty (food all over floor, filthy bathroom) terrible vibe.

The food..I was so hoping that by some chance the food would be good..nope. I had pork tacos, dog food grade meat with zero seasoning, just cooked meat. BFs chicken enchiladas were bland, cheap meat, refried beans worst I had..about to vomit writing this. 

So this place is trashy, nasty, but inexpensive..but seriously if you are thinking this may be a nice addition to Pleasant Hills, it is not. Run.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Courtney B.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
I really like this place but after my first visit both my boyfriend and I ended up sick. We thought maybe it was something else since the service and food were both great. 

We decided to try Old Mexico again. Another great experience: awesome service, great food, neverending nachos and salsa, drinks always filled, all for a fair price. 

Everything you could ask for at a restaurant. 

Later that night, same outcome - my boyfriend and I were sick once again. 

It's a shame because we really like this place.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Joe T.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description: Wouldn't say it's authentic but it is delicious. Generous portions and cheap. Menu is big but it's a lot of the same items reused which is fine, if you make it good then stick with it. The rice was what really impressed me, most places over cook it and it was done right so that is a plus for me. Will be back for more

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Steph H.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
Very tasty authentic type Mexican food! I was surprised by how cute the inside decor was! Our server was so friendly and welcomed us right away.

We started off with two medium frozen margaritas. They were very large and tasty, but barely had any alcohol in them. Oh well. We then had queso and salad. The queso was nice and thick. I wish it was a little spicier but the texture and taste was still good. Same with the salsa!

The menu has a lot of opinions. My husband got a combination plate where he was able to mix and match meats and entrees. I got the chicken and shrimp fajitas which were not on the menu but our server said no problem! Yay! The portion sizes WERE HUGE. My fajitas could have fed a family. Very nice seasoning, but if you want cheese make sure you ask for it. My husband ate his whole
Plate and loved it too!

I told the server it was my husbands birthday and he brought him out a dessert and sombrero. He was so nice and this made our experience a lot of fun! We will definitely be back soon! A must try if you want authentic Mexican and not a mad mex style Mexican dish.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Phil G.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
This visit I tried the chili rellenos and a tamale (side option.) I can't recommend either. The rellenos were drowning in cheese and sauce and lacked flavor.  The tamale had a sweet sauce, I think pineapple was in there, and it was ok but not a flavor I like. Also, there was so little chicken in the tamale. The salad that came with the rellenos was superb. I would happily eat that again. It was lettuce, sliced dark red tomatoes, avocado, grated cheese, maybe something else - and it all went together beautifully. I don't think there was any dressing and it didn't need any either.

We got beer this time as well. The waiter asked small, medium, or large?  I retorted with what's the difference in sizes? He motioned with his hands which was absolutely unhelpful. I don't know if he was trying to be funny or a jerk but neither approach works with me. I opted for medium thinking it would be a pint but actually it was larger. If you're looking for a modest beer to go with a meal, get the small. If you're planning on having a couple anyway, go with the medium.  Don't get the large unless you are also looking for a bicep workout. 

My companion again got the flautas, and I tried half of one.  That tasted great so I'll probably try that dish next time, along with a small beer.

For now, still four stars.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Sammi A.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
My boyfriend and I decided to stop here the other night to try this place out for the first time. After being seated, we got our drinks and menus and began sifting through the many options and choices. The atmosphere itself was very pleasant and colorful. After closing our menus and realizing that we had been chatting for a while, we noticed much time had passed since we saw our server to take our orders. The place was not crowded; it was a Sunday evening so it was apparent that they were not being bombarded with customers. My boyfriend said it appears all the other tables have chips and salsa. I wonder if we were supposed to get that. We began to notice that mostly everyone was getting great service but us. Another waiter passed by our table and my bf asked him if we could get chips and salsa for our table. He immediately looked embarrassed, went to the back, and grabbed our server. She apologized and said "Oh, I thought someone else would bring them to you. Are you sure you still want them now? I can take your order." After our chips and entrees came out at the same exact time, we never really saw our waitress again until the other gentleman serving refilled our drinks and she ran over to the table and made a joke about him taking over her table.
Overall, the food quality and taste was good but the service was lacking.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Stephanie G.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description: really disappointed with their food- no flavor/gross texture. I thought it would satisfy my craving for another Mexican restaurant we used to go to, but the food doesn't even compare, sadly. wish i could have got a refund, honestly.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Casey K.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
Authentic Mexican food is hard to find...especially in Pittsburgh. You can stop scrolling now, because you've found your next Mexican night out. 

This location has turned over a few times to other restaurants and I hope this place is here to stay! Delicious Fajitas and Tasty Enchiladas, with incredible value this place is great for family and big groups. 

Now I am a huge fan of Mad Mex so listen to me when I say skip Mad Mex and try this place out!

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Katie W.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description: I really wanted to love this place. It has a really nice atmosphere, and very friendly staff. We started with a pitcher of strawberry margaritas that just were not right. I think there was way too much syrup poured into the drinks. Complimentary chips and salsa were served, the salsa was fresh and the chips were good. The meals came out in a decent amount of time. I ordered the chimichangas, and while it tasted pretty good, the plate was very clearly microwaved. The refried beans were all dried up and hard on the edges and the rice had a chewy texture. Everyone at the table had very good looking meals, and we were all satisfied with our meals. Old Mexico is good, but I guess I was looking for a bit more attention to detail.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Meg W.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description: Poblano pepper dish is the best! Steak/ chicken all the chips, guacamole, queso great too! Ive found their combination platters bland and that is big part of menu. Good service fun atmosphere. Menu seems updated since they moved out of the mall in a good way. Live close and will be back!

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Charles B.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
Everyone at the bar was underage and way over served. You couldn't get the server to help you because he was busy flirting with said intoxicated people. 

Don't waste your money, go somewhere better.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Valerie P.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description: Do yourself a favor and drive the extra 15 minutes to Totopo in Mt Lebanon instead of coming here. It has a musty smell as soon as you walk in. Slow service with "meh" food. How my meal was described on the menu was different than what arrived. It was just supposed to be chicken, rice, beans and cheese. What came out what was seemed to be a hybrid of Chinese chicken and broccoli and a chicken fajita. It was...weird. I wish i took a picture of it. My friend's margarita tasted like it had wayyyy too much sours in it, so much so that it made her face pucker. The only redeeming point of this place is that they have a decent beer selection. Will definitely not be back.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Danielle H.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
Love the inside decor! Also appreciate the vegetarian options.
Wonderful local Mexican place with good service!

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Jason O.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description: My family and I eat here all the time. The food is consistently good. I haven't had a bad meal here yet

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Alyssia B.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description:
The steak and chicken fajitas are amazing. The guac was perfect. It was Mother's Day and packed so service was a little slow as to be expected. Very friendly and everyone enjoyed their meal. It cost $80 for 2 adults and 4 kids to eat with and have the lava cake dessert (which was as good as it sounds). 
The only complain I have was with the shrimp fajitas..... there wasn't a lot of flavor.... or any flavor... aside from the onion and peppers. It was disappointing. I still ate it because I'm not a picky eater but I won't be ordering that again. I also didn't see any fish tacos on the menu which makes me sad. Over all it was a great place to eat and we will be eating there a lot in the future.

jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.author: Michael S.
jlyuxZtZ5M6TlAlR0_c7kw.description: What can I say besides "yuck"? Nothing tasted fresh or homemade. Sauces, salsas and guacamole all tasted like they came in a can from a restaurant supply store. Bland, bland, bland. It's what I imagine a microwavable convenience store frozen entree tastes like.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Heather B.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: Great, Thai food! Fresh ingredients and great flavor. I have only walk in to order to go and the food was ready very quickly.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Carrie N.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description:
More of a 3.5.  Thai Hug is located across from Children's Hospital in Lawrenceville.  I felt the need to disclose that when we made the mistake of thinking it was right off of Butler and an easy walk from a local brewery.  It's not and nor was the walk especially on a humid August day.  Once we got there we settled into the ghost town restaurant for some dinner.  

As usual we ordered the fresh rolls.  I love fresh rolls often called summer rolls.  They serve two to an order for $6.00.  I was somewhat disappointed that they didn't include a protein with the rolls as most every other place will and they serve them whole.  I prefer pieces as opposed to eating it like an eggroll.  The roll lacked flavor, very minimal herbs mostly lettuce served with an overly sweetened peanut sauce.  I requested my usual Thai paste to improve the flavor and spiciness of the dish.  WOW.  I honestly don't think I have ever had anything hotter in my life!  I immediately began coughing, something I never do.  Even my husband said I have never seen you cough before!  It was spicy times 100.  I was very impressed and regardless of my tearful expression I found myself going back to it over and again.

Next we ordered pork belly steamed buns also $6.00 for two.  Yes! Order these.  Delicious flavor.  The buns were perfectly soft and the pork was fatty and savory served with a cucumber slice to balance the richness and hot sauce to bump the heat.  I really enjoyed the composed flavors of the buns.  

For my entrée I went with the Pad Kee Mao with Tofu.  This is my go to dish at Thai restaurants.  I love, love, love, the fat wide rice noodles I just can't seem to order any other entrée simply because if it isn't broken don't fix it.  I decided to go with a spice level 8, being a little timid since feeling the burn of their chili paste.  8 ended up being too mild, so I used some of the extra chili paste to kick it up a notch.  Well that did the trick!  The flavor was pretty good, the noodles were not the best.  Not overcooked but choppy.  Not those long fat ribbons I look forward to.  The big disappointment came with my tofu.  Just spongy wet tasting tofu. Other than that this was a decent stop with lots of options and affordable prices.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Kim D.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description:
Hug Thai is small, cozy, clean, and quiet. They have an extensive menu and  all gluten free options are marked. My food was filled with fresh vegetables and large prawns. It was delicious. I highly recommend Hug Thai. 

Be sure to tell your server about any allergies so they can modify the recipes if necessary.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: David B.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description:
Really excellent Thai food that will keep me coming back. They serve those delicious Thai Samosa that used to be on the menu at Smiling Banana Leaf. 

I was inspired to try a dish new to me, so I ordered the Tom Kha Soup.

Our server was friendly and funny and welcoming. She was helpful in every way.

For dessert we tried the Thai Custard with Sweet Rice. It was the perfect way to end a delightful dinner.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Larraby C.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: I tried pho and this place is not true Thai food. Also, portion is incredibly small for the price

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Tammi L.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description:
I stopped here while my son was in the hospital and just got a simple chicken with broccoli. It was very nice, with the sauce more like a tasty broth and the chicken very lean. Spice level was 5, but I probably could've gotten it higher, as it seemed kind of mild. 

Very convenient for someone sick of the hospital cafeteria, and good food at a nice price for ther size of portions. I'll visit again and try other dishes in the future.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Alisha V.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: Ordered take out from this place blindly and I was pleasantly surprised. I'm always trying to find a good Thai restaurant and one that makes good pad Thai. This is a decent place! Solid pad Thai with a really large portion. I also ordered the Tom Kha soup because it's my favorite and I always want to find places that make it well. This soup was great! I hate mushrooms and although they're almost whole in this version, I loved it anyway! The spice level is pretty hot, though. I got a 3 out of 10 (from what my ordering app asked me) and 3 is a bit spicy! Still good, though. I wish they put some lime in the pad Thai, though, I just prefer it.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Megan Z.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: This new Thai restaurant is about one month old and located directly across from Children's Hospital. I went to check in on Yelp but learned they weren't on Yelp yet. First take-out tried pineapple fried rice with chicken spice level 4 and the crab rangoon. The crab rangoon was unlike any I have tried, seemed puffier with more filling. Next day ordered the mango fried rice with chicken spice level 4 (have not seen this on any other Thai restaurants I've tried) and the drunken noodles with beed spice level 5. As typical, large portions enough for two. Excellent friendly service, quick and convenient. Additionally, found how to add them to Yelp! Glad to finally another staple Thai restaurant in the burgh!

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Rachel M.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: This was terrible. I ordered my food with a spice level of 5 and it ended up almost inedibly spicy. The spice profile didn't even make sense -- crushed red pepper (like the kind you put on pizza) all over my salad (???), which was also drowning in peanut sauce. I have never received a salad with peanut sauce over it from a take out Thai place -- who doesn't put it on the side?? Incredibly angry. Never ordering from here again, and you shouldn't either.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Colleen S.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description:
Ordered delivery from here and was not blown away. I ordered the chicken fried rice and found it to be quite bland. My coworker ordered his sweet & sour chicken with a spice level of 8 and he said it was more like a 2 or 3. It was not terrible, but I wouldn't go out of my way to order from here again, especially considering the price.

My biggest gripe is that the food prices are higher on Grubhub than on your actual website! Each entree was about $3-4 more expensive...

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Tiffany Y.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description:
I ordered dinner as delivery. 
Crab rangoon - 3 stars - contained a bit too much cheese and grease. 
Green curry chicken - 3 stars - was too watery but tasted good.
Yellow curry chicken - 3 stars - was also too watery but tasted good.
Jasmine rice - 5 stars - was a generous amount for the price.
Fried pot stickers - 2 stars - had dough that was way too thick. 
Pad see ew with shrimp - 2 stars - had overcooked shrimp and too many carrots and eggs.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Casey C.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: Pretty darn good. I like that it is called Hug. Most of their dishes pair well with hugs from animals and humans and also hugs children beverages. Their green curry thing was a delight!

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Stephanie A.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: Ordered through UberEats. Had Thai Somosa and  Pad Thai.  The somosas you get 5 with sweet and sour sauce - very good. Pad Thai was a solid choice. My only complaint was I ordered a spice level of 8 on a 1-10 scale and there was no spice at all.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Maria L.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: Ordered through Grub Hub while I was at work. I got the chicken pad thai and a coworker got a thai iced coffee on my recommendation. The chicken pad thai was bland. Barely any sauce and the chicken looked weird. I didn't each very much of it before it went into the trash. My coworker took one sip of the iced coffee and said it was disgusting. I LOVE thai iced coffee and tea so when I tried it, I knew something was wrong. It had a weird chicken or meat taste to it. They must have kept the iced coffee in the fridge with their meat because it was not good AT ALL. The whole drink went into the trash. I would not order from them again.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Shirley P.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: I love this place! My go-to dish is the pad satay noodles with bean sprouts added, which always tastes superb. I usually try to order from here at least once a week, which goes to show how much I need to fulfill my Thai food craving. I prefer getting takeout or delivery, but have dined at the restaurant once and the host/server was very friendly.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Gretchen B.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: Outstanding Thai food. Went for a late night dinner with the fam and the food (and owner/server) couldn't have been more delightful. What I appreciated most was the precision of flavors - everything was super fresh, not overdone - just right. Very happy we went here for a last minute meal - we will be back!

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Sasimaki K.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: Never again! Larb kai(chicken salad) smelled really weird and was way too sweet. It actually had no other flavors even i ordered spicy10. Fresh rolls were too expensive for what you paid for (no meat) and taste extremely bad. Spicy basil sauce dish was ok but still not impressed. Very disappointed. Never again.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Jennifer Z.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: I've been here once for dinner and the food was delicious! We ordered crispy spring rolls to start, which were really yummy and fresh. I got the green curry with pork (spice level 4), and my boyfriend had the pad see yew with chicken (spice level 6). Both dishes were definitely pretty spicy so I'd play it safe if you are unsure of how much you can handle! Be warned, they do not have AC in the restaurant so if it's a hot summer day like it was when we went, you may be better off ordering takeout. Still, a great price for some really great Thai food.

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: Amanda Z.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: I have ordered from here twice--- the pad Thai noodles with tofu and pad cashew noodles with tofu. I was expecting more from the spice level ( ordered a 10 on both) but they were both flavorful and the portions were huge. Definitely one of the better thai places that I have tried

k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.author: N S.
k2wKGAnlSb4n5WT694GcTA.description: So far so good! I got the Tom kha soup and beef salad. Both were extremely fresh and flavorful. Best Thai place I've found in Pittsburgh thus far!

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Adam C.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description:
I have probably had everything on the menu at this point and have not been disappointed in any way whatsoever. I'm usually the kind of person to get delivery but I often find myself changing it up for this Fox's in particular and going down and hanging out for awhile. The TV screens to watch many sporting events along with the atmosphere provided by the management team and staff is top notch. They are the best people on the boulevard.

Now for the goods about the food. My top choices are the wings whether boneless or bone in. Lots of meat and sauced with just the right amount. All varieties are incredible, trust me.
But let's be honest you go to a pizza shop for what? PIZZA! The pizza is not heavy on the sauce always cooked with the famous cheese blend just melted the right amount, they can't seem to make a bad pizza. I love how they venture out and have even made "The Big One" which is bigger than their Big Daddy, never knew a pizza could be so big and still great quality but somehow they do it great every time. 

If I could rate them on a scale of 1-5, they would be rated a 10! The food, the atmosphere, and the people are what makes me LOVE this pizza more than any. Great Job Fox's Brookline!!!!

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Jamie K.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Fox's is a classic pizza and hoagie go to for me. I have been ordering from the Brookline location for years, and they have yet to disappoint. I rarely veer off from my normal order of pizza and an italian hoagie, but they do have a lot more to offer if that isn't your style. I suggest the wedgies. They're legit. You keep being reliable, Fox's. I will keep coming back!

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Fox E.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description:
I don't give a Fox what you think about this place. I like it. And it's named after me, so.

I've had my own pizza a couple of times from different locations but it always bothers me that when I fancy a slice of it I cannot get it because they don't serve slices. This one is my regular location because it's right next to Las Palmas (with the best Ribeye tacos) so I'm down here in Dormont a lot.

Nevertheless it's a pretty good standard of Pittsburgh pizza. But not as good as Fiore's and Aiello's.

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Kristy G.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Best Fox's I have ever had. Always fresh and always good!! Staffs very friendly as well so Thankyou for affordable delicious pizza

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Stephen A.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: The Brookline location is definitely leagues above most of the other ones. The food is always fresh and the service is quick and friendly. Also, the owners Matt and Katie are genuinely awesome people and are there working their butts off alongside their staff seven days a week. Much respect!

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Billy L.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Fox's pizza has been in Brookline for years. Years ago it was inside of 711 and left for a few years before coming back in the location of the old CVS. Growing up with Fox's so close to my house I couldn't wait for the return and for a little bit it was good then it just went down hill. Fox's changed owners a few times before now being owned by a younger married couple who had made Fox's everything it could be. The owners are great along with the staff very welcoming pleasant young man work in the shop along with the drivers one is an older gentleman who's been there for years and the other driver who is younger with glasses is usually my driver and he is always so friendly and efficient one of my favorite drivers anywhere. I'm so glad the owners put so much care into their business because Fox's is the best it's ever been and have solidified themselves as one of Brookline's best pizza shops.

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Jessica T.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Being new to the area, I was super excited to see we had a fox's... it's our go to for quick and easy dinners

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Steve T.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Always fast and courteous service. Great food at great prices. Delivery is always received hot and faster than expected.

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Valerie P.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Food is always consistently delicious. Friendly staff and fast delivery! Love how they always have great specials and coupons too.

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: A K.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Called on Friday night at 10:15 PM- got an answering machine (?)

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: James H.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Only 2 stars. I called 7/12/16 at 9:49 pm and no answer? Yelp as well as the online website said they close at 11. I called multiple times before giving up. I only wanted a tossed salad. Haha

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Trina B.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Ordered from here this week and one of the pizza's was made wrong. Called them up and a new pizza was made for us and delivered immediately. Awesome customer service!! Very fresh toppings and tasting pizza!

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Kathy J.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description: Food is excellent, reasonably priced and delivery employees are very friendly!    I especially love the grilled chicken salad, boneless wings and taco pizza.  Italian hoagie is shy on meat as other reviewer mentioned.

G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.author: Darren W.
G0tUd_gFsRMGY3HXQQ3FJQ.description:
Not bad for a chain at all, this joint used to be stuck in a gas station down the road if you can believe it. 

We got the typical pizza, wings, hoagie combo.

The Italian hoagie was decent. Some would say they skimped on the meat, but I didn't mind too much. It was a fine hoagie. 

The wings had lots of meat on them and were flavorful. I got the Garlic Parm. 

Now for the pizza itself. It was a thin crust, but was thin without being floppy. It was very soft too, the cheese being creamy and melt-in-the-mouth good. 

No complaints here.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Holly R.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description:
WOW! Not only does Duke's Rib House & Grill serve ribs that fall off the bone, but they have a staff that is just as amazing! We have never had a bad experience dining there.
  In fact we stopped in for dinner on a Wednesday night, and the restaurant was packed with people. We thought about leaving and going somewhere else, due to the crowd, but we enjoy Duke's food so much, that we stayed.
  And, once again, we were not disappointed. Our server, Amanda, had such great success multitasking a million things, all while remaining professional and polite in that super fast-paced environment.
  I highly recommend Duke's Rib House & Grill. I am confident that you will also have an
amazing experience like we always do.

**I also want to mention CHELSEA, KELLY, and BRIAN; other staff members that have provided EXCELLENT service, as well!

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Jenna W.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: Great game day atmosphere! My boyfriend and I came here to watch Thursday Night Football and were not disappointed. There are tv screens every way you turn and the broadcast  playing over the speakers. Steeler fans packed the tables and cheered on the team all night. Thursday is also 86 cent wing night, so we took advantage of the deal and ordered 30. They let you split the flavors in 10s. We ordered the Hot Buffalo, Butter Ranch, and Honey BBQ. The Butter Ranch were the only wings with a crispy skin, the others soggy from the sauce. Butter Ranch was my favorite out of the 3, it had a sweet flavor that mixed well with the fresh chicken. I would have liked if the Hot Buffalo had more spiciness and sauce on it. The sauce had nice flavor, just needed more of it on each wing to enjoy it fully. Service was quick and they let us relax and watch the game. They even respectfully waited until commercial to check in on us. Definitely a great place to watch sports and enjoy a pretty good meal.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Jaclyn K.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: I always enjoy coming here for a quick lunch during the week. Everything I have had has been delicious. The service is always great, and the portions are hefty. I usually can only eat half my meal and have leftovers for the next day still. I recommend the flatbreads, as well as the grilled chicken sandwich and the philly steak wrap. Their sweet potato fries are also awesome (just a $0.99 upcharge from the regular French fries and totally worth it)! The bar offers a wide variety of beer and liquor at reasonable prices, too.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Michele L.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: Don't waste your time!!! Where do I start, served a beer to my husband in a cracked glass, chilli tasted like it was out of a can. Ordered the steak sandwich, had way more pepper & onions than meat, the steak itself was disgusting, no seasoning!! Mom ordered grilled fish sandwich, again absolutely gross, no flavor. Both of us had no more than 3 bites, server didn't even ask what was wrong & we were charged for both. I get it for the people who eat their whole plate then say they didn't like it, but 3 bites!!!! The ribs again had no flavor, baked beans are actually advertised as Bush's beans!!! Like I said, Don't waste your time! Oh & I almost forgot the dead fly in the napkin my mom's silverware was wrapped in!!! I didn't want to give any stars, but had to give 1 so this would post!!!

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Jamie L.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: I've been a few times and each time was good. They have a large beer section. Ive had their pulled pork sandwich which was good. I've also had the pierogi burger which was different and delicious. Our waitress was great and very attentive.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Jason F.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description:
I stopped by here a couple of Sundays ago with my wife for dinner.  We had both been to Duke's before a long time ago but only for drinks.  So whenever we found it in the Enjoy book, we decided to give the food a try as well.  Whenever you first walk into Dukes you immediately enter into the bar area which has a bar and some high top tables.  Then much like a split level house, there are dining rooms both a half level down and a half level up from this area.  The bottom half (where we were seated) has a lot of exposed brick as well as some Pittsburgh sports memorabilia and some large TVs.

For dinner on this evening I decided to get the smothered chicken and chose sides of sweet potato fries and a side salad.  The side salad came out first and was your usual iceberg lettuce mix with red onions, cucumber and croutons.  It was an alright side salad but as you probably guessed with the mention of iceberg lettuce, somewhat tasteless as well.  Once my wife and I had both finished our salads our meals came out.  The first thing about my meal that I noticed was that it was garnished with a green leaf and an orange.  Wow talk about 80s garnish!  Honestly there isn't anything inherently wrong with that other than the fact that my green leaf was somewhat wilted and made for a not very appetizing appearance.  As for the rest of my meal, it looked good with the cheese, peppers and onions smothering the chicken.  However the chicken was maybe a half of a breast and I would have liked more of it.  Still it tasted pretty good as it had a grilled flavor to it and I enjoyed the cheese and toppings with it.  The sweet potato fries here were decent too and I liked that you were able to pick them as an option, even if they were a $1 up charge.

The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  While nothing on my plate was amazing and I was a little disappointed with the portion size, it was a solid meal.  Perhaps my wife and I should give some of their ribs a go in the future since they do consider themselves a rib house.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Jan S.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: I was with a group at Dukes Sunday for the Steelers game, but the staff were really rude. Everyone was ordering drinks and some were ordering food as well, and then they decided to charge us an additional $15 each because they have a "free" buffet at halftime. The waitress started lecturing people saying "it's the service industry, I don't make any money if people are just ordering sodas and beers." We were ordering at least as much as other patrons, but we'll find someplace else to go to watch the Steelers.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Joshua L.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: Watched cook place dirty rolled up floor mat on top of the cut fruit at the bar. Then he asked bartender what to do with floor mat so she picked it up and placed it back on cut fruit while she took an order. Do not order any drinks that require a garnish! You were warned! Btw, the fruit was not covered. There was direct fruit to floormat contact.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Julie H.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: It was the worst experience I have ever had. The waitress was rude and the owner was worse. They tried to charge the party I was with a service charge for sitting at the tables. The most unprofessional greedy underhanded maneuver to try and extort money from patrons.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Jesse T.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: After Driving by Dukes for years, we finally stopped in, and we are glad we did. Immediately when you walk in you're hit with a slight stench of sour beer, giving you a bit of a nostalgic dive bar flashback. However, after your eyes adjust to the somewhat dark innards, you're greeted by a very uniquely 3 tiered restaurant. Which offers some delicious bar food and reasonably priced drinks. The beer on tap tasted a little like the lines need to be cleaned, but wasn't bad enough to send back, however, I did switch to bottles. As for the food, we started with boneless wings which were delicious, my Bacon Cheeseburger and sweet potato fries were very good, and my GF's steak sandwich with coleslaw was apparently awesome. She especially loved the coleslaw. I love Barbecue but am very cautious about ordering it at restaurants that don't primarily sell just BBQ. So I steered clear of their ribs, but someday might feel adventurous and give them a go. Overall, I would recommend Dukes, but somewhat cautiously. It leans more towards a dive bar, rather than fine dining. So if you're in the mood for something more refined, Dukes might not be for you.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Miranda D.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: Delicious food. I tried the pulled pork sandwich and was extremely impressed. I have heard the wings are delicious, I will have to return to try them. Good beer specials during the Steeler's game too.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Joe T.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description:
My friends and I come here at least once a week for a few drinks and maybe an appetizer. The staff is very friendly, including the owner. The drinks are also reasonably priced. 

I've never gotten an entree from here, but the appetizers I've had were very good. I had the quesadillas with pulled pork, and the potato skins. Both were excellent. Fried zucchini was good too. 

The bartender named Toni is very friendly, she is usually there when my friends and I sit at the bar. 

Highly recommend this place for a chill night out with a few good friends. Relaxed atmosphere but not boring. Love coming here.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Rich R.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: Definitely a place full of regulars, but it's not a bad thing. Great food, service is decent. Comfy atmosphere to watch a game.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Eric Z.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description:
First time here after having been recommended by a friend. Pretty interesting atmosphere with the split level bar and seating area. There is no shortage of flat screens to watch the game (Pirates vs Reds when we where there).

Started with the mini pierogie appetizer. They were good but could have used a side of sour cream. My wife got the pulled pork wrap and loved it.  

I ordered the half rack of ribs and 6 wing combo. Wings were ok. A little over done and not that much meat, though the Jerk Dry Rub was good. The ribs were awesome. Extremely tender and flavorful.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Megan Z.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: First time last time....over an hour wait for dinner with about less than 20 people here and still no signs of getting served?! What the heck!

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Patrick P.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description:
I am a fan of Dukes rib house.   It is always crowded and the staff are always pleasant.

One of the better BBQ's in the area.   I enjoy the ribs (Capt Morgan Spiced Ribs) but my favorite item is the burgers.   I think they cook them on the same grill the ribs are done.

I  waiting like some other burger joints where they marry the pulled pork and burger - see flip daddy's review from Miami.  Awesome!

Sides are awesome too... Try the twice baked potatoes :)

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Jack H.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description:
I've been to Duke's twice now for Meetups. This last time I was on a restrictive diet, so I want sure how great it would be. The server and the chef worked together to make substitutions fire all of my restricted foods with no trouble. And the server managed this while waiting on our party if 15!

I ended up with a delicious grilled salmon filet and steamed mixed veggies with a squeeze of lemon. It was fantastic!

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Ally V.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description: Great food!! We go here about once a month as it is in our neighborhood. A great menu selection and everything is consistently cooked hot and perfect. We've never had any issues here. All the waitresses are nice and friendly. It can get loud in here with the music and voices rising (if you sit upstair) but it is a bar too so it's to be expected. Take out is also an option and that always worked out for us too. Burgers, flatbreads, all the apps, salads are all delicious and well worth the price! The wings are to die for and ribs are excellent also.

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: Simone H.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description:
Definitely a fan. Was here with a group of 4 for not just lunch, but drinks and then even dinner. We had a great waitress who kept us on our toes for Football beverages and the atmosphere was good.

It's definitely a great local bar to hang out for a game!

tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.author: George D.
tdFv4HMVEuqebqjHtkZVdw.description:
Atmosphere was ok, service was great.  Unfortunately the food was underwhelming.  Everything had the taste of "big store/pre-prepared".  The ribs were tasteless after you got past the bottled sauce; zero char on the meat or the sauce, so I assume it was just pulled out of a tray and sauced in spot.  Chicken was pre-cooked frozen.

Nothing had the grilled flavor I would expect out of a barbecue joint.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Dara D.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description:
What a cute place!  I was able to bring my pup  and sit outside on a beautiful morning.  They brought out a little dish of water for him too.  

Had the patio all to myself but there were lots of customers coming in and out.  I got the Hushwee and Eggs- delicious!  I was hoping for more fun coffee  options.... but first world problems, amiright? 

I got some baba ghanoush with a hefty side of fresh pita.  Had a quick taste before leaving- it's nice and smooth and so yummy!

The waitress was really sweet, the flowers were beautiful, and the food was on point.  Not much more you can ask for!

Definitely highly recommend, especially if you're looking for something a bit different from the standard American breakfast.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Darren M.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description:
Very slow inattentive service. It appears that the servers were taking turns on who walked in, instead of working a dedicated section. It was 15 minutes before our order was taken, no checking on us after food was delivered, and at least another 10 minutes waiting for our check after done eating. There were a lot of people waiting to be seated, and our table could have been available much sooner if they would stop jumping around all over the restaurant to wait on customers.

The food was great. Had to have been the beast lamb I have ever had.  The grape leaves were also fantastic. Pita bread was stale. A shame that they don't have traditional tea service. The salad was good, great lemon dressing, but seriously guys, iceberg lettuce? If you are going to charge $20ish a plate, you need to step up the game a little. Use some different greens, and more than I slice of soggy tomato, one olive, and one cucumber slice. The sesoned rice that the dinner was served on was very tasty, but the plate was also garnished with a grilled tomato slice that was good as well.

Parking is very limited.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Andrew P.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description:
If you put lamb on your menu, I will most likely find your restaurant. I guess I have a thing for lamb! Who knew...  And I love Mediterranean food. So I'm not shocked that I found Shouf's. I had intended on going elsewhere, only to find that they had been flooded in the recent months, and had to rebuild. Fortunately for me, Shouf's was around the corner and - bonus - had lamb kofta on special that day. It was served as a wrap with a side of chips. Very well done!
I don't usually indulge in dessert over lunch, but the baklava was sitting there screaming my name, and I went for it. Do yourself the same favor, and try it.
The staff was very friendly and attentive, and place looked spotless. I highly recommend this place.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Andrea E.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description:
Yum! I loved the food and the atmosphere! Friendly people too! 

I wasn't starving so ordered the appetizer that included hummus, baba ganoush, etc. It was delicious and filled me up! I had enough for lunch the next day!

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Michael H.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description:
Amazing! Service A+. Food A+. Atmosphere A+. 

If you like Mediterranean Food, please give this a shot. 4 of us and ordered the Family Feast. It was perfect. All of the food was fresh and cooked perfectly. 

Topped it off with homemade Baclava. Off the charts!

Some of these Mediterranean places have become so hipster that you can't enter unless know every Mumford & Sons song. All are welcome here, whether you are a legit foodie or a gyro every now and then kind of person. 

We will be back!  Lastly...the people are so kind who work here. You can't help but want to support their passion.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Rebecca M.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description:
(BREAKFAST REVIEW)

Basic, and I mean very basic menu. I would give two stars, but have been here for dinner and was impressed in the past.

The breakfast I chose could have easily been from anywhere else, to be honest I was kind of disappointed Shouf's didn't have a more diverse menu. Diner food more or less. 

Pancakes were pretty dried out, and hardly had any chocolate chips in them.

Also, is there alcohol here for brunch? I would have LOVED a bloody Mary, or a mimosa but no one even presented me with the idea.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Troy B.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: I have been here quite a few times over the years, and I have always enjoyed eating here, whether solo for a quick lunch (they have daily lunch specials), or spending time with family, or a group of friends.  They do have a wide variety of Lebanese dishes on the lunch and dinner menus, and also desserts (Baklava, Rice Pudding, Cake), plus a fully-stocked bar (For something different, try the Almaza beer, imported from Lebanon).  The Mazza plate is fantastic, and has a nice sampling of appetizers (If you are really hungry, and up for a challenge, you could try to eat this as a whole meal by yourself).  Breakfast on the weekends is good, but it is mostly American style offerings.  I would like to see more Levantine dishes available on the breakfast menu (the Eggs Hushwee are the closest thing to Lebanese that they have for breakfast, and they are very good, but if you ask nicely, you can get some other items that are not listed for breakfast, such as Hummus, Baba Ghanoush, and Mjuddara).  I really wished they had Ful (Foul) Medames on the breakfast menu (hint, hint).  The service is very good, the owner and staff have always been very pleasant, and I look forward to visiting again . . . Cheers!

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Jamie L.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: This is a cute Lebanese restaurant. The place is not very big but has a decent amount of tables. The food was very food and they give you plenty to eat. There's a wine and drink list.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Russell D.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: I was not really impressed with dinner here it was ok but not fantastic I have heard that they have a great breakfast but dinner was uninspired and bland

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Steve R.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: Good tasting Mediterranean food, lots of it, and great service!! It's like eating with family! Mezza platter and lamb kabobs hit the spot! I came for lunch and the service was attentive and friendly. This place is clean!

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Jeff M.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: Got the Mediterranean Chicken and stuffed grape leaves. Both were excellent.  Highly recommend this place.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Greg K.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: Great dinner.  The lamb kabobs were cooked perfectly.  Hummus and baba ghanoush done right.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Maryna L.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: We stopped here for brunch. Had tuna and chicken sandwich with fries. Very tasty food and clean place. Our waitress Denice, she was very nice! Brighten my day after visit to DMV office               --

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Greg S.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: We stopped for late lunch/early dinner. We received excellent service and excellent food. I ordered Loubieh, my wife a spinach pie and we split a Baba Ganoush. This is a rare restaurant where one can get good quality vegetarian fare without processed vegetable oil. I was very pleased.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Falcon V.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: Wow. Moved here from Chicago years ago, now in the South Hills area. So greatfull  to find an authentic and reasonably priced Lebanese restaurant. Never disappoints and something for everyone. Kid friendly and awesome friendly staff!

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Dominic S.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: Always a great time when I get a chance to stop into shoufs. I'm a big fan of the grape leaves and the gyro plate, but i have yet to be disappointed with a single dish

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Michael D.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: I've come here twice from out of town (Houston) to take my mom out for a special meal. She loves lamb! The people at Shouf's are great and really helpful in explaining the menu selections. The food is fresh and the shared-servings salads and dips are large, with lots of pita to mop them up. You'll feel like you visited a nice family's place - because you have!

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Karla D.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description:
One of the few things I miss about living in Bridgeville is eating here on a regular basis.
Their kebabs, spinach pies and tabbouleh are out of this world.
My daughter and I would often split an entree as well as an appetizer because the food is so plentiful.
Oh my and the grape leaves are out-of-this world.

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Lisa M.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: Stopped to place a takeout order. The waitress explained some of the dishes and made some recommendations. I needed to go back to the car where my mother was waiting. The waitress volunteered to bring the food out to me. Best service ever!!  The food was spectacular. We had the most tender lamb, great green beans with tomatoes and tasty souvlaki. I will absolutely come back here again!!

X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.author: Alexis K.
X8KLsPEgLe4FuJwRU0tPag.description: Delicious Lebanese food!  Fattoush was on point, baked Kibee was perfect.  The pita's were done just right.  I will definitely be returning when in the area again.

BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.author: Renee J T.
BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.description:
Great Pittsburgh chain offering icy coffee beverages ...
And of course hot coffees
This location Is great big spacious high ceiling 
Nice and quiet 
Friendly service 
I love their caramocha coffe  & caramel icy drink
They also serve loaf cakes some bagels (just eh) and already prepared packaged sandwiches 
They always have a large biscotti selection too
These are perfect sides to a coffee
And a little parking lot I always find a spot

BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.author: Lyndsay A.
BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.description:
Of all the coffee shops around Pittsburgh, this one ranks high on my list! As an avid lover of coffee and former barista, I'd be lying if I didn't say I have high expectations. Crazy mocha offers a variety of coffee, espresso, and tea options (something for everyone!) With lots of tables and more importantly, outlets, it's a great space to get some work done, or spend a morning chatting with your friends. I love the open space and natural lighting, too. 

Pro tip: bring a light jacket. Sometimes very chilly!

BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.author: Allie P.
BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.description: I really like this Crazy Mocha location because it is spacious and has a lot of natural light. There are plenty of large tables for doing work and studying, and it's usually much less busy than the Ellsworth Ave location. The coffee is average, nothing special but still good. The biscotti is huge and delicious.

BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.author: Art K.
BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.description: I've been coming here for years. It is a 5/5 in every respect except that their internet is just god awful and has been for years. At least half the times I come here it just doesn't work at all, on my phone or laptop, but randomly will for others, then sometimes it works for me but doesn't for the people I'm with. The atmosphere is good and it's great for getting work done, unless you literally can't do anything you need to because everything depends on having functioning wifi. I don't understand how this has not been fixed. Great place if you got a book though.

BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.author: Karla D.
BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.description: This is a nice location because it's bigger than most and if meeting with a group there's plenty of room. As with other locations the beverages are delicious and rival any big chain coffee establishment.

BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.author: Taylor K.
BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.description: Nice spot for grabbing a coffee and getting some work done. Not somewhere to stop if you're looking for food as their options are very limited, but their drinks are great! They have a lot of seating and it's always filled with lots of people on laptops or reading. Recommend the monkey mocha if you want something sweet!

BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.author: Rory R.
BvJD3TvjGFVuJMuZ5D6FUA.description:
For me, Crazy Mocha is an ideal working coffee shop. The coffee is good and very affordable, there is no music that I've ever noticed or if there is, it is very low.
