The WiFi is strong and there are several to choose from.

gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.author: M e.
gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.description: I came in for a simple light lunch.  I got a little quinoa and lentils about half cup of broth and an egg.  Doesn't seem like a good value for $10.

gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.author: Joe D.
gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.description:
Yikes! It's been awhile since I'd visited a Panara restaurant, and was a little shocked by the final bill. We stopped after my cousin had an MRI at McGee hospital. Having had to fast from the night before, by noon after her test was finished, she was pretty famished. 

I had half a turkey and roasted kale panini and bowl of potato soup and bottled water, the cuz had a bowl of cheddar broccoli soup and half a turkey cheddar apple sandwich, bottle of water for her too. Ready? $24.35. That's insane! It's expensive to eat clean, and that's Panara's selling point. It was good, don't get me wrong, but almost $25 is a little outrageous IMO.

gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.author: Chris J.
gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.description:
This is all you would expect from a Panera Bread. Easy ordering. Good sandwiches, salads and bakery treats. Not to mention good coffee. 

I go in expecting what I always do, but sometimes I need more than food and drink. There is wifi, which is always reliable. But there are no power outlets. Which prevents me from getting some work done.

I was there today, but had to leave without giving them any business because there are only two outlets in the whole place

More outlets please. That's the only reason I gave 4 instead of five stars.

gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.author: Cayla T.
gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.description: My experience at this Panera was great. Unlike when I'm at the Forbes Avenue location, I didn't have to worry about parking or finding a table. This location has plenty of room. My Fuji apple salad and French onion soup were delicious as well as my favorite flip flop cookie! I will return here especially when I'm in a hurry.

gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.author: Shalane Chaco T.
gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.description: I ordered the steak and white cheddar panini, the half size. What I actually got was a kiddie size!!! It was too small for the $7 I paid for it!!! I made a complaint and they made me a SLIGHTLY bigger one, but it was horrible. The bread was too hard, I had to pull it while eating it and I did not enjoy it at all. What made it worse was that the employees were all so miserable. No one likes their job there! They all seemed so grumpy and unhappy. The vibe just wasn't great and it was our first experience there. The only thing that made up for it was the pastries which we warmed up in the microwave.

gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.author: Victoria S.
gYY9U9CXRS12O-oUFoO0cg.description:
Large selection of breakfast & lunch items.  Looks like they don't use any artificial sweeteners or color just natural ingredients, I don't think it's organic or anything but none the less I'm happy to know they use fresh ingredients.  I enjoyed an all egg white with turkey sausage, cheddar cheese & spinach on a 7 grain fresh bread.  The hot tea selection was nicely stocked with fresh tea bags, they had peach & mint 
Mango, grey earl & hibiscus.   The staff was courteous and friendly, bathrooms were clean.  I'd totally go back

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Chelsea C.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description:
I've been to this location numerous times now, only during the week in the mornings, and I have to say, the service has seemed to improve greatly! For the first few times I visited, I felt like I was almost bothering the employees or waiting for 10-20 minutes for my order. I don't know if it's just a coincidence, but there's hardly a long wait and I never have an issue with my order. Sure, some of the employees could smile or not seem so annoyed, but anyone that works/has worked in customer service has those days. It also looks like they changed their menu so it's very easy to read and follow now.

This location seems to have some negative reviews and I just wanted to stop and review regarding the improvement I've noticed here.

I've never utilized the Jamba Juice services.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Ashley F.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description:
Unreal. The employees are miserable, the wait in line in way too long, and the wait for your bagel or sandwich is even worse. If you walk in and see more than 3 people in line, you should just leave. The workers don't change their gloves, they touch their phones, they touch their drinks, and then they still take 10-15 minutes to make a simple bagel. One time I went in and it was slow, but still every single trash can was overflowing, every table was dirty, there was a puddle of coffee on the floor. The employees don't care, and I don't really blame them since they are probably underpaid and under bad management. Don't get me started on the Jamba Juice part of the store. If you're lucky enough to find it "open", then expect to wait a long time for something made completely half-assed by somebody who was probably never trained. Do yourself a favor and walk 5 minutes to the Einstein's on Grant, or to the other Bruegger's location on 4th Street, where the employees are actually helpful and friendly.

Oh, I forgot to mention that the employees will argue with each other or customers loud enough for everyone in line to hear

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: H H.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description:
Super convenient location if you work downtown.  For us, as out of town-ers who stay downtown while visiting, it's perfect to grab a quick, casual bite-especially when most of the quick serve businesses are closed on Sundays (and I think Saturdays in some cases too).

There's nowhere to park, so just be aware that you'll have to walk there, and if you ordered catering, you should have somebody's walk by and pick it up-there's barely room to stop and put your 4-ways on .

Also, you'll likely find it busy because again, unlike Einstein's and other quick breakfast places, they're open on weekends, so the lines can get long especially if there are a lot of people who have come in for a game and are heading over to the north shore.  Another thing to consider is how quickly they run out of things because of the busy nature and lack of competition on the weekends.

Good news is-it's right across the street from the T station, and they have now merged with Jamba Juice so you can get smoothies too!

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Douglas H.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: I would literally give this location zero stars if possible. Waited a half hour for a bagel sandwich I ordered off menu. Location was understaffed and frankly the workers were non-chalant with no sense of urgency given the restaurant full of people waiting on sandwiches. As poorly managed a lunch hour as I have seen. Do not recommend!

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Margaret B.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: Hit the spot. There were so few choices on a weekend morning, I was glad Bruegger's was there.  Not the speediest line but it served our needs well. Good coffee.  Egg sandwich and we were on our way.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Merlyn R.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: Bruegger's is conveniently located downtown and provides decent service to many! I'm impressed by how quickly they can get through a line. The Jamba Juice selection is wide with high quality drinks. Some options are a little pricy, but again, there's a range of smoothies/juices/etc. to choose from. Many of their beverages can be made dairy free which is nice. As a smoothie enthusiast, this is a great place to come on a hot day!

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: A L.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: The workers and managers seemed to just be standing around despite a huge backlog of orders. Steer clear of this place if you have anything else to do with your day. If you don't want to give up on your morning bagel, there are other locations a few blocks away.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Bob L.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: As downtown chain restaurants go, a pretty decent location. All of the staff I encountered on a particularly busy Saturday morning, with a big Furry convention in town, were pleasant and efficient. Pretty clean inside. Good selection since Jamba Juice in in same space also.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Ishani M.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: Sub par food and service. Everyone in there looked and sounded like they didn't want to be there; mumbling questions. Got a sausage egg and cheese just tasted like it was microwaved. Not worth $5.34 I paid for this would recommend going elsewhere

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Ron C.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: Food was good.  Cashier was a courteous, professional gentleman.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: MS A.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: yeah, this place is even overrated right now: employees are unfriendly, argue with each other so the customers can witness it. Juice bar is always not available because "there is no cutter".

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Ronald V.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: The incompetency to make a sandwich at this place is baffling. I just witnessed one worker throw away two different orders back to back as my order sat on the counter half made till it too was thrown away for being wrong. You're making sandwiches people it's not rocket science. Unfortunately off-putting things like this continue to happen at this location so I wouldn't give the "bad day" excuse. The employees here are incredibly rude, unorganized and usually texting as they make your food. If it wasn't for the location I think this place would do ZERO business. Do yourself a favor and visit a different location until this establishment gets new management.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Georgina S.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description:
Pre-Ordered a fruit bowl and bagel box. The fruit was old. C'MAWN!
This was a business order. You are off the vendor list. Ridiculous!

BUT because of this post I was contacted and issued a refund. 

That said, the bagels were delicious.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Kathy P.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: One particular jamba juice employee was so rude and put out by the fact she actually had to WORK today the entire experience looked to be a bust the moment I walked up to the counter.  If this rating were based on just the interaction with her it would have been a 1 Star. Then, another, much nicer and more friendly employee stepped out from the kitchen and her attitude was 180 degrees the opposite of her coworker. She gets 5 stars because she was courteous and didn't act like she hated her job. The menu says to advise about food allergies, and that really seemed to impose on employee #1. The second employee's friendly demeanor and willingness to accommodate saved me from walking out the door and writing a horrible review. As far as product quality, excellent--also a 5 once I was able to customize the order to eliminate allergens. I had the açaí bowl. Fruit was fresh and tasty.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Leonel H.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description:
They have the worst service. They don't give you a number for your order and expect you to recognize your order based on what you order. The problem is that everyone orders the same thing. Also, if you show up with a group of people, you will need to know everyone's order. How retarded is that?

The other problem is the 30 minutes it took to get an order of 3 breakfast bagel sandwiches.  Hard to say if other parties took our order or if we even took our own. 

Summary, don't come here!

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Matt W.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: Convenient as all hell, but the morning lines are a nightmare and on my visit they weren't well-managed. On top of that, I got a decaf when I ordered regular coffee, and I couldn't get them to rectify it without waiting in line again. Almost disqualifying as a mistake.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Karlie L.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description:
I just waited 30 minutes for a Leonardo Da Veggie sandwich. There were 3 men working behind the counter and all looked like they were so confused. As if they were conducting brain surgery. 
Two of them kept going to the back for extended periods of time and one would come back out and just mill around. The line kept growing and there still was no urgency. The two women standing near me said they had been waiting for two Caesar salads for over half an hour.  It is 1:30 in the afternoon. 
Wouldn't recommend.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Brandon P.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description:
This place honestly deserves 0 stars. Management needs replaced and so does the staff! With 10 people ordering sandwiches and 0 people wanting smoothies, why not cross train people JUST standing there and make them help the other side!
I waited over 10 minutes for my sandwich. I watched 3 people in front of me not get their order. This was the second time my order took forever and my last time coming to this spot! No wonder this place is going out of business everywhere. 

The manager hides in the back, I didn't see her helping the chaos that was going on out front. 

Also, the team needs to work on cleanliness. I watched one of the workers wipe his nose with his GLOVES ON!!! That's what led me to get into line and ask for a return, that and I knew it would take another 10 minutes if they actually were going to make my order.

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Rockwell R.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: Honestly waited in line for 15 minutes and that's just not ok there are only 5 people ahead of me. Please hire new employees

But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.author: Jay G.
But8zrzUE3-VGr5P6PLgxQ.description: Terrible. Always super slow. Workers stand around and talk to each other or are confused by the register for hours at a time. Today I decided to try them again. Bad idea. I wanted juice. I went to Jamba Juice. Turns out they don't have juice. Their juice machine has been broken for 3 months. Avoid this place unless you have all day and don't really want juice.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Adam V.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: The food is good and the location is great. Tons of room in the restaurant and also a large bar in a separate room. You have to try the fish sandwich and don't forget to get the tater tots!

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Scott L.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description:
I had a decent club sandwich and (home made?) chips.  Nothing special here but the server was friendly and it had a comfy atmosphere. 

The tap beer selection left me wanting, so make sure to check out the coolers of bottled beer, they had a lot of choices.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Michelle M.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description:
Living in Thornberry, we really wanted to make this our "go to" yet time and time again we are left disappointed. Most recently we ordered on GrubHub, they screwed the order up, told my husband I didn't order the right thing, then when I called told me to take it up with GrubHub.  I'm left asking myself why I continue to set myself up for disappointment. Food is alright -would probably taste better if it was what I ordered. 

UPDATE: ordered takeout again. Asked for a grilled chicken salad. Was given a piece of grilled chicken on bread. Embarrassing excuse for a sandwich (lettuce, tomato, onion??) aside from the fact that's not what I even ordered. Called and was told it happened because they were busy. Clearly uninterested in business.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Ana A.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: This place is great for a drink or a casual dinner. I always order the apple pecan salad and add chicken, and it's always consistently good. It also comes with a breadstick, and I'm not gonna lie I kinda order the salad just so i can get the breadstick that's how good they are. I've had good sandwiches and burgers here too, but I like to stick to the salads, personally.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Laura L.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description:
I ordered the "build your own" burger, fried pickles and wings. I ordered the burger medium rare but i think whoever cooked it, cooked it about 2 minutes too long then when they ran it under the broiler to melt the cheese it cooked the patty even more. So by the time I got it, it was medium well almost well done. It still had moisture though. As far as the rest of it goes, i thought it was perfect. The chips were perfectly cooked. 
     The fried pickles and wings were delicious. However, when they packed my order, they forgot to put blue cheese in. I ordered blue cheese and that shows on my receipt. So those minor details is why they got a 4 instead of a 5. I would order from here again though.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Katie S.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Tried this place out one night for date night. Nice little hidden location within Pennsbury apartments. The parking can be really rough if you don't get there early. The food could have been a lot better, I got pasta and the sauce kinda ruined the dish. I will give them another try for sure though.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Abraham L.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Came here on my first visit to Pittsburgh. Food was good, beer was cold, service was fast, people were nice. What more can you ask for? Tried gnocchi with pesto sauce and Italian wedding soup. Delicious! I'd definitely come back here!

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Joe R.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: This place has sure gone downhill over the years. You'll notice a common theme, they can't get orders right. The food you get is usually ok, and if it were what you ordered it may even be decent. When I see this level of mismanagement and disorganization, it makes me think that there is no way their kitchen is cleaned appropriately. Don't waste your time or money here, it isn't worth it. I know I won't any more, and I've been fooled more than once.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Maggie R.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Nice atmosphere, solid cheeseburgers and chicken sandwiches. Great kettle chips served with mostly everything. Only problem is the service isn't always amazing. I've had a lot of big group dinners and the staff is very tolerant.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Jackie A.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Pennsbury pub and grille is a great spot for good drinks, excellent service, and awesome food. Friendly people and overall nice atmosphere. Grilled cheese is to die for and basically everything else on the menu! A+

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Julie M.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: We've checked out this place three times because we really wanted to make it our neighborhood spot because we live really close, but it fell short all three times. The first time we went we waited 45 minutes to get a server's attention. It was during a Pens game so we made allowances but the food really wasn't very good.  Second time, the service was better but they don't have Bud Light on tap and we really don't like Coors or Miller and especially not Labatt. The bottles we ordered were warmish.  Third time we went we gave up and agreed on the way out that we gave it a good shot but the convenience is just not worth the food. If we go back it will only be to drink.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Simone H.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Good neighborhood bar. Have only been here for late night drinks, unfortunately never food [look for updates]. Good large space, ideal for groups of friends. Friendly bartenders who diligently shake their heads at you as you order another round of fireapple shots. Patio out will be ideal for afternoon lounging.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Zakiya P.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Went here for a late night drink. Prices are pretty cheap. Has a hole in the wall atmosphere. It was conveniently located in the neighborhood I was staying at. I went around 11 or 12 at night and the kitchen was closed at that time.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Kia D.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description:
My mother in law rants and raves about this place, so during one of my trips to the Burgh, she took us there.  

She was not kidding, those wings, oh my.  They were really crispy yet juicy and the fried pickles...some of the best fried pickles i've ever had.  

the server was really nice and asked us if we wanted to be in the dining area or near the bar instead of assuming...nice job!

I am thinking about those wings right now, dang I wish i had some.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Daniel J.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Pittsburgh atmosphere, great prices, great appetizers, and solid pizza selections. Bring friends or a happy hour crew here. If you live in the Pennsbury Village community, it is an easy walk up the hill.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Patrick S.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Always great food! Never had a bad meal! Can't go wrong with their wings. Excellent place to watch games and hang out with friends.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Rob K.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description:
We used to frequent the Pennsbury Pub back when it was Scores.  They have great beer specials  When we went there they had Molson drafts for 2.00 all day every day.  They also had pitcher specials.  Lots of flat screens.  There is a bar area and a dining room.  Wings are pretty good as are the fries or homemade chips.  Sandwiches are also pretty good.  Service has always been good as well.  

This is just a nice laid back venue with friendly wait staff to make sure you have a good time.  Great place for a low key happy hour.  We will continue to come back!

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: DJ J.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: Nice place to grab a quick meal or watch a sporting event.  About 10 TV's in the bar area.  Had the soft taco special, that was good pub grub.  Service was very good and very friendly.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Bob S.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: This a great little place to watch a game or catch up with a few friends without being drowned out by music or cigarette smoke. The drink specials are good but fairly typical of any neighborhood bar.  Standard bar food, but still good.  I'll continue to go until my friends move out of the surrounding complex.

xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.author: Lauren P.
xcjEnqXQU4a6FfomtQR9tQ.description: One of my favorite places to go for dinner. Their grilled cheese is amazing and definitely worth a try. I love that you can choose chips, fries, or tater tots depending on your mood. I have never had anything here that I didn't like. Food is fresh and very delicious. Definitely worth a try.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Rui T.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: This place is perfect for students at Pitt! It's opened everyday, for long hours. Whenever you are lazy and want a delicious sandwich, salad, or pita, campus deli has your back! We love the alumni, as a true Pitt almun, chicken parmesan, and chicken tender BLT.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Katherine L.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description:
I do not understand the hype surrounding campus deli, but the food is not my issue with this place. I have gone to campus deli a few times, and their prices have increased. $7 for a small side of mediocre onion rings is absolutely ridiculous. "The Student", which is Campus Deli's most popular sandwich, is $11. I know people love the food, but I have tried The Student a couple of times and I have been unimpressed. 

The last time I was at Campus Deli, they were ridiculously understaffed. There were two people working total during a rush just around 2 AM. Our food took over an hour to come out. The poor girl at register was being harassed by angry, drunk customers leaving bars. Considering how expensive the food is, Campus Deli could afford to staff more employees during peak times.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Julie D.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description:
Campus Deli is a great place to go if you're craving a very greasy and unhealthy meal. Basically, it's location in the middle of Oakland, surrounded by bars and college students, is perfect. 

I love the bread that they make their sandwiches with, and I always crave their fries whenever I walk by because you can smell them from outside. The portions are huge and can easily be split into two meals, which makes it even more tempting to go inside. 

Campus Deli isn't gourmet food by any means, but they are good at what they do.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Will R.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description:
Campus Deli has been my favorite since High School. I really enjoy the Senior, fries and chicken tenders.

The chicken tender and fries are some of the best I've ever had. The bread they use for their sandwiches is fresh and light, it's Fantastic.

My biggest issue is their service isn't always the best. They seem to have a revolving door of helpers and then regular employees. The regulars are great. 

I often order delivery and it's really fast. Even at peak times. I'm constantly amazed how much food they churn out.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Michael D.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: This was my favorite place to eat when I was at Pitt, and I still try to visit if I'm ever in the area. My go-to is The Mascot - just a perfect sandwich. But they have a lot of great sandwiches to choose from. It's definitely a college place, and it's probably not somewhere to go if you want to sit down with a group (not a lot of seating). If you live in the area, definitely give it a try.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Hope M.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: The sandwiches are so fresh and delicious, better than any other sub shop I've been to and they are fast! They can't be as fast when it is filled with people but it is worth it! They also have specials certain days. I've had the chicken parmesan sandwich before and tonight I got the campus club. The white bread is so good it's thick and fresh not like prepackaged and it really hit the spot. I skipped a meal today and needed food late and they are always open late which is so helpful :) They were also really nice and friendly

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Olivia B.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description:
Good place to go to if you want to pick up a sandwich. We went around opening time and there was already a short line but honestly not that bad. There are a bunch of different sandwiches to order from, and we decided to get the Buffalo Chicken Philly Cheesesteak and a regular cheesesteak. We got the fries and onion rings. You get a good amount of fries but for whatever reason there aren't a lot of onion rings. They were well made but it was unfortunate there weren't that many that came with it. The regular cheesesteak is good except it's a little dry. 

I would probably come again though I did think the sandwiches were a little bit on the pricier side.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: James H.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: Awesome spot near campus for a tasty sandwich. Highly recommend this if you're hungover and need to get back on the horse. Prices are a little steep but the guys who work here are cool and will make your order fast.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Brian P.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: Just ordered a Philly cheesesteak and onion rings. Took 30 minutes longer than expected to make and when received the food was cold. Disappointed in the quality of food, especially for its price.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Megan S.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: I'm confused why this only has 3 starts? We order delivery from them at least once a week and everything is amazing. The chicken strips and fries are a favorite go to, the chicken wraps ate always great and the themed sandwiches are amazing! I just wished there fries were bigger since they are almost $5.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Tyler M.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: Great food, quick and easy, only bad part is no dining inside, take out only. If you're drinking at Bootleggers across the street this place is nice cause they're open late!

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Lauren W.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: Tasty sandwiches. South Oakland sub spot with lunch hours. Tasty and lots of meat. The price is super steep but the service is friendly and fast. I'd actually rank them above a Jimmy Johns or Papa DaVinci's in taste, which threw me off. 3.5 stars....subs too small overall for the price but taste is solid.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Jake C.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: Have never had a bad sandwich from here. It just seems hard to gauge when they're open. Tried calling 3x today to order lunch and no answer. Have walked there a few times as well only to find the door locked. Disappointed.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Matthew U.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description:
I have been wanting to try this place for a long time.  I should have waited a bit longer I suppose.  The experience I had was not stellar at all.

I opted for the breaded chicken salad after contemplating several other items on the menu.  I should have stuck to a sandwich from here.  When the salad arrived, the dressing was missing.  A very important key ingredient to any salad is the dressing.  With me being at work and on a limited amount of time to consume my salad on my lunch break, I had to rummage through the work fridge for some type of salad dressing to top this off.

From the description on the menu you are to receive a handful of fries along with all the other ingredients for this salad.  If they consider this a handful of fries, I consider that they have a two year old working there.  I counted, and there were no more than eight total fries on this salad.  The breaded chicken was actually good.  It appears that they may make it on site (I cannot confirm this), but is was lightly breaded.  Not like the chicken tenders at most other restaurants.  Easily the best part of the salad.

One other shining star to this salad was that they give you a pita on the side instead of bread.  Giving you the option of putting the salad in the pocket and eating while doing other tasks.  But it wasn't shining enough to give this place more than two stars in my opinion.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Greg C.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description:
I've heard good things about Campus Deli and I was excited to try them when I was visiting Oakland. I placed an order for delivery: 2 sandwiches and 1 order of fries. The order was 2 hours late and ice cold. When the order arrived the delivery girl sat in her car and texted me to come out and get it. 

Be sure to have your oven ready for reheating your food when it arrives. Also, make sure to order a pizza to snack on while you wait -- (like we did).

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: CJ L.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: Chicken Parm was good. The Professor was interesting, but still good. For the price and convenience, not a bad stop

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Jenny B.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: Awesome sandwich (GET THE MASCOT). It was made to order right in front of us and came out very hot. The atmosphere is very much geared toward college students and the pricing was definitely fair

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Ahmad H.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: One of the most incompetent places I've ever seen. They wrote my address AND phone number wrong. After an hour and 40 minutes I had to call them to ask where my order was only to be told about how they called the wrong number and never got an answer. To top it all off, they offered to send the food, the SAME food that was sent out before and they only offered to reheat it and not even make new ones. Really bad service. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Brittany B.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description:
The food is pretty good, but do not order from here unless you want your food to be totally wrong when it's delievered. This has happened to me 5 out of the 8 times I have order from here within the year.

Probably won't order from here again.

d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.author: Li W.
d6zooCvFxThM1SGye7JJfQ.description: Don't order from here.  Delivery through Grub Hub was slow.....2 hours +.  The hot food was cold, and the cold food was warm.  The spring mix in the salad was more like 'winter' lettuce.......way past its prime - brown, wilted with some mushy patches throughout.  The cheese on the bacon cheese fries and in the philly cheese steak had congealed by the time we received our food.  We were missing ranch dressing, napkins, forks - and we requested these items; we paid extra for the ranch. STEER CLEAR OF THIS PLACE.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: S H.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description:
Omg this food is AWESOME!! exactly what I ordered! It's hot, fresh and FULL of favor. I would recommend this place 
It was delivered right on time.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Megan C.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: Ordered delivery from here while on a trip.  It's okay but really nothing to write home about.   $20 for a large "okay" pizza is a disappointment to me.  Could have ordered from a chain, felt just as satisfied and not wasted as much money.  With the number of local pizza spots in the area, y'all really need to step it up if you continue charging premium prices.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Ron A.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: I ordered my food at 9:50pm.  It arrived at 1:27am. I was told I was being hooked up for my inconvenience. They sent sent me two jalapeño poppers and two mozzarella sticks for my trouble. Avoid this place!

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Nick H.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: The pizza was very good, but they had grub hub deliver the food...to the wrong hotel. We got our pizza 40 minutes later than expected and cold. Get a better delivery service !

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Maria B.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: Staff is EXTREMELY rude. I walked into an empty restaurant with no staff behind the desk. I called out and a man in sweats came out to tell me my food wasn't ready and walked away. It's a gross, terrible, negative place.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Bee M.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: I recently started ordering from this place about 2 weeks ago for lunch at work. I ordered 2 salads which I though were fantastic. The steak salad and the cranberry apple salad. The third time I ordered a burger and was very disappointed. The patty was thinner than a fast food joint, although it was seasoned well. I fed as though the patty needs more meat or they should charge less for the burger, or, don't sell burgers at all. I will order from here again but will stick to salads and possibly try the pizza in the future.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Miguel W.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: I'm gonna be honest, compared to New York pizza this shit sucks but compared to Pizza Parma, at least these people have eyes.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Yep N.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: When we first heard and started ordering from here, it's was amazing and we swore off any other pizza place. But. The last handful of times we've ordered, our pizza comes like what is pictured - cheese slid off to one side, messy and almost entirely unsliced. I expect pizza to require napkins but, this is impossible to without having  to rebuild and repair our pizza; for that, we'd make it at home or better yet, order somewhere else.  Thanks but - for that sort of sloppy service, we'll go back to driving to Fiori's.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Ambrose L.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: This is my first visit...won't be my last if I pass through again! Cheesy without request...a perfect golden brown served with a house ranch! Full and happy! Could have had a few more pineapple but that's just me being greedy!

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Bob G.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: This was a shot in the dark and it paid off. The pizza was delicious, service great.  The dining area is small but I got the impression this evening most business was delivery or take out. Very, very clean.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Rebecca C.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: My family loves the hogies at this place! We have been going here for years. Pizza is not bad either. The customer service is not good but the food is great. Just order your food to go and eat good food at home in front of your tv.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Catholic G.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description:
If you like wings this is the place to get them!!!  The pizza is also great.  The owner and his employees have always been nice!

I order from here at least once a week!

Best Wings in Pittsburgh!!!

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Sweet S.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: Tonight was my 3rd time as a customer since this pizza spot has been under new ownership and all I can say is it gets better every time, the pizza is exceptional and the customer service is spot on, I am totally satisfied 100%. Keep up the good work !

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Zack B.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: I'm a big fan of bellamonte pizza. It's a family run place with ample seating right on main street and the pizza is great. It's not overly American and greasy, which is great. Frankly it's expected given that the brothers who run the place are Italian. It's the definition of your "mom and pop" pizza place and while there is some influence from American pizza trends on Bellamonte's pizza's you and a friend (a small pizza is enough for two people or two meals easily) will be 100% satiated by the pizza. I heartily recommend the mozzarella pizza and the Hawaiian pizza.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Aaron M.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: Just got to the hotel at 1045pm and asked the front desk who delivered this late on a Sunday. He game me the menu and I ordered the chicken carbonara and side salad. Was quoted 35 minutes, and it showed up exactly when promised. Very hot and ready

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Eric D.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description:
Mixed reviews. I love that I can order online. I typically use a credit card and it's just easier. I will choose a place with online ordering over a place I have to call. (typically). The very first time I ordered we (my girlfriend and I) thought the pizza was amazing. Tons of cheese (I didn't order extra cheese), greasy, good seasoning & all around flavor. The cheesy bread was amazing too! 

Sounds awesome right? Not so fast. Their website says 45 minutes for delivery. It took about an hour. Have ordered  from here about 7 times & only once, has it been on time. But hey, great food is worth the wait right?

Sure, if it stayed great. The second time I ordered a pepperoni pizza with extra cheese. Yum?! And some cheesy bread. OMG hope it gets delivered fast! Haha. Nope like 15 minutes late. And guess what? It was horrible. My "extra cheese" had less cheese that the first pizza I ordered. There was like no seasoning, and it was ice cold. The cheese bread was under cooked, lacked flavor, and had a strange aftertaste. (Never figured out what the taste was). It looked great, but it was horrible. Think most of my $20+ order went in the fridge, then to the garbage can. Ordered zucchini on one of my orders. Not sure which one, but it was a greasy mess. No seasoning, no parm, overcooked, almost completely burnt, with no flavor. Disgusting. 

Back on a positive. I'm a ranch fanatic. I LOVE the HOMEMADE Ranch dressing but it is not worth 75 cents for a half filled tiny tiny ( I STRESS TINY!!!!)  cup of it. Once when I ordered the homemade ranch they sent non homemade buttermilk ranch. Was so mad being I payed for 75 cents each for 3 & they went straight in the garbage.

3rd time I ordered, I just got a pizza. Late delivery, ice cold pizza. Overcooked, not much cheese, no seasoning, no flavor. Edible, but not good.

4th time. Same as above. 

5th time, same as above except the food came on time! I think even 5 minutes early, and was still hot. not much cheese, no flavor, no seasoning. Just eh.

6th & last time. Late delivery, cold pizza. Mediocre, edible, nothing to brag about. 

No idea what happened but I'm very disappointed. That first time I ordered it was amazing. It still wasn't a (mineos) but it was great food. Every time since, has sucked. Seems they got rid of the garlic salt & w/e other seasonings they used. 

I probably will order from here again at a last resort. They deliver to my house, I can order online, and that's about the only reasons besides hoping it will once again be like it was the first time I ordered. It will be a good while before I order though. Preferably never but we will see.

From what I see, they seemed to have had a Grand Reopening from failing before? Not sure if that's true but I don't see them surviving on the food they have been providing. 

Im hungry, picked up my menus to look through for something to order & decided to leave a review. Now I'm even hungrier from the wait and will find somewhere else to order from.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Darren W.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description:
Yet another flyer came to my doorstep with the local Pennysaver advertising a new pizza endeavor. This evening, we ordered ourselves a "meat classic" pizza, an Italian hoagie, and some cannoli from Bellamonte, the latest combatant to enter the eternally raging Pittsburgh Pizza Wars. 

Eh, I've had this kind of spongy, heavy, bread-like crust before along with the invisible sauce, and loads of a mozzarella/provolone blend. There was pepperoni, sausage, ham, salami, capicola, gyro meat (!), bacon, and I was bored. 

The "Supreme Italian" hoagie was sufficiently stuffed with l-t-o, vinaigrette, cheese, hot peppers, and the usual Italian deli meats, but again, if this were a movie, I'd be yawning. 

The same could be said about the cannoli. 

There's just entirely too many pizzas and hoagies like this in Pittsburgh. Bellamonte doesn't stand out among the throngs.

I give 'em 6 months before the door revolves again.

P.S. According to the aforementioned flyer, Bellamonte delivers to Greentree, Sheraden, Crafton, Ingram, Mt. Washington, Downtown, North Side, South Side, Beechview, Brookline, Elliot, Dormont, Banksville, and Carnegie. $10 minimum order.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Cassie M.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: The pizza is good..the crust is said to be made fresh daily.. Definitely true. It is perfect thickness.. Not to thick not to thin..cooked just right. The sauce is amazing. Sauce is the first thing I look for in a pizza. Delivery was fast and food was hot and fresh. The hot wings were not what I expected they were a smoky hot and you can see the flavor of peppers and spices. O was expecting a "buffalo style" hot being from NY. But they were still good. They paired well with then delicious homemade ranch. I'm pretty picky about what and where I eat so when I travel i try to stick to chains so I know what to expect. I looked up a few different places in the area and I'm glad we choose to come here. I'll be ordering again when I return to Pittsburgh!

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: Kay E.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: Yeah, I wasn't crazy about their pizza, either. It was a typical doughy type pizza. I didn't have any of Darren's sub. The cannoli was decent. Delivery was pretty fast, though.

I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.author: David E.
I5kKpCDxdrV1Lxss2T681g.description: I ordered delivery to my hotel two consecutive evenings.  One night I ordered the spaghetti with meat balls and the second night I ordered the lasagna.  In both cases the portions were huge and the food was very good.  Definitely was home made.  Delivery was fast and courteous.  The next time I visit Pittsburgh I will be ordering from Bellamonte's.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Jen C.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description:
Service is always fast, the employees are always nice and pleasant, and the food is always good.  I miss the Chai Tea machine they got rid of about a year ago - I wish it would come back!

Not the best bagels in the whole wide world, but solid!

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Cassie M.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: Fast service on a Saturday morning. Maybe I'm spoiled by New York, but the bagels are kind of small. They ran out of everything and cinnamon sugar bagels when we were there. They need a number system with receipts - people were grabbing wrong orders and it was chaotic. Coffee is average. Staff was half friendly / half rude

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Allie P.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: Is Bruegger's the most delicious, fresh bagel place ever? No. But, in Pittsburgh, where there are very few bagel places, this is some of the best you're going to get. They have a wide variety of bagel and cream cheese flavors. They also have a lot of sandwiches that go beyond your basic bacon, egg, and cheese, which I appreciate. This visit, I got the western. The fresh bell peppers and chipotle sauce on the sandwich elevate it. Overall, Bruegger's is a great place for a quick, cheap, hangover-curing bagel sammie that's a step above a traditional fast food breakfast.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Luke Z.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description:
Bruegger's has always been one of my favorite sandwich stops, and this location is no different. The bagels and coffee are always fresh, the staff is always friendly and let me customize my sandwiches to my hearts desire, and now with the rewards app I can get free stuff!

PSA: TRY THE SUNDRIED TOMATO SPREAD ON A BAGEL YOU WONT REGRET IT

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Justin B.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: I can't understand how this location has any positive reviews. The wait is always extremely long, the staff extremely unprofessional, and the bagel selection limited. I could list at least 20 examples of unhygienic, rude, and inappropriate behavior I experience on a daily basis here. I wish there was somewhere else to get a bagel on walnut. I have been holding out in writing a bad review for a long time but at this point it's just ridiculous. Every now and again there will be a couple of decent employees, but they seem to leave ASAP. I come here almost everyday.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: B D.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: The people that work here do not look at all happy to be there. When I order I get the sense that they feel they're doing me a favor. It's like an assembly line with zombies working behind the counter. They are almost always out of the best bagel varieties. Today I asked for a replacement bagel because my son didn't like the one I ordered- the woman behind the counter gave me the stink eye. I wish there were nicer people here.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Paul G.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: Be prepared to wait a long time for anything here.   They are always either short staffed or have clueless workers with obvious lack of desire to even acknowledge customers.  With few exceptions

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Kelsey S.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description:
I will continue to come to this location because it's really the only fast, cheap option on Walnut Street. Everything else is full-service/sit-down. The quality is pretty consistent. Service is spotty. When I'm given the option I'll usually choose another bagel place, but especially in Shadyside - I'll continue to come back because they really don't have any competition.

I do love the rosemary olive oil bagel. It's great toasted with butter - and something different that you can't get at many other bagel places.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Mike J.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description:
My girlfriend and I like stopping here on our early (okay 2PM) Saturday adventures. Close to where we live is this Shadyside location right on the edge of bustling Walnut Street. When we've gone later in the day you may find lesser stock of bagel varieties but nothing that is too off-putting. The service is average but the staff are nice enough and the food is prepared fresh to order. The location itself could use some better cleaning at times but it seems like they have 2-3 people working at a time. 

Another poster commented on the parking situation, I've always parked in the large lot next to Bruegger's (Walnut and Aiken) without issue. I've actually never even seen a parking attendant in the area, maybe it's just a weekday thing. 

Overall an acceptable place to grab a quick bite, good overall taste and quality!

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Steven H.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: It's a Bruegger's, like all other Bruegger's. The non bagel options at this particular location are a bit more limited and the space is a tad on the small side but by and by, you get the usual Bruegger's quality with this location.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Po La R.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: This place is generally clean. Bagels are fresh and sometimes you can get a bundle off bagels at a lower price. Bruegger's cream cheese are pretty decent, too. Coffee is okay. I wouldn't say it is cheap, because special recipe bagel sandwich can go quite pricy for just a breakfast.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Max R.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description:
I would love to give this place a good rating but wow, three times in a row you guys struck out. The average wait time per customer is usually around 5 minutes... So if there's 6 people or more in front of you, allow yourself at least 20-30 minutes.

I just do NOT understand why this location is so slow... I would not recommend this spot to anyone, unless your in a real pinch.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Claire S.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: I love this place. They have few seats outside and on the first floor, but there is more seating upstairs. They have some really nice photos of (bagels, of course) that get you in the mood. They even have a cute window with a nice view up there. The whole place is really cute!

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Penny P.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: This is the slowest Brueggers ever. It doesn't matter if I am the only one in the store or in a like out the door, the staff is slow and does not care that they are slow. They frequently mess up my friends orders when we go there. The food is okay/typical Brueggers quality usually which is the only reason I am giving it 2 stars instead of the 1.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Stacy M.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description:
The staff here was friendly and even offered to show me nutritional information when I asked questions.  My bagel was decent, similar to other bagels I've had from bagel chain places.

But this place is dirty,  at least in the customer areas.  The bathroom toilet did not look cleaned for many days.  The same with the stairs where dust and dirt checked in to the step corners. I saw an employee clean a table using nothing but his hand and arm. Nasty.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Megan V.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: Very good if you're looking for an average bagel. Nothing like a New York bagel but probably the closest you can get in Pittsburgh.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Andrea M.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description:
The toppings on my salad were barely there.
I never had the bacon I asked for. The salad dressing was watered down... The salad has been greatly reduced in size. 
I used to love their salad... Not anymore. Cutting too many corners.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Cary S.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description:
This Bruegger's is a parking nightmare.  They have a tiny lot behind the shop that is often packed to the gills.  The larger parking lot next-door, often empty, is managed by a parking attendant who takes his job very seriously.  Very very seriously.

Despite the trouble securing parking, I frequent this location and find service to be great despite the long lines.  If you want turkey sausage make sure to point that out as I only recently realized that it's not the standard when you ask for a egg/cheese/sausage bagel.  

Also, order your drink while they make your bagel and if you slurp it all down while still in line they are more than happy to give you a free refill as you head out the door.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Eric G.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: As much as I typically avoid bigger industry-type chains, I've always enjoyed stopping in here while hanging out in Shadyside. It's at the perfect location at the end of Walnut (though technically on Aiken) to grab something on your way into Shadyside or on your way out. I walked in today and the manager greeted me sweetly. I just picked up a bag of day-old bagels (who can beat a bag of 6 for less than 3 bucks?) and a soda, and the woman was nice enough to offer a free bag of bagels to me! I don't even care if they had to get rid of them by the end of the afternoon, it was an incredibly nice gesture which almost guarantees a stop in the next time I need a quick breakfast or lunch sometime soon. Great upstairs area with Wifi (though limited outlets) to eat and work.

eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.author: Jessica K.
eFos_qY9NM_zRdtKmN8fKA.description: I love this Bruegger's location. The staff is super friendly. The coffee is always fresh. They have never messed up an order and are always prompt. I can't say enough about the staff. I know it's just a bagel shop but customer service at most other places I visit is sub par compared to this Bruegger's.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Hayley T.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: Sicilian pizza is WONDERFUL! So good. We also got an Italian hoagie, also really good. We went on a Sunday afternoon,  sat outside, it was really nice. In addition to good food, The staff was super friendly which made our experience even better. If we had room, we would have tried the chocolate chip cookies that just came out of the oven. Really happy we came here, we will be back.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: David D.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: So far it has about a 3 star average.  I'd say that is about right.  Crust was pretty good overall taste and toppings was average.  Could do worse but not one I'd go out of my way for.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Fox E.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description:
I knew a girl in Pitt so I center a slice from here and she liked it. I like it too, even though it's not amazing and is far from my fave in town (Aiello, Fiori).

They have lovely service, and serve a decent slice. It's not really Pittsburgh-style Pizza, just generic pizza but still pretty good and worth a try if you're in this area.

If you live in Pitt and haven't tried it yet, my question is... why avenue tried it yet?

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Maria S.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description:
Great pizza! Thin too just how I like it! Wings are great! 
Tastes like home! 
Or Ny style pizza. We got garlic wings. Delicious! Delivery was fast also.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Laura C.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description:
I've lived in Pittsburgh for almost ten years now one neighborhood over from West View and this is my first time ordering from Center Avenue Slice. My order consisted of a side salad @ $4.50 and a 10" hand tossed junior size pizza. 

The salad was a good size and and included iceberg lettuce, tomato cubes, fresh sliced mushrooms, green pepper and two types of cheese. They include additional veggies or peppers that I told them to hold including olives, banana peppers and a couple other items. It also came with a nice sized round container of my selected dressing - Italian. The salad was well worth the price and was very fresh.

The pizza I ordered was the hand tossed pan crust with mushrooms, hamburger, green peppers and diced tomatoes. The taste was very nice and the toppings were plentiful. The toppings were spread well and no one topping dominated in any area of the pizza. This is just good normal pizza. 

I called at 8:37 p.m. on a Sunday and my husband drove and collected the order, so I have no experience with their delivery service. They close at 9:15 p.m., so I was very pleased by the fresh food provided so close to closing time. I will be ordering in good faith again from this eatery.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Sarah M.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: Center Avenue Slice is my favorite pizza around. Might be a little pricier than some places, but it's well worth the money. Pizza has great crust, sauce and cheese. Fries are fresh-cut, like potato patch fries, which most other places don't have. Wings are appetizing as well, and the fried provolone sticks are delicious. The workers and the owner are all friendly. I always order takeout since i cant get delivery; they're almost always on the nose with timing, except for the few times when they are so busy and have a whole line of people waiting, i still get my food fresh and warm. Definitely recommend to anyone and everyone looking for good food.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Nicklas V.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: Another average Pittsburgh pizza shop. Been wanting to try a lot of different places and heard this was one to try.  It wasn't bad but wasn't great by any means.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Doug H.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: I stopped in at 10:05pm on a Friday night and was told the place closed at 10pm. Sign out front still said open which confused me and I came here to see what time they closed, so something is not correct. I was told the pizza is really good.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Man P.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: Every neighborhood has it's own local pizza place for a quick and easy meal when you do not have time to cook.  They are reliably open, deliver to all corners of the neighborhood, always taste the same, and reasonably priced.  That is Center Avenue Slice - West View's Local Pizza Place.  The people working there and the atmosphere were uniquely "West View".  The service was friendly, on point, and few words were exchanged.  I arrived a bit early, paid the nice young woman behind the counter, and had a decent place to wait while they finished baking it.  The pizza was suitably cut, boxed, and still piping hot after making the drive home (to my neighborhood).  It tasted just like pizza.  Is it the kind of restaurant that would compel you to drive a half hour to eat there?  Maybe if you grew up on it and moved away; missed the familiar taste of home.  Is it worth making the trip to cheat on your own neighborhood's pizza place?  No.  Your own local pizza place has always been there for you, cooks for you every day, and is loyal to you.  You should take care of them like they take care of you.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Larry G.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: Order the everything but anchovies pizza . Best I ever had. Quick delivery. They have never let me down.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: John P.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: Center Ave Slice is our favorite pizza in the area, and i think we've tried them all.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Amanda J.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description:
Wow.  Peace out Center Avenue Slice.  The quality on the pizza has crashed, and the customer service SUCKS!

The parents ordered a pizza a few weeks back to pick up.  The order was simple: large pepperoni pizza.  When they arrived, the workers said the pizza still needed ten minutes, despite this being longer than the quoted time.  Ok, things happen.  

Five minutes later, a man walked up, ordered, and was given a large pepperoni pizza a few minutes later.  This pizza turned out to be my parents.  Want to hear the solution to this?  The employee gave my dad two options:

1.  He could pay the LARGE price for an already made MEDIUM pepperoni pizza.  Because they don't correct mistakes (WTF?) or do refunds.

2.  He could wait ten minutes for a new pizza.  (What kind of pizza is ready in ten minutes?)

How long did that new pizza take?  45 minutes.  And the cheese and sauce quality is now on par with Papa Johns or Dominoes.

The pizza is now passable and nothing more.  No one would miss them if they closed tomorrow with their new attitude.  Bye, Center Avenue.  We will never order from you again!

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Samantha M.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: I like there pizza,and have never had a bad experience until my husband went to pick up our order tonight and they had given it away to someone else.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: lauren t.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description:
Horrible quality of food. Pre-made crust and very little sauce. 
All that aside, we ordered a pizza at 9:30 and it did not arrive until 10:45 after a "30 min" estimate. Aaaaand cold. Worst pizza joint in the Burgh by far.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Fred M.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description:
Worst service ever.  Called and ordered food, they told me 1/2 hr...an hour goes by and I called back.  They couldn't find my order then proceeded to tell me it would be another hour before I could have my food.  


This included the girl on the phone talking to the manager and him saying "make him wait" guess they didn't think I could hear them.  I'll never order from here again.  BUYER BEWARE!!!!!!!!!!!

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Amber M.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: This place is awesome the staff is friendly the owner is a really good guy and the pizza is really good and so is the rest of the food like the hot sausage casserole or breaded cauliflower or even their calzones. I say forget Pizza Hut forget Little Caesars forget Domino's supported two small business guy go to Center Avenue slice

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Dave L.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description:
Its okay.

Hand tossed dough was good, classic neighborhood pizza shop, but the rest is not for me.  The sauce was a sweet sauce, but I've had better.  The cheese was just the standard.

I'd WOULD order if it was my local pizza shop, but as I was just passing thru I won't be back.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Alexis H.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: Good food, but the girls who work up front are some of the nastiest young ladies I have ever had the displeasure of speaking to. If you call, they are short and rude when taking your order or asking any questions. They need to lose the attitude, or lose their jobs.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Carol S.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: Center Avenue Slice is pretty close to where I live. We have ordered a couple times and the results are varied. The calzones were really good the first time we ordered, but the other times, they are undercooked and soggy in the middle. The dough is nice and chewy, and there is usually a lot of cheese on the pizza. If you get additional toppings, there are pretty scarce. None of our orders were made on time. I usually have to wait an extra 10 minutes. They are usually pretty busy, so I can see why this can happen. The people who work there are very nice, and I have never been treated rudely.

P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.author: Kimy B.
P3Dy7GF1Sw8RrW1Dd9ZVjA.description: This pizza joint is near my house, so I'm a little biased, but the calzones are amazing, especially the Italian calzone.  Dine in is available, but the dining room isn't really all that great, so their main business is from carryout and delivery.  Definitely worth a call for a good meal.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Kim K.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description: I really enjoy this place. It's my absolute favorite lunch spot downtown. The salads are incredible and very reasonably priced. I really enjoy the Chicken Cobb.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Merlyn R.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description: What a quick, healthy, hearty lunch! For only a little over 6 dollars, I was able to build my own salad that was the size of my head! While the topping options aren't as extensive as competitors such as Hello Bistro, this was still a great place to stop. My salad was dense, the roasted tomato cilantro jalapeño dressing was one of best dressings I've ever tried (and I usually hate dressing), the speed and price was unbeatable, and the bread that comes with was fresh and doughy. Not all stops have enough seating to dine in, but I definitely recommend this for a to-go lunch option during work.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Laura M.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
I love how unique the ingredients are here. To me, it's worth it to buy a salad because I truly can't make it at home with what I get. Would give five stars, but the employees change a lot and they aren't always super friendly, some are extremely friendly but some are really rude and with the constant turnover there's a lack of consistency.

Update: removed a star because they got rid of some of the aforementioned unique ingredients. Stopped in today and they got rid of my favorite usuals: spicy broccoli and pita chips! Dang!

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Erica S.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
I love this place. They are really flexible with the ingredients of you don't eat meat. I have had the vegetable wrap, the egg wrap...but substituted egg with potatoes and the salad that you can add your own ingredients. The food is very fresh.  You may run into a
Line if you go around lunch time though.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Kim K.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description: This was $8.25 and barely half full and had to get a second breakfast elsewhere (and I'm a small woman). The employee didn't even acknowledge me until after she was done chatting with the delivery person. Not worth the money or time at all

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Carol C.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description: I got over charged for a chicken Caesar salad (paid 12.50). Watch your receipts people (although they don't give you a price breakdown). I don't mind paying extra money for a salad I just don't enjoy being over charged-just be honest about your pricing. Probably won't return as I feel I can't support businesses that do this.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Kristina W.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
I'm always on the hunt for a healthy, quick lunch spot downtown during the work week. What's not to like about a place where I can build a healthy salad with all the fun tasty fixin's?!  Plus this a great spot to support local ,as Earth works with local communities, farmers and sustainable partners! All around a lunch spot to feel good about.  

I have enjoyed the Bovine Bleu salad and the Southwest Turkey all the ingredients were fresh & tasty, the meat was cooked well & flavorful.   Also tried the Wok This Way Pad Thai rice bowl with shrimp. The flavor was nice and light, almost refreshing - not the in your face kind of curry which is actually great for lunchtime in my opinion.

Definitely would recommend for lunch time healthy eats, not a long wait like similar spots are downtown.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Allyson H.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description: Great place to get a fresh salad downtown. Not very many choices for toppings but it was good.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Carrie L.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
Best salad in downtown for many reasons:
1- Great portion (I always have left over salad for snack)
2- Great combo (My favorites are Veg Out and Taco)
3- Great speed (Lines may be out the door but you'll be next in no time)

This is the only salad place I'd crave for lunch.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Huyen D.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
Honestly, I've never been a fan of buying salads. If I want a bowl of vegetables, I can throw that together myself at a fraction of the cost. My friends, however, absolutely love this place, so after a year of listening to them rave on and on about Earth, I finally gave in. 

The Beets 'n Berries sounded like a delicious way to kickstart my relationship with Earth AND it's only 391 calories. They have a build-your-own option but only the first 4 add-ins are free and all the proteins come with an extra charge (a pretty hefty one at that). We came in during the lunch rush so the tiny shop was uncomfortably full. The employees seemed a bit frazzled and kept forgetting what to put in the salads. Once I got the finished product, I was a little disappointed to see that the container was not even full. The ingredients were fresh and the vinaigrette was tasty, but nothing about it was impressive or special. I was hungry again after an hour. 

Overall, the quality or quantity of the salads do not justify the prices they charge. If anything, I would opt for Hello Bistro because at least you can choose as many toppings as you want instead of being nickel and dimed.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Marina C.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
I used to live in Philadelphia where we have salad shops like this on every block, and really missed having a quick healthy option for lunch.

I really like this place, even though it's a bit pricey and can be a little inconsistent quality-wise, but the service is usually friendly and efficient, and I'm usually pretty satisfied with my salads. I do think the quality is better than the salads at Hello Bistro, where sometimes I can taste that the chicken is still semi-frozen. These ingredients all seem very fresh.

Today I had the vegetarian salad and added chicken and it was very good! I like that they give you bread with it as well. The service was very friendly though I didn't catch the name of the employee that helped me. But whoever was working today was lovely, haha!

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Karolyn A.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
I am of the opinion that people that hate salads have just been eating boring salads.
As a person that used to hate salads, I consider myself a connoisseur of creative salads.
This place has truly got some creative salads. I've been wanting to try them for a while, and the long lines elsewhere in market square finally convinced me.
I got the "Thai One On" salad. It has Grilled Shrimp, Sesame Broccoli, Radishes, Carrots... and a wonderful seaweed salad I just went gaga for. I seriously just adored that stuff. 
The blend of toppings was successful, and they didn't skimp on the shrimp! (THANK YOU!)
I will definitely come back. Yum!

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Rachel F.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
I really wanted to like this place because it's close to the office and there aren't many healthy options close by but I didn't enjoy my bowl at all.

 I got the Fiesta Bowl and it wasn't what I expected. I opted for the spicy chicken and it was cold rather than warm. If I had known this I would have gotten different chicken or a cold salad. The combination of warm rice, cold veggies, and cold chicken mixed together made a cold to lukewarm bowl which was kind of blah. Additionally I added a sauce but the bowl just didn't have any kick to it. 

The redeeming part of the experience was that the employees were so nice! Everyone that I interacted with made me want to like my bowl so much more than I did. I'm curious to try the salads and see if I enjoy it more, but I'm not rushing to come back.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Don A.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
Update from the long standing check in all-star of this joint ... This is obviously a summer/sping type of thing chomping down on them greens, you know? 
This is my second time back since spring decided to rear it's ginger head and honestly ... I gotta drop some stars here. Sorry Earth. I used to love this place, now it's getting kinda shabby. 
Behind the glass them toppings are getting slim. Meaning what Don? I'll tell you! Relax. Damn! As I was saying ... the beans were looking sketchy, cheese all mixed in with the peppers, no more of them mandarin slices? What? And no quinoa today? Huh? I've never heard that sentence in my life.
C'mon Earth. You know you slippin. Kinda like the planet you're named after ... if you think about it. Bet you didn't know this grub review was going to go all philosophical, huh? Bet.
Pick it back up and I'll break out them missing stars homeboys and girls. You had it, gotta get back there. Thanks!

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Alyssa D.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description: I am a big Whole30/Paleo eater and this restaurant appeared when I searched for Paleo friendly places in the burgh. I was excited by all the good whole foods I saw on the menu and they were easily able to find the ingredients to a salad dressing I asked about. I ordered the "Talk Curry To Me" salad and subbed lettuce for rice. It was really delicious! The only reason I docked a star is that the salad was kind of comically small...and it cost over $10. It didn't even have meat on it. That will probably keep me from coming back on the regular. But if you're looking to treat yoself or don't want to prepare a meal for a day and are trying to keep it healthy, it's worth checking out!

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Pgh Food E.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
I ordered the king cob salad with salmon, and it was pretty good. The salty cheese paired with the Smokey bacon was superb. The salmon was a little bland, and the could have probably added a little more. 

One disappointing aspect was the dressing. I would have expected a citrus dressing, but they served it with a white sangria vinaigrette. This sounded interesting, but the flavor was lacking of really any flavor and the consistency was a little flem like.....sorry. I would probably go again and try something else. The staff was helpful and quick, and, overall, the atmosphere was friendly. I just won't try that dressing again.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Gretchen U.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
Great ambiance. Thankful to all the cooks. Loving the salad options and the people. Happy to have noticed this place open February of 2017 and happy and satisfied every time. Salads are colorful and filling. The bread is a nice touch. Soups are colorful and tasty! Thank for all your efforts! I'm a fan!

Recommend if you love your pallet for spicy: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Chicken.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Rachel B.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
Came in a few minutes after 5. Web site said they are open until 6. I ask for a Borderline salad. I am told they already put away all the meat and cheese bc they are getting ready to close. I said I thought they closed at 6. They said yeah, but they start putting things away early.

I'm writing this at 5:25 - and have been back in my hotel room for about 10 minutes. They should still have the meat and cheese out if they don't close until 6.

I'm steered to the premade salads. I'm not happy, but have been eating unhealthy takeout most of the week. I grab 2 salads and go pay. I get back to my hotel - I have no forks (they knew it was takeout - and that I didn't live in town and didn't either give me forks or direct me to where I could pick them up) and NO DRESSING in one of the salads. And it was $20 for 2 salads. 

I really wanted to like this place, but no.

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Alyssa R.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description:
Best place to get a salad. Outstanding value for price. I always get the local greens mix with "4 fixins" for under $7.

They have a wide selection of toppings it gets hard to pick. Their employees are friendly and attentive. The greens are never wilted or sad. The salads (at least the ones I get) come with free bread. They ask you how much dressing you want which I love because I hate getting too much dressing. My favorite part, they MIX THE SALADS FOR YOU!! I don't have to awkwardly fiddle with a salad over-stuffed in a tiny container making a mess anywhere. I love going here for a hearty, healthy and filling lunch that won't break the bank.

EDIT: I recently went there again and wound up receiving a surprisingly small portion. It was too small to be acceptable, since it was roughly half to 2/3 the size of the portions I normally get. I was disappointed, especially because when I went in that day, they weren't even busy or rushed. So I e-mailed the address provided on their site and sent a picture of the problem and they were very understanding and professional and sent me a $10 gift card. Hopefully when I go back it won't happen again, but I appreciated the good customer service. [P.S. after reading this, don't be that person who makes something up to complain about so they can get free food. There are too many people who do that and it's not okay unless you ACTUALLY have a real problem with your food.]

zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.author: Daniel V.
zuEJKjSkX-4qw8MlEcI0Xg.description: The food was a little expensive and the selection was limited.  But hey, these folks are running their business right.  Stick with what you know and don't leave money on the table. My salad was delicious. I'll definitely be back.

vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.author: Roman W.
vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.description:
Street food's world is a nice place on in downtown. Good for lunch. Reasonably priced!

Employees are very nice and even gave me a free piece of their pistachio baklava, which was wonderful!

vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.author: Michele W.
vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.description:
Reasonably priced!
I got the chicken gyro shawarma on green salad, loved it ! The chicken flavoring and tahini sauce was delicious! 
Can't wait to try more off the menu

vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.author: Hannah H.
vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.description:
Street food's world is a cute new place on liberty ave. Food is good and some many different types. They even have vegetarian options! The prices are very affordable. 
Employees are very nice and even gave me a free piece of their pistachio baklava, which was wonderful!
The only thing I would like to see change is their use of styrofoam and plastic utensils. Please switch to an environmentally friendly option and help our planet! 

Overall good food and nice people!

vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.author: Jamie A.
vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.description: Great place that just opened in town.  The food was fresh, tasty, and many options.  I got the falafel meal, which was plenty of food for lunch.  Also great space for large groups or team lunches!

vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.author: Meghan S.
vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.description: Nice new lunch spot in the city. Had the meatballs and they were super tasty and fresh. Sides were really good. This will definitely be a regular lunch spot for me.

vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.author: Ashley G.
vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.description: I tried the smash burger and fries today and it was awesome. The burger was big and juicy and full of flavor. The fries were great and crisp and not dry at all. I will definitely be back and order the same thing.

vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.author: Hal C.
vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.description: From out of town and stopped or lunch. Wide menu variety. Very fresh food. Staff is very friendly. Quick service. Highly recommend

vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.author: Tonten R.
vXZo5NPavJbajYa-jXooqA.description: Great place to grab lunch downtown, especially if you're after a healthy option! Great food, great staff, short wait. Highly recommended!

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Ash C.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description:
We haven't had any issues with Hop House and enjoy ordering from them frequently. The Mac and cheese is delicious. The pizzas are pretty good. But the pot stickers are really where the secret is. They're SO. DANG. GOOD. even my toddler tried to steal them from us when we order them!

Disclaimer: we don't frequent the actual restaurant, we only do delivery.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Brittany N.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: I went to the Hop House for dinner and drinks on a Saturday night and it was mediocre.
