The bar area is smoking so if you are looking to sit at the bar and don't like being in an area surrounded by smokers, this might not be the spot for you. Food was mediocre but our waitress was very nice and accommodating ( I'm sorry I cannot remember her name).

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Jessica P.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: I've lived in the area for about 6 years now but only just tried Hop House because I knew it was a smoky place. We sat in the restaurant area which is separated by a door but it still had a bit of a smoke smell. And the bathrooms and entrance/exit are through the bar so you have to go in there whether you like it or not (I'm in the "not" camp). We ordered hot garlic wings and the sauce was so strange. It was thick and creamy. I've never seen wing sauce like it before. We had to scrape most of it off. The loaded fries were decent but I didn't like the buffalo chicken dip. I thought it was bland. For an entree I got the steak sandwich and the onions were very sweet so that turned me off to what otherwise would have been a good sandwich. The server was nice and helpful and I appreciated that she managed our big group well but I will probably not be returning.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Rachel K.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: We tried for the first time after being in the area for 4 years now. The food was decent and what we expected. My chief complaint is when entering you, from the signs we seen you are forced to walk through the bar/smoking area to get to the dinning area. Now I'm not sure if it was just a slower day and the closed the other doors until the picked up, but everyone was forced to go through the bar. We will be back as for the quality of food and price we will be back.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Steph M.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description:
We tried The Hop House through GrubHub because we had a decent promo code. First and last time unfortunately. I got a chicken wrap. The wrap itself tasted burnt and it was filled with old, brown lettuce (see photo). The fries with it were very cold, beyond the 15 minute delivery cold that you may expect. My husband got the Mac and Cheese and said it was okay. 

Two stars because if the fries hadn't been freezing, they would have been pretty good and my husband didn't hate the Mac and Cheese. But that wrap was unacceptable.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Autumn H.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: I come here almost every week for wing night, and I always love it. The servers are all great, and the food is consistent and tasty. Only one really bad experience I've had was last Wednesday, we went late and we always sit in the non smoking area. When I say late I mean around 945ish. Halfway through, 5 obnoxious guys come back and light up cigarettes. Not once since we have ever been there since they made the back non smoking have we seen that be acceptable. I said something to them about how it was non smoking, and they yelled at me that the bartender gave them permission. It really was ridiculous and all the waitresses ignored them. I spend a lot of money here, like I said, I come here probably once a week, and that was really obnoxious. There's a reason the back is non smoking and I didn't appreciate that. I'll be back though, hopefully that doesn't happen again.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Miluska E.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: Dayton the bartender is amazing we went there three times and she knew our names and what kind of beer we liked to drink. The wings were delicious and you can't beat the price! The lower score comes from the old beer bottles(stick to domestics) and the smokiness of the bar they need a better ventilation system.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Amanda J.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description:
So in total fairness- even when I lived in Pittsburgh I thought the North Hills bar scene was pretty pathetic. When my friend wanted to meet up on the evening of Christmas Day, this bar was at least open at 11 pm.

This is your standard Pittsburgh dive bar and is comparable to Shenanigans down the road. My mixed drink was $2, which as a resident of D.C., left me shocked. The drink was mostly sours and small, but I almost wished to move back to somewhere so inexpensive. The kitchen was closed, but they do $4 pizza and appetizers later at night apparently. The kitchen closes early, though, most week nights. I might have been interested in trying the food another time, if not for other issues.

As other have mentioned, you will be thrown back to the 1920s and shave five years off of your life as you inhale second hand smoke. My friend and I went in a back room where there was no one smoking, but you cannot really escape the stench. The people drinking in here could be defined as Yinzer trash, as it was all white people making audible racist remarks, while throwing food at each other. The bartender was rude and did nothing to stop this, which was really not OK. I am more than ecstatic to be a city dweller, and had I not forgotten my ruby slippers, I would have clicked my heels to go home. This is not the scene for an educated young professional, to say the least.

All in all, two stars for being cheap and being opened when nowhere else was. I hope to not come back here.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Christine T.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: I've tried this place twice and I just can't get on board with it. The first time I ate here and it was mediocre. I had a pizza. The second time I just stopped in for a drink at the bar with my husband. It was very smoky and I got some dirty looks from the people I would presume are regulars here. The prices weren't great but they did have a fair number of beers on tap and TVs over the bar with sports on. One thing I did appreciate is that the music playing was really random and spanned a lot of genres, so that was fun! Sadly this isn't a place I'll go back to though.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Shawna Y.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: This place looks divey from the outside but their menu is amazing and they have a good beer selection. Our waitress was friendly attentive and our food came out quickly. Definitely will be coming back!

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Frank M.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: Terrible,,, Bad service by waitress that didn't want to be bothered with food and drink  orders or any questions we had concerning the menu.. food was below par and wasn't worth what we paid. Draft beer came out warm and every time we ordered another drink we inconvenienced the waitress with an attitude. The place was dirty the kitchen was filthy,,our table was situated right out front of the kitchen door.. i'll never spend another penny in this place again...

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Sean B.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description:
Did an over the phone order. Went to pick up, and it was really busy. The waitress/bartender had brought out a to go order and I thought I might free her hands and let her know it may be my order she had. 
She then gets attitude and says, " Well, it's not, and who are you and what did you order?" She then realized how she acted and came over to apologize. 
Waiting, they told me they didn't put the phone order in. So, I waited for my order. The other waitress was really gracious and apologetic. Word of advice: A lot of your customers see if you're busy and stressed, don't hang your attitude up on those who are patient.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Anthony T.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: Decent place. Updated from the last time I was here years ago. The food was decent for bar food, good beer selection and they allow smoking! Surprisingly fresh and good salad.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Mike M.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: First time we went, left feeling like it wasn't worth trying again. Months later, I returned for the 35 cent wing promotion. The bartender was very friendly and the wings were great value with unique sauce options. There was no tap list but the bartender politely offered to read them all off to me. Returned for a promo I saw on their menu and website. At 915pm I asked to order the pizza special. The bartender told me that was only Thursdays despite what I was looking at on the menu. I then asked to order the $4 appetizers on special from 9-10. The bartender again said no...it was now an 11-10 special despite what the menu said. I left without ordering and passed on my review via Facebook. I was shortly thereafter contacted by the owner who apologized for a miscommunication but said "there is only a pizza special on Thursday, but we do have $4 specialty pizzas 9-10 every day." So yes...there was a pizza special that I was not allowed to order due to a miscommunication. After offering a gift card, I turned it down. They then asked me what it would take to take down my negative review. I basically said I was not one sided about my review. I pointed out the quality wings. I even chose not to review until my 3rd time here. I said I would change my review when service gets consistently quality to where I don't have to leave the establishment not able to order food. It appears that since then they even took down their Facebook review option. I just found it fair to share my thoughts and it said a lot when the Facebook feature got taken down over one constructive public review

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Paul A.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: First off, let me say, I've never been to the restaurant, so I'm only reviewing the food.  I've ordered delivery from here a bunch of times, and I'm always very pleased.  First off, the prices are cheap, too cheap in my opinion (hopefully they won't read this and raise them), but it's only $7.50 for a half pound burger and side.  They are not the best burgers I have had, but I'd give them at least an 8 out of 10.  Their "seasoned fries" are really great to go with the burger.  I also order the BBQ pulled pork pizza.  It's $6.95, and they put so much pork on it, I can never finish it.  I'd definitely give the pizza top marks.  I order through Uber Eats, and it's a way better place to order from than their competition on the app, which is Stokes Grill, which is higher priced, and their food isn't that great.  Definitely a good place to order from, I get food from there at work at least once a week.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Todd K.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: The food here is amazing! Best wings in town. I cannot bring myself to eat here though because of the smoking in the restaurant. It's completely overwhelming and makes this place impossible for me to eat at. If you can deal with the smoking this is a must try. I fully support the businesses decision to allow smoking -power to the business owner- also the service is pretty terrible

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Kt H.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: The service at the hophouse couldn't be better,  nikki, deighton,Jen, tiffany, Jen, Melissa and deb are best staff you can find in the north hills.  I continue to frequent this location because of the amazing staff,  introducing me to there ever changing beer list and delicious menu.

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Hailey F.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: We've never been to the actual restaurant but with the food we have gotten on two separate occasions (on UberEATS) we may just have to go! The Mac & Cheese is literally the absolute best Mac & Cheese I have ever had (I make a good Mac and I am jealous of their recipe). We just got the wood fired pizza tonight and it did not disappoint. But that Mac & Cheese. Will definitely have to go for that again (and maybe try on their wing night!)

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Cait V.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description:
First and foremost I need to warn anyone who goes here that is a "Smoking Allowed" restaurant. What? Is it 1998 already?

We were there on a Tuesday and I guess it was busy for a Tuesday because the service was super slow and there were a lot of people there. Luckily I was in good company and had no where to be, so it really didn't matter.

The drink specials were pretty sweet, my mom and I treated ourselves to Pumpkin Martinis, they weren't very strong but they were delicious. Unfortunately our waitress did not have talent in carrying multiple martini glasses because a lot of the drink was dripped down the sides! 

For dinner I had the Secret Club on a focaccia, not bad. Typical bar food and the fries were fresh cut but waaaay overdone and hard! I stole a couple of my bf's fried onion bits and they were delicious!! I would recommend the Siracha BBQ sauce to dip them in, very yummy!

All in all it was good, could definitely leave out the patrons at the next booth smoking, but the atmosphere was fun and it was clean enough. The menus could definitely use a wipe down!

YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.author: Sage D.
YAci8e4YFgaVYyI1mDpp7Q.description: Come here for the food and prices not the service. Great wing prices and late night menu. But I have to pull teeth to get a drink under 12 minutes.

ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.author: Colleen S.
ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.description:
I absolutely love eating here for lunch downtown! It's one of the few outdoor spaces around here and I always enjoy my meal along with the whole experience. They have many different sandwich and salad options-- burgers, grilled chicken, Caesar salads and more. Last time I went here, they had a strawberry basil lemonade that was wonderful to drink while sitting out in the sun near the calming sounds of the waterfall.

I have never been here for happy hour, but I know it is on Wednesdays and they have food and drink specials, along with live music!

ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.author: Gina W.
ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.description:
Just landed from orlando, checked into hotel and found our way to garden cafe....good thing we stopped! Food was great! Service was great! Outdoors was fantastic ! 

I should have tipped 20% but your order and then sit down and I didn't realize the wait staff is a real wait staff not just deliver your food!

I would recommend! We had grilled shrimp, garden tacos w shrimp, salads and also chicken sandwich.

ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.author: Jamie M.
ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.description: After my horrible experience with ECCO shoes, I've been writing about my positive experiences.  Beautiful place to have lunch.  Shaded tables, great food and service.  Fabulous fountain.  Cool place to have lunch on a hot day.  Loved the summer minestrone & the best iced tea.  Wish it was in Richmond.

ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.author: Kendra W.
ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.description: Best place for lunch in Pittsburgh! Gorgeous patio, remarkable service and people, delicious food and drinks all to the sound of a beautiful fountain. I'll be back!

ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.author: Lori O.
ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.description: What a great location for lunch!  It's very casual, you pay for your food prior to sitting down.  The meal I had here was great and the servers were very attentive.  I've also gone here for happy hours and the music was wonderful.  Plus you get free food with your drink purchase and drinks were very reasonably priced as well.  Wish I had made a point to come here more often during the summer!

ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.author: William E.
ukB1l0o0MfPtE5GoUzJnIg.description:
I've long been a seeker of those places that make you feel like you are having that quintessential city experience. Things like riding a subway, eating a meal by big windows overlooking downtown, taking in a show, kissing you significant other under the lights on a snowy night in the holiday season... The Garden Cafe just made that list. And the best part was it wasn't something I knew would fit the bill.

The Garden Cafe sits in the courtyard next to Heinz hall, on the corner of Liberty and 6th (where 6th doglegs to become Market in front of the Fairmont Hotel). The cafe is only open on days when the weather forecast is favorable because the entire place is outside. You walk into the plaza, and there is a table with a register. You order here, and go and find a table on the brick patio, sitting among fountains, trees, and the beauty of this serene downtown setting, separated from the randomness and dirt of the sidewalk by the beauty of brick walls with lush greens growing atop. 

I had a chicken and brie wrap with corn something (salsa?) and some kind of Aioli suase... it was AMAZING. And it was served with a quarter pickle spear and fires. The fries were shoestring, crispy, DELICIOUS and awesome. The Wrap didn't seem huge (big enough, I figured, for a light lunch), and the whole thing was $7.something with the initial included 10% gratuity. 

I was stunned when I returned to my office and found myself fighting off a food coma. SO filling. This place is unbelievable and has such an amazing ambiance. You feel like you are really in a city, but an idealistic one where everyone is nice, all the air smells amazing, the new buildings are cool and unique and the old ones are classy and ancient in their stories. You get the feeling that you can conquer the world and when you get back to the office you are going to win that big account. OK... i guess this has nothing to do with the food, but it is pretty cool. The fountains, the trees, the food, the staff... all just really great! 

It was a little windy and that made it slightly challenging to eat normally, and the sounds from busses can on occasion be a little much. You will also hear any crazies yelling from the other side of the wall, but only the loudest ones. 

I would absolutely recommend this place. 

Weekdays 11:30-2:30, weather permitting.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Russell D.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: Typical Denny's which is good The food is exactly what you expect the people are friendly and service excellent Not much I can add

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Adam H.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
It's Denny's, what is there really to say?

So after having just moved to the area and not making it to the store yet, my.breakfast pickings on UberEats were slim.

I opted for Denny's Build Your Own Slam due to the free delivery. 

The pancakes were fluffy and had good flavor, the sausage & bacon were barely warm, and the hashbrowns were great. Only thing missinf was butter (they included syrup, jam, & ketchup).

Overall not good not bad, but it got the job done in a pinch.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Debbie C.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
Bad!!!!! Thought I'd try their crepe breakfast. Never again. All of my food was ice cold. Bob Evan's are much better 
 Server was not very attentive. Won't go back.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Funtime P.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
Sometimes I just want cheap tasty food so I go to Lenny's.

I went here twice this weekend cause the barbecue joint I went to for labor day ran out of food! Oh dear god!

They have a seasonal menu and good breakfast food.

I tried their tres leche pancake breakfast and their cinnamon ice cream pancakes and their Bourbon Burger. All were good and cheap.

Plus they're open 24/7.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Kelly M.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
Always great customer service and never a wait for a table.

They have leaned back in to breakfast with a smaller lunch/dinner menu.  I am partial to the sandwiches, namely the grilled Tuscan chicken sandwich! 

My only gripe is with their salads.  I always like to get a side salad with my sandwich, but at Denny's it is hit-or-miss with me having to pick out a few pieces of wilted/gummy lettuce or mushy grape tomatoes.  There isn't much of a demand, sure, but it's disappointing that there's not more attention to detail with their fresh vegetables.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Eileen S.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
I was here 2 weeks ago on a Sunday, soon after reopening following renovations.  It look great! Done in "Coffee House"neutrals, they replaced everything: lights, booths, chairs, tables, and, mercifully, the carpet.

 We were seated immediately,  but after almost 10 minutes I had to go find somebody to take our drink order. We ordered the senior turkey dinners. The server, while nice, could have done better. Both our dinners were cold; we sent them back. She forgot our cranberry sauce. Both times. When she brought our check, we told her (she never checked on our dinners or we would have told her). We wanted dessert, but she never even asked us and when I try to place a dessert order, she walked away. We paid and left.

I came back the next day for breakfast. What a difference! The server, a guy, was great. The pumpkin cream pancakes I ordered were light, fluffy, hot and delicious and had a generous portion of pumpkin cream on them. My coffee was hot. I was happy.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Dan K.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: I'm updating my review--we are frequent customers at this location and up until the last three times we've been here, we thought this was pretty much a flawless restaurant. Welp, the last three times, they have screwed up our orders--this last visit kinda was the reason I'm knocking stars off my rating. We usually always order the same hamburgers & wavy fries-because we think they are the best burgers coming from a chain restaurant. Last three times I requested to "build my own" burger--ground beef patty, very well done, Brioche bun, Swiss cheese, onions and lettuce with mustard. First time--they gave me American cheese--which I despise. They took it back (waitress was very kind!) and when she brought it back it had fried onions and mushy on it--NOPE--brought it back again and it was correct but ice cold fries. They did bring hot fries-and plenty of them to compensate for the burger debacle. Next visit--same request except I asked for NO CHEESE--came back with the stinkin American cheese again. They corrected it and it was fine. Third time's a charm--last night I ordered same thing--Swiss, Brioche bun, raw onions, lettuce and mustard. What did I get???? Swiss cheese, BACON, TOMATO, PICKLES and onions...my spouse's burger was also screwed up-ordered the Bourbon Bacon burger--received it with NO bacon and we both received crappy COLD bottom of the pan fries with all the little bits they could scrape up. TERRIBLE. Now please understand--we are not the nasty, complainers that some people are known to be-we are gracious, hate to complain and I actually gave my spouse the bacon that was inadvertently placed on my burger-just to avoid any conflict-but-that's the last time. It seems there was no manager there (6/6/2019) and it seemed rather chaotic-at one point even one of the waitresses yelled "get the door"!!!! And everyone looked wondering what was happening. Apparently no one was hosting at the moment so there was an unnecessary line at the door. Our waitress, an older lady, was not too pleasant, until tip time, of course. She seemed rattled and was rushing through taking our order-which probably partially accounts for the mixed up burgers. She seemed to cut us off, not really being attentive to our requests. We are older as well and if she can't do her job well, it may be time to hang up her apron. There is another young waitress who is AWESOME and checked us out at the register. She has waited on us many times before and goes the distance to make sure our drinks are refilled and everything is good. Last night-our little waitress didn't bring us refills until we asked another waitress to ask her to bring them. The trouble with getting burger orders wrong is--even though you want to take them back and make them right--it's another 20 minutes and if one person gets their food, the other has to wait and eat theirs 20 minutes later. Kind of irritating. Not sure I want to do this again--we'll miss you Denny's--you WERE a great place!

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Xandra A.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: Unacceptable!!!!! I first received my "medium well" steak bloody as hell!! I send it back, and received this!!!! DONE!!!!!!

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Macie P.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: Instant food poisoning. Coming out both ends is not a good look for Denny's, I should've known something was up when I ate the food and it didn't taste right. Maybe it was a bad cook or a bad produce day but I don't know. I'm sick as a dog.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Sue A.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: Probably the worst breakfast I have had in a year. The pancakes were thick and raw inside, hash browns and eggs were barely cooked and ice cold and my coffee had grinds floating.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Larissa G.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
I am the first to admit, Denny's is not an instant choice of mine when it's time to grab some grub. I hadn't been to this particular location in about eight years, until a friend wanted some cheap late-night eats last month. And while the meal went well enough, it admittedly had some hiccups.

Service was mediocre, with our waitress coming and going at an inconsistent pace. Sometimes we were checked on often, sometimes we were left waiting for a chance to place an order or to ask for a refill. The place didn't seem particularly busy either, but in fairness, perhaps something else was going on and keeping her busy behind the scenes?

The food was sadly just as "hot and cold" as the service. My friend and I split our meals that night: a burger, a side salad, party nachos, and a grilled steak skewer. The burger and skewer were actually pretty good - I would say my skewer was even great, featuring well cooked and seasoned steak, all served on a lovely stack of hot fresh vegetables and crispy potatoes. My friend called her burger "fine", so, an average burger it must have been. But as for the salad, I could only enjoy a single bite before turning it over to my friend; it was dripping in dressing. Most disappointing, however, were the nachos, as the chips tasted stale - so stale that their pile of meat and toppings could not make up for it. Something that stake has no place in any kitchen.

Disappointments there may have been, but as I mentioned, the main courses were actually pretty good. I felt that Denny's delivered an a-ok experience overall. Plus, I also got a large, cheap meal out of the deal. Fine dining it is not, but I'd consider returning for a budgeted meal again, now that I know more about what to expect (and avoid). Perhaps next time I can see how a breakfast course compares!

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Jay D.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
Got seated right away and the staff was very pleasant. One of the cleaner Denny's I have been to.  I ordered a burger, fries, and a shake and all were really good and cooked just right.
Denny's has always been one of my favorite casual dining restaurants, so this one is worth a visit when you are in the area.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Scott K.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: I'm no stranger to Denny's food. They have always been a way for me to get a good cooked meal. However this was the first time I ever ordered online for delivery. From the time the order was placed to the time it arrived at my door was no longer than 45 minutes. Which in retrospect is exactly what I would have seen if I was eating in the diner. When the food got to my door it was warm and fresh. And for not wanting to leave my hotel and still get a wonderful dinner was amazing. The speed in which the restaurant made the food and got it to me was faster than most other restaurants I would highly recommend Denny's to anybody that wants a good hearty meal you will not leave the table not feeling for.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Ilke B.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: It was fantastic, everything was fresh and yummy that we ordered. Especially try homemade fries

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Ralph H.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
I've never really had a bad meal here. It's Dennys though so you know what you're getting. 
I find the breakfasts are good tasting and filling. They have plenty of pancake specials and toasty hot coffee. Good sammiches for lunch and a decent assortment for dinner. Find a coupon which they have plenty of in flyers or email club and tie your feed bag on. Just remember you need to print all of their email coupons which is an antiquated system.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Melissa K.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: The longest wait I've ever had at a restaurant, and our food was still raw. The service was absolutely awful.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Kenan H.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: $25 for an almost two hours wait time for food that was undercooked, from slimy eggs, to raw in the middle pancakes, to cold hash browns. Our waitress even know this was a huge mess, as she never once asked me how anything was, just produced a check and called it a day. Worst dining experience of my life and I would recommend anyone ever going here.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Robert U.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
This place exceeded my expectations.

I've been to some dodgy Dennys over the years, so my expectations were pretty basic.  But this place is great.  Here's what I like:

THE GOOD:
- It's open and airy and surrounded by windows, emitting lots of outside light.
- It's been remodeled fairly recently, so the colors and textures and surfaces are all modern and fresh.
- The FOOD is really good.  Eggs are eggs, so I should say my food was prepared very well.  (For the record - I had one of the classic "Slams," with your basic eggs, bacon, biscuit, and hash-browns.)
- They've got a large, private parking lot.

THE BAD:
- Nothing.

I like it, the service was good, the food was good, it was clean inside, and quick and easy.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Kevin C.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description: The restaurant was clean. The server forgot the silverware the food came before the silverware. My son had to hunt down the server Lenna for silverware. The dish was bigger then the food. Over all average for Denny.

oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.author: Jessica D.
oxb73l504iA68bWdHqymHQ.description:
I was pleasantly surprised when we came here on Saturday morning with my daughter for breakfast.  She loves pancakes, but at 15 months, doesn't finish a full meal, so I end up eating whatever she doesn't.  She loves pancakes and I was excited to try the new fluffier buttermilk pancakes, and I can say that they totally exceeded expectations.  You know when you are watching a commercial and think that the food looks amazing and then you go to the restaurant and are so mad that the advertising tricked you?  These pancakes are just like the commercial - fluffy, vanilla-y and really just about perfect. 

We also had an omelet which was good and the grand slam which was about as expected.  But if you are in the mood for pancakes, I highly recommend them!

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Alan W.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
I am a big fan of Chipotle as it is a inexpensive healthy alternative to Mcdonalds and Wendy's.
I had a bowl to go with white rice chicken green peppers and onions and tomatoes and sour cream and lettuce.
the food was delicious and I definitely will be going back as it is near by.
The staff are fast and friendly and the place is clean.
The store has plenty of seating, But they dont seem to need it as it does not seem to be that busy ever.
In any case I love Chipotle and definitely will be going again.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Tori S.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
We were very excited for Chipotle as we usually are. We went to this location instead of our usual because of a fundraiser. The store looked clean.. nothing seemed out of the ordinary. Finally we got to our turn in line and the first girl had ZERO personality. I've also never seen someone put as few beans as she did... A scoop would have been nice. Luckily the next girl was a little nicer and gave actual portions. The guy behind us seemed to be having issues with the first girl too. We get to the end and the cashier, Brandon, also had zero personality. Not a hello, hi, how are you.. NOTHING. then we told Brandon that we were there for a fundraiser and he/she didn't even say a simple "okay". They said "receipt?" Obviously we took it because that was the only way we could tell if our proceeds went to the cause. Honestly very dissatisfied with this location and don't think I'll be making it back there. STEP UP YOUR GAME, Chipotle isn't supposed to disappoint.

One more thing... My burrito shouldn't be cold within minutes... Like ice cold.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Nicole D.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: They are always out of something! I don't know who is in charge of making sure they have all of their supplies but they are not doing their job. There is one nice lady there but the rest are usually miserable. I'm a huge fan of chipotle, but this one disappoints. I was there once and they had no sour cream, another time no chicken or chips, and I don't think I've ever been there when they have the fajita veggies.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Melissa A.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: Food was delicious and they actually speak up so I can hear them at this location! Clean tables and it was very comfortable, even as crowded as it was. The bathrooms needed a good wipe down but besides that, everything was great. The customer service was excellent and they were really polite. I got through the line pretty quickly too so everything went really well here. I'll definitely be back for more!

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Keenan A.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
The chips weren't stale this time at least.
Service remains mediocre to poor...
Portions are comically small.

Why is the queso gritty?!

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Kranthi Kumar B.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: No proper greeting to customer. Burnt chicken , less meat , kept actually all things kept very less , covered with sour cream and uncooked rice , salad seems to be out of date. I don't know why they kept a different expressions while serving us . All the staff seems little rude while serving. Never gonna come here again . This was my third time. Guys see the ratings . I think this restaurant has less rating. Inspite of it we came here out of our hunger. Guys improvise in order to attract customers.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Hayden K.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
Eh... getting pretty sick of them not having my online order ready 5-10 minutes after the app said it'd be ready. For a few times, I show up, get a deer in headlights look when I say I have an order to pick up, and then end up waiting longer than if I joined the line initially! Drives me crazy.

Also this place was the origin of my most traumatic chipotle experience. I have to share: the person making my burrito punctured the foil and tortilla with the sharpie at the end of the line. The person gave me a new tortilla and added a huge dollop if sour cream under the hot wad of crusty beans and filling from the first try and created this sloppy warm mess of a burrito. Couldn't even finish it.

Would you look at that? They finished my burrito right as I was finished up writing this. 11 minutes over when I supposed to get it.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Ciara C.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: It's a shame because this chipotle is the closest to my house and it's the absolute WORST. Every time I come here, the workers are ignorant and rude, they rush you completely out of the way and don't give a crap how little they put in your bowl. This bowl that I just received, I asked for a little more sour cream, they gave me a dirty looked and literally scooped another entire spoonful onto my bowl. I literally can't taste anything but sour cream now and the bowl is just ruined. Save yourself the frustration and go to the one in mccandless crossing. Avoid this place like the plague.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Nick M.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: Poor service. Food is not great at this location. Online orders never ready on time. Food is barely warm

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Matt K.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: Better than taco smell. Anyone who complaines about fast food should get a life, you know what you are walking into.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Bee M.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: Always love chipotle!!! Was in and out and everything was fresh. I tried the Queso and I was disappointed it tasted like fake processed cheese. Chipotle Corp you can do way better!

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Katie W.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: This is a decent chipotle. The seating arrangement is very nice here, there's even a few booths. My bowl had good proportions of food, and it was all very good. The fajita veggies were especially good, lots of colorful peppers as opposed to the usual green ones. Staff was friendly, and it wasn't very busy. Good experience.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Chelsea S.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
THERE WAS A DEAD FLY IN MY BOWL. I got takeout from the Chipotle at 4861 McKnight Rd, when I got home and opened my bowl, I saw a DEAD FLY in it. I have uploaded 2 photos in the photos section. I'm sure the fly was from the store because I saw it as soon as I opened the lid and it was dead.

I called the store and asked to speak to the manager. She told me to go back to the store to get a refund for the amount I paid, or a free entry. She did not sound sorry at all. NO APOLOGY, NO ADDITIONAL REIMBURSEMENT. Since I already know their food is not clean, I did not go back.

In addition, my husband has a sensitive stomach and he often got sick after eating there, which generally is an indication of unclean food. But due to the fact that Chipotle's food is so delicious and this location is very close to our home, we still visited a lot -- until I saw a whole fly in my bowl. We definitely won't go back anymore, no matter how delicious the food is. I've also seen a worker there accidentally dropped a plastic dip container into the Guacamole tray, she saw it but didn't pick it up immediately, she went back to work on someone's order, then picked up the container afterwards. After seeing all those details, I don't even want to imagine how they prepare their food. In short, what you eat there is not as clean as you assume. 

I want to remind future customers to avoid getting food from this place. If you do, check your food before your eat, to make sure there's nothing like a fly in it.

Chipotle is still good, but this location is the worst.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Catherine C.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: Chipotle is more of a rip off than it was before. Small portions, barely anything is included, 2.00 if you want guacamole on your burrito (basically a tablespoon of guac). Got burrito bowls with my husband tonight with a side of chips and guac (3.00). Left feeling hungry and spent 22.00 altogether. They gave us a ridiculously small amount of chips. I'm going to say approximately 13 chips (not kidding) for two people for 3.00... lower your prices if you're going to give that amount. Super annoying. Probably won't come back for a long time. Not worth the expensive prices.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Mrs W.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: Food is old and dry. We got there early, 11am. The food. Was obviously from last night. I ordered anyway had to get home. (I eat left overs). I took to bites and threw it away. It was awful!! Staff was friendly. The food was gross! We love chipotle. Never will I go to this one again!

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Rami N.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description: After trying multiple Chipotles in Pitt, by far this is my favorite Chipotle. The staff is very friendly, place kept clean (floors are to blame the management). The portions are very generous in comparison to other Chipotles.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Hannah M.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
First time here: we ordered chicken tacos, steak burrito & a steak/chicken bowl. Overall the meat is spicy.. It was fine for some of us but not all. The place was clean and the employees were fine. 

Chicken tacos were okay at best. There was plenty of sour cream and cheese but not a lot of chicken (ex: one of my tacos had like 2 bites of chicken).

Steak burrito: good overall. Only problem is that half the burrito is rice & lettuce and on the other side is all of the beans & steak.. So half the burrito is a waste. Next time would order just a bowl to get all of the toppings together.

Steak/chicken bowl: much better option than the burrito. Tasted good. "Pretty hard to mess up."

Chips are REALLY yummy. I love the salt and lime. I would go back just for the chips.

Total for 6 chicken tacos, 1 burrito, 1 bowl, 3 bags of chips & 2 drinks: $39.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Jan M.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
its  good for a taco fix    been here  5 time and i have mixed review some days are better  then another for example   chip and dip  to much salt and to saltly dip  black some days  not saltly   
steak hard some days super soft and good the food its not the same all the time  again its a quick fix for me   another chipotle  are better for sure but i always pass this one

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Maria Q.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
I like this location of Chipotle. For a fast food place, this restaurant is great.

Yet, my last visit wasn't so pleasant. 
We ordered a children's chicken quesadilla, and a salad for me but the quesadilla was left too long in the press and then lost (I assume they gave it to a to-go customer).  My daughter had eaten all the chips waiting for it and by the time we got the (second) quesadilla it was uneatable.
 
A timer is needed for the quesadilla press. There's no need to cook it, only heat it enough to melt the cheese. A child can't wait for their boiling hot melted cheese to cool off.

gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.author: Will H.
gkeGCryFC7z2vlFSDdKH0g.description:
I'm a big fan of this particular Chipotle. Pleasant staff, consistent food, and a clean restaurant. Not to mention, it's rarely busy enough that we've had to stand in a long line.

I usually get a burrito bowl with brown rice, black beans, and chicken, topped with the corn and mild salsas. Surprisingly, there's enough flavor in just those ingredients that I can pass all of the filthier options and be happy with my reasonably-healthy lunch! Whenever we're in the mood for a chain burrito, we typically opt for Chipotle, and this particular location is perfect if you're looking for a quick bite during a long day dealing with McKnight Road shopping/traffic/etc.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Amir H.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
This place was the only place we could find, especially when we were misled that Mike and Tony's was open till 3 (which they're not). 
We were pleasantly surprised to say the least. We met Johnny who was the bomb. Absolute gem! Pizza was awesome, service was old school for real. Only place that should be in this list. I'll be back for sure!

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: James E.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: Great pizza, I'm not around late night so Idk about the crowds but the pizza is great! The staff is really great too. Very accommodating and friendly

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Veronica M.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: Alright so the stars are for the pizza and company.. but downside is the inside of this place. It looks dirty even though it may be relatively clean. For me walking in I was a little hesitant. The pizza was sitting out and of course the man warmed it up before serving it. The pizza itself though was good. Mind you we got there like at 7-8pm so later on. Over all I would come here again. The pizza is good and for a good price. Don't mind the spiderwebs in the window or bathroom. Lol

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Mike H.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: It's good as fuck , definitely buy. It's some good pizza. might have to be drunk to buy. But still great pizza .

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Leah C.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: Absolutely delicious pizza. I've been here a few times during Friday and Saturday nights and even with extremely long lines the service was prompt and the employees were friendly

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Nick T.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: I was told that this was the place to be whether it was after a long night in the Southside area or just wanting a quality slice if you were in the mood for pizza. I can confirm that both of these are far from the truth. I paid $3.50 for an oversized slice of something they called a pizza. The bottom was completely burnt and black. The top featured a rock hard crust and underwhelming toppings. To top it off, the sauce and cheese were lukewarm and had no taste at all. No amount of pepper flakes or ranch could fix this mess. I have never been more disappointed by a pizza after a night out than i was with this one. If i could give a 0, i would.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Alec C.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
Sal's pizza is a south side staple and in my opinion by far and away the best pizza ever. The atmosphere is very New York and the guys behind the counter are friendly. One of the guys behind the counter wears a shirt of a band i like and one drunken night i engaged him in conversation about said band and he didn't blow me off like i was some drunk idiot. He was engaged and really appreciated the conversation.

One night we came in after we closed out the bars and my friend (who was a little belligerent) got in a shouting match with Sal. You'd think that it would have escalated but Sal sassed his way out of it and put my friend to shame. He takes it all in stride.

This is the only good eating establishment opened after 2 am on this side of south side, so you can't go wrong when you're closing out the bars. Seriously.

My absolute favorite is the bbq chicken za but i don't discriminate. All of their food is good. I hope this place is around for a long time. It's seriously the best. This isn't drunk me talking either. I just got done eating a slice and I'm stone cold sober and it was delicious. The only place that tops it is doce taqueria, but that place is pretty hard to beat.

Keep it up, fellas. As long as you're open I'll be a loyal customer.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Patrick P.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
Sal's New York Pizzeria provided a hot slice pretty fast.    The knock on their slice of pizza - crust was good, the toppings were meh...  The place needs a thorough cleaning.

We just needed a quick bite before we went on our way.  Based on the experience - I will probably opt for something else.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Brett C.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: Friendly, good vibes, and gave us an extra latge pizza for a large price (due to a miscommunication).  Best pizza in Pittsburgh and best staff in Pittsburgh.  Highly recommend! Johnny, Otto and Josh are awesome!

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Tian Y.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
Meh. I don't think this is great thin crust.  My friend mentioned hearing good things about it when we walked by, so we decided to split a slice.

We were told that the buffalo chicken just came out of the oven and is their most popular one out of the others that were out (cheese, sausage, pepperoni, some ombination of those, and a couple others). Out of their selection, the other pizzas didn't look too appetizing.

The crust was kind of crumbly and stale instead of crispy and the topping was really sparse - like a drizzle of generic hot sauce and a few small pieces of questionable chicken. Not sure a slice is worth $3something. 

Pretty acceptable drunk food. But otherwise, nnnno.



Jamaican patty... if I happen to walk by Sal's again, I'll give that a try.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Angela D.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
Filthy 
Place needs to clean everything from top to bottom ..... Come on Pittsburgh get with it 
If u are serving food and charging for it please please do so in a clean environment and also keep steady hours I've gone to the door 2x and it was locked when it's suppose to be open 
Just gross

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: John C.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
I walked into this place late Saturday. It says "Sal's Pizzeria" on the outside but I didn't see anything about New York. They had Biggie turned up, and when I asked if they had slices, the guy who I assume is Sal took a 22" thin-crust pie out of the oven.

The New York was implied.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Lisa E.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: I will never give this place another dime. Went here to buy my son a slice of pizza this evening.  A guy was smoking in the doorway. He happened to be the worker. He asked us what we wanted and without washing his hands grabbed two slices of pizza and handed it to me. When I confronted him about not washing his hands he gave attitude and shrugged his shoulders. I said that was nasty and he didn't make any attempt to apologize. If he doesn't care after being confronted it makes me wonder if he washes his hands after going to the bathroom. This place is unsanitary and not interested in customer satisfaction. AVOID!!!!!

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Casey N.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
So your in Southside, drunk, hungry, and wanting pizza. Where else do you end up but Sal's.  Sal's pizza is always somehow so good when you are drunk but thinking about it the next day, not so much. 

The idea Sal's has is good. Big slices of thin crust pizza tossed in the oven to quickly heat, with different toppings to choose from and a cheap price. But it's not really good quilty pizza, and it's never hot enough! 

Honestly if I ever am in Southside, drinking, and need some quick food this would be where I would stop. It's become almost like a tradition so even though it's not the best, I will still go. Here's too all the drunk pizza eaters each weekend at Sal's! Always entertaining.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Farha A.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
Once my roomate and I moved to Southside, this became our number one pizza spot. I've gone to many "small pizza shops", including Antoons and Sorrentos of Oakland, but this is by far the best tasting pizza I have come across at a local small business.

It was great at any time of the day or a late night snack. 

Sometimes, the area was a little shady, especially at night since this was a huge party area so I wouldnt go alone during these times or make sure nothing shady is going on around the shop on Friday/Saturday night.

Aside from all that - really great pizza and thats all that matters to me!

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Billy E.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: Great pizza! It's your classic NY style pizza...if you looking for a nice place and happy people, this will not work for you. These guys have grit and you have to respect that! Try the Jamaican Beef Patties! Just like a bodega in NYC! Thank you Sal!

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Stacie C.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
Many moons ago, as a recent college graduate, I took up residence in the South Side of Pittsburgh (South 22nd Street to be exact).  I enjoyed many a nights during that time at the plethora of watering holes.  And as I would make my way home I often stopped by a local eatery for a late night snack.  My favorite was DiSalla's, a pizza shop that served up square pizza.  It was by no means the best pizza but it was close to home, cheap and very tasty with alcohol.  DiSalla's, sadly, no longer exists.  Pizza Vesuvio was another pizza place I enjoyed because it was also cheap and had nice big New York slices.  It has since become Pizza Sola and way too expensive.  Enter Sal's Pizzeria.  

My first trip was really just a fly-by for a snack on my way to a show at Club Cafe because a friend had told me to try the meat pies.  Yes, for $2 you can get a Jamaican meat pie.  And for $2, it was tasty and hit the spot.  

Yesterday I walked in and was told they had just opened so they didn't have pizza ready yet, but that it would be out of the oven in 5-7 minutes.  I was willing to wait.  It's exactly what you'd expect or want when you walk into a place like this - a slice of New York.  Thin crust oozing with sauce and melted cheese as I folded it in half....and for only $2 (plain cheese)!  It might just be the cheapest meal in the South Side.  An unbelievable deal at an unbelievable price.  The guy behind the counter even asked me how it was as I left.  A side of nice with a cheap slice?  I'm hooked.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Morgain C.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
The pizza is good. The staff is friendly. Prices are comparable to other pizza-delivery places. The best advantage to Sal's? They deliver till 4am! Because I work night shift, I often don't think about ordering pizza till after midnight, and that leaves me with only one other option, that I have long since tired of.
That would be reason enough to earn my food moneys, but when I was in South Side and stopped in to get a pizza to take home, I was struck by how quick the entire staff was to smile and laugh with the customers who were obvious regulars. I watched them discuss everything from national politics to women in the bar next door, all in the ten short minutes I waited for my delicious and well priced pepperoni pizza.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Dave L.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description: This place use to be good. I was just served by a guy that was strung out on heroin (no doubt) and couldn't answer the patron's simple questions.

G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.author: Stephanie T.
G7QZWVm-ytyKHpvUq3ggFA.description:
Sal's is shockingly good for such a dive. I mean, they give Pizza Sola some serious competition in my opinion!

Don't be fooled by the dingy interior and decor. A slice at Sal's will put you in pizza heaven, all for $3! These are New-York style slices - in other words, larger than life and all built on a fairly thin crust. I've only ever gotten the cheese here and it's always been fantastic (that's how to judge a good pizzeria, right?). Their twilight hours provide ample room for drunk dining and bad (but delicious) diet decisions. Only downside to that is dealing with the obnoxious clientele at that hour.

Sal himself is also super nice, in that New-Yorker-running-a-pizza-shop kind of way. While they could use a bit of housekeeping, their pizza is pretty darn good.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Sammy B.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
Yum place to have a SUPER Great FISH sandwich the people are nice here and u can come here for lynt 
P.s. There is a bar in front so walk to the back to order... 
So check this place out my yelpers

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Emily T.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: Armand's is exactly what I expected from a Bloomfield bar. Laid back, community atmosphere, with what seems like a lot of regulars. Nice, small place to stop for a drink. PS the drinks are STRONG!

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Michael B.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: Just a neighborhood bar now.  No kitchen with their famous fish sandwiches anymore

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Nathan T.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: Very solid dive bar. The drinks are cheap and service was quick and friendly. I would like if there were bigger TVs for watching sports, but that's a small complaint. There is not a lot of seating, making hanging out a little difficult when its crowded. Though, this if definitely one of the better places I've been in Bloomfield.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: john p.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: Armand's Kitchen is CLOSED.  Went there today for a fish sandwich and bartender told me that it closed two years ago.  Very sorry that it closed, but closed it is.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Karla D.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: The epitome of a neighborhood dive. Smokey, sometimes loud, good jukebox, lots of drinkers. But you know what? I love my neighborhood and I love walking in and seeing familiar faces. Prices are fair and the bartenders are cool---they're great to talk to and look out for patrons. Seriously can't beat an ice cold pitcher of PBR when you're low on funds.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Rob C.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
My favorite place in Bloomfield. Best bartenders, best people, best hockey atmosphere, best pours, best TWD watching crew. 

If you don't like this place, you're absolutely better off elsewhere, AY OH AY! 

The fish sandwich is so famous you can't even get one.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Jacob A.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
Armands is the most chill dive bar in Bloomfield. Come to Armands to sit and have drinks. Talk to the regulars. Talk to the bartenders. Or not, nobody gives a shit. Joe, Gail and Steve are all friendly and never put a wall of service or distance between them and their customers. The drinks are not the cheapest in Bloomfield. Pollocks or Lue's are cheaper but less expensive than the hipster haven Sonny's... if not in the price than at least in the pour. Expect reasonably well behaved alcoholics. The crowd gets younger as the day gets older. 

The fish sandwich is amazing. 

The bathrooms are sketchy with the benefit of respectful patrons. (Pretty clean.) 

The ability to sit and have a drink is unparalleled. Bam! Armands!

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Rick W.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
Don't come here if you're a hater. The bar sucks for your kind. If you don't tip well, go to another dive bar. If you enjoy chatting with friendly Pittsburgh folk of all walks of life, you've found your place. 

Feel free to show up from noon to 4pm when the fish sandwiches are made, I've never had one cause cheese costs $1 for a single slice, same with tomatoes, lettuce, and onions. But since I don't remember eating a sandwich I can't say they're bad.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Tim M.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
This review is only for the fish sandwich.  

This sandwich is well worth navigating the odd hours (see photos).  Two (yes, two) flaky, buttery whitefish fillets generously coated in a cornmeal-based batter and fried to golden, crispy perfection.  The sandwich barely qualifies as such, as it wears its bun like a hat.  I would note that tartar sauce if pretty much obligatory since the fish, while firm and flavorful, is naturally a bit dry.  I would recommend two people and an allotted half-hour naptime to conquer the large.   I imagine the small might be more manageable for a single hungry soul.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Ammie-Marie S.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: If you and your friends have got about $15 to spare, you can get yourself a gigantic, delicious fish sandwich that you can share between 2-3 people with an extra bun or so. I've had many of these sandwiches over the years during lent, and they are worth every cent. You may want to stop at an ATM beforehand because this place is cash only.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Shana M.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: This place is sketchy from the moment that you approach the entrance. Even looking in through the window should have been hint enough not to go in there.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Jordan F.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: Come during the day when gale is here she is choice people! Conversation is good and she doesn't take shit from anyone. Customers are nice and easy going. If your looking for craft cocktails go across the street. This is a shot and a beer bar.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Sean L.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: If you want a shot and a beer Armands is fine. Don't ask for a greyhound though because the bartender didn't know what that was, and instead of asking he tried to talk me out of getting a mixed drink. For reference a greyhound is gin or vodka and grapefruit juice. A bar that can't handle a 2 ingredient drink is not much of a bar. The fish sandwiches are large.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Dylan K.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description: The fish sandwich alone is why I give this place 5 stars. It was one if a kind and worth the money. I bought the large fish sandwich and it had 2 and a half huge filets of a white fish over powering the large circular bun. She wouldn't say what fish it is but I didn't even care. Food is served from 11am-5pm Monday through Friday. The bar is "smoker friendly" and I'm not a smoker so I can't judge a smokers bar.. The older lady that made the sandwich for me has been making the same sandwich for over 40 years. That alone should make you try this sandwich.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Deana M.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
After a 45 minute wait, with no communication, standing there inhaling cigarette smoke like you've never seen/smelled before, we gave up on our order.  We tried to get them to give us our money back, or even one piece of fish or just half of our order or any food at all, and they became irate.  (I told the lady we couldn't wait anymore......she just turned her back to me). The food looked good whenever they could get it out.  I think they were surprised that people were going to come......on a Friday.......during Lent......for fish........  They were clearly overwhelmed.  It was like the blind leading the blind.

I hope they take our $20 donation and invest in someone who can help them get organized.  

Never. Again.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Vanessa W.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
Let me preface this review by saying that I love dive bars. I'm not talking about trendy hipster bars that aspire to be dive-esque, although those have their place and I'm not knocking them. But when I find that sweet spot of a total and absolute dive that I don't actually fear for my safety in, I am super-happy.

Walk into Armand's Bar anytime of day or night and it is full of cigarette smoke and regulars who are half in the bag. The drinks are absurdly cheap and the pour wondrously stiff. The people who drink there are friendly and when I've gone there with my husband we've been just left alone to drink and relax and when I've gone there with female friends old guys sometimes talk to us in a totally jovial/friendly/non-threatening way, but I've never had a problem just having my own space.

The bartenders are so sweet and as I said, very generous with their pours.

Seriously, I love Armand's Bar. First discovered it because I wanted to try the fish sandwich they brag about and it is DELICIOUS! I crave it every time I know I'm going back to da 'burgh. I seriously think this is the best fish sandwich in the city, and that is saying something in a place where many restaurants do a great fish sandwich.

So, this is five stars for a *dive bar* because if you want the *dive bar* experience, this is it, and it's awesome. Obviously this is not a place to go get a great Sazerac (er, or any Sazerac), and yes, the bathroom's kind of iffy, but if you just want a place that is totally chill and downtempo where you can drink with friends, it's a great spot.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Jan R.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
You will literally HATE this bar if you are a Miss Pristy person who loves umbrella drinks.
There are no froth glasses with fruit or ice around the rims.  The mix drinks are plain and simple.  Nothing fancy.  However they are decent and very good.

If you are a Miss Pristy and hate being around smoke - again skip this place.  It is a smokers bar.  

There are a lot of regulars at this bar and many of the people know each other.
Still everybody will immediately feel welcomed.

If you are craving a fish sandwich when the kitchen is open - GET IT.
The best fish around!!!!!!

Again if you are a Miss Pristy who freaks out because they ate a piece of lettuce that has two calories in it - stay away from the food.

The fried  fish sandwiches are freaking HUGE!!!!

There is NO such thing of a small order of French Fries.
You definitely will get your money worth.

There ONE meal will overfeed 8 - 10 Miss Pristy's appetite 


Why the three stars

There is no FREE Wi-Fi here.
Most of the places  go to -have free Wifi.

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Matt D.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
Sandwich lives up to the hype! The cornmeal breading is phenomenal and it isn't greasy like some others.

As of 07/2014 food service stops at 7 PM on Friday. The sign looks like the one pictured but with a giant black 7 over the kitchen closing hour for Friday so I'd guess all the other hours are the same (I didn't take a very good look as I was focused on the deliciousness before me).

DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.author: Nichole M.
DzviZnBOgPD3YTnBCDEM9Q.description:
Right in the heart of Bloomfield you'll find Armand's: The Home of some Giant Monster Fish Sandwich... While I can't say anything about the fish sandwich, this is the home of some of the cheapest PBR pounder 6 packs ever.

The bar itself is small, and would be considered a cozy-dive bar if the patrons weren't smoking like chimneys. If there was ever one thing that will lead me to never frequent a bar again it's the smoke. 

I've left here after 5 minutes of buying pounders to go home with and smelled so badly that I had to change my clothes...

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Maria M.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: Consistently decent food. Nothing life altering but you won't get a crappy meal here. Great lunch time spot. Decent prices. Try the saucy chicken salad. Their home made breadsticks are

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Digger 1.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: Stick a fork in it done with this place. Bad service, waitress was not friendly or helpful. Brought wings to our table with no extra napkins or plate for discarded wings. Call me old school but this is the way I like to function. Asked for a plate and brought out a dirty used plate. Asked for wet naps she said they don't have them. Been to the cafe many things have gone downhill. I can tell you this for sure I will never have a bad experience here again because I won't go there again.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Melanie E.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: Terrible experience... Bartender shorted me change and then blamed it on not having anything other than quarters?  WTF?

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Karla D.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description:
This is basic bar food. What I mean by that is: wings, salads (with fries of course), sandwiches, etc.

It's kind of like a sports bar. Actually it's definitely a sports bar which isn't my typical scene. But it's a spot to grab quick lunch since it's not far from my office.

I like the fries because they're always crisp and not soggy. The provolone cheese wheels are also fried well.

Grilled chicken salad-fresh veggies with seasoned grilled chicken and of course fries. Decent.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Merlyn R.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: This is a convenient place to stop on Fifth Avenue! The inside has a sports bar meets sit-down restaurant atmosphere and the wait staff is incredibly friendly. The food itself is very nice, and it's a perfect portion to be full but not stuffed. I ate the tuna fish (not salad) sandwich with fries! I had an excellent first experience, so I would definitely recommend this to a friend or family member!

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Tony M.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: My first time here and I'm happy my first time was a good time! The one thing I must stress about this place was that the service was on point. Got my food the minute I ordered with it being as good as it looked. It feels like a place you'd go to for a few drinks with some friends with food to pair nicely.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Natalie S.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description:
Stopped in for a drink and a bite before the pens game. We asked the waitress what was on special or for happy hour and she directed us to the beer portion of the menu. Spoiler alert: nothing was special and it was unhappy hour.

I had the Buffalo chicken salad. I was disappointed the ranch was just some bottled nonsense put into a plastic container and not homemade. The fries (because a salad in the Burgh without fries is a waste) were perfectly fried and crispy but soft on the inside. The chicken was delicious! Pretty sure the Buffalo sauce was just Frank's and you can't go wrong with that. 

Overall the service was good, the food decent and the beer selection good as well. It just wasn't anything to write home about but definitely worth stopping by before a game!

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Katelynn D.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: My fiancé and I went here before a Pens game because our usual spots were packed. Overall, I was definitely not impressed. It is a very crowded place, with a downstairs and upstairs sitting area. We were led upstairs and it took a while for our waiter to stop by. We were so close to the table next to us that we started just talking to them to make it less awkward. We ordered wings and a small pizza to share. We really enjoyed the full-size buffalo wings; they were crispy and delicious! The pizza- on the other hand- was very doughy and not very tasty. My fiancé's Yuengling tall can was $6, which we thought was a bit outrageous. Most places sell them for $3-$4. Overall, it was a lackluster experience.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Chad B.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description:
Great little spot near the Arena for lunch or some drinks and a quick bite before a game. I went here on the suggestion of a co-worker for lunch one afternoon and we liked it so much we have gone back a few times now. The have daily specials which usually includes a wrap of some sort. First I tried the Spicy Chicken wrap which was incredibly good. Actually scratch that...it was one of the best wraps I've ever had...hands down!!!  I don't know exactly what they did to this thing but if it is on special, get it!  Next I tried the Tune Melt wrap during Lent and while it was still good, it didn't quite hit the level of awesome that the Spicy Chicken did.  I'm okay with just getting the homemade chips but they also have a fry option with the wraps or a few subs like Onion Rings for an up charge. Speaking of charge, these wraps are a pretty big portion for around an $8 price tag.  Service has always been fast and friendly. It just seems like a good crew here during the day.

I'm not sure how things are for the dinner crowd but they look to have some really great happy hour and game day drink specials.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Dale W.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: Good food. Lots of drink options. Great atmosphere whether you're pregaming before hockey or a concert.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Allyson H.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: Food was delicious but the service was average. We were one of two tables and were in there for over an hour waiting for food and then checks. Their fish sandwich is huge and I had the quesadilla.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Kat C.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: Decent food and great portion sizes. We stopped in after a Pens game...wasn't too crowded and we got our food pretty quickly. We'd definitely go back if we were in the area.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Ashley E.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: The only reason I didn't give it one star is because the food is actually good. But the service is terrible. The waitresses are slow, lazy and non engaging. I called in an order at 1:20pm. Was told it would be ready on 15 minutes. Got there at 1:40. There we're 4 other people in the entire restaurant. I then had to wait another 15 minutes for my food to come out and only because I asked one of the waitresses to check on it. I truly don't think they started making my food until i walked in. I wouldn't have been as annoyed if I didn't only have a 30 minute lunch. Regardless, terrible service all around

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: HN S.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description:
I walk past here on my way to and from work every day and I've been telling myself that I need to stop in for lunch or dinner someday. Well today is "someday".

Unlike other reviews on here, I stopped in for lunch on a day and a time when there was nothing going on at the Consol. There were only 20 some other people in the establishment while I was there making it like any other restaurant on any given day. 

Overall I'd have to say that this bi-level tavern is a comfortably roomy place with brass railings, wooden paneling half way up the walls and hardwood floors. It has that "mature" appearance and feel to it. As of this writing 6 out of the 10 taps are pouring craft beers and the bar appears to be well stocked with all of the major brands of booze.

Sitting at the bar, as I usually do when I dine solo (as I usually dine), I ordered a raspberry ice tea and decided to go with the special of the day: the flat iron steak with broccoli and hash browns that was advertised on a sign parked outside the door. 

It took a little over 10 minutes for my order to make its way in front of me. I cut into the steak and wha'la, cooked to perfection. The steak was melt in your mouth awesome and screaming with flavor. The hash browns were browned and lightly peppered while the broccoli was bright green and steamed retaining a slight crunch. Delicious!

My billed totaled to $12.74 plus tip. 

With so many restaurants popping up on the Pittsburgh foodie radar, it's easy to forgo the tried and true established establishments. I found my lunch at Café Fifth to be one of the better values for your buck while satisfying my inner foodie.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Jeremy B.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: New owner and new things happening- worth coming in for a drink and appetizer! Comfortable environment and beat prices near Consul Energy Center! Worth the stop!

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Kerri M.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: We've been here a few times before a hockey game to grab a bite to eat and some beers. Recently had a not so great experience though. There were no beer specials for the game. I ordered pizza and my husband ordered the Italian hoagie. The pizza was terrible, no flavor in the dough and it had a strange soap taste to it. The Italian hoagie was alright, nothing to get excited over. We were pretty bummed because we've stopped here before and had better experiences.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Mo M.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: I'm so tired of pretending I don't hate this place. It's old and filthy. The menus still advertise their St Patrick's Day specials (I am writing this in October). The food is not good. (Who makes a quesadilla with jarred jalapeños and canned black beans?) Their chicken tenders aren't even any good. Their beer selection is decent, but unfortunately that's about the only thing good I can say about this place. That, and the location.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Laura M.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: Great spot in a great location right downtown.  Huge place with tons of room and great specials.  All of the staff is really friendly and accommodating.  The provolone moons are the BEST appetizer ever, make sure to get a few orders of those.  I have been there for lunch as well as happy hour with friends and I definitely recommend for those looking for good bar food and a fun atmosphere!

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Kat V.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description: Great neighborhood bar for before/after games. Very good food. Not the best, but it's a bar. If you want a fancy restaurant, this is clearly not a good option, but if you want a good meal before the game or concert and some drinks with good prices, this is a very good option around CONSOL Energy Center.

ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.author: Paul S.
ql0AaBp68ckekxvWOF8xLA.description:
Best locally owned bar in the area. 
Great bar food, wings and pizza are great. Hostess is very helpful when finding previously seated friends. Never had a bad item from the menu.

z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.author: Elizabeth B.
z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.description: The Pub Chip Shop Food Truck is always a favorite at my workplace! I recently ordered the fries with both cheese and gravy on the side. The fries were perfectly crispy and delicious both on their own or paired with a sauce. The employee that helped me was particularly friendly, and I enjoyed my brief chat with him. This food truck is a winner, and I look forward to eating from here again sometime soon!

z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.author: Pete J.
z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.description: I've always enjoyed the brick and mortar and was excited to try the food truck. I ordered fish and chips and was not disappointed. $10 got me two hefty portions of fresh and crispy fish as well as a ton of chips. The fish was just awesome. The chips were perfectly salted and nice and crispy. Best food truck meal that I've ever had. I would make a special trip to find this truck again. The fish and chips were actually much better than a lot we had this summer in England. I can't recommend them more.

z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.author: Allyson H.
z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.description: Delicious food! Highly suggest stopping for delicious tacos, chicken tenders, fish and of course the delicious fries. The homemade ranch is also amazingly delicious.

z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.author: Chad B.
z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.description: Spotted outside of PPG Paints Arena! Settled on trying the Thai Fish Tacos which were great. The breading on the fish is light and fluffy which goes perfect with the Napa Cabbage and Thai Sauce. The sauce has a nice sweet taste with a touch of heat which is again complimented by the Napa Cabbage.  You get 2 for $8. Not into fish? They offer these with chicken as well.  A few other items include standard fish n' chips (or chicken), chips with cheese or gravy, Mac n' Cheese and a very tempting Scotch Egg.  It will be mine next time!  Ohh yes, it will be mine!  The service was fast and friendly while the truck itself appeared very clean and organized. Sometimes food trucks can be a scary sight if you are a sanitary nut butt his one was in great shape.  If you see them roaming around, make sure to give them a try.

z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.author: Troy B.
z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.description: If you are familiar with The Pub Chip Shop restaurant on the South Side, this is the mobile version of it, with a slightly smaller menu than the brick & mortar location.  Today I caught the truck for lunch in Foster Plaza, Bldg. #9, where it was on site from 11-2.  I had a Scotch Egg, along with some Chips w/Gravy.  Both items were delicious.  They also have drinks, and condiments available.

z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.author: Jennifer C.
z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.description: This food truck came to our office. Amazing biscuits, as big as your head. Everything was super fresh and delicious. The menu also is incredibly broad with offerings from donuts to biscuits and gravy to run-of-the-mill breakfast sandwiches. I will definitely be lined up the next time this food truck is around. I will also plan to look them up the next time I'm in Southside!

z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.author: Leslie S.
z2o5wCs-O0ZjnSTVtVQfpw.description:
Fabulous
Beats the one we're used to across the pond!
They got their fish done right!
Just enough time in the fryer.
Chips a bit dry and crispy but hey! This is the us of a...we seem to like our chips more fried. Hence fries not chips.
Fabulous. Two very nice dudes in a truck...and you can bring it into the Roundabout Brewery.
