The parking situation is not great, but they make it work. If you are looking for a classic diner meal, head on over!

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Emily H.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: This was a wonderful small diner. Really authentic. The food was great, quick service, and really cheap! Love love love!

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Danielle D.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: Went here because it was close to my friend's house and we needed a place to grab a quick bite. First... parking sucks. Second... the menu is quite limited. I was looking for some grits for breakfast, but no. Decided on a burger for breakfast with an egg added, but don't like fries. Coleslaw? No. What diner doesnt serve coleslaw? Okay, side salad. Fine. Chopped up iceberg lettuce with diced tomatoes and onions. It was gross. The burger? Meh. The service was also miserably slow. There aren't that many tables in the place, how can it take 1/2 hr to cook an omelet for my friend?

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Helen E.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: Adorable little hidden gem. Really friendly staff, family-owned place with basic breakfast options for a very low price.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Jonathan P.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: I ate here for the first time on a Sunday morning when there was a moderate crowd. Three of us ordered one of the specials, and 20 minutes later our server told us only one was left. We decided who would get it, and then a few minutes later were told another customer had gotten it. Other orders and side dishes were late. The food was fine but no better than dozens of other breakfast spots around Pittsburgh, most of which have far better service.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Beth L.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: Wonderful original authentic mid-century diner. Yummy food, seriously. And the friendliest people.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Jason F.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description:
I stopped by here earlier today for lunch with my father and goddaughter.  We had both driven by Valiants many times in the past and for some reason had never gone so I was happy to oblige him whenever he expressed an interest.  Whenever we got there the parking lot was mostly full, both front and back and I think we got the last spot.  We then walked around the restaurant and went in and seated ourselves in a booth.  The inside of Valiants looks like how you would picture an old diner complete with lunch counter, checkboard floors, 50's/60's pictures on the wall (Elvis, Betty boop, Marilyn Monroe and other diners) and interesting colored mint green booths.

For lunch on this day I decided to go with the Valiant burger with a side of fries.  According to the menu, the burger was an 8 oz party with Swiss cheese, grilled peppers, onions and mushrooms.  It ended up taking a pedestrian 30 minutes from ordering until it got to our table which I normally wouldn't mention but with a somewhat fussy 1 year old at our table, it felt longer.  Honestly I wasn't expecting much from it due to its price ( less than $6) and the 2.5 star Yelp rating for Valiants.  So I was pleasantly surprised whenever I bit into the burger and I thought it was actually quite good.  It was larger than I expected as well with ample toppings and a nice layer of Swiss on the top.  The only part that could have used improvement was the bun.  While it was toasted it could have been toasted longer as the bun ended up being soggy and fell apart whenever I ate it.  Their fries were crinkle cut and came out piping hot and tasted pretty good.  When eaten plain they could have used some more salt but whenever I added Franks red hot to them I was happy.

The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  Even though our order took a little longer than we hoped, the food was good and the prices are too.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Nick S.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: This is one of my favorite places to get a great breakfast in the Pittsburgh area. It has amazing breakfast and lunch foods, a cool retro atmosphere, and it's not too bad on price. I would definitely recommend Valliant's to anyone. If you are traveling to the area, visiting this 50s-60s themed diner would be a huge thing to miss if you didn't get the chance to visit. I especially recommend their omelettes and burgers.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Elizabeth J.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: One of my absolute favorite places to eat breakfast or lunch! It is an old style diner, I love the way it is set up, but to each their own. I have been going there since I was a little girl and everything I've ever ordered was correct and amazing! Never had one issue. The service is friendly and fast, even when they're pretty busy. There is parking in the front and also along the back of the building. I have nothing but good things that I could say about this place, so if you haven't go try it out! You can watch your food being cooked. The chef even cooks at the Greek festival. He's an amazing chef and only hires the best to cook with him at the restaurant. You will not leave hungry. I just wish they stayed open longer lol. A great place to go.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Philippe K.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: I haven't been this excited about a legit diner in 30yrs. Perfect, classic diner food. Im claiming this place as our new spot. The were constantly busy because, clearly, they serve quality in all regards. My 6 y/o even remarked how nice our waitress was. Pretty sure it's family-run, which would explain the warm atmosphere. Can't wait to go back. Thanks!

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Bradley R.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: First know this is seat yourself - this isn't posted in store but throws a lot of first time Boston's. Second this is a place with a lot of long time local customers who will get served before you so don't freak out. Typical diner fare at a cheap price and decent flavor. Enjoyed how low key it was. Plenty of parking in the rear if needed.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Kathryn F.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description:
They split the huge sausage links long ways then fry them.  Yum ... I could make a meal on the home fries. I don't think anything is broiled ... so take an aspirin with you.

They do breakfast and early lunch ... and then go home.  It is a family owned business.  See the write up in the Pittsburgh Tribune / Post Gazette ... 

Every time the front door opens ... I look up expecting to see Fonzi coming through the door. The 50's decor is just right.

Parking is limited but the food is delicious.  The waitresses are wonderful.

 I am very happy to see a non - chain mom and pop restaurant thriving.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Elle G.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description:
First off This is another local business in the North Hills. It's awesome to be able to support these whenever possible.
The hours are limited, so it's nice to catch them when you can. The soups are great, still made by the grandpa who started the place. I had the omelet and got a sausage sub to go for lunch later. I was super happy with both.  The flavors are just normal kitchen food. I have pics, but no idea how to attach. The theme is 50's. Additional parking in back.
It's not fast but a fun place to take it slow some morning if you are over chain restaurants.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Carol S.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: A nice little diner. The service was friendly and fast, which was surprising since they were busy. The portions were huge! There are specials up on the board and they have good old-fashion meals like fried bologna. I will definitely come back.

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Rick T.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: Got there a little after 10:30 and at 11:45 never got my food yet never was asked if I wanted a refill of coffee by my waitress or even checked on was walked by a could times and told them I'm leaving cause I didn't get my food after waiting 45 minutes

K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.author: Daria T.
K0dp91jd_vqW4uNgvW6oag.description: Cute little 50's diner with great food and service. Our waitress was very attentive to our needs without even having to ask and also since she was the only waitress on staff at the time. The food was delicious and large in portion.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Jan R.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
I have been visiting several Panera's locations for many years.

I go to the on on Centre Avenue in Bloomfield/Shadyside because it is directly across the street from the church that I attend.  Also I live a few blocks up the street from this location.

So for tonight's visit, five stars are not even enough to cover the beyond excellent service that I received from Eric 

From all of my many visits through my many locations this visit was beyond exceptional!!!

The cashier Eric was so friendly professional, personable, kind, sweet etc.  I noticed that he gave all of the customers one on one, attention.  He treated everybody like he would his family or best friend.

I am a very very very picky eater.  There are only about ten foods that I like.  Eric made sure that my order was to my liking.

Thank you so much Eric.

Keep up the prossional and one on one friendly communications.


Eric definitely rocks!!!


Five stars plus!!!

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Brenda W.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
Always like Panera visits for consistency and quality. This was my first visit to this particular Panera and I was pleased. I was promptly greeted and waited on by pleasant staff. My order was very good, a pick 2 option of a Thai salad and mac n cheese with a 99 cent chocolate chip cookie fresh out of the oven thrown in.
All was good and it was a lot of food.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Lizzi P.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description: Horrible horrible horrible just ask them about the homeless guy sitting outside begging for food or money as you walked in and two employees told me he's always out there just ignore him I never heard of such and uncompassionate response from a company so sad you have all this food you're throwing away everyday how about walking outside and giving him a sandwich and asking him to step aside so that people are not assaulted bye is questions as you walk in

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Jason N.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
Placed an online order to be delivered,three blocks down from their location, at 1100am. Order delivered at 1215.

Ordered a Roast Beef Panini, yet received a Cuban Sandwich (which was pathetic looking even if I liked them). Called the store and spoke with the Manager Jennifer who said she would send the sandwich asap.

1:25pm rolls around and still no sandwich, my lunch break now long being over so I call and ask to speak to the manager. Jennifer answers and proceeds to tell me that they tried to deliver it but we didn't answer the phone when they called. I ask her for the number they dialed and she says ext 2882..... the ext is 2282. She tells us that it's our fault bc we provided her with the wrong info. I explain to her that they had the right # bc they called us the first time to say they were here the first time they delivered? So how did we give her the wrong number? Records show right number was provided and they screwed up.

I ask the Mgr to just refund the Sandwich, which she does..... unfortunately for me, it's been over 2hrs since we ordered and now I have no lunch and my break is over.

I would highly recommend steering clear of this location.
Dine at your own peril.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Sarah H.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
I've struggled a lot with the slowness of service and attitude of the workers here. Sometimes the line to make your order runs all the way to the entrance, and with only one register open it sometimes takes a really long time to place your order. Then, when you get to the register to place the order, the employee will give you attitude and impatience. However, I have been here several times and I know there are some friendly employees as well.
While this Panera does leave a lot to be desired with the service, it does have some positive aspects that brings me back to this location. I personally love that it doesn't really ever fill up so I can bring my work here and get things done. Also, there are always spots with outlets available, which is definitely a plus. 
Don't expect 5 star service when coming here and the food is pretty typical for any Panera, but this is a great place to come to get some work done or meet up with some friends to have a quick lunch.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Fiona F.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description: 2 stars because the bagel was not burnt. I have to knock off 3 stars because they only gave me 3/4 cup of caffe mocha, that's even after my whip cream melted. Clearly a disappointment. Be better panera.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Leslie T.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description: To be clear, this rating is specifically for the Panera on Centre Ave.  This place has consistently provided incredibly slow service, to the point that even though it's closer to where I work and live, I'd rather drive out of my way than dine here--the convenience isn't worth the poor food prep and increasingly unkempt dining area.  The steak and arugula sandwich is something I typically quite enjoy.  This version was thick with gloppy mayo (and not the usual horseradish tangy sauce) and had possibly 2 wilted leaves of arugula and zero of the pickled red onions.  And, then, to top things off, the area where customers are supposed to clear their plates was kinda gross.  The trash bin open and overflowing.  Tables weren't wiped down and the bathroom?  Eeewww.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Karen V.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
Panera is just an average place to get a bite to eat. But it is dependable. 

The good things:
- they brought the Asian chicken salad back (that salad gets a 5 star!)
- the sandwiches are really good
- their breads are delicious and fresh
The not so good things:
- the tables are often taken by people who bought something over an hour ago and just hang out for the Wi-Fi 
- their pastries are way, way too big and over glazed, I wish they would offer smaller portions a pastries that are not glazed with so much sugar

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Rachel S.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description: Best Pick 2 combo ever. Salad was made perfectly and Mac and cheese is always delicious.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Bethany B.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
They are really bad at getting any rapid order pickup correct. I almost barfed when they put sausage on my egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on Sunday- I'm a vegetarian.

In the past they're forgotten sides or only given a half sandwich when whole is order, but this experience was the nail in the coffin for my patronage.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Penny P.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
I have been to this Panera a few times before but ended up there twice in the last couple of weeks. Overall the food is the same quality you would expect from other franchise locations but the service was inconsistent. There is also a small parking lot. 

The first experience I had was terrible when it came to ordering. The cashier seemed untrained and there was only one other person in line but the employee seemed frustrated as though there were a major crowd. My order came out wrong and luckily the food prep staff quickly remade my food. 

The second time my cashier was able to correctly and quickly take my order. And my food came out as expected. I'm a fan of the you pick two and the seasonal strawberry poppyseed salad is great this time of year. 

The cleanliness of the tables both times wasn't the best despite a no more than half full restaurant. The location might need to spend a little more time cleaning off tables during peak hours. Overall I'll be back out of the convenience of this location only.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Jessica D.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
I've been to MANY Paneras - as I'm sure most people have.  I have been to this one a few times.  But today I am writing about a specific experience.

I placed an order yesterday over the phone for Panera Catering - a few dozen bagels, pastries, etc.  I spoke with Jayla (I could have spelled her name wrong) on the phone to place the order.  Jayla - was phenomenal. She worked the order out to even save us a couple bucks!  (every penny counts!)  We worked it out that I would pick it up at 7:30am.

This morning - I went in to pick it up at 7:30a.  The catering coordinator came, I paid, and then she was great enough to help me carry the order to my car.  I made sure to tell her how much I appreciated Jayla.  

I will go back to this panera - for personal and catering items.  I was in and out in under 5 minutes.  I know there will be times the wait will be longer - but that's ok.  Thank you for making my residents happy!

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Jason B.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
I travel a lot for work and go to many Panera locations.  This location just cannot get their employees on board to do the right thing....look at the other reviews.   I'm not sure I have ever had an order come out exactly how I ordered it.   I am tired of asking them to redo it or checking the bag before I leave with takeout.  How hard can it be to get it right??   

If you can....go somewhere else.  Panera is overpriced as it is but to not even get what you order is unacceptable.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Ctny C.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description: Very disappointing. There's not even a bite of chicken in chicken lentil quinoa bowl, and there is no side which is supposed to come with. Stay away.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Bebe B.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description: Oh I love Panera Bread! I'm having the Strawberry Chicken Salad!  Yum and the chicken dumpling soup! Their desserts are yummy and BIG! The prices are resonable and the portions big

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Max R.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
It's one of the most popular chains in the United States so I think it's fair to say we have all been to a Panera. This one is very unique a definite standout. 

They are very slow, the staff does not seemed trained. I ordered a bagel toasted with butter. There was no one else in line yet I was asked to repeat my order 4 times. The cashier had to re enter my order twice and than asked what kind of smoothie I was having again? 

I don't have very high standards for service at Panera but wow they were really off their game. It took about 5-7 minutes for them to toast a bagel, they than put it in a to go bag even though I was dining in. 

My girlfriend ordered a turkey sandwich plain with just lettuce and turkey. They served her a sandwich with just lettuce. Literally the sandwich was two pieces of bread and lettuce. They did correct the issue but what is going on here, cooperate should really invest in taking the time to train their employees.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Matthew U.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
After I had eaten here I went back through the other reviews for this location and I am glad that I am not alone when it comes to having a bad experience here.  And I can see why so many fellow Pittsburgh Yelpers really do not like this place.

I showed up here because I had some time to kill before I headed to work and I wasn't in the mood for fast food.  When I entered I was hit by a noise wall that was extremely loud.  So loud that when it came to ordering I was basically shouting my order to the employee behind the register.

After ordering I proceeded to the pick up area and just waited, I'd rather do that when I am dining alone.  Once the order was placed on the counter and my name was called I became disappointed.  When I was yelling my order to the register girl I had said that I wanted the pick two combo, half tomato mozzarella Panini and mac n cheese.  When I picked up my plate what I got was my Panini and half a ham and cheese.  o_O  Mac n cheese does not equal ham and cheese.  And I ended up with a piece of baguette even though I said I did not want it.  Who wants that much bread on one plate?  The only thing I got right in this order was the lemonade.  I didn't even argue because I know that I wouldn't have been heard anyway.

When I got to the table, or should I said crumb top table, I was disgusted.  I really didn't even want to eat my food.  I know you are busy, but have one of the twenty or so employees prepping food come out and wipe down the tables that are recently emptied.  In fact, I really didn't eat my food, I more like picked at it.  One bite of the Panini and I was done, especially when I came across a nut that I'm pretty sure didn't belong in there.

I attempted there sad interpretation of a bathroom and left feeling even more dirty that I had when I stepped in there.  If I want Panera, I'll head to a different location, never this one again.  It is obviously the worst in this city.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: David F.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description: Got the order completely wrong. Wrong sandwich and left onions when I explicitly said no unions. Will never go back there again

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Jasmine C.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description: The employees were very friendly and the service was quick. However, I ordered the chicken avocado melt full sandwich and once in the car I realized they only gave me a half sandwich. Also, the avocado in the sandwich was black and didn't look super fresh... Overall, the sandwich was pretty yummy and nicely flavored, but I was just unsatisfied with the quality.

0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.author: Mike B.
0dRqzEG9-2QNnvJtdpdDZw.description:
Stoped at this restaurant to get a chicken salad sandwich to go. I frequent Panera Bread when I am on the road as they are consistent in quality. What separates them is the staff. 

When I picked up my sandwich I placed the pager on the counter and stepped away with an ice tea in on hand and my sandwich bag in the other. The millennial behind the counter says, "the pager goes in the basket".  The pager is equidistant between us.  I hold up my hands to say, "my hands are full could you help?"  He just glanced at the basket. I put the sandwich down and tossed the pager in the basket. Customer service at this store has its limits.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Jennifer A.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: This the best place to eat downtown when your on a lunch break or even just a quick stop to eat. The bread that the subs are made with is the best. Even after toasting it still is nice and soft.  The toaster that they use melts the cheese nice and even for every bite. Their fresh cut fries are great too! It's quick service by a very nice and friendly staff.  If theirs ever any problems they are more then happy to fix it. I love the food and people!

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Arlene M.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
My husband and I stopped in here for a fast bite before attending a show. This place is somewhat on the lines of Subway only they specialize in sub sandwiches, wraps and salads. Prices are a bit on the high side but we decided to go with the wrap special. The wrap special includes your wrap, fries, and a soft drink from the automatic drink machine.

What is unusual is that you order at one end and pay at the other. The place wasn't especially crowded after we ordered the club wrap special. As a result we got our food fairly quickly.

The club wrap was okay-nothing to write home about. The fries were your average fries you'd get at any fast food chain. I did want water to drink and for once I was grateful that they gave me a descent size cup to get it in. Most places will give you a tiny cup.

Penn Station subs sits on Liberty Ave next to Arby's and is convenient for those wishing to grab the T station at Wood St or visit the stores and of course the cultural district. Parking garages are nearby and of course it sits directly on the bus route downtown so there is no trouble finding the place.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Jonathan H.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
It's dumb that they have one person take your order then you have to walk to the other side of the restaurant and pay with a different person.  What is this a drug deal or something?  Why can't the person who takes the order also take my money?  In the time it takes you to explain to each customer where to go, they could have just swiped a card and been done instead of giving them extras pointless steps to do to order.  Every other fast food place has you pay with the same person you order from, why do you think they are all wrong and you're right?

The food is fine tho, not as good as Uncle Sam's subs but not bad at all.

Here's a tip, if you download their app and make an account you can get a free 6 inch sub.  That's what I did.  And i'm very very happy with my meal for the $0.00 I paid.  If I had paid the normal $5.59, i'd be a little disappointed for a 6 inch sandwich.

The rugs all need vacuumed.

Still giving them a 4/5 because honestly it's a fine place, they didn't screw up my order, there was a little wait, but not too bad.  All my complaints above are pretty nit-picky and I'm just looking for something to complain about.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Lexi N.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
A coworker and I ended up checking out Penn Station Subs when we were looking for something besides our usual lunch spots. When I learned they had a pizza sub I was beyond thrilled because I can't think of any other place around work that offers that. It was something different so it was perfect.

The sub itself was good but not great. Certain bites didn't taste like they had much sauce if any at all. I tend to like my things a little more on the saucy side so that was a bit of a disappointment for me. My only other complaint is regarding the size and price of the subs. The prices seem like a bit much for a sub that doesn't have a whole lot going on. Other than that the taste was great and I would definitely go back at some point. However it won't end up being a regular spot for me.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Ashley W.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: My husband & I had a great experience at Penn Station subs on st Patrick's day. We stumbled upon this sandwich shop on our way to meet friends and decided to drop in for a quick bite to eat. We ordered a food long Italian with a medium order of fries and shared.  Both the sub & fries were made to order, hot and delicious. I love a hot Italian hoagie & fresh cut fries! It was plenty of food for the two of us. The location was clean, our food was made quick, and the staff was incredibly friendly. We will definitely return!

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Karla D.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: I'm a fan of this chain and this particular location is pretty ok. Service is usually really fast and efficient. The food is fresh and tasty. Nice to have as an option during lunch downtown.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Kyler W.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
The "Italian" is a sub that I will be back to eat again, and again! Word to the wise it is a pretty salty sandwich but I like salt so I was very happy with what I got. 

The fries were talked up so highly before I got here I was a little disappointed but I will be back to see if I came on an off day. 

The atmosphere is very casual and the staff was quick to make some suggestions to someone like myself who was visiting for the first time. 

Wait time was pretty reasonable. $$$$$ Price is were Penn Station falls short. The price compared to the other sub companies around town is significantly more for the amount of food received. 

I hope to revisit and update this review with to reflect the same thing everyone else is saying about the fries.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Jason A.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: I watched as the clerk took my sub and with her bare fingers placed a finger on top of the salad dressing dispenser and shook. When I complained that its unsanitary they looked at me like they couldn't grasp why. I explained that your fingers should be inside gloves before contacting a food source. Got a refund after waiting 12 min for a sub. Gross.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Mark H.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: Went here for lunch and was very disappointed.   Service was a bit surly.  There were no napkins.    Drink options were poor.  My sandwich was embarrassing.  I got a 10 inch Reuben, which is a $9 sandwich.   It had about 7 sad pieces of corned beef on it.   Maybe 2-3 ounces.    I should have just gone next door to Arby's.  I would have gotten more food for less money.   And it would have tasted better.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: T G.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: Apparently under new management and quality for food and employees professionalism has suffered greatly. Won't return.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Allison G.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: Customer service lacks ALOT to be desired!  Something in the food irritated my lips!!

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Elizabeth O.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: Waited 20 minutes for a cold tuna wrap that fell apart as soon as I opened the paper it was wrapped in. Such a mess and certainly not worth the wait. One of the women preparing the food wasn't wearing gloves. Yikes!

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Chelsea M.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
I live near the one in Shadyside & ordered a decent cheesesteak one time (although I added extra meat after reading reviews) 

Bobby & I headed to the downtown location maybe a week after it had opened. We had plans for dinner that day so decided on a cordon bleu to split & get our stomachs by a few hours.

We sit down & eat. After 3 awkward bites of bread, mayo & lettuce (ick), I open my half sub to find 4 measley pieces of chicken.. & not chicken strips.. just chopped chicken. oh yeah there were a few more (maybe 5 total) of pieces of ham the size of my brittle nonexistent fingernails.

So if you enjoy lettuce subs then you'll love it here for lunch.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Jay H.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
I came to Penn Station on a lunch date on a Monday afternoon. The dining room was quiet but there was Pandora playing on the TV so that gave the place a little more life. 

Ordered the classic Philly Cheese Steak sub with small fries. The sub was bigger than expected and was a great value for the price we paid (we split the sub). The cashiers were very nice, and the whole staff seemed to be in a good mood. 

I don't usually go out to chain restaurants, but this definitely fills a craving that comes up every once and a while. I do plan on returning in the future.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: J.r. G.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: Ate there tonight and didn't care much for it. Been here before but this will be it. The sandwich fell apart and was inconvenient to handle. Tonight they had the Pandora on the TV set to some rap station and the lyrics were highly inappropriate. I don't need to hear the N-word when waiting for my sandwich.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Sailesh P.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
Got their grilled veggie 6" sandwich. The taste was great. Compared to subway this sub had a lot more flavor and was hot, grilled and delicious.

Another place to go for a nice veggie sandwich. It is hard to find veggie options in most places  and even if you do, they are not delicious. This is an exception.

A must try if you are in the area.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Nick J.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description: Ok I read the reviews of Penn Station East Coast Subs and they weren't all that great. I was berated by some very close friends for wanting to try this place but every place deserves a fair shake. All told its not a bad sub. Plus the fries are fresh cut and pretty good as well. The staff was very friendly, tried to up sell me and delivered my meal with a smile. That's all you can ask for. :)

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Josh P.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
I got a 6 inch Italian and I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was very helpful and friendly, while the sandwich was grilled perfectly and the cheese and meat good quality and tasted excellent. I will say that this particular sandwich was just a little bit salty and a bit messy.

All in all, very good location if you need a quick cheap tasty lunch.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Colleen S.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
For the price, I expected to be blown away by their sandwiches. This place gets PACKED for lunch during the week, so don't go if you're short on time. 

I ordered a 6-inch, toasted  "Dagwood" create your own sandwich with turkey, cheese and veggies. The bread was ok, but I was not blown away by the overall sandwich. 

The fries looked delicious, but I couldn't handle that heavy of a meal for lunch or I would be asleep at my desk in no time. 

Next time, I'll probably save some money and go to Subway, where I'll get a footlong subpar sandwich, drink and chips for a cheaper price.

dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.author: Dan M.
dfVmClBit5Hd7u9_lFY1Lg.description:
This place was very disappointing to me. I've walked by it several times, thinking 'I need to try this place'. I got a 10" cheesesteak. It looked no where near how good it looked in the picture.

The length looked short, although I didn't have a tool to measure. There was a skimpy amount of meat. No lettuce or tomato. Mayo & mustard? I must not have heard that properly. For the price I paid I felt like I got the short end of the stick. Before I was done eating I was regretful that I didn't go to DiBellas instead.

My experience was so disappointing that I don't think a second chance would make a difference.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Rebecca M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
Really surprising experience here. First, place is JAM PACKED on the weekends (at least the parking lot) There were several vehicles waiting for a parking spot (including us).. must be good, right? I've ordered take out breakfast before but never have dined in. I'm glad I did!

The inside of the restaurant is giant - so if the parking lot is full, chances are there are still many seating options available. 

The menu selection is huge and includes anything from specialty hotcakes - to omelettes (and everything in between)

I ordered the blueberry waffles, and my dad ordered the breakfast crepes.. which were the most delicious thing I've ever had! Perfect combination of breakfast omelette food - and sweet and savory crepes. 5/5 Highly recommend that menu item!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Nick H.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Always great, especially for a chain restaurant. The menu is large, the portions are large, the seating is large... it's a lot of everything. Go hungry...you'll need help finishing some of these huge breakfast plates.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Kelly M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
My partner and I decided to visit the Original Pancake House for a late weekend breakfast. 

We were quoted 15 minutes and we waited about 10 for a table. 

We were greeted quickly and we both ordered a large orange juice. It was definitely fresh squeezed, and quite sweet!

We were given the breakfast menus but I had heard there were lunch menus. I am not a big breakfast person so I was looking for it. I didn't see it on the menu so I decided to stick to breakfast but after ordering I found that some nearby tables had one tucked in to the condiments. so they may offer lunch in the morning I am not sure.

My boyfriend of course ordered the famous Apple Pancake which we were told takes at least 30 minutes to prepare, which he was fine with. It is worth the wait people! It basically tasted like a huge (the size of a frisbee) apple cinnamon roll that with a gooey, syrupy, sometimes crunchy coating of pure caramelized sugar deliciousness. It is extremely rich & I would recommend sharing this with at least one other person, because it's huge & very very sweet.

I got the Italian omelette w/ a fruit cup. The omelette was just huge. The egg was fluffy, and the sliced hot sausage inside was soft and yummy, but the sauce tasted very bland and just thrown on top. I also didn't care for the sharp shredded cheese on top, I think mozzarella would fit better. Mostly, there was just way too much egg to get an even bite of everything. I wouldn't recommend this omelette.

The fruit cup was good with a nice selection of bananas, grapes, pineapple, and cantaloupe. 

Our waitress was very friendly but when it's packed, it does take a while to get a refill of water, our food, etc.; service is so-so. They need to hire more people.

Also, it is a bit expensive for breakfast but they seem to cook everything to order and make many things from scratch. I would categorize this as more of a special occasion than a 'hey let's go get breakfast' kinda place.

I might be back if my boyfriend makes me, but I wouldn't choose it for myself.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Lynn E.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
Normally I enjoy this place. But not this morning.
The server brought out our drinks and as soon as I took a drink of juice, the bottom of the glass fell right out of my drink and there was glass and juice all over the table, my lap, my boots and the floor. 

The waitress, after being called several times finally came over to see what happened. She went and got one cloth. Really one cloth???  Then someone came out from the kitchen with a tray and a couple more clothes which barely did anything. 

They started picking up the glass saying that this happens a lot when they put cold liquids into the hot glasses.  Why, if they know this, does it happen at all????  There are training issues that need addressed. 

I expected a manager to come over, but when that didn't happen we walked to the front door and asked for the manager. She came over and said she was going to come to our table, but she had apparently more pressing matters to take care of so she was planning to stop by after that. 

Customers getting covered with glass is not very important here!?!?

My clothes were soaked. Coat, boots, even underwear was wet!!!  The manager didn't seem to care at all and barely offered an apology.  I would of expected that they offer breakfast at least and at most cover my cleaning bill. But she was unconcerned and defensive. Not a way to run a restaurant. Very poor management. 

We will not be back.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Kevin P.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: This place was pan-tastic (Sorry was trying to be punny)! Anyway, this place exceeded my wife's and I's expectations and the prices were not bad. We were greeted by a nice young gentleman, then seated promptly. In a matter of minutes we had a waitress asking what we would like to drink. Of course, we both ordered the vanilla coffee and it was surprisingly very tasty. We then placed our order (*drum roll*).... my wife ordered the chocolate pancakes (large one) that came with 6 nice size one and whip cream. She ended up taking 2 of them home. I got the smore pancakes with eggs and bacon, which I regretted almost immediately since the portions were a nice size haha. The bacon was crispy, eggs (scrambled) were flavorful, and the s'mores pancakes were drizzled with chocolate syrup, powdered sugar, graham crackers, and marshmallows. Upon leaving I requested a wheelchair due to the amount of food I ate (not really).  Will definitely be back!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Ed M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Tasty food, good service. Reliable place! Had 2 meals here. Seems the pancakes are top notch and was impressed by bacon and Canadian bacon. Coffee are huge

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Henry N.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Just plain old pedestrian breakfast food at Cadillac prices. Not somewhere I would eat again. Have gotten better food for less elsewhere.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: T S.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Just waited for 45 minutes for our simple order of pancakes and an omelette with no substitutes, with two children at the table, watching tables around us arrive after and served before. Asked multiple times what the delay was.Our waitress did not even apologize. She sent the manager over after we finally received our food for a lame apology and offered us more coffee, at which point my children at near starvation actually laughed--we'd had so much coffee on empty stomachs my husband and I were bordering on ill. No offer for reduced price, just 'that was unacceptable the kitchen made you wait that long.' Food was then cold and overly processed --Highly suggest you avoid, we will not return.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Mariah M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: I would say that the food was good but nothing special. The menu is really extensive with a lot of pancake, crepe, French toast, and waffle options from the griddle. If you're in the mood for savory food, they also have a lot of options with eggs, omelets, and the whole 9 yards for breakfast. They also have a lunch menu, but I didn't look at that. The service was really not that great, but it wasn't the worst I've had either. I would probably go back though!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Bill T.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
Do you like pancakes? Then this place is for you.   Went at 10:00 am on a Saturday morning and the place was packed but only had a short wait.

I had choco chip pancakes (short stack) with a side of bacon.  They go crazy with the whipped cream, which is a good thing.  Bacon was nice and crisp and the portion was generous.  Our server was very nice.

Table was clean and the place looks tidy overall.   Definitely a great place for breakfast.  

Decor is weird, though.  It doesn't look like a pancake house.  I am just wondering if the building was previously a German restaurant or steakhouse.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Sara B.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
Unfortunately we will no longer be going to the Pancake House. This morning we went for breakfast. My husband wanted to order a few things a la Carte as they didn't have exactly what he wanted. Our section was about half full and it was not super busy. The waitress charged us for 3 meals rather than 1 meal and the a la Carte items. We pointed out the math to her and she said she'd be right back. She never came back. She waited on other tables and ignored us. 20 minutes later when she came back she handed us a new check. Or what we thought was a corrected check. 

When we got to the register, it was the exactly same check (after she told us she would adjust it). At the register we asked to speak to the manager and we waited for another 20 minutes but no manager appeared. We had spent enough time waiting at the Pancake House.  We were tired of waiting and ended up paying and leaving. At that point, we just wanted to go home. Customer service seems like a very low priority. We were really disappointed with this experience.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Joe G.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Not bad, but nothing special. The omelets had a weird aftertaste. Not a place I would seek out again.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Sean G.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Best Eggs Benedict in the area (the hollandaise sauce is what makes it great)! I also love their pancakes. They have a slightly different taste that makes them delicious.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Rick D.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: I specifically came here because Waitlist said there was no wait for a table. Arrived to find out they weren't using any electronic list.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Jeff M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Where did you get this bacon? I've never had bacon this good. Thick, meaty but very crisp. And the orange juice must be squeezed minutes before it comes. The bacon and juice alone are worth coming. I'm serious.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Krista B.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
We go here sometimes when we don't feel like going far. The food is ALWAYS good and there is enough of it to make you full.
This time around, we had a coupon to use so we made use out of it. We got two nice filling entrees for a quick meal. I got a spinach omelette with three pancakes and my husband got an egg entree with three pancakes. We will be back !!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Pooja G.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
Yummy pancakes.. friendly staff.. great service. 
Go for it if you love pancakes. We went there on a Saturday morning place was busy but we got seats after 10 minutes of wait.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Linda M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Been frequent breakfast diners here since place opened and usually use their coupon which comes in an email and must be printed. Last visit manager said she could not accept coupon since it did not have the name of the restaurant on it! Couple behind in line had the same coupon. The coupon is not that great a deal since you must purchase a beverage to get 20% off. She did eventually accept it but not a pleasant experience.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Oren S.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Although the food continues to be generally excellent, today's visit, Sunday, 17 February 2019, was somewhat disappointing. Parking was difficult to find in the inadequate lot as is often the case. My party of three waited 30 minutes to be seated and then 30 minutes for our food to arrive: not desirable with a 9-year-old boy who wants his pancakes.  Our server told us that the kitchen was backed up.  We were all disappointed to learn that the restaurant no longer serves the french fries that we love.  Our server is a seasoned worker, but there is always a mistake when she handles our orders.  Today it was the wrong potato being brought.  Additionally, our dishes came out at different times and there was no quality check.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Jan M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
Our group planned on Denny's which was closed for renovating, so we ate at OPH instead. Our group of 3 was seated as soon as we walked in around 9:30 on a Sunday morning, in the back area. Our server was friendly, she seemed young, and unfortunately couldn't answer our question about the type of filling in the blintzes. She also forgot to bring extra silverware, straws, and coffee creamer after running back and forth a few times to get our drink orders.

The 4 slices of thick cut bacon could've used a bit more cooking to be crispy, sunny side eggs were cooked nicely, and the stack of pumpkin pancakes were a bit on the thin side. The strawberry blintz was about the size of a good burrito, my daughter couldn't tell if the filling was cream cheese based, or not. She did like it, but not enough to eat the whole blintz. Our fellow diner, had ordered 2 of the crepes, but only got one in his order. So he wasn't too happy about that oversight. 

My impression is that this is a nice place to try, but nothing I'd plan on making it a regular spot. Extra training for service would help a lot, and the parking lot could use some extra space as well.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Amanda B.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Definitely go here if you love pancakes! They have some great combinations, and the portions are enormous. I'm not huge on breakfast sweets but I still very much enjoyed my Swedish pancakes, and I thought it was cool to try something different besides your typical chocolate chip or blueberry hotcakes. We were in and out of there pretty quickly, but we did go late on a weekday morning so I'm not sure what the wait is like during peak hours. I really enjoyed their coffee as well, and the restaurant was cozy and I imagine would be perfect on a chilly winter morning for breakfast.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Ralph H.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
Man the pancake dishes they have here are incredible. For me personally though I prefer good Ole delicious pancakes without all the fancy stuff piled on top. I've worked hard on my figure and I plan on keeping it. Wait, I should eat all the gooey stuff on top then. 
The meats are tasty as is the coffee. Plenty of sides to add onto your meal such as grits, bacon, sausage or hash. 
The place is huge inside and pretty but it comes with a price. PH is expensive.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Jessica T.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: We stumbled on this restaurant when we were planning on going to Dennys. Going to the pancake house was the best decision we made that day. We've been back a few times since and we'll be back!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Patrick P.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
My friends and family enjoy TOPH very much.   

They offer many options on pancakes (my guests ordered the buttermilk and chocolate variety).    

I am a sucker for their omelettes.   You can go large (6 egg!) if you want.   I kept it small - the size of a chipotle burrito with some home fries.

 Great Service / Great food / Good Price.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Joy C.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
I forgot how good The Original Pancake House is. Their breakfast is so delicious! My favorite is the strawberry pancakes which comes with fresh strawberries, whipped cream and house made strawberry syrup. Their omelettes are very good as well. Their portions are huge and prices are good. 
Definitely worth eating @ Pancake House.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Shan S.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: I always get the strawberry pancakes because they are excellent. I love their food and it's one of the only places i actually enjoy their eggs. I will continue to come back. Customer service is good too.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Chris M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
To all gluten free people..... 
There is GLUTEN IN THEIR SAUSAGE PATTIES But not the turkey sausage links.  They make PATTIES themselves and add flour to it so it doesn't burn when cooked. 

Their Maple syrup is considered to be gluten contaminated. But they say their flavored syrups are gf And they have a no sugar syrup they can give u. It has some chemicals in it that we normally avoid (like carmel and sorbate and artificial flavors etc.) so we bring our own syrup. 

We came the first time and we told the waitress that my young boys have issues with gluten. 
She told us nothing we ordered had gluten (eggs, sausage, gf pancakes, syrup butter) and we had issues. Ugh. Second time the different waitress was educated enough to inform us. 

Aside from that the food is amazing and the food portion is huge. Avoid on Sunday's after church bc this place is Jam packed with a relatively small parking lot (sadly due to Scott township laws about not excavating hills)

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Natasha L.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: On our way out since the nearest Pamelas was closed due the Labor Day Holiday we drove here. I ordered the kielbasa and pancake platter and it was really good. The coffee was terrible though, and the waiter had add as we had to keep repeating what we wanted.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Davidcia G.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: I've been here a handful of times over the span of a few years. They have a huge breakfast menu, and also a lunch menu. The lunch menu is mostly sandwiches and wraps. I love the decor inside and everyone is always friendly. The location is behind Denny's all the way up on the hill.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Cole B.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: This place is amazing! The bacon was crispy the pancakes were good, honestly the experience is great! I would recommend the Dutch baby, it is an interesting bowl shaped pancake with thicker dough that has lemon, powdered sugar, and butter on the side that can be placed on it. It has such a good taste I would most definitely recommend it!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Mark M.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Hair in my food 2 x in a row! The owner felt obligated still charge us even though hair was in 2 x and I sat there for 45 minutes waiting while everyone else was done! Customer Service is a complete joke!!!!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Fritz J.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Unmatched experience for customer service and flavor. Seriously above any other pancake spot in Pittsburgh

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Bob S.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Food is generally good breakfast food. Service runs very hot and cold. Hostess is not effective. Dull normal. If their service improved, would be a great breakfast place.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Linda D.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Gluten free options here! You feel welcome with a food allergy, not like a nuisance.  Delicious!!!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Mickey S.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: This pre-Christmas breakfast was perfect. Spinach omelette was cooked perfectly sausage gravy crapes were so delicious with hashbrowns. The basic egg and sausage links were cooked to perfection. The waffle was absolutely divine. Crisp on the outside and nice and tender inside. Top with Lingonberries it was Scrumptious. It was our first time there and the atmosphere was so warm and cozy and it was so clean which is very important to me. Very nice get together with family with no clean up after LOL. The only negative appeared to be the basics of serving water, silverware, cream as we had to ask for everything

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Dawn T.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Wow.  Just called in for takeout.   Their response:  "we are too busy. Not taking call ins today. Sorry".    How about you staff accordingly?   What a way to ruin Father's Day jackasses.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Serena T.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description:
Met up with a few out of town friends for brunch at this spot and was pleased with the food.  When we got there there was a 20 minute wait, but we may have waited less than 10 minutes before being seated.

I ordered scrambled eggs and sausage patties and a side order of pancakes (be aware that side orders come with 3 pancakes...I would have been content with 1!).  I only had one of the pancakes because that's way too much food for me but I will say the pancake was delish.  

I can't say the same for my husband's blueberry waffles.  Rather than have the blueberries cooked in the waffle batter they were thrown atop of  a waffle.  While this may not have been a problem if the blueberries were fresh (they weren't, they were frozen) or in the least bit sweet (they weren't and barely edible) my husband took off all the blueberries and ate them without it.  I get that it's not blueberry season so there may be an issue with getting fresh blueberries, but tossing inedible (still cold/partially frozen) blueberries on to an otherwise decent waffle makes it worse.  

I would suggest sticking with their pancakes or getting a plain waffle.  The eggs and sausage are good, but not sure how those can be messed up!.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: LouCindy A.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Simply elegant for a pancake house. The place sits atop a hill and is decorated and maintained beautifully. We love the original pancake house and it is unfortunate there isn't one closer than 2 hours from our home. While we were in Pittsburgh we were lucky enough to find this place close to where we stayed. The food, coffee and decor are great!  The freshly squeezed OJ is fantastic, from what I was able to enjoy.  My one year old Isabella decided she liked it too and frank most of it. :-) This place will not disappoint. This gem in Pittsburgh is simply great! It's a must!  Enjoy!!

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Jason E.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: Hands down the best breakfast I've had in years. There is a big commitment to quality here. I'll probably be dreaming about the bacon later. Nice thick cut and delicious. I highly recommend you try them out.

QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.author: Julia J.
QqGMtc24VdCzYAajw1g4bA.description: The building itself seems to be renovated from an old house, awesome atmosphere. The staff was friendly and our waiter was great! Food was outstanding, we got the blueberry pancakes and an apple cinnamon waffle. Both were light and fluffy, nothing was too sweet. Both dishes featured real fruit; the pancakes came with extra blueberry sauce and the waffle with warm apple syrup. Portions are generous without being overbearing, at least for the short stack. The best part though, real maple syrup!

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Michael Y.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
Not sure why this place has such a bad rap.

Food is solid here---I'd say unless you want a cold sandwich basically everything else is better than Subway. You also usually get more meat, toppings, and flavor with these sandwiches. 

The $5 sandwiches are a great deal when they come by, so look out for those.

I just wish they would open a little later so I could grab some late night bites here...

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Tiffany Y.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: I ate at this location of Quiznos for a second time. I give my Italian sub a rating of 4 stars, but my husband did not enjoy the taste of his prime rib sub. The staff was polite. Several tables were available to sit at.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Chris S.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
Cmu employee here.

Not the quizno's experience I've been used to anywhere else, and not in a good way.

Food is not prepared as specified, employees are unprofessional...

I probably won't go back, but I love Quiznos, especially since they're hard to find nowadays.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Hun N.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
Good place to eat. Better than subway.

If you find a place three star in Craig, you should start thinking to visit it. There not much place to visit near craig st. Dont go 2 star.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Peter C.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
So normally great food and service unless apparently you go in their "off hours." Tried to get my yoozh at 3 in the afternoon and the servers just ignored me until I left. Who knew? 
  24 May 2019 - again with the lack of service during expected hours. Stood waiting for someone to ask my order with no quarry - finally left. Sad state of affairs .

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Misty C.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: Last week was the first time my husband and I been to Quiznos in years. Because this is the only one still around and we live like a half hour away. I'm so glad that the owner decided to keep this store open. The food still has a great taste.  Today I brought my mother with me to get some hoagies. The ladies were so pleasant and the food was great. My mom was so glad I took her there. That was the 1st in a long time that she was really pleased with the service and the taste of the tuna melt. I had an Italian. Great! We can't wait to go back.  Thanks for having a professional staff, It makes a difference

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Karla D.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: Another chain review. But I chose to do this one to give a shout out to the employees at this location. They are so nice every single time I'm in there. I do a lot of special ordering with their sandwiches ie add this, take that off and so on. The sandwiches  come as ordered and with patience because sometimes I'm a tough customer. Thanks, gang!

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Rob K.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: Food is always decent. The staff here is beyond unprofessional. Yesterday we stood at the counter waiting to order while the guy behind the counter was bs'ing with his friends. And a loud homeless guy asking people for money. As we sat down, we saw the friends all getting free food and drinks. And loudly swearing amongst each other. If you can't afford a better staff, I'll never go back.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Ryan K.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: The sandwich wasn't bad, but I've been in there a couple of times and when the manager is not there, the staff acts like animals. Yelling at each other, swearing, giving people free food. It's just such an unprofessional atmosphere and uncomfortable. Hire better employees, because they all suck!

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Alex C.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: Employees here yelled at each other the entire time.  Creating can unprofessional and unenjoyable environment.  Food as always was good.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Jack M.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: Pretty average sub shop though doesn't add too much to the Craig St food scene, which is average at best but caters perfectly to the college crowd. Standard sub options all around to be found, they divide up the menu by meats, specialties, sides, and the like. Sizes here are either 4, 8, or foot-long in terms of how big sandwiches come. I will say that customer service here is pretty stellar, but the star rating is reflective of food quality, which I will say isn't so bad that it's not edible, but it's also not anything to rave about either. All in all right in the middle in terms of food quality. Good for a quick stop or bite if you don't have the time to wait for takeout at surrounding nearby restaurants.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Brian J.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: Used to be great, but the past 3 times I've picked up subs there they have been smashed to the point where the bread is soggy and torn, and veggies are falling off.  It's hard to eat these subs because they are smashed so bad they fall apart.  The owner should tell the Wreck-It Ralph at the finishing station to ease up on the smash.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Chris H.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
So, generally, I don't go to Quiznos because I just don't think it's that good. (Disclaimer: I'm a pescatarian so I have limited options. I assume that some of the dishes with meat are at least decent). I've visited Quiznos recently due to multiple coupons being offered.

I always get the same veggie sandwich and although it was made just as I asked, it's just not that good. I don't entirely know what it is, but even Subway sandwiches just seem to taste better. The avocado was my favorite part, but the pretzel bread was a close second. The sandwich itself isn't *bad*, and I always eat the entire thing (which says something), but at the end of every meal I'm always wondering why I chose to go to Quiznos again. 

This specific Quiznos actually has pretty good service. They're generally friendly, prompt, and make my sandwiches right. 

If you actually enjoy Quiznos, this is probably the location for you.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Kyle T.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
This Quiznos is similar to most others and is well maintained.

The reason I am writing this review however is to applaud the staff that work here.  I think this is probably the only fast food place I've ever been to where the staff are friendly, make your food quickly and correctly, and seem to actually care about your presence.  I've even been offered discounts by the gentlemen at the register a few times without even knowing that my meal qualified for them.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Rahul I.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: As a CMU student, I go to this quiznos a lot. The employees are always super nice. Always come for the happy hour deal in the evening. Much better than the subway nearby. Pesto Chicken Cesar is consistently superb.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Ronald W.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
Good Quiznos location. Takes national coupons unlike the Pitt location.

Fast courteous service. Had the lobster and seafood sub yesterday for dinner. Great value for the money and really tasty.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Diane X.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: Not a guy into fast foods but the lobster series is good actually. Recommend. Haven't tried other stuff yet.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Alyssa D.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
Good, fast food.

I stop here every so often when I'm walking on Craig for an inexpensive, but filling meal. Go for the sub combos, easily the best deal on the menu and make sure you ask them to toast it!

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Melanie Z.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description: Gah, I am officially done with Craig St. sandwich places. Stopped in for a quick sandwich en route to school, and requested that my sandwich be made without cheese. Lady calls it out (correctly, without cheese), then the sandwich (which she made) proceeds to come through the toaster with cheese on it. The girl wrapping sandwiches points this out, and the lady ignores her. I ask her if she can take the cheese off of it, and she says that this one won't be mine and that they'll remake it (yay! or so I thought...). The lady making the sandwiches disagrees and tells her to just scrape it off. The girl obliges her, without making any eye contact with me, and I am told to pay for my sandwich without apology from anyone. At the point at which I'm paying $6 for a tiny sandwich, I expect some courtesy and straightforwardness along with it.

uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.author: Kevin K.
uqNCIsAUgH0YxIXq5BWYTA.description:
Let me start off by saying I've been to this Quiznos over 20 times, and that's a conservative estimate.  Last year they had probably a 25% failure to make the right sandwich rate.  But they have Improved this year to about 10% though.  It can be a good place to eat if you follow a couple guidelines.  First off,  never tell them what you don't want on sandwich.  Even though the ingredients are clearly listed behind them they will look at you like your speaking another language.  Tell them " I want an x with just the y and z".   Next,  don't tell them what veggies you want before theyve cooked it.  They will forget it or look at you weird.  It's kind of a hassle because you have to keep track of your sub through the cooking process but that's just the way they do it.  Follow those rules if you wanna have a good meal.

Also if the manager is reading this yelp review like any good manager should then Know this:  every single time anyone orders a sub at your quiznos they are asked if they want it for here to go twice? Is the first one just for fun?  That's a lack of communication that reflects poorly on every single customer that comes through.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Kathleen A.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description:
(Delayed review from Restaurant Week) Had a great experience at Garbarinos! I loved their sustainable efforts of using a pasta straw instead of plastic. Started with the asparagus, then got the Paccheri Amatriciana for my main. Don't be scared by the spice indication, I didn't think it too spicy at all! Everything was flavorful and worth trying. I enjoyed the Paccheri but would probably order a different dish next time. They have another restaurant (The Twisted Frenchman) on the second floor that I'm interested in trying as well. Parking is available on the street and depending on the time of day, it is either free or paid. 

I would return for the cocktails and food in the future!

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Jeffrey D.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description:
East Liberty is brimming w restaurants, many new and many I have not tried. This was special occasion and looking for a different venue we went to Garbarinos. First off the entry is poorly designed. It wasn't designed. There was no thought concept idea awareness prior past experience knowledge of what happens when entering a restaurant be it IHOP or Au Pied de Chochon. There needs to be a host station where someone can greet guests. It needs to be somewhere visible. There needs to be a place where people can gather while this is going happening. Not outside of the restaurant in the vestibule immediately at the bottom of the stairs shared w the restaurant on the second floor. And no one working inside can see that there are four, six, eight people sheepishly waiting there at the unstaffed podium unless they walk out there to check. Huh. I have been in many busy successful places where the host station is crammed and jammed and annoying. I have been in many where you wonder if someone really works there. But this is the first one where I wondered is this possibly the place. After some time some one from the arriving party would come in, go up to the bar just inside and ask to be seated. That's what we did. Either someone showed up to help or the bar staff would make a call. Ok I've beaten thIs. 

The interior is big and open and attractive. This part was designed. Everyone once seated seemed content and enjoying themselves. 

The menu is good and the food was ok. A competent packaged Little Italy experience. Could support a bit more zest and depth as far as taste. Portions are very generous and it seems the take-a-way is part of the schtick.

The staff were also good and helpful. Not necessarily in sync but certainly striving to make things work even if no one seemed to be actually in charge and running the place. 

It's new give it time.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Joshua B.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description:
Again I wish I could give half stars as this restaurant would get 3.5.  We went to celebrate and ordered a lot of food to share.

First off, happy hour is not worth it.  The happy hour cocktails are ok, and the HH apps are just a few dollars cheaper than menu price.  We decided to order the more enticing apps of the full menu then the hh menu.

The cocktails we had that were seasonal, were very tasty, whereas the HH cocktails tasted mostly of champagne (not a problem, but in comparison we were let down).

For our appetizers we got meatballs, fried artichoke hearts, and the Brussels sprouts.   The winner of the three was definitely the sprouts.  I have never had such tasty sprouts before.  Crispy with a touch of sweetness from honey - delish, we finished the huge plate and thought about ordering more.  The meatballs were light and yummy, though there are better meatballs in Pittsburgh, and the artichoke hearts were a bit basic.  Battered and deep fried with marinara sauce on the side - I would expect to see this more in a bar/pub setting and was a bit let down.

The four of us shared the following entrees: Chicken Parmesan, Eggplant Parmesan, the Gnocci, and the Bolognese.  The hands down winner (and the reason I gave it 4 stars over 3) was the gnocci.  It tasted of delicious roasted red pepper, and was (i think) lightly deep fried.  This gave the gnocci a slighlty crunchy texture on the outside, followed by the smooth, velvet cloud that you get from a stellar gnocci.  I would return for this dish.  The chicken parm and bolognese were good, but didn't stand out in the same way.  Standard, good, but not amazing.  The eggplant parm was also good, though as a fair warning, it is more like a casserole or lasagna than what most people expect with eggplant parm.

The venue is a bit big for the number of tables/space.  It didn't feel warm or homey and the ceilings are super high.  The bar is really cool to look at and the kitchen is behind windows which I tend to love (though it wasn't so busy on a Thursday night to take full advantage of)

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Lisa K.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description:
We are going to Italy this week, so I was hungry for Italian. I had been meaning to try Garbarinos since dining at the Twisted Frenchman upstairs this summer.

Garbarinos has a casual vibe, but it's menu is anything but bar food. I would like to say that we tried several dishes, but they had posted a new risotto that day with roasted brussel sprouts and squash, and we were all too tempted by that to try anything else. We did have an aperol spritz before dinner, and would highly recommend it. The risotto did not disappoint, and was big enough that I took a third home with me for the next day's lunch.

For dessert we had limoncello gelato (me) and cannoli (the others).  My gelato was perfect, but the cannoli was a little disappointing to the others at my table.

I would give this three and one-half stars based on the service. Our server seemed to have an attitude that was off-putting, strolling over to our table with his hands in his pocket, cutting me off when I was asking a question, etc. I'm usually pretty forgiving in this regard, but his attitude detracted from the experience.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Debbie T.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: Simply the best! We had 2 appetizers, the calamari and the brussel sprouts, and they were both phenomenal. They also serve bread with a small skillet of butter and garlic which was delicious. The rigatoni & ragu was also amazing. In addition to the great food, the service was perfect. Everyone was attentive and friendly. We're in town visiting our son and now I'm looking for the next opportunity to visit so we can eat here again.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Lexy M.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: I can't add much more that hasn't already been said. It's delicious and fun! The desserts are really great as well.I love the look of the place and the service was great both visits. Everything is really fresh and they pay attention to detail while plating dishes. It tastes as good as it looks. I'm an arancini snob and loved it. Fried cheese is great too with good thick sauce.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Amanda N.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description:
We tried Garbarino's for Pittsburgh Restaurant Week and were not disappointed! Everything we had was delicious. The restaurant week value was good, though I didn't notice the regular menu prices to comment on value of the normal options. I thought the drinks were slightly expensive, although everything was good. We thoroughly enjoyed everything we had to eat and drink. 

Our server was very personable and was happy to make recommendations if asked. The decor was a nice cross of rustic and industrial. My only complaint was noise volume. During prime dinner hour on a Friday, it was extremely loud. There was also a large party next to us, which may have contributed to the noise, as well. 

Overall, we loved the food and atmosphere and will definitely be back outside of Restaurant Week.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Lauren B.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: It's nice to see another Italian restaurant in the area.  The atmosphere is cozy, spacious and well lit. I went there for dinner and we shared the caprese salad and meatballs as appetizers which were on the happy hour specials. For dinner we both had one of the specials of the day which was a Puttanesca pasta.  All of the food was excellent and all ingredients were very fresh and of high quality.  The heirloom tomatoes on the burrata caprese salad were beautifully colored and so flavorful and the meatballs were delicious, just like my Italian grandmother used to make.  The puttanesca pasta was very flavorful and the noodles tasted homemade.  My only issue with the pasta was at one point I bit into a large red pepper which left my mouth burning for a few minutes.  Normally I like spicy food, but it was a bit unexpected since this was not a spicy dish, so watch out for those if you don't like spice! They also served the meal with warm bread and a skillet of warm olive oil with roasted garlic cloves, which was a nice touch (and fresh bread should be a requirement at any Italian restaurant!). One surprising thing that was lacking was fresh shaved parmesan cheese, which I would have expected at an Italian fine dining establishment.  When we asked for Parmesan with our pasta, they brought out a shaker of parmesan cheese like you see at a casual pizza joint. The other reason I docked a star was the service was a bit lacking. Although the servers were attentive they weren't very friendly and didn't go out of their way. For example, I had a question about an ingredient in one of the cocktails. She said she didn't know the answer and just stood there waiting for me to decide rather than asking the bartender who was nearby. I asked her to come back in a few minutes so I could find the answer myself.  Then later when I ordered a glass of wine they brought the wrong wine.  I didn't say anything since it wasn't a big deal, but these details make a difference.  But overall it was a good experience and I would go there again. The portions are generous and of high quality and it is a good value for the price.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Jessi S.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: We had great food and great service at Garbarinos tonight. Would highly recommend the caprese salad, chicken piccata and short rib rigatoni ragu!

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: David J.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: Garbarinos is another limited menu Italian restaurant, like so many of the new restaurants. It's twist on the concept is home style food, which it delivers. The dining room is attractive and, amazingly, there is convenient parking near by. The menu is short, with a few salads, pasta dishes, and several entree choices. We had an excellent caprese salad, and eggplant parmigiana and pasta in vodka sauce with meatballs. We liked the food, which met expectations, but except for the salad, nothing was outstanding. The wine situation is a little confusing. The website list is the same as the Twisted Frenchman's, all French and $$$$. I therefore planned to bring my own until I called and found out that there is a $$ Italian wine list. The wine choices were pretty good. Service from the bartender was excellent because the restaurant was not very busy (not a good sign!). Prices are quite reasonable and the cocktails were very good. We will return.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Steve B.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: Great place to eat. They had gluten free pasta which was why we decided to go there and we were glad we did

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Alex D.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description:
Five stars tonight - with a little room to improve.

Food was exceptional, as expected from our experiences at Bar Frenchman (the previous iteration of this space) and the always amazing Twisted Frenchman upstairs over the past several years. Chef Drew is absolutely able to deliver delicious Italian meals with all the skill and creativity I've known him for in this change in concept. His family's experience with running an Italian restaurant in NJ definitely shows!

So, the space has changed very little - it's still trendy with an incredible bar and wine cellar. The kitchen is still well outfitted, and now sports a pasta extruder, which produces the most delicious fresh pasta I've had anywhere - more on that later. The noise level is probably the only negative for me - I had issues with it when we came to this space, and was happy to learn from the Chef that they have plans for acoustic tiles and baffles to help decrease ambient noise so diners can enjoy their conversations more. The music was good, and not overly loud - it was a nice background for the meal without getting in the way.

We were warmly greeted upon arrival, and seated immediately. Our server, an extremely friendly young lady who also dances for the Pittsburgh Ballet Theater, was very attentive to all of our requests during the evening and made sure we were able to enjoy ourselves.
