Overall, the pace was a little slower than I'd prefer, but I learned that it was a result of a temporary staff shortage and the recent and significant increase in popularity of the restaurant, which is just about the best reason for things to run a little slow. They are aware of this, and also are working to make this better. All of the staff were working very hard, and were skilled in their actions.

Now, for the menu - it's a little long for my taste, but since I'm not running a restaurant, I won't be overly critical. We had a big party with diverse tastes and dietary restrictions and the expansive menu gave us great options. The cavatelli with rapini and Italian sausage was delicious, as was my fusilli with shrimp, mussels, and scallops. The scallops were enormous and perfectly cooked (as was the rest of the dish). I cannot praise the quality and taste of the pasta enough - in most places, the flavor of pasta barely registers. Here, it has a certain freshness which can only come from being made with excellent ingredients that don't sit around for long periods of time. The tomato sauce that accompanied my dish was super bright and not the heavy acidic sauce that plagues most Italian eateries. They even had high quality garlic that had been sliced with a mandoline dispersed throughout the plate - a nice inclusion. The only thing that would have made my dish even more delicious would have been to have freshly ground pepper and freshly grated Parmeggiano Reggiano offered / applied to the plates at the table side by the serving staff. This should be a simple addition to make for service if they agree with my statement. I didn't feel that the dishes were lacking, just that the experience could have been heightened by this small addition.

Chef Drew continues to make the rounds and enjoys meeting his diners, always sharing insights and listening to them. It's a wonderful personal touch, that is definitely noticed. It would be easy to hide out in the kitchens upstairs and downstairs, but he adds this practice to his skill set as a dedicated professional, and seems to have a genuine interest in those who frequent his establishments.

Bravo! We definitely look forward to our next visit, and know that this wonderful restaurant will be well worth the trip across the river, even when we have another two Italian places close by - this place beats them hands down. Thank you, and we wish the crew at Garbarino's (and of course the Twisted Frenchman) every success as they continue with their passion.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Carolyn F.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: After coming to Garbarinos for restaurant week, we had a lovely experience. The waitress was very attentive and the food was great. Especially my main meal. Excited to come back and bring friends and family from out of town.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Chelsea D.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: The food was delicious and the service was great. Highly recommend. The beans and greens were my favorite.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Peter H.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description:
After a few excellent experiences at The Twisted Frenchman over the past few years, I was excited to give Chef Garbarino's new Italian joint a try (especially as a fellow native Long Islander who grew up on great neighborhood Italian food).  Bottom line, a very good and relaxing meal that could use a few tweaks but I think has a very promising future.

The hostess had our reservation and got us right to a very nice booth. Started with cocktails, and both my wife's Aperol spritz and my Woodford Reserve Rye old fashioned were spot-on. We decided to start with a share of the grilled asparagus and the fried calamari. For main courses, I ordered the grilled veal chop (not the parmesan version--a little confusing in the menu), and my wife ordered the eggplant parmesan with a side of rigatoni marinara (off menu, but more to follow on that).

Goods/Greats:
- Again, cocktails were outstanding, as was the glass of Barbera I had at our server's recommendation with my veal dish.
- The calamari was excellent. Cooked perfectly with a feather-light breading. All rings to the delight of my wife (I love the tentacles, but I know I'm in the minority). Both the marinara and chili aioli sauces were really good, and it was fun to alternate between the two.
- Grilled asparagus was easily the best I've ever had. Perfect cook, amazing grilled flavor. Roasted red peppers were delicious. We had some with our appetizers, kept them on the table with our entrees, and even brought some home for leftovers. Fantastic each and every time.
- Veal chop entree of all things was a vegetable party. Perfectly grilled green beans as well as very good, lightly dressed arugula. Veal chop itself was a big, fresh, and very good piece of meat.
- Eggplant parmesan was very tasty (and oddly, even better the next day as leftovers), but the simple pasta side of rigatoni marinara was absolutely delicious. The house marinara is so perfect I wish I could buy jars of it.
- Service was overall very good.
- Leftover packaging was fantastic. They even take the time to label what's in every container. Never seen this before and we loved it!

Others:
- Bread came out with small skillet of roasted garlic in pool of melted butter.  I thought it was heavenly--I could drink melted butter with a straw and eat roasted garlic with a spoon, but it was a major turn-off to my wife. The option of some normal butter and/or some herbed olive oil and vinegar would be nice, as I'm sure lots of people don't like dripping butter.
- When asked to describe the eggplant parmesan dish, the best our server could do is "well, it's just eggplant parmesan." I'd argue it a little different than most restaurants as it's just an individual casserole. Don't get me wrong--it was very good--but I'm glad we could get a side of pasta at a small upcharge. Their chicken parmesan comes with pasta, so why not the eggplant?
- I overall enjoyed the veal chop dish, but frankly it was just too busy and could really stand some editing. Besides the previously mentioned veggies, it had a heap of crab meat with olives and pesto hollandaise on top. Every individual component was delicious, but it was just too much stuff. I was looking forward to a perfectly grilled veal chop with some great accompaniments, but ultimately the chop got a little overwhelmed by the toppings. Sear on the veal could have been just a bit better, too.

In summary, lovely space, delicious food and great add to the neighborhood, and we're definitely looking forward to coming back. A tiny bit of refinement and it's well on its way to being a five-star destination.

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Laurie H.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: What a gem! How lucky we are to have this authentic Italian food right in our neighborhood. Our meals were WOW tonight. Delicious bolognese sauce and meatballs like my grandmother used to make, to die for tomato cream sauce and some of the best Eggplant Parmesan we have ever eaten. And that is saying a lot from someone who is a foodie and grew up Italian!

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: David P.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: We had researched Garbarinos for a birthday dinner, and they definitely delivered. Their asparagus, bolognese, and cavatelli were extremely tasty. We topped my girlfriend's birthday dinner off with some delicious tiramisu (and the drinks were great as well).

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Lynn R.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description:
I would have rated five stars- the food is very good and I like the ambiance. Here's my "beef": I went with a friend who had been there before and she said when she had ordered a Manhattan on the rocks, it was priced $2 higher than the menu price. 
So we asked our waitress, who clearly couldn't really explain it - she stated that with the ice, bartender does an extra pour. Do, why wasn't it just priced that way instead of looking like the place was charging for ice. And she stated " all restaurants do this". Well, three of us who were together are well/ traveled and dine in many different restaurants and none of us ever experienced this. I mentioned that and she actually said ( I'm 67) " that younger people are used to this". For Heavens sake - just up the price of the cocktail and train your wait staff how to. communicate!!  And despite the fact that she was a good server, when she presented the check, she stood at the table waiting for our cards and then stood at the table again while we signed- totally intrusive.  
There are now a number of restaurants with equally good food in Pittsburgh.  Garbarinos is almost there if they can be more customer centric

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Lauren S.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: Came here for restaurant week. Server Monique was fantastic -- very attentive and personable. The butter and garlic served for the table is a really nice touch. I loved being able to dip my bread. We started with the arancini and beans and greens. Both really tasty! The beans and greens was very creamy and flavorful. The sausage was mild, which I prefer. The arancini were crispy and filled with decadent cheese. For our meals we had the rigatoni with meatballs and rigatoni and ragu. Their marinara is very tasty and the ragu was creamy made with short ribs and mushrooms. Dessert was tiramisu and cannoli. The tiramisu was out of this world!! Overall a wonderful experience and we will be back

Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.author: Alex M.
Egwnk84ioGxzx6BsJmWkrw.description: Literally, the best Italian food I have had in this city, and I'm full blooded Italian. We ordered the grilled asparagus for an appetizer which was incredible and then chicken piccata and a seafood dish for our entrees and they were fresh, flavorful and filling. It's a super nice atmosphere and is very relaxed. The owner was actually serving food that night and mingling with guests! Would HIGHLY recommend that you add this restaurant to your list!

CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.author: Tom J.
CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.description:
Fantastic food and
Excellent service. This is a gem In Forest AHills.
Called at 5 PM for pick up at 5:30. They told me no problem and they would cook it just before I was ready to come at 5:30 so it will be fresh. Food was excellent. My only suggestion is they start delivery so we all can enjoy his excellent cuisine 
Very much I suggest you call and order now..

CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.author: Nelson B.
CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.description: There really aren't that many places to go to or get food in he Forest Hills Area but this is a nice place to get take out from. They recently opened and deliver. The pizzas are good and their Mediterranean food is worth getting. I got a veggie pizza and the Baba Gannouj which was amazing! It was creamy and had roasted garlic in it.

CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.author: Gina L.
CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.description: I live right up the street from this place and I've been waiting patiently for them to open. I ordered a falafel salad and an order of hummus and it was well worth it. They give you a good amount of hummus for a regular order and will have left over for days!

CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.author: Matt A.
CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.description:
So, I found this place tonight. I love Mediterranean food and like to try new places all the time. Most places I dont review because it's just so so at best.

If you like Mediterranean food or you want to try it, this place is the real deal.... and in Forest Hills! 

The baba Ganouj was delicious, probably best I ever had. Good olive oil sprinkled on top. tabouli was super fresh and spiced just right. Falafel were perfect. Hot and crisp on outside with soft delicious center. The tahini yogurt sauce was excellent. They said everything is made fresh... and now I know they weren't just saying that.

To top it off, the owners are a sweet couple who are so friendly. I feel like they are my new friends.

I literally cant wait to go back !

CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.author: Alison S.
CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.description: Forest Hills really needed an option like this! My husband and I stopped in on a whim and ordered shish tawook and hummus. It was delicious! The man who cooked our order even came out and asked us if we wanted turnips on our pitas. When we weren't sure, we brought us out some to try while we waited! They were delicious! And it sounds like they must marinate them in house. Everything was super fresh, as we watched him make it! Please patronize so Forest Hills can have more local, interesting cuisine made by good people!

CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.author: Jp H.
CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.description: The man behind the counter (who I assume is the owner) was very friendly. I've had the kebab rolled and the falafel appetizer. Both were very good. Make sure you ask for the hot sauce and tahini on the side. Will be coming back often.

CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.author: Mary K.
CHceWQu2mGXkYzt4s7TaQA.description: This is such a wonderful addition to the community of Forest Hills.  No more traveling to Squirrel Hill for Mediterranean food. Yeah!!  The food is absolutely delicious!  Tabouli is terrific!   Owners are even better than terrific. Very kind and helpful and really want you to be happy with your meals.    Love this place

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Michelle M.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Haven't everything on the menu but the pizza is great. They have a great kid's night with a balloon artist which is great keeps the little ones amused! It was a bit bumpy at the door to get sat but for all I know maybe the hostess was new. The servers were attentive. They have a great brunch!

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Rebecca M.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Terrible dining experience. I've been here for both brunch, and dinner in the past month. I didn't review brunch because I thought it was a fluke; however after having dinner here this weekend I am sure to say that this place has some work to do.

My food the other night was awful. I ordered a Greek wrap, and asked for very light cheese. Instead I got a Greek wrap with TONS of cheese & hardly any vegetables. It was more like a lettuce wrap. 

When I asked for more veggies, I was brought a cup of lettuce, tomatoes, and black olives... 

Ordered a second glass of wine. When our server brought our a glass that looked like a taste sample I was confused. He told me it was the bottom of the bottle, and they were all out. He then told me that it would be 1/2 price, if you could see the look on my face....

I asked him to bring me another type of wine, and that I shouldn't have to pay for a splash of wine. Of course when the check came it was still listed, and then had to be removed. 

This is the busiest restaurant in Beverly Rd Shops and I'm not sure why. Would be open to coming back for a pizza but that's about it.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Derek P.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
First of all at my place of work, there aren't many places to eat. 

In comes the food trucks....Thank you! Bado's food truck stopped by and have to say, one of the best food trucks in town. With the pizza ovens firing along with the grill running the smell of pizza and cheese steaks wafted into our complex.

I went out with a couple work buddies and we each had the cheese steak. Have to say the $10 combo meal of the cheese steak, which was loaded with steak, mushrooms, and onions, along with chips and a drink was well worth it and phenomenal tasting. 

Everything came out ready in under 5 minutes and was piping hot. 

Will recommend this food truck and grille whenever they come around.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Cindy S.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Horrendous service. Rotten lettuce in the salad. Waitress needs to change her career path!

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Valerie W.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
I ordered Bado's while on my trip to Pittsburgh, and it was the best pizza I've ever had!

I ordered the Meatball gourmet pizza and it was FANTASTIC! Definitely recommend to give it a try!

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Matt P.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Pizza was extremely disappointing, not what it used to be. Dough had an inconsistent roll, way too thin on half of the pie, no sauce and very little cheese. Also had a sandwich calzone that was terrible. The whole bottom of the calzone was completely soaked in grease and a disgusting soggy almost raw dough mess. I will not be wasting my time fighting to find a parking spot to come back to this place.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Jennifer G.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Bado's is the kind of place you go when you don't feel like cooking and just want to have a relaxed, casual meal with your family. Unfortunately, tonight we didn't experience anything close to that. To be fair they were busy. It was a Friday so that was to be expected. Our waitress did say that the kitchen was a little backed up but we were in no rush.

We ordered right away.

We sat, we waited. We kept our 8 year old entertained with games of would you rather and 20 questions. Finally our waitress returned with my entree. Just mine. She said the other food would be out soon. I tried to wait to eat but as my food got cold everyone insisted I eat. So I ate slowly hoping their food would come. It didn't. 

I finished and we sat debating if we should just go home and boil some pasta and call it a night. Finally, nearly 90 minutes after ordering our food it arrived...and was subpar. My daughter's meatball was undercooked, the sauce was bland and my husbands hot pastrami sandwich had a nice cold slice of provolone on it. In 90 minutes you would think the cheese would have at least been melted...

I get it, people get busy, things go wrong in the kitchen. But in a case like tonight the restaurant should have at the very least bought us a round of drinks. We will not be back.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Danielle L.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Was at a pizza cook off at Grist House and decided to try Bados.  They had their new food truck their and I was stoked!

They had 6-7 personal pizza options... when I'm trying a new pizza I like to go with a classic and went with the pepperoni.  The wait was a little longer than I liked, but Grist was packed and I was hungry! 

Pizza came out and could easily be shared with 2 people.  It was covered in really tasty thin pepperoni, a healthy amount of cheese and good quality tomato sauce.  The crust is thinner, solid crisp, very good.  

4 stars because to me this is not THE BEST pizza in the burgh, but still very good! They could also work on wait times :)

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Jamie L.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: We tried this the other night and the food was good! Lots of beer options, some wine, and specialty cocktail list. I had their holiday sangria and it was really good! They have daily specials and a typical pizza place menu. There were lots of options. I would definitely go again.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Arlene M.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Stopped in here for lunch. Place is relatively dark inside but staff warm, friendly and helpful. I learned that if you come during the week for lunch they have a pizza and salad/soup bar for less than $7.00. The only type of pizza on the bar is cheese and pepperoni.

I decided to order a thin crust veggie pizza in the smallest size they had. I got my food fairly quickly. Normally you pay by the topping(s) but some come premade up which is what I got. I did learn that if I could not finish it then would wrap it up for me.

The pizza was okay. Nothing overly spectacular about it and I was amazed at the fact I was able to finish it. Probably since I had ordered a thin crust it wasn't quite as filling as I would have thought it to be. I did enjoy the vegetable toppings since they are my favorite.

My ice tea seemed a bit strong but it came with lemon and I was okay with it. They have a huge bar on one side along with TV sets.

They have other items on the menu but pizza is their specialty. Located in the heart of the Beverly business district in Mt Lebanon pay metered parking is available outside or in the lot behind the row of buildings on this side of Beverly Blvd.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Briana B.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
If I'm going to be totally honest, I saw reviews for this place last week on Yelp and a picture of their meatball pizza and simply had to have it. I came here around noon on the weekend but they were only serving brunch and I was initially disappointed. However, after sharing with the server that we came for pizza, she asked the kitchen if they would make it and they agreed to. Such great service and that was really appreciated! 

The pizza was everything I hoped it would be. The crust was fluffy, the sauce savory, and the meatballs were fantastic. The ricotta cheese went perfectly with the meatballs and the banana peppers were the cherry on top. I'll be back for more.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Jennifer B.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: If there's anyone that loves pizza in any form or shape it's me.  I love them all deep dish, thin crust, ny style, grilled, wood fired - you name it - I love it.  It's always been my weakness - I can't resist it.  That is until we got pizza from here.  This is a first for me - usually if I don't particularly love it I can doctor it up somehow with additional seasonings or crisp up the crust somehow to make it edible.  Unfortunately there was no help here. I thought it might've been the style we got but we had two different kinds NY style and Sicilian style - both were terrible and inedible.  The crust on both had no flavor and seemed like it wasn't cooked through. And the sauce tasted like what you get from an elementary school cafeteria and I can't finger it but it was either too sweet or possible slightly rotten.  I have never thrown pizza away till now and it made me incredibly sad.  Wings were not that great either.  I hate to leave a bad review but was sorely disappointed.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Leah V.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Ordered take out and was told it would take 30-40 min. It's been an hour and currently still waiting... I don't mind if I wait at home for my food, at least tell me the right time to come get the food instead of waiting. 

Update: after waiting a little over an hour for the food my pizza was cold.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Bruce Y.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Don't try to order delivery unless you want to wait two hours to only have someone hang up on you when you call to ask about it. Plenty of other options.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Andrew G.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Love it love it love it , Came here on my vacation.. Drove from Southern California to Pittsburgh.. Glad I came here to eat pizza .. the best I have ever tried .. and there calzones where just as good ..
When I come back again to Pittsburgh will definitely do a trip to come back here .. 10 out of 10

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Brad H.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Really like this place because of their diverse menu.  You can get their pizza, but they also have a lot of other options to choose from.  Two of my favorite non-pizza items here are the buffalo chicken hoagie and the reuben.  The reuben is one of the best in the area.  

The pizza here is one of my favorites.  I go with the traditional crust.  It is thicker than places like Fioris or IVP, but the dough is fresh and cooked perfectly.  All of the ingredients they use seem to be high-quality and it makes for a great pizza.

Great place to come for lunch or dinner.  Also, their Tuesday buffet is a great bargain.  Make sure to show up early though because it gets packed.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Ashley W.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
My husband & I are Bados regulars. The very first time we ate there, we had a terrible experience.  We decided to give it another chance whenever we moved right up the road, and I'm glad we did. We get takeout at least twice a month, and sometimes eat in too. They have a nice breakfast menu. Recently, they had a special that was egg nog French toast, and it was really good.
Typically, we get lunch or dinner. I absolutely love their vodka sauce. I usually get the pene vodka add Italian sausage and it never disappoints. One thing they could work on is getting some real garlic bread. They use hoagie buns to make "garlic toast" and it's not very good and always over toasted.  Not sure why they don't use regular Italian bread. The hot Italian hoagie is pretty good, and my husband loves their pizza. Their house Italian dressing is delicious and the anti pasta salad is a great deal. I always get two meals out of it. Bados service is decent and they have a nice deck upstairs for out door eating whenever the weather is nice. If you're on beverly, give it a try.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Everett M.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Amazing chewy crust (I asked, the friendly bartender said the secret is it's actually a bread recipe), sweeter plum tomato sauce, chill local staff, WALL of drafts in chalk because they change up, pizza and beer happy hour 3:30-5:30. Tuesday night balloon guy and all you can eat pizza buffet $7 6-8pm. Nice modest music volume and atmosphere during Happy Hour, can get busy during rushes and metered parking lot costs (but not hard to find a space, meters take nickels, quarters, and credit cards). Also an upstairs party room and outdoor deck depending on weather.

Definitely recommend the Margherita pizza, with the buffalo mozzarella and fragrant fresh basil. Tonight I'm enjoying their signature Leopold Square Pizza with the amazing dough, lightly applied but flavorful marinara, sweet sautéed onions play great with the optional salty Anchovies to kick it up a notch (I get the fishies on the side because my wife doesn't like them, and Bado's accommodates). Seriously crave worthy pizza! I want to try the cannoli and Oreo waffle sundae sometime, but I always eat more pizza than I need and feel full, haha!

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: James K.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
This review is for the food truck they have, It was out front the science center where they were ripping off the family crowd. 

This might be the worst pizza I've ever had, and I'm being nice, considering it came from a truck.

Sauce was waaaay too seasoned with some dry parsley and other crap.....and the crust.....man that crust....I had to drive Fiori's and eat a slice just for therapeutic reasons. I didn't know pizza crust could be so flavorless and texturally unappealing.

I seriously didn't know pizza could be this bad AND EXPENSIVE, and rightout front the Science center where they know people have no other choice cause the cafè is closed. 

Gauging from this truck, I will avoid that restaurant like the IRS.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Antonio C.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Ugh, I hate this place with a passion. The food looks and tastes excellent I just don't understand why the kitchen (s) are ALWAYS so dirty?

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Stephanie P.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Hey I just met you 
And this is crazy 
But here's my number 
So call me maybe...

Obsessed. The pizza was incredible and unlike anything I've had in the Burgh. Fresh, homemade, pillow like crust to dunk in unlimited, on your table ranch, to your heart's desire. This place is the real deal. God bless America and Bado's -- I can't wait to see you again.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Rodger S.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
I was hungry for a Reuben & The Burgh seemed to me like the town that could make a great one. How right I was! 

Bado's makes one that's absolutely everything you could hope for in a Reuben. A huge pile of corned beef & bread toasted perfectly brown.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Troy B.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: I am a fan of all-you-can-eat lunchtime pizza buffets, and I visited Bado's today to try their buffet.  I found it to be adequate.  The price, at $6.95, is fair for what you get, but unlike some of my other favorite lunchtime pizza buffets, this one does not include the drink, so that is extra.  It does come with a soup or salad included in the price, and I chose the Wedding Soup, and unfortunately, I was not enamored by the soup at all.  It didn't have much taste, and even after adding salt, pepper, and grated cheese, it still wasn't very flavorful.  As for the pizzas, they had three choices, Pepperoni, Plain, and Supreme.  I thought the pizzas were just O.K.  I am not a big fan of pepperoni, so I personally found the choices a little limited, since two out of three had pepperoni on them.  I did try a slice of each, and they were fine, but the taste to me was just average.  I was hoping that they might bring out a different style of pizza once the first pies cleared off, but they only brought out another pepperoni while I was there.   Overall, it was a decent lunch buffet, but in my opinion, there are better ones in the area.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Casey K.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
We recently hosted an event at Bado's for our family. 

I was able to easily speak with the event coordinator and set up the details of our event when I called. I customized the menu a bit due to some food allergies and called in two weeks ahead of time to confirm our count for our "adult pizza party" off of the banquet menu.

When we arrived, we were able to set up early and get ready for the event. Everyone was able to fit comfortably in the space and since the private room is upstairs, you also have access to the outdoor deck area. The room was clean and well laid out. There were also 2 TVs, a private bar, and the outdoor deck.

For food we had a mix of veggies and various dips, sandwich ring, and pizza. The pizza was probably the biggest party pizza I'd ever seen and was a big hit with guests. Included in the pizza party per person pricing were also three beers that were on tap.

The one weird thing was that at the end of the party there was some leftover food (i.e. about a quarter of a pizza); so as I was paying the bill I of course asked for it to be boxed up. Before this there was no indication that it was "catering" style and that any leftover food was to be left in the restaurant. I was told that the food could not be boxed due to house rules. I didn't understand since I had literally just paid for all of the food, but wasn't able to take it with me. It also wasn't explained well when I asked about it. In general it made me feel like they were being super sticklers and honestly ruined my excitement about telling others about the good parts of our experience.

For what the party was, it was a great room to host an event, but there are definitely some oddities that need worked out.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Jamie K.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: I went to Bado's with some friends on a Sunday for brunch. We had a fairly large group, but they were able to seat us quickly which is always a plus in my book. They have a great beer selection, and the brunch menu had something for everyone! I got the chicken and waffles, it was huge so I probably should have shared it, but I didn't want to. I was very happy with my choice, and everyone else loved their food too. The lunch and dinner menu definitely has something for everyone too. The atmosphere and service was great - perfect for a chill hang with friends!

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Nick L.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Was the pizza even cooked? Wow!! Severely disappointed , heard it was great pizza. Dear lord!!!

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Craig P.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Night didn't start off too bad. Had a drink at the bar while we waited for our table. The bar tenders there are always very nice and accommodating. Once seated at a table is when the night went south. Our waiter seemed pretty disinterested in being at work as he moaned and groaned during introduction. I ordered the 'Famous' fish sandwich and my wife ordered a Cajun burger. Well the 'Famous' in my food title must stand for famously bad. It was the worst piece of fish I have ever had...it was flat as a pancake...no flaky white fish to be seen.  I'd equate it to eating a sponge full of grease. The only taste out of it was from whatever other food shared the grease bath. Maybe I could have disguised the taste with the condiments I asked for but the disinterested fellow I mentioned before didn't bring them until asked and the sandwich was half done. As for my wife's burger...the taste was good but it was way over cooked since she ordered medium and the burger was well done. I'd return for a drink if ever passing by, but can honestly say I'd never come back for a meal there. Too bad because it's a nice little neighborhood to visit.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Phyllis L.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Insalata pizza is awesome. Meatball sandwich and appetizer are delicious. We always get delivery and never late or delivered cold. 
Highly recommend

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Crystel P.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
I've been to Bado's a few times now mainly to try there nice selection of craft beers but this time I actually tried there pizza for lunch! Me and a friend ordered an eight cut Florentine Pizza pizza with out diced tomatoes and it was delicious. Only thing that was disappointing is our pizza was suppose to have Sicilian crust and it came out with regular instead. We ended up keeping the pizza but they did offer to replace it but due to time constraints we could t wait. 
Overall the pizza was excellent I would like to see how it tasted with the actual Sicilian crust

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Ralph H.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Good pizza, good food and even better beer. Plenty of tvs to watch your favorite game. The bar area is good sized and they're usually packed so you'll probably have a wait. 
The parking is always very difficult to find a spot and is paid meter parking.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Grace K.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: I visited Bado's for the first time and found them extremely accomodating.  I'm a vegetarian and needed my Reuben made with portabella mushrooms instead of meat.  They we're happy to do this and IT WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!  Going back ASAP.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Kelly M.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Casual, rustic pizza house with a bar attached. Check their website for daily specials - pizza buffet, all you can eat spaghetti, lasagna night, etc., all at extremely affordable prices!

I visited this establishment on a Tuesday and had the pizza buffet- the buffet has standard pizzas (pepperoni, cheese, supreme, and then a specialty pie, for example a margherita pizza). The buffet was small but had pizza to suit anyone's food personality! It also comes with a small house salad, and their dressings come in large bottles that they leave at the table; I got ranch dressing with my salad (which tasted homemade and delicious) and I was glad that they left the bottle so my boyfriend and I could dip our pizza crusts in a little big of the dressing! 

Also, on the buffet night, they had a balloon artist who makes flowers, headbands, or swords for the kids, a really nice touch. The kids at he tables surrounding us were all giggly and happy when the man was delivering their balloon gifts!

Also, it is worth noting that the bar area is separated from the restaurant section almost completely with a wall; so no need to worry that you and your family will not be able to enjoy each other's company or feel uncomfortable with little ones in the bar. Just ask for a booth by the window in the restaurant area and you will be farthest from the bar and you will be able to feel comfortable with your little ones.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Matt M.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: This place has really gone downhill.  The lack of service today was probably the worst out of all the times I've been to Bado's.  Came in with a party of three and waited 20 minutes and still no one came to our table...not even drinks!  I get it if you have a packed house but there were seven tables and 3 people working there.  We ended up leaving and still no one said anything.  Extremely disappointed.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Megan Z.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Last time trying Bado's. Ordered takeout. Rude customer service order. Restroom at restaurant still like a wild western with swinging doors that do not lock and do not have a purse hook. And very rude bartender to pickup/pay for order which included burnt meatball calzone.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Melissa G.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Bado's is a family favorite for us. We moved into the neighborhood 8 years ago and they've been our go-to for awesome pizza since the day we moved in. The dough is yeasty and obviously house made. The sauce is perfect, with the tiniest bit of heat, but not any sweetness like some places. They use quality cheeses and toppings. 

My *only* gripe is that sometimes the cutting of our pizza seems to have been done by someone with a very dull cutting blade, which is a small pain in the butt. 

We have had their sandwiches, salads and other items too and they're all good. The pizza is where it's at though.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Carley K.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Got the Bianco white pizza 8 slice. Huge pieces could definitely share with three people maybe even four. Huge chunks of artichoke, generous helping of fets, and nice chewy crust. Must get!

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Mt K.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: Great breakfast!  New low carb items yummy.  Eggs with choice of veggies and cheese.  No guilt and delicious.  Watched my daughter eat the Belgium waffle with chocolate chips-finished quickly.  Still a little jealous-lol

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Brandon H.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description: So literally as I'm writing this review my wife and I are sitting here waiting to be waited on.  We were greeted at the door and seated.  Fast forward 20 minutes and nobody has stopped by for anything.  Once I finish typing this we're leaving.  I'd stay and complain, but don't feel like eating a pizza with spit as a topping.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Patricia L.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Stopped at East End Brewery, saw the Bado's truck parked there, spouse ordered a pastrami Reuben......OMG, seriously the best Reuben ever.
We just might have to venture over the river and through the tunnel to get to Bado's to sample their menu.

B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.author: Linda M.
B5hl4fV8ZmwN2bLDgdr0Fw.description:
Tried their Sunday brunch. Menu was quite extensive, a lot to choose from and prices were reasonable. However, french toast was not good, mushy and not at all flavorful.
Waitress seemed to know several customers as she spent a lot of time standing at their tables talking while we were waiting.
Sadly, although this place is very convenient, we will not be back for breakfast.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Hannah G.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description:
Surprisingly good. The chipotle of pizza. Great when you want a fast, personal sized, reasonably priced pizza. Much better than just buying dominos or Pizza Hut. It's also fun to make your own. If you have kids they would probably really enjoy this. Nice staff who were very friendly and made good conversation. Cool interior. Would definitely come back. 

Recommendation: don't get the pesto topping, my friend had it and got really sick possibly bc It sits out all day and goes on after it's baked.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Allen W.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description:
After leaving The Flats after an impromptu night out drinking I headed home feeling defeated while everyone else was scavenging the various local spots for food I just knew that there would be no where to grab some vegan options.  

That was until I seen Lotsa. The first time I had LOTSA it was at the Oakland location.  I'll just be honestly I was fairly disappointed , but after a while with some adjustments to my order I found the perfect order for me.  This was all pre-vegan by the way. 

Any-who tonight the pizza was absolutely delicious. Thought it was slightly busy with a line to the door because the rest of drunk folks looking for a quick bite to eat this was not a hassle for the staff. The staff handle the lines with grace, patience, and speed. I was able to get in and out. 

The vegan cheese I would give a 4/5.  


While it was pretty loud in here as you could imagine it's still a good place for you to hang out late with friends and chill.  I gave the restaurant overall 4/5 because let's be honest it isn't most spectacular pizza but it gets the job done.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Spencer S.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description:
Walking along Carson Street when I started craving pizza. Lotsa was right across the street and the 'Now Open' sign was too much to pass up! 

Not terribly busy when we entered and the establishment was clean too. Couple TVs on the walls to watch sports also. 

My wife and I shared a pizza which was very good! The ingredients looked to be freshly prepared. Definitely worth the $8.99 price tag. 

Only complaints were that it took a while to place our order since there was only one person frantically manning the oven, taking orders, making pizza and working the register at the time. And then while the employee made our pizza they reached into their back pocket to check an incoming phone call and then used the same gloved hand to grab out some roasted garlic... I'm sure they just weren't thinking about it.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Susan A.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: So I tried this place tonight on Uber eats and I must say the cheese bread sticks are delicious. The make your own pizza is a little too burnt for my taste. I do love the fresh basil and the olive oil they used for sauce.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Phil B.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Pizza is lousy and clean up in front of your place of business. Just picked up four pizza boxes with pizza still in them from Saturday night. Great neighbor.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Brian S.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Tiara deserves all the praise in the world. She was busting her butt handling every single order, both online and dine-in, by herself. Great pizza, but they need to get her help on Saturday mornings (11-2) to cut down the wait time!

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Jay N.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Lotsa is a nice break from the usual pizza you find in the South Side. The stone fire oven gives your pizza a unique flavor and crunch and is guaranteed fresh each time you order. While you can make your own pizza, they offer a variety of speciality pizzas as well. The combinations are endless. While the personal pizzas are a little on the pricier side, there is more than enough for one meal and couple slices left over for later. The business was a little hard to find due to the fact they don't have a formal sign in place but once inside, the clean and simple restaurant shows off some local photography and graffiti-like writing on the wall. If you're looking for pizza in South Side, and tired of the traditional, greasy pie you find, you might consider checking this place out!

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Kathleen F.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Not sure how this place has received so many positive reviews. Ordered the gluten free pizza. It was soft and doughy with almost no crunch. Also, the pizza was cold when it arrived. Not a fan.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Caitlin M.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Recently moved to the Southside and have to say I was pleasantly surprised with this pizza place!  You can make your own or choose from their speciality creations.  My husband and I ordered one classic margherita pizza and one buffalo chicken.  The margherita was my favorite!  The buffalo chicken was just as good but definitely more on the filling side.  What I loved about the margherita pizza was that it was the flavor, it was nice and light and cooked to perfection!  We waited about 10 minutes or less for both pizzas to be cooked!  Will definitely go back for a quick bite and good quality pizza.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Jim H.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Brand new and open for Pi Day. This is a fast food pizza place,like an Italian Chipotle. You select a standard pizza or select from the fresh ingredients and a few minutes later you have a hot pizza. For the first day, everything seems to be running smoothly. The Pizza is good and a reasonable size. The staff is friendly and seems efficient. The weather is beautiful for March and the windows are open to Carson St. I don't believe there is any beer or liquor but soda and water is available. Try it out.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Doug L.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Detroit Style at it's finest! Sooooooo frigging good! Quick, fresh, and friendly. Super tasty as well. Definitely would recommend.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Sean O.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Ordered the Carnivore and Bianca, both came out fast and were evenly cooked and delicious. Will return soon, good pizza and fast friendly service.

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Ryan D.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: I loved the pizza. Their sweet sauce is perfect. I want to try other things, but I'm not sure I can go and not get the sweet sauce!

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Mark M.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: I'm always hesitant to order from a place with only a few reviews but I'm glad that I did!  As of this writing there are currently 4 excellent reviews.  The pizza was better than I've had in a long time and the breadsticks were the best I've eaten.  Fast delivery and very reasonable price for amazing food!

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Alison H.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Ordered Lotsa at 10pm with door dash to my house on the slopes. It came faster than estimated and was really good. Got the meat lovers and the pepperoni plus cheesy sticks, the meat lovers was obviously better than just pepperoni and the cheesy sticks were surprisingly good! Lotsa cheese! The wood fire was tasty and would definitely recommend to friends!

4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.author: Deb H.
4MyZEzAuoh8oXPzCEhw_FA.description: Great tasting pizza!  Crust is perfect and sweet sauce is awesome!  Would definitely recommend

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Johnny M.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
Note: This review is solely based on the food, as I used DoorDash.

What. A. Great. Breakfast.

Zero complaints. I had the Meatlovers omelet AND the hungryman special. Needless to say, I had breakfast for the next day too. For example, I ordered Ham for like $2 extra on the side. They have me THREE good sized slices. Awesome. Bacon? Like 7 slices! They were very giving and you couldn't have asked for better bang for your buck. Thank you for helping my vacation go great!

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Natalie B.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
This has been a neighborhood favorite for years. For some reason it's taken me forever to try it out. 

It's a very cute restaurant but SMALL and there's nowhere to wait. It was packed but I expected as much since it was a Sunday after church. 

Service was beyond friendly, I never waited for a drink refill and they checked in frequently. Atmosphere was very homey. 

I got the loaded home fries with jalapeños, bacon, and mushrooms. The portion was huge and so delicious. The cheese got a little hard but that's probably because I was going more talking than eating. 

I can't wait to come back!

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Katie C.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
First time trying this place today ! 
Food was very delicious and very inexpensive. 
I got a delicious chicken sandwich and fries.
On the other hand our waiter was terrible. 
I also ordered a chili that I never got that I was billed for, and never got any refills on my drink. 

All and all food was good ! Waiter was terrible. 

Probably will try again just for breakfast next time !

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Kat V.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
All of our food was very good, the prices were great, and the service was also really good. We definitely have to go back, since we went at dinner time. 

The only down side of this cafe is that they didn't seem to serve breakfast all day - we were not given breakfast menus. Oddly, when I looked after the fact, I see no times on their breakfast menu (their dinner menu does have a time on it), so perhaps we COULD have gotten breakfast if we'd only thought to ask. I figured they gave us all the menus we were able to order from at the time, but perhaps that's not the case. I'll have to call to check... A friend told me their PB&J French toast is amazing. I MUST try this. We'll definitely go back sometime for breakfast!

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Lindsey H.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: This is a great spot for breakfast on the weekend! I came for breakfast Saturday morning and was seated quickly! The server was friendly and did check in. I ordered the Greek omelet with home fries and toast-so good! There was a good selection of different omelets and other breakfast options. The only cons were that I was served a cup of cold coffee and had to ask for a water 3 times.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: A G.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: Found this place randomly online and decided to give it a try. Food was amazing and service was great! A cute little place.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Arlene M.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
It has been a long time since I dined here. It was formerly known as Andrea's restaurant. Came here for breakfast. Waitress is warm, friendly, and very attentive to my needs. I decided to go with the veggie omelet which comes with your choice of a wide variety of toasts and home fries. I went with the rye toast and believe me it did not disappoint. 

Got my food in record time and was amazed at the size of the veggies in this 3 egg omelet. It was so good! I loved the home fries and could only finish half of the bread. They also have smaller portions if you wish as well as pancakes. For $1.00 upcharge you can have your eggs made with egg substitute. They even have a low carb breakfast if you are watching carbs.

This place is reasonably priced and you can get a descent meal for under $10.00. That's the way I like it. Good food at affordable prices. Located on the far end of the Crafton Ingram shopping center it makes a good choice for either breakfast or lunch.

They have their daily lunch specials written on a chalkboard outside. Will definitely return again!

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Abby L.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
Being a newer resident of Crafton and a breakfast fanatic, I'm always up to visiting little local diners! Sunday morning my boyfriend and I both woke up with some family visiting and decided to head to Hanlon's to get some brunch.

We walked in with no idea what to expect and were greeted with a family-friendly, classic, small town diner feel. These places usually have the best breakfasts! I ordered the loaded home fries and chose sausage, peppers, and onions as my toppings. You can choose 3 toppings (cheese comes with them), and your home fries will come to you still steaming in a big skillet. This is an awesome deal for $5.99. My boyfriend got one of the breakfast meals from the menu, but he substituted the regular pancakes with the cookies and cream pancakes. The menu was hard to choose from because everything looked amazing, and some of the plates were really unique!

The staff were all super friendly and accommodating, the food was great, and the prices were low. It's hard to think of any negatives about Hanlon's. We will definitely go to Hanlon's again, and I'll be looking forward to it!

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Beth S.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: First time here and the breakfast was amazing . My boyfriend and I loved it so much. I will be heading back to try something else. The staff were very friendly and helpful .

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Ron A.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: I have never had a bad experience here. The staff is friendly and the food is good. I definitely endorse Hanlon's Cafe.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Stephen R.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: Best breakfast in town. Just moved to the area and this has become my favorite weekend tradition

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Joe G.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
The only thing that prevented Hanlon's from being a 5 stars was the service. The waitress didn't seem to know the menu, and she only came around once. We had to ask another server for refills. She also didn't write down my wife's order correctly, and we had to send it back. While we waited, she was just standing around chatting. We don't expect to be treated like royalty, but when one person has their order and the other doesn't, you would hope for some type of urgency. 

With that said, the fact it still got 4 stars speaks to the food. I ordered a ham and cheese omelet with broccoli added in. It was loaded with fresh ham and broccoli and more than enough cheese. My wife ordered poached eggs, which had a heavy vinegar flavor to it, but it's still hard to mess up poached eggs. She really liked her raisin toast, too. 

We will likely come back, just hopefully get a different server.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Lisa F.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: I have been to Hanlon's several times and the most recent was fair at best. The griddle/grease mustn't be clean because the whole breakfast tasted like it. The service here is wonderful, the waitresses very sweet. Just stick to the menu as is, asking for anything special totally throws a curveball into the finished product. Their "alterations" were a bit pathetic. Not sure if there was a new cook or not. Also, the hot sausage tasted freezer burnt.  The hash browns are totally different...just like McDonalds. Will possibly give it one more chance.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Todd S.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
I had the Ruben and is what great. Right amounts of meat, kraut and dressing.
Pepsi- perfect mix!
French fries- nice and crispy.
Looking forward to trying breakfast next timer

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Brendan L.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: Just had lunch at Hanlon's hot roast beef sandwich was luke warm at best. Fries had the grease coating that I don't care for. The service was the pits. Not once did anyone say anything to me after I ordered, remember when people would ask how is everything?  Nothing. Will not be back

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: D S.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description:
A good serviceable breakfast. Wasn't great, but wasn't bad. Just average. We had pancakes and they were OK. Even the syrup was just OK. The bacon is paper thin without much flavor. Only the French Toast stuffed with apple pie filling shined. 

The real stars at this place are the servers. Efficient, friendly and kind. 

I'd go back, but nothing here -- at least regarding what we had -- that I couldn't make as well if not better at home.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Kaysi S.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: Well, the place is so good at breakfast that I forgot to take a pic of my food. Ordered handful and hit the spot. I've only eaten breakfast here but always hear good things about their other meals. Stop in and try a lovely local cafe.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Ben G.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: Good food and very reasonable price. All with exceptional service. I got one of the breakfast combos with eggs, bacon, home fries and French toast. Of those, the French toast, bacon, and home fires were all great. Home fries had just the right amount of seasoning and onion. Eggs were a little plain but definitely weren't messed up in any way. Would recommend if you're in the area and want friendly service.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Janice V.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: Went for lunch. Cup of chili was really good. Ordered Chicken cordon bleu sandwich. Fries were good and crispy, but sandwich was horrible. Bottom bun was soo soggy, when I picked it up, it gushed between my fingers. The consistency of paste. Nasty. At least  I had the chili, cause couldn't eat the sandwich, would have made  me gag.

pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.author: Shelly W.
pv-bAsIJc6s31dYHxjKpvQ.description: Just tried the Cobb salad for the first time.  Outstanding!!  Generally really like the food here, but wish they'd make chicken soup a more regular part of the menu.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Kathryn F.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description:
What a lovely surprise a food truck at work.

I had the spinach, mushroom, pesto etc. crepe.  It was DELICIOUS.  I was able to watch the cook create my lunch.

I couldn't walk away without dessert.  I ordered a strawberry, blueberry & nutella crepe.  Again DELICIOUS.

I am not a food truck person so I was happy to see a napkin & fork already in my takeout container.

Definitely look forward to eating here again.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Aaron Z.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description:
I found this food truck in Carnegie on a Friday night. Not having an opportunity to eat crepes often, I was excited to try this place and so ordered the chicken ranch. 

Good thing it wasn't crowded because I think the gentleman who was making my crepe was new and it took a little longer to make than I would have thought. I also got about a third of the way through the crepe before realizing that there wasn't any ranch on it and had to go back to get some squirted on. The crepe itself was more filling than expected and was big enough to be a meal by itself. 

The crepe overall was just ok, nothing really special about it. I would still get it again but would probably try a breakfast crepe instead.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Angela G.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: Pontine tasted kind of funky-- cheese was cold and the gravy had a weird taste. Fries were also undercooked.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Kristy A.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description:
I love a food truck, but this one definitely disappointed at Kennywood Park last night.  I should have known when they didn't have a line at all, but I was hungry and it was right there.   

I ordered the strawberry, banana, nutella and a bottle of water.   I stood there and watched as it was cooked and filled.  So I saw him pile the strawberries in really early and then cut up a half rotten banana right on top.   The entire thing was warm all the way through, which did not hit the spot in 85 degree weather.  I'd have preferred the fruit to be a little less cooked; because served warm as it was, it was a mushy mess.  

$11 bucks for the crepe and a warm bottle of water.  It's 85 degrees people - you should assume that people ordering water don't want it to be 85 degrees as well.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Carly T.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description:
I was very disappointed in my crepe.  I am so upset, because my coworker bought it for me and now I owe him $9 for something that I would have handed right back had I gotten my eyes on it.  I ordered a strawberry-banana crepe. My crepe was very hard and there was no taste of Nutella in it at all. I am not even certain Nutella was included.  The fruit seemed... old.... and I'm honestly a little nauseated after trying to eat some of it.  

This was literally my worst crepe experience in my life.  I did not even know a crepe could be screwed up before this particular experience.  I am hoping this is just a fluke, but I wouldn't recommend anyone to risk it.  This was $9 down the drain.  

My coworker's crepe looked a little better.  He invested in a savory option.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Courtney P.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: I thought it was impossible to mess up crepes, but mine was awful! I would've rather eaten a tortilla with Nutella! This was dry, chewy and bland. It didn't have that moist, spongy texture you'd expect. I could literally tap on it and hear the hardness of it. I paid $8 for this! I would be a little less upset if the staff wasn't so rude and dismissive when I was so polite and cheery. I would never eat this again, and I'm not hard to please. I DID eat this at Kennywood Park, so I completely understand they could be busy, but that shouldn't affect the quality.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Michele M.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: This place is overrated I make better crepes at home. I got a berry one which was a joke. What little berries that were in it had stems and were sour. The crepe was like beef jerky. Now I feel terrible definitely nothing to write home about. I threw $9 in the trash.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Aliya S.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: Literally the best crepes in town. Had the Gyro crepe last time at Kenneywood and was amazing! I asked them them to make it crispy and they did it very well

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Rachel L.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: Today PGH Crepes came to our school to put on a small event for my French students! We didn't have a lot of time, as it was in the middle of the school day, but the crepe truck was quick and efficient. They even helped create a menu that could even be enjoyed by our students with allergies! The students loved the crepes and it was a really neat experience! Thank you PGH Crepes!

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Dana R.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: Food was amazing! They serve both sweet and savory crepes, with many different flavor combinations and fresh ingredients. The service was fast too. We'll definitely follow this food truck to other venues, no doubt. I could take down a good many crepes in one sitting, I'm sure, and it's not like the portion sizes are skimpy either.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Julie R.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description:
The Crepe truck was parked in front of Espresso a Mano and my friend was keen to try the crepes.  There were a bunch of handwritten signs dotting the window of the truck.  No credit cards, cash only (despite the truck displaying a variety of credit card options), no bananas, etc.

I ordered a strawberry and nutella crepe.  It was $5.  What a letdown.  The girl making the crepe didn't have nearly enough batter so about one third of it was "lace" rather than an actual crepe.  There was maybe a teaspoon of nutella and maybe one or two strawberries diced.  That was it.  My crepe did not come close to resembling any of the pictures on the truck and not close to any of the photos posted on this site for this food truck.  Skimpy, skimpy, skimpy.

It was OK.  There were no sugars or anything else to put on the crepe.  They provide a napkin put no plasticware.

Next time I want a sweet french treat, I'll go down to La Gourmandine.  For five dollars you can get a substantial, wonderfully baked treat and a coffee for the same price.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Laura M.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description:
I visited this food truck when it was at the South Side Works Fall Food Festival on Sat.  I wanted to hit both this truck and the PGH Pie Guy, but at the time that I arrived (5:45pm), the pie guy was packing up.  Because this was the only other truck at the event I was interested in trying, I ordered a chicken ranch spinach crepe and a strawberry nutella crepe so that I could try both a savory and a sweet variety.

Based on the other reviews for this food truck, I was expecting the flavor of these crepes to be great.  Unfortunately, however, this was not the case.  The chicken ranch crepe was bland tasting, even despite the ranch sauce.  The strawberry crepe had a better flavor profile, but it still wasn't super-exciting.  It consisted only of chopped strawberries and nutella, with none of the powdered sugar or whipped cream mentioned in other reviews, so I can't help but wonder if I was shortchanged.

One other issue was the lack of napkins and utensils.  Given the messiness of both types of crepes, I expected these to be available, but I wasn't able to find any.  While I am not averse to eating the crepes by hand, doing so made for messy eating, and I wasn't able to clean up afterwards due to the lack of napkins.  While I'm not a huge napkin user, I was left with a messy mouth and hands after eating the crepes that I had no way of cleaning up, which further detracted from my experience.

While I hate to leave a negative rating, I feel that I have to in this case, given the various shortcomings and lack of redeeming factors.  If napkins and/or utensils had been provided, I'd probably be willing to award 3 stars, but at present, I'm awarding 2.5 stars.  If you like or want to try crepes, there's a place on Craig St. in N. Oakland I'd recommend leaps and bounds over this food truck.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: A S.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: Best Crepes!! I definitely recommend trying the Chicken crepe, but they are all really great. & the S'mores crepe is amazing !! 10/10 would recommend

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Gordon C.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description:
They did ok.  had their strawberry nutella + chicken something something before.  
cash only.
I bet the workers there are all part-time, so you see a lots of new faces making the crepes, hence no consistency.

Biggest issue being their opening hours.  Havn't seen them for a while now.  feel very much a hit-or-miss.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Mia M.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description:
Today I was at a rowing meet and I can across this food truck called the PGH Crepes Truck, and the food was kind of disappointing.  From the get go the food truck didn't have a really nice feel too it, which set up some red flags for me. I first wanted the Walnut crepe, but they were out of walnuts. The one thing you should always do is be prepared for lots of customers so you don't run out of food.

So instead of the Walnut crepe I had the S'mores crepe. Even though my standards were low, the S'mores crepe still seemed to hit below my already low standards. I can understand that bagged marshmallows and gram crackers are cheaper, but the one thing I can't stand is canned whipped cream. It's not that hard to make a good whipped cream, all it takes it heavy whipping cream and sugar. 

In all not a good experience, and not a bad one ether, but I know I will be making different choices of where to eat in the future.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Regina A.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: I just tried their new American Crepe!!Omg that is soo good! And I loved how ground beef , mushrooms and green onions tastes together.!I missed you, guys.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Lauren P.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: I would say this was solidly ok. They had food trucks up at WPIC that I visited. It was super quick but I didn't feel like they had a lot of options and they were all pretty ordinary. They also let someone butt in front of me and served them first (I know it's mostly the guys fault who butt in front of me but still pissed). I had an egg and cheese crepe first but the only sauces they had available was ranch whereas most crepe places have bechemel sauce which is really yummy. Second time I got a fruit crepe but no whipped cream. lame.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Eric G.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: I'm glad that I was finally able to stop by the truck before I moved out of the city, because I've passed by it so many times for years and always have wanted to try it.  I wanted a savory crepe (I will likely go back for a sweet option sometime this summer), so I decided on the veggie- which was better than I expected.  A lot of people make veggie crepes with a liberal amount of cheese, but the cheese to veggie ratio was great.  The guy working at the truck was nice and quick (though I wonder during peak times if I'd want to wait).  The crepe was $6, which I thought was a couple dollars overpriced- especially compared to other food trucks on the same block that offer much more food for less money.  I'll try to stop by for lunch again soon.

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Ummu K.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: My kids love this place, specially banana nutella crepe.  They have crepes truck too.  Awsome service

cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.author: Greg L.
cPZ5ugSrVrqnqD5ZsJhnpA.description: Hot crepe on a cold day. Really fresh veggie crepe with basil sauce hit the spot as did the chicken ranch. Nutella crepe looked pretty good but that'll be for later.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Tabitha C.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
Visited here last weekend for the first time in quite a while. The wait always seems to be at least 15-20 minutes no matter the time of day. I wish I could remember our waitress' name as she truly made our visit as good as it was. She was really friendly, smiling at us, and just really attentive. That type of demeanor truly goes a long way in the food industry, or any industry for that matter, that many forget.

I really enjoy the IHOP menu as there is so much to try. My son and I got a rather basic breakfast as we weren't feeling too adventurous. I like the flavored syrups at the tables and the coffee being readily available to pour yourself more at the table. The breakfasts here are just the right portions, I feel, and we were satisfied without feeling overstuffed. For my son and I my bill was only $16 before tip which is just awesomely affordable for a nice weekend morning out. The tastes of IHOP pancakes (even the basic ones) are what give them their uniqueness.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Kristy A.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
The server was super-friendly...but that's about all the good I have to say for the place.  

There was no host at the station when I walked in, but someone walking by did seat me immediately.   She was wearing flip flops, which I thought was weird for a restaurant, but whatever.  She was friendly.  The server came over shortly thereafter.  She did an excellent job - friendly and attentive.  

My breakfast, though, was absolutely dreadful.   The pancakes were ok at best, but were drowned in what was essentially a couple of Smucker's ice cream toppings.   That one is probably on me - I should have ordered them plain.  The eggs, which I ordered scrambled with cheese, didn't even taste like eggs.  They had a very weird texture - grainy and rubbery at the same time.    The bacon, ordered well done, was flabby.  The hash browns were a sad, unseasoned, brick of under-cooked potato mush.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Chris S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
I would avoid this iHop like the plague. 

My family went to this restaurant on the morning of 8/18/19.  We ordered chocolate milk for my daughter who is 3 years old,  the milk came to us spoiled and made her ill later in the day.  We also told our waitress about it and did not get an "I'm sorry" just a "well do you want something else".  I also heard another table order chocolate milk about 10 minutes after ours arrived and I warned them that our milk came spoiled and so they should check before letting their kids drink it.  Sure enough when their milk came the milk was spoiled as well, meaning the kitchen staff did not throw away potentially harmful product and kept providing it to customers.  When our bill came we were still expected to pay for the spoiled milk, even after I asked our waitress at the register and tried to address it.  

Needless to say I am NOT thrilled with the level of customer service I received.  Not once did a manger come to try and talk to us and make things right, not once did our server apologize and offer anything to help, and I had to deal with a toddler throwing up on the way home because her stomach hurt after eating at this establishment.  It is unacceptable.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Daniel L.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: Avoid this restaurant at all costs. Waited for 30 min and the restaurant wasn't even half full. Visited with a party of 7 and all 7 orders were wrong... just a completely terrible experience. Would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. Terrible

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Crystal A.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: We were in the area of the waterfront so decided to stop at IHOP. There were maybe 3 people at tables but 5 other tables filthy with plates and glasses. Waited for 10 minutes in the lobby just waiting to be seated but no one ever came. You can hear people yapping away in the kitchen but no one ever came out. We left to Buffalo Wild Wings and had a great meal- definitely recommend BWW.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Elis H.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
I came for pick up and I was really disappointed. It was supposed to take 20 min. I waited for almost hour and a half for just 2 meals!! Then I told I couldn't wait for longer because I had an appointment. Well, everything came wrong but that's fine because we're not coming back anymore. It doesn't worth it so much stress for a mediocre meal and terrible service. I regret for tipping (20%) before I got my food. 
Advice: do not tip before you get your order. Not in there...

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Eileen S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
A business  has to be really slacking to earn a one or two star rating from me.

The restaurant was very chilly, to be charitable. My companion, who has 2% body fat (seriously annoying) was freezing, but picked ihop and really wanted their fffffooooddddddd. Okkkkkaaayyy.

I had a fantastic Egg White Vegetable omelette, which was light, fluffy, and topped with fresh diced tomatoes, melty Jack cheese, lightly cooked spinach, and a perfect avocado. It included a yummy-looking fresh fruit cup, which I took home. The restaurant was so "chilly," I wolfed my omelette, which was not an enjoyable experience. The other diner did the same with The Sampler, which had 2 egs, bacon, ham, and sausage, and two pancakes (Not hot. Or even warm). I had just finished 24 + ounces of coffee, and didn't order a drink. The other diner, however, said it was decent coffee; nothing special. 

The ladies rest room was dirty. While at the sink, a male employee (who didn't knock or yell in), burst in, and trying to hold door open, grabbed the "wet floor" sign, folded it, and pinned it in the door. He never said a word. Not a one. Thoroughly unprofessional. Had I been a jerk, i could've given him/ihop all kinds of legal woes.

The topper was the server, Jeanette, returned with change from the bill. She apologized for being short $.34. I've been a server, and in the hospitality industry a long time, albeit part time (quit last year). I have/would never say that to a customer.  Period. I would tell the shift manager or GM, but I would absolutely NEVER do that to a customer. 

I will NOT return. Not even the omelette could get me back here.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Jayden R.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: This is my frist time here it is soo good  it's is the best food I ever had in my life you should come here I might have 3 stars but it's soo good 5 mint wat for food ihop is soo good

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Pauline C.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: Service was okay and the food was also okay. I feel every time I go here they're understaffed or extremely busy. The amount of food you get for the price you pay is great, but not sure I'd go back too often.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Judy J.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: This place is very "meh." We we here for "lunch" and were happy with the food, but we were there for a good hour or so waiting for the food and check. It was very atmospheric and the waiters were kind, but my nephew was soooo bored. Not the place I would go in a time crunch, as we were there an hour and a half, the half hour eating our food. At least they have big portions...

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Denali G.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: We went on Easter sunday so it was busier than normal. I've been to this IHOP many times but this was definitely the best experience. Because it was so busy our waitress was just constantly cycling around. They had runners that would bring the food out so it came out faster and hotter than normal. The churro pancakes are AWESOME but i def didn't need the side of hashbrowns lol i will say though... the "runners".... one was actually running around and it stressed us out. a few times she actually did run into someone. the few seconds she saves running vs walking isn't that significant. It creates an anxious atmosphere from her running. I didn't see the rest of them do that. Next time i think walking or fast walking is sufficient. When they gave us the coffee container it was almost gone so i think if they checked that before that would be helpful or have someone walking around refilling coffees. Overall good experience and it seems like this IHOP is improving compared to the past visits we have had.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Aiyana L.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: Had this delivered by Uber eats and it was good and what I expected. French toast and fresh fruit cup. I asked for syrup , fork and knife and they were in the bag which I was happy for. French toast was nice thick slices of bread and fruit was definitely fresh.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Courtney B.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: This place has poor, slow service. I've been here twice and have gotten something spilled on or near me both times. I'd rather go to a Denny's or Eatnpark.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Jane S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: Everything I got was cold and just plain wrong. What??? Did you just give me the mess ups that were in the window?????? He wrote nothing down. It took us 30 minutes just to get coffee and water. Both of my partners hash browns were cold. We ordered chocolate chip pancakes, got plain. Ordered over medium eggs, they gave me scrambled, THEN gave me over easy. I ordered a fruit bowl in stead of hash browns.......I got hash browns. Whenever I finally got my fruit bowl, the bowl was warm. Ordered toast, it came dry, asked for butter, and they never gave it to us. My first warning should have been that they didn't even know the wait time........

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Sherry M.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
We came to I hop for Free Pancake Day ! It was not a disappointment. Lunch today was very good. Very pleasant experience dinning there today. 
The food was hot and served quickly. I did expect a long line and a long wait, but I was pleasantly surprised as to how smooth everything ran today. 
Service was great ! All the servers that walked by or  next to our table were friendly  and accommodating. 
The dining room was clean and we sat at a clean table. 
I know the negative comments and I can't comment on them. I just know that we had a great lunch, ate hot free pancakes and enjoyed it. 
I did give a donation to the children's miracle fun that I hop is supporting. 
We will return ! 
I hop at this location is 24/7

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Kristy B.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
