I have been hearing people rave about IHOP for years and was so excited to finally eat here. I had a coupon for free pancakes and decided to try it out. I have to say I was extremely let down from my experience. 
As soon as I pulled in to the empty parking lot, during what should of been the dinner rush, I was concerned. The atmosphere, or lack of, once inside the building didn't give me any more hope. The bathrooms were disguisting. None of the toilets had been flushed, toilet paper was all over the floor and there was hardly any soap. After seeing the bathroom I almost decided to leave and I wish I would of. My daughter and I were the only table in the resturant for half of our meal, whixh half of our meal consisted of just waiting for our food. Then one other table came and was sat directly besides us even though the whole place was empty. I ordered an omelette which only came with one side, 7.99 plus .99 for each topping. Peppers and onions were listed together as one with one price but I was charged separately for them even tho the menu says papers & onion .99. So now my omelette became 9.99. I got my side of hash browns and they were just a small square of what looked to be previously frozen. They were hardly crispy and the inside was cold. My omelette was so greasy I couldn't even eat it. My daughter got sprinkle pancakes which were okay, nothing more than average. The worst part about the meal was everything had black crunchies in it, as if they reused the same pan for everything. I'm assuming it was left over burnt food from a previous order. At least that's what I'm praying it was... After the meal we hardly ate, we waited a solid 15 minutes just to pay. 
Honestly I do not understand why so many people talk about IHOP. Dennys is far better and you get way more for your buck. Maybe it was just this location that is terrible. I will never return.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: John R.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: From the beginning upon entering the restaurant appeared disorganized. Tables weren't cleaned and there was debris on the floor. The hostess had to clean a table for us. We were seated and a waitress brought us coffee with no silverware. Another waitress brought silverware. The original waitress then took the order and another brought our order. When I asked the cleaner if there was a party considering the debris he said he didn't know. He never finished totally cleaning but tried. Meanwhile several employees were out back loafing. The restaurant just seemed disorganized but at least our order was almost correct. I don't think we'll be back soon.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Tiffany Y.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: I need to stop coming to this IHOP. During my most recent visit, the waiter was very slow in taking our order, and the cooks were very slow in cooking the food. The worst part was that a piece of plastic was cooked inside my pancakes. I felt something hard in my mouth and had to spit it out. I also do not think that the toppings for my pancakes or the fillings for my husband's omelette were completely correct. One plus was that the waiter used polite words.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: John M.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
I used to go there fairly regularly for a few months a few years back. Each and every time, the service was horrible. It seemed like no server was working our table, and we always had to flag someone down and request service.

A few weeks ago, we decided to try again. Same thing. Servers walked past our table for at least 10-15 minutes before we finally flagged someone down to ask if anyone was working our table.

Apparently, some things never change at this location. I won't go back.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Walter A.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
Nice place. Not too crowded. 
Fast service( for a IHOP it was pretty fast, like 10 minutes to get my order). 
Good service and nice employees.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Shane S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
The service and food was excellent. My wife, myself, and 2 children were seated within 5 minutes on a Thursday night. The server came and got us drinks, took our orders very quickly. The food was delicious. Kids eat free weeknights and they really enjoyed their meals.

The cons: the menus were sticky. The kids high chairs were dirty and one had a missing buckle. The diaper changing station in the mens room is broken and the changing platform is not level, it tilts downward.

All in all I was satisfied at the very least I believe our dining experience was superior to eat'n'park.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Wendy H.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
This was my first visit to this IHOP - and it's going to be my last. 

I mean, IHOP has never been my favorite place to eat, but it's never been truly horrible, at least in the San Francisco area, but this was my first Pgh. area experience, and I am reminded of why I generally have always preferred to eat almost anywhere else, only on steroids. 

Where to start?

After visiting a couple of sick friends at nearby Charles Morris this evening, I was starving, and deeply craving a salad. A quick Google search showed a beautiful Cobb salad on the menu, and for a good bit less money than my current local favorite Shady Grove (and minus the bar scene noise and hassle), so off I went. 

The place was deserted. One waitress, and at most two tables in use. So far, so good. It also appeared to be spotlessly clean- another big plus, obviously- although the Pergo/vinyl floor and dim, bluish lighting made it feel quite cold and not very welcoming. 

The waitress tries to stick me at a table just in front of and across the aisle from the serving station, which had what looked like a pail of bleach sitting right in view, so I said I didn't want to sit right by the station. She tries to seat me a couple of tables away - equally close to the station but on the other side of it, cleaning pail still fully in view. I end up at a table in the far side of the restaurant at the very back, which was OK, although a bit of a hike. 

I order my salad, and the first clue that all would not be well surfaced when I learned that they don't have vinegar and oil, and that avocado is a whopping $0.90 extra. Well, OK, it's not a Cobb salad without avocado, and I love the stuff unreasonably, so fine. 

Food and decaf ordered, I head to the rest room. 

O. M. G., what a mess! Four stalls, and not a single one usable, *including* the handicapped one, which I need because of, well, walking issues, plus a large service dog. (Did I mention she stuck me at the very back of the restaurant, as far from the restroom as possible? Despite using a cane and said large dog?)

Exiting to get someone to clean the place up, I am greeted by the sight of a group of something like 20 people just arrived.  

It took forever, and at least 3 requests, including an actual threat to pee right there on the floor in the entry to get someone to clean it up at all. It had to be a good 15-20 minutes total before the server finally took a super quick swipe at it and I was able to use it. Standing only, though. 

Outside the restroom, the party of 20 church group has been seated, and both waitrons were buzzing busily around them. And the other two patrons who had also come in after I did. 

I get back to my table, expecting to be able to sit down and at the minimum start my coffee - and even the water isn't there yet. 

The water and coffee show up, finally, and then my onion rings. The coffee and onion rings are both only lukewarm. The onion rings were at least warm enough to still be crisp, and were very tasty, but it was still disappointing. 

The salad shows up. Oy gevalt, such a sorry looking thing! Limp greens, a mere sliver of avocado, the whole thing only barely covering the bottom of the bowl - nothing at all like the robust picture on the menu. At least it wasn't iceberg, but there was less than a cupful of greens. 

They were out of blue cheese "crumbles", and I was offered parmesan cheese (or croutons) instead. I declined. Blech. 

The bacon was limp and almost stone cold, only warm enough to let me know it had just been cooked, but was at least edible - which is a lot more than I can say for the chicken. Vile, disgusting- and clearly made of rubber. My dog went nuts for the smell of it, of course - but it was so gross I didn't even want to give it to him. 

So now the "Cobb" salad that actually wasn't has lost absolutely *all* resemblance to what a Cobb salad actually should be. There wasn't even an egg. Way, way overpriced for what it was. 

I think the salad dressing was actually rancid. It was certainly the worst "ranch" dressing I've ever had, so I ate the salad (such as it was) completely bone dry. The party of 20+ was in full swing; there was clearly no way I was ever going to be able to get anything else this side of next weekend. The one ten days from now. 

Not that I was able to find even that out in a timely fashion, because the fork they gave me was filthy. So was the second one I was finally able to obtain after asking three different times. I did finally get a clean one.  

Needless to say, no one ever checked in to ask me how things were after serving me. 

I asked to have the charge for the avocado deleted when I went to pay, and at least the waitress was willing to do that. 

This all went down several hours ago now, and my stomach is still churning in revolt. I'm hoping this will be the end of it.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Kaysi S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: I went there with my friend to get food around midnight. We waited around an hour to get our food because they are understaffed literally there was one waitress and a cook that's us and they had decent amount of customers. Very unhappy with the location and the management. Although the place is clean

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Jade C.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
It's late. You are hungry and everything is closed. Look up. You're in IHOP. 

How did you get here? 

Don't worry about it. A dejected waitress will lead you to a stained booth with a slightly sticky table. 

Get a coffee. Yes, it's mediocre, but it's late. There's nothing else to choose from. 

Ask the waitress if there is red #40 in the strawberry topping. 
"What's that a dye or something, hunny?"
"Yes."
"Probably. Everything is processed here", said the waitress in the same tone as if to?say "do you want the slop or not, piggy?"

You do want the slop. You are desperate. It's late. 
Order something.
It's gonna be bland or slightly plastic-y tasting. It's better than the emptiness that was there before. 

Your waitress keeps the drinks filled and stops by a few times. She does the minimum without a smile or kind word. You wonder if this is standard service or if something happened to her. 

You get up to pay and see a customer loudly complain that his takeout meal costs too much (it doesn't). The waitress calmly responds to this nonsense, gently telling him to pay or kick rocks. 

Now you understand the joyless waitress and just hope to make it out of the restaurant without laughing in the face of Complaint Man when he asks the waitress: 
"Can you break a $50?"

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Gordon C.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
There is no line, but service was slow.  There were 6 unclean tables when I walked in.  They eventually cleaned those, but we waited at least 15 mins before we were addressed by any waitress. 
We asked for a to-go cup at the end.  Another 10 mins wait, and we just left cause we needed to go.

Foodwise.  4 syrups to choose. 2 of them tasted like medicine. (strawberry and blueberry). The other two (old fashioned / butter pecan) syrups were ok.  We had a steak omelet. The steak meat was alright.  "Double blueberry pancake" was very sweet.  The only good thing is mocha-flavored cold coffee has free refill.  The portion was big, I didn't touch my three pancakes that go with my omelet. 

At the end of the day, IHOP breakfast is typical American breakfast. Big, lots of potatoes, thick pancakes, very sweet drinks and syrup, and it's cheap.  But be honest, I rather have one great benedict than a big table of so-so. 

American breakfast is not for me, so that's a 4.  The food was ok, but not wow, makes it a 3. Slow service makes it a 2.  So a "2" it is.

Has "guest wifi", but not working.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Taylor S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
Request Gideon! He's honestly one of the nicest and personable servers I ever had. He chatted with us like we were long lost friends and talked about our serving stories. Food came out fast and drinks were always refilled. We ordered grits and they came out amazing. Highly recommend. Will never cheat on I Hop with Denny's again. 
Love,

his favorite eat n park girls

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Bob G.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: This is my third and last visit. When I was seated there was a large dead cockroach next to my menu. The manager pushed it onto the floor crushed it and walked away. No one washed the table again, so I walked out and will not ever be back.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Tim F.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
Jasmine sat us at the table and brought our coffee and offered to pour it for us. She told us she would be our waitress. I had to ask her for utensils at this point because we had none to stir our coffee with. She said she would be right back. 5min go by and I notice she is seating another guest, still no utensils. I get up and go to the front desk and get my own utensils. Jasmine returns, no utensils still, doesn't notice that I now have utensils... takes our order, leaves. I don't see her again until the end of our meal (other staff bring the meal to our table, they have no idea who gets what because they didn't take the order) jasmine stops by towards the end of the meal to ask if we need anything... I ask her for more napkins because we only have the one napkin that came with the original set up that I had to get myself. Those napkins came right before we stood up to leave.
As my wife starts to eat her French toast with strawberries she notices that the strawberries are still frozen and tells the manager who does offer a remake of the diner but that probably would have taken more time than we were willing to put up with so long story short... bad experience.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Georgetta H.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
I am currently at IHOP our first visit,  waitress doesn't know menu, nor does the manager.  Asked about their gluten-free options and manager sends me a 2- inch thick allergy book to look at that had nothing to do with gluten-free options.  It would have been much better for him or her to had said they didn't know.

I ordered rise n shine and husband ordered 2 x2, both breakfast meals.  They couldn't cook eggs to our specifications- light scrambled.  We were given ice cold butter to put on cold pancakes. Plus food was totally cold.  Husband sent food back and it was returned same way.  This is our last visit to Ihop.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Tucker D.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: My toast was floppy, my eggs where not what the menu said they were and my pancakes were pretty good. Bad service. Don't come here.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: K K.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: A hour wait for our food when they were not busy.  Food arrived in shifts wtb the last person just getter hers to go since everyone one else had completed eating.  Soup came out so cold you could hold the bowl in your hand.  This while at least 5 workers stood around talking.  I asked one of them to refill a drink and he replied one moment     When I saw him while I walked out and thanked him for his help(never got the drink), he said he was busy.   Went to use the bathroom, and someone was there sweeping.   First 2 stalls needed flushed.  She left without doing that.   If you're close enough to squirrel hill, I would go to Pamela's instead.   Service and management terrible at iHOP

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Susan A.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: Came into this place for breakfast after work. We knew it might be a little busy due to the fact it was Mothers Day and 9am but that was not the trouble we were faced with. We both ordered the Churro Pancakes and coffee the food came out quick, why u ask they were still doughy in the middle and gross. I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and to my surprise there was one of the workers in there putting her hair up and left green goo all over the sick as well as hair everywhere. When I came out I got ran over by a waitress that told me to watch where I was going and to get out of the way of people working, um Hello. We asked our waiter for the check and 20 minutes later he still never showed up. When we went to the counter to ask for our check and pay we were told that our server gives us our check and to pay him. I explained to the man that he never came around and then ten minutes later our check came and I paid for it. Never again the servers need better attitudes and the food needs checked

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Jane S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: From the minute we walked in everything seemed really disorganized and it never got any better.   We waited 20 minutes to get a seat and 45 minutes for our food.   The food was fine, not great but fine.  We never received any water, the server came by twice, once when the food was delivered to see if we got everything and then to give us the bill.  When we left there were 7 employees standing in the front entry doing NOTHING!  As I said very disorganized.  We won't be going back.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Alyssa M.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
Today was probably the last time I will come to this IHOP. It's near my house so my boyfriend and I sometimes think it's a good idea to give this location another try for a quick breakfast and we always end up being there for sometimes over an hour. We're laid back so a lot of the times we have laughed it off and walked out saying "I don't know why we do this to ourselves." Today we saw a table walk out before their food was delivered because it took long and they had been there before us and we even contemplated leaving and going somewhere else as well but we stayed. 

Another occasion I ordered a Pepsi and when the server brought my Pepsi it was clearly diet, when I told her it tasted like diet and if she didn't mind changing it I would appreciate it and she told me "no, that is Pepsi, I poured it so I know" and she walked away. I finished the diet and asked for a refill of Pepsi and when she returned it was in fact Pepsi, so I knew that it wasn't just because the drink tasted funny. Either way I was just taken back that she wouldn't just switch out my drink in the first place. This was a laughable situation but.... ehhhh still not idea. 

I will give it 2 stars because the location, the food was good TODAY and our server was pleasant TODAY. Just don't plan to be in and out when you come here.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: J S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
Really great experience. No wait, very friendly people, food served fast and decent. 
Good job IHOP!

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Jim A.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: Food is excellent... However, Dana was extremely rude to us, my wife thinks she was high or on drugs. This woman was Spacey, abrupt, and actually said " why you want to eat with the black folks?" I can't understand how this person has a service industry job.x

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Rachel S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: I came here this morning for the first time in a few years. I have to admit that the other times I came here, the service and food was subpar. However, our service was excellent this morning. We were seated right away which was surprising for a Sunday morning. Our waitress left a carafe of coffee on our table which is a huge bonus for me for Sunday breakfasts! I love not having to flag a waitress down for a refill. I got blueberry pancakes and they were absolutely delicious. The bacon could have been thicker, but that is my only real complaint. I'm very glad to see that this business seems to have really made improvements over time.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Sue R.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description:
This place is a mess, since it is impossible to guess what the service will be like on any day.  As other reviews noted, the inconsitency has taken its toll:  the restaurant is rarely busy, even on weekends.  Given its prime location, one has to wonder why this place cannot get its act together. 

There have been times when an individual server has been attentive and profesional.  But too often, the servers are disinterested and inattentive.  Sometimes the food has been delivered, hot and tasty.  More often, it's cold and badly cooked. Silverware often is not set and I have actually gone searching for my own utensils on more than one occasion.   And it's questionable whether the staff knows how to properly bus a table after service.  I don't know how often a manager is on-site, since the staff seems to hide in the kitchen (rarely exiting with food), or gabbing near the register.  

I am a forgiving customer and I want to like this place. It's close to my home and the prices are reasonable.  In the final analysis, it's hard to blame anyone but the management, which does not teach basic food service skills to the young staff, nor exercise oversight of operations.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Abbie S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: Ordered via uber eats. Ordered pancakes. Came without syrup. I had asked for hot sauce for my hash browns and didn't receive any. Terrible experience. You sell pancakes for a living. At least remember the syrup.

4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.author: Ivory S.
4jswtizEiT3-ZMauIzWXxg.description: I love iHop, but last time I went to this location was disappointing. The food was great, per usual. The service was sub-par. Our server was clearly new to the job, and seemed untrained and very overwhelmed. He kept forgetting basics, like silverware and filling drinks. When our food was brought out, it was brought in parts on different plates. Sides being brought separately from the eggs/pancakes, etc. After eating, we waited 20 mins for the server to come back and acknowledge we were done so we could get the checks. Our checks were separated per person, and the server was very unorganized with our checks. We were not given itemized receipts, as is normal, we were only given a receipt with the price and tip lines. When the server gave us our cards back, he picked up money from the table that someone was leaving as a tip, asked if it was for him, then pocketed it. I don't know how people are trained nowadays, but I was always taught that servers do not touch a tip on the table until the customers leave. We paid and got out of there as fast as possible, the server was upset because his other tables were complaining as well. Food was great though!

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Domenic D.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description:
I moved in down the street from this place and was excited to check it out. However every time I tried to go during their posted business hours, they were closed.  This is because they ARE NOT OPEN everyday.  The owners keep their Facebook page up to date with when they are open.  So don't think about going without checking their Facebook first!

Now onto the food experience. The restaurant had a very local, personable feel to it. Upon entering my friend and I were greeted by the owner, who introduced himself, and asked for our names.  The other customers seemed to be Southside slopes regulars.

I ordered the sliders and fries, which did not disappoint. Each slider was a 1/4 lb burger, which could hardly be considered a slider. And while I prefer thin crispy fries, the thick cut steak fries were very good.  I will definitely be back now that I know how to tell they are open!

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Soms O.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description:
This place is totally my speed. My girlfriend lives a few houses down and we've been coming here at least once a week for a couple months. 

Why? This restaurant is different than any other place in Pittsburgh. They always have a rotating menu of great dishes (and huge portions) at VERY affordable prices. The server, Tom, is always quick with the orders and knows everything about the menu. They have their clientele of regulars that keep coming back despite the funky hours. And they have a great drink menu. 

In summary, it's just the perfect neighborhood restaurant and we plan on coming back once a week for many years to come. I hope they never change.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Afroza H.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description:
We moved to Philadelphia last August and of the few things that I miss about Pittsburgh, living down the block from UUBU is at the top of that list. 

I still think about the delicious pierogis and the always-wonderful desserts here. Miss you guys, Tom, Diane, and Mike! Shout out to all the Slopes' regulars who also frequented this place for dinner + watering hole at least 3-4 times a week.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Anna M.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description: This is literally the best place to eat in South side! my boyfriend and I live close by and frequent UUBU quite often and we have never been disappointed. The menu is always unique and the serving sizes are more than ample (we always have left overs!). The crab cakes are to die for and a must have. Couple that with their bar and expansive wine cellar and you have one of the best dinners in south side, you're a fool for missing out on this place :) ps, they aren't always open, follow them on facebook and Twitter for the days/hours they're open.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Lauren S.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description:
I didn't show up to UUBU6 expecting a great meal. However, it's a neighborhood place in a funky old Union building with a bunch of regulars and 2 dollar beer special. It's the only restaurant in the South Side slopes, and you can't hate a neighborhood joint.

...unless they charge your credit card twice for your meal and you pay 40 dollars for a burger. Worse still, that very burger was an inedible 2 pounds of meat, burnt on the outside and raw on the inside, laying inside a tiny bun. Even the pickles from a jar tasted bad. My 10 dollar house red tasted bad. My expectations were low. But if the burger isn't even edible...come on.

Maybe you could come here for a beer? But first just throw a frozen meal in the microwave at home. This was even more disappointing because we have tried to go to UUBU6 half a dozen times, but the hours are inconsistent. We've even shown up 30 minutes before closing time to find the door locked, and the waitress, Diane, just stared at us from down the hallway. 

Persistence did not pay off on this location. If you don't live in the neighborhood, don't even think of making the trip. If you want a "cheap, divey spot" there are plenty of other places on East Carson that serve bad food. It is quiet though. One star for being quiet and having local high school football on the tvs.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Burt B.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description: I really really love uubu!!! My best friend brought me here after her and her ex boyfriend used to come here. Well the boyfriend is gone bust the restaurant is staying!

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Holly D.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description: Great little hidden place...friendly staff...great food! Diane (waitress) takes the cake though...she's hysterically awesome!!!

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Cara J.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description: They closed. They re-opened. Their hours are questionable, but they are a great deal for happy hour, have an extensive wine list, and serve reasonable comfort food. Call ahead.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Donald P.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description:
In an interesting location in the South Side Slopes.  Parking can be a pain, look for their lot on 18th.  

Old workers union meeting hall.  Check out the still intact dance floor and tin ceilings.

Almost everything I have had here rates high.
Bread baked fresh, in house.
For starter, try the seafood bisque of the truffle fries.
And as for mains, the duck and the striploin were winners  for me.
Avoid the crab cakes as they are quite salty.
Desserts to die for-try the cherry rhubarb tart.

Weekends there is live jazz, but a bit crowded.  If romantically minded, try week days and you may have half the place to yourself.
Lastly they do brunch, but I never tried it.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Jennifer W.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description: Very limited menu and an unusual location. Had a hard time finding parking. I had the chicken parm sandwich which was just o.k. My friend had the shrimp alfredo which was good. I will say the prices are cheap and the portions large. I just wish there was more to choose from. If you want a cheap divey place then this is your spot.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Abigail S.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description:
Just got back, and had to Yelp immediately, because I was so disappointed.

My man and I have been looking really forward to eating here.... and now we wish we wouldn't of wasted our money.

Our waiter was not educated on the food, he was shabbily dressed and still acted like a snob.

They were out of the wine we ordered, and the bottle he just brought instead was horrible.

My pork was undercooked, my boyfriends steak was over cooked (he offered him A1 for 20 dollar steak - isn't that big time nono?), and they use heavy salty sauces to cover up there shameful cuts of meet.

Do yourself a favor and Save your money;  just buy a flank steak, cover it in soy sauce, and wash it down with a $2 dollar bottle of wine.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Shanna C.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description:
Uubu 6 is a bit tiny, but it's pretty unique. We came for Thanksgiving dinner, and if you can use it as a basis for the rest of their food, it's pretty good.

As the below poster said: they bake bread in house. We got the most delicious, fresh, warm rye bread (and I typically hate rye) with a plate of tasty, melty butter. Next was a delicious mushroom bisque, followed by a decent salad with pomegranates, raspberries, and walnuts. They served a good, but typical Thanksgiving plate with all the fixins. For desert was a dense chocolate cake (and I suspect flour-less?), which was quite good.

They have a large wine menu, and recently have added a $20 bottle page. Also our server was an incredibly friendly and pleasant, despite the stress she must have been under due to the high volume of large families coming in. Parking is kind of a pain though, the "lot" for customers can probably only fit 6 cars, luckily they have a valet to deal with that. There is street parking across from it, but there's no sidewalk. I would drop your guests off at the restaurant before parking on South 18th Street as your passenger side will be extremely unpleasant to get out of.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: darren l.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description:
Good food and unassuming location.

I've eaten here twice and thought the food was excellent. They don't have many choices at any particular time, but everything put on the table has been good. 

The Valentine's special menu for $66 per couple including a glass of wine, shrimp appetizer, salad, filet, crab cake, vegetable, dessert and coffee was by far the best deal on a meal I've had in years. The three couples left wondering how they could serve so much for $33 a person.

What is particulary appealing is low-key, quiet nature of this place. You can hear the other people at the table without shouting.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: My D.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description: It's a very quiet restaurant, which I definitely enjoy.  The lamb is cooked to perfection.  Drinks are pretty delicious too.  Very unsuspecting place is a quiet neighborhood.  Good experience though.  Would go back.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: Jason C.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description: Being that I'm the first Pittsburgher to review UUBU6, it pains to me rate this typically superb restaurant with only 2 stars. But unfortunately last Saturday night, my lofty expectations fell well short of what we had experienced here before. We arrived early for our reservation at this funky spot up the hill on the South Side, and decided to have a drink at the cool bar of what used to be the Workingman's Beneficial Union No. 6 lodge (somehow they get UUBU6 out of all of that). I was excited to see a large beer tub full of one of my favorite beers, Blue Point Hoptical Illusion, and quickly ordered two for the guys. Our ladies each decided on a pomegranate martini which were so strong even I had a hard time taking a sip. The four of us were seated in the grand main dining room with the yellow and green checker board ceiling and the dramatic yellow drapery. But unfortunately after we sat down, the staff forgot we were there. We waited almost 20 minutes until a server approached us and asked if we were ready to order. I said "we would be happy to order if we had menus." You can see where this night was headed. The server apologized and quickly returned with our menus.  UUBU6's menu tonight looked nothing like the menu on the website (it does say "menu subject to change upon the Whim of the Chef" ) but I have to say we were very disappointed with the night's offerings. The entire first page was a Lenton menu ( this was a Saturday night) with 8-10 seafood specials. But the biggest disappointment was the fact that there was only one appetizer (asparagus frito misto) to go along with 3 or 4 salads. Are you serious???   The app selction on the website had so many different choices and our only option was asparagus which also happened to be the vegetable of the day?  Fortunately I saw a very attractive cheese and fruit plate on the dessert cart next to our table and we decided to order it for our appetizer. The waiter obliged and it was actually a very good selection of a Maytag blue, a brie, a borsin and a smoked Gouda to go along with the grapes, strawberries, crackers and bread. The wine list is extensive and is attached to every menu, so after finally settling on a bottle of wine, we were sorry to learn that it was unavailable. Our server suggested a similar California Red from the $20 bottle list. I was confused because none of our menus had this value list. So he returned with another menu and we were lucky to have a very good Cali Pinot Noir.  The salads were just okay with a blood-orange vinaigrette.  Nothing to get excited about.   But  my seafood bisque was very flavorful and hearty. My lady ordered the Hangar steak with mustard sauce and sweet potato fries. Our server informed us that he thought they were out of it so he asked her for a plan B in case it was unavailable. After another 20 minutes, we motioned to our server to see if she was getting the hangar steak and he informed us that there indeed was one left. We wished there hadn't been because the steak came out a little overcooked, but drowning in mustard flavor. But her biggest disappointment was that the accompanying fries weren't sweet potato, just plain ordinary steak fries. She wouldn't have ordered the steak if she had known they were out of sweet potatoes and our server again neglected to mention this to us. As for my dish, I went in ready to order either a duck or a lamb dish from the website but of course neither were on tonights menu.  So I decided on the soft shell crabs with spring onion and tomato relish. I chose poorly.  The "salsa" on top was just that, chopped tomato and sliced green onion.   But that was the least of my entree's problem. The soft shells were so salty I could feel my blood pressure rising with each bite. It was almost laughable but by now I was too hungry to send them back. Apparently it was contagious, because the accompanying asparagus also seemed to be inflicted with this same salt problem. In fairness, our dining companions enjoyed their dishes, I especially liked his Angus beef tenderloin (we like to try each others dishes) but his wife's salmon dish was a little on the dry side. The dessert cart (again, none of the desserts on the website were on the cart tonight) sells itself with the elegantly arranged trays of small cakes and pastries. The ladies' Chocolate flourless cake wasn't very awe-inspiring but a strawberry Napoleon with whipped cream was sublime. All things considered, and because of my $50 gift certificate (thanks WPXI Just Pay Half) our final tally came to $65 per couple.  All things considered, UUBU6 can give you a pretty good bang for your buck with the $20 wine list and also a $30 recession buster prix fix feature.   So as you can see, you can get pretty good value here.   As long as the kitchen and waitstaff  rekindle the commitment to excellence that I had come to expect when UUBU6 first ascended up the slopes of the South Side.

In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.author: A. A.
In8gjAPQ1eE2F2OMY0H9ow.description: Incredibly charming little restaurant tucked away on Pius Street in the slopes away from the craziness of Carson St.  Everything we had was superb.  A but pricey, but well worth it.  We will be back.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Carol S.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: I really enjoyed the house blend of coffee. It has a smooth taste...not bitter or acidic. The woman who waited on us was patient and very friendly. There are numerous tables and chairs. I like the bookcase and games customers can use. By the door, there is a box for collected used Legos to donate.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Allen H.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description:
This place gets the most-improved coffee shop award, it's on its way to being a gem. 

They've been reliability serving really good coffee and home-baked pastries. It's actually worth stopping here to indulge in whatever beans they're brewing on a given day. 

On top of that, the service is fantastic.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Ada T.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: Great place to hang out and connect with friends and family. They have different sections within the establishment to gather. The barista was also knowledgeable about their coffees and made a wonderful suggestion for my cravings. I would head back there again and again.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: David B.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description:
Comfortable and inviting. Expect great coffee at a reasonable price served by welcoming and attentive staff.

While the coffee is excellent, there is also a good selection of teas. 

Definitely the antidote to the large chains, there's a feeling of community here. With comfortable reading and conversation spaces, you can't go wrong.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Kaitlyn T.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: I got a signature beverage called 'the parking chair' which was an iced espresso drink with cream and some other secrets - one of which I'm pretty sure is some vanilla. We talked with Andy, who is cited on the website as the go-to guy for some Q&A and he explained the history of the building and the story behind the name.  The drinks were really good and the environment was welcoming. The place also smelled like warm donuts. I would recommend a visit to any coffee shop explorer.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Bradley J.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description:
This is a fantastic spot to get some work done. They have a large amount of seating in different varieties (tables and chairs, countertop/stools, sofas, oversize chairs, etc) and they aren't piled on top of each other so you have room to spread out. The wifi was outstanding too.

I had one of their specials that was called the Smokehouse Latte and it was unbelievable! It was a mocha latte but with a hint of chili powder and I have a weakness for spicy chocolate! The lady at the counter was very helpful and brought my drink to my table and even let me pay later because I had a Skype meeting that was about to start. 

Coffee was great. Atmosphere was perfect.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Jenna M.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: Had a lovely experience at this cafe that I had heard about through one of my colleagues. I came here the other day to grab some coffee and catch up on some work. The environment is warm and spacious, with plenty of seating available by the window or on comfortable couches for a more relaxed feel. What I really enjoyed about this place is not only their wide selection of baked goods, but also their food options. I love breakfast warps, and their spinach egg and Gouda cheese wrap was a welcoming start to my day!

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Haeshah D.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: Super cozy atmosphere! Pretty good drinks and great for meetings and just hanging out. Seating can be limited, especially when there are a lot of people there or book club is happening. Overall, I enjoy going to this coffee bar!

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Carrie P.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description:
This review is for the Coraopolis location. 

 I loved my little trip out to the Coraopolis Anchor & Anvil.  I was looking for somewhere to spend a little time between town and the airport and spent about an hour there right before closing on a Sunday.  It was oh so very quiet there, not like the more urban coffee shops with competitive seating.  There was an entire 3-seater couch and 2 easy chairs up for grabs.  There were a couple other people in the shop.

The barista was really friendly and interacted with super-shy me, which takes some doing.  I had read the menu in advance and had my heart set on one of their signature drinks, The Parking Chair.  I read the menu again anyway, and decided to order it, even after finding out that it is pre-mixed and thus cannot be made decaf.  They promised it would taste like melted espresso ice cream, and live up to that it did!  I don't 100% know what they put in it, but they say they use real ingredients, and it tasted that way.  This is not something to get on a regular basis as it was quite sweet, but it was a nice treat.

I liked the open and airy space, the minimalist/industrial vibe, the peace and quiet.  I liked that I had somewhere cozy to relax.  I took over an easy chair and noticed they had a couple of issues of a magazine for coffee and tea professionals called The Cup.  I didn't get anything done I'd planned to do because I read this magazine cover to cover--it was a great & inspiring read.  I'm looking forward to trying more of their signature drinks, either in Ben Avon (where is Ben Avon anyway?) or in Coraopolis, probably on the way to or from the airport.

PS: Coraopolis has a bit of a downtown so it's a good place to take a walk, too, if you make this coffee shop a destination.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Keith T.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: Well I have seen this place when they were turning that shop into another great venue in Coraopolis . The town needs it ! Quite a nice little establishment, and if you're in need of something to eat; just walk on down the block and pick something up ! They open up the whole front of the coffee shop  !

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Amanda S.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: I loveeeeeeee loveeee this coffee spot. I was so happy to find this place on my recent visit. I WILL be back on every trip i take to Pittsburgh. Its a little off the beaten path in a neighborhood. Perfect spot GREAT coffee and food. Staff is al friendly and they have a second location in coraopolis. Love them! Better then starbucks. Hands down. ... unless you are not a real coffee drinker and you purchase all of those coffee flavored drinks from starbucks.....then you should just never go here and quit pretending to love coffee!!

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Silent D.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: I love this place, it's large and homey. Staff are friendly. Coffee great. I've been told their jelly donuts are delicious though I have not tried yet.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Monica D.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: At first glance, this place looks really cute. It's in a residential neighborhood. But upon a closer look, the place is gross and dirty. There's stains on the carpet and upholstery, food all over the floor...really pretty disgusting. My cappuccino  was weak and I threw the biscotti away because it had no flavor. The girls that were working were talking for the 45 min I was there instead of restocking the bare pastry cabinet (which I was told they had more in the back) or cleaning up some of the garbage and food on the floors and tables. It wouldn't take much to improve this place, probably won't be back though.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Michelle F.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description:
Nice cool coffee shop in the middle of Emsworth- Pittsburgh! We walked down to Anchor and anvil while in town. They have a nice selection of craft coffees- you can smell the quality as soon as you walk in. The staff is friendly and happy to help with your selection. The shop is nice and big with a lot of seating. 

Anchor and Anvil appears to be a nice addition to the quiet town.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Beth H.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: Excellent coffee and a coffee shop where everyone behind the counter knows the regulars' names. Neighborhood vibe. Dog friendly sidewalk seating. Great pastries and lunch menu all week; Oram's donuts (until they're gone!) on Saturdays. Plenty of space/tables for work or casual meetings. A gem just minutes from downtown Pittsburgh! (Again, excellent coffee! Mad Cap beans all the time.)

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: J P.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: This is the best kept secret.  The service is always incredible and the lattes are pretty awesome

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Sue E.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description:
We stopped in this coffee bar for lunch while driving through the neighborhood and loved it.  The coffee bar has a great vibe with a lot of space to relax and unwind.  I am not one of those people that can concentrate and do work in a Starbucks.  It's too cramped or loud for me, but I could definitely see myself setting up shop here to get some work done. They have tables, comfortable chairs, and a retro diner bar area to sit.  

They have a wide selection of coffee and tea choices.  We were there for lunch and I had a quesadilla while my husband had a turkey pesto sandwich.  Then, we had monkey bread for dessert.  All good and tasty.  We'll be back.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Samantha S.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: Not good for to-go food. I quickly ran in before work because i was craving a salad from there, I asked for it to go and she said okay. I then received a tiny to-go container (like the ones you get from take-out Chinese food) with literally only 5 pieces of lettuce and the rest was corn, beans and chicken. There was the dressing in a cup on the side but none of the usual chips on top either (i would've gladly taken them on the side in a bag or something) So, I was left pretty disappointed when i opened the bag to see that. I'll for sure never get anything to-go from them, despite how much i'm craving it, ever again.

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Jamie A.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description: Very Cozy! Great tea, coffee and food selection! Baristas are pleasant and knowledgeable! Definitely recommend!

7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.author: Ben S.
7YLvFqyFkIZkj5l6tnbqrw.description:
This place is great. Great location, great space, great vibe, great healthy date squares

Dude: terrible coffee. You have one job. Make delicious coffee. And you are failing The grinds are not fine enough and so make an absolutely sour cup. Close the shop, invite friends. Experiment with different providers and grind resolutions and do a blind taste test. Then open your doors again with the best results. There's too much competition out there to be making coffee this gross. I've been here three times and every time. Sour sour coffee!

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Benjamin P.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description:
We finally got a chance to stop on our way home and grab pizza from the new spot on 27th Street in South Side, Crust Almighty Pizzeria and More.  For my tastes, it's the best pizza in the neighborhood.   The plain cheese is good but the Spicy Sausage pie is amazing.

Going to have to try their Meatballs Deep pie next time.

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Bailey D.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description: I wish that the owner knew how to talk to people who have an issue with the quality of their food. I wouldnt suggest going here unless you want a hard time from them.

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Antony G.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description: This is an unexpected, hidden gem in South Side. For pizza aficionados this is where you want to grab your next slice of pizza.

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Tim P.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description: A little hole in the wall on the SouthSide that has the most amazing pizza I have had in a long time. Much better than the chain stores and are loca owners.  Can grab a beer at the bar next door whilst waiting for the pizza and yummy garlic bread.  Gotta go there.

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Stephen L.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description:
Cash only. 

There's a lot of mediocre pizza in Pittsburgh. This place is well above the average. Best part is the sauce, not overly sweet like so many places in town, here you actually taste tomato and seasoning. Really, you can tell that quality ingredients are used across the board.  Thin crust, appropriate amount of cheese, and not a grease bomb. This is the kind of pizza where you can "accidentally" slam 4 slices and not suffer intestinal mutiny for the rest of the day. Slice I got off the top was perfectly crisp as well, though the to-go pie may have been pulled a bit early as it was slightly doughy and had some serious flop that wasn't present in the slice. Still, the pie I brought folks disappeared quickly with no complaints heard. 

I've visited twice, and both times I've had to figure out what on the menu could actually be ordered at the time (you can make small pies but not large pies?). Also, for a place that advertises selling pizza by the slice, they don't seem to have slices up very often. These are things that I can chalk up to being brand new though, simple fact is this is the best NY style pie you're going to find in the south side, and one of the better I've had around Pittsburgh.

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Amber R.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description:
This place is the TIDDIES!!!!!

The Pizza rock my ass off! The sauce has a touch of sweetness to it. The pepperonis are the tiny round ones that puddle the tasty grease (good look guys).

The Italian hoagie was fantastic. The bread was soft yet crunchy! 

I can't wait to watch them expand and offer even more!!!

Great job! Keep up the good work!

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Melissa O.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description: Ordered here for a party and every body was raving how good the pizza was! Great prices and fresh quality pizza. Not overly greasy either.  The white pizza was my favorite!

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Paula L.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description:
We stopped at Crust Almighty because of the reviews we read online.....WELL..
this was in NO WAY the best pizza I've ever tasted. It was greasy, the sauce and cheese did not have any special characteristics that would make me say WOW! I will not be visiting this pizza shop again. I will stick to my BEST GO TO PIZZA....MINEOS!!!!

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Stacy P.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description: Checked on Facebook for their hours because you never know when they're open. Tonight, Sunday, December 23rd they say that they're open until 8:00 p.m. I call and order a pizza at 6:49 and he tells me they're closed!! I reminded him of their hours on Facebook and he responded that they hadn't had any calls in two hours and they stopped taking orders at 6:45!! I asked them to please make me a pizza, and reminded him that he answered the phone. He laughed and said no, we already cleaned up. We're closed. I will NEVER order a pizza from them again. Try Azimer's in Oakland, they deliver and they're ALWAYS open when they say they are.

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Preston S.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description: The best pizza in Pittsburgh. After going once I refuse to even try other pizza places.

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Julie K.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description: Best pizza this part of south side. Crust almighty makes a good za... a nice thin crunchy crust, fresh delicious toppings, and decent prices. Definitely worth a try  the next time your looking for a solid slice!

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Jason K.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description:
Thank you GOD for bringing this place into my soul, and for the gentleman inside making pizza giving me my everything. Crust Almighty, you're the one for me. Folks, please..i implore you, please. Listen to me. You need this pizza. For a small donation you can satisfy all realms of the senses with our Crust Almighty. Inside their doors, they are creating the uncreatable. The perfect pizza. 
It's a pizza miracle. Rejoice at the marvel of Crust Almighty, for he is pizza god. 
Seriously, though. This is the best pizza I've ever effing peroid had period ever.  fo eva EVA, even. Seriously, if this pizza had a dick, I would suck it. If Lucifer himself handed me this pizza, I'd accept it, S the D on the most beautiful angel.and eat every bite knowing it's sending me straight to hell. but this is about the pizza. I'm an old man, I've eaten a lot of pizza and at a lot of places. I legit had one bite and started this review. My friend and I ate the whole pie.
He asked me where the pizza's dick was.

1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.author: Joshua T.
1POxn1NDKlH7kvWQqmP6Yw.description: Absolutely fantastic pizza. Little pricey but it is very good. Great ingredients and crunchy crust provided a great combination

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Marcus E.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description:
Frank's Bar and Grill
https://www.frankspgh.com

Excellent Bar/Grill in Shadyside

Weeknight stop just steps off of Shadyside's busy Walnut Street with our middle-school aged kids. The wings are savory and perfectly prepared and the burgers are simply fantastic: excellent meat blend served on toasted rolls that stand up well to toppings. The French Dip sandwich is simply jaw-dropping: we will absolutely order again. We found the staff to be gracious and engaging, and the tap-list to be thoughtfully curated. Very highly recommended.

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Abby S.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description:
Mmmm. It's really nice to see a new restaurant open in Shadyside when so many are closing or relocating. I didn't really know what to expect - looking at the menu beforehand, it seemed eclectic and I didn't know if they could pull it off. But I can definitely say my expectations were exceeded. 

My friend and I came in tonight, on a Friday night, to a bar that was a little busy but my no means overcrowded. Our bartender was nice and funny and very attentive and gave good suggestions and specials. The drink menu is short but very good, and what really stood out to me were the flavored mules.

My friend and I split three dishes - the Fried Buffalo Cauliflower, the Pork Chorizo Steamed Buns (3 in an order), and the Teriyaki burger. I do wish the cauliflower was a little bit crispier, but who doesn't love buffalo and ranch? Anyone who is anyone loves a steamed bun and I could have eaten easily three more. And the Teriyaki burger was cooked correctly; it was sweet and a lot softer of a texture than I thought would be possible with a whole slice of pineapple in it.

Before leaving, the owner stopped by to thank us for coming in, and we both got menus to the new sister restaurant opening downstairs, Frances, which I am equally as excited for.

I'm glad I didn't take the other reviews to heart and tried it out for myself. This is a place where I'll definitely come back.

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Ilham A.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description:
I cannot say enough great things about this restaurant.  We were walking around looking for Stack'd and realized it had been replaced my Franks.  This was around midnight when their kitchen was technically closed.  The owner welcomed us in and had the staff keep the kitchen open for my friends and I so we can order.  The staff was super friendly and welcoming as well.

Now to the food, the food was amazing.  My friend and I had the orange honey firecracker shrimp steam buns and they were phenomenal.  My other friend had the classic burger and she loved that too.  I will definitely be back to explore the rest of the menu.

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: John P.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description:
This place is brand new. We stopped by on a Friedan evening for foods and drinks. Cocktail selection was pretty decent, and the burgers were half off!! 

I will definitely come back to try Sunday brunch out on there patio!

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: L M.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description: Yo this place is great.  I've been here three times now to get food and a beer and plan on going back many more.  Food: so far I've had the smash burger, chicken sandwich and Italian cowboy and all of them were freaking delicious.  If I had to choose one, I'd go for the Italian cowboy. Drinks: their tap list seems to change out pretty frequently so I've been able to try a number of great beers. Atmosphere: it feels like a sports bar but the last time, we all (patrons and bartenders) got really into watching a game show shouting out the answers.  All in all, you should check this place out.

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Yuae P.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description: The bartender was friendly and the animal style burger was great! It was juicy! Happy to have them in Shadyside :)

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Amanda O.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description: We just happened to stumble upon Franks and I'm glad we did! I had the Moscow mule and the animal burger and both were great! The burgers were also half off on a Friday night and the kitchen is open late. The staff was very energetic and excited about the place. Needless to say the service was great.

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Joe M.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description: Went here tonight with friends to play darts and check it out. We had great service from the bartenders Joel and Brandon. They were both personable and chill guys to talk to. Brandon delivered our food quick and was tentative when we needed things. This is soon to be a shadyside hot spot, check it out!

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Scott B.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description: I was not disappointed by my first visit. Having been in this building previously where the "Stackd" chain restaurant once stood; Franks blows it out of the water and is a good addition to the neighborhood.  The Pittsburgh salad was exactly what I was looking for.  The chicken was perfectly cooked and the lettuce/vegetables were all fresh.  It was topped off with some bomb fries. I will definitely be stopping back.

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Marisa S.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description: Amazing! Came out with a friend for dinner- everything on the menu looked so good we ended up splitting a bunch of different items. We tried the Kentucky fried cauliflower, the pork steam buns and the teriyaki burger with fries. As good as all of the items sounded on the menu, they each exceeded expectations. We also tried the peach mules and they were so fantastic! We meant to try more on the cocktail list, but the mules were so good we had to get a second round. We will definitely be back to sample more of the menu and drink list. I'm also excited to try the lower level of the restaurant for lunch!

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Rachel M.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description: Yikes I don't know where to start with this place...I went in on a Wednesday night and it was fairly busy. They only had one server, Cameron who was the absolute best and only good part of the night. He was clearly stressed as he was the only one working and needed some help but that didn't stop the owner from sitting at the bar and drinking while fawning over a male customer. It was extremely uncomfortable to watch knowing she was the owner of the place. We ordered the queso fundido which tasted like it came from a jar. We also got the animal style burgers which were pretty mehh. The fries were good but that's about it. Definitely would not go back here.

Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.author: Sarah P.
Vg5T_n_JO_Svryi9tFSCiA.description: This was one of my worst food experiences ever. We came in and nobody was in there, which now makes sense. The place looked a bit disheveled and dirty, which is weird since they opened not too long ago. We sat down and didn't have any service for about ten to fifteen minutes. When the person came over he asked for our orders and rolled his eyes when we asked to see a menu. All of this not a big deal because it is a bar. The reason why I write this review is because we watched our food sit at the bar for about fifteen to twenty minutes while everybody ignored it. There was literally no one there...... The girl then noticed it and we proceeded to watch her go through the trash with the other guy. She then proceeds to bring my partner's food, which is now disgusting and cold and tells me they made my food wrong. She then leaves and doesn't have any silverware for my partner to eat her meal, which is fine because it is cold already. I see her then do a few laps as she is avoiding eye contact, which I get because she is now stressed out but again still no silverware. She then drops my food off and we ask for silverware. My food was now too disgusting and cold. We just paid our tab and left feeling just as hungry as we had when we came in. Look I get it. Sometimes the kitchen sucks or you're having an off night, but take some accountability when you leave food sitting on a bar for twenty minutes. There are so many yummy places in this part of town that I sadly know time will weed this place out.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Alan W.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
This was the first time I have gone to this  Boston Market .
I have been to many other Boston Market's in New York.
I generally get a drink and a 1/4 white meat chicken, comes out to about $10.00.
You get two sides with meal, I generally get mixed vegis and mashed potatoes.
Service was good, And staff was very friendly.
I really like Boston Market, It is a real bargain price wise, And it is a lot healthy than going to Mcdonalds or Burger King for the same price.
Plenty of seating and very clean environment.
If you are in the Mood for a good fast healthy meal Boston Market is the place to go.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Eric L.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
Better than microwave dinner. Barely. It looks pretty busy. Nice location by hotel and hospital. My order wasn't ready but apparently they are going to work on the next order after mine first.

The dining area is a bit of a mess. There are uncleared tables everywhere. The lady working seems a bit frazzled and overwhelmed. 

If you order online, check in. They don't start it until you do as another reviewer indicated. Apparently there's no benefit to ordering online as people who came in after me are leaving befor

Mashed potatoes taste like it was made from powder. Reminded me of a microwave dinner taste and brought back memories of when I was a kid. Chicken noodle soup had lots of chicken but it was over cooked and bland. The corn bread had a gritty texture.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Karla D.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
I live down the street from this location and every now and again decide to pop in to grab a bite. It's a chain obviously and I should know better. Especially since each time I go the service and food seems to be worse and worse.
There really is no reason for anyone to eat at a place like this when we have so many locally owned and locally sourced restaurants at our fingertips. It's totally overpriced here as well.
Yuck. Never again.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Domenica D.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
If I could give this place less than a star, I would. The customer service is absolute trash and they get my order wrong EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. 
I worked in food service and this ain't it

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: John P.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description: The food was not great. I ordered the 3 piece dark meat and the chicken was decent. The sides however was. The creamy spinach was bland and had no flavor. The corn bread was still cold from the fridge. I've been to Boston Markets at other locations and have great experience, but this is sub par.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Mark F.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
The food is general Boston Market Quality but the service leaves a lot to be desired and ordering online is useless through these folks. I ordered and paid for my meal online to be picked up in half an hour. When I arrived, at the time it was supposed to be ready my food had not even been started and they proceeded to waste an additional 15 minutes of my time before my food was ready. While I could potentially understand this if they were busy they had 2 tables with customers and a total of 3 customers while I was waiting. 

When I asked for a manager the cashier threw a fit and walked away leaving her colleagues confused what the issue was yet by this point my meal was "ready" without my desert and she wouldn't even give it to me. The manager never would come to talk to me. If it wasn't the only home style meal near the hospital my son is in I wouldn't eat here because of the service.

When I got to the hospital my order was screwed up and I had to pay double for parking and lose my only chance this week to eat with my wife and all of my children to go back and get it fixed.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Ronald V.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description: I should have turned around and left when the girl putting cornbread in the bag threw the utensil down (where her hands were touching) unto the rest of the bread while using profanity under her breath because someone in the drive-through expressed they had an allergy. My experience continued for the worse when my three piece dark was a two piece, with the one being cut in half. It then became hard to eat  my meal and listen to the workers ( the younger girls) bicker and use profanity about cleaning the bathrooms and leaving early. I believe I even heard one say something about a COCKROACH. Not sure if there is a manager here but if there is what a disgrace for allowing your staff to act like this. I never been to a restaurant where the works were louder then the patrons. Until sometime is done about this I will never revisit this location.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Miss M.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description: This Boston Market NEEDS SANITARY EDUCATION & A CLASS IN BUSINESS ETHICS.  As a local, I've came here for years.  It was one of the cleaner fast food spot with better food.  Key Word:WAS.  During my last trip here in the past week, the tables were not wiped off, crumbs were on the seats everywhere, and the garbage cans in the seating area were missing.  I asked where the garbage cans were, and an employee informed me that they were expected to get our trays.  Boston Market, you cannot expect to treat people like waiters/waitresses while the public does not tip.  You are an awesome fast food place but do not try to be an Eat N' Park.  You are failing.  I insisted that I wanted to throw out my garbage (so my baby would stop trying to play in his food) & was instructed to leave it on the counter where people receive fresh food.  How gross.  Since the public is not tipping, do not treat your employees like waiters/waitresses.  They are not slaves.  They employees feel belittled.  Less cleaning is done.  Trash sits on tables and crumbs are not picked up.  There is no incentive for your employees to care about your establishment if you don't care about them.  Your dining experience declines.  This place was cleaner when employees were just expected to wipe off the tables & benches & customers handled their own garbage.  Please bring back the garbage cans & go back to being an awesome fast food place!  I believe Panera tried this before and FAILED.  They brought back their garbage cans and now Boston Market, it's time to bring back yours!  I refuse to eat here until garbage cans are places back in the dining room.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Essam S.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description: Absolutely redicuolois customer service, makes me wonder how could you hire staff like that, rude, incompetent, and loud..I stood there for 10 completely ignored, and when my food was ready 20 min later the girl TOSSED my food on the counter and said "there" with a nasty look!!! shame on you Boston market, that Baum blvd one is a joke and needs new management and staff that can actually deal with other human beings

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Felicia E.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
Okay everyone. I went to Boston Market on Baum Blvd today and picked up my online order. I got back to work ready to partake in a meal.
I cut into the chicken and BLOOD not juice came out. I had two breasts both were uncooked! Both were pink inside!!! The potatoes were nasty too!
I ordered mixed veggies the gave me some broccoli with a tiny piece of carrot in it.
My lunch was ruined...
I called the store.
They told me I had to come back and bring the food to get a refund. I told them I was all the way in Bakery Square.
Manager said too bad that is our policy.
Then he tried to explain the chicken is okay to eat because all their chicken cooked on the same temperature?!?
I was so upset I went back over and did return it.
No apology
But he did credit my card.
I will NEVER go to the. Boston Market Baum Blvd again.
That meal was straight up NASTY.
Oh and btw I ordered a cookie. Someone bright put my cookie on top of the hot "meal" so the cookie got all squishy!
Eww
HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Krista B.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description: Boston Market used to be on McKnight Road until it was closed down. I LOVE the pot pie here. This Boston Market in particular changed a whole lot. They made the inside roomier and it's like a traditional restaurant but without the waiter/waitress service. You still have the choice to take out or sit in. I give this place a 4 star because it is modern and the food is still great  in my eyes. Keep up the great work and hopefully this location will not close down.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Rob K.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
Food is great.

However:

-Once there were two co-workers loudly arguing with each other while people waited in line to be served.

-Once I had a cashier actually tell me to leave a tip on the table after I was done eating.

The staff here needs to do better.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Årńöłt S.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description: Delivery guy was a moron.  Had all the food upside down; spilling everywhere.  Not sure if incompetent or just a jerk, but either way, worst.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Cayla T.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description: I usually get my food to go or by the drive-thru window. I've never had a bad experience. I eat here, because I know I'm getting fresh, tasty food. I wouldn't go as far to say 'home cooked' nevertheless it's still good at the sane time. The chicken, turkey, mashed potatoes, and creamed spinach are some favorites of mine. The drive-thru is usually quick. I once picked up some chickens that weren't called in until that morning, and they had them ready for me. When you need something a little different and not greasy, Boston Market is your place.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Rod W.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description: Staff was friendly and welcoming . The interior was clean with the exception of the men's bathroom. That was a mess. The food was good. Nora went out of her way to assist us with our meal selection. Glad she did. Would stop back when we are in the area.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Lucretiz C.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
I went on Tuesday and enjoyed it so much I went back on Thursday too.

I have never before this week dined at Boston Market! I don't know what I was waiting for this place is something special.  When you dine in they serve you on a real plate...not some plastic plate or out of boxes. That fact alone was enough to award 5 stars the plate was nice but the food on the plate was even better.  

They have two kinds of gravy beef and chicken
The food was excellent 
the ribs were so tender

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: John M.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
We often eat here when we are too busy to cook and it never disappoints. When you think about it, there are not very many places where you can get a reasonably healthy meal that is quick and affordable. Boston Market is one of the few places you can. 

The rotisserie chicken here is usually moist and flavorful. That may sound like no big deal, but cooking a chicken breast to the proper doneness is not easy. They give you two sides plus cornbread with most meals and you can go healthy with green beans and spinach or pig out with mashed potatoes or mac and cheese. The sides are generous and every one I've tried is great.

This will continue to be a mainstay for us at dinner time.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Aaron R.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
The food was plentiful and very good, better than expected in fact.  Most of the staff was very pleasant, and the restaurant was clean.

HOWEVER

The restroom was absolutely disgusting, and it appeared as though the toilet/urinal hadn't received the appropriate attention in quite some time.  

In addition, there was one white male staff member who appeared to be the manager that was exceedingly loud and obnoxious in what would have otherwise been a pleasant and relaxing environment.     He worked all around the restaurant during my time there, seemingly filling in as needed.  He talked loudly across the whole restaurant to staff members back in the kitchen.  He kept his food prep gloves on while delivering food to tables, and after scratching his head, and touching countless other restaurant surfaces before returning to the kitchen and continuing to use the same gloves.

What could have been a very positive experience was absolutely ruined by this man.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Ronald W.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
Good homestyle American fare. High quality ingredients, well prepared. Liked the new gourmet sides of loaded potatoes and Mediterranean green beans. I think the quarter dark plate with 2 sides is pretty good especially if you use one of the free soft drink or $1 coupons in the paper or from their website.

Service was good, and restaurant super clean when I went. Oh yeah, pretty cool to get real plates and silverware when dining in.

L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.author: Matthew U.
L5wNKBuK6-tj7cfFMmgv1A.description:
I'm not one for ordering out at work with coworkers very often and this experience can probably tell you why.

Boston Market has this nifty gadget on their website that allows you to order via the Internet, the order is sent to the store that you select and you just go and pick it up.  Humph, that's where the happiness stops.  Just because you send your order in and are given a time for pick up does not mean that your order will be ready.  Also be sure to print out your "invoice" prior to going or they will literally argue with you that you order is complete.  Out of five orders, only two were done correctly.  So that meant the estimated twenty minutes on the "invoice" actually turned into about 45 minutes.  Would have been easier to drive here, walk into the store and wait for the order to be done.

And prices weren't really that great.  Food not as good either, the meatloaf I ordered has several pieces of gristle in it.  And if I hadn't asked for gravy to put on it, it would have been dry beyond believe.

As the stars say, "Meh.  I've experienced better."

WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.author: Emmalee N.
WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.description: Wow! Wow! Wow! This was waaaaay better than I was expecting. I travel every week for work and I'm always trying to find healthy options, most often that means sacrificing flavor and taste...but not here. I ordered zucchini noodles with shrimp and veggies - everything was wonderful. I came back again and ordered another bowl with the citrus chicken. The sauces were tasty, the vegetables were fresh and warm, and the protein choices were both moist and cooked perfectly. I am back in Pittsburgh each month and will be sure to eat here every single trip. The menu also has all the calories listed so if you're a calorie tracker (like me) it makes it so simple!!

WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.author: Danielle L.
WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.description:
Came here the other day with a coworker to try.  The selection is great.  Definitely comes across as "fresh" and so many healthy options!

I got their standard kale salad with shrimp. I swapped the quinoa for greens.  Really good salad, good portion of meat and the ranch (healthy version) was really tasty.  

Docking as star for price.  It was $16 for a bowl that is similar in size to chipotle.  I love that it's fresh and healthy, but even $12 would be more realistic.

WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.author: Lauren A.
WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.description:
This place is pretty good. I picked a create your own bowl and was impressed with how the bowl turned out. I would recommend choosing a pre-selected bowl the first time you go in however. 

I thought the place was clean, well ran (despite how busy it was) and the staff were friendly. 

Definitely will go again! 

Also, a suggestion for the menu: ahi tuna and a chipotle sauce!!

WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.author: Carlie M.
WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.description:
Just went to the soft opening today at SoFresh's first location outside of Florida! All the options looked really healthy. I decided to try the 'kale & apple smoothie' which was refreshing on this hot summer day. 

I also found out that you can order online or use their app, which will be convenient when I'm in need of sustenance on a quick lunch break. I'll definitely be coming back!

WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.author: Rachel D.
WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.description: Came here for an early dinner, and it was pretty good! I ordered a warm bowl with zucchini noodles, broccoli, mushrooms, onion, goat cheese, eggs, chicken, and the kale/basil pesto. It was pretty tasty! I also ordered my food online which made it super convenient- my food was ready right when I got there! Nice spot for a quick healthy and filling meal, would recommend!

WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.author: Danielle P.
WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.description: Great spot to grab a quick, healthy lunch. Employees are kind and helpful and food is pretty good. They have the best zucchini noodles around!

WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.author: Jordan J.
WcDCiLGrh33-1034jDnWsA.description: Great location in the heart of market square. Love the fresh breakfast and lunch options at this location.
